title: THE WORST experience EVER! Don't book with Japan Airline (JAL)
review_text: After a long awaited time, my sister and I finally can and decided to meet in Japan for our dream trip.  I booked my flights with JAL, and I'm so excited!  I sent my itinerary to my sister so she can match my flights to meet at the airports in Japan.  It was really hard to sync up together to book our flights due to the time difference between us.  We finally booked everything and now my sister realized my return flight is departing from 2 different airports in Japan.  My return flight is from Osaka ITM to Haneda then from Haneda to Narita before flying back to Vancouver.  Why would I book a flight that makes me fly to Haneda and then have to go to Narita before flying home to Vancouver.  From Haneda to Narita I would have to transit there.  So I checked and there's another flight 20 mins later at 14:50 to fly from Osaka ITM to Narita and then from Narita to Vancouver.  So I called fully willing to pay a penalty or book another flight just from Osaka to Narita but the agent that I spoke to on the phone said I can't rebook not even with a penalty fee and I could not just book another connecting flight because if I don't follow my flight plan the rest of my flights will be cancelled.  This just doesn't make sense.  Also, the agent that I spoke with yelled at me and told me that  it was their policy and no one can do anything about it.  When I asked to speak to a manager they declined.  They said no manager can help me either and the only option I have is to forfeit my ticket that I paid over $1600 for and to rebook and pay another $1600 or book a flight which is $2600 from Haneda to Vancouver.  This blows my mind when I read other reviews online there's many reviews that this happens to many people and it's a complete money grab.  I don't align with Japan Airlines values, what a disgrace to Japan.  Japan is known for being courteous and kind and the service I received today is the complete opposite of that.  I'm fully willing to pay a penalty since it's my fault, or buy a connecting ticket to replace my mistake but the ridged "policy" (money grab) is completely disgusting.  If you are thinking about booking with Japan Airlines, DON'T!!!!

title: Thank you Arito-mi & Sagya
review_text:
Have decided to extend my trip ‘assumedly’ for another day and paid about SGD500 additional for change of reservation to end up foolishly mistook my flight booked for 13 December 0010hrs when it was 12 December 0010hrs. I didn’t manage to thank Arito-mi (if I got her name correctly). I was incredibly in distress, worrying that I will have to rebook my tickets and on top of the extra costs, worrying that next available flight would be the next day (because i checked online) - I live in Singapore and I do have to say that in our country, every thing is all about money and there is barely any empathy or ‘go for the extra mile for your customers’. Arito-mi was so very kind and instead of how usually customer service would ‘brush you off’, she calmly told us to hold on and had us seated aside while she checked what she could do for us to catch the next flight. To my surprise, instead of a SGD600 that I supposedly had to pay for a one way ticket back. We only had to pay less than SGD50 per person and the best part, it is a flight in next 3 hours. Later was handled by Sagya who handled our baggage check-in. I suppose she noticed my partner and I were seated apart, she made a call and shared to us that she had requested for seat reallocation so we could be seated together during the flight.

I am incredibly touched by the customer service and the genuine initiative from both of them. From a very distressing situation over a mistake that is obviously of my own. Both Arito-mi and Sagya has warmed my heart after a sobbing time finding out I missed my flight. I am so glad that I left Japan in a good note.

Thank you to both of them and I must say they are a great asset to JAL. All the best and take care! I hope to come back to Japan soon!

title: Visiting my son in Japan
review_text: Just wanted to say thanks to the crew on the plane that took my wife and I to visit my son in Japan. I  haven’t been on an airplane since my honeymoon 42 years ago! And everything about the japan airlines flight was great! The attendants were courteous professionals and very friendly and the food was great! Thanks again jal!

title: Great service!
review_text: Great hospitality. Food was served with a cup of miso soup. Cabin was clean and comfortable. Another excellent flight with JAL.

title: Worst rule from check in counter Japan Airlines - Narita Airport
review_text:
I took business class for both return flight Kuala Lumpur. Flight from Narita very strict and not tolerable for the luggage. the staff there said only 3 luggages allowed and my small bag weight 2.2kg consider 1 luggage eventhough my limit is 105kg. I want to check in all my luggages but the staff insist only 3 luggages are allowed. 

Even if I want to wrap and combined together they are not allowed me to do that. 

I never recommend to any of my friends because of this stupid rules by Japan Airlines.

my booking no : 5FSDYW

title: Check in process needs to be improved
review_text:
My ticket was through American Airlines reward program, from Hanoi Vietnam to DFW, via connecting in Haneda airport.  My journey required a change of airport from Narita to Haneda in a 4 hour layover.  My online check in was denied using JAL app and website, so I show up on 11/30 to catch my flight departing at 11:55pm in Hanoi.  I was 2.5 hours early before departure which was plenty of time to check in, at the ticket counter, the attendant said I need to provide them with the ticket number in order to issue a boarding pass.  I show them my booking information on my phone in JAL portal and they said it is not enough and they must have the ticket number.  I told them the ticket was issued via a reward redemption with AA.  They said they couldn't help me and I need to contact AA to get more information.  I got on the AA chat immediately and was able to obtain the ticket number, I immediately provided the ticket number to the counter attendant, they were able to locate the flights but only could print the boarding pass from Hanoi to Narita, and said the second boarding pass will have to be issued in Haneda airport for departure to DFW, when I told them that I might not have enough time because the layover is 4 hours, they let me carry the carryon (even though 2 kg over the limit) rather than have it checked.  I do find that very nice of them for allowing me to carry on. 
 
However, the fact that they can't find my reservation unless I give them the ticket number is odd.  How can an airline not have my name or passport number to pull up the ticket information/reservations?   If AA chat was nonresponsive, I could have missed my flights.  

I would say that the meals on both flights were very nice.  I chose the asian meals on both flights.  Flight attendants were all very attentive and courteous.  

JAL needs to improve their check in process!!!  Although I did arrive on time and got on the connecting flight in Haneda airport, the delay in getting the boarding pass and the check in process could be improved.   I am giving 5 of out 10 stars due to the check in issue.

title: Avoid this Airline at all Costs
review_text:
I was looking forward to a trip to Japan for myself and my wife in November and went with JAL because they had a great reputation and I didn't want any hassles or problems on our 10th wedding anniversary.  I booked our flights in late May for a November visit and received an email confirmation.  I wanted to double check our seats in August and it's a good thing I did as there was no record of our booking despite a confirmation email and code!!  I contacted a JAL rep who said he could book the flight, but that we would have to pay for the flight again and get refunded later.  As the rest of our trip, including accommodation and trains were already booked, I reluctantly went along with this.  I later received a call  from the same rep who said he would get us upgraded seats on the outbound and inbound flights, but would have to pay for the upgrades upfront and that they would be refunded later.  At this point I was pretty suspicious and checked out the name of the rep, who was in fact, a JAL employee.  Long story short, we never received the upgraded seats!  The outbound upgrades were never recorded and the inbound upgrades were cancelled because the video monitors for both seats were not working.  Icing on the cake was that we sat under a vent on the inbound flight and were absolutely freezing for 10 hours.  We are still dealing with a cold/flu one week after returning.  

After all this, we were told it would be "one to two billing cycles"  (i.e. one to two months) before our refund would appear on my credit card.  

Japan was beautiful, but flying with JAL was an absolute nightmare with a lot of broken promises.  As of this date, I am still out $3600.  

Do yourself a favor and go with any airline other than JAL.

title: Japan Airlines disappointing service
review_text:
Very disappointed with Japan Airline Customer Service and care.
I booked a flight for next June 2025. Sydney to Madrid return on a special deal of $1500.00 return.  I was going to add on the Lounge and went in to manage my booking only to find my surname in their system was incorrect.  They had left the last 3 letters off my name.  Its a co share flight with Iberia aways from Heathrow to Madrid.  They will not amend my surname as per my passport details.  The only option they say is to pay a cancellation fee of $300 an error that was not my fault as I imputed my information to purchase a ticket and my passport details.  So, I have to pay a fee for their error and now I can't rebook at that price.  My option now is to pay $2500 with another airline.  I will NEVER recommend Japan Airlines and certainly will NEVER travel with them.  I work in the airline industry and was really disappointed in the Lack of service and could not care less attitude they gave me.  According to them it was my fault.

title: Poor provision for vegetarians
review_text:
We had requested vegetarian meals when making our booking, but were labelled as vegans on board and literally got just vegetables and fruit, plus some rice, during the flight. The meals were very low on calories and quantity. The hostess handing out snacks put one in front of my partner then suddenly snatched it away, saying we couldn't have it, but didn't provide a replacement! When the other passengers got a French pastry for a breakfast snack, we got clingfilm-wrapped rolls with soggy lettuce and tomato in. We were starving when we got to Tokyo! 
On the return flight we made sure we weren't treated as vegans again and the food was a little better, but by no means equivalent in volume and variety as the standard food package. And we still weren't allowed the snacks or pastries.
Very disappointing.

title: Disappointing service on JAL
review_text: While the JAL equipment remains some of the best in the business, the service seems to have dwindled somewhat.  We had the weird experience of one of us (as a couple traveling together) being almost completely ignored during the main meal service. The service started at 8:30 p.m., and almost 30 minutes elapsed between the warm towel and the appetizer, and another 30 minutes between that and the salad.  After that, others were served entrees throughout the cabin, including my spouse, but i was left waiting.  At 10:30 p.m., I still had not been served.  I used the call button to ask what was happening, but no one ever came.  In frustration I cleared my own dishes and took them to the galley, where there were 5 flight attendants gathered, clearing dishes.  They were shocked to see me.  I told them it was too late to eat and I wanted to go to sleep.  After that, 2 different flight attendants came to my seat and offered apologies and other foods, but there was never an explanation as to what had happened, if the entree was not available or if the oven was broken or whatever.  Neither FA was the initial flight attendant who had introduced herself to me at the beginning of the flight - she seemed to have disappeared.  My take is that it was a  mistake and I was just ignored or forgotten, but no one acknowledged that.  I notice that some of the flight attendants are now not Japanese, and I wondered if someone was in training or inexperienced or just not working up to par.  It was atypical of our experience with JAL and quite strange.

title: Horrible Customer Services
review_text: Booked the tickets with Japan Airlines with the mileages credited to my One World Account with American Airlines. The itinerary had 3 segments but only 2 segments were credited. American Airlines told me to contact JAL since the tickets are with them. JAL claimed they cannot help even the tickets are with them. The frustrating part was that they kept me on hold for 1 hours 30 min and told me they cannot help. Horrible customer services. Will stay away from them in the future

title: Pleasant Flights For Senior Passengers From Jakarta To San Francisco
review_text:
My elderly father, my aunt (  my late mother’s sister ) and I departed from Jakarta to San Francisco via Tokyo on 14th May 2024 to visit my sisters and the family in Northern America.

This would be my 7th visit to Northern America.

The last previous visit was in 2010 whereas my first trip with Japan Airlines to Northern America was in 1982.

We took the 6.35 AM flight from Jakarta ( JL720 ) which was approximately on time and arrived safely in Narita Airport at roundabout 4.15 PM ( Tokyo time ).

Transit was less than 2 hours as scheduled and the duration of the JL 58 flight from Tokyo to San Francisco was approximately 10 hours.

The plane from Jakarta to Tokyo was not fully occupied.

In contrast, there was hardly a vacant seat for the Tokyo to San Francisco flight.

One thing I noticed from the flight tracker was that the plane flew directly above the Pacific Ocean from Tokyo to San Francisco whereas in the past, Japan Airlines would fly north to be near the Alaska and Canadian shores. 

That really explained why the flight duration was shorter than in the past which would take between 11 - 12 hours.

Furthermore, both the cabin crew and ground staff were polite and professional in particular by providing excellent wheelchair service for my 84 - year-old father right from the check-in process in Jakarta until arrival in San Francisco International Airport.

Highly recommended for senior passengers for Northern America - bound flight from Jakarta.

title: They downgraded our booking class last minute & refuse to refund difference
review_text:
Just flew Japan Airlines from Australia to Europe via Tokyo. Booked Premium Economy seats almost a year in advance - and chose Japan Airlines specifically to secure Premium Economy seats for the long flight. Two weeks before departure, Japan Airlines phoned to advise that the aircraft had been changed and Premium Economy class was no longer available. Options were to make an already long journey longer by adding another stop in Europe in order to fly in Premium Economy or to downgrade to Economy. All arrangements for the trip had obviously been made by this time and we couldn't cancel or change carrier, so we reluctantly had to accept the downgrade. Again, booked 11 months in advance, they advised just 2 weeks from departure, and even had the nerve to suggest that we cancel our tickets outright and re-book, despite the ticket prices being far higher given that it was so close to the departure date.

We were told we would need to wait until the trip had been completed before we could request a refund. We were also told that the refund amount couldn't be confirmed until after the trip. We were provided with no receipts or paperwork related to the new ticket purchase, and as numerous reviewers already note, the website is useless for trying to manage your own booking.

We put in cash bids for upgrades to business on our return flight, having endured the long haul economy on the way over and dreading the return, but bids on both legs of the trip were rejected. Would have been nice if there had been a red flag on our booking to say that JAL had stuffed us around at the last minute and perhaps accepting our bids would go some way towards compensating - we weren't asking for free upgrades.

We get back from the trip after a very long journey in economy class and contact Japan Airlines to arrange the refund as we had been advised then the tickets were downgraded by the JAL phone operator. In short, Japan Airlines has now advised it will not refund any amount, as the economy fare that they booked in downgrading us was the highest cost / fully flexible fare that equated to the cost of the Premium Economy tickets. This was not communicated to us at the time of the downgrade, and we certainly wouldn't have agreed if we had known that the phone operator had discretion in which booking class the downgraded ticket was allocated - how dare you spend our money without permission?

I spent ages on the phone talking with different people, who all advised that there will be no refund and there is no recourse. So we have paid extra for Premium Economy class, paid in full well in advance of our travel dates, to sit in economy, through no fault of our own and with this change being made two weeks before our departure.

This is our money that has been taken under false pretenses! We paid for something we didn't receive. Japan Airlines couldn't care less and has offered nothing. I can't go back in time to check the difference in economy and premium economy classes when I booked, but searching now for a similar time next year shows that premium economy is more than double the price of economy.

We would have expected a refund of maybe ~$1,000-1,200 pp, so $2-2,400 in total! This is completely unacceptable and feels like theft.

Insurance doesn't cover it, because it's the airline's responsibility. Currently checking with my bank if it can help through the lens of products/services paid for and not received. We'll also check with ACCC around consumer guarantees relevant to flights offered by international companies that depart from Australia, but it doesn't look good.

For what it's worth, the on board experience is good but I'll never fly with them again.

title: Dunno why people recommend this airline
review_text: Dunno how people rate this airline as good, each flight we did was subpar, service from staff when there's an issue is completely useless

title: BEST 5 HOURS FLIGHT EVER!
review_text: I flew Japan Airlines From Bangkok to Osaka, and It’s my first time flying full service airlines After stuck flying low cost carriers and from my experience It’s phenomenal. check in process was fast, can’t believe I got nice legroom space on economy, the flight attendants were friendly and polite, as soon I seated seat was actually comfortable and there was pillow and blanket included as well headphones and also the seat has leg rest in flight entertainment, Since it’s the 787 all seat came with dimmable windows, the flight attendant gave everyone a bottle of water to drink and at that time I was thirsty all because the security won’t allow water through, now guess what? Delayed departed from Suvarnabhumi at 1 in the morning, during cruising flight attendants offered me variety choices of drinks of course I choose Apple juice but guess what? Free snacks napkins as well wet wipes, now of course I went to the bathroom and it’s clean speaking of cleanliness seats were a bit exposed but that’s fine the seats still comfortable, the in flight entertainment has a lot of movies and 5 games, 3 hours later the meal was served I got some kind of salmon porridge, a salad, strawberry yogurt, fruits and another salad, then flight attendant offered me the same variety of drinks but I choose orange juice this time but guess what? Silverware in economy, it’s supposed to be plastic but the airline was very nice and gave me Silverware, then I enjoyed the meal after all it’s delicious and tasty, then I watched some movies in the remaining time, then guess what? landed early overall I would recommend this airline since the meal is good, plenty of legroom, great seats and friendly service

title: Nice Flight...Terrible Website
review_text: In a way JAL reminds me of my entire Japan experience. Great service, nice people, but sub-par websites. Trying to figure things out on their site is a bit of a maze. Forget the app and trying to sign up for their rewards. Otherwise awesome flight great attendants.

title: Great Legroom, Best Flight Experience, On Schedule.
review_text: Great, maybe BEST flight experience. Always on time or even early. Food is conveniently served 6 hours after takeoff so passengers can get some sleep. Seat had a good amount of recline and the biggest amount of legroom ever. I'm only around 5 foot and i can stretch my legs out in my seat. Flight attendants were very helpful as I have accidentally dropped something into the seat structure whilst I was asleep. Table was averagely large. I haven't used in flight entertainment but it is worth noting that if you are flying from or to Europe you should never pay for the wifi because It wouldn't connect to the satellite. Overall, I would fly Japan Airlines again.

title: Providing misinformation
review_text: Deceiving baggage information prior and after making payment. Terrible customer service. Agent on line keeps cutting me off. Had me waited too long when asked to transfer the call.

title: Fabulous airline
review_text:
Would highly recommend JAl
Service great
Staff wonderful
Inflight service excellent 
Kind friendly helpful staff all the way through 
Go out of their way to help 
Provide assistance for people with mobility issues 
All round service top notch 

Would highly recommend

title: Only if you have to and eat before you get on the plane!!
review_text:
Nice  flight attendants. One of the WORST online experiences I have every had with an airline. The site was totally impossible to figure out and the app never worked for us.
The Premium economy cabin was not worth it and the food was the worst I have ever experienced in the air. We love to travel PE and it is usually worth it but not in this case. Never again

title: ~~~~      Pleasant Flight    ~~~`
review_text: I am glad I choose Japan Airline from LA to Osaka , on their Business class , about 12 hours none stop  , for  me matter to me most  when I travel long haul flight to Asian ,  I all way travel in Premium Economy or Business class , Cabin Comfort , Professionalism of the crews and on time ,  flight was only delay about half hours , seats spacious and comfortable , not  over crowd  , fight attendant all way have The Can Do Attuite  very  professional   understand English really well  , they all surprised my Japanese not too bad !  excellent  tasty  Western menu , beef is so delicious  , top ingredients and lovely flavors  ,,  must  try their light  meal  snake , Curry Potato is  out of  this world !  I am so relax and  sleep like a baby all most all the way to Osaka !  *** **   P.S  also in Lax  for international flight best arrived airport less 4 to 5 hour , it is busy airport , best come  early morning ,  no long line  up , so peaceful and fast moving for  security  screening    so take  my word  remember Early Bird do gets the worm ! you will get pleasant  happy journey !

title: Worst experience ever
review_text: Worst company ever. They broke up 2 of 3 suitcases and gave us less than 30 euros. The suitcases costs more t han 150euros. NEVER FLIGHT WITH THEM

title: BIG NO for travel in JAPAN AIRLINES
review_text:
They are too much into their culture. 
Neither they speak proper English, nor they have any Indian food available (even when the flight departed from Delhi). Not even any bakery item or readymade food or any packed item is available. 
This even applies to non-vegetarians also. 
The worst thing was that they don't converse in English. They speak only Japnese language. 
The inflight entertainment (TV) is also playing japnese items. A very few old english movies. Forget about any hindi / indian movies or shows. 
Being in the Business class, we suffered a lot. I can't imagine the condition of economy class passengers. 

I will highly recommend that, if you are travelling to japan, then please take Indian Airlines. 

COMPLETE NO NO NO to JAPAN Airlines.

title: Excellent customer service
review_text:
On 17th Sept, I took the 10:40 JL736 flight from Hong Kong International Airport Tokyo Narita International Airport. I was so impressed by the highly outstanding and professional customer service provided by the team particularly the cabin crews. They were very polite. I can truely feel the sincerity from the cabin crews particularly those I interacted with one-to-one most frequently with including the Cantonese-speaking cabin crew that I also met on my return flight on 24th Sept JL735.

Thank you so much, Japan Airline cabin crew team! 🥰 I wish the team all the best, a fulfilling and happy career life 😃

title: Decent business class flight
review_text:
Flew on JAL’s 777 from Heathrow to Haneda in July 2024. I arrived at the airport and had a bit of a wait until the check desks opened but once they opened check in was quick and I was soon on my way to the lounge.

JAL direct you to the BA lounge in terminal 3 but as they are a oneworld member you can you any of the 4 oneworld lounges including the Cathay which is probably the best and the Qantas lounge which is a close second and the AA lounge which is a distant last if they re open which they all were for my flight which departed at 7.20pm.

My flight left about 20 minutes late but arrived about 10 minutes early which to me is an on tome flight.

The service onboard was fine but like previous JAL flights I don’t think the staff feel that confident when dealing with English speaking passengers but all the staff were great.

The meals were all nice as was the mid-flight ice cream which for a change on a flight wasn’t rock hard.

I am not a huge fan of their business class seat as while it is very private it does lack storage but is comfortable and I did get some sleep on the 13 hour flight.

The IFE when compared to Emirates lacks a lot of choice but was ok but I thought the amenity kit was a bit on the lacking side with no lip balm or moisturizer but it did come with a handy stand for your mobile phone.

Overall an enjoyable and on time flight and I would fly them again plus they have a very generous luggage allowance which is helpful after a few months away.

title: Excellent flight experience
review_text: I would like to express my sincere gratitude to the JAL’s registration- and flight service team of the flight JL 047 Tokyo Haneda to Helsinki, Finland on 21SEP 2024. To my surprise my seat was upgraded from Economy to Premium Economy just before arrival at the counter desk some minutes before boarding. The flight was smooth and the flight service team did excellent job.

title: Meh
review_text: The customer service is trash, like just look at other reviews, and they are right,flight itself was fine i guess, bt next time i think i’ll book ANA instead, overall, basically just like American Airlines but a little bit better

title: Terrible communication, useless website and loooooong refund waiting times.
review_text:
Worst air company experience I've ever had in my life. They cancelled my flight and said they would get in contact with me to rearrange the flights, which never happened. When I called back and asked what happened, they said they would return with options, and guess what? That never happened as well.

What happened if that they changed my flight and asked me to accept or decline in their website, which, guess what? Doesn't work. I'm not able to see or manage my bookings. It's like they're stuck on the 90s. The worst air company website I've seen in my life, you can't do anything there except to buy tickets I suppose. 

If you have any problem with your booking, don't expect to be able to solve it through the website. It's useless. 

Want a refund? You'll get it. But take your chair and wait for a good 2-3 months for the money to be back in your account. Don't have money to buy replacement tickets? That's your problem I suppose.

All in all, I haven't even started my trip to Japan and Japan Airlines has managed to make everything stressful and troublesome. Thanks Japan Airlines!

title: Customer Service is 50% of Flying...
review_text: Flights are good.. but the WORST website, app and customer service in the entire travel industry.. and thats really saying something!!! Not remotely possible to find your booking on the app, or online. The chatbot is laughable, customer service not available on weekends (what?). You simply cant access your reservation. Period. We will see if anyone actually answers the phone at any point. Sure, any product is 100%—unless you have a problem.. then you find out what the corporation is really like.

title: Poor customer service
review_text:
Had booked a flight to Japan with transfer in Finland. In Finland the flight got cancelled, and we sat there waiting for six hours before we got the final call about the flight being cancelled. They mainly gave the messages in Japanese, and didn’t seem to care too much about notifying the other passengers in English. They also gave snacks and drinks to everyone else waiting but not to us (probably because we were not Japanese). Our trip was delayed two days, but they gave us accommodation and 20euros for food those days. On the plane they could also have been better at bringing drinks during a 14 hour flight, in this time we only got offered drinks about two times other than when we got food. Other airlines are a lot better at this.
The worst part of this whole case is the requesting of compensation. Since we are under the passengers rights regulated by EC261/04 we are eligible for compensation for this two days delay. You cannot reach them by email, you have to call. They will make you wait for hours(!!!) before they pick up the phone. And their phone line is terrible so you can’t even hear what they say, this combined with poorly English makes this whole situation quite frustrating. It’s doesn’t even seem like they know the rules so they keep putting you on hold, declining our rights or avoid giving answers. I’ve never experienced this poor service. It’s probably a good airline when everything’s goes according to plan and when you don’t have to reach them though.

title: Japan Airlines (JAL) customer service number +1-800-580-3770
review_text: I had a fantastic experience flying with Japan Airlines (JAL) The staff were courteous, the seats were comfortable, and the in-flight service was exceptional. For any assistance, you can reach their toll-free number at +1-800-580-3770 or visit their office Tokyo. Highly recommend Japan Airlines for a pleasant journey!

title: Best flight!
review_text: The best flight I ever had! The seat was comfortable, food was decent, the flight attendants are friendly!! The aircraft was very clean. great airline.

title: Find another airline to fly!
review_text:
I am deeply unsatisfied with the service provided to me by JAL for a flight change. My family has been faithfully flying JAL since the late 80's and have ALWAYS used JAL for trips to Japan to see family. In the future this will not be the case. We intend to fly on one of their competitors that also offer non stop flights and far more reasonable pricing and that does not charge exorbitant  prices for a change in  flight plans. The cost quoted to me to change the FIRST LEG of my round trip airfare is more than the original round trip airfare. This makes no sense, the flight I wanted to change to has many empty seats and will most likely have empty seats when it departs. JAL needs to examine the level of service it is providing. It would be cheaper for me to walk away from my original booking and book a new round trip travel.  Additionally my daughter and wife recently traveled to Japan and the food they were served on that flight was abysmal. JAL had been riding on old positive reviews and ratings from its customers. The JAL of today is NOT the JAL of previous times!!

And one other thing, the website and the App are both absolutely abysmal. Neither of them perform well and the website does not allow you to search fir a round trip airfare now.

title: Choose other airlines if you could
review_text: They scratched my luggage really bad, with two big dents. When I talked to their CS at the airport, they just showed the careless attitude by pointing to a board and told me that’s a SMALL scratch. They never say a sorry to me in the whole conversation. Unbelievable careless.

title: The worst flight experience from JAL
review_text: This is the second time I flown on jal, last time was from HK to Narita, this time my flight wasn't delayed just an hour, by a freaking ine and half hour, I am writing this review on ground, as I can't get on plane yet, but I hope it is the same experience as last time , which was amazing! Only 2 stars thi, still bad duh, when I'm home, it's gonna be 12 am or 1 am

title: Not a baby friendly flight
review_text: If you are travelling with a baby , avoid JAL at all costs. Unlike other airlines, JAL has this bizarre practice of allowing only one adult per baby to sit at bassinet seats. This means you will be separated from the rest of the family on the plane and have to sit alone with the baby. Call centres or service counter refused to let my mother sit next to me to help me with the baby. I had two empty bassinet seats next to me and still they refused to let my mother sit next to me to help me. Also for some bizarre reason I was not able to book the bassinet seats when I purchased the tickets so had to rely on call centre and service counter. Do not trust the message on their website that says priority will be given to passenger with baby. They literally mean "passenger" in the singular form.

title: Now I see why JAL is almost always at the top of the pecking order for inflight service!
review_text: Japan Airlines inflight service stands head and shoulders above any U.S. based carrier. We had problems with my inflight display and the flight attendants went out of their way to fix the issue! They were also extremely apologetic. The seat is amazing (3K) and the interior noise level was very low. You didn't have to yell to be heard.

title: Amazing experience!
review_text: I love how they gave a menu for food and how tasty the food was. The drinks were really good too. I like how they have the latest movies and shows for entertainment.

title: Customer service made me miss my flight
review_text: I was so excited about my next trip to visit Japan and this made me dread ever coming back to the country. I arrived 4 hours early as I had a medical letter to get an upgrade. 4 hours later, I had no upgrade, missed my flight and they want me to pay for changing my flight. They need to fix their customer service. I got bounced around to so many agents only to be told there is nothing to be done and I missed my flight. Worst flying experience in my life.

title: Never again.
review_text: Im never flying Japan Airlines again. My new york to tokyo flight was torture with American Airlines (operated by JAL). No headphones for entertainment for 13 hr flight. Food was so so bad. Now they’re telling me my flight from tokyo to manila that my assigned seat doesnt have entertainment. A total of 18hrs flying time staring at nothing.

title: Japan Airlines stole my money
review_text:
Worst customer service ever. Called them to ask if I can appeal for my non-refundable ticket to get a full refund due to visa complications, they said to submit a refund form and they will get back to me. Submitted the refund form like they asked and they proceeded to cancel the ticket with no refund. I emailed them to say that I did not want my ticket to be cancelled if I cannot get a full refund, and they told me that there's nothing they can do because the cancellation has been processed.

So now I am left with no ticket and no refund.

title: If going Japan...
review_text:
Whenever you wanna travel Japan, this airlane, is in my humble opinion your best option, their staff is kind, and the amenities on the service make it worth it. 
I have traveled 3 times, and the last two of them where on this airlane, every single time we had a great time, all the service was incredible, and we had no problems at all!

title: 40 years in the making
review_text: A 40 year dream come true in September 2024. I am going to Japan. I am  chef by trade and worked 40 years ago in the Hotel Nikko, a JAL owned Hotel, in Düsseldorf. I learned a bit about the Japanese culture being friendly with the Japanese chefs had a brush of Japanese cuisine. This experience actually gave me the urge to travel, which I actually did. I worked in Israel,  Saudi Arabia, China, Hong Kong and Indonesia but never made it to Japan. I am really looking forward to experience, a one in a lifetime experience, JAL business class.

title: One booking reference, but still my family could not sit together
review_text:
Friendly staff, ok food, interior of the airplane looks nice. 

The entertainment system barely has english subtitles, which is inconvenient because of all the (engine) noise in economy class english spoken movies are not always easy to follow. 

However, we had 1 booking, 6months ahead with 1 family. But they did not give us seats  next to each other. They sell the window seats for extra money. So only 2 people can sit together, as result dad was sitting 6 rows behind the rest of the family and they were not willing to change it because window seats are paid. Tried to change it upfront by phone, by the seat reservation system, in the airport and onboard. No luck Very sad, daughter was crying for an hour... We've seen other families being spread over the economy class as well, so we were not the only ones. So I would not recommend flying with them if you expect the free seats from 1 booking/family to always end up next to each other.

title: JAL, Always Late Airline
review_text: JAL is always late. They start boarding 15 minutes to the scheduled flight and they end up delaying the flight. Pilots have chance to make up the lost time in flight but they choose not to. Upon arriving they apologize for the delays with excuses such as winds, heavy airport trafic, etc but these are not true. Assume about 1 hour delay if you fly with JAL domestic.

title: Excellent Services!
review_text: We (2) flew from Bangkok to Tokyo and to Dallas in July 2024. The ground officer at BKk was nice and helpful. The air hostesses were helpful for getting medication for my wife. The food was delicious. The airplane was nice and clean. The movies were good.

title: Great customer service
review_text: This is the first time my wife and I have travelled with JAL business class and having got a great deal for travel to the UK we decided to tryout their premium service. Firstly I want to stress that the cabin staff are absolutely brilliant and although their English is average they do their very best to communicate with you. The 7 seats across each row in business is in my opinion too many. The seats are only slightly larger than premium economy and as a flat bed turning from side to side is difficult. Their pricing makes them an ideal choice for value seekers but if you are looking for a “true” business class experience then perhaps Singapore would be far better if a lot more expensive. The food on the flights was good especially the steak but the selection was only average. Lastly the entertainment available to English speaking customers is very poor and well below that of comparable airlines. I would recommend them for value and customer service but lacking in the refinements of some of their competitors.

title: Never again: JAL has long passed its peak.
review_text: JAL has long passed its peak. As a Business guest, I had to accept a downgrade to Economy on a feeder flight. I then had to spend 8 hours (!) at the counter in Tokyo. I had to spend the night in front of the counter. The employees were incompetent and just kept apologising. I was not given any compensation. On the alternative flight, then in Business, the TV did not work. I was brought the wrong menu. The crew only realised this when the things I had ordered were not available. There was no apology. All in all, I have never been so disappointed with a flight and an airline. JAL's staff are friendly but incompetent in exceptional situations.

title: Worst travel experience of my life.
review_text: After experiencing a six hour layover my scheduled flight was delayed eight more hours due to mechanical issues. They said they could not put me on another flight. Will not use this airline again.

title: Awesome experience!
review_text: I chose Japan Airlines to take my daughter to school in Australia, rather than opt for a shorter trip, as I read the seats reclined more than most. This was true, and in addition to very comfy seats, the staff and food were outstanding!! I also managed to get us an upgrade to business class on one leg of our journey, and the lie flat seats were something special. We were on a newer aircraft from JFK to Tokyo and it felt like First Class. I will def be flying with Japan Airlines again.

title: Bad
review_text: Flew JAL years ago and remember it was fine. This time around I can see airline has really gone downhill. First, on the flight to Japan our seats were changed without notice. I wanted an aisle seat so this was disappointing. On the flight the left side bathrooms weren’t working so only the set on the right could be used. The toilet seats also looked like they haven’t been changed in a long time. Given how clean the public bathrooms are in Japan the fact that the airline’s toilets were old and nasty is gross. For flight back home 50 minutes before scheduled boarding received notice of a 5 hour delay due to aircraft rotation. What the heck does that even mean?  And if that was the case why not notify us earlier so we could have spent more time in Tokyo instead of at the airport. I really very disappointed in JAL. Will fly ANA next time.

title: Great Experience with JAL
review_text:
Flew first class on Boeing 773 from Haneda to Chicago.

Overall great experience with hard and soft product. Lounge at airport amazing as well.

Not much to fault and expectations were met given First Class service with a Japanese carrier.

Pros:
* Amazing multi-course meals and food selection which would give top restaurants a run for their money. Same with Alcohol.
* Great amenity kit.
* Unbeatable service from check-in at airport to staff on board.
* Royal treatment at every and any point in your journey where JAL is in charge and has control.

Cons:
* Seats show signs of wear and tear given their age. Also, when it comes to style, privacy and ergonomics, JAL seats in First falling behind the times when compared to newer First class seats with other airlines (however JAL A350 have newer seats).
* TV monitors on board are not of highest resolution (behind when it comes to its competitors).
* Bathrooms are nothing special and fall behind competitor First class offerings.

Overall great experience. Highly recommended!

title: Good in-service experience, but bags were damaged during transit
review_text:
The in-flight experience was mostly enjoyable, with friendly staff and good food and beverage options. The premium economy is pretty comfortable for long-haul flights. The in-flight entertainment had some great selections, but I was somewhat disappointed the volume of movies and shows to select from.

The biggest disappointment came in Japan Airlines' handling of my personal items. One of my larger bags was severely damaged during travel, to the point that my large suitcase is no longer functional (the handle was crushed and no longer extends...see photos). When I submitted a claim, I was only offered a $75 reimbursement for a suitcase worth close to $200, not to mention the cost of the airline ticket for premium economy. The handling of this situation will directly impact my thinking around future flight purchases with JA.

title: JAL follows the rules - even if it is unethical
review_text:
I wanted to cancel my flight because my wife is pregnant and I want to be there for the birth.

After numerous back and forth, they are still adamant about me paying a USD 200 cancellation fee despite me...
1. Having a legitimate reason
2. Cancelling 6 months in advance
3. Tickets being SGD 1,000 more expensive now than when I booked

Japan Airlines has truly disappointed me with their inflexible and uncompassionate disposition.

Don't you have expecting fathers or mothers among your employees?
I guess compassion doesn't translate well to Japanese.
No wonder your suicide rates are so high.

title: Easy and Helpful Rebooking
review_text: Great economy seats, service, food, and entertainment. What really stood out was during our rare delay in Bangkok, JAL staff were helpful in rebooking onto a flight that I found while waiting in line that would get us back home in time, and give us a layover in Tokyo to explore for a while. Not only did they rebook us without question, our bags arrived as normal in Tokyo and they even paid for our transportation into the city and a nice hotel room. Very happy with their service and would fly with JAL anywhere possible.

title: Excellent. JAL beats them all in economy!
review_text:
JAL were absolutely fantastic. I have flown on 'the big 3' (Etihad,Emirates and Qatar), and I can say with confidence, I feel JAL were better than all 3.

Professionalism and service 10/10. Even in economy, the flight crew could not do enough for you, exceptionally polite and respectful, and the kind of service normally reserved for business and first class.

The in-flight meal was delicious, hearty and sizeably larger than most other economy sized meals on other airlines. 

Seat configuration on the 787 and 767 were 2-4-2 which I also prefer as it does feel there is more legroom and individual space compared to most other major airlines. 

All in all, 2 long gruelling flights were made much easier and comfortable due to JAL's excellence. In my opinion, unrivaled in economy from all other major airlines in Europe, Middle East and USA. 

Thank you JAL.

title: CANCEL YOUR FLIGHTS WITH JAL
review_text:
A COMPLETE ZERO, terrible experience with customer service today. A complete mess and RUDE customer service!! I was trying to book the same flight as my family at the SAME TIME they were booking but the JAL website was showing an error. After refreshing the page for an hour and a half I decided to book it the next morning and the price went up $340!! Although it shows seats are available at the original price through a 3rd party I called the customer service rep (I wish I got her name!) and she was so rude... I told her my name multiple times after she called me the wrong name, and then she LAUGHED at me. They refuse to match the price even though it was THEIR ERROR on their website. My family has booked 5 other tickets and this customer service representative was so unhelpful and rude we are all never flying with JAL. 
My family is cancelling all tickets and booking on a different airline. 

I was on the call for close to an HOUR. 

If I could leave a minus rating I would.

title: Functional
review_text:
It's efficient but functional. There's no personal touch. The language barrier was difficult for me as a hidden disabilities traveller.
The plane was ok but seats uncomfortable,  food mediocre. The vegetarian "snack" on boarding was a bread roll with a slice of lettuce and a slice of tomato in it!! 
JAL did get our luggage transferred to a connecting flight efficiently.

title: Major disappointment
review_text: Never ever again. I had a very miserable experience from their business class. Everything is old and dirty. I flew in many airline companies including Qatar airlines and this one can't even come close to Qatar  and Dubai and even Lufthansa. Upgrade your airplanes it's nasty.

title: Old crappy seats-no eye mask--yukky
review_text:
This is the worst Business class experience I have ever had. The planes are old. The food is average at best. They made me check in 3 times--each airport.
They didn't even have an amenity pouch so no eye mask for sleeping.
The lay down seats are hard and old and the blankets are thin and no you can't have two.
No on-line check in--so no getting your seat or food chosen ahead of time.
it was awful!!!

title: BAD Experience
review_text: Lost my luggage during transition flight, spent few hours at the airport try to figure that out. got to hotel at midnight with no clean clothes and No store open. Found it two days after, and found the luggage was badly damaged, with the case can't close completely. They offer my US$50 for compensation said because my luggage only damaged one side, and it's NOT 100% total lost. WTF...... back and forth with JAL in email, wasting time and energy. JAL sucks

title: Soulless uncomfortable red eye business class experience
review_text: I bought business class tickets for my wife and me to go to Chicago from Delhi via Tokyo, and return via Honolulu. As such, nothing is terribly wrong but overall it is a very poor quality of experience. Right from check in through to in flight service is okay but soulless. The seats are good; the television does not really work and is very glitchy. Very few movies (relative to something like United) and movies have poor prints and keep stopping or being erratic. But the worst part is the cabin service. While the cabin attendants are very polite, they are politely ineffective. A meal service takes 3-4 hours and in a 8-9 hour flight, lights are barely dimmed and if so, then hardly so for 1 hour or so. I buy business class tickets mainly for the flat bed and ability to sleep through a red eye flight but JAL makes that impossible. I would not recommend it to anyone.

title: JAPAN Airlines Professional and Excellent Service, Food, Staff !!  The Best !!
review_text:
I have chosen JALfor 4 Trips to Asia, and I find that the Comfort, Food, and Service is one of the Best of all Airlines.  I flew on June 12th, 2024 on Flight 712 from Singapore to Narita, then on Flight 58 from Narita to SFO.  On Both Flights the Food is Beyond Excellent.  My wife, Judy Ng believes it is Michelin Star fine dining quality,  The effort and planning of the Food shows Excellent work by the chefs and staff.   Secondly,   I would like to commend the Stewardess Staff on both Flight JAL Flight 712 and JAL Flight 58 on June 12, 2024 on Business Class.   They did such a wonderful job, I wrote their names down:  first names were Kondo and Handa on Flight 712 Business Class, and Ms Aoki and Ms Seto on Flight 58 Business class  ,  both on June 12th.   I believe me and my wife spoke to each Stewardess and were overjoyed with their kindness and service.   On Flight 712, we spoke to the Manager of the Crew I believe.  Thirdly,  I'd like to commend the JAL organization for their ability to switch my wifes non-window seat to an "locked"  Window seat on Business, and they were able to move me so that we were togeather.    This request Started in Singapore JAL Check In ( I have a photo of both the ticket agent lady, and her Manager) who took the matter and contacted Narita Airport Staff to execute the Seat Change.   What FANTASTIC coordination and Service !!   Thank you !!  We were met at the gate by JAL Staff person and she had a sign for  Ms Judy Ng ( Wife) and escorted to the transfer desk/Sekura First class lounge for re-ticketing.   Every thing was so quickly &
professionally done.  What a overall professional organization and Staff.   Thank you.    Judyhippofant@yahoo.com and RichJohnLee@yahoo.com

title: Thank you Ms. Yamanouchi from Japan airlines HKD check in counter
review_text: On June 14, 2024, we flew from HKD to NRT on flight JAL584. Ms. Yamanouchi went above and beyond to assist us with our luggage check-in and boarding passes. She even included a heartfelt thank-you note, making our experience with Japan Airlines truly memorable. We were deeply touched by this personalized gesture. Thank you, Ms. Yamanouchi!

title: One of the best airlines
review_text: One of the best airlines out there. The flight attendants were super nice. The food was great. The seats were comfy, the plane was clean. Overall a great experience

title: Compare JAL and ANA first Class
review_text:
Comparison of the first class services of Japan Airlines (JAL) and All Nippon Airways (ANA):

---

Service

In terms of service, Japan Airlines (JAL) clearly has the upper hand. JAL's cabin crew is renowned for their friendliness, professionalism, and meticulous attention to detail. Whether addressing passenger needs or handling unexpected situations, JAL staff respond quickly and gracefully, making passengers feel warmly welcomed. While ANA's service is also excellent, it falls slightly short in the finer details compared to JAL.

Food

JAL also excels in the food department. The first-class meals on JAL are designed by Michelin-starred chefs, offering a diverse and delicious selection, especially in Japanese cuisine. The ingredients are fresh, and the presentation is exquisite, reflecting the chef's dedication in every dish. Although ANA's food is also good, it is somewhat less impressive in terms of taste and refinement compared to JAL.

Hardware Facilities

When it comes to hardware facilities, ANA takes the lead. ANA's first-class seats are more spacious and comfortable, providing better privacy and entertainment options. The seat design is more modern and comes with a more advanced entertainment system and seat control features. However, it is worth noting that JAL is continually improving its hardware facilities. Although their latest first-class equipment has not been widely implemented yet, it is expected to catch up with or even surpass ANA in the future.

 Amenity Kits, Pajamas, and Slippers

In terms of amenity kits, pajamas, and slippers, ANA is more thoughtful. ANA provides high-quality skincare products and comfortable pajamas in their amenity kits, and the slippers are designed with great care, ensuring passengers feel more comfortable and relaxed during long flights. In comparison, while JAL's amenity kits are also quite good, they are slightly less impressive in terms of detail and material quality.

Conclusion

Overall, JAL outperforms in service and food, offering passengers a superior experience. On the other hand, ANA excels in hardware facilities and amenity kits, focusing more on passenger comfort. If you prioritize in-flight service and food quality, JAL is a great choice; if you value seat comfort and privacy more, ANA would be the better option. Ultimately, the choice between the two airlines depends on personal preferences and needs.

title: Terrible Customer Service, The Company has no morale, never fly with JAL
review_text:
Purchased 4 business class route trips for my family vacation from JFK->HND,
The flight was delayed for a day due to JAL's own fault and airline promised reimburstment for a single day during the check in.

Following their instruction, I submitted the documentations via email to JAL(jfkll@jal.com) 
After waiting or 3 weeks. I finally called JAL. Upon confirming my information, they refused to reimburst for my lost of hotel use, which is only $400(relative to the cost of 4 business flights).

This amount of money is not too significant, but morally this feels wrong. JAL is dishonest and will look to scam you every chance they get.

title: Overal sastified
review_text: I recently booked a flight from San Francisco through JAL's website and was incredibly impressed with the experience. The website has a clean, user-friendly design that made it easy to navigate and find the best flight options. The booking process was straightforward, and I appreciated how seamlessly everything worked. Checking in online was also a breeze, allowing me to avoid long lines at the airport.The flight attendants were friendly and attentive. If you are flying to Japan, take this airline. If I had to find any drawback, it was that there were not as many entertainment options as other airlines, but still had plenty of choices.

title: Very good
review_text: Exceptional staff attitude from check in, onboard up to my arrival in Tokyo Haneda. Proactive, client orientated, and a perfect example for japanese know how of service and respect. Next time hopefully on a long distance flight.

title: Helpful staff
review_text: We had to fly from Osaka to Tokyo and then on to Sydney. Our first flight was late leaving Osaka because of bad weather so only had 1/2 hour to get from terminal 1 to 3 in Tokyo. The staff were very helpful with one staff member walking us and then onto shuttle bus to terminal 3 then  another took over through security and waited until we boarded. We found them so helpful and the seats in economy were roomy.

title: Needs better communication
review_text: Japan airlines is constantly surprising me how poorly they communicate in English. One airport has a same day check in, while the other is 4 hours before only, leaving me and my family stranded in the airport waiting to check in with over 115 degrees outside in Delhi airport where there are no restaurants before security. They didn't even have a specific check in counter and we had to deal with the unhelpful information desk. Because of their lack of communication, my family has now been put in a difficult situation 2 times on this one trip. I was told they have amazing service, but only if you know how to find information hidden away on their website. Good luck if you travel with them.

title: Terrible service
review_text: Awful service. Unorganized. Asked for a glass of water and got a rude reply to wait till food is served since there will be water on the food tray! Such a terrible flight attendant behaviour. Also, there was a question to choose beef or chicken and when I said chicken she replied we run out of chicken. So what is the point of asking then!? And how can you run out of food when you just strated from your base airport!? Terrible service, rude attendant - probably not all flight attendants, just this one I was unfortunate to have serving my row. She influenced negativly the whole JAL experience, can not beleive who they employ.

title: Worst checkin experience
review_text: Worst checkin experience I've every had via self checkin, took long time and so many steps and wasn't  even seated next to partner. Online booking managing dificult to use as well and staff at counter coulsnt help to fix.

title: JAL is the best!
review_text: JAL is my favourite airline. If I am crossing the Pacific it will be my first choice. Firstly the cabin crew are superb. They go out of their way to serve, I was impressed. Food, top notch, Wines was excellent. Seat very comfortable, a mattress was helpful. Love the cardigan that they gave. The plane was sleek.

title: Great flight!
review_text: I enjoyed this trip. I had paid seating upgrade which made the trip a lot better @183 cm tall. The food is excellent and the flight crew are amazing. Do not buy the WIFI it is a complete scam. Across the pacific and down the coast of China and Japan and it never worked nor did they try hard to get it working when asked for help. Also the plane was in incredible shape. The other airlines could learn from JAL! No Duct Tape anywhere! The plane looked like it was new.

title: Their Premium Economy is not what you expect.
review_text: Think carefully about premium economy.  Not the greatest.  Most disappointing is they are part of the one world alliance.  Being a sapphire member you'd think they would not disappoint. On my return I checked in at least 10 hours earlier.  I found I couldn't get my preference of an aisle seat. What happens is you have couples taking both aisle seat in the centre arrangements and abuse the system.  They put in in the J seat with is the front seating.  The problem is that you share both tray an TV screen.  Instead of independently living the arm rest you could only lift one wat between two. The person next to me continually ripped open with such force. I could not sleep or get comfortable.  Not only that, the seat I was assigned to was not comfortable.  I saw at least four hours to go and I contemplated sitting on the floor.  Eventually I sat on the pillow and blanket to make it less stressful and relieve the pain from sitting.  Not only that they were happy to take other customers meal tray and refused to take mine. Anyway they blamed the travel agent and ignores the one world alliance sapphire membership.  Thus couples booked both aisle seats and paid for two seat and got three in return while I booked a seat which was nothing more than economy and paid premium prices.

title: Japanese JAL customer service is a joke. Their politeness is a myth.
review_text:
First, my wife and I tried to call JAL on the phone the day before travelling. They were useless on the phone. They could not upgrade us over the phone like every other airline could. Then they couldn’t even seat us together via either the crappy app or on the phone.
Next, when checking in at the airport after several failed attempts via phone we were able to upgrade. They told us the price would be 30,000 Yen each and we agreed. Then when they took us to another counter to pay they said the price is 40,000 Yen each. We told them the first check in ppl told us the 30k but they didn’t have a clue and we just paid the 40k. So already feeling ripped off. 
Next the lounge situation. What a joke. If I had checked in on the app I was able to purchase entry to the Sakura lounge for us both and was happy to pay. But then guess what ? If you pay to upgrade your seat you are NOT ALLOWED to even pay to get into the lounge. Seriously? Wow. 
Next, I’m disabled and had registered for mobility assistance. I can’t walk far or stand for long so I need a wheelchair to the gate. I have been travelling all over the world registering as needing mobility assistance and never was asked why. Until today. The counter assistant asked me why I needed the wheelchair and if I was on medication… just wow. No other airline or country has ever asked these things. So right after explaining that she went back behind the counter said something to her coworker (the JAL employees all seem to work one job in pairs for some unknown reason)  and they literally laughed out loud at whatever she said. Now I can only assume that was at my expense. So so rude, so much for Japanese hospitality. 
Next, it takes two people to take us through security and customs, one to push the wheelchair and one to do nothing but supervise the whole thing. Very weird. So they say we cannot access any lounge and leave us our gate. As soon as they leave us, my wife goes to an information desk and they direct us straight to one of the lounges where we were able to pay and access. Again, seriously?? What a joke of customer service.

title: Definitely won’t fly with JAL again
review_text: I was traveling for business and booked my husband as well - despite calling JAL to connect our bookings over a month before departure, they are now saying we can’t sit together?!? Terrible for the airline meant to be a leader in customer experience

title: JAL is a terrible airline
review_text: I fly all the time and JAL is by far the worst airline I have ever flown.  I booked business class tickets but when I checked in I found out they didn’t offer business class on my flight.  They called it “like business class” because they offered water and juice.  But they charged a “business class” price and listed it as business class.  False advertising.  They would only let me carry on my computer and a couple other things that weighed a total of 10 pounds.  I had to check everything.  They kept weighing and re-weighing until it was exactly 10 pounds.  We were also in the last group to board the plane.  I will never fly JAL again.  What a shady airline.  In the same class as Spirit Airlines in the USA.

title: An Excellent and most customer-centric Airline with cabin crew that is nothing short of exemplary professionalism
review_text:
I took a return flight on 30th Apr 2024 from Singapore to San Francisco on JL36 and JL2 and on 4th May 2024 on JL57 and JL711. My experience with JAL on those flights has been fantastic. Cabin crew’s professionalism had been exemplary. They were courteous, attentive, smart and incredibly efficient. Cabin and toilets were clean, well maintained and quiet. They were also equipped with automatic bidet. Illumination and dimming of lights of the cabin were graceful and gentle to the eyes, adjustable window’s tint instead of the pull-down one, excellent foods in the economy class with wide variety of choices of beverages- juices, red and white wines, green tea, water, soft drinks. JAL is by far the most customer-centric airline I have been on. 
I absolutely recommend JAL and look forward to fly JAL again.

title: The WORST!
review_text: It was the worst experience I’ve ever had on any airline in business class.  I was seated in a center aisle seat and it was awful!  I feel they should not charge regular fares for those seats.  I felt like I was in a coffin.  The service was almost non existent and the food was yucky.  It was my first flight with them and certainly my last.

title: Great Airline
review_text: I have been flying JAL for few years now from Boston to Jakarta and by far the best airline compare to other choices out of BOS. Every single staff from check in to FA are super friendly. Foods on board are also good.

title: Terrible service
review_text:
Terrible service, website is useless, you can’t check in online, so when you get to the airport you find out your entire family is split all across the plane, and they can’t do anything about it. 
Avoid this airline!

title: First Class Service with an Economy Ticket
review_text:
I flew from SFO to Tokyo on JL 001. Then on the same day I caught a connector to Kagoshima with my 86 year old father who has issues walking. ALL of the flight attendants were professional and very pleasant. They took the time to make sure my elderly father was comfortable and safe.

I fly alot on business domestically, and our domestic airlines could learn alot from JAL!

title: Premium experience even in economy class
review_text:
Good seat, good food, good entertainment. JAL delivers top class service even in the cheap seats. 

In flight entertainment had one of the better selections I've seen on an Asian carrier. And more logically arranged. An entire season of Kimichika Kazama Kyojo Zero was on offer, and soaked up flight time. Much better than scattered episodes of multiple TV shows. All the while, plenty of drinks and snacks were served.

A paid exclusive meal is available on flights from Japan, and I had Kabayaki eel for the first time. One of the friendly flight attendants explained each of the dishes, and how to best enjoy them. I'm not an adventurous diner, but everything was tops. Was very nice to have someone guide me through the menu, JAL customer service is aces. As for the price, a bit on the high side at $30. A comparable paid meal on ANA is only ¥2500, or just under $17 USD at today's rates. 

Impossible to choose between JAL and ANA. They're both very very good at making long haul flights bearable, even enjoyable.

title: Great seats, across all classes
review_text:
We flew to Japan in both premium economy and regular economy. This is one of the best premium products that we have experienced. Good seating, trademark exceptional service, and fun food. 
Even the economy class seats are newer and feature a better leg support that actually slides forward, producing way more comfort. Will fly again and worth it.

title: Flying with JAL for the first time
review_text: First time trying JAL because I got switched to JAL from Cathay Pacific the food was nice best part was the  ice cream and the Coca Cola nice seats

title: Flight delays and too bad for you! But nothing we can do!
review_text: Supposed to leave today for a 7 day trip to Tokyo to be told my flight is delayed 22 hours due to aircraft rotation. I now paid for 2 car services that have to be  rebooked and a non refundable night in a hotel that I won’t be using. My only option cancel entire trip or agree to change- no offer to reimburse expenses, voucher for future flights and even refused to let me change my return flight to give me my day back!

title: Terrible internet connectivity. Uncomfortable seats.
review_text: Spent a lot on Business Class. No Internet the entire flight. Seat would not go flat like it was supposed to so couldn’t sleep. Everyone from JAL is very nice but couldn’t fix the problem. I flew on a Boeing 757. On flight home on an Airbus plane, internet was also terrible working less than 20% of the time. That’s pathetic for business class on a wide body. Next time I will fly a different airline.

title: Amazing, world class travel experience on JAL!
review_text: First time traveling on JAL. They were exceptional, great layout of the A350-1000, largest 4k screen I have seen in any business class....to top it off, curated business class menu by top chefs and amazing hospitality.  Definitely not my last time flying JAL!

title: Japan Airlines flight is memorable
review_text: We have visited Japan three times; our favorite trip was to Hokkaido. The major city Sapporo is a large energetic capital; we visited everything from restaurants to Sapporo's opera house. The island's culture is memorable. The National Park and Museum was wonderful. We had marvelous passenger treatment on Japan Airlines. We were served with Ramen noodles, followed up with a half-bottle of French champagne. Taking Japan Airlines was a rewarding selection for our family.

title: Great Experience 10/10 recommended
review_text: I first time travelled with this airline and the experience was 10/10. Halal food, courteous staff, best service. Making the long tiresome flights amazing and beautiful. Meal and snack times are amazing plus ample legspace and comfortable seats behind business class.

title: Overrated
review_text:
We were so excited about our trip to Japan that we decided to splurge and fly JAL instead of the cheaper options. I ended up paying $2k for a round trip flight, more than I’ve paid for any other international flight. I was told the experience was great and it was worth the price, but that was not the case.

The person I’m flying with has status on Alaska Air and was able to choose seats. When I booked the flight, I wasn’t given the option to choose seats. Fast forward to trying to check-in and I STILL didn’t have a seat assigned — for an international flight that I spent $2k on! The person working at the counter was able to help me pick a non-middle seat but the experience was still stressful. Also, trying to find your reservation on their app is a nightmare. On my return flight I was never able to access it.

I am a vegetarian option and picked this as a special meal option. The meals they served leaned vegan. I basically got mushrooms and rice on my way there (x2 meals), and some vegetarian stew and rice (x2 meals) on the way home, which I didn’t even finish. The person I was flying with got margherita pizza for his 2nd meal and ice cream on the way there — which are both vegetarian and much better options than what I was served. I love airplane food and it’s usually my favorite part of the flight. All the meals and snacks I had on JAL were disappointing.

I tried to sleep on the way home since it was essentially an overnight flight but kept getting woken up by the flight attendants. This was also odd to me.

Lastly, the plane felt old and nothing special. I was hoping to be wowed here as well as I have been with other airlines.

I will never be flying JAL again and would never recommend it. What a bummer.

title: Very good experience once again
review_text:
Security / Immigration : There wasn't any separate queue for First / Business Class passengers at Haneda then , which led to a long waiting time. I believe this has changed in recent months.

Lounge : Instead of JAL's own lounge , we went to the Cathay Pacific lounge one floor above. Very plush , excellent views of the tarmac and much better F&B options

Boarding : Zone-wise boarding was implemented religiously. Expect slight delays in boarding time at Haneda though.

Seating / Layout : Same reverse herringbone seats that were there on our other flights ( 1-2-1 ). Comfortable ? Yes. But might be a bit tight for some. Also , the headrest tends to oscillate with turbulence , while in lie-flat position.

Service : Kudos to the 2 senior cabin crew members handling Business Class , who were exceptional at their job. Thoroughly impressed.

Food & Beverage : The best out of the 4 flights we took. The Japanese fare was top-notch.

Arrival : Dedicated First / Business Immigration counter at DEL. Luggage came on a priority basis as well.

title: Comfortable flight from Honolulu
review_text:
Check-in : Very courteous staff. One of the Business Class counters got busy handling a Premium Economy passenger's ticket issues , and it was temporarily 'closed'. Thus , this led to a long queue for just 1 active counter i.e. slower clearance than even the regular counters.

Lounge : Japan Airlines has its own lounge at HNL , in partnership with American Airlines. The food was great , and so were the garden views.

Boarding : Streamlimed process , with zone-wise boarding being implemented.

Seating / Layout : Reverse herringbone seats , with a 1-2-1  pattern. Comfortable for the flight to Tokyo.

Service : Very good chief purser , who ensured that everything was immaculate. Some of her team members were not up to the mark though.

Food & beverage : Both the Japanese & Western options were horrid , as expected from Ex-USA flights.

Arrival : We were parked at the very last gate of Haneda , leading to a long walk to Immigration. No separate queue for Business Class passengers.

title: Great service and food but angled flat seat, luggage damage issue ultimately well handled
review_text:
I flew from Hong Kong to Osaka, taking Cathay Pacific from HK to Bangkok and then connecting to Japan Airlines JL728 from Bangkok to Osaka (Kansai).  After arriving at my hotel (Hilton Osaka) in Osaka, I discovered that one of the 4 wheels on my suitcase had been damaged such that it would not roll in certain directions, having been rammed in towards the suitcase and scraping the bottom of the suitcase when rolled.  I initially contacted Cathay since my luggage tag was issued by Cathay but they explained that airline rules dictate the last carrier in connecting flights is responsible for luggage.  I then contacted Japan Airlines and was initially told that any damage had to be reported at the airport before I left the arrivals area or JAL would not be responsible.  I reasoned with JAL that as Kansai airport provided luggage carts, I simply took my suitcase off the luggage carousel and put it on a luggage cart and never had to wheel it around until I arrived at my hotel.  Initially JAL staff stuck to their policy but thanks to some assistance in Japanese from the staff at Hilton Osaka (highly recommend!) and my pointing out that JAL's own website and the conditions of carriage shown on their website only indicate damage has to be reported to a JAL office within 7 days, JAL referred the matter to a manager and I was generously offered a replacement suitcase as a special favour.  In fact, when  staff initially contacted me and offered a replacement suitcase that was a zippered suitcase and I indicated my damaged suitcase was a hard frame suitcase and I would prefer that, staff actually worked hard to find me two other options that were hard frame suitcases to see if they suited my needs better. 

I had hoped JAL could simply fix the damaged wheel on my suitcase but JAL explained that repairs would take months in their normal procedures and so was not practical (Hilton Osaka confirmed the same for me by calling local luggage repair companies).  JAL also arranged to have my damaged suitcase sent back to them so that they could have parts of it recycled rather than simply thrown away by me, a very green step.  

It started as a frustrating run in with inflexible and what to me seemed like unreasonable policy, but it ended on a very kind and generous note with JAL going above and beyond to provide me with a usable replacement suitcase in a very quick timeframe. 

As for the flight itself, I had a couple of hours connection time and used the JAL Sakura lounge at Kansai.  The lounge is quite large with lots of seating areas and a dining area where largely food is ordered from staff from the displayed menu and then prepared by staff and placed on a tray to be taken away by the guest.  The menu items look simple but the quality of the food is always very good and delicious. 

The flight was delayed about 50 minutes due to the incoming flight being late due to bad weather.  The flight is an overnight flight scheduled to depart 12:55 am and arrive at 8:10 am.  Unfortunately, this overnight flight has always been operated with a B787-800 in a 2X2X2 configuration in business class with the Shell Flat Neo seat, an angled flat seat rather than a fully horizontal flat seat like the Sky Suite seat on other JAL long haul flights.  I had an aisle seat but as the cabin appeared to be about 1/3 empty, was fortunate to have no one sit at the window seat beside me and so could shift over to the window seat for more privacy when sleeping.  

Prior to take off, breakfast orders are taken.  After take off, there is a quick service of a snack but most passengers opted to immediately go to sleep.  About 2 hours before arrival, breakfast is served.  Passengers have the option to skip breakfast and not to be woken up by the flight attendants but I think that is fairly useless as the lights are turned up and there is noise anyway from breakfast service to other passengers.  Therefore overall for an overnight flight, it is difficult to get much good sleep on this flight, particularly due to the angled flat seat rather than a fully flat bed seat.  

Nevertheless, as always with Japan Airlines, the service onboard is superb and the food is very good.  The toilets are always clean because the cabin attendants constantly clean and then neatly fold the toilet paper tip into a triangle.  This is a good solid overnight flight and a good use of time.  But it is not an ideal flight to sleep on due to the older angled flat seats and the configuration that requires the window seat passenger to step over the aisle passenger for access.

title: Another Scam Airline
review_text: I asked for Isle seat they said no problem.  I was assigned to middle seat.  The food also sucks, I've had better canned food then that crap. For dessert the ice cream was so hard you couldn't chip it with knife, so I trashed it... Never again.

title: Smooth flight is a pleasure
review_text: We had never taken Japan Airlines. Boarding JAL in Sapporo was smooth. The stewardesses were very helpful; service was marvelous. The young lady asked if we would like noodles, so she bought ramen noodles. She asked us if we woud like
