title: Quick comfortable Premium Economy flight
review_text:
"Daylight flight" from Haneda Airport in Tokyo direct to JFK in New York City (11 AM takeoff, but cabin lights dimmed after first meal for people to sleep) . Premium economy allows you access to the Sakura lounge at Haneda - take advantage; it's spacious, clean and supplied with multiple food and beverages.
The flight, on an Airbus 350, was full so nice that Premium Economy gave you access to a spacious dedicated bathroom, dedicated except when the attendants were serving beverages and food in economy. Bathroom even has a bidet seat.
Check-in went smoothly once you realized that you get your baggage tag from a kiosk before going to the dedicated Premium Economy line. 
Seats reclined within a shell so they do not lean into the space behind (or in front of) you. Motorized recline and leg rest controls, with a foot rest. Spacious unless you have a lot of things in the foot well.
Entertainment system was efficient, but I found the selections a bit limited as I am current on most movies and am not Japanese and so do not follow their TV series. Ended up listening to soft music to sleep to. Airline provides noise-cancelling on-the-ear headphones which did a fair job of masking plane noises.
Meals were similar to what I would expect in Economy, although you were able to request small servings of instant ramen noodles and they handed out steamed buns (red bean filling?) during the flight.
Flight attendants came by often and were very pleasant.
As I was able to pay with Alaska Airlines miles, at a very good rate, this flight was a great value (thanks point.me), based on a suggested rate in a review of this flight segment by someone else.

title: Excellent!
review_text: We flew to and from Japan with Japan Airlines  and internally to Sapporo and were very happy with the flights, all of which left on time.. The planes were in excellent condition with comfortable seating, excellent, attentive and very friendly service and reasonable meals. Our only complaint was that the inflight entertainment had only a small selection of films with no recent releases.

title: Sincere help from the Japan Airline crew
review_text: On this occasion, our family would like to express our gratitude for the work of the Japan Air Line crew and especially Goto San at Narita airport who have helped a lot in an incident that we did not want to happen to one of our family members on March 11 2024.

title: Excellent service and great staff
review_text: Excellent service and great staff made for an enjoyable flight. Meal menu had good selection to choose from. Good selection of inflight entertainment. Seat comfortable.

title: exceeding expectations
review_text: phenomenal, i mean it! I was flying JL 745 onboard one of their B787s. this was the first time i flew 787! food was good, legroom was good, the IFE had so many options! crew was very nice! be sure to choose this airline!

title: More staff training needed
review_text: Flight attendants need better training. Passengers don't need to be woken up for every little thing. If passengers are resting, it would be best to let them sleep instead of waking them up to ask them to wear their seat belts even though it was not during a take off nor during landing. If they are asleep, it would be better not to wake them up to ask them if they want a drink or to eat. Excessive disturbance of passengers can be very stressful as sometimes what passengers need is a good rest during a long haul flight. Please train your staff better.

title: Lies re business class seat and refusal to resolve after
review_text: Appealing airline to work with. They promised a sky suite for business class and then moved to a smaller aircraft and downgraded to regional business (sloping hard old seats). Advised this was done to save full and that a visa compensation voucher would be provided.  They even provided a form to claim. Then refuses to issue it. First and last time to fly with them as they outright lie about their business product and it is nothing better them a premium economy half the time as they swap you to a smaller craft with no notice. Deceitful airline and appalling service.

title: Two Angels
review_text: Yuzuka Sonobe and Mahiro ito - cannot praise these two members of staff - the airline should promote these ladies went beyond what was needed and worked through the issues and me and my friend made it to our destination- thanks ladies we love you!!!

title: Poor quality
review_text: It took nearly 3 hours to serve dinner.  By time my main course arrived I was so tired I didn't even care about dessert.  The food was not good at all.  Hospital cafeteria options.  They did not bother to serve bread with the butter they gave me.  We had several unnecessary announcements.  The seats were rudimentary compared to other airlines.  They did lay flat but I felt like I was in a very awkward coffin.  I couldn't wait to get off that flight.  Definitely not worth the price.  Poor food, uncomfortable and annoying announcements.

title: Missed flight and terrible customer service
review_text: We took this flight from Sapporo to Tokyo, the baggage check took over an hour waiting in line with no direction from any of the staff. Our flight was delayed an hour and a half due to a late arrival of the incoming aircraft. Due to this, we missed our connecting flight to San Francisco, JAL moved our flight to the next day (the only available) but did not offer hotel or meal vouchers even though the delay and missed flight was entirely their fault. We ended up having to spend an extra $300 (USD) to stay the night in Tokyo. When asked if we could get vouchers or even an upgraded seat they said the delay was “not their fault” and therefore not their responsibility to reimburse us even though it was their fault. The attendant originally stated the delay was due to weather, but when we corrected her she checked the information and confirmed it was not due to weather but still denied it was their fault. Overall, really poor customer service and will likely not fly with them again.

title: Can't Wait for My Next Flight!
review_text: This had to be my best flight experience I've had so far. JAL's service is unmatched by any U.S. airline. From the getgo, you feel welcomed on board and are well taken care of. Cabin crew is very attentive and polite when you need something. They are always coming down the aisles to check on people. The food was the best airplane food I have had and was a great start to my trip to Tokyo. The whole flight was. I will definitely be looking to fly Japan Airlines again when I return to Japan.

title: Made to pay "Cleaning fee"
review_text: Was held at the destination airport for two hours and told to pay compensation (as a "Cleaning fee") to a japanese passenger as the overhead compartment containing both our bags had a water leak. No consideration for any evidence I brought up that showed it was unlikely my fault. Felt that the airline staff were quite clear in their preference for the japanese customer and had little regard for the international one as their attitude towards the japanese customer was constantly apologetic while the only words spoken to me were to ask how much I was willing to pay the other guy. Doubt I'll be flying with them again with their lack of customer protection and reading the other reviews about them.

title: Damaged luggage
review_text: Luggage badly damaged and JAL refused to take any responsibility,  very disappointed expected much better. Have been to Japan many times and this certainly is not Japanese culture and not what we have come to expect. Accidents like this are rare but do happen , completely unprofessional JAL to not fix the issue so unfortunately couldn’t recommend your company again.

title: Haneda JAL First Class Lounge superb, comfortable late night flight to Bangkok with Sky Suite III3
review_text:
I connected from Narita to Haneda airport at Tokyo to take my ovenight flight to Bangkok on Japan Airlines JL33.  Transfer from Narita to Haneda was easy on the limousine bus with frequent departures.  However, it took a bit longer than scheduled due to late afternoon traffic.
 
Once I arrived at Haneda, check in was quick using the First Class check in and I was quickly into the superb Japan Airlines First Class Lounge at Haneda based on my OneWorld Emerald Status.  The lounge is very spacious with a very large dining area on the main floor with a side seating area, and then upstairs there is a salon bar area serving drinks including the previously hard to obtain Suntory Yamazaki 12 yr premium whiskey.  There is also a separate area upstairs with several massage chairs that offer pre-set massage programs lasting about 10 or 15 minutes each.  The lounge is mainly set for ordering using the QR code on your table, with a few self serve items such as coffee and cold drinks, buns, rice and the trademark JAL curry, and several canapes. The food is beautifully presented and delicious and definitely fine restaurant worthy.  I enjoyed a pork filet with pepper paprika sauce and phyllo wrapped scallop with sea asparagus.  Of course, I did not pass on ordering sushi made to order by the sushi chefs.  If you have access to the Haneda First Class lounge, you will want to go to the airport early to enjoy its elegant ambiance and superb dining. 
 
My overnight flight to Bangkok was operated with a B787-9 fitted with the Sky Suite III seat in a 1X2X1 configuration.  The seat is fairly comfortable but there is not much storage around the seat for your things and the seat is fairly narrow in flat bed position.  As it was an overnight flight, most people opted to sleep as soon as the flight reached cruising altitude.  If you opt to be served breakfast, you will be woken around 2 hours before arrival for breakfast.  Western breakfast is not a strength for JAL so I opted for the more filling Japanese breakfast which came with a bento box with 5 sections with fruit, pickles and various different small bites and then a main of flounder with vegetable sauce and rice.   As usual, it was beautifully presented and delicious.  

The flight landed on time at 5:05 am,  Bangkok Suvarnabhumi airport has a sprawling terminal so it is a fairly long walk to immigration.  Due to the early arrival, only one immigration desk was opened for business class passengers and there was a fairly long line up of maybe 20 people by the time I got there.  Fortunately shortly afterward authorities opened up a counter for elderly and those with children and I and a few others in the business class  line were ushered over to the new counter since there was no one there.  I was at the luggage carousel by 5:40 am, out into the arrivals hall by around 5:50 am and quickly into a car to my hotel soon after that.  

As always, JAL provided excellent service and delicious food on the flight.  It is definitely one of my favourite airlines to fly with and I would always recommend it to friends.

title: Comfortable Flight
review_text: Great airline. Staff were super attentive and did their best to communicate with their passengers. The seat was ok for a business class seat, a bit tight as we were sat in a reverse hearing bone seat rather then the expected Apex Suites which are far superior. Food was a bit of a let down but i would attribute that to the horrible airline catering that exists in North America and not Japan Airlines fault. Overall a pleasant and comfortable flight.

title: Great service as usual, older plane, bare basics temporary Plaza Premium lounge
review_text:
I flew JAL from Vancouver to Tokyo Narita.  Japan Airlines does not have its own lounge in Vancouver and uses the Plaza Premium lounge.  That lounge is under renovation so Plaza Premium currently uses a temporary space, just an open area that is cordoned off.  The temporary lounge is very bare basics, offering simple food and drinks served on paper plates and using disposable wood cutlery.  As Plaza Premium is also a pay to use lounge, the space can get fairly crowded.  Just lining up to get in took a while as the person in front of me was trying to pay to get in using a discount that is only available on the app. 

The flight is operated with a B767, an older plane.  Business class has the Sky Suite II seats where the window seat alternate with being right next to the window with a counter next to the aisle on the even numbered rows or having a counter next to the window with the seat being right next to the aisle instead on the odd numbered rows. The cabin is configured 1X2X1 with all seats having direct aisle access but with the even numbered row window seats having greater privacy with a counter between the seat and the aisle.  I find the Sky Suite II seats to be quite narrow at the shoulder when reclined to flat bed position because the armrest does not lower down, and much prefer the original Sky Suite I seats which are wider at the shoulder in bed position and has greater privacy due to its layout. 

Older plane and less desirable seat notwithanding, JAL flights are always a pleasure because the food and the service are consistently excellent.  Every flight seems almost like a constant competition between passengers and the cabin attendants as to whether the next passenger can get to the toilet first or the cabin attendant will get there first to clean up the toilet for the next passenger's use!  I have been on 10 hour flights with JAL where there was never a time I went to the toilet without finding the cabin attendant had already tidy up the toilet and folded the toilet paper into a neat triangle point.  

I usually opt for the Japanese meal since they are always very filling, delicious and beautifully presented.  This flight I opted for the Western beef offering for a change - a starter plate of grilled chicken, prosciutto and salad, and a main of beef tenderloin with stroganoff sauce and pumpkin and pine nut puree.  The meal was very good as usual but I confess I miss the beautiful presentation that the Japanese meal would have had.  Dessert was chocolate fudge cake which was fine, but I always thought Japanese chocolate desserts tended to be on the light side and lacked the strong bittersweet chocolate taste I prefer.  JAL now also offers pre-flight meal reservation for an express meal or a vegan vegetarian meal supervised by Chef Yonezawa of the Japan restaurant No Code. 

Once again, I enjoyed my JAL flight and felt extremely well cared for by the cabin attendants.  I happily recommend JAL everytime and the small deductions are for the older plane and the third party temporary lounge.

title: Worst customer service
review_text:
Worst customer service ever. Will not fly with Japan Airline anymore. Not recommended for everyone.
My daughter got sick on the plane, so they had to return back to Narita. On the next day, they charged me for $7k for 3 tickets one way from Tokyo to Ho Chi Minh City (normally cost around $1k). After negotiation, they gave me the boarding pass. 15 minute before departure time, they suddenly asked for my daughter’s health check by a doctor, which they did not do for 5 hours ago. So I obviously could not fly that plane. Damn. They want to make money from me. That was a horrible memory.

title: Foreigner unfriendly, avoid if you travel with family and wheelchair.
review_text: discriminate airlines,  as a foreigner on board, we got different services such as no choice of meal, skipped meal services, unable to change my seat with my family. Traveling with Family and wheelchair is not welcome on board. Nightmare flight

title: Shame on the JAL customer support
review_text:
This airline staff at the airport were bullying a customer. 
They will not stand by the customer side to understand the situation. They have no flexibility, even when the policy is unclear or the information is not clear.

title: Premium Economy is not worth it.
review_text:
POSITIVE: The crew was fantastic, very sweet and kind. Lounge access was great too.
NEGATIVE: Seats were not that comfortable, food was pretty average (same as in economy class). Considering the premium I paid over eco fare, really not worth it.

title: Way too hot and sweaty!
review_text:
Hottest cabin! It is almost always so hot inside the cabin that I wear summer clothes during winter flights. No personal air vents to utilize. I bring wet sports towels to stay cool.

Even during temperate weather, the airport turns on the heat but during the hot days will turn down the air conditioning.

Impeccable service. Best airline food.

title: First Class Airline
review_text:
This was the BEST flight experience ever, the service ,the seat from beginning to the arrival was unparalleled with any flights I have ever had.
The Flight crew are genuinely happy and extremely helpful and I felt welcomed and comfortable which was a great way to finish a tiring trip in Japan. I arrived refreshed, relaxed and ready to take on my next adventure

title: The best flight service ever…
review_text: What a fantastic flight. The service and dining on this flight is the best I’ve ever experienced. And I do a lot of flying! A special thank you to Aoki who was an absolute angel. The cabin crew are a real asset to JAL - they did you proud. Comfortable seat too and all in time. Couldn’t find anything I’d change. Thank you Japan Airlines.

title: appreciation of great customer service
review_text:
I am writing to express my sincere appreciation for the exceptional assistance I received from your staff member ,Willy, at the Hong Kong Office.
As a senior individual with limited computer knowledge, I recently purchased a multi-cities ticket online and subsequently needed to make changes to the itineraries. Willy's remarkable patience and dedication stood out during our interaction. Despite encountering challenges, she maintained a calm demeanor and took time to accommodate my requests.
Willy's professionalism and high-caliber customer service were evident from the beginning to the end of our conversation. She not only found solutions for me but also explained all possible options, outlining their pros and cons for my understanding.
I am truly grateful for Willy's outstanding support and commend her for her exceptional service.  such positive experience contribute significantly to customer satisfaction and loyalty.
Thank you once again for having such a dedicated and competent team member.

title: Best Airport and Flight crew
review_text: One of the best airlines from customer service and flight crew perspective. Business class for their Dreamliners are little dated but crew makes up the shortfall. Airport crew of JAL and flight crew is one of the best in my experience of flying for past 25 plus years.

title: Last minute plane change and defective seat
review_text:
Changed of plane 30 min before boarding. Ended up 4 hrs delay.
Replaced with dated 787 which has more inferior seat. My seat was unable to recline.
The ground crew was not organised to handle.
Overall contingency handling to be improved.
Although we were compensated with points or coupons, we rather they had done more check before assigning the plane.
However, the flight crew was on their level best to ensure our comfort.

title: Great flight, Sakura lounge access worst in the world.
review_text:
Flight as always good.  But paid usd45 to use the lounge only to be told upon arriving in Haneda that can only access 3 hours before next flight.  So too late to use, so don’t pay for the lounge, they just stealing your money.  

I am a million miler on “one world” and cannot even pay for the lounge and get access.  I sincerely hope JAL enjoys stealing my usd 45 as I don’t need the lounge 8 hours after  landing from a 13 hour flight.

title: Best Airlines in the world
review_text: Great big and spacious plane. We were traveling with disable person and the Lady / Staff from JAL Special Assistant service at Haneda Airport (Special Assistant Check in next to Check in number 12-17) were very helpful and kind with her professional manner. During our last minute boarding, she helped us along the way to our departure gate and really provide the best courtesy service in the airlines industry. I’ve been traveling with many airlines and many classes around the world but I’m truly amazed with JAL services.

title: Not family friendly and an all around hot mess.
review_text:
I upgraded my ticket from economy to Business so my flight with a baby would be more comfortable. There was a system error though, where my infant's lap baby ticket wasn't also upgraded. Customer service said we could upgrade at the gate. At the gate, they couldn't figure out how to make the change despite us waiting an hour. To not miss our flight we had to give up. On the flight, I explained I was a nursing mother. I was told I was only allowed to nurse her for a predefined short interval at certain times. I was not offered a meal service. I was not permitted to switch seats with my husband either. I ended up finding an empty seat in economy to sit with my baby. No apologies or refunds were ever offered. 

In addition, the business class seats weren't worth the cost of the upgrade. They were very dated and uncomfortable.  The food was the worst I've ever tasted. Service was disorganized throughout. There are many anti-family policies in place such as not allowing a tiny travel pram to be opened in the cabin when deboarding.

title: JAL First Class is First Class.
review_text: It was flight that was leff than an hour and half.  They served us dinner which was surprisingly very very good.  Service on JAL First is incredible.  I have previously written bad reviews about JAL ground staff service, which stands, but this time there is a whole separate line for first class passengers, that gets you in a special security line wizz inside, which isn't fair, but I guess that's the way it goes.  This line is quite commendable, and it's too bad they cannot offer at least part of the same experience to the economy or business side which I normally use.

title: Deceptive, Disorganised, Disappointing
review_text:
I have flown over a thousand flights, and this is a good contender for one of the most disappointing ones. 
1) Deceptive:
I booked the flight in October on JAL UK's web site, where it offered a 'business class' option. Once in Sapporo, I was told that it was not a business class seat, despite being 'Class J' which internationally is considered as business class, and despite SeatGuru showing the business (NOT Premium Economy) label on the aircraft plan (image attached). 
So they are selling under 'Business' (now the app shows 'Class J') something which is not even Premium Economy. Here are the 'benefits' of this class:
- NO lounge access
- NO priority boarding. You are actually boarding LAST, I kid you not. You're in Group 5 
- Catering: 2/3 glass of cold green tea, nothing else, over a flight > 1h30. Any other airline does better
- NO priority baggage handling (ours were delivered towards the end of a 200+ passenger service
2) Disorganised:
It's a nightmare to access the app as a guest if you're not a JAL member
Boarding is a complete mess, self-checking, self handling of luggage
You receive information emails in Japanese!
In the lounge, the staff were completely out of their depth. When I complained about the situation, their first reaction was to give me a lecture on the back of en envelope on the various flight classes! When I moved on saying that I would not insist on accessing the lounge but wanted the coordinates of customer relations, they suggested that they would process the complaint themselves!
3) Disappointing:
Chaotic boarding, and you are boarding last
Full fare but half service - better fly JetStar!
... this is supposed to be a Skytrax 5* airline? NO WAY!

title: Appalling
review_text:
We booked the 2x2 seat configuration and paid for extra leg room for the 2 adults with the 2 kids sitting behind us. 4 months after we booked, we received an email telling us the kids seats had been moved 2 rows back. We spoke with customer service and said this is not ok but were told there is nothing that can be done. We asked if we could move our seats but were told because we paid for an option that we can not change our seating for the adults. 2 days before our flight leaves we received another email telling us the kid’s seating has been moved again , this time to the centre of the plane next to complete strangers .we again tried to move next to our kids but again was told because we paid for an option we can’t move. After an hour on the phone , we were told there is nothing that can be done, no one else to talk to and we just have to accept the seating plan. Japan Airlines think it is acceptable to split up a family and have strangers sitting next to young children.
I wonder if any of the management or board members would allow this to happen to there family?

title: Good experience
review_text: Premium economy includes access to airport lounge. The premium economy seats are very spacious.  The entertainment system is average.  The food is good.  The toilet seats are the best with bidet and very clean.

title: Terrible service at check in
review_text: Terrible service from the lady managing the checking counter. We only brought 2 bags out of 4 allowance, but since one was 1 kilo over, she made us open both suitcases and transfer over. She also seemed to enjoy making us do it.

title: Very nice
review_text: Is a great place to visit and I would like to live here I will try to do my best to move to 🇯🇵 japan

title: Typically awful customer service from JAL
review_text: As usual, horrendous service before the flight in Japan. Typical racism in Japan means that if you have a middle name, it is often impossible to check-in online. Try calling in? Good luck. They CHARGE customers for calling them…about 50 cents per minute. You then wait for 10-20mins for anyone to pick up 9listening to a repeating message about them not being available that simply repeats on a loop. So after you’ve spent $5-10 just waiting, the staff simply read everything off the internet, the same as customers…without having any power or ability to assist customers. What’s the point?

title: Don’t choose Japan Airlines
review_text: Very very bad experience that they broken my baggage and lost my baggage cover!!!!! I will never choose Jason airline one more time!!

title: Great food. Terrible website and app
review_text:
- Impeccable food, but ONLY if you have not requested special meals. The default meal design is by the "Red Under-35" young chefs JAL has hired via a competition. Limitations: Only flight segments that *start* from Tokyo (HND and NRT) have these glorious meals. Also, if you ask for ANY special meal, you won't get the curated "Red U-35" menu. YMMV. 
- Avoid transit between Haneda and Narita, as the train ride is a LONG 1h30m to 2h00m. Only acceptable with fit travellers willing to sprint. Difficult with young children or physically infirm unless there is a 4-hour minimum gap between flights. YOU HAVE TO COLLECT YOUR LUGGAGE and clear TWO immigrations when transferring between HND and NRT. Plan ahead!
- The website struggles to take India-issue Visa and MasterCard; they really don't want our money ;) 
- The website is slow in every operation. 
- The iOS app is a thin layer over the website, so it's equally sub-optimal for 90% of the tasks
- JAL needs to learn from Emirates, Etihad, and Qatar on how to deliver high-speed purchasing experiences, app services and features, and staff-led experience.

title: Be careful when booking
review_text: Bought a 3700 pound ticket, booking type x, the airline blocked all the window seats saying I couldn't reserve them due to my discounted fare. That totally sucks and have to wait 24 HR before departure for online check in

title: Don't fly Japan Airlines if carrying Portable hair straightener, go ANA instead!
review_text: This feedback is for those who will travel domestic within Japan or I imagine international as well with JAL Japan airlines they require to take their portable hair straightener. Today on the last leg of my travel my little GHD portable hair straightener was confiscated as they do not allow hair straighteners. I wasn't aware the restrictions were airline based as ANA who I flew with to Sapporo from Osaka allows hair straighteners such as mine on carry on luggage. I checked with airports and I guess assumed when ANA allowed this that the other airlines would too. I should have triple checked. I think it's silly that one airline allows and the other doesn't. Strange and not a nice experience. Therefore I will never fly JAL again. ANA was great and had a seamless experience and at least I would not have lost $500 had I flown with ANA again.

title: Waste of money and time
review_text:
I missed one leg of my round trip ticket from dfw-Tokyo-Seoul which was the Tokyo Seoul part of the $2800 ticket because I bought another ticket from Japan air from Tokyo - Seoul 24 hours later to spend time in Tokyo and Japan air canceled my entire return flights from Seoul-tokyo-dfw and didn’t even inform me they are cancelling the return flights leaving me 2 days to buy a one way ticket home on Korean air.  
You can be on hold for > 6 hours while trying to reach JAPAN Air and you end up speaking to someone who is in India, because it’s definitely outsourced and I heard three different stories from three different agents after three different phone calls telling me first, I had a ticket it was fine no problem go check in. I had seen assignments. from another agent, saying your flights were canceled because you missed the segment. I basically got three different stories from three different agents and ended up with a refund of only the taxes which was a total of $300.  
What I think is crazy about Japan Airlines is the fact that they’ll cancel your return tickets and not even notify you of that,  just because you miss some piece of some segment. No other airline in the United States will do this. This is absolutely ridiculous.  No way United, Delta, or American Airlines would cancel any of your return flights just because you miss a segment of one of their flights you already paid for.

title: Don't Be Discriminated Like Me
review_text: Everything seem to be geared to Japanese passengers as though the rest of us didn't count. All announcements were primarily in Japanese and the stewards barely spoke or understood English. I felt discriminated against for various reasons. They announced two main meal choices. By the time they got to me, only one was available, a curry-based meal, which shows poor judgment on their part. With 10 more hours to fly, anything "curry" would cause foul odors. I couldn't bare the thought of eating something like that. There were no other choices and I politely refused. Poor judgement and poor thinking on their plan to stock insufficient quantity of a seemingly better meal. Later, they came around with a pastry and choice of tea or other drinks. I asked for coffee. Of course, I "was the exception to the rule" and had to ask three (3) times for my cup of coffee. And, to top it off, during our breakfast, it seemed as though I was transparent and they chose not to retrieve my tray until all other Oriental passengers on the plane were cared for. Stewards kept passing by and looking at my empty tray, but wouldn't even attempt to grab it. No, I didn't complain, act disrespectful, raise my voice or even show any displeasure. I just simply sat quietly. I have never experienced anything that bad even on a "low-cost" airline. I would not recommend this airline at any price, unless of course you are Japanese, in which case you will likely only travel on your home airline, anyway. Shame on Japan Airlines. I would have expected more respect and care for other people like me.

title: Terrible website and customer service experience
review_text: Worst website and combined customer service experienced in a very long time. Thought I would book a premium economy multi-city itinerary for my partners 60th birthday next year and our recent engagement and was quoted 5K for 2 economy class and 32K for Premium Economy. When calling JAL to enquire why is the price higher than Business class, they said it just is, taxes and things, they did not look into it, did not care and could not offer an explanation.  As a result we had to book economy class - if we weren't going to Japan I wouldn't have booked them at all.  Also the booking platforms advertise the correct price 8K for both and then JAL won't let you book them.  Terrible terrible experience and took 4 hours to try and sort it out. Won't be travelling with them again after this.

title: JAL Narita humiliates and discriminates against disabled passengers
review_text:
Due to a seizure suffered in Tokyo and a resultant 3 week hospital stay, I was too weak  to walk from the curb to the gate at Narita, so I requested a wheelchair.  The desk clerk took our passports but did not issue boarding passes. She asked, three different times, "what my symptoms were."  I stated alternately that I was 1)too weak to walk to the gate 2)my leg muscles were too weak for me to walk 3)I was disabled after a hospital stay.  After her third repetition of the same question, my boyfriend asked her if she was a doctor.  She said no. He then asked if she would like to speak to the doctor that had treated me, and started to dial his number. She panicked, said no and called a supervisor.  
The supervisor said "I just have one more question" and then asked me, you guessed it "what my symptoms were."  At this point I assumed we would miss our flight and would not be given our passports back, so I said, in desperation, that my muscles were too weak to walk to the gate, I did not have a contagious disease, I was not a danger to their passengers or crew, I was not going to die on their airplane and that I was now extremely angry.
That finally got our boarding passes issued and our passports back.  The flight itself and the onboard service and amenities were excellent. I grieve for people who use wheelchairs all the time and the humiliation they must suffer.  Shame on JAL.

title: Worst customer experience company even having business class
review_text: Paid more than $5k extra for a business flight at night and I was coming back in economy during the day (I'm doing it with a little child). The company change the flight times with no other option than accept it and we can't change out business location (despite having paid $15k for my tickets), I also had to change all my hotel and tickets bookings and the customer service was useless (they took 6 days to come back to me with a price of a flight)

title: Great experience for a person that hates flying
review_text: I hate flying overall it’s terrifying for me. JAL was the best experience I’ve had on an airline though. Compared to North American carriers; Take off and ascent to cruising altitude was smooth, no sharp turns, and the pilot didn’t full throttle to 10,000ft. Cabin and crew were clean and attentive, and had more meals than I thought I would have. Overall awesome experience, recommend JAL would book again.

title: Efficient, Friendly and Consumer Focused Airline
review_text:
Flew from SYD to Haneda Airport with JAL and they were honestly so amazing. Extremely efficient, friendly and consumer focused which made for a great experience.

The staff are on the ball with their servicing and make you feel as comfortable as possible. If you are thinking about flying with someone else, think again.

Would fly with JAL in a heartbeat

title: Service lady at gate 17 is awesome
review_text: We had been late getting to the airport, due to a missing bag, but the lady at gate 17 helped my family and I, she was very sweet she made sure we got to our flight to misawa. The flight itself was good but the people make it great.

title: The nightmare with JP airline
review_text:
I am standing at the airport writing this review, hopefully you can read it early before booking your airline ticket and avoid Japan airline at all cost. 

My family arrived in Tokyo and 3 days after my dad got sick and admitted into a hospital in Japan. He can’t sit straight on the way back so we asked JP to upgrade economy to business class and we pay the difference. They said no. Okay, then we asked if we can cancel for medical reason, get a refund and purchase a new ticket for business class. They said yes on buying a new ticket with no refund. Fine!

The day we arrived at the airport to check in, they told us the economy seat that we paid for is now cancelled without refund for some safety reason. And that reason is for them to sell that seat for someone else! I’m speechless! 

At the same time, Expedia has not tried to help over the matter. Both Expedia and JP told us to contact the other party for the matter. None of them want to refund or help us to upgrade. 

I know it would be a lot if you book everything for your vacation separately, but next time I rather take my time to do that on my next trip, than have to deal with this headache, on top of the fact that our family is exhausted on this trip.

No one expects their vacation turn into a nightmare but craps happen and here is our story.

title: Extremely Uncomfortable Premium Economy Seats
review_text:
I flew recently on JAL Premium Economy from Sydney to Helsinki and back, flights 52,47,48 and 51.  I found the seats on the JAL Premium Economy extremely uncomfortable, even painful.

I’m a seasoned air traveller with Silver for Live from Qantas.  I flew Premium Economy with Qantas and Cathay Pacific and I believe the JAL seats are some kind of a design mistake.  They don’t recline in the usual manner, just the bottom part, the seat, moves horizontally forward and the back support, being mechanically connected, attains a more reclined position.  The seat then attains a very unergonomic shape, not compatible with a human body.  This arrangement also automatically reduces the passenger’s legroom, increasing the discomfort even further.

There are only two buttons to operate this contraption, one for the “recline” movement and the other one for the lower leg (calf) support. However, the lower leg support doesn’t function at all due to its low range of motion.  So, it just hangs there.  I couldn’t find a comfortable position and couldn’t sleep at all.  The seats are also very hard and my bottom still hurts a week after the return flights.
 
I find it hard to believe the Japanese people, renown for their design prowess and attention to detail, installed these seats on their national carrier!

On the other hand, the service was superb and the food exquisite albeit a bit small on size.  I also believe, the food was the same as in the economy class.

title: JAL very disappointing experience
review_text: Could have flown with cheaper airline but wanted to try JAL. Flight was a morning flight.Flew on 777 economy JAL wider seats. First problem was checking in at Haneda, I had checked in online and all 3 boarding cards were on my mobile, we asked for printed off cards but we're told no. You had to do your luggage labels and place on conveyer belt and scan mobile boarding cards it wouldn't read ours, ended up a ground stewardess had to print off paper boarding cards for us for the scanner to work. I saw the queues getting longer as a lot of people seemed to be having problems, Haneda security queues ran right through the self check in stations so the place was very chaotic and people not knowing what was happening, so unlike the usual Japanese efficiency you experience everywhere else. On the plane now seats weren't noticeably any wider but legroom was really good. Flight entertainment was very poor, very limited choice of films, screen wasn't very big, seemed very dated with a pull out handset to control as touch screen didn't work. When seatbelts light went off they came round with a bag of mixed rice crackers and a bottle of water. After about an hour trolley came round with lunch and a choice of wine which wasn't very chilled, beer was and soft drinks. Handed a large plastic menu between 3 of us at time of serving, choice of pork or chicken...had to make your mind up quick, chose pork it was ok , served with rice but nothing like beautiful meals we ate in Japan, also had ice cream, no bread or cheese and biscuits, just some little dishes of tofu, cold broccoli , salad and some other cold veg, only ate some if it, very disappointing. After 4.5 hours into the flight they dimmed the lights and a steward walked round with a pole pulling down any window blinds that were still open, it stayed like that for hours, he walked around the cabin constantly looking in each row for?? to check we were sleeping? I felt I was in a nursery and being put down for my afternoon nap. They closed the curtains round the galley and only came round regularly offering green tea. About 7 hours into the flight the lights went on and we were handed a horrible milk tea flavoured kind of cake with white chocolate chips which was very dry to eat then offered coffee or green tea or soft drink. Now 7 hours into the flight we still had not been offered any trolley service offering alcohol other than at lunchtime . My husband went up to the galley and asked for 3 gin and tonics and the steward replied with surprised 3, my husband replied there are 3 of us... 1 each, when the male steward brought the drinks to our seats he never said a word but frostily sat them down with a napkin and another packet of the rice crackers. 11 hours into the flight my husband again went up to the galley and asked for 3 drinks but this time he was attended by a pleasant female stewardess, smiling, she brought them to our seats smiling. Half an hour later they came round the cabin with a drinks trolley offering alcohol drinks for the first time during the flight with only 2.5 hours before landing! At no time did they suggest to visit the galley for snacks or drinks, you had to decide that for yourself and depending on who was there how you would be treated. About 1.5 hours before landing they brought round something to eat, it was in a takeaway box and you had to open containers and mix it all up, chicken and noodles but it surprisingly good. Definitely wouldn't fly with JAL again, we flew Singapore airlines last time to Japan, economy was like first class, meals, service, entertainment nothing was a bother to them and they constantly came round with drinks and snacks trolley and toilets were immaculate, JAL toilets were just ok and extremely small.

title: The worst airlines I have ever taken
review_text:
This airlines is horrible. They treat passengers who purchased tickets from agency differently. The system do not allow you to check-in electrically. You have to go to the airport and check in at the counter. 
Similar problem I still have when have to check in from SFO to Bangkok. It said I am not eligible to check in through their system. The worst thing it's system allocates seat for the passengers arbitrary.
Never fly with this airlines.

title: Fly anyone else from USA
review_text: Booked the flight through American Airlines.  Called immediately 4 months before the flight to get seats.  Seats disappeared 5 times.  JAL told me to contact American.  American assigns seats but they disappear and change:  Got to the airport and seats had changed again.  All I wanted was an aisle seat anywhere.  Disregarded status on American.  We were supposed to be able to check in 72 hours before the flight.  Will never fly them again.  If you are a foreigner, they just do t care and won’t help you.

title: Good seats and cabin but the online experience and food was disappointing
review_text:
Seat was comfortable, good leg room for economy etc. 

A few areas let this down compared to other airlines

1. The food, including the kids meals, is strange. It's not western, it's not really mainstream Japanese. It was odd and definitely not suited to kids (even the kids meals!). Our kids left almost all of their meals, and most kids trays I saw went back full. We were glad we had some snacks packed for the kids. When I asked a hostess on the Narita - Melbourne flight if they had any bread rolls or snacks for the kids, as they had not eaten their meal, she simply said "no" and that was that! 

2. The online system for checking in is clunky when doing it for a family. AT points we ended up with all boarding passes on a single phone but their system at the airport requires everyone to have their own which didn't work (our kids are too young to have phones). They printed us out boarding passes in Narita when we were coming back to get us through one gate, but then refused to give us the boarding passes which meant we had the same issues later on in the airport. 

3. The entertainment system is sufficient but most other airlines have far better entertainment options and variety.

title: Top of the list for customer service by a long way
review_text: Recently had to cancel a flight due to health reasons and JAL staff were fantastic to us.  The managed the retrieval and storage of our luggage and booked us on the next available flight when we were free to fly.  Everything about their service is fantastic and they really make you feel like a valued customer.  They will be on the top of our list next time we wish to fly a route that JAL service.  They set a standard other airlines would struggle to to achieve.

title: I enjoyed my flight
review_text: I've flown with these airlines twice and had a great experience both times. I enjoyed my flight, good food, very friendly staff!!

title: The worst experience ever with the airline.
review_text: On the way back from Europe to Sydney flight from Berlin was delayed 10 minutes we were told we are too late for our flight to Tokyo which was in 20 minutes,( that's how JAL booked our flight with only 35 minutes between the flights) we will be put on a next flight at 18:30 to Tokyo, as it happened the next flight wasn’t for us maybe because we are not Japanese? we were put on a flight in 9.5 hours at 2am to Singapore with Finnair ,then to Sydney Qantas economy ,we paid for premium ,and then that was changed again to flight to Brisbane and then to Sydney arriving at 9:40 am , I don’t even know if my luggage will arrive in Brisbane or Sydney or if ever? my car was parked at the international airport so I have to catch the bus from domestic to the international terminal and probably pay extra as it happens our flight was changed back to Sydney with Qantas  economy , not sure why but thankfully we arrived safely in Sydney collected our luggage and got home safely, this is so unacceptable Japan Airlines you are the worse airline I have ever flown with and never ever again.No one at the airport in Helsinki was able to help they were saying that’s all thru Japan Airlines so we sat there almost 10 hours with limited food as everything shuts at 6pm only small kiosks are open and expensive but no choice. Send an email to the airlines with complain but  no answer yet and it has been 2 weeks now.

title: Poor Food In Business
review_text: The JAL service between Tokyo and Australia was always much better than Qantas when it came to food. but sadly they have slipped down to the Qantas standard with limited and poor selection and  poor quality. The service and crew were fine, the aircraft an older 787 with old style uncomfortable seats. Disappointed.

title: A little disappointed.......
review_text:
The soft product was amazing, the service friendly and helpful, the food was exceptional.
however,
The hard product was a let down, the seats were quite narrow, and we are not big people, compared to what is out there (offered by other airlines) these days, we ere a little disappointed with the overall product.

title: Our flight used gate 137.  137 uses buses to get you to the plane.  Imagine buses full of people with carryon luggages..
review_text:
Japan airlines uses gate 137 at haneda.  It is an awful gate.  It uses buses.  We had a widebody that was sold out and idiots dont check in their fairly large carryons and shopping bags so the ride gets interesting (sarcasm).  They dump you off at the bottom of those air stairs,  so there is a  rowd of people with their carryons and shopping bags on the tarmac now have to climb the stairs.  Those old folks who have problems walking with their carryons and shopping bags, you can imagine the number of steps to get to the door of a widebody...  very fascinating sercie... free exercise workout in hot humid haneda.  
Gates 131 through 139.  Just talk to someone up above and ask that you not be handed a 13x.  Good luck.

title: Rude and incompetent staff
review_text: the staff at haneda airport was extremely rude and incompetent. the planes are really old and business class offering was really bad when compared to qatar.

title: One of the best airlines
review_text: It was a great flight with great entertainment, good food, and super friendly cabin crew. All stuffs are clean and it was an enjoyable flight!

title: Bad.. just Bad
review_text:
I haven’t flown with JAL for awhile so I am shocked with the terrible experience.

Leg room is not so bad, however the seat width is miniature size and I am average weight (5’8 138lbs).

Serice from Cabin Attendant is good even tho they should have provided snacks between 1st and 2nd meal considering it’s 11 hours 20 min flight.

Not sure what the real reason but I am sweating like a pig because they must have turned the AC off half flight (at some point it feels like 85 degrees farenheit).. OMG it’s the most painful thing when you combine, not sleeping, terrible food and tiny seat.

And the ticket checked lady in Haneda is rude too. Very shocking thing to encounter since Japanese always pride themselves in politeness.. just skip this airline! Just go Singapore Airlines

title: Avoid Japan Airlines
review_text: YVR had the worst and most misinformed customer service. Avoid Japan Airlines unless you enjoy rude and incompetent staff.

title: Bad experience
review_text: My family flew business class from Vietnam to Boston and had connecting flight at Narita airport. My parents in wheelchairs but weren’t allowed to preboard or board first based on the ticket class because there weren’t any wheelchair attendants available at the time of boarding.  We ended up boarding last. Food was cold and bland.

title: Worst customer service for an airline globally
review_text: JAL has without the worst customer service that I have ever encountered. I have been trying to get in contact over points and a confirmation of flight details and you juts can not get in touch with them. The phone call was 45 mins and then a transfer of which I hung up after another 45 mins. There is no email (in this day) and they try and make it as difficult to get in contact as they possibly can. If you want to have any follow up with an issue - baggage , flights, anything DO NOT fly with them. I give them a zero out of 10 for customer service. Jetstar I’m Australia has much better service and that’s saying something.  Absolute disgrace !!! You guys need to wake up to your customers

title: Terrible customer service. No one gives a crap. Dont use their Sakura Lounge.
review_text:
Wife and kids flew JAL from Finland to Haneda. I pre-booked their lounge passes with JAL Sakura Lounge. After a 14 hour flight, all they wanted to do is shower and have rest before the next flight which is in 5 hours time with another 9.5 journey to Sydney.

They went to the lounge front desk, they were denied entry. The lounge entry only allows entry 3 hour prior to your departure time, so if a flight takes off at 7pm, you can only use lounge at 4pm. However planes that take off at 7pm usually board at 30 - 45 min before take off. Basically you get ripped off for your lounge pass, paying for 3 hours and only allow to use 2 1/4 hours.

Wife asked them if they can set a timer and use the 3 hour and checkout themselves. NOPE, they wont allow you. Wife was really unhappy and tired so she gave up arguing with the front desk staff.

So I rang and spoke to JAL in the Australian phone line spoke to the phone consultant to lodge a complaint. The guy was very nice and I explained the situation and ask why the logic of paying for 3 hours but only get to use for 2.5 or 2 1/4 hours in lounge. He couldnt answer my question. I asked for cancellation of the lounge pass and get refund. He could not get a refund as they don't refunds apparently. What third world country is this?

So asked him to lodge a complaint for me and he said I have to use their website to lodge a complaint. He also can lodge a complaint. He said that all calls are recorded. I asked if all calls are recorded, what's the purpose of recording the calls if you cant use it to provide feedback. He couldnt answer the question.

Iam disappointed with JAL. Their lounge access timeframe has no logic what so ever. Also What third world country technology do they have working there, can record a phone call but cant use the recording as part of their complaint process?

This will be my first and last time using JAL. Customer service is so poor!!!!

title: Great , but not awestruck
review_text:
Security / Immigration : No separate queue for Business Class passengers. Expect long queues & plan accordingly.

Lounge : The new Sakura Lounge (4th floor) + old Sakura Lounge SKY VIEW (5th floor)
Surprisingly , we weren't impressed. Uncomfortable seats with underwhelming F&B options. Definitely not meant for long layovers. The only saving grace was the availability of shower rooms.

Boarding : We arrived at the gate on time , only to be told that the process was delayed. After a considerable wait at the cramped-up seating area , boarding was initiated in a systematic manner. On entering the aircraft , the crew guided us to our seats.

Seating / Layout : Similar to our previous flight , this too had a 1-2-1 layout with  reverse herringbone seats. Comfortable , with all functions working perfectly fine. The only flaw - tight seat belts , with multiple passengers requiring extenders.

Service : Not as great as our previous flight , but good nevertheless.

Food & Beverage : We chose the Japanese meals yet again , which were well presented.

Arrival : All the luggage was being dumped on the ground by the high-headed airport staff. Beware.

- Great Food
- Lounges are a 10/10 (Great Food, Private Bath, Clean + Modernized Toilets
- Decent Legging Space
- Great Customer Service
- Smooth Landings and Takeoff

title: Excellent Narita First Class Lounge and great service and food on long haul flight
review_text:
I flew on Japan Airlines from Narita to Vancouver.  Prior to the flight, I used the JAL First Class Lounge at Narita based on my OneWorld Emerald status.  The lounge offers excellent food and service, I tried several dishes by scanning the QR code at my table and ordering and each was beautifully presented and delicious.  Special dishes included appetizers of Serrano ham with figs, marinated squid and marinated algae, and Manpuku Chinese soba noodles from Manpuku in Ginza, one of the oldest ramen shops in Tokyo.  At the main eating times, there are also sushi chefs making sushi to order.  There were also two different champagnes on offer - Joseph Perrier Brut and Pierre de Bry Brut.  There was plenty of seating in the lounge and in the dining area, and even a couple of massage chairs that offer a number of preset massage programs.  The lounge is an excellent pre-flight experience and most comfortable and relaxing before a long haul flight. 

The boarding of the flight to Vancouver was delayed due to cabin preparation issues.  Fortunately the delay was only 10 minutes and the plane managed to make up the time in flight arriving on schedule. 

The flight is operated with an older plane - B767-300.  Business class used the Sky Suite II seats in a 1X2X1 configuration with the window seats alternating between being separated from the window by a counter in the odd rows and right by the window in the even rows.  The Sky Suite II is not the most comfortable of seats as in bed position, the armrests do not lower down and therefore the bed is very narrow at shoulder level.  Therefore, I found it more comfortable to sleep with the seat in an incline position rather than fully flat.  Entertainment system is not a JAL strength so while there were enough movies on offer and some quite current, it was quite limited.  There were a lot of Japanese movies and TV programs that were either only available with English subtitles or not available with any English at all. 

In flight service, as always, was elegant, understated and attentive. Meals served on board were delicious and, once again, beautiful to look at.  I had the Japanese dinner which starts with a bento box of many different items and then followed by a dish with three separate mains.  Japan Airlines is unique in that it offers a special coffee in business class for each flight, with a full origins and tasting description in the onboard menu just like for wines in a wine review.   The one for my flight unfortunately had high acidity, which I do not prefer, but fortunately it was also a rich coffee and very very smooth. 

Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed my flight with Japan Airlines.

title: Customer service when needed
review_text:
Sorry, it's maybe long but explains thing...
Hello!
Recently I was traveling with family (wife and two kids, 7 and 9) from Naha (Okinawa, Japan) to Bergen (Norway). Our first flight on the 28th of July 2023 had a flight no: JAL914 from Naha to Tokyo (Haneda) with planned departure at 15:30 which was significally delayed.
Because of the delayed, we've missed our shuttle bus to Narita which we paid for and departed 19:25. Already on the plane (flight JAL914) we've notify the crew member about our problem. We kindly asked if we could get our luggages one of the first on a belt so we'll have a chance to catch the bus. Ironically, our luggages came out as the ones of the last.
Then I approached the JAL personnel to present my problem and ask for potential solutions. We supposed to picked up our additional lugguages from currier "Yamato" and catch flight AY 0074 to Helsinki departing 23:05 (Finnair/JAL).
It was then , I've realized that I'm dealing with polite bench of kids where nobody speaks English. I understand it's very normal if we talking about local grocery store, but travel company STASION AT AIRPORT with no single person able to communicate with foreigner?
That's very low, cheap and armature to me.
With precious time on table I waited long time for somebody who supposabely speaks English, but then communication were bumpy and unproductive turning our already bad situation to even worse to waste more time.
Let me point that I was asking for supervisor from the moment I approached the JAL counter which eventually I wasn't able properly to speak with. I was forced to take a TAXI and when I sat in, I've finally  saw the supervisor. With no second to spare I've just told her that I will complain about that.
The circumstance created by JAL cost me ¥30 000+ for TAXI to Narita and tons of stress for whole family along.
We consulted JAL customer service before we choosing a ticket and we were ensured that everything should be OK with those we had.
I also believe that air ticket also includes an airport fees like; taxes, security and others.
It was not our fault that flight was delayed but with absolutely NO HELP FROM JAL it became our big problem.
I should mention that my wife is Japanese and we used JAL quite much until now with satisfaction, but after recent experience which is every traveler worst nightmare I don't think I will look positive at Japanese Air Lines.
The e-mail will be forwarded as a copy to whom it may concern.

title: Best service ever
review_text: This is the best airline i have ever travel. The customer service is pretty nice and devoted. I have used the ordering touchscreen, it is ease to use, time saving and convinient as I didn't have to call the attendant but can order my food and process the payment myself. I hope all airlines can develop this service, it really did personalize my experience during the flight.\

title: Best service and entertainment
review_text:
Flight attendants were nice. In-flight entertainment was diversity. Easy to order food by touchscreens and the payment thru touchscreen really quick.
Best service ever.

title: Bread & Water in Premium Economy for Real!
review_text: Booked a R/T flight through AA. NRT to BKK, BKK to HND and HND to DFW were on JL. Horrible experience. Everything with JL was "Cannot do!" On the HND to DFW flight, a snack service consisted of a slice of bread wrapped in cellophane, followed by a beverage service of water only, I kid you not. This was premium economy!!! JL only serves Coke and Sprite, no diet options. I could not get on the web site to pre-order a meal. JL blamed AA for that.  JL in BKK indicated that check-in for my flight would start at 6:00 PM. JL staff showed up at 7:00 PM. Never again will I shell out premium economy money for budget airline services on JL.

title: The Only International Airline for our Family
review_text: I will ONLY Fly with Japan Airlines whenever possible. They appreciate their customers and run a very tight operation. When my family is flying International, I feel that we are in amazing hands far from home.  The International "issues" and "fiascos" just don't exist when I Fly with JAL.

title: An amazing flight , just as we had expected
review_text:
Check-in : At the dedicated Business Class desk , which unlike many other airline counters at DEL , was being used only for the said passengers. The entire process took barely a few minutes , just how it is supposed to be.

Immigration / Security : Via the dedicated First/Business Class lanes , which took 5-7 minutes in total.

Lounge : The makeshift lounge at the Holiday Inn Express hotel. Nothing worth mentioning , apart from the amazing views i.e. much better than the dingy claustrophobic lounges DEL is infamous for.

Boarding : Streamlined , with Business Class passengers being called as per the Priority category. Once inside the aircraft , the crew was proactively guiding the passengers.

Seats / Layout : 1-2-1 in reverse herringbone fashion. The seats are comfortable , with the functions working perfectly fine. The only flaw being the seat belts - too tight for everyone I suppose , with a number of passengers requesting for extenders.

Service : Very friendly , courteous and consistent. No flaw at all. One of the best crews we've seen in the post-Covid world.

Food & Beverage : We went for the Japanese meal , and it was good to taste & presented very well. In short , we had no regrets about our choice.

title: JAL excellent service
review_text: I usually fly with ANA but decide to try JAL for this trip not disappointed, service on board was excellent and the attention to detail was beyond expectations. Food was very well prepared and served with care. JAL is certainly an airline I would recommend to others.

title: The worst experience we’ve had with an airline.
review_text: Japan Airlines has to be the worst airline I’ve ever experienced and the worst Business Class experience. I’m traveling in a family of 6 and we’ve all collectively agreed that Japan Airlines has, quite possibly, the worst both in-flight and out of flight service. Buying Business Class tickets gives you zero priority, unlike stated. The flight provides no drinks, and when we ordered the beef from the menu, we were told that there was no more beef meals. Flight attendants were “international”, yet did not understand anything in English so it was difficult communicating with them. Check in at departures was the slowest we’ve ever experienced at well. This was the same for domestic flight check ins. Overall I would not recommend this airline to anyone, not even to my worst enemy.

title: Beware if travelling with disability
review_text: We planned a family vacation to Europe booking online and choosing our seating as 2 family members suffer from mental disabilities and need window seats or sitting next to another family member. We did not fill out the special assistance request as it has never been an issue with airlines in the past so thought it would be ok. JAL changed the seating plan on 3 of our flights moving us from the seats we had chosen and on one flight to non adjacent seats. When we contacted the call centre and asked if we could change the seating arrangement and explained our situaton we were told no, they are the allocated seats there is nothing we can do. After going back and forth with the operator I said that we would be unable to fly with the current seating arrangement can they move someone else. Again told no, as they will not move passengers from their seating location eventhough ours had been changed??? Having no alternative I asked for a refund which they stated would take 2 to 3 months to process. Entirely unhappy with the whole situation I sent an email explaining our issues and got a quick reply saying sorry we ask for your understanding but nothing we can do. No offer of alternate flights etc just we changed your seat bad luck.. Lesson learned dont care about their customers, special assistance policy or anything so beware if you are thinking about flying with JAL

title: Best experience to fly with JAL
review_text: I would very much like to thank you for the service of Mr. Ariyoshi and his superior at check-in. I was very happy with the differentiated service and education that served me and my wife. Really a very good experience that I will recommend to other people! I would like them to know about this feedback. Thank you very much.

title: Do not fly Japan Airlines!!!!!
review_text: Customer service is non existent!  The website provides one customer service line with no options for anyone other than some sort of special members but I dialed it anyway. Called their customer care line multiple times over three weeks and waited on hold each time at least an hour and a half before hanging up. I was trying to speak to someone about my ticket. I went so far as to go to the airport to try and get assistance. There were no ticket agents available so I went to the administrative office and was denied help from the manager because he said if he did it for me, he’d have to do it for everybody. He told me to keep calling customer service and wait until someone answers the phone. There is no way to communicate virtually on the website. It was an infuriating experience to say the least!  I never got the help I needed but luckily, my trip was great. Will fly to Japan with an American based  airline next so that I don’t have these issues.

title: Urgently need to update the aircraft and services
review_text:
We spent some time during the peak season, June and July 2023, in different parts of Asia.  Being members of the oneworld alliance, we were not able to get on our preferred airline because of schedule conflicts.  Despite that, we were able to get tickets from one of the partners - JAL.

First time flying JAL embarking from different countries within Asia and between the US, and the conclusion from different routes was that, it was consistently below standards; we all felt like we were in the economy class instead of business class.

Reasons for not flying JAL again:
-the lounge in different parts of the world sucks, consistently (look at the ramen pic below)
-food on the plane was bad, bland, cold, they went out Wagyu beef all the times
-the aircraft was dirty, old, had an odor that was irritating
-if you don't specify the kinds and the amount of food or utensils that you want, you will end up putting your finger on the buzzer many many times.  For instance, I asked for 'some bread', I was then given a kid-sized cold bun with no butter and jam; I asked for water and then I was given water with no ice, if don't ask for napkins or toothpicks, they won't put some on your tray.  The whole process was beyond frustrating and inefficient; it was like begging for food and services.  Other airlines will offer desserts, extra drinks to you without even asking to make sure that you are well fed and hydrated.  You will assume that fruit, salad, and bread are pretty standard.  However, if you don't ask, you get NONE.
-they don't have a specify time for the last meal before landing, you have to time it yourself or else they will tell you that the pantry has been closed
-they don't take away your trash even if they see it, I think they only take away your trash once or twice during the flight.  I needed to bag my trash nicely
-after you order your last meal, they will tell you that it is your last order; very funny
-they still struggle with English; asking for a cup of decaf tea and was given a decaf coffee and then a cup of tea with lemon
-was asking for a glass of champagne Drappier and a glass of OPIA, the flight attendant kept clarifying to me they were both different, it was very funny, even that they wanted to put a cap on it
-was asking for their Japanese white and red wine from Coco Farm, they were available on all my six routes
-some of my traveling members are not Diamond / Emerald members, even though they knew that we were traveling TOGETHER, they put us in different lounges and groups for departure
-did not inform us that our check in would be a training session, making us standing at the counter for a long time without apologies; they also forgot to give us back our membership cards after checking in, they had to chase us back while we were in the security area already
-flight attendants were stiff and not trying to make you feel welcomed and at ease
-the cabin temperature at night was way too warm to be able to sleep well
-when they assigned seats, even though they knew that we were traveling TOGETHER, they separated us
-the seat was uncomfortable and narrower

I was surprised by the positive reviews on YouTube.  The truth is that it was not good at all.

title: Better than expected and worth your time for consideration!
review_text:
For an international flight home that we were dreading based on the time spent in air, this was one of the most comfortable and easy travel components I have had in a long time.  Incredibly friendly and interactive flight attendants helped at every turn we needed.  
Customer service reps at Haneda airport took great care in addressing a problem with seating that was caused by American Airlines.
I would highly recommend Japan Airlines for travel!

title: Terrible experience
review_text: Worst airline experience in my lifetime, been flying 40+ years.  Unbelievable sardine can accommodations for an international long haul flight.  No personal A/C above seat- first time I've ever experienced this. Zero flexibility in changing my flight home. I highly recommend choosing another airlines.  Had to change airports in Japan, which meant a 43 mile / $230 Uber after having to go through customs and claim bag, then of course check in again. 👎👎👎👎👎👎👎👎

title: Unpelasant Eperience with Japan Airlines
review_text: I worked with American Express to book our travel to Haneda Tokyo on July 2023.  We booked in business class.  I had arranged seats where my husband had a window seat and I had the aisle across from him.  Today, June 29 several days bfoe our trip I saw that Japa Airlines changed our seats.  I was not happy.  I called American Express and they were on the phone with Japan Airlines for nearly two hours. I erroneously disconnected the phone. I then called Japan airlines (800-525-3663) and I am still waiting for almost 2 hours.  I understand that if there is a change in configuration of the airplane that they need to change seats.  This was not the case.  I sense that because we are not of Japanese descent JAL felt that it was okay to change our seats.  We had made our reervations 10 months prior.  My husband is a "wanna be pilot." He love looking out the window on take-off and landing. That is why I try to select our seats.  Additionally, we like to sit across from each other and not next to each other.  Patricia Newman

title: Recommended
review_text: Comfortable flight, good food, reasonable layover, luggage intact, and courteous staff, meets expectations!

title: employees
review_text:
I had a very bad experience with Japan airlines leaving from Philippines to Japan,
our flight was suppose to leave at 2:30 pm, but was delayed and changed to 4:30 pm, then it was changed again  to 1230 pm midnight . An attendant asked me if I am willing to take  a different plane and flight , I said, yes. but she did not approach  me again . i assume non of the passenger was able to leave with another flight or plane, while we were boarding for our midnight flight , I heard another passenger discussing 26 passengers were able to leave earlier with a different flight  or plane , so I felt  a disappointment , I then asked one of the attendant what was the criteria they made on what passengers are allowed to leave earlier , she did not look at me or answer me, I had to ask  the question again and she said something that I could not understand. I could see all the attendants gathering together , some were looking at me strange , a couple of them pass by me and i was trying to ask for a letter that the earlier flight was cancelled , they would not look at me , they were trying to ignore me, then finally they gave me the letter before I boarded , no apologies and no  explanation was made, this is very poor customer service. I regret flying with them, I thought I would have a great experience compare to other airlines .

title: Bad experience with Japan airlines employees
review_text:
I had a flight from Phillipines to Japan at 230pm it was canceled and change to 430pm then change again 1230am, an attendant ask me if I would want a different fight and plane , I agree to take a different flight or plane. At 1230am  , I assume no one was able to fly earlier , since no one notified us ,but I heard 26 passenger was able to leave earlier , I was disappointed,  so I ask the attendant what was the criteria for 26 passengers to be able to leave early , they ignore and avoided me  They would not make.eye contact with me. I was  also asking for a letter stating that the flight was cancelled , that was the word they used "canceled " but again I was.being ignore , then finally the letter was given to me 
Before I boarded , with no explanation  and no apologies , I regret  flying with Japan airlines ,  I did not expect  this from them .

title: Was impressed with the space at the Economy Class, automated c/i and everything else
review_text: Except the App, everything else was great. C/I, automated baggage drop off, was not only easy but as well fun, space in Economy was great, biggest +, good inflight entertainment, overall very good and look forward to my next fly

title: Bad service, racism is the biggest issue
review_text: Since touching down in Narita, nothing good about JAL. Asian mostly looks alike, obviously racism, from transiting counter until in flight, even flight attendant’s leader can be racism. So disgusting. First and last for me with JAL. My flight info : JL 0068 NRT to Seattle 22Jun2023. If JAL can read this I hope you guys seriously look into this racism issue. This is a very ugly behaviour. Shouldn’t be in service line if that’s the attitude.

title: Excellent service
review_text:
Travelled London to Tokyo on 787 economy, the seats were noticeably wider than other carriers and the 2-4-2 layout was great, most airlines running 3-3-3. The aircraft was clean and modern and staff were very accommodating.

Return flight on 777, 3-3-3 formation however managed to book early and got row 27 so just two seats together. The seats were a little less comfortable however the service was once again exemplary, worth paying a little extra to use this carrier. Especially the 787 using the ‘Sky wider’ seat layout.

title: Comparing ANA and JAL's flights to Tokyo
review_text:
We took ANA's flight to Haneda in December 2022, then we took JAL's flight to Narita in April 2023. Both were six-hour flights. The differences we spotted were:

1) Prices:
JAL's tickets were about 10% cheaper than ANA's at the time of our booking.

2) Seats and entertainment:
- Legroom was less than ANA's.
- Seats looked and felt older.
- Entertainment system looked like it was running on an 1990s OS interface.
- Movie selection was also less than ANA's.
- Our retractable remote control had some bits of food on it... probably because the service team wasn't able to wipe down every single item during the short turnaround time.
- Suggest to invest in newer planes/seats/entertainment systems which are totally touch-screen and high definition. Singapore Airlines had introduced an app that lets you use your own personal devices as remote controls since 2016... this technology was around for over 7 years! Also, no retractable remote controls = less dirty corners = less bacteria.

3) Food:
ANA served us Japanese mixed nuts twice and dessert was Häagen-Dazs ice cream. Their soba tasted fresh.
JAL didn't have pre-meal snacks, and their somen was... a little hardened.

4) Toilets:
ANA's toilets were larger, and we observed the stewardesses checking the toilets almost after every passenger's exit, refreshening it ever so often. They also had a bottle of lavender-scented lotion and fragrance spray in each.
The JAL flight we took had none of the above.

5) Stewardesses:
ANA's stewardesses were professional and very hardworking, you could tell that they were always on the move, but could seem a little cold as they were always rushing.
JAL's stewardesses seemed friendlier. They smiled, greeted and were more patient when asking our kids to choose a toy (by the way JAL's toys beat ANA's cardboard plane) they liked.

ANA seemed to be the clear winner here. Hope JAL update their planes!

title: Time for change
review_text:
Trying to register via their jmb scheme is laborious and eventually impossible via Android. Boot up the laptop, jump through hoops, a few emails and registered. Only to find as a member, my domestic japanese flights cost 50% more than if I book the exact same jal flight through an online 'agent'.
Maybe time senior execs were hired on merit not time served or who they know?
They are way behind the game in 2023.

title: A very mixed experience
review_text:
Wife and I took JL30 from IGI to Haneda with high expectation from this international airline. We were in for a rude shock. Both food and inflight service were terrible. Food was as if procured from some roadside eatery. Cabin crew seemed indifferent. I had to remind twice to get a glass of wine. 
To add insult to injury the cabin crew handed over breakfast in plastic bags to us even before we had struggled to finish our dinner.  The plastic bag contained a STICKY muffin, flavoured yogurt of an average brand some cut fruits. All wasted.
I assured my wife that food and service should be better in the next sector, Haneda-SFO and indeed it was, as if we were flying a different airline.

It is unfortunate that some reputed airlines give less than average service and quality of food  on sectors from & to Delhi. Some kind of apartheid??
Inflight entertainment was limited. Cabin crew announcements in English weren't clear.

title: Excellent International Flight
review_text:
Sky Suite accommodations in Business Class are among the best in the industry.  The lie-flat has multiple adjustments from recline to flat.  Food and service are fantastic.
