Attention to detail from the cabin attendants is outstanding.  The on-board entertainment is fine but perhaps a bit limited for English speakers on long-haul flights.  The use of the lounge in Tokyo was nice but the food was kept on the second floor level.  Chairs at the windows were not overly comfortable due to a low back and odd recline.  The lounge itself was quite crowded and there was not enough staff to keep the tables cleaned off so it was not the best experience.
Overall, Japan Airlines did a fantastic job with this flight and we would highly recommend them.

title: Good Connecting Flight
review_text: This flight is the daily ITM airport connecting service for international passengers transferring at NRT.  The flight arrives outside terminal 2 at NRT and then you are transferred by bus to the terminal where you then make your way back into the departure check-in area to once again go through security.  The flight is just what you'd expect from a domestic 737 flight.  The boarding process was super-smooth because not only do they board from the back of the plane forward, they board from window seat, to middle, to aisle.  Overall a very quick process.

title: Good Domestic Flight
review_text:
We were using AA Advantage miles for this flight which they marketed as Business Class.  Turns out JAL called it Premium Economy so we had no lounge access.  The airport terminal was clean and orderly with plenty of places to have food and simply to sit.  Boarding was well handled and quick as it appeared they board the back of the plane first, which worked really well.  The flight was short but perfectly fine.  Service was good and seats were comfortable. The cabin was too warm for our taste.
Overall, this was fine for what it was.

title: Disappointing Experience
review_text: We booked this flight 11 months in advance.  A couple months prior to departure, the time was changed by almost 8 hours with no notification from JAL--we just happened to check on it ourselves and found the change.  Yes, changes happen, we understand.  However, this now required an overnight stay at the Melbourne airport at our expense.  Moreover, our arrival in Tokyo was now timed to arrive 3 hours after our connecting flight departed for Osaka.  JAL had changed the time on the long-haul flight but not the connector.  Because our arrival was now late in the day, we could no longer connect the same day to Osaka so we had to pay for a hotel night at NRT because JAL refused.  They also refused to book a new connecting flight to Osaka so we had to make our own arrangements including expense for the Tokyo to Osaka flight.  For as premium as the long-haul service was, this lack of appropriate response from JAL was quite disappointing.

title: Beautiful Flight and Service
review_text: Sky Suite accommodations in Business Class are among the best in the industry.  The lie-flat has multiple adjustments from recline to flat.  Food and service are fantastic.  Attention to detail from the cabin attendants is outstanding.  The on-board entertainment is fine but perhaps a bit limited for English speakers on long-haul flights.  The use of the lounge in Boston (we used the British Airways lounge) is excellent and even allowed us to board directly from the lounge onto the plane (we were departing from gate E12).  We would absolutely choose Japan Airlines again.

title: Excellent airline for a long flight
review_text:
1. The airline is very good in terms of offering a competitive price for the great service they are providing
2. The leg space was much better than many other airlines that I had travelled in the past.
3. The way in which they handled the checkin process was also amazingly efficient with almost no chaos.
4. The Asian Vegetarian Meal was definitely better than the Jain Meal. The “light meal” served in the latter half of the flight was also great.

Shortcomings :
1. The inflight entertainment options were very less I would say. Could have had more Indian movies on the listing
2. Charging points - just one regular USB point and no plug point provided which I had seen available on many other airlines. 

On the whole, it was a very pleasant flying experience with JAL and I would definitely recommend.

title: Good customer service by employee
review_text:
Wonderful customer service by employee shejin 

Keep up the good work shejin 👍

Great job from Japan airlines

title: The best flights me and my partner have ever taken!
review_text:
We flew on flight JL42 on the way out to Tokyo and JL43 on the way back to London, and both flights were really amazing! Flight times were between 13-14 hours each way.

Seats and general comfort:
Me and my partner are not the slimmest of people and sometimes travel on planes/trains etc can feel a bit cramped so we were very pleasantly suprised to find on both flights that even in the economy seats on JAL the seats were really spacious, felt more like a business class sized seating than economy which was great for us!

The seats were super comfortable, you have plenty of leg room (my partner is tall and could fully stretch out his legs) loads of space for your bags and bits you want while on the plane and even when the person infront reclines you don't really notice any difference in the space around you which is fantastic.

The head rests are really comfortable and are able to be adjusted in multiple ways to suit everyone.

Seat material again increased the comfort as kept a nice temperature (not too hot or cold etc).

Both flights the air stewards controlled the lighting and dropped it to night time settings except during take off, landing and when food and drink was being served etc and the lighting subtly transitioned at each point which was nice.

Food and Drink:
The food on both flights was wonderful, I personally preferred the food on the flight out there but when I served a dish on the way back that I just couldn't have eaten (lots of fish) they very kindly swapped it out for a vegatarian dish they had spare.

Flight out to Tokyo:
Dinner: we both opted for the Chicken cooked in Japanese radish sauce with rice rather than the beef dish they offered, this came with some small dishes on the side; soba noodles, smoked salmon cream cheese & dried tomatoes, vinegared cucumber & wakame sea plant, bread and butter, fresh salad, shortbread, ice cream. It was all really lovely but the smoked salmon side was especially good.
Snack: Red bean bun, rice cracker snack pack
Breakfast: omelette with tomato ragout, hash browns & turkey sausage, yogurt, fresh fruits, croissant
Drinks throughout: Generally whatever drinks you wanted, plenty of choice of soft drinks, a few alcoholic options and then several opportunities for hot drinks. 

Flight back from Tokyo:
I opted for the grilled chicken cacciatore with mushrooms and pasta
My partner opted for the hamburger steak in ginger with corn & mustard rice.
Both of which were nice but not quite as nice as the flight out.
The sides were: sansho pepper kinpira with lotus root & fried tofu, steamed chicken & zucchini with tahini sauce, salad of quinoa, mochi mugi barley &
fermented vegetable, fresh salad with dressing, ice cream
Snack: rice cracker snack pack, miso soup (this was really special, just what I needed)
Lunch:
chewing Tuna, Clam & Millet Short Pasta in a Japanese Ginger Sauce (this was the one I just couldn't eat - it was far too fishy for me but the air hostess promptly found me an alternative of a mushroom curry which was delightful and very accommodating)
Orange Jelly with Nata de Coco (which was very tasty_
Drinks throughout: Generally whatever drinks you wanted, plenty of choice of soft drinks, a few alcoholic options and then several opportunities for hot drinks. 

Cleanliness and Bathrooms
The planes were both really clean but I have to mention how clean and generally excellent the toilets were on the flight back to London!
It had the most spacious airplane toilet room I have ever seen, it was delightful, it had little luxuries like deodorant/freshener spray, face towels, and was decorated lovely.

Entertainment:
Plenty of films, shows, music and other bits to keep you entertained, I think I watched about 6 films in total, 2 on the way out and 4 on the way back...  but there were plenty more I could have watched, I liked being able to make a music playlist also from the songs they have available and given there were so many chilled piano and nature sounding songs I was able to create a bit of a sleep playlist.... was exactly what I needed.

Customer service:
So friendly, so accommodating, really brilliant service on both flights and in the airports.

At all points where turbulance might be encountered they gave fair warning as an announcement and given my partner is a nervous flyer especially with turbulence it made it easier for him to feel reassured, as he said - two of the best flights he has taken, both were so smooth, with minimal turbulence really even given the warnings.... just brilliant!

Baggage came through quickly at both airports and seemed to have been handled with care.

Flight back arrived about 1 hour earlier than I expected based on JAL original time on app, winning!

The views both landing into Tokyo and especially taking off from Tokyo with Mount Fuji in the background - incredible!

title: Some things premium, some things economy
review_text:
The Premium parts: 1) Sakura lounge access, though the lounge is not among the better world lounges. It was too small for the huge crowds, and very noisy, full of screaming babies for hours on end. Catering is uninspiring – a few Japanese-style dishes. Strangely, there is absolutely no fruit – a very basic food item. They did have shower rooms and a quiet room with massage chairs. And lots of alcohol. The wines were of high quality. Also, very many kinds of spirits including Japanese brands. And the lounge is clean. But the fact that Premium Economy gets you lounge access is unusual and a big plus. 2) Separate check-in counters for Premium Economy rather than together with Economy. And checked-in luggage gets priority after Business Class. 3) Some amenities on board – slippers and a small bag containing eye shades and ear plugs. 4) The seat is slightly better than Economy, though it is a far cry from the flat-bed Business seats. Basically, you can recline a little more and have a little more space than Economy. The Economy parts: 1) The catering is awful – exactly the same with Economy meals, though Premium Economy gets you 2 extra alcoholic items on request – a quarter bottle of champagne and shochu, a Japanese liquor. 3) Nothing in the bathroom – no eau de toilette. 4) Service is polite and efficient but rather cold and distant. I suppose this is the Japanese style but the Southeast Asian airlines have warmer crew.
Seat: 3/5
Service: 3/5
Meals: 2/5
Inflight entertainment: 4/5
Lounge: 3/5
Final thought: If you’re small size, there is absolutely no reason to go for Premium Economy. If you’re big size, it might make the journey that slightly more tolerable.

title: $3,800 for a name change...yes, you heard that correctly.
review_text: My employee just told me that this POS airline just charged him $3,800 to make a slight change to his wife's name to match her passport.  Of course, since the five tickets were purchased more that 24 hours prior to noticing this they were unable to cancel for a refund and start over.   So, the airline took full advantage of this man and his family.  This type of customer service should not be rewarded.  Stop flying them IMMEDIATELY!  There are other options out there....find them!  They are not traveling until August 2023.

title: terrible customer service
review_text: if everything goes fine with your flight you are lucky.  if there is any problem.... good luck. every time I try to call I am placed on hold for over an hour and then no resolution. when they respond to email they state they need "more information" although the information they need is on the email and it seems they cannot read English. They don't respond to online forms or complaints. There is little else I can do but report them to BBB and consumer affairs.

title: Comfortable but dated
review_text:
Positives first: The lounge that Premium Economy gets you is really good - the first time we have used something like that, and lots of free food and drink, peaceful atmophere and comfy chairs. 
The seats had a lot of legroom - I am 6 foot 2 and I had about a foot from my knees to the back of the seat in front. Having 2 seats by the window means no disturbing or being disturbed, if you're travelling as a couple.  The food if you're not vegetarian was good. The cabin staff were excellent, and the toilets were  spotlessthroughout both 14 hour flights
The negatives: The vegetarian food was poor. And there was very poor inflight entertainment. Out and back from Tokyo, one of our screens didn't work. There were 3 games, all board games. There weren't many films. And you pay extra for wifi. I paid for it on the way back, but it only worked for a few hours - although to be fair, when I complained to the provider ( not JAL) they did give me a full refund.

title: Absolutely terrible customer service.
review_text: My wife booked me to fly out with her and missed the date by a day.  They won't change the fight for a fee, they won't let us cancel.   The only option is to buy another ticket.

title: Moderate flying experience.
review_text:
JAL from BLR-NRT was an overall moderate flying experience.The ground staff at BLR  check in,which seems outsourced,needs a major revamp.
JAL  inflight crew were courteous.Inflight entertainment was limited.Food menu was moderate & limited.Beverages were served only when asked,which is definitely BAD !!Inflight service was erratic with the crew confused &  sticking small slips on the seats at various points depending on the meal preference & servings were haphazard.Ground staff at NRT were comparatively better. Overall a mid experience.

title: Operates smaller airlines as scams.
review_text: The service from JAL through ZipAir is terrible. My wife got sick just before our travels to Japan. Her family was to fly BKK to NRT. She had a tumor, thankfully not cancerous. We fought for almost a month for a refund from ZipAir. They would not offer anything. This was a month for the flight. THEY ARE HORRIBLE!!!

title: Exemplary Service
review_text: I had a great experience flying from NRT to DFW. The staff was extremely helpful and provided a world-class experience.

title: Lack of understanding of overnight layovers and incompetence leads to a never again will I travel Japan airlines
review_text:
Flight attendants are not accommodating or understanding of their own layover requirements or airport working hours in their own home country. I had five different interactions with agents to try and understand whether I needed a hotel to stay in for an overnight connecting flight resulted in them saying that I may be denied entry for not having a hotel booked. Furthermore they thought that I did not require a declaration and/or other documentation. After going thru customs and talking to information desk I was made aware that a booking was not required for an overnight layover even though the main terminal closes at 11 pm- the whole airport doesn’t close which is what they were saying. Nothing was mentioned in my booking that I needed a hotel booking, they continued to state that one was needed but they were wrong. 

Their English speaking ability and comprehension of what is required for a foreigner to do an overnight transfer is poor. I would not recommend this airline due to their negligence and the confusion that they caused while I was traveling on their airlines.

For their incompetencies, poor English skills, and understanding of foreigners travel requirements for layovers - I will never nor recommend travel to Japan via their airline. It not only represents their airline poorly but also Japan itself.

I hope that they improve but as an American I saw them treat a minority in a similar position as me with the same disregard and misunderstanding. 

Food was ok. Foot space is ok, width of seats is not accommodating and I am 5ft6 120 lbs, so keep that in mind when booking. The stress that their gross ignorance of overnight layover requirements has caused along with their poor English skills and impersonal “nod” and smile to pass the problem onwards to someone else is appalling.

title: Will avoid JAL next time
review_text:
Extremely unpleasant experience checking in with JAL in the flight 043 from Tokyo to London. Firstly, impossible to check in the luggage the night before our early flight. The morning of the departure only one check-in point worked for all Economy check-ins, the assistants were ignorant limit arrogant requesting, intra alia, my 9 year old son to move our luggage on his own without proposing any help. 
No help in responding to my request in changing seats or to upgrade to a higher travel class against the supplement. As a result, I will be travelling with a child squeezed in a middle seat during 14 hours (although I have booked different seats during booking).  
Such a pity that JAL managed to spoil the end of our trip to Japan…

title: Exemplary service
review_text:
There are several airlines that have very efficient and highly professional flight crew but out of about 50 airlines that I was flying with, Japan Airlines by far outshines them all. What fantastic hospitality, efficiency, courtesy.
Besides, legroom in JAL if greater than in majority of other competitors. 
The only small complain is about the onboard  entertainment that is little outdated and need a "refresh" and some investment.

title: Good flight
review_text:
Pretty decent flight in business class from Paris to Tokyo Haneda with Japan Airlines on one of their 787’s with their Sky Suite in a 2x2x2 configuration but unlike many cabins with this configuration all their seats give everyone direct aisle access via a small gap for those in a window seat which I was.

From what I understand only a few airlines use these types of seats and while it was comfortable it doesn’t offer a lot of storage space. 

I am not a fan of the 787 with their dimmable windows which the cabin crew can control and stop you from operating which I found annoying at around 1pm local time as we flew over Korea and not able to see out. The windows were only unlocked as we approached the Japanese coastline.

On taking my seat I did notice what looked like some food or juice residue on the window and cabin wall near it and mentioned it to the crew and they seemed truly horrified and got some wipes out and cleaned it off apologising profusely.
The service onboard was fine with good food and drinks including Maison Brutin Besserat de Bellefon Rose Brut NV champagne being served. I pre-ordered the western beef menu before my flight which was great.

The crew was professional but I got the impression that they lacked some confidence when speaking with English speaking customers.

One of the great benefits in flying JAL on my route which was Paris to Tokyo to Sydney was the fantastic luggage allowance which was 3 bags at 32kg each which is an awful lot of luggage but after just over three months in Europe I managed nearly 70kg split over three bags.

Overall a pretty good flight.

title: OK but I don't like the layout of the business class cabin
review_text: Firstly I don't like the layout of the cabin on this aircraft, there's nowhere to store things unless you use the tray table. The only other place is a narrow ledge covering the tray table when it is stowed. If you are travelling with a companion you cannot interact with them unless you loosen the seatbelt and lean forward.  There is ample leg room and the seat goes flat for sleeping. The cabin crew were friendly and efficient. On the return journey there was no estern breakfast available....they had run out! not very good for business class.

title: Strong recommended
review_text:
This was my first time to fly with Japan Airlines.
The services was absolutely amazing and unforgettable.
Strongly recommended to fly with JAL.
I would fly with JAL again if I have any plan to Japan.

Big thanks for K’Ben for your kindly services
and all crew members on JL727.

Thank you krub.

title: Very pleased and would fly again
review_text: Recently fly on JAl 3 times in Premium Economy and was quite pleased. Flights were on time, check in a breeze and the class of service was quite attentive. Seats were roomy than US airlines and food and drink options were plentiful. I did find that the IFE needed a bit more options. I will definitely consider flying them in the future when the opportunity is there.

title: Unjustifyable face mask coercion
review_text:
In January 2023, JAL still required all passengers to wear face masks. This was not justifyable because there is no regulation both in departure and destination countries, plus people already know masks are not effective for preventing infection.

Just because this face mask coercion, I would not choose JAL.

title: Travelling as a family with 3 small kids and were treated appallingly
review_text: We travelled as a family of 5 from London to Tokyo with three kids under five years old. We purchased an extra premium economy seat for our 1 year old as we were told we could strap her into a car seat on top of the premium econ seat. Just prior to boarding they confiscated our car seat as they were unsure of the regulations (turned out they were incorrect) and offered no solution for our 1 year old but to carry her on our lap. At one stage they said just put her in the seat asleep and strap the belt on. The belt did not fit and she fell down and banged her head. We asked if we could trade our 2 premium economy seats for 1 bassinet seat in any class (economy, premium, business). They refused to do this even though there were available seats as they said it would disrupt the passengers who paid extra for these front row seats (none of them had kids). It was very ironic given we paid a lot more for a premium economy seat that we could not use. I wrote a few letters of complaint to their complaints department. It has been 3 months and quite a few follow ups and I have not had one singe reply

title: They don’t pick up their phone
review_text:
I haven’t gone on my flight but I’ve tried to call them multiple
Times and wait for at least 40 mins, they never pick up.  I email and their response takes 3 days and the answer does not answer my question.

title: Japan Trip
review_text: Sitting in Economy, there was additional seating space.  The food and service were outstanding.    My only complaint was their website, which was a bit confusing.

title: JAL Transfer at HND.    No baggage transfer at HND from International to domestic!
review_text:
I reviewed a similar simular situation a year ago.  The excuse was COVID then.
Now restristrictions are lifted, but JAL will not transfer baggage after customs at Haneda, to a domestic flight at the transfer desk.  You have to lug your suitcase to a shuttle bus, up the steps, hang on to your suitcase(s), and lug it down and to their transfer desk, not check in (because I've already checked in, cannot recheck in).
Extremely inconvenient.

title: My first time flying this airline. I expected more from Japan Airlines
review_text:
The service was good but the overall experience was not. The plane was old, with old TV technology plus limited space. 

If I were a heavy person I’m not sure I could have walk through the little seat space.

The seat itself was not comfortable, and for a pricey seat option, the difference between coach and business was minimal.

The movie selection was limited, and the remote not always worked, in fact the flight attendant had to reset it. 

My connection experience was not much better. The crew seemed shifty, and I had to show my passport multiple (on what I can only describe as unnecessary workflow) times. 

Sadly, in an effort to be efficient, they had the old sign system for group one, then two, etc. 

I’m summary, I’ve flown business class multiple times through multiple airlines and I have to say my experience with Japan Airlines had to be the worst.

title: Ok but needs improvement
review_text: My first time to fly JAL. Check in was too slow but flight was on time. No choices for food. We were served a fatty  pork dish which was very unhealthy.  Limited choice of inflight entertainment.  My flight back to Manila was very uncomfortable. Check in was again very slow. I was seated in the middle beside a burly passenger who dominated the arm rest and about one fourth of my seat. The ground crew should have seated him beside a vacant seat. Food was again bad.

title: Most disappointing, disgusting customer experience with JAL.
review_text:
Bought a JAL round ticket from SIN to Chitose. Return
Was with a Jetstar codeshare 
Flight was delayed from chitose to Tokyo 
When we got to Tokyo - we were bumped off the flight.
5 hours later still no proper details on what’s happening 

Utterly disgusted with how JAL conducts its business - apparently as this was a codeshare with Jetstar though we book the whole trip via JAL , JAL had pushed all responsibilities to Jetstar 
And Jetstar of course was pushing it back that JAL didn’t wait for us

By 2300hrs of the 20 of us still standing at the counter  , only 4 of us were assigned hotel rooms.

No transfers to hotel was provided 
No meals 
No basic water provided 

Due to flight connection hick ups 
We the customers got victimized
No empathy to senior citizens and children who
Got stranded 

My 73 yo mom and my 3 yo 
Got rushed, mom hurt her leg due to all the rushing 
And JAL takes no responsibility at all 

Disgusting.

title: Japan Air to London
review_text:
August 2022, and hardly any good airline from Sydney since Qantas goes down with terrible covid recovery and bad management and some how I managed to get 2 Business class tickets to London from Sydney via Haneda-Tokyo. At that time Japan was closed to outsiders but transit was allowed as long as its was done before mid night. 
It was great air line experience ( I have used JA before) with amazing food and services and all flights were on time and smooth transit at Haneda. I will recommend any one flying from Australia to take Japan Air rather than Qantas since Qantas flights, prices and services are now 3rd class.

title: Excellent
review_text:
My first time fright best service JAL in the world. I arrived Heathrow then JAL staff said this way!Wow!! So nice then after on plane so elegant service and passenger's and meal restrant taste. Ohso my suitcase send straight way to lonfon to Kochi my home town in Japan. So good service. Next time definitely going to japan so clean people are kind and lovely foods and helped a lots for me.I was stay minatoya hotel in Kochi. Every day we'll come gest same JAL. Thank you for JAL my best memories in my life to Japan.❤️✈️

.

title: If you are over 5'8" do not buy Business if the Sky Suite III seat
review_text:
What a miserable flight!
Excited to see the 787 had the new Sky Suite seat but from Bangkok to Narita and on to Los Angeles it was so, so uncomfortable and could not get any rest, plus aggravated an old sciatica problem that took several weeks to resolve.
I am 6ft 2" tall and 240lbs, this seat is way too small, even the seat belt is too short to fit.
If spending the $s make sure the JAL flight has the APEX seat in Business or go with the much better ANA seats.

title: Terrible customer service
review_text: Horrible customer service. For some reason, their web site doesn’t like American credit cards. I tried to purchase a ticket with different credit card and using different divides and browsers. I was unable. I checked with my bank and I was told that the problem is with Japan Airlines. A number of customers reported this. Now I wish you good luck if you try to call them over the phone. You may wait a couple of hours to speak to an agent. The agents are rude and uninformed. I talked to a number of them. Some gave me wrong info. Others just hang up. One quoted to me price 3-4 times larger than what is on their web site, I guess they don’t value customers. I spent a couple of hours trying to buy a ticket. I can’t spend more. I will check out ANA instead.

title: Great Flight
review_text: Great flight, great service, comfortable and very friendly team. I really enjoy flying with JAL especially in First Class when I can, JAL set the standards for all others to follow, thoroughly recommend JAL.

title: Yao at the ticket desk is an angel
review_text: I had an extremely difficult experience canceling a ticket I booked with booking.com, as the international call center couldn’t help me and I was unable to complete a call to the domestic one. Finally, I got to the Asahikawa airport to board the new flight, and Yao was able to cancel my old ticket and refund me, using Google Translate to communicate with me. She was patient and kind. It was very appreciated after all of the previous rigamorole. Thank you, Yao!

title: Always late, but the staff is nice
review_text: Japan is famous for having really good customer service.  Or at least the staff is unfailingly polite when they are in the wrong.  JAL had it's staff doing a lot of apologizing as my flight was delayed by over an hour & I missed my pickup and transfer connections.  If I did not have insurance, i would have been incredibly screwed over.  My 2nd flight with them was delayed again, by 30 minutes.  They seem to have a lot of issues with trying to board and take-off on time.  The stewardess' are very polite and try to make up for the screw ups, but it is unfair that they bear the brunt when whatever their issue is, they need to fix it.

title: JAL Website is the WORST
review_text:
Forget about the flight. This is the worst website since the early days of the internet. How is it possible that a Japanese company from a country known for technology can have such a bad website.

Forget the translations. It just makes no sense. Constantly giving errors, links are impossible to find and redundant. For example, they have 4 buttons asking the customer if they are flying domestic or international and if it is before or after April 12,2023. Don't ask me why but it is what it is. 

Since on the next page I am going to have to enter the flight, the departure date, my name and some number they use; why can they not figure out if I am flying before or after April 12, 2023. Just ridiculous.  Let us forget that they don't even email you with a welcome email telling you your membership number. If you assume it is going to be emailed and skip the page it's on, you will have to make another account like I did.

Things they ask for:
-Email
-Password
-6 Digit password
-A one time password

Ridiculous! And after all that, I still get errors and cannot see my flight info.  I click "Manage Booking" and it gives me an error and I haven't entered any info.

Just utter crap.

title: Avoid travelling premium economy on this airline
review_text: Smiles all round but the service is poor and the food quite atrocious -- the menu is presented on a plastic card and shown to you just before service. The food is congealed -- I made the dreadful mistake of having a spaghetti on the grounds that everyone can cook it - not Japan Airlines. I suppose you will get a different class of service if you tarvel business or first - but I cannot afford to do so, especially since they are considerably more expensive than British Airways on the same route

title: Flight was excellent but ticket refund is nightmare
review_text: The service, food and flight were excellent!  I had to purchase a ticket in SFO exiting Manila before they would let me board.  Over and over they pointed out it was an extremely high fare but no worries, all will be returned online with NO problem.  Well there is a problem.  The have a form set-up to apply for the refund but when selected, it sends you right back to the beginning of the refund process.  Yes, there is a number to call.  Which took me twenty-five minutes to navigate through and finally hear a voice on the other end.  That thrill didn't last long as we were disconnected within fifteen seconds.  Yes, all out of pocket international long distance rate.  I wonder how much that is going to set me back?.  Fool me once shame on you, fool me twice shame on me.  This was suppose to go so smoothly.  They take no messages on website or e-mail contact.  The chat does not take your e-mail or phone number so how does this help me?  This was suppose to go so smoothly.

title: A great airline with wonderful staff!
review_text:
I am amazed how much different flying international is from flying US Domestic. The staff seem authentically nice. They want to help you have the best trip possible. I am annoyed that they force mask wearing but the world is still brainwashed that this helps anything on an airplane.
I talked to a lovely stewardess about my wife in the Philippines I was going to see. I shared our story how we go married in Costa Rica, etc. Then she and other ladies made me a gift bag to give to my wife. Wow how nice is that! I really like the food as well. I only wish I could afford a first class ticket.
If you are considering Japan Airlines, I recommend it. Remember to be gracious to the staff on board, they are nice people. Any annoying rules are probably the government's fault.

title: Excellent B787-8 Sky Suite Seat, Outstanding Western Meal from Michelin Star Restaurant, Thailand Entry January 2023
review_text:
I flew from Vancouver to Bangkok connecting at Narita airport onto JL717 from Narita to Bangkok.  I had about a 90 minute layover but due to the airport being much busier than when I last flew through in late September, I did not have enough time to use the Japan Airlines lounge after taking time to purchase some things at the duty free stores.  Back in September, practically no stores were open at the satellite terminal and only the main Akihabara duty free shop in the main terminal was open.  At that time, there were almost no customers and I found staff were actually approaching me to introduce products since I was the only customer in the duty free store.  This time the experience was quite different.  I went back to Akihabara duty free to try and buy some things but the line-up for cashiers was so long that it ran outside the boundaries of the store and there was no hope that I could line up and pay for purchases before it was time to board my connecting flight.  On the other hand, there were many small duty free shops open in the satellite terminal so I was able to buy a few things from there.  Generally the airport was much busier and many more shops and eating places were open inside the main terminal and the satellite terminal.  It seems the general expectation is that it is going to get much busier at Narita airport in the next couple of months as tourists from China start coming in force. 

JL717 to Bangkok boarded on time for its scheduled departure at 6 pm but pushback was delayed to 6:15 pm as there were passengers who had checked in but who did not show up on time to board.  Then there was a long wait for take off and the flight finally took off at 6:48 pm.  Fortunately the flight was smooth once enroute and landed slightly early in Bangkok Suvarnabhumi airport at 11:19 pm. 

The flight was operated using a B787-800 with a 2X2X2 seat configuration in business class using the JAL Sky Suite seat.  All seats have direct aisle access as the aisle seat is slightly offset from the window seat next to it.  I actually like this seat very much, much more than the newer Sky Suite II seat as the original Sky Suite I has armrests that lower down when the seat is put into flat bed position and therefore is much wider at shoulder level in bed position than Sky Suite II.  It also does not lower down as much as Sky Suite II, which seems a bit too close to the ground when in bed position.  For the Sky Suite I seat, in bed position, you can sit up at the edge of the bed and you are seated at quite a natural level in terms of angle of the knees.  Sky Suite I also has a fixed ottoman/footrest under which is ample storage for a carry on bag, and there are storage compartments and shelf space all around the seat so lots of places to put things even without the retractable table open.  The retractable table also swivels so you can get up out of your seat without having to fully retract the table by swinging it out of the way.  I find the Sky Suite I seat is very comfortable to sleep in when in bed position, much better than Sky Suite II. 

The flight was not very full with about 8 seats empty in business class out of a total of 30 seats in business class. 

I had pre-ordered my meal as the menu could be reviewed on-line around the beginning of the month.  For flights originating from Japan, JAL business class has meals designed by famous restaurants in Japan.  For this flight to Bangkok, the Western meal was designed by three Michelin star French restaurant L’Effervescence in Tokyo, so while the Japanese meal was designed by the also impressive one Michelin star Ginza Tokyo restaurant Ren Mishina and the Japanese meals on JAL flights from Japan are always spectacular and spectacularly presented, I opted for the Western meal of wagyu beef sirloin with wasabi cream sauce and spinach gnocchi.  The meal did not disappoint.  From the appetizers to the bread to the very tender and well marbled wagyu beef sirloin, it was an excellent meal, one of the best Western meals I have had on a flight in recent memory. 

An interesting feature in JAL flights is that a special coffee of the month is served in business class, and the menu includes an introduction of the coffee of the month together with tasting notes.

As always, service on JAL was excellent.  Not only are the cabin attendants attentive, but they are polite and discreet in the unique Japanese manner that Western airlines can never replicate.  Also as always, the toilets are much cleaner than on most other airlines as the cabin crew clean the toilet after almost every use by passengers.  

Masks are required to be worn on board except when eating or drinking and it seemed compliance with the requirement by passengers was very good throughout the flight.  

The flight was an evening flight and I was able to sleep fairly well for a few hours during the flight.  Overall I enjoyed the flight very much – enjoyed an outstanding dinner, slept well in the Sky Suite I seat, and appreciated the understated elegant service from the cabin crew.  

I was concerned about arriving in Bangkok as Thailand had recently changed its rules for arriving passengers.  Despite being fully re-opened to tourism since October 1, 2022, Thailand on January 9, 2023 reinstituted a vaccination requirement and a requirement for health insurance for Covid-19 medical expenses if a traveller originated from a destination or is going to a destination that requires a pre-departure PCR test.  Even more confusing, by the morning of January 9, 2023, Thailand cancelled the vaccination requirement.  I was going to overnight at Suvarnabhumi airport and then catch a flight the next day to Hong Kong, which has a pre-departure rapid antigen test requirement.  The announcements from Thailand were not clear, as least in English media, so I was worried I would be asked to provide evidence of health insurance.  I was also concerned that the flight did not provide landing forms for Thailand, which I had been used to filling out in pre-pandemic times.  Fortunately on arrival at Suvarnabhumi airport, I was able to use the priority immigration lines for business class passengers, no landing forms were required and no questions were asked about vaccination history or medical insurance and I was through to the luggage claim area very quickly.

title: Plaza Premium Lounge Vancouver, Exemplary Service on JAL B767 Sky Suite II
review_text:
I flew Japan Airlines from Vancouver to Bangkok in January 2023.  First leg was JL17 from Vancouver to Tokyo Narita.  JAL does not have its own lounge in Vancouver and uses the Plaza Premium lounge.  The Plaza Premium lounge is open to anyone who wants to pay to use it but nevertheless it was not very crowded the day I went.  It has a food station with hot foods (meat lasagne, tri-color pasta and buttered corn), hot soup, and desserts in a refrigerated case.  That day, the lounge did not open the second section at the back of the lounge that has an additional food counter that was a pasta station on a previous visit. 

Flight JL17 boarded on time.  It is operated with a B767 with a 1X2X1 seat configuration in business class with the Sky Suite II seat.  I was actually hoping for the B787-800 with the Sky Suite I seats instead, which is sometimes used on the Vancouver-Narita route, as I like the Sky Suite I seat much more – it has a larger video screen, is much wider at the shoulders in flat bed position, has storage for a carry on bag under the fixed ottoman and has storage space and shelves all around the seat.  The Sky Suite II has a staggered configuration with a fixed counter and headphone storage cabinet next to the seat.  Odd numbered rows have window seats with the fixed counter between the window and the seat and the seat located right next to the aisle, whereas even numbered rows have the fixed counter between the seat and the aisle and the window right next to the seat so even row window seats have more privacy and better window views.  I was in 2A, which is nicely located near the front of the cabin where both toilets for business class are located.  The arm rests on the Sky Suite II seat are fixed and do not lower down in flat bed position.  As a result, in flat bed position, the bed is very narrow at the shoulder and it is difficult to sleep on one’s back rather than on the side.  As the flight was mostly a daytime flight, I found it more comfortable to use the seat in recline position to nap rather than flatbed position to sleep. 

The flight was quite full with all seats in business class occupied except for one in the last row reserved for flight crew rest use.  The flight was scheduled for 12:45 pm, pushback was on time at 12:47 pm and take off was at 12:59 pm.  The flight landed at around 4 pm, about half an hour early.  JAL has always been very reliable with its scheduling with flights departing and arriving on time consistently. 

As usual service was exemplary on the flight.  JAL has some of the cleanest toilets throughout the flight as the cabin attendants are constantly going in to tidy up the toilet after almost every use. Service of drinks and meals was courteous in typical JAL fashion and meals always look beautiful as well as taste delicious.  I have a low tolerance for alcohol but was intrigued by the unfamiliar champagne offering – Champagne Drappier Carte D’Or N.V. – and so asked for literally a tablespoon.  Usually I end up receiving a quarter glass or a third of a glass but to my pleasant surprise, the purser actually did pour me about one or two tablespoons of champagne, perfect for a sip and taste!  I ordered the Japanese meal, which started with a bento box with 5 compartments each filled with different appetizers and colorfully presented.  This was followed by the main of simmered chicken sukiyaki.  

One unique feature of JAL flights is that a coffee of the month is served in business class.  The menu even has a description of the chosen coffee, including tasting notes just like for wines.  

One weak point for JAL is its in flight entertainment system.  It has fewer movies and TV programs on offer compared to other airlines and a number of non-movie video programs were offered in Japanese only without even English subtitles. 

On arrival, an announcement was made to stay in our seats as Japanese authorities would decide the order of disembarkation.  For our flight, those who were entering Japan or transiting to domestic flights were asked to de-plane first while international connection passengers were told to wait to de-plan about 10 minutes later.  However the lost time was quickly made up as security for international connections was very quick so I was back into the departures part of the terminal by around 4:30 pm for my connecting flight to Bangkok. 

As always, I enjoyed my JAL flight from Vancouver to Narita – good food, excellent polite service and a comfortable seat.

title: Overall good for short trips
review_text: Seat was comfortable enough for economy for short trips but would probably prefer business class for longer travel times. Food was better than most airlines with the same airfare.

title: Longer flight better aircraft
review_text:
Layout similar to AA business: better experience. Essentials bag nothing special.

Food was disappointing: buy fresh sushi or something you like at the airport in Tokyo to eat onboard.
Flight attendants made fun of us for bringing out own sushi onboard in business when their food was practically inedible. Glad we did.

Seats had more space and better storage. No pjs though, which is expected on 12 hour flights, like Qatar. Attendant smirked when I asked.

Service overall average and lack of respect for foreigners: I understand Japanese and the flight attendants continue to look down on foreigners. Disappointing.

Japan Air overpriced and nothing special. Choose Qatar if you can, better in every way, you won't want to leave.

title: Pack'in those business seats!
review_text:
Booked through AA, thus imagined an equivalent to AA business class.
Japan Air added a couple more seats in business, making the fit tight, no storage space for a phone even, one seat row had an added utility box which made the flat bed position impossible to achieve, near claustrophobic experience !

The Japanese flight attendants smirked and giggled at inability to finish first course, which was a Japanese inedible "delicacy." Flight attendants were unprofessional and condescending. Even my four well-traveled teens were shocked that Thai Smile (domestic Thai airways) was friendlier and simply more neutral.

Japan Air lounge in Bangkok was depressing and cold, felt like a "1984" throwback.

The whole experience was unpleasant and I wondered what those sitting in economy must have experienced and felt pain for them.

title: Absolute Pleasure To Fly
review_text: Absolutely fantastic trip. The crew put every possible effort to welcome me onboard and to accomodate every possible desire from extra snacks to champagne. Selection of food, presentation and attention are at absolutely highest possible level. Special thanks to the team of Taguchi Yuko, Takemura Hinano Fai, Jarupoom Na, Oochi Sachiko for hosting me aboard and to making this flight as easy as a breeze. Thank you again

title: Can never get through by phone!!! Horrible service
review_text:
I have been calling Japan air for 5 days and cannot get through to a human being.They claim 5 minute service BS been on phone for days and hours on hold till phone just disconnects.NO ANSWER NO HUMANS.
There website is a disaster to navigate.Horrible experience.I thought very high of there actual flight service but disgusted with customer service when you need to speak to a person.

title: 79 degree Cabin for 14 hours is no fun
review_text: Look, the folks at JAL are super nice and attentive. But there are no individual air vents to give any relief when they crank the temp up well over 75 degrees for the entire 13+ hour flight. Same issue on the return flight. My entire family of four was complaining, it wasn't just me. I literally had to use their wet washcloth over and over (poured water on it) to try to cool off. I am so very disappointed, because the leg room was nice, and like I said the workers are great. I don't know what standard puts the temperature so high though, it is just unacceptable. No personal vent either, I don't understand why.

title: Wonderful
review_text: from boarding till landing, it was an absolute pleasure. The aircraft was well maintained and clean.The crew was so caring, and I am sure no other flight can ever offer you a crew better than JAL! my 9 yrs old daughter slept off from haneda to Newyork and the air hostess was really so concerned that she had no meals throughout! the crew was so polite and responsive. other airlines should send their crew for training under them.

title: The food didnt meet expectation
review_text:
JAL is famous for the food even in the economy.
One isle was served very slow compared to the other isle.
When my turn came, the senior cabin crew asked me which menu that I prefer, chicken with herbs (taste like Indian curry) or Hambagu Japanese style.
I chose Hanmbagu but when I opened it is the chicken with herbs. 
The cabin crew did not know and apologized, she went back to get hanmbagu but it was not available anymore. It would be better if she apologized for telling me first that there is no more hambagu rather than asking which menu that i would like to have. 
It was just an unlucky day for me. Why the flight from Japan serving a weird menu in the flight to Singapore? The aircraft 767 is old and toilet is dirty. 
I would prefer other Japanese airline than JAL i guess. 
Movie selection is also not as complete as others including the Japanese movie selections

title: Thank you Japan Airlines for going above and beyond
review_text: The last leg of our trip from Tasmania to Vancouver was from Narita, Japan to Vancouver. This was cancelled due to heavy snow in Vancouver and the airport there closing down. Japan Airlines put us on a bus and put us up in a hotel for two nights while they arranged a way for us to get to Vancouver, then scheduled another bus to bring us back to the airport where they booked us a flight to Seattle (the closest available to Vancouver), and gave us a bus voucher to get from Seattle to Vancouver. We were provided with food and drink whenever we had to wait around too long at the airport. All the staff at JAL were literally running around trying to do the best they could for us and we appreciate all the effort and sincerity from the individuals that took care of us during this busy time.  We ended up getting a delightful visit in Japan during our trip.  Thank you for taking care of us!!

title: Racist and body shamming
review_text:
Going to Tokyo was fine. No issues there. Coming back was terrible.

I had a good start with the checkin and baggage but went downhill from there.

The business class lounge was pretty decent, just incredibly hot and packed full of people.

The woman at the gate was very racist towards me. Did not believe I had a business class tickets, even after I repeated three times. She kept trying to push me out of the line and putting people in front of me. I finally went around them and saw a third shorter line, that made her angry. 

On the flight I could not get anyone to bring me water. I became dehydrated. When I asked for food, I was asked if I was sure if I should be eating that. She was trying to say I was fat. So in turn she brought my food ice cold, with no water, so I couldn't eat it. I am not fat btw. I am a size 6. And even if I was, I paid 14k for the seat. Give me water and food.

title: Excellent
review_text: This flight was on board Boeing 737-800 with no Personal TV screen for this 1.30 hours flight but JAL provide WIFI. The legroom was great on the narrow body aircraft and the crew was the best. Drink was served with no snack.

title: Another 5 Stars Flights!
review_text: I flied from Bangkok to Sapporo VIA Haneda. I always fly with JAL as their Boeing 787 is the best in class with seat arranged in 2-4-2, no other airlines has been doing this, the seat was very comfortable and cabin very clean. Their crew was very professional and helpful, always walk around the cabin.

title: Business class seat is good except that Foods are subpar.
review_text: I flu JAL business class from SFO to SGN on Oct 5, 2022. In general, seats are good enough to sleep for a long range trip. However JAL foods, either onboard or at airport lounges are subpar. Don't know if food quality are affected because of Covid policy, but my flights Pre Covid on the same route by Cathay Pacific gave me great satisfactions.

title: Excellent service and a comfortable ride
review_text: Booked a flight from LAX to Malaysia and what a wonderful trip. Comfortable seats and excellent customer service from both the flight crew and JAL customer support. My return flight did get delayed but only by about 25 minutes. Can’t say I fly often but I had a connecting flight from LAX to Japan than final destination to Kuala Lumpur. Both arrival and return flights were operated by JAL and I don’t regret choosing this airline. would recommend this airline if you’re flying into Japan. They even served Hagan Daez for desserts on the ride 😂😎 also get Sakura lounge access if you have long layover, or you can also rent a room w shower. I paid $40 for 4 hours to take a small nap (single bed w shower)

title: Rated 5 stars up to ticketing
review_text:
We bought multi-cities BC tickets back in April 2022 for flights starting January 2023. We recently read very negative reviews of JAL on Trip Advisor and Trustpilot.uk related to last minute changes, cancellations, selling pre-booked tickets for higher prices, no one to talk to at customers services, etc. All this made us very nervous about our tickets as JAL had also made a couple of changes on our tickets with some incoherence. We need to point out, though, that each change was communicated to us via email. With that background, we called JAL (1 855 604 1744 for USA and Canada) and was so happy and relieved that: 
a) an agent came on the line right away; b) she was very pleasant, knowledgeable and helpful with updating our itinerary based on changes for which we agreed; c) she also ensured updating of our seatings with the best available options; and finally d) sent us confirmation and ticketing promptly as indicated during the telephone conversation. 
In summary, we are very impressed with JAL quality of customers services and up to now, we must say that was our best experience. (we travel a lot , around the world, with the best rated airlines as QATAR, Singapore Airlines, ANA, Cathay Pacific, Air France, etc). 
We hope the actual trip starting in January 2023 will be as planned and enjoyable. Why not?

title: Great!
review_text: Definitely the best airline I have taken.  Had an 11 hour flight and felt really comfortable sitting in economy.  The food and service were excellent.  The check-in process online was very easy.  The flight attendants were friendly and attentive.  If you are flying to Japan, take this airline.  If I had to find any drawback, it was that there were not as many entertainment options as other airlines, but still had plenty of choices.

title: Perfect in every way
review_text: Flew JAL from Melbourne to Narita and on to Frankfurt. Both flights perfect. The planes have plenty of leg room, lots of space, the food and drink was plentiful, regular and excellent. Staff very attentive and polite. Can't fault anything. Would definitely fly again.

title: Inflight services great.  Ground service awful (zero star  actually...)
review_text:
avoid this airline.  inflight service is fantastic.
ground service not so much.
you have to transfer baggage after customs yourself.  
if you have four large luggage - too bad.  drag it to the shuttle, get to a different terminal, drag it out and go to the drop location.  
Why can't they set up a drop location near the exit of the customs area, like most other airports.  (like all other airports that I've used anyway).  never had i had to lug my luggage personally between terminals on a connecting flight in any other airline.
i cannot recommend JAL for this one reason

title: A Kafkaesque nightmare to deal with - do not fly with JAL
review_text:
JAL "customer service" is a Kafkaesque nightmare to deal with, very "computer says no". When I tried to write a written complaint on their website I got a response over a week later advising that if I wanted to make a voluntary change to my flight I needed to call the same number I had called twice before (and written about in my complaint). There is in reality NO way to complaint to JAL. If you ask to speak to a manager they refuse, they repeat the same line over and over again and have to be the most inflexible and unhelpful airline out there. 

The story - 

The ticket was originally booked from Glasgow to London and then on to Australia (business class). When plans changed we enquired whether we could just board the flight in London and not Glasgow. did not seek a refund or any other change. 

We were advised that changes were impossible, than if the flight wasn't boarded in Glasgow the whole ticket would be cancelled. We will be forced to fly from London up to Glasgow, stay in a hotel over night, and then fly back to London, in less than 24 hours. We have to fly to another country in order to fly back to our starting point - it's insane! Imagine missing your flight back to Australia because the completely pointless flight you are being forced to take is cancelled, and although you could board the flight in London you now wont be allowed to. 

I understand the inflexibility of a ticket which doesn't allow changes, but we weren't technically trying to change the ticket, just board when the flight stopped in London.  The absolutely refusal to even appear to try to be accommodating was completely shocking. 

In addition the stop over on the way to London changed to a massive sixteen and a half hours over night. There is no hotel offered so I hope you enjoy laying on the floor of an airport terminal because they kick you out of the business class lounge at 10pm.

title: waited 4 hour because they canceled my flight they hung up on me and told me off, frack JAL they can go bankrupt AGAIN!
review_text:
browsing the flight modification on my flight and then got notified my flight was cancelled,
immediately call in just to wait 5 hours for no one to pick up (YES NO ONE PICKS UP IF YOU CALL IN) then they just drop all the calls when its time to go home and you get to try again the next day, tried again for a month, flight came and went i lost 3k ....I LOST ALL MY FN MONEY....AND MY FLIGHT.., how the F does this happen? go ask them, wait ask who? because you cant contact anyone and no one responds to anything....ahh what a beautiful experience...if the anger i felt could be transformed into hot burning fire i think my whole world would just set ablaze and id be surrounded by burning ash and an inferno at my back

title: never book japan airlines
review_text: I was not allowed to rebook my ticket. There's no other option at all for rebooking. Customer service was CRAP, had to call 3 consecutive days, called the whole day just to be put on hold for hours. Surprisingly, someone answered just to tell me I'm not allowed to rebook after being on hold for 3 hours. Lmao. Food was so BAD, was hungry the whole entire flight, no snacks at all between the 2 meals. Considering our body clock are still in the USA, dinner was serve way pass our dinner time. The next boarding gate was so far from where we got off. Not to mention airport staffs were not helpful at all. And just to make things much more worse, tickets are SO expensive. Just wasted my 900 dollars. Will NEVER recommend to anyone and I will never fly from this airline anymore. This was the worst airline I've experienced so far.

title: Don't transfer from international to domestic at haneda
review_text:
Jal does not transfer baggage for you after customs to connecting flight.  You lug your baggage out, use the terminal shuttle and recheck baggage.
Shuttle bus not level so you have to drag suitcase up and down the shuttle.
All other transfers I nave done, the baggage drop offs were at the end of customs then just go to your new terminal and board.
For this reason a four dot travel o jal is downgraded to one dot.  If there was a way to give zero, I would.  Do not go to japan, place advertises great service, but fails to deliver in a big way.

title: JAL - Need to grow up if you want to be in the Top 5
review_text:
Let me start first by giving credit to JAL in operating long distance 787 with 2 -4 -2 configurations.. This definitely gets rid of at least 2 most dreaded middle seats.
Checkin agents did a great job and when they shifted as gate agents, they were equally impressive that the whole boarding process took about 20 mins ( with about 95% occupancy on the flight). 
The worst part was with the catering ..
1. I had ordered an oriental vegetarian meal and both the meals were served with just steamed rice and steamed vegetables .. NO condiments.. SERIOUSLY JAL.. Not even pepper and salt which are staple in the cutlery pack.. Cost cutting on salt and pepper?  No sauce to add or mix in!!
2. The other passengers (who opted for regular meals) were served ice cream and when I asked for one, the flight attendant did give a “serious knee jerk reaction) that she pulled the tray away from her ( as if I was snatching it)( and said that it was for other passengers and I cannot be given one.  ..Appalling service and training from JAL!!! 
3. Later I saw all unused ice creams being dumped into trash while standing in the galley area. (.. JAL can’t you ask for a second serving if some PAX want it or keep it in the so called snack bar that you operate like done in British Airways.( note my 2nd point above, you did not serve one to someone who asked for it ).
4. The so called self serve snack bar had a packet of potato crackers - smallest potato chips I’ve ever seen and may be in the count of 10 -1 5 of them.. What is the purpose of this ?

I think JAL is very contended in staying out the top league ( while its National competitor is stepping on the gas every notch).  
If you ever think of ordering Vegetarian Oriential meal, be prepared to eat steamed rice and steamed vegetables ( like some monks do).. 

I’m traveling NRT - SFO tomorrow and this time I’ve switched to a different offering..Waiting to see what’s in store !!

Time for JAL to grow up!!!

title: Some good and bad
review_text:
So as a taller guy at 6’4” I’ll take all the extra legroom I can get.  The seats were comfy and I had plenty of legroom which was nice!  The service was excellent as the attendants came around with miso soup green tea and coffee which was a nice touch.  But now for the not so good.  My wife and I agreed that this was some of the worst airline food we had ever eaten in all the years of flying.  It was consistently bad on all four of our legs from Seattle to Bangkok.

I’d fly again just for the extra legroom but because of the food, JAL is a notch lower than EVA.

title: Best airline for service, food, and handling the passengers
review_text:
I have been flying with almost all the hairlines in the last 25 years 
economy, Business class and few times in first class but this airline by far the best airline ever traveled . I am very impressed with the flight attendants   they put their heart to help passengers and keep the airplane tidy and clean , hope all airline follow japan airline in the future.

title: Superb food, attentive service, nice lounges in business class
review_text: When PAL canceled our flight home--and Expedia was no help--we bought a ticket on JAL. The only thing which could possibly have been better was the pod seating on the Boeing 787 (too tight, limited choice of seat positions). The food was better than any Japanese restaurant (that we can afford) in the SF Bay Area USA, the flight attendants were the model of Japanese care and dignity--and you knew everyone was diligent and competent in all they did. The business class lounge in Narita is huge and seems to offer anything you could need. In the future, I will spring for JAL even if it costs extra. It's worth the money.

title: Outstanding experience
review_text: I have been spoiled after this flight. The flight crew was amazing, the food spectacular and I slept 7.5 hours of the flight. I was so impressed that I just booked JAL again for next October.

title: Horrible service to and from
review_text:
I will write this in a list form

Point 1: Leaving Japan

- Lady at check-in counter made me stand there forever because she kept flipping through my passport and looking at the computer over and over again as though she was looking for something she could not find. Why did she not ask me? I don't know. So I waited there, 
- In the end, realising how annoyed the people in the line behind me were, and my own frustration, I had to ask her, "Is there anything wrong, or something I can help you with"
- Then she says she cannot find my visa or ESTA for America. 
- Mind you, when i handed her the passport, I had flipped to the page with the Visa together with all the COVID related document in that page. 
- Thats solved.
-Proceeding to the security checkpoint, the man there tells me to stop and immediately closes the line in front of me using the retractable banner . He does not explain why he is stopping me.
- I ask him what is wrong, he tells me to just wait. "Sir what am I waiting for?"
- He does not explain, my Japanese speaking colleague asks him. He then explains that someone at the check in counter forgot to check the expiration date on my visa, so now i have to wait a few more minutes for that same lady to come down here and note it before I can pass through.
- She comes, writes the information down on brown paper with a pen. In my head I am thinking: Ma'am, why did I have to endure that torture at the counter if you were not taking down my info? But guess what, i cant argue nor show my rage much because I dont speak fluent Japanese and they barely speak English. So I am boiling inside. 

The whole thing took forever and the lack of communication was just very annoying especially when traveling with three other people who's experience was so different because of their Japanese nationality (no need for visas and hence no need for this drama)
But the real question is, was this their first day dealing with a US visa? was I their guinea pig? Why were they so confused and uncoordinated? 

Point 2

No wifi on plane

Point 3: coming back to Japan

On JL015 from LAX to Haneda

-Flight was delayed about 30 minutes, but still the airplane staff were ushering everyone to stand up from the lounge seats to stand in line, even though the plane was not ready. Why?
-Some people noticing that it is going to be a while sat back down but the JAL staff were walking around like police dogs telling people to stand. I don't get it. baggage on your back and crowds getting smooshed together after scanning boarding passes is not the right tone to set for a 12 hour flight. 
-On top of that, the in-flight meals were a choice between chicken and a veggie curry. Guess what, they ran out of chicken before they even made it half way through the flight (What was the logic there?). I told the lady I dont want to eat, and she still brought me the meal anyway. I have no idea why. To be honest their menu was not appetising to begin with.
-Again, no wifi and this time movie selection was so different from the JAL line 906 when we first came (Only has older movies yet still listed them as new releaes). Urghh.

If I could avoid JAL I would, because this was probably the worst flights and services I have received in my whole life. but I will most likely be back on board again, and I do hope that someone with authority gets to see this and makes the necessary changes for the comfort of the customers. We are paying way too much tp be treated like this.

Thanks for reading.

title: Mr.
review_text:
First: when I arrive at the airport I can’t get to lounge as JAL people are not here until 7:30 PM Terrible as this is part of my ticked and travel.  Disappointed. Part of flight is the overall service. No way to write comments on their email as it is directed to online form which rejects it over and over with no clear direction as to why? It is easy to score great rating when not a single person can deliver negative comments. 

Second has to do with JAL website unable to find me in the system. Every time. Is it a name issue? Why is there no search criteria by flight number? The only thing is to pick search and system arrives to “not found “ each time.  When You have late flights and your crew is not here all I can do is sit with crowds at the front of the airport , no way to check my luggage, go shopping or eat as traveling by myself it is cumbersome to leave the bags.  There is just a card on the counter showing 7:30 PM return ( I guess it is related to when someone will show but can’t be sure as it is in Japanese.. ) Is there no  way for JAL to show another terminal which may have a way to check bags and go through  the security? I was counting at getting some work done in the lounge.  Not happy. Not well designed and shows no respect for a customer. Terrible website for what I am doing. No instructions and it keeps rejecting even when those fields are not highlighted in red as required…Silly and frustrating. JAL app has a very very low rating yet no one is doing any improvements? 
Flight is just one part of the travel service and JAL failed before I even started…

title: We will not fly with JAL again.
review_text:
JAL business class, sold through American Airlines. The AA/JAL fare from SEA to BKK was $9429 total for our 2 round trips tickets. 
My husband and I have flown biz class from Seattle to BKK many times with Eva air. First time trying Japan airline (because Covid ...long story). 
The onboard experience was a shocking disappointment in comparison with Eva. The quality of everything on our past flights with Eva was top-notch, especially the fresh and incredible dining experience. 
Whereas at JAL, the Salmon and other meat were mostly over cooked, I had to spit the food back out after one bite. I asked for noddles, again, Eva air had impressive restaurant quality noddles, JAL had instant cup noddles only, really? For biz class! 
When comes to inflight entertainment, the selection was very limited, and 90% of the movies came with Japanese subtitle which’s very annoying. 
Sakura Lounge at Narita offered beer and coffee, the only “food” in there was small packaged seeds with two pieces of almonds in each pack. 
The Eva Air lounges are top quality in all regards including food choices.

title: Outstanding airline. OMG what a service.
review_text:
OMG what a service. I wish that other airlines are like JAL.
This was our first trip to Japan ever. All started with JAL. From the time we checked in at LAX to the time we arrived at Haneda airport, we were treated with respect, great care and attention. The plane was very nice and super clean. The seats in economy class are very comfortable. Legroom is generous compared to other airlines.
In-flight services were impeccable. The stewardess always came around to offer drinks (tea, juice, ...). They genuinely paid attention to our comfort during the flight. They are so polite. No attitude. The meals also were above average. 
The entertainment system was great with movies, games, news, flight info, etc...
All in all, we really enjoyed the 12-hour flight very much. Didn't seem long at all. 

HAT OFF to JAL. And a Japanese bow.

title: 2+ Hous on Hold
review_text: Hire another person to answer the phone.  2+ hours to connect to a person is abhorrent in this age.  Just crap all the way around.

title: first class flight on  Boeing 777
review_text: I must place a review as I was very disappointed with our trip in the above. Plane was tired and not in the condition I would expect. First class was not up to standard. I have gone first class a few times and expected the same. No privacy in the open seating, looked a little shabby, toilet facilities were inadequate for first class and the food and wine  choice was not up to standard.  Travelled business class from Tokyo to Sydney in a JL789 and was cleaner and better laid out for a little privacy.  Also my inflight entertainment did not work. Kept cutting out. Hostess tried to fix but would just drop out, so was very long flight.

title: Another problem returning from trip
review_text: After leaving late from Bangkok, but arriving with 25 minutes until connecting flight to San Diego,  they transferred us to another flight to Seattle in business class and then Seattle to San Diego in coach adding 6 hours and a connection through Seattle. Horrible customer service again and paid for business class.

title: Horrible customer service and scheduling changes
review_text: The flight was cancelled and we were not notified until we arrived at the airport on the confirmed day of travel.  They booked us the day after. Then, they didn’t change our connecting flight and we had to spend 5 hours on the phone on the day we were supposed to travel to try to get new flight to our final destination, Bangkok. They had no space availability and asked us if we wanted to change our plans. NO!  The trip was planned and paid for months in advance.   They  finally offered another flight on another airline (Al Nippon) at another airport (Haneda) and we had 7 hour layover to transfer and missed a night we already paid for at hotel in Bangkok and golf already paid for. Horrible customer service trying to work this out. Finally got supervisor who changed flight/airport after being on phone 4 1/2 hours.

title: Not worth the hype
review_text: We were on our way to Australia from London, via Helsinki with Finnair.  The airport in Narita was over crowded.  I must admit the staff did try their best under the circumstances.  The plane was a 787 but had neo-shell seats which did not fully recline.  The plane was tired looking, the food mediocre at best, staff were uninterested- generally everything was tired.  Had to sleep when you keep on sliding down.  Always wanted to fly with JAL - never again.  Very disappointed!

title: Great first time experience!
review_text: Our first time flying with Japan Airlines and I was floored by the quality of service we received as well as the plane itself. Everything was clean upon arrival, with not even a crumb on the floor. As a tall person, the seats fit my long legs without any issues (not something you find in North America without an extra fee). The in flight entertainment had lots of Hollywood blockbusters and activities to choose from. The staff was lovely, professional and were patient with everyone around me. The in-flight meal was the best I’ve had on any flight I’ve taken (and that have been a few hundred). Delicious, flavourful, hot, and there was a lot to consume. I will definitely be flying with this airline again.

title: Super Employee Shimada-san Tokyo Haneda
review_text: Prior to the pandemic, I frequently travelled with JAL, and it's always been a great experience. On October 22nd, I took the 9.20am flight from HND-LHR, as I was boarding, I realized I forgot to return my pocket wifi. Shimada-san who works for JAL was a HUGE help and kindly took care of this for me. I really appreciate her help and support. SUPER EMPLOYEE- !! Five stars

title: SHOCKING!
review_text:
Routing - LGA-ORD [AA] ORD-NRT [JL] NRT - CGK [JL] and CGK-NRT [JL] NRT-LAX [JL] LAX -JFK [AA] - Was honestly excited to experience JAL business class, especially with a reasonable AA/JL fare from NYC-CGK at ~$2,600 RT for Business Class. As I sit at home recovering from this trip, however, I am nothing but disappointed. Mostly because my last flight from LAX-JFK on AA somehow provided better service than any of my JAL flights. I had ordered a Vegetarian/Vegan meal which was confirmed on my outbound trip but not on the return, leading to a very unpleasant experience. The Vegan meals when they were offered on the outbound were pathetic. For the main course of a meal on a 13 hour flight from ORD-NRT was one small boiled carrot with white rice and a piece of cabbage over the top! The second meal of that flight was slightly better, and the connecting flight had passable service except for the pre-landing meal in CGK which was a bun with maybe two bites of vegetables served in blue plastic wrap! That’s somehow supposed to be acceptable in BUSINESS CLASS??? I mean, across the board the hard-product on JAL sucks unless you have the Apex-Suite [SkySuite Original] on the 77W and select 787-8/9s, however, I had the SkySuite III on my flights from/to the U.S.A, and the Shell Flat Neo my flights to/from CGK. To think what airlines invest in business class in the transatlantic market from NYC on flights of similar length or even shorter than NRT-CGK-NRT, JAL should feel the shame of offering this product that was at no point competitive. I can’t fault any of the cabin crew, however, their main objective seemed to be avoiding conflict, which I of course was not going to engage regardless of the meal discrepancy I had on the return. I you do not have status with JAL or OneWorld and are “ONLY” flying Business Class, expect ZERO special treatment or priority, including baggage delivery. The airport experience boarding the NRT-LAX flight was shocking, as they corralled everyone into the gate area at Narita only to line up Group 1, have those in Group 1 stand up waiting in line, while everyone else crowded around to wait, including those in Group 2, the standard Business Class boarding group. To be honest, and I am being truthful in my personal experience, I have flown similar distances on other airlines in Economy Class and felt more rested and less ripped off than in Japan Airlines Business class. Further, the entertainment selection and hardware  is not sufficient for the lengthy itineraries that JAL sells. It truly makes me sad to write such a harsh review, especially when the service was so well intentioned, or at least manufactured to be, however, I could never in good conscience recommend JAL
Business Class. When the only positives are the showers in the Sakura Lounge at Narita and the packaged rice crackers with two [yes I’m serious] almonds in each pack, something probably has to be done to improve the passenger experience.

title: The Good the Bad and...... JAL
review_text:
The good the bad and the …. JAL
Fawlty Towers airline style
Be careful
If you did not see this for yourselves, you would not believe it.
JAL Flight number 5 JFK New York to Tokyo 11th October
As frequent international travelers, VIPs with major airlines and life member of Qantas we decided to use some points for a simple Premium Economy flight from New York to Tokyo with Japan Airlines. Remember the name.
Easy, points used, flights booked all good… Until we arrived at JFK airport.
3 days earlier we had tried to catch the flight but due to Covid updated regulations we needed a PCR test, so the flight was postponed. We then paid the additional charge to Qantas, all good, we thought.
Japan airlines then informed us  on our arrival via their supervisor our tickets were FAKE!
 We were not confirmed on the flight.
 Yes, FAKE and we were to call our bank immediately and put a hold on the payment.
Earlier that morning we had double checked with Qantas (Eddie from customer service was great not only did he confirm all good he called back to make sure everything was ok).
Until we got to the check in at JAL
We showed our email confirmed tickets to the JAL manager…. Answer no
We showed our receipt of payment…. answer no
Quote: “ you have been scammed, call your bank and stop payment” 
The manager did imply we could but another ticket!!!
