While my wife tried calling our bank I thought, hang on wait. I called Qantas customer service and asked for Eddie, no problem. Eddie asks how I can help.
He was stunned, he says…. Tell them to look at their screen.
JAL Manager says no its FAKE and walks away from me.
( His name he would not show us, but it was not Japanese he was in his mid-50’s and the name sounded like Isuze with a mid-European accent)
I call Eddie again; he says this is crazy ask him to get on the phone with me. At this point ( sometime later) the manager is now trying to avoid me, I call to him in front of everyone ( and in a very calm respectful tone) please speak to Eddie from Qantas here is the phone.
 Eddie says to tell you all you have to do is look at your screen!!
He still refuses to talk with Eddie.
Well, well the manager looks at the screen and guess what???? Our tickets were there all along.
No apology nothing.
Thank you, Qantas, thank you Eddie.
JAL if this is the quality of your management you have problems big problems
And by the way the flight was fine.

title: Disappointing business class experience - Australia to Europe
review_text:
Just got back from Europe after a very disappointing business class experience. Cabin and ground staff were rude and unhelpful. Western food options inflight were very low quality compared to Japanese meal options.

Flew on a 787-9 and seat was very uncomfortable. Not able to fully recline seat into a flat bed and was very claustrophobic.

Business class lounge at Haneda airport has very limited food options and no showers. After a 12 hour flight (and then another 11 hours to come) being able to have a shower during a layover is very important, and all JAL had was a small change room. Also no shops open I. The transit area at Haneda so not able to do any duty free shopping.

Won't be travelling JAL again.

title: terrible website, terrible customer service
review_text: Japanese corporate websites are notoriously bad, but Japan Airlines is the worse.  It is impossible to know if your flight has been booked or not.  The Customer Service phone line often rings busy (!!!), and then when you get it, you are on hold until the line hangs up.  I do not ever want to fly Japan Airines, if I can avoid it.

title: No problems for us.
review_text:
Except for having trouble getting in contact with them a few months ago, when one of our flight connection wasn't going to work (and we did get it sorted) we have no complaints. We got updates via emails while away, and no changes were made.
Service was good, both planes and staff. 
So, for us, we were perfectly satisfied with JAL.

title: Terrible Customer service
review_text: Very bad experience with customer service, I called in 2 days and when they re route me to the department always nobody pick up. This was in the span of 2 days of 12 hours just calling them.

title: Disappointing change of product
review_text:
I would not understand why the 10 hr flight will be using regional business seat as 2-2-2 instead of Sky Suite. We fly business class long haul for more privacy and a good sleep. 
The Japan - Australia routes should never be regional.

title: Terrible in-flight and customer service
review_text:
A transfer flight via NRT to LAX. And it's cost more than usuall, about $2571, and their service sucks.

Extremely terrible in-flight service. The flight attendence keeps knocking restroom door endlessly during you use it, and shout loudly. Even you ask them to wait. Never experience this terrible service in other airline.

The headphone in seat is half opened....

The drinks during the flight is only offered once. Unlike some other airlines will ask you if you need refill.

They don't have bilingual annoucnement at LAX.....Just in japanese. How can a international flight don't have board cast in multiple languages?

And you almost can not find their customer service. Like they don't exist at all. Tried phone, email. None reply.

title: Customer Service is nonexistent; terrible unser-unfriendly website
review_text:
I couldn't fid my reservation when I tried to manage my booking or even check in online! So I called the airline customer service contact and was on hold for 2 hours one time and 1.5 hours another time with "please wait for the next available agent". They could have saved us time by saying "there are no agents available" instead! 

What a waste of time and with no indication if I was flying or not the next day. Inflight service and food was very good, but the website and customer service are both non-existent and useless.

title: Best Airline
review_text: Great service and michelin grade food. Most important the toilet is clean. Even though I could have chosen a direct flight from HKG with other airlines, I would rather fly with JAL. Best airline!

title: A little disppointment
review_text: My wife and I choose JAL business class night flight from Bangkok to Tokyo (Haneda Airport) because we expect to have good service and some good rest. We found the configuration business class seat of JAL Boeing 787 is quite unexpected. The seat configuration is 2-2-2 which make the seat not so large. We can not make flat bed but rather tilted bed which make us unable to sleep. Otherwise the service was good and the food was nice. We do hope that JAL may make some change regarding business seat.

title: Extremely reliable, helpful and comfortable airline
review_text:
First experience flying with JAL and it was great, the food was good, seats were comfortable with plenty of leg room, plenty of free luggage allowance too (2x20kg+cabin bag), movie selection offered something for everyone. Best part about them though is their staff, unbelievably helpful, always polite and always keen to go above and beyond to help. When my travel agent messed up my flights and left me stranded in Sydney on my way back, JAL were the ones to help me find another flight (for free, even though they had done nothing wrong), as quickly as possible. 

Top airline all around

title: Hassle free flight
review_text: I traveled with infant and service which they provided was above and beyond. I would 100% recommend Japan Airlines for traveling with Infant.

title: Worst than the worst.
review_text:
Worst airlines ever.  Staff wasn't bad but the food unbearable and for a 10 hour flight to Narita, it was just embarrassing.  
You want to call customer service, impossible.  I spent three hours on hold and nothing, and then spent another 2 hours on hold and still nothing, other than, "please wait for the next available agent."  This company will never get my business again or anyone I talk to.

title: Airline fine, Check-in by local KLIA confused
review_text:
The check in crew at KLIA gave confusing information. They insist all pass including transit only ones, need to have MySOS app on the phone to board. The guy said this would be checked at gate. He also said we needed eVisa for transit, but another crew told him not to bother! Nobody checked MySOS for transit pass. However, we and many others at KLIA had to download the app and fill out the info it requested. That took about one extra hour to do! JAL should retrain the KLIA local staff.

Cabin crew, plane and amenities were great on the plane. At NRT, we required some first aid and ground staff there took good care of us. We had to take another flight which they arranged later that day. They were courteous and in view of the pandemic, everyone wanted to be extra careful. 5* for airline.

title: Flying safe is their priority
review_text:
Do your homework as to what an airline is expecting you to do prior to international boarding with health requirements as the rules change constantly.  Also, may I recommend you try to have at least a 2 hour layover for an international connecting flight.  

My travel was Economy Class  from Boston/Tokyo/Singapore and was pleasantly surprised with my overall experience. Even though the Boston/Tokyo flight departed an hour later due to a passenger's health issue, JAL's staff was efficient  and kept us informed on a regular basis. As a matter of fact, they were efficient all through the booking process through to departure.  My connecting flight to Singapore was also delayed and I was able to arrive safely.

title: Dont plan on canceling or changing your flight with this company
review_text:
Wow , i booked a trip with this company thru expediataap . There was no warning that there is no solo travel right now in japan . 
went to get a refund for he 1400 I spent . No deal they will not give me a refund . 
What kind of scum bag company is this ????????????????
Do not use this company !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

title: Could Not Find Help
review_text:
For over 20 years, my family and I have flown the AA/Japan route from Dallas to Ho Chi Minh city and we always had a pleasant experience. We would book directly with Japan Airlines. However, recently this week, my parents misread their ticket for 8PM instead of 8AM. When they showed up to the airport, they found out that they had missed their flight. Completely understandable, it was their fault that they misread it. When they went to the ticket counter for Japan Airlines at Tan Son Nhat International Airport, they people there told them that there is nothing that they could do about them missing their flight. They would either need to buy a completely brand new ticket or call up whoever they bought the ticket from. I explained to them that we bought it from Japan Airlines. They said there is nothing they could do...

At this time, my parents are stuck in Vietnam and I am in Dallas, so I waited for the customer service line to open and called them immediately. When I explained to the representative, he basically told me that their policies state that since my parents miss their flight, they lost their value and they would have to buy a brand new ticket for $2K each. I asked them if there is anything that they could do to help because we do not have $4K to spend immediately to get my parents back. They told me word for word, "well if you want to get them back to America then you have to pay $4K." Completely heartless. I understand your policies but I was asking for help because it was something that we could not afford, I do not know the average person's affordability but for my family, we do not have $4K to simple drop in a moment. I can say without a doubt, we will never miss a flight again or ever do any service with Japan Airlines. There are plenty of other airlines out there who will make a connection to Asia, if I have to eat less to save more money to fly another airline, I definitely would. I called Singapore Airlines and they were able to help quickly and reasonably. Thank you Singapore Airlines.

title: Awesome customer service from ticketing agent, Tomoko (LAX)
review_text:
Hi Japan Airlines! I would like to share my appreciation for your ticketing agent, Tomoko. I wish I had a better photo of her or it would have been better if I had a photo with her. I also hope I got her name correctly. 🙏

Tomoko was the agent who attended to me in LAX, FRI 8/5 at around 1pm Pacific Time for the JL 061 flight to Manila, Philippines. She was most efficient and demonstrated outstanding customer service. She was very genuine in ensuring that I am able to get on that flight and get back home safely to my family. 🤩

I hope this message reaches you Tomoko! You are so excellent in what you do, helping JAL customers. Thank you again for being so awesome! 👏👍🏆

I would also like to commend JAL’s inflight WI-FI. I had some work to complete and was able to do so with onboard internet. Thanks again for the great end to end service! I had a great flight back home! 😍🥳🫶👍👍👍

#greatcustomerexperiences #JAL

title: Premium Economy sucks
review_text: JAL maybe a great airline, But if you are flying in their so-called Premium Economy, avoid it!!! Bad food, bad seating, entertaiment was a joke and impossible to sleep. I would be better fly Emirates and fly Economy instead of this even tough it's far. I would not fly with JAL in this class again unless I fly for hell.

title: The worst customer experience - Call Centre ineptitude
review_text:
If you actually manage to get onto a flight that has not changed or been cancelled then well done !! The service onboard is one of the best in the air.

HOWEVER.... if you are one of the countless victims of JAL's flight changing / cancellations (or worse, you need to contact the call center) then it is one of the worst customer experience you will have. 

I had flights to Tokyo and then a domestic connection within Japan. Out of the blue I receive an unclear email that states the flights have changed, the departure time and date are the same but the arrival times (on a direct flight) have changed and the connections are now misaligned leaving me stuck. The website was not functioning properly and so I was forced to call the call centre during the slim daily window in which they operate. This is where the issues started... nobody EVER answers, 

Unfortunately due to the fact that I had a meeting I had to abandon my attempt and getting any information after a mere 90 minutes in the call center queue, listening to the same loop of music and the same condescending voice "All of our agents are busy, please wait for the next available agent or call back later" - the really galling part is every so often I hear a beep on the line where somebody is there but not answering. 

Even though I travel to Japan regularly I will really think long and hard before ever choosing JAL again, they really have let themselves down with their appalling customer service, no callback service, no estimated wait time NOTHING...

title: Literally the worst customer service I have ever experienced
review_text: JAL threw my autistic daughter (and wife) off the flight after screaming at her to "shut up" when she didn't want to wear a seatbelt, and are currently refusing to pay the legally required compensation - their UK help line requires about 2 hours of being on hold each time you call and you end up needing to wait for a callback even for the simplest thing.

title: Brilliant airline
review_text:
I flew from London Heathrow to Tokyo Haneda. Due to the closure of Russian airspace the flight was slightly longer than usual, but even this 13-hour flight was surprisingly pleasant thanks to Japan Airlines’s incredible service, food and entertainment. I am a regular customer with JAL and never have I been disappointed. The crew were professional, polite and helpful, the food was more delicious than you’d expect from an economy class product on a flight and the selection of entertainment was more than enough to keep you entertained for the flight. Two full meals and two snacks (ice cream and dorayaki - this seems to be standard on Japan Airlines). 
On the other hand, the seats are quite firm and perhaps a bit uncomfortable to move around in on a 13-hour flight - JAL appears to use the same seats on its longest international flights as well as its shorter domestic flights…Plenty of legroom though and seats are very wide. Recline is also somewhat good.
I’d definitely recommend Japan Airlines to you if you’re travelling from Europe to Japan. Compared to BA and ANA that I’ve also flown with to Japan, JAL seems to be the best in economy class.

title: Very bad experience with Japan Airlines
review_text:
JAL has changed my trip without any notice and I could not check any changes on their website. My husband had to call on JAL call center to get the latest flight information. JAL gave us a 26-hour layover in Vancouver Airport instead of 3 hours as before and also another transit airport between Halifax and Vancouver with more than 4 waiting hours in Toronto. The call center guy of JAL in North America also has a very negative attitude when checking flights or options for us. He asked me to call WestJet to check and changed flights instead of working himself. However, we are not WetJet's customers, we pay the whole trip money to JAL. The call center guy told me that "How do I know if I do not try to call WestJet". After calling him, I did call WestJet but WetJet could not help and asked me to contact JAL again. 
I did fly with my international airlines but it's the first time I had a very negative experience I had with JAL. I would not recommend this airline to anyone. 
It's my honest review for JAL.

title: They took $4000 USD from US
review_text: The ZIPAIR assistant changed our ticket to THAILAND instead of Vietnam and told us where we could buy a new one to our original destination. We got stuck in the airport because I need a visa to get out of the airport. We ended up buying another 2 tickets coming back from Thailand and getting stuck in the airport for 50 hours. We couldn´t fly t another country because nobody accepts passengers from a cheap airline like ZIPAIR. NEVEEEEEER fly with this airline!!! It´s a waste of time and money!! They ignore your emails and calls, and don´t care if they made a mistake, they just want your money!!!!!

title: Warning to JAL Transit Passengers
review_text:
How times, and airlines, have changed. A few years ago, JAL was our favourite international airline.  We are booked on a JAL premium economy return flight from Sydney to Paris in a few weeks which requires a 14-hour overnight layover at the Haneda airport hotel airside.  This was the only connection available.
We started to get concerned when we read that due to COVID, Japan was not issuing any tourist visas (unless in a group) or even transit visas.  The Japanese consulate in Australia has confirmed this is the case and as we must pass immigration to get to the airport hotel, 200 metres away, we will be denied entry into Japan.  
So, what to do?  Some travellers suggest sleeping in the airport waiting area (some banks of seats have no arms so stretch out they say) however that definitely wasn’t an attractive or an acceptable option. We are way past sleeping on airport benches or floors.  Notwithstanding, we now understand that a new development is airport staff are now shutting down the airport late at night, again due to Covid concerns and kick everyone out – to where?  Can’t enter Japan, can’t stay at the airport, can’t go back to the plane.
As most JAL customers know and despite Japan’s customary politeness and civility, etc.,  the airline’s customer service is practically non-existent, certainly there is no capacity to email the airline.  I waited two hours on the phone only to be addressed by someone who didn’t want to be there and had absolutely no interest in the issues I was trying to resolve. I achieved nothing and was left with a feeling that the airline was happy to keep my flight payments knowing full well that I would be left in ‘no-man’s land’ at Haneda airport, unable to go anywhere.
Bottom line is that, in my view, JAL’s behaviour has been unconscionable.  The airline hasn’t even had the decency to contact us  (and no doubt all the other transit passengers on the flight) and offer alternatives.  I will cancel my flight and fight the A$600 (for 2 people) cancellation fee that JAL will impose.  It is clear that JAL has little interest in the current unsolvable issue their only flight connection has created for its transit passengers.

title: Very poor compliance
review_text: We had our tickets booked from New Delhi to Los Angeles on the airlines for 4th August 2022 via make my trip. The airline cancelled the flight and refused to accommodate any request for an exchange from mumbai to Los Angeles on the same date. Very poor service and compliance. This was less than one month before travel.

title: Inaccessible Customer Service
review_text:
Japan Airlines is the worst airline that I have ever attempted to work with.

I booked tickets for my honeymoon with JAL. They cancelled one leg of a 4 leg journey and refused to transfer me to the other flight that worked with the existing itinerary. The only option they provided was for me to depart 24 hours earlier, still arriving on the same day due to the horrible layovers with their alternative itinerary.

Obviously I chose to cancel the flight and booked another trip with Singapore air. At time of cancellation they told me I'd be receiving a full refund. 4 months later, I'm still waiting on my refund.

While writing this I'm 3 hours into waiting on hold on their customer service line so that I can figure out when they're going to return my captive $2000. As far as I can tell, sitting on hold is the only way to get in contact with JAL.

I have and will continue to advise everyone I know to avoid this airline like the plague.

-Andrew Bitzko

title: Broken seat upgrade to First Class, usual fine service in lounge and on flight
review_text:
I took the early morning 8:05 am flight from Bangkok to Tokyo Narita.  I arrived at the airport at around 5:20 am before check in opened at 5:35 am.  I lined up for the First Class check in line based on OneWorld Emerald status eventhough I was booked in Business Class.  The line was not moving as the first passenger in line seemed to have a complicated issue that took a lot of time so one of the Business Class counters took over checking in those in the First Class line.  

I had reserved seat 5A which is a window seat in the first row of Business Class.  On check in, I was told the seat had a problem with the partition between the window seat and the aisle seat and that it could not move up all the way.  As the flight was pretty full and I was pretty sure all the window seats were taken already, I said I was fine with my seat.  Business and First passengers can use the priority lane security entrance on the main floor and did not have to go up one floor to go through security like the other passengers.  I was quickly past security and passport control and in the Sakura Lounge at Suvarnabhumi airport. 

Instead of the usual self serve buffet, Sakura Lounge is now on an order system where you go up to staff and order your food items or drinks.  At the meal counter, you could order chicken curry, donburi set, sausage and egg set, salad, corn soup, Japanese gozen or fried chicken, more than enough food and plenty of choices for breakfast.  Service, as usual for JAL, was very efficient.   There is a lot of seating in the lounge and plastic dividers have been placed between seats for Covid-19 protection.  

The flight boarded on time.  On boarding, I discovered the partition between my seat and seat 5B was completely taped down in the open position so that there was no privacy at all from seat 5B.  I went up to the purser to mention this as it was a different situation than check-in had explained to me.  After checking briefly, the purser came back to me to offer a seat in First Class instead since this flight did have a small first class section with 8 seats and there was a single unoccupied seat.  

Business class is configured 2X2X2 and First class is configured 1X2X1.  The First class seat was much more spacious than the business class seat, with neat storage compartments all around the seat and a foot rest that could double as a second seat for a companion to have a join meal in the seat.  The First class seat had beautiful wood trim all around, a very large video screen, and a shelf under the video monitor that can move toward the seat as a large table.  There is also ample storage space under the food rest for a carry on bag. 

On this medium haul flight, the toiletries bag and menu were the same in First and Business class and only the blanket was different with First having a warmer textured blanket.  

Service, as always on JAL, was excellent.  Lunch was served during the flight and I selected the Japanese meal with the bento box of various starters, followed by soup, rice and the duo of mains of grilled flatfish miso yuan style and grilled pork saikyo style.   It was delicious, filling and visually extremely appealing. 

I have always enjoyed my JAL flights and this one was no exception.  An upgraded super comfortable wide seat, excellent food and service - another great flight experience.

title: ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE
review_text: I definitely expected a lot more from JAL. My mom was on the flight from NY JFK to Seoul S.Korea and had the connection in Haneda. JAL canceled the flight without any reason (no weather or problem with the plane) and let my mom know at the boarding gate! She checked in her bags already and was waiting for her flight and was notified that her connecting flight was canceled and the one that they booked for her was now 15 hours overnight stay at the airport. When I got on the phone with customer service, they told me the flight was canceled 10 days ago but they did not send us any email regarding the changes to the flight. They refused to get her any hotel or meal to compensate for the changes to the flight. My mom is 65 years old, does not speak Japanese or English, and is now stuck at the airport for 15 hours without any help from the airline. Absolutely ridiculous experience and will never take JAL ever again.

title: Usually perfection, but these days they are overwhelmed
review_text:
JAL is usually one of the best airlines in the world. I've flown several times in Business and also First class. Wonderful!  But now, after flying a round trip with them to Jakarta and back, I wouldn't be very excited to fly them until Japan changes its quarantine rules for tourists: EVERY SINGLE JAL FLIGHT WAS DELAYED both to and from USA and to and from Asia. 
This isn't really JAL's fault: the Japanese govt isn't allowing JAL to leave a single passenger in Narita overnight, so if even one connecting flight from JFK/ORD/LAX/SFO/SAN/SEA/YVR/DFW is delayed, then ALL of the connections to BKK/CGK/SIN/KUL/MNL/HAN are delayed so that every single passenger gets on their connecting flight. Same thing on the way back to USA. My delays were: SFO-NRT 90 min delay; NRT-CGK 3 hours delay: CGK-NRT not delayed; NRT-SFO 1 hour delay, causing me to miss my connection from SFO to JFK. 
In addition, the intra-Asia flights on the 787-800 features slanted beds in Business Class (NOT FLAT) which is not competetive with the other airlines-- Garuda, Singapore Air, Malaysia Air, Cathay, ANA. 
Lastly, JAL weirdly serves only a tiny snack after take off on the 7 hour flight CGK-NRT, which departs at 06:35AM. 5 hours into the flight the main meal is served. I hadn't eaten anything before the flight because I (like everyone else on the plane, right?) got up at 3AM, got to the airport about 430AM, went through immigration and customs etc... before boarding at 6AM. When were we expected to eat? I wish I'd have known this ahead of time. 
Ummmm also I tried calling JAL's USA number at least 15 times before the trip began and.... busy busy busy busy. Ridiculous. 
Pro: Seat and food on in Business class on the 777-300ER for SFO-NRT and return was excellent!

title: ANA > Japan Airlines
review_text:
My first flight from DEL to Haneda was with economy class, it was very uncomfortable! No leg space at all, food was Japanese style and very limited. The service wasn’t the best as well. 

When I landed in Haneda I asked to upgrade to Economy seat with more leg room for my next flight. First of all, the language barrier is a huge issue! I have been told all leg room seats are reserved and I had no choice to pay more for economy premium. 

The seats in economy premium are okay, I can’t say they are that comfortable but I got enough leg space. 
You also get a small bag with some goodies for the rest of your flight. Food was okay, not better than regular economy. 

My main issue was that I saw a lot of unreserved leg room seats in economy so I don’t understand why I was been told that they are sold out. 

My experience with ANA was definitely much better!

title: Absolutely the best airline I've ever traveled with
review_text: I can't say enough obout this airline. After getting canceled and ran around by Delta, we finally got rebooked on JAL. Going from Seattle to Manila. Their economy seats are better than Delta premium comfort.  The food is better.  I wish I'd known about JAL prior.  I'll use JAL anytime I get the opportunity.  They EARNED my money with their customer service and amenities.  Thank you JAL. This should be the industry standard.  Finally,  a company that actually cares about their customers.  On my connection to another airline,  they had a rep to personally escort us to the next flight so we wouldn't miss it. Amazing service.  Even if it is more expensive,  it's worth every penny.

title: Customer service non-existent by phone if you need them
review_text: Tried to get a hold of customer service by phone for three days straight to make changes with my flight after booking online with no luck. As far as the the flights themselves that I had, I had a great experience with the cleanliness of the plan. The service received from the flight attendants and the food that was served was much better than most other airlines. I have had better entertainment choice on other airline flying similar routes. In the air, 5 star experience, on the ground 1 star experience.

title: Good Airline But Puzzled
review_text: Flown to Japan round trip with my wife about a dozen times using JAL. Pretty consistently good service, food, overall experience in this regard. On this last return flight to San Diego the vast majority of travelers were Foreigners (non Japanese). Upon landing the head flight attendant walked around and personally thanked the handful of Japanese travelers (including my wife) but no one else. She spoke Japanese which I understand. I thought that an odd business practice and one which I'd guess did not escape notice by other non-japanese as well. Again, overall service was satisfactory but I think the time has come to retire this business practice. Poor judgement in my opinion.

title: Don't use if need transit or change flight
review_text: Bad customer service. Not able to help much. Please don't use them if need any customer service. Cannot communicate in English.

title: An airline company that offers limited solution and victim blames
review_text:
My parents and I are on vacation to attend my brother's graduation in Canada. We are now required to look for alternatives on our own because JAL cancelled our flight to Malaysia a couple of days prior to our flight due to it being an overnight transit. They are NOT assisting with alternatives and the only compensation they offer is a refund which is NOT immediate. 

PLEASE PURCHASE YOUR FLIGHT TICKETS WITH CAUTION. DO NOT PURCHASE ANY FLIGHTS WITH LONG/OVERNIGHT TRANSIT THROUGH JAPAN AND DO NOT PURCHASE WITH JAL UNLESS YOU ARE ABSOLUTELY SURE THE PURCHASE DOES NOT REQUIRE YOU TO REACH OUT FOR JAL'S CUSTOMER SERVICE IN ANY WAY.

Also, I am uncertain as to why the lady who called needed to ask for my family member's names (even the one who isn't flying) but just in case the information is going to be used for malicious intentions, I have gone through the trouble of recording the second half of our phone call in case nobody was recording it.

title: Cannot make reservation change - Non existent customer service
review_text: After hours of calling their customer service, I was not connected to a customer representative. Their website does not allow changing ticket. Horrible airline. Pay few hundred dollar more to flight with another airline will save you lots of time and work.

title: Uncomfortable business class
review_text: My trip to Jakarta had 2 flights.  Service and the flight attendants were uniformly excellent although their English skills were limited.  (First time that I've found that limitation on a bi-lingual flight.) The film offerings were few and rarely tempting. On the first flight, had I been a tall,  size 12 woman,  the seating area would have felt cramped, but it was private and the seat reclined well.  On the second leg, however, the seat was not private but more like a reclining economy seat.  The major problem was the seat itself.  Fully reclined,  it was like lying on a slant board,  my feet almost on the ground.  Uncomfortable to say the least.  Bad for circulation.   On both flights the design was not thought through with little perching space for personal items and food service at the same time.  I was spoiled by my Turkish airline business class experience last year.

title: Japan Airlines at DFW
review_text: Maha at Japan Airlines at DFW was able to easily switch me to another flight! They anticipated what I need and I appreciate that so much.

title: Worst Customer Service
review_text:
Japan Airlines has good cabin crew. But other than that… good luck to you if something goes wrong with your booking. Their customer service is nonexistent. All you get is a busy tone. And people at the ticketing gate are the worst, no compassion whatsoever. One lady from their group tried to help me and only because she felt bad because I am traveling with a baby. They don’t smile at all. 
I got left behind because the ticket number that my infant was assigned to was incorrect. It was an easy fix to think about it because it was a lap infant ticket. But I was left behind with my 2 kids. And worst is that I got stranded on my second leg. Meaning I had to buy tickets to get back home. I have 2 kids with me… a five y/o and a 1 y/o. 
They are so heartless. Even if it was purchased thru a 3rd party booker they should still  help or atleast try to help their passengers because it is still their product. 
Never flying JAL ever again. Love their cabin crew but other than that it’s a rating of zero. 
It was a nightmare. One of the worst days of my life…thanks to Japan Airlines.

title: Worst flight experience of my life
review_text: Lack of customer responsibility, unethical, opposite of what Japan is known for, I was not able to fly from Seattle to Malaysia because I have 20hours layover and I was not allowed to go to and I was not given any notice about. I tried calling, emailing and all kinds of ways to reach them and I had no answers weeks before my flight. They just hang up the phone each time, called Narita Airport and they said I was good to go. When I got to Seattle they do not let me board the plane and DO NOT help me get another. Their staff were rude, and was yelling at me like it was my mistake. I hope this airline get shut down some day.

title: One of the Worst Airlines
review_text:
Where do I start? Customer service is awful, from inquiries to check-in. I can't tell if it's communication barrier, rudeness, lack of confidence with employees to communicate properly with customers or they just don't care.

Plane, 777 - I don't understand how JAL was rated a 5 star airlines. In all categories, this should be a 1 star airlines. Toothpicks were all around my seat area & my seat area was dirty & uncleaned. JAL prides itself on cleaniness, it's far from it. I will advise that you get your personal Clorox wipes handy. Headphone jack was screwed up. I literally had to use books to support the headphone plugin to watch movies. USB port was non-functional in my seat location. To be honest, once I observed the attitudes & the communication experience with JAL employees, I simply ignored everything around me, including the flight attendants and more focused on getting to my destination - home. Never, will I make a mistake to book with this airline.

Food - it was pathetic, a joke for business class. I watched some YouTube videos before making a reservation & the talk of food & flight experience seems stellar. Be careful about recommendations of those YouTubers.  Wait till you have the real experience, it was awful. 

Lounge - The Sakura Lounge at Narita Airport was decent, clean & some food options. The meal I ordered was ok. The corn soup was good. I didn't interact much with the lounge staff due to COVID-19 protocols but I did say thank you in Japanese & most responded politely. However, the lounge experience doesn't transfer to the in-flight experience.

Overall, an awful experience for my roundtrip flight.

title: FRAUD
review_text:
Covid significantly changes various aspects in our lives. I understand that businesses are in the process of recovering from the impact of Covid. However, it does not mean that an airline can create an itinerary that customer absolutely can’t travel and push all responsibilities over to booking agents.

My family and I booked a flight to travel from JFK to SGN. Japan Airline offers flights from JFK to NRT, then from HND to SGN. We went with JAL instead of ANA because of shorter layover. Less than 24hr before departing, we received a courtesy call telling us that we must cancel this flight and work with our book agent for a different path because of the covid restrictions in Japan. We had asked for assistance since we had contacted JAL in the past, and none of the calls were successful. The average wait time is 3 hrs. There’s no call back options. 

Our agent tried to contact JAL, but waiting from 3:30pm to 9:40pm and never got a response. When we arrived at the airport, the staffs completely ignored us and others who are on the same boat. We had to go back to our agent to book a flight for the next day. 

In such challenging period, working together to find a solution is much more effective than denying responsibility. Selling a flight that no one could possibly fly is unethical. A reasonable person would believe in the airline’s arrangements while preparing necessary documents such as proof of negative PCR result in response to the current environment that we are in. It’s the airline responsibility to offer fly itinerary that would take their customers to where they need to be.

title: Nightmare dealing with JAL -- Worst experience
review_text:
Bought a RT ticket for my mother but the returning flight was cancelled and changed by JAL...from less than 24 hour trip to 38+ hours trip. I called JAL, their unwillingness to help really frustrated us. They basically want their customer to just deal with it, wait in the airport for 15+ hours, can't go out to stay in the hotel and no resting area in the airport. They let their customer to purchase tickets online and then subsequently cancel/change the flights...BE CAREFUL with JAL. . 
Yes, they offered the refund for the returning flight but it's less than 1/2 or what I paid is not even enough to cover the one-way ticket. If I were to know this, I'd never purchased JAL.

title: Airline stuffed up our return flights
review_text:
I have not travelled yet, but I already have bad experience with flight change.
Two days ago I received cancellation email for Frankfurt to Narita leg of the flight from Helsinki to Sydney. They moved me to the earlier date effectively killing the Helsinki to Frankfurt leg. So change of flight was done with disregard to my itinerary. Worst thing is Helsinki to Frankfurt leg being operated by Finnair, but still booked through JAL and paid for.
Later they moved Haneda to Sydney leg for later day increasing our layover by 24 hours.
And one more thing: 
Change the terminal from Narita to Haneda seems not possible with current government regulations. But the system let that booking through.
So looks like we are in trouble now, have to ask for refund for return to Sydney flight.
Two hours on hold calling the Australian contact number, still not getting through.
What a  nightmare

title: CROOKS
review_text: I reserved a 10 day round trip with JAL, but missed  some connections on the first leg of the trip and had to book a flight with another carrier to get to Jakarta. 10 days later, I showed up for my flight home, stood in line for an hour only to be told that  because I didn't board those earlier flights, JAL had canceled my reservation without any notice and without any refund, and resold my seat to someone else. All the while, JAL continued to send me email notifications about my upcoming flight, even as I was being told by their employees that I was booted. JAL does not allow online check-in, at least not with international flights during COVID, so without any notification from JAL there was no way for me to know I would be stranded in Jakarta. I submitted a complaint to the company on the website, but never received any response. I picked JAL for my trip because they have a lot of glowing reviews, but this was such a rotten experience I will never recommend them to anyone and if at all possible will avoid booking with them in the future.

title: A nightmare flight back worsend by the existence of noisy and irresponsible families
review_text:
The flight my husband and I took from Haneda in April were filled with four or five families with kids (infants or teenagers), which was usually a bad sign. Here is a list of the pet peeves we had on this flight journey:
1.	Have you checked which seat you are going to occupy properly? : We reserved isle seats for both of us (my husband to be seated in the seat in front of me in the row C, and myself behind him). When we arrived at the seats, my husband noticed that his seat was already occupied by someone else who was seated with his families and had to tell this guy that he was occupying my husband’s seat in error. This ‘family guy ‘moved to the window seat and my husband was seated in the designated isle seat. Some people just assume where they are sitting. But there are always some people who reserve certain seats for reasons.
2.	Mind your kids and their behaviour:  Looking at three seats in D,E,G on the same number row across the isle from my seat C were occupied by a woman with two infants. They were the main cause of the nightmare on the entire journey. Two daughters, who were assumingly 1 and 3 years old ,were either bawling or screaming constantly. The noise got worse with seat tray banging and lamp flickering by the kids and their mother had no intention of controlling their behaviour. They also trashed around their food debris and litters constantly on the floor. Did anyone see the amount of rubbish they produced for the entire flight journey? At one point, I saw the woman changing one of the kids’ nappies on the seat. Another time, she was checking the content of the nappy by pulling down the pants of the daughter’s, while food was being served.  
3.	Be considerate to other fellow passengers:  my husband’s sleep was constantly disturbed by a family of five who were seated next to him occupying over two rows of seats, who often kept walking back and forth to get snacks situated at the breakout area. The father figure of the family tried to cross over my husband’s legs while he was asleep. Unfortunately he wasn’t slim enough to squeeze himself out of the narrow space left and knocking off the a bottle of water left in the seat pocket situated at my husband’s seat, hence waking him up with a loud din. 
4.	Opt out of ‘Codeshare’ flight:  It seems that the flight we took from HND to LHR was a codeshare flight with BA, though we originally purchased the option with JAL only. So in a way we ended up paying more than these BA passengers would have paid. I personally have never had good experience with codeshare flight with BA and this flight has proved it once again.
5.	The speed of serving airline food: Is it necessary that the passengers simply get fed with airline food in a hurried manner with less than 20 minutes? When we get served with a main meal, a pot of ice cream gets served at the same time. Why ? For someone who has delicate digestive system, consuming ice cream straight after the main meal does cause an issue. But I do like ice cream, and can only indulge myself in this when I do have good appetite. Mostly I don’t especially prior to the flight, so I tend to skip it nowadays. But I really would like JAL to stop feeding passengers like a herd of cattle.
6.	The level of service during the pandemic and post pandemic: I was fortunate enough to fly back to Japan once with JAL during the pandemic outbreak (before the lockdown and more tight restriction on the overseas travelling) and on that flight there were just about 10 passengers on board. We in the economy class were treated almost like VIPs and Cabin attendants were so attentive and even thanked each passenger for choosing JAL to travel. On this codeshare flight back to the LHR, I felt being part of ‘cattle’ class, having to put up with noise, smells and litters on the entire flight journey.

I am sure there are many reasons or occasions why kids have to accompany their parents on the flight journeys. But when they do, I urge the parents to take care of their kids so as not to cause any nuisance or disturbances to other passengers. I also feel that airlines should manage better seat allocation befitting each flight situation. For instance, families with (small) kids should be seated in ‘family friendly’ allocated seat location, and other passengers can choose seats away from them if they wish.

title: Cancelled leg, moved to next day flight and then told us we can't layover overnight.
review_text: Booked a flight with a layover at Tokyo. JAL cancelled the last leg of the trip and put us on a flight that leave Tokyo on the next day. Then they called us two days before the trip and told us we can't stay overnight at the Tokyo airport due to COVID restriction. But they were the one who cancelled our flight and put us on a flight that leaves the next day (our initial booking does not have an overnight layover)! Told us there's no other alternatives and does not respond to refund request and does not pick up the phone! WORST AIRLINE EVER!

title: Horrible airline
review_text: I booked a trip to London about a month ago to fly out in July with Japan Airlines. Never flown with them before but figured I'd give them a shot. Two nights ago they emailed me saying they've cancelled my flights for no reason, and put me on a different flight. I tried calling their contact line the next day, after FIVE hours of being on hold, the call disconnected 3 times. Finally got through, they couldn't give me a reason for the cancellation, told me the only flight I can get will cut my trip short 3 days and add another 10h of travel and layover each way. Or my other option was a refund minus tax to be in my account in 2-3 months. Refused to give me paper trail of the refund request, I just have to trust it will show up in 9-12 weeks. DO NOT FLY WITH JAPAN AIRLINES!

title: JAL - cancelled legs. No viable alternative offered
review_text: I booked two business class seats in September 2021 for travel in June 2022 - Sydney to London return. In April 2022 JAL informed me that two of the legs were now cancelled. They offered no alternative  for one of the legs and the other leg they offered a connecting flight 17 days after the first leg. Go figure. In the end I had to cancel my flights and rebook with another airline at greater cost. I will never use JAL again. Having spoken to others it appears this is common practice with JAL. Beware. What was once a premium airline is no more.

title: Ultimate Experience in Business Class with JAL
review_text: After two failed attempts at the start of covid19 to fly with JAL, I finally was able to do this trip in Business Class. I can say it was well worth the wait, I have flown other Oneworld partners but I have to say that JAL is my favourite and it will be my first choice when I fly again in the future. The friendly and attentive service from the flight attendants was exceptional and  their attention to detail was no exception. You can see the pride in each and every JAL representative. I would highly recommended their business class product when travelling long haul. Thank You for a wonderful experience.

title: Terrible service
review_text:
Still no response despite posting on very Public social media sites, they obviously don't care about their customers. Lets show them by avoiding them in the future, terrible airline.
Where's my refund?
JAL cancelled one of my Business Class return flights from Sydney to London and now say I have to wait 8 weeks for a refund, WTF.
Never again will I book this airline, no wonder they went bust 10 years ago!

title: JAL cancelled our flights and make us wait 8 weeks for a refund
review_text:
We booked business class to London with JAL despite a long wait for a connection in Tokyo. With one week before departure they cancelled one of our return flights which resulted in us having to totally cancel our plans, now they are making us wait 8 weeks for our refund which means we cannot fly anywhere until we get our money back.
The entire exercise has been a waste of time and I hate to think how they treat their Economy passengers!
I cannot recommend JAL to anyone, it's not surprising they went bust 10 years ago, they're heading the same way again.

title: Really nice fly
review_text: Very polite staff. Everything was organized. Nice food. Lots of options for drink. Knowledgeable crew

title: Very bad customer service... Several hours on hold trying to amend return travel dates. but not succeded.
review_text:
For several days now I have been trying to reach JAL customer service to amend my return travel dates but have not succeeded.
I called on different days and at different times,. On every occasion, I was put on hold by the recorder for almost 2 hours and I was so frustrated and angry that I couldn't wait any longer.
I am a Skyteam member and I chose JAL from many other carriers thinking that they are major airlines with customer service awareness and reliable after-sales support.
However, It seems that I was totally wrong, disappointed, nerve breaking, and made a bad choice in flying JAL. 

I would not recommend JAL to anyone with a flexible flying schedule as they will be disappointed as I was.

title: No Customer Service
review_text: This is the least trustworthy airline, or company for that matter, that I have ever had the misfortune of using. I have been on the phone a total now of ten hours on hold to get a refund for the ticket Japan Airlines canceled. They canceled the flight. I did not. When I finally got through to them, the representative I spoke with told me she didn't know how to process a refund and said another representative would call me back. I was called back late in the evening, did not pick up, and so received a voicemail: "This is Japan Airlines. We will only call you this once. You will have to call us back to find out about your refund." They still have my money. I still have no ticket. Do not travel with Japan Airlines.

title: Bad experience with food
review_text: They don't have any option of India meal , if you flying from India you should have Indian meal even in Narita Tokiyo Airport , i don't not find a burger , or sandwich all the choices they have japnese ,i am not expecting for India food not a even international foor burger , piza and sandwich . I never use their services again and recomend any international pessangers to visit there because they don't have to any option to eat i don't eat any thing in flight and also nothing to eat in the airport . That's totally bad experience .

title: Ridiculous layover, rude staff
review_text: EXTREMELY rude and unpleasant staff in Narita airport! I have a ridiculous 18 hour layover, no one was willing to help me or offer me vouchers, a hotel stay, or to change my ticket. The woman "helping" me, named Kobayashi, took my ticket and refused to return it to me. She rudely handed me a blank sheet of paper when I asked for an official form stating JAL's policy (or lack of) regarding long layovers. She mocked me in Japanese to her colleagues. She was extremely rude. I never want to fly JAL again, with staff like this!

title: a beautiful experience
review_text: I have been to Japan three times on JAL, always LAX to KIX in business class and have always found the service both on the ground and in the air and the food to be really great. The seats were comfortable and the in flight entertainment always had something worth watching and things were clean and orderly.

title: My son abandoned in an airport for more than 12 hours ( Tokio).
review_text: I never thought that this company would leave my son abandoned in an airport for more than 12 hours.  No sleep, no food, not a single bottle of water.  A shame.  Where is the fame of Japanese companies?  Warning in case you are looking for a flight to Japan, a disaster.

title: Over an hour on hold, then they closed
review_text: Three days in a row I've called JAL customer service and failed to connected. Today I waited 78 minutes and then it seemed to pick up, but call ended. Also no response from online message sent through JAL's "contact us" tab.

title: Limited but excellent Narita lounge service, superb food and service JAL flight, Thailand Pass process
review_text:
(Photos of in flight meals and menu, lounge food posted separately) 

I transited in Narita to fly to Bangkok on Japan Airlines.  As my incoming flight to Narita was early, I had time to use the First Class Lounge in the main terminal, the only JAL lounge open at Narita.  It did mean a bit of a walk each way as my arriving flight and my departing flight were both in the satellite terminal. 

The lounge has lots of seating and a large eating area on the second floor of the lounge.  Food is now ordered by scanning a QR code at each table and is quickly delivered to your seat.  All the tables have every other seat blocked and the counter seats have plastic dividers between seats for pandemic safety and distancing.  I ordered some salmon fusilli and steamed vegetables and each was delivered to my seat beautifully plated on a huge plate on an even larger platter.  I also ordered some of the trademark made to order sushi from the sushi counter where you can see sushi chefs making sushi and again the sushi plate was delivered on a large platter.  Therefore just three dishes and I was running out of room on my table already.  All of the food was delicious.  

I boarded my flight to Bangkok on schedule.  The flight is operated with a B787-800 Dreamliner and was about half full in business class.  Seats are configured 2X2X2 with seats staggered slightly so window seats have direct aisle access as well.  There is a lot of larger and smaller shelf space on two sides of the window seat so lots of places to put laptop/tablet, phones, glasses, drinks.  The seat converts to a fully flat bed and was comfortable and quite spacious in bed position.  On this flight unlike the flight from Vancouver to Narita also operated with the same kind of plane, the front toilet was not blocked for use by flight and cabin crew so there were 3 toilets available for use by business class passengers.  

The flight was an evening flight scheduled for 7 hours 25 minutes but in reality about 7 hours long so instead of a full toiletries case as is provided on full long haul flights, a small cloth pouch was provided with the basics – toothbrush, eye mask, ear plugs and moisture mask (a unique JAL feature where you wear it over your mouth and nose and insert in wet sheets to increase moisture in the air you breathe). 

Service on the flight was exceptional.  Cabin crew always took time to say a few extra words that created an exceptionally friendly environment.  JAL service is always excellent but on this particular flight, the cabin crew took it up another level yet. 

Initially there were some issues with the entertainment system and the system on my seat and the empty seat next to me both did not work.  Cabin crew came by a couple of times to help and in the end restarted the whole system to fixed the issue. 

Food was divine on the flight as it was catered out of Japan.  Not only is the food delicious but it is presented in such a beautiful and refined way that your taste buds already won over when the bento box (for appetizers) or dish (for mains) arrives at your seat.  As always, the JAL menu includes a page describing the special coffee that is served in business class on that flight.  This time it was not a favourite as it was a lighter roast with more acidity than I like, but nevertheless it is always interesting to see what special coffee would be served on my JAL flight. 

The flight arrived about 25 minutes early at around 11:08 pm.  I passed through the Thailand Pass checkpoint and immigration and had picked up my checked luggage by 11:48 pm, and was on board the hotel arranged van enroute to the hotel by midnight. 

The application for the Thailand Pass process was a bit tricky as the application website is finicky requiring you to upload photos of your passport, first night Test and Go hotel booking, required travel insurance, vaccination record but with limits on the size of the photo files.  However, once I was able to complete the application and submit it, I received the approval and the issuance of the QR code with my Thailand Pass within hours.  Under the Test and Go system you must book the first night of arrival at an SH+ hotel and stay in your room until you receive your negative PCR test result from your arrival test.  I booked the Sukhothai Bangkok and they were very helpful with information I needed to deal with my Thailand Pass application and testing process.

The Test and Go program requires you to take hotel provided private transportation from the airport to the hotel.  I was somewhat surprised by the van that Sukhothai Bangkok provided to take me to the hotel as it was a decked out blingy VIP van with changing color lights on the ceiling like a party van.  Nevertheless it got the job done and I arrived safely at the hotel, was quickly taken to a nurse on site from the hospital partner of the hotel to take a swab sample for my arrival PCR test, and was in my hotel room by around 12:30 am – less than 1 ½ hour after I landed. 

The whole process was relatively stress free and quick.  An excellent late evening flight with JAL, very comfortable, well pampered with superb service and delicious food.

title: Great staff
review_text: One of the best airline service I have received. The staff really helped me at Honolulu: helping me to rebook my flight, helping me with my bags when I struggle with the kids,...also great in flight staff. Would definitely fly again

title: HORRIBLE AIRLINE!
review_text: I CANNOT BELIEVE THIS AIRLINE. HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE, HORRIFIC WORKERS. PLEASE NEVER FLY WITH THEM. I was booked on a flight for June 2022 to London from Sydney. The airline suddenly CANCELLED the flight and sent us an email to let us know it had been cancelled. No information on redirection or refunds were included so we called the airline... After waiting on hold for over an hour, we got through and the lady on the phone told us we would get a refund in 12 weeks!!!! THIS IS NOT OKAY. THEY CANCELLED AND THEN TELL US WE CANNOT EVEN HAVE OUR MONEY BACK FOR 12 WEEKS!!!! We need our money to book another flight!! Then, after us explaining to her that is not ok and we need the money SOONER, she hung the phone up on us... PATHETIC. ABSOLUTELY SHOCKED. no explanation on the cancellation either... this is ridiculous and i will NEVER fly with them again. they have lost me as a customer as well the people that i am travelling with.

title: Worst Airline ….
review_text: One of the worst flight experience. Bought the ticket online directly from their website as free of charge change. Initially we were supposed to fly out of LAX on Feb 25th but they didn’t check us in because one us didn’t have traveler’s insurance not to mention that was not indicated as a requirement to check in when I purchased the tickets and on top of that didn’t even bother notify us of such a requirement prior to the flight . Anyway after spending couple of hours on the phone trying to purchase the insurance we weren’t able to do so because insurance companies cant issue the insurance on the same day of the flight so we had to reschedule the flight for first available and that was for 4 days later. This caused us losing 4 days of our Airbnb and our vacation, extra expenses and inconvenience back and forth to LAX and another $450 for covid test since the test is good only dir 48 hours, not to mention that how rude and inconsiderate their staff are at LAX airport . Anyhow at the end of our trip we decided to extend it for few days but when we went to Manila airport they said our return ticket was not changeable and that we had to purchase another ticket if we wanted to stay longer. I couldn’t even believe that because the round trip ticket was purchased as free of charge change but they said only going to Manila was changeable “ category k “ and return ticket was not changeable “ category q “ ! It’s hard to believe that none of this was mentioned on the website when I purchased the ticket and on final confirmation that I received it indicated that ticket was purchased as free of charge on changing and it wasn’t specified that applies to  only for one way! This is by far one of the worst airline experience that we have ever had . It was our first time taking Japan airline and would certainly be the last time . Their plane are clean but the service and food is HORRIBLE! Not even worth it

title: Many last minute cancellations
review_text: My flights got cancelled twice in 4 months in the last few weeks before departure. It now costs me double to fly because of last minutes booking. I'll never trust them again.

title: Superb service, outstanding food, quick and easy transit process at Narita
review_text:
I have been flying Cathay Pacific to Hong Kong the last couple of years due to the pandemic.  However, since Hong Kong has a flight ban in place preventing flights from Canada and preventing anyone who has been in Canada for more than 2 hours in the last 14 days from entering Hong Kong, I flew Japan Airlines to Narita to connect to Bangkok, and then to wait out the 14 days entry ban before flying on to Hong Kong.  

Flying Japan Airlines after Cathay Pacific was quite an upgrade.  The service is much better and the food is also superior. 

Check in opens 3 hours before the flight and I arrived at around 11 am shortly after check in opened.  Check in was already very busy and even in the first class line, there was a bit of a wait for an available check in counter to become available. This may be due to the need to check each person's extensive documents for whatever destination they were travelling to.  As I was not entering Japan, I was not required to comply with Japan's conditions but staff had to check my Thailand pass documents and that took about 5 minutes. 

Vancouver Airport has reopened the D gates entry since there are now increased flights so it was nice not to have to walk all the way over to the domestic flights entry to go through security and then walk back to the international gates.  Security was a bit slow as there was only one security line open. 

Japan Airlines business class passengers have use of the Plaza Premium lounge.  The lounge was not very busy when I entered which was good as I noticed that one section of the lounge which used to have the hot foods station was closed.  All food is now provided in the former coffee bar section with sandwiches in the refrigerated cabinet and a small selection of hot foods on the side like mie goreng and butter chicken.  

Boarding for JAL flight was orderly as usual.  JAL operates a B787-8 on the route with 30 seats in business class split between a front section with 3 rows and 18 seats and a back section with 2 rows and 12 seats in a 2X2X2 configuration.  The seats are staggered so every seat has direct aisle access.  I love the window seat as in addition to the window, it has a large shelf right under the video screen that has enough space to put a small laptop or a tablet, and a narrow shelf along the side of the seat to put my phone and glasses.  

The seat is the Sky Suite 1 which I like quite a bit as it is quite roomy and enclosed by a head level partition which affords a lot of privacy.  In bed position, the seat has great length so my feet did not even need to reach the shelf section under the video screen that is the last section of the seat in bed position.  Shoulder space is also very good as both armrests lower down flat with the seat in bed position although the aisle side armrest is quite hard and not comfortable to rest my arm or elbow on in bed position.  

There is plenty of storage space as in addition to the overhead bin, there is a small shelf behind my seat for miscellaneous items and space for a carry on bag under the video screen.  The tray table pops out from the side of the seat and can swing out so I can exit my seat without putting the table away, though requiring a bit of manoeuvring on my part to do so. 

12 out of the seats in the front section were occupied so it was not too full.  The seat beside mine was empty so I could keep the partition between my window seat and the aisle seat down unless I wanted more privacy.   

When it is time to sleep, cabin crew will help put out the bedding which consists of a thick mattress pad and a light blanket.  The mattress bed completely eliminates any feel of the ridges in the seat where it folds in seat position and makes for a very comfortable bed to sleep on. 

This flight had the Magic 6 entertainment system which is quite an upgrade from earlier JAL in flight entertainment systems with a lot more choices of movies in multiple languages from multiple countries. 

Service on the flight is as always with JAL, superb.  Very attentive but discreet and refined.  Everything is done meticulously - even a glass is carefully placed with the JAL logo facing you.  Toilets are always neat and tidy as the cabin crew are constantly cleaning it after passenger use. 

Food is a highlight on JAL flights.  I almost always choose the Japanese meal for the appetizer bento box with multiple sections featuring a variety of delectable and beautiful bite sized eats.  You start enjoying your meal even before you taste it as the presentation is always so beautiful and again meticulous.  Meal service consists of lunch/dinner served after take off and then a snack served 2 hours before landing.  One unique feature of the JAL in flight menu is the page describing the special coffee of the month for the flight.  JAL features different specially selected coffees and gives a description with tasting notes as one would normally find with wines.

Throughout the flight, cabin crew were constantly going through the cabin looking for any passenger service needs and as soon as I finish a drink or a snack cup noodle, cabin crew would very soon after notice this and remove the item. 

The flight arrived more than an hour early.  Passengers are requested to remain in their seat after the plane reached its gate as Japan has specific procedures to deboard international transit passengers first before then deboarding passengers who are entering Japan and must go through the arrival Covid-19 test procedure. 

We lost about half an hour after disembarking from the plane as they had to wait for all transit passengers to be accounted for and they kept counting and counting and could not get to the correct count.  Eventually, all the lined up transit passengers were allowed to exit the gate and head to the international transit station.  Once there, passing through security was quick and then I was into the departures section and able to go to the lounge to await my connecting flight to Bangkok. 

The JAL flight is very enjoyable, with the service and food being particular highlights.  

Arrival and transit procedures at Narita airport are orderly and generally very quick and efficient, as the Japanese are famous for.  If you have to fly somewhere that JAL can fly to, you should definitely consider JAL for your flight and you do not need to worry about transiting and connecting at Narita airport.

title: Patient, kind and caring staff
review_text:
I flew JAL return to and from Canada twice in 2021 and 2022. Every person I encountered of their crew was kind and patient while dealing with the numerous issues travelling with Covid causes. Staff both onboard and in the terminal were professional and efficient. 

On my return, I also had to rebook my flight within 4 hours of it leaving due to a positive COVID diagnosis. The customer service representatives were polite and helpful each time I called (6-7 times). 

This experience has made me want to choose JAL every time I fly. They also fly pets which is a huge plus.

title: Worst customer service
review_text: I got delayed due to a blizzard. This happens it is out of everyone’s control. But they way they handled my ticket was deplorable. I was rebooked onto a very tight connection then of course the first leg was delayed and I missed my connection. As soon as the first leg was delayed I asked to be moved to a later connection and was told over and over again that it would be “taken care of” at the next airport. In the air I again asked about it and begged to be given a seat on the next connection snd was told not to worry, that someone on the ground would assist. We landed and it was about 45 minutes before the next flight and I was ignored by all of the gate agents and ground agents for so long that by the time someone finally looked at what I needed the next connecting flight had already left. During the time I could have been making that connection I was helplessly watching the ground agents laugh with each other instead of helping me. The next available flight they could book me on was 4 hours later. All of my friends flying a different airline (ANA) made it home without any of these issues. I will never fly JAL again.

title: The flight attendants were all excellent in service they make sure all passengers were all taken care of on board
review_text: kudos to all FA"s . Keep it up the excellent service :)  staff were all accommodating. they make sure to check back on us how our doing.

title: Rescheduling of flight 9th May 2022
review_text:
Yoday I recieved an email ftom Japan Airlines that they have preponed our Haneda- Delhi flight to 8th May 2022. The flight now dhall lesve at 10.45 am on 8th May 2022. I along with my wife are flying from Dallas to Haneda on 7th May 2022 snd shall reach Haneda at 1420 hrs. As such, it's not technically possible to catch Delhi bound flight on 8th May.

I wanted to get in touch with Japan Airlines on their only customer service number in US i.e. 1 800 525 3663. But no one is lifting the call despite wsiying for even 2 hours. No other US number is available on the site. Surprisingly, no email id is given where one can drop an email. The phone number given while booking the tickets was of India which is no longer available. Wonder how JAL is going to connect with me. Airlines should have shown some common sense by preponing both the travel legs. Even on their website, in Manage Booking the system is throwing error and not displaying any information. 

Very poor services.

title: An impatient n rude ground manager at DFW
review_text:
I'm a frequent flyer and have flown Japan Air for a number of years. Thus far was well treated till I checked in for a flight to Singapore last Dec '21 from DFW.  The ground staff, Natsuko K, was impatient and rude in handling the process.  She rejected both of my'-' Covid tests without proper verifications.  One of the tests was a NAAT test similar to PCR test, taken at Albertson, and the other was a PCR test as well from a recognized clinic here in DFW except that part of the standard form they used was hand-written. I even had the medical prof on the call for Natsuko to verify the test result but she refused.  I felt being discriminated against for no reason.  I was refused boarding and had to go take another Covid test.  That's ridiculous!!  According the Med professional at the third clinic, those two earlier tests were already valid PCR tests!!
Later, I called my embassy who told me those 2 tests should be accepted as well.

Apparently she did not seem to be competent for the job even though she claimed to be a ground manager.  I believe she reports to Tomoko T.  JAL:  You need to review and take adequate action to prevent her from tarnishing the reputation of Japan Air. 

I actually called JAL support few times days before my departure to get more details about the Covid test requirements but they have no clue !!  Later I decided to take the test twice just to be sure but they were both turned down for no reason!!

title: Love this airline
review_text:
I fly Japan Airlines across the Pacific whenever possible, especially eastbound as the times and jet lag effects work well for me. 6 crossings in the last 6 years on the same 777-ER configured aircraft each time. TYO-LAX

There are fancier and more private first class seats in the air, but the service and food set Japan Airlines apart, and I enjoy the interaction over the multi-course wine paired meals. If you are lucky, some Hibiki 18yr...

Then I'll sleep on a bed prepared just for me. When I wake the large bathroom is cleaned after each person (I think), and I have a light meal and a fruit plate.

title: Quality and value for money
review_text:
Very comfortable, best in class legroom.
I was really impressed with the quality of service. If you arrive when the ticket counter opens in the morning, the staff stands in line and bows to greet the customers. They are very friendly and went the extra mile to print the documents that I needed upon arrival. The food that is offered is delicious, they offer Japanese staple foods, and drinks which I enjoy

title: Gotogate and Japan airlines COVID-19 scam customer
review_text: Don’t use Gotogate. They didn’t refund over 400 dollar . On October 6th, I bought a round-trip ticket with Japan Airlines. Because the Covid-19 PRR test views were one hour late, I couldn’t board the plane. Call the agent and she gave me one that can’t be used.  No one answered the phone number, and no one answered the call on her Japan Airlines phone in our company. She said she could not help me change the ticket and needed Japan Airlines to help change the ticket. Now if you mind canceling this ticket, buy it again, I listen.  In response to her opinion, she bought a round-trip ticket on October 8. She said that her company is very busy and it takes a few weeks to refund me the ticket on October 6. In mid-November, I got the money for a ticket refund.  It’s not a round-trip ticket. I called them and it’s hard to answer the phone. Today I answered the phone and said that their company needs to cancel the fee, 71US dollars. The rest of the money is deducted by the Japanese company. They asked me to contact Japan Airlines. I called  They told Japan Airlines that they would not deduct customer cancellation fees during the epidemic. They asked me to contact the agency, and I contacted the agency. The agency said they could send me an email to prove that they wanted me to call Japan Airlines to not deduct the deduction during the epidemic.  For customers’ cancellation fees, I called Japan Airlines to ask Japan Airlines that they changed their terms and said that they had deducted the cancellation fees.  Now they are all playing games with Covid-19, the final victim is our consumption! You not law asking them cancellation fee?what?  I will never use Japan Airlines again. I hope Gotogate will close down soon. I also hope that the government can rectify this black-hearted travel agency!!

title: Quality on every front
review_text: I was really impressed with the quality of service. If you arrive when the ticket counter opens in the morning, the staff stands in line and bows to greet the customers. They are very friendly and went the extra mile to printdocuments which I needed upon arrival. The food that is offered is delicious, they offer Japanese staple foods, and drinks which I enjoy. Not that is impacts the experience but I really love the uniforms they wear, the women are dressed in black suits with red and white scarves that look so nice.

title: Very good service.
review_text: We were very well served by Miss Matsumoto and rest of the staff. She was very polite and helpful towards my parents and other passengers. Would recommend 100%.

title: Michelin Star Dining Experience onboard JAL
review_text:
On JAL F Class today (25 Dec) from HND to JFK, and honestly I think the dining on JAL is simply worth every memory! I chose the western meal curated by Tokyo Quintessence (Michelin 3 stars) Chef, and it was superb! Even the bread tasted so different fully cream flavour and excellent texture!

Salon Champagne and Jyuyondai sake probably brought the experience to another level!

Simply think the experience is just worth the memories for years to come!

Will like to also highlight the great service delivered by both Hara and Nagano onboard this flight. Both of them took great care and hospitality throughout the flight. 

Ms Nagayama on JL36 SIN-HND, 24 Dec also provided great service and hospitality throughout my flight on the Business Class.

title: Worse Check on experience ever
review_text:
I will never fly JAL again. 

Long story but brief version, the check in people issued us all (4) boarding passes after a very long check in. 

On leaving to departure s, they stopped me and took back my boarding passes and COVID tests. They Li said we couldn’t fly because our certificates were not complete. They were. Issued by a top level PCR testing lab in Tokyo, with English translation. Fully certified. 

They lied and said HK and Cathay would not allow us to fly to HK. After about an hour of mounting tension and stress,  I called Cathay myself to find out why they blocked us. Cathay rep said we were all clear to fly to HK and into Sydney. 

I gave the phone to JAL supervisor. They ran around with radios etc. boarding time Was by then only 40 minutes away. Luggage still at the counter. 

This had now been over two hours at the JAL counter with 2 hungry kids and we were wiped out after 5 months of planning and packing for a complete international move, COVID complications, quarantine, vaccines, testing,  relocation planning etc etc. 

This was the only cluster we had after months of meticulous planning with all contingencies forecast, except gross incompetence with an Airline check in. 

They finally emerged waving four papers we could sign and board, now 15 minutes before take off. We quickly signed including 2 kids. We were totally stressed as our onward plans had multiple things set up including : vehicle deliveries, 3 lots of accommodations, visiting plans for aged sick family in care, all teetering on our correct arrival time. 

It turns out the papers were to indemnify JAL from us suing them for ‘damages, losses etc.  I quickly read the paper as we were leaving.  Disgusted but too stressed and worried about getting on the plane, we left. 

I wrote my concerns the JAL, got a polite reply and guarantee they would investigate. They did, but the staff obviously lied again and no remedy offered. The report sent had clear omissions and false statements. We we’re deprived of the use of the lounge, stressed to the point if melt down, yet these clown think it’s fine. 

I love japan and can say this was the first time in years of living in Japan, that Japanese people lied and lied and lied again to me. Shame shame shame.

title: Better than average experience!
review_text: One of the better experiences in flying economy class that I have had. Especially the food. That little effort goes along way!

title: Not happy at all
review_text:
Hardly speak English , very hard to communicate with ,
