My daughter was sleeping and was told no good will be served in the flight I till 7 hours later and have to eat at airport lounge , I told them I need any sandwiches for my daughter when she wakes up , totally ignored my request for my surprise !!! Saying sorry nothing we can do !!! Really not happy .

title: Worst customer service ever!! DO NOT USE!!!
review_text:
We booked a flight to Thailand through JAL for a trip in Dec 2021. JAL cancelled a connecting flight due to Covid, making the trip impossible, offered no alternative , so we requested a refund, just as they state on their website. 
JAL refuses to respond after 2WEEKS of requests!!!  This is the worst customer service I have ever experienced in my life. They take your money, do not provide the service promised, and just keep your money. 
I will never fly JAL again!!! Worst company, no wonder they needed a government bailout.

title: Incredible service - best airline
review_text: I cannot thank Japan airlines enough for flying me home during Covid. They are probably the only airline who didn’t cancel economy seats to prioritise first class. Their service was incredible and I would chose them over any other airline!

title: Absolute filth and garbage
review_text: Hello I booked the ticket with American Airlines and selected my seats early on to ensure I had a comfortable flight. When the day came, I did not have the seats because the flight was being operated by Japan Airlines. They did not honor my choices and placed me by the bathroom on a 10+ hour flight in a half empty plane. One I did not appreciate being by a smelly and dirty bathroom especially in times of COVID. User beware do not book flights to Asia with American Airlines if they put you on a Japan Airlines flight odds are you will end up next to a filthy/smelly bathroom since you did not book through them to begin with. And yes it stunk the whole way. I am never buying a Japan Airlines ticket, I wasn't even given the option to pay for an upgrade.

title: Cancelled Flights, No Alternative Offered
review_text:
Extremely disappointed. JAL is only half of this disappointment. I booked my tickets through MyTrip and they just kept passing me around. JAL cancelled my inbound flights, less than 10days before I'm supposed to depart, with no alternative flights provided (while I clearly see other flights available online when I search). It's almost like they want you to cancel and get a refund so you're forced to purchase the more expensive fares. 

The issue is still not resolved, but I ended up booking a one-way return which was more expensive than my entire ticket. I made sure I booked directly with the airline and NOT JAL. It takes at least 2hours to get to someone on the phone, and I made 3 phone calls to them. This isn't the first time I booked through an online travel agency with cancelled flights but this is the first time I've had this issue. 

Book this airline at your own risk. If something goes wrong, you're on your own and you're basically throwing your money away unless you buy the refundable fares. Good luck. I'd stay away from this airline if I were you.

title: Wonderful Experience
review_text: Had a wonderful experience on JAL flying a 787 in Premium Economy.  First having Sakura Lounge access was wonderful for my 4 hour lay over.  Next the flight attendant service was exceptional.  Premiums economy seats are fantastic.  Food and beverages are wonderful.  Again the service is great! I hope to fly JAL again sooner than later.

title: delayed refund for one year and a half!
review_text:
I’m a customer who is really upset. I bought four return tickets (JL52) from Sydney-Tokyo (departure on 12 April 2020) through a travel agent called “Qunar”.  Due to the COVID situation, the flight was canceled and a refund application was made on 28/03/2020. Over one year and a half, I spend time communicating with “Qunar”  about the update of this refund. Every time I had the same answer that “Japan Airlines hasn’t refund yet and no information can be provided”. I totally understand there must be a large amount of application to deal with and I was really patient. However, it has been one year and a half and I really lose patient now. I’m here to confirm with you whether you have refunded but the agent kept the money, or the refund has not been dealt with. If not I sincerely hope someone in this big company with a reputation fixes this problem. I, as a consumer, have no other way to protect my own interest but hopefully, your company can be responsible.

by the way, there is no option in the travel date so just pick up one.

title: Amazingly helpful staff!
review_text:
While travelling back to the United States, I had a flight from Fukuoka to Tokyo Haneda, with a connecting international flight with American Airlines in Tokyo Narita.  My flight was delayed by 80 minutes, which left me almost no time to be able to catch the shuttle from Haneda to Narita.  

When we landed, I was paged to meet a representative on the jetway.  She informed me that JAL knew I was in danger of missing my connecting flight due to their delay and escorted me directly to the baggage claim.  However, when my baggage finally arrived, we had missed the last shuttle to get to my flight in Narita.  

The representative then worked on an alternate method to get me to Narita, and 5 minutes later, they paid a taxi to drive me there (a 30,000 yen trip!), and I was able to catch my connecting flight instead of staying a night in Tokyo.   They had also informed American Airlines of my delay, and I was expedited through the American Airlines ticket counter to make it to my flight as it was boarding.

The lengths JAL went to ensure I got to my next flight was above and beyond what I would have ever expected, and I know for sure I will never receive this level of customer service ever again.  I wish I wasn't in such a hurry that I could properly show my deep gratitude to the staff.

title: Greedy airlines
review_text: They charged me $672 for extra baggage. There were less than 10 people in the flight, still extra charges. 2 bags of 23kg each are allowed, my bags were 29kg and 30kg. $672 is a lot. I requested but no help, not even 1 cent discount

title: Execellent customer service
review_text: I originally booked my flights through MyTrip (PLEASE AVOID THIS COMPANY). But unfortunately my flight got cancelled due to covid and I experienced the worst customer service with MyTrip. When I thought everything was lost I decided to call Jal (the operating airline of tickets) and they solved my problem on the same day. From now on I will directly book with the airline company and avoid such agencies. The customer service was also really friendly and patient.

title: Horrible service
review_text:
My girlfriend  and me booked two flight tickets from Melbourne to Germany  4 months before the supposed flight. Like.many other flights it got cancelled,  already 2 months before the departure. 1. Not mytrip or japanairlines sent us any message that the flight got cancelled. We only find out by checking.it. In the end we did the whole refund process (paid extra.55$) and were calling them both 2 to three 3 times and japan airlines always said to us we have to talk to.mytrip despite the fact that japan airlines were the ones who canceled the flight. And mytrip.com gave us kind of the same answer. So both of the parties are not taking any responsibility and go against there own official guidelines they have written in their website.  Mytrip said it take some time.to process the refund because of covid, but we applied for our refund over 3 months ago! This is bullying and abusive behaviour and calculating that people  get tired to ask for their money  back. But not with me. If someone trying to go against them into court, I am happy to.join.

Cheers,

Willi

title: Very impressed with handling of flight cancellation
review_text:
When my flight was cancelled due to Covid-19 flight restrictions - I received a courtesy call from JAL informing me of the cancellation and asking whether I'd like a full refund or credit. The refund was in my bank account within days. 

I've flown a lot with JAL in the past and will stay loyal to them.

title: Worst experience ever!
review_text: I booked my flight literally 6 months in advance. The changed absolutely every flight on my itinerary right up to a month before I'm to depart they cancel the flight from London to Glasgow. If I want to get there 2 days later it will cost me extra. If I just want to get to London and find my own way to Glasgow they still wanted to charge me extra. So now I'm 28 days before I'm to leave the country and my flight has now been cancelled. I will now have to wait another 6 weeks to get my money back from them and I've had to book my flight last minute with a totally different company. Do NOT book with Japan airlines. They can't be trusted to get you to your destination no matter how far in advance you book. They are less than helpful over the phone making the whole experience a complete nightmare.

title: Passengers beware - cancellation fee still charged for COVID cancellations!
review_text:
I booked a flight for my husband and I for January 2022. It was part of a trip that involved the UK, USA and cruising. It's now clear that this won't be possible due to 

COVID, so I cancelled our flights. JAL processed my refund promptly, but charged a $600 cancellation fee. My understanding when I booked was that there would be no cancellation or change fees if the flights were cancelled due to COVID restrictions. I have tried unsuccessfully to get the rest of my refund via their Customer Service, so I can see that I will need to take my complaint higher.
Other airlines have provided a full refund, so I really hope JAL will do the right thing. 
I had a put a travel date to submit this review BUT we have not yet travelled with JAL. And are not likely to do so unless they honour their free cancellation due to COVID commitment.

title: way above and beyond!! Friendship!
review_text: We recently had to book a flight to take our smallest family member to Tokyo to have open heart surgery by the top canine cardiologist in the world. The people who work at JAL were so amazingly kind and understanding. They called and checked up on us and invited us to bring Sonny by to meet them at their Santa Monica location once they re-open after covid. I felt enveloped in their caring. It was on of  the hardest times of my life and their kindness will live in my heart forever. Thank you so very much.

title: Difficult to beat JAL’s service
review_text: JAL stands out consistently in one aspect - service! At Dallas Airport, ground staff actively asked for baggage tag to make sure my luggage will be checked through to Tokyo. Onboard the crews were very hardworking. Even between meal service they walked around with drinks and snacks and collected garbage. They kept toilets really clean. They even turned off the personal TV of passengers who have slept to avoid disturbance to passengers because of the light. They answered call buttons within seconds. On arrival there were always plenty of staff to assist with luggage. I have experienced over 20 international airlines and none can reach JAL’s service standard, none of them is even close!

title: Be warned - free cancellation due to Covid-19 not honored
review_text:
Despite touting free cancellation for Covid-19 related issues, JAL didn't honor this. After booking a flight to Bangkok for Dec. 13, I discovered that there is a mandatory period of hotel-bound quarantine even for fully vaccinated passengers on my arrival date. So I tried canceling the ticket and their staff argued incessantly with me that things could change, etc.
The whole point of my booking early was to set my plans, including time away from work and meeting friends in Thailand. 
It seems pretty clear to me that this is Covid-related cancellation. The last thing I expected from JAL was a sleazy interpretation of what they clearly advertise as "free cancellation."

title: Air Travel Report
review_text:
Air Travel Report
11 March 2021
Ho Chi Minh City (HCMC), Viet Nam – to Jacksonville, FL, USA

After being gone for 13 years I just decided, ‘It is time . . . to come home’, and my wife and I made the trek. 
The Airlines work together to offer customers an organized, coordinated, start to finish, ‘package’ itinerary, and that is good, convenient. 
Itinerary:
•	HCMC to Tokyo, Japan – Japan Air Lines.
•	Tokyo, Japan to Dallas-Ft. Worth, Texas, USA – Japan Air Lines. 
•	Dallas-Ft. Worth, Texas, USA to Jacksonville, FL, USA – American Airlines.
o	Flight time? ~ 18 hours.
o	Total travel time? ~ 30 hours. 

Japan Air Lines
From HCMC, Viet Nam to Tokyo, Japan and from Tokyo, Japan to Dallas, TX, USA, folks, I-have-nothing-but-PRAISE-for . . . Japan Air Lines.
Every nuance and detail from departure and arrival times to in flight service and attention, meals, and-even-the-coffee . . . were in every way above reproach and commendable.  

American Airlines
From Dallas, TX, USA to Jacksonville, FL, USA the ONLY good thing I can say about American Airlines (AA) is, “They did – eventually – get us to Jacksonville, FL, USA. Period.” 
In the interim though, “Wow.” 
International Flight Passengers must collect their baggage (for us, two max weight suitcases & carryon – EACH), carry that baggage everywhere we go and, have it rechecked for a/the Domestic carrier (AA). 
And that’s fair enough, I guess.
Problem? Dallas Airport is H-U-G-E HUGE and we had to lug our baggage and carryon from the Arrival gate – to the far-far away Departure gate. 
And that’s fair enough too, I guess. 
**Problem**? AA changed-the-Departure-gate . . . !!**FOUR (4) TIMES**!! . . . and each time WE had to lug our baggage & carry-ons to each NEW departure gate, which were far-far away (hundreds of meters) from the OLD departure gate. (Sidebar: I am 73.)
**Problem**? Without reason or apology, AA informed us the flight would depart – 2 hours late.
**Problem**? AA Personnel. Wow. They were all amiable, friendly and talkative – to each other – but to the customers, to the ‘Herd’, their attitude, tone and demeanor was disdainful, begrudgingly helpful, and on the very precipice of being rude.
**Problem**? AA in flight service? The inflight service personnel were much like the on ground service personnel. ‘The Herd’ (the customers) was tended and managed with complete indifference and impersonal rote efficiency.
AA Summary: AA DID get us to our destination. Beyond that I have no/none/zero positive comments. I energetically do NOT and will NOT recommend AA to anyone – period.

title: The best flight attendants!
review_text:
There were only four guests at the business class and four flight attendants.  Each attendant came to say thank you to me and took care of me during the entire flight.  All of them smiled and they were very professional.
Foods were amazing and wines were wonderful 🍷.

title: Very Bad Experience
review_text: I booked a ticket from DEL to DTW with Henada airport(TOKYO) in connecting flights. After 1 week they told they have change the connecting flights airport in TOKYO to some other airport. From Henada to that airport it was 65Km and Also I would require a transit VISA since i was living airport . With these difficulties and having just 4 hours for connecting flights I asked them to cancel and ask for full refund, but they have took cancellation charge which is very frustrating.

title: Very Disappointed
review_text: I was trying to fly to Tokyo in June. The airline cancelled my flight and said to get a refund go online. So, I did that and was charged a $300 cancellation fee even though the flight was cancelled. I called and talked to a very rude guy saying I should have called and that they’ll have to call me back to see if I’m even eligible. No where on the email did it say call. And I’m not supposed to be charged if I’m asking for a refund on a cancelled flight. I won’t book with them ever again.

title: Comfort with attentive service
review_text: I just flew in business class last week from SFO to Bangkok. There was no line/nobody at check in. It took a while to check all required documents for travel. Food and service were very nice. The food came with plastic cover. They still tried to offer business class experience as best as they can during Covid. Bathroom was cleaned very often. I wish the blanket was better. It was little too short and not that soft. My food did not come with their famous rolls, but I asked and they brought couple for me ( in sealed plastic bag). The flight from Narita, Japan to Bangkok offered very comfortable seats. But I did not like the gift bag on this flight. There were airport staffs walked you to the connecting flight as soon as you stepped out of the plane in Japan. Overall it was a good experience traveling during Covid.

title: World's worst major airline
review_text:
Having flown business or combined first/business on (alphabetically) American, British Airways, Air Canada, Cathay Pacific, KLM, Korean Air, Malaysian Airlines, Singapore, Thai Airlines, and United, I can authoritatively state that Japan Airlines is the absolute worst.

In chronological order, here are the problems I experienced on one or both legs of my trans-pacific journey from North America via Tokyo to Vietnam in the first class cabin:
(1) The lie-flat seats have huge privacy barriers so if you get stuck with an aisle seat there's no way you can see out of any of the windows as the flight attendants roll up all the visual barriers. If you're inclined to feel uncomfortable in a windowless space, beware.

(2) I was given no choice of dinner menu items, as the flight attendants let their preferred passengers (a group of about 15 suited businessmen traveling together as a group) choose their menu selections first. There were snack items, but no palatable main entree items. (no slice of chicken or beef or a pasta dish; nothing but grotesque looking un-nameable seafood-looking items that, I presume, are popular among native-born Japanese. 

(3) The in-flight entertainment system (for movies etc.) is an absolute joke. Think Windows 2000 (or similar) operating system with lots of DOS-type prompts... seriously and truthfully, the system used on these two aircraft dated back to the year 2003.

(4) The overall experience inside a JAL aircraft is dreary, dreary, dreary. It's a good thing that, other than wanting a nice filling hot meal, I wanted to sleep, and got lots of that. Oh, and there was a box of chocolates set out for everyone (in First Class) on a snack tray by the toilets, and in that box of chocolates, at least 3 or 4 in the box were actually chocolate, as opposed to chocolate-covered mystery creme. In the name of saving on costs, apparently no corner was cut.

(5) On a happier note, the executive lounge inside Narita Airport is a nice place to wait for your connecting flight. Luckily, though all six (count 'em, six!) showers were occupied when I arrived, I was able to "book" a shower for 30 minutes later, enough time to have myself a shower and a shave before rushing out to board my next flight.
(6) JAL seems to thrive on its long-standing relationships with many very large Japanese companies who send their salaried employees lucky enough to travel overseas, in Business or First class.

title: JAL Excellent Flight and Meal, Narita First Class Lounge, Airweave Mattress, Vancouver Arrival Process
review_text:
I connected at Narita airport for JL18 from Narita to Vancouver.  After passing through security for international transits, I had about a 3 hour layover before my flight and so made my way to the only Japan Airlines lounge that is open at Narita – the First Class Lounge on level 4 of the main terminal building of Terminal 2 – now open for both First Class and Business Class passengers.  On the way, I noticed that the airport was noticeably empty of travellers and even at the duty free shops that are usually full of Chinese tourists lining up for purchases, there were few customers.  

Normally the First Class lounge entrance is on the 3rd floor and you take the elevator inside the entrance to go up to the 4th floor.  Now, you take the escalator outside the closed entrance to the First Class Lounge on the 3rd floor, go up the escalator to the 4th floor and enter the First Class Lounge there.  From the 4th floor, you can take the elevator inside the lounge to go back down to the 3rd floor where the shower rooms are located.  The dining area is on the 4th floor.  When I was there from around 3:45 pm to around 6 pm, it was not very busy, there were plenty of seats with plastic partitions between counter seats and open tables designated with signs for one person or a couple only.  There were plenty of staff to assist and as always, service is superb, attentive, low-keyed.  The coffee and soft drinks machines are still self serve, but all of the food is now served to you by staff and not self serve.  This applies even to the special KitKat bars for coffee that used to be self serve in jars but are now neatly displayed one to a dish in a glass cabinet and must be served to you by staff behind the counter.  There were still quite a few items available made to order, including sushi from the made to order sushi counter, but I thought the food selection was noticeably smaller and more snack like rather than meal like.  The only meal like items were the trademark Japan Airlines beef curry (which is traditionally available in both the Sakura business class lounge and the First Class Lounge), the Japanese style breakfast (curious offering for late afternoon) and the ramen.   Hot snacks to order included soup dumplings (Chinese xiao long bao) and Sichuan style mapo tofu.  The coffee served in the lounge is the same special coffee lines that JAL sources from Japanese coffee specialist Mi Cafeto for first and business class on its flights – always very enjoyable and flavourful.  

After grabbing a quick bite, I then went to the seating area of the lounge.  The seating area has lots of individual sofa type seats and some counter type seats at the large windows which provide a good view of the adjacent gates and the runway beyond.  Surprisingly, the massage chairs in this section of the lounge are still available for use.  I did not have enough time to use them this trip as they typically have a cycle that runs about 10 or 15 minutes, but I have used them in past visits to JAL lounges and think they are quite good and enjoyable as far as massage chairs go. 

I arrived at the gate for my flight before boarding time and counted 70+ people in the gate area – indicating a relatively full flight during pandemic travel restricted times since JAL uses a B787-800 with 186 seats.  Uncharacteristically for JAL, boarding was actually delayed for about 15 minutes – the announcement indicated “airport issues”.  Boarding was by rows and as expected from the very orderly Japanese people, passengers only lined up when their rows were called.  There was pre-boarding for wheelchairs and families with young children requiring assistance following which was boarding for First Class/JAL Diamond/OneWorld Emerald, and then Business Class.  There is no First Class cabin on JL18, and I was the only person in the JAL Diamond/OneWorld Emerald line. 
 
The flight is operated with a B787-800 aircraft with only business class and economy seating.  In business class, the plane is equipped with the JAL Sky Suite in a 2X2X2 configuration.  There are 30 seats in business class and about 7 or 8 passengers in business class on my flight.  The Sky Suite is a great seat with direct aisle access from every seat, fully horizontal flatbed option and an enclosure around your seat that is a little above seated head level for a great deal of privacy.  I had a window seat at 1K and the seat beside me was empty as well the two rows of seats behind me so there was plenty of buffer between me and other passengers.  With direct aisle access, the window seats on the flight are a great choice as in addition to greater privacy, you can also take advantage of the extra large windows on a B787 Dreamliner.  Note that the Sky Suite window seats, aisle seats and center section seats differ slightly from each other in terms of little storage areas and counters.  The window seats are particularly good as they have more ledges and counters around the seat to put things on and a storage tray behind the seat headrest for smaller items.  There is also a storage shelf under the video screen and room for a carry on bag under the shelf.  On boarding, there was a large pillow, toiletries bag, slippers, noise cancelling headphones, light blanket and bottle water already placed at the seat.  Surprisingly, for cleaning obsessed pandemic times, there was also an in flight magazine, a duty free shopping magazine and an entertainment program magazine at the seat, and actual printed menus were handed out before meal service.  

Pushback was similarly 15 minutes delayed but with a short flight time of 8 hrs 20 minutes, we were scheduled to arrive early and in fact did land very early at 9:51 am, over an hour earlier than scheduled.  Shortly after take off, cabin attendants came around to take drinks and meal orders.  Japan Airlines seem to have made minimal changes to in flight dining service – the same number of meals in flight, the same choices of food and number of courses are offered, for a Japanese style meal – tray with bento box with 5 sections for different appetizers, followed by a tray with the main course with rice, miso soup and pickles, followed by a third tray with coffee and dessert.  The only difference is that all the containers now have covers that the passengers must remove themselves.  Flight attendants wore masks at all times and wore gloves during meal service.  I opted for and pre-ordered the Japanese meal for dinner and as always, it was beautifully presented and if anything, even more delicious than on prior flights with JAL.  This might be due to the fewer flights that JAL is now operating and it apparently switching to serving what appears to be the same menu on all its flights for similar meals.  I checked on JAL’s website the menu for JAL’s flights on the same day for other US and European destinations and they appear to all feature the same menu items. 

Meal service was completed about 2 ½ hours after take off.  Cabin attendants then offered to put out the new Airweave foam mattresses that JAL now offers on some long haul overnight flights.  This was my first experience with the Airweave foam mattress, it is made of quite thick foam of maybe an inch, and I thought it greatly enhanced the comfort of the seat when in flatbed position.  

The Sky Suite seat has a fairly large video screen – JAL website indicates 23 in.  But it is not a touch screen and while there is a separate hand held remote unit, the interaction between the control and the screen is awkward, they do not mirror each other.  In flight entertainment for English speakers has never been a strength of JAL and so while there was an adequate selection of a few newer movies, more older movies and then a handful of movies and TV programs with English subtitles, many of the offerings were in Japanese only or subtitled in Japanese only. 

About 1 ½ hr before landing, the second meal service was offered – a Japanese or Western breakfast.  I tried the Western breakfast, described as a sweet potato Spanish omelette but it in fact came with sausages too.  Not outstanding like the Japanese dinner first meal, but still good. 

Prior to landing, the head cabin attendant came by to thank me for flying with JAL.  Throughout the flight, service was excellent and the cabin crew did an excellent job of keeping the toilets clean. 

Arriving at Vancouver International Airport, there was the usual pass through the machines to complete your arrival declaration and then all passengers joined one line for the customs and immigration officers.  The line was quite long but moved quickly.  I had downloaded the ArriveCAN app and filled in and submitted my quarantine plan and health declaration prior to my flight and so passed through very quickly when it was my turn.  A bit confusingly, the customs and immigration officer gave me one handout about quarantine and then as I passed those counters and walked towards the luggage carousels, the area was cordoned off in a way that you had to pass an individual, who I believe said he was with Health Canada, who then gave you a different handout about the quarantine.  There was also information which you can access on website links through the ArriveCAN app but the information from the various sources differed.  For example, the two handouts indicated I would receive calls from two 1-800 type numbers and that I must answer those calls, but then the links through the ArriveCAN app refers to a third and different number. 

Overall, a very pleasant travel experience with JAL during difficult times for travel.  No diminution of in flight service, enhanced sleep product and excellent meals.

title: Tried to illegally charge us $10K
review_text: We flew JAL to Helsinki but were not allowed entry because the layover was in Tokyo. JAL assured us before we boarded in Sydney that this would not be a problem and that they were responsible for only boarding us if we would be able to enter Helsinki.  We were denied access at the border. According to law in Finland JAL is responsible to fly return us since they boarded us.  The JAL representative tried to trick us into signing a paper that would make us owe them almost $10K for the return flight. Thankfully the officer from Finland stepped in. The representative knowing he was found out said "okay I'll get the tickets" No apologies.

title: Great experience
review_text:
I had an excellent flight with Japan airlines. Their service was amazing and the staff were very attentive. 
The flights were quite empty due to current government and travel restrictions, which meant that it was a very spacious and comfortable journey.
I hadn't flown with JAL before but I will definitely consider flying with them again in the future!

title: Great experience
review_text:
I had an excellent flight from London - Tokyo - Sydney. The staff were all incredibly attentive and looked after us really well on both flights. The flights were quite empty due to currently travel and government restrictions which meant that the journey was very comfortable.
I had not flown with JAL before but will definitely fly with them again in the future.

title: i love everything about JAL!!!!!!
review_text: Love comfy seats and legroom on economy, foods are great. They have the latest inflight movies and shows. Very accommodating attendants. Complete with toothbrush, small soaps, sanitary pads in flights.

title: Bad costumer service
review_text: I called their costumer service in Canada because I need to bring my guitar. Well, as far as I know any airlines will allow you to hand-carry your guitar. however, The JAL website say yes but not for their customer service. It's so confusing and their turn off the phone because they can't Answer it. unprofessional Customer service. it is a simple common question.

title: customer service fantastic
review_text: staff were fantastic, even at airport they were friendly and courteous. plane was clean and nothing was too much trouble

title: Buyer beware
review_text: Website allows you to buy ticket for another person but that person cannot board plane without your credit card. Cost me $150 in cancellation fees cancelling only one hour after ticket purchase and they call to inform us of the issue ...

title: Best customer service
review_text: I had some trouble with getting the correct health certificate to go back home since I don't speak very much Japanese. The attendants went way above and beyond their duties and made phone calls to the hospital that issued my certificate, walked me to a different clinic that could help me get a new certificate; all so I could make it on my flight. They were literally running around helping me so I could make it on board at the last minute. Truly the best customer service experience I have ever had. Thank you!

title: Friendly service
review_text:
Check in was handled in a friendly efficient manor, and at my leisure. They even let me choose my seat and print out my boarding pass for my return flight. 

The flight was quick and comfortable, and my seat assignment was perfect for my needs.

When boarding, I noticed the plane was painted as a large whale shark - although, it was a pink whale shark. I mentioned to the flight attendant that I loved whale sharks and have snorkeled around them in the past - I loved that we were traveling in a large pink whale shark. In the middle of the flight she brought me a sticker, they usually give to kids, that depicted the plane. A small thing, but it shows they listen and care.

title: A most memorable internal flight!
review_text:
Travelling from South Korea to Sapporo with limited flight options available, the best deal I could get for flights came with an apparent drawback; the outward leg involved changing airports in Tokyo (from Narita to Haneda).  As a retired Senior with plenty of time on my hands, this didn't present as an insurmountable problem.  Not having passed through Narita for 13-years and Haneda being a first for me, by contrast, I actually looked forward to crossing Tokyo.
The transfer turned out to be quite painless; within 30-mins of arrival at Narita, I had cleared Immigration and Customs and had proceeded downstairs to the JR Station to catch the Narita Express for the 70-min journey into Central Tokyo.  After changing trains onto the Keikyu Line at Shinagwa, the overall transfer to Haneda Airport from Narita took about  90-mins overall, with about 90-mins to spare before departure to Sapporo.
Surprisingly for an internal flight, the Haneda > Sapporo leg was operated by a wide-bodied Airbus A350-941  with a 3-3-3 seating configuration in Economy and this January afternoon flight wasn't particularly busy.  I had selected a seat at the rear of the plane (Row 50) in order to take photos of the snow-covered landscape coming into Sapporo (unobscured by aircraft wings) and the rearmost cabin was virtually empty.  Leaving the rain behind in Tokyo, the weather was perfect throughout the flight and coming into Sapporo with the sun low in the sky, close to setting (at 3:00pm in the afternoon!), was picture perfect.
No drawbacks ... instead, a most memorable internal flight!

title: Never again!
review_text: I had one of my worst flights experiences with JAL when I flew from Sydney to Tokyo. The service from staff was ok but the cleanliness and food is below expectations. I was extremely ill after the flight that I was not able to get to my first hotel of choice in the city but rather an airport hotel as i kept having to run to the bathroom. I did send an email to head office but the reply was dismissive and no apologies despite sending them pictures of hair on the pillow and stains on the tray and seats. If you want to fly to Japan only fly with ANA airline, the service, the food and cleanliness has always been way ahead of JAL just a shame the day I traveled flight was full!

title: Refuse to refund my ticket that JAL cancelled itself!
review_text:
Japan airlines (JAL) is one the most greedy and dishonest airlines I have ever dealt with and I have dealt with a lot of airlines in my life. They do any tactic and tricks to get away with their obligations. We bought our tickets through a travel agency (return tickets from Canada to India) at the beginning of COVID-19 crisis and at that time there was no talk of pandemic and lockdowns or even flight cancellations. However, during our trip countries locked down and flights cancelled, and many people had to forget about their flights or ask for refunds. We contacted JAL and they said we cancelled your original return flight, so we asked to reschedule our flights for later dates. Since JAL changed our flights dates, travel agency did not assume any responsibility afterward and we had to deal with JAL directly. After a few weeks we called to make sure our flights are set, but JAL said, sorry this flight is cancelled too and either you have to reschedule or cancel your flights. At that point we had to get back to our country, Canada and had no choice but to get the repatriate flights through government and cancel our JAL ticket. So we requested a refund and now they say since you bought your ticket through a travel agent we can’t issue a refund to you and when contacted our travel agent they said, as soon as JAL changed your flight dates they took over and we have no control over your tickets. We contacted JAL again, at first they agreed that they have control over our tickets however in a subsequent email they sent this: “Dear Valued Customer, Thank you for submitting your refund form to Japan Airlines. Upon review, we regret to inform you that your ticket does not qualify due to the reason below:   *  Ticket is issued by a third party travel agency”
Basically, JAL doesn’t want to honor our tickets and refund us and look for any excuse not to do so. This is the worst and most irresponsible airline I have ever dealt with. 
If you value your money and sanity, do not fly with Japan airlines, they easily ignore you and look for any excuse to rip you off !!!!!!!!!

title: Fantastic airline
review_text:
I have to say I couldn’t fault jal airlines in any way.

Flew in mid March just before the lockdown, and because of this, there was loads of room on plane,had a whole row to myself.

All the staff, from check in to stewardesses were friendly and helpful.

Food was of Japanese style and served with either chopsticks or proper metal cutlery.

Would 110% recommend for the attentive service you get.

title: Premium Economy is worth the extra $$
review_text: Great little exras in premium economy including priority check-in, lounge access, dedicated boarding time, more comfortable seats and sound cancelling headsets to name a few.

title: Excellent Staff
review_text:
This was my first international trip and I did not have any clue as to how the airlines and their staff would be. Travelling with a group on 26th January, 2020 and on my birthday eve I initially enquired from the ground staff if I could carry a small cake inside the aircraft as I wanted to have something sweet as this time I could not a cake. They agreed to it. Finally I dropped the idea as i knew it will be difficult to keep  it inside. While just about to board the aircraft I saw the crew dressed in ethnic wear as it was India’s Republic Day. This small gesture from their end will remain with me forever. My inflight experience was equally good as the crew was very supportive and attentive to my requests. I was booked in the economy class and the leg room was good enough to stretch my legs. While returning from Tokyo to New Delhi on JL 749 on 31st January, 2020 I was given a middle seat to which I was not comfortable sitting. While requesting to change the same for an aisle seat or a window seat they happily gave me 2 Premium Economy seats so that one of the group members can also sit with me. I was impressed with the presence of mind and the eye for detail which their staff had. Whenever I travel to Japan it shall be through JAL.
One suggestion : If a passenger is travelling with you on his birthday/ anniversary the staff should make it a point to wish the passenger as this will earn you more customers in the future.

title: Great Business and First Class Product and Service.
review_text:
We had the opportunity to fly JL in their international first class on a recent visit to Asia. We were the only 2 in a cabin of 8 people. In spite of all the turmoil associated with COVID, the on board service was excellent. Their menu is more comprehensive than a Michelin star restaurant. The FA's were ou going and always there when we needed something. Seats are good sized, although not like some of the other first class carriers like EK ( a little dated in my opinion). In flight entertainment options were limited for a 13 hour to NRT. But, the overall experience was phenomenal! 

 I have flown them in business class before, and their business cabins are also very comfortable and offer privacy and aisle access to every passenger.

title: Thanks a lot JAL
review_text: My family has been flying with JAL since 2018. Their on board service is always excellent. The cabin crews are extremely professional and helpful. The economy seat is so comfy especially for my 6'5 hubby. The food is fine for my taste as Asian but not to my husband's liking. End of March during the pandemic, we as a family decided to fly back from Indonesia to US since the choices of flights were narrowing down because of the traveling ban from several countries. Thankfully JAL still had some flights to US with reasonable price even though we paid almost twice the price that we used to pay. The flight from Jakarta to Tokyo still had decent amount of passengers meanwhile Tokyo to Boston only had like less than 20 passengers. But man, their crews were still professional. Thank you so much, JAL for bringing us back to our home in the middle of this chaos.

title: Good Experience
review_text: The flight attendants were friendly and the food was good.  On the return flight, we were given a make-your-own dish, which was an interesting concept and fun to put together.  The in-flight entertainment was great; there was a decent selection of recent movies to enjoy.

title: Steaming Passengers Alive
review_text:
It is much easier to put on a light jacket, use a blanket or drink some hot tea to warm yourself up.   However when you are hot there's very little you can do to ease the discomfort.    The airline both times (to and back) has manage to keep the cabin well above 75 degrees F at the minimum.   My traveling partner and myself sweat through the entire uncomfortable plane ride.   
If you are sensitive to heat, do not ride with JAL, you will be miserable.   ANA and Singapore airlines are your better bet as they have always kept the cabin comfortable.

title: A Million Thanks!!!
review_text:
It's a good thing to have a great customer service during normal times, but JAL has proven itself worthy even during crisis!
I bought JAL flight through a third party that bailed out last min. My flight was rescheduled a day earlier and my connection flight forced me to stay in Japan airport for 2.5 days, and because of COVID, I couldn't get pass through the immigration, and had to stay in the airport, without any restaurant opened!

Tried to call the agent and waited for hours for 3 days straight with no avail. I called JAL and they promised to help me contact the agent. With JAL's help, I could get the agent to contact me. They sent me an email saying that the flights I wanted was full, and I need to get an upgrade to business class costing USD5000/person (10,000 for 2). SHOCKING! I then called JAL's customer service to check, and though they mentioned that it is customary for them to only reschedule flight through the agent that we booked in, they would like to help and made an exception. They  rescheduled me to a flight I needed.

Their in flight crews were really attentive.They came over n translated to us every single time because all passengers are mostly Japanese (at this time, nobody really travels to Japan except their own citizens).During our final flight to Seattle (JL 068), though there were only 9 of us, they were still excellent. They made us origami with our names, and said we could choose whichever seats, extend our seats and relax. JAL, YOU're the best!

title: long walk
review_text:
I was exhausted, after a long international flight. So, although on one level I appreciated the exercise, on another it was the last thing I wanted. The walk from the bus that brought us from the international terminal to the departure date for the Okayama flight took me almost as long as the flight itself. A long, long way. Admittedly, there were no hassles of check in and security check, since the bus dropped us arirside.

In comparison, it was a relief to pas through the electronic gates and settle into my Economy- class seat. Relaxing, too, to know the rhythm and cadence f JAL service. No surprises, nothing unexpected. Just the regular rhythm of good, by-the-book service.

Arrival was fast. Small airport. Short wait for luggage. Bus waiting outside. Hassle-free.

title: Excellent service both up in the air or on the ground
review_text: There was a lot going on end of Feb and early March and alternation and changes were made a few times during this period. Staff at the North American hotline was patient and very helpful. Up the air, during this critical time, the crew looked after travelers well. I would definitely fly with Japan Airlines again when everything is back to normal.

title: Thoughtful service, nice flight
review_text:
I was in no particular hurry to get to Haneda, with lots of time before my connecting flights. For once, though, the flight left on time and arrived slightly early. Relaxing, then

Service was very good. Kind, thoughtful, gracious. Check-in clerks could not have been more thoughtful seeing that I had a long journey ahead of me.

No food, of course, but an entirely predictable, and thus somehow comforting, selection of drinks, delivered with a smile.

Plane was only two thirs full, which always helpw people relax.

Al in all, then, a good flight.

title: Excellent service
review_text: Excellent service as usual, lovely air and ground crew. Our flight was on time. Definitely recommend.

title: Best Airline I Have Flown On!
review_text: Wow, what a brilliant flight! Japan Airlines,  together with Malaysian Airlines are the two greatest airlines I have flown with, and I have been lucky enough to have travelled many times around the globe.  The staff were truly outstanding - polite, helpful and provided an exceptional service. The plane was very clean, seat space generous and food brilliant with so much choice.  The infotainment screen was comprehensive and kept me entertained for 13 hours! The food was a real highlight whereby they provide information on the chefs who created all the individual dishes, which is a beautiful touch.  The food was generous,  original and very tasty.  The drinks that were offered were both non and alcoholic in nature,  which was great.  They also offered snacks throughout the whole flight,  which in over 200+ flights,  I have never experienced.  However,  for me,  it was the incredibly profitable customer service that I experienced is the true beauty of flight.  Well done Japan Airlines- my greatest flight experience ever! Please accept my respect.

title: Outstanding service, excellent food and very comfortable economy class seats
review_text:
We loved our experiences on JAL. Also like ANA a lot but decided to give JAL a go this time as they advertised their awards for Economy Class seats in addition to having a 2-3-2 split on their 767. Not often do you get a 2 seat configuration in cattle class anymore. 

Everyone we dealt with was fantastic. The seat lived up to our expectations and was miles more comfortable  than AC.  The cabin was kept spotlessly clean. The service was very quick and attentive. The meals, we thought, were excellent. Washrooms always clean. And available snacks and drinks replenished frequently.

Though we waited on hold for 1.25 hours to connect with an agent to rebook our seats back to Canada, the agent was exceedingly helpful and did everything we asked of her and was super friendly about it. 

We often travel to Japan, usually with ANA to acquire Star Alliance points. Now will choose JAL over ANA, if available and not overly expensive as the seats were comfortable and there was a lot of space around our seat.

Thanks!

title: Japan Airlines sucked big time this time around.....
review_text:
Unfortunately for us JAL really disappointed us big time as opposed to a few years ago when they gave us excellent service.
Under the current situation Japan Airlines DID NOT honour a reservation made by our carrier Delta Airlines to begin our journey back from Singapore back to Montreal, Canada. 
The Delta representative did a remarkable job securing a reservation for us and JAL simply did not care and bumped us from our flight out of Singapore!!!
Shame on you Japan Airlines!!! You guys did not have the decency to honour a commitment to us your customers in that flight......
And by the way, your app sucks big time as well because it is only in japanese and you are supposed to be an international carrier!!!
JAL as an airline has quite a bit to learn about customer care. Try getting a few pointers from Delta Airlines who have been outstanding helping us to get back home.
Please share this review as much as you can so that Japan Airlines treat customers with more empathy and respect. They are a disgrace to Japanese culture this time!

title: Excellent handling of cancelations due to coronavirus
review_text: Japan airlines has been very considerate of its passengers requiring flight cancelations during this difficult times of coronavirus. Excellent service Japan Airlines!

title: Great flight
review_text: JAL is a quality airline. One of the best things about JAL is the 2-4-2 configuration in the economy cabin of their 787. Also great seat pitch. Service was excellent. The IFE was lacking a bit but still enough to watch.

title: The best flight
review_text: The food was tasty and the show was amazing and I loved the snack and dessert were astounding and loved the flight attendant

title: very good
review_text: The flight was good, the plane I was on was a bit outdated, Service was good it was              hard to hear the staff because they all wore masks

title: The worst service ever
review_text: It is absolutely impossible to get a hold of a person to make a change in my reservation. I have been calling Japan numbers (toll number, very expensive) and US numbers, to no avail. They obviously do not care. For some reason the change cannot be done online, but they won't answer the phone or the emails. The most pathetic thing I've seen in my life.

title: Best Economy Class
review_text:
I always choose the aircraft I fly in because I want to choose the seating type.  I usually choose aircraft with twin seats when I fly with my wife and 2 kids so we can sit two by two.  I don't like triple seats because that means I will be the odd one out sitting next to a stranger while my wife sit together with our 2 kids.  

On this trip from Singapore to Vancouver, I was travelling with my son so it was only two of us.  Airlines use B777, B787 or A350 on long-haul flights which are normally configured in 3-3-3 or 3-4-3 seating in Economy Class.  Since I don't like sitting in triple seats when there are only two of us, I chose JAL because it is the only airline that configures its B777 and B787 with twin seats.  On the Singapore-Tokyo sector, JAL uses B777-200 configured in 2-4-3 seating with increased seat pitch in their Sky Wider cabin.  And on the Tokyo-Vancouver sector, JAL uses B787-8 with eight abreast 2-4-2 seating.  This means on both sectors my son and I could sit in twin seats by ourselves.

The seating was the most important factor to me.  Next was the service.  JAL always offers excellent service.  Even the food is special.  They have special Japanese meals such as eel rice and Mos burgers prepared by their flight kitchens in Tokyo.

I chose JAL even though the fare was a few hundred dollars more than other airlines.  To me, comfort is more important than the cost.  I will definitely choose JAL again.

title: Satisfied
review_text: The flight ticket was relatively cheap. The food was great and the service was good. There was a lounge in Narita where we have a buffet meal before we boarded the plane. It was free, you just present your boarding pass to avail it.

title: Flight to Cambodia
review_text:
Very nice and relaxing flight, the crew were functional and the food was acceptable.  
Getting to the destination was problem less.

title: Uneventful flight. Too hot though!
review_text:
Flight attendants were polite, helpful and efficient. Seats seemed to have generous legroom. Selection of movies was fine and food was good too.
My only criticism is that the cabin was hot and they did not bring drinks around often like other airlines.

title: Even economy class was real nice
review_text: I was real impressed with the comfort and service that I received from the folks at Japan Airlines, even in Economy Class.  The flight was long but they made it nice with multiple meals, free drinks, free movies, free headphones, hot towels to freshen up and everything except a bed.  If you need a bed, you have to move to first class but we did not find it necessary.  The staff was first class and made the 13 1/2 hour flight very comfortable.  If I ever have to fly to this part of the world again, I will be sure to book with Japan Airlines.

title: Best Airline Ever
review_text: After much research I decided to pay the little extra and fly JAL as my son flies them all the time to Japan and highly recommended them. Wow was he right. I will only fly JAL if my destination is where they fly. The North American airlines could learn a lot from them with respect to customer service. From booking to check in to flight experience, they are beyond exceptional. They have extra leg room in economy, they offer incredible food constantly throughout flight with real silverware. Imagine that! They provide alcoholic beverages in their pricing as well. The plane is immaculate and the bathrooms are well maintained throughout the long flight and are larger than a shoebox. The flight attendants are overly polite and helpful and don’t yell into the intercom just so they can hear themselves talk. They only come on for 1-2 announcements and with very gentle voices.  They don’t flip the lights on in the middle of the night-  they slowly bring them on. The pilots did not even speak on our first flight  so the plane was very quiet and we had some restful sleep en route. The airline is extremely on time - they depart as scheduled - and on our return flight we departed and ended up on tarmac about 30 mins due to lightning and pilot came on and apologized and said “we promise to do what we can once in air to keep you on time” and they did - we arrived 30 mins earlier than scheduled. They provide pillows, blankets, excellent movie entertainment and headsets. This is how an airline should be!

title: Excellent customer service
review_text:
I too( like Chontl's review ) am very impressed with Japan Airlines excellent customer service in fully refunding airfares due to corona virus. 
Last year when Singapore airlines cancelled my flight and I needed to seek a refund as alternative fares were not suitable to us it took them over 5 1/2 weeks to refund nearly $4000. I was expecting a similar situation at the very least but got all my money back this time within a few days with out so much as a phone call needed. It was all handled proficiently through their website. 
I will definitely be rebooking with Japan airlines in the future.

title: Flight from DFW to Ho Chi Minh City
review_text: At the early part of the CoviD19 breakout, we needed to re-route our trip from HK to another transfer point due to VN tightening their travel requirements.  We changed from a Cathay Pacific flight to JAL through Tokyo.    The quick connection (1:25) at Narita in Tokyo was super quick, very efficient.   The airline's cabin crew were all very good at their jobs and the food was decent/good.   Didn't get much sleep, but the cabin stayed dark enough that many did.

title: Speedy Refund of flight cancellation due to Covid-19
review_text:
I have booked the flights from Bangkok to Haneda for myself and my niece during 18 - 23 March 2020. 

However, due to the Covid-19 situation, I have regrettably had to cancel the bookings and the airline is kind to not charge the cancellation fees (due to ticket's class conditions).

I have called the airline to cancel my bookings and request for full refund on 26 Feb. 2020 and the call center named Khun Nichaporn and I got my full refund through my debit card on 12 Feb. 2020.

I am truly appreciated the efficient and the fairness of Japan Airline for this case and I will always fly Japan Airline with my Japan's trip. You are such professional and generous airline. 

Thank you so much for making this process so efficient.

Best regards,
Chonticha D.

title: Amazingly friendly staff
review_text: Great people on this flight  and the one back They were so lovely  I told our lovely attendant that I really liked the wine we had with dinner She promptly popped back with another bottle for me ( The little ones )The plane was comfortable the food was delicious  I could recommend JAL more highly

title: To and from Japan
review_text: Excellent service throughout, very comfortable reclining seats. A really good selection of food and drinks.

title: Wonderful experience
review_text: One of our best flights ever. Two seats by the window and plenty of space for our feet made it very comfortable to go from Tokyo to Helsinki. Good and tasty food and drinks, and very friendly and service-minded crew. We slept very well in our seats with pillow and blanket available. We can highly recommend Japan airlines.

title: JAL (BA Code share)
review_text: Good service, nice food and enough space to squeeze out (just) from the middle & window seats without having to disturb the aisle seat. Only slight issue was the seats seemed firmer than other airlines and were a bit hard.

title: Very comfortable economy class and customer friendly airlines
review_text:
I have been travelling to Japan regularly twice yearly. I love the good food, lovely scenery and great hotels. Since five years ago, I have been using JAL and no other airlines.  The cabin crew are friendly and the food is enjoyable.  
What I wish to emphasise is that they are very customer friendly. In view of the recent covid-19 outbreak; I cancelled my trip to Tokyo for arts auction. JAL allowed me to cancel all my international and domestic flights and gave me full refund within two weeks.  I have different experience with my travel agent when I wish to cancel another trip to Europe for the same reason. From now on I would definitely consider JAL as my first choice.

title: Love flying JAL
review_text: Whenever we can, we prefer to fly JAL. Their service and level of comfort is second to none. Last trip especially, the cabin was not cold, so we were perfectly comfortable without adding a wrap or blanket. And the food is wonderful.

title: Improved a lot comparing to before!
review_text:
JAL used to be a snob airline while they even used to see video how to be a JAL's cabin attendant in their flight.  So, I used to avoid JAL because of their unfriendly service.

Firstly, the seats are so comfortable and wide.  It made me relaxed during my whole of trip.  

Served food is also improved comparing to salty previous foods.  

Minor but some improvements are necessary on JAL are, for example:

1. Cabin attendants never helps passengers to lift up baggage, which is normally done by ANA.
2. English announcement is very poor.

title: JAL Makes an Effort
review_text: I travel back and forth to Japan 3 or 4 times a year and I always enjoy flying with JAL. I have flown other airlines (Air Canada, Cathay, Korean) and I have to say, for comfort, quality of food (even in Economy) and service, JAL is the best, although Korean comes a very close second.

title: Outstanding
review_text: Pleasant flight, the service is superb. The stewards are very accommodating and also pleasant. They made sure that we are comfortable.

title: Economy at its BEST!
review_text: Opted for bulk head seats, the 1st row with more leg space.....it had a lot of leg room, couldn't reach the bulkhead even with legs fully extended!  More than any other airlines in economy!

title: Famous quality, great food, real cutlery
review_text:
Many reviews rave about this airlines superb organization, customer service and amenities. When it comes to food, Japan Airlines also exceeds all expectations when it comes to their food. Face it. An airline's food can make or break the flight. 
JAL not only gives free drinks with the meals, but the main meal showcases the signature dish of up and coming chefs. The food is served in dishes, not cardboard, to be eaten with real metal knife, fork and spoon. You will find no plastic sporks here. While I am not a fan of their red house wine, I did enjoy their sake and Japanese beers. Special meal needs are welcome. Just let them know food preferences when you book. 
In respect to their planes, seating, service and cleanliness, the rest of the flight experience was head and shoulders above the no-frills service which we have been made to tolerate with North American carriers.

title: JAL vs QANTAS
review_text:
Second time with JAL (One World partnership with QANTAS) on their Dreamliner, so comfortable along with fantastic & polite service. Being a loyal QANTAS Frequent Flyer for numerous years, and travelling in Premier Economy our luggage is tagged with Priority & access to QANTAS Business Lounge (not offered by QANTAS!). Upon return flight we get same & again access to the fabulous JAL Business Lounge. The pluses are numerous flying with JAL especially when we get to baggage claim and our luggage is waiting for us! . 
Last year I did send a letter & email to QANTAS querying why they don’t offer same to a loyal customer ... never received a reply!!!
So .... definitely JAL #1 preference for me on my travels from now on 😊👍🏻

title: Wonderful Service but terrible food!
review_text: My seat was very comfortable. The service was excellent.  The staff was friendly and accommodating.  Everything was very good.  The only reason I am not giving it five stars is because the food was horrible.  I had the western menu but there were items and tastes not recognizable to me.  The only food that was warm were the main entrees.  Mini quiches should not be served cold.  Ruben sandwiches should have melted cheese and be warm.  Everything looked beautiful but when items that should be warm are served like they were just taken out of the refrigerator, they are tasteless or horrible.  The bad food was not just on one flight.  It was on all 4 separate legs of my round trip.  If you take them, order a special meal or bring your own food.

title: Disappointing...
review_text:
From the time I flew JAL 10 years ago, I have been a strong supporter of the airlines. My memories from those flights were great.. the seats were comfortable, the service impeccable, and the food so memorable. It made flying long distances more bearable and I have recommended the airlines at every opportunity. I didn't get the chance to fly it again until recently and was dismayed to find that the standard had fallen.

I booked four flights - Hawaii to Japan to Singapore, and on the way back Singapore to Japan to Hawaii. Regretted it after the first flight... The seats were small and uncomfortable. The service was still excellent but they don't offer you a choice of meals anymore. We were only provided one option - hopefully you like the meal of the day!

title: Lovely staff and comfortable travel.
review_text: The staff on board during my journey were so helpful, they couldn’t do any more to help. On boarding the plane, the staff came to my seat to introduce themselves, explain the food/drinks service and to offer champagne or orange juice. Throughout the flight the staff were offering drinks and food service was as and when you ordered. You are given an extra mattress to put on to the bed when it is in full recline which was super comfortable. In board entertainment was plentiful and varied. Would definitely fly with JAL again.

title: Best overall Business class experience
review_text:
Our first experience flying JAL.  When checking in, the entire staff came out  from behind counter and bowed to us.  
Very comfortable seats, and fabulous food.  Had our choice of either Asian or Western cuisine.  So impressed.

title: Disappointed
review_text: Perhaps it is downhill after you fly Singapore Airlines. I had such high expectations for this airline and they were not met across the line. The entertainment system was hard to navigate, the food was not as good as I had expected and neither was the service. I did not care for the seats either.

title: My favorite air carrier
review_text: I am not joking: I really consider JAL as the best air company for its courtesy to passengers. JAL provides excellent service on every step so your journey to Japan starts on board. I highly recommend this air company and it is sincerely

title: Amazing flight
review_text: The service was awesome, the staff are always very excited to help you, the food was not as bad as i spected, and the flight was super nice, if I'll be able to have a flight back to Japan I will take it again with Japan Airlines

title: Excellent Service
review_text: All of the flight attendants were so well mannered and pleasant. Actually not only them, most of the Japanese travellers are so kind as well.  When I came to my seat, the guy in the seat next row to me waited for me to take out whatever I wanted from my hand luggage and then said "Let me help you Madam" and he carried my bag to be placed in the luggage space above us.  I didn't need to ask for help.  Then while meals were being served later, I was so tired and wanted to sleep, so one of the flight attendants told me to just sleep.  When I woke up one of the ladies came up to me and asked if I would like to have my meal now.  I replied "Yes please" and she brought the meal to me specially.  I have never experienced such care in any of my travel before.

title: Great service and fabulous crew
review_text:
I can't recommend JAL enough.  

From the check in all the way though to deplaning the staff and crew were fabulous.  Comfortable business seats, delicious food and no request was too much.  I had trouble opening the overhead bin during flight and asked the attendant "when she had a moment" to please help me out, she dropped what she was doing and immediately ran to help saying "I'm sorry it took me so long" - it literally was a nano-second.  What a pleasant change from the usual surly North American airline crews.

We'll definitely fly them again if/when the opportunity arises.

title: Narita to Honolulu
review_text: A very pleasant flight, the crew very professional and attentive, didn't regret flying with Japan airlines!

title: Best economy flight you could ask for
review_text: JAL gives you the best value you could expect from an economy flight.  Great food, attending staff, frequent snacks, and comfortable seats.

title: Very nice airline
review_text: Very nice, good service.  Very comfortable seating station.  Worth it if you can afford it for the 11 hour trip.  As a bonus all passengers were allow into the Japan Airlines loach in those in economy.

title: Very misleading booking process
review_text:
During the booking process I was not able to book Premium Economy on the way to the US, but was able to for the return from Boston.

The site lead me to believe I could do seat selection, a determining factor for me in using an airline. Turns out that is not actually possible on the economy bookings so this was incredibly frustrating. 

Follow up customer service was terrible, and overall experience was very unsatisfactory.

Definitely going back to Cathay once the world returns to normality again.

title: Really good airline
review_text: Flew from London-Haneda on B787 both ways. Probably the best airline I’ve ever flown (from about 15-20 international airlines). Everything is tailored to the customer, really good flight and better than their other Japanese competitor by far. Definitely recommended if it’s a good price !

title: Great flight
review_text: This was the best economy long distance flight I ever experienced. The new dreamliner that JAL uses had excellent leg room and pitch in economy. 2+4+2 configuration. I ordered a special meal (Hindu), probably thinking it would be vegetarian. It wasn't but it was absolutely delicious and the FA explained all the ingredients to me. The staff are very kind and attentive. It was great value, booked via BA, and I was able to check in a snowboard for free.

title: Comfortable seats and pleasant trip
review_text: I travelled to Tokyo on this airline. I find the seats comfortable with enough legroom. The food served was also good. The in flight entertainment can be better, but I am ok with what was provided.

title: Wonderful!!!!!!!!
review_text: We traveled from Miami to Manila with a connecting flight in New York. We were cutting it close with time with our connecting flight when Japan Airlines called me to make sure I was on my way, a staff member met us at t he counter, promptly checked us in and personally escorted us through the lines/security  all the way to boarding the airplane to make sure we made our flight. The flight itself was great. They provide warm hand towels prior to serving meals, beer and wine are included options with meals. They provide a variety of entertainment options from video games to movies, books, and music. The staff was great. I highly recommend flying with Japan Airlines!!

title: Poor handling of cancellation due to coronavirus
review_text: We booked business class flights to Tokyo. Due to government travel advisories on the corona virus outbreak in japan we cancelled our flights. Japan airlines insisted on charging us $800 in cancellation fees when all other airlines like ANA announced special handling arrangements to provide a full refund. We were going to rebook with JAL but they refused to consider waiving their cancellation fee. This is unfair and unsympathetic to passengers. Very disappointed and will not rebook with you

title: A Little Dissapointed
review_text: We checked in on line the night before our flight.  When we got to the airport 3 hours before our flight, a long line had already formed before the counter opened.  When counters opened, there was no sign as to the location of bag drop for on line check in.  Had my husband not sought help from an employee, we would not have been directed to the shorter line.  When we finally got in the plane, I was sanitizing the trays and seat belt when the stewardess kind of scolded me to buckle up.  Food was better this time than my initial trip from LAX to Manila.  It was decent that they fed us more on this airline than any of the other ones I’ve flown.  Overall, I was satisfied with my experience but a little dissapointed to have experienced these minor issues that I did not experience with JAL in the past.

title: Sterling customer service
review_text:
Note: We did NOT actually fly with JAL on this trip. Here, I am describing their customer service when I called to cancel our trip. 

My family was supposed to fly to Japan next week but we decided to cancel as there is currently a travel advisory for Japan (from Singapore) due to COVID-19. When we called JAL, they were very understanding and waived the cancellation fee. We didn't really expect them to do so because we've heard that passengers on other airlines have been having issues getting refunds on their flights to South Korea, and South Korea currently has many more cases of COVID than Japan. 

We flew with JAL before and liked the trip very much. This time round, we were extremely impressed with their customer service standards and would choose them for our next trip to Japan!

title: It's easy.
review_text:
The cabin is clean and i can speak in Japanese, so it's easy.
Enjoy conversations with cabin attendants in Japanese! Best!
China International Airlines, I'm not going to ride Eastern Airlines!

title: great flight
review_text: great airling, good service, the food was a good variety found enough to eat. they have earphones available and it was restful.

title: Perfect
review_text:
Organisation,efficiency & service,
Jal excelled in every aspect of our journey to Tokyo looking forward to our next visit.

title: Great Flight in Coach Class
review_text: I flew in coach class from Bangkok to Narita.   The flight attendants were friendly, very efficient and professional.  The food was quite tasty and filling and the entertainment system was pretty good with a large selection of new movies (in English).  I would recommend flying JL to my friends and family.

title: Excellent Service - A Very Nice Flight In Coach Class
review_text: I  flew from DFW via AA and connected in NRT to Japan Airlines to fly via a B787-900 in coach class from Narita to Bangkok.  The flight attendants were all young and very friendly and professional.  The food was quite good - we had a choice of chicken and rice or pork and rice.  To speed things along they presented a picture card of the main course (chicken/pork) in a few languages so you simply pointed to what you wanted.  For desert they served little cups of Haagen-Dazs ice cream.  Because it was a 7 hour flight, prior to landing we had a fluffy breakfast bun and choice of beverage.  I would fly JL again and would recommend them to friends and family.

title: Customer Service Lacking
review_text:
After booking our trip almost a year ahead, as we got closer to our trip, we called JAL to get seat assignment. It was almost impossible talking to a live person, and once you did get someone on the phone, i felt like we got the runaround. Our flight was on 'American Airlines operated by Japan Airlines.' We first called American Airlines and got to talk to someone immediately. They informed us that any changes had to be made thru JAL. We called JAL, and after waiting for about 45min, they told us to call AA. But wait, there's more...
After 7 days in Japan with 8 of us traveling, JAL counter could only check in 4 of us! What?! Why?..we ask. They have this unapologetic smirk on their face and say we should call American Airlines. Are you kidding me. We call and AA airliens says they have nothing to do we ticketing. JAL counter then tells us there's nothing they can do and we should call our travel agent. Its probably 1am back home...we can't call our agent. JAL counter attendants just stand there and don't try to help at all while we franticly look for local travel agent info. We are in Japan mind you...and can't even call the local agency office. I go back to one of the many JAL staff standing around and beg her to at least help us call an agency contact on Japan. After minutes of dumbfounded contemplation, she gestures to an agent standing at the counter...thank God, because we feel that woman bent over backwards to help us...and she did! She got on the phone and called the number i had for the local agency, and after 15+ minutes on the phone, told us everything was ok.
Back to the others...there was one agent that 'helped' us initially...she was rude, condescending and everything but helpful. If it werent for the last two ladies who helped us, and the only interaction I got was from this first counterperson, i would never fly Japan Airlines again. How could an airlines ever employ such standoffish unhelpful personnel...

title: Elegant Flight
review_text:
First time I fly with JAL and business class, the simple and elegant of Japan is show at the service and plane interior, compare with others it’s come with simple and calm color and ambience. 
For business class passengers fly from Narita airport is encourage to use the Sakura Lounge located in 2nd floor which provide lunch but there is not much variant menu. In others hand, they served good food, Chinese siomay, Italian chicken wrap (with caesars dressing), Japanese Soba, Japanese rice with beef stew. Attractive automatic beer machine, wine & sake bar, coffee and excellent tea corners, kids menu include juice and desserts is available. 
Sakura lounge is separated two stores, 2nd floor is for dining and 1st floor is lounge also bathroom in 1st floor. Will you take a shower before flying 8 hours long haul ?

But lounge is not access to boarding gate, so please enjoy yourself but don’t forget the boarding time.

I fly with JL729, for business class they offer the JAL comfortable pajamas like cardigan with elegant soft green, a pouch of eye mask, moisture mask, ears plug, tooth brush.

About the in-flight meals, it’s call BEDD cuisine by Jun Kurogi
I choose Japanese meals, it’s 3 course meals start from appetizer menu is “Yuba” & crabmeat with wasabi flavored soy starchy sauce, Tuna sashimi, poached potherb mustard. Garland chrysanthemum & mushroom in Japanese broth with salmon roe, simmered chicken & vegetables, bechamel sauce & caviar, grilled shrimp with aromatic vegetable sauce. Japanese omelet vinegared turnip wrapped with salmon. 
There is lots for appetizer right ? serve in a overcute bento box. The chopstick stand is red Japanese Crane origami but its plastic, you may bring it but ask the permission with the crew. 

For main course, it’s Dainomono : Marinated chicken with tar tar sauce and yellow tail teriyaki and they mention 503 kcal and served with Japanese famous steamed rice, miso soup and Japanese pickles.

And of course even I am full but it’s always have a room for desserts, Black sesame pudding served as dessert and hot tea.

All time served if you still hungry, instant noodles, peanuts, chocolate in the pantry.

One hour before landed the crew served ice cream or Chinese dumpling, I choose Haagen Dazs Ice cream.

In-flight entertainment is not updated but so far not lousy at all, funny Thai movie, box office movie is available.

The business class chair is reclining flat and comfy blanket is available. 

The toilet amenities is awesome, the toner and lotion is Shiseido which is Japanese famous branded lotion, but the toilet size is same with others toilets. 

Overall, fly with JAL is experience, great service and thank you for the ground crew and cabin crew.

title: Excellent service, don't need to fly business cabin
review_text: Should've checked the aircraft type before booking business class, it's not worth it. Service is excellent, but that's always true for most business cabin service. For this route with this airline just go with economy unless they upgrade the business cabin.

title: Business - could do better
review_text:
Complaining about business class is pretty snobby isn't it?  But reviews require honesty so I have to say that yes it was better than economy or premium economy but not the standard I expect from business class.

Service quite good, and certainly friendly, although they forgot one of our main meals (served entrees and then totally forgot the main dish).  Out of the wine selections on the menu they didn't have half available (I ended up getting my third choice). Movies have very limited selection in English and you cant remove subtitles.  No pyjamas for overnight flight (you get a top but no bottoms??).  Seats do go flat but are not as big or as comfortable as some other premium airlines.

It wasn't a disaster but for business class they can to do better.

They lounge is awesome though, classy and great food and drinks.

title: Enjoyable flight
review_text:
Was one of the best economy seat I ever experienced.
Good service, delicious food, great in flight movies, and comfortable seat...
Thanks JAL!

title: J class
