review_text: JAL called it J class which is premium economy seats for their domestic flights. leather seats with leg rest wider arm rest and of course room space. they only served drinks for domestic sectors.

title: Reverse herringbone biz class seats
review_text: got a promo price and decided to try. service was good and food was much better. seats were typical reverse herringbone. your legs will go underneath the tv console. managed to sleep well since you get a 180degC flat bed.

title: Premium Economy JAL
review_text: the key is when you recline your seat, you dont have to worry about the passenger behind. you are given 2x 23kg baggage and access to airport lounge. food was ok but you get sake and mini champagne. Service was excellent.

title: Japan Airlines a total let down!
review_text:
With the global Covid-19 widespread. Many countries badly affected with high numbers of infected cases are allowing cancellation both for airlines and hotels. Japan is one of the highest in infected cases outside China yet main a regid stand on cancellation. I am truly disappointed and disgusted by the way the situation is handled. Compromised on concerns by travellers and their safety has never been a priority.

I will never recommend JAL and highly discourage anyone I know from choosing this airline.

title: Beware of JAL Cancellation or Change Fee. It costs like another ticket
review_text:
I booked a flight via the website a few months ago and there is the Corona virus outbreak. 
Thinking that the situation in Asia might get worse, I went on the website to cancel the tickets to realize that they will charge me $600, yes, $300 each flight. 
That cancellation fee is insanely high. My coworker cancelled her round-trip tickets for 2 and it only costs her $200 (EVA airlines).

Changing the tickets will cost $250 each way + difference in fare. 

This is the last time I'm going to fly with JAL. I'm more than willing to pay more for a lower cancellation fee. Now I know...

title: Comfortable flight
review_text: First time taking JAL to Sapporro. The flight was comfortable. Ample leg space and comfortable seats. Crew were friendly. Highly recommend this airline.

title: Good flight, but very warm cabin
review_text:
I loved flying Japan Ailines, but this flight was just very hot.  The trip was 13 hours long, and the cabin was at least 76 degrees, if not warmer.  This severely impacted the comfort of the passengers.  

The service was still excellent, but the climate was uncomfortable.

title: Great flying experience
review_text:
The flight from San Francisco to Tokyo was great.  This plane had more legroom and wider seats than I've seen on domestic economy flights.  They also served two meals and free beverages, which was nice too.  

The in-flight entertainment options were ok, although I appreciated that I didn't need to use my own device.

Service was excellent, with friendly, helpful staff.

title: Amazing Airline
review_text: I can’t say enough about Japan Air. My daughter (19) and I flew to Japan in November.  This was her first time flying. Japan air made the trip a memorable one for her and for me as well.  They are so attentive to detail and take the time to make sure each passenger is well looked after which is a rarity in today’s airline industry.  Where most airlines treat passengers like cattle, Japan Air treats you like a VIP even in coach.  The airplane was clean, the food was well prepared, it well presented and very tasty.  The leg room was more than enough and we were able to stretch out our legs without restriction.   We will fly Japan Air whenever we can they are hands down one of the best airlines.

title: Five out of Five again
review_text: We have flown many times now with JAL and it is superb. The crew are always fabulous and the plane is clean with excellent service and good food. Their Japanese timing is, as always, incredible. We will be booking our next trip in the not to distant future. Keep up the good work!!

title: Probably as good as it gets for long haul economy travel
review_text:
We flew from Tokyo to Boston on a 12 hour flight.   The convenience of non-stop was the most important factor in flight selection.  
We like the configuration of seats which was 2-4-2.   Seats were reasonably spaced for coach.  
Service was pleasant, the dinner was quite good, and bathrooms were kept clean.   The second meal which was billed as a taste of N.Y. from Dean and Deluca was poor.  
Individual screens played a variety of movies, but many of the same features were being shown both in early January and early February.

title: Top class
review_text: First time flying JAL and it won't be our last as regular travelers (economy class) I must admit that JAL economy class is a level above the rest of the airlines we have flown over the last 30 years, the extra leg room and wider seats make for a very pleasant flight with an attentive crew and very good food just sit back and enjoy the flight.

title: Would fly with them again
review_text: First time flying JAL and it won't be our last , as regular travelers (economy class) I must say that the JAL is one of the best so far ,more leg room and seats slightly wider than normal, good food and attentive crew made for a most relaxing flight.

title: Is this a low class airline?
review_text: Got in on a seat sale, so took advantage as offers Skywards points for Emirates. NEVER AGAIN! Polite service, but NON-EXISTENT online check-in (thought for a while my flight had been cancelled?!), poor communication (received zero emails past my payment confirmation), food onboard was inedible, service was ok. Overall, besides the decent baggage allowance - cannot say anything great about this airline, and would not fly again.

title: Simply the best
review_text: Superb level of service and comfort. Having travelled practically all world’s most recognized airlines, JAL by far exceeded my best expectations. Generous space in economy class canine, fabulous selection of food and beverages (including menu created by rising Japanese chefs, sake, gin, French wine etc), and highly professional and attentive to the very detail crew. Bravo!

title: WORST TRAVEL EXPERIENCE EVER!
review_text: My husband and I were flying through Japan Airlines on January 11th-12th when the Taal volcano erupted and all airports in the Philippines were shut down. JAL flew to the Philippines and the captain flew back to Japan after learning that NAIA was closed. When we returned to Japan, we had to go through immigration, collect our luggages and had to check in to a hotel. The first night was covered, however, we had to pay the extra night that we had to stay. I understand that this was mother nature and there is nothing we can do. The experience would not have been that horrible if JAL actually kept us updated about our flight. When we went to our hotel, JAL provided us with a sheet of paper with instructions on how to call for any updates. Mind you, there were approximately 100 other passengers on the same flight as us at this hotel. When we called the numbers that were provided to us, it was ALL in Japanese. We had to ask the employees at the hotel to translate for us. We waited for about an hour to finally speak with someone. When I spoke with the representative at JAL, she said to check the website for any updates. The website they provided us was in Japanese!! At this point, I was so frustrated. We literally felt stranded in Japan not knowing if we would fly today, tomorrow, next week or at all. It is so difficult to communicate with almost everyone that we spoke with at JAL and no one was able to give any answers to when we would be able to fly to our destination. The website, nor the phone number that was provided were of no assistance. Expedia finally assisted with setting us up with Philippine airlines. It is disheartening to fly with an airline company and you feel so helpless because of the lack of communication and unsure of when you are actually going to reach your destination. We have been flying for almost 24 hours when this occurred. When we were going to Narita to catch the flight with Philippine airlines, we had to walk to the shuttle bus area that was 10 minutes away at 4am. The hotel was an hour away from Narita airport. I normally do not write bad reviews when I fly as I know things do occur, but I am writing this review to urge better communication with passengers so we don't feel like we are in the dark. This was the worst travel experience I have ever had. I will never fly through Japan airlines again.

title: JAL is totally top shelf.
review_text: Flew it, liked it, will do it again. Great service. No......... impeccable service. They didn’t miss a trick. Highly recommend the flight and crew.

title: How long haul economy should be done
review_text:
I recently flew with JAL as part of a code share booking I'd made with British Airways. They're hard product is superb. I've flown on 787's with other airlines in the past, and they've always felt very cramped, however, unlike other airlines JAL only has eight seats across, rather than nine. So the seats were much more spacious width wise. There was also plenty of legroom in front. The crew were very polite and proved good service. The food was very good for economy too. The infight entertainment system was large and very responsive. My only slight criticism is there wasn't as much film/TV choice as on other airlines, and the free headphones were terrible (for my return flight I bought a cheap pair of ear bud earphones instead - highly recommended instead).
Certainly if I ever fly to Japan again I'll be looking at JAL as a preference.

title: JL41 departure and arrival time is no good
review_text: I’ve traveled with this flight (JL41) few times, a departure time is Earl morning(2-3am),which a public transport is not available, airport shops are closed, only a couple of shop are available. Arriving in uk London Heathrow is early morning (6-7), which is a business morning rush hour ,it’ll take a long hour to reach central London , by car , public transport. An aircraft is ok , even an economy class . But always a long queue for a toilet users.

title: Awesome Service
review_text: I had to cancel my flight from Singapore to New Chitose Airport recently due to my sudden injured ankle. I called the customer service to do so and the lady also suggested that I get a medical certification (MC) to waive the cancellation fee. After I had emailed them the MC, they called me almost immediately and explained clearly the details of the full refund. The last time that I flew with them was more than 25 years ago which was a very pleasant experience. Such superb service and I couldn't wait to fly with JAL again. Thumbs Up!!

title: Impressive economy
review_text: Traveled on JL0414 on 31/01/2020. Hard to fault JAL. The economy seat product (called JAL Sky Wider) is one of the best out there in terms of width and pitch. Food was great with various little extra dishes to accompany the main meal. Second meal service also good. Excellent service from the immaculately presented cabin crew - polite and efficient. Perhaps some extra western content on the IFE system would have been good but overall a very good flight with JAL.

title: Best international economy I have tried
review_text:
My flight was Melbourne to Tokyo return
Large seat and leg room
Great staff
Great food, I had vegan option
Two 23kg checked bags
No charge for Snowboard bag
Seriously hard to fault
Could have some more in flight entertainment options

title: JAL Sakura  lounge is HORRENDOUS at the Bangkok Airport
review_text:
I am taking the morning flight on JAL to Haneda airport in Tokyo from BANGKOK . I expected an excellent lounge with food for all tastes. Instead I am experiencing  very un-elegant  lounge with mainly Japanese dishes probably replicating the lowest eatery in Tokyo. For a Westerner there is nothing but some soggy banana muffins and danish of the worst quality, and not one choice of breads. The lounge reeks of highly strong smells coming from the Japanese dishes which are not fit and appropriate for an early morning departure. I have been in other JAL lounges and this one has taken me by surprise.
Where are the airlines headed?  
Do they not care about their customers?

title: Very Nice service
review_text: This was my first time flying this airline. Partners with American Airlines. Although the plane was definitely a bit dated, and seats were not as modern as others, the service and food options was very good. I would not hesitate to book again or to recommend.

title: Best service I've ever experienced on an airline
review_text: I was excited to see that my flight from Chicago to Tokyo that we booked through American Airlines was being serviced by Japan Airlines since I had heard good things about them.  The flight attendants were so attentive and pleasant and the food was very good!  It was a comfortable flight and it was on time (maybe even a little early!). The entertainment options were very good also.  Very, very good experience!

title: Worst flight experience of my life
review_text: Worst flying experience of my life. Thirty hours of delays entirely the airlines fault, no information, not permitted to leave gate, not hotel provided, everyone had to sleep on the floor. Lying, cheating supervisors refused to inform how to make a complaint or claim, tried to pressure into signing some Japanese waiver for a tiny gift card. Airline currently paying a $300,000 USD fine for similar issues in Chicago.

title: Great flight, rewards redemptions difficult
review_text:
Overall the flight was good. I was traveling with my wife and 1yo daughter and it was very comfortable and relaxing. The flight crew were great as well, very friendly and were able to make adjustments to meals and such so my wife and I can take turns taking core of our daughter. 

Only downside is the miles program makes it extremely difficult to redeem miles for flights. Firstly, you can only redeem for flights that start or end in Japan, you cannot use Japan as a connection to some other destination. If you do want to travel somewhere else via JAL, you effectively need to book two flights that end/start in Japan and go through the entire customs -> checkin -> security process in Japan as JAL will not combine them as a proper connecting flight. Also, the points required for a flight or upgrade can vary drastically, the difference of a single day can result in needing 10x as many points.

title: Comfy seats, yummy food!
review_text: I absolutely LOVED this flight. It was mine and my parents first time flying this airline and we would definitely fly with them again. The seats in economy were spacious. My dad, who is over 6 feet tall had the first relaxing flight of his life (in economy). The food was great (vegetarian and gluten-free meal). Great customer service, nice entertainment options but the seats were the best!

title: Best airlines
review_text:
This is the first time im using JAL, i often go abroad using so many airlines..but this time i have to give 5 stars to JAL...the flight attendant is very friendly amd helpful. Im so impressed on details they do. That time my son accidentaly touch his glass so the water goes all over him. One of the flight atenndant came fast to him  tought she will clean the mess with unfriendly face like other airlines atenndant. But wrong she came to my son and asking “ are you ok? Are you ok? “ helo clean him and bring him new glass of drink then after she clean the mass. 
And in the airport I saw JAL crew bring a paper with someone names as this passanger almost late and when they find him this passanger couldnt walk fast as age. And they sudden run took wheelchair to bring him fasy to the plane. Im realy impressed....try and you will thinj same as me

title: ZERO CUSTOMER SERVICE
review_text:
I recently booked a flight from Paris to Sydney premium economy with Japan Airlines. I flew Finnair Paris to Helsinki and then should have been on a Japan Airlines flight from Helsinki to Tokyo. My flight from Paris was delayed so I missed my connecting flight. When I arrived in Helsinki I was told I was being put on a Finnair flight. However Finnair don't have premium economy. When I queried this they told me there was nothing they could do and I would have to take it up with customer service when I got home. 

So I took the flight and then I contacted Japan Airlines when I got home. They have now told me there is nothing they can do. I have to contact Finnair. I am slightly confused by this as I booked and paid my flight through Japan Airlines. In my compliant I was also requesting a refund for the flight I booked. So why would an airline that I didn't pay give a me a refund?   I have gone back to Japan Airlines 3 times and been given the same response each time. They also haven't addressed some of the issues I raised in my letter. 

It is such a shame because I had such a good experience with my flights from Sydney to Paris. However after this, knowing the way they act when something goes wrong I will never fly with them again. They actually have a really good product but their responses to my complaint letters have been diabolical. Looking at some of the other reviews I have read on other websites this seems to be a fundamental issue for them. If you are thinking of flying with Japan Airlines think again - because if something goes wrong they don't want to know.

title:
Smiling and helpful
笑顔で対応
review_text:
I was in the cattle car, so it was cramped but that's not that big of a deal since the flight's only for an hour and I don't have problems with leg room since I'm short. The flight attendants were always ready to lend a helping hand with a smile. 

エコノミークラスだったので座席は狭かったのですが1時間程度のフライトでしたので大した問題はないと思います。客室乗務員の方は笑顔でお客さんに対応してます。短いフライトでもドリンクサービスありました。

title: Wonderful!
review_text: I’d read that the JAL travel experience had reviewed so well. And I was not disappointed! The care and consideration from the flight attendants was exquisite. I found the food and presentation impressive. Such pride was taken to introduce their chefs and a range of food options. Oh and the seats had so much arm and leg room. Such a treat to travel with JAL!

title: Not great if you're using them for domestic flights as foreigner
review_text:
Dsiclaimer:
If you plan to use them for international flights then disregard this review. This review only applies for domestic flight.

This airline is good for international flights but if you are using them for domestic flight as a foreigner you will be shut out of all their online service.
You cannot book any domestic flights online unless you pretend to live in Japan. And you can only manage your booking as long as you pretend to live in Japan. If you sign up for their JMB program you will not be able to see your domestic flights because you do not live in Japan and this is only available for people living in Japan. To get their app to display English text you need to know Japanese to find the option to switch to English. then of course you cannot log on to your JMB profile because again you have to be Japanese. So then you also cannot automatically find your flights and the get your ticket on the app. And you cannot sign up for JMB pretending to be Japanese so there you go. Shut out of their online services and you are stuck with having to save pdf's or printed out sheets to manage your bookings. 
Planes are average, the typical smallish domestic aircrafts. Staff is polite tho in the good Japanese fashion. But they seriously need to stop excluding tourists from their online services. Not every tourists wants to use train when going long distances that will take more than 6 hours with train.

title: WOW JAL !!
review_text:
I had the pleasure of flying JAL for the first time on vacation to the Philippines 4 flights. I have to say I was truly impressed with the crew on all 4 flights. The flight attends are the best. I fly a lot for business & I get to see the good the bad & the ugly, but the JAL attendants  are the best in the business. Nice is an understatement you could tell how much pride they took in doing a great job & always smiled even with 2 unruly passengers they kept cool & dealt with the issue. I was seriously impressed with the crews. I will update with my flights here are 2. JAL 745 & JAL 62 
I will fly JAL again & recommend JAL to my friends & family. 
Leg room good 
Food way above average actually really good. 
Check in was a breeze with the JAL App
Planes very clean !! 
Again to me its about the flight attendants & how great they were it makes the flight !!

title: Best economy overseas flight!
review_text: I've been spoiled with business class flights to Asia.  Wasn't fortunate enough to fly business on this flight.  We used AA miles for this flight.  The configuration of this plane has 2 seats on the sides rather than 3 so our family of 4 sat 2 and 2.  This way, no crawling over sleeping strangers to get to the bathroom.  There's more legroom than most economy seats.  We were quite comfortable.  The food was pretty good as well.

title: Long but very comfortable flight
review_text:
Japan Airlines has consistently been on the top airlines list and it's easy to see why.  Brand new planes, good amenities and impeccable service!  The bathrooms are kept so clean, which is hard to do on an overnight flight!  The food was beautifully prepare, in typical Japanese fashion, and very tasty.  
The only negative is the movie selection.

title: My mistake, but...
review_text: Bought a ticket by agency supersaver.ru. But did mistake, wrong sequence of name and surname. Unfortunatelly JAL didn't agree to change sequence, cause tickets boute by agency.

title: I am impressed
review_text: We flew jal from Melbourne airport to japan we were immediately impressed with the amount of leg room they have in economy. They have a wide variety of entertainment for adults and kids they even have mini games. But the food was lacking for kids, the staff were very friendly. Overall jal is a really good airline and we would fly them again.

title: JAL Business Class to Tokyo
review_text:
JAL Business Class wasn't that great. The crew were really good, the plane was really old, a bit dirty and carpet was ripping in some places. Food wasn't that great either. I tried the Japanese Menu coming back and it tasted weird. The Western Menu on the way over wasn't too bad but for business class I would have expected better food.

The movies were really old, no new releases and you couldn't turn the subtitles off on some of the movies. Compared to Vietnam airlines we flew in May it doesn't compare on any scale. I felt like I had stepped back in time on this flight to the 1980's.

title: flight to Japan
review_text:
I picked Japan Airlines purposely to experience Japan and its people before actually stepping on Japanese soil.
The best choice without question. The best service ever! If I had a choice I would not travel with anybody but this airliner. Nobody can touch them.

title: Fligth from Tokyo to Hawaii in Business Class
review_text: The flight from Narita was on one of the older planes a 767. Overall the business experience was okay, I was surprised I did not receive anything or was told that I could use the express security line. The Japanese lounge was the highlight, new modern with a great selection of food and drinks. The flight was good, the seat was comfortable and was practically flat. The crew in business were all mature and did their job, while not the best I have experienced and not the worse. Overall it was okay experience.

title: Good service and roomy seats
review_text:
Took the flight recently with my family to Japan.  The flight attendants very polite and offered good hospitality to all passengers,  always smiling and available. 

We were impressed with the range of entertainment and new movies on offer.  The in flight meal is high quality compared to other airlines and is similar to Japanese Bento Box with ice cream.  Tried the Japanese plum wines,  Japanese branded beers and kiwi juices. They offered in flight small souvenir to all young kids. 

We loved the roomy leg rooms,  not squashed like some other economic airlines. The aircraft has business/premium and economy sections.  

Overall in flight experience better than usual airlines we travelled with. Best of all,  it is direct flight from Sydney to Tokyo saving us times in travel.

title: A HUGE Disappointment!
review_text: For years I had been hearing that Japan Airlines was a very special experience.  In commercials and other media, JAL was always touted as having great service, luxurious appointments and all that kind of thing.  The actual experience, however, was far different, starting from the very first arrival at Narita airport.  Rather than having a nice special boarding area with such luxuries as a shower, good food, drinks, and other things, it was really no different than any plain old boarding area in any plain old “budget” class, filled (and I DO mean FILLED) with screaming infants, harried travelers and other unpleasant things.  Usually in any “prestige” waiting area you have nice food displays, larger and more comfortable seats, and things like that.  NONE of that was in evidence here.  Add to that the SHOCKING news that the wait for a shower would be THREE HOURS(!!!), and you have the equivalent of having to wait for your flight in the psycho ward.  On the flight, instead of luxury food and other service, you got something not much different than coach service and food, and the only thing I was glad of was that this was a flight at night and I could just go to sleep and forget all this!  Don’t ever look for me to fly JAL ever again, and I go to Japan usually at least twice a year.  Give me United any day!

title: NEVER again! Horrible with Families
review_text:
After spending two lovely weeks in Thailand where both the people were incredibly hands-on and delightful with my 2 year old, I flew home alone with my toddler on JAL from Bangkok to Tokyo; had a 48 hour layover and again from Tokyo to JFK.  

Outbound we flew Cathay Pacific and they were incredibly kind with us, doing anything to make the 24 hour travels easier on us.  BUT JAL only added stress on us.  JAL to Tokyo simply seemed nit-picky. My son had the window shade down and they “really” needed it up - on a plane of 60+ rows.  They also commented on his reusable stickers that leave zero residue - which I showed them, and then they needed them removed “for the landing.”  I’d understand if they had been real stickers, but it seemed to be a sticking point for them (pun intended).  They also kept serving more food before clearing any trash, so I couldn’t even take a meal for myself because they’d served the kids trays first and then all these snacks and drinks— but never clears anything before adult meals.  I was buried in trash.  

Finally, and this was the deal breaker for me - on the way from Tokyo to JFK I checked in online in advance and was about to drop my bag off at the luggage check when someone pointed me to “family assistance.”  In Hong Kong and Thailand all security and airlines pulled us aside to prioritize us, so I thought the same was to happen.  NOPE!  I had to drag my bag and stroller across the hallway where they insisted I was 5 lbs too heavy for our one bag.  When I explained that we’re permitted FOUR bags and I’ve only checked one, they told me to put the extra 5 lbs in my backpack. This may not seem bad, except when you’re a pretty t revamping alone with a toddler and already managing your child along with 2 carry-on’s and a stroller.  I can’t split into multiple bags.  So they told me to go all the way to the other end of international to the post office to buy a box and I had to old 5 lbs into the box.  They told me it was “ no problem.”  But what they failed to realize is that it IS a problem.  As a parent already juggling a lot, now I have to repack my bag at customs upon arrival.  I was furious and so appalled at the lack of service.  

Never again will I fly JAL!

title: Passenger was racially profiled.
review_text:
I was so excited to bring my partner "H" to Japan aboard this airline because of my great experiences with it in the past, and how this was going to be her first time.  The initial flight to Japan was very comfortable, and we were practically singing our praises about the in-flight food, entertainment and service.

The return flight, however, was another story.

We understood that security would most likely be tighter since it was just in the wake of an Iranian leader's death.  After passing security and customs smoothly, which included facial recognition technology comparing us to our passport pictures, we started boarding the plane.  At the gate, an attendant who was checking the tickets overlooked H and skipped over to the person behind her in line.

Once we boarded the plane, flight attendants were greeting the passengers as they headed to their seats.  One of them asked to see H's passport, inspected it closely and even dropped it on the floor.  She didn't do this to the passenger before H, and when I offered my own passport to her, she just sent me along without looking at it or touching it.

H felt singled out by this action as she was the only African-American passenger.  Having your passport inspected at security would be one thing, but that was done with no issues.  Once you're past that and boarding the plane, to be treated as suspicious because of your appearance only makes a person feel unwelcome.

We didn't complain about it to anyone at the time because we wanted to at least make sure we got home.  But now H doesn't want to travel with this airline again if it can be helped.

title: The most interesting airline food ever!
review_text: Although the selection of entertainment was not to my liking, the two meals were amazing. JAL has moved to a young chef designed menu scheme, and we had some really interesting and tasty choices. Apart from that, the seats seemed larger than most other airlines, and the service unobtrusive and effective.

title: American Airlines reward travel on JAL is now given center seats on tranpacific economy travel. A new low!
review_text: Japan Airlines has recently changed their handling of partner reward travel and gives travelers using economy miles center seats. This is a new low and the first time I have seen this for a flight booked months in advance. JAL has really gone downhill quickly since I last flew them a year ago.

title: Direct from Kona to Narita
review_text: Given the choice I will always take JAL, their service is excellent. It was also a direct flight from where I live to Japan.  Large selection of recent movies, free drinks and good food and leg room in economy.  We were served specialty ice cream and cookies on route to Japan.  On the return trip my son dropped his wallet changing in the lavatory and they found it and returned it to him.

title: Why no kiosks?
review_text: Why can't JAL install some kiosks rather than making most of the people on the airplane wait for hours on a ridiculously long line? The manager told me that they had three kiosks last year, but none of them were working. So instead, we have a Disney style line that goes on forever...

title: Worst counter service I've ever seen!
review_text:
The attached picture is of JAL's customers waiting in line for an hour and a half at MNL because JAL can't be bothered to install a kiosk to print out boarding passes and generate luggage tags. The picture actually shows only a small part of the line. Japan Airlines is horrible and should be avoided whenever possible. 

JAL's employees are also worthless and ill informed. JAL should fire all of them and start from scratch.

title: Melbourne to Tokyo - Economy class
review_text:
In September 2019 we flew Melbourne - Tokyo (Narita) - New York (JFK) and back in JAL economy.  The direct service from Melbourne to Tokyo is fairly new, as it started on 2 September 2017, and is very welcome.  The seats, food, aircraft and service are all superior to the Qantas alternative which we have also flown recently - Qantas is using very old 747s, whereas JAL is using 787 Dreamliners and the difference in comfort, lighting and particularly noise levels is very noticeable.  Qantas really needs to lift its game.  JAL claims that it had taken a seat out of each row and fitted wider seats, and they were noticeably wider.  Not by a huge amount, but it all adds to the comfort.  We were seated in the exit row so the leg room was good, but I'm 178cm tall and would've been happy with the standard seats as well.  The only negative is that the Melbourne flight goes to Narita rather than Haneda, so you spend about an hour longer getting to and from the airport and domestic connections are more time-consuming - we had to catch a bus from Narita to Haneda to catch our domestic connection.  The other negative is that JAL's inflight entertainment services isn't as good as some other airlines', but at least it's better than it used to be.  

Once we were back in Australia and putting our points into the JAL Mileage Bank I realised that it was also easier to earn rewards on JAL than Qantas - so we'll probably use the points for upgrades on our next flights with JAL.

title: Small airplane for this route
review_text: Flight was good, small airplane for this route so the business class wasn't really worth it, but flight attendants were excellent. However as business class and priority on luggage I had to wait 45 minutes for my luggage when most other people received theirs already.

title: Excellent flight from New York to Tokyo and Manila
review_text: Japan Airlines has the lowest fare from New York, USA to Manila, the Philippines. The one we took leaves around 11 in the morning and arrives in Tokyo, Japan around in the afternoon. There is a connecting flight to Manila around 6, but we stayed in Tokyo for 2 days and took a morning flight from Tokyo to Manila. The service was excellent, from check-in, boarding, in flight and disembarking. The flight  from Narita to Manila was also excellent. Another advantage of taking Japan Airlines was the flight from Tokyo to Kyoto. Domestic (in Japan) fares for international travelers was lower than the fare for a train.   The flight from Narita, Tokyo to Kyoto, and from Kyoto to Haneda, Tokyo, and from Narita to JFK, New York were also excellent.

title: Leaves sometime to be desired
review_text:
Compared with Qatar and Qantas seats are cramped, leave a lot to be desired. 
Entertainment for English speakers was terrible, really old movies, a lot of shoot-m-up ones and very few to choose from. Even an English speaking documentary was dubbed over with Japanese and only Japanese subtitles.
On such long flights it would have been nice to have PJs instead of cardigan.
Food and service was fine.

title: Beyond expectations
review_text: The best economy flight that I have ever taken to Asia...First of all is the seat itself. It was just like premium economy seats on other airlines.  Plenty of legroom even if you are six feet tall. The flight attendants were so friendly and helpful... I requested gluten-free meals and they were actually quite good.  I will only fly them from now on—they exceeded my expectations!

title: Good service
review_text: The food was very good. Cabin crew were very friendly and courteous. Lots of in-flight entertainment but a bit more expensive, compared to ANA.

title: Poor experience overall
review_text:
Flew two trips, four segments on JAL in business class, using miles from my American account.  70,000 miles one way in business class seemed like a great deal.  It turned out that you get what you pay for.  The transpacific flights (SAN-NRT, NRT-SAN) were in 787-800s.  JAL uses the Sky Suite which is an innovative design that allows them to get a 2-2-2 configuration, where many airlines are using a 1-2-1.  The seat is comfortable and converts to a spacious fully flat seat, nicely squared off.  The downside is that there is nowhere to store anything in fully flat mode.  The inter-Asia flights (HND-SGN and TPE-NRT) were in shell flat seat configuration which is angled-flat.  Not a great seat.  

Food was decent, though not spectacular.  On the long flights there's a service just after take-off and a second whenever you wish, up to two hours before landing.  JAL is promoting the top chefs who develop their menu, but an airplane galley is not a great place for execution.  The food quality was variable.

Service was generally very friendly and professional.  No faults here with one big execption.  At the international transfer desk in NRT, after checking in, I was told by the woman at the desk that there were two lounges that I could use.  One just upstairs, and one closer to my gate.  But that the upstairs lounge was very nice and the one by the gate was 'not so good'.  I was just going to sit and read and have a drink so I walked the 15 mins to the lounge closer to the gate.  Turns out that 'not so good' means closed for renovation, and had been so for some time.  And at this point I was too far out to make it back to the other lounge.  IMO, this is an inexcusable mistake on JALs part.

title: Best economy service
review_text:
I’ve flown many airlines and this trip I flew 4 legs from Shanghai to Hawaii with JAL and I mist say they have the absolute best economy service ever. That goes for ground staff to check-in staff to on board flight attendants. They were all so friendly (especially toward my son) and helpful and professional. The seats were comfortable, the entertainment system was top notch, my son got his child meals so quickly and they were excellent quality. Actually, except for the leg leaving Hawaii, all the food was the best I have had on an airline in economy class. 

Bravo JAL.

title: Smooth Travel
review_text: Japan Airlines is an airline that will surely provide you the comfort, service and care while crossing continents.

title: Premium Economy from Sydney to Helsinki
review_text: JAL uses 787 jet for the route from Sydney yo Helsinki via Tokyo.  The only downside for these flights are the extended transit time; we have to spend an overnight at Tokyo (or Narita airport hotel) on our way from Sydney and 7 hours on our way from Helsinki.  The seat is spacious compared to most airlines and on our way back to Sydney, we have been upgraded to Business class Sky Suite (lie flat is possible) from Helsinki to Tokyo.

title: Superb & Friendly Service
review_text:
I would like to specially thank Ms Stephanie Wong, stewardess on my 8/23/19 Japan Airlines Flight JL7016, Code Share with American Airlines Flight AA-170.  I can feel her earnest attentive service attitude towards all passengers.  She would occasionally checked on passengers if we need anything to make our 10 hours 30 minutes Trans-Pacific Flight more comfortable.  She is very polite and well-mannered.  Hooray to
Ms Stephanie Wong, a 5-Star Service!  Thank you!

title: Tourdec2019
review_text:
Excelent flights with JAL disappointed  with return BA ,with JAL food and service was excellent and inflight films 
BA disorganised and minimalistic ...tried hard but lacked basics.

title: Excellent service and hospitality with on time fight
review_text: Always satisfied JAL's services and hospitality.  All cabin crues watch everybody with their warm eyes.  If you wnat to request something, one of cabin crues walk up to you without your voice.  It is amaging.  This is Omotenashi, Japanese style hospitality.  Also, flight is always on time.  You never forget.

title: One of the best airlines WW
review_text: Although it was a twelve hour flight in economy it was such a pleasant flight! The onboard service was top notch and all the flight attendants made the experience worth to positively remember. The plane, an almost brand new Dreamliner, was silent, comfy and really pleasant. I’ve flown dozens of airlines and JAL is one ot the best in long haul along with Finnair, BA, Lufthansa, Air France, TAP, Delta, Emirates and Turkish. A+

title: Excellent flight
review_text: Like everything in Japan the plane was exceptionally clean and the staff incredibly gracious. I booked with American Airlines and could not be happier that I was put on JAL.

title: Wonderful Service
review_text: I recently travelled to Japan with Japan Airlines> It was the first time I have travelled with them and it won't be the last. The plane was new and very clean and the service was even better. Both flights crews were pleasant and very polite. I highly recommend them.

title: Excellent economy long haul
review_text: A brilliant experience for long haul. We were in economy. Good food (2 meals, snacks and complementary drinks), blanket, pillow, great choice of movies, audio, news, games. Staff couldn’t do enough. So friendly. Would recommend

title: Lied to & Ripped off
review_text: Would never fly this airline again missed my inward leg but told by JAL staff wouldn’t be a problem on return leg but upon trying to check in told ticket had been cancelled as standard JAL policy, then told only one seat left and is Business Class I paid for that then was handed an economy seat and asked if I wanted a window aisle seat when i questioned this they lied again saying they’d not said it was business class was 4 X the original return ticket one way and then when I get on board there are 22 empty seats in economy class- would never recommend or use this Airline again

title: Disappointing
review_text: Given what I had heard I was expecting a much better experience. Having been on any long haul flights I'd say this was no better than average. Food in PE was not as good as I'd hoped and service was only OK. We paid quite a bit exrta for what proved to be just a bit more room.

title: Spacious seat
review_text: The seats were spacious and I cNnot believe how efficient the airport staff are when the plane was being docked.

title: Positive experience
review_text:
I have not taken JAL for many years and found my experience very positive this time.

The check in was very fast and easy.

My plane was a Boeing 787 and the interior was clean and pleasant.  The seat was comfortable with a reasonable amount of leg room.

The service was very straight forward and efficient, which was typical of Japan.

It was a stress free and relaxing flight overall.

title: Delhi to Japan
review_text: Xxxxxxxxxxxx visit for all world and take a more enjoy Next trip Japan Xxxx/xxxxxxxxxxxcvvvxxbbbbb Nnjjh NJ JK. Hubby. Bubble. Njbbbjjb. Job.  Jhb

title: not so five star
review_text:
If possible, avoid the Sky Suite III configuration. I much prefer Sky Suite II: there’s more room and privacy. Configuration III is like a coffin! 

The tv equipment is bulky and there’s no room to wiggle. Cathay has a similar seat, but they were astute enough to carve out some space below the side console. 

As others have said, JL really lacks in the IFE department. I tend to watch on my own tablet. I wanted to watch a Korean film called Parasite, but it was only available in Japanese subtitles (wth)? 

JAL really shines when it comes to the Japanese meal option. However, they should offer one more western option; not everyone likes to eat red meat. Moreover, after having flown JL a few times, I long for something besides simmered burdock or braised fish. 

The FAs are pleasant, polite and check up on pax frequently. 

I try to seek JAL when flying to Japan and beyond because I’m an Alaska Mileage Plan member. 

However, I’m leaning more towards ANA these days; they’re consistent with their business class seat offerings. Meanwhile, JL has three international versions (why????). 

The Sakura Lounge in NRT is solid, but I actually prefer the Admirals Club (sadly, they’re closing in Mar 2020).

title: Spacious cabin
review_text: The plane was not cramped. One can freely move around without bumping into something or someone. I dread airplane bathrooms but JAL’s are different, they are clean, odor less and the one I got in had a full length mirror! I have been flying all my life with different airlines but JAL is the one for me from now on.

title: Jolly Awesome Leisure
review_text: I anticipated this year’s holiday to be special but had no idea to hear extent. My SO and I were planning our annual international vacation and, as luck would have it, came across relatively cheap flights to Japan in December. Here’s the catch: It included a brief layover in Dallas (Seattle on the return flight), but certainly more tolerable than that in Hong Kong. (Virtually any layover is preferable to that of twenty-three hours at the HK Airport...)The flight into Narita was fairly smooth, as the airline staff provided utmost courtesy and comfort. I will say with utmost  Bconfidence that the economy seats at JAL single-handedly top United, my other favorite mid-priced international airline. American Airlines (sorry to say) do not come close, either in the staff’s attitudes nor in the food and entertainment selections. JAL provides a succinct snapshot of the culture, itself: unadulterated cleanliness, customer care, and courtesy that is genuine, rather than one projected by fake smiles. As par for the course of a flight into Japan, we experienced somewhat frequent turbulence (an aerial version of an earthquake, as if were), it seemed to occur almost on cue, while the staff served and poured beverages. Naturally, my red wine added a splash of color to the tray table. The program selection was excellent, as I was able to dive headlong into Japanese cinema and get in the zone for my trip. Every venture into the country feels new and fresh, regardless of the frequency, with which I visit. This was my third time abs certainly will be one of many more to come, especially if it is via JAL.

title: Excellent service and good lay down beds
review_text:
The service always great on Asian airlines.the business class seats were lay downs but narrow. Gave out blanket but no duvet.
Meals were so- so, nothing outstanding. Movie selections were good.
Would fly again with them.

title: Don’t Expect To Be Pampered
review_text:
I flew LAX -Osaka on JAL, and returned Tokyo(Narita )-LAX on American. I never thought that I’d say this, but American Airlines was more comfortable!

Aside from very good dinner on JAL, business class was only marginally better than comfort class on other airlines. The seats were VERY cramped, with a lot of space taken by a very bulky console between the two seats. When in the flat position for sleeping, the whole seat was raised, making it an even more cramped situation. It was brutally hot during the flight, and when I asked about it, the attendant said that there was nothing that could be done. I understand from friends who were in coach that after multiple requests to lower the temperature, their cabin became more comfortable. Amenity kits were nothing special, the wine was house-wine quality, and other than the dinner, the food was average, and the entertainment choices were very limited, especially for a flight of that length. 

On the return flight, on American, the seats were definitely more spacious and comfortable. The service was acceptable, and the cabin personnel were attentive. I have friends who have asked my opinion about which airline to use, and contrary to my general policy of avoiding AA, I found that on this this routing, American was superior to JAL.

title: Serene and Welcoming Airline Makes One Feel Very Comfortable
review_text: We really enjoyed flying with JAL as the title of our review suggests.  The JAL staff are well organized, respectful, and welcoming.  The service is very good too.  We really like their flying schedule and chose to fly to Delhi via Tokyo on JAL after comparing it with airlines that fly across the Atlantic.  There were a couple of areas that could do with improvement: The specially prepared "Chef" meals can be a hit or a miss, and on the flight from Tokyo to San Diego the food was very unappetizing.  We also did not understand why on the daytime flight from San Diego to Tokyo, they darkened the cabin for 6 daylight hours, when one's internal clock should be on daylight time!  This did not make any sense, unless JAL was trying somehow to reduce activity and service to save money.  It felt a bit manipulative.  Otherwise the flights were very comfortable, restrooms were always clean, and the pilots were excellent landing gently on different runways.

title: Narita First Class Lounge under renovation and superb service on long-haul flight
review_text:
I had about an hour between connecting flights and made use of the JAL First Class Lounge at Narita near gate 60.  The lounge is under renovation.  The upstairs renovation is completed so the dining area upstairs is in great condition and well equipped.  As for the main floor, more than half the lounge area is now closed for renovation so there is only a seating area on the main floor with all dining moved upstairs.  The upstairs dining area now serves food to order instead of a buffet.  There is a sushi station offering a set of three different pieces of sushi, which selection changes every week.  There is also a noodle station offering a choice of two different soup noodles, which you order and then are given a device which will signal when your order is ready.  Finally there are two stations offering Western and Japanese style dishes made to order such as pasta or, on this visit, chicken in mushroom cream sauce.  On a side island station, there are serveral breads and pastries and soups for self service.  All the food I tried was very good and presented on beautiful plates too. 

The flight boarded on time at 6:15 pm for the 6:40 pm flight.  The flight is operated with a B767-300 with 6 rows of 4 seats each in business class configured 1X2X1.  I had seat 2A, a window seat that is nicely positioned next to the window with a cabinet next to it between the seat and the aisle for greater privacy (row 1 and the other odd numbered rows have the opposite arrangement with the seat next to the aisle and the cabinet next to the window).  Business class was not full on the flight with about 6 empty seats.  The seat is the Sky Suite II fully horizontal flatbed seat.  When reclined to the bed position, the bed lies very low to the ground.  Sleep was fairlly comfortable on the seat in bed position but the bed is quite narrow if sleeping on one's back rather than side.  

There were two meal services - dinner shortly after takeoff and then breakfast about 2 hours before landing.  For dinner, there was a choice of a Japanese meal or two different Western meals.  The Japanese set starts with a bento box of many different items followed by a main of marinated chicken and yellowtail teriyaki with rice, ending with a dessert of sesame pudding.  The Western meals both start with several hors-d'oeuvres and then a main of either roasted Japanese beef sirloin or olive flounder with clams, ending with a dessert of a cream puff stuffed with bitter chocolate cream and yuzu confit.  For breakfast, the choice was between the Japanese set with simmered pork or the Western set with an omelette with bolognese sauce.  I had the Japanese choice with both meals, but opted for the chocolate cream puff dessert from the Western menu instead for dinner.  All the food was beautifully presented and delicious.  

I also made a point of having coffee at both meals since JAL serves special monthly chosen coffee in business class on its flights.  In fact, the menu has a description of the monthly coffee, in the same way as the available wines and sakes are introduced. 

Between take off and preparation for landing, and the two meal service, almost half of the 8 hr 22 min flight time was used up so I only managed about 4 hours of sleep on the flight.     

Service in business class on the flight was wonderful as usual.  The cabin staff were very efficient and gracious in meal service and clean up, were constantly going through the cabin to see if passengers needed anything else, and constantly cleaned the toilets so they were always in good condition.  
 
Our flight landed on time and first bags were delivered to the luggage carousel promptly within about 20 minutes after landing. 

Another wondeful flight on JAL superb gracious service and great food.

title: Worst customer service, always late..
review_text: I wish I could give them less than a one.  They messed up my reservation and didn't care, didn't try to fix it, put 0 effort in.  Every flight I flew left late and arrived late.  I could go on...but why?

title: Great service in economy!
review_text: This was a great flight & the service was amazing! Get to check in early and request a goo seat. Take some movies with you.

title: Ricky was great!
review_text: This was a great flight. Cabin service was excellent. The entertainment selection could be more varied.

title: Blah experience
review_text: Having flown several Asian airlines I had high expectations for JAL flight from Tokyo to San Francisco.  Additionally, having just spent time in Japan and knowing what service levels are there I was looking forward to the business class service.  I was doomed for disappointment.   Service was relatively slow compared to other airlines and our specially requested vegetarian meal was bleh- truly unappetizing, a complete opposite to the service and food in Asian Air in which we flew across to Asia.

title: Japanese service and hospitality in the air
review_text:
One of the few good OneWorld airlines (with Qatar Airways).  Flew economy on very modern planes (787 out, 777 back) with well-appointed cabins (compares well with Emirates - much better than BA or LH).
Service was friendly, food was pleasant (makes a change) and imaginative.  Service was friendly. 
The best choice for a direct flight LHR-HND

title: Cherry Blossoms in the Sky
review_text:
Japan Airlines has very clean aircraft and the cabin crew are always impeccably neat.
The food is OK and substantial. Then again this is on the meal provider. 
The politeness of the Japanese is legendary and cannot be more displayed. The crew 
bows before the waiting passengers before they board. It is always almost on schedule.
When everyone is asleep, snacks are available in the galley. Their home ( Narita) has the cleanest rest rooms.

title: Amazing!
review_text:
Had a pretty long flight, arround 11 hours. Even though I didn't pay for any premium service or had extras the attention was excellent. I'm a really tall person and usually struggle a little with the economic airlines because my legs don't fit. But in JAL it was all the opposite. Sits are comfortable, space for the legs is okay, space in the restroom was perfect for even stretching myself. THE FOOD IS INCREDIBLE. Had lovely meals, tea and snacks. They give you pillow, blanket, slippers, headphones, three meals and hot towels to clean yourself. 
The enternetainment was okay, recent cool movies and series.

title: First trip on JAL, wont be last!!
review_text:
This was my first trip flying on JAL and after hearing a few positive things I decided to book their long haul flight from London to Tokyo direct. I was travelling to Japan for the Rugby World Cup, and the quarter final was the day I was due to arrive, so I was anxious having not used JAL previously of possible delays. I should not have been worried as not only did the flight leave early, but it also got in early!! 

The flight was just under 12 hours, which played havoc on my knees and back. However the attendants were always on hand with an extra cushion, drink or additional food (of which I took advantage of each time!). 

I am 6" and there was good leg space in economy, and my only issue was on the return flight when the individual in front of me reclinded their seat for the best part of four hours....no fault of JAL of course. 

Overall it was a good flight with efficent timing and atentive staff. Would recommend and use again for any future Japan visits.

title: Great service
review_text: Easy check in online and then extremely quick baggage drop off. Comfortable seat with good leg room. Onboard service was great, flight attendants were excellent. Ordered boarding instead of the usual rush and you actually had free space in the overhead locker.

title: Excellent service!
review_text:
Our first time to fly JAL and we absolutely loved it!   The flight was on time and boarding was orderly. The cabin crew are so gracious and attentive.  Food is good!  They even serve wine in economy! I was not able to view the in-flight entertainment because the flight was short but my husband enjoyed watching some movies.
Already planning our next flight using JAL!

title: First trip on JAL
review_text:
Very comfortable seats/beds with mattress if required - nice  touch.
Service was attentive and friendly and food and refreshments were of a high quality.
Entertainment could have been better though - I felt there was a limited choice of films compared to other airlines.
Flights were on time/early and all in all a very pleasant experience

title: Very good service!
review_text: I was looking to book through Japan air because of the very good service they have on board. Flying attendants are always smile, check on passengers all the time, food is great, many movies to watch. I would definitely recommend to fly by Japan air!

title: comfortable
review_text:
Comfortable seats, awesome wine list, food portion enough but have room for improvement.
Wide selection of movies which is a big advantage.
Very polite server.

title: Pleasant airline
review_text: Pleasant flights to and from Kuala Lumpur on this airline. One of the few airlines that actually have a bit of extra leg room. Service is good and no complaints with meals or service. Try Not To fly to Australia Via Singapore on JAL as they code share with Qantas out of Singapore and their flights are not as good and neither is the planes used.

title: Bad Food, Bad Service
review_text:
We have used this flight from Narita to Honolulu.

1st thing we were welcomed with was even though we have used coach class, we have reserved to use Sakura lounge prior to flight through one of our credit card service provider as a benefit of its card.   We were welcomed with hard rejection of the lounge usage and lounge receptionists weren't helping much, kept telling us we were not registered.   We were sure that we were registered to use the lounge but it was not on their record.

2nd thing on the returning flight, when they deliver meals to us, we were sitting at the end row and one of the 2 choices meal they had run out.   That could happen because again it is an economy class but the food provided as a result was enormously bad taste.   I have been using multiple airlines in my life, maybe 20 or so, but it was the worst of all, I had to spit out and didn't even touch the rest.   It was the same for rest of the people in my group, we were group of 4.

The other meal provided on the same flight was also extremely terrible.   Not sure how to describe but they should be serving purchased $10 bento or sandwich box at the airport instead of such terrible meals.   It was way over the limit even it is for economy class.

It was cheaply priced flight  for sure but they should at least give us some dignity.

title: Great first flight
review_text:
First time on This airline.
New 787 with good seat configuration 3-3-3 meaning more room than my previous flight on a BA 787 which had 3-4-3
Great food
Great entertainment and movies
Excellent service
Very comfortable 
Would definitely fly with them again

title: Great experience
review_text: Nice variety of entertainment. Up to date movie list. Great food and drink. Great service. Comfortable seat.

title: Asian airlines
review_text: It was difficult to get seat assignments early on Japan Airlines so we had to take what we got, which wasn’t a problem after all. The economy section on JAL is very good. It’s roomier than others and has that wonderful Japanese service

title: Excellent experience, thoroughly recommend
review_text: The whole experience was excellent. I hated the idea of a 12 hour flight but it was made so easy with attentive staff, great seats (wide, deep and comfortable). Lots of leg room and plenty of storage space. There was a sense of calm and quiet not normally experienced on most airlines. I would definitely use them again.

title: Incredibly the Best Economy Class by far,.....
review_text:
There is no doubt that the hospitality of the airline staff on Japan Airlines 3083 was the best ever in over 60 years of air travel
The plane was exceptionally clean. The seats were the best ever, large, spacious.
It was a Boeing 737 -800 series

Flight very smooth, bit the key talking point was the close-by pass of Mount Fuji

Everyone got up, took photos exchanged pleasantries …..very social, and many shared learning.

Excellent value …….beats all airlines that I have ever flown on, hands down - in economy class...………..

title: ALMOST EXCELLENT
review_text:
We flew round trip in premium economy in October (to) and November (from).  

STELLAR SERVICE:  The cabin crew is unfailingly polite, helpful and attentive. If only all airlines could offer this level of service. The onboarding process in both directions was breathtakingly organized and efficient. The best two onboarding experiences in all our years of travel.  It really makes you wonder why it can't always be that way.  (Don't make something simple something hard!)

COMFORT: The premium economy seats are comfortable and certainly worth the price. The restrooms are cleaned and restocked so frequently that they are always fresh and pleasant to use.  

NUTS AND BOLTS: The power outlets in either of our seats did not work in either direction and that was a downer, particularly on such a long flight.  Underseat storage in front of you is limited but better than some others.  The headphones weren't great and outlets didn't accept our headphones.  The movie selection was poor and resolution not great.  On the flight between JFK and Haneda, the plane was so hot it kept us awake.  The flight back was very pleasant.

FOOD:  we have read here that many people liked the food on their flights.  We found it awful. Really awful.  Both flights. The best and saving grace was the ramen noodle cups made available on our return flight.

Despite the negatives, we view JAL very favorably.  They treat people very well and the kindness and consideration shown by their personnel (ncluding check in) is exemplary. Premium Economy is comfortable and good value.

We will likely fly JAL preferentially whenever possible.

title: Great Airlines
review_text:
Great Services, Good Food, Excellent Crews, Reasonable Price.
Ground Service is also amazing. Staffs are full of service mind.

title: Good Japanese food
review_text: The cabin crew were very pleasant and helpful; the food, if you enjoy Japanese fare, for economy class this was five star. The seats were very cramped. Check-in was easy too. This is certainly one of the world's better airlines but our first choice, ANA, is better but their schedule/destinations did not suit.

title: Loved My JAL Flight to Japan, Even in Economy
review_text:
My first flight to Japan was on JAL.  I made sure the aircraft was a 787, for the many hidden comfort features built into that particular model aircraft.  I was well pleased with the result.  JAL configured seating on the Boeing 787-8 aircraft in Economy (International) with their "E12" configuration, resulting in 8 seats across, better than many competitors, who use 9 seats across.  Cabin comfort in the 787 due to better air, better humidity and lower noise, was excellent.  The crew was helpful, efficient, unobtrusive and friendly.  The flight path chosen by the Captain avoided turbulence while reaching our destination on time. If you like to avoid surprises, JAL is a solid choice.  The mother with infant who was seated in our bulkead row center section was given a wall-mount bassinet, allowing the infant to sleep comfortably and quietly, directly in front of Oka-san. The cost was very affordable, though I did not compare airlines to search for cheaper fares. Video/audio entertainment was good.  Meals were amazing, with stainless flatware--in Eonomy.  Seriously.  So, I'm not even going to look at any other airlines for my next trip to Japan or other East Asia destinations.  Then, there is this:  
Note:  Japan Airlines (JAL), was awarded by customers for featuring the World's Best Economy Class and the Best Economy Class Airline Seat at the at the Skytrax* 2019 World Airline Awards held at the Paris Air Show.

title: Long Haul Trip - not so bad
review_text: Braced myself for the usual loooong haul flight from Manila to USA (via Haneda) to my surprise, it didn't seem that long because of the comfort the whole flight offered.  I was pleasantly surprised to realize the seats were not as cramped as I recall, the crew was excellent and flights left and arrived on time.

title: Love JAL!
review_text: The service from JAL staff both on the ground and in the air is excellent! We've flown JAL several times to and from Japan and prefer to fly this airline than any other. Their customer service via phone resolved an issue I had quickly, and efficiently.

title: JAL,
review_text:
การบริการ ระหว่างเดินทาง ดีมาก พนักงานให้บริการบนเครื่องบินที่เป็นทั้งชาวไทย และชาวญี่ปุ่น มีความใส่ใจกับผู้โดยสารมาก ห้องน้ำสะอาด ที่นั่งสบาย อาหารรสชาติดี ถึงที่หมายตรงเวลา

Very good service, all cabin crew flight attendants are trained with very good service mind. Cleanness Airline, comfortable seat, and food is very tasty meal.

JAL is Recommended Airline.

title: Great flight from a LAX to Osaka on aJAL
review_text: Found a great deal on cheapoair r/t lax to Bkk business class. Don’t splurge often but glad I did this time. I was greeted personally by the crew supervisor by name before takeoff and again before landing to make sure everything was good. The food, service, seat, and entertainment were excellent. You must try the Japanese menu at least once. Amazing!  Cannot wait for the return flight!

title: So impressed by this airline
review_text: So polite and well mannered. Nothing was a problem, efficient and very friendly. For an economy flight I really enjoyed it.

title: Nice and comfy flight with JAL
review_text: I took JAL (economy class) for my flight (return) Jakarta-Tokyo and Osaka-Tokyo-Jakarta on November 2019. It's a nice filght experience, starts from the airport ground to the airplane cabin. The whole service was great; easy check-in and baggage procedures, on-time boarding and departing (even the pilot & crew appologize for 5-mins delay due to take-off queue), spacy legroom, great in-flight entertainment, delicious in-flight meals and free flow drinks :). The cabin crew also very polite and helpful. It's really worthed flight.

title: Smooth and pleasant flight
review_text: Overall, the flight was pleasant and smooth, nothing in particular to specifically highlight. The crew were professional and courteous all along and have pleasant smiles. The in flight entertainment was enjoyable, though there wasn't a great selection to choose from. The food being served were nice.

title: Fantastic Service, very comfortable large seat, super clean aircraft
review_text:
I recently flew a 2-leg trip from Saigon-Haneda-JFK. Iverall, it was a great travel experience. The gate staff were professional and courteous, we boarded Saigon on time (Haneda a 10 minute delay) but arrived both times, a little ahead of schedule. 

My seats on both the 787-800 and 777-300ER were comfortable, large (compared to US and other Asian carriers I’ve flown), with good legroom and mobility, AND EVERYTHING WAS CLEAN!!!! This has always been my experience on Japan Airlines!!

I had a lot of in flight movies, TV, and music programs to choose from; Western and international, with or without subtitles (my choice).

The food and cabin service was good, and the flight attendants courteous and professional. Good eye contact and respectful, giving me their full attention when they were addressing me (Thank you Ms Bando!!) I had confidence that they would be able to handle any situation.

The entire cabin was nicely appointed and the lavatories were always clean (the flight attendants see to that; excellent job (not everyone’s favorite!!!). My seat, the carpeting, and the tray tables were well maintained and clean too. Not always the case on most other airlines I’ve flown!!

At 21 hours flying time, it’s definitely a long haul, but my experience onboard made it one of the best economy experiences I’ve had. 

This was also a GREAT VALUE!! I paid $938USD, round trip, which is a highly competitive fare. Combined with the service, aircraft, and baggage allowance, it was a great value!! 

Domo Arigato Japan Airlines!!!!

title: Love to fly again with JAL
review_text:
I used this airline on January 2019, fly for about 7 hours from Jakarta, with 1 stop at Narita and continue to Sapporo.

The staffs start from check in counter and cabin crews were so kind, friendly and helpful.

The flight itself was very clean and I have smooth fly experience with them.

The food was good and we have free flow water/juice everytime we need with snacks in between. You won't feel hungry if you fly with them.  Oh ya, I love the ice cream!

The option of videos are vary. You can choose music, movie, news etc without feel bored.

So I enjoy my first fly with Japan Airlines.

Good job! Keep the good service!

title: Great Crew, cramped economy class
review_text: Standard flight to San Diego.  Only because I was coming home did it feel good.  It was NONSTOP and the only way I want to fly.  Connections are too dangerous these days.  JAL on whole was a good flight.  Crew attentive and fairly comfortable 787 for economy.

title: Finally! Leg room in economy!
review_text:
I read reviews before booking. Most commented that there was leg room in economy and it’s true. The price was right and so grateful I could fly into Logan Airport, Boston. 

Some reviews said the food was terrible but that was not my experience.  

It was a breeze to check in online and get boarding passes. I generally cannot get boarding passes printed in advance on other international airlines.

title: Great Leg Room
review_text: Japan airline may be a little more expensive but the extra legroom and service is well worth it. This was especially good for me as I had an overnight return flight and was refreshed ready for work when I landed back in Sydney.

title: Spoiled for other airlines
review_text:
I have flown a number of other airlines, including another trip to Japan approximately 16 months prior with ANA.  ANA was okay and I had no complaints but JAL went above and beyond.  
The cabin crew were attentive and friendly, the seats were comfortable, the food was delicious and the flight seemed to go quickly with us arriving relatively relaxed and refreshed.
I couldn’t recommend JAL more and only wish they flew from Sydney to more destinations.

title: Returning from SE Asia
review_text: Excellent service and pod lie down seats.  Food was very good and flight attendants helpful.  Flight time of 9.5 hours was fine with these seats and entertainment options

title: Perfect way to fly
review_text: I couldn’t have asked for a better airline. Everything, from the lounges, service, food and seating was first class. I have been doing this trip every year for the past 9 years and have never had a lost suitcase and have never had any delays. Treat yourself. This is a great airline.

title: Exceptional Servive
review_text: JAL continues to be one of the better international carriers that I’ve flown! Would highly recommended.

title: Leg room!
review_text: Second time to fly with JAL - both experiences the same. Friendly from the moment you leave the ground until you touch it again - no sour faces like other airlines tend to have! So much leg room down the back. The food is outstanding, the drink choices amazing and the toilets always clean and seem more spacious than other airlines. Give them a go, you won’t need to think twice. The only thing that could be improved is the entertainment particularly the music selection and TV series! 5 stars from us!

title: Phil trip
review_text: Food is good they feed you well.staff is very nice no attitudes seats are comfortable and movies on seats chargers for phone..plenty drinks even two bloody maries...i love japan airlines and ibhave flown a lot.

title: Service
review_text:
Excellent food , presentation and taste 
Staff are courteous and professional 
I would not hesitate to fly with them again 
Worth all your Benjamim’s

title: Best airline we have used so far!
review_text: I am a very nervous flyer so I was not looking forward to the 11hour flight to Japan. We travelled Premium Ecomony because of the fact that I am nervous so wanted to be as comfortable as possible, and it was definately worth paying extra as the seats were very roomy and comfortable with plenty of leg room. I spoke with a member of the crew and explained that I was nervous so he asked my name and checked on me regulary throughout the flight to make sure I was ok. The bathrooms were kept very clean, but now having been to Japan and seen how clean the country is, its understandable why the planes are so clean. I forgot to mention the boarding process at Frankfurt and how amazing quick it was. Premium Economy boarded and the we were ready to go but we did not even realise that Economy had even boarded, so we guessed they boarded both at the same time but at different entrances. The only downside was the food. None of it was good which was disappointing but then again plane food is never good! Overall, the flight was good and the staff were great and I would recommend Japan Airlines with no hesitation. I just hope I get to fly with them again (we loved Japan too so it is likely we will go back!).

title: Japan Airlines is just ok
review_text: Japan Airlines is highly rated, but sitting in Economy you don’t feel like they’re going out of their way for you. You are at the bottom of four class levels and you really feel it. Food service is hurried and limited- not a lot of selections for drinks. Movie selections were limited. That said, you are no doubt getting bigger seats than on any American airline and they do have direct flights from NYC. I would take them again for those reasons, but not gladly. Our flight to Tokyo was probably made worse by a child who cried loudly practically the entire way there. The plane was pretty much full, so no possibility to move further away from the crying.  Fourteen and a half hours on a plane is probably too much for a 1 1/2 year old child. Parents probably need to look into some sort of sleep aid for a child of that age. Otherwise, they are being very inconsiderate of other passengers.

title: JAL provided excellent service.  Friendly and comfortable.
review_text: Surprised by a flight all Business or First.  I was so glad that I could stretch out.  Sleep not possible, however.

title: Quite the experience!
review_text:
We raided the piggy bank for business class owing to the length of the flight.  I had prior experience with JAL a number of years ago and it has gotten even better.  Comfortable "pods" with legroom to stretch out and sleep (I'm 6'2") and the mattresses they provide were extremely comfortable.  Flight attendants were courteous, attentive, competent and seriously attractive in stylish uniforms.  Food, both Japanese and western was excellent!  Our return flight was from Haneda Airport and we availed ourselves of their business class lounge while waiting to board. Best I've ever seen!  ありがとうございました
Arigatōgozaimashita!

title: Superb service
review_text:
I flew to Tokyo by JAL in November for two weeks visit in Japan. 
The service on sky is excellent and cabin crew were always plite with gentle smile . Food was lovely and snacks were always given away between as well. 
The entertainment didn't bore me out.
In the toilet cubicles, there were  handwritten  messages from the crews on the day , it was heartwarming . 
It is a long flight but JAL will give you a comfortable journey for sure

title: JAL Non-Stop To Japan
review_text:
Enjoyed my 3 week trip :Non-stop Direct flight aboard Boeing 777 on JAL-3 from JFK NY to Narita Japan and return on JAL-4. This composite plane allows more pleasant humidity level thus avoiding that typical dry scratchy feeling and a little more leg room.
The stewardesses are polite, pleasant, efficient and work hard to keep everyone happy.
My return trip was a bonus: had 3 seats to myself to stretch out and sleep sideways.
On this trip I got a prepaid Sim Card at Narita arrival for my Unlocked iPhone good for 1 month, Unlimited Data 4G for US $60. It worked out great, got all my E-mails, text, Google, GPS, without worrying about data use or if Wi-Fi available. For phone conversation use in Japan or to call my friends and family in USA for free, used apps: WhatsApp and Line. WhatsApp worked flawlessly for text, photos, videos, video calls, and phone calls.

title: On time!
review_text: Flight is on time! Flight stewardess are friendly and accomodating, as always it must be the Japanese culture

title: Comfortable Economy Seats
review_text: For long haul flights, I will choose japan airlines whenever I can. Their economy seat is better than most airlines I’ve taken and the meals served are quite decent. Some flights can be quite packed because of the 3-4-3 configuration but besides that I’ve mostly had good experiences with JAL.

title: Flight to Japan
review_text: Excellent airline. Even though economy, the seats were spacious enough. The food was delicious, the hostesses attentive. Movie and audio were better than the average airline.

title: Friendly staff, good food, LEGROOM!
review_text: I'm only 5'2" tall and even *I* feel the pinch of not enough legroom.  But there was PLENTY on this flight.  The staff were more than friendly and attentive.  The food was very good (for airline food) too.  This is a WIN.

title: Hospitality at its best!
review_text: Impressed with the hospitality and the way they take care of small details. The quality of food and taste was so good and they were happy to customized as per my needs. I m sure would love to travel again with them.

title: Best Flight
review_text: Amazing flight with JAL. They are so efficient, friendly and great. I highly recommend this flight and airline.

title: Haneda Sakura Skyview Lounge and Overnight Flight Haneda to Bangkok
review_text:
I took JAL’s overnight flight from Tokyo Haneda to Bangkok in Business Class.  Prior to departure, I visited the lounge.  As JAL’s First Class lounge in Haneda is closed for renovation, First Class passengers and JAL and OneWorld Elite members (ie. Emerald) are directed to the Sakura Skyview Lounge instead on the 5th floor near gate 114.  The lounge was very spacious with lots of seating in the buffet dining area and elsewhere.  The buffet had a good selection of food including JAL’s trademark beef curry, but does not have any made to order stations as found in JAL’s First Class lounge in Narita (and before in Haneda).  The lounge was not very busy when I got there around 10:15 pm for my 12:05 am flight.  It picked up a bit closer to 11 pm but there were still plenty of seats for everyone to stretch out a bit with empty seats buffers for all. 

I made my way to my gate 112 a bit early and lined up in Group 1 for OneWorld Emeralds and JAL top tier members.
