JAL sorts passengers into 5 groups and has separate lines for each group, very orderly.  Uncharacteristically, the flight was late in boarding by about 5 to 10 minutes.  As a result, pushback was also late at about 12:15 am for the 12:05 am scheduled flight.  Take off was about 12:33 am with the video monitor showing a flight time of 6 hours 20 minutes.  

The flight was operated with a B777-200 equipped with the Sky Suite III horizontal fully flatbed seat laid out 1X2X1 in Business Class.  I had the first window seat 1A, which was nice as it was on the side with an additional toilet at the front and the front galley was located on the other side of the plane so there was no galley noise or traffic near my seat.  The downside for seat 1A is that it only has one window whereas most other window seats appear to have two windows.  The Sky Suite III seat is a bit unusual in that it does not have a leg rest that can be raised in recline position like the Sky Suite II seat.  Instead, the entire seat just slides forward and flattens out for recline to a flatbed.  When fully reclined to the bed position, the passenger’s legs fit into quite a deep hole under the video screen but as a result, the exit space to the aisle is located quite high up the body when lying down so it is a bit difficult to exit to the aisle from the bed position.  There is a small storage cabinet on the window side of the seat to store the headphones and the bottled water provided on boarding, and there is another storage space under the armrest on the aisle side which can be raised or lowered.  With the aisle side armrest lowered, there is extra width to the seat in bed position but I found the material of the armrest to be a bit too hard to comfortably rest my arms on it, as opposed to on the cushioned seat.  That said and also perhaps because it was a late night flight, I found the Sky Suite III to be quite comfortable to sleep in and slept for about 4 ½ hours on the flight.

On boarding, Business Class passengers found a form at their seat for them to fill in as to breakfast preference.  I opted to be woken up for breakfast and chose the Japanese menu.  As soon as we took off and the seatbelt sign was turned off, I reclined my seat to bed position and fell asleep fairly quickly.  About two hours before landing, the lights were turned on and breakfast was served.  As usual, the Japanese meal was both beautifully presented and delicious.  I also had some coffee as JAL serves special coffee in business class sourced from a coffee hunter based in Tokyo.  The coffee is always excellent and JAL even includes a description of the coffee of the month in the menu with growing region background and tasting notes just like for wines. 

Our flight landed a few minutes early at 5:01 am.  Immigration was quick as Business Class passengers have use of the Premium Lane which only had a couple of people in each line.  Therefore I was at the luggage carousel before the first bags started arriving about half an hour after our flight landed.  One of the benefits of an overnight flight is that Bangkok’s notorious traffic is not a factor at all and I was able to get into the city center in only about half an hour with the light traffic of early morning.

title: One of the best airlines
review_text: We enjoyed our long flight on JAL. Check-in was efficient and friendly. The 777-300 was clean with the longest seat pitch in economy that we have experienced recenltly. The flight staff were well groomed, friendly and provided excellent service. The 2 meals served were very good(better than US carriers), accompanied by a good selection of complimentary beverages including beer, wine and champagne. The entertainment system was good with an excellent set of earphones that were provided.

title: Exceptional service
review_text:
Travelled on their B737 - 800 on their 3rd flight to HND of the day.

Ground service was polite as usual. Unable to purchase J class as it was a full flight.
Plane was new. Newspaper and sweets, souvenirs were given at the entrance upon boarding.

1 round of drinks were provided in this 1 hr of the flight.

Newly furburised seats were of light made material with minimal padding and recline. However legroom was better than the Europrean flights within Europe.

Individual air vents were available at each seat. It provided some relief as the air con was not switched on during take off and landing.

JAL inflight and ground service are as exceptional as always.

title: FOR THE ORIENT THIS IS MY CHOICE
review_text: I also returned on JAL and both directions were top service and comfort; I had paid extra for leg-room and felt (on both flights) that i was at home in my comfy chair in front of my TV.  When i return to the east i will book wherever possible JAL.

title: This is a Major Airline? Stunningly Poor, Inept Customer Service
review_text:
I haven't flown with them yet, but they have stunned me with their profoundly poor customer service and amateurish communications. They changed my flight notifying me in a poorly written note that included only a phone number, from within Japan. The only available number for JAL inside the U.S. was overwhelmed, sometimes busy, and did not have an option for me, so they hung up eventually. They didn't address my companion's ticket, or changes for a connecting flight, and my locator number no longer works ... and so forth and so on.

I wrote them through their website and received another strangely poor note asking me to just write them back, without addressing the several issues they created.

Seriously ... this is a major airline? I really thought they'd be efficient. I can't believe TA named them fifth best in the world.

title: Great in flight service
review_text:
Great customer service on board, friendly crew, smooth flight. It was one of the quieter planes I've been in and even though we were told there might be turbulence, it seemed a very comfortable flight. 
They serve plenty of food on this 10+ hour flight, I just found it rather bland, but that's just me.

title: CX Vancouver Lounge and JAL Business Class flight Vancouver to Narita (photos)
review_text: I wrote my review of this flight but was unable to upload photos of the CX lounge and JAL flight earlier.  Here are the photos.

title: Nice Business Class Product
review_text: I’ve flown JAL business class several times, not the best business class but I’m happy with it. The service by the flight attendants was great, the actual flight was comfortable, flight departed on time and 11 hours later with a 90 minute stop at Tokyo Narita to change planes for another 5 hours flying time to Manila, it actually seemed quite quick. Now to get over the jet lag. Thanks JAL. See you again.

title: Excellent ground staff
review_text:
Travelled to KMQ on their first flight out from HND on a full 767 flight at 745 am.

We were terribly late and reached the check in counter 15 mins before the flight.

Ground staff were kind to print our boarding pass and personally escort us to the gate with our 4 big suitcases.

The suitcases were loaded to the aircraft at the boarding gate.

Flight crew were courteous and did one round of drink service.

Seats had little padding and recline. However leg room was good.

They deserve a 5 star rating in skytrax.

title: Good Value
review_text: Good service. Nice, smooth flight. Seat is not the best, but plenty of leg room. No complaints. Arrived on time. Flying PE grated access to JAL private lounge in Narita upon landing while waiting for connecting flight. Very good lounge, so I would recommend.

title: Horrific experience!
review_text:
Japan Airlines was at one time our airline of choice.  
Well, times have changed.
  We (family of three), missed our red eye flight (12:05am) from Tokyo to Bangkok, our mistake regarding the date, and we took full responsibility by purchasing tickets from another airline because Japan Air could not help us get to Thailand.
The  return portion of the flight remained unchanged, but to our dismay, Japan airlines cancelled our entire flight without warning (they had our email address and phone numbers).  When we arrived to the Bangkok airport for return to Tokyo, seat assignments in hand, they said that our tickets had been cancelled.  Even though there were empty seats in their flight, the Japan Airlines officials refused to honor any portion of our paid tickets, or to put us on the flight.  Our option, pay for new, one way tickets on Thai air (very nice by the way), and wait for 8 hours in the Bangkok airport. 
 Next time we will just avoid the headache and skip Japan Airlines entirely.  They would not even give us the frequent flyer mileage we paid for. 
 Stingy and bureaucratic would be two words to describe that behavior.  
Shockingly when they use Japan in their name, a country that excels at customer service.

title: Amazing experience on JAL
review_text:
JAL Premium Economy proved to be not only an excellent value way to travel to Japan, but an excellent way to start my time in Japan.

A dedicated check in line was swiftly able to check in me in, then provide an Express path card for departure security and immigration.

One of the great things JAL offers for Premium Economy guests is Business Class Lounge access, both in Sydney and Tokyo.

The Qantas lounge is pleasant enough, more so early on before it gets crowded with a reasonable selection of food and drinks. Big plus is the barista made coffee.

After heading to the gate, priority boarding is offered also.

The Premium seats are very comfortable both in width and pitch, with a dedicated leg rest and foot rest also provided.

A comfortable blanket, pillow was waiting on arrival, along with a basic amenity kit, more than adequate for this flight.

Recline was excellent, and being a shell seat, you won't have anyone reclining into your space or legroom.

On the food front - food is the same as Economy with the addition of a few drinks such as Sparkling wine and Sake.

Food was of high quality by economy standards for both taste and presentation.

Udon noodles are available in between meals, and a small snack bar is available also in the galley.

Entertainment wise - JAL is definitely lacking compared to other carriers, however there was more than enough to pass the time.

Wifi is available and is reasonably priced.

The crew were warm, engaging and helpful - both during meal services and otherwise.

title: CX Vancouver Lounge, JAL B767 Sky Suite II Flight to Narita
review_text:
I flew JAL from Vancouver to Narita in business class.  Prior to the flight, I opted to use the Cathay Pacific lounge rather than the Plaza Premium third party lounge offered by JAL since the CX lounge is much nicer and much less crowded (Plaza Premium allows anyone to enter by paying, always crowded).  As usual excellent service in the CX lounge particularly as the JAL flight is about a half hour earlier than the CX flight so the CX passengers largely had not arrived at the lounge yet when I was there. CX offers the noodle bar with hot food to order, and also a side buffet with sandwiches, salads, desserts.  I tried the chicken risotto (quite good but a bit too salty) and shrimp dumplings (wrapping stuck to the paper so both dumplings ripped open when I tried to pick them up) but did not want more food since I had to save room for the great meal service on JAL. 

General boarding for the 12:35 pm flight commenced promptly at 12:15 pm (pre-boards - those who require assistance and young children started earlier around 12:10 pm).  JAL has switched to a B767-800 instead of the B787 Dreamliner for this route.  The trade-off is an older plane but better seats in business class with Sky Suite II fully flat bed seats instead of the angle flat Shell Flat Neo on the B787 Dreamliner.  The seats are configured 1X2X1 with just 6 rows and 24 seats in the business class cabin, considerably less than the 30 to 30+ seats on the Dreamliner configured 2X2X2.  Every seat has direct aisle access and the window seats alternate rows with a console beside the seat on the window side or the aisle side.  My seat 2A has the console on the aisle side so provided a bit more privacy from what happens in the aisle.  

In addition to converting to a fully flat bed, the Sky Suite II seats also have a lower back massage function, which felt quite nice. 

The flight was slightly late on pushback due to some passengers boarding a bit late, and then there was quite a wait after pushback before the plane started to move to taxi and ultimately take off was a bit after 1 pm. The flight was not very full in business class with about 6 empty seats out of 24 (though one was being used as a pilot rest seat).  

As always, a highlight of the flight are the meal services, with each meal being beautifully presented.  I had the Japanese meal for the lunch served after take off, which started with a bento box of 5 delicious and visually attractive starters, then rice with both salmon and sukiyaki beef, and finished with the lemon mousse cake dessert.  JAL serves a special coffee in business class and the menu describes in detail the coffee of the month, much as a wine review would describe a wine.  As a result, I always have at least a couple of cups of coffee on JAL flights. 

For the second meal, I chose the Western option of a ham and cheese frittata.  Also good but was disappointed the croissant came bare without any butter or jam.

There appeared to be at least 3 cabin stewards, including the purser, attending to the small business class cabin so service was very attentive and always courteous and excellent.  They seem to be constantly cleaning the toilets, even taking the time to fold the toilet paper into a triangle at the end.  A gentleman was celebrating his birthday that day and the cabin crew actually brought him a bottle of champagne, a little fruit plate and a small gift bag and sang happy birthday to him (cabin staff even went around to the other guests to ask them to join in the celebration). 

The entertainment system is a bit weaker in selection than perhaps Cathay Pacific, partly because many selections are Japanese only. 

Due to the time of the flight, I did not sleep much as it was mostly afternoon and early evening Vancouver time, but did find the flat bed comfortable enough for napping. 

The flight was quite turbulent and at the wrong times - during both meal service.  For the second meal service, the turbulence was sufficient to cause the cabin crew to serve coffee in a paper cup with a plastic lid instead of a ceramic cup.

Due to a combination of the late pushback and take-off and probably a relatively long flight time, we arrived around 20 minutes late.  Perhaps this was the reason we had a remote stand and had to walk down steps and be bused to the terminal.  Arriving around 5 pm into Narita is a horrible time for immigration line-ups with so many arriving passengers flooding towards the passport control counters that airport staff had to hold up signs indicating where the end of the queue line was.  All told, it took about 45 minutes from the plane touching down on the runway to my exiting into the arrivals hall after passport control and customs.  There is no priority immigration lane that can be used by JAL business class passengers, so everyone just joins the general line.

All in all, another excellent flight on JAL with excellent service and food.

title: What a dump !
review_text:
What a dump this airlines is ! I highly do not recommend anyone to fly with Japan Airlines, particularly for long flights . 

Firstly, they starve you with insufficient meals on board. Their solution to this is to provide you with instant noodles when you are starving... ?!! Great, so no just starve you, but make you mal-nuourished at the same time 

Secondly, they try to blind you with overly bright fluorescent lighting both in the plane as well as when you're in transit in Narita airport. Unless you love fluorescent lighting, I advise you to avoid this airline at all costs. 

Thirdly, when you then had enough of their crappy service, and you go to cancel the return flight while in Boston, they put you ON HOLD FOR AN HOUR just to cancel the flight ! No cancellation via internet allowed, I don't know why , is this the 90s ??!?!

All in all, a nightmare experience created by the Japanese, like you're caught in some bad hentai movie with no escape and with crappy lights to boot.

title: AA members cannot book a seat for AA-operated-by-JAL flight in advance.
review_text: I am an American Airline (AA) member, and have recently booked my flight between Chicago and Japan, using AA mileage points. From Chicago to Japan, there is only one AA flight service, so I had no choice to book the AA flight operated by Japan Airline (JAL). Then, I tried to select my seat in advance, but simply was unable to do it. So, I contacted AA and learnt that JAL is very strict about seat selection for code share flights (irrespective of the AA membership levels). This is ridiculous given that both AA and JAL are now Oneworld Alliance members (and also given that AA passengers may have to use the AA flight operated by JAL if it is the only one AA flight service provided). I have no intention of becoming a JAL member again (I am Japanese and used to be a JAL member) only to solve this issue (i.e., I have more domestic travels in US, relative to flying between Japan and US). Japanese airline companies, including JAL, provide excellent care and service to passengers, which I like very much, but JAL (and probably All Nippon Airways?) can be more flexible about seat selection for code share flights.

title: Really really nice flight Singapore to vancouver
review_text:
First leg ending in Narita japan. Second let to Vancouver BC. 
I’ve had better food on an airline. Quantas and American come to mind. But I’m not so sure the service on Japan Air has its equal in my own experiences which only include British and Alitalia to the above for international flights. 
These people never stop looking for someone to attend to. They came around at least ten times with drinks, four times with food, and once with warm towels. 
They are quick to attend to small children and those that just look like they need something if they do or not. 
Love this airline. I would fly them anytime.

title: I was   in  awe  as  I  walked  in to the plane
review_text:
This   plane  blew  me  away  as  I walked in the  door  past  the  first class  seats   wow !,,! Then got to my  seat  I could  actually  sit  and had room  for  my  legs  
Then the  service   started  free   meals   3  to be exact  .  Hot  clothes  about  every   5  hrs  to  refresh  you  drinks  non  alcohol  all  u  wanted  ,watched  3  excellent   movies   free  as  well  very  comfortable seats   the  bathroom   wow   again   Evan  had   toothbrushes if you desired   wrapped    I   strongly   recommend  this  airline   my  best   by  far  experience   on  any  airline

title: Very Personal care experience
review_text: Very comfortable journey with courteous service, variety of inflight entertainment and serving requested special meal on priority.

title: Comfortable with excellent service
review_text:
After the terrible experience with Cathay Pacific last monrth I decided to try JAL for this trip, been a long time and regret not using them again sooner.
Benefit of JL009 is that flight is that it boards from the T3 at ORD so no need to make the trip over to T5. Plane is a 777-300.
Service and catering was excellent, very generous measures for all drinks too, only small negatives are that the Business seat space is a little tight with the JAL 2-3-2 staggered configuration and the window seats could do with more storage space.
Also took a look at the Premium Economy cabin, seats seemed spacious and comfortable and cabin has much better design for the twin toilet area compared to Cathay Pacific's noisy and poorly placed single toilet on the 777-300 plane. Will definitely be using the JAL PE service in the future.
The fare paid for this trip was surprisingly reasonable and the connection flight JL707 continued the excellemnt level of service.

title: amazing trip to India
review_text:
this is the first time we flew Japan airlines.
we we treated so nicely and at time did not know to handle the Japanese politeness and courtesy. but nice to get pampered.
the whole experience was flawless from check in to deplaning.
no hassles and issues.
outstanding service.

title: So many apologies I felt guilty asking for anything
review_text:
Very good food.  Despite my wanting to do as much Japanese as possible, the Wagyu beef for the Western selection was fantastic.  
You can get robes, a mattress pad and other things, but you have to ask.  Slippers with a shoe horn, light blankets and pillow, along with the amenity bag, are standard bs. class.  Very nice.  
The flight attendants sailed down the aisles with smiles but I couldn't get their attention.  Then I pushed the call button by mistake and instantly two attendants were there to help me.  That's when I learned you have to ask.  I was politely waiting until they had time to notice me and they were politely allowing my privacy.  
The lounge was good but not great.  At first we were disappointed until we realized that the real food was upstairs.  Yes, there was a sign, duh.

title: Flight cancelled
review_text: Flight cancelled. Alternative involves 13 hours in Tokyo, transferring to Haneda from Narita (at my own expense) arriving 24 hours later. Stupid, useless airline can't even run a schedule. Never again.

title: Japanese service on the ground is unbelieveable
review_text: Ground Staff amazing. Despite the English, Japanese barriers- hey even my Japanese does not go far into airline technical language, these women were so helpful. Lot of support to get my bag to me for the next day. Promised to contact my hotel, they did. Promised to find the bag, they did. They could see I was tired and stressed, so courteous to this soon to be cranky traveler. ( I wasn't happily). The desk staff had to fix about five airlines issues about baggage. About 8 staff to help many issues, they post a whopping big sign that I almost fell over to attract my attention enroute to baggage carousel. I asked a random staff member, they had a list of passenger issues and directed me to that main desk. All had my details. While I could make judgmental comparisons of other destinations, I wont. they do not deserve the space here for the terrific staff. Trying their best, friendly at 8pm! My crank-o-meter rises after 4pm! If I get my bag or not, that is not the issue. It was the amazing service.

title: Best airline
review_text: Amazing quality and service. Bento boxes. Salmon. LEGROOM IS INCREDIBLE. Console-like games on entertainment System.

title: Disappointed in change of aircraft
review_text:
We are regular patrons of JAL flying from Vancouver to Manila with stop overs in Japan and have always been very satisfied with the overall service.  This year it was a marked disappointment with the downgrade of air craft from the Dreamliner to a Boeing 767.  
It was not a pleasure to fly a long transpacific journey on a smaller uncomfortable aircraft which lacks the luxury of size of the planes used in the past.  That it was a disappointment would be to put it very mildly.  More so on the return journey, they ran out of the Western breakfast as requested by my husband.  Unacceptable for a business class service.
Otherwise:  the service was as usual excellent.  
On one note:  the new amenity bag by Maison Kitsune (a brand I like) is rather useless in its flat sizer.

title: business class Japan airline
review_text:
service is very, very good. staffs & cleanliness is among the best in the industry.
No complaints, but not as good as emirates......for overall experience.

title: Feel like they care
review_text: Very comfortable flight and check experience. Staff very kind and polite. Nothing is to much trouble.

title: Bought two round trip tickets through Tokyo
review_text: After buying two round trip tickets, notice sent that we would land in Haneda  and fly out of Narita.  Requires a transit visa for Filipino wife?? We were refused Visa by Japanese Embassy in Manila...?? JAL said was our fault and could not get refund.  We were going to my Sisters burial. Had to buy wife a RT ticket through Hong Kong to Dallas.  I flew on original flight... Noticed my seats (Confirmed by JAL RXQBWU ) were changed and my wifes seat sold to another passenger.... JAL was great airlines up to this experience,, will never fly them again after many flights with them before..  Extremely disappointed in JAL .. My wife has USA Green card and is a RN working on Masters...

title: Extremely poor customer service
review_text:
It is difficult to classify the nature of this complaint, as it spans JAL's reservations office, as well as airport experience, but it revolves around the above flight, as well as my connecting flight (JL879) which I missed because of delays in the initial flight. 
Once I received notification that my flight was going to be delayed, my travel agency and I, both tried contacting JAL, but the numbers just rang out. I appreciate that they were in the aftermath of a typhoon in Japan, but nonetheless, it is unacceptable for an airline to just go "AWOL"!!

In the circumstances, my travel agent advised me to go to the airport early and see if the staff there could help me. This I did, but the guy on the check-in desk could do nothing for me. He suggested that I speak with the JAL staff in the American Airlines lounge, once through security.

Here's the best bit - when I got to the lounge, I was told that the JAL staff had gone home for the day!! Can you imagine my frustration at this? The flight from ORD to NRT was delayed by many hours, but the JAL staff didn't even bother to wait around to deal with travelers' queries! I'm sure that they would have known that there were going to have many customers in similar circumstances to myself.

Effectively, I was left in a situation where I was leaving ORD with no idea what arrangements would be put in place for my onward connection.

All of this amounted to a thoroughly disappointing experience - the first time that I was taking this route under a JAL ticket, although I have flown the route on an AA code share number on previous occasions. Based on the thoroughly unsatisfactory customer experience with JAL, I am extremely reluctant to fly JAL again (particularly as a JAL flight). At least, if I had flown on an AA ticket, I could have expected much better customer service, as an Emerald OneWorld member.

title: First JAL Flight - hopefully, not the last
review_text:
Very comfortable flight in economy that hit all of the right customer -service buttons (except for the long flying time).  Easy check-in. Boarding could be smoother but minor issue. Clean, fresh-smelling 777. Amazingly friendly welcome from everyone. Overhead space was good. Seat comfortable - leg room was fine. 3-3-3 seating allowed for more aisle room - good on a long flight for the walkers. Take-off was on-time.  
Staff was amazing. Friendly.  Excellent care. Always asking if you needed anything, if you were comfortable. Food was very good and served hot. Even the cutlery was warm ! And this was economy !
Cleanliness on this full 14 hour flight was incredible. Bathrooms were cleaned by staff more than once and not with a quick wipe of a paper towel. All floors were kept clean with the help of a sticky roller. There was nothing messy about the condition of this airplane, from start to finish. Amazing attention to detail and Japanese cleaning traditions.
Based on this one experience, would recommend JAL as a preferred airline to use in Asia.

title: Two Great Flights
review_text: In October 2019 and November 2019, I flew on JAL on the Bangkok to Osaka route and again on the Tokyo to Chicago route, and both non-stop flights were great. The JAL app allowed me to check in early and select my seats on my Economy flights. The flight attendants were always welcoming, friendly, and courteous. The food was pretty good as well and was plentiful. The seating had a little more room and reclined pretty far back allowing for sleep and relaxation. I enjoyed my flights and if ever in Japan and if the price is right, I would fly with JAL again.

title: Another excellent flight
review_text:
To the way back to Germany we had another very positive experience with the Japanese airlines. Very polite, very helpful, very good service, enough room for the legs also in the economy class, excellent food and beverages. No delays, no problems.
Every other airline should take example on them.

title: Not happy with the seat despite being the very front of the Ecoointnomy class
review_text: We flew back to the UK with Boeing777-300ER (773) aircraft. Despite the fact that we couldn't select our seats in advance, we were fortunate enough to be given the front seats in the Economy class ( aisle and middle). I was  very pleased at  first that I was given a seat with more leg room than other seats. There was an English passenger who was already seated at the window seat when we got to our seats. I had to sit in the middle seat as my husband preferred to take the aisle seat and didn't have much complaint up to the time when I realised that the seat I was allocated had some faults later on. The passenger next to me was a large lady with an injured leg and she kept moving about within her seat. Unfortunately everytime she moved,  tossed or turned, the rest of the seat ( i.e. my seat directly and my husband's) were affected in that her movement made the rest of the seats to be shaken badly and we hardly could get any sleep in this flight journey. When I was seated in the middle trying desperately to get some sleep, my seat was shaken in connection with this passenger's movement. It was almost as my seat was constantly pulled from behind when she moved each time. To make the matters worse, this passenger would like to take a peak at the view outside the window shutter a few times for the duration of the journey. When the aircraft was flying into a daytime zone, she opened the shutter unexpectedly and it really interrupted my sleep. I really couldn't wait to see the end of the journey and get away from this hell. Honestly I really wished I could have my seat swapped with another had there been any vacant seat available. Unfortunately it was a full house with a large entourage of Japanese school  kids also on the same flight. The only good thing about this journey was excellent customer service provided by the cabin attendants and food being served. Next time I fly back from Japan to the UK, I hope to get a better seat with possibly a better and more polite passenger. Another annoying incident once the aircraft finally landed at Heathrow was that we were told off by a grumpy old English passenger at the Premium Economy class not to block the aisle when we were already waiting with our luggage for the aircraft door to open (this was after the seat belt sign was turned off upon arrival ). I mean some people would like to get off quickly (for transit etc) and for that reasons, they are waiting standby with luggages. They are not blocking the aisle deliberately but simply just want to get out of the aircraft quickly as possible. I don't quite understand why he has to complain about us and he himself ended up standing at the aisle waiting to get out whilst we were waiting for  the door to open. Just because he has paid extra for the seat doesn't give him any more automatic privilege and rights than the rest of the passengers in Economy class.  Please note my rating on this review just refers to the quality of travel I had with this particular aircraft, nothing to complain about the JAL service or staff. I think they were excellent hosts. It's just a pity that on this journey I had a terrible journey back from Japan to the UK.

title: Almost perfect flight journey from Frankfurt to Narita with the latest flight carrier
review_text: This is the second JAL operated flight I took from UK/EU to Japan. We were fortunate  to have flown into Japan with the latest aircraft carrier ( Boeing 777-346). From the last review I have done for JAL flight, they have made more improvement in the choice of the aircraft carrier: one of the feature which I was pleased about this carrier was the window shutters - no window shutters, so especially the passengers (who would like to keep the window left open during the whole journey) can't do anything about !  The window was shutterless, but it can shut any brightness or glares out coming in from the Sun outside. The Economy seat dimension (JAL Sky Wider) was another great feature in that the width of the seat and leg room was more than the conventional Economy seat and it doesn't seem to affect me that much even if the person in front of me decides to recline the seat.  In addition, I feel some improvement was made to the touch panel screen, which has become more touch sensitive so that you won't have to touch the screen with more force, which I hate to see especially when your rear passenger is someone who likes to tap abruptly at the screen rather than touch while you are asleep. So overall I was very pleased with the aircraft and the quality of the  travel from Frankfurt to Narita.

title: Trans-Pacific Flight on JAL
review_text:
Our experience with Japan Airlines throughout the years have been quite positive, that we have always
taken this airline on our annual visit to the Philippines.

Their planes are well maintained...even the toilets are always kept very clean; typical of Japanese culture.
Their stewardess are very polite and hospitable.

title: Highly recommended
review_text: One of the best airlines I've been on and would definitely use again. Food was good and service was excellent. The planes were comfortable too! Very smooth security and check in process at Haneda.

title: A very nice flight
review_text:
We had till today always bad experience with the long trips . Not enough place for the legs, not enough beverages and drinks and so on.
BUT that was not the case by Japan airlines. A really perfect service, very friendly and kind.
Enough place for the legs also at the economy class. A good program to offer the drinks and the beverages and tasteful food with a variety of Japanese tastes.
What is more, wide selection of films and series to watch free of charge during the flight.
A very good experience that we will be happy to repeat.

title: Amazing midday meal!
review_text: The lunchtime meal was amazing, both regular and the gluten-free option I had. They had a program of inviting young chefs to compete to provide meal options. Best airline meal I've ever had (service was augmented by hot towels twice during the flight and good blankets provided at no extra charge....) I hope never to fly with anyone else between Australia and Japan...

title: Excellent Service
review_text: The food in the plane is amazing. Stewardess are all so polite and respectful...Highly recommended..

title: Functional
review_text:
Everything was efficient and orderly. 

Check in fast. Seemed you had to be at least Sapphire one world to get fast track (i am), biz class alone not enough which is a bit crap especially given Naritas propensity for queues. 

Lounge ok but a little unexciting given this is JALs home base. Wifi was good - capable of streaming video. 

Seat was a little narrow but good length in a 777. Good hardware for inflight entertainment but the choice was a little limited. 

wifi was chargeable in biz class. I didn't try it. 

Food was good as was the wine. 

Whether you choose JAL or SQ on this route probably a matter of taste and/or pricing. If money not an option Id go for SQ. 

Not flown ANA or UA recently on this route so cant comment but heard UA have improved.

title: Comfortable Great flight!!
review_text: I really recommend flying Japan Airlines when flying to Tokyo. In economy class the seats are really comfortable, you have plenty room of leg space. The food is great and you can start your trip enjoying a typical japanese meal. They have a nice entertainment system with nice movies to watch in case you can’t fall sleep. The flight attendants are really nice and helpful.

title: Best economy seats
review_text:
- The economy seats are wider than your average economy seats with more leg room. 
- Each seat had USB input for charging your device, a provided TV and controller which was loaded with movies/shows, music, simple games and able to view your flight itinerary
- For my flight (international and about 10 hours of travel), blanket and pillow were provided for each seat, toothbrush/toothpaste provided in the washroom, 1 dinner, 1 breakfast + snack time (but can request for more). Free beverages including liquor
- In flight staff was very friendly and helpful when I had issues. Spoke both Japanese and English
- Loading and unloading was quite efficient

Was a great overall experience and would recommend others to use this airline for travelling international.

title: Returning home from vacation
review_text: 9 and 1/2 hours flight from Tokyo to Vancouver was pleasant for a long flight. Plane arrive on time and left on time and we even got in Vancouver about 15 minutes ahead of time. Flight attendant was efficient and polite and decent amount of leg room. Entertainment center in plane was typical and had lots of movies to keep you entertained. Best long flight I had for over 8 hour plane trip.

title: Excellent cabin crew
review_text: I am giving 5 stars to the cabin crew. Went JAL on return trip as well. It was a 787. Seat was well padded and enough room but 1 major issue is it doesn't lie flat. At it's "flatest" I tended to slip towards my feet so had to keep readjusting myself. I decided to not sleep and just watch a movie. The food is good. The toilets clean. Crew were somewhat late serving the meal but I wasn't that hungry.  Anyway, the crew were polite, helpful, gracious, very attentive. Always smiling. True, the overhead PA announcements can be hard to understand with the accent but they were willing to repeat and explain to you personally if you didn't understand or have  a question.   Overall, a pleasant flight.

title: Great Airline
review_text: Absolutely nothing to complain about. Everything was great with this airline and would most certainly fly with JAL again.

title: Disappointed
review_text:
Great service from crew, but an old plane, uncomfortable bed in business and so so food .
Our return flight from jfk to cgk was similar via Narita - problem was one of my suitcase appeared on the arrival carousel with a wheel assembly missing ! Staff was oblivious and couldn’t have cared and we left airport ! 

Wouldn’t fly JAL again after this experience and cost !

title: JAL no more
review_text: First time fly JAL ... and it was disappointed... Cabin service was ok  (I'm sorry I just have a very hard time to understand what the cabin crew said) food was below medico er... for japanese cuisine on a japanese airline .. how can it be bad right?? not it was not good at all ... the entree cooked fish was hard like rock. the crew member doesn't seem to communicate to each other ... difference member come to ask us the same thing ... like breakfast we ordered before .. one will tell us the item we ordered was out and we told them .. we ordered ahead of time ..so now is not out . Since we have 3 - 4 more JAL flight to catch... I try to call the customer service number .. guess what it charge per mins ...if you use your cell to call it will charge you per 20 sec (i am not sure but it less than a mins) seriously?? which airline will charge for customer service???? so NO More Japan Airline.

title: Go Japan Air
review_text: We flew from Bangkok to San Francisco with change of jet in Tokyo.  The service on both legs was terrific.  We found the service better than first class on Virgin and British Airways which are quite good.  We have traveled on other Air Singapore, Cathay Pacific, China Eastern Airlines, and Thai Airways.  Japan Airlines is handsdown the best.  The food was quite good.  We try to fly business or first class on long flights but decided to fly Economy this time.  We were suprised.  I would fly Japan Airlines anytime.  There were a number of flight attendants.  They were so sweet and kind.

title: Straight "A" Flights all the time
review_text: Japan Airlines has never failed us in giving their best to make sure our comfort and safety. The cabin is always super clean, plenty of leg room and superb service from the crews. Flight is always on time and on board entertainment is awesome.Highly recommended.

title: Amazing service, put BA and Virgin to shame
review_text:
Were suppose to be on BA but got moved to Japanese Airlines and so glad we did. Things like seat room, cleanliness, food were average and what you would expect from a mid priced airline on a economy seat. Entertainment was at the same level as BA but not as good as Virgin. 
The staff were AMAZING. They were polite and smiled when they served you (a rare thing with cabin crew these days). They were efficient, remembered the children meals we had ordered, again an issue we have had again and again with Virgin and BA with very unhelpful/rude staff from both. The staff couldn’t do enough for you and found that completely refreshing.

title: Frankfurt bag returned!!!
review_text:
A big thank you to the JAL staff at Frankfurt for returning my bag to Manchester. Short connection and no way of checking all the way through resulted in me leaving my bag in Frankfurt. The staff at Frankfurt made the effort to have it transported to me at Manchester airport at no extra cost. 
Many thanks
James

title: Relax n warn plane
review_text:
Nice crew and friendly team 
Will seat again when came Japan 
Good choose 
In time to departure and arrival on time too😍😍😍

title: Business class on JAL
review_text: I booked my JAL flight with American. There's a JAL kiosk at O'Hare in the newly remodeled Admiral's Club Flagship Lounge, which if you are flying business class, you get access to, whether you are flying American or JAL. The service at the JAL kiosk is impeccable, and I dare say better than what you'd experience at the Admiral's Club. The flight itself is pretty standard for business class. I prefer AA long hauls--there's just a little more freedom to wander. JAL customers seem very orderly by contrast. The cabins feel a little dated, too, though the seats lay completely flat, and the entertainment options are good, and the food in business was actually much better than what I experience on AA. The service on board was excellent, as expected, friendly but slightly formal. JAL terminal and Sakura Lounge at Narita were excellent with good shopping and dining.

title: Customer Service - Improvement Required
review_text:
I requested for vegetarian meal during my flight but the request was missed out.
The flight attendant just said that they didn't receive any request on their end and left it as that. 
There were totally no service recovery done, like offer some cakes or vegetarian sandwiches etc.
I was left hungry till later when they took out some cakes and muffins for the passengers during snack time.
Why wasn't this offered to me earlier? Very disappointing service.
It's my first and last flight with JAL.

title: Excelent service
review_text: Flew from Helsinki to Narita airport,Tokyo very comfortable flight more leg room in economy than B.A as they were who I booked with, good food I had the vegetarian option, very attentive sevice I would definatley fly with them again as a preferred choice of airline to Japan.

title: Comfortable flight
review_text:
On the 20/10/2019 my wife and I went from Melbourne (Australia) to Tokoyo  (Japan) on a flight at 12.35 am. The staff were friendly, the seating was comfortable and food was good. We were greeted with a smile when boarding and on arrival in Japan. 
This was my first flight with this airline. I would definitely recommend this airline and hope to fly again with the airline in the future.

title: Response to Negative Review Ignored, Unanswered or Undecisive
review_text:
This is a review of their review and survey.
I wrote a negative review of their check in service at ITM.  I responded to their survey to criticize their idiotic check in staff at ITM and requested a response.
I also sent a criticism to their website requesting a response.
Three out of three, no acknowledgement, or response of any kind positive, negative or neutral.  Is Japan Airlines being overly sensitive to anything negative said to them?
All US airlines are far better at responding to a complaint … whether or not they do anything begs another discussion, but at least they ALL respond.  Invariably most airlines, the problem is the understaffed airport services, like check in, transfer, baggage drop off, ticketing etc.
Most flights once they take off, are usually fine.
I know they can do only so much in the air.
I also understand they can only do so much on the ground, when the place usually look line lines at Disneyland.  Now, Disneyland does a much better job of controlling lines, and the masses. 
JAL may want to consult Disney on how to operate a line (people waiting to be checked in, ticketed, baggage drop, etc)…
JAL is the worst in response of all airlines I've encountered.

title: Very Poor Jakarta Office people
review_text:
I need to remind my self to avoid Jal if flying from Jakarta. the office people was super unhelpful. I booked my ticket through a online 3rd party without any cancelation policy. It was business class ticket and I spend 300k yen. so its not the cheapest but it was last minute ticket. and I need to have a change one day earlier due to some urgent work. they did not allowed me to.

they were so strict and unhelpful. just reply NO NO NO and NO. Non refundable as well. So take it with the japanese, super calculative and unhelpful. 

I think just stick to Garuda, at least they

title: Unprofessional airport handling from Japan Airlines
review_text:
I received unprofessional airport handling from Japan Airlines in Jakarta for my flight departure from Jakarta-Tokyo-New York on October 13th, 2019.

On October 12th 2019 06.44 am via email I received Notice of Web Check-in Result with seat no all the way to New York

On October 12th 2019 01.08 am via email I received Notice of Flight Cancellation for JAL 004 Tokyo to New York
follow with
On October 12th 2019 14.18 am via email I received Notice of Flight Cancellation for JAL 720 Jakarta to Tokyo

"due to Typhoon Hagibis. We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience."

Was mentioned that I can contact Local Japan Airlines in Jakarta and I did it and waiting for almost 40 minutes without never able to reach the reservation staff. The other no was an answering and open only for week day office hour.

On October 13th 2019 as I received no information at all about my flight schedule so 
I came to the airport 04.00 AM

Japan Airlines check in counter open and assisted by Japan Airlines staff ( Use JAL Uniform) who immediately told  me that this is a force majeure and He can't do anything about it. 

I told him I open my reservation online and I saw Japan Airlines already rebooked my flight October 14th KE 81  Seoul Incheoon 10.00  but he said its a computer generated itinerary and nothing he can't do about it.

While we talked I found out via Flight Radar  that JAL 720 on that morning fly to Tokyo. I noticed that every single Japanese
nationalities assisted by Japan Airlines staff (Japanese and wear JAL Uniform)  assisted quietly to Immigration.

I also received an email from Japan Airlines that Flight JL4 Tokyo to New York back 
to operation as per schedule.

I'm a frequent traveller so I asked the counter if he can transfer me to Qatar Airways 
( Both JAL and Qatar member of One World)

First he try to confuse me and he said he will transfer me via China airlines, Malaysian Airlines and Cathay Pacific.

After I pushed him finally he was able to book my flight to New York QR 957 13 October 2019 ETA 17.25. The bad news I can't
change my return flight as I arrived one day late in New York.

I have to wait at the airport for almost 12 hours without any hotel provided by Japan Airlines before leaving Jakarta

I know Typhoon Hagibis (Typhoon No. 19) will stop everything but Japan every year have more than 12 typhoon and I believe a reputable airlines like Japan Airlines sure have a protocol to assist their customers when typhoon or earthquake occur. 

I wrote this review to remind everyone that you may experience the same situation in future. 

On October 13th 2019 I'm the lucky one as finally I can fly with Qatar Airways although I have to pay my own hotel in Jakarta and I lost one night accommodation in New York.

I noticed a some passengers left behind in confusion as no one take care their journey. 

I gave poor rating for my flight Jakarta to New York

title: JAL is best !
review_text: No departure delay. The cabin is clean. Wide sheet spacing. Good service. Japanese quority. Amenity is good.

title: Excellent Airlines for International Flights
review_text:
I and my family are always using JAL for the international flights due to my home is in Bangkok and my daughters study in US.  I always use JAL because of good service and always on-time.

My daughters are sitting in Economy class in which also get the good services and good food as well.

I recommend JAL to anyone that would like the great pleasure international flight.

title: Fabulous customer service
review_text:
We would like to say thank you so much to Hori, the wonderful and super helpful supervisor for Japan Airlines at Haneda Airport for changing our flight so easily yesterday, and for taking away all the stress. 
We were in a bit of a stress as we presented ourselves to the wrong Tokyo airport and we had no chance to catch our flight back to France. 

We had a great flight back to Paris. Food on board was very good.

title: Good standards overall
review_text: Aside from the flight being full and the seats my colleague and I received were not so great, everything else from food to comfort to the larger entertainment screen was of a good quality.

title: Beyond my wildest dreams
review_text: This was such unbelievable service! I can't stop raving about how much I loved it! Champagne was served to me from a Magnum of Crystal to start. Dinner you had your chose of anything your heart desires! I t was incredible. Lobster, filet mignon done right not over cooked. My favorite was the truffled egg sandwich again amazing! Comfy pajamas and the amenity bad had everything one could imagine in there Love this airline! the staff were amazing!

title: Best ever with cool Asian hospitality
review_text: National flag airline company. The aircraft was B787-9 as my favorite one. I love to board to Asian airline companies, very very good to service, hospitality, meals and beverage etc. I was very surprised to the toilet in this plane! They have bidet toilets in the plane! Also the space was super clean. Super comfortable flight to me.

title: Domestic was alright...
review_text: Regular domestic flight journey off to NGS, as it was only a 90 minutes flight they will only serve drinks (there's beef broth also... it's weird but tasty) quick service, on time landing.

title: Outstanding!
review_text:
Flight departed on time from TSA bound for HND, what made it exceptional from all other major airlines's economy was the food on board! I seldom clear all dishes, but JAL had such a high standard of catering service that deserves a wide mention!
Flight landed on time and I have a connecting to NGS, FA stood in front of gate with my name on it and gave me a ticket for the train service from the INTL terminal to the Domestic one, yet I could not figure out how to use it, anyway, i managed to squeeze past the security and immigration within 10 minutes and managed to get my bags and drop within 30 minutes for my next flight. See, even with a connecting of only 75 minutes, you will still be able to make it on time!

title: Outstanding service
review_text: I fly almost every week for work, sadly usually in Economy. JAL is far and away the best airline I fly in. It is comfortable and clean with decent food. But the main thing is that the airline gives the full impression of really wanting you on the plane. Thats not always true of USA carriers. To give a small example. I left my pencil case in the lounge at Narita Airport. I told the flight attendant and soon a pencil case was being run the length of the airport and delivered on to the flight just before take-off.  It was only a pencil case but JAL treated with care. I hear many stories like this. Excellent airline. Always my first choice.

title: Business class was good, service was good but food was massive disappointment
review_text:
as i said, the seat etc. is good, the drinks offering is good, the service was good but the food was just very boring and disappointing. i pre ordered an ovo lacto meal and it was so boring, like on many airlines to be fair. my amuse bouche was salad and some peper sticks, my starter was exactly the same, just a bigger plate, followed by some boring pasta with sauce. and this twice on the long flight. so twice pasta. 
there is so much amazing japanese food which COULD be made vegetarian but JAL chooses to serve salad and pasta. was really not impressed. 

for the flight you get the usual amenities kit and some slippers but no PJ! you can have a cardigan if you ask for it. 

selection of movies was also not great

title: Surprisingly Spacious
review_text:
I have been traveling a lot on Singapore Airlines and this was the few instances that I am flying on another airline.
The one main comment that stands out is the seat spaciousness compared to SQ. Feels roomier and cushioning was better. Other than that the food and service were about the same.
Although I am high on SQ loyalty tiered program, my future choice for flights to Japan would be now based price delta as loyalty has a price limit.

title: Average service not worth the value
review_text:
Travelled up from Sydney to Tokyo on their JL772 flight on board Boeing 787 Dreamliner.

Far from any dreams on this flight.

Seat space was sparse for a business class fare compared with other airlines.

There entertainment system is the worst experienced in either economy or business ever. Poor selection for non Japanese speaking people so glad this was a short flight.

They ran out of food options & crew made excuses every time a food option was not available. They should offer smaller selection so have more dishes to go round!

Coffee was warm at best & I tried multiple times to get a good cup so gave up.

Happy when plane landed & could get off.

title: If you are flying to Tokyo and want an amazing flight
review_text: My wife and I flew Japan Air to Tokyo from San Fransisco. What an amazing comfortable flight. I’m 6’3” 240ish. Had more room then first class on a domestic flight. Was fed amazing food and drinks for free, drinks being the adult kind, and was treated as a first class person all the way to the hot towels and beverage selection. Amazing crew and very happy to help.

title: Ripped Off and Lied to
review_text:
The below is a letter I sent to JAL by e-mail but five day later no response.
Dear Sir/Madam

It was most disappointing to end my great trip to Japan with having to deal with a lying disrespectful JAL person when trying to check in along with being fleeced for a considerable amount of money I shouldn't have had to pay. 

While I missed my inward flight to Japan through no fault at all on JAL part due to my flight to Manila being cancelled and me having to get a later flight, it was most distressing to find when going to get the return flight that this had been cancelled, this was despite the JAL personnel at T1 in Manila telling me this wouldn't be a problem when I didn't make the time to check in there. I flew with another airline to Japan later that day as JAL didn't have any more flights I could get on that day.

I would like someone to please explain the following and are hopeful for honest answers which is something I certainly did not get last night at the Narita airport,

Why was my ticket cancelled without informing me after I had been told that it would be OK to use by JAL staff in Manila
Why did the young gentleman checking me in tell me that this is a World wide rule with all airlines that if you don't use the inward leg the return is cancelled (I know this is not true as I've experienced the same with China Air and Air New Zealand, Cebu Pacific and PAL for various reasons and never had an issue with the return leg)
Why does JAL have this rule where tickets are cancelled without contacting the Customer - a very poor rule that you need to reconsider
Why when I first started to try and check in and was told that my ticket was cancelled and that it was impossible to check me in and despite that seats were available on the flight - this shouldn't have been seen as impossible - there is very little that is impossible, this should have been very simple to sort.
On being told I would have to pay for a new ticket which I said I would that the plane was suddenly full and the only seat left was a Business class seat. I said that would have to do as I had to be in Manila today as I have a meeting with people flying in from Taiwan, Thailand & Malaysia.
I was told the price for the ticket was Y176,460 , while this seemed expensive even for a business seat I said yes I would do that as I had to get to Manila that night. I very much got the impression the young man didn't think I would accept this and didn't want me to fly that night.]
Why after being told that there was only one seat left did the young gent ask me if I wanted a window or aisle seat? I challenged him on this if he was lying when he told me there was only one Business class seat left, he said that some passengers had not turned up for the flight.
Why after being told that I had to buy the only Business class seat left on the plane did I get a Economy seat for the Y176,460, again I asked why I had a Economy seat when he told me the price was for the only Business Class seat available. His response was that he hadn't told me that was for a Business class seat another blatant lie. 
Why once the plane took off was I able to walk around the plane and spot 21 empty seats after being lied to that the plane was full? 
The empty seats were as follows;
 Row 19 E
Row 20 A/E
Row 24 E/G
Row 25 K
Row 26 E/F
Row 27 D
Row 29 E/F
Row 47 A
Row 51 E/G/K
Row 52 E/G/K
Row 53 F
Row 54 E/G
What a disappointment it was dealing with a dishonest and disrespectful person that works for you after such a great trip to Japan where I found everything to be so good and the people so polite, honest, respectful and disciplined this was the first person I met on the trip who is a disgrace to the good people of the Japanese nation. I will not let me put this off Japan as I plan to have another holiday in Winter and maybe catch some of the Olympics. I will however be flying with another Airline, this person has lost me as a customer for good and I will pass onto all my contacts how poor JAL treat their customers.

I'm hoping someone at JAL can answer my questions above.

Kind Regards Michael J McGrory

title: Outstanding Business Class Service
review_text: I hadn't flown with JAL for some years and was bowled over by how good the experience was. Impeccable service from the cabin crew, who were courteous, charming and went out of their way to be helpful.  Everything else was good, but it was the crew that made the extra difference. Food was excellent, with a choice of Japanese or Western menu and good wine and beverage choices, again including some Japanese options (sake, umeshu).  Seat was roomy and comfortable, with support to keep your legs up - it's perfect for short/medium haul and although the lie-flat bed option isn't great (a bit short and not completely flat), it seems this isn't the seat JAL uses for long haul flights any more.  Decent entertainment selection with easy to use touch screen system and for once the headphone jack is clearly marked and easy to find (so often not the case).   The only downside is that JAL doesn't seem to fly from Hong Kong to Haneda, a much better airport with much better access than Narita.  Nonetheless, JAL will be my preferred option for Tokyo from now on.

title: Japan air
review_text:
Great service and efficiency, meal was good, friendly flight attendants, entertainment below average, on time 

Flewi September 2019

title: Superb Overnight Flight, Kansai Sakura Lounge
review_text:
I took the JAL ovenight flight from Osaka Kansai airport to Bangkok.  The flight is the last departure for JAL for the night at 12:55 am.  When I first arrived at the Sakura lounge at Kansai around 9:30 pm, it was very busy as JAL shares the lounge with a number of other airlines including Emirates and there were a number of jumbo international flights around 11 pm.  By 11 pm though, the lounge was almost empty as most of the other flights for JAL and the other airlines were boarding or had departed already. 

The Sakura lounge has a good selection of food in a buffet - several hot vegetable dishes, sandwiches, salads, halal beef hamburger pieces, and of course, JAL's trademark beef curry with rice.  After I had eaten, I noticed staff then brought out different items for the buffet including a Japanese noodle offering and fried pork and fried lotus root on skewers.  There was plenty of food on offer for a dinner pre-flight. Service as always with JAL is extremely good - food is replenished promptly and as soon as a guest finishes, staff rush over to clean the table for the next guest. 

The late night flight boarded and pushbacked on schedule.  Flight time was 5 hours 20 minutes.  JAL uses a B787-800 with the Shell Flat Neo seat in a 2X2X2 configuration in business class for this flight.  The Shell Flat Neo is an angle flat seat and the window seat passenger has to step over the aisle passenger to access the aisle.  However as I had seat 1A in the first row, it was easy to step over the aisle seat passenger as there is no console from another seat in front blocking me.  While the seat is only angle flat, I find it quite comfortable to sleep in as it seems to have greater width at the shoulder and chest level than JAL's fully flat Sky Suite I, II and III product. 

On boarding there was a meal service selection card at each seat for the passenger to select whether to be woken for breakfast or not.  I chose to be woken for breakfast notwithstanding the short sleep time on the flight as JAL has excellent food.  I was not disappointed as the Japanese set breakfast that I was served was both beautiful to look at, and filled with a wide variety of great flavours from a bento box of a selection of several starters and a hot main of fish and vegetables. 

Due to the late night departure time, very quickly after takeoff, the captain announced it was fine to recline one's seat and most passengers quickly settled in to sleep.  About an hour and 20 minutes before landing, I was woken for breakfast service. 

Service was exceptional with the purser for the flight making a point of coming by to chat with each passenger once they awoke, and making sure to provide reminders about the premium lane fast track through immigration set-up that is provided for business class passengers arriving in Bangkok.  She also went through the cabin prior to landing to individually thank each business class passenger for flying with JAL. 

The flight landed about 20 minutes early at 4:18 am.  There is quite a long walk from the gate to immigration but so early in the morning, it was not busy at the airport or immigration.  First bags arrived at the luggage carousel around 4:53 am shortly after I got there.  One benefit of the early morning arrival is the lack of traffic on the roads.  I was at my hotel in the Sukhumvit area in less than 30 minutes as opposed to the one hour plus travel time that is the norm.

title: Too good for a short haul flight
review_text:
I took a connecting flight from Tokyo Narita to Osaka Itami airport.  This is a very short flight of only about an hour, and JAL put too nice a product on this short haul flight with a B787-800 equipped with Sky Suite fully flatbed seats in J Class (domestic business class) in a 2X2X2 configuration.  With such a short flight time, there was really not much chance to take advantage of the fully flatbed feature, but I did appreciate the privacy of the seat with semi-enclosed seats and staggered set up so my window seat had direct aisle access without having to step over the passenger next to me.  There was a large video screen for my seat but on this short flight, the entertainment programs were disabled so the screen only showed flight information. There was a quick paper cup drink service for the short flight.  

Our pushback was about 10 minutes late and there was about a half hour wait for take-off due to heavy traffic at Narita airport in the early evening slot.  As a result, the flight arrived about 10 minutes late. First bags arrived at the luggage carousel about 20 minutes after landing. 

I was headed for Kobe and luckily, the airport limousine bus to Sannomiya station in Kobe is quite frequent and I was on the bus enroute to Sannomiya about a half hour after landing. 

JAL operates a number of different planes and configurations for these domestic short haul flights.  Often the flight will be with a B767 or B787 with just standard seats often configured 2X4X2 so this flight with the much more luxurious Sky Suite was a pleasant surprise.

title: Exceptional customer service
review_text: The customer service was exceptional. First time flying with them and would do it again. I am 6 feet so I have a 4 out of 5. Always will fight for more leg room hence it not being 5.

title: Subarashī furaito
review_text:
Wow. The plane crew bow before getting on the plane.
The crew was very polite and the trip very smooth. Would fly again with JAL.

title: Friendly staff and Roomy enough for me.
review_text: First time I flew to Japan. I am 6 foot 7 inches tall and we were seated in the back of the plane in coach. I had plenty of room. Comfortable flight. Food was good for no extra cost. Service was great and attendants were always friendly and available when we needed something.  No bathrooms at rear which was good because no constant traffic. There was even an area behind us to stand and stretch. Also 2 suitcase check-in and one carry-on per person. All in all it was a good experience and we will fly with them again.

title: Excellent crew and overall experience
review_text: The premium economy cabin provides lots of legroom and seats are wide. I was seated in 17k which has extra space, given its location directly behind business class. The crew on JAL are excellent, always have a smile and very pleasant. The cabin and toilets were very clean and food  was plentiful and of a good standard. Overall, I would highly recommend JAL and will look forward to flying with them again in the near future.

title: Complicated
review_text:
The overall flight is fine, but I can say it's not better than some other airlines. 
I got that business ticket from SFO to HND with the air miles redeem. I never take JAL and heard a lot about the Japanese airlines have great services. So I have a high expectation for that flight. 
(1) The Sakura Lounge in SFO it's only opens between 12:30 - 3:30pm. It's especially only open for services for the JAL passengers. It's quite small, the space between seats are bit narrow. It's OK. The foods they served are limited. The sushi is cold and the rice is hard. The fried chicken nugget do not taste good. Compared with the United Club lounge in Hong Kong it's much better. 

(2) On the flight - The plane model is 777-300, I choose a window seat. I don't like the design of that seat. It feel narrow, not much space to extra storage. I feel like I am sitting on a economy seat, just it have space to stretch my leg and able to convert into a flat bed. 
The good is it has a very large screen but it's not a touch screen, need to use a wired remote control. The entertainment is OK have the latest Hollywood movies but most of them I already watched before. Also you can use the remote control to order the side foods anytime you like. 

(3) The service - of course the flight attendants did are excellent jobs for the services. I have no complaints. 

(4) The foods - I love Japanese foods so I choose the Japanese menu. I looked at the pictures of the foods they served it's very attractive and seems very delicious. Yes the foods they served exactly like the pictures I seen before but I am disappointed to the taste. It's quite mild and not much flavored. The meat are over cooked. So I want to say I didn't enjoy the foods it served.
After the main dinner/meal. If you want some snacks or side meals, you need to order through the remote control, or you can have the flight attendant order for you. It's OK

Overall it's good and acceptable with that flight. I am glad that ticket is FREE, I want to say if I have to pay I prefer some other airlines such as Cathy Pacific, China Airlines, or Singapore airlines .

title: Total lack of service or contact
review_text: Ok I understand and accept that my flight home to Sydney from Narita was cancelled due to a severe typhoon. However what’s not acceptable or explainable is the total lack of contact by email,phone or text from JAL to firstly advise of the cancellation or to advise of arrangements they would make to put me on an alternative flight. All phone numbers on their website rang out without an answer so my last resort is lining up in  2 hour long queue outside of their Tokyo office. Is this a first world airline  or not? I think not and would be very disinclined to fly with them again

title: Best airline I have flown with
review_text: Got cheap tickets through a website and have to say fantastic service, legroom, food and to have the crew come around and personally thank each passenger for flying with them is a real change. I would definatly fly with this airline again.

title: Clusterfck
review_text:
Absolutely fuming with Japan airlines and would never recommend them to anyone. Booked through them as I thought they were a reputable airlines - how drastically this perception has changed. Came to Japan for the Rugby world cup and everything seemed sweet, unbeknownst to everyone a typhoon hit Japan and we knew things would be a little chaotic ( no fault of JA obs ), so we called JA to consult as to what to do with our trip. As our flight was to take off the day after the typhoon hit we were told that the flight would likely go ahead and that if we were not there for check-in we would not be given a new flight. As the chaos continued the only way to the airport was through a bus the day before, so we stupidly took this bus got to the airport and thought o well at least we will make our flights. 

Where things get troublesome, is that not long after arriving to the airport we hear that the last bus to Tokyo city is leaving, but hey we check again and our flights are still scheduled. So we decide to stay, half hour after the last bus had left, we get and email our flights are canceled because of the connection issues between Tokyo and the airport, so now we are stranded in the airport and no way to leave all because we were told that had we not been there for check in we would have to buy another flight.

Where things get even worse, I've been trying for the last 6 hours to get though to anyone from Japan airlines to work our when our next flights will be, but hey all phone lines are not able to be REACHED AND Noone from JA is here. So instead of staying in a nice hotel we're stranded in an airport with no knowledge of when we can leave and no idea when our next flight is. Thanks JA you're definetly NOT recommended.

Completely understand this must be a chaotic time for you but wtf would you cancel your flights the momemmnts after the last chance for anyone to leave the airport. 

Theres still hope we may be able to get home without too much more unneeded stress, but hey I'm not holding my breathe.

title: friendly & helpful flight
review_text: Staff were friendly & helpful during check in. There were some baby & toddlers on the flight, but the crew were very helpful in helping parents to deal with children, which make the long flight tolerable. Thanks to their hard work.

title: Good Short Flight
review_text: This was a short flight from Nagasaki to Haneda and  went well. Check-in was flawless and board the same . The aircraft was spotless and the staff smiling and courteous.Baggage arrived promptly as did the flight on time.

title: Extra Leg Room than the average plane with great service
review_text:
I can't believe that I did not know this before, but JAL has more space in economy class compared to other planes (in certain newer models).  They have removed one seat per row ensuring wider seats.

On a ten hour trip from Sydney to Narita, Tokyo, this really made a difference as you did not feel so hemmed in.  The seat in front was also a little further away, which just made the whole experience more pleasant.

Staff were extremely polite, and the food beautifully presented.  

For the return flight, I had managed to get an economy plus ticket for the same price as my outgoing economy seat.  It's definitely worth looking at booking directly through their website.

When I consider that I could have been stuck in a cramped JetStar flight for the same price with no food or entertainment included, I feel so happy that I came across Japan Airlines.  Will definitely fly with them again to Japan.

title: JAL 1st
review_text:
The 1st class lounge is bigger than the one in Haneda airport and has better food.
This flight is similar to the one I took last year from Haneda to New York. cabinet crew and service are very good. The only difference is the food on board. This flight from Narita has international cuisine besides the Japanese cuisine. The last year flight from Haneda do not have international cuisine.
The excellent services from the crew are similar.

title: Finally horizontal flatbed Sky Suite II on Vancouver route and Cathay Pacific Lounge
review_text:
Prior to my flight on JAL from Vancouver to Narita, I opted to use the Cathay Pacific lounge instead of the Plaza Premium Lounge that JAL uses as the CX lounge is much nicer, is less crowded and has better food.  The lounge had lots of seating and was never very full during the hour or so that I was there.  CX has the noodle bar offering dim sum, wonton noodle soup and dan dan noodle made to order but they also always have a Western offering too.   It was chicken risotto today so I gave it a try, quite good tasting.  CX also has a cold buffet section with sandwiches, salads and desserts. 

My JAL flight from Vancouver to Narita was operated with a B767-300 instead of the Dreamliner B787-800 that JAL has been using the last few years.  Whereas the Dreamliner was equipped with angle flatbed Shell Flat Neo seats in a 2X2X2 configuration, the B767 is much better equipped with the Sky Suite II fully horizontal flatbed seat in a 1X2X1 configuration.  I selected the window seat in row 2 as the window seats alternate by having a shelf next to you on the aisle side or next to you on the window side, and 2K is nicely situated right next to the window with a shelf between the seat and the aisle for more privacy and less disturbance from aisle traffic.  Row 1 by comparison would have the shelf on the window side putting distance between you and the window view. 

There were only 6 rows of seats in business class for a total of 24 seats, with 4 empty seats on this flight. 

Boarding and pushback was on time, expertly and efficiently handled by JAL staff as usual. Flight time as reported by the captain was relatively long at 10 hours 15 min due to strong headwinds.  We ended up landing at 4:44 pm about 20 minutes late as a result.

Once in flight, I noticed the engine noise in the cabin was considerably louder than on the Dreamliner.  The air was also noticeably drier since the part carbon-composite Dreamliner is able to be pressurized to a lower altitude with more moisture in the air than the all metal B767.  The toilets were also smaller and less nice than on the Dreamliner, just regular old style toilets instead of the Japanese toilet spray equipped ones on the Dreamliner. 

On the plus side, the Sky Suite II seats with their fully horizontal flat sleep position was much more comfortable for sleeping than the Dreamliner Shell Flat Neo seats, though when fully reclined, the bed position was quite narrow at the shoulder position.  Unlike the original Sky Suite seats, the side armrests/partitions on the Sky Suite II seat do not lower down when the seat is reclined to bed position so no extra width is provided in the bed position. 

The Sky Suite II seat does have lots of little storage spaces - a good size one located on the shelf next to the seat and a small cubbyhole under the video screen for a phone or small tablet.  There is also a cubbyhole close to floor level for shoes. 

Meal service on this 2:05 pm departure afternoon flight was dinner after takeoff followed by a breakfast/snack about 2 hours before landing.  Food as always on JAL is delicious and beautiful to look at.  I selected the Japanese meal for both meals.  The hot entree at dinner was salmon and pork belly, with the pork belly particularly distinguishing itself in taste. Prior to the entree, a bento box style starter selection is served with 5 different selections.  Dessert was coconut pudding with peach sauce.  As always, I finished with coffee as JAL serves a special coffee in business class only in flight and it is delicious. 

For the second meal prior to arrival, the Japanese selection was grilled rockfish with rice.

Service as always on JAL is gracious and attentive.  When I mentioned I always have the special coffee served on board, the flight attendant kindly offered a pack of the coffee brewpack for me to take home to enjoy. 

The entertainment system had a good selection of recent Hollywood movie as well as a number of Japanese and Asian movies. 

I am not a big fan of Narita airport as it is always too busy.  After landing, I made my way to passport control for my connecting flight and was lucky to be a few steps quicker as the line became much longer a couple of minutes after I joined it.  Fortunately the line moved quite efficiently so it was about a 15 minute wait to get through immigration.  My luggage was already on the carousel by the time I reached baggage claim and a few minutes later, I was through customs and into the arrivals hall at about 5:21 pm, a bit more than half an hour after landing.

title: Short Domestic Flight Done Well
review_text: It has been a  while since I had flown domestically with JAL and this flight did not disappoint. Check-in was seamless and courteous and boarding the same.. The flight left and arrived on time and baggage came out reasonably fast. Overall a goof flight in an older Boring 767-300.

title: A clean aircraft, friendly staff and no meals - BUSINESS CLASS
review_text:
Being in Japan for the RWC, we arrived late into Osaka and had an early connecting flight to Sapporo (as a number of others did as well!)
