Our plan was to get a meal in the lounge....there was pretty much nothing there, tea coffee and beer......we had one of them!  No food. 

OK, wait for the flight....again the staff were friendly and everything was effiicient....but no food.  Tea or Coffee etc if you wanted it!

title: Vancouver-Narita return flight
review_text: A top notch airline, good food and free drinks, flight crew was excellent! We used to think Korean Air was the best for flights in that direction, not any more.

title: 服務細心餐食好吃
review_text:
雖然空間不算大，座椅也不算好睡，但是餐食實在是太好吃了，即使是咖啡都很用心！雖然冰淇淋非常普通甚至太甜，但仍不減整體餐食設計的優秀！
The seat is not really comfortable for sleep and the size isn’t spacious. I still appreciate the wonderful meals and the considerate staff offered me a nice flight experience. I don’t like the ice cream. Too sweet and not tasty.

title: Great flight with comfy seats
review_text: The seat pitch is larger than other airlines and the leg room was great for a 12 hour flight. We were provided with neck pillows and blankets and I was able to get very comfy. The crew were friendly and the food was really nice.

title: Great service and comfortable seats!
review_text: We upgrade to Premium Economy by paying approximately US185/= and it was well worth it. Great service. comfortable seats and good food :)

title: Excellent food, entertainment and service!
review_text:
They'll wake you gently with a nice hot towel, offer a choice of 4 beers and the food even comes with instructions and write up on the chef!

Would be happy to receive such service and food at a restaurant, much less miles high. Plenty of movies and games to play, so the only drawback is lack of sleep upon arrival.

Keep up the good work JAL!

title: Spacious, gracious and spotless, but... clueless?
review_text:
This is one of my most favorite airlines, another being Korean air. Traveling economy is like the old days — you can actually sit in the seat (and not get a stomach ache from scrunching your knees to your ears like other airlines make you do). 
The bathrooms are spacious, complete with those great Japanese toilets! The staff is so wonderful — gracious Japanese hospitality. So why did I give it this rating? Going from Tokyo to Delhi, the dining options were— fish and BEEF! Going to India and serving beef as an option is culturally clueless I’d say. And this is the second time that’s happened on this leg. (Weird that From Honolulu the options were chicken and shrimp). Now that would be a leg to have beef. JAL if you’re looking at this review, please respond! I’m so curious to hear why this is the case. Thanks!

title: Golden Sun
review_text: When I said comfort I meant comfort, its a very large plain like a 747 could possible be. The air turbulence was next to none throughout that 14 hour The flight  attendant was wonderful service is great the food very nice so many different choice on the menue just to name a few beef stew, chicken curry with rice, and even a special birthday celebration for a passenger, vegetable all king of drinks,When the pilot announce we about to land I said wow.

title: comfortable as ever
review_text: We traveled with JAL Global Card so could enjoy smooth procedure. Lounge at Narita was renewed wth wider space and what most supried us was that the airplanes were equipped with washlet!!

title: One of the best
review_text:
We flew JAL Business Class from Sydney to Tokyo for a week at the Rugby World Cup. We had use of the Qantas lounge in Sydney and JAL lounges (choice of two) at Narita. Both flights were on time. The, all female, cabin crew were very welcoming and attentive and all spoke English. The seating is 2-2-2  and we had the middle two both ways. The seats are very comfortable, lie flat (of course) and with all the usual facilities. The entertainment package is comprehensive with a good choice of new movies.
The absolute stand out is the food! There is a choice of Japanese or Western cuisine: go Japanese. It is beautifully presented and exquisitely tasty. You'd struggle to get a better meal in a quality restaurant. My partner had the Western menu on the return flight and it was similarly delicious.
As an interesting aside, the flight crew have taken taken taciturn to a new level. On the flight out there was a curt "crew seats for landing": on the return, not a peep. Not a problem for me - I'm glad they're concentrating on flying the plane.
If you ever have the option of flying JAL, take it. I have flown Business Class with almost every airline and this is one of the very best.

title: JAL Itami check in line - idiots running the show there
review_text:
Conclusion :  Instead of giving people trying to make an international check in a run around, open more desks.  JAL has numerous agents running around giving you advise (their way of telling you what to do) - and their response when REFUSED (which is rather amusingly obvious that a REFUSAL is not what they want when they are trying to  tell you what to do in a suggestive manner).  Only one agent here that handles international flight so go wait for the four desks to open 45 minutes later.  We were already second in lne - so why go where we have to wait 45 more minutes?
We had plans to have lunch at Itami, so heck with baby sitting the luggage for 45 minutes longer, plus more waiting.  What are all those agents with JAL lapel pins doing?  Open the damn desk at 11 instead.  Suggest to people standing at the back of the line to go elsewhere and wait some more.  
The reaction of the agent when I REFUSED to go was surprisingly unpleaseant when done full of smiles.  It was suggested several times that it would be quicker to wait until 1145 than to keep waiting where we were.  By the time the suggestions stopped, we were served and checked in at least an half an hour prior to the other check in desks opening.  Several families and unfortunate souls who tood the advise where all gathered waiting in line for a line that didn't open for another thirty minutes.
If they didn't like where I was waiting, just say so, and tell me to move.  Then I may have moved.  It was a suggestion, so I politely declined, the first couple of times, but when it is done for the third, fourth or fifth time, most people get irritated.  I am one of "most" people.  
What I concluded was the airport manager for JAL at Itami must be an idiot.
Just so you know, the business class to Japan on JAL - fine.  Business class NRT to PUS - fine.  Economy to NRT, economy to NRT-ITM - fine.  Gate and check in and transfer agents were fine.  Thus my conclusion of the idiot running the ITM ground agents.

title: Racial Profiling
review_text:
The Japan Airlines flight from Singapore to Miami. Both to and from I was asked to provide some proof that I am allowed to be in Singapore, even though as a citizen of another ASEAN country, we are allowed to travel among the member nations visa free. Any other airline would not have even asked for me to show some card or ID that I am living or working in Singapore. (I have lived in Singapore for over ten years)

I’ve travelled all over the world for many years, the experience with JAL was a first for me. 

It was a very offending experience. I will never take Japan Airlines ever again. If you are not white or Japanese, don’t take this airline as they will racially profile you.

title: Very poor!
review_text:
I am very disappointed with JAL. It has ruined my first Japan trip/experience. We were set to depart 12am 10th September 2019 and because we heard about the typhoon that hit on 8th and ended on the 9th morning, on the very day of departure we even rang at 5pm to make sure our flight had not been cancelled/rescheduled  and we got the “All OK” and happily we prepared and booked our transport to the airport for 9pm. Just as we were about to leave for the airport, we got an email saying it has been cancelled due “rotation caused by typhoon” in the morning (bear in mind typhoon has left Japan by then). 

We weren’t given any further instruction on the email and the toll free reservation number put us on hold for an hour (we need to know when our re-scheduled flight will be postponed til) so we were forced to go to the airport (6 adults 2 babies and 1 children) and you can imagine the anxiety and confusion at that time!

When we reached we were greeted with a bottle of water and a sandwich, we were then told to get a number and waited in line at 10pm. At just about 12:15am we were finally at the front of the queue and was told we didn’t have much choice anymore and the the next flight would be on Philippines Airlines at 430am transiting in Manila for 3.5 hours. We asked if we could get a hotel just to freshen up while we wait for (bear in mind we booked JAL cause we hate transit flights to be then put in this situation is appalling!)

1) Philippines Airline counter to be open at 230am
2) Airport departure gate to be open at 330am

But we were declined that.

We were forced to wait with 2 crying babies (no sleep) on the floor in Tullamarine Airport. 

Subsequently we went to Manilla on a packed plane. JAL forgot to get us a bassinet for my Baby and we are forced in a role of 4 adults with no room for baby (my baby had not slept since 10pm the night before). That was so horrible for the 8 hours flight... you would think a mainstream airline would usually have bassinet for under 18 months olds but JAL forgot to book me that on the replacement flight!!!!

The following is not directly due to JAL’s fault, more Phillipines Airlines/Manila Airport’s incompetence, but JAL put us through this hell.

When we reached Manila, and told them at immigration that we were transiting to Narita, they assumed (not sure why and what?) with Phillipines Airlines and took us straight to the transfer desk which is OUTSIDE the immigration hall - we even asked if we can collect our luggage first but was told not to worry at that stage. When we got to the transfer desk, they were shocked to find out our transfer was actually with JAL (the Manila - Tokyo leg) and they panicked after realising their mistake as by then we were outside restricted areas without of bags. They also refused our re-entry to collect our bags. And after 1 hour waiting/watching them panicking there, they finally offered to get our bags for us but came back 30 minutes saying they couldn’t find our bags!!!!! We were forced to rush to another terminal (waited another 30 minutes for bus) without our bags and board the plane to Narita. 

We got there late the next day and lost 2 days (1 day transiting/stuck in airports and 1 day having to buy clothes as we had NOTHING). We missed our tour to Gotemba and Mount Fuji as a result of this. 

We were not offered any apologies whatsoever and when we flew back on 23rd, we asked nicely if we could get an upgrade or at least an apology at least if no compensation, we were only given a lame Sakura lounge entry which we only had less than 30 minutes to spend in there. 

I am very disappointed with how Japan Airlines treated us and how this has ruined our much anticipated trip that we booked 6 months ahead and has caused us all the stress and dramas. It was hardly a holiday thanks to you.

title: What about some food?
review_text:
I query whether it is worth paying extra to go Business with JAL.
We had to search for the check in , which doesn’t even mention ‘ Business’, there is no Business Lounge, all we got on the flight was a drink and the seating doesn’t seem much better than Economy seating.
I was surprised at the lack of food, as this was a lunch time flight and the overall time in the plane was close to 2 hours.
In addition, there was no inflight entertainment.

I guess that I sound like a whinger but this was the first Business class flight I have been on which felt like Economy on a budget airline but with better seats.

title: 5 star service from staff
review_text:
The only thing I liked about this flight was very attentive and caring  flight attendant.
The hardwares are aged so much and did not feel I was in first class cabin.
Also, food are very mediocre and tasteless.
The only dish I enjoyed was ice cream and some desserts. I would not fly again with JAL'' s first cabin. It's not worth it for my experience.

title: Very Enjoyable Connection to Japan
review_text:
Japan Airlines (which I will refer to as JAL) is an amazing way to enter Japan from anywhere on the globe, with their very comfortable aircraft & amazing service. On my flight, check - in was very fast and efficient, with no line as there were many counters open for passengers. A diagram was shown of the Boeing 787 - 9, showing how half the cabin was for business passengers (surprisingly), and only 1 cabin was for economy passengers.

The boarding of JAL's aircraft is very fast and efficient, and was completed within a few minutes. However, despite the gate in Sydney being located right next to the food court, there is no seating directly at the gate, as it is shared slightly further away with 3 other gates, and at the time the morning flight departs, it can be hard to find seats. During boarding, economy & business class were boarded at the same time, and after the 'express' queue for business class ended, economy passengers were invited to use that queue too.

Right after boarding, the very friendly cabin crew accounted for any dietary conditions, putting identification stickers on each seat which required them so the process would be smooth when the meals were to be served. From this moment, the experience felt very strongly Japanese, with the cabin crew taking a bow in the initial welcome. 

The on - board bathrooms also were extremely spacious, has marble flooring & had toilet seat 'cleansing' functions straight from Japan. The toilets are some of the cleanest & most modern toilets I have ever seen on a plane, and the crew were constantly cleaning them!

Unfortunately, apart from at meal times, beverage services were very sparse, and when they did exist, only one type of beverage was available. This meant that you were often very thirsty, and unless you wanted the particular drink being served, you would have to wait until the meal service. There were 2 meal services on this 8 hour flight, one after takeoff and one before landing. 

Due to the plane being a Boeing 787 - 9, the amount of legroom was massive! Also, according to a brochure in the seat - back pocket, it has been rated the best economy airline seat for 3 years in a row. However, the recline on the seat was a bit less than expected, and I couldn't fall asleep (however lots of other passengers could!).

JAL was an amazing airline experience which I'd never expected, and I definitely would fly with them in the future.

title: Nice and soft flight
review_text: Although it was a very long flight the staff made it very enjoyable, always asking if I neeed anything else, the food was good and served at good times. Very nice trip

title: JAL was better than I expected!
review_text: To be honest, I really didn't expect too much from JAL. The plane wasn't new or anything like that, but the devil was in the details. On our flight to Tokyo, my girlfriend pointed out that the tint on the windows was adjustable via a small 2 button control system next to the window. There was USB slot available to charge a device and a small Velcro pocket next to it in which you could hold the device, like a phone (Galaxy S10 5G). I didn't try the food on the flight to Japan or the way back but it seemed to be decent and the stewardess were extremely courteous. If I had one bad thing to say about the experience, it was that they turned the seat belt sign on way too early in my opinion. They had it on about 40 minutes before the plane landed. To be fair, I'm not sure if this is standard as I'm usually sleeping right until we land on other flights. All in all, I'd fly Japan Airlines again.

title: JAL client forever!
review_text:
JAL Russia support was very kind to return me full price (1200 euro) for NON-refundable tickets taking into account my health situation. 
I severely broke my leg and we had to cancel the planned trip to Tokyo. I e-mailed to JAL support, the next day they replied they took decision to return me the full price and in a few days the money were transferred to my account.
I really appreciate this decision taken by JAL Russia support. Now I’m a very loyal JAL client and going to chose them for my Japan trip when I recover!
Thank you JAL!

title: First time to fly JAL !
review_text: As an ANA frequent flyer I had never flown JAL.  However on a recent business trip my organization booked JAL round trip from Tokyo to Seattle.  I was extremely happy with the quality of service and the cleanliness of the cabin in economy class even though the flight was full.  Keep up the good work!

title: Great Service
review_text: The service on JAL was excellent.  The staff was attentive; the food was good; and there was plenty of food provided.  The airplane was great--all seats had plugs with the ability to charge your phone, and the inflight entertainment had lots of choices.

title: Great service
review_text: Since my wife is Japanese, we travel to Japan every 4 years. We have two daughters and I also like for them to keep in touch with their relatives from over there. Every time we have used this airline and the service has always been exceptional.

title: Impressive Customer Service with Attention to Every Detail
review_text: This airline is excellent; providing a most pleasant and comfortable air travel experience.  The bilingual staff are truly dedicated to customer service; being highly efficient, professional, polite and kind to everyone.  Food and beverage service provided a quality offering of selections, nicely packaged Japanese crackers and meal of edible art.  Beautiful presentation and delicious; an amazing in-flight meal!  The plane was immaculately clean; including the bathrooms; which were constantly tidied up during flight; down to the toilet paper being given a triangular end fold.  The flight attendants were highly attentive; checking on passengers and amazingly helpful; cheerfully assisting with special wheel chairs for those with bathroom needs.  Very impressive airline and staff!

title: Pleasant scents in cabin
review_text: In addition to adequate ventilation, pleasant scents in cabin gave an extra bonus to the flight. There are many code shared flights in JAL now and I would prefer JAL flights if possible.

title: Great Service
review_text: I flew Delta the past several years, but tried JAL since it started a direct flight service from Seattle to Tokyo.  I felt that I had more leg room in economy seats than I did on Delta.  Most difference between Delta and JAL is the service.  Everyone was friendly, professional and patient.  Food was better, too.  I would fly JAL again if they keep offering competitive fair.

title: Best airline food by far
review_text:
We flew Japan Airline Business a couple of days ago from Haneda to Singapore. Whilst this was not our first experience of JAL Business, it was the best. We chose the Japanese meal option and it was better than any restaurant we experienced in Japan.

Just the best airline food I think I have ever had !!

title: Best flight
review_text:
JAL
Provided excellent food an attention to detail when presenting my partner with diabetic meals. Definitely recommend this airline for customer care on long haul flights.

title: Amazing service!
review_text: We flew round trip to Osaka from LAX on JAL.  The level of friendliness and professionalism on this airline is exceptional.  Even in economy class, the flight crew makes you feel special.  In addition, the quality of meals is far above expectations.  Great experience on a very long flight.  Also, when arriving in Osaka, I left my iPad on the plane.  JAL staff retrieved it and returned it to me in the terminal within only a few minutes of reporting it—and their agent stayed with us the entire time, until the device was returned.  What great service!

title: Worst business class food - ever!
review_text: Last minute change:  my reservation with Malaysia Airlines was cancelled due to engines problems.  Changed to JAL (same one world group).  Maybe it was because of the last minute change (at Narita airport).  I always requested for Fruit Platters on board.  Prefer to eat the foods in JAL 1st class lounge before departure.  However, JAL very kindly informed me that they Do Have Fruit Platters on standby.  I would recommend that JAL DO NOT serve what they call as Fruit Platters.  No even at last minute order!  Never seen such sad and OLD looking fruits.  Should have been in the bin weeks ago!

title: Good flight
review_text: Good flight. On-line check-in was done smoothly. Aircraft foot space was wider than I expected. Food was good. However, the lavatory wash basin was clogged at the early stage of the flight. I asked a flight attendent to clean. She did immediately. That was good.

title: Amazingly Clean and Polite Airline
review_text: Japan Airlines are amazingly clean, polite and service is second to none. Premium economy from Los Angeles to Tokyo to Melbourne was great. Obviously it was more roomy than economy but it was more than the physical space that was great, the ambient space and overall respectful way that the Japanese staff managed that flight was brilliant. I'm already booked into my next flight with them and will not fly another airline to Japan if they continue to operate in this way. 10/10. Also, their Vegan option was superb... By far the best plane food I've had.

title: Amazing
review_text: Words can not describe this airline - amazing service with smile and attitude. Very helpful, all was clean and nice. Thank you.

title: Japan Airlines ... still one of the best!
review_text:
Excellent service, great crew, good food (great concept of having featured chef's )
Good selection of movies and music.  The long haul - Haneda to NY was not as bad as these flights are.

title: Good Leg Room
review_text:
Exceptional Baggage allowance.  Economy passengers could take 2 suitcases each 23 kg.   This was especially valuable to me as I was taking a whole lot of sheets, towels, blankets, kitchen utensils etc., to help set up a house there for a family member.  
Plane left on time.   Seats were very comfortable with Extra Leg room.   Attendants were very attentive, polite, professional.  Meals were nice and ample food for the flight.

title: The best airline
review_text:
The best airline in the world. Our economy seats are very comfortable and have all the amenities like free movies, wifi, flight tracker. Not to mention the best airline food.
The crew are always very helpful and very courteous. The plane was well maintained and very clean. It was a 13-hour flight but the bathrooms were always clean whenever I will use it. 
I will definitely book with Japan airlines on my next trip.

title: Great flight
review_text: Great all around airline, our airlines in North America could learn something about hospitality and service from them.

title: Excellent Flight
review_text: Excellent service, excellent seats, excellent food, excellent cleanliness. Rivals Qatar Airways and Singapore Airlines.  My Japanese SO especially enjoyed the Japanese meals.  Will fly again.

title: Marvelous airline to fly in
review_text: Flight to Japan Tokyo Narita airport took about 4 hours . From checking in to boarding , everything is a breeze . The online auto checkin is rather easy to use , just need to register info 48 hours prior to flight . The 787 plane interior is very well kept and clean , bright and spacious , seats are comfortable and with good legroom . Flight crews are well mannered and very courteous and helpful . The inflight system is simple but somewhat lacking contents . Food is great , one of the best I have eaten so far . Ticket price is attractive and reasonable , overall a good recommendation .

title: Great flight and great service
review_text: JAL always has 'first class' service, no matter what cabin you are seated in.  I especially enjoy the "Class J" seats offered on domestic flights.  I travel to Okinawa frequently for business, and have never been disappointed with the service from JAL.

title: Dreamliner to Tokyo
review_text:
Service was great from check-in to arrival.All staff on board the flight were extremely efficient and very professional providing excellent food and wine.
The best part are the large seats,big T.V,electric privacy screen and the lie flat bed.
The cabin is kept spotless and even the carpet is cleaned after each meal service.
There is also a self serve counter with wines,biscuits, various snacks and wonderful chocolates. JAL runs a very efficient service on this route.

title: Great airline
review_text:
We chose to fly through Japan to Europe as the fares suited us, as well as the 2 seat plane configuration. I was very impressed with this airline. Staff are all immaculately presented and polite.
 The legroom in economy was excellent, better than any other airline I've travelled with. The seats are comfortable and the seatback is designed to have all sorts of different pockets and hooks to store all your gadgets during the flight.
Free bottled water and bag of snacks provided during the overnight flight. Some of the other meals were a little peculiar and not to my liking, but overall I would definitely travel with JAL again. The overnight flight to Tokyo is direct and hassle free and the 2 seat configuration makes it great for couples, no arguments over who is lumped with the middle seat!

title: excellent flying experience
review_text: the service was blown me away,,,,even the ground handler was so thoughtful and helpful, i can feel the truly Japanese hospitality.

title: Flight to San Diego and transit in Narita, Tokyo
review_text: JAL flight is always great, food is great too, we can order various type beer and wines that makes me feel relax

title: True value - flying with JAL
review_text: MH was cheaper than JAL when flying from Japan to Malaysia in the past (at least Business class). But recently it is not the case. The cost competitiveness of JAL (from Japan to Malaysia) is the best mostly. Food, entertainment, service, cleanliness, comfortability...etc.: most of them exeeds your expectation. The flight atendants are supportive and kind, which is not so common all over the world. If you travel with Business class from Japan to Malaysia, select JAL. It is worth. However, if you are tall and/or big, be careful a bit as the leg room is not that big. I am 175-180cm in height but rather heavy 90-95kg in weight, so I am big in some sense (I do not want to accept I am fat... hahaha) and felt leg room was a bit narrow. Except for that, mostly everything was excellent.

title: Wonderful business class
review_text: JAL always serve the best of the best, friendly fight attendant with professional manner.  What I like about it is for the second meal you can choose the time you like and basically you can eat anytime you like. The seat are so comfortable , it will become your bed (180degree) and they can provide you more cushion if you like.

title: Awkward Tokyo transfer
review_text:
The overall flight experience from London to Melbourne with JAL was very good. My two sons and I were issued bulk head seats on the first leg which made for a comfortable journey to Tokyo. The staff were great, the cabin (including toilets) was kept spotless and the food was pretty good for those on a standard menu. My son is coeliac and his GF food was not as good due to some inedible fish.

Upon booking we were informed that the incoming flight would land at Haneda and our outgoing flight was from Narita but it would be our personal responsibility to transfer across Tokyo. With a 5 hour layover we were informed that it was possible.

An hour passed by the time our flight landed late and it took a long time to clear customs at Haneda. Upon exiting we discovered that there we no spaces left for the transfer bus leaving in the next 10 minutes and would have to wait 1hr20mins for the next bus. This journey takes approx one hour.

We opted for the 'Express Train' option between the two airports, however, I'm not sure why 'express' is used at it stopped at all but a few stations, went through the Tokyo subway system and took almost two hours! The strangest part of the process was the requirement to purchase the tickets using cash rather than credit card which necessitated an ATM withdrawal.

I think we arrived a few minutes earlier than had we waited for the next bus but my children enjoyed seeing Tokyo from the subway and it was an easy door-to-door journey if long. This flight was chosen as we were using points and didn't have much choice. I wouldn't pay and willingly choose this flight route.

title: Enjoy JAL Lounge Sushi Bar Before Boarding
review_text:
Tokyo Narita Airport is rather far from down town Tokyo than Haneda Airport.
There is, however, Sushi Bar Counter at JAL First Class Lounge and typical Japanese style order and served. Three kind of selection with a mix and/or three single is available. It is a weekly menu such as Tuna"Maguro", Snapper, Octopus, etc.. There are other Counter, Salad Bar and Noodle Soup "Ramen" Counter same as typical Japanese style order and served. Why not enjoy those Japanese food before boarding?

title: trip to Tokyo during Faxai
review_text: Given the typhoon concern the flight was surprisingly smooth, no turbulence; it was also on-time.  Premium Econ VERY comfortable, lounge access for Prep Econ passengers also a great touch!

title: Narita Tokyo to Melbourne
review_text: JAL far surpassed my expectations. The food was quite good. There was a balance of food groups. (My previous flight was United from NRT to SFO and it screamed of cost cutting carbs of chicken and noodles with a noodle salad and bread -Chicken a la scurvy. Melted ice cream which is the cooling for part of the main meal). The JAL meal was attractively arranged on signature red - even the containers showed attention to detail. I would recommend JAL hands down for food. The only fault was the plane was uncomfortably hot. No one likes to feel like they are short of breath- that was the only fault- cabins that are too hot.

title: Great way to get to Japan
review_text: I had a great fare for around $600 but chose to do the upgrade bid and 'won' an upgrade for about $250 the week prior to the flight. One of the best perks besides the ample legroom on board was being able to eat/drink/ relax in the beautiful JAL airport lounge at LAX for several hours before my flight.

title: Terrible service
review_text: The Jal customer service is terrible. We arrived to Narita Airport around 4.30pm to transfer to SGN. At 5.50pm, we were noticed that the flight was cancelled due to the typhoon. And no one lead us, just was told to go the transfer counter, and line up there to get help. The lobby were filled up with passengers since all flights were cancelled at that time, no any slot attendent was out to arrange the lines, no any decided for lines, so the lines was messed. Asked the customer service if they had any arrangement for us, they tried to avoid the answer, kept telling us lining up. After lined up for about 3 hrs, was told to group together whoever had the same destinations,so we got pulled out from the line and asked us to wait in group. And we were waiting for another couple hours, the slot attendants decided to take pictures of our boarding passes. So we thought we would get to arranged another flight, so we waited for another 2 hours. I felt something wrong since no one came out let us know what happened, so caught a slot attendent, asked her what was going on. She told us should line up to get help, but not waiting in front their working area.... Or we could book another flight online, but we must pay for it. And I asked her about the boarding pass photos, she rejected that they took photos, so we ended up lining up again. And we have been in the airport 11 hours. No food, no any info, only a bottle of water. And they started sending out blankets around 4 am, but we had been here for whole night. Also, we were told if we were signed up for another flights, we must get out the airport grab our check in luggage and re-check in.... And no one told us the narita airport closed at night, so we couldn't even get out the airport to get a hotel and rest since immigration booth was closed....so eventually, we all got stuck at the airport, couldn't sleep, no food no drink.

title: Japan Airlines
review_text: The plane was super clean looked literally Brand new lots of legspace delicious food and super nice staff.

title: JAL-720
review_text: So far JAL is giving the good service and i like it. They provide delicious food and also they have a good wine and beer.

title: JAL - courtesy and cleanliness
review_text: Outstanding courtesy, delicious food, clean and well-maintained cabin and lavatory made this length trip a pleasure

title: It was a long but pleasant flight
review_text:
I took the JAL flight from Taiwan to Boston, connected in Narita (Tokyo Japan). It was a very long flight, but JAL made it as comfortable as it could be. The seat was more comfortable, the screen was new and big, and the meals were actually good! 

The connecting flight in Narita Airport was one hour, but it's easy to find the gate and not too rushed.

title: FLY JAPAN AIRLINES
review_text: Left on time and arrived early.  SERVICE WAS GREAT. Airline food was was very good and the free drinks even better.

title: Extremely inflexible and inconsiderate
review_text: was on hold with Japan Airlines for more than ONE HOUR about a flight my family and I were supposed to take to Warsaw TOMORROW. It turns out there was a problem because my husband couldn't input my updated family name on the JAL website when booking our flight so he ended up using my maiden name. When I called JAL, the customer service representative at JAL flatly told me that I could not possibly board our flight so I should just cancel my flight. I said this was impossible since we are traveling with our 8-month old baby. The CS rep from JAL then suggested we all just cancel our flights and book new flights (adding that it was going to be more expensive)!!! I was shocked that she couldn't suggest any other solution. Most airlines, to my knowledge, allow some name change especially if it's a problem with changes from maiden name to a compounded family name. But JAL was *completely inflexible* to even suggest just cancelling my entire family's flight. We are all packed and ready (imagine how difficult it is packing to travel with an 8-month old!!), we are booked at a hotel near Narita, and my husband is meant to participate in a conference the day after we arrive in Poland. But now all our plans ruined because JAL would not consider our situation. In the end we booked a flight with a different airline and we will be departing the day after tomorrow for Warsaw. I managed to contact JAL finally and asked to cancel our flight. The second CS rep we spoke to was somehow more helpful and tried to provide some other solution. Still the problem is that they absolutely do not allow name changes. THIS WHOLE FIASCO COST US MORE THAN 200,000 yen NOT TO MENTION the stress of preparing for an aborted long-haul flight with a baby. I've enjoyed the food and service onboard previous JAL flights when I was single but It was extremely upsetting to be told to just cancel all our flights when there wouldn't have been any problem in the first place if we did not have any trouble with JAL's website. I WILL DEFINITELY NOT FLY JAL AGAIN now that I have a family NOR DO I RECOMMEND IT TO ANYONE traveling with small children.

title: Excellent Airline & Staff
review_text: JAL hands down absolutely one of the best Airlines. The flight from Narita to Dallas was perfect. I will definitely start flying with your company more often. I would like to give a special thank you to "Flight attendants – Kaneko Nanami & CF Kunieda Mari for your wonderful conversation and true professionalism.

title: Great service and affordable prices!
review_text: I flew on 9/9/2019 at 5:25 PM boarding time. The gate agents were extremely helpful and friendly. The gate agent manager (dressed in blue vest) was extremely busy with setting up the gate, but she and her staff went out of their ways to help me. I am extremely grateful and recommend Japan Airlines to all friends and families.

title: First-rate service even in economy-class
review_text: Both JAL (Japan Airlines) and ANA (All Nippon Airways) are my favorites, as they have first-class service even in economy-class. For this particular trip, I booked a multi-city itinerary of New York - Seoul (with a stop at Haneda), Busan - Tokyo, Tokyo - New York. Normally, I fly ANA, but since ANA does not have a flight from Busan-Tokyo, I took JAL for the first time in several years. They did not disappoint. The seats feel wider than most U.S. airlines, staff is super helpful, service is impeccable, movie choices are adequate. Choose your seats quickly, especially if you are traveling as a group of two. The economy area had three-seat and four-seat rows, but very few two-seat rows.

title: Cramped seats and awful food but lovely airline stewards
review_text: In typical Japanese fashion the airline stewards are amazing. Nothing is too much trouble. The seats I feel are a bit more cramped than other airlines for economy and it made for a long trip.

title: Great airline stewards food very ordinary
review_text: Premium economy provides extra comfort with the seating but the food is the same as economy. It is very ordinary scrambled eggs with minced chicken for breakfast which I found a strange combination.  The airline stewards gave excellent service.

title: Great Economy Premium and Great Service
review_text: Seats like Business Class of Old almost.  However I'm not used to the seats reclining downwards like business seats and not leaning backwards.  But definitely clean and quite good service with great tv screen, charging port and plenty of space to stow things.  This comes with slippers and nighttime pack with a mask as well.  Food was good quality and they walk around often serving drinks and snacks.  Bathrooms was spacious for an airplane with a separate bench to sit on in the toilet room.  Clean and well maintained throught the 7 hour flight.

title: Great airline
review_text: Dreading this 11+ hour flight. It turned out great. The seats were comfortable and reclined to a good pitch. The cabin was large and airy. It also felt like the pressure and air circulation worked well. Very little jet lag. The bathrooms were large (for an airplane). Plenty of storage space. The headphones provided, for a list of recent movies, were large and comfortable (however no eye masks or earplugs were provided so make sure to bring your own, if you want them). The drinks were all free and readily provided. The meals were fine (nothing to write home about but not bad). I will definitely fly with them again.

title: JAL（日本航空）
review_text: BRITISH AIRWAYS (BA)、MALAYSIA AIRLINES (MH)、AMERICAN AIRLINES (AA)、MALAYSIA AIRLINES (MH)、QATAR AIRWAYS (QR)、CATHAY PACIFIC (CX)、JAPAN AIRLINES (JL)、純粋に飛行機に乗るのが夢だった私には　one worldは多くの夢を与えてくれた。私の住む街から世界につながるのだ。まさに平和そのものであろう。今回はWi-Fiが無料ということで若いころに聞いたU2の『New Year's Day』をモバイルパソコンで聞いた。U2は広島・長崎への原爆投下を生き抜いた被爆者達が描いた絵画からもインスピレーションを得て作品を作ったそうだが、We can be one 世界の秩序が変わりありつつある現在JAPAN AIRLINES の役割も重大であろう。「ヨシュア・トゥリー・ツアー2019」が楽しみだ。

title: Best service
review_text: We had planned to book a Finnair flight for this trip but ended up with a booking from JAL. This is worth your money. Very well organised, extremly friendly staff which makes for a wonderful customer service experience and great in-flight F&B . An excellent travel experience which I can only recommend.

title: Impressive domestic Flight
review_text:
I have a short day trip to Osaka from Tokyo so that time is extremely tight for me, so i rather take domestic flight than high speed train. Both Haneda Airport and Itami Airport are located near city centre compare with others so it won't take long to get to the airport.

I was impressed by JAL's extremely efficient boarding arrangement for domestic flight as all the passengers were well co-ordinate. It took around less than 10 minutes for 400 passengers to board the flight.   

Though in-flight entertainment was just limited to radio and no meal was served (only drinks and nuts as I remember), I rather stay relax on the comfortable seat than rushing for a meal. I have pleasant outbound and inbound journeys and both flights were arrived on time.

title: very pleasant flight
review_text: i took the airline from manila to chicago via japan, the only unpleasant of the entire trip was transferring from haneda airport to narita in tokyo! though i was aware by the time of purchase but find it too uncomfortable transferring with two large luggage in tow! but the inflight services of Japanese ladies is so good that how i wish my flight is longer! food is good even at economy!

title: Vietnam visit from California via Tokyo
review_text: First, a word of caution.  Unless you are traveling with an organized group which is taking care of arrangements, you MUST get a visa for Vietnam before you leave from the States. Non negotiable. Now about the flight.  Wonderful in terms of comfort and service.  Our flight attendants were anxious to please us in any way they could, which is what one has come to expect from Asian airlines.  The only aspect we found lacking was the food, which was often quite unusual for our palate, even the Western menu.

title: maybe only one cabin attencant's problem
review_text:
I like JAL and their wonderful aircraft, and their service.
However, this time I wondered what happened. A cabin crew served us, but unfortunately her behaviour was not good. She looked insencitive all time.
Especially, in the night, when she asked a passenger at my next seat to shut the window's cover her elbow touched my water bottle in the holder and dropped it. With the noise and shock I woke up, but she did not do anything, not pick the bottle, not say excuse me. She just took no account of it. 
Frankly speaking she was an eccentric person.

title: LOVE JAL
review_text: If you have a JAL flight, you can only board JAL wherever you go on various airlines for about 15 years.  JAL is very kind except for the Web Center.  About 80% of crew members are also good people.  However, it is difficult for business class to cancel the purchase.  And I want more JAL from Centrair.

title: 安定のサービス / Reliable service
review_text:
恒例になっている年一回の沖縄旅行は、必ずJALで行きます。子どもが小さいため、客室乗務員のフォローは欠かせません。安定したサービスが期待できるので、いつも安心して搭乗しています。

The annual Okinawa trip, which is an annual event, always goes by JAL.  Because the children are small, it is essential to follow the cabin crew.  We can expect a stable service, so we always board with peace of mind.Thx!!!

title: Excellent Airline & Staff
review_text: JAL hands down absolutely one of the best Airlines. The flight from Dallas to Narita was perfect. I will definitely start flying with your company more often. I would like to give a special thank you to " Dallas Gate agents - Mar Samson & Laila Ali and Flight attendants - Doi & Aigaki for your wonderful conversation and true professionalism.

title: First Time, but not the Last Time
review_text:
I have been a member of American Airlines AAdvantage for a few years and always try to fly on One World partners airlines whenever possible.  Recently I travelled on Japan Airlines to Tokyo Narita from Dallas, TX.  As an AA Platinum member (One World Sapphire) I have been lucky enough to have been upgraded occasionally on AA, but it's been a challenge on the partner airlines - specifically Cathay Pacific, Finnair and British Airways. I was already prepared for being told "no" when I asked about the possibility of a complimentary upgrade from standard economy.  I was pleasantly surprised when the agent smiled, thanked me for being a Sapphire member and handed me a boarding pass for their Premium Economy cabin.  

The seat was comfortable and came with a variety of creature comforts including an amenity kit, slippers, a large pillow, blanket and noise cancelling headphones.  I had more legroom than I needed and the footrest was a nice touch also.  The seat itself was quite wide, had a small privacy divider, a large seat-back screen, convenient storage spots for cell phone/glasses and the seat recline system was kind of cool in that the seat slid down and forward within it's own space, not bothering the person in back.  I was able to sleep reasonably well and felt pretty good upon landing after a 12 hour flight.  

Overall, I was extremely impressed with the Premium Economy cabin and would certainly consider paying the price in the future.  Looking forward to flying on Japan Airlines again!

title: Wonderful Experience though it was a short haul flight
review_text:
I was noticed during check in that Premium Economy Class Passenger could access to the Sakura Lounge and I could have a full breakfast before boarding at 10:00am.

The inflght services was excellent with all the necessary amenities provided including slippers. Plenty of leg room for 6 ft tall passenger like me.

title: Excellent!!!!
review_text:
We were very impressed with our flights in Business class from Chicago (ORD) to Bangkok on JAL.
The flight attendants introduced themselves to us, knew our names and were so helpful and kind.
The seats in business class were very comfortable, the food was exquisite, the drinks (I had champagne and Japanese plum wine) delicious and overall, the service was excellent!!!
We usually flight business class and we have had the chance to do so using other 4 airlines and I rate JAL number 1. 
One of the most impressive things for me was how clean and neat the bathrooms are kept during the almost 12 hours flight from Chicago to Bangkok. In other airlines, after the first 2 hours you can see how much a bathroom is used during a flight because of the smell, spots and dirt on the floor and sink. In our 4 flights with JAL, from Chicago to Narita airport in Tokyo and from Tokyo to Bangkok and back, we didn’t see a spot on the floor and there was a supply of toothpaste, toothbrush, mouthwash and hand lotion until the end of each flight. 
We will continue flying with JAL, our favorite airline now!

title: Excellent ground and air staff, plenty of space in premium economy
review_text: We got premium economy seats for the 13hr flight for 6"2 traveller and enjoyed the space provided, even as middle seats in a 2-4-2 config, enough space to step over sleeping neighbour if needed. Reclining the seat does not impact the person behind, although the seat felt a little used up already the seats were good. Decent food and drink options and extremely nice and helpful staff. Also efficient boarding process, overall outstanding service.

title: What very professional airline
review_text:
We boarded the Boeing 787 very smartly. We were greeted with smiles. Even though we were at the rear of the plane the seating was the best we have experienced. The accommodation puts QANTAS and British Airways to shame. There was plenty of legroom for me (1.9m tall). The seats were comfortable. Cabin service was impeccable. Food was a good average. The only disappointment was they ran out of our preferred dish, The alternative was fine.

Entertainment was fine with latest release movies. 

Disembarkment was very efficient. Buses were used as the airport is being renovated.

title: Top choice of Airline
review_text: This was my 3rd time flying economy class with JAL from San Diego, CA and I am very pleased with all flights including the connecting ones. Seats are considerably roomy with spacious legroom area. Food service is good depending on one's taste. Most important, I noticed the lavatory was always super clean. I think it was thanked to the ongoing attention from the flight attendants.

title: Best Airline
review_text: I been traveling to Tokyo,Japan every year thus far and I would never fly any other airline other then Japan Airlines. The airline ticket can be expensive though I do not mind it. I love the service that I receive all the time. The flight attendants always make me feel at ease and comfortable and I always feel safe when riding with JAL too. I never had any bad experience with this airline thus far. I would definitely recommend this airline to family and friends and to anyone traveling international.  I been traveling with them for 9 yes or so and counting! The attendants are very friendly also. I remember last year when I flew into Narita airport I was late picking up my luggage so when I went down to look for my luggage,there it was waiting for me at the Japan Airlines counter and the agents were holding it for me or keeping an eye on it for me! I thought that was so nice! When I went to pick it up the agents had a smile on their faces which made me feel at ease.  Also they are always on top of things when it comes down to safety too.this is a must for any airline that you travel with! I will definitely use them next yr again.

title: Website of JAL is not great and food was mediocre
review_text:
Flying on JAL to Aomori in August was my 1st time on JAL. Folks going to Aomori to take note that even though it looks direct, Aomori doesn't have a clearance counter so passengers have to alight in Tokyo and retrieve all luggages through immigration and then re-check in again for Aomori flight. 

SIn - tokyo haneda - aomori was smooth but seat arrangements was bad and the website didn't allow me to change designated seat at internet check in(this is free for all regular airlines i've travelled with before) resulting in middle seats for all 4 of my group. 

Aomori - tokyo haneda - tokyo narita - sin - no mentioned that other than retrieval of luggages at haneda airport, passengers have to make their way from haneda airport to narita airport (no free transfer and the bus journey took 1 hour + costs ~3000 yen + you have to lug luggage from the belt to the bus and then back to narita airport to check in again).

I booked a flight from sin - aomori - sin thinking that i don't have to lug luggages during the transit/transfer. it's the first time on a "direct flight" that i have to pay for transfer from airport to airport + there was no information on this upon purchase of ticket that this transfer is not included in ticket pricing. What's the point of buying JAL to travel direct from SIN to Aomori when it feels like it's 2 separate bookings? I could have bought SQ from SIN to tokyo and buy a domestic transfer to Aomori instead. then the shuttle transfer from haneda to narita on my own expense is something that's acceptable.

title: too much hospitality
review_text: the service is great, but too much. no need to pause the inflight movie like 10times for meaning less announcements. seats are small and tight. there was this rude old lady, just jestures to the CA to lift her luggage to the shelf, and the CA smiles and do it. customers are not higher than the staffs. other then that, its always clean, on time.

title: Great business class product
review_text:
Flight attendants are top of the line. You can expect meticulous customer service on the ground and in-flight. 

Check-in was smooth and fast, as the business class lane was empty. Baggage claim at DEL was also quick, as our luggage came out first. 

Usually, choose to sit in the middle and the second cabin (12K & 12H). There are fewer seats which make for a less noisy environment. JL749 uses the B777 Sky Suite 3 with the 1-2-1 reverse herringbone configuration. Fully-flat beds let you sleep comfortably. Meal service is top of the line, with western and Japanese choices for lunch/dinner.

It's a shame the business class tickets don't have a separate security line. That would make the whole experience quite comfortable.

title: Flight was good
review_text:
What is surprise that business class ticket did not give you priority lane access Haneda airport.  
Was surprised that when we sat down was not offered a drink in business class as normal.  The meal on the flight was fast and fish-based which should be OK unless you did not like fish like me.  Did not like it.

title: Good airline
review_text: Japan airline has some of the best service in the industry. Their flight attendants are so professional and caring especially when you have young children. Something I've never seen before is when deplaning everybody got up at the about same time and we departed the plane in less than 5 minutes. US flights and seems like people think, everybody needs to wait for them. Only negative is about a month later we found a cheaper flight for JAL after we purchase the ticket and they would not honor the lower cost flight difference.

title: Best choice for Flying to Japan
review_text: The service is very good, we got a full meal and a great snack, my kids were over the moon because they gave us ice cream... they gave them little toys and were very attentive. I forgot to inform ahead of time that my boy has food allergies and told them on the flight and immediately they made sure his food was safe to eat, they checked all the ingredients and offered me options. Good variety of movies, free beer and wine. We flew economy but didn’t feel trapped, we we’re comfortable in our seats for the 10+ hrs of the flight.

title: JAL from SFO to Tokyo in comfort
review_text: Just the way you want your flight to be - uneventful. Also, as is typical with a Japanese airline or most any Japanese service - great service. This, along with great attitude, good food, comfortable seating, clean bathrooms, snacks provided to take as you like. All good and I've flown millions of miles.

title: I wish I can do it over...
review_text: I was lucky to have a first-class experience on JAL. I've traveled on first class on AA a few times when they still had direct flight between NY and TYO. There was no comparison. The service, food, drink selection, and bathroom, etc. everything was better than AA. The flight attendants are friendly but keeping distance between customer and staff. For return flight, I used AA business class. I realized that JAL service was superb.

title: Pathetic excuse for an airline company (and boarderline racist)
review_text:
So dissatisfied with Japan Airlines. My wife's ticket apparently shows as an “infant” and our infant shows as “child” and after being at japan air kiosk and talking to both Expedia and American Airlines for 2 hours (we arrived 2.5 hrs early) We still weren’t allowed to board and missed our flight. And of course the flight for tomorrow is booked. On top of that, everyone at these three companies is still saying NOT OUR PROBLEM. How is this acceptable? Especially with an infant? Everything is correct in our itinerary, but apparently something got lost in translation when transferring to #jal. But save for one jal worker, everyone passed the baton into someone else and now we’re left stranded in a city w don’t live in with our ten month old and no game plan. 

After spending the last SEVEN hours on the phone, we were told by Expedia that my flight “looked like an infant fare” because it was “so economical”. 
To add insult to injury, the manager at the JAL SeaTac kiosk refused to acknowledge me (a Hispanic woman) or my husband, instead telling her workers to “tell me she can’t hell me” when I was literally in front of her. MEANWHILE SHE WAS TAKING SELFIES AND ALL SMILES WITH HER JAPANESE CUSTOMERS. This is unacceptable behavior, and now we’re being told it will be $5000!!! For us to fly out tomorrow?! I have never heard of such an absolute disregard for customer service as this.

title: Trip to Tokyo
review_text: Excellent service on check-in. Comfortable seats with extra legroom. Testy and diversified in-flight food .

title: Help with wheelchair
review_text:
We recieved helpful, courteous, gratious, and needed services, on our recent flights in Japan.

Just before leaving for Japan my wife was injured and ended up traveling in a wheel chair. We had a lot of luggage that was needed for this trip including two carry on bags and four large suitcases. 

Not only did JAL take care of my wife's needs by transferring her to a wheelchair in the airport, at the same location JAL checked our bags and helped to get her to the gate and onto the plane. It was all done in an atmosphere of graciousness. 

They were incredible!

title: Great Flight - Comfortable and enjoyable trip - Delhi - Tokyo
review_text:
I usually travel to abroad once or twice in a year for leisure and business. I have used many airlines in past 10 years including Emeritus and Ethihad. But I found this fight very comfortable. Aircraft was new and with latest features.
Not only the legroom was sufficient (even in economy class) but hospitality was also excellent. I choose the Hindu Vegetarian Meal and the food was par excellence. Honestly not expected in a airline not belonging to India. 
Bar was having wide variety of drinks. Japanese Green Tea and Roasted tea were the point of attraction as it was giving a feel of Japan before actually reaching there.
Infotainment system was very good although Hindi movies were very few. Hollywood programs were in plenty. Language selection was wide for about 6 languages.
All the service was with smile every time. 
I enjoyed the flight and landed fresh for the day to come.

title: JAL great service, warm plane
review_text: JAL is still using an 800 series 787forcthis route, with no premium economy and outdated business class.  At least in economy, the seating is 2-4-2 as designed by Boeing (not the ridiculous 3-3-3 the greedy American carriers have squeezed in).  Good and service top-notch for economy.  But for 11 hours passengers were fanning ourselves because flight crew either refused our requests to lower the temp or the ac system was not capable.  Imagine being too warm for 11 hours.

title: Awesome Airlines, but better not to change airports in Tokyo
review_text: JAL is a great airline with wonderful service.  However, some of their international flights go into Narita International Airport and others into Haneda.  It is not worth saving a couple of hundred bucks to change airports for a connecting flight. Besides the $30 for the transport between the two, one has to collect their baggage and recheck it.

title: Frustrating ground service undermines good in-flight experience
review_text:
We actually flew with JAL twice in the past 6 months - both times business class.  On both occasions the actual flights were okay, but the ground service was difficult and frustrating.
For the the first flight (Melbourne - Osaka return in February)  I had trouble finding our flight on the mobile app and tried contacting their offices.  Well, that was just too difficult and frustrating.  Eventually everything worked out but it was unnecessarily frustrating and time consuming.   
For the second flight, (Melbourne - Madrid return) things got worse.  I booked a business class ticket online and the money was taken.  When I tried to confirm seats, I was told that on one sector there were no business class seats left and we were bumped to economy.  We were told that we'd be wait listed for business and if the business seats did not become available, we'd get a refund for that sector.  That wasn't very satisfactory.  I contacted JAL several times in the lead up to our trip and this information was repeated ... you are wait-listed and may have to apply for a refund.  48 hours before the flight, I received a phone call to say that we could have business class seats, however, because the tickets had to be re-issued, we had to pay additional charges.  Apart from being very annoyed at this new fee, I had to spend a considerable amount of time "on hold" whilst the process of re-issuing the ticket was "managed" by JAL.  Very unsatisfactory service and I really wouldn't risk flying with them again.

title: Excellent service, very good food
review_text: This was the best flight I have had in nearly 20 years.  The service was excellent on the flight and on the ground in Tokyo.  The only issue I had was long lines at check-in in Manila, but I suspect this was much more due to the airport than JAL.  The food on the flights were excellent, a full gourmet meal (including Haagen Dazs green tea ice cream) that was far better than anything I have had in economy since I flew on Pan Am.   And as a big man the seat belt was large enough to not need an extension.  I will fly JAL whenever I can from now on.

title: Japanese respectful and excellent quality service
review_text: JAL has been my last carrier of choice when flying inbound and outbound from Japan, has really surprised positively when compared to AA service under one world alliance. Very punctual, courtesy service, and very respectful to the passenger. Provides a great value for the money in economy and business class, and for those whom enjoy the emerald status on one world, the lounge experience in Narita is outstanding. By far the best in my history of business travel.

title: Comfortable, Easy Travel
review_text: Air Japan is a very professional airline with great staff, smaller than average seats, good in-flight entertainment and average food. When an issue arose with a drunk passenger, staff members handled everything very professional and made all other passengers feel safe.

title: Very hard and uncomfortable seats
review_text: We flew economy class from Osaka, Japan to Los Angeles, California, USA. The service was good and the stewardesses were very polite and helpful. The toilets were clean throughout the flight. The economy class seats were wider than that of other airlines but the seats were very hard indeed and most uncomfortable. The food was reasonably good for economy class.

title: Real business seats
review_text: Even for a short flight like Seoul to Tokyo there were real business seats, which is not the case in Europe, even for longer flights like Paris - Moscow. Service was excellent, as it's always with japanese people. They are so sweet, kind and attentive toward customers. Everything went smoothly.

title: BOSTON TO NARITA DIRECT JAPAN AIRLINES JL7
review_text:
I use this flight to travel across the US directly to Tokyo in the larger Dreamliner aircraft for the entire journey.  It's far more preferable than the smaller aircraft used by US Airlines to transfer to an international flight at LA, San Francisco or Dallas.
It should be noted though that window "Skysuites" in the JAL Dreamliners have less personal storage space than the aisle seats but have great privacy and a personal aisle entrance.  
I also like the excellent Boston BA Lounge made available to JAL passengers.

title: Terrible Food at Lounge and Flight
review_text: Worn down lounge at Suvarnabhumi and Osaka Airport, few food options only and not tasty at all. Same goes for the flight - the Western and Japanese food tasted terrible. The best choice were the paper cup instant Udon noodles. All in all a disgrace!

title: First time with JAL BUT won’t be my last -GREAT SERVICE
review_text: I flew from Sydney to Tokyo in July. I am not a happy flyer BUT a frequent one.  This was my first time with JAL and I was very impressed.  Economy class was more roomy (only 2 seats on the outside rows). The food was good.  The staff very friendly and helpful.  I then flew with another airline to Amsterdam and the difference was so obvious. JAL really shined.

title: Unforgettable Economy + MOS Burger
review_text: No long haul economy flight can be considered comfortable but JAL's superior service at least makes a 10 hour flight pleasant.  Great choice of in flight entertainment.  Food was quite good in airline terms - especially flying out of Tokyo which included a JAL version of a teriyaki MOS Burger.  Looking forward to our next flight with JAL.

title: Spacious Economy Seat Ever!
review_text: Decided to fly by JAL as I’ve heard many positive reviews about this airline. From boarding to transit in Narita airport to arrival, everything went on smoothly, no confusion at all. Flight attendants to ground staff all very friendly, helpful and speak good English. But what I really love is the seat, I must say is the most spacious seat I’ve ever experienced! You will never regret to fly JAL.

title: Great service
review_text:
Comfy seat, delicious food, wonderful service. 

I couldn’t decide which sake to drink. The crew gave me all of them to try. Then asked me which one I like better, and gave me more of it. 

Would definitely recommend it!

title: Japan Airlines flight Vancouver to Narita – Business Class
review_text:
After waiting for the airline counter to open (they don’t open until 3 hours prior to the flight’s departure), we were checked in fairly quickly and were allocated our seats (as selecting them online was unavailable to us).  The aircraft was a Boeing 787-8 (Version 3) and we were seated in the second section of Business Class which only contained 2 rows (row 7 and 8).  

Whilst we were taking photos of the cabin, the flight attendant offered to take a photo of both of us which was very nice of her.  

On the seats were a pillow and slippers.  The Amenities bag (contained toothpaste & toothbrush, ear plugs, moisture mask, steam eye mask, lip balm and tissues).  The remote control for the seat to be converted to a flatbed was easy to follow. 

Entertainment had a reasonably good selection of options with recent movies and TV series.

The menu had both a Japanese option and a Western option, but you couldn’t mix the two – it was either one or the other – bit of a shame as there were dishes I would have liked to have tried on the Japanese menu.  The Western Menu Main meals were either Beef Cheeks or Ling Cod.  The Raspberry Mousse Cake had gold flakes in it which was interesting.  

You could also order Cheese, Fruit and Chocolate from the “Anytime” menu during the flight.  About 2 hours prior to our arrival we were served a meal - the Western Menu was Mushroom Frittata with a Croissant, Yogurt and fruit.

Thoroughly enjoyed the flight – our section of the Business Class only had 12 seats in such a huge space and the flight attendants were really friendly and caring. 

Wouldn’t hesitate in flying on Japan Airlines again.

title: Excellent airline, clean, on time, good service
review_text: Japan Airline is an excellent carrier, with newer planes, enviable seat configuration in First Class.  Very clean, on time, with very good service.

title: Excellent customer service from the flight attendants.
review_text:
The seats in economy are very comfortable with plenty of leg room.  The amenities provided included a blanket, a pillow with a cut out to fit your neck and a wide variety of movies, games TV shows and music in the entertainment portion of the flight.  Two meals were served and they were excellent.  During the flight, the flight attendants came around offering water, juice and a full bottle of water was provided with the dinner menu.  Each seat provided a USB hook up for charging your devices.

Hot towels, tooth brushes and small towels were provided to freshen you after the long overnight flight.

During the meal, the flight attendant asked each passenger to return the recline seat to the upright position so that the passenger behind the seat could enjoy their meal.

title: Excellent
review_text:
Just completed a trip. First time I've booked JAL. Singapore-Osaka via Tokyo return. Excellent experience at a considerable saving as compared to the newly announced No 1 airline for 2018. Would have no hesitation at flying JAL again.

Just one warning. If travelling from Osaka Itami with an international connection there is a separate check-in line and in the morning peak it is very slow. Took nearly 1 hour to get to the front of the queue

title: Great Service
review_text: Premium economy is all one needs for this long flight.  Service is great and the seats  provide great leg room and comfort for this long journey.

title: Great way to de-Americanize yourself on the way to Japan
review_text: I like flying JAL to Japan because the moment you get on the plane you immediately are entering Japan airspace so to speak. You are entering Japanese culture with a pretty good business class Japanese menu. The flight attendants are incredibly polite as you would expect. And, Japan Airlines, at least in business class to me is as good as any airline. I like the cabin configurations as well. Yes, there is more space in first class but quite frankly not enough to justify the price difference. Definitely recommended. The only downside is the rules based inflexibility of JAL. My kids were flying premium economy and they wouldn't allow them to come into the same airport lounge as my wife and I. They did have access to the basic international lounge so the 4 of us could only use that lounge to stay together.

title: One of the best flights
review_text: The service was excellent, the flight attendants were all polite and attentive and the foods were good also, they served miso soup which we can’t find in other flight, seat was spacious. I left behind my pouch in the plane and asked the staff about it when in the immigration, they’re very helpful and fast in coordination, they even shuttled me to the plane to look for my pouch. When we arrived all the left items had been handed over to the lost n found, then we headed to lost and found and yes I got my pouch back! The service truly reflect the hospitality of the Japanese people.

title: Friendly, courteous & efficient
review_text: Very pleasant experience recently with JAL. Flight with layovers from manila to San Diego.  Boarding procedures in Manila were efficient.  staff made every effort to answer questions and provide customer service before the flight.  . Kudos to the flight attendants. Very responsive and exceptionally courteous. Baggage handling also well above average. Bottom line : JAL pays attention to every detail and makes every effort to provide exceptional customer service.  Good Job!!!

title: Helpful
review_text: Back couple months ago i took flight back to Atlanta... first flight is from surabaya to jakarta m8 hour transit.. and its been exhausting... and when i check in to JAL the staff behind counter  is very helpful... patiently help-full when i had to arranged the luggage... and help with my mother in law . Thank you mr. Hendri Susanto... if im not mistaken his name... thank you JAL

title: A False Business Class
review_text: JAL so-called business class is basically a fraud. What other airlines call business class is the first class. “Business class” has slightly larger (but still small) seats, no lounge access, no priority boarding, no welcome drinks, no possibility to hang your jackets. Paid “business class” and was squeezed in a row of four in the center of the plane. An egregious way of cheating unsuspecting non-Japanese out of their hard-earned money. Avoid!

title: Brilliant
review_text:
My first time flying with JAL and they were magnificent.  The flight left from Melbourne a few minutes past midnight (a bit of trap and easy to get the day wrong) but on time.  There seemed to be more than average legroom in the economy section and the seat belt was incredibly generous, which is really unusual.  It made for a very comfortable and easy trip.

I took my own water and was glad I did - there was little offered although I'm sure I could've asked for some if I'd needed to.

title: South Korea to Japan
review_text:
A comfortable flight on a small ageing Boeing aircraft.
Quite adequate for the 1 hour and 40 minute flight.
The snack (a salad roll) was welcome en route.
Nice to get a cup of Black Tea which was hard to find in South Korea.
No entertainment I guess due to the short flight

title: Great Experience!
review_text:
My experience on JAL was wonderful.  Their boarding is easy.  Passengers are welcomed multiple times and acknowledged with direct eye contact and a smile. The crew is exceptionally polite and try very hard to anticipate your needs.  What I found really great was that if a passenger falls asleep during drink or food services, they won't wake them, but will put a sticker on the seat table, so as to be able. to provide service when the passenger wakes up. Finally, they provided a pillow, added back support pillow and a blanket!

Very enjoyable trip both ways.

title: Great Service until Something goes wrong
review_text: We had a great experience with JAL until a major delay on our return trip where the airline didn’t even provide as much as a lunch voucher.  However, up until then I would have easily given them 5 stars for service , comfort, quality of food and courtesy. Entertainment program was great seats were roomy with plenty of leg room. Food was delicious and staff was friendly. Personnel on board was wonderful but ground personnel in Tokyo although courteous didn’t do much for us. With an almost 8 hr delay I would have expected at least some food vouchers. We saw them hand cash to Japanese passengers, but I’m not sure what their situation was. I would fly with them again though, our experience on board was great.

title: 安定感
review_text:
5月にお盆の便を予約をしたので
先割で片道1万でした。お得。
海外旅行ではJalを使ったことがないですが、安定の日本品質で快適な空の旅が過ごせるんだろうなと愚考。

Japan Quality.
Very polote, well educated cabin crews.
Feel bit sorry that they have to behave that way for an economy  flyer like me .

title: 無懈可擊
review_text:
JL03 from JFK to Tokyo
service was excellent
dining was fabulous
space and bed was amazingly broad
some japanese sake n plum wine or western red/white wine n champagne
for the customers to choose
nice entertainment system
very cozy 14 hours flight
highly recommend
空服員笑容可掬
空間是經濟艙至少六人的空間合體
餐點、酒類多樣
鋪床、附睡衣褲（我沒換因美東為白天）
娛樂系統電影不少：新、舊片兼固（但國泰更好）
皮椅可完全躺平且有床墊、舒適棉被
值得推薦

title: Back to Indonesia with JAL
review_text:
Fly at night..depart from Narita 6 pm. In this flight we didn't apply halal food. So only could choose chicken for my husband.Because I didn't like chicken and no fish menu..so I didn't eat all night long.Only fruit..and vegetable and little cake and Hagendaas ice cream.

So I can't sleep because still hungry.. and I offered a little bread again..and only got 1.
Different when I fly from Jakarta to Tokyo on last June,the stewardess gave me 2 breads/bread contain meat and big/ ..so I felt full enaught and could sleep well.
Maybe JAL serve a Sandwich with omelett besides a round little bread ..next.
But overall I like fly with JAL

title: Awesome business Sky suite
review_text: Japan airlines offers the best and most intimate seats in business class. The sky suite provides you with full privacy. All seats have direct aisle access. The ANY TIME YOU WISH concept is a plus. I’m looking forward to flying again with JAL. Crew is at all times caring and attentive.

title: Enjoyed fly with JAL
review_text:
Check in smooth and fast.Meals 're halal food.Tasty and can apply more bread.
Everything is fast and on time.
We 're  enjoyed to fly with JAL.All flight attendant very kind and helped.We wanna to fly with JAL for next destination.

title: Bumpy Ride but safe and good landing
review_text:
Dear Sir,
 
My recent trip to Tokyo on JL38 was quite an experience. Things were going well on flight but the heavy rainy weather around Japan affected the flight on its approach to land at Haneda. It was quite a bumpy ride and turbulent but the calm manner of the flight and cabin crew was very impressive. Basically it was quite like a mild roller coaster but everyone was calm and the landing perfect.

title: Any airline from japan- The best. especially JAL
review_text: Food is good, They make u stay hydrated (unlike korean air) and their attendants are always so kind. Love it.

title: An Excellent Premium Economy Experience Even Though the Cabin was a Little Warm
review_text: We flew Premium Economy from DFW to Tokyo Narita then Tokyo Narita to Sydney. We flew on Boeing 787-9 for both flights. We had access to a lounge at DFW before our flight and at Narita between flights. This was welcomed especially for the 4 hour layover in Tokyo. It should be noted that Premium Economy on other airlines do not always include a lounge visit. The  787-9 is a great plane to fly on and my favorite since I feel better at the end of a flight. The seat is a recline in the shell so the seat in front of you will not encroach on your space. The legroom is ample. The food and on-board entertainment were fine. The room under the seat was a little limited. The cabin was warm so it was harder to sleep than it should have been. The amenities kit was nice. (The Points Guy has a review which included pictures of the seats, the amenity kit and the food in Premium Economy) Overall I would certainly fly JAL in Premium Economy in the future.

title: Wifi paid service
review_text: Wifi - don’t waste your money, I’m on a flight from Tokyo I to Singapore and after 3 hrs I can’t get enough data to do anything other tha this mail, don’t waste your $18 $US, pathetic

title: Melbourne to Tokyo to pick up the QE2
review_text: From the check in to the landing everything was perfect, polite , comfortable, on time and very well done. The staff at checkin were very organised and ready to help. Nothing was too much trouble and they all were very efficient. Food on the flight was excellent as were the hosties. A really good experience will fly with them next to time Japan and then on to London as i understand i can have a 7 day stopover. Love my 3 days in Tokyo. I thought signs and language would be an issue, but some signds and google translate, downloaded without internet was fine.

title: First Time at Japan Airlines
review_text: I decided to go with JAL because my original airlines changed my itinerary twice after booking three months before my trip. JAL also has routes from San Diego-Tokyo-Manila. Staff were very attentive, cheerful, and kind. Newer airbus model, roomier legroom, average size seat width, clean cabin and bathrooms. Boarding and disembarking were smoothly done and on time. I did not mind a long layover because all the resources available in Narita airport such as customs and immigration and hotel transports that make layovers a pleasant experience. My only beef with JAL is the food. It could be better but please do not take away the real cutleries and the ice cream cup-that’s my favorite. Other than that, I’ll fly JAL again and recommend it to friends.

title: Service with attention to detail
review_text:
I love the JAL business suites.  Very comfortable, private and all seats with aisle access - perfect for the long transpacific hauls.
The service is attentive and courteous. JAL excels in small details - like extremely clean bathrooms throughout the flight (which some airlines tend to neglect on long flights)
I also find that the Japanese menu which is light but filling excellent for a long flight.  In any case, the additional "on-demand" menu available throughout the flight is wonderful when the munchies grab you!

title: Upgraded To Premium Economy... Flying In Style
review_text:
Was flying to the states from Vietnam via American Airlines and the stretch from Hanoi to Tokyo was operated by Japan airlines. We were supposed to be in the economy class, but got upgraded for free to premium economy and it was literally the best plane ride I've ever been on. Free wine, Free Udon noodles, great in-flight entertainment (with noise-canceling headphones) and ample space. The seats recline super far, with a fold-down foot rest and flip up leg rest.
