The arm rests are quite wide, so you don't have to jostle with your neighbor for elbow room -- plus there's a partition at head level so you have a good amount of privacy. 

Couldn't be happier with the flight. Arigato!!!!

title: Good customer service
review_text:
good seating layout 3-4-2 and specious seats.
flight attendances are very friendly and helpful. service is excellence.

title: What a painful transit experience both inbound & outbound - Singapore to/back Hokkaido
review_text:
In my many years of travel, never have i experience such great pain in doing a transit/transfer, international/domestic. While making the booking, the JAL system auto book us with a gap of 1.5 hours for a change to domestic plane in Haneda airport. Upon checking in, only did we learn that we have to clear full customs & baggage be taken out & check in again at domestic transfer counter - NO thru baggage into Sapporo. AND baggage will not be accepted at the transfer counter if you are later than 45mins to flight departure, then it has to be carried all the way to the domestic terminal & be checked in there. (Hair stands up in HORROR)
Arriving at Haneda, the passport clearance was miles long, it took full 45mins to clear, then we dash to the baggage area with the heart thumping all the way ...
Found our baggage, run to find the transfer counter ...now its only 35 mins left, we see the staffs kept looking at their watches, trying to decide if they would accept the several poor souls on the que !! More heart thumping.. thank God they accepted the luggage, gave us the train tickets as it is too late to take the bus. We had to run, really run to find the train platform to catch the next train. At the domestic terminal, clearing the security was another mile long, by chance we saw the priority lane, we fought for attention of the staff & showed our boarding time is almost closing - they allowed us to join the priority que.. by the time we ran to the gate, its only 10mins left !!! Our heart was thumping endless !!
WHAT A SUPER BIG PAIN, HOW COULD JAL ALLOWED THIS KIND OF CONNECTION in their TICKETING  & ALSO WHY DIDN'T provide sufficient upfront information eg baggage will not be checked thru etc .. to travellers !!!

Same horror story on the way back - when trying to check in on- line, we realized tho it has a JL plane id, it was actually a code share under Jetstar. Means we can't check in on-line. At airport, Jetstar could not print the boarding pass for the 2nd lag on JAL. And Jetstar flight was delayed 35 mins !! Heart starts thumping again as we knew the nightmare with insufficient time to transfer. This round, its Narita - even bigger, more running, searching, right bus to right terminal etc and the running gets real stressful, clearing passport & security ... run, dash, run dash .. we arrive at the gate with the boarding started !!!!!
This is the nightmare that i thank God that i survived through, but do you want to put yourself through it ???  
my advise, AVOID THE PAIN, take those airlines that does direct flights into Sapporo & NOT JAL that has to transit / transfers to domestic flights in Tokyo. I don't understand why JAL process flow and design are NOT so traveller friendly

title: Mr.
review_text: The seat is roomy and comfortable. Food is very creative and delicious.the attendant service is kind and excellent! I miss the hot hamburger on breakfast very much.

title: Best Airlines with Great Food
review_text: My first experienced with Japan Airlines. Check in was quick. Friendly and polite cabin crew. The food is fantastic. Happy flying with comfortable seat. Will fly with this airlines again. Love

title: Great Flight
review_text: Great flight attentive staff. My dietary requirements were not passed on to them for some reason but the cabin crew went out of their way to put something together for me, it was greatly appreciated.

title: Above and beyond
review_text:
Had a long layover in Osaka from Thailand. I had injured my ankle and my husband asked the first class lounge for a bag of ice since that is almost impossible to find in the limited space we were allowed in the airport. The attendant came out, took one look at my foot and ran and got someone. They got my ice and insisted on a wheelchair. I tried to protest but since I couldn't even get my shoe on, I didn't really have leg to stand on (pun intended). 
They went back and called whoever was in charge and called ALL MY CONNECTING  FLIGHTS TO MINNEAPOLIS. LAX, to CHI to MSP. There were wheelchairs waiting at every gate, shuttle at LAX, cart in Chicago and in MSP. Talk about above and beyond! Who does that?! Japan Air, that's who. I had priority seating, they were very kind to me and the rest of my trip was made so much easier. Good thing too because my gate at LAX was 1/2 mile away. 
Extra bonus, we are vegan and the food is amazing as well as very pretty. 
FYI: I have never seen airline bathrooms this big, ever...ever.

title: Ms
review_text: The aircraft is spacious. Seats are very comfortable. Food is highly superior. Service or the flight crew is implacable. Every meal is a special surprise, it’s really of superb quality compared to all other airlines. Great job JAL!!

title: We were made to feel special
review_text:
1966 my Mom dressed me in a pressed dress shirt, my best pants and made sure my hair was combed. We were getting on a AA plane to Florida. The Flight Attendants; all smiles and welcoming serving up hot meals and great service. Long gone are those days in America.
WELCOME, Japan Airlines! From the gate at Dallas to our final destination, Narita Airport Japan, we were greeted with smiles and excellent service. Hot food options, hot towels, snacks. pillows, blankets and anything else one might need in a long flight. The plane was new, including personal entertainment, electronic window darkening, foot rests and enough lavatories to satisfy anyone. Just a joy to fly with such a professional airline, who hasn't forgotten that we are passengers and guests, not baggage and cargo. Do yourself a favor and treat yourself to with this airline.

title: Good flight
review_text: Good flight. Flight was not delayed. Seating comfort is good even though its a little tight for a 6-feet tall person. Service is good and professional.

title: New Updated Aircrafts
review_text: I flew on JAL on the DEL YVR sector and found the aicrafts to be new, with all the modern amenities on board be it the infotainment system, usb chargers on every seat. The crew is very courteous, good legroom, nice warm meals served with a smile.

title: Excellent Airlines
review_text: whenever travelling to JAPAN feel free to book JAL as they are the best airlines i have come across so far.Especially if you with a toddler you get food variety.milk basic needs etc and a great airline staff. Amazing seats and leg space that you get in this airline.You can surely give it a try and i am sure you wont be disappointed.

title: Best Flight experience ever!
review_text:
The toilet is always so clean like a 5 star hotel with washlet. Normally I hate meals on the airplane but the food taste great and they have hot miso soup on the plane!
The service is also impeccable, all and all, awesome experience, I'd definitely want to pick Japan Airlines if I am going to fly to Japan next time, although it is not cheap yet but that's what you need to pay for the excellent customer service.

title: Very good flight & excellent service
review_text: I travelled to Tokyo from Melbourne by JAL in economy class in May this year. The seats were comfortable, the aircraft was clean and modern (Boeing 787), and the customer service by JAL airhostesses and cabin crew was excellent.I would recommend JAL, and fly by them again.

title: Comfortable Flight with Friendly Service
review_text: I always love to fly with Japan Airlines.  There is considerably more leg room than average airlines, and the flight crew are very friendly and nice.

title: Great service
review_text: Great service and excellent food. The JAL Dreamliner economy seats have to be some of the best with heaps of foot room and very comfortable seating. My only criticism is that sparkling wine doesn't seem to be available in economy although I have had it in premium economy previously. the flight attendants are always smiling and go out of their way to assist.

title: Conformable trip
review_text: (1)Clean, good service, flight on time (2)The flight going is small plane  and return journey is big plane

title: Business class worth the extra cost
review_text: Paid extra for long haul to Europe. This was first leg. Customer service was excellent. Seats were comfortable. 'Bed' was better when I realised there was a mattress in the overhead locker (silly me). Transit lounges were also much appreciated.

title: Excellent service great travel
review_text: Excellent customer service, the hostess remembers and delivers my on-board requirement excellently. On-board entertainment was great and kept us occupied throughout the flight. Departure and arrival time was punctual.  Seat arrangements are good, in a 2x4x2 seats arrangement. However, check in service is slow and can be improved by allowing an extra lane for those who have done the internet check in to drop off their bags.

title: Loved it
review_text: I flew JAL for the first time.   I did fly one leg in Business and the other in economy.   I loved this airline.  They have the best in-flight food of any airline I have ever been on, and am going to be flying them as much as possible in the future.   I had a 3 day stop over in Tokyo and they were amazing to deal with.

title: Everything well taken care of
review_text: It was a long 10-hour flight for my family and I (with 3 young kids) and I was initially quite apprehensive about it. But it was good. First of all, the attendants were really friendly and polite. Some of them could only speak a little English but they make it easy by giving you cards to look at and point out what you want/need. The kids were given a good quality welcome toy and the kids' meals were really cute. Throughout the flight, they will periodically offer water/juice without having to ask for it. The seats were comfy (slightly wider than usual) and they have snacks near the service counter for you in case you can't sleep and felt like munching something. I would definitely fly JAL again if I have the chance.

title: A Perfectly Amazing Flight
review_text: We spent some time considering Premium Economy and Business Class on our JAL flight.  In the end, considering the length of the flight and the need to move around, we decided on business class.  It was a VERY wise choice.  Because we had individual, compartmentalized seats that we could raise and lower partition screens, we had a true sense of privacy.  The seats reclined and raised in a variety of positions, so we never felt cramped or hemmed in.  On top of all this, the service was stellar.  The stewardesses were concerned for all of our needs and were extremely helpful: the best of any airline I have ever flown.  The food was exceptional and help was immediately available, regardless of the hour.  Additionally, access to the First Class lounge was included.  It was an amazing experience.  From check in through arrivals I could not have asked for kinder, better attention from everyone.  I consider the flight, especially one of this length, as a day of my trip.  I cannot imagine spending it in discomfort.

title: Super easy trip
review_text: super airline and while my Japanese is very limited, the ground and onboard staff always make my trip so easy... online check-in for non-Japanese is a little cumbersome but with the help of my office team, is possible.

title: Great, Polite while Waiting for 6+ hours for a 12+ hour direct flight
review_text: Worth paying the extra monies. Our car service picked us up earlier than we had requested so we arrived before JAL even opened their counter. We were first in line and when it was opening time, staff marched out together. lined up in front of the counter and then bowed to whomever was in line. Then because we were so super early, we were given coupons to their lounge. The lounge was stocked with snacks (even sushi for a bit) and all you can drink (including alcohol). Lounge was located above so there was a view for people watching. Once on the flight, staff regularly fed us with 2 meals, snacks and drinks. There were also a selection of movies and all the comforts were provided including headsets. Check to see if there is a food difference between economy and economy premium. If more leg room is necessary, weigh all that against cost difference.

title: Trip back home from Thailand
review_text:
I just have to say that even flying economy was almost as Good as First Class. Being a Sapphire member with American Airlines Sure has it’s perks. Japan Air Co-Shares With American, and they are Definitely Worth it ! 
Thank You !

title: 1st trip to Japan
review_text:
The foreign airlines (Japan, Australia and Canada) are so much better than United.

Free food and free entertainment package.
Japan Airlines took it to another level
of service.  The flight attendants were so service oriented, they came around with water numerous times.  The seats were huge and comfy compared to United.

I will definitely use them again to go Japan.

title: Sad Customer srevice and lies
review_text: So my wife had to go to the Philippines to see her sick father. Basically she had a 4 hour delay in Tokyo. They said it was because of  weather in Beijing, I checked the weather in Beijing to Tokyo when she was flying and the weather was beautiful. But if there was weather problems that is not where my complaint is. She had to catch a connecting flight to her home town on a different carrier. So the delay caused her to miss that flight. They told her in Tokyo that they would take care of it ( very poor English) they should have better speaking English employees if they are going to fly from the U.S. So she got to Manila went to the ticketing counter of Japan Air to get another flight to her home town. Nope said they could not help her because it was not Japan air (they don't fly to her home town) I called Japan air while she was in Tokyo and they told me they would accommodate her. They also told her that an hour and a half connecting to Air Asia was not enough time to get there? That's irrelevant, however It's in the same terminal and it has only taken me 10 minutes to get there when we have done that trip before. So the guy at the counter said that he could get her a flight for $40 to her home town because they work with that airline. He went on the internet to find her one? $102 (I could have done that and cheaper) I spoke with him too, poor English and rude, like he did not care. So in the end she went to the Air Asia Terminal (took 10 minutes to get there) and had to buy another ticket that was 6 hours out and it took 2 hours for nothing at the Japan ticket counter. Lies, Lies, Lies. I will never fly on Japan airline.

title: Very Disappointed
review_text: Food, awful.  Yes, many Japanese traveling to the US and food reflected that but many Americans traveling back home.  Felt the plane was just dirty.  I didn't take the plastic bag off the pillow (put my jacket between my head and pillow) and wouldn't use the blanket.  I usually wipe down tray table and things I might touch, but this time, I wanted to wipe down the seat and walls between seats.  If anything really necessary was said by the flight attendants or pilot, we would never know because we couldn't hear or understand either.  NEVER AGAIN

title: Don’t Do It !
review_text:
My fiancé & I flew business class London/ Manila July 2. We had to change airports in Tokyo ie landed in Haneda & transfer to Narita.
Fine we knew there would be some disruption but we were not prepared for the complete lack of service from JAL! Upon check in at Heathrow we were assured that the transfer was common occurrence and would happen seamlessly, in fact there would be someone to meet the flight and aid us since we had to get through immigration & collect our bags considering we were business.
The check in at Heathrow wasn’t professional & up to the standards of most font line International carriers ( they share veryl limited facilities with BA ).
So I boarded in London with some misgivings which I expressed to the purser. She allayed my fears stating the transfer was common practice & would radio ahead. So now the flight was great, food good, service excellent 11 hours of top class flight.
Disembarked to find no one waiting for us, approached one attendant holding a little card & was told to go through immigration, collect our bags, go to the bus counter & buy a ticket for Narita. 
WHAT A BUN FIGHT .... it took an hour fifteen to get through the queue only to be told we were at the wrong counter! Half an hour later we got to the carousel to collect our bags. To their credit (our bags last to be collected) they had an attendant with the bags. I explained our predicament and was told to go through into the concourse and buy a bus ticket.
NO ROOM ON THE BUS......FULL 2 & HALF HOURS LEFT  NO JAL STAFF WITHIN COOWEE.
I had to leave my fiancé (who was totally stressed) with the baggage & go upstairs to arrivals in order to attempt to sort out the situation.... NO HELP TOLD TO TAKE A TAXI.
By this stage our connecting flight was due to take off in just under 3 hours.
TAXI DRIVER WAS GREAT HE REALISED THE GRAVITAS OF OUR SITUATION & SPED TO NARITA 
He did what JAL should have done. Cost of cab AUD $370
Eventually got through, boarded to be told no Western food they had run out! Don’t give me that sitting in 3D in a half empty business class .... no Western food came aboard..There is more but I’ve bored you enough don’t touch JAL  unless you’re desperate.... good if nothing out of the ordinary happens but no backup .... a disgrace. I travel heaps and without doubt the worst Asian airline.

title: Amazing Premium Economy
review_text: What a great place to be for 10+ hours. Premium Economy on this flight was excellent with great entertainment, comfortable seats and cabin crew that care.

title: Amazing experience
review_text: We flew by Japan airlines for the first time as we usually take Emirates. We were amazed how excellent the service was. All the air hostesses were very friendly and helpful. Food was great and the seating was very comfortable. The fare was much cheaper than Emirates but quality of service was much better. Also for economy class, passengers are allowed to take two bags of 23 kg each plus hand luggage 10kg.  We definitely will advise to fly with this airline and this will be our first airline of choice.

title: Terrific flight!!
review_text: JAL is a terrific airline and their business class is pretty impressive.  Starting with the lounge at JFK which was way more than I expected -- great food, relaxing atmosphere and a self-serve bar.  Boarding was quick and easy and the onboard staff could not have been nicer or more attentive.  The business class seats are staggered...meaning you do not have to bother the person next to you when getting in and out of your seat.  The seats also flatten to a bed.  (A nice plus on a 15 hour flight!)  I was lucky enough to get a window seat.  The window seats are very private, especially when you raise the divider between you and the next seat.  The aisle seats in business class can feel a little busy with aisle traffic.  Both food and service were amazing.  I love that they have Asian and Western choices on the menu.  (I kinda tried them all!!...and they were all great!)  A lot of great choices for in-flight entertainment.  You have to pay for internet and it's not cheap.  There are also some great little amenities onboard.  I will definitely be flying with them again.

title: Top Airline
review_text: I have flown on JAL before but it has been a number of years ago. I forgot how great the service is on this airline. All of the flight attendants are focused on making your flying experience an enjoyable one! As a result, this flight seemed to be shorter than I thought it would be. I have decided to use JAL more often when I fly to asia in the future.

title: Best Flight Ever
review_text: This was the best flight I have ever been on. In the beginning, I wasn't looking forward to the 10 hour flight, but, it was very good. The service was amazing, they serve 2 hot meals in the 10 hour flight, drink no cost, hot towels served before you get your meals, ect..... Another thing that is great is, the Japanese people and how they travel. Every time you get on an airplane with a bunch of Canadians and Americans in is a painful experience (I am Canadian). The Canadians and Americans don't know how to act, as soon as the flight is in the air they are standing up and digging in the overhead compartments, or letting their young kids run up and down the isles and walk around staring and invading others space. The movies on the flight were all free and all new releases with many to chose from. Getting on and off the plane was very organized. It was a very pleasant experience.

title: couldn't be better
review_text: When we checked in for our flight we were told we would not be seated together , but after my wife told them it was my 60th birthday and she would like to sit together we were told we will see what we could do, when boarding the flight we were greeted by " it's a double celebration we upgraded you too premium economy and we have bought you a present, a lovely hip flask from Harrods, the flight was lovely and the food and wine couldn't be any better, at the end of the flight the cabin crew gave me another gift ' a model of the plane with happy birthday and flight number written on the top' all together a great experience from Japan airlines.

title: Very comfortable
review_text: First time on this airline and was really  surprised  at how nice it was for an economy  ticket. Big seats lots of leg room. Food was better than most airlines,and served  with real silverware.  Service was outstanding,  I really  thought I was in premium  economy  class.Plane looked like a new one. I would fly again no problem.  Check in was quick and easy. Very nice service for economy  class.

title: Great Experience
review_text: Fantastic crew, greta food. Very comfortable seat/flat bed. Used miles to get the First Class experience. Great value!

title: Japan Airlines - OK for the long haul
review_text: The premium economy seats were comfortable for a long flight.  The facilities were clean.  The food was good. The Staff was friendly and courteous.  The entertainment was OK.

title: Amazing.
review_text: Overall i will highly recommend. They have great seats and they also offer free use of their lounge which comes with a shower.

title: Domestic flight in Japan
review_text:
Boarding was quick,crew was efficient,the airplane a South American plane wasn’t comfortable, didn’t feel safe
It was a short flight ,due to heavy turbulence I was sick but the crew just ignored it
I was happy wh3n I could get of the plane

title: Great Airline!
review_text: My first long international flight and it was Great! The space was good, chairs were as good as you can get for economy, entertainment great (all the movies etc.), food and beverage service was great. I didn't get to pick my meal since they were all gone, however I was extremely surprised by my seafood dish which was excellent. I enjoyed the staff, they were very nice and made me feel comfortable. I would definitely fly on (JAL) again.

title: Excellent flight
review_text: Comfortable flight, lovely professional staff and definitely the best airline food I've ever had.  The plane had a nice area with drinks and biscuits that you could access between meals and I felt comfortable moving about the cabin.

title: Excellent flight
review_text: Just flew JAL to Japan for a two week holiday.  Direct flights from Melbourne to Tokyo.  The flight staff are very professional and make sure everyone has what they need.  On the flight home the food was delicious.  The food was designed by a top winning chef.  I chose the vegetarian curry option that included 3 salads and desert followed by ice-cream.  Before we landed we got a make yourself burger which was also a novel idea and delicious.  Would fly JAL again.

title: honestly the most terrible, worst service
review_text: I haven't even flown, but the ground service is appalling! Whilst confirming my flight information everything looked fine, correct and ready to go so pop i confirmed it. Turns out after picking my seats my names are magiclly misspelled, while on 2 different forms of confirmations i have correct spelling. Took me 2 hours to even connect to a human being. When i finally connected i was treated as if i was stupid and badgered at for making sure my name was correct, i have screen shots and copies of my confirmations with correct spelling. Ive been waiting 4 days stressing over this whole ordeal. They cant manage to help ease this tension, it seems as if theyre so set on just waiting untill its too late to cancel where my fees will double! This whole time i havent been treated as a paying customer , but rather a criminal. I dont suggest using this airline at all, the inflight service could be good but i wouldnt know. I cant even manage to get my tickets fixed.

title: Excellent service, fantastic food
review_text:
Very good service, friendly staff and the food was delicious. JAL has engaged world class chefs to develop their in-flight menu and I appreciate it. My only complaint is it felt that I had slightly less leg room than Air Canada. I'm nearly 6'2 though so I always feel a little squished.

I was traveling with my visibly pregnant wife and the staff at JAL in the airport and on the aircraft treated her very well and ensured she was given priority without us having to ask. It not only made us feel special, it was nice to see that the airline values family and is happy to accommodate the slightly more difficult task of flying around in that condition.

title: Best flight to japan.
review_text:
I have been flight to Japan many times, and tired various airlines such as British Airways, SAS and Finnair. 
Japan Airlines is by far better than any of the others. The service is on a whole different level. The staff is very polite, respectful and helpful. the flight is a lot calmer and passes faster. The food is excellent, even in economy. Worth every penny.

title: Best Service Airline among one world group
review_text: Experienced world round trip on One World Group, AY, BA, AA and JAL. AY's new A350 C class seat was comfortable and flight attendant were friendly. Food and drink were standard. BA flight inside Europe, even it was very short flight, they served food and drink efficiently. Just worked for service in time. Then BA long flight, C Class seat arrangement is not very comfortable because seat side by side are sitting looking each other. Space among seat was minimal. BA lounge at Heathrow was good. AA service inside USA was minimum. Poor food and drink service same as other US base airline. After these flight experiencs, JAL flight from San Francisco to Haneda was the best, check in, lounge service, inflight food and drink and flight attendant. When you have choice among One World flight, my recommendation is use JAL.

title: First but not last time flying Japan Airlines!!!
review_text: We flew on two separate JAL flights, one Bangkok to Tokyo, one Tokyo o Seattle. We really enjoyed both of these flights. Though any airlines economy seats suck for legroom, sorry. It seats shouldn’t recline when it’s this tight. We adored the flight attendants on both flights, friendly, efficient. Food was OK. I ordered gluten free and all 3 meals were fish, which I enjoyed. But their idea of fruit was two separate dishes of the same melon, ugh. But we would definitely fly JAL again.

title: Service
review_text: The service you get from the crew members were excellent. They were very polite in every way. Also, little things like a free toothbrush in the toilet helped a lot. The toilet was always kept clean by the staff.

title: Perfect Flight
review_text: Only 88 seats in economy in their 787 so the space is maximized to give extra pitch and larger seats ..nearly premium..Food and staff stunning as expected in any japanese business .It was a really great flight ..I will certainly fly again on JAL

title: Long haul Narita to San Diego, Sky Suite seats instead of Shell Flat Neo
review_text:
I took the long haul flight from Tokyo Narita to San Diego on JAL 66.  I flew in from Bangkok and had a short connection time of one hour to make the flight scheduled for departure at 5:20 pm, but found that the San Diego flight was delayed as there had been a gate change from one end of the terminal to the other.  As a result, boarding was delayed and we pushed back about 15 minutes late.  There was a long wait for takeoff due to the many flights taking off from Narita at that time of the evening, and it was around 6:20 pm before we took off.  

The flight was operated using a B787-800.  On boarding, I was pleasantly surprised that the plane was outfitted with JAL's Sky Suite fully flat seats instead of the angled flat Shell Flat Neo seat that I expected based on Seatguru.  The Sky Suite seat is wonderful - not only does it convert to a fully flat bed, but there are also narrow shelves and counters all around the seat and little storage nooks here and there, plus storage under the legrest for a carry on bag.  

Meal service on the flight was dinner, which was delayed and then service interrupted part way due to turbulence.  After the main meal was served, many snack or second meal options were available for any time service according to the menu - salad, JAL trademark curry, ramen or udon, sandwiches, cheeses, Japanese and Western set plates - the choices were too plentiful to sample even on a long haul flight.  For dinner, I had the Japanese meal, which featured seared Wagyu beef and grilled black cod.  Before the appetizers and main was served, there was also a really delicious amuse buche of sesame tofu with wasabi and sweet corn flan with sea urchin.  Cabin staff asked me whether I wanted to be woken for the second meal prior to arrival and I opted to be woken and ordered the Japanese plate with roast beef roll.  Eventhough both meals had miso soup, the two soups were very different ones, a thoughtful touch in variety.  As always, the meals on JAL were delicious and beautiful to behold.

Notwithstanding a very turbulent flight with the seat belt sign turned on repeatedly, I managed several periods of good sleep of a couple of hours each.  JAL has added an airweave mattress pad for sleeping.  These were stored in the overhead bins and when I was ready to sleep, I unzipped the package and the pad folded out easily to cover the seat converted to a bed.  I thought the pad - probably about an inch thick - did make a difference in making the seat more comfortable as a bed.  

Despite the delayed boarding from the change of gates and the long wait for takeoff due to Narita traffic, the flight arrived in San Diego only about 15 minutes late.  

I enjoyed the flight very much and thought the many choices for any time dining after the main meal service and the airweave mattress pad which JAL has added made the flight even more enjoyable than prior long haul JAL flights I have taken.  Would love to repeat this long haul experience if flying on the same route again.

title: Good Morning Flight and JAL Sakura Lounge Suvarnabhumi
review_text:
I took an early morning flight from Bangkok (Suvarnabhumi) to Tokyo Narita on Japan Airlines (booked as American Airlines AA8412).  As the flight is scheduled for 8:05 am, I arranged for a 5 am car from the Millennium Hilton Bangkok which arrived around 5:35 am due to the light traffic that early in the morning.  After a quick and courteous check in at the JAL First Class check in from my One World Alliance status, I used the priority security lane to quickly pass through passport control and was in JAL's Sakura lounge.  The lounge is very large and as JAL did not have many flights early in the morning, it was mostly empty.  There is a full buffet of food including Western eggs and sausage but also Japanese offerings like yellowtail and daikon, kelp in soy sauce, sweet potatoes, cooked jelly mountain vegetables, Japanese style buns stuffed with noodles and more.  (Not that I needed the food as the Millennium Hilton Bangkok thoughtfully put together a packed breakfast with ham and cheese sandwich, pastry breads, fruit and orange juice).  The lounge has a good view of the departure gates and the runway.  

The flight was operated using a B787-800, configured 2X2X2 in business class with angle flat seats (Shell Flat Neo).  We pushed back on time at 8:05 am.  Flight time was estimated to be 5  hours 35 minutes and we arrived on time at 4:18 pm.  

Meal service was lunch shortly after take off and drink service.  I opted for the Japanese meal since I generally find the Japanese meals better than the Western ones on JAL.  I was not disappointed as the meal was delicious.  

I found the angled flat seat actually quite comfortable for napping, and, as long as I positioned myself at the correct place on the angled flat seat, I did not slide down on the seat.  It is also relatively wide.  I had seat 1D, the first row, so I did not have the cabinet in front of me with the video monitor that other rows have and therefore it was very easy to exit from the seat.  Legroom was also very good in the first row.  The video monitor for first row seats has to be retrieved out of the armrest and is smaller than for the other rows.  However, the entertainment system for JAL is not its strongest point anyway so it did not bother me (JAL has a smaller range of English movie choices than other airlines and most of the movies in other languages have Japanese as a subtitle choice instead of English). 

As always, service on Japan Airlines is superb and courteous, and the washrooms are kept very tidy by constant cleaning by the cabin crew.  

Overall, no complaints and a very enjoyable early morning flight.

title: Could not reserve seats and have to sit separately from travelling partner
review_text: Be warned that Japan airlines does not allow reserved seats for economy class. Was allocated 2 seats which were separated from my travelling partner. They have very poor seat allocation system as the person beside me was a single traveler and they could have just made the seat arrangement for people travelling to sit together instead of separate. Not worth the price paid as could have got better service and seats on other airlines such as Singapore airlines at similar price.

title: $1,345 Dollars GONE!
review_text: The travel agent that I was working through for this flight booked the wrong date for the flight. When they tried to change it, JAL refused to do anything about it, even though it was a mistake, and I caught the mistake within 24 hours. After repeated attempts by myself and the travel agent responsible, JAL still refused. I offered to pay whatever fee was necessary to fix the flight dates, but their customer service refused to listen to my situation. They had an appalling lack of willingness to help me with a situation that was out of my hands. I can't use the flight on the day it was booked, so now I have effectively paid $1,345 dollars for NOTHING. As good as they are at the flight itself, I cannot recommend this airline because of their customer service. They were totally willing to make me pay for a completely new flight.

title: Great flight and experience
review_text:
Great flight and experience. 
Started with the lounge, enjoyed the Admirals Club in NRT airport.  Great customer service working on the seats for my family (4 ppl).  Not sure why, but in the reservation my family got split up, so we had to work on that.  
Mostly accommodating, were able to get me and two kids near, and then wife two rows ahead.  Worked well enough.  
Customer service on boarding and in-flight was excellent.  Kids got toys, and flight attendants were very friendly to them.  
Best parts of the flight.
1) Yamazaki whiskey
2) Seats I fit in to sleep. 
3) Food. 

Yes, the food and drink probably the highlight of the flight.  
They served a Wagyu beef, was excellent.  Not just regular tenderloin, this was a legit Wagyu cut steak.  Fortunately I was able to eat mine, and then my kids already asleep, I had to suffer with their portions.  Didn't want the food to go to waste.  
And the Yamazaki to wash it down was wonderful. 

I have another JAL flight booked next month, and I am very much looking forward to it!!

title: Average
review_text:
This is my first review for JAL.  
Checking was ok, the check in person was not the most friendly.  When I said items are fragile she made me sign the tag and said "airline not responsible", when I said the items are good now, so it is their responsibility if they are broken, she gave me a lot of lip in return.  Not the best first impression. 
Luckily, nothing was broken and cases were just fine. 

The flight itself was good.  Family and I slept well.

Flight crew was very nice and friendly with the kids.   Gave them gifts. 

I liked that the crew did not wake us up for food, but rather asked us before we fell asleep if we wanted food or not.  

Hakushu whiskey on board!  

Most importantly, I am 6'4".  And I fit in the lay down seats.  Very comfortable.

title: Comfortable aircraft, Average customer service
review_text: We had a comfortable flight from Sydney to Tokyo. The aircraft was new dreamliner with sufficient legroom, comfy seats and good interior ambience. In-flight food was at average level as compared to Qantas/SQ on this route. Also, We felt that the in-flight crew were bit 'lost' in their attempt to provide the best service. Overall, an average experience and value for the money we paid for our discounted fare flights.

title: Good seats, but service and food are wanting
review_text: We had high expectations for JAL on this flight, but were let down by the service and the food. As a non fish eater, I was disappointed to note that the second meal was only a fish option (absolutely no alternatives, which meant we didn’t get a meal) and then the whole cabin stunk of fish making me want to throw up. This is the first time as a platinum frequent flyer of many years that I’ve ever come across this and was severely disappointed. In addition, to add insult to injury, the stewardess singled me and my partner out to put our seats up (don’t have any problem with this during the meal service, but they did not ask the couple in front of us to put their seats up, which left us cramped and squashed). Overall, although the product is not too bad, I would not recommend flying JAL

title: Good Service but the food could be better
review_text: Very good service, and the staff was extremely courteous and friendly. However, the food left a lot to be desired. I have experienced this in the past as well when I have flown with Japan Airlines. If JAL improved the quality of their food they would get a top rating from me.

title: Japan Airlines and Airport
review_text:
Japan Airlines, the most systematic airlines which i ever had. The ground staff are so friendly to assist whatever doubrs we had.
Even the airplane which the seats are so confortable in legs space compare to other airlines.
Moreover the Japan Airport its so covenient weather its in Nagoya Chubu Airport or Haneda International Airport or Narita international Airport. Easily find the hotel nearby and even in the airport, easily can see the direction board to tell you the train station, limousine directions etc. 
So convenient, easy to find and no stress during your travel.

title: Bangkok-Kansaii-Bangkok
review_text:
It was round trip from Bangkok to Osaka recently. 2-4-2 seat allocation. Brand new airplane (window is electronic sunshade). Seat pit is wide legroom is good if you’re average height.Pro: Cleanliness, politeness of Crew services, In flight entertainment. It was a 6 hours of comfortable trip.
Con:Meal, they served on Economy just only one choice and their taste is below average even miso soup.
For anything else, can’t complain! Compare with their competitors like Thai Airways, ANA. JAL is in the middle. It is one of the good choices for your Japan trip.

title: Flawless Regional Economy Product and Experience
review_text:
It has been more than 15 years since I last flew JAL.  I had to go from Japan Narita airport to Kaohsiung after arriving from the US. Given the schedule, I had two choices - the LCC Vanilla Air or JAL.  I am glad I chose JAL despite the slightly higher fare. 
Boarding started on time (to a remote stand via bus).  The flight was operated by an older 767-300ER, but it has been retrofitted with larger luggage overhead bins and JAL's award-winning "SkyWider" economy seats.  At 19-inch width and 94-inch pitch, these are probably the best economy seats in the industry in terms space and comfort.  The IFE is also stocked with plenty of movies and music. 
Service is executed with traditional Japanese professionalism and precision.  I noticed some of the crew members were able to speak Mandarin to the Chinese passengers.  Not being a fan of airplane meals, the meal was actually quite good for economy class and it came with a small Haggandaz green tea ice cream!  I don't think you would find that on too many 4-hour regional flights. 
We arrived at our destination on time.  Although I was quite tired from having just flown in from the US (and got virtually no sleep), I still found this JAL flight to be a pleasant one

title: Efficiency and professionalism
review_text: Detail-oriented cabin, extremely comfortable seats. Professional cabin crew and excellent food choices.

title: Poor Service for JAL's Most Loyal Customers
review_text:
I've been flying JAL Executive Class (Business Class) since 1988 and have visited Japan more than 20 times. Since joining the JAL Mileage Bank (something I didn't do for many years), I've spent over $100,000.00 on JAL. I always appreciated the fact that if I booked over the phone they would allow me to reserve flights well in advance (about ten months) and I would not have to pay until two weeks prior to the flight.
Not once did I ever cancel those flights. I always honoured my arrangements with JAL. I am a 'Sapphire Tier' customer, for all the good it does me.
Now JAL, in their wisdom, have decided that there is no more 'buy now, pay later' deal. In other words, they have seriously downgraded their level of customer service.
Certainly I can appreciate that there are some potential customers who cancel their bookings late. I however am not one of those people. My loyalty to JAL and the fortune I have spent on them over the years means nothing to them. They show no loyalty to me. Being a 'Sapphire Tier' customer means you get a shiny blue card and bugger all else.The way JAL treats its best customers is a disgrace.

title: Excellent Service with Little Planning
review_text: Japan Airlines has got really good service both in flight as well as ground. I flew 787 and the seats were really comfortable in Business class, full flat. The crew was really good and helpful. The biggest issue is with the food and beverage on Board. The beer on board is only Ashi which unfortunately is not that good. There are no other international Beer brands. The other drinks are Saki. There are few international brands of Alcohol. As far as Food is concerned,  there are predominantly two choices Japanese and Western on any flight. The Japanese is understandable and is mainly fish and see food. I am allergic to fish and seafood so can't eat it. The other option is western which is   Beef and Fish. Universally on all other airlines it is Chicken and Vegetarian. This shows how much knowledge the featured chef have of the world cuisine. Even on the flights to and from India, which had about 60% Indians, the menu was exactly the same. Most Indians don't eat Beef and lot of them are vegetarian, imagine what will they eat? All airlines cater to the local taste rather than forcing what they like. If you are going to fly JAL, please pre order your meal.

title: Used Transocean Air which is a branch of JAL
review_text: Nice extras like squash and sweets included as part of the service. Check in Bags included in the price of booking up to 20KG which makes it nice and simple and no need to book in additional luggage after paying for the flight. Good times for leaving and departing. We were given an Exit Seat and asked if we would mind which was fine for us.

title: Perfect Dreamliner experience
review_text: Everything about this flight was perfect--from check-in through arrival. Granted it was just a few hours, but you know you're having a great experience when you don't want the flight to end. It was my first time ever on a Dreamliner and I was glad it was on this airline. The aircraft (B787-9B) was squeaky clean, had a modern cabin with new window tinting technology, and 2-3-2 configuration. Legroom was wide, the seat (32K) was comfortable, the IFE screen was large with a good entertainment selection. Excellent service, quality, and efficiency were evident throughout the flight. Food was equally excellent as expected on a Japanese carrier.

title: Great Service
review_text:
I was looking forward to flying JAL because my dad flew with them before and had a good experience.  My concern on this flight was that I bought my ticket separately from the rest of my family and therefore was afraid we could not sit together.  However I give the airline credit for making adjustments so that I could sit with my wife and 2 young children.  The flight was uneventful which is the best type of flight.  Flight attendants were friendly and professional.  They also gave our children JAL souvenirs which made them really happy.

The food wasn't bad.  I had fish which was moist and tasty.  The seats had plenty of legroom.  In-flight entertainment was all right but most of it was geared towards Japanese passengers.

Overall I was glad to have flown with JAL and had a pleasant experience.

title: Comfortable for a relatively long flight on a new airplane
review_text: From checkin to modifying seat assignments and meals served, JAL has a very comfortable package with excellent service.  My main complaint it that the movie selection was limited, especially as the origin was in the U.S.  However, I compensated by listening to some of my favorite classical music.

title: On time and good service
review_text:
* Very professional and helpful though we were unlucky when we were checked in as a Trainee was doing it and she made some mistakes and took us quite a bit of time to complete check in.  
* Aircraft was very clean.
* Food PRESENTATION was absolutely great and food was decent
* landing was good and on time.

title: Japan Airlines flight Sydney to Narita – Business Class
review_text:
Check-in was quick - being 5.30am there weren’t too many people around.  The attendant allocated our seats as selecting them online wasn’t available to us. At the Boarding Gate we were in the Priority Queue which didn’t take long to board the aircraft.
The aircraft (787-9) was quite good and had a good feel to it.  We were seated in Business “Open Suites” and in a middle row (side-by-side with a divider between us).
On our seats were a pillow, menu, blanket, slippers and an Amenities bag which contained a toothbrush, tissues, moisture mask, steam eye mask, lip balm and ear plugs.
I was taking photos of the Business Class cabin (as you do) and the flight attendant offered to take a photo of us which was a nice touch.
The “Western Menu” had tiny serves of 4 courses being Smoked Salmon & Fennel Soybeans; Tandoori Chicken followed by Asparagus Tart; Seared Tuna Sashimi Agrodoice; Shrimp with Chia Seed Sauce.  Mains was either Roasted Duck Leg (with Jus Sauce) or Beef Fillet Steak (with Brown Butter Balsamic Sauce, Migas Dip & Wild Rice Gratin).  Dessert was Blueberry Cake.  
Bottles of water were available throughout the flight as were the items on the “Anytime You Wish” menu.
Entertainment had a good selection and the movies were quite recent.
All the flight attendants were friendly and respectful.  Overall an enjoyable 10hr flight.

title: Business class on new 787-900 is just average
review_text: JAL's 787-900 Business class cabin configuration is almost as bizarre as British Airways. Access to the window seats is via a very narrow lane; even a moderate size person has to turn sideways to get through. Only the window-side aisle seats have any accessible storage. All the others have storage behind the headrest which means you have to get out of the seat to access !  On this particular flight, food was very average in choice and quality. Service was - OK.

title: Plenty of legroom
review_text: This is the first time we have flown JAL and we had a great flight with plenty of legroom. The Flight attendants were friendly and the restrooms were kept clean during the flight. Meals were above average. No hesitation in flying with them again

title: Pleasant flight
review_text: Our flight with Japan Airlines was all that we could have wanted.  The aircraft was very clean and the seats comfortable.  The staff were immaculate and very respectful catering to all our needs.  We enjoyed the food with a choice of Japanese or western and liked being provided with warm refresher towels twice during the flight.  The toilets were clean and toothbrushes and razors were available.

title: the service standard is always there…
review_text:
We have taken many JAL flights to-fro Japan in our annual 3~4 times to Nihon.  Our feel is always the International flights are better than the Domestic ones overall, oops…Nevertheless would like to share the most recent trip experience in late-May when we took JAL38 from SG to HND.
A red-eye flight it is 7+ hours journey. The embarking and check-in was good, as other Airlines.  The takeoff was on time and orderly.  Inside the cabin the seat legroom and Aisle spacing was respectable, especially for us Asian.  But agreed with some TA reviewers that the inflight entertainment is only average.  Movies are ok, not too dated but the Audio is mainly Japanese and Korean.  If English be prepared for more selection of “oldies” songs than contemporary.  The Chinese selection is minimal.  Though there is a personal entertainment screen/page the programs are all in Japanese..    
Meal wise always something to look forward to.  It is probably in Japanese airlines that they serve warm miso soup, really refreshes us, beside the hot/cold green tea.
Just like to highlight an incident that I believe speaks volume of their good customer service.  It was mid-way through the flight and light were off (resting time).  I was thirsty so I approached them for a warm water.  Minutes later the air stewardess came back with one, and with a lid cover over it!   Apparently worry that it will spill and/or ensuing the temperature will not drop so quick.  A small gesture but I take it very positively.!
We will continue taking JAL if the timing slot is good, and also believed all passengers will continue to receive attention and good service throughout their journey.   

title: Crew was attentive and amazing
review_text:
Overall experience with Japan Airlines has always been good as their crew is warm and friendly, as what Japanese usually portray themselves to be. On this return flight from Narita to Singapore, the crew serving the aisle I was sitting at was especially attentive to my kids. 
The food on Japan Airlines is always good 👍🏻 Even a simple porridge dish for breakfast can be made so amazing

title: I love JAL
review_text: Always a joy flying with them. The crew is always pleasant. The airline always selects a catering company which prepares super small neat portions but very yummy. I love passing through Narita or Haneda airports in Japan. Please fly with JAL. Hands down one of the best out there

title: Japan Airline
review_text: I would say this is one of the best airlines I have flown with. The entertainment has current and older movies and games for kids . Good was great and the cabin crew were very friendly and efficient. They couldn't do enough for you . Price return from Melbourne was very reasonable as we managed to get their first birthday specialfrom Melbourne to Tokyo for $709. I hope to fly with them again

title: Not pleasant :(
review_text:
I was on a short flight, just under 2 hours.

Everything seemed okay until I requested a blanket.
At first, the staff was handing out the blankets walking down the aisle and I asked for one.  It was not wrapped in a plastic bag, I thought it was a bit odd, but took it anyways.  When I looked at it, there was a stain on it, so I handed it back telling the staff that it was no longer needed.

Then, after takeoff, it got quite chilly inside the cabin, so I requested a blanket again hoping that they wouldn’t bring be the one with a stain this time.  Fortunately, they handed me a different blanket, I was very relieved, but when I took it in my hand, I smelled this horrible filthy smell...  at first, I tried using it just cover my legs, but i couldn’t bare the smell. 

I just don’t understand why they wouldn’t notice this smell before handing out... it was disgusting and I so regretted touching it.

After that, everything in the cabin seemed filthy and dirty and I felt very very uncomfortable.

title: Premium Economy that is truly Premium
review_text:
The Routes Flown:  LAX-Narita, Hong Kong -Haneda, Narita-LAX

Cabin:  Premium Economy

The Equipment- 777-300 ER 4 cabin layout and 777-200 3 cabin system 

Check In- Separate Fast and Efficient Check in for premium economy passengers at LAX and Hong Kong and Narita.  Bags get priority. GOOOOOOOOOOOOD!!!

Lounge Access LAX-  As a premium passenger you get lounge access at LAX but JAL does contract with a basic lounge provider at Tom Bradley.  Not as good as Norwegian Premium Economy passengers getting the One World Business lounge.    But the JAL Lounge at LAX is in my opinion way better than most Plaza Premium and Priority Pass Lounges I have been too around the world.  Also Virgin Atlantic PE passengers dont get a lounge and neither do AIR New Zealand passengers.  THE Los Angeles Lounge has some sandwiches, cup of noodles, snacks, a small outside seating area, good wife and BOOOOOOOOOOOZE.  Enjoy.  GOOD

The Lounge JAL contracts with at  Hong Kong is Qantas Business and this lounge is the BOMB.COM.  It is a very very very big, comfortable lounge.  Way better than any business lounge at LAX or SFO or JFK or Newark.  PE passengers on JAL get to use this lounge.  Amazing!  Food is good, alcohol selection is good (not as varied as One World lounge LAX) but the FOOD is way better than what they serve at LAX One World Business Lounge.

The Flagship Sakura Lounge NARITA-GOOOOOOOOOOOOOD  better than most US airlines international lounge and AA Admiral Club lounges.  AS PE you Get access. Food is good, booze is good.

The Seats-  42 inches of pitch Gooooooood.  Better than United PE, American, Virgin, all of ANA, some of Air New Zealand, most of cathay pacific fleet but not as generous as Norwegian (Norwegian offers 43 or 46 depending on the equipment flying) but the seat is very functional and spacious and you will have enough legroom.  The controversial thing about the seat is that it slides forward to recline rather than slides back.  Frankly for a premium economy product, nothing beats the recline on Norwegian PE seats and their pitch is good too.  So I was not a fan of the JAL recline but they make up for it in so many ways.

JAL FA's:  They are the best in the world besides the gulf carriers.  They are prompt friendly and kind and willing to serve.

The Food:  You will NOT starve on a JAL PE Flight.  Snack after snack, Udon De Sky, Probably the best economy food offered in the sky (not enhanced food like Virgin or Air New Zeleand) but when you have lounge access you tend to have your meals at the lounge instead of eating on the flight unless your flying a solid business class like Qatar Airways or Turkish Airlines business catering.  Again for economy food it is pretty good..  Also you get Hagen Daz icecream and snack after snack after snack.  GOOOOOOOOOOOD.  My advice is EAT AT THE LOUNGE and if the food is good eat the airline meal.  But enjoy all the yummy snacks and Udon de Sky and the Hagen Daz

Overall:  I will fly JAL again.  I normally fly business class when going overseas but when I am paying for 5 people and not traveling alone PE is the Way to go with JAL.

title: Best
review_text: Japan for tourism is awesome . Friendly. Safe. Go with proper planning to enjoy. Not that expensive as people think . There’s an agent at delhi who does good planning . If anyone wants her link I can give .

title: Comfortable flight but boring
review_text:
The flight was on time and orderly. Boarding is straight forward though security clearance and luggage check in took a while. Advise jal domestic pax to be at the luggage check in counters 45mins before take off instead.
The inflight entertainment is 0/10. Everything is in Japanese though you have a personal entertainment screen.. But the programs are all in Japanese.. Is not movies or anything.. Just some Japanese travel program which I did not understand a peep. 
Even the Jal WiFi programs on gogo system were all in Japanese and very limited. 

Flight is comfortable and the gifts for kids is interesting and well liked by the kids. I chose Jal so because of the super early program which cost me less than 150usd per pax both ways.

title: Always aware of your wellbeing
review_text: Now I live in Moscow and always travel by this company, the attention they provide is of very high quality, regardless of the kind of seat you have. Punctuality (Japanese) is something that is very much appreciated in these times, and, this company, knows it perfectly. In all my trips I have always had very good experience with the menu (you can choose between 2 options) and the combinations and flavors are of very good quality. And do not forget the appetizers that help you taste meals better. In one of my trips my suitcase broke down, and when I went to pick it up from the conveyor there was a person from the company waiting for me with the bad news, however they gave me at the time a new suitcase with the apologies of the case. Yes I don't change JAL for other.

title: Top class
review_text:
After having a terrible experience with Qantas flying into Osaka, we were happy to be on a different airline heading home.
JAL actually exceeded our expectations in regards  to their welcome, their craft, their service and the quality of their food. First time ever I’ve eaten and enjoyed an airline meal! In stark contrast to Qantas staff, nothing was too much trouble, and they were constantly up and down the aisles with coffee, tea, green tea and water.
Upon landing, staff were at the baggage carousel offering help and directions to anybody who needed it.
I highly recommend JAL

title: Great experience
review_text: Fly with JAL for the 1st time and I really have a great and pleasant journey with their excellent services and also the ontime schedule. Hope I can have another flight with

title: Horrible customer service!!!  I will never fly JAL!!
review_text: So I bought a round trip ticket for my girlfriend from MNL to NRT airport, with my US credit card.  She had no problems flying from Manila to Tokyo.  But a few days before her return flight, JAL cancelled her flight.  They told her I needed to go to the airport in the USA to show them the credit card I used to purchase the tickets.  Not is this a tremendous hassle, since the airport is not that close to me, but I don't even have enough time to go to the airport now before her return flight back, because this is so last minute, and I have to work.  And they also said that they won't issue any refunds for the ticket too.  I think they should at least refund half the price of the ticket; but actually should probably be the full price given the great hassle and inconvenience!  Now she had to buy a different last minute ticket to fly back to the Phillipines, and that ticket is very expensive.

title: Love it
review_text: Love the Japanese service quality. So polite and helpful. Great food on board too. If there is pyjamas, it would be perfect.

title: Convenient flights with excellent services
review_text: Everything was excellent even for the economy class passenger, the pillow they provided was just wonderful for supporting your neck, whereas the only part I did not like is the windows of the 787 aircraft.

title: Ruined baggage and clothes. Worst customer service
review_text:
I’m not one to write a review unless it’s incredible or atrocious. This experience was the latter. 

This was the first time I flew Japan Airlines, after hearing about their amazing customer service experiences from my friends who live in Asia. Sadly, I have to say it was one of the greatest disappointments of my flying experience that I've had. 

My luggage was damaged somewhere from JFK to KHH, via NRT. There was some type of oily liquid that was spilled on my black luggage, which I later discovered had seeped into my bag and ruined my clothes. Japan Airlines obviously knew about the spill, as my baggage came out onto the baggage claim carousel wrapped in a pink plastic bag. I didn't think anything of it, since I thought maybe they had covered it due to severe weather/rain. It also had a strong, foul smelling odor when I took it out of the plastic, but again, I just thought it may have been the plastic. Bag felt dry, and I couldn't see liquid damage since my bag is black. When I got to the hotel, I opened my bag to find my belongings soaked and stained in an awful smelling liquid. Photos and videos were taken immediately. I also washed my handbags and clothes as quickly as I could to prevent permanent damage. 

We contacted Japan Airlines the next day and spoke to their customer service at Kaoshiung Airport. We submitted all my travel documents, the baggage tags and boarding pass, along with my photos and videos of damages. Even though they covered my luggage with plastic, they are refusing to accept fault. The only compensation they are willing to give me is a cheap replacement luggage that doesn't even compare to mine, and they refuse to take responsibility for my damaged hand bags and clothes. No dry cleaning; no allowance for clothing (which is frustrating since the majority of what I brought is now ruined and unwearable); and no compensation for the inconvenience they've caused.

Needless to say, Japan Airlines has lost my business. I would NEVER fly with them again. My biggest regret is that I could've saved $300 and flown with Cathay Pacific.

title: Name typo--no help#$! Ticket is unusable.
review_text:
We purchased an air ticket for my wife to travel to visit family in Tokyo, Japan, on JAL. The ticket was purchased via GoToGate travel - purchased on 4/3/2019 for travel beginning on 6/25/2019 at a cost of approximately $1200.  Unfortunately, after booking and upon inspection of her travel document, she discovered a typographical error in her first name.  On the ticket, her first name (four letters) has an extra letter (ii instead of i) rather than the correct spelling. We're not sure how this happened, and were quite surprised to see it.

We made repeated attempts to rectify this situation and get the typo corrected.  We contacted GoToGate by phone and email multiple times.  We contacted JAL by phone and email multiple times.  We drove to the airport in San Diego and asked for help at the JAL desk.  We contacted Alaska Air.  Though our efforts did receive some replies, none were satisfactory.  The typo remains on the ticket.

Given the fact that TSA or the Airline may stop her at Airport Security Screening, or stop her  from boarding the flight, she is not willing to use the ticket.  

Therefore, we have requested a full refund for the amount of the ticket, minus an appropriate handling fee, so that her booking via Go To Gate on Alaska and JAL will available, and so that some other passenger may book travel on the seat.

We believe that the airline and the travel agency have a moral obligation and responsibility to serve customers to the best of their abilities, and to rectify this kind of situation.  Moreover, both the airline, the travel agency, and other customers stand to benefit by allowing the seat to be used by another customer.

We are aware of the airline policies and practices regarding refunds and changes, yet we believe certain situations are exceptional and require flexibility.  At this point, all we can do is chalk it up to corporate greed and feel a simmering anger over our loss.

title: great service, good legroom in econ
review_text: great flight! The entertainment system has dozens of movies and TV shows to watch which make the flight go by quickly. The service is exceptional and the food was very good for any flight. We flew economy class and had enough leg room. Their other classes of service looked even better. I would absolutely fly JAL again when going back to Japan!

title: Perfect service.
review_text: Japanese airlines is an expensive airline and we would hardly fly them, but you can fly cheap even expensive airlines. Need to play only dates. We flew the next day after the World Cup in Moscow. Thousands flew from Moscow, including to Tokyo, but why fly back? The flight, by the way, was not 100% loaded. We didn`t buy a ticket on The Japanese airlines website, but on the S-7 website, with which they are in code-share. It turned out cheaper than Aeroflot. As it is sung in the famous song: "First of all planes, well and girls then". As ANA, its the main competitor, the Japanese airlines used of Been -787 Dreamliner. We were already flying these planes with Nowegian Airlines in the United States. Despite the current skepticism about Boeing after two catastrophes with the 737 MAX, the Dreamliner is an excellent aircraft with best ergonomics and the notorious smart chameleon portholes. Now about girls. I mean flight attendants. They work great. Smart, sensitive. In short, a role model. There is a simple means to conquer air passengers on long-haul flights is to offer metal Cutlery. I don't know why it's so important, but it works! That on flights on Emirates, that on Japanese airlines. The food is excellent. Breakfast and dinner a sandwich with fruit for lunch. The quality of food 4 and 5 star airlines Skytrax the food is about the same. Equally good. Wine. For some reason, almost always French. If you don't have enough, you can ask for another glass. The entertainment system is good. Movies, novelties and a little classics, games. In General, 9 hours passed unnoticed. The best praise can not come up for long-haul flights.

title: FlywithJAL to US
review_text: Ths is my first time using JAL and it was amazing, from the boarding process, service, very nice and friendly staff willing to help and fulfill your needs. Meals are incredible I got salmon creamy for lunch and ice cream. When take off from jkt i got two yakult. Seat ang legroom is soo nicee very convenient even you are travelling in economy.

title: Best Aircraft I have ever been in..
review_text: A direct flight from Melbourne to Tokyo. The Cabin was spotlessly clean. Ample leg room and the inboard service excellent. The dividing partition separating economy class from Business Class had a window which I believe made the inside of the Aircraft appear much more open and spacious. My seat number was 19c and I believe the plane was a 780 B. I give this Airline my highest recommendation,I flew 3 times on my trip with Japan Airlines and could not fault them in any way..

title: Japan Treats in the Air
review_text: Loving the experienced at JAL. Feels the Japan even before you reach the island. Best economy seat i ever had.

title: Very good and attentive service
review_text: Good comfortable chairs. Everything was extremely well organised. Food was better than average in so far as airline food is concerned. Toilets clean all the time.

title: Excellent service.
review_text: A very fuss free check in by a lovely member of staff. Bags were weighed and on their way in no time. I don’t think it took much more than 5 minutes to be checked in. The flight was fully booked but the plane was efficiently loaded and took off on time. Seats were a little bigger and were great my only thought was I wish they weren’t synthetic. Food served was yummy and we were at our destination right on time. We would definitely fly with JAL again.

title: WOW they know what service is!!!!
review_text:
It was such a pleasure to be treat the really good old fashioned way. Too many airlines have lost their way. They were friendly and obliging on the plane. The two young ladies who helped us off the plane in our two wheel chairs were so helpful. They were patient and strong in handling our four pieces of luggage. They helped us through immigration and customs. All with a smile. They absolutely refused any tip.
Thank you Japan Airlines. I look forward to flying with you again. And look forward to recommending you to everyone.
I wish that I had written down the names of the two wonderful ladies who helped us.

title: Japanese Service at its finest
review_text: Had the pleasure of returning to Japan via JAL business class out of JFK.  Checkin was smooth once the attendant realized my baggage wasn't overweight as she confused LBS and KG.  TSA Pre so security was a breeze and they use the Lufthansa lounge in Terminal 1.  3 different german beers on tap and it's never too early right?  I waited for food for the plane as I knew in business it would be better and was definitly good choice.  Since it was about lunch and I knew I was sleeping immediatly after I went with the western and actually had fish on the plane for first time and was excellent as was the service.  I had the first window seat behind first class and was really private the way the seats are designed so zero disturbance throughout the flight.  Downsides to the seat are that it gets a bit hot as the port side of the plane gets full sun blasting for about half the flight at altitude and for my 191cm frame it was just a tiny bit short.  Otherwise everything else was great and will certainly repeat in the future.

title: Disappointed
review_text: We flew with this airlines twice. The first time, the flight attendants were rude and inattentive. They ran out of chicken and only had pork left. Maybe it was a mistake on my part to not order a special meal, but I thought because they had chicken on the flight, which I ordered while booking things would be ok. The second flight we ordered a special meal for our 3 year old and they gave it away. They tried to give her a replacement meal of unhealthy and snack that consisted of peanuts, which she could not eat. When we told them no, they came back with baby food.

title: Easy trip
review_text:
Economy Sydney to Japan, we chose JAL for a few reasons - daytime flight going over meant we started the trip not tired, and everything we needed - JR office, supermarkets etc - were still open. Plus no delay checking into our hotel.
The price was very reasonable, the flight both ways on time, the staff efficient and we were able to move seats on both flights to bulkhead seats.
Movie selection was adequate to a 9.5 hour flight, food ok with reasonable drinks offerings.
Would definitely recommend.

title: Friendly and Comfortable
review_text: I flew JAL flights 007/008 to/from Japan. Premium economy was better than business on other airlines. For starters, we had lounge access on both ends which was relaxing. The seats were roomy and had tons of legroom. The aircraft was a 787-9 which was quiet and felt less claustrophobic than most planes I’ve flown on. The seats reclined in a way where the seat back didn’t jam into the person behind you. Meals were good and there were snacks and drinks available throughout the flight. Crew was very friendly and happy to do anything to accommodate passengers. I was very concerned about what I’d do for 14 hours on a plane but the flight went by quickly. The direct flight from BOS to NRT is a fantastic route and seems very popular.

title: business is a win
review_text: the business class at Japan Airlines is much better than economy class. the price gap is not as big as expected.

title: Japan Airlines.... What's Happening
review_text: I don't know what's happening with Japan Airlines.  Such terrible customer service in the new First Class Lounge.  Signed up for a shower.  Waited an hour.  Rechecked with attendant and she had not written me down.  Now 10 people in front of me as everyone was arriving for the flight.  I had the pager but just kept repeating there were 10 people ahead of me.  No apologies.  New food service is a step down from the previous first class lounge.  So disappointing.

title: A good airline.
review_text:
We were travelling overnight from Japan to Canada which was a challenge in itself. 
Mostly I can’t fault the flight, as staff were accomodating and friendly, comfortable environment and flight in time with little turbulence.
My only considerations when choosing the airline next time would be limited movies, challenging menus for western travellers ( especially children), the seats on this flight don’t lay right down and for a business class seat there was limited privacy. Usually this wouldn’t worry me but considering the flight is overnight, I would prefer to rest without worrying about disturbing the person next to me. Due to this, I didn’t sleep at all.
I’m not sure I will use this flight again during the hours, but for a less fussy traveller, the airline provided a great service at a reasonable price.

title: Great airline
review_text:
We travelled as a group of three from Sydney Au to Narita Airport in Japan. 
The flight was great especially considering the daylight hours with little turbulence or delays.
There were a few disappointing issues, namely limited movie selection, a seat that didn’t recline for one of our travellers. Another didn’t have a working USB port and the third had problems pausing the movies ( when needing to go to bathroom/ meal times etc.) 

However, the staff were friendly and tried to fix whatever problems they could. 
All considered, we enjoyed our flight and only had a few minor issues with JAL.

title: Very mediocre airline in every way
review_text:
This was a very long flight with a 2hr transit in NRT. The 2x2x2 seating configuration for both planes, the B772 and B788 made the flights a bit crowded. Arrived YVR very tired.

JAL want to milk revenues for seats, but they'll never achieve superior status. They could learn from CX and SQ in-flight delivery capability.

I'd avoid JAL, but this time I really had no choice because of last minute trip arrangements.

title: Great Flight
review_text: We had a great flight flying JAL, everything is great from check in to landing and pick up luggage. deffinately will fly with JAL again next time

title: Tokyo to Singapore
review_text: Check in was very good and quick the seats where good and the choices of moves was a good  selection the lunch on our seven hour flight was tasty and a good sized serving leg room was better other airlines we have been on

title: Good seats, Great Service and Amazing Food
review_text:
While the cabin is starting to show it's age, and is not as fancy as the new First Class Suites that are popping up, this product is still amazing.

The suite itself, while door-less, is very private. I was traveling with a partner, and found it quite easy to talk to each other, but with the partitions raised, I cannot see her at all.

The seat is roomy, and for a 6foot, 250lb guy, I had plenty of space to toss and turn and sleep. And JAL still provides a mattress pads with the choice of firm or soft.

The service is top notch, the cabin crew were all super friendly, and was available immediately as soon as you needed them, but at no point did they feel intrusive.

The food is one of the true highlights of the flight. This meal would be great even if it was at a restaurant on the ground. My favorite dish was the tuna, which was made with fresh high grade O-toro. It was so good, I ordered 2 plates.

I slept for majority of the flight so I could not try all the food, but everything we did have was delicious.

This F cabin does have the seatbelt on the ottoman which means couples could dine together. Although it is a little awkward as the person sitting on the ottoman has their back leaning on the TV, but other than that, it was fun to be able to dine with your significant other on the plane.

My small gripe is that JAL no longer serves Dean Deluca ice cream in first, and now it's just haagen daaz which seems too "plain" for First class imo.

The amenities kit is now by Etro, (it was loewe last time I flew with JAL) and for ladies a CDP face mask was given, while men got the Shiseido grooming kit, I opted to get the CDP facemask for myself as well, as men can also appreciate a good face mask.

The PJs offered is now unbranded, the old ones had a JAL logo, I found these new PJs to be much softer than before, and are very comfortable. They fit big, the Large actually for me when I am usually a XXL in street clothes. 

Overall JAL still offers a super amazing First Class with good seats, great service and amazing food.

title: Great service and comfortable seats in Economy class
review_text: Our first trip to Japan and this 13 hour flight was the start of our vacation.  We were 2 in the 3 seat section next to the window near the back of economy class.  The staff was attentive and kind.  We had 2 full meals and a small sandwich offered in between, no charge for wine served with food.  The food was pretty good.  Frequent trips were made by the attendants to offer tea, water or juice.  They left pitchers of both in the back of the cabin along with a basket of assorted snacks where you could help yourself.  There were movies, TV programs, music and games all available for each seat.  Blankets, pillows and eye masks were available.The plane was clean.

title: Superb Service
review_text: Heard about the great service of Japanese airlines and sure was not disappointed with this flight. The flight was very well organized from the start of the boarding process to deplaning. The only slight flaw was the Economy Class food was not so great, although the Japanese beers being offered made up for it! Also the plane was older so the inflight entertainment system and seat need to be refurbished!

title: A highly recommended airline to fly
review_text: This was my first experience flying with JAL and it won’t be the last.  The services was 5 star (even in Economy) and the level of comfort was great.  The steward staff were great, especially with our kids. The food was the best airline food I have tasted in a while, even better than some business class meals I have experienced.

title: Lousy food in business class
review_text: The business class experience was okay overall and the service was very friendly. I chose the Western menu and it was disastrous. The food looked and tasted dated, the main dish (fish) was not properly warmed up and had totally dried up; quite frankly it was a disgrace. Even the coffee was lukewarm and weak. Not a good experience!

title: Surprisingly Great.
