review_text: We travelled to Tokyo (ex Sydney) return and the experience was superb.  Crew were attentative.  Food not bad. Seats were more roomy than others.  Overall a great experience.  On the return trip I logged on 24 hours before departure and was able to secure the exit row.

title: Premium Economy is a great value
review_text: I was dreading the long transpacific flight but the experience was better than many shorter domestic flights in the US! Spacious, comfortable, good food/amenities and great service. From boarding to deplaning, it was a positive experience. I might have wished for a better entertainment/movie selection, but that's about the only criticism I can come up with.

title: Good but room for improvement
review_text:
Check in:
only 24hrs in advance compared to CX 48hrs, can be better. 

Business Class lounges:
Taipei / Nariata/ Honolulu 
~ not much food variety, but you sure will get the beef curry with rice in every JAL business lounge. 

On the carbin:
Seating 
~ typical business class seating, acceptable 

food
~ only provide western or Japanese 
lack of quantity, you have to pick it once you on board. otherwise, the popular dish will gone, and you need to get what is left. 

~ taste is good. well, compared to China airlines, and Asiana airlines. Similar to Korean Airline, and Cathay Pacific airlines.

Overall, I think JAL is good. But still has lots of room for improvement.

title: Excellence in Economy Class!!
review_text:
I recommend it!!!
Excellent food! Excellent drinks! Excellent attention! Excellent comfort! Everything Excellent!!!

title: One of the best!
review_text:
The flight was really good!
Service is great and the flight is very clean. 
Economy class is better than most other I have travelled. 
Entertainment could be better. 
Overall great experience.

title: Nice and Service mind staff
review_text:
I took a flight from BKK to Haneda, Tokyo (round trip, JL32 and JL33). The Online Check in was fine and easy. 
The flight was overall good and Cabin Crew are extremely nice and helpful. 

Highly recommended.

title: Very good short-haul flight
review_text: This was a very good 70-minute flight from Tokyo (HND) to Tokushima (TKS).  Everything met or my expectations, especially the wonderful views of the Japanese Alps and Mount Fuji.The airfare was 15% lower than the only other airline offering non-stop service on this route.

title: I found cheap ticket by internet.
review_text: I know Japan Airlines is good but it is normally over my price. This time I found cheap by internet. I picked Exist seat, so I had very good leg room. I know I have to help when I need to. By the way, it was like LCC. Need to do check in by machine by myself. But very comfortable as usual.  But It depends on who assist me as usual. Flight was JTA610.

title: Beyond expactations
review_text: Amazing, I was well taken care off.  Being a Vegan the Stewards ensured that my needs were met at all times.  I really appreciated that.

title: Great flight
review_text: Excellent service.  2 meals and a "snack" which was a sandwich, side, and ice cream (a meal for me!) along with great beverage service....including complimentary alcoholic beverages!  Highly recommend

title: Wow, What and Improvement
review_text:
I swore off taking JAL years ago due to poor service and aging equipment. This was the first time I had flown them in over 10 years. They have most certainly improved!
The 787 was clean and the seats were some of the best configured business class of
any over-water airline that I flown recently---and I've flown a few. The cabin crew were friendly and professional. The food was OK by airline standards but nothing memorable. The only down-sides were a totally inoperable flight status function in the seat video and a cockroach that had made itself at home next to my seat.

title: Avoid Avoid Avoid
review_text: Worst customer service ever !! Booked flight from Knoxville to Hanoi for Sept 1 . Tried to have me fly to Chicago a day early with no place to stay . I told them of a connecting flight through D.C. that would save me this problem . They said okay , but refused to email me a new itenary . Told me if I opted for a refund that I had to wait 1-2 months . All this after 1 hour and 3 minutes on hold waiting to take to someone . The customer service rep (Tomie) was completely unhelpful and could care less about my flight problems . Opted for the refund and will go back to Flying Korean Air and ANA when I go to Hanoi . Avoid at all costs !!!

title: Never Again
review_text: The most uncomfortable seats in any cabin on any airline. My whole body hurt for a week. Bad food and terrible movie choices. Two stars not zero only because of the cabin crew.

title: Good Flight-Woeful Entry To Helsinki
review_text: This was a better than average JAL flight with food prepared in Japan much better than incoming flights.It was code -shared with Finnair as this is a convenienet way to get to Europe as Finnair provide the next leg into many destinations in Europe. The entry process was an abomination with two officers asking many questions and taking excessive time to procees people. Taking care is needed but this was not well done. We waited nearly an hour and we were about 8 in line. This is totally unaceptable for airlines like JAL and Finnair who promote Helsinki as an entry port to Europe. This is not new and time for change. Oficers appear arrogant and not focused on getting legitimate people,through in a timely fashion We were first of a number of flights in from Asia and one can imagine the delays that occurred later.

title: First time won't be the last time, very good experience
review_text:
I flew from Tokyo to Singapore return in Business Class. The experience was excellent throughout, with good food Western and Japanese selections, wine (NZ Sauvignon) although the lack of any rum was noticeable. I could not find it in the airport duty free or lounge either, so I assume rum is not so popular there.

A standard Dnata lounge in Singapore, but a full JAL lounge in Tokyo with showers, breakfast, very comfortable seating, good light and low ambient noise. 

On board there was a nice greeting at your seat from the lead stewardess, amenity kit, slippers, a lie flat bed with space, although notable on the return leg I found a bit more space with the window seat than the aisle seat in the 1-2-1 formation. This was the JAL Skysuite 3. Power points, privacy, good screen and a comfortable lie flat bed I got a good 5 hours sleep on.

Overall a good product I will be very happy to use again.

title: Service and product doesn't provide much value for money
review_text:
Japan Airlines charges a premium for their business class, but I can't see how the experience onboard justifies the higher price. The biggest problem is the seats themselves - hard, uncomfortable, narrow. Not relaxing when sitting upright, and hard to sleep in. I don't understand why they are so narrow given the huge amount of space devoted to each seat.

Food is substandard. The Japanese choices are unappetizing for a Western appetite, and the Western options are unimaginative and often not well prepared. 

On the whole the cabin crew is excellent and gracious, but it doesn't make up for what is basically a very uncomfortable flight.

Groundside, their lounges tend to be overcrowded with slow internet. Again, for the prices they charge it doesn't feel like value.

title: Outstanding service
review_text:
Supposed to travel from Haneda to Sydney via Beijing on 28 April (connecting flight out of Beijing was Qantas), but due to cancellation of the Qantas flight we had to stay in Tokyo another three nights. Funds were provided for this by JAL.
Returned to Narita three days later and we were hosted in the Sakura Lounge prior to boarding. Very nice.
Service on board was exemplary: polite and attentive. Excellent catering and good in-flight entertainment.

title: JAL April Flight 2
review_text: First time flying JAL into San Diego. The 787-8 was a newer aircraft with upgraded entertainment system. The flight was overall good with the exception of food provided on this flight. Good leg room and comfortable seats made it better than average. Customer service both on the ground and in the air was great.

title: JAL April 2019
review_text: This was my first time flying with JAL and in a 787-8 aircraft. The flight was fine with great customer service and aircrew. The one thing I was not too keen on was the food on this fight. The leg room was sufficient and the seat was confortable as well.

title: Long Distance Travel Done Well
review_text: Flew Japan Air Lines both ways for SFO>HND>SFO in Premium Economy.  All of the personnel were immaculate in dress, courtesy, efficiency....the epitome of Professional.  The Check-In counters at both airports do it right!  They are prompt, courteous, and treat you in such a special way.  Utilization of the Sakura Lounge on both ends is a real treat with plentiful snacks/foods, drinks, and extremely clean lounge.  The airplane was also very clean, with bathrooms extremely clean in-flight.  Entertainment system functioned well and plentiful in choices for length of flight.  It was a very unique & welcome treat to be cared for in such an outstanding human manner.  Well worth the time & cost...go to Japan and back with this airline.

title: Good But Better Out Of Japan
review_text: Firstly JAL is a better service from Australia to Japan than Qantas. It is lower cost, new aircraft (787) and charming crew and generally much better food. An issue with this service which is a good one is the ridiculous departure time of five minutes after midnight. Obviously cost driven but not good for the customer.A second observation and a pattern on a number of JAL flights is that the food is lower quality depeneding on the route  and if it is prepared in Japan or the  or the country of departure. Overall still better than the other alternative.

title: Aloof business-like efficiency
review_text: Everything was very prim and proper, very efficient, and personal interactions very cool.  They get the job done.  Warmth and personal interactions were second.  That's ok.  The food was not catered to an international taste...seemed very Japanese, which makes sense for this airline.

title: Very good
review_text: Very fly from Honolulu to Tokyo or Osaka good service good food 🥘 and drinks 🍹 too !! Many fly a day to both destinations from Honolulu

title: Left for 15 hours without water and food at airport
review_text: Japan Airlines (JAL) flew me from Tokyo to Beijing knowing I had missed my flight connection as I had brought it up with them three times prior to takeoff. Landed Beijing where I was left without any food and water for 16 hours. JAL staff wouldn't give any information on what, if anything, they were doing about organising ongoing flights. Was left in small transit area with a guard unable to go anywhere and virtually no contact from JAL. Finally flown back to Tokyo after 40 hours with no sleep. I am an older woman in a wheelchair and was only offered 1,000 yen (about AUD$10) to catch train in packed Tokyo subway to a hotel. No vouchers or money given at all for food for two days while waiting for flight to Sydney. Hotel room was dirty smelly smokers' room. JAL staff at Beijing indifferent to my problems and need for food and water. Staff also aggressive, completely unhelpful and unwilling to give any information on what was happening throughout all this time. As well as myself, there was also a 12 month-old baby who also had special needs and no concern for either of us was shown. Only got water (after 16 hours!!) because I managed to finally convince younger JAL staff person to bring some as older man dismissive. I have had a number of health problems since as a direct result of the extended period without water and food and the stress caused by the attitude of JAL staff.

title: Good, but could of been better
review_text: Recently flew return from Melbourne to Tokyo. Check in at Melbourne was good except no express pass to get through customs etc as have experienced in the past. Flight over to Tokyo was great with friendly service same as the return flight. The only criticism I have and was very dissappointed about is that on top of already big amount you are paying for business class you don't get free wifi. In this day and age you would think this would be automatically included. I flew with Qantas on a domestic flight in economy and it was free! Japan Airlines really need to look in to this especially in business class!

title: Very good and great service
review_text: The flights all left on time. The service was excellent. The plane was kept clean and tidy. The entertainment unit was good with a wide variety of movie options... but best of all there was excellent legroom in economy. I will fly them again

title: More leg-space than most aircrafts I flew with, in Economy class
review_text: It was my first trip with JAL (Japan Airlines), having used several airlines before. I usually fly Economy & I found the leg space is the most spacious I have experienced, so far. (much more than Qantas and Emirates).Seats were also very comfortable (more than Emirates & Qantas ones).The toilets were always exceptionally clean throughout entire flight. Flight crew very attentive. The only downside I would mention is the Breakfast was very poorly. However, Main meal was very good. I would still use this airline if I had to fly to Japan again.

title: One of the best dreamliner operators...
review_text:
JAL has to be one of the best operators of the 787-900 Dreamliner planes... They just get it right!

The customer service is excellent and food options is impressive! I got to say the Japanese always aim for perfection with anything they undertake and JAL holds that standards close to heart!

title: Some tickets do not allow seat selection.
review_text:
Be aware that certain tickets you purchase through JAL web site don't allow you to select your preferred seat. Seat map is not available for certain tickets, and you'll find it out after you decide to choose a particular flight. You may have to go to airport counter for seat assignment. (By the way, I booked this flight 3 months in advance.) I find JAL web design a bit hard to browse through and frustrating. 
Quality of service by flight attendants is excellent and they keep toilets very clean always. Food is not bad at all.
ANA (All Nippon Airline) lets you view seat map always and seems much easier for me to search flights on their web site.

title: Very good and friendly service and spacious!
review_text: The flight was on time, the service was good and friendly. I always get served vegetarian food on flights and this one was by far the worst, i.e. the main meal. However, I had other little nibbles that were offered with the food.

title: Superb Customer Service
review_text: Highly recommended airline. Asian customer service is still the best! Best meal on the air! Kudos to the management and staff of Japan Airlines!

title: Very service with spacious legroom
review_text: The staffs were very friendly and provided excellent services during the flight time. The meals were very good, spacious legroom and clean lavatory. Even the flight time was punctual. My only complain was the airline only offered 23 kg baggage compare to 30 kg I used to have.

title: Excellent service
review_text: Great service compared to North American airlines. Upon boarding the plane, we were offered candy and headsets all for a domestic flight. The announcements were in both languages and the flight was smooth and pleasant. The staff were very friendly and professional. The flight was on time and there was a lot of help upon landing to guide you to the right direction.

title: First Business class flight, best flight ever
review_text: The sky suite is perfect for solo traveler. A window seat is like a personal suite with ample space for you to enjoy the flight. The meals are very delicious, I didn't know that you can have such amazing meals on the airplane. From savory Japanese appetizers to delicious grilled salmon to a variety of items (ramen, beef don) on the on-demand menu. The flight attendants are very attentive and polite. JAL definitely made this 14 hour flight from Boston to Tokyo quite a pleasant experience.

title: Good flight, nothing to complain about
review_text: except that it was hot and AC seemed to be running on the lowest possible setting. Besides that flight was just fine.

title: JAL-my favourite Japanese Airline
review_text:
I often fly with JAL First Class from either Tokyo to Osaka or vice versa and have never been disappointed, the service is definitely the best I have experienced, the crew are so polite, professional and friendly, I think our Australian national carrier international/domestic flight crew should be trained by JAL.
	Sadly, the flight is only 45 minutes  but nonetheless you are treated like royalty, the meal was delicious, plentiful and presented so well that it would even out shine some of the fine dining restaurants that I have eaten at. 
	Thoroughly recommend JAL First Class

title: Very pleasant - First Time on Japan Airline
review_text: I have been traveling for 45 years for both business and pleasure and all over the world. I have flown other International carriers and this is my first time to fly Japan Airlines. I flew premium economy and was pleasantly surprised how much the seats reclined and how great the service was. I also enjoyed the Japanese food on the airline it was very good. I'm also a fan of foreign film and they had some great little Japanese films. I will definitely fly them again.

title: Daytime flight
review_text:
Our second flight with Japan airlines and much more enjoyable than our previous overnight flight. 
The cabin staff were all pleasant, attentive and service orientated. A really excellent and friendly team. 
The cabin was half full with most seats in the centre empty. Two meals were served during the flight, a hot lunch tray after takeoff and udon noodles before arriving in Melbourne. Quite good overall and much better than the overnight snack pack and breakfast we had last flight.
Legroom was very good and the general atmosphere quiet.
I recommend taking a day flight over flying at night if you can, as I found it hard to sleep well overnight in premium economy seats. They are quite firm with limited adjustment.

title: Very happy
review_text: I dont fly very often, but I felt even in economy that the staff did an awesome job.  I would definitely fly with them again

title: Good service
review_text: Flight was delayed about an hour, due to a problem with the entertainment system (according to the announcements).  But we saw them loading cargo into the bay (which we think was the real reason for the delay).  Got on board pretty fast after the delay and we were seated and take off without any problems.  We actually arrived in New York on time.  The crew was was friendly and helpful, hang up jackets, got us drinks and blankets, etc.  There was only one served meal on the flight - dinner.  The food was okay, with the main course being fish or beef.  The appetizers were strange but okay.  After the meal, everything has to be ordered with the flight attendant or the remote, choices were good from sandwiches, noodle, rice, salad, etc.  They were served until 1:30 hours before landing.  Luggage got there okay.  Somewhat enjoyable flight, will take JAL again.

title: Disappointed!
review_text:
Crew were also kind & helpful however, this time boarding got delayed a few minutes but the flight was delayed for an hour. We were early going to the airport since Narita is further than Haneda.
Food served during this flight was not good. It’s a good thing there are 3 appetizers, since the other two were unpalatable. The main dish was just passable (was already hungry). Desserts and drink saved the meal.

title: 1st time with JAL
review_text:
It was my 1st time to fly withJAL & it did not disappoint. The crew from the ground up to the flight crew were nice & helpful. The only hitch was during bag drop, she (crew) did not accept a photo of the online boarding pass on my phone even if it has the correct name & the QR code so I have to bring out my iPad. During boarding, I showed the boarding pass photo on my phone, & the crew was able to scan the QR code without a problem. 
In flight entertainment has enough choices. I guess the language barrier led to the adequate food serving, with choices of appetizer & desserts. No need to ask for the passenger’s choice. We boarded on time, and flight was on time. Overall it was a good experience!

title: Even though in coach, I felt "special"
review_text: On the trip TO Japan, we flew coach (Business Class on the trip back!). Even in coach, JAL treated us all with great care. Attendants walked the aisles with water and snacks throughout the flight. Meals were tasty. Bathrooms were kept clean and supplied. Entertainment selection was broad and contemporary. Seat pitch was awesome for coach. FLY JAL is all I can say!

title: awful service
review_text: The worst service ever on any business class flight. I was traveling with my son, who fell asleep promptly on boarding. Not once did the crew ask if he would like something to eat or drink. Basically we were ignored for 14 hours. Seems you have to be a Japanese salary man to get served in business class on JAL.  Crew did not help with airweave mattress or anything, though they assisted Japanese passengers. Very disappointed at the discrimination on this flight.

title: I’ll be using this airline again.
review_text: I love japan airlines. The seats were comfy (my friends said it was too hard), but I have no complaints. My 6’2” boyfriend manage to live thru economy (he said it was pretty good). The seats were an inch more than American economy airlines. The flight attendants were very friendly. We were served two meals and a small snack during our 14 hours flight. The food was a bit salty but tasty. Also, several drink services. When there were no meals served, they set up a snack station where you are welcome to help yourself. I was allowed two free bags to check in, which is great! No one fought for overhear bin space, so there were bins that were actually empty. In flight entertainment was excellent. Saw 3-4 movies that I had been wanting to see (fairly new movies were available). Took a small nap or two and then we arrived. I’m actually looking forward to my next flight to japan with japan airlines.

title: Great service and comfortable ride
review_text: JAL surprised me with spacious leg room and great service by cabin crew. Non-stop serving water (at least 4 times) within duration of 6-7 hours. Food and snack was delicious.

title: JAL Business Class - not as good as ANA or SQ (but still way better than any US airlines)
review_text:
I flew on 10 April 2019 from Seattle to Tokyo and then Singapore, returning on 24 April on the reverse Singapore/Tokyo/Seattle route.  The Tokyo-Seattle route is a new one, launched on 31 March 2019. Business class was totally full on the Seattle/Tokyo/Seattle flights, maybe because of the attractive promotional fares that were nearly US$2,000 less than the equivalent business class fares with ANA and Singapore Airlines (SQ). This review is of the Tokyo-Seattle flight.

The Japanese reputation for efficiency was quickly undermined at check in and at the airports, Seattle as well as Tokyo, although Tokyo was noticeably slower. Everything seems to take longer than it should and longer than it does elsewhere. In Tokyo this was true of both check in and security - not because the hand baggage security screening is better or more thorough in Narita but just because it all moves slowly. 

I found the language barrier particularly noticeable on the ground and in the air. I say this as someone who has regularly flown Asian airlines such as Singapore Airlines, Cathay Pacific, China Eastern, China Southern, ANA. This is not a comment that comes from a lack of cultural sensitivity: I speak a number of languages and do not expect everyone to speak English. But the situation is different when considering international airlines services English-speaking routes where it can be anticipated that a significant proportion of the customers primarily speak English. In this context I found that many, perhaps most, JAL staff have a surprisingly poor command of English and are sometimes incomprehensible. Despite years of living in Asia and working with Asians, including Japanese, I found it almost impossible to understand the attendant at the check in desk in Tokyo; and the flight attendants were barely better.

The JAL flight attendants were all friendly and well-meaning, hospitable, and attentive to the point of intrusion. The famous Japanese service training is certainly evident in the air. 

The food and wine were disappointing for business class. In comparison with other airlines serving these routes JAL is less good. Not bad, but not as good as others. Of course the standard is better than a US airline would be – nobody is ever going to suggest that United should get an award for its food and wine offerings, even in their ever-shrinking international first class. But I recall ANA as noticeably better, and SQ is significantly better on both food and wine, as well as on pretty much every other category.

It was unfortunate that my seat had a broken monitor/entertainment screen. I was informed of this at check in, twice at the gate and twice on board; but as the business class was full there was no alternative seat and therefore no solution. The compensation offered (it was quickly volunteered; I did not ask for it) was a JAL coupon for a discount on a future flight or 20,000 points for onboard purchases or15,000 JAL miles. These were not much use: the first two only apply if one intends to fly again with JAL and the third says the miles can only be credited to JAL’s own mileage program, not to a program partner. And it may take two months for any compensation to be mailed to one’s address. 10 hours is a long flight with no entertainment available.

As is standard these days, the seat becomes a flat bed. I found it hard and uncomfortable. At least plenty of [very soft] pillows are available – try getting an extra pillow on United!!

My conclusion: try ANA instead; better still, go with SQ.

title: SMOOTH FLIGHT ON THE 787
review_text: The comfort of the JAL 787 is superior to other carriers 777s.  The 2-4-2 seat configuration gives the feeling of spaciousness.  I think I was flying on a newer aircraft as my connecting flight onto HongKong was obvious an older 787. I noticed the difference right away with the color scheme plus the seats didn’t seem to be as wide and leg room was less.  The in flight service was lacking as the flight attendants seldom passed through with water and juice for hydration. The past three years I’ve flown SIA and the FA’s would do the water service about every twenty minutes!   As with most carriers today, the food was mediocre, a notch below SIA, but above the others. I chose JAL this year for convenience, my home to takeoff, two hours, not having to go to SFO. I did have to pay about $400 more to save six or so hours.

title: Great Experience
review_text:
My first time flying to Japan and I was a little nervous because of the length. 
The attendants on the flight were so patient, kind and attentive. The meals were unlike any I've had on other airlines. 
My only downside is that because it is under the same family with American Airlines, the first layover was not enjoyable, as their attendant/customer service is horrible.

Would HIGHLY recommend JAL!!

title: Consistently rreliable
review_text: Japan Airlines operate a quality service. Their aircraft leave and arrive on time as scheduled, Their inflight service is always good and a choice of Japanese or Western food is available,

title: The best flight I have ever been on.
review_text: Service is second to none. Food is incredible. Good choice of entertainment and seats were very comfortable. Thank you Japan Airlines for a great experience.

title: Pleasant First Time
review_text: It was our first time using this airline. Our departure time was delayed (airport's fault) for roughly an hour, but we still arrived on time. The in-flight entertainment kept me occupied during the delay as well as the flight. The food was great, and I liked how they went around and offered drinks (tea mostly) every 30 or 40 minutes for free after serving the meals. This was all on economy.

title: Efficient,Great service
review_text: Absolutely no complaints  Leg room seemed greater than other 787 airlines,communications excellent. Check in prompt meals less boring,

title: JAL To Osaka, Transit Tokyo
review_text:
Our first visit to Japan and my chance to fly JAL.
Trying to catch the cherry blossom season, we caught a night flight to Osaka and onward by bus to Kyoto.
This 9PM flight will transist at Haneda with about 2.5 hrs window to catch the domestic flight which will land at Itami.
JAL boost of generous leg room at economy,  which I found it true, but the seats has rather thin cushions all round, which made sleeping a bit uncomfortable. I would suggest a travel pillow for more comfort.
Light supper, beer, sake, etc , are all available,  to help you sleep better. We land at the international terminal at Haneda. You will have to clear customs, retrieve your luggage, and check in at the domestic flight counter located in the International terminal. Then you go to the basement and catch the right bus to the domestic terminal. There are 2 types of bus service. One goes to where ANA uses and the other JAL. As you can see, this process takes time, and if your flight is delayed, you will need to rush. The domestic flight was smooth, and I would like to praise the JAL ground staff for arranging the next connecting flight for us, as I've missed the scheduled flight, because I forgot to adjust my watch, for the 1 hour time difference. 
The return flight is from Osaka, Kansai, also transit Haneda. This sector is much better, as our luggage were automatically transfer to the international flight.
As the flight from Kansai also lands at the Haneda domestic terminal, you still have to take the bus to the International terminal. Duration of bus ride is about 15 mins, but sometimes due to aircraft movements,  the Tower may halt all vehicles movements.
Overall great flight, good experience,  nice Japanese politeness and food.

title: Japan airline
review_text:
A great flight ,seats with plenty of leg room.
Good on board entertainment and food very good .
Crew very attentive , would recommend this airline.

title: Acceptable Service but no English at all
review_text: The service was ok apart from no English language at all for all the announcements which I didn’t like also the landing was not the best

title: Best
review_text: They have the best service..... i luv always japanese... they are the best. But the food was not good

title: Ignorance service mind
review_text: I have been japan for traveling with family around 8 days with a fantastic trip. Everything looks perfect from the trip begins until back to Thailand with Japan Airlines flight JL0727 (14th Jan 2019).My family get some problem which is cabin crew’s responsibility to solve it but when I noticed to Japanese Cabin crews. She cannot deal with this problem and ignore it. I feel really bad,It’s not because of the problem but the service mind with Japanese cabin crew done to me. I have been flied with Japan Airlines for 14 years but customer loyalty will be ended here thanks.

title: First rate service
review_text: Flew Japan Airlines from San Diego to Tokyo and Shanghai. The service from check-in to landing was first rate. The 787-8 SkySuite for the San Diego/Tokyo legs are really roomy in economy class. The seat was extra wide and there was plenty of leg room to spare. The flight attendants were very attentive and polite, even reminding the people in front of you to put the seats upright during meal service. The Tokyo/Shanghai legs used older 787-8 models and the seats were noticeably more narrow with less leg room, but the service was still on par with the other leg of the trip. The only concerns I had were the cabin being a little warm and the seat pad wearing down after a couple hours in. On a 10+ hour flight that can become a little uncomfortable. Other than that I enjoyed my flights and would highly recommend flying with JAL.

title: Good service
review_text: Often take JAL for domestic travel in Japan! They provide free WiFi service during the flight and complimentary drink on the flight! The soup is the best choice for the complimentary drinks ! JAL never fails me for their service!

title: Fantastic
review_text:
Super roomy on the Dreamliner! Everything was fantastic, and the 'a la carte' dining was just great. Highly recommend their ramen which was just delightful.

The only knock (and it's a minor one), the amenities kit was a bit sub-standard compared to what was offered on Malaysia Airlines.

Probably the last time I'd ever fly Business, but I would have no hesitation flying JAL in Economy.

title: Fantastic
review_text: Have flown Prenium Economy with a number of airlines. JAL had so much leg room that I had trouble reaching the foot rest in front. This was one of the new aircraft with the shell seats that slide forward when recline not back onto the person behind. Brilliant trip. Food good to eat, staff pleasant and toilets very clean throught whole trip.

title: Once they get delayed by their own fault, they have no idea what to do, and awful.
review_text:
With their mechanical trouble, a flight got 1hour and 30mins delay, and it was notified only 2 hours prior to the departure; not only that, because of missing the connection, they  had to find a flight to SFO, which was failed.

The ground staff had no idea and ended up helping her looking up on sky scanner, no way to compensate any of the loss, basically paid me 15000yen to change my connection flight after the arrival to SFO, and made up all the story after all also told me f**k off.

So they are good at not delayed, but once they do, they have no idea what to do, and no compensation, then gets mean, hopeless.

title: very pleasant flight experience
review_text:
Great flight with a very attentive crew. Premium Economy is certainly worth it. Sufficient legroom, confortable seats.Very much on time.
Great staff at check-in in Narita and lounge access.

title: A Good Rerot....
review_text: My main concern on a long haul flight, (economy) is will the seat be comfortable, so pleased to report they were... in flight entertainment good, food good.

title: Business Class Jal flight from Tokyo
review_text: My daughter and I had a very comfortable flight from Tokyo in Business Class.  We went to the Lounge before the flight.  I didn't eat anything as there was not a wide choice of food. The food on the flight was very nice and the service was very good. Plenty of leg room and the seat was comfortable. There were no problems with boarding and disembarking. I would fly with JAL again if the price was right!!!!

title: Economy Class of JAL
review_text: the service was great..everything was good except the in-flight food..it didnt meet my expectation..tasteless..but other than that, i feel comfortable flying with JAL..the wifi service also available in this aircraft (skyliner)..

title: Best Flying Experience
review_text: Absolutely the best flight I've ever taken. The alcohol was free flowing, the seats are incredibly comfortable and the service was impeccable. Hoping JAL starts flying to every destination on earth.

title: Comfort
review_text:
When looking for a good plane trip, comfort and service is key. Japan Airline(Jal) is the best at doing both of this because of their new leg space improvement, good service, and their great comfort during flights. 
	When talking about Jal, your probably thinking about Japan and the flights from my closest airport to Japan takes around 12 hours. Even though sitting down for 12 hours with only little bathroom breaks may sound impossible, Jal makes it possible by adding more space to your seat, and improving the material used for the seats. Also, they’re rated number one in economy class seats on Skytrax. Last of all their service is really good. Whenever I wanted a drink, they would bring it to me without any hassle. Wherever you go on Japan Airlines, you for sure want to fly it again.

title: Very bad ground service/customer service
review_text: Booked Okinawa Tokyo flight via Opodoe.de. Seat allocation prior to check in wasn't available. While checking in online, no combined seat form my wife an I have been available any more :-(, very untypical for a none low cost airline. At the baggage drop we had to wait for more than 35min, though only limited opened baggage drop counters. We asked again for seats next to each other, but only middle seats in rows behind each others were available. We took them, but didn't get a new boarding pass. On to security with another long waiting line. While scanning our mobile boarding passes, staff told us that these are not valid, so we had to wait till a Jal agent brought finally paper based boarding passes. On the plane no announcement in English, just Japanese which we found odd. Not the service we expect from a Japanese company

title: Clean, timely service
review_text: The airline was clean and on time, which are both major plusses to me. I flew Premium Economy, which is definitely worth it if you can afford it - there are only two seats next to the window, the seats are large with plenty of leg room, and there is a tiny divider between you and the person sitting next to you. There are also tons of free movie choices. Food was hit or miss - first flight it was delicious, second flight not so much. Expect Japanese style food if flying from Japan (a plus to me!)

title: Excellent cabin crew, comfortable seating, reliable service, and consistent food.
review_text: Recently travelled between Heathrow and New Chitose via Tokyo (and return) using JAL, and were very pleased with the experience. Both the international and internal flights were on time, comfortable (premium economy economy), and the service was both charming and efficient. The homeward flight was at two in the morning from Tokyo and we were surprised not to be given a light meal before settling for the twelve hour flight, (snacks were available on request)  but apart from that we found the floor flight to be very good, and as this is a route we use often we will be using JAL again. The costs, too, compared very well with other airlines despite it being a popular holiday travel time.

title: An awesome way to fly
review_text: This is our first time flying direct from San Diego to Narita and back and there were no better way to do this than with a top notched airlines.  We have travelled with several world class Asian airlines before and JAL ranks amongst the best of the best.  Air attendants were friendly and attentive and were prompt to ensure that all our needs were taken care of. The flights were super comfortable in the awesome Boeing 787 Dreamliner and there were sufficient leg room even in economy. Announcements were made in both Japanese and English. The touch screen entertainment systems were easy to operate and there were more than sufficient movies from fairly recent ones to oldies to keep all of us entertained.  The meals were very good and creative and out of the box - for one of the meals, JAL had winners and finalists of the Red U-35 chef competition in Japan create their in flight meals and they were really delicious and gourmet. For another meal, they had MOS Burger (a famous Japanese burger joint) create a burger meal.  These were arguably the best airlines food I ever had. JAL will definitely be a top choice airline the next time we fly internationally.

title: Great Japanese Hospitality - High Standard Maintained
review_text: I have flown with JAL to Tokyo several times before so I knew what to expect and I am glad to say the standard of their great oeverall service has maintained.  There are several other options for this route but I didn't think twice before confirming my reservation.  Service was pleasant and attentive and the meal served was just as good as before.  My only comment is that their in-flight entertainment system, though adequate, could do with an upgrade with more varieties offered.

title: Good flight for 10 hours
review_text: For a 10 hours flight it was better than expected.  There was complimentary food service twice with free drinks (alcohol included) which I didn’t expect. It was decent airline food. I appreciated the variety of entertainment selections.  Leg room was typical, the cabin was warm and I didn’t need my courtesy blanket at all. Bathroom lines were minimal with clear signage to indicate when available.  Flight staff encouraged you to stay buckled up and in your seat.  But 10 hours is a long time and my swollen ankles were not happy when we landed. Don’t try to bring on more than the allowed number of items.

title: A pleasant flight filled with non-stop service.
review_text: The business suites on this flight provided enough comfort and some privacy for this long-haul.  The attendants were always available to help and after the amazing first meal you are able to order a complete menu of items for the remainder of the flight through the IFE controller.  Seats were comfortable and went to lie-flat bed mode for an comfortable sleep complete with mattress top, pillow and blanket.  Entertainment system was filled with movies and music.  All-in-all this made the long flight much easier.

title: Very good and attentive service.
review_text: From counter service to attentive onboard personnel, baggage handling, entertainment choices and comfort, I would fly this airline next time I go to Japan. Baggage allowance: 2 (50 pounds max.) checked bags plus 1 carry-on (22 pounds max.) plus one personal item (purse, backpack, briefcase, laptop).

title: JAL Domestic Flight
review_text: First time travelling on JAL domestic flight from Tokyo (Haneda) to Nagoya. Even though it was a short 1 hour flight. I could not believe that candies were served on the flight instead of drinks! I would expect more from a full service airline.

title: loved it
review_text:
Good flight. Was very impressed with the whole crew, they were very courteous and responded to anyone's requests immediately.  The aircraft 787, was very clean inside. The seat was fairly comfortable as much as can be expected on a nine hour flight. With adequate leg room. They gave us row 52 which has no window so were quite disappointed by the seat selection given to us when assigned a month before. 
The food was quite good. The free wine was an unexpected bonus.

title: Very impressed!
review_text: I was impressed with the comfort of the flight. The seats and restroom were spacious and there was plenty of legroom. At one point, the flight attendants provided toothbrushes with toothpaste in the restroom for anyone wanting to brush their teeth.

title: Top notch professionals
review_text: All in all a very pleasant experience.  Service was polite y professional- 2 out of the 3 meal/snacks were good- dessert almond butter/pudding was the best. Was not impressed by the beef in wine sauce. Had a taste for Gin -was not charged for drinks- took the edge off flying y allowed me to get about an hour nap on a 12-14 hr flight. This was truly a upscale experience- service esp.

title: A happy flight with an anime
review_text: It is a good trip on the flight. Food is really good and suit my taste. During the flight I watched one beautiful anime called Natsume's friends book via nihofun.com and my animelist. Perfect travelling.

title: A very comfortable and ideal choice for your journey
review_text: I was very happy during my journey to Japan. I have to say (JAL) is one of the best airlines to flight around the world. They provide you with the ideal supplies drinks, food,etc. A very comfortable environment; you can see movies, anime during flight. Everything was fine.

title: JAL japan
review_text:
Ive been travelling across the world and i never had a problem and/or we never had a problem about combining luggage, trying to save space and our luggage is only at 29k for 2people in 1 luggage 
we even travel from tokyo to hokkaido thru "ANA" and didnt have problem even from manila to tokyo then didnt question us combining luggage in one bag/luggage which we are supposed tohave 23k each.
We were very rush (20 mins before the plane leaves) and they even hold our pass to go thru beacause we have to pay first our flight and then i asked to show me if its in the policy caused back in manila and Hokkaido we didnt have that typ of problem and guess what they gave us a "Japanese printed policy" (take note i cant read japanese sir/mam)
(And no specific words that we cant combine combining.) This happened in narita airport

title: Not impressed
review_text: The staff was outstanding, nice, attentive, and very competent. The food was very disappointing and the plane pretty old and not well kept. I heard how highly ranked they were and was very underwhelmed.

title: Comfortable seating and service
review_text: It was a very short flight from Osaka to Sapporo but was comfortable with good sized seats (myself being 220lbs).  Looked like a newer plane as it was very clean.  Staff were very friendly from check-in and on the flight.  Free drinks on the flight but no food.  They were very attentive and kind.  Travelled with my daughter and they gave her a model plane.  No problems at all with checked luggage even though we checked in hockey equipment and sticks which are oversized.  Nothing to complain about but it would be good to know that you need to download the JAL app before takeoff if you want to use the inflight WiFi and watch tv or use the internet.

title: Japan Airlines Tokyo NRT to Jakarta, Indonesia
review_text: It was my first time traveling on Japan Airlines. I'd always heard of Asian carriers attention to customer service, hospitality & emphasis on detail. All of the aforementioned were not only met but exceeded on my first flight aboard JAL.  The Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner was immaculate and constantly serviced by the flight attendants throughout the 8 hour journey from Tokyo to Jakarta.  The meals were all excellent with options for both Japanese and western menus.  I opted for the Japanese menu and was delighted with the options presented so masterfully.  The opportunity to sleep was afforded with the lie flat herringbone seat.  Of the 8 hours I slept for nearly 6 hours very comfortably.  The crew was outstanding from boarding to deplaning in Jakarta.  Would fly JAL again anytime and anywhere they fly!

title: JAL flight
review_text: Business class seats are terribly uncomfortable, a nightmare.  Tried every angle with different points of contacts.  Sleep position was the worst.  Ended 10 hours of fighting for comfort with horrible headache and pain through entire body.  Wasn’t the only traveler complaining. Other than the seats, food was good and cabin service was very efficient.

title: Outstanding Airline
review_text: Top quality all the way.  The cubicles are well-designed. The seats easily adjust to any desired level down to "lie-flat". You can get in and out without crawling over anybody. There is room for one's belongings. The individual TV screens are large. The food is excellent. On the leg from Tokyo to Hanoi, they even served me a steak exactly the way I like it.  The amenities include a sleep jacket, quite soft and comfortable and slippers as well as the usual items and of course a face mask. The many flight attendants on JAL are so attentive to our every need.

title: first time on JAL
review_text: love the 2/4/2 seating in economy the wife sat next to me was a very good flight on time running at both ends I request wheel chair was provided no problems the only minus was the food very Japanese not my taste but others loved it I was cared for very well by crew

title: Japan Airlines is an excellent product
review_text: The new business class Cain is excellent with each person having their own mini suite so you don’t bother or step over anyone when you need to get out of your seat for any reason. Their on demand dining works extremely well too

title: Excellent Flight, Couldn't have been better.
review_text: Booked the tickets for the flight about 80 days in advance to get around $500 off the average round-trip ticket (economy) for a direct flight from NYC to Tokyo. There was a freak snow storm the day of our departure and as soon as I found out the flight was canceled I called JAL customer service. They were extremely helpful and put me on standby for the next available flight from a different airport (since the original flight was not to be rescheduled for a few days later) they even managed to get two seats next to each other! So amidst the disastrous conditions of having a multi-day snow storm almost end my entire trip, JAL saved the day. The flight was delightful (which is saying a lot since it was 14+ hours). Lots of movies to choose from, attentive flight attendants, and comfortable seating. I will be booking my next trip to Japan with them.

title: Good service, terrible food
review_text: I was in business class to help accommodate a back injury. Business class seats on this plane lie completely flat and have a nice area to stash items. Unless you have the window seat you do not have much privacy. The Sky Suite design has the side of the seat wide open to the aisle. I think the center might be preferable to aisle because there is a separate entry area and you have partition walls between seats. The food on this flight was horrible. The plane seemed very dated and it felt like the air was not able to circulate. I was in 8th row and the smell of the bathroom was evident throughout the entire flight. Further back seemed better on that front. In flight entertainment was a very dated system with few offerings. The screens in business are quite large but that meant you were more subject to light from movies watched in other seats despite the partition walls.

title: LAX - Osaka JL69
review_text: The service was outstanding. Very attentive crew. I purchased business class ticket for lie down seat as I have a back injury.  The plane was a newer model but the business class seats do not lie flat as described by ticket agent. They come close but still have an incline. The food was pretty good. It leaned toward Japanese menu but there were still a few Western items on it. Not much offering in the media area - a few movies and strange collection of one or two episodes of tv.

title: JAL Flight Leg Two
review_text: Again a 787-8 aircraft (second time). This seemed to be a newer aircraft. One could tell buy the carpit wear. Seats were comfortable and leg room was adequate. The service was excellent on this flight all the way from crew and ground personnel. Food on the aircraft was hot and tasty with the exception for breakfest meal (only one choice) was not goos at all. All-in-all this was a good flight.

title: JAL April 2019 Leg One
review_text: This is my first time flying on a 787-8.I booked the flight through American Airlines account so this was a code share flight. The flight was goodand the service was excellent in every way. This was not a new aircraft and the flooring was well used but the aircraft seemed to be well maintained. The food was good with three selection available and it tasted good too. Seating was ok if your are under 6 feet but gets cramped if your over 6 feet.

title: Who else would you fly to Japan with
review_text: No problems with the JAL service. As expected vert polite service, food was good and plentiful. Flight on time and all else went well. Bit more expensive than some but would recommend if this is your only trip to Japan.

title: 5-star Comfort and Service
review_text:
Departure was after midnight and the journey was so smooth, the seats so comfortable that I slept for much of the trip. The great thing about the premium economy seat, apart from its generous width, is the fixed back of the seat which does not encroach on the space of the passenger seated behind even when fully reclined. 
My flight attendant did not wake me up for the meal service and only served me breakfast when I requested it at the end of the service. How very kind and considerate! The meal was light and tasted ok. 
The only downside was the airline lounge at Osaka airport(Itami) which was extremely crowded. Passengers had to go down one level and then up another to access the buffet spread. Like several other travelers, we did not take the trouble to do so.

title: Wonderful service
review_text:
I flew on a flight from Tokyo to Seoul and was treated so kindly by the crew. When they served the meal, they provided me with a translation of what I was about to eat on a pre-printed piece of paper. I thought that was so thoughtful. Obviously safety is number one when flying, but on board service always makes the experience so much better. JAL is an outstanding airline in my opinion. 
Looking forward to another flight in the near future with them.

title: Good flight
review_text:
Flight departed on time at 6 pm. Boarding was orderly and there was a sign to indicate JAL's boarding priority. JAL & One World elite members board first followed by Business Class passengers who don't belong to the first group. There is no First Class service on this flight.

There is no pre-take off beverage service. When FAs were released from their seats, they came by to take meal and beverage orders. There is a printed menu laid out on the table during boarding. Choice of Japanese or Western meal. I chose the Japanese meal since the flight was out of Japan. 

The seats, arranged in a herringbone placement are comfortable, however, they are not that wide. Window seats have a little extra space on the triangular tabletop by the window. There is not very much storage space for your belongings. Magazines and instruction cards are placed in very thin pocket on the wall below the tabletop. Can't put anything thicker than magazines in it. Items placed on the tabletop are not secured and will slide around during turbulence. There is a tiny locker in the wall above the tabletop at shoulder level. It's triangular space is not very usable and is adequate to store the headsets provided. They are over the ear headsets, though not noise cancelling. I didn't use them. Amenity kit had eye shields, socks and toothbrush of disposable quality. Had to put my belongings in the foot well to ensure they didn't slide around.

There is an extendable arm rest on the aisle side. It must be retracted (stowed) during taxi, takeoff and landing. When extended there is a small storage box below. Not much use due to triangular shape and unusable when arm rest is required to be stowed.

Movie selection was quite good and includes Japanese selections. New Release movies were adequate though not as extensive as other airlines. I was tired and watched only one movie. 

Japanese meal was adequate; disappointing for something coming from Tokyo. The starters were served in a flimsy Bento box. Numerous one to two bite items that were tasty. Main course was served after the Bento box was cleared. It was disappointing - rice served with stir fried beef which was of meager portions and not particularly flavorful. 

Dessert was served after table was cleared. It was nothing memorable. I remember much better meals served before the airline went through re-organization.

Lie flat seat was quite comfortable. You have to adjust the lumbar support to make it totally flat otherwise you will feel the bumps. Despite that, I could feel the joints in the seat cushions. It needs a bed pad to cover up the joints. Had to adjust my sleeping position so that my hips would not come in contact with the joints as they were a source of discomfort. The blanket was quite thick and I perhaps should have used it as a bed pad.    

FAs were attentive when you press the call button. Surprisingly, they did not hand out bottled water at the beginning of the flight. I had to ask for it. It was supplied on my outbound flight. Snacks were available on request - choice of Ramen, Soba or Udon instant noodles. Nothing terribly exiting and I didn't need it. Slept the rest of the flight. Ice cream served as pre-arrival snack.

Overall, the flight and service was good - not outstanding.

title: Very nice flight
review_text:
It was my first flight with a full fledged airline and I was not disappointed!

The staff spoke English and seemed to take the time to note which passengers preferred speaking English or Japanese. I sat next to a Japanese lady on my return flight and the attendant switched languages when asking which meal I preferred. I found it very impressive. 

The meals were good! They made sure to have 2 options, one more Asian and one more western. However, the sides always included something Japanese. I thought it was a great touch. Sample some lesser known Japanese treats while on board. 

They handed out some rice cracker snacks and ice cream. The drinks available included some JAL exclusive wine which tasted good. Had a chance to taste both because my bf ordered red and I had white.

The seats were comfortable. They provided a small pillow and blanket, very much appreciated. It had a wire in the head rest that could be used to stop your head from rolling too far. I liked that a lot. Not sure if that's a standard feature for all full airlines. 

Entertainment was good. The movies weren't too old and being able to see some Japanese movies was cool. ;)

title: International flight with JAL
review_text:
We recently flew from Dallas, TX to Tokyo, Japan on a flight with JAL. The flight one way was approx 12-13 hours. We were in the economy class and were concerned we should have upgraded our seats due to the length of the flight. 

To our pleasant surprise, our seats were very comfortable (able to lean back) as well as having a monitor (installed in the headrest in front of you) stocked with numerous movies, tv shows, and games to keep you entertained during the flight. You were also provided a neck pillow as well as a blanket; both items were sealed and located in your seat upon arrival. The seats themselves were spacious (to be economy) and there was plenty of leg room. Also, the overhead bins were spacious and held our carry-on sized backpacks easily. 

The flight attendants were very nice and accommodating. Due to the length of the flight, numerous meals, snacks, and drinks were provided. You were given a choice on entree (or main dish) of some of the meals; the food was surprisingly good! The food was served accordingly - heated dishes remained hot and chilled dishes remained cold upon being served. You were also given silverware with each meal. The attendants returned promptly to remove items upon completion. 

Also, the one thing I forgot to pack was my headphones. To my surprise, the flight attendants came around at the beginning of the flight and asked everyone if they needed a set of earbuds!! While these were not expensive earbuds, they worked perfectly and were conveniently free of charge. 

I have no complaints of our flight to or from Japan and would highly recommend JAL to anyone.

title: Back to Tokyo
review_text: The seat were comfortable but did not have any individual entertainment for a 777. The laggage was a little slower that ANA, but it was still fast.

title: Business class that does not feel like.
review_text:
Compare to SIA and Qatar. 
JAL seats are tighter compared to both
Amenities are not great compared to Qatar
Service is average compared to both. 
Food is average compared with SIA.
Transits was rushed n did not enjoy the lounges. 
Lots of room for improvement. 😉

title: Comfortable with Service a Priority
review_text: JAL is second to none when it comes to customer oriented service.  They make it priority to make sure customers are comfortable and have a good flight experience.  The planes are well kept, clean and the attendants do their best to keep it that way throughout the flight.  One of the top airlines available and still doing their best to make it better.

title: Business class in JAL
review_text: Our family of four had taken JAL business class from Singapore to Haneda airport. I was always told JAL is one of the best. Unfortunately, quite disappointed by the food and space on the business class. They also don’t have pre-flight drink. The chair can’t lift the individual leg rest and must turn into a bed to raise the leg rest.

title: Weird Child meal policy
review_text: We are expats living in Manila and took a family trip to Tokyo with our 2yo daughter. The plane was brand new and the crew was so helping and welcoming. To our surprise, we had to pre-order our daughter’s child meal in advance. This is kind of weird as their policy is to even offer toddlers a regular meal unless they are asked differently. As if a toddler would eat a regular meal. In any case, as I had ordered a special meal for me and my husband, this option was not an option online. I checked more than 10 times with no luck. Thank God I had some snacks with me but our daughter was really disappointed she did not get the kids cutlery etc.

title: Friendly and Efficient
review_text: We flew JAL for our quick trip to Nagasaki because of their flight schedules and affordable airfares to Nagasaki. Their service was very pleasant during the short two hour flight. Their attendants were all smiles and helpful during the whole flight.

title: Review of JAL economy flight
review_text: Food on the plane was quite bad. Some kind of pizza with tomato sauce and that was the only option available. Because the food was so awful, I asked for cup noodles and I was told that they only offer cup noodles to premium economh customers. Cup noodles are not even expensive! The worse thing was JAL served the same food on the flight back. Definitely a bad experience and will avoid JAL economh flight.

title: One of the BEST!
review_text: One of the best airlines I’ve tried! From the moment I stepped into the aircraft, I instantly felt its world-class aura. Their SERVICE is on point! From the ground staff, assistants, and of course flight attendants, they were all professional and kind. I bought my tickets maybe 2 months (or less) before my trip to Japan. I chose economy but it felt like business class (what more if I opted for business class). The entertainment available during the flight will surely keep you entertained the whole flight. Their movie selection had recent movies (I watched “The Greatest Showman”, “Tomb Raider”, “A Star is Born”, and “Bohemian Rhapsody”). They also had movies from other countries and Japan of course. Music and other sorts of entertainment was available but wasn’t able to really explore them since I was busy watching and eating. Yes, EATING! The food in JAL was really good, it was delicious. Overall, JAL for me is one of the best decisions I ever made. I have already recommended JAL to my family and friends, and for sure I will fly with JAL on my next Japan trip.

title: Premium economy was the way to go
review_text:
This was our first trans-Pacific flight and we’ve had some less than ideal long haul flights in the past.  For this trip, we decided to splurge and go with JAL’s Premium Economy.

The flight actually exceeded expectations. The obvious extra room was much appreciated (I’m 6’ 1”) but the other enhancements such as lounge access, expedited baggage handling, and enhanced menu offerings also added to the overall experience.

The JAL team, both on the ground and cabin crew, were top notch.  Professional and friendly.  I was sort of dreading the 13 hour flight, but my fears were quickly dissipated.

We’ll definitely return to Japan and JAL will be the first airline we consider

title: Onsen
review_text: Great to stay a week and take advantage of the JR tickets. Relaxing trip to Yunomine Onsen. Wonderful foodie stay in Tokyo.

title: Treated us poorly
review_text: We had an issue where we were trying to bring a lithium ion battery item that was safe for travel through, but Japan’s version of tsa said it was unsafe. We tried to argue and proved that it was safe, off their own website no less, but to no avail. That isn’t the issue here though...when we asked how we could mail it home, the Japan Airlines staff had no clue. When we asked what we are supposed to do, they shrugged at us and said sorry, no idea, they are just the airline. While we tried to google to figure it out, the staff then cracked jokes at us and called us stupid argumentative Americans. So there was that. Will not recommend Japan Airlines or fly them, American, or any sister airline ever again. Whole experience was awful and it didn’t help that while we were giving up an expensive item (that mind you, is on the approved list on JAL’s website), we got to be made fun of too. Don’t assume we don’t know the language.

title: They made my first international flight one to remember
review_text:
My first time traveling outside of the country with my wife, for our honeymoon. I was a little nervous, but the kindness of the flight crew, the comfort of the plane, the amazing inflight meal... all of it made the long 12 hour flight fly by, pun intended. There were plenty of recently released movies available to help pass the time (I watched 3 on the flight there). 

We intend to go back to Japan as soon as possible, and we will most definitely be flying Japan Airlines again.

title: Good legroom but hard seats; food poor
review_text:
Overall it was a good flight as far as boarding and timing went and general quietness in the cabin. I found the seat harder than expected and even maximum adjustment wasn’t comfortable, so hardly slept. I would not consider a flight to Europe at this class.
Food was extremely poor. Snack for overnight after we boarded at around midnight was 1 packet of Smith’s crisps, 1 TimTam biscuit, 1 small pastry and 1 bottle of water. Pretty awful offering for a premium economy meal. Hot breakfast was not at all appetising, more like lunch or dinner. Can’t say I’m looking forward to the return trip.

title: Short & Sweet
review_text:
I appreciated the touch and go service which negated the need to print any documentation. 

The flight was comfortable and I was surprised there was “drink service” for such a short flight. 

The seats were comfortable, hostesses hospitable and the flight was smooth. 

It felt as if by the time I blinked I was already at Haneda. The first flight from KIX means that you can arrive in Tokyo in time for breakfast. 

Would definitely use JAL again.

title: JAL's direct flight from Sn Diego a blessing
review_text: JAL's service was excellent from  San Diego airport to in-flight service and on to the arrival airport.  A couple of small issues. We were not allowed to purchase tickets for JAL's lounge and could not upgrade at the airport but we got what we paid for. An on time flight with good food and entertainment.

title: All the time, it’a always JAL
review_text: Back & forth to Japan once a month, JAL is my all time favorite to travel. Next time I’ll try the business class. Leg room is spacious even in economy, i’m 171 cm and feel so good flying with economy class of Japan Airlines.

title: Wonderful service and amenities
review_text: Excellent service, food, and in-flight entertainment. The flight attends were friendly and courteous throughout. No complaints.

title: Pleasant flight
review_text: We did not know what to expect, but the economy plus allowed us to fly together with the two seat row instead of the there or four seat row in economy. The flight attendants were pleasant and thoughtful and efficient. Food on airline has improved and is a plus for customers.They did not supply Bose headphone, fortunately, I we had our own. Charging plugs are available as well as a good selection of entertainment.

title: Service with Japanese courtesy
review_text: Seat  was comfortable and good to rest which was quite important for me who was so tired. Service was good as usual. About meal...we can not expect much from inflight meals. It is always better to bring your own foods. I do not like the too polite announcement. I hope  crew or captain do not disturb us who are enjoying the inflight entertainment.

title: The flexible ticket is not flexible at all
review_text: Ticket is not the cheapest but theres no changes at all. First they said no seat, but when I tried for a new booking, theres some seat. Then they ended up said. My ticket can not be changed at all, its the rules ans regulation that they dont show previously. Not reccomended at all.

title: Convinient Flight
review_text: This was my second rount trip flight with Japan Airlines from San Diego to Asia. Flying in and out San Diego instead of LAX or SFO is convinient. No LA traffic and less time processing thru customs and immigration, though the airline fare is mnore expensive thanfluing in and out of LAX. The checking counterstaff in San Diego and Manila were so accomodating. Thje flight itself left on time, our flight attendants were friendly and attentive. Food selection is okey, I wish there more westernise choice. Public announcements were little bit long because they were announced in Japanese and English. Wish they annouce it in English first. The plane  was clean on all flighs. The legrooms between Tokyo and San Diego were little cramped compared to Tokyo and Manila flights. Overall great service, on time flights and short layover between connecting flights.

title: Great airline
review_text:
A great airline with plenty of leg room.
My Husband and I flew from Haneda Airport inJapan to Dubai on an 
11/12 hour flight . and it was a comfortable flight . Plenty of onboard 
entertainment , food good and friendly and helpful air crew.

title: Excellent leg space and seat comfort, Very clean plane, Great service, Good meals
review_text:
Right from the staff at check in at Tokyo Airport, we had an excellent experience on Japan Airlines.
The staff in the flight were always going up and down the isles serving water and juice frequently. The food and snacks were very good and the beverage service was also very good. We also enjoyed the inflight entertainment and the selection was very good.
This was the first time in many years that I can recollect the seats were very comfortable and the leg space for a tall person like myself was more than adequate even in economy class.
I would strongly recommend that if you have the opportunity to use this airlines, then you will not regret.

title: Looking forward to fly again with JAL
review_text:
Food not only looks good, but tastes good too!
Great service for economy class, comparable to business class.
Comfortable, clean, and well-maintained. 
Punctual!
Great quality at a reasonable cost.

title: Consistant Value and Service.
review_text: We recently made our third return flight from Melbourne to Tokyo using Jal in the last 18 months. This experiance was as good as the last with excellent service, on time departure and arrival, spotless and modern aircraft and very enjoyable vegetarian meals. The economy seats are comfortable and the leg room is much better than most other carriers. The flights are as enjoyable as any 10 hour flight could be.

title: Pretty good, but not great.
review_text:
Check in at Frankfurt was nice and easy. Checked out the Sakura lounge which is well stocked with snacks, drinks and everything else you’d expect from an airline lounge. The lounge is however very small and is also used by almost every other Oneworld Alliance member so finding a seat was challenging. Staff were excellent though.

Boarding was smooth. The seats are pretty nice with everyone in business class getting aisle access. The footrest area is wider than some other business class products, but I noticed that in lie-flat mode, it was a tight fit and I’m only a shade under 5’10. A small glass of champagne was served in a plastic glass. It really was two gulps worth and was a little bit underwhelming. A hot towel was given, and then take-off procedures started.

Once in the air the staff came to take drink and dinner orders. The menu was in Japanese, German, and English. The FA’s English wasn’t great and she kept trying to refer me to the German menu despite me wanting to turn the page to the English menu at the back. We went back and forth on this for a while until she realized that she had made a mistake and that the English menu page was not the pre-landing menu. I ordered a German Chardonnay which was very nice and the “western meal.”

 Like ANA, JAL have a Japanese or western option. I’m not a huge fan of simple binary options like this because they do tend to be...very simple. Not being a fan of Japanese cuisine I had to choose the Western option which, like the Japanese option, was very seafood heavy which is something I struggle to eat. The first two courses were a shrimp and corn potage amuse bouchée followed by a raw salmon and quail egg entree. I can handle shrimp but the singular shrimp was a bit dry. The corn potage just wasn’t my thing. Since I can’t stand salmon in any form, or quail eggs for that matter, I asked the flight attendant if I could skip that course after explaining that I couldn’t eat that. She agreed. I guess it would’ve been nice to have been offered anything as an alternative, but there were some nice German breads served, so it wasn’t too bad. A few minutes later my entree of salmon and quail eggs was delivered to me anyway. Later, the flight attendant remembered that I didn’t want this and cleared my table and delivered the main course, veal, straight away. The veal fillet was very nice. Again, quite small with only a token slice of red and yellow pepper. The desert was a small slice of chocolate and raspberry cake. Again, very small, but very nice. 
All in all, dinner tasted very nice but I felt like I hadn’t eaten much at all. I was pretty tired and just went to sleep soon after.

Staff lay out a mattress for sleeping and it was pretty comfy. I got about 4 and a half hours light sleep. The on demand service meant that the cabin was quite busy and noisy all night though so I was waking up quite a bit throughout the night. 

Breakfast was scheduled shortly after I woke up and again, it was a Japanese or western option. The western option this time was an omelette and sausage with a crossaint, jam, and some yogurt. The omelette and sausage was pretty bland and again, quite small. The single croissant and jam were nothing to write home about and the yogurt was a tiny cup with two desert spoons full of plain yogurt with a little bit of fruit syrup for taste. Nothing special at all and I can honestly say I’ve had better economy class breakfasts than this.

All in all, a pleasant experience that neither disappointed nor stood out. I thought the food was “okay” but the servings were very small. I think the lack of choice that Japanese carriers offer is a big sticking point for me. Japanese carriers are very “one size fits all” in their approach to dining. If you don’t like Japanese food, then you only have one other option, and if you don’t like what’s offered in that, you’re out of luck. My time living in Japan has taught me that Japanese customers tend to enjoy fancy branding and products. The menu was proudly advertised as being designed by award winning Japanese chefs and this is a great selling point for the average Japanese customer. On the other hand, non-Japanese tend to be not so concerned with branding and image. For me, I like options, and neither JAL or ANA are very good in that respect.

Staff were pleasant, but were “just there.” Again, it’s what I’ve come to expect in Japan. They were very good at their prescribed job and only performed the minimal level of service but we’re a bit cold and impersonal. There were no personal greetings or farewells and they didn’t call you by name. I find it’s little touches like this that really make a business class experience for me. My business class flight on Thai a few months back was good for this. Staff knew your name and came to check on you regularly. Even Air New Zealand’s premium economy had a far more personal level of service than JAL’s business class. JAL lacked that little something extra here.

Inflight entertainment was pretty good overall and the large screen was very nice. Controls were a little slow but nothing unusual.

I’d give JAL a 7 out of ten on this flight. A good base level product but it did feel like bare bones service.

title: First class customer service!
review_text: Japan Airlines is first class all the way.  The flight attendants were professional and respectful.  The meals served were excellent quality, and the video and audio entertainment was top notch.

title: Smooth ride
review_text:
My first trip to Asia. can only compare to flying to Europe. It was truly a Dreamliner. It was a quiet, smooth flight. Very impressive. First rate movies for a 13.5 hour nonstop trip. Watched 4 coming home!! Service was fine. Would take a 787 again if I had a choice. 
I wanted to pick my seats ahead of time, but because I bought on Hopper, the airlines refused. Though we needed to sit in the middle section, it is only 4 seats across and there was an empty seat beside me.

title: Great experience
review_text: First time flying with JAL. Service was excellent, and food was nice. Easy check in service. Definitely recommend them.

title: Great seat , shame about the food
review_text: Seat is great and in-flight screen good, but the food, very poor quality, luke warm. Not great. Staff are of course really great. Check in was good , but even with Gold card , no fast track through security at Haneda.

title: dnata Loung Changi Airport Terminal 1 and Sky Suite III Flight Singapore to Narita
review_text:
I had an early morning flight on JAL 712 from Singapore to Narita.  I arrived at Changi Airport Terminal 1 around 6 am for my 8:20 am flight.  The terminal operates a Premier Check In Lounge for business class/first class passengers for multiple airlines located behind Row 4 instead of the JAL regular check in at Row 11.  I had a connecting flight at Narita on JAL on a separate booking but after a phone call to check with JAL, staff at the Premier Check In Lounge were able to confirm they can check me in for both flights.  There were probably 6 or 8 check in stations in the Premier Check In Lounge of which only about 3 were in use so there was no wait to check in, but I found check in staff was a little slow in checking me in, probably because they check in for multiple airlines rather than being dedicated staff for JAL as I am used to for JAL flights. 

The lounge leads directly into passport control (security check is at the gate) and I was quickly into the dnata Terminal 1 lounge which JAL uses at Singapore (JAL does not have its own lounge and so uses the third party dnata lounge which also serves a number of other airlines).  The lounge had lots of seating and a fairly wide selection of hot and cold food for breakfast including Chinese shrimp dumplings and BBQ pork buns, fried vermicelli noodle, sausages and egg, three kinds of sandwiches etc.  I tried the BBQ pork bun and the vermicelli noodle and both were a bit hard and dried out, probably having sat out too long.
