On a brighter note though, the lounge had a barista making specialty coffees to order and it was pretty good.  Wifi was inconsistent in the lounge - I kept losing the signal and often found it easier to connect to the internet on the Changi Airport free wifi rather than on the dnata lounge wifi.  

I went to the gate a bit early as security check was conducted at the gate but there was not much of a line up and security check was quick.  There was a slight delay to boarding at 8:05 am instead of the scheduled 7:50 am due to aircraft cabin preparation and pushback was also a bit late at 8:30 am instead of the scheduled 8:20 am but we made up the time in flight and landed at 3:50 pm ahead of scheduled arrival at 4:05 pm.  Perhaps because of the slightly early arrival, I was slightly disappointed to discover that on arrival, we had a remote stand and had to walk down the stairs to buses to take us to the terminal.  I was connecting to another JAL flight and had lots of time to connect so the slight additional delay on arrival was not a concern for me. 
 
The flight was operated using a B777-200 aircraft fitted out with the Sky Suite III fully flatbed seat in business class.  Each seat had direct aisle access in a 1-2-1 configuration.   I found the seat to be quite comfortable but rather inflexible in operation (table lifted up and angled toward you but difficult to use except in fully upright seat position, seat recline button covers entire recline function with no separate button for top of seat and leg rest so one could not, for example, raise the legrest in an upright seat position). 

In flight meal was excellent as usual.  I selected the Japanese meal as they always seem more substantial and more interesting than the Western meal options.  Service is as always courteous and excellent and the washrooms were maintained in a very good condition by constant cleaning by the flight attendants.  

All in all, a very pleasant flight.

title: Sakura Lounge
review_text:
Narita Airport has got to be one of the busiest airports around. Great food lounges and shops.
BUT, JAL Sakura Lounge has got to be The Best ever.
The food, customer service, accommodations and the smiles are amazing.
All attendants provided the special care personal service.
So very thankful for the experience.

title: JAL The Best
review_text:
Checking in to take off. Everything was exceptional!
Impeccable & friendly service. From the check-in attendant to the flight attendants. Nothing but smiles and great personal service. Their conversations and smiles made me feel comfortable, relaxed and special. This had to be one of The Best flights ever for me. Thank you JAL 785.

title: On time and customer service excellence
review_text: The cabin crew is always impeccably neat and very courteous as the legendary Japanese culture is known for. The food has improved and better. The aircraft is very clean. The pilot knew how to land smoothly. Overall, JAL makes you feel important as a human being and not as a revenue cash cow.

title: Easy direct flight from Boston to  Tokyo
review_text:
Flew over the arctic.
They have it down.
They dim the cabin so you slept earlier and adjust to the time zone with the least amount of stress.
Food was great service impeccable.
I will always take this flight to Narita going forward.

title: Haneda First Class Lounge and Sky Suite III to Singapore
review_text:
Flying out of Haneda to Singapore, I arrive quite early around 8 am for my 10:50 am flight.  Using First Class check in and priority security line, I was quickly into the JAL First Class lounge at Haneda.  At around 8:30 am, the lounge was very busy and almost all the tables and seats in the dining area were occupied but most had cleared out by around 9:30 am.  Food offerings for breakfast were fairly standard - sausages, eggs, hash brown, grilled mackerel, two soups (lobster soup, potato an scallop soup).  There was a chef making pancakes with strawberry or caramel sauce to order.  Set up, decor and food offerings were pretty much the same as the First Class lounge in Narita however one area where Haneda clearly has the lead is in the washrooms - in the men's toilet, twice as many toilet stalls as Narita First Class lounge for a similar sized lounge. 

The flight to Singapore was operated using a B777-200 equipped with JAL's top level Sky Suite III fully flatbed seats with direct aisle access from each seat in a 1-2-1 configuration.  The seat is quite comfortable and has a small side locker to store the headsets and other small items.  The table is a bit awkward as you pull it up and swing it towards you but there is not a lot of flexibility in how to position it.  Similarly the seat simply reclines back down to a bed or straightens back up to an upright seat and there is no option to individually control the seat back and the leg support portion of the seat (ie. you cannot raise the leg support without reclining).  Also once the seat is partially reclined, it is very difficult to get out of the seat so you have to raise the seat back almost to fully upright position before you can easily get up and go out.  Similarly, the table does not work well if the seat is reclined so you pretty much have to have the seat fully upright to use the table for eating.  There is a fixed armrest on one side of the seat that does not move so when you recline to a fully flat bed, you actually have to fit your arm under the fixed armrest in the space between it and the seat/bed.  Because of this, I found the seat a bit narrow when in a bed configuration but there was plenty of length.   

Shortly after take off, we were served drinks and lunch.  As usual, food offerings on JAL are delicious and visually appealing.  Having had many Japanese meals on JAL recently and seeing an interesting Western offering, I opted for the Western meal with Wagyu beef sirloin steak with foie gras sauce with a bit of oxtail on the side.  The beef was very tender and the oxtail wonderfully stewed and flavourful.  The starter was interesting too - Moroccan style abalone salad. 

Prior to landing, Chinese rice dumplings were offered.  This is literally a ball of rice wrapped in leaves and steamed so not much of a snack.  Therefore, I opted to also have one of the instant noodles, with udon, soba or shrimp flavoured noodle on offer.  
Service as always on JAL was courteous and excellent - no airline's flight attendants are as meticulous about cleaning out its toilets as frequently!

Our flight arrived a bit early but as it was still around 5 pm/late afternoon, passport control on arrivals was very busy.  The line-ups for passport control basically occupied the whole of the arrivals lobby and backed up almost to the escalators leading down to the arrivals lobby.  It took about 25 minutes to get through passport control and by the time I arrived at my hotel on Orchard road by taxi, it was about 2 hours after landing. 

The JAL flight to Singapore was very comfortable, with excellent food and service.

title: excellent option between sydney and North America
review_text: I traveled to NYC from Sydney in business class and it was a wonderful experience. Their planes have aisle access from window seats so if you fly solo you can enjoy and view outside without bothering anyone when you want to get up. The seem to serve a full meal shortly after takeoff and everything after that is on demand. Using a touch screen to order food and drinks solves any potential language barriers and I found the service to be extremely fast, polite and professional. My fellow travelers were also very quiet and courteous which I very much enjoyed. Food was AMAZING!!! I stuck with the Japanese options and was in heaven.

title: Friendly and impeccable service!
review_text:
The best thing was the crew. The food service might be slow but come with friendly and attentive service. Great portion and variety of food inflight.

The Boeing 787-9 was new and the IFE run smoothly and offering great price for WIFI Service.

title: DO NOT FLY IF YOU ARE A SINGLE FEMALE TRAVELER
review_text: They would not serve single female travelers in business with drinks.  I rang the button twice and finally walked up to the galley where they ignored me until I tried to pour my own drink.  They yelled at me in Japanese.  The "lie flat bed" does lie flat but it is narrow and very hard.  They were late for some reason and some safety announcements were not in English although over half the flight was Americans or Brits.  Boarding was chaotic at best and food was not edible.

title: JAL (Japan Airlines)
review_text: JAL is a cheap & very big airline in Japan. It has a seat capacity of more than 500 passengers. JAL has wifi connectivity inside the aeroplane. You can use the wifi connectivity for multi media uses. They have class system in all airlines of Japan i.e. upper class membership card, vip membership card, platinum membership class etc. for local citizens & those who are frequent flyers. The meals are also very good that is served on JAL. There is also the facility of Hindu Meal in JAL and there many movies one can watch including hindi movies and also cartoons for children and animated movies for them inside the airline. There is also one guide tour of Japan's sight seeing channel and it is a must watch channel for those who are visting Japan for the first time. which  It is a well known airline in Japan & i would give a 5 star rating for JAL.

title: Pay care attention how you book
review_text: Be careful how you book if you are traveling with a friend.  If you book through any site other than their own, you will not be able to choose a seat.  It will be assigned on check in.  If the plane is anywhere near full you will be guaranteed to be separated and  each will have a middle seat somewhere on the plane.  Research before you book.

title: Strange start but good finish
review_text:
Not the airlines fault, but the flight began with the passenger next to me having an emotional breakdown and screaming just after take off.  Thankfully the flight crew did a great job calming her down and she was fairly docile rest of flight.  

The flight was good overall.  Business class has fold down flat seats and large personal TV monitors. You get a complimentary overnight bag, a pillow, blanket and can also add a foam cushion to sleep on.  Thought the food was just ok.  Tried Japanese option on way to japan and western option on way back. The sea bass on Japanese option and steak on western option were the best items.  Just felt overall that the service was not as prompt as it is on American run flights like delta and American. All in all, was a comfortable flight.

title: The worst customer service imaginable
review_text: As the title suggests, worst customer service experience. My partner and I are travelling to Japan for our honeymoon and have been told we cannot sit together. We are on our honeymoon and I am pregnant. Was told by the airline that the seats are “blocked out” and not yet allocated but still they can’t make arrangements. Nobody reply’s to my emails and when you sit on hold for over an hour you’re lucky to get to speak to someone. When you do, the customer service rep offers no service what so ever. We haven’t even flown yet and still the customer service is terrible. Will never book with JAL again.

title: Amazing experience
review_text:
This is the first time I go to Japan and fly with Japan Airlines. Two thumbs up for the pilot, because of the plane fly very smooth especially when landing.
The crews are very very polite and helpful even for passengers in economy class. 
The service makes me feel very comfortable.
Enjoy the meal and beverage very much. You'll never feel hungry in this flight. Next time I come to Japan, I'll fly with Japan Airlines.

title: I flew first class and it was an excellent experience!
review_text: For long flights, I always fly first class or business class.  The extra cost involved is well worth the comfort of the flight.

title: WOW
review_text: Not at all like a USA domestic carrier. This airline actually cares and takes pride in their service. They smile, they pamper you and do the upgrade to premium economy for a 14 hour flight. Food was outstanding for real. USA carrier crew face would crack if they tried to smile.

title: Wonderful Flight
review_text:
Flew SAN to SIN via NRT on JL65 a nd JL711 on 20 Nov 19. Although JL65 is the older Shell Flat Seats, i did find it to be very comfortable and the JAL service was absolutely perfect. 

Although flight departed almost an hour later, the team went to each individual guests and apologize for the delay and assured the flight will be on time. The flight landed on time. The in flight meals were fantastic and the crew including Jean, Seki and Takao were very hospitable.

title: Great service... long flight
review_text:
Certainly going from NYC to Hanoi via Tokyo is a long trip, so be prepared.  However, an airline can make or break the experience.  We left JFK on time and arrived to Narita International airport about 30 early, excellent service, especially from Reith, one of the many flight attendants who took excellent care of us.  Premium economy is worth the extra money, but realistically after 14hrs, few things are still comfortable.   
Our flight from Narita to Hanoi, was also excellent.  
Lounge service at JFK (Alitalia’s for some reason) while dated (think 70’s), was clean and offered snacks and drinks.  The lounge in Tokyo (Sakura) was fantastic and very efficient, offered buffet-style meals, snacks and drinks.
Great experience.

title: Comfortable and ideal flight
review_text:
It is rewarding when things just work the way they are meant to work. And that's how I felt about my flight. It was delightful in all aspects; seats, food, service... everything just worked well without any... any issues or complaints. 

Top class! It'll be my new fav airline from now on.

title: A comfortable economy class experience!
review_text:
Compared to economy class of other flights i.e. British Airways (our return flight). The leg room was more than sufficient. The food quality was great on board. No difficulty with check in. We were within the weight limit. 

On board wifi was utilised. Though this was rather slow. In flight entertainment was ok with a selection of recent movies. The customer service was pleasant. Overall flight seemed to be pleasant and comfortable.

title: A very comfortable trip
review_text:
Recently flew with JAL from Tokyo to Vancouver, in business class. This was an overnight flight. The check in was very easy and all staff members were friendly and helpful. Language was not an issue. 

The Sakura lounge located about 10 mins (walk) from the gate  was large and had a selection of food and drinks available. The lounge was clean and tidy and a good place to rest before the flight.

Onboard the staff were very friendly and helpful and I quickly settled in. I was surprised that Business class is using an old side by side seat layout. It is good if you are wanting to conduct business or as a couple. But if you are sleeping you had to climb over the person next to you to go to the bathroom The seats turned into a bed, although it wasn't a flat bed and you slept on an angle. I found this annoying as there are other competitors who offer lie flat beds in their business class. This was an overnight flight and I was looking forward to a good rest.

The food and drinks selection offered both Japanese and alternate selections. Both meals were delicious. There was a snack bar near the rear of the section where passengers could choose what they wanted. There was also mini-meals that the attendants could prepare for if required.

The entertainment was good with a selection of movies, both new releases and old favourites. The inflight progress maps were limited and I was surprised that there wasn't an external camera to view the takeoff or landing. Maybe this model of B787 didn't have such cameras.

Overall the flight was smooth and the staff very helpful, friendly and welcoming.

title: Codeshares are crap!! Shame on you JAL!
review_text:
Booked a codeshare Garuda flight operated by JAL because it was the lowest and our corporate booking tool only books the lowest fare. So of course, since the flight is actually operated by JAL, Garuda Airlines is basically useless after taking the money.

So after I had to check in online at the JAL website with my e-ticket number (since the Garuda booking reference connects to nothing), I conclude my business in Jakarta and head to the airport to do some work in the lounge before my flight. Since it was a codeshare flight I was not able to get a boarding pass online. Well... apparently, JAL cannot be bothered with having a person or a kiosk to print a simple boarding pass. After I finally walked to various counters and kiosks, I called JAL customer service and was informed there are no kiosk for JAL at CGK and a person would not be there until 2 hours before the flight’s departure time. So here I sit for the next 3 hours on the checkin side of the airport where it’s hot, humid and there’s no where to even plug in. Not to mention I’m here with hundreds of people trying share limited seating. At least I had some time to type out this review. 

Shame on you JAL!! How hard would it be for 1 kiosk to print a lousy boarding pass!!

title: Japan airlines fllight aircraft type B-350 brand new aircraft
review_text: 8 hours flying time seat placement for flat bed seats is not really in ideal angle, it is a bit uncomfortable but service and on time departure and arrival is great and a reason to fly from tokyo to Honolulu is Cathay Pacific or Thai air do not fly to Honolulu, Hawaii U.S Territory

title: What A Great Airline
review_text: Such wonderful service. i will never fly another airline when i have an option for JAL. they have me for life

title: Impressive service!
review_text: I flew JAL in Feb 2018 from LAX to Manila RT. I am impressed by their courteousness. I travelled with elderly mother and they were very accommodating and respectful with everyone especially the elderly. In flight entertainment with movies and music, food was good. I would highly recommend them!

title: Disappointment with the counter staff
review_text:
It’s just a very short transit flight, however the counter staff seem have no information regards international flight and domestic flight trying to push us to pay for over weight luggage? I have explained to her we just came from HK (an international flight) and we are not over-weight of our luggage as we have 30kg allowance not 23kg. She kept on asking for ticket and not accepting my e-ticket? Nowadays who will have paper ticket with them and not e-ticket?? How could I give her a paper form even I don’t use any paper ticket in last ten years. 
Anyway, I guess as all the good experienced travel to Japan and with Japanese people I think just a disappointment that someone sit in the counter service will have that attitude.
In the flight is fine, nice smooth trip. Staff are nice and professional too.

title: The best ever
review_text:
I haven't flown the arabian airlines that advertise how awesome they are all the time but this airline that doesn't advertise everywhere is awesome. The difference between them and airlines in the US is staggering. 
The attendants care. The food is good. We flew in premium economy which is a touch better than economy but my son and I walked through the back part on a few laps and it looked comfortable. 
But the best ever was the service. My gosh they actually cared. So different from the US. I will fly these guys whenever I go to Asia in the future.

title: Excellent airline
review_text:
We fly quite regularly to Australia, and now choose to fly via Japan. It is a fascinating country and we spend three or four days inTokyo or Kyoto, to break up the journey. It also really helps to avoid jet lag,
Flying JAL has been a real bonus. They are considerably cheaper than BA and Qantas, but service and comfort are superior. Service from cabin crew is exquisite and charming, and the food is exceptional. I sleep much better on JAL than other airlines, and I wonder whether they circulate air more generously. So far, they have always arrived on time. My only minor quibble is that their films are not quite so good, but I rarely watch in any case.

title: Premium Economy Seat
review_text: It was very fairly a premium economy experience. The seat was as comfortable as one could get without actually laying down.  The amenities were just fine. The food though...very typical of the Japanese to have delicious food, even on their airplanes. It was so good!  Flights left on time and there were no hiccups...until I got to Hanoi and my bag didn't arrive with me.  Fortunately, JAL is part of an airline group that easily tracks bags within their network. My bag was delivered to my hotel promptly the next evening.  Even with that, I give them five stars.

title: ,1st R
review_text:
The Boeing 777-300 1st class is very spacious. Privacy is very good when the screen is up. Not a problem for window seats.if you like Japanese food than you have good choices.
The attendant even make bed for you if you need to sleep.The entertainment system should be good though I didn't try it.

title: comfortable professional
review_text: Check in was quick and well organized. They have a wonderful system to get the largest crowd quickly checked in . The line was long but keep steadily moving so there wasn't a concern about missing your flight. I love that they allow you to check one to two bags for free depending on your destination. My new preferred airline for travelling Asia

title: The best Airline
review_text: Outstanding service and quality standards. The staff courteous, smiling and efficient. The seats are Spacious.

title: The best Airline ever
review_text: The politeness, friendliness and kindness of the cabin crew is commendable. Excellent service. Food is also really good. Nothing to complain.

title: Try not to book on their website
review_text:
This review is about booking on their website, not the flight.  

I learned the hard way. After booking on their website to save a few dollars less than Expedia, I’ve decided to book on their website and made a mistake of typing my last name as my first, and first as my last name. This mistake cost me an extra $50 for re-issuance of ticket . 

Even though I paid for the ticket on the same website JAL, their system did not intuitively see that I’m the same person with same address. ( I’m just used to better AI employed by Most US companies)

Just book on known travel websites.  We have better protection and complaints are heard without slapping penalty for mundane incidents

title: Pretty comfortable flight but can improve on the meals
review_text:
We bought JAL air tickets (to and fro trip) for our family trip this time. They do provide child meal - looks appetising but not tasty at all. 
Their speciality drink - kiwi drink was well received at least by my family.
Unlike SQ flights, they do not have earphones which are catered to children; just one standard adult size. Also on my returning flight, i have asked my husband (who was seated at the aisle seat) to inform the air stewardess that not to open the small bottle of red wine first (as i want to have it later after my dinner), it was ignored and that air stewardess still give us an unhappy look. 
In comparison, the flight from Singapore to Japan was more pleasant and approachable even though not all the flight attendants spoke good fluent English (the return flight attendants were more fluent in English).
If asked me to choose, if my budget allows, i will take SQ flights or try out ANA for future Japan trips. Or better still, try out premium economy or business or first class of JAL and compare if there is any difference in the treatment by the staff.

title: Good flight
review_text: There is nothing to complaint about their on board services. Attendance are professional, caring, polite and patient in handling passenger need. It was a great experience flying with JAL. The only thing I would suggest them to improve in providing Halal food for muslim. Personally I did write a remarks during purchase the flight ticket and i guess it was not put enough attention to the crew and the team who preparing it (they did serve non-halal to us which we have to asked and there is no replacement to it except salad :) ). Overall it's a good experience flying with JAL!

title: Comfortable Flight in Premium Economy class
review_text:
It was my second trip to Asia and first time to use Premium economy seat.  From check-in, Premium economy was separate from other class and check-in procedure was quick without waiting.  In flight, there are many goods such as mask and slippers small pillow and blanket.  Quality of inflight item is closer to that of business class although foods and beverages are almost the same from economy class.  
   Overall satisfaction was good.  If there is another chance, I would choice preimum economy.

title: CAN'T BEAT JAL
review_text: Service from start to finish, great food, more leg space than American airlines upgraded seats.  Boarding and take off from Osaka was so fast I didn't even realize that the doors were closed.,

title: Great airline
review_text:
The japan airline is good , the seats are bigger room for leg space and the food is wide range. except my boyfriend who was flying from Boston with Japan airline to Singapore feedback that the meals are limited and not multiple with snacks on the long flight.

Basically, I flew back from Haneda to Singapore . the flight was good, as the friendly ground staff was very understanding and provide me with a seat after the premier range of passenger seats. I have alot more rooms for my long legs to be stretched. My meals in the flight was well done with good presentation and the food was still hot when serve. The only issue will be the snack should be like a warm chicken or tuna wrap instead of the bread.

title: Outstanding Experience
review_text: The flight crew on Japan Airlines is like no other I have ever experienced!  All of the attendants were professional, caring, friendly, patient and accommodating.  It was the best experience I have ever had on any airlines.  Nothing seems to rattle this crew, and they communicate in a very genuine manner, by making eye contact and speaking to passengers at their level.  The food, water, snacks and refreshments were tasty and plentiful.  We even were served my favorite ice cream for dessert.  I am now a happy customer, for life! (Oh, and I even was able to watch several current movies on my flight).

title: Japan Airline
review_text:
Meals is delicious
Service is great
Staff is very tactful

When they serve their meal or dessert 
They make sure every passenger is being address 

Dessert was Haggen Dazz

title: A very good experience
review_text: Travelled JAL from Beijing to Haneda and the flight was fine. The service was attentive and friendly. Traveling in business class in a slightly dated 2-2-2 arrangement, only complaint is there was no welcome drink before takeoff. Otherwise great service and highly recommended.

title: Japanese efficiency and comfortable flight
review_text: A perfect flight from Singapore to Tokyo. Great cabin with superb space for economy flights and a great screen for entertainment. Food and service was good too. Highly recommended airlines.

title: Great airline
review_text: Wide seats, good seat pitch and great service at reception and in the air. Seating is as good as many premium economy of other airlines.Even take your oversize luggage ie ski's and process them for travel.

title: JFK-NRT
review_text:
Pleasant flight with friendly and helpful crew.
I thought the the food was good for airplane food when compared to other airlines.

title: Great flight
review_text: We recently flew JAL from Vancouver to Tokyo and had a wonderful  experience. It was the first time foe the three of us to fly with JAL and to fly on  dream liner as well. The service before, during and upon arrival was excellent. The flight attendants were very pheasants and gave every impression that they loved their job. The service was very good and their attention to derail regarding my MSG allergy was awesome. The flight was long but it was a pleasure with this airline - would highly recommend JAL!

title: Don't count on your seat selection
review_text: The night before our flight and without any notice, JAL changed plane configuration.  Both our travel agent and we tried to get us back to adjoining seats.  We tried at check-in and we tried on the plane.  We even asked single flyers if they might switch (I won't go in to that).  So, we ended up paying for business class on a flight where we were separated by 5 rows, and I have a flying phobia.  Oh so sorry!

title: Excellent service
review_text: I flew JAL round trip NRT-KHH as part of my trip from Orlando to Kaohsiung. JAL service is impeccable. The flight staff were professional and courteous. The seats were human sized (unlike the American flagged carriers, who keep shrinking seat and pitch) and very comfortable. The economy meal was amazing. Even came with miso soup. Blankets are offered to all in economy.

title: Always on time
review_text:
Excellent with newer planes.  Very pleasant flight. Just sit and relax and enjoy the food.
Very good overall I felt safe in flight

title: Great airline
review_text: This airline was wonderful. The airline staff was outstanding. The flights were always on time and the lounges were great. From the ticketing agents to the stewards and stewardesses, it made a very long flight comfortable and relaxing. Would definitely fly this airline in the future.

title: First class airline
review_text: This is the second time I’ve traveled with JAL and it is amazing how the flight attendants go out of their way to comfort you. On my return flight I had even received a birthday card and a replica of the plane since my birthday was the next day. In general this is the best airline I’ve flown by far. They make economy class feel like the business class of other reputable airlines. I would definitely recommend JAL, especially for long international flights. Their service is top of the line.

title: BEST flying experience I've ever had !
review_text: Great people, clean and newer airplane. Superior service and just a fabulous experience. Lots of movies, and the food was fantastic! I will fly JAL again when I return to Japan. Highly recommended! And when you are in Takiyama visit the Sukyo Mahikari Center for Light.

title: Great experience
review_text: The flight was great, and unlike other airlines the sleeper seats were easy to get in and out of.  The return trip was delayed and we were afraid of missing our one toon, but they called ahead and rushed us thru security and waited u til we arrived

title: AHhhhh.MAZING
review_text: Even in the "cheap seats" the service, the room, the entertainment and food were on point. With very comfortable and spacious seats even a nine hour flight is not that bad. The movie selection and also the food, snacks and drinks were delicious, the flight attendants were very polite and helpful.

title: Fairly Good Premium Economy
review_text: JAL have the best economy class going and their Premium Economy is also good, but with reservations. For a start, it was a night flight, taking off at 2am and there was no food  for the first eight hours, although snacks and drinks were available. I suspect many would have preferred more choice about this. The seats were comfortable but you were locked into a a rigid space; you can't move the arm rests and as I was traveling with a young daughter, it was not what we wanted. She had to sleep separate from me and it was hard for me to move as I slept. Economy was better in that respect. Otherwise, all was good, although the food when it did come was hardly spectacular.

title: Fantastic Airline
review_text: My wife, 2 boys and I flew nonstop roundtrip Boston to Tokyo this February in economy and can only say great things about this airline. The staff went above and beyond, really catered to our kids to make a 14 hour flight go by fast and comfortable! I highly recommend this airline.

title: great flight
review_text: great flight heaps of leg room good food and friendly staff.Would definitly us again and highly reccommend

title: Great service
review_text: I felt the difference from checking in. Everyone is so attentive. As an American customer who is used to lower level services, I greatly appreciated these ladies who went beyond means to serve the customers. I especially am grateful of how they treat kids. Families got on board first with the top paid customers. Kids always got their meals first. And most of all, these ladies will always serve with smiles. Thank you JAL!

title: Excellent Service
review_text:
All the crew members paid attention to the passengers so that we could enjoy the flight.
They make a good group and give the service of good quality even though we had no meals (economy class) from Osaka to Okinawa.
At the airport, their check in service was speedy and helpful.

title: Excellent Service, slighlty older aircraft, spotless toilets!
review_text:
At about five and a half hours this is an “in between” time flight – not short, not long.
One odd feature – JAL’s frequent travellers are boarded before business class passengers…
Good news is that it is long enough to get an hour or two of sleep after lunch.    You might need that sleep as the crew give you huge glasses of champagne and wine.   The champagne a grand marque, the whites were adventurous, but the Bordeaux was superb.
Crew were friendly and very helpful however failed to bring drinks or water before take-off unless asked.  Lunch was excellent.  Before landing hot towels, refreshments and ice cream were served.  JAL Japanese “shirts” were offered to passengers.
The aircraft was well maintained, but the lie flat seating a bit older, as is common with this length of flight.
As this is a Japanese flight the toilets were pristine, and the WC had all the toys you would expect from Japan!
On time arrival and Haneda is a lovely airport, smaller and friendly and easy to negotiate around.

title: Japan turned into an airline
review_text: A wonderful way to end my trip to Japan, wish I had flown them both ways! The attendants were polite and caring, the food was far above most airline food, and it was just a great experience!

title: Excellent customer service
review_text: We flew on Japan Airlines from San Francisco to Tokyo and then to Bangkok and back and it was a very pleasant experience.  The flight was comfortable and the customer service was excellent.

title: Class J: Business Class Seat with only 1000 yen plus
review_text: I took a domestic flight from Tokyo/Haneda to Okinawa/Naha. Japan airlines has "Class J". The seat is available with only 1000 yen (approx. 10 USD) surcharge, and unlike "Economy plus" of many airlines, they offer full business class size seat with wide seat pitch. The service is the same with the economy class, but you do not need services for 1-2 hours domestic flight. Having extra space and comfort with only 10 USD additional is a great value for those who travel frequently within Japan. regardless of travel class of the ticket, if seats are available at the airport you can upgrade by paying the surcharge. Very good value for money.

title: JAL for life
review_text: Whenever possible, I will ALWAYS choose JAL.  The staff were extremely polite, exceeding all my expectations.  They were prompt and so kind.  The food was amazing, warm, fresh and JUST OVERALL amazing.  The seats were comfy and I loved the hot towels before meals, our own pillows and blankets.  OVERALL A+

title: Not really an Airline to fly with
review_text:
Small, uncomfortable and extremely lousy food. Not really edible. Sad because I love Japanese food. The movie selection was terrible.
I would not fly with JAL again, there are many options for the same cost.

title: Short Domestic Flight Chubu (Nagoya) to Tokyo Haneda, Centrair Domestic Lounge
review_text:
I took a very early morning flight on Japan Airlines at 7:50 am from Nagoya (Chubu International) to Tokyo Haneda.  I chose to fly as booked more than a month in advance, it was cheaper to fly than to take the train.

For early arrival at the airport, the train was the only option as the limousine bus does not operate early enough.  I took the first limited express from Nagoya station at 6 am which arrived at 6:30 at Nagoya airport.  The train was completely full since it was the first fast train of the day to the airport. 

On arrival at the airport, it was a short and well-signed walk to the domestic check-in.  Again, as it was the start of the flights for the morning, there were line-ups at every check-in counter for economy, business and first class.  I used the First Class check in based on One World Emerald status and after a short wait for the 4 or so guests in front of me, was met with the usual friendly courteous JAL service.  

As it was a domestic flight, no Japan Airlines own brand Sakura lounge was available and instead JAL offered the Centrair domestic lounge, a third party operated lounge used by a number of different airlines including both JAL and ANA.  The lounge was really nothing more than a place to seat with an offering of some basic soft drinks, coffee and a little alcohol, but that is pretty much as expected for a domestic lounge. 

The flight was scheduled for 7:50 am and boarded as scheduled at 7:30 am. The flight was operated using a B737-800 configured in J-Class (ie. domestic business class) in a 2X3 configuration.  I was in the aisle seat on the 2 side.  All seats were full in J-class for the morning flight.  Seats were reclining seats with a little recline only but for a short flight, that was fine.  I was quite tired and therefore napped through the entire 1 hour flight.  There might have been a drink service but I would have napped throught it.

The flight arrived on time and luggage delivery was quick, with the luggage coming out shortly after I arrived at the baggage reclaim hall.  One thing to note is that the arrival time of 8:50 am meant that by the time I exited the airport and caught the limousine bus at 9:20 am, it was rush hour so the expressway out of the airport was more like a parking lot than an expressway.  Nevertheless, I was able to reach Shinjuku station by around 10 am.

title: Premium economy
review_text: Cannot speak highly enough of JAL premium economy. Row 17 H and K are the best seats. Great leg room away from the toilets and the galley. JAL premium economy gives you access to the qantas business lounge and the JAL business lounge.

title: Detained Due to International Travel Agent Reservations
review_text:
We were flying from Tokyo to Okinawa in February. We had originally booked all of our flights using a travel agent in Maryland. We went from Guam to Tokyo, Tokyo to Misawa, Misawa to Tokyo, Tokyo to Okinawa, Okinawa to Guam. From this listing you can see we were traveling a lot in Japan. Japan Airlines had been fine thus far until this flight. There were 3 of us traveling 1 went first, no issues. Then we were helped by two other staff. They first gave us one figure for our luggage overage. Then they tried again and gave us another figure for the overage. Then there was an issue because our flight was originally booked in America which made it International even if we were flying from Haneda Airport to Okinawa which is a domestic destination. They took our money then told us they needed to have the back office clear our reservations and I guess our money too. The they told us to go out of the line and wait on the side until the back office could verify our reservations and our money. We asked how long we would be waiting and they said 15 minutes, we said no. Why are we not getting our boarding passes and change for the bags. We gave them yen. Well they kept leaving the counter and asking us to leave. Finally we asked for a supervisor for assistance. 10 minutes later a supervisor appeared with still another amount for our excess baggage and our boarding passes and our change. She just kept saying so sorry, so sorry. No real explanation of what the hold up was about or why the difference in the pricing for the excess baggage. I do know when JAL does screw up they screw up big time. No explanation, it took us over 40 minutes to check in. We probably would have still been standing there had we not asked for a supervisor. Really then we took the flight and really they cater to their Japanese speaking clients on these domestic flights. Explanation in English but no written signs in English.
Happy to get to Okinawa and happier that my flight to Guam will be with United and not JAL. I would be leary of flying JAL if you flight was originally booked in America and your are flying out of  Haneda to another part of Japan.

title: E#xcellent experience with JAL NYC-HND-MNL-NRT-NYC
review_text: Excellent service, excellent food.  The cabin crew were very polite and frequently helped passangers put their bags into the overhead bins.  This is almost unheard of now among the US carriers.  One little thing that was a nice touch was a cardboard sign at the entrance area of baggage claim indicating the appropriate belt number. I know the screens eventually give the information, but to me it was still a great touch at the end of a long flight.

title: Excellent flightbsck from Japan
review_text: Great food great inflight entertainment, lots of leg room and comfortable seats.  The onboard service was very good staff very friendly great customer service would definitely fly with this airline in the future

title: Typical Japanese efficiency
review_text: Myself and my 2 sons flew economy direct Sydney to Tokyo (Narita) return with JAL January this year ( JL771 /JL772 ) .  Like all things Japanese the whole flight ran like clockwork . We booked online through a UK based booking agent for around $700 per ticket cheaper than either the airlines direct or any other site . Sydney check in was  good and well managed , the return Tokyo check in was perfect , Sydney being Sydney the snowboards had to be taken to oversized baggage counter after weighing our luggage, however at Narita they just went straight through with the rest of our bags.. The 46 kilo checked luggage allowance ( 2 by 23 kilo bags ) plus carry on is double that of Qantas and much appreciated when taking snowboards , boots , apres boots ,ski jackets etc and there was no extra charge for the oversized luggage . The plane itself was near brand new , the seats comfortable, for economy seats , ample leg room ,good entertainment system and wide choice of what to watch . Inflight service was excellent, meals offered were good and the Fight Attendants attentive and helpful. To sum it up it was a typical Japanese experience, efficient , on time ( in fact early on the return leg ) and exactly what you paid for .

title: Just have to Love JAL
review_text:
The flight was great. Foods was good. Order special meal when I travel to TPE because of there is beef on the going flight n normal meal on return. 

The crew service was ok, there is Chinese crew onboard that who can’t speak English or Japanese. 

I don’t like is the announcement as it’s too long. Can’t watch the movie n cannot finish due to the long announcements. 

Entertainment was good as there new movies. 

Return was delay more than 35 min due to waiting for one missing passenger plus ATC hold which I don’t think it’s good for other passengers who have connections.

title: Premium Economy Great, basic Economy not so good
review_text: Flew DFW to Bangkok round trip two legs each way through Narita. Second leg of flight was Basic Economy from Narita to Bangkok  Premium Economy not offered. Premium Economy was very comfortable and amenity filled. Blanket, Headset, Eye Mask, Pillow, slippers provided with good seating room. I would give it an eight  of 10. Basic Economy  few amenities and crowded 4 of 10...Premium Economy or higher is way to go.  Crew very friendly and offered great service 8 of 10. Food Japanese oriented menus and about airline average 5 of 10. Boarding system very strange and inefficient. JAL does not recognize Pre Check in US. Overall would fly again at or above Premium Economy.

title: BEST ECONOMY CABIN EVER
review_text:
5 stars airlines and best economy cabin by skytrax can’t lie. I’m really really comfortable flyingwith Japan Airlines. Good staff, very helpfull. Seat so fluffy and distance every seat very wide. I’ll fly again with Japan Airlines!!
Arigatou

title: JAL Business is great but transfer in LHR Terminal 5 a disaster
review_text: So this is really a pity as I find the JL 041 a great flight and the service of JAL is fabulous but the transfer at LHR Terminal 5 is a shambles (40 minutes wait at security as no Fast Track security in transfer zone so almost missed connection even if I had a 80 minute connection time).   So while JAL is great the BA service and treatment on the ground is a disaster.  Now some will say that the solution is to go through immigration and back in through the First Wing of Terminal 5, after Brexit that will not be a solution unless immigration controls as as today.  This will make transfers at Heathrow unviable.  It is a pity for JAL with a fabulous service and product to have it devalued by BA no longer paying for the Fast Track security for Terminal 5 transfers. (same problem a week ago transferring through Heathrow to a BA connection from Africa).

title: Smooth Flight!
review_text:
- Check-in was quick and efficient. 
- The flight attendant staff were all friendly and professional. 
- Even though the economy class seat I had was not an aisle seat, there was still plenty of leg room available.
- My flight from Bangkok - Suvarnabhumi to Tokyo - Narita was smooth, comfortable and on time.
- I always enjoy listening to the Japanese language from native speakers.
- Thanks JAL! I had a pleasant experience.

title: Affordable and Comfortable
review_text: Japan Airlines is a comfortable flight, even in economy. There is plenty of legroom for someone of my height (6ft 4in) and the amenities are plentiful during your flights over the ocean. All of the seats recline back a good amount, and the in-flight entertainment is incredibly diverse. Not the cheapest, but not the most expensive, JAL ends up being pretty affordable for the value you receive.

title: Wow!
review_text:
I have flown with a variety of airlines over the years and until I flew with JAL my favorite airline was an American competitor. Not any more...JAL is number ONE in my book now! From baggage check in through deportation of the plane, the customer is treated like a king! Even though I was flying Economy I felt as though I was in First Class!
Thank you JAL for such a wonderful flight experience and please keep up the good work!

title: Great experience
review_text: A very comfortable flight from Moscow to Tokyo. Looking forward to flying this company again, because the flight attendants are so experienced and professional and many things are made me feel like a guest, not just like a passenger. Although the webpage is a bit tricky for me, so I did not manage to understand how to book the vegetarian meal. I hope to find this option of the next flight)))

title: Flight to Misawa to Narita was Great!
review_text:
Flight to Misawa was great!. Just enough legroom for my long legs. If the flight was longer than 2 hours I would have not been able to enjoy the flight with the current leg room. The seats were comfortable and the staff was very pleasant and courteous. The ride was smooth until we got closer to Misawa they we did experience bumpy skies. But we were able to land and got our baggage and then got out to experience the snow. 
All in all it was a quiet flight.

title: The best airline I have ever used
review_text: This was a non-stop flight from Boston to Tokyo and it was by far the best flight experience I had ever had. The attendants were flawlessly dressed and extremely polite. The food was excellent and the plane was spotless.

title: Pretty quick flight
review_text: Great quick flight with excellent service.  JAL always lives up to its reputation as a top-notch quality airline.  I like that when weather related problems at my destination could have caused a delay or diversion of my flight, JAL notified me about it.  Delays can be quite annoying to say the least and by being informed about the possibility lessens the impact.  The flight wound up being delayed about 15 minutes.

title: 日本航空
review_text:
日本航空公司班機
上次一月份去日本東京 乘搭日本航空公司 令我對日本航空公司非常有歸屬感 服務品質高 食物又差
Japan airline : I go japan for shopping and I took japan airline .I have some comments for this airline .it is really good . Nice food than others airline ,Good service and Polite ,even I book econ class , the seat also wide and comfortable.it have wiskey drink and beer and snack .I like it so much ,I will suggest my family and friend to take japan airline if for family trip to japan . so I do choose japan airline each time I flight to Tokyo . It is my first choice airline . Thank you so much !

title: Great airline----TERRIBLE airplane----Yikes!!
review_text:
The airline was perfect, the flight crew epic and the food wonderful. The Boeing 787 "Dreamliner" as outfitted by JAL is the worst aircraft on this planet and likely any others. Whatever you do avoid the 787 and go for the 777. The space between the forward seat and your face is so close that it renders the entertainment system useless (see the enclosed photo). 
Having purchased the seats months before departure JAL could have made a bit of an effort to seat my wife and I together but it is still the seat spacing that makes this ride terrible. Only two classes of seats, economy and first class. No good options here.
Food, crew, cleanliness and everything else was wonderful. Just a miserable ride.

title: Japan Air Flight 17
review_text: This was my first experience with Japan Airlines and overall it was very pleasant.  I had the pleasure of sitting in business class and honestly, it’s the only way to travel on a long flight!  Food was excellent, flight attendants were very professional and well put together, and I loved having a ton of leg room!  Only downside?  The WiFi was useless.  I purchase a flight pass and it worked for the first hour.  That’s okay.  I entertained myself with free movies and shows.  Two thumbs up for Japan Airline!

title: JAL Milage bank very difficult to use
review_text:
flew on business class last december. flight was great. and we have accumulated milage on several of our flights with them. service is great. but the japan milage bank website is so bad.. we tried to redeem the milage and it was so difficult to use. we can only book flights to or from japan. booking process is so tedious. 

i have used kriflyer several times and it is much easier to use. i can complete a booking within 5-10 minutes on krisflyer website. i spent half an hour on jal milage bank site and finally gave up. their customer service is also very bad. the wait time is 40 minutes or more.

title: Good flight
review_text: This was our first JAL flight as we usually do long haul flights with another carrier. I think the legroom was better than what we are used to, however that is where the similarity ends. There was no menu and no idea what drink options there were. When meal time comes, you are offered one of two choices. The food was fine though. Service through the night is limited which is normal. One flight was slightly delayed but that is not usually the fault of the airline. Overall, we arrived safely, in relative comfort and that is what matters to me. It was a pretty good flight but still a bit to go for top marks.

title: Great !
review_text: Great flight, good food and nice staff. The only bad thing is the 12 hours flight, it's too long, obviously JAL is not responsible for that . When I take a plane for 3 or 4 hours flight I have no problem, so with nearly 12 hours I came very tired.

title: If you have to fly economy you may as well fly the best
review_text: By far the best economy seat I have ever flown.  I am over 6 feet tall and there was more room, especially leg room when the seat in front was reclined.  Service is top notch and the staff are especially polite and helpful.  Best economy I have ever flown.

title: Terrible service
review_text: Terrible service ! 6 hours delay and no information , no servies for Business class     not 5 stars airline !!!!!

title: Poor seat and bad onboarding process
review_text:
Airline between TSA and HND is a popular choice for its short distance to downtown and JAL has an advantage of flight time for TW based passengers.
However, the deployed airplane(s) for JL96 and JL99 is quite old-decorated. The seat facility including seat adjustments, personal TV or even seat width are all quite medium to low quality. The seat adjustments are not working smoothly and personal TV touch screen is not always responsive.
The ground staff for my departing JL96 flight is not friendly either.
I had a ski luggage and she asked if there is a wax therein.
I answered it is a whole new ski and should be coated with wax and no box of wax additionally. Next, I asked her whether wax is considered as flammable material so cannot be transported. And No Response from the staff anymore, she just felt unhappy of a ski luggage....a really bad experience of Japanese Company service!

Both JL96 and JL99 boarding gates are quite far away from terminal entrance. The passenger bridge is only with one entering way. Once biz class passenger seated, all passengers will walk through your seats and need to mind not being slapped by other people's jackets, backpackers and even arms.....

title: Are you kidding me!
review_text:
We were going from cold weather Mt. Fuji to warmer weather in Okinawa.  So we had more than normal clothing. We had to check in 2 luggage per person and the allowance was only 20 kg per person PER PERSON.  That means 10 kg or 22 lbs per suitcase!  Some suitcases already weight 5lbs! Most airlines allow 20 kg per suitcase even low budget Airline like Peach allows 20 kg per suitcase. 
We had to pay over US $130 for overage and we were flying J class or their premium economy class. What a rip off!
I definitely am not recommending JAL to anyone!
I would definitely like to hear from someone at JAL to hear their explanation!

title: End of January Low Season Flight (but change to come in peak season)
review_text:
I took an end of January JAL flight from Vancouver to Tokyo Narita and was surprised at how empty business class was - I counted the front section of the B787 where I was seated (seat 1K, right side first row window) and about half the seats were empty.  Therefore, almost every passenger had an empty seat beside them and with 3 toilets for business class, there was always an available toilet with no wait.  The flight was punctual as is reliably common for JAL, and service and food was excellent.  I selected the Japanese meal for the first meal (lunch) as I find generally the Japanese meal is better than the Western choices on JAL, the starter bento box provides an always interesting combination of many different small bites, and overall the Japanese meal seems more substantial than the Western meal choices.  The main is always two meat/chicken/fish with rice and pickles and this time, it was fish and chicken.  

For the second meal, a smaller snack before arrival, I selected the Western set as the Japanese meal did not seem particularly interesting and was surprised when the flight attendant came back to advise me they were out of the Western meal and whether I would take the Japanese meal instead.  I reluctantly agreed and probably frowned as a minute later, she returned to advise that another passenger had agreed to switch their meal choice and she would be able to serve the Western meal to me after all.  I was glad as the Western meal was very delicious, particularly the mango citrus slaw and the soft fresh rolls.

I noticed JAL was serving two Junmai Daiginjo sakes on the flight so I asked to try one, expecting to be poured a small cup for tasting.  Instead I was given a whole small 180 ml bottle, which was very nicely full bodied but much more than I could drink.  

The usual complaint about the 2X2X2 layout and no direct aisle access for window seats in the B787 Dreamliner used by JAL for this route did not apply this time as the half empty plane meant I had an empty seat beside me so no effort to step over another passenger.  The angle flat seat is still not as good for sleeping as a fully horizontal flat seatbed, but I did note JAL has introduced a new dense foam pillow instead of the previous soft fill pillow and it was much more supportive. 

Being in the first row, I had the smaller pull out from the armrest screen instead of the larger screens in the other rows which have the screens on the back of the previous row, but I always thought the smaller screen was a good trade off for a window seat that has much easier step over access if there is a passenger in the aisle seat and because JAL does not have as broad a selection of movies as Cathay Pacific or British Airways, for example, by comparison.  But I was a bit surprised JAL had Bohemian Rhapsody playing on the flight whereas a Cathay Pacific flight I took on the next day did not have it yet.

Checking on future planned travel, I discovered that JAL will be switching to a B767 on the route during the peak season starting in early June and that the plane will be equipped with JAL's much nicer fully flat Sky Suite II with direct aisle access for all seats.  However the trade off appears to be price as flights in early June to around mid-October seem to be priced around the $4,900 range round trip instead of the current $3,400 or so.

title: Great Airline, Great Service, but Frankfurt Airport Lounge substandard
review_text: We enjoyed a wonderful flight with Japan Airlines from Tokyo Narita to Frankfurt return in January 2019.  The flight from Narita to Frankfurt is of high appeal to me as I do not like night flying and with a departure out of Narita around 11.00am local time and arrival into Frankfurt at 5.30pm local time and flying over the beauty of Northern Russia, it is a fantastic flight.  Similiarly, the return flight from Frankfurt is 50% daylight with a 7.30pm departure out of FRA and afternoon arrival into NRT.  The ongoing service, in flight catering, and on board facilities of the Boeing Dreamliner 900 series is fantastic.  The only failure was the JAL lounge at Frankfurt which is definitely not up to JAL standards.  The venue, catering and the environment is none different to a school classroom. Needs a major overhaul.  we look forward to flying same route with JAL again next year.

title: Terrible customer service
review_text:
My partner and I booked the listed tickets and received multiple emails of cancellation of seats and 
change of flights. This resulted in the following: 
- Firstly, seating that was not together
- Secondly, downgrade to economy
I called and spoke to a JAL representative and I was informed that premium economy was not available due to the change of flight and was told I had to downgrade to economy or pay the difference and 
upgrade to business. I then asked if other dates were available for premium economy as my partner 
is a tall gentleman and cannot fly economy and was told that no dates can be confirmed. 
I asked to speak to a manager and this was denied. I had to argue to have a refund which I still have 
not received.
This has been an appalling experience and subsequently ruined our holiday to Japan. I would never 
fly with Japan Airlines or recommend JAL services based on the extremely poor service I received. 
There was absolutely no attempt to fix the problem, which your airline created by changing the 
flight. Good customer services means assisting the customer – this was not the case. A very unsatisfactory outcome.

title: Old and tired
review_text:
The overall experience from
The lounge to the flight was sub par .
I was expecting a lot more and was completely disappointed.
The lounge was very old and the food wasn’t far behind .
The flight was just ok and the seat was old as well

title: Affordable Domestic Fares for Foreigners with Japan Explorer Pass
review_text: Chose the airline because of the Japan Explorer Pass that is available for foreigners to fly domestic routes on a very affordable fare. Service and comfort on board was good. Check in process is very efficient and staff courteous and helpful. Would definitely choose JAL again because of the provision of this Explorer Pass. Thank you!

title: Amazing Experience on Japan Airline
review_text:
We flew JAL recently from Singapore > Narita Airport > Hawaii and I would highly recommend JAL airline. The chair for the airline is larger than other airlines since I had plenty leg and elbow room. I felt comfortable the whole flight so can’t complain too much. The in flight entertainment content was plentiful so if you stay awake the whole way you won’t be bored. 

The staff was very helpful and service was excellent.

title: Will certainly travel with JAL again!
review_text:
We flew JAL recently from Melbourne to Tokyo - Narita and I would recommend this airline to friends and family and not hesitate in flying with them again.  I had booked the tickets using Webjet and then choose our seats by visiting the JAL website after consulting Seat Guru.  I would have liked to see the price for Premium Economy but this was not an option on Webjet ( it may have been out of our budget anyway!).
As my son and husband are quite tall I prebooked aisle seats for them, the seat configuration on our flights were 2 4 2 so we had one seat behind the other in order to get the aisle. The seats seem to be slightly deeper and there seemed to be more elbow room due to the seat configuration. Don't get me wrong it is not Premium Economy though! But we were comfortable.
From check in to boarding and landing the customer service was spot on. The plane left on time with no delays. The flight to Tokyo was an over nighter and we were given a snack bag and then breakfast close to arrival. On the flight home from Tokyo to Melbourne we had a flight during the day and we were served lunch and dinner.  There was a good offering of movies and entertainment which was easy to access.
We were very impressed with JAL and will definitely fly with them again.

title: Efficient and Courteous
review_text:
We flew JAL from PVG to KIX and a return flight NRT to PVG recently and we were totally wowed by the level of service we received, the comfort on board, and the efficiency of boarding/deplaning.

The meals were edible, though nothing incredible - by the hagen daz ice cream was a nice touch.  We loved the SkyKiwi drink, and were so please that we could opt for that along with a glass of wine and a cup of hot green tea after our meal.  In flight entertainment was awesome, and especially on our second flight when we had a newer plane with their extra-wide economy seats we were SO comfortable.  One of our best flights ever.  They gave us blankets even for the short haul flights, and the little things like cup holders and extra compartments in the seat back really made for an enjoyable flight.  Can't wait to fly JAL again!

title: Never again
review_text:
JAL is supposed to be all about customer service and I did not get that. I went in line and due to a codeshare flight I checked with their staff to Check if this was the right place I need to be. The staff in polo shirts were like no, you need to go 2 gates down.... carrying two heavy luggage, I raced there to find out I need to go back to the original spot. Sweating and tired I told them of the situation and they tell me that, the staff in their check in counter area don’t know how to speak English and not their staff...so this situation does not have to do with JAL... ummm ok... 
then one of my bags was 3 kilos over and they charged me.. haha. Great service recovery too! -_-;;;

title: Great service and excellent food but not cheap
review_text:
The food and drink options were excellent,  the seat didn’t lay completely flat and I ended up sleeping reclined but was very comfortable.  I feel like premium economy may be the best value for the dollar with this airline but if it’s not available then business class is still a good but pricey option.

Cheers!

title: Best Asian Airline for me
review_text: Yes, the way it should  be when flying. Highly respectful and well educated crew, staff, absolutely ravishing food , real champagne ,not fake bubbly like on First (haha) American or even worse UA and of course japanese elegance. I tried ANA several times, each time was disappointing so I came back to JAL. By far the best airline on oneworld together with qatar and cathay. All the rest on that alliance just pathetic. Big seats, good selection of food,elegant dark design,unlike that horrible ana blue, either japanese or european meals,drinks first class. Excellent wine selection.Nothing to complain.

title: A First Class First Class
review_text: Everything first class is supposed to be.  Private compartments, great ameneties, Bose headphones, excellent food and wine, pajamas, and lie flat beds made up with mattress pad and quilt by attentive flight attendants.

title: Excellent
review_text: This airline is a amazing lots of food to eat hostess was great, everything with the flights was great. I would recommend to everyone

title: The best way to get to Europe from Melbourne
review_text:
I flew MEL-NRT-HEL in Premium Economy before flying on to Oslo, returning from Hamburg in October and November 2018.

Simply put, this is an amazing experience, with space galore and a comfy seat.

The food is the same as economy but it's good and you can get champagne (or Sky Time Kiwi, which is well worth a try, as is the Udon de Sky). Service was top notch too.

Both Narita and Helsinki airports are easy and stress-free to navigate. Unusually for Premium Economy, lounge access is thrown in but you can't really take advantage of it, so good are the connections. 

Downsides? The cabin temperature was a bit warm, and the entertainment a bit lacking in English stuff (well, it is a Japanese airline!). And it looks like they're discontinuing Premium Economy from MEL to NRT in early May.

But these are not enough to keep me away - I've booked them again in May - over to Budapest in Premium Economy, back from Paris in economy!

title: Premium economy wonderful experience
review_text: The seats are spacious and lots of legroom compare to other airlines and the sector is also quite zone. Very comfortable when travel on long direct flight

title: Overall very good service in premium economy
review_text:
JAL service was very good - food, staff, cleanliness, amenities.  Movies were average.

A big bonus in JAL premium economy is access to the business lounge.  This was a great surprise - we enjoyed breakfast in Sydney and several drinks and nibbles in Tokyo on the way home in a comfortable setting.  Everything is as you'd expect in this class of service except there is no priority boarding. We had the first row of premium economy which provides even more space and leg room (although TV screens must fold away).

title: Wonderful Customer service!
review_text: While this is a long flight, it is a direct flight, which is a huge plus!  The flight attendants were all very polite.  Because its a long flight, everyone gets a pillow and a blanket! You don't get that all the time! I was able to plug in, watch movies, etc and charge my phone, watch etc the entire time.  And even though we had to depart a bit late, the pilots made up a lot of the time!  Overall a really good experience.  Same good experience on the way back!

title: Surprisingly spacious economy seats!
review_text: The economy seats are super spacious and comfortable compared to other airlines. As an average height person, some economy seats felt very cramped and the barely reclined. But with Japan airline, my knee was nowhere near the seats in front. When reclined the angle is very good that I almost thought that I was in premium economy!

title: Manila to Tokyo
review_text:
I took this flight together with my family.
The service was awesome. Attendant and friendly crew.
I would also like to compliment the food that was served - best airline food I've had in economy class (Tokyo to Manila leg).

title: Spacious seats and good service
review_text: Had the opportunity to fly to Japan (Tokyo/Wakayama/Nagoya) on a holiday in December 2018, and decided to fly via JAL.  It was one of the best decisions we ever made.  The flight was cheaper than some other airlines and the seats were way more spacious, even roomier than the SQ Premium Economy which I took from MLB to SG. Service was impeccable and food was decent.  Definitely good value for money and comfortable too.

title: incomparable «in-Japan» treatment
review_text: We wouldn't think of flying to Japan with another airline. In 2018 my wife and I made three round-trips between San Francisco and Tokyo on JAL in premium economy, which might be the greatest bargain in airline travel. For a few hundred extra dollars you get the lounge before flying and your bags get business priority. The seats are plenty spacious and lack nothing in comfort. The servers are unfailingly attentive and charming. They don't wake up sleeping passengers for any reason. This is the incomparable «in-Japan» treatment that we love.

title: Super airline, will fly again with them
review_text: American Airlines booked us with Japan Airlines. We rode on the ‘Dreamliner’, premium economy seats were plenty comfy if you can get first class. The chairs adjusted in the legs and back, and even had a foot rest. The movie selection was nice. I liked the goodie bag, they even had noice canceling head phones, which was so helpful for a 14 hour flight. The crew was so kind and kept the lavatories clean, where they left toothbrushes after dinner. I appreciated their food, that’s what tickled me most. The mid flight snack was noodles! Look at the pic! Airplanes on the noodle or veg (couldn’t figure that out). Japan Airlines lounge was nice I pigged out there too. Again the crew was great at all three airports.

title: Great service ... some challenges with the gate crew
review_text: Great onboard service and hard product.  Flight delayed due to incoming passengers.  Much confusion with the gate team trying to get the flight boarded.  Very polite but very disorganized.

title: Not worth the money and the service was horrible.
review_text:
Ive always heard that JAL Airlines was a great arline but now that ive experienced it for myself I strongly disagree. I've been flying first and business class for over 25 years so I know a great airline when I see it. Never have I been told that I can't have something to eat that's on the menu until JAL and they also were very slow responding to my request. I paid extra to get extra but its obvious JAL trears you like an economy flier :( biggest waist of money and I will never fly this airline again. There are so many amazing business class flights to choose from. Its sad that for the extra money I paid they still don't value the customer. Needs serious improvements!

Food selection was poor.

title: Clean, comfy, very friendly service
review_text: Cabin staff is excellent. Truly caring, friendly, helpful. Exceptionally clean cabin, great coffee. No pajamas but a re-usable cardigan is offered - feels a little strange.. good slippers, ok blanket. Food is not quite what it used to be

title: Old...
review_text: One of the 2 biggest airlines in Japan, but compared with another (ANA), Japan Airlines have older aircraft, and service is not so good.

title: Excellent Service
review_text: This airline has excellent service by all staff.  I was on a very, very long trip and while the "other" more American Airline was okay, as soon as I transfered to Japan Airline, it was quite a difference.  You are made to feel welcome by all staff at the gate and while in the air.  Everyone is smiling and offering to help you or serve you.  When the gate agents arrived to open it, they all looked at their customers in the gate area and bowed to us!  I will always fly this airline if I have a choice.

title: Very Professional!
review_text: First time JAL flyers and what an amazing flight! The cabin staff were dressed very professional, extremely polite and efficient in tending to the passengers. The food was very tasty and the plane was clean and restrooms were well tended to. They even provided disposable toothbrushes. They also provided comfortable blankets and pillows. My husband and I agreed that it was like flying years ago when the airlines and employees took pride in their jobs. We will fly JAL again!

title: Delilghtful trip.
review_text: My first trip across the pacific was accentuated by comfortable accommodations, attentive flight attendants, and delicious food. I had to return early because of an emergency at home which necessitated traveling coach. The accomod0tions were not as comfortable and spacious but the food was good and the attendants were so polite and helpful.  I look forward another trip in the future on this fine airline.

title: It was good
review_text:
Mostly the legs of the flights seemed smooth. Only the last leg from Narita to LAX was very turbulent that I thought we would die. The food was good. I loved the ice cream cups. No sushi though. Going from Narita to MNL, there was no other choice but a salmon meal which was not okay because hubby is allergic to seafood so he did not eat anything. Good thing the flight was just about 4 hours. He survived...

Regarding cleanliness, the flight from MNL to Narita, there were so much dust where the carry on luggage bins were and the aircraft itself.

title: Good Flight
review_text: This is my first time travelling with JAL with my family. We are 2 adults and 2 Children (age 7,9). Flight is on time and smooth during my travel date. The entertainment and food are good and we have comfortable seats as well. Definitely will choose JAL again if we travel to Japan again.

title: Incomparable
review_text: Have flew several airlines from USA to Asia, specifically Hong Kong for more than 15 years, no airline services can match Japan Airline.  Locking up in a airplane for more than 10 hours, the high quality services offered by the flight crews is crucial.  JAL has the best western and Japanese food menu, the fresh cook rice, and most important is the food served by exceptional professional JAL flight crews.  The flight attendants are not just smile, but maintain the virtues of Japanese hospitality and kindness.  They create an atmosphere of comfortable and memories.  I always felt my 10-hour flight as if it were only a few hours.

title: Excellent flight
review_text: No need to say more. Best flight ever. Hostesses were very accommodating even though it was a short 6 hr flight. I would travel Japan airlines again.

title: Excellent Airline and Experience
review_text: This direct flight from JFK to Narita was a dream.  I was impressed from the moment I checked in at the ticket counter: the agent noticed that I was tall and (without me asking) arranged to have my seat changed to the exit row, where there was unrestricted room for my legs.  The onboard staff was extremely professional, courteous, and helpful.  The flight departed on time, and arrived early.  My premium economy seat was comfortable enough relative to business class.  On board entertainment was expansive.  I was a bit disappointed in the quality of the meals (although the meals on my return JAL flight were excellent).  I have flown to Japan several times before on Delta and KAL, but JAL will be my first preference in the future.

title: Perfect!
review_text:
Everything was perfect!
The staff was incredible friendly and the food was good! 
The flight was on time !
I’ve just loved everything !

title: Well run airlines. l,
review_text:
Travel a lot in last twenty years and always impressed with JAL.  Orderly, clean, timely. great service from Ticket counter till departure from destination terminal.  
 Attendants on board are friendly, courteous, timely and helpful.  I am old enough to remember most American airlines were this way... Sad,

title: Good redemption. Wouldn’t buy it.
review_text:
Four stars for hard product and food only. 

Third time in long haul first class on this flight. First time traveling with my husband. 

JAL wins on hard product, mostly for being able to see out the windows and the memory foam mattress 

The food on this flight was excellent. 

As for all other aspects, I still prefer ANA. 

Cristal was gone before dinner service (mostly because they kept my husband’s glass full and mine empty). I was basically ignored and crew deferred to my husband (interesting as I bought the tickets and am the only one with OW elite status). I had to ring the call button multiple times and was not greeted with the typical Japanese high level of cabin service. Was treated more as an inconvenience. 

If I can redeem miles for the ticket, I’ll fly again. Otherwise, my cash goes to ANA.

title: A delightful flight
review_text: Unbelievably good flight! What an unexpensive award ! It's amazing how travel in Asia carries great value and excelent service! This was a BA award . flew Economy Plus cabin . For a 3hour flight, perfect. Marvelous lounge service,  great on board food terrific entertainment.

title: Very Solid Performance
review_text: Flew the family (4 of us) to Tokyo. I am very experienced international traveler (54 countries so far). Very spoiled as I usually flew business, but flew economy plus with the family from NY JFK to Tokyo and was very pleasantly surprised. I have back issues too but premium economy had lots of leg room and the seats were large and comfortable enough for this big American male. The food was good, but not great. So we traveled with some extra snacks. However, overall we found the service to be excellent - very professional and attentive. Was overall very pleased with the airline.

title: Worst Airline ever. Treated u like criminal.
review_text:
In flight staffs treated my family and I very badly. I never imagined to experience something like this in my life. Worst flight of my life time, and My opinion JAL is worst Airline of all. 

After took off my flight JL773  Narita to Melbourne 10/01/2019 one hour later my two years old daughter was trow up, we both were all cover with vomit. Staffs only helped us by bought us some wet towels, but I did have to clean everything myself. I used my dirty top to cover the seat which still dirty with vomit. I know my daughter throw up so did try to not bother much for help. But my top covered with vomit so had to ask if they have spare top and they helped me with one cardigan. I did offer to buy this cardigan but she said is was OK, and I did plan to ask if how she want us to return this top. However no one offer to help and ask how about us, treat us like it was your fault u better leave with it. 

Then 2hours before landing, one Japaness Staff did come to ask my husband to return the cardigan because she need to do stock taking and want to make sure we return it. Then just 5 mins later another staff came to ask me to make sure we have to return the cardigan in 5mins!
