Really!!!, I never feel treated like this before, do u think we really need your logo cardigan that much!!!!! Do you really think we need to take it with us that bad, we did not want even wore it if my sweater was not full of vomit. All you care is the cardigan? What I going to wear? Have u ever care how well of my daughter? Have u ever came and ask how she feel? Why did she throw up? Not even once you came and ask how my family are doing alright? She is only 2!!! What you care is only the one cheap cardigan which have your logo on the chest, who want to ware that! We return your cardigan straight away. That show me enough if something ever happened JAL staffs will definitely worry about their belonging more than passengers. Sorry this matter also shows me enough about what is JAL airline main focus is and I will make sure will not travel with you again! Mark my word even we have free ticket I will not take it, that flight make me feel so bad, like I am a criminal try to steal your stuff. I did pay for nearly $16,000 for my family and all my staffs to travel with Japan Airlines and let me tell you worst decision ever. This trip is worst trip of my lifetime thank to you. And I will make sure i will pass this message to everyone I know to not use Japan Airlines again in the future. Because if accidents happen they will not care! No courtesy, no care, no customers service. Worst than budget airline. Food also bad. NOT and NEVER AGAIN!

title: comfortable and good services
review_text: the seat is comfortable even for economy class. Cabin crew always stand by and look after passangers, even in the evening when most of people fall asleep. the minus is only there's no wifi.

title: Exceptional Empathy
review_text: I was flying back after a ski accident in Club Med Sahoro which made it impossible to walk with no pain at my knee. With 2 children and a couple of luggages, my husband was struggling. A friend suggested asking for assistance from the airline. Right from the start at Obihiro, they took care of everything. All the crews were informed, connecting flight from Nareda was totally full but everyone from ground to flight did they best to make it easier and comfortable for me. We appreciate all the extra effort and they did it with so much pleasure that I felt bad being such a burden. When we arrived in Singapore, this experience was different. All the arrangement was made but somehow the ground crews gave me the feeling that it was grudging meant to be. The disparity in attitudes were so great that I can only accord the attention and assistance received from Japan sectors were truely exceptional. I am flying next week for work alone, still needing assistance to move around, let’s see if Singapore Airlines is as good as they claim. I will share again. 😃

title: Best Customer Service!!!!
review_text: After a long flight from SFO to Tokyo, my boyfriend and I were sure we were going to miss our connecting flight to New Chitose (20 minutes to clear customs, transfer bags, and make it to our new gate).  This was the last flight of the night.  Upon leaving the plane, a JAL agent was waiting for me and my boyfriend (with a printed sign with our names).  She said she knew we had a tight connection and rushed us through customs, grabbed our bags for us, and her and a couple other agents helped us navigate to our connecting flight.  They literally carried our bags and ran with us through the airport.  In the US, not only would we have missed our flight, but our bags definitely would not have made it.  This was hands down the most amazing customer service experience!  Japan Airlines for the win!!

title: Amazing meal surpassed only by the exceptional service
review_text:
Clean New Plane, nice comfortable seat.   Amazing meal as good as any you would find at a great steak house.    The service was exceptional, polite, quite and attentive at all times.   Many other carriers could learn well from observing the JAL crew on this flight.   Could not give them higher marks.

The only two downsides on this were, that in the Business class seat although it was comfortable the lie flat is on an angle -which makes it tough to sleep. And the Internet was not working the entire time—- spotty reception.

title: Family holiday in japan
review_text: Family of 4. Booked prem/ecom.  PE seats same price as QF disc economy Syd to Nrt.  PE seats excellent, heaps of leg room especially front row.  Food same as economy. Rate JAL P/E best i’ve travelled

title: First rate flight...
review_text: The only reason for giving four stars instead of five was that the plane felt ready for a refresh.  The wear and tear on the seats and seating areas were apparent.  So that said, I can't recommend the airline highly enough when it comes to service and quality.  The air hosts were all absolutely amazingly attentive.  Their dedication to ensuring that passengers had a comfortable flight was apparent from the moment we boarded until our departure and this was true on both our inbound and outgoing flight.  A pal who travelled first class said it was superior in all respects.  The food was light years better than the food I've experienced on other airlines, the bed was comfortable, the beverage selection was first rate and the flight was smooth and utterly painless.  I arrived in Japan refreshed and ready to explore.  I would absolutely recommend this airline and I would fly with them again in a heartbeat.

title: Japan holiday
review_text:
I couldn’t recommend Japan airlines any more highly. I flew with JAL from Melbourne to Tokyo, Tokyo to Sapporo and then in reverse 
Excellent service, meals, entertainment and comfort

title: Less than appetizing meal
review_text: The flight was excellent save one issue.  The tortoise shell chicken meal was not very good and I was only able to eat a very small portion of it.  The airline claimed it was made by some award winning chef and this meal was picked to be served to economy class passengers.  My advice is to stock up on snacks and eat a large meal before boarding.  I lived in Japan for 10 years and am not a stranger to the cuisine.

title: Spacious and Courteous
review_text:
My first time with Japan Airlines has been fab experience especially in terms to the leg room, choice of movies and attitude of the stewardess. Even though a red eye flight they were prompt and not grouchy when I asked them for drinks etc.
I love the efficiency they had compared to the other (apparently)world class airlines we travel by. I would highly recommend Japan airlines. This would definitely be our preferred airline for now.

title: The best economy class
review_text:
When traveling in economy class the most important is the seat and legroom. 
This is my first time flying with JAL and I'm amazed how spacious the legroom and I also believed that the seat is wider than other airlines. 

I also find out that one of the toilet is bigger than usual, the toilet have an additional space for baby changing diaper. 

I would highly recommend for everyone that plan to travel with economy class to try JAL

title: Such a helpful staff !
review_text:
We were impressed with the helpfulness of the flying attendants! They reacted to a small and big issues with a genuine care. 
Treated us extremely nicely

title: Barely Average — Old Planes & Lame Food
review_text:
The service on JAL isn't bad. Unfortunately, it's clear that they are operated by the same company as American Airlines, which to me, means they're underfunded. The planes are fairly old, seating is less spacious, food is sub-par, and the movie screens and tech is all outdated. 

All in all, this is still a better airline than say, China Eastern, but that's not saying much. Don't book with JAL expecting better food or service because they are Japanese. This company operates more like American Airlines, which means they're stingy with economy class. They're out to make money more than to please their customers. Qatar is a far better option.

title: airline
review_text: i experienced very good service from check in to off board.  very typical Japanese hospitality that never went wrong.

title: Service and food quality, quantity...the best...!
review_text: This is Malaysian Airline code share operated by Japan Airline. The food quality and quantity was simply No.1. Never enjoyed airline food...like this...for a long2 time. Very attentive...

title: Never disappoints!
review_text:
I continue to fly JAL for my trips to Japan.  I won't ever consider a US carrier.  Why would anyone want to?  I'm willing to pay the difference in price for a completely different experience.  Clean bathrooms, good food, impeccably dressed flight attendants, helpful flight attendants, pleasant flight attendants, comfortable seats, I could go on and on.  
This time I opted to try premium economy and was glad I did.  Not inexpensive but totally worth it.  Unlike US carriers that charge you extra just for a bit more leg room and nothing else (same way how they charge you for baggage) the premium economy seats are wider and have a crazy amount of leg room.  Premium economy also grants you access to the JAL lounge.  Excellent food and beverages.  Rather than eating at restaurants and their crazy prices at Honolulu Airport you're able to have a really nice meal and relax in comfort.  The Narita lounge is even nicer a bit better outfitted.  I'm not sure but the food spread also seemed to be a bit larger.  
All in all another fantastic experience on JAL.  Another reason why I'm flying less and less to the US mainland.  Why subject myself to the torture of flying US airlines when I can fly to Japan and have a great time?

title: JAL Doing What JAL Normally Does--Good Service
review_text: Having previously flown into Tokyo from LAX and disappointed with the service and attitude the flight from Tokyo to Melbourne on a 787 was back up there with typical JAL standards. The staff were friendly and attentive, the food was designed and prepared in Japan (not LAX)  by top chef's and it was very good. The flight departed on-time and arrived on time and priority bags came out first. and quickly/ Well done JAL.

title: Service, Service, Service
review_text:
Japan Airlines is like the United air of Japan. Also known as Nikkō, is the flag carrier airline of Japan. The Service is incredible! from the moment you step into the aircraft. Just after takeoff you are presented with a hot towel just like first class. hahah, then a snack plus a drink. Alcohol is free on international flight. then two meal service and two more snacks. Pluse constant drinks. The food is really good, portions are standerd size.
A tip, if you never flew an asian airline before , It's warm in the plane. to warm for me(around 80 digs,) but my wife was happy. 
.

title: Anime and manga onboard
review_text: I flew on this airline for both domestic flights within Japan and international flights to/from Japan.  The service was great as the attendants were probably the most polite that I've encountered.  The food was good and I liked the variety of entertainment.  Some of the flights I was on had free Wifi while on other flights, I watched a few anime movies and read their selection of manga titles.  The premium economy class was slightly more comfortable with more legroom and amenities but I probably wouldn't choose that class over regular economy class if I had to pay for the tickets myself as regular economy was pretty good by itself.

title: Great but at a price
review_text:
This was my first flight on JAL. I was excited to fly them as I’ve read great things. I am a bit of a snob and like to travel biz class but Cathay and JAL one world guys wanted ridicules prices for biz Hong Kong to HND RTN so went with premium economy. Over all I would fly them again but I don’t think it’s worth $1000 more then Economy the seats 18 were very comfy and would be great for long hall good entertainment and big screen. I’m used to premium Econ on qantas which is a step just under biz this was just a step over Econ 

The food was ok if you are into Japanese food and there was no pre flight drink and I had to ask for alcohol it wasn’t offered. The flight attendants were very respectful and polite I could not fault them if I could put JAL flight attendants on Qantas flights that would be perfect. 

We left a little late and the pilot was asking forgiveness and it wasn’t his fault. We made up the time no worries at times we were traveling over 1180kph that’s the fastest I’ve ever travelled. 

Summary great crew and plane poor food  I would travel short or long hall without question just look for better prices. Thanks JAL for my intro to Japanese culture PS I loved seeing the ground crew bow to the plane and wave until we left

title: The Ultimate
review_text: JAL is the best. JAL is the best. I needed to write that twice because there is no other airline I would rather fly. They are classy, smart, very serious about excellent service, helpful, and the model for any other airline. I've been flying all over for over 30 years, on a whole range of aircraft, but JAL is always in first place. Highly recommended!

title: Premium Economy class both ways
review_text:
We had a great flight back in 2016 when we took premium economy (PE) back from Haneda to Singapore. So this time, we book PE both ways but it wasn't as enjoyable. The lounge at Singapore is not great as its not the JAL lounge. The food and drinks served are not of Japanese standard. We hardly ate anything and the lounge is not conducive. Can hardly find couch seats. 
The toilet in the flight to Tokyo is also bad. It smells of urine and it was only half way thru the flight. But the service from the stewardess is still great. 
The lounge at Narita was awesome. Though its crowded, but its still conducive with lots of seating, great food/drinks.

title: Had great expectations for flying business class on JAL as all the reviews were great.
review_text: I read all the reviews before I purchased my business class tickets on JAL. Some how though I missed any reviews on the business class hard product out of San Diego. I thought the product would be the same as out of LA. Why would it be different? Yet it was. I was shocked to find on the San Diego flight they use the old style 2-2 configuration and the seats don't go completely flat plus no privacy. I was very disappointed to say the least. For me it was not comfortable and will never go that route again. I actually felt cheated out of my money, especially for the same price I could have flown a nicer product out of LA. This was the first time I've flown JAL. It won't be the last either as the service was outstanding, probably the best I've experienced but I'll be much more careful in the future to do my research on which type of business class seats JAL is using on a particular flight.

title: Domestic short haul Itami to Haneda and Itami Diamond Premier lounge
review_text:
I took the short domestic flight on JAL from Osaka Itami airport to Tokyo Haneda airport to connect to an international flight from Narita.  Itami airport is very close to Osaka city center so a quick half hour limousine bus ride was all that was needed to get to the airport.  Check in was quick and I used my One World Alliance status to access the Diamond Premier Lounge near gate 18.  Nothing fancg but there is a good amount of seating including lots of counter seating next to the small food area with a selection of a few bakery items to snack on in addition to offerings of drinks.  

The flight was operated on a B777 and I was in J Class which is domestic business class.  Nothing fancy here just regular seats with a slight recline configured 2-4-2.  I had an aisle seat next to the window seat but had unlimited legroom and no disturbance from my neighbour on access since we were on an exit row with no seats in front of us.  The flight was very busy and J Class appeared to be full.  Due to the short flight, there was time only for a quick drinks service which was efficiently done with the usual JAL grace and courtesy.  Flight was on time, luggage delivery was fairly quick and it was easy to reserve and board the limousine bus to connect from Haneda airport to Narita airport.

title: Not Up To JAL Standards
review_text: Maybe it was an 'off' day but a  feature of JAL is their friendly and attentive staff but on this flight the crew seemed disinterested and there were few smiles or attention or for that matter interest. The food standard was OK but not to the standard when flying out of Japan  where they use 'famous' chef's as the inspiration for their dishes but out of LAX, the famous chef's  were not in the BEDD menu, maybe because they cannot guarantee the quality available in Japan.The aircraft was an older Boeing 777 and not as comfortable as a 787 but having said that it departed on time and despite 200 KM heads winds arrived on schedule.Still much better than most domestic US airlines but noy what one comes to expect from JAL

title: Fantastic service
review_text: They always give us a great  friendly service. Last time I went to Japan, they couldn't fly due to a strong wind but they offered me a transportation to go to the different airport and a hotel to stay. I love Japan airline!

title: Great Expetience
review_text: I paid the premium fare as I wanted to sleep and enjoy a great meal, JAL delivered. Unfortunately the Nashville to Japan portion of the trip was on JAL’s code share airline American (subject of a negative review under American Airlines). American’s food and service is much below that of JAL. As an added Bonus JAL’s checked luggage allowance is 9 kilos higher than American and they allow three checked bags vs. two on American.

title: Great experiences
review_text: Comfortable direct flight. I request halal meal and it was nice and delicious. Very friendly cabin crews.

title: Great Flight
review_text: Wonderful staff, attentive and friendly. Comfortable flight. Good movies on in seat monitor. Lots of fluids served to keep us hydrated. Nice hot clothes to wash our face and hands.

title: Best international airline for economy cabin!!
review_text: I have never written a review for an airline but felt indebted to share my experiences for its excellent service and quality of the cabin. First, it was very spacious with lots of leg room, probably more spacious than most of US major airlines. The food was quite good compared to other airlines that I have taken. My family and I actually finished all the food for both lunch and dinner, which never happened before with other airlines. 😉Furthermore, their restrooms were huge and super clean (they were all the time!! Is it amazing!!) One of the restroom could fit 3 people, even larger than the business class of other airlines that I have tried. The best part was their service. My family and I were celebrating our anniversary and birthday on this trip. The Chief flight attendant, Maru (not sure if I got her name correctly), and her crew members were so incredibly thoughtful that they gave us special gifts and a handwritten card. We were so touched by their thoughtfulness! They made our long journey to Japan memorable and joyful! Highly recommended!!👍👍👍

title: Business trip to Japan
review_text: First time using this airline which I found to be very good, I would fly with them again It was business trip

title: wonderful service
review_text:
Plane very clean,
Staff very polite,
Food above average,
Washroom clean regularly,
Good choice of movies.

title: Great way to go
review_text: I always use JAL as a point of comparison when talking airlines/flights. Simply the best air travel experience I have ever had

title: Very nice and comfortable
review_text: The check in process was easy, the stewardesses were all very nice, the airline was incredibly clean and the food was actually pretty good!

title: Japan air is awesome
review_text: This was a 14 hour flight. It was a very comfortable flight. They came around very often with food and stuff to drink. There in plent to watch on the little monitor in front of you in many different languages, as well as listen to misinterpret if you like. The seats are a little wider than on a regular plain ans every seat has a pellow and blanket so you can sleep. They do turn the lights down lawn as well as lower all blinds, to make it easy to sleep.

title: Best sleep experienced in business class flight
review_text: The flight attendants couldn't do enough for you - superb service.  Quiet, clean and exceedingly comfortable ride.  Excellent food service and meals.  Will fly again with JAL.

title: Zen smile and hospitality
review_text: Gentle and professional service with genuine smiles and courtesy. Food was well prepared and served on time. However, efforts need to improve on the children's games and toys

title: OK to fly, not great.
review_text:
The ground staff is excellent at the check in at CTS.  Helped me all the way with our twins traveling together.

The flight is average and the food and inflight entertainment leaving much room for improvement.

title: JAL accepted my aisle seat request
review_text: I'm posting a follow-up to my previous review of JAL, which complained about their (undisclosed) refusal to allow seat selection or seat preferences to economy passengers. At that time I had called their customer service and received no satisfaction. Subsequently I went to their website and made a strongly worded complaint on their "contact us" form. This apparently went up a little higher, and I was informed that their gate agents would be notified of my need for an aisle seat. I was skeptical, but to my surprise I was not only given aisle seats, but preferred boarding, and treated with kid gloves by all their personnel. All four flights were on time, and my travel experience with JAL was excellent. If I had not complained repeatedly perhaps I would be less satisfied, but I have to say that they do take customer service issues seriously, and my actual experience on the flights could not have been much better. My last flight was only half full, and JAL still kept their schedule, in stark contrast to Garuda, which canceled two flights on me that had not filled, and caused some real headaches.

title: great service..decent meals on board
review_text: Japan Airlines really impressed me.  Their inflight meals for the economy class was quite good.  Did not see what the first class people ate but I enjoyed it as many other carriers do not give meals to the economy class.

title: Hospitality Japanese Way
review_text:
From the friendly smiles to courteous demeanour nothing is more welcoming as you board the plane. The stewardesses seem genuinely concerned about your comfort. The other time we flew JAL, my niece with peanut allergy was with me and the attention they gave to addressing this was commendable. From asking if someone eating peanuts nearby would affect her to providing allergen free food then checking if she was alright. I can’t say the same with their partner American Airlines. 
The leg room is longer and the seats much wider than most airlines. The meals are also more appetising. Toilets are kept clean. The only second thoughts I have is about the price. But if I am able to get a promo price, I will definitely take JAL.

title: JAL codeshare with American Airlines
review_text: The service is excellent, the food is definitely better than most and the seats are nearly lay flat.  I fly pretty regularly to Japan on JAL and American.  You can’t go wrong with either airline, just make sure you’re in Business Class.

title: A class above other airlines
review_text:
Amazing service, with great food and attention to detail. On my way back, due to a minor back injury, the flight crew helped me with every part of the check in and settling into the plane and also made sure I had two seats to myself.
At the end of the flight, the attendants went around and thanked every single passenger for taking Japan Airlines.

I travel a lot and take it over 25 flights annually and Japan Airlines is always my favourite.

title: Comfortable Flight
review_text: Clean,comfortable and quiet. The only problem we had was our meals got mixed up on the first leg but our flight attendant was able to rustle something up for us, she was so sweet. We had a 12 hour stop over in Tokyo and we got to explore the airport, what a great airport! For the second flight the attendant at the gate was able to quickly order meals for us so we had no issues for the remainder of our journey. Polite and efficient,a great airline.

title: Comfortable and good flight
review_text: First time with JAL after more than 40 years in 1970s, I was surprised on how comfortable and very modern aircraft it is now. I fly to Tokyo and return back to Jakarta. I I enjoy good food, movies, music and even the toilet...

title: Attention to detail and impeccable service
review_text: I spent my entire birthday in airports and on planes with little to no communication with my family or friends.  While onboard, before we landed they presented me with a birthday gift which absolutely made my day.  Thank you so much JAL for the amazing service, awesome plane, and the wonderful gift that made my birthday memorable.

title: overseas travel with JAL
review_text: Always on time, friendly stewardesses, Clean seats and facilities.  Highly recommended for low stress travel

title: Great service
review_text: Pleasantly surprised by their service & efficiency. You get used to such a mediocre service with other airlines like Delta, American, AirEuropa, Norwegian, etc., that when you get to enter to an actual clean airplane bathroom you feel so amazed, like if you were receiving a first class treatment. I flew in four different flights with Japan Airlines, in all of them, we left on time. Boarding was very quick, the staff was extremely nice and helpful. I had severe allergies, and my medicines made me more dehydrated than usual, and they kept bringing me water and juices to battle both my allergies and the effects of a 14 hour flight. Seats are hard, not much cushion, but they have good leg room and an ample selection of movies & drinks. I think it was a great for the price of the flight.

title: Very good, but not great
review_text: This overnight flight was part of  a JAL package from Europe back to Australia through Tokyo where we had had a 3-day layover to mitigate jet-lag. The biz class, flat-bed pods are good. The entertainment on the big flat-screen TV was more than acceptable. The food (western) was a highlight. As was the Japanese single malt whisky. The service was a little slow, but very Japanese … and delightful. It cannot be scored higher than four stars when benchmarked against other international business class flights taken in the past. It was expensive: JAL charges heavily because there are only four carriers who fly Tokyo-Sydney direct (JAL, ANA, Qantas and Jetstar which is effectively a Qantas subsidiary). There are other, much cheaper ways to fly to Europe if you do not have to go to Japan.

title: good service
review_text: when returning to san diego from Narita.   JAL is the best for a direct flight.  it leaves at 5pm and arrives san diego at about 9.30 am.  flight time is 9 hours 50minutes.  the food is good, in quantity and variety (variety of alcohol good).    flight attendants are couteous and attentive. the only thing I didnt like is that the plane is B787 and the toilets are in the middle of plane.

title: Tremendous service both in the air and on the ground
review_text:
Last week I flew on Japan Airlines for the first time. It was a memorable experience and very positive.  The service was top notch.  On the ground, I had to have wheelchair assistance and JAL uses their own employees to meet and transport its wheelchair passengers with uniformed personnel that could be mistaken for inflight attendants.  They were friendly, spoke English perfectly and would not take a tip.  Best wheelchair service I have encountered.  Checkin was flawless and they actually came to me while I sat in the boarding area and asked me to board first; then, once at the plane they took my carryon luggage and stowed it for me; the flight attendant introduced herself and let me know if I needed anything to let her know.

In flight, service was again at a very high level with good food and very innovative - some a result of a chef competition that they held. I thought the Minestroni soup and small loaf of bread for breakfast was perfect and a great substitute for the usual breakfasts on airlines.  Seats were comfortable Recaro seats and inflight entertainment had an excellent choice of movies.  Coffee, tea and water were offered several times during the flight.  Some snacks were offered during flight in the flight attendant serving area but only rice crackers and some chocolate - this is the only aspect that I would rate as below average. The flight attendants were always available if one needed them and very cordial and attentive.  In Vancouver, I was again met at the gate by a JAL employee and transported by wheelchair all the way through Immigration and to my connecting area.

Overall, I had two very impressive and comfortable flights.

title: Excellent experience really caring and attentive staff
review_text:
Every thing about the flight was perfect 
Could not fault anything 
The seat was slightly narrower then other business class seats but comfortable

title: THE best!
review_text:
Its the best. Service is excellent. All very kind, helpful and respectful unlike American Airlines such as United/American who has no pride in their work as CA.
Food selection and the level of the taste was great too.
Clean toilet that is cleaned by CA very often.
I HIGHLY recommend it.

title: Pleasure to choose the JAL
review_text: JAL services are great!! There is nothing to point out. I prefer to choose their airlines most of my travel trips.

title: from jakarta to tokyo japan and back to jakarta again, it was a superb flight, all of its aspect.
review_text: informative check in process, warm greeting, quick respond, baggage handling, its fabuluous food, communicative air crew service, its interior and film etc, its crew action to clean a mesh

title: Great service on a smooth flight
review_text: I had a pleasant return journey on JAL 711 on 130818 after climbing Mt. Fuji. The service was great & the flight was punctual. The take off & landing was smooth, and I enjoy the meals & in-flight entertainment. Thank you JAL for the great experience!

title: Flew to Vietnam last Feb
review_text: Great airline with superb service , going on Japan air to Singapore early Feb in business class. Unfortunately have to fly coach back in March because I did not book soon enough

title: An Unexpected Experience!
review_text: 1stly, the meals served on board JAL is not very nice compared to the other airlines I took previously. My dept flight to Chitose was ok, but my return flight from Chitose was chaotic because there was heavy snowfall when I reached Chitose airport and all flights were suspended. I would think such situations should be expected and managed in a more professional way.  The JAL staff at the Chitose airport cannot speak or understand english and that makes it worst. During such chaotic situations, especially for passengers like my group of 3 which is our 1st time encountering this, the Staff should at least provide some positive & substantial info and try to ease and calm the nervous passengers, but they did not.  I have to go from 1 JAL staff to another to get to an English speaking staff who can understand and converse with me.  In the end, I got a staff who was quite helpful and he speaks good english. Thank God we were able to get help from this particular staff and he managed to give us a standby tickets out of Chitose.

title: Mixed Bag
review_text:
Flights were on 787-8 or 787-9 aircraft. JAL is one of the few airlines that have a 2-4-2 seat arrangement in economy, most others squeeze an extra seat in each row. So Jal economy seats tend to be a tiny bit wider. However the the distance between rows seems to be pretty tight. For some reason, I found the flight between Melbourne and Tokyo was much more comfortable than the flight between Tokyo and Vancouver. 
The food and service were ok but nothing outstanding. Generally I would try to give the 787 a miss and find a more spacious aircraft if possible. Always check Seat Guru for seating plans.

title: Flying business class on this 14 hour flight !
review_text: If you can spend the money - you will have a fabulous experience.  It's night and day difference traveling in business class from economy. Service, comfort so special !

title: Comfortable and Restful Ride
review_text: This has been my second time flying JAL. The first experience was bad when I had gotten a old vessel that wet my carry on bag which I placed below my seats. However this time round was better. I have wider leg space for seats, civilised passengers in board and attentive cabin crew. My flight involves flying into Haneda airport and then transfer to a domestic flight to fukuoka. I enjoyed both journey where I managed to get good quality sleep on board without being disturbed by unnecessary lighting or announcement in the flight. Airplane plane was average yet I also enjoyed Haagen Dazs ice cream given a dessert at the end of my meal for both of my trips.

title: nice hospitarity
review_text:
CAs took care of me, frequentry. 
Chief CA's announcement in the flight is good enough.
Japanese meal was good, though Idid not try Western meal.

title: Great way to visit Japan from Los Angeles
review_text:
This is a great flight for anybody going to Japan, especially for tourists visiting Kyoto.  The flight departs from the nice Tom Bradley Terminal at a reasonable hour and arrives in Osaka before the trains stop running.  The train station connected has trains to takes you to Kyoto in a little over an hour so you can spend the first evening in Kyoto if you like.  If you are the type that cannot sleep on the plane, there are 2 good hotel options connected to the terminal.  
There was no premium economy offered when I flew but it appear they will off that starting mid-2019.  That will make the 12 hour flight more bearable without costing too much.

title: Loved flying with Japan Airlines
review_text: Had a great flight, the cabin crew on Japan Airlines are beyond efficient and really make the difference.

title: Excellent service.
review_text: Cabin services are always excellent,helpful flight attendant,always on time.but only thing that I disappointed was meal. Even Business class meal was not good,tasteless. I ate only one bite and didn’t touch the rest.

title: GREAT INTERNATIONAL FLIGHT
review_text: Choosing JAL (whether its expensive) is really value for your money. The leg room is quite comfortable and even the seats. You have your own monitor to watch movies or TV shows. The stewardess are very courteous and organized unlike other international airlines. Food is simply great.

title: Cleanest airline in the Sky
review_text:
I have flown with all the Major international airlines, at one time or another and have found faults and hygiene problems with all of them , the exception is J.A.L ...I paid economy and got upgraded on the departing flight from Sydney to Paris and returned Paris in economy .....both classes were exceptional both in service , comfort and the cleaniness a 10/10...also the food was great in both classes.
I enjoyed an overnight stay with full breakfast included ...staying at the Airport Nikko Hotel included in the air ticket price ....I also received  a nice meet and greet at the airport in Japan ....  the only reason I do not fly with J.A.L ..is because now I live in Queensland and they have cut  all their Brisbane flights , such a shame , but with all the health risks involved in travelling its great to have an airline like Japan Airlines ....who are way ahead the others when it comes to hygiene and cleaniness .

title: Fly JAL
review_text: Best airline to fly to Japan. Same price as American but 10 times better customer service, making the reservation, and service in the air. Friendly staff and flight attendants. Highly recommend. Once you fly JAL you’ll never want to fly American Airlines.

title: Superb service, space, comfortable seats
review_text: The upgrade to Premium Economy was worth it. We allowed to use the lounge with free food and drinks, comfortable massage chairs etc.

title: Very enjoyable flight
review_text: This was a very enjoyable travel experience for a long flight from Singapore to New York via Tokyo. The flight attendants were wonderful, kind, courteous, helpful.  The plane was spotlessly clean, even the restrooms were maintained well on the long 22 hour flight to New York. They did something I have never seen before- my adult son was sleeping when they served dinner so they put a sticker on his seat so they would know and remember to offer him food when he woke up.  They were constantly walking around with water, coffee, snacks.

title: Airline to Japan
review_text: Great service and commitment. Nice food and choices. Two eggs for a personal breakfast. ComfortAble Seat and accessories

title: Pleasent surprise
review_text: At booking desk we were upgraded to premium economy, which was a very pleasant surprise. We flew from Melbourne to Narita as in economy, and were well looked afterand reasonably comfortable. The return flight in Premuim was a very nice experience indeed, arriving feeling very fresh. I would highly recommend JALfor the for the level of service they provide.

title: Clean, on time, treat you well...
review_text:
I've been using Japan Airlines for more than 20 years, at least twice every year. The conversion point of the mileage isn't good at all but the rest of the service is great. I usually try to avoid using a bathroom which men and women have to share, but with 14 hours flight, you can't avoid... I like the fact that I see flight attendants go to the bathrooms so often to keep them clean all of the time.
From the check-in counters, in the lounge, at the boarding, and on the plane... people treat you very nicely. 
Most of the time, the flights are on time.

title: Good Airline, just 1 comment
review_text: Excellent flight, service and timing. The best airline I've travel with, even the economy class is much better than others. The only thing that was difficult is that on my way back they had an alliance with an Airline from Malasya and it was very difficult to check in online and to find the flight at Delhi's Airport.

title: No Better Way to Fly
review_text:
Having flown JAL to Japan and the United Kingdom on several occasions, my experiences have been very positive. The airline is reliable, efficient and has a good safety record, Its cabin crew are courteous and helpful in every possible way

In the past I flew on a number of airlines but none met the standards of JAL; their performance is second to none.

title: A great company
review_text: What great service,we can not speak highly enough about the attendants,would use them again in a flash.

title: JAL 787-8 business class not for tall/big people
review_text:
The crew was super attentive.  The meals were okay - I don't think airlines should try to do gourmet.  Keep it basic and tasty.  Fancy restaurant style just doesn't prepare well in the air.  Just saying.  I did appreciate the double menu - western and Japan types of food.
I am over 6' tall and when I fully reclined, my feet pressed against the foot rest.  Not good for 15+ hour flight!!  From Tokyo, we took at a 777-200.  Great leg room, tight on the shoulders.  Only 8 hours, so it was tolerable.  Looking to stay away from 787.  
The movie selection was pretty good.  Those and a book got me through.
4 stars is solid - not JAL fault for the type of planes they fly.

title: From Moscow to Tokyo.
review_text:
1st flight with JAL from DME to Tokyo Narita.
Great trip, friendly attendants, great food and drinks.
The only cons small lavatory.

title: Good service, comfortable and less turbulent flight on higher altitude than usual
review_text: If I am flying to Japan - only with JAL. The price is quite reasonable, food and overall service is good for economic class, and the best of all if there is turbulence, the aircraft goes higher, where is it less turbulent. Our flights have been mostly on 13 000 meters altitude, very calm and comfortable. This is an extremely important thing for someone who is very y anxious when flying.

title: Best way to fly back from Japan
review_text: The service is unparallel. The food was delicious (I have plane Food). The place was super confortable even for a 12 hour flight.  Great way to fly back from Asia

title: Great customer service in a comfortable seat in basic economy
review_text: The online experience with JAL was pretty bad. Horrendous really. I wanted to login to the system and see my reservation but was never able to do that. First time this ever happened to me. But I read that their economy seats were good and I was pretty confident I was booked as they did send me an email after I inquired. I had the most basic of economy seats. But everyone at JAL had me believing I was a valued customer.  Customer service was better than I expected. The seats were better than premium economy on delta/united.  The flying experience was better than I could ever recall flying the standard usa airlines.  I highly, highly recommend JAL

title: Excellent. Customer service. Friendly. Top notch
review_text: Best airlines for flying to Asia.  Staff was super friendly and helpful.  They speak English. The flight is comfortable no matter where you sit. The food was amazing and service was impeccable.  My go to airline.

title: Excellent Economy fare round trip flight from sfo to Tokyo
review_text: Service was excellent as was the food.  Typical japanese Seven course meal for dinner and a very nice breakfast and snack in between.  Seats were adequate with above average leg room.  Considering the price and service level, I would not hesitate to flay JAL again.

title: very comfortable 15 hrs.
review_text: I wasn't looking forward to such a long flight. Business class seats were much more comfortable than BritishAir and United- less claustrophobic

title: Good flight with wonderful in-flight service
review_text: Really great service. The flight attendants were very polite, neatly dressed and courteous. They consistently served meals and were generally available to assist at all times. A note of caution though, the food tends to be Japanese oriented so persons with special dietary needs MUST advise the airline in advance. Do not presume that there will be anything to suit special needs.

title: high quality service just as expected
review_text: The airline as known for its high quality of service, I flew more than 10 flights a year and was never disappointed regardless of the flight classes.  The only improvement I wish is for the quality of tea in business classes, as it tastes like the ones from supermarket at low price. The airline should tie up with one of the famous brand and serve them.

title: FLIGHT FROM NEW YORK TO SINGAPORE
review_text: My 1st experience with JAL from New York JFK to Singapore via Tokyo, i have a feed back may help you to improve your services i believe.

title: Best airline
review_text: Japan Airlines is by far the best airline I have flown.  It starts with the attendants who are well dressed and extremely polite. The airplanes are spotless and the food is excellent. Add to that the timeliness of the flights and you have an excellent airline.

title: Spacious and Comfortable Journey From Sydney To Tokyo
review_text: We traveled in November from Sydney to Tokyo (Narita airport) and back to Sydney in Japan Airlines Premier Economy Class in a non-stop flight. The flight was very comfortable. Our vegetarian food was good and delicious.  The check-in was smooth and quick. We were allowed in Qantas Business class Lounge at Sydney Airport and in Sakura Lounge at Narita airport. The staff in the flight were polite and always attentive.

title: Can’t remember anything significant
review_text: Took this flight on Thanksgiving Day. Fairly crowded but everything was orderly. Leg room was good. Food was okay with either Japanese or western style. Had some new movies to watch but choices was limited. No big surprises.

title: The best Business Class in the air!
review_text:
Over the last year I've had the privilege of traveling on long haul business class flights with a number of airlines including Emirates, JAL, United, and British Air -- and JAL is the BEST!!!  Their plane was the cleanest after 14 hours in the air, their beds were the most comfortable and their food was certainly more than adequate.  If you ever have a choice -- this is the airline to chose.

I had a Visa problem for my on-going travel and the JAL staff handled it masterfully.  It was, in total, a fabulous experience.

title: Great product!
review_text: This was my first time on JAL and I loved everything from the staff with exceptional service and also the cleanliness.  The food was superb as you can choose Japanese and western. The flight entertainment is also good however I did wish their was more movies that were newer releases. On the way home I flew Premium Economy.  Again a fantastic product - the service and meals were unbeatable.  I felt like their was constant food being served with was great. the seats were extremely comfy and the barrier on the side of the seats next to the head rest is perfect as it gives you privacy without looking at the person next to you.  Other than that a great product I would recommend anyone to fly with.

title: Most humiliating experience ever
review_text:
We had a very unpleasant experience on JAL, and my husband was ordered out of his premium economy seat.

We flew from Tokyo to Singapore on 29th November 2018 in a family of 3, my husband was on premium economy class as it was work travel while I and my daughter of 2.5yo were on economy. 

Normally on long flights, my husband and I would swap seat to take turn to look after our daughter. We have done this a few times on Singapore Airline and there was absolutely no issue. So today I took the premium economy seat first. After two hours I swapped my seat with my husband to put our daughter to sleep. However one of the stewardesses immediately ordered my husband out of the premium economy seat and said that no seat swapping allowed. We explained our situation and said that the seat rightfully belonged to my husband. We apologised and said we would not do it again. However she insisted that my husband must return to the economy seat. Now, at this time my daughter was over tired and refused to leave my side. So I sat down with her in economy while the stewardess pointed to an empty economy seat (far away from our seats) and said that he could sit there but not allowed back in premium economy. Afterwards my husband explained the situation to other stewardesses and they were very sympathetic, however they said that the person giving the order is the head steward and they have no say. They suggested that if we wanted to, we could file a complaint and so my husband did. 

A few hours later my daughter woke up from her nap. Although we tried asked her to sit with daddy and let mommy sit in the front she refused to and kept screaming I want my mommy. When I returned back to the premium economy seat she ran after me with tears streaming down her face asking for me. She looked so distraught that I lifted her up and let her sit on my laps and told her that she can’t sit here. Almost immediately that stewardess came back and said to me your daughter is not allowed to sit here. I couldn’t believe it as the stewardess looked like a mother herself, and how could she be so unkind and heartless to ordered a teary toddler right back to the seat. So I just looked at that lady and then carried my girl back to economy. I asked my husband to go back to the premium economy seat again as this is just absurd. He paid for the seat and yet ordered out of his own seat. So he did and that stewardess made a big fuss again. She even said to my husband “I understand that you have filed a complaint about us and so have we. We know all your details and I have reported you to our airline”. Now this is just ridiculous. My husband was firm but never lost his control or got too emotional. At that point he was so frustrated that he just left. And to make the matter worse the lady went to apologise to every single customer in the premium economy cabin because of our disturbance.

In the end, we spent the majority of our flight back in economy with the premium economy seat being left empty (as my daughter just wanted to be with me and I didn’t want her to scream or cry on the plane and disturbed other passengers). 

On top of that, we felt so humiliated and discriminated as if we were thieves from economy seat trying to steal a seat from premium economy. Had the crew members told us from the beginning that no seat swapping allowed, we would have definitely sat in the correct seating. We felt discriminated because in the same row of premium economy seat, one passenger kept swapping back and forth between business class and premium economy. He is a huge man and hence I noticed it when he walked down to sat next to his wife in premium economy. So that very man was allowed to go back and forth but not us? Later on when we complained about the differential treatment to the ground staff in Singapore, we were told because the man was on business class, he could switch however he wished to. And because we are on (lowly) premium economy, we are not allowed to do that???

I really really liked JAL and would always have only good things to rave about this airline. However after this incident we are very scared by the airline and we are seriously want to avoid this airline forever.

title: Smooth & smart flight from JPN to SIN
review_text:
It's very confortable Airline from Japan to Singapore. Departure time is set before noon and arrival time is before evening. So it's convenient for me.
Especially for the business traveller, time consuming viewpoint, this flight schedule is very good. In flight service is an acceptable level both Foods and Drinks. Cabine is clean and there is no claim on this.

title: Comfortable and great service
review_text: I flew JAL for the first time, and was very impressed by the service and cleanliness.  The economy seats were comfortable as far as economy goes.  There was a variety of TV and movie selections.  The food was good by airline standards.  I would recommend JAL for long haul flights.

title: worth to pay
review_text: nice, friendly and helpful flight attendance. the food was good and looks healthy. comfort seat and spacey

title: Not worth the price!
review_text: It's my 2nd trip to Japan by JAL. This time, my family of 4 travel in Premium Economy Class. Sadly, there's isn't priority for boarding; unlike SQ. Also, the stewardess didn't ensure that all windows be 'up' when landing (though they walk through the aisles). In fact, it's my first time witnessing such a scene. Not worth the price!

title: 5 Star Customer Service with great polite friendly flight attendants
review_text:
I had a great flight with the JAL airlines. The check in was smooth and gate agents was very nice, and allowed me to board first because i am bringing my child along.

They also provided seamless good customer service and was always very accommodating and smiley throughout the way. I cannot praise this airline enough. They also provided cute and nice bento set for my child and even gave a free toy on each way of the flight. I definitely will choose to fly with this airline again if i travel to Japan again.

title: Awesome Flight
review_text:
Our flight was awesome, took off on time and was very pleasant. The flight attendants provided us with outstanding service.

I would highly recommend this airline.

title: Very bad experience with JAL from New York to Singapore
review_text:
I tried 1st time with JAL since i had a good impression with Japan and people, but really regret because of communication attitude in New York office, specialy food and other stuff.

only i am happy with cabin crew tey are realy helpful.

title: Narita First Lounge, Great Food and Service, Entertainment and Duvet could improve, great view of YVR airport
review_text:
Arrived at JAL First Class Lounge at Narita around 3:30 pm for my 6:40 pm flight and the lounge was not too busy.  However, by 4:30 pm, the lounge was packed and lounge staff had to make announcements apologizing for the condition of the lounge and asking guests to share tables.  This is becoming a frequent experience with the JAL First Class Lounge in the main building of Terminal 2 at Narita as the second floor of the lounge is closed for renovations thereby reducing seating significantly.  Having travelled through several times in the last couple of months, I have found the First Class Lounge often to be not relaxing and peaceful at all but instead over-crowded and difficult to find an empty table or seat.  It does fluctuate through the day so whether one will have a good experience in the lounge will depend on your luck.  The First Class Lounge in the satellite building may be better since it is not under renovation yet so if you are unsure of where your gate is, you may be better off going to the satellite building First Class Lounge instead of the main building First Class Lounge. 

I left a bit early for my gate as I know JAL is very prompt with boarding and as I have priority boarding with my One World status.  I was one of the first to board after the infants and assistance boardings and was quickly settled into seat 1K (window seat in the first row on the right hand side of the plane).  Business class was completely full on this flight so overhead bins were quite full.  This is particularly the case for the bins over row 1 since there are no bins over the two seats in the middle section of row 1 (2X2X2 configuration).   JAL uses a B787 Dreamliner on the route but installed Shell Flat Neo seats so it is not fully flat bed and the window seat passenger does not have direct aisle access.  However in row 1, there is no cabin with the entertainment system in front of your seat so it is much easier to step over the aisle seat passenger.  Window seats are also more attractive on the B787 than other planes because of the significantly larger windows giving views that would not be possible on another plane (eg. view more directly straight down below the plane). 

As usual, JAL served great food on the plane.  Generally the Japanese meal is more substantial and more interesting and delicious than the Western offerings so I chose Japanese meal for my dinner and it was delicious starting with a bento box with 6 different starters, and then two mains served with rice.  I saw a salted chocolate dessert on the Western menu that sounded more interesting than the dessert offered with the Japanese meal, asked whether I could have the Western dessert instead and glad that this change was possible.  For the breakfast served 2 hours before landing, I opted for the Western meal for a change.  It was described as a salmon cake (more like a salmon patty) and turned out to be served with some nicely cooked pasta (not soggy!).  It was delicious and I was very happy with my choice. 

Despite the short 8 hour flight and the angle flat seats, I managed a good 4 hours of sleep as JAL was quite efficient with dinner service finishing about 2 hours after takeoff, and then also waking up the cabin 2 hours before landing for breakfast service.

In terms of weaknesses, JAL does not have a great entertainment system and the choice of movies is not very broad.  Other than Hollywood/English language movies, JAL does also offer movies from China, Vietnam, Thailand, India etc. but those only have subtitles in Japanese. English language movies though can be viewed in a number of different languages with subtitles in a number of languages.  A negative of row 1 seats is that instead of a large entertainment screen in a console cabinet in front of your seat, you have a small screen that pulls out of the center armrest.  The other weakness is that JAL does not provide any seat covers or other special bedding to improve sleep and the duvet that is provided is very light and not very long so a tall person will struggle to be fully covered. 

Nevertheless I always highly recommend JAL business class as it is priced very well and the service and food are always excellent.  The washrooms are also in much better shape throughout the flight than with other airlines as cabin crew frequently tidy up the toilets after use.

title: Good Service And On Time
review_text: For some reason JAL do not operate the Boeing 787 Dreamliner on the Narita to LAX route and still use older 777's. They fly into San Diego with the 787 at the same time departure.That was the only negative as the Boeing 777 is not as comfortable, as quiet or as new as the 787's. Food service and quality was good and better than most other airlines. Staff are always friendly and service oriented.The flight left late but arrived on time and baggage arrive intact and relatively quickly.

title: Superior Service
review_text: Despite being in economy there was plenty of legroom, convenient as I live in Kona and the flight is direct.  Meals were excellent with premium Big Island Candy cookies and Onolicious ice cream. I can't imagine what first class is like.  Frequent tea or drink service and snack before arriving in Narita.  Free movies as well.  Lots of new movies to view. Great service and food.

title: On our way home
review_text: We decided to fly from Tokyo to Osaka before flying home to Brisbane on the last leg of our journey. We had not flown JAL before and were pleasantly surprised at the amount of leg room we had especially comparing it with some of Australia’s airlines. The staff were ever so friendly and accommodating. The food was delicious with a Japanese and western meal offered. We were so impressed that we will now look at flying with JAL again especially when we travel overseas.

title: Exceptional service
review_text: My child has a nut allergy and I had advise the airline. They were very thorough in their questions in what I need to know about what food rad being served and very aware of her allergies. I definitely recommend them as we were very happy with the service.

title: A Good Service To Tokyo Out Of Melbourne
review_text: This is a good service that links Melbourne with Tokyo despite the 00.45 AM departure.The only benefit is the ability to get into Tokyo early AM. The aircraft is a Boeing 787 and new and clean. The staff are always pleasant. Two benefits over the alternative carrier (Qantas) is a lower price and better food and service.

title: 4 star service from boarding to landing1
review_text: Terrific service from check-in at Los Angeles  to arrival at Kansai Airport.  Flight attendants were extraordinary and provided superior customer service and attention.  If I am fortunate enough to return to Japan, I wouldn't fly with any other airline.  Japan Airlines earned a 4 star rating from me for every aspect of the flight.  Even the food was terrific!

title: Out of character boarding confusion but still excellent service on board
review_text:
I took the JL17 flight from Vancouver to Narita again, which I have done many times before, but this time encountered unusual boarding confusion at Vancouver.  There seemed to be people lined up and milling around the boarding pass reader lanes in all directions and JAL did not do as good a job of keeping things organized as they usually do.  That said, part of the problem may have been the unusally high number of passengers travelling with infants and young children, several wheel chair boardings and at least 15 seniors who needed assistance pre-boarding.  As a result of the boarding chaos, the plane was a bit late pushing off at around 1:13 pm, there was a long taxi with many planes ahead of us waiting for take-off so take-off was not until 1:39 pm or so, but nevertheless we landed around 4:18 pm slightly ahead of the scheduled landing time of 4:30 pm.  That is one thing that I have found in numerous flights on JAL - they tend to be very good on departing and arriving on time and punctuality is a trademark for the airline. 

The flight was operated using a beautiful B787 Dreamliner but outfitted with angle-flat seats in the Neo Shell Flat Seat series.  I took seat 1K as the larger windows on the Dreamliner really make the window seats attractive and with no seats in front of me, there was not the usual entertainment screen cabinet to make stepping over the aisle passenger next to me tricky as with other rows.  Row 1 also gives a good vantage point to watch on and quick access to the washroom at the right front of the cabin which many business class passengers overlook in favour of the two washrooms between the two sections of the business class cabin.  

As I had flown the route recently, I opted for the Western meal instead of the Japanese meal I had before for my lunch.  The beef tenderloin in red wine sauce was good but it does not compare to the excellent Japanese meals on JAL.  

Row 1 seats do not have the larger screens in a cabinet in front of the seat and has instead smaller screens you have to pull out of the center armrest.  Entertainment system was never a strength of JAL anyway so I did not mind the smaller screen tradeoff for the huge picturesque window. 

Notwithstanding the angle flat configuration, I did get a few hours of decent sleep before cabin attendants woke the passengers about 2 1/2 hours before arrival for breakfast.  

Another little hiccup I had related to my checked luggage. I was connecting to a Cathay Pacific flight the next morning at 9 am and asked if JAL could check through my luggage since they are both One World Alliance partners and as the CX flight can also be purchased on JAL as they are code share partners on the flight.  I was told by Vancouver check in staff they could not check through and I had to pick up my luggage and check in with Cathay at Tokyo Narita.  However when I failed to see my luggage delivered in Narita and checked with ground staff there, they pointed out my luggage receipt actually said Hong Kong so apparently my luggage was checked through anyway.  I checked with JAL upstairs in departures again to be sure and they explained that they can check through for flights departing within 24 hours of my arrival on JAL. 

A couple small hiccups on this particular JAL flight but will stick with the airline for the route as it is competitively priced to Hong Kong compared to Air Canada and Cathay Pacific, and service and food are excellent.

title: Haneda Diamond Premier Lounge and J Class Domestic Short-Haul Haneda to Itami
review_text:
I took the short haul flight from Haneda (Tokyo) to Itami (Osaka) on JL121 in J-Class, which is the domestic business class.  I arrived at the airport about 90 minutes before my flight, used my One World elite status to use the very efficient First Class check-in and then the dedicated security entrance and lane for First Class passengers and top level frequent flyers located just to the left of the check-in counter.  The whole process was extremely efficient, friendly and a surprisingly nice touch for a short haul domestic flight.  

The dedicated security lane was very quick with no line ups so within minutes, I was into the JAL Diamond Premier lounge.  The lounge was huge and the decor was stunning for a domestic level lounge.  Pass the reception desk, there is a luggage storage area with keyed lockers to store your carry-on (including handy roll in ones at the bottom for your roll on board).  Past the storage area and then washrooms is the entrance to the main lounge.  To the right, there was a dining area with some basic foods on offer (corn soup, miso soup, some breads including a curry bun referencing the famous curry that is served in JAL international lounges, and two kinds of rice cakes), then to the immediate left an open seating area with seats that are well designed with a privacy screen between seats and a built in storage area next to the seat for your carry-on, and finally to the far left a larger seating area with individual cubicles that are very private (the cubicle walls are high enough that from the entrance you cannot see the occupants of the cubicles at all) equipped with a comfortable arm chair and a little pedestal table.  The level of comfort and size of the domestic lounge at Haneda puts the JAL Narita First Class lounge to shame so hopefully the renovation that has begun on the second level of the First Class Lounge for JAL at Narita Terminal 2 main building will result in a revampt of that the seating areas in that lounge to at least match the domestic lounge.

I had to try the curry bun since it is featured in the JAL website description, and it was very good, not very spicy at all.  My lounge stay was thoroughly enjoyable. 

The flight to Itami boarded on time 15 minutes prior to the flight.  For this domestic flight, JAL has a small First Class cabin with lie flat seats and serves a hot meal even during the short flight.  For business class, or J-Class in domestic speak, the configuration was 2-4-2 on the B777-200.  I had seat 10C the bulkhead row right at the door where the second airbridge connects.  During boarding, it was a bit inconvenient as passengers entered right in front of your seat but during flight, it was a good seat as the passenger next to you does not need to step over you to get to the aisle and there is unlimited legroom to stretch out.

The J-Class seats recline a bit and also have a leg rest that extends up a bit but only useful if you recline your seat as well as the leg rest does not actually touch your legs or support them when your seat back is not reclined (at least for an average height person).  No entertainment system on this short flight, other than music channels at your seat. 

Actual flight time is less than an hour so there is not much time for anything other than a simple drink service.  The flight arrived on time and exit out out Itami airport was quick.  The gate was very near the baggage claim area, there was a short wait of a couple of minutes for luggage (there are windows in the baggage claim area and I could actually see the luggage containers being removed from our plane and then being driven over below the baggage claim area), and then I was quickly out to take the limousine bus with its cheap frequent service to Osaka city center.  Transit from Itami to Osaka is only 30 minutes, about half the time that it would take if you flew into Kansai airport instead.  

A good domestic business class flight offering that is only slightly more expensive than economy, worth it for the less crowded J-Class cabin, a more convenient arrival airport at Itami rather than Kansai, and an impressive experience at an unexpectedly luxuriously fitted First Class lounge at Haneda airport domestic terminal.

title: JAL premium economy - get a lot more than expected
review_text:
Having suffered from Qantas' and Virgin's economy class, I chose JAL premium economy in Nov 2018. I think some of the things I got was for Business class. For the small additional fare compared with economy, it is value for money. But I am not sure how long this could last.

Here were some good things. I got a ticket for speedy custom service. There was virtually no queue. It took about 10 minutes in total to go through custom including security check.

Then I could use the Qantas lounge - comfortably seats with free breakfast and drinks. 

The leg room on the plan was more than I expected. I estimated that the leg of a person of 5 foot tall could not reach the back of the seat in front.

On the return flight from Tokyo, JAL's Sakura lounge provided free dinner and drinks. There was another quiet and nice area for people to go on the web or rest.

Most surprisingly, I got a pass to use the quick custom service when I returned to Sydney. While other people were queuing for the self custom service, I was already out. And ... my luggage was already on the conveyor belt. This is the first time that I did not need to wait for my luggage.

title: Easy connection and pleasant flight
review_text: I usually fly with Korean Air or Air Canada to visit Korea. Since my shoulder is not great, I decided to use Japan Airline this time. Last time I used it was almost 18 years ago. I wasn't certain about Narita airport for the connecting flight. The sign at the airport was great both ways and I had plenty of time to go through security check before the connecting flight. Food in flight toward Pusan was not that great for my taste but on the way back was much better. The service was courteous and pleasant. I would definitely fly JAL if I travel to Pusan again. If Incheon is my destination, I would still prefer Korean Air or Air Canada.

title: Narita JAL First Class Lounge and B787 to Vancouver
review_text:
I had a long layover at Narita before my flight to Vancouver so had lots of time to try out all aspects of JAL's Narita First Class lounge.  I arrive shortly after it opened at 7:30 am and found that it filled up very quickly.  I had breakfast and lunch in the lounge and there was a great selection of hot and cold food in the buffet.  The made to order sushi counter was also opened at breakfast (it operates 7:30 am to 12:30 pm and then again from 3 pm to 8 pm.

There was a special treat in the lounge on the day I was there - JAL was introducing some kind of local sweet made with red bean paste and chestnut - and in the afternoon, there were a number of reporters crowded around the featured sweet taking pictures.  

After breakfast, I used the shower rooms to take a shower.  The shower room is not very large but does have everything you need and a rainfall showerhead and multi side jets in the shower.

JAL is renovating the second floor part of the First Class lounge at Narita's Terminal 2 main building so the lounge was more crowded than usual.  Around 10 am after taking my shower, I had trouble finding an empty seat in the lounge.  Luckily the crowd seemed to disappear quickly too so after an hour or two, suddenly the lounge was quiet and fairly empty again.  I came off an overnight flight and wanted to nap a bit in the lounge but found there were very few seats that you could comfortably nap in (most have low backs). 

JAL used to have massage therapists giving short back massages but stopped that a couple of years ago choosing instead to rely on installing more massage chairs.  I used the massage chair once again on one of the 15 minute programs and it was fairly good but still feels like small bowling balls rolling up and down your back, a far cry from the real person massage therapists the First Class lounge used to have.

I went to the boarding gate a bit before the scheduled boarding time as JAL typically does board promptly.  JAL has special priority lines for its highest frequent flyer levels and offers the same privilege to One World Alliance Emerald members so I boarded very early and got settled in quickly.  JAL uses a beautiful B787 Dreamliner for the Tokyo to Vancouver flight but as many have complained, continues to use an outdated angled Shell Flat Neo seat.  It is quite comfortable and actually works quite well but still cannot compete with any of the other airline's or JAL's own fully flat bed seats.  

Service and food as usual were excellent on my flight.  Window seats do not have direct aisle access and window seat passengers have to step over the aisle passenger, which can be a bit tricky balance-wise when the aisle seat passenger has fully reclined into an angle bed mode.  However, in row 1, there is no cabinet with the entertainment system in front of the seat (the screen is pull out from the center armrest) so the window passenger can step over the aisle passenger much more easily even if the seat is in angle flat bed mode.  With the much larger windows that the B787 offers, this is one plane that makes it worthwhile to select the window seat even if it means less convenient indirect aisle access.  

Flight was on time departing and arriving.  JAL is behind the times with its angle flat seats on this route but makes up for it with superior food and service.

title: Very good service even for domestic route
review_text: Took the morning flight from Haneda to Itami and was surprised that it was a huge plane and it was full. Service was good and staffs were friendly all the way. check-in was smooth at the airport and arrival was good. Thinking of using JAL for next international trip.

title: Wonderful airline
review_text: What a wonderful airline!  Great service and wonderful food!  Really wonderful!  I'd endure the long flight again to eat the food. We also came back Narita to ORD and it was again wonderful.  They even have wrapped toothbrushes with toothpaste in the bathrooms.

title: Top notch
review_text: Very clean, very efficient, excellent and friendly service. No complaints at all! Will def use JAL again!

title: A classy airline!
review_text:
What a great airline!
The check in and boarding process was swift and efficient. The flight attendants were exceptionally considerate, kind, and professional. The food was terrific!, and the airline has a heart. I requested all aile seating on my flights because of certain medical issues that require me to have easy access to a restroom. JAL was happy to accommodate me, and they did on all 4 flights, in advance! When I got my boarding passes for my return flights, I was told they were all aisles! Great,! When on the last and longest flight I discovered that I was not on an aisle, I mentioned our arrangement to the flight attendant . At first, after looking, she said there no aisle seats available. Then, when I explained the situation to her and even mentioned that JAL had a copy of my doctors note on file, she left, then came back and said she had one aisle seat available and would move me after take off.. Which she did, to an aisle seat, with leg room, and next to an empty seat! I was in passenger heaven! JAl is the best in my book. An airline with heart!

title: Busy Lounge but Excellent Overnight Flight
review_text:
I took the overnight flight on Japan Airlines from Bangkok to Tokyo Narita.  When I checked in, I was requested to use a third party lounge rather than JAL's own Sakura lounge until after 9:30 pm as they said the lounge would be too busy with other earlier overnight JAL flights.  However, when I got to the lounge, they said it was not overly busy so they admitted me anyway eventhough it was earlier than 9:30 pm.  The lounge was pretty packed but there were still seats and table available near the dining area.  I wanted to eat dinner in the lounge and go to bed after the flight takes off as it was an 11:25 pm departure and the flight time was less than 6 hours so there would not be enough time to sleep.  Food offering in the lounge was quite good with lots of variety - both chicken and beef curry, hamburger steak in tomato sauce, clams cooked in kimchi, sausage, fried chicken - a bit of a strange mishmash but definitely substantial enough for dinner.  I noticed also that after I finished my meal, a few of the food options had been changed.  After 9:30 pm, the lounge became a lot quieter as a couple of earlier flights were boarding.  Seating is not fancy but it is a good sized lounge with good food offerings for a business class lounge.

The flight was boarded on time as is usual for JAL.  The flight was operated using a B787 fitted with Sky Suites in Business Class - this is an excellent product, fully lie flat, great privacy and lots of trays and storage areas to put drinks, glasses, tablets or phones.  There is a really clever little storage tray just above and behind your seat with a mesh cover that is handy for charging cords, phones, and any other small items to be kept safe from falling into the seat sides.  I noticed that each of the seats has slightly different configuration of trays and storage spaces.  I had the window seat which is the only one with the storage tray above and behind my seat and by comparison, it looks like the window seat has the most usable and useful storage areas. 

I was feeling a bit hungry when I boarded the flight and therefore opted to try the late night sushi snack.  On boarding, cabin crew also asked you to fill out a form indicating if you want to be woken for breakfast and if so, your food choice.  I filled in that I would like the Japanese breakfast set as typically the Japanese food on JAL is better than its Western options. I did note that while the food is very good, it was noticeably inferior to th earlier flight I took on JAL from Osaka Kansai to Bangkok, probably because the Japan based food caterer is better than the Bangkok based one. 

I had a very good sleep during the flight as the Sky Suite is very comfortable for sleep.  The flight was scheduled to land 7:15 am and arrived a little early.  By the time I walked from the gate at the satellite terminal to the main terminal, the First Class lounge was just opening at 7:30 am so the timing was good. 

I enjoyed this overnight flight very much.  Service is excellent and the seat is very comfortabel for sleeping in an overnight flight.  There was also lots of privacy and with direct aisle access from every seat, I was not disturbed in my rest.

title: What a surprise
review_text: Booked the flight without knowing much beforehand and it took us by surprise the little touches made by JAL. Before taking off the crew wave goodbye at the ground with a banner wishing well! That’s a first time experience! What made it lovely was the seafood meal choice that was made available to economy class too and for all seafood lovers/ pescatarian could be another option. Staff are polite and helpful, generous with amenities when you asked for it. The screen restarted a few times and the crew actually mailed vouchers as an appreciation after we got back, service standards 100%! Only 1 downside is the leg room, pretty tight for their planes, would definitely fly again and recommend JAL!

title: Best Airline I have ever flew
review_text:
Wow! From service to food to legroom! Everything was tasteful, classy and perfect! I cannot wait to fly this airline to Asia again! 
Thank you!

title: Narita Singapore Narita
review_text: Made a very quick last minute trip from Tennessee to Singapore on November 16, the flight did not arrive in Singapore from Narita until 12:50am, the inbound flight to Singapore was nice, the regular business class seats that on JAL are not the best, the service was great and I was able to sleep after a 14 hour flight from Dallas to Narita. The return from Singapore 3 days after was much different, same air craft 777-200 but the service was slow, I was on seat 6 A window single seat...it took more than 30 minutes to get something to drink, had to ring the attendant bell several times to get someones attention. It was the same for the lunch service, slow and no sense of attention to the customer, at least that is how I felt. On another note their intercom announcements are excessive and disturbing, it is hard to see a movie with the amount of constant interruptions that have no significant meaning.
