Next time I will take my I pad with my own movies to that I don't have to hear the a flight attendant that loves to hear her self talk... 2 out of 5 for JAL

title: tops the list
review_text: We are just at the end of a trip around the world and in the  process have flown a number of airlines on different international routes.  Of all the airlines that we utilized this Japan Airlines flight was the very best that we have experienced.  Boarding was very quick and efficient directed by immaculately dressed  and very polite personnel.  The seating was comfortable and although in economy class almost roomy, the food excellent and the service throughout the nine hour flight most attentive.  As an added treat there was a Japanese breakfast that provided a most authentic taste of the real Japan.  Hats off to Japan Airlines for a job very well done.

title: Very good economy class service
review_text:
I joined a group of friends traveling to Japan’s northern island of Hokkaido for a holiday.  As the flight was short and we were holidaying, we elected to buy the cheapest tickets available, which we located on Vayama.  One thing that I appreciated was the rather generous baggage allowance for such reasonably priced tickets, 23kg per passenger.
Arrival and check-in at Tokyo’s Haneda Airport went smoothly and we had time to grab lunch before boarding.  Clearing security was very efficient with a minimum of delay or hassle (very different from the usual TSA rigmarole), and boarding was swift and orderly.  The aircraft was a Boeing 777-200 and seating was 3-4-3.  I found my window seat to be comfortable enough for a 1h20m flight and the plane was very well maintained.  Take off was on time and soon we were flying high over Honshu.  While there is insufficient time for meal service in economy class, a complimentary drink was offered - and appreciated.
Arrival was slightly delayed due to weather, but Japan airlines acquitted itself handsomely with the quick delivery of our baggage.
All in all, the good, efficient, and courteous economy class service of Japan Airlines is fine, especially for rather short, domestic flights in Japan.

title: As good as always
review_text:
cozy seat and nice meal especially Japanese set lunch and sake.
In business class You can order your 2nd meal anytime from your seat video controller.
You do not need to call flight attendant.  This system is very convenient.

title: In a league of their own
review_text:
Are we glad that we booked JAL Business Class for our return BKK-NRT flights.

Both flights were on time, the food and service were up there with the absolute best in the sky.  The cabin and seating were spotlessly clean.  The flight attendants really made the journey that much more special with their attentiveness and friendliness.  Nothing was too much trouble and all delivered with genuine and sincere smiles.

The seating outbound was the Shell Flat Neo which was perfectly adequate and the return leg was the impressive Sky Suite boasting a 23" LCD monitor.  We should add that the Sky Suite is the best Business Class product we've ever had the fortune to be seated in.

We very much look forward to flying with JAL again in the future.

title: OMG WHAT AN EXPERIENCE
review_text:
This is little late as we travelled Oct 17.  But due a stroke on return, it has taken some time to get this written. More to follow on our trip to Japan. 

First time booking FRIST with any airline. But this was a special trip and a surprise for my wife. We were directed to the private check-in area, and boarding passes issued very quickly. We were then exported through a private security screening and then straight into the FIRST Lounge. The facilities were amazing. The flight was called and we headed to the gate. Boarded first as ♿ pax. Offered champagne 🥂 nice touch. The fight 1 1/2 hours. A hit towel before lunch service a hot meal and more champagne. The Cabin Service Director welcomed us by name and ensured are journey and requirements were taken care off. Absolutely spectacular crew, who all spoke English. The food and beverage were excellent.

title: As good as before
review_text: flight was smooth and aky was cleanand blue and everything was in order and we had a great short flight.

title: the flight attendants and personnel are amazing
review_text: Initial flight was from Shanghai to Tokyo and I had to change planes to get to LA. the plane was almost an hour late in leaving Shanghai and i was going to miss my connection in Tokyo. I asked the flight attendant about it and she said not to worry. When I arrived in Tokyo, a woman from Tokyo airlines was waiting for me with a sign with my name and escorted me to security and then to the gate for my flight to Los Angeles and I made my connection on Japan Airlines without any problems. It was superior service and stress free. it was my first time flying Japan Airlines. I usually like to fly Qatar Airways when if fly overseas. I am from the USA. I was pleasantly surprised and would fly with Japan airlines again.

title: Leisure time.
review_text: Very nice the foods was good the staff always asking you what you want . And I will fly again via JAL from Narita to manila Philippine the best airlines and hoping next time they give souviner for their passenger I heard some of the passenger they ask can we bring this blanket.?

title: Excellent experience!
review_text: Legroom was spacious and food was nice, it was really a good welcoming feeling to fly for a holiday to Japan! Staffs are nice both on board and at the check-ins.

title: Great nonstop flight from Boston to Tokyo
review_text: I flew Economy Plus from Boston to Tokyo on the 787. Very comfortable and spacious seats with a large monitor and USB charger. The staff was excellent and attentive. The food was also very good. One of the best flight experiences I have had in a while. Close to 13 hours but very comfortable.

title: Fly Japan Airlines (JAl) and experience true luxury
review_text:
When flying to South East Asia you have many options. For me it will always be JAL Premium Class. For only a few dollars more  
JAL premium class offers many luxuries: Lounge, wider seat with foot rest and separate line for ticketing. In all my years of flying I found JAL one of the best experiences followed by Lufthansa. What made this flight stand out  was the combination of professional, kind, diligent, warm, attentive, but not obtrusive service . 
This premium class flight was booked through American Airlines and was less expensive then most airlines flying to Hanoi.

title: MARVELLOUS STAFF
review_text:
What I admired most about Japan Airlines (JAL) was their staff. Whether it be at the check-in, at the gate or in the cabin they were all wonderful. Kind courteous and helpful. It makes me wonder why other airlines can’t be like JAL.  Their inflight meals weren’t great and movies on offer were not good either. But these minor deficiencies were all overshadowed by marvellous hospitality shown by the staff!

Their website is not user friendly and online check in was impossible. If JAL can rectify these shortcomings they could easily be one of the top airlines in the world!

title: Excellent Service
review_text: Flight Attendants were very attentive to our needs. The food was awesome. Flight was smooth even though we were seated at the back.

title: Impeccable flight attendant service
review_text: I flew business class from Guangzhou (CAN) to Tokyo (HND) on Japan Airlines (JAL). The flight was on a Boeing 787. I selected JAL based on lowest price (excellent value for money) for the business class airfare, time of day departure, and the non-stop, direct service. I departed from Guangzhou instead of Shenzhen, as the price was less by about 1,000 rmb. My seat was very comfortable and roomy, and the cabin service was impeccable, very friendly, Japanese-graceful, attentive and helpful.  The food quality was very good and the portion just right for me. In-flight entertainment options were average.

title: best flight ever
review_text: this is our first experience with JAL. we expect good service simply because it is a japanese airlines. but the services we received are beyond our expectations. flight attendants are friendly and cheerful. cabin is clean and comfortable. food and beverage is ample and delicious. this made our 12-hour flight from LHR to HND totally pleasant and enjoyable.  we look forward to another flight with JAL. highly recommended.

title: I’m lovin’ it!
review_text:
The Sakura Lounge (Level 2) at Narita International Airport was huge and the service & amenities were awesome. Plenty of beverages & snacks. Best place to chill until my flight (Gate 93 - JL 711) was ready for boarding. 

My seat (20K) was already prepped with an amenity kit, a blanket, a pillow and noise canceling headphones. I definitely enjoyed the nice headphones, since I didn't have one myself. The amenity kit was great for a short red-eye flight. I also got slippers & a shoehorn. The entertainment selection was up-to-date and had Western & Asian options. 

The seats had a comfortable, adjustable headrest & a padded seatbelt. I had a ton of leg room, a leg rest, an adjustable footrest, and a center divider for some privacy! I've never sat in an airline seat with so many footrest options. The seat was also wide & instead of reclining backward it reclined forward so that it doesn't disturb the person sitting behind me. Cabin crew was attentive & friendly. 

JAL Premium Economy seats were a huge upgrade from the economy seats. I have sat in JAL economy seats and the Premium Economy seats were a million times better. 

I would definitely fly JAL Premium Economy again.

title: The Japanese sense of hospitality at its best
review_text:
I am so glad I quit flying Emirates and I gave JAL a try. The service in economy class is simply stunning. All these new Middle Eastern airlines can do what they want, their flight attendants are simply not up to the job. In addition, the boarding is super smooth unlike the madness at Dubai airport or in Doha.
On JAL the flight attendants show the amazing tradition of hospitality of Japanese, and the food is excellent. Even the Japanese snacks during the meal services are great!

title: Truly outstanding service, even in Economy Class
review_text: It has been a very long time since I flew JAL (over 14 years) and I have to say I've been utterly impressed by the excellence of the service, way above SQ and Cathay Pacific. The cabin is pleasant, but the food is really the best I've ever had in economy class and the flight attendants are amazing.

title: Very Comfortable Economy Class
review_text: The economy class seats on this flight were very comfortable with lots of leg room compared to other airlines. Flight attendants were attentive, friendly, and always smiling. (I think it must be a directive that they smile every time they talk to you!) The food was good for an airline (2 full meals and a snack), wine and beer are free.

title: Individually separate seat facing isle and window
review_text: JAL's newest aircraft has 1-2-1 configuration in its business class, and offers great convenience (all isle access) and comfort (full flat and side table) for long-haul flights. Japanese food is great with nice chardonnay wine.  Elite member has access to Cathay lounges, which are the best by far at the Hong-Kong airport.

title: Terrible Business Class Seats
review_text: We booked business class on this, our first trip into Japan on Japan Airlines, seats 1H and 1K.  As soon as we sat, both seats reclined back too far into an uncomfortable position.  The flight attendants recognized this was a problem and called for 2 technicians to fix our seats.  They quickly arrived and without even examining the seat, simply said in broken English "normal, very normal" and walked off the aircraft.  There were lots of smiles and apologies from the flight crew, but no action.  I have flown around the world a couple of times and I know what a business class seat or any aircraft seat should feel like in an upright position.  It should not feel like I am lying down.  The flight was just over a couple of hours and my old back took a beating, but I must say the flight crew were gracious and attentive.

title: Good quality of services for the duration of my flight
Smooth Sailing
review_text: I flew from Sydney to Narita and then on to JFK. It's a long flight but JAL is a good choice, the seats in Premium Economy are a little bit bigger than the economy and the cabin crew were delightful. Flying premium economy allows you to enter the lounge which is nice.

title: Best Airline
review_text: One of the best airlines. Service was great. Their flight attendants are very accommodating. I felt relaxed during our flight from Manila to Tokyo.

title: The best airline
review_text: JAL is my #1 choice of airline when I travel to Asia. Service is great: from check in counter to crew on the plane.

title: extremely pleasant experiance
review_text: I just flew from Toronto to Tokyo with Air Canada and then Tokyo to Bangkok with Japan Airline.  The service and experience was night and day difference.   Japan Airline even offered very delicious meal.  Very happy with Japan Airline and even the flight attendants are so cute.

title: Very tired
review_text:
When you’re on a flight of 13 hours One would expect a comprehensive selection of movies. What a disappointment! I know we were on an old plane, (737 I think) but that’s no excuse for JAL not to download some current movies applicable to the demographic of its business class customers. 
The staff were friendly but their service was a reflection of lack of numbers?  The food was average to poor quality. JAL must be into some serious cost-cutting exercises. 
We hate to think how bad conditions in economy might have been.

title: Boston to Tokyo, nonstop
review_text: Premium Economy seats, the nonstop flight on a 787-9, and the always smiling and always helpful crew has turned me into a Japan Airlines advertisement.

title: Japanese Service : World Standard
review_text: Comfortable and full equipment seats make passengers relax. Staffs in nice uniform and manner look neat. All services are attentive and helpful. Safety mind comes first, especially checking overhead luggage compartment throughout the long flight. It is worth for money and time.

title: Widest Economy Seats I've Ever Seen
review_text: Most comfortable economy  seats I've ever seen.  The 2-4-2 configuration also meant not having to clamber over someone to go to the toilet.  Like everything Japanese, everything was as advertised.  Although we were late taking off, arrived slightly early.

title: one of the best companies
review_text:
This is a great company. I had two checked-in luggage places included by default in my ticket - extremely convenient and not expensive! 
They could have better variety of films and free wifi on board (c'mon, it is 21st century!), but everything else was perfect. 
The jet was brand new. To make the window dark, each window had a button with smart glass - extra cool! Also, the service was greaet!

title: Best Service oriented Airline
review_text: This was our 3rd trip to Asia on JAL. Every trip was a pleasure to travel on this airline. Service is great. Seats are roomy and one can do 14 hour flight comfortably. Food was good. Only thing needed little more selection of food at their lounges in Asia. We highly recommend this airline.

title: The Middle Seat Wins
review_text:
I originally started my journey in Kuala Lumpur, but this review is about my flight from Narita to LAX on JAL’s 777. 

I had a ten-hour layover at Narita so journeyed to Shinjuku and spent a few hours wandering. When I returned to the airport, I found my way to the fast track security and I was airside in about 10 minutes. 

Being a J class passenger, you’re afforded access to the wonderful Sakura Lounge. For those in the know, however, you also have access to the Admirals Club, Cathay Pacific Lounge and the Qantas Business Lounge. If you’ve the time, I highly recommend lounge-hopping. The Qantas Lounge is SUPER quiet (since their flights are red-eyes). 

When I checked in in Malaysia, the agent asked if I wanted an aisle seat instead of middle. I declined because I read the middle seat is actually very private. When I checked in at Narita, the agent also asked if I wanted an aisle instead of middle. Trust me, for this flight, you’ll want a middle seat. 

Boarding promptly began at 16:40 in such an orderly fashion. Boarding begins with passengers with children and those that need extra time. Then, first class and upper tier Mileage Bank members can board, followed by business class. 

On their 777, there is a forward, intimate biz class cabin - there are only seven seats in this area. I highly recommend you secure a seat in this forward area. 

Flight attendants came round with welcome drinks and I helped myself to some champagne. 

While it doesn’t seem like the middle seat provides much privacy, once the dividers go up, you’re in your own little world. What’s also great is you still have aisle access. 

After takeoff, cabin crew came round to take meal orders. I opted for the Japanese menu and a lovely sauvignon blanc. I love JAL cabin crew because they’re not only friendly, but they’re incredibly gracious. 

I highly recommend the Japanese meal. It’s beautifully presented, tasty and the ingredients are top-notch (I really enjoyed the root vegetables simmered in broth). 

After the meal service, you’re able to order snacks from your seat (why don’t more airlines offer this technology...?). I ordered a katsu sandwich, udon soup and ice cream. My flight attendant brought it out about ten minutes after I ordered it. 

My only one complaint is I found the entertainment to be lacking. While there are new movies on board, I didn’t have much interest in them. Though, I enjoyed the Japanese movies. 

Sadly, our 8 hour flight came to a close. We landed and taxied to our gate. 

I paid $1500 for this one-way flight. Highly recommend JAL.

title: Wonderful flying experience with Jal
review_text:
Nice food, drink, and service. 
Recommend: crystal champagne, blue tea, 磯自慢sake
Food, Japanese food is priority
I have to say I am so lucky to have all crews to serve me and another customer at first class. 
美妙的一趟日航頭等艙之旅
我選了日式餐點，這絕對是首選
我幾乎忘了使用機上各種設施
因為能在一萬英哩高空，享受米其林星級的餐食，夫復何求

title: Great Overnight Flight with Lots of Sleep
review_text:
I tried an overnight flight on JAL from Osaka Kansai to Bangkok departing past midnight at 12:55 am and arriving at 4:40 am.  I was a bit worried about the overnight flight as the flight time was not very long and I was worried about getting enough sleep to be functional on arrival.  My worries were misplaced as I actually slept very well on the flight.  

We departed on time, taxied for a while and took off around 1:10 am, and arrived about 10 minutes early at about 4:30 am.  JAL uses a B787 Dreamliner with angle flat Shell Flat Neo seats.  While the angle flat seats are of course less comfortable than fully flat bed seats and as the Shell Flat Neo do not give direct aisle access for all seats, I found my seat 1H in the first row on the aisle to work quite well for this flight.  The flight was completely full in business class and the passenger beside me in 1K appeared to be quite ill with a cold or flu so he was sleeping even before the flight took off and rarely moved from his seat during the flight.  

On boarding, cabin staff distributed breakfast preference cards so passengers can select whether to be woken for breakfast and what they wanted for breakfast.  I selected being woken for breakfast and the full Japanese breakfast set.  Soon after take off, I reclined my seat to its full angle flat position and slept soundly for about 4 hours out of a slightly less than 6 hour flight time.  Because of the time of the flight, eventhough business class was completely full and there were children in the section, it was very quiet throughout the flight.

About an hour and a half before landing, I was gently woken with a pat on the shoulder for my breakfast.  I regret not having collected my senses to take photos because the Japanese breakfast set tray was simply stunningly beautiful in presentation. Even small pieces of vegetable were carved into the shape of a maple leave and colored to give a more beautiful presentation to the meal.  Not only beautiful, the breakfast was also delicious.  Especially memorable was one of the many starters offered in the bento box which consisted of a slightly more solid tofu with a wasabi sauce topped by a couple of shrimps - the wasabi added just the right interest to the tofu.

Prior to arrival, cabin attendants distributed priority lane passes to all business class passengers allowing them to use the very fast no line-up priority lanes for immigration at Suvarnabhumi airport.  My suitcase was delivered within a few minutes of my arrivingn at the baggage carousel and I was out to meet my ride within about 20 minutes of the doors opening after landing.

title: Excellent Flat Bed Domestic Flight
review_text:
I took a domestic connecting flight from Narita to Osaka Itami airport on JAL and was pleasantly surprised that JAL chose to use a B767 with Sky Suite flat bed seats for the short 1 hour or so domestic flight.  The Sky Suite is very luxurious and comfortable since it can convert into a flat bed and as it is very private with the seated passenger well shielded from the aisle.  The configuration is 1X2X1 with the window seats alternating with the flat console on the window side or on the aisle side.  I was in 2A, which is the better window seat as the console for my seat was between me and the aisle giving me additional privacy.  There is a storage cabinet next to me on top of the console and a storage slot under the video screen for your smartphone or tablet.  Sky Suite would be a very comfortable seat for a long haul sleeping flight and so for a short haul, it was clearly beyond expectations. 

Due to the short flight time, there was just a simple drinks service which was carried out with JAL's usual grace and politeness. Also due to the short flight time, there was no video entertainment program eventhough all seats had video screens.   

We departed on time and arrived on time.  An excellent beyond expectation short haul domestic flight.

title: Usual Quality Flight Vancouver to Narita, Damaged Luggage but Fair Resolution
review_text:
I took the JAL afternoon flight from Vancouver to Narita on a Boeing 787 Dreamliner, configured 2X2X2 in business class with the two window seats without direct aisle access.  As the plane was fairly full in business class, I opted for seat 1C since it would be easier for the window seat passenger to step over me because there is no seat in front.  When I reserved my seat 1A was unoccupied but unfortunately it was occupied by flight time.  Nevertheless, with no seat in front, I was not disturbed when the window seat passenger had to step over me to access the aisle.  

The usual complaint applies that JAL chose to use a beautiful new plane in the Dreamliner for the route but install outdated angle flat seats in business class.  I slept a little bit on the flight but not deep sleep but I think it was more a matter of the flight time during the afternoon and evening rather than the angle flat seat.  1C does get a bit more traffic passing by it as there is a washroom in front of it past the galley but it was not excessive as there are two other washrooms behind the first set of business class seats.  The relative ease of step over for row 1 seats is counter-balanced by the negative that your video entertainment screen has to be lifted out of the divider between the two seats and therefore you cannot continue watching entertainment during landing as you are required to stow your video screen. 

As usual, service is superb and food is both beautifully presented and delicious.  There are both Japanese and Western meal offerings and while the Western offerings always sound tempting as well, I almost always opt for the Japanese meal since they seem to be so much more substantial with many more items.  Coffee on JAL in business class is a special blend only offered on flight in business class and it is one of the best coffees I have had in the air so I always enjoy a couple on a flight. 

JAL is very good with time management and boarding management so we departed on time and arrived a little early.  I did have an issue on this flight in that when my priority tagged luggage showed up as the first suitcase delivered to the luggage carousel, it was damaged.  Aside from some indentations in the soft sided suitcase, the entire pull out handle was missing and there just two wires sticking out of the tubes from which the pull out handle would have been extended.  I reported the damage to JAL and they sent me to JAL Lost & Found located outside immigration and customs and next to the domestic check-in desk.  I told Lost & Found my suitcase was severely damaged and hard to use without the pull out handle and I had a connecting domestic flight to catch in about 90 minutes time.  They offered me a replacement suitcase but they only have one type in two colors and it was a very solid but very heavy hard sided suitcase weighing more than 13 lbs whereas my usual suitcases are light soft sided suitcase weighing less than 10 lbs.  I had no choice but to accept the replacement suitcase as my damaged suitcase was not really usable for continuing my trip on the domestic connecting flight so I took everything out of my damaged suitcase and put it in the replacement suitcase.  Luckily the replacement suitcase is a full 28 inch large suitcase so there was plenty of room for all my luggage contents.  I should mention Lost & Found was extremely polite in handling the problem and thorough in helping double check my damaged suitcase once I transferred all my belongings to make sure nothing was left behind.  Lost & Found also advised that they would arranged for the destruction of the damaged suitcase once I left.  

Lost & Found then required me to sign a form acknowledging I received a replacement suitcase and told me I would not be able to claim compensation for damage since I received a replacement suitcase.  I told them I would take up the issue with JAL after I get to my destination as I felt it was unfair that I was forced to accept a heavy replacement suitcase that I would not normally buy and be unable to claim for part of the cost of a replacement suitcase similar to the one that was damaged and that would be what I would normally use.  

When I arrived at my destination, I did contact JAL through their website and initially their response was the same as Lost & Found in denying any compensation because I received a replacement suitcase.  After some back and forth explanation, I am glad to report JAL did accept I did not have a choice but to accept their replacement suitcase and that the replacement is not what I would buy for myself or use normally.  They agreed to compensate me for part of the cost of my damaged suitcase, which I accepted as a very fair handling of the situation.  

In summary, while I did have an unexpected unpleasant experience of finding my luggage has been severely damaged in transit, ultimately JAL handle the matter well, gave me a replacement suitcase to allow me to continue my travels and made a fair agreement to partly compensate for the damaged suitcase as the replacement was not what I would buy for myself.

title: One of the Best Flights I have Ever Had
review_text: The customer service was at an excellent level. The crew is very very friendly. The flight was also new. Nothing to be complained about their service. Only a couple of points that I had concerns. The first thing is the bag holders on the roof was shivering at the take off and landing. I don't know if it's natural, but I was concerned. The second thing was that as it was a Japanese flight, some food was not to my taste. Other than that, I highly recommend this flight.

title: Travel to Japan
review_text: We travelled to Japan on Japan  Airlines  to Tokyo. The whole experience was excellent. Check in, check on, food, seats, staff efficiency and courtesy were all wonderful. Highly recommeded.

title: Non-stop flight to Tokyo, Japan
review_text: Very long (14.5 hrs) flight on B-787 Dreamliner.  Brand new aircraft.  Comfortable roomy seats for Economy Premium, nice added amenities.  Excellent food service.  Very accommodating cabin crew.

title: Comfortable
review_text: Comfortable and enough space for seat.  Attentive and kind crew.  Movie choices were up-to-date. Special request for diet (vegan) from Osaka (Itami) was carefully attented. Not the usual food served for vegetarian/vegan.  Was different patty with rice and a chocolate cake dessert - definitely Specially made!  2nd time from Singapore to Japan and will continue.  Recommended.

title: Nearly perfect !
review_text:
Team members were pleasant during check in. 
The Sakura Lounges in Honolulu...Narita...Bangkok...the team members at the entrances could be more welcoming...lounges served very little food compared to other lounges !
Surprised that some of the flight attendants onboard were not more helpful with stowing the overhead luggage !!!
Powder rooms were well cleaned before another guest enters. 
Japanese meals could be tastier ? The layflat beds would be more comfortable with even a thin padding  ?

title: The perfect airline for international travel
review_text: We flew JAL to get to bangkok.  This was by far the best airline I've traveled on so far.  Others I have used are American Airlines, (steer clear of that one)(I'm American too) China Southern, Cathway Pacific, China Eastern, Korean Air, and United.  JAL is the best.  Clean, lots of leg room in economy, perfect and proactive service and friendly authentic smiles.  I had to fly American on my way back and wished I could have jumped out of the plane with a parachute. (not really but wished I was back on JAL for the return.)

title: Superb service and comfort at a very attractive price.
review_text: JAL have a small number of companion, two persons travelling together, fares for seniors in business class. We have used this method of flying for the past 15 years. The flights are during daylight, leaving Sydney in the morning arriving in Narita (Tokyo) in the afternoon. An overnight stay in an airport hotel at JAL expense. Leaving the following morning for Europe (Helsinki, London, Frankfurt, Paris) arriving in the afternoon at your destination. JAL use the latest Boeing 787-900 with very comfortable flat beds. The food is excellent both Japanese and Western. The service is great. You also get entry to airport bisiness lounges. And as a bonus when you look out the window you see a vast snow covered Siberia with large rivers and mountain ranges, absolutely superb. Try it, you will not regret the experience.

title: Lovely customer service and food. Not very comfortable seats.
review_text:
The journey was a long one - 11 hours there and 13 hours back - so comfort was key. I recommend that if you can afford it you upgrade to at least premium economy if you want to sleep. I was travelling with my five year old son overnight for the flight out so getting some sleep was important. He slept for about six hours but was very uncomfortable as the seats to not recline much and there was nowhere for him to rest his feet (other than on me!) I did not sleep at all. In premium the seats recline more and a footrest comes up. In business you get fully flat beds. 

On the positive side, however, the service on the flight both ways was excellent. Staff couldn’t do enough for us. Snacks and drinks were left out for us between meals and my son was thoroughly spoiled with toys and a special child’s meal (which was bigger, tastier and more fun that the adults’ one!) I can’t fault my food though, and it was nice to get Japanese food. There was a decent range of films and TV to keep us both entertained, although there could have been a few more children’s films available. 

On the whole I would recommend flying with JAL. A pretty painless experience for what could have been a hellishly long and horrid flight.

title: SAFE flight, but food and service subpar
review_text: My Alaska Airline frequent flyer miles purchased the business class ticket. The food and service were subpar and generic.  The 787 plane landed safely, good news. The JAL flight was my only option when using frequent flyer miles, so I did not really have a choice of airlines.

title: Spectacular, comfortable and classy
review_text:
I was supposed to fly with economy class. However, for some apparent reason that didn't bother me, all seats had been taken up when I arrived for my check-in. Japan Airlines did the favour of escorting me to premium class which I was not expecting, at all.
Service or Japanese hospitality was charming, and nothing out of the ordinary.

My only advice for the future is to provide HALAL option. There is an increasing demand for this, and even the "vegetarian option" did not leave out foods not suitable for vegetarians and people of religious faiths.

title: Excellent service, amazing staff!
review_text:
It was my first long haul flight so i was pretty nervous! Japan air was absolutely incredible from start to finish. The staff on board were incredible and couldn't do enough for you. Constantly offering drinks and snacks. The food was delicious and made me incredibly excited for what Tokyo would hold! I fell asleep at one point and an air hostess actually turned my tv off and put a blanket on me! (Ridiculously sweet). 

Highly recommended!

title: Great experience!
review_text: I got lucky and got the exit row so I had lots of leg room. The in flight entertainment was great with a nice selection of music and movies. The food was really good and they had the snacks and drinks flowing. What really makes this airline is their employees - they are so kind and accommodating.  I would most definitely fly JAL again!

title: Incredibly uncomfortable
review_text:
Do not think this airline caters for anybody taller than 5ft 5!!!
The seats do not recline, just the base moves forward!!
Food was not to my taste, even after staying in Japan for 7weeks eating local food. I have no idea what they are thinking, serving a burger that looks and has texture of rubber.Disgusting.!!

title: Dreaming on a Dreamliner
review_text: The new JAL on a Dreamliner 787 in a window seat business is as good as many First Class offerings.  Noise level low and seats / beds excellent. And great and non-intrusive Japanese service. Keep it up!

title: Mixed Bag
review_text: Overall the people were fanatastc and professional.  The comfort of the cabin seating, layout was dated and cold.  The seats were lay down but hard as concrete and not enough room to lay sideways comfortably.  The entertainment was also difficult and combursome to navigate.  The food was marginally better than cafeteria in business class.  The 767 plane coming from Narita to Taoyuan was the worst seats I have ever been on.  It reminded me of my grandfathers broken recliner.  Horrible design and broken seating adjustments.  JAL will get you were you want to go but I hope the review their competition!  The pillows are so small it’s comical, the blanket is thin as a sheet.  The details matter in business class.  Other Airlines are offer MORE for the same price.

title: JAL is superb!
review_text: The service on Japan Airlines is simply superb, as is the food. The equipment on this flight was very modern -- for example, you could darken or lighten the windows by your seat by choosing from a 5-point dark-to-light dial. The flight attendants are exactly that -- attentive. And they'll speak to you in any language you prefer -- they'll even open the conversation with a Caucasian in Japanese, if that's what he suggests! No problems with luggage either -- it arrived very timely.

title: Best customer service
review_text:
Excellent customer service...... Thank you japan airlines for such an amazing customer support.... A few days before i was facing an issue with my flight cancellation but i literally want to say thanks to this toll-free number 1-888-324-1990 for helping me... As the experts guided me instantly... One of the best customer support till now

I HIGHLY RECOMMEND JAPAN AIRLINES

title: Good... not great!
review_text:
The food was just OK. We had trouble understanding much of what the Japanese stewardesses where saying. 

The configuration of adjoining seats where not aligned so my wife and I seemed to be artificially separated.

title: Best company
review_text: Best company I ever flight! Delicious food on board, cheerful staff. Very comfortable aircraft. Check in without any problems and delays.

title: Osaka/Itami to Tokyo/Haneda Boeing 767 JL130
review_text: Aircraft presented well and crew were very friendly. Took off at scheduled time and landed similarly. Even it was only an hour flight light refreshments were served along with drinks.

title: Jal fails on service
review_text: Traveling first class on jal but they don’t connect to pre-tsa system so am waiting 30 minutes in line. Somehow they don’t have a “contract” so don’t fly them until they do!

title: Excellent service from Japan-based crew
review_text:
Excellent outbound onboard service from Purser Horiuchi. Hubby went to sleep right of Narita and when he woke 90 minutes to landing in Honolulu, Horiuchi was already waiting to serve him is kaiseki meal!
Inbound, we were delighted with Masako our Chief Cabin Attendant /Senior Sommelier who looked after us very well.
Sky Suite 3 beds are definitely an improvement from the Sky Suite 2. We noticed that window seats have much larger footwells than the middle couple seats. Avoid the middle seats if you are tall. 
Cons – again, cabin can be on the warmer side, bathrooms weren't as impeccable as the last time we flew. Pillows can be more substantial and a mattress pad would be absolutely appreciated.

title: Old - bad and disappointing
review_text: I ended up on the flight as part of a trip to Hong Kong, Korea and Japan. This was the last long haul leg and I usually use this leg to adjust back my body clock so good sleep is essential. To be fair I make multiple long haul flights a year in either business or first class and with over 25 years of doing this I have seen all the seats and all the levels of service across many airlines so maybe I am just getting picky. But - this is an old configuration that few still use and on pretty much my favorite aircraft (Dreamliner) this was very surprising. These days business is pretty much 4 across in a ‘pod’ style arrangement with large screen, full lay flat and usually a mattress pad etc. However this flight was 6 across - so you are sitting right next to your fellow flyer, no privacy screen and seats that should have been banned years ago. These are the seats that recline to about 30 degrees, have the hump in the middle and the flip out footrest to catch the continual slide that the angle causes. They are by far the most uncomfortable seats ever put in business class and the inventor should be made to sit in one for 10 painful hours every day and then apologize to all flyers who ever used one. Multiple complaints and grumbling from passengers and it amazes me the Japan Air considers this acceptable. So I did not sleep, ended up with back ache and once off the bed of torture swore I will never fly this route with this airline again. These seats were so old fashioned they even had the screen that comes out of the arm rest and sits at a crooked angle.  Food was mediocre, service excellent. Stay well away - this is just cheap old fashioned seating and cram as many passengers in travel that most abandoned 10 years ago.

title: Excellent service
review_text:
Excellent service, clean, comfort, On Time, and Wider passenger seat.
The stewardess offered us to take our picture, it was very nice.
I love this 5 stars excellent airline, for sure I will put in the top priority for flight to Japan.

title: JAL Premium Economy
review_text: We asked about an upgrade from economy to premium economy at check in. The cost was $350 each Sydney to Tokyo which we gladly accepted. Access to the lounge was not included. The JAL service was impeccable from check in to exiting the plan. The seat was very comfy with lots of leg room. The configuration was 8 seats across in 2 4 2 configuration. All other airlines have 9 seats across on the 787 in a 3 3 3 configuration. Really nice food. The toilets remained tidy and clean throughout the flight. JAL is now my favourite airline.

title: Good flight as usual
review_text:
As is typical with JAL it was a good comfortable flight.  Leaving from San Diego, only one flight a day, is easy for us as we live in the area.  Further it avoids the indignity, hassle, maltreatment and general nastiness of going through LAX.  I regard LAX as to nations worst airport as regards service and the connection between domestic and international flights stinks.

Perhaps a bit too much food was served but other than that nothing to fuss about.

A nice feature is a washlet in the loo which I have not seen on other airlines.

title: Great service! Good meals! Enough in-flight entertainment services! On schedule!
review_text: I have always used Japan Airlines for Japan-China trip. I have nothing but faith for the airline. Great service, good meal, in-flight entertainment, and almost always on schedule! What more can you ask for the airline? If you are travelling to Japan, try them once!

title: Great flight
review_text: When I took flight from Tokyo to Kona , That day was my birthday! So clue gave me miniature airplane and some gift with their message !! It was great memory.

title: FLIGHT OF THE YEAR
review_text: Totally love JAL for having flight attendants so polite, lots of leg room in the plane, everyone have entertainment if front of them and headset is provided.  The foods are served warm and healthy.  They sure take good care of their passenger from babies to seniors. Excellent! :-)

title: Very nice choice
review_text: The food was great and service was good too for a fair price. would definitely take again and recommend for others

title: Great experience flying
review_text: For our first trip to Japan, we flew with JAL and had a really great experience. Both flights  between Boston and Tokyo (going there and coming home) were smooth and efficient. The crew is very polite and friendly. It was one of my most pleasant flying experiences.

title: It’s business class but not as we know it
review_text: It’s not exactly business class more like premium economy, not very comfortable seats just soft drinks in paper cups ,

title: Feel Safe
review_text: It's not my first time flying with JAL...I just love and feel safe traveling with this Airline. That is why I always recommend it to my family and friends.

title: Excellent customer service, one of the best!
review_text:
I flew from London to Tokyo with Japan Airlines for the first time, I have to say I received excellent customer service - very attentive, excellent quality food and drink - although I did find a hair in my meal, but they changed it very quickly - and I love the fact that the seat don't recline but you can amend the chair up and down. Avoids any confrontation.

Cabin crew were always on hand to answer any questions, they were polite, friendly and were very welcoming - a typical trait of the Japanese. I will definitely fly them again as their entertainment system was one of the best I've encountered.

title: Other airlines do it better
review_text:
While it was all so very polite, lots of bowing etc. the actual service delivery was just average. For a start, very few of the cabin attendants spoke reasonable English which made communication difficult. The magazine had so many languages that I couldn't easily ascertain how some of the equipment worked. Also the airline seemed to treat their own nationals better than Westerners. It was impossible for us to pre-select our seats and only sterling efforts by our travel agent had us seated reasonably together. another couple was not as fortunate being separated by 4 seats and an aisle.
When one travels in a Premium class it is not much different to walking into a restaurant. I am used to being offered a drink after I board the plane as happens on all of my other international flights.  On this flight there was no service for an hour. While this might have been acceptable to a passenger starting their trip at Narita, we had come from Berlin and had been travelling for about 15 hours already. 
That said, the actual plane, a Dreamliner, was fine and the seat comfortable. Because flights from Australia to almost anywhere the level of service is so important. To me, and my wife, JAL failed the test. My wife now even wants to fly Qantas, although she has been critical of that airline in the past

title: Great flight but let down by codeshare
review_text:
Got a great deal on Japan airlines premium econony as a 2 leg flight from melbourne to london. I was excited to see it included lounge access which meant a chance to freshen up in Tokyo
However -even though we booked the whole journey through Japan airlines it was only afterwards we learnt the Tokyo-London leg was codeshare and a British airways flights. 
This meant no ability to select seats or preselect meals (which can be done on british airways). It also  meant no access to the lounge at Narita -even though we thought we had booked a JAL premium economy ticket because of the codeshare we were not eligible (fun to find out when exhausted after 10 hours flight)
The flight itself I'd have given 4 stars to -great seevice by staff, food was okay, plenty of room in the seat. Would have liked a bit more recline and extension of footrest but that was fine. Got some sleep (would have got more but as with all flights there was a crying toddler)

At least our return flights are all JAL so lounge access is fine.

title: Great value for optimal comfort
review_text: First time flying JAL. I was quite impressed and would gladly fly with this airline again. The service and value were top, I highly recommend this airline.

title: Great experience!
review_text:
The flight was in midnight but all the staffs were nice and friendly. The entertainment resources were good with many movies, music,... 
However, it's better if they provide English sub to English movies. Also, need more albums of new music.

title: JAL Premium Economy Seat 787
review_text: Bucking the trend here to say the premium economy seat on JAL's 787 is one of the most uncomfortable seats I have ever sat in. Whilst the rest of the JAL experience was excellent the seat is awful. The seat is as hard as nails, I was constantly having to re-adjust my position because I was sliding on the seat's fabric when the seat was in the recline position and with no in-built foot rest it was nigh on impossible to maintain a position consistent with sleep. My bum was numb after 6 hours of a near ten hour flight. I won't be flying with JAL again which is a shame because the lounge, the food, the cabin crew were all excellent.

title: Comfortable seats, good food, fair entertainment & great cabin crew.
review_text: Flight departed on time, seats were comfortable (I'm 6'3"), crew was attentive, food was great, and flight arrived on time.

title: Japan airline 011 and 759 business class
review_text:
It was a long haul from Dallas, Texas to Ho Chi Minh in business class. Most of all I enjoyed wonderful services. The hardware of Japan air business class from Dallas to narita with private seat but from narita to Ho Chi Minh’s unflat seat( 9A in flight 011 and 2k of flight 759). As expected JAL crew deliver top notched service especially Ayano Takeuchi, flight 759 from Tokyo to Ho Chi Minh. I want japan airline recongnize her genuine personality with professional service. Most of crews are super excellent but her service was outstanding with fluent english. I must point out floor carpet and divider units of 011 are bit outdated and quality of main meal. The quality of dinning and limited selections of movie in inflight entertainment must be improved immediately It was worse than previous fly and quite short to meet JAL’s reputations.
Over all I enjoyed and thanks to JALs flight.

title: Always Amazing
review_text: I have flown with JAL for every Japan trip I do. Both economy and premium economy are wonderful, comfortable and convenient. I do love the extra leg room for premium though. The service is the thing that always stands out for me. Staff go above and beyond and are always kind and helpful. The food is also delicious. 10/10 will always fly JAL for my Japan trips.

title: Spacious, good service, and on time.
review_text: I had the first row in Premium Economy class.  There was a big space from my seat to the wall that separate us from Business class.  I (height 163cm) wasn't able to touch the wall with my foot even when reclined.  CAs were graceful.

title: As Close to Perfect As a Flight Can be
review_text: I've made this trip many times, but this was the best yet, for comfort, service and promptness. Can't fault it one bit.

title: Top Notch First Class Product
review_text:
I was in first class seat 1G. Everything about the flight was fantastic. I actually flew round trip from JFK-HND and the HND to JFK leg was much better in terms of soft product. The food was a notch better because they enlisted chefs from 3 Michelin star restaurants to cater the menu. Men received a Shiseido Men's facial care kit in addition to the standard amenity kit and women received some extra facial mask. The lotion inside the amenity kit  was too fragrant. The seat was wide and comfortable. We even got to dine together. One of my favorite F class products. 

The In-Flight Entertainment system can be better. Selection was decent but the handset was hard to use.

title: Love to fly with Japan Airlines
review_text: Love to fly with Japan Airlines, my 8 hours in the sky was amazing, the staff are nice, the food very good and tasty, the inflight entertainment is great. Just love it.

title: Great overall service
review_text: I have always heard great things about JAL so I was excited to try it for the first time. JAL was worthy of the hype! The staff, from ground agents to flight crew, was exceptionally courteous and polite. Waiting at the gate, the flight crew passed by, stopped, turned around and bowed to the passengers before boarding the plane. Boarding started 30 minutes prior to departure and was so efficient that the plane was backing out of the gate with about 8 minutes to spare. There was ample overhead bin storage available. Even though my family flew economy class, there was more legroom than we are used to on American carriers. The seats were comfortable. As the plane left the gate, the JAL ground crew on the tarmac lined up, waved, and then bowed to the plane and its passengers.The food and beverage service was very good, much better than we are used to. Passengers are even given slippers. The cabin was clean and there were multiple entertainment options available. The inflight service was excellent. Deboarding the plane was also very orderly and efficient. I don't know why boarding/deboarding takes so long on American carriers. The flight departed on time (actually ahead of time) and arrived on time (actually ahead of time). The service on JAL is over the top. My family and I are flying on JAL again in a couple of months. It is definitely worth it!

title: Finally, an airline with the 3 C’s - Cleanliness, Comfort and Courtesy
review_text: First time to travel with Japan Airlines and I am now a fan.  Cost of airfare is reasonable considering that my checked baggage allowance is consisted of 2 bags (23kg each).  Staff are courteous and respectful - from the time I checked in until the plane landed at my destination.  For someone like me who frequently travels economy, seats are so roomy and entertainment selection is a delight.  Food is fab (my stomach and my palate were happy).  And most important is the restrooms are roomy and very clean.  With what I have experienced so far, would definitely fly with JAL again and would recommend it over and over again!

title: Late night service missing
review_text: This was an overnight flight6 from Melbourne in a B777. It left just after midnight and there was minimal flight service … no offer of a turn-in hot or cold drink. Passengers were just tucked up on their very good flat-beds.The 777 is getting s little dated, although this aircraft was in tip-top condition in the cabin and the toilets. The cabin attendants  were reactive rather than proactive. All in all, a classy operation  frayed around the edges.

title: Small meal size
review_text: My flight was delayed by about an hour, but I was able to arrive on time coming back to NY. I love the service, they were very helpful and respectful. You can get full bottle wine and can of beer during your meals. I love how they put snacks near the restroom area and you can take as much as you want. They served drinks throughout the flight. I thought the food on the flight was just ok. The portion was a bit small for me. I thought they would have some sushi, but they didn't. I was a bit surprised when they served a hotdog as a full meal. I was very hungry still after eating that. I wished they didn't turn on the light so much. They give out haagodez ice cream. The seats were very roomy. I love how they made the pillow with a neck rest, but they didn't have good movie selection.

title: Definitely 5 star!
review_text: Enjoyed every moment of the flight. The attendants were professional and their services were just  excellent. They set the bar very high.

title: Overnight flight
review_text:
Took the overnight in PA. I had pre-selected my seat but was asked to move to accomodate a family. I of course did but it meant being penned in by the window as the fellow passenger went straight to sleep. It made for not the best experience. I also found the flight warm and quite stuffy, but perhaps due to my circumstance.

TV choices were good. 

I hadnt experienced before not having a take-off meal. There was a notice at check-in re being presented a snack bag on boarding, which indeed they did. You could also get a noodle cup if feeling peckish.

Overall I think JAL offer a good direct service. Returning in economy on the day flight so will see how that is.

title: Efficient
review_text: As a handicapped passenger I couldn't have been treated better at both airports. Wheelchair service was offered and the handlers were very courteous. Everything about the flight was very good except the food. It was likely good if you like Japanese, but it's not for me.

title: JAL Business class is a waste of money
review_text: My wife and I recently flew business class Melbourne/Tokyo. It was a waste of money! The business class lounge at Tullamarine airport was a shared arrangement and quite ordinary. The plane cabin layout was cheap looking and the seats narrow. Sleeping on the overnight Melb/Tokyo sector was very difficult. Our vegetarian meals were all cold and largely tasteless. The only saving grace was the very friendly and efficient cabin staff. On top of that (not necessarily the airlines fault) one of our cases was damaged. However dealing with JAL ground staff re: repairs is inefficient.

title: Superb service
review_text: If one remembers Singapore Airlines in-flight service in the old days, you would have a point of comparison with Japan Airlines. The in-flight service is superb, including the food. Premium economy was completely full. As an indicator, I asked for a mid-afternoon snack, so the stewardess brought me JAL's own original Udon de Sky noodles accompanied by a half-bottle of French champagne.

title: Very polite & helpful flight attendants
review_text: JAL has amazing staff, both on the ground and in the air - due to an approaching hurricane, all flights in and out of Kona were delayed by 4-5 hours - we were expecting that to be the case with our flight too, which would have totally upset our plans in Tokyo - surprisingly, we took off right on time and had a very smooth flight - thank you JAL!

title: JAL's Premium Economy Seating
review_text: What a pleasant surprise to be told that our Premium economy seating allowed us to visit the Sakura lounge at both the Melbourne and Narita airports; almost as nice as the business class lounge. The service and quality of the food served on both our inbound and outbound flights to Tokyo were outstanding and I found the cleanliness of the bathrooms the best of any airline I flew on.

title: JAL Experience
review_text: It's my first time riding JAL and I'm quite satisfied. It's on time, flight crews are very good and always with a smile. Food is very good if you love Japanese cuisine.It's more than what I expected. Domo Arigatou ! I will ride it again next time.

title: Trying hard, but not a 5* airline
review_text:
The second experience with JAL was not quite as good as the first. The outbound flight from Bangkok as usual struggles with ground services - the business lounge stinks of "curry rice", not great at the best of times, and quite revolting early in the morning. The boarding procedure is deficient. All passengers use the same to have their ticket and passport checked before entering the boarding lounge. At least boarding is separate, but airlines need to raise this issue with AOT. The desk was built to allow two lanes, why not use it that way?

Drink service on the outbound commenced 1 hour after take off, and meal service about 1 hour and 20 minutes. Food quality and general service is as different as night from day outbound versus inbound. Flight information page on VOD was not available. Seat was uncomfortable, with limited functionality, and not the best if you suffer from claustrophobia, or unless you enjoy sleeping in a coffin.

title: Unsatisfactory customer service - Food not up to the standard expected for Premium Economy travellers.
review_text:
My friend and I had a most unnecessarily distressing and anxious journey during the first and second stages of our round trip booking with Japan Airlines.
My friend is a sixty-two year old pensioner who suffers from anxiety and depression. He has also recently had a by-pass and open heart surgery. I am an 85 year old pensioner, and my friend's carer, This trip was planned especially to be a relaxing holiday for both of us where we planned to stay with my sister in the United Kingdom and then spend four days in Tokyo on the way back to Sydney, Australia.
We booked our flight through iTalktravel & Cruise | Blue Mountains, Australia who sold us The package: Japan Airlines (JAP).  JL 772, JL 7081(British Airways), JL 42 & JL 771. We accepted this even though on our first stage we would arrive in Tokyo at Narita 17.05 hours on 30 August 2018 and depart the following day from Tokyo Narita at 12.55 hours (a stop over of  19 hours). Our Travel agent was quite clear the the package included JAL arranging the transfers to and from overnight accommodation paid for by JAL. The booking also required wheel chair services for my friend on every section of this round trip journey.

Both my friend and I were looking forward to a most relaxing and enjoyable trip to help us recover from all the worry and anxiety we had gone through as a result of my friend having open heart surgery and a by-pass operation in April this year.
 
At Sydney International Airport we needed to advise the JAL personal that my friend needed to be wheeled from the check-in to the Qantas Lounge then to the aircraft. This was then arranged.
 
A short while after take-off we were given the customs forms to complete. These required us to indicate the address at which we would be staying while in Tokyo. As we did not know which hotel JAL had booked us into we told the Flight Attendants that we expected them to advise us where we were to be accommodated during the stopover. This would have been about one hour after take-off. The Flight Attendants stated that JAL never arranged for overnight accommodation for their passengers and that this should have been done by our travel agent. We showed the Flight Attendent our booking itinerary, which clearly stated "... Once flights have been ticketed JAL will provide confirmation for your stopover..."  

The Flight Attendants insisted that JAL'never ever' paid for passengers overnight accommodation. 
We explained to the Flight Attendants that because there was such a long delay between flight JL 772 on 30th August 2018 and flight JL 7081(the BA flight) on 31 August 2018 ( a stop over of 19 hours) JALhad made this package to sell the tickets. 

This constant insistance by the Flight Attendants that it was not JAL's responsibility to provide our overnight accommodation caused us extreme distress. As we did not know what we could do when we arrived at Narita Airport we asked if it would be possible for us to use the JAL Sakura Lounge and stay there overnight. 
'NO this was not possible', we were told. At no time did any of the Flight Attendants offer to communicate with JAL or our Travel Agent to confirm what we had believed to be, and what were in fact the arrangements. 

Fortunately, we noticed that Wi-Fi was available on the flight. We tried to send an email to our Travel Agent but it failed to go. This would have been now some six hours since we boarded the flight. We asked the Flight Attendant why the email could not be sent and were told that we would need to pay for the service. Having then paid US$12.50 we sent the email to our Travel Agent. 

Within thirty minutes of our email to our travel agent, a JAL Flight Attendant came and apologised and showed us the message they had received. The message read:
	TO JL772 RE ST18A/18C PAX CASE 2
	THE PAX ALREADY HAS A HOTEL 							RESERVATION,
	HARROAD INTERNATIONAL HOTEL NARITA.
	TWIN BWED ROOM.
	PAX DO NOT NEED TO PAY ADDITIONAL FEES.
	THKS
	FROM NRTOO
This confirmed everything we had been saying ever since take-off. 

Why did JAL Flight Attendants not contact JAL to confirm what we had said right at the beginning of our journey? It would have saved us having all the worry and anxiety for the entire journey. So now just before arriving at Tokyo we were able to try to calm down. 

HOWEVER THIS WAS NOT GOING TO BE THE END OF OUR TROUBLES.

On the morning of the 31th August 2018 we arrived at Narita Airport at about 09.00 hours. We went to the JAL check-in and inquired about the wheel chair for my friend. The JAL officer said that this was the responsibility of British Airways (BA) and advised us to go to the BA check in counter. We stated that as we had booked our flight with JAL it was JAL's responsibility. The JALofficer telephoned BA and then told us that BA would provide the wheel chair service for my friend. When we enquired if BA would take us to their lounge we were informed that as we were travelling Premium Economy with JAL we could not use BA Lounge. We asked if we could use JAP's Sakura Lounge and were told that we could not as our flight was with BA. We insisted that as our entire trip was with Japan Airlines this seemed absolute nonsense, for,  if JAL had used one of their own aircraft, we would be entitled to use the JALSakura Lounge. 

Again the JALofficer insisted that this was not possible. We stated we were prepared to pay for the use of the JALSakura Lounge or the BA Lounge if necessary. Again we were informed that this was not an option. Finally after over one hour of  discussion and our trying to reason with JAL personnel, the JAL officer contacted her manager. 
Thank goodness that this lady (JAL manager) used common sense to immediately organise a wheel chair for my friend, and we were escorted to the JALSakura Lounge at Narita Airport. 
Once again we had to suffer unnecessary anxiety and stress for a good hour before the matter was resolved to our satisfaction.
Our entire Premium Economy round trip from Sydney Australia, via Tokyo, Japan to Heathrow, United Kingdom with return with stop over at Tokyo, Japan, then return to Sydney, Australia was booked with Japan Airlines. Why did it take so long for Japan Airlines personnel to provide us with the service we had paid for and expected to receive as Premuim Economy passengers? 
These flights with Japan Airlines that we had anticipated being a most enjoyable start to our four weeks holiday became a  horrendous and dissapointing experience. The food provided by JAL was absolutely disgraceful for the price we paid. It most certainly did not cater to the European palate. The only positive aspect regarding this flight was that the JAL Premium Economy seating was wide, comfortable and most satisfactory as the seats were able to recline without encroaching into the space behind. 
Our official conplaint to Japan Airlines with a request to upgrade us for our entire return trip was rejected. All we received were apologies and assurances that JAL staff were expected to know that JAL did infact pay for and provide overnight accommodation when there are delays between connecting flights.
Two very dissapointed customers,My friend and I had a most unnecessarily distressing and anxious journey during the first and second stages of our round trip booking with Japan Airlines.
My friend is a sixty-two year old pensioner who suffers from anxiety and depression. He has also recently had a by-pass and open heart surgery. 	THKS

HOWEVER THIS WAS NOT GOING TO BE THE END OF OUR TROUBLES.

On the morning of the 31th August 2018 we arrived at Narita Airport at about 09.00 hours. We went to the JAL check-in and inquired about the wheel chair for my friend. The JAL officer said that this was the responsibility of British Airways (BA) and advised us to go to the BA check in counter. We stated that as we had booked our flight with JAL it was JAL's responsibility. The JALofficer telephoned BA and then told us that BA would provide the wheel chair service for my friend. When we enquired if BA would take us to their lounge we were informed that as we were travelling Premium Economy with JAL we could not use BA Lounge. We asked if we could use JAP's Sakura Lounge and were told that we could not as our flight was with BA. We insisted that as our entire trip was with Japan Airlines this seemed absolute nonsense, for,  if JAL had used one of their own aircraft, we would be entitled to use the JALSakura Lounge. 

Again the JALofficer insisted that this was not possible. We stated we were prepared to pay for the use of the JALSakura Lounge or the BA Lounge if necessary. Again we were informed that this was not an option. Finally after over one hour of  discussion and our trying to reason with JAL personnel, the JAL officer contacted her manager. 
Thank goodness that this lady (JAL manager) used common sense to immediately organise a wheel chair for my friend, and we were escorted to the JALSakura Lounge at Narita Airport. 
Once again we had to suffer unnecessary anxiety and stress for a good hour before the matter was resolved to our satisfaction.
Our entire Premium Economy round trip from Sydney Australia, via Tokyo, Japan to Heathrow, United Kingdom with return with stop over at Tokyo, Japan, then return to Sydney, Australia was booked with Japan Airlines. Why did it take so long for Japan Airlines personnel to provide us with the service we had paid for and expected to receive as Premuim Economy passengers? 
These flights with Japan Airlines that we had anticipated being a most enjoyable start to our four weeks holiday became a  horrendous and dissapointing experience. The food provided by JAL was absolutely disgraceful for the price we paid. It most certainly did not cater to the European palate. The only positive aspect regarding this flight was that the JAL Premium Economy seating was wide, comfortable and most satisfactory as the seats were able to recline without encroaching into the space behind. 
Our official conplaint to Japan Airlines with a request to upgrade us for our entire return trip was rejected. All we received were apologies and assurances that JAL staff were expected to know that JAL did infact pay for and provide overnight accommodation when there are delays between connecting flights.
Two very dissapointed customers,

title: For me the best so far
review_text: I fkew with southwest, AA, delta, Aeroméxico, avíanca, star Perú, and that far Aeroméxico Was ok, But Japan, great food, excellent service crew, good tv  do far great at all

title: There are options with less hassle
review_text: This is actually update from my previous review on JAL and Im downgrading it as it did not get any better as I hoped. In my view the in-cabin service is only part of the whole experience and I dont think its too much to ask that if you decide to buy air ticket and fly from 'A' to 'B' it should not be too much hassle. Well, it was a tremendous hassle with JAL. And Im sure will be with anybody if you need anything but just 'vanilla' flight LAX-Tokyo or NY-Osaka. Im flying to Okinawa, hopping there to Kume and Ishigaki islands, as well. I have spent many hours for several days trying to book these flights. The web site would not allow that - multi-destination reservation would not work, giving some cryptic errors, the Japan Explorer ('discount program') reservation would not work, either, and when finally I was able to at least reserve trip between Tokyo and Naha it was more expensive than just regular flight. I finally was able to get it done through Japanese site guessing on what kanji characters might mean there. Finally I bought round trip ticket and discovered later on that my return flight is not the same as direct flight-it actually goes through the wrong airport and I have to transfer within very limited time frame from Haneda to Narita. And no assistance with transfer is provided, nor can I rebook the flight from Naha without paying exorbitant fee, though multiple flights directly to Narita are available on the same date. So now I will have a very stressful time and a chance to miss my flight from Narita to LAX unless paying another >$600 for rebooking. At the very least the web site could warn customers that particular flight requires transfer. Waiting on phone whopping >1hr for customer service does nothing to make the whole experience less unpleasant. And to top it off, when I filled the contact form on their we site, describing my poor experience, hitting 'submit' button brought beautiful 'Access denied, you are not allowed to email from this server' message. At this point I could only laugh. First time Im flying JAL and sure the last one. All I need is to buy ticket and get where I need to go. Making it a battle and adventure is not it. Why did not I choose Cathay Pacific or Singapore Airlines ? A little longer stay in Hong Kong on the way but judging from my experience no hassle. Seems I need to learn things hard way. If you are like me, sure try JAL. The only reason I rate it 2 stars, not one, is that in-flight service and accomodation is fine, though not exceptional.

title: Long haul travel
review_text:
This was the second time I took JAL.  The reason it was the second, is because the first time was so pleasurable and I could take a JAL coded flights all the way through from Buffalo to HCMC.  
Last year I took JAL from Kennedy and appreciated the friendliness of the personnel and the efficiency of their boarding.  Once on board, the entertainment was sufficient for a halfway around the world flight, and the meals on board were surprisingly good.  Who ever thought that Tex-Mex beef served aboard a Japanese airline would be better that the Asian selection, consumed by an Asian?  Plus, Narita Airport is quickly becoming my favorite place to refresh during a layover after a long flight.
From now on, I 'm going to try an book on JAL whenever I have the opportunity.

title: From Sydney to Tokyo
review_text: The seats were tiny. The air hostesses were like tiny pinyatas....but adorable. The Geisha girl costume costume worked for me....

title: Wonderful service, lousy seat JAL.
review_text: The staff on board the 787 from LAX to KIX were fabulous. One out of four ordered the Japanese menu but the western menu of beef was far better. The seats on this plane are so hard and so short (don’t lay flat) that the ride was not a comfortable one. Immigration at KIX was not as bad as we had read. Line moved quickly. Currently, you can only go out of the airport via a train. That was a fairly miserable train ride after a 12 hour flight. We got off at the first exit to meet our driver but it is very confusing which exit to take, therefore taking more time when we were tired. If you have a driver meeting you, get very explicit directions as how to which exit at the train station. Drive to Kyoto was another hour and a half. In hindsight, maybe a night or two before Osaka before we headed to Kyoto would have been better.

title: Warm hospitality
review_text:
Took the flight from Singapore-Narita-Singapore on the 777-222ER JAL Skysuite. Seat is surprisingly wide with good leg-room for economy class and even better for premier economy.  I find it so much comfortable than Qatar 787 and SQ 777-300ER which I traveled last year. Not much comparable on the food, though i like the variety of Jap beers they offered. 
The services and attitude of the crews make this airline great to travel. Prompted to requests and always served with great smile. Show us an excellent customer service, We felt your warm hospitality and definitely our first choice for our next travel plan.

title: Great LegRoom
review_text: Good timing and great legroom. Great service. Good timing and great legroom. Great service. Good timing and great legroom. Great service.

title: Perfect 😍
review_text: Cabin crue very kind, comfortable flight, good facilities altough in economic class, can bring 2 bagage, good n nice servis, all is good ... perfect !

title: Getting better
review_text: Japan Airlines has problems but is once again becoming better and better with their customer service - food and onboard service  is excellent

title: The best airline in the Industry
review_text:
Irrespective of which airline wins skytrax or any award Japan Airlines wins the respect in all categories. 

The crew is awesome, helpful, curtious, and will help you in case of any issues especially food or any other kind. 

I would like to travel with them wherever possible without any other option.

title: Gone down hill
review_text: I travel a lot.  This was my 3rd trip to Asia so far this year.  I have taken Emirates, Singapore Airlines and American.  This $7,000 trip was the worst ever. Flight #4 on September 29th.   Food was alfull, comfort of the seats was less than average, size of seat is fine for a small person but not a 6 foot American.  Most flight attendants did speak English, they listed 5 wins on the menu but had 2 of them on board, then the white wine was not cold. I could go on, just flight another airline!

title: Family vacation
review_text: Highly recommended! Our flight from YVR to narita then narita to Manila was such a great experience. More leg room and a window seat gave us the comfort and easy flight. Very friendly and helpful and happy staff

title: Highly Recommended
review_text: Very comfortable, great service, will happily fly this JAL again. Multi-lingual staff were greatly helpful when selecting food

title: Superior service from Japan's flag carrier
review_text: Due to some inexplicable snafu, we weren't able to  have our baggage transferred directly to Sapporo from Tokyo, so we had to collect our baggage from London then have it reloaded. We had priority collection and  then the JAL staff processed our ticketing very quickly. We made the Sapporo flight in adequate time, and then had a very enjoyable flight to Sapporo. We were most grateful that BA and JAL recognized our predicament and that they acted promptly to sort it out.

title: NO ROOM!!!!!!!  Squished!!!!!!!!  Nice Service but NO room in seat
review_text: My flight from Narita to Bangkok is JAL number 707 or American flight 8411.  I have an aisle seat in coach.  Hopefully it won’t be super tight!!!!  It’s the next day now!!  It was SUPER tight and hard to even semi-stretch out!!!  I could NOT even get my computer bag in my seat when sitting there.  The person in front of me put the seat back and I literally had NO room!!!  It might have been the most cramped I have ever been on a flight!!!  Attendants were nice but being cramped so badly didn’t help.  Also, I am a “Sapphire” with American Airlines (Platinum Pro) and JAL did NOT even let me pick my seats out.  I was assigned these seats the day of the flight with NO input?????  I don’t get this at all?????????  I usually fly business or first class and I would have upgraded to Business on this flight but was given NO opportunity to do this?????????........so on this flight from Narita to Bangkok there were EMPTY seats in Business…… I would have upgraded for sure if I was given any chance to do…but again, I was NOT!!!!  From now on I think I’ll just fly Cathay Pacific from the USA to Asia.  I am flying back with them when my business is done in Thailand and they worked with me several months before my flight to give me the best seats available due to my Sapphire status with “One World Alliance”….. I just DON’T understand JAL and why they refused to work with me???????????  They might have just LOST me forever………

title: Would NOT give me a seat prior to day of flight!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  booked weeks in advance!!!!
review_text: My flight from O’Hare to Narita was flight number 9 on Japan Airline and flight number 8404 on American Airlines!!  I came very prejudiced to this flight due to the fact that JAL would NOT let me procure a seat prior to the day of the flight!!!  I called American and JAL the day before I flew and JAL said I had not paid enough money for my flight to be able to pick a seat.  I paid about $1600 for the flight and I am a Platinum Pro (Sapphire) with American and One World Partners (Alliance??).  I was not very happy and on top of that I flew with JAL in March on the same flights to Bangkok and I DID pick my seat out early.  JAL said if I was an Executive Platinum that I could pick my seat out…….it worked out OK for me as they assigned me a seat the morning of my travel and gave me an aisle seat in the middle bulkhead.  The lady in the bulkhead on the right side of the plane wanted to stow her baggage under her seat so another guy with the seat behind the bulkhead, myself, and this nice lady from the Philippines changed seats and I was given the seat I desired a long time ago.  No one is in front of me and I can stretch out easily!!!!  Now, the attendants on this flight are SUPER!!!   They are a great reason to fly JAL!!!!!!  They are super helpful and always have a smile and go out of their way to make you feel like you are the only person on the flight!!!  Also, the meal we were just given blows other airlines food out of the proverbial water!!!!!!!  I received a 6-course meal and every course was great!!!!!!!  My initial headlines were going to be NEVER fly JAL, but I am changing the crux of my article, thanks to the great people I have mentioned above!!!!!!!  I will write later about this on-going flight!!  We are just leaving North America and still have quite a ways to go!!!!!!  I’m back!!!  Just had a snack.
