These flight attendants are busy as bees in a hive and as nice as you could be!!!!!  I’m laughing now as I’m typing as I have done a 180 on my original intent for this story!!!!!!  These are the nicest and best flight attendants I have ever had the privilege of working with and I have flown an awful lot!!!  They also put out a piece of bamboo with a towel over it for people to stand on and relieve different stresses in their body.  They also posted a graphic on what part of the feet corresponds to different parts of your body!!!!!  This has been a great flight and I’m actually going to post some pictures of this flight and that is highly unusual for me!!  They also have a cool wine label for their white and reds.  It’s using different vinifera from France!!!!!  It’s called Double Zero.  I also took a picture of a snack box they put out for all of us with the sign “please help yourself”.  We have been flying now about 9.5 hours and it’s gone pretty quick!!!!!  Great, great flight!!!!!!

title: They were puncture, kind, and friendly.
review_text: The crew were kind and friendly. They provided good food and drinks. The only disadvantage was it was too cold inside the plane. I was glad to fly directly from Narita to San Diego.

title: Disappointing Booking Process
review_text:
This review is for booking and pre-flight customer service with JAL.
I regret not reading through more complaints about JAL before booking on their website.  My issue has happened to others with shared code flights. My husband and I booked our first leg with JAL for our honeymoon.  We went onto their website for the booking.  At no point during the booking process are we informed about not being able select seats on the flight until check-in.  But that ended up being the case.  We called up JAL and their response was that we probably missed the bit where we are informed about no seat selection possible.  We went back and went through the online booking process again and cannot find a statement that informs us about no seat selection until check-in for that flight.  We called back again, the agent on the phone this time said that is the type of flight we booked and they cannot do anything except to add a note about that we wish to be seated together and informed us we can pick seats upon check-in time.  (On the side, all the calls have 30 min+ wait time so far)
When it comes to harsh seat selection policy, we feel that if this is a short flight, fine.  If JAL is a bare bones budget airline, then fine.  If this is not our honeymoon, then fine.  Except this will be a long haul, international flight with a supposed 5-star service airline for our honeymoon.  JAL is beyond disappointing for us in the booking process, not only are we not informed about critical information that could help us decide, we cannot seem to get any help in correcting a situation that we did not create.

So to sum up, only fly JAL if you are aware their online booking can miss critical pieces of information (such as no seat selection available until flight check-in time).  When something goes wrong pre-flight, you may likely be dealing with rigid, non helpful customer service.

title: James Tan
review_text: We took the flight from Sin to Boston via Narita. Both sector,crew were very good and efficient. They were attentive and also friendly. Aircraft were well cleaned and thru out the flight, the flight stewardesses were coming out with drinks. Very pleasant flight even though the cabin were a bit warmth. I do understand that the Japanese like the cabin warmth but do spare a thought for the other passengers that are not Japanese. After all this is an international airlines.

title: Average at Best
review_text: To start off, JAL’s business lounge at Singapore’s Changi Airport is no better than the breakfast you get at a budget roadside motel in the United States. Very disappointing compared to the lounges we experienced on a four week Asian trip. The business class seat (there was no first class on this flight) was pretty tight. Service was efficient and impersonal. Not once did the flight attendant ask if we needed anything. I was in the restroom when dessert was served, and was never asked if I cared to have some when I returned to my seat. This is not what I would expect from JAL, but maybe my expectations were too high.

title: round trip to Japan
review_text: Premium Economy on JAL was terrific.  The service is impeccable!  the extra leg room and seat size helped stay comfortable on the 11+ hour flight.  I wish the lower leg foot rest raised a bit higher but that would require a whole design change.  The food was quite tasty and the overall experience was amazing.

title: Good airlines for long travel
review_text:
The flight is good. Service is also good. Being a vegetarian ,the flight serves tasty Hindu veg meal.
Overall good experience .

title: Perfect customer experience yet !!
review_text:
Flying on a leisure trip from Delhi to Tokyo, we were glad to choose JAL as the in flight service experience was simply amazing, best so far.
First of all, Economy seat comfort and leg room is way better than its any other competitor International airlines. 
Cleanliness on point, as expected. But what impressed us the most was the awesome customer experience by the cabin crew. Being a vegetarian and forgetting to pre-book the meal, had little issue with the available non-veg choices but the crew was so courteous that they went over the top and made us quick vegetarian snack with the things available with them (sandwich sort of thing) and feeling so sorry about us not able to have proper meal. Had it been some other airlines, they would have hardly cared for that. Also, dazed off during breakfast meal, they put a hand written note to inform them once we awake to have meal as per need, instead of just passing by or putting the food in the seat pocket.
Simply amazing experience.

title: bLISS.
review_text: Due to the distance we decided to try Premium Econ. I would never fly economy again. The seats were roomy and very comfortable and as well as having headrests, there was a personal led light for reading. The windows had a colour change to block the sun if necessary. The food was quite enjoyable (for airlines) and the wine list had very good wines and a champagne !! The staff were very polite and helpful,  as well, we had access to the flight lounges. I recommend J.A.L. Premium to travellers, if you want a comfortable tripand 1st Class/ Business are out of your price range.

title: Biz redone
review_text: Customer service to the core, from supporting the customer right from check in counter till making feel like home till landing is the experience you will feel while you fly JAL

title: Truly Biz Class
review_text: Right from check in counter to welcome @ aircraft, seating comfort, hospitality with overall options like entertainment, dining makes a worth to travel

title: Leisure trip
review_text: Meals were average.  Not much legroom.  The seat was uncomfortable.  The flight was on time.  Flight attendants were very friendly.

title: Luxury in the Skies
review_text: Have travelled with JAL many times and just love their Sky-Suite in Business Class.  One feels cocooned from the rest of the passengers!  The service is excellent and the food is good.  Can thoroughly recommend this airline.

title: beyond awesome flights
review_text: flown on JAL from Sydney to Tokyo and return over 10 times, each experience has been faultless... I've only realised how good they are until I flew on an airline inferior to Japan Airlines...JALs service and comfort is always exceptional. arigatogozaimasu

title: Comfortable Ride
review_text:
Took Japan Airlines for our first ever trip to Asia.  Great service by grounds crew.  The flight crew were in a totally different league though! Excellent service! They answered every customer call promptly and provided everybody whatever they asked for.  It was amazing to see these petite ladies put all size of luggage on the overhear bin!  

The seats were a little cramp, no legroom for the tall foreigners and not comfortable for the 14hour flight.  My butt hurt for a week after we landed.  

The food was not very palatable though, especially to an American palate. cuisine is mostly geared towards Asian travelers, and no alternatives were provided.  Even the chips were seafood flavored.

I used the bathrooms after we took off and i was surprised that it smelled like urine!  That was a turn off.  Otherwise, it looked clean and had enough supplies - sanitary napkin, toothbrush, etc.

Overall, it was a pleasant ride!

title: Shortest flight Australia to Japan
review_text: Enjoyed an overnight direct flight from Melbourne to Japan. Not having a stopover and thus shorter travel time was great. The airline serves alcohol free of charge and for airline food is better than the usual. Staff were welcoming and service was good.

title: Adequate flight from Adelaide to Tokyo
review_text: This was my first trip to Japan and I chose JAL as they are supposed to have a bit more leg room in economy. The flight times also suited me as it is an overnight flight and as there is next to no time difference you do not lose a day traveling. The first leg from Adelaide is a Qantas flight to Melbourne then a bit of a wait until you board the JAL flight around midnight. It was quite comfortable in economy but I would probably opt for a cheaper flight as it was not that much better in leg room. The overnight flight was great for me.

title: International Flight with Lovely Service
review_text: The staff could not have done more to help out and make sure we were comfortable.  They even had cardigans for us (they are to borrow, not keep) which helped when the temp fluctuates in the airplane.  Nice and dark, all passengers were considerate to keep shades down as long as possible.  Food was fair but the service shined!

title: allaways fly  JAL
review_text:
I just return from Sapporo Japan flying with JAL Airlines this was my sixth trip to Japan being twelve international flights plus twelve domistic flights to Sapporo I all ways Fly with JAL, my first flight to Japan was with Qantas six years ago which is a good airline, but as I have a cultural interest in Japan now I find JAL provide the experience I like, flying economy is not so bad, price is right for a direct flight to Tokyo only 9hrs, i am not interested in cheap flights that take you about 24 or more hrs with stop over in other counties eg Hong Kong, JAL provide a good service with good in flight service, I all ways request an aisle seat,  leg room is ok better than being cramped in a middle seat, food is mostly Japanese style, Airline staff always friendly and help full, all normal airline facilities, jAL also have a frequent Flyer program to earn points for future flights.
I will continue to fly JAL,

title: JAL FLIGHT
review_text: Excellent service and on time departure and arrival. Very scenic flight down to Osaka. Staff are very friendly and courteous. Can thoroughly recommend flwith JAL.

title: Free Wifi on domestic flight!
review_text: All i could say is this is the most comfortable economy seat i have ever flown on a domestic flight. Despite there is no individual TV but they offer unlimited free wifi inflight. I would love to take JAL again.

title: Excellent
review_text: The plane is very comfortable, smooth and feel safety while on board. I was request for Muslim Meal and the crew very concerned about that. They explained why I didn't get the ice cream or the same sandwiches, which is for me that is sweet. The same experienced when I flow back to the country. Thank you JAL

title: Comfortable and relaxed.
review_text: This flight left Tokyo Haneda at 0155 in the morning for an eleven hour journey. Cabin crew helpful and polite. Plenty of leg  room. Lights dimmed in cabin on completion of drinks/snacks. Easy for sleeping. Only one meal served which was prior to landing at Heathrow. Once again I commend cabin crew for service. Thankyou.

title: Not up to Japanese standards
review_text: We flew home from Japan on the Japan Airlines 777-300ER business from Tokyo to NYC. the plane got  great reviews online....but not from me. There are 49 business class seats and they are 7 across...who would want to pay for business and sit in the middle? Unless you're a party of 3.  The window seat gives the most privacy but you (and the flight attendant) have to squeeze between the the seat next to you for access. It's a bit claustrophobic in there and the width of the seat is narrower than most. It does provide a flat bed seat and the flight attendants are great. But the plane seems old and worn out. Some of the compartments were kept closed with duct tape...no kidding. Probably the  worst plane I've been on in business class.

title: Great service
review_text: Staff were very helpful and went out of their way, even to the point of running after us after check-in and asking whether we would like to a free upgrade to premium economy. My first international flight with JAL but will definitely be back!

title: Great airline with leg room
review_text:
They clearly put a lot of effort into service and I have to give it to their flight attendants. They did a great job and we're courteous and professional throughout our flights. The plane going to Tokyo had plenty of legroom for my 6'3" husband who usually complains of cramped legs. The food options can be found ahead of time on their website so you know what you're looking forward to. 

Overall, would recommend.

title: Great flight to start our holiday
review_text:
Premium Economy on JAL is probably the same as Business on BA.  The seats were very comfortable, there was a lot of leg room, the entertainment was great (with touch screens that actually worked).  We got given noise cancelling headphones, slippers, eye mask, ear plugs and toothbrush/toothpaste.  The service was very attentive and friendly as expected.  We also noticed that the air quality was much better in our area and much less noisy as compared with Economy (we had a stroll through to stretch our legs).  The windows had a special filter so you could still see the outside but were darkened so that we could sleep if we wanted to.  
We flew with our 1.5 year old son, and though it was much easier in this area with lots of room, the seat partitions and arm rests weren't movable so we couldn't lie him flat across two seats for his nap.  This would have helped him sleep a bit more comfortably.  This problem will resolve itself though once he's grown up a bit.  It is definitely worth flying this class if you want a good journey and not to become too tired on reaching your destination.  Everything was so efficient and neat, even our buggy was put in a plastic carrier bag to protect it when loading on to the plane.  The seat arrangement was 2-4-2.  It wasn't busy at all and it was nice that they didn't fill the seats by giving upgrades to Economy class (selfish, I know...) because you do have to pay quite a lot more for these seats.  We got given some nappies and snacks for our son, and his first hot meal was great.  Chicken and mash with broccoli, very good for young child.  For some reason he didn't get a second hot meal when the adults got one, which was a bit of a shame but we just shared ours with him.  It would have been great for him to have a meal with us as we used up all our spare snacks for this as well.  
I would have given it an 'excellent' rating if we were able to use 2 seats to lie him down and for him to have had a meal with us.  If you're travelling as adults with older children then this would have definitely been excellent!

title: Very good cabin crew and all airport staff as well
review_text: This is very good airline great modern planes and great inflight entertainment and on board meals and beverages as well will be flying with JAL Airline again

title: Smooth travelling
review_text: Experienced a lovely trip, very courteous service nothing was too much trouble.  Only negative is they need to update inflight entertainment to more contemporary and current.

title: Kyushu
review_text: Great flight! Service was excellent. Very attentive attendants. Food was good. Seat space was better than many other airlines.

title: Great flight
review_text: Great Airline. The food was fantastic, the service was really good. I would certainly travel Japan Airlines again.

title: JAL Domestic
review_text: Cleared Customs at Narita then caught a bus across town to Haneda. Seamless transition from International to Domestic notwithstanding the requirement to change airports.  Smooth flight to Osaka picked up luggage and walked on to train.

title: New and clean cabin with decent plane food
review_text: This was my first time on a JAL flight and the experience was quite positive! Flight attendants were all smiles and friendly. And not to mention - finally some decent plane food!! And most importantly, my flight was on time too!!

title: Flying to Fencing Competition
review_text: Helpful check-in staff and very friendly cabin crew. First time flying with this airline and if the opportunity arises will fly with them again.

title: Very Impressed
review_text:
Was able to choose seats at no extra cost. Nice clean modern cabin. Staff very professional and welcoming. Loads of films to watch onboard. Was easily able to book vegetarian meal in advance and noted different options for other dietary requirements (vegan/gluten-free). 
The food was the largest airplane meal I’ve ever had and tasted very acceptable, also served with proper silver cutlery. Very comfortable for long haul flight. Would use again.

title: Amazing Service
review_text: NIce food and amazing customer service. legroom is better than other airlines. they offer a variety of drinks including alcohol and food. only bad thing about it their entertainment is not so up to date. worth the money you pay.

title: Excellent
review_text:
JAL made my trip perfect. 
The service is great, the hostesses are so kind, and the meal and wine menu are just amazing. I couldn’t have hoped for a better flight. 
Thank you so much to the company and the team this day (08.09.18).

title: Pleasant service and lots of leg room in economy.
review_text:
Overall a good flight experience. The service was very good, the flight was on time and for a tall person (183cm) I appreciated the adequate leg room in economy.

The only disappointment was that I checked in at Osaka (Itamy) on a domestic flight which was excellent but late and had a very tight connection in Tokyo.

I arrived in Melbourne on Friday night but my luggage did not come until Monday. No one had contacted me and I tracked it down after making several phone calls. As they could not guarantee delivery by Monday evening I went to the airport to actually collect it myself. It had been sitting in the luggage agents office for two days. It was fully labbelled with name and phone number etc.

title: 매우 친절한 승무원들.
review_text:
Very Attentive Crews but not enough English skills.
The dish and tea was amazingly good.

영어 실력이 부족한 것만 빼면 굉장히 친절하고 부가적인 서비스도 휼륭했던 승무원들 덕분에 좋은 비행 경험이었습니다.
기내식도 여타 다른 항공사들 보다 압도적으로 맛있어서 더 먹고 싶을 정도 였어요.

title: Comfortable
review_text: This was the first time I’ve flown Premium Economy with any airline so I was interested to see what it was like. Departure was delayed as a result of electrical storms in the area - unavoidable, of course. But the flight was about 1.5 hours late in departing and for well over an hour we sat there without the offer of even a glass of water. Not impressed. The range of movies on offer as ok if you don’t normally see many. Food was patchy. Dinner was quite good; breakfast was pretty ordinary. The seat itself was quite comfortable and there was plenty of room - more so because the seat next to me was empty. The crew were friendly and efficient. I’d like to travel Premium Economy with another airline in order to make a more valid comparison.

title: Best of the Best
review_text: I have flown several airlines in Business Class and JAL rates at the top 1% as far as I'm concerned.  Most comfortable seats.  Variety of food and drinks.  Outstanding service.

title: 絕佳體驗，商務艙與經濟艙 Best experience both Coach and Business Class
review_text:
已經搭過十次以上日本航空，每次都讚不絕口！無論商務艙或經濟艙，都一樣讓人驚艷。在經濟艙上可以吃到牛肉丼飯，商務艙就更不用說了，清酒隨你喝！
Taking JAL for over 10 times, every time is extraordinary!!

title: Amazing experience
review_text: I took my granddaughter, who dislikes flying, to Japan for graduation in June.  I splurged and got the Premium Economy seats.  We also took the non-stop flight.  It was an amazing experience!!!!  The service was spectacular, the entertainment system was supurb, the food was excellent, the long flight mostly comfortable, and my granddaughter didn't have to use any of her motion sickness antidotes!!!  Our tickets allowed us access to the first class lounge in Boston and it was a superior place to wait for the flight.  Unfortunately, in Japan, there were no premium lounges, but that was okay.  I will definitely make this trip again!!!

title: Very good flight
review_text: Our return flight to Melbourne with JAL was as good as expected from our previous outward leg flight with them. Quite, efficient courteous staff make the journey effortless. Would fly with them again. The only 'grumble' is the fiddly in flight entertainment system control. Additionally more information on the available movies & music would be good (both minor issues really). A more substantial pillow would also be good.

title: Holidays
review_text: I will highly recommend to fly JAL to Tokyo. We flew fro Sydney to Tokyo in March and the flight was terrific. The Hostess were very polite, helpful and well mannered. The service and the food was very good, in flight entertainment was of great quality and the seats were very comfortable with plenty of leg room. I will fly again with them👍Well done

title: Japan Airlines impeccable service!
review_text:
Loved my flight on JAL - esp the layflat seats from Tokyo to Hanoi- I wish they had those on the run from YVR.
The service was impeccable and a nice touch was when the cabin crew came around Near the end of the flight and  said something personal about each passenger.   
The JAL lounges were also comfortable and wellness stocked... I had a whole day in Natita coming back so not only got great info to go into town, but was refreshed before getting on my next leg of my trip.
Thank you Japan Airlines - it was my first time with you but not my last!

title: Comfortable and pleasant economy class
review_text: Modern aircraft, comfortable seats and great leg room for an economy class. Service is excellent. Bathroom kept very clean all though the flight. The food was a bit disappointing but OK. In-flight entertainment not the best I've experienced but again OK. Overall, a very pleasant experience - and a big step-up from Qantas, at least on this route.

title: great flight
review_text: JL773/774 return from Melbourne with ADL - Mel arranged by JAL with Qantas. Good flight, good service and no problems. Even Qantas were good this time for the first time in ages, we've had problems with them in the past and their so called 'customer care' has been more like 'do not care'.

title: I won't fly CX to Japan again
review_text: Much better value for money when compare to Cathay Pacific and the food and beverage is great. Just a pity that their in flight entertainment was a bit boring and the collection of movie is very limited.

title: The service is excellent but they still have those terrible chairs in business class
review_text: The service is excellent but they still have those terrible chairs in business class. the chairs do not go horizontal completely and there are very uncomfortable. I would understand if it is old equipment but the fly the new 787.

title: Great airline
review_text: This was a great airline to travel on. Premium economy was excellent with very comfy seat plenty of legroom and the food was pretty good. The crew were super polite which you would expect of a Japanese Airline. I discovered at check-in that if you book Economy you can upgrade to PE at checkin for a very reasonable price if there are seats available.

title: Japan-nice!
review_text: Had a very smooth flight from Manila to Narita airport. Food was great presented by 4 acclaimed chefs. Although there was a wait checking in. It was a good flight all in all

title: Professionalism of JAL
review_text: JAL is prompt, efficient, very neat and clean, helpful, and respectful. This is total professionalism at its best as exhibited by the pilots, flight attendants, and ground staff. They may not know English very well, but will try their best to help you. They will bring you to someone who speaks English and will also show you the way. In contrast to some Chinese airlines I have tried - like China Southern airlines or China Eastern airlines - you will get a feeling that they don't care about you at all. I tried to ask help from some ground staff in Shanghai but the lady seemed annoyed at me that I couldn't speak Chinese. I look very Asian, by the way. Not only that they do not speak English well, but possibly due to a lack of training in people skills, their attitude could get very rude. So kudos to Japan Airlines! Keep doing what you do best - being respectful to everyone! I highly recommend JAL.

title: Great flight experience
review_text: Food collection is great, service staff very friendly.  Though compare to same route air ananda, this plane model isnt as modern, and seat isn’t as comfortable, I’d still choose JAL for their staff friendliness and good quality food.

title: Very Good flight
review_text: Very good flight experience.  I especially liked having 2 seats only on the side for window and aisle - no middle seat.  The flight departure and arrival times were good for each end of the trip, the service very good too. Entertainment was varied and very good too.  Overall it was a very good flight experience in economy class.  Please note that I am short so the leg room was not a concern for me, but tall people might be concerned.  The cabin ceiling height makes the plane feel spacious.

title: Flight attendants very attentive and kind
review_text: Had round trip flights on JAL with three (3) legs serviced by America Airlines.  Bought JAL as it was the cheapest option offered via AirTkt.  And the difference in service was could readily be seen between the American Airlines legs and the JAL legs. The JAL flight attendants were more attentive and kind.  JAL also had a memory foam pad to use on one of the overnight legs, and they made all the difference on ability to sleep comfortably.  When next head into Asia, will look to fly JAL again.

title: Enjoyable flight in Business and Coach
review_text: We actually flew with an award ticket Business Class to Narita, Japan and Coach back to Dallas, TX.  Business class was wonderful. The seats reclined completely and amenities/ service were a treat. We weren't lucky enough to snag Business on the return, but we had a two seat arrangement for our Coach seats.  JAL Economy seats are wider and less pitched than many airlines - notably One World partner, AA. It made the long flight home significantly more tolerable in Economy.  Food was interesting - noodles for breakfast on the return - but hey - going all out for an authentic experience. I definitely would fly JAL again.

title: Fabulous flight... awesome airline!
review_text: I was terrified of flying for 14 hours from Boston to Tokyo! However, after my flight with JAL, I am totally comfortable... and doing it again in 2 years! They were on time; the seats were comfortable; they gave me a blanket, pillow, and headset; the staff could not have been nicer; and the food was delicious! My favorite part was the entertainment. They had so many movies, shows, and games - I stayed entertained through the entire flight. Then I did it again to get home. Now I can't wait to go back!!

title: Best economy seat ever!
review_text: Read that JAL economy seat is the most spacious and won World No.1 Economy seat and since my favorite Singapore Air does not fly direct to Hokkaido (prefer direct flight for my trip), thought I might as well take the chance to try out JAL. It was indeed spacious. It was the most spacious economy I had ever tried, but then again, the comparison could be limited as I had flown on just SQ, Thai, Cathay, Lufthansa, ANA, Eva, China Airline, Air NZ, SilkAir and the budget air Scoot/Jet Star/Air Asia/Ex-Scoot Tiger. It felt as spacious as Scoot’s business class that I taken before perhaps is due to the very slim seat design which has well thought-out features, in line with what the Japanese are famous for, their thoughtfulness and consideration for others. The meals served are on par with SQ and the air-hostess sevice are ever gracious and attentive. I would definitely start flying to Japan on JAL. Please note when booking, choose the flight that offers these JAL Sky Wider economy seat. Not all flight will have these seat and I think most of the JAL domestic flight in Japan will not have these seats.

title: Service with a smile.
review_text:
Exceeded our expectation in the quality of service provided.
Staff were very helpful and obliging on the ground and in the air.
I would travel with this airline whenever it services the destination we are traveling too.

title: Premium Economy with Japan Airlines
review_text:
Attentive crew, much more space & could stretch out your legs. 
Didn’t feel like the usual can of sardines.

title: Great service
review_text: I would definitely recommend JAL.   The flight crew members were amazing.   The bathrooms were kept very clean.  Roomier leg space than some of the American airline.  I would choose this airline anytime without hesitation.

title: Great flight again
review_text: Having flown with JAL before (I rated this my best flight) I didn’t hesitate to fly with them again to Japan. I like the 787-9. More legroom than an A380 (Qantas). Great service and food although the bread roll should be fresh. Looking forward to my return flight.

title: Pleasant and Curtious Staff,  basic seats
review_text:
The flight over was during the day which was great, staff pleasant and seats we ok. The TV has plenty of entertainment to keep you occupied.
The flight home was during the night for 10 hours. It would certainly be better if the foot rest on the premium economy seats would go level, as trying to sleep you would slide down so made it very uncomfortable. The seats reclined more than economy but still I feel they could improve. When the seats go back they slide into themselves so don't encroach on the person behind.The food was quite ok and the toilets always clean. Would definitely fly again with them but pick a day time flight.
We were lucky enough to get into the business class lounges before boarding which was an added bonus.
We had two different planes.

title: Good service, nice people, good/tasty food
review_text: JAL had a wonderfully caring crew on this flight----they really made my daughter feel welcome.  American Airlines made ZERO effort.  Our 787 had good seats unlike the American Airlines flight with horribly immobile seats. Good flight, good service, I would fly them again.

title: Staff could not have been more friendly and helpful
review_text: The only downside of this trip was having to change airports in Tokyo, and collect luggage, get a bus and then check in again- I would have thought that premium economy passengers might have had their luggage taken for them. However the lounges at Haneda and Narita were exceptionally clean and well stocked with food and drink. The PE seats all the way to Europe and back were very comfortable, and in the Dreamliner PE passengers had their own tollets.

title: My choice to fly to Japan
review_text: Always a pleasure flying JAL.  Excellent service, friendly crew.  Food was okay, but better than other airlines. Free alcohol always a plus.  Love the small touches like disposable slippers and toothbrushes they include.

title: Surely a Top 3 global airline
review_text: The cabin service and food offerings are absolutely top notch. The cabin staff really go out of their way to make the trip as comfortable as possible. While the entertainment options maybe fall a little short of some rival airlines, and are more geared towards the Japanese-language market (their core customer), there is still plenty of choice. The JAL Sky Suite is an excellent business-class product, but try to avoid the middle seat in center of the aircraft, because it loses out on storage cubbies compared to the other seats. It's a little annoying they turn all the cabin lights on again two hours before landing, in order to offer passengers a last meal before arrival. It means the sleep time on a flight of this duration (9 hours) isn't great.

title: Comfortable with great service
review_text: We were on our way from Rochester, NY to Beijing, China.  The longest part of the trip was Chicago to Tokyo.  I was told by an Asian friend that Asian airlines had bigger seats, that is true.  We were in premium economy, even though on the trip to Tokyo we wwere in the middle 4 seats, there was ample room. I am 5'10 and I would stretch my legs to my hearts content.  The amenities were great.  There was plenty of food and drink.  The food was very good quality.  The choices for movies and TV was impressive.  I will fly them again and have recommended to friends.

title: Good company
review_text: This was my first time flying JAL. I will use them again. Friendly service crew, acceptable food (compared to the quality of the other carriers), take off and landing on time.

title: Wonderful when I had to rebook
review_text: I was on vacation in the US when I was diagnosed with the flu - 2 days prior to my return trip to Bangkok.  My doctor told me to delay my flight, for my own health and that of the other passengers.  But I had booked a non-refundable ticket with no travel insurance and had to just throw myself on the airline's mercy.  Thankfully, they were very gracious to me and rebooked me on the same flight a week later without even charging me the normal change fee!  Thank you, JAL!  I highly recommend this airline for their excellent customer service!

title: Nice plane, friendly crew
review_text: The flight was perfect on time. The food was good. The crew was very friendly. For a five star rating the landing should have been better.

title: Good airline to fly domestically
review_text: I have flown JAL many times and its always a good service domestically.  Seats are comfortable, staff are courteous. and everything is always clean.

title: Recent flight to Tokyo
review_text: Was my 1st time fly with JAL to Haneda Airport. The flight lavatory was super stinky once onboard. Ride was bumpy and the worst was landing. The pilot shocked me twice during landing..flight to Tokyo and back to Singapore. I can only say no no to JAL if I need to fly to Japan the next time.

title: Serenity in the Sky
review_text: Beautifully maintained 787 Dreamliner with spotless cleanliness in the cabin. The crew were extremely efficient as well as attentive. Comfortable  seats and reasonable choice of meals.

title: Excellent service
review_text:
Our first time flying on Japan Airlines and my wife and I were impressed by their service.

Boston to Narita route is served by their Dreamliner, which offers confortable lay flat seats on business class.

Entertainment onboard was not as good as Emirates but service was excellent making this a very enjoyable flight.

title: Osaka
review_text: Boeing 772. Premium economy is excellent with seat pitch of 42"! Excellent seat comfort and legroom with good food and decent service from crew. Excellent inflight entertainment.  Lounge access was also a plus.

title: First time travel and would highly recommend
review_text:
Such a friendly and comfortable experience 
Would definitely travel with this airline again.
Great aircraft,
Service 
Meals

title: Exceptional service and oh so clean
review_text: Only took this flight because BA cancelled a direct UK flight. With hindsight we got the better deal. The cabin crew were the most polite I’ve ever seen and the standard of the cabin was superb. Food definitely to my liking and the cleanest toilets in the air.

title: Exceptional service, how business class should be.
review_text:
Whilst it was mine and my wife's first time in business class, it was a bit of a let down with Q***** (to say the least), the JAL business class was simply amazing. 

- The crew were super attentive and made us feel at home.

- The food was restaurant quality

- The IFE system monitor was HUGE

If I had to pick a downside, the seats might feel a little narrow for some, but in no way uncomfortable.

Simply put, if flying from AUS to JAP, there is no question who I'd choose.

title: JAL flight Sydney to Tokyo return
review_text: We travelled  to Tokyo (Narita) from Sydney this year  in April flying JAL Premium Economy class. Service and staff were helpful, friendly and prompt. The space in the seat area was fine however the footrest which extends at the front of the seat to allow you to stretch out in comfort was of poor design. The footrest would not hold position when the height was adjusted and once the weight of feet were added it caused the footrest to sag, resulting in sliding down from your sitting position and this impacted on my bad back. Initially we thought it may just be an issue with the seats on that plane, however on the return flight to Sydney we had the same experience. As a result it was difficult to get into a fully comfortable position to rest.

title: Good
review_text: I chose to spend more to experience the premium economy.  I don't know that I would spend that money again. The seats and extra leg room were nice but given that the economy seats have decent leg room I am not sure there was enough added value. The food was average, the entertainment selection was probably below average. The staff were all very friendly. I would say the biggest advantage of the premium seat was having no trouble with finding luggage space in the bin above. The benefit of the lounge access was nice. The sfo lounge is very underwhelming though.  I think I would probably just buy the lounge access in the future. I am curious as to the experience on the other airlines. JAL was a fine flight but nothing to brag about.

title: Sometimes flight attendants hold a grudge.
review_text: So my family and I were on a AMA flight LAX to Osaka, which was flown on a JAL plane. About 30 minutes into the flight, when the attendants were passing out beverages I ordered my kid a soda. It was noisy, I was distracted by kid, who as a 4 year old was excited to be on a plane, and I did not realize he had given my kid a soda water until a few minutes later after he passed. I chuckled, thought it was no big deal, and passed it to my wife who asked another stewardess to exchange it for a soda. The flight attendant actually made my wife apologize for the mistake and then ignored us for the rest of the flight. I mean literally the attendant gave the guy next to me a drink and then walked away, from my frantic requests and hand signals.  It was unreal. I am guessing it was racism, as in the initial confrontation the attendant kept on using English with my wife, who is Japanese and of course spoke to her in Japanese. Between the grudge keeping flight attendants and the 787s uncomfortable seats it was a rough 13 hours. After the flight we contacted JAL to complain. They contacted the flight attendants who said they had given us special service because of their mistake. Believe me, you do not want the special service.

title: Stellar Service & Super Hard Economy Seats
review_text:
Check-in staff at JFK could be a bit more consistent, utilise their discretion and be a bit hospitable.

The flight from JFK was uneventful thank God, and the service was generally attentive although some passengers got a little loud at some points during the flight which was "understandable" to a certain extent due to the length of the flight.  The meals were tasty and the bathrooms were always clean.

I am not a tall person and had adequate leg room but the seats were super hard and initially, I found it very difficult to find a spot to fall asleep in but managed to at some point during the flight.

On arrival at Haneda, I noticed that my suitcase handle was broken and went to the relative parties to report it.  The lady spoke English and was very thorough; completed all the paperwork and I was on my way.

The hard seats alone are enough for me to fly business on my next long haul if I fly with JAL again.

title: Flying Auberge
review_text: It was good there was a check-in counters and security check of first class only. But, it was not good there was no emigration of first class only.First class lounge was comfortable. Cabin attendant welcomed with smile. It was the seat surrounded by a pattition, such as modern living room with decoration of wood. The combination of the french courses and extensive wine selection ot top chef supervision were like a flying restaurant. After the turn-down service, I was able to sleep soundly dressed to the prepared pajamas. Cabin attendant gave me service in advance understand my needs. My heart was filled with the flight such as I stayed in Augerge. I was not tired at all in spite of the 12 hours of flight. British immigration was smooth in the use of fast track.I was able to spend without stress from the biginning to the end of the flight. I want to use JAL first class again.

title: JAL Suite. Best First Class service!
review_text:
Best First class experience from start to finish. JAL First class passengers also get access to Sakura lounge at Haneda airport. Shower room is available although a bit on the small side. Staff is very friendly and lounge is really spacious. Made to order food "hamburg steak w/ Madeira & Truffle" was available during 17:30~23:30. Other services such as massage chair and shoe shine service available.
Once on board, the flight attendant introduce themselves. Service is top notch and attendants very genuine unlike the other airline *cough cough* but it could be because this is First class and this was also my flight attendant's first time in this cabin. Needless to say, every is great in terms of food and service. Wagyu beef, caviar, champagne, and bed was made when ready to sleep. IMO JAL provides the best service in the sky and staff seem very genuine in making sure you are taken good care of!

title: Marroad hotel - oh dear JAL
review_text:
On the 30 August my wife and I were travelling business class with  JAL to Prague JL 772 from Sydney with an overnight stay paid by JAL at the Marroad Hotel

I would like to report back on our experiences 

The food in the restaurant was of poor quality and lacked the flair and skill Japanese food is known for.

The room had a dirty towel on the sideboard

I use a CPAP machine, this needs to be plug into next to the bed,   The only way to have the bedside power point work was to have the hallway light on.

I called reception who came to the room who confirmed this was correct. 

The required us to sleep all night with the light on in the room.

The internet was unusable , the router was outside if our room door and we still had virtually no connection .  We had reception come and assist but could not fix the issue 

 Overall in my view the hotel was at best 2 stars.

I am confused and disappointed as to how the sits along side JAl business class airport and inflight product.  

I understand the airline prides itself on the quality of the product , and rightly so.

title: Good experience
review_text: My family took the flight to Narita for 7 hours. Eventhough we were in economy, the leg room was spacious and did not feel cramped. The toilet was very clean and with the electronic buttons for bidet and all other functions. Crew were attentive and very polite. Overall a good experience.

title: Comfortable Flight to KL
review_text: Our flight to Kuala Lumpur from Narita was very comfortable with JAL. Nice and friendly staff.  I had the Japanese lunch which was good. I ordered an earl grey tea but was not available only had English beakfast tea. Inflight movie /entertainment selection was average. Vanity kit was not given therefore cannot comment on that. Overall not a bad flight 😉

title: Wonderful airline.While everything is in the book.
review_text: If you wonder why such a disparity between reviews, between 1 star/'terrible' and 5stars/best! its because of 'cultural insensitivity' :-).  Simply put, to understand it one needs to realize that as a rule Japanese are highly cultivated people who are generally very polite and warmhearted and would like to go out of the way to help you. Thats how Japanese are brought up. But. On the other hand they are also brought up to be ultimately loyal. Like to the company they are working for. And that means the company rules book goes before the bible. Between these two polar opposites they have to live. So here we are. If things are simple, straightforward and along the book all is perfect, you'll get wonderful service and experience. However, if anything, anything at all, is slightly off... all is crashed, nothing is going to work anymore. Don't expect any problem solving. My personal experience started with ordering tickets on line. Sure enough, no problem getting ticket LAX-Tokyo. Nice options, all crystal clear. But, alas, I need to fly to Okinawa with at least one stopover in Naha. Thats not a straight line. And here it just refuses to work properly. TIme I spent trying to make things work any way imaginary would be enough to walk to Okinawa and back. Calling customer service and asking for help to handle their web site predictably ended up with statement they don't know what is the problem with web site and offering me to pay $100 fee for the privilege to buy tickets over the phone. Even that though did not work as by the time I convinced the agent that 'stopover' means Im stopping for several days in Naha before proceeding to Ishigaki, which is also Okinawa (as island in Okinawa archipelago), which took significant efforts btw, it hit 6pm and line just went dead (seems they automatically cut it at 6:00:00pm). Maybe as well too as I already started to have images of Hawaii in my head, vs dreadful images of having a day of bad weather in Okinawa and get stranded there by JAL as that would be a problem they could not solve. Bottom line - three stars - arithmetic average of great service and absence of any problem solving.

title: From Seoul to Fukuoka
review_text: Flew short haul flight with Japan airlines from Seoul to Fukuoka.     Cabin was clean and fresh.   Seat pitch had enough room.   Small snack/meal was served even for this short flight and I was pleasantly surprised.   Had very enjoyable flight!

title: Pleasable Japanese Airlines
review_text: I flew from Jakarta to Tokyo when departing at morning. Their check-in is quite fast including their maximum baggage allowance allow me to bring 2 pieces of luggage. Thanks to extra space for USB port and charging socket, I could work and entertain conveniently. The breakfast was good, also the drinks where you can request anything you want. Extremely polite and nice flight attendants. Great in-flight entertainment where you could watch Japanese shows or movies, music, and some mangas you could read. The lavatory is frequently cleaned for a few hours so it gave a fresh scent for passengers who need to go there.

title: Japanese Airlines- da best!!!
review_text: This our second trip with  JAL and it is always a pleasure flying with this airline. Staffs are nice, Food are great, Seats are good and plane is very clean. Always on time and always nice to have a lay-over in Japan. My second choice airline, for my number 1 will be ANA airlines. But pretty much the same as both are from Japan

title: First time with JAL
review_text: Flew Melbourne to Tokyo, departing at midnight, arriving around 9am. Intended to sleep all night, or at least until they served breakfast. Idea worked, but poor pillow made sleeping less comfortable. The thin ‘biscuit wafer’ type pillows don’t work for this Westener. Staff excellent, food good. Had seats 2A & 2C, good location. Only issue is it’s a bit squeeze getting past aisle seat to window seat, but hey we’re in BC not CC (cattle class) so shouldn’t complain right? As expected of JAL, flight departed and arrived on time. Would fly with them again.

title: Outstanding service and flight
review_text:
My daughter and I were excited to fly on JAL and we were not disappointed.  The configuration of their seats allow everyone to have their own private compartment.  I liked the window dimming system which allows the windows to gradually get darker or lighter.  The tvs are 21 inches (super huge).  There is a good variety of entertainment to choose from.  The flight attendants are so polite and helpful. They volunteered to take a photo of my daughter and I.  There is so much food available, outside from your regular meals.
The seat becomes a lie flat seat, which is excellent.  The only downside is that the seat cushion was hard.  Even with the mattress pad that I was given, the seat was uncomfortable.  I found it difficult to get comfortable.  I look forward to flying on JAL again.

title: Long range comfort
review_text: Have flown on JAL economy two times on the 777 ER and both have been wonderful. For a 10 hour flight the seats are far superior to any US airline and of course the service you receive is great. The attendants are gracious as expected from a Japanese company and the food was delicious with Japanese flair, but could be eaten by someone who's not too keen on trying different foods. Good size tv screen with lots of movie options to make the flight go by quickly.

title: Incredible service mixed with older planes
review_text: Our flight was delayed about 30 minutes due to weather and I was amazed at how apologetic the crew was for the delay. It is highly unusual back in the states to know any reason a flight is delayed, or receive a heart felt apology. From he ground crew, to the pilots, to the flight attendants, the service was excellent. Flying business class though, I wish the seats would have been better cleaned between flights.

title: Wish I could select my seats
review_text: The return flight was good the flight to Vietnam was cramped an hot.  Because I booked my flight through United airlines I couldn't pick my seats on JAL, they put us in the back 3 rows in the middle.  I tried to pay to upgrade our seats and they wouldn't even let me do that. The food was really good and the service was great, just wish I could get better seats.

title: Friendly crew and highly attentive
review_text:
Seems like most people had woes with their pre-flight processes, I don't remember much about that though. One thing that stuck with me was - I couldn't resist having an ice cream prior to the flight and was fighting hard to finish it as the gate was closing. Didn't want to waste the ice cream, and we then tried to board the plane with the half eaten ice cream - without being stopped! Yay~!

On a different leg, we were also given the privilege of priority boarding as we picked the seats next to the emergency exit. (That's where I want to be waiting when I do not have an ice cream in hand.)

Flight crew were also friendly and attentive throughout the flight, seats were also comfortable for a domestic flight. The journey was much more comfortable than the international flight we arrived in, just wished it could just bring us home.

title: They should be shut down
review_text: Booked a flight for domestic japan airlines and apparently it never went through.  I received the email providing me with the confirmation number and fare cost.  After one month I decided to check up and found the flight hasn't even been booked.  I called and they said they have no credit card record and the flight was canceled.  I flipped and said how can that be, I added in my credit card and everything.  So I decided to do it again, went through and filled out everything online and added all my payment info.  I get a similar type of email stating "The ticket purchase deadline of this reservation is August 26. Please purchase your ticket by the deadline above, otherwise the reservation will be canceled automatically after the deadline."  So I told customer service and she said it went through you don't have to do anything anymore.   Then I argued what about the first time I went through it?  I wanted the fare of my original booking.  So I next decided to cancel the flight I jut booked because I was only trying to prove a point of what I did and what email I got.  Then next I cancelled the flight I just put in.  So happens I only get 50% of my refund back so I lost another 250 bucks!!!!  The stupid site said I would get all my refund back but if you dig down, certain flights will have a penalty.  So they said I would have to call domestic japan airline.  I tried calling and waited over 30 minutes on the line.  Just gave up.  What the f### man.

title: JAL refuses seat selection to economy pax, but does not disclose that in advance
review_text: JAL had the best schedule to reach my destination from my home. I went to their website and compared their classes of service. The website showed that "Premium Economy" had minor differences from "Economy" at 3 times the price, so I chose "Economy." Booking on JAL's site proved impossible because it refused to accept numerous entries including my name, address, frequent flier number, etc. All in "wrong format." So I booked the same flights with Travelocity - super easy. But Travelocity didn't give me a chance to select my seats, so I called JAL to get my seats reserved. This is 3 months ahead so should be a good choice of seats. After 2 hours - yes two hours - on hold I got a JAL agent who informed me that my class of travel does not allow seat selection until check in. The agent would not even allow me to request an aisle seat, which is essential to me for health reasons. I double-checked their web pages describing the different classes of service, and there was no mention of this difference between the two classes. There is even a section on seats, which shows pictures of the seats for the two classes, but never mentions that they will not allow advance seat selection in economy, unlike all other airlines I have flown. Some airlines charge a small fee, such as $25 for advance seat selection. In the case of JAL it would cost me over $2000 to upgrade service for these flights to get my aisle seat. To me this is inexcusable. I will not fly with JAL again.

title: Check your seat number in checking in
review_text:
Having booked my window seat 18A many weeks before I find on boarding I have a middle seat 18F.  Two things here - What’s is the point of having advance seat booking and always check what seat they have given you at check in.

Premium economy is very good but disappointed with this flight seat re-allocation without notification at check in

title: Wonderful
review_text: My 19 year old just flew this airline to and from Asia.  He had very positive things to say.  Very attentive crew, great food, clean.  Would definitely fly JAL on our next trip.

title: Great Service
review_text: Japan airlines is fantastic to travel with, their service is awesome, the cabin crew are very helpful and the ground service camparable. The premium economy seating does not recline as much as other airlines and the food is not up to scratch, however as a seasoned traveller, I eat before I get on a plane and I dont sleep. Your really paying for wider seats and less people in your space, sleep quality is non existant. To upgrade to business would have been good but not at the cost they were asking.

title: Remove toddlers from Business Class!
review_text:
Although the service was nothing short of spectacular, on par with all of the other airlines known for superb service, I have to knock Japan Airlines for two things: first, the Business Class seats in the 787 are nowhere near as comfortable as the ones I have experienced on many other Business Class flights with other airlines; and second, it is amazingly hard to sleep with a toddler screaming and yelling for 75% of the flight. Beyond that, my daughter was asked if she would be willing to move because the couple wanted to give the toddler his own seat, even though only the two adults had paid seats. This was easily one of the worst BC flights I have ever been on due to these reasons. Even the earplugs provided could not drown out the yelling and screaming. I definitely recommend JAL for its service, but not for the other reasons listed.
My hope is that some day an airline will set age restrictions for Business/First Class and that airline will likely win me as a customer for life.

title: Japanese cuisine
review_text: The flight was so relaxing and in no time we arrived in Japan.In business class we experienced beautiful Japanese cuisine .We also have got a cardigan.

title: Great experience
review_text: Flight was part of homeward journey to New Zealand. We had been away 2 months and during that time had flown on many different airlines and this was the best after Air NZ of course. Staff were friendly and polite the food was a choice between international and Japanese food. Flight was 11 hours long, new release movie choices to watch. Leg room seemed more than other airlines and seats had an optional foot rest, a good head rest adjustment and were comfortable.

title: It is worth to pay extra
review_text: After so many years of flying between USA and Japan, now I only fly with Japan Airlines.  Even in economy class, they treat you like a human, not cargo.  They place snack stations at the back of the aircraft where you can help yourself with water, juice and snacks during the flight.  It is 13 hours flight and you want to be as comfortable as possible.  I tried to save few dollars and flew other airlines, but I always come back to JAL.

title: One of Good airlines
review_text: My first time with JAL. Every single detail is ok. Staffs are all nice, both ground and air services.

title: Service is generally excellent
review_text:
One of my 3 favorite airlines for flights to Asia (The other are Asiana and Cathay Pacific).

It's 787 Dreamliner service on both legs, SAN to NRT and then NRT to MNL. The 787 on the Manila leg was a bit newer and slightly larger than the one on the SAN to NRT flight.

Seats are comfortable with decent cushioning and leg room. They're 2 abreast on the outboard rows and are wider than most. The Dreamliners are comfortable to ride; quiet and with a 6000 foot pressured altitude. I don't care for the LCD-dimming windows. While it's nice to be able to dim the shade and still see through the window, it's slow to react to the control and keeps changing even after you release the button. An indicator for the setting would be nice.

The aisle seats on the outboard rows have a vertical metal case that takes up about 1/5 of the side-to-side leg room on the SAN/NRT flights. The Dreamliner between NRT and MNL doesn't have it.

One thing I didn't expect: When I booked this particular itinerary, I booked it through American Airlines because the trip was marginally less expensive than booking through JAL. What they don't tell you is that you can't get a seat selection until you check in. That's a bit rough when you consider the possibility of seating somewhere uncomfortable for 11-12 hours.

title: Not the best
review_text: I didn't expect to be packed inside the airplane for seven hours! I didn't pick this airline, it was chosen for me. What a nightmare run by young kids (less than 30 yo!) with no sense of customer service!

title: Good connection; Average Airline
review_text: Somehow I expected more for our flight from Osaka to Tokyo.  Boarding was slow. Service was okay, but only average.  But regardless, it's a good option and priced about the same as the bullet train (with less hassle to get to the airport train station)

title: Great start to Japanese Holiday
review_text: polite staff. I was sleeping on take off, and when I woke later found a sticker on the back of the seat in front of me, telling me to contact them if I needed anything. Later when they served breakfast they gave me extra food.

title: AA 8481 codeshare on JAL 11
review_text: What a world of difference!  After several times flying to Japan on American Airlines, we decided to choose the one non-stop flight operated as a codeshare by Japan Airlines.  And considering the 14 hours we had spent previously packed into an undersaized AA seat, we decided to opt for the Premium Economy.  It included access to an airport lounge at DFW with free snacks and beverages.  Instead of 3-4-3 across in a 777, JAL has 2-4-2 across in a 787, and the Premium Economy has 2-3-2 across.  Extra legroom in front of us, leg rest and foot rest, and the seat reclines in a shell, where it doesn’t lean back into the person behind you.  The food and service were also superior.  The only minor hiccup is that JAL doesn’t participate in TSA PreCheck.  In the future American Airlines should issue a boarding pass in their app, or print one at the counter with our TSA PreCheck Status, and then use the JAL boarding pass to get on the plane.

title: Finest Japanese Hospitality
review_text:
Almost everything about this flight is as good as you can expect it to be. 2-4-2 configuration on a B788 gave plenty of seat width. Leg room was even more impressive. The seat was very comfortable, even without declining. Arrival card in every seat pocket. Our flight was delayed an hour and we received updates from the cockpit every fifteen minutes or so. They informed us the exact time expectancy they received from ATC, and it turned out to be pretty accurate. Food was absolutely delicious and presented nicely. My favorite has to be the limited custard pudding ice cream from Haagen Dazs, which to my understanding is served on all outbound international flights. The cabin crew was, as you would expect, amazingly nice and polite. 

If there is any complaint at all, it would be the entertainment system which was a bit limited compared to the average airline. I could not turn off subtitles which bothered me a little. The provided headphones produced good sound quality but were not the most comfortable. 

Overall, it was a great experience flying JAL. I am looking forward to more custard pudding ice cream in the future.

title: Fly High
review_text: Great Servuce with JAL. Comfortable and reasonable fare ticket. Will ride again for my next travels. Really recommend it.. The attendants are kund and friendly.. And attended our needs.. Same as with other customer's needs

title: Lovely ride over Japan
review_text:
Following a thoroughly enjoyable visit to Fukuoka, I had to get to Tokyo.  I contemplated the Shinkansen, but opted instead for a ride on a Japan Airlines Boeing 777 from Fukuoka to Tokyo Haneda.  For the flight I opted (JL314), they were operating a tri-class configured aircraft, with economy, J Seat and First products on board.

First Class check-in at Fukuoka is a dream.  Located upstairs, the wood panelled check-in lounge resembles a five-star hotel.  After an efficient check-in followed by a luxe private security zone, directed me instantly into the Sakura Lounge, with terrific views across the tarmac. 

After enjoying light refreshments in the lounge, I made my way to boarding where First Class was boarded as priority through a dedicated jetway.  The dedicated F Cabin is nicely configured in a 2x2x2 staggered arrangement of fourteen recliner seats in soft cream leather, with a seat pitch of 51-inches.  Cabin crew swiftly pointed out the features of the seat, including charging points for electronic devices, and offered slippers and shoe horns.

Lunch was served on this short, 85-minute flight.  A single tray was offered with multiple dishes beautifully presented including rice crackers to go with a drink, a steamed salmon appetizer, a sesame tofu and crabmeat dish, and a main dish of braised chicken in a Japanese pepper soy sauce, Niigata premium steamed rice, some miso soup, and Japanese sweet.  All was absolutely delicious, light yet filling, flavoursome and rich.  For those keen on lighter options, Udon de Sky was available, as was consomme.  

Drinks included apple, orange or Sunshine Juice Liquid Salad (a cold pressed smoothie of sorts, unique to JAL), colas, teas, water, iced coffee and a non-alcoholic Suntory beer.  In addition to two sakes on offer, Nicolas Feuillatte Brut 2008 champagne was available, along with a Ferrari sparkling brut wine from Italy, two white wines (Chenin blanc or a white Bordeaux) and two reds (a Temperanillo and Cote du Rhone).  Quite a nice selection covering most palates, I thought.  A premium Shochu was also available, in addition to four beers and Suntory whiskey.

Crew were extremely polite, attentive and engaging.  The aircraft was immaculate and remained so throughout the flight.  The chief purser, who had personally greeted each F customer, returned as we were on stand to thank us for flying Japan Airlines.  The crew gave me a small bag containing rice crackers, as I had commented how particularly delicious their rice cracker mix was...a delightful touch.

The view of Japan from my window seat was wonderful for the duration of the flight.  It put a different perspective on compared with the train journey.  I was in a taxi at HND within 10 minutes of landing.  Overall, a thoroughly enjoyable travel experience.

title: First Time on JAL
review_text:
Very accommodating with seat selection.  No extra charges.  Started from Kona, Hawaii
requested exit row seating.  They told me I needed to talk to someone at JAL in Honolulu International Airport.  When I got there.  They expected me and  provided me
exit row seat with no charge.  JAL staff was really  hospitable and friendly.
Food was good.  Seat was comfortable for that long flight to Narita then to Manila.
I would flying this airline again.

title: Not as Good as Expected
review_text:
JAL used to have the best Premium Economy when flying to Tokyo (compared to Air France, Alitalia and BA, all tried out), considering seats, service and pricing. In that regard this flight (return) has been clearly disappointing, in particular considering that the price for one of us was 2,400€ which is clearly not a bargain for a Premium Economy seat (there was Business on Korean Air at that price but we could not have travelled together). Speaking of travelling together, this has been one of the main issue when using separate bookings. In all fairness, bookings were taken via BA, but what is the point of registering a named travel companion if this is simply ignored? We were separated both on the outbound and the return flight with in both cases ground staff unable to come up with a helpful solution. It is only once on board and largely due to the proverbial courtesy of fellow Japanse travellers that we could travel together. During these permutations it was hilarious to discover that we had not been the only coupled separated despite the moderate size of the Premium Economy cabin. As for the service, it is still competitive compared with other airlines but not as good in my view as in previous years on JAL. For instance, on the return night flight there were unusually few rounds of water and beverages. 
For a similar price I don't think I would fly JAL PE again.

title: First Time
review_text: I used to Fly Domestic in the Philppines with our local airlines and since I had a chance to go Japan I like to try different Airlines and not to book with local airlines in Ph but Japan Airline instead. The price is reasonable , from the Airport the staff are kind. I requested them to give me a window seat. The flight used Boeing 767 and it was also my first time to ride on that wide aircraft . I was so amazed , the seats are wide enough and theres also an entertainment were you can watch and listen to the movies and various music. They served delicious foods of course Japanese food and I enjoyed it so much. I had experience Japan automatically even im still on the plane. This December I will be flying to Japan Airlines again and that was Manila- Narita ( layover ) Haneda-Itami and KIX-Haneda(layover)Narita-Manila

title: Premium Economy Is Worth The Extra Cost
review_text: Flew both to and from LAX/Narita on JAL.  Paid for Premium Economy since it is such a long flight (even though we were a family of 4 so it was pricey to upgrade). I also booked through American Airlines so I could earn mileage (AA and JAL have a partnership arrangement).  Premium Economy is a very small section of the plane between Business and Economy.  Seats give you extra legroom, lots of little freebie extras (love the slippers and free alcohol) and a pretty good recline.  Of course, not as good as First Class or Business where you get your own pods, but still appreciated.  Couldn't swing First Class or Business costs when dealing with 4 tickets.  Seats themselves weren't very comfortable but not worse than regular airlines.  Would have been nice if they had a little more padding, though.  Also a nice 'extra' with Premium Economy is that we were able to wait for our plane in the JAL lounge and that had drinks and snacks and comfortable seating which managed to pass the time nicely.  Overall, a very comfortable flight.

title: Great airline
review_text:
Great flight, service was as usual excellent. The staff were attentive, but not intrusive as is sometimes the case with other airlines. I chose the Japanese meal (I’m western but love the food) and have always believed the best Japanese meals are served when leaving japan, but on this flight from LHR the food was excellent and easily as good as the return flight.
A great selection of wine, and a nice surprise a couple of Japanes options on the menu as well.
Overall a great experience.

title: Best Airline
review_text: This was my first time using Japan Airlines.  Am a frequent traveler and have used Singapore Air, Cathay Pacific, Emirates, Qatar etc.  JAL was a very pleasant experience for me and family.  Leg room is much better than Airlines mentioned above.  Inflight Service is par if not better.  All flights were on time.  Plane for Jakarta to Tokyo (B787) better than Tokyo - USA (B777).  Meal quality good though choices of Movies limited.

title: Efficient flight from Tokyo to Sydney
review_text: A typhoon was nearby which effected the scheduling of the flight out of Narita. Check-in was initially effected but once a plane was ready it was all efficient service with respect and a smile. Check-in was excellent. With a Premium Economy ticket, access to the business lounge is included which is a definite plus when considering flying with JAL (also offered when flying Sydney to Narita). The lounge is a little 'retro' these days, and the offerings are rather basic but it is a very nice place to spend an hour before the flight particularly as shopping options in the crowded international departure area of Narita are rather limited. The plane was very new and comfortable and overall the flight experience was very good. Seat is excellent, entertainment screen is great (I watched two movies), food is good, service is great. The premium economy experience is lessened compared to other airlines as there is no dedicated toilet, the range of snacks offered is very small with nothing exciting to nibble, and no pre-take-off drink (bubbly, juice or water) as provided by some other carriers - the missing little premium economy perks which reduce an 'excellent' rating to a 'very (very) good'. I will definitely fly JAL again.

title: Great flight but children’s meal was better than adults!
review_text:
Return flight to Hong Kong. Again, nothing to complain about - great aircraft and superb service. My only gripe was my child’s meal was great and had lots of child friendly things - the carrot was in a shape of an airplane, for example, and they had a very small Hello-Kitty type fork and the dessert had a teddy-bear shaped chocolate. My expectations for my meal were increased as I thought the Japan catering would be better on this leg than the outward bound. 

Unfortunately this turned out not to be the case and I would describe the food as ‘edible’. Perhaps next time I will order the kid’s meal for myself!

Other than that, the flight was delayed due to strong winds in HK - nothing to do with the airline - and I couldn’t really fault the overall experience.

title: Great flight to Japan
review_text:
We sat near the front of economy from Hong Kong to Narita. Not a long flight, but we really couldn’t find anything to complain about!  The service was excellent, the plane was clean, and the food was good (for an economy class flight!). We ordered a kid’s meal which came very quickly following take off and the lunch service was also served quickly with a good range of drinks. 

Not the most spacious of cabins and leg room but it was only a four hour flight. Would definitely travel with them again.

title: Having a mixed experience
review_text:
Good things
had free wifi during flight time on my way to Tokyo
Had early check-in and baggage release facility

Bad thing
Had a poor communication at Naha airport, 
we were almost missing the flight due to lack of information. 
Had no wifi on our way to okinawa.(thats not a big problem as its a free service)

title: Guam to Narita
review_text: You can’t go wrong on JAL and with business class it’s a comfortable relaxing experience.  The food and service was great.  The only complaint is the lay flat seats are a little short for anyone six foot or taller.

title: Business Class Uncomfortable!
review_text: When I boarded the aircraft and saw that the seating arrangement in business class was similar to American Airlines, I took heart.  But, it was short lived.  The seats on Japan Air in Biz Class are VERY uncomfortable!  They are narrow and hard and have few ergonomic adjustments.  The area around the seat is not well utilized, with no place to store/hold items during a long flight.  Considering the high price of these seats, think twice before spending the money on this class of service for long flights on Japan Air.  Made me REALLY appreciate American Airlines' setup.

title: wow
review_text: never had that much space in economy class...Crew was very friendly, service was great, everything was fine...totally recommend that airline...

title: Narita Airport to Melbourne
review_text: We arrived at Narita airport looking forward to our premium economy flight to Melbourne. It was a very pleasant surprise to be told we had been ungraded to business class for the trip. I can say without question the service and food served on this flight was outstanding. The staff were attentive and the Western main course meal, in particular the beef was in a class of its own. A very enjoyable flight made more enjoyable by the staff and the food.

title: Nice crew and aircraft interior
review_text: The crew are nice although can’t converse well in English. The seat is comfortable and interior of the cabin is nice. There are good selection of English movies but not so for other Asian movies. They are mainly Japanese Asian movies and musics. The food however was horrible. Not very appetitising...none the less, the price tag is the most attractive part of the flight.

title: Best premium economy I've flown.
review_text: Japan Airlines premium economy is the best I've flown and I won't hesitate to fly again. The pod like seats mean that you can recline within the space of your own pod, not disturbing anyone behind you and not being disturbed. The service is typically Japanese, polite, courteous and nothing is too much trouble. The food is fine, it is plane food after all, and the amenities are comfortable.

title: From start to end awesome
review_text: Check in was easy, staff members excellent. Flight crew were also exceptional. The trip was an easy run made easier with the assistance of crew. Would not hesitate to recommend this airline. The only downside was the entertainment, lacks new movies.

title: Comfort and Care in Air
review_text: Flying Japan airlines was one of the best decision that we took. The flight attendants were warm and hospitile. The food was gourmet quality. The seats, even though in economy class, were clean and comfortable. Even after getting down the flight, the flight attendants helped us with some key information on the airport and the city. Looking forward to travel again with the same airlines.

title: Advance seating reservation really helps
review_text:
The seat was comfortable, helping me to sleep well. The airline provides privilege tag to checked language, but long immigration queue made meaningless.
The portion of food was a bit small for me, and economy class food was provided. Advance seat reservation really helps for me to book my favourite place.

title: Great alternative from Australia to Europe
review_text:
Great airline, always super efficient, friendly helpful staff, seamless connection in Tokyo.

Onboard wifi really works well, food is well presented & drinks well selected.

title: Prepare to go hungry.
review_text:
I flew from Melboune to Tokyo to Moscow. Flights and seats were ok. I have flown in more comfortable and modern seat compartments. It was ok it not fantastic. The problem was food unless you liked or ate Japanese menu. My wife fell asleep on take off and was then told sorry all western food is gone. Japanese or starve. Not even sushi was on offer.

The tickets were ok but we will never fly with them again and I travel constantly.

title: One of best airlines I ever travelled with so far
review_text: I went Okinawa, Japan in March 2016.I flew from London to Tokyo by British Airways (BS) which was not as good as I expected, while I returned to London by Japanese Airlines (JAL), which added to my disappointment with BA. Anyway, JAL was the best airline I travelled with. The flights were amazing. The food on flight was amazing,just like had in Okinawa. I was surprised with the Free Wi-Fi service they had on the flight. Although, I was a bit uncomfortable with Legroom, I expected a bit of wide space for such a long flight.The flight attendants were excellent, helpful. They had provided a huge Entertainment options on board, headphones and shawl for cold.Amazing, overall my experience with the JAL was amazing, despite the legroom thingy.

title: JAL flight
review_text: Legroom was very limited. Food was average . Flight attendants were attentive and helpful. Entertainment choices were ok but not fantastic.

title: Amazing service
review_text: Both JAL and ANA are the representation of the Japanese service. Dedicated staff thinking in passenger service, giving you a fantastic experience when traveling. Everytime I can choose JAL I go with them.

title: Great Airline!
review_text:
Have flown most Asian airlines out of San Diego and Los Angeles.  For me and my wife, JAL is hands down best.  Stewards are super nice, polite, professional.  Floors, bathrooms, kitchen are are immaculate.  

That said, their PE class is not worth it given huge price difference from China Airlines, EVA, Cathay.  $1K difference is typical.  But JAL is so clean and spacious in economy that i often fly it due to cleanliness and great flight crew.  Their service and cleanliness is direct reflection of values Japanese culture.
