Philippine airlines is the worst!  Dirty bathrooms, snooty flight staff, slow clean-up after meals (like 30-minutes last time we flew). After an almost 10-year gap, we decided to try them in Feb 2018 (LAX - MNL) since it was a quick get in and get back to San Diego in 10-days and direct connection to other parts of PI saves few hours.  A 15-hour flight and two of bathrooms in economy were unusable for half the flight.  No toilet paper, dirty, disgusting.  So big line-up in business class.  Flight attendants didn't care.  My wife is Filipina and it's embarrassing to her as it reflects badly on culture and mentality of her native land.  We've sworn off PAL for internal flights.  Their domestic flights are better, but always late (Plane Always Late = PAL is well known in PI).

title: Mediocre
review_text: I was not impressed of the service and the whole experience. The seats are very small compare to other international airlines. I thought that it is clean as Japan is very clean but I was disappointed. I would try other airlines before JAL again.

title: Excellent experience on Japan Airlines
review_text: I was supposed to fly on Air India on that day, however the flight was  delayed by 7 hrs. due to some technical problem. I was informed by Air India in Tokyo that I could take Japan Airlines flight . Problem was that my fare was calculated Round-the World, C class  basis and on Star alliance member airline only. However, Japan Airlines accepted me to fly with them even though it is not a Star Alliance member. This saved me 7 hr. waiting time at Tokyo airport.Flight experience on Japan Airlines was excellent.

title: Ms. Demi F
review_text:
When I go to Japan, I always take JAL.
It’s only one direct flight from Boston I believe. Besides great flight attendants every single time and good, satisfying meals as “airplane food”.
They serve a cup of ice cream as a dessert after dinner. Often JAL’s original Fravor with ice cream makers. Those ice creams are truly frozen solid. Every time it makes me wonder how they can keep them such good shape? They serve sliverware not plastics (Plastics will snap in half because of the solid frozen ice cream lol)
Their sheets are quite comfortable even for economy class. You don’t feel so clogged up.
Their economy class sheets received some kind of world prize ( Please refer to JAL’s website for the details)
They hardly ever delay their flights. Can be arriving a bit earlier due to the weather conditions but never been late even once when I experienced.

Over all they are quite established, steady company in my opinion. And the best part is they must keep trying daily bases to hold their quality up there. May be better than yesterday but never less.
I highly recommend JAL for the long flight! You can count on my words above!

title: Excellent flight experience
review_text:
We recently flew JAL to Tokyo and return for a holiday 
This was our first time with this airline.
It proved to be one of our best flight experiences.
The inflight staff excelled with continued unobtrusive service from food to drinks and any other needs 
So different to others where when the lights went out everyone disappeared.The food was also good and the flights were on time.

title: Great flight & in-flight meals
review_text: It was my 2nd time using JAL and I still remain very happy with this airline. Stewardess were genuinely warm, flight was smooth, landing was calm and meals were greater than my country’s airlines

title: Warm and Friendly Service
review_text: I can't help but think of the financial difficulties the airline has faced in the past ten years and reflect on my recent flight with JAL.  The service was impeccable–warm, friendly, attentive–reflective of the Japanese spirit of hospitality.  However, flying in Premium Economy you see that while you have some choice in your meals, JAL is looking to keep their costs low.  The quality is quite good, arguably excellent and worth of mention, but you will not get much of a choice or a spread, even in Premium Economy.  In some ways, the Premium Economy product was no different than some of the business products I've experienced on US carriers, except that you had excellent service from the start at Haneda at the ticket counter to deplaning in San Francisco.

title: Once Again
review_text: Flying to Jakarta, Indonesia, JAL flight number 007 was the first leg of a two flight sequence. JAL once again lived up to expectations in service, food, and the flight itself. The flight is about 13-13.5 hours. The cost is just under Cathay-Pacific and Singapore. All three are great. However, Japan goes the proverbial extra mile. A big plus is they operate with Boeing 787’s. With that planes configuration, there is plenty of room even in economy which I flew the first time a while ago. JAL is a great choice.

title: The best airlines!
review_text: The airplane is amazing,the technology, food  and service are the best! The flight attendant are all beautiful and  also dress very nice and presentable! They really work very hard to provide the best service possible! I highly recommend this airlines to everyone! It’s the best!

title: Lacking in Service
review_text: We haven't flown on JAL for some twenty plus years as they were always more expensive, however, this particular time they were less expensive than ANA so we booked.  The onboard service both ways were mediocre at best which is like Cathay Pacific.  Nothing special, just routine work.  Food was borderline ok and did not serve any real snacks or light food.  The entertainment - movie list was also lacking in selection, luckily we downloaded movies from Netflix into our devices.  Will probably not fly on this airline again.

title: Onboard service is great however after sales support is terrible
review_text:
JAL needs to work on their online reservations systems so that International reservation changes can be made online whilst in Japan.
Currently you cannot make International reservations changes/manage bookings in Japan online you must use the call centre which charges Y100 USD $1.00 for every 60 seconds with a wait time on average of 30-40 minutes,That's $40.00 before you have even spoken to an agent to enquire about changing a fare date.
When you get through to the call centre often the agents understanding of English is poor and you will be shuffled around until the call centre staff find a member who can understand exactly what you want to do with your booking.
My advice: Onboard JAL is a superb airline but their system for handling booking changes is frustrating,expensive and time consuming when booking with JAL check wether your fare is changeable online particularly if travelling on business or working on projects that may require a flexible departure date.

title: Very good airline!
review_text:
I flew with Japan airlines 787 because Finnair cancelled our flight. Boarding was very good, and seats was very comfortable. Staff was very good too. In-flight entertainment was very varied. take off and landing was VERY smooth. Food was ok.

I can recommend this airline!

title: Japanese standard
review_text:
Took this flight from Los Angeles to Tokyo.  Departure was delayed due to a delayed arrival of the aircraft.  Overall service is pretty good, I would call it the Japanese standard. 

Inflight meal was good but the main dish (fish) was 
too sweet.

title: Great service
review_text: JAL certainly lived up to their reputation for good service. The cabin crew were attentive and nothing was too much trouble for them. The food was excellent and the seats were very comfortable. My only issue is that we had a day flight but we were served a meal at 10.30am and then cabin was darkened for people to go to sleep.

title: Great prices, service and tons of leg room
review_text: I'm a tall guy so having extra leg room is always a plus. Our family did round trips flights from Chicago to Tokyo and I could be more pleased.  The level of service, as is often the case with non-American airlines, was quite good with consistent and reliable service throughout the flight.  What's more, I had the most leg room I've ever had on a standard economy ticket.

title: Beware, DONT FLY WITH THEM
review_text: Was told I needed an escort to my next flight during a layover because of passport issue, airline took my passport and boarding pass and refused to return them unless I gave them $300. After 2.5 hours of arguing because they couldn’t justify it I had to pay or be stuck without a passport, refused to call embassy after me constantly asking. EXTORTION. And illegal for a corporation to seize an American passport. BEWARE

title: Excellent Superb
review_text: I had travelled on JAL long time back in 2007 from Singapore to Kuala Lumpur but that was a very short flight lasting only 40 minutes. Now I got a chance to travel to Tokyo from Delhi by this airline with lot of expectations. It was an awesome experience. The cabin, the staff, the food everything was great. Above all the humbleness of its staff is something to be experienced. The flight too was smooth barring 15-20 minutes of turbulence. The check-in process is unique and very pleasant surprise as compared to other airlines. The return flight too was equally perfect. Hats off to JAL

title: Excellent First Class experience!
review_text: In Tokyo/Haneda I used a designated First Class check in counter. After passing through the security checkpoint quickly I proceeded to the JAL First Class lounge. The lounge was very spacious, but crowded a bit, and offered a good selection of breakfast food and drinks. They also had shower rooms, a champagne-bar, a room with a kicker machine and a smoking room. I enjoyed the time during my stay in this lounge! After boarding the Boeing 777-300ER I was guided to the JAL Sky Suite 1A. The cabin was not fully booked, which was not too bad. The charming crew members in the First Class cabin introduced themselves with their names and offered some drinks before takeoff. The seat was really spacious and clean, but a bit outdated, which was not a problem for me at all. There was also waiting a red amenity kit from Porsche Design. Up in the air the service started with an amuse-gueule of my special preordered japanese vegetarian menu, followed by a very delicious multi-course special meal. Every time I was served a new plate or bowl the flight attendant explained to me what it is consisting of and also the meaning in japanese cuisine. I was really surprised of the friendliness and attentiveness of the airline staff, which I enjoyed pretty much! Concerning the drinks I decided to try after the french champagne a Pommard red wine, which also was from France. After meal service was over I was handed out a pyjama and I changed my clothes in the bathroom. In the meantime my seat was converted to a comfortable bed with a mattress and very soft sheets. By the way in the bathroom they had a typical japanese toilet with a lot of the famous functions toilets have in Japan. I had a very good sleep above the clouds, although I woke up and could order a noodle soup and a pot of tea. There was served another delicious vegetarian meal before arrival in London. I even could order some stuff from the regular menu at all times. Very special for japanese airlines is, that they offer a good selection of japanese drinks like different kinds of sake wines, which I also tried a glas or two from. All in all I have to say, that JAL is a reliable and safe japanese airline, which I definetly would fly again with! This First Class flight was one of the best experiences I made in this class of service not least because of the professionalism of the cabin crew members.

title: Upgrade
review_text:
We were upgraded on our return flight and what a wonderful experience. The cubicles were divine. I had so much room and was so comfortable for the entire journey. The food was magnificent. Drinks and snacks were plentiful if required. Flight staff attended immediately once the call bell was pushed. The toilets were always clean whenever needed. Something that is definitely not common. 
Will definitely consider a trip in business class again.

title: Really pleasant
review_text: We went premium economy due to our height and we loved it. The staff were very nice the food was tasty and we could have endless drinks and snacks. Fantastic. Would definitely fly again.

title: horrible transfer counter service on july 23’18 at 16:40
review_text:
i booked my flight from flight network. i pay for my window seat all the way from edmonton to jakarta, somehow japan-jakarta is not window seat. i asked at vancouver counter gate to help me change it but they couldnt do it even though the window seats are available, so they ask me when i arrive in japan, i should go to transfer counter.
After i went for security check at international tranfer, there’s transfer counter on the right, so i went there to ask them change to window seat. unfortunately the lady is rejected my request rudely, then i showed her that i paid for the window seat, even the service at vancouver asked to change it in japan. another drama that she talked to her supervisor in japanese about my case, still she said no service for economy class!!!!! so when you are in economy class means no ground service in narita airport!!!!!!! i wish i took photo of them!!!!!

title: A Dream
review_text: Undoubtedly the best flight of my life. As there were only three people in the cabin, the crew recommended we move to another row so we have a full row to ourselves - so we didn't even see the other passenger. Demonstrating the service and consideration we'd see throughout the flight, they made up the empty window seats as beds, so we could comfortably move between seat and "bed" for the duration of the 11 hour flight. The crew were incredibly accommodating and attentive, walking us to the restrooms to change into our pajamas, talking us through the various menus and letting us alternate between the western and Japanese menu (I wanted the caviar AND sushi!). The food was astonishing and beautifully presented, and both champagne options exquisite. We'd been looking forward to the flight for a while, and it was everything we hoped for!

title: Disruptive passengers?  Don’t expect JAL to do anything about it.
review_text:
Just arrived back in Melbourne on JL773. There was a family of about 7 people including 2 children seated around and in front of us. For almost the entire flight one of both of the children were screaming or yelling, disrupting other passengers. The family members did little to curb that behaviour other than to say a quiet ‘shhhh’ occasionally. The children played in the aisle - often with an adult - getting in the way of staff and passengers. Although this went on for hours, the cabin crew did nothing to intervene. Given JAL’s otherwise high standards, this was very disappointing. 

An additional point with JAL is that the cabin temperature is set quite high. On 3 of 4 flights we took with JAL over the last 3 weeks, the internal temperature of the cabin was uncomfortably high.

title: Flight full of comfort and freshness
review_text: Having flown several times I can say that Japanese airlines generally have great concern for hygiene and customer experience. They do not stuff too many passengers like some airlines do, their seats are comfortable and throughout the flight they ensure that you are hydrated and satiated. I took another connecting flight of JAL to Singapore and experience was consistent. Strongly recommended!

title: Good experience with wonderful customer services provided
review_text:
Have a recent trip to Hokkaido, Japan is a nice and enjoyable while travelling with JAL. Being a premium economy customer we are allowed to enter to lounges both in Singapore and Japan international airport which actually allows us to rest inti before the flights.

The sitting for the class is nice but the cushioning is a little thin it will be great if they can look into it.  The seats can fully lay off without disturbing the back customers and are perfectly fine and comfortable for tall people like me by the way I am 1.88 Meter.

Entertainment in the plane has a wide selection but the bad point is that outbound and inbound are the same, therefore I got a little bored after a while. As for the food, wise is not fantasy but still good.

Language is an issue to many of us as we don't speak Jap but what I have encountered is that the staff have lots of patients and even will go and look for someone who can speak English to assist us on the issues we have.

As our flight is being delayed but we reach the airport early during the return flights but the staff who can't speak well in English got a friend who is going off duty to help, this lady not only help us to change to an earlier flight and ensure all the processes in.

title: Japan Airlines is favorite!
review_text: Travelled three different trips to Vietnam with Japan Airlines. Their service is outstanding and attention to detail is spot on. Enthusiastic and friendly staff that really make it seem like it’s their sincere pleasure to take care of their passengers.

title: My JAL Experience
review_text:
My 1st time flying with JAL. Cabin Crew all are friendly. Asking how we doing? Etc. It’s so pleasent. 
Comfortable seat for Economy 

In flight entertainment bit disappointed. Can’t really enjoy it because not so many choices of current songs/movies

Meal it’s okay. I ordered Moslem Meal (MOML)

Overall, it’s a relaxing and enjoyable journey

title: Great service, value for money
review_text: Awesome airline, first time flying with JAL and would definitely do again. Service was prompt and first meal was great. Second in flight meal had some very oriental options which was not really suited to our taste but the service was outstanding. The screen entertainment was also excellent.

title: Everything was great except food
review_text: Never flown JAL before and to some good fares. The seats were comfortable, with individual lamps. Couldn't lie flat for sleeping but good enough. The entertainment system was one of the better ones and very easy to use. Choice of programs could be expanded. The care package was lovely with toothbrush, slippers, eye mask, face mask, water. The food was not so great- actually there was no dinners when we left at night but a small bun. Didn't mind that but the bun was not great. Breakfast next day was dried salmon and rice- quite fishy. Service was impeccable, everyone so friendly, polite and big smiles.

title: Best Economy Flight I've Had
review_text: Everything was just above average compared to other airlines I've been flying with. The food was not that great but you get what you paid for. They also serve ice creams after meals. The best meal was the breakfast one because they served a 'known' Japanese burger on board. The flight attendants were great and very responsive.

title: JAL one of the best
review_text:
This was my second time flying with Japan Airline. I really liked their service and their hospitality to their customers/passengers. First of all, I was happy with JAL when I flew with them two years ago, therefore I knew I wanted to fly with them again this year. My husband and I booked Economy seats from Kuala Lumpur to San Diego. We were amazed by the leg room they have. I was very happy with the interior inside the flight, the seats are very comfy and very new. I liked the fact that they always providing free toothbrush and toothpaste in the toilet. That's a plus. 
In terms of food, I'm not a fan of airline food because I can't eat while I'm on the flight. No matter what airline I fly with I had a hard time eating on the flight. I like to just drink a lot of water or nibble on some snacks. 
The flight attendants were very professional, friendly and always smiling. I really liked that. I for sure will choose Japan Airline again for my next trip.

title: Short trip but very good.
review_text:
Although only a 1 hour flight, I found JAL to be excellent.

The aircraft, a 737 Winglet, was clean and spacious and the staff were very pleasant from check in to flight attendants. Free on board WiFi was an added bonus.

Would recommend them to anyone wanting a good flight experience.

title: Great way to fly around the world
review_text:
Booked direct flights from New York to and from Tokyo on a JAL Boeing 777.  The price of direct tickets was only a few hundred more than flights with connections, so it was a no brainer.

I am a nervous flyer, but the flight to Tokyo was smooth as butter.  We flew north from New York, through Canada, over the Bering Straight down through the coast until reaching Tokyo. Magically, this 13 hour flight over some pretty active weather regions, was buttery smooth.  

There was a generous amount of legroom in economy class, and a 6” 1’ ,  I was able to extend both legs fully beneath the seat in front of me.

The entertainment systems were OK.  A very good selection of movies, but the music and video games were basic.  The video games, especially, were poor— equivalent to bad cell phone games 10 years ago.  Singapore Airlines has much better games, actually using Nintendo brand.

The food was passable.  Dinner consisted of a Japanese meal (rice, 3 sides, and a meat).  Dessert was pleasant—- a cup of Haagen Daaz ice cream.

The return flight was a bit bumpier, but the staff told us right at the start to expect some light turbulence, and made an in flight announcement before hitting a rough patch in the North Pacific.   This really helped to settle my nerves.

All in all, an almost perfect flying experience.

title: JAL flight
review_text:
Wonderful way to end a fantastic holiday. A little bit more leg room and comfort.
JAL were great to fly with and the lady at check in, couldn't help us any more than she did

title: Best flight I’ve ever had
review_text: I sit in economy class. The leg room and seat are comfortable. They provide halal food which is really good. The flight attendant are really nice.

title: Screaming kids / infants do not belong on planes! Flight crew useless! Bad parents also!
review_text: Flight from NRT to TPE, flight delayed, then some Taiwan parents did nothing to control their infant.  Four adults in the family, two kids, one of which was an infant, screaming for the entire duration of the four hour flight.  Flight crew did nothing.  Parents and Grandparents did very little.  Infants DO NOT BELONG on flights, period!  Selfish parents bringing their infants with them on vacation, what is the point? Seriously?  And this all was in Business class!!  I paid extra for my seat so I don't have to deal with this garbage, unfortunately both airlines and parents take no responsibility for this issue.  BAD! Just really bad!

title: Excellent service and large baggage allowance
review_text: Excellent customer service and superb food. The quality and space of seat in Premium Economy is almost as good as the old style business-class (before the sleeper seats were introduced) and definitely worth the money. JAL offers a huge baggage allowance (each person is allowed 2 x 23kg check-in bags), which really helps when travelling with the family after a "shopping holiday". The entertainment system is excellent and easy to use. Premium Economy customers can also use the airport lounge. My only criticism is the relatively poor standard of English and JAL's insistence of its staff "squeaking" in as high a tone of voice as is humanly possible when making announcements - extremely annoying and antiquated (JAL management need to revise this policy and move into the 21st century!)

title: JAL website is the WORST
review_text:
I have flown at least 700 times in my life, and dozens of times with JAL.  Their in-flight service is always pretty good, the meals are okay, but...

Their website and web check-in process is the WORST of any airline. It's so frustrating trying to get through their system; confirmation number not valid, can't find my booking, error error error...

Hey JAL, here's some advice:  just COPY what another airline does.  Just do exactly what they do.  Figure it out; completely revamp your process.  It stinks.

title: Direct from Boston
review_text: Flew the Dreamliner on the direct flight and for a 13+ hour flight, it was actually enjoyable. The only challenge is trying to sleep as the flight leaves at 1:30 pm, Boston local time. Business class seats are very comfortable and offer plenty of room. Overall the food was good and plentiful. Service was very professional and responsive. Amazing how easy it is to fly across the world.

title: Codeshare failure
review_text:
Flying an American Airlines flight, operated by Japan Airlines, meant that little or no service information made it through between the airlines' systems.   A window seat, confirmed with AA on the phone and showing on the AA mobile app was totally absent for JAL, so even with a high priced business class ticket, I got the dregs of the seats.  All the JAL agents could say was, "so sorry."  
Arriving in DFW, I had to ask where the baggage claim was, because the two airlines' systems couldn't link and update me.  One world isn't a good thing unless its a good world, and from my experience, it's not.

title: Economy review
review_text:
The aircraft is 787-8. It's new. The service quality is very good. When I pushed the call CA, they tried to help ASAP.

The missing points are the following.
- There is no amenity. Because this is a long-haul flight, the eye mask is helpful
- Breakfast meal is not good taste for me. It looks the English breakfast and it's only one choice.
- The seat is hard. I asked another blanket for the cushion.

title: Best Economy Class
review_text: Japan airlines sacrificed one seat in the economy class to make 9 seats a row, instead of 10 seats a row for many other airlines. They also increased the seat pitch. This made noticeable difference in the sense of space and the comfort level of the economy class, especially when you fly long haul. The inflight entertainment is very good, with touch screen functions. Food service is very good quality for economy class, and I especially liked their campaign to feature young and rising chefs in Japan to come up with appetizers, main dish, desert etc., with a touch of Japanese innovation and tradition.Cabin attendants were very attentive to passengers and take care of their requests quickly and nicely. I am not surprised they are voted the best economy class by Skytrax for the second time. Most highly recommended for those who want space and quality in the economy class.

title: Tokyo to London first class - wow
review_text: from check in to fast track exit - complete and professional service and the 11 plus hour flight is made to remember - all the latest movies, food choice between Japanese and western and drink menu is extensive and on tap. Yes you have to pay for it but you only live once for the experience.

title: A service to remember- excellent gluten-free food
review_text:
The 10 hours flight became a excellent experience. The flight attendants were all superfriendly, and gave the best service with a big smile. The glutenfree food was served two times, and tasted perfect! 
The seats was not the best, a little bit hard to sit at, som I had took a pillow to sit at. The entertainment was just perfect. 
A flight that served the passengers from departure to arrival.

title: From San Diego - DON'T DO IT. Bad experience in "Business Class".  Might as well be Japanese Aeroflot
review_text: Took this flight for convenience.  I will never fly JAL again.  For some inexplicable reason they literally cannot EVER fly this route on time despite it being only two aircraft from SAN to NRT and back again.  Check out Flight Aware and you will see the ontime performance is like 8%.  No explanation from the flight crew either.  Also, this flight goes to Narita which is like 2 hours from Tokyo.  I have been spoiled by always flying into HND, and since this airline is a government monopoly, you would think they'd offer it to HND, but no NRT it is.  We bought Business seats since first is NOT available EVER on this particular flight.  We were excited to fly the 787, but alas JAL put "SHELL FLAT NEO" seats in the plane.  These are the most uncomfortable "business seats" ever.  They are narrow and don't even lay out a normal angle for sleeping.  They were world class business seats 2 decades ago.  Why JAL would put this crap in a new plane is beyond me, but for an 11 hour flight it was torture.  The flight attendants smile alot but beyond that there is not much communication.  On the way home, delayed yet again, we had seats 1D and 1G.  These seats should be torn out, as inexplicably there is NO storage overhead whatsoever and since its a bulkhead, no place to put anything.  Ridiculous to have to fight with other passengers to put a bag overhead.  The food was not good and service uneven.  I have never seen flight attendants drop so many things. At one point a dinner roll went careening down the aisle.  The clanking and dropping of dishes in the galley was obnoxious for like 8 hours straight.  For all its faults, its back to Delta and flying through LAX for me.

title: Good service, comfortable seating
review_text: Attentive and friendly service and good selection of food and drink. Also good selection of in flight entertainment, and the Ramen were delicious!

title: smooth
review_text:
I enjoy flying with JAL, even on short flights like that. The whole experience was smooth and professional. Friendly check-in, hassle-free boarding, on-time departure. Not even much turbulance along the way. Arrived in Tokyo on-time and rested for my meetings.

In-flight service - a cup of apple juice. They don't have to provide it, but it is a nice touch. Got a nice big smile with mine, too.

title: Best Long Haul Economy Class
review_text: We booked this flight using 35K American Airlines miles each. You cannot book this flight on the AA website - you must call their reservation number. This is by far the best long-haul economy class I've ever flown. The leg room and seat width is excellent. Instead of 3-4-3 configuration on most airlines, JAL uses 3-3-3 on economy. My seat, 26H does not have a seat behind it so reclining does not bother anyone. The meals are excellent and the flight attendants are warm and friendly. I recommend ordering the SkyTime drink (it's made of Kiwi juice).

title: Roomy and comfortable
review_text:
Japan Airlines economy class was comfortable and roomy. For someone who is 6 feet and 210, I did not feel cramp. The check in process was fast and smooth. Their website is a bit difficult to navigate and slow. The flight attendants was helpful and pleasantly nice. They offer some of the latest blockbuster movies to watch in their in flight entertainments. The food overall was good. LAX, it’s LAX, not much can say with it. I did not sit in Premium Economy, but from looking at the seat, I did not think it is worth the price upgrade. Unless it is cheap upgrade, free, or if you want to sit toward the front of the plane, then it might be for you. 

They have a snack area you can get drinks and light snacks anytime you need. 

There is a USB port to charge your phone.

title: Excellent Customer Service and good comfort
review_text:
Even though I flew economy on this occasion on a B777-300 with 3-3-3 seating, I must say that the leg space for myself at 181cm was ample and I did not have the feeling of being squashed in. All flight were on time, food and beverga service was very good, with ample choice and tasty meals. Aircraft was clean and even after 12 hours, the toilets were more or less clean. In flight entertainment I would give 8 out of 10.
Before landing we received a "put it together yourself" Burger which was unexpectedly tasty!
I can highly recommend JAL.

title: Japan Airlines
review_text:
I had booked a round trip from New Delhi to San Francisco and back with a stopover in Tokyo on our return flight. I booked the flight economy class thinking I had a deal. Did not realise that one has to change airports Narita to Haneda , which involved getting transit visa and additional cost of changing airports with luggage. On adding up the costs it was expensive compared to other airlines. 
   Once I had booked my tickets it was impossible to contact the Japan airlines on phone. Also tried through an acquaintance in Japan he also could not contact the airlines on phone. I wanted to extend my stopover in Tokyo from 1 day to 3 days but could not contact the airlines through various means. 
   The flight was comfortable with good leg room. The food served was tasty, the flight experience was good.
... Anand

title: Great service
review_text: We was travelling from bkk to nrt the service was very nice during the trip for 7 hours. seat is comfortable clean inculding movie on borad

title: very good!
review_text: Always the same high-level of service. Flight attendants are well-trained to be friendly and attentive to passengers' needs.

title: A for In-flight Service Big F for Missed Connection Experience
review_text:
We were on a Japan Airlines flight to Narita from Vancouver recently. The in-flight service in the economy cabin  was  unquestionably better than most of the airlines we have experienced in our travels to Asia and Europe from North America. The cabin crew were so polite and courteous and the meals were outstanding.

Due to severe winds at Narita our flight was diverted to Haneda Airport and as a result we missed our connection to Singapore from  Narita. When we finally got to Narita, we had to line up for more than 4 hours to get another flight to  Singapore. We were tired, thirsty and hungry and only after some complaining we did get some water from the ground staff about 2 hours after we started waiting in line. Since our new connecting flight was some  12 hours away, we managed to get hotel accommodation from Japan Airlines. We could take a shuttle bus to go to the hotel but we were told that the airline policy was not to provide shuttle transportation from the hotel back to the airport and the airline would also not provide any meals. After some more complaining we were given 2000 yen for return transportation but we could not get any meal vouchers.  We  finally checked in at the hotel at 1:30 in the morning and everything was shut. We had to wait till early morning before we could get some snacks from a store outside the hotel. 

Obviously we can only blame mother nature for the inability to land at Narita on time to make our  connection but we think Japan Airlines  could have done more for the totally exhausted customers who had to wait in line for hours.

title: business class experience for JAL transpacific
review_text: The JAL business class check in at NRT airport very efficient and polite. The business class lounge great with some good food and drink. The boarding very smooth. The business class seat is not as good as JAL's oneworld partner American Airlines. The crews are very polite and helpful. I ordered Japanese food option, but in the end I got western option beef course as Japanese option run out. The beef is one of worst I ever had.

title: Very on time and great service
review_text: I'm a moslem with family, and request moslem meal on the board, the attendant serve us first compare to others, its great and the kids got a present from them, the plane touch down Narita on time.

title: First Class Business Class
review_text: I recently flew in JL 773 from Tokyo to Melbourne, and the comfort, food and beverage and service offered was outstanding. JAL is a great option for anyone travelling to or from Japan or Europe, as you can spend some time in Japan, which is a wonderful country. I would recommend Japan Airlines very highly, and they are a fantastic option if you are looking for a tier classy one airline.

title: Great service and hospitality
review_text:
My experience with JAL is always great. 

Last week, I took flight from Narita to Manila. I noticed today that I left my tablet PC in seat pocket by mistake. I thought it will never come back. 
However, when I called JAL, they quickly found my tablet!

The aircraft was also great. Latest aircraft, Boeing 787 is used for flight 741. Light adjustment is very smart, and I could rest very well although it was a short 4.5 hours flight. In-flight entertainment system was also great with lots of movie and music selections.

For meals, I could enjoy Japanese style delicious lunch and Hagen Daz ice cream as dessert. 

As OneWorld Sapphire member, I could also enjoy Sakura lounge service at Narita airport, where I could enjoy delicious breakfast buffet.

title: Premium economy ORD-SIN
review_text: I've made this trip on premium economy many times over the past 20 years or so, mostly on EVA. Decided to try JAL this time because of OneWorld status, and booked through AA. I rather wish I'd booked through JAL, because PE travelers have business lounge access both at ORD and NRT. I did not because I booked through American Airlines.  In addition, the gate crew at ORD was American Airlines, so of course they were abrupt, and boarding was confusing and ill-managed. The flight itself was great, other than the fact that I found the PE seat unusually uncomfortable compared to EVA, Qantas, Cathay, or Lufthansa, for example. It's one of those seats that slides forward in a shell to keep from invading the space of the person behind you, but I found that it placed the weight directly on my tailbone, which more than a week later is still aching. Food was ok but not great, and the selection of movies was fine without being outstanding.  I think in all all in all that I would not go out of my way to fly JAL in Premium Economy again, if there's a convenient Cathay or EVA flight.

title: Shaming
review_text:
Shaming company!! We are traveling one year using a Round the World ticket and after already flying more than 10 routes this year we just had the worst check in service in ours lives. After more than one hour waiting JAL people charged us in USD600 for ours surfboards here in Tokyo while other flight with JAL no charge was applied.  We are traveling with 2 luggage less than what we could have and it is just non sense to receive a charge like that and people behaving really bad. Someone need to change this rule and staff should focus on customer service not only playing the paper rules. WE WILL NEVER TRAVEL AGAIN WITH THIS COMPANY. 
Ps.: I am a sapphire customer!

title: Best airline in Japan but
review_text:
Voted as the best airline in Japan but I think it is still a grade lower than the top international airlines. 

-The Biz class seats are well designed but just a tad too narrow. Another 5 cm wider will be good.
-The food on the way to Tokyo was quite tasteless. I think the best is the ramen cup noodle :(. The food on the way from Tokyo was much better.
-Entertainment program was good with touch screen

title: Great flight with ample legroom and seat.
review_text:
T
First flight with JAL and I was quite happy with the service and the seat. The flight was 13hrs in a 777-300 ER. If anything the extra room made it unfamiliar to snooze but that is a personal thing. We had a meal on flight and two snack options for our 13hrs. There is a drinks and snack station for economy at the rear of the plane. There were 8 toilets available for economy. In flight entertainment was on par with other airlines but the software running the entertainment was fast. No delays when pressing your choices.

Overall I felt like premium economy but sitting in the cheap seats.

title: Best service for an Economy Class
review_text:
That was my 1st experience using JAL and I love this flight and the service. 

Comfort seat even in an economy Class and good service from the flight attendant. 

JAL Lavatory is not too small as a normally flight and they also serve a good flight meals. 

I Love JAL 

Note: This is a very late Flight review since Tripadv just asking me to write a flight review which my actually trip by JAL was on last Spring 2016 (CGK-NRT).

title: Excellent service
review_text: Traveling long distances is always very daunting. But our experience with Japan Airlines was excellent.  The service was really superb. It was very comfortable and the attendants were very efficient.. I would always consider JAL when traveling.

title: Great airline
review_text: The flight was very good and although we left New York 1 1/2 hours late due to the snow , the pilot made up most of the time on flight. I had a connection to Osaka and was able to make it. Flight attendants were courteous and put me at ease with the delay.

title: Great
review_text:
A pleasant flight, with very friendly cabin crew. This was a midnight take-off, and interestingly they didn't over-feed us like so many airlines do. My wife really enjoyed the Japanese style breakfast. I had the European breakfast and found the omelette very disappointing (read: didn't eat it) 

I am rating legroom as average below, simply because I am 195 cm tall and even in business I can never lie flat and be comfortable.

title: A truly First Class Experience
review_text:
A flawless experience from beginning to end.  The cabin has an intimate feel with only 8 seats.  On this flight, only 4 of the 8 seats were occupied making the flight attendant to passenger ratio 1:1

The seats are spacious and comfortable.  Not as private as Singapore, ANA or the Middle East 3 but still very nice for a 13-hour flight.  Food was excellent and always available. Wi-fi was complimentary for first class and fast enough to check e-mail and send texts.  Pajamas were offered but JAL typically keeps cabins at a warmer temp so I would advise bringing alternative sleep attire if you have difficulty sleeping in warm temps.

Overall a fantastic flight and wouldn't hesitate to fly JAL again.

title: Great airline that deserves to be one of the world's best
review_text: My first experience with JAL was very very positive. Flying every year on the long routes from Australia to Europe and having much experience with 5 stars Singapore Airlines, Cathay Pacific, Garuda, 4 stars Emirates, Oman Air, Vietnam Airlines, Thai Airways, Malaysia Airlines I would rate JAL services much better. They were good in everything starting from boarding till debarkation. It was amazing to see how efficient they were on boarding, for example. They reserved 30 minutes for it and finished 8 minutes earlier. It was the same on my connecting flight in Tokyo. Both flights departed earlier thanks to it and arrived to their destinations much earlier as well. All in-flight services were very good, the aircraft were new and very modern, the crew was very nice and responsive, the food was the best I have ever had on long flights. The aircraft cleanliness deserves a special mentioning. It was outstanding. It looked like the toilets, for example, were cleaned after every visitor. It is worth mentioning as well that they were in line with Japanese standards that was astonishing to see on the aircraft. I think that a small addition to in-flight amenities would make this airline even better that their 5 star competitors. What I missed on their flights were small things like night socks, air plugs, mouth wash, skin conditioner, razor and other accessories.

title: Best of Japan
review_text: Choosing the premium economy seats was probably the best decision we made for our trip to Japan. The seats were spacious and comfortable. Not to mention clean. We were thoroughly entertained by the movies provided on our personal tv screen. Food was good. The fligh stewardess made my kids very, very pleased by giving them a souvenior from JAL. And before giving my kids their drinks, the flight stewardess drew a Doraemon face on their cups. It made the children feel special. We had a delay in our flight and the ground staff of JAL handled the situation very well. I did not see one grumpy passenger. We had to take a connecting flight and I am pleased to say the quality of service is the same. Kudos to JAL for setting such a high standard for flying in comfort.

title: One World Airline with Japanese attention to detail
review_text: I actually made a round trip on JAL to Singapore and the year previous to Kuala Lumpur  the previous year. The airline went out of its way to make sure that my wife and I got seated together when there were problems with the reservation last year and gave us a free upgrade. This year they have had a meal upgrade in both premium economy and business. I would recommend that you give JAL a chance to serve you.

title: JAL has its Mojo Back
review_text:
Pleasant, smiling and courteous staff says it all. Couldn't have been more helpful at check-in nor more pleasant.
It's great to see how culture and training come together to give a flawless outcome.
The grooming of each staff member was super and customer service seemed uppermost.

title: The best!!!
review_text: When I fly, it is always with JAL or ANA. They are the best. Having researched them, I know about their unyielding commitment to absolute safety and perfect service. I heard later on that there was a CA who drank alcohol on the flight I was on, but i didn’t notice anything. That’s how good they are. So, if you have to pay an extra $270 to reschedule your flight last minute, that’s on you. Don’t blame the airline. Blame yourself for not planning properly and expecting somebody else to pick up the pieces. JAL is one of THE best airlines in the world.

title: Perfection in terms of comfort, friendliness. and service
review_text: I have never flown on JAL before, nor business class> Everyone was so helpful and kind- the accommodation was excellent, and the meals were truly unbelievably good. I slept well and was entirely relaxed- best flight ever!

title: very comfortable "full flat" sheet for business class
review_text: I could have very relaxing sleep on board with spacious full flat sheet for business class during my long flight over the pacific ocean.

title: Tip top service
review_text: This was my first trip to Japan with MH and returned Malaysia with JAL. The checked in process was easy and fast and we were offered the Sakura lounge prior to our 787 flight to Kul. We spent most time in the lounge and the foods offered was excellent. Boarding time was accurate and flight depart on time. The 787 business class has excellent hard products. Seat was spacious and comfortable together with some nice quality amenities. Cabin crews service were top notch and very caring to each business class passengers. We had a wonderful flight experience with JAL and will definitely try it again in future!

title: Just yes !
review_text:
We spent 10 hours on this flight in economy class.
The efficient at the gate was amazing. 
All staff in the plane was very friendly and helpful.They really went the extra mile to make the flight as enjoyable as possible, even if we were in economy. Food was actually very good. 
I would take JAL again in case I would go back to Japan.

title: 11 hours endurance plus a half hour
review_text:
I don't have a good physique,but the seat of economy class is tight and hard.
I'm a bit of a diabetic and on a restricted diet,but there was no food selection(I guess money might have solved this problem,but on-line booking i could find no option.).
At Haneda airport I had to wait may baggage delivered in over half hour,I know this no exceptional,but a series of misfortune made me sad and fed up.

title: All round ok experience, but a few disappointments
review_text:
As the title says, my JAL experience was ok - neither good nor bad. As a Premium Economy flight, it delivered the leg room, but the seat was not particularly comfortable, the pillow flimsy, my video system had a few problems, and I found the meals acceptable but uninspiring. 

I was hoping to start my trip with some Japanese inspired meals, but PE shares the same menu as Economy, and with Spaghetti Bolognese as the default main meal for one occasion, the menu was, overall, disappointing. They need much more of a Japanese theme to their meals.

There was no priority queue to board the flight, but to my surprise the ticket did include access to the Qantas Business Class Lounge in Sydney, which was a great start, as we felt very relaxed and somewhat privileged!

I'm not sure I'd fly JAL again, as it was clearly inferior to my PE experience with Cathay Pacific in late 2017.

title: Going the extra mile
review_text: I was flying home with my loved one who was receiving cancer treatment overseas and the flight staff were very attentive, listened to our concerns, and provided a special pillow to relieve his pain. At the end of the flight, several attendants came to say goodbye and well wishes, even gave us a special gift of origami crane necklace they handmade during the flight. Moved me to tears.

title: Best airline imo
review_text: One of the best airlines that I have used to fly to Japan. Price is reasonable, cabin crew friendly and welcoming. Food is good too. Nothing much to complain

title: Very enjoyable flight
review_text: Very good wine selection, good food presented with artistic flare, friendly and attentive crew, and excellent entertainment selection. Restrooms remained spot less during flight. Also flight offered an assortment of anytime meals in case you got hungry.

title: Really one of the best airlines there is
review_text: The staff was very kind and always happy to help and very profesional, diversity for the meals and also Japan is one of the most diverse countries.

title: Premium to Economy Seat
review_text:
I was on the premium economy seat to Tokyo for night flight, and wanted to see the differences, I booked for economy seat for morning flight to KUL from Tokyo and frankly speaking, it was as satisfied as the premium seat!

Although the seat was different and there was no extra amenities, the space was still big compared to other airlines economy seat (it was rated world first class economy seat) and one thing I couldn't forget is how amazing the meal was and we were given a cup of Haagen Dazs ice cream for dessert! Imagine when you finished your meal and expected nothing else but then you were given a cup of ice cream and everyone loves ice cream! I was enjoying the whole flight that I watched a few movies rather than taking naps till we reached KUL.

Certainly choosing this airline again for my next trip to Japan!

title: Premium Economy was truly a great experience!
review_text:
JAL offered few classes of seat and being curious with the premium economy seat, we booked for it for our night trip to Tokyo from KUL by paying a little bit more than the economy seat and the experience was great as you would have never expected for this class of seat and you get to enjoy the lounge service before the flight.

First we were seated before the economy seat rows, with bigger space, different seat, extra amenities (slippers/toothbrush/hair brush/eye cover) and we have already felt how premium it was. The flight crews were all really professional and they were smiling the whole time, I guess they have the best smile compared to other airlines. Not to forget, clean lavatories and it has a full body mirror inside.

Since it was a night flight, we slept all the way to Tokyo and to be honest, I wasn't even feeling tired or having body ache after the long flight and the seat must have contributed to this!

title: Excellent Airline
review_text: This is our 2nd time flying on JAL. In flight service is great. Hostesses are always waiting to help. We highly recommend this airline.

title: Great Airline!
review_text: very clean and sophisticated bathroom. huge extra leg even for the economy class, great foods, love it!

title: Excellent Airline
review_text: We travelled with JAL again after our last two trips to Japan because they were so good. This time we were going through to London as an experiment to see if it minimised jetlag. It did, and we hit the ground running in London. The second and third legs of our trip,Tokyo to London and return to Tokyo were also very good. The best thing, apart from the service on JAL, is their Premium Economy seats. They are in a shell so that you never lean back into someone else's space and they don't lean their seats back into yours.

title: Terrific economy, premium economy is not worth the cost
review_text: Flew JAL roundtrip JFK-SIN via NRT/HAN. Upgraded at JFK to premium economy for first leg, rest of trip was in economy. Service was generally excellent throughout the experience. Boarding was orderly, check-in counters efficient. Premium economy is not really worth the upgrade though. Food is a little better and you can have champagne, but the footrest of the seat is awkward. I could not find a good sleeping position at any point during the flight. JAL's regular economy has such generous pitch, comfortable seats, and good food that premium economy feels superfluous. I slept better in three legs of coach than one of premium economy.

title: Very good airline
review_text: The JAL lounge gets very busy in the hours prior to this flight leaving. I was annoyed when I requested use of a shower. I was was told there was over a 90 min wait for the showers which put the vacant time at the same time as my boarding. With 10 mind to go I enquired again and was now told that there was at least another 20 min wait. The member of staff running this apologised but offered no alternative. So I enquired at the front desk and they suggested I try the American Airlines lounge. So I rushed over there, found their lounge empty and was able to have a shower before my flight. Why did JAL staff not tell me of this option sooner. The flights themselves were good. I found the seat comfortable. I recommend odd row seats a and K as these are the good window seats. JAL use the BA lounge is Boston which was good. Funny that the jumper was offered on the day flight to Boston but not on the return flight from Boston. Ask and it might be offered. All flight crew were delightful.

title: VERY PLEASANT
review_text:
Their flight crew service is excellent.....the stewardesses are always polite, attentive and always serve with a smile not like other airlines. 
The check-in counter staff attitude to their work is excellent.

title: JAL 003 JFK-NRT
review_text: I am writing this as we're still over the Pacific as we were handed free wifi access codes when we took our seats. While it's not super fast, it's nice not be charged for it, especially when flying first class.  Check in at JFK was a breeze. Very friendly staff had us on our way in less than 5 minutes. She then walked us to a special lounge adjacent to security. There two helpful airport employees helped us remove our electronic devices and carried them to the front of the security line. A special TSA employee checked our passports an boarding passes. Not sure how this works- I guess the airline pays for this service. Shortly after take off we were given very comfortable pajamas and a nice amenity kit. The seats are wide and soft leather and will be made up into a bed anytime you request it. What was nice is they lay out a soft cushion and provide a down comforter. The lie flat bed is over 6 feet and I was able to stretch out very comfortably. The Japanese set menu for lunch was delicious. There were a number of small dishes followed by the main course and a wonderfully sublime dessert. The cabin staff is always smiling and are always ready to provide anything you want. The bathrooms are cleaned each time someone uses it. Overall, this has been a very positive experience.

title: Japan Airlines is worth it
review_text: For whatever reason Asian airlines are warm, compared to American airlines which are cooler. My mom was sweating like hell and felt somewhat miserable. My dad and I were fine though. The Wi-Fi sucked though

title: Thumbs up
review_text: I flew 3 times with Japan Airlines in a time frame of 3 weeks and all three flights were more or less on time. The crew was friendly and my luggage always arrived as well. All in all, this is everything one would hope when flying, so I'm satisfied with Japan Airlines' services and would definitely book again with them.

title: Good value for money
review_text:
A thumbs up to Japan Airlines for their service. We took the connecting flight: 
Singapore-Narita-San Diego. 
The check-in, baggage handling, information and flight was quite good. The seats in economy class are good value for money and cabin crew is soft spoken and well organized. The food served during the flights was of good quality. Their serving of ice-cream at the end of the meal was a good way to end the meal.

title: Business Class - Unexpected Service!
review_text:
From the moment you board and step on the plane, the level of service from JAL is like no other. The staff are willing to look after all your needs. The business class seats on the 787 dreamliner were comfortable and it was great to be able to lay flat. Plenty of dining choices and snacks available through the flight (I did not select a meal so can't comment on the food quality). 
In this instance it was cheaper to fly business compared to economy - so always check just in case! Well worth it as it was superior service!

title: Above expectations!
review_text: This is our second flight with JAL and again it has again met and exceeded all our expectations.  What a great airline.  We flew on the Dreamliner and loved the experience.  What makes this so special is the staff.  Wow! they go out of their way to make your flight as comfortable as possible.  Always courteous and friendly and very professional.  They seem to actually LIKE doing things for you!  So different from surly staff encountered on other flights.  Love this airline.  Even the ground crew wait in an  orderly line and bow and wave  you off as you taxi the tarmac!  Food isn't too  bad either and plenty of it.  We love the seats at the back near where the staff sit.  It's quiet and plenty of room to stand without disturbing anyone else.  We travel a lot and after this great second flight we will always look first to JAL before booking flights.  For long haul flights this is the airline to use! The only negative I can think of is if you need to call  JAL before your flight.  Beware of holding on for a long time whilst listening to the same repetitive music.

title: “Premium Economy” Seat Is Superb!
review_text:
The seat is wide and comfortable.  The toilets are clean and less occupied since the number of the seats is less than Economy Class.
The additional fare was approximately JPY40,000 (USD360) . This price is quite reasonable for this great facility for a long flight.

title: great flight
review_text: A friend recommended JAL, and they had a great price for my round trip.  The friendliness of all employees, the speed of checking in,and the great service on board made this a great experience.  Food was very good and filling, seats were well padded and good leg room, and they left and arrived on time.  Stewardesses were ready to answer any questions, solve any problems.  Lots of programs, movies, etc to watch and keep entertained. This is now one of my two favorite international flights out of the seven I have flown for the last 6 years.

title: Loved flying JAL again
review_text:
This airline is a reflection of the country. Everything is done right, service is great, everything is clean, and you feel like a guest instead of a burden. The seats are comfortable with adequate leg room, inflight entertainment worked and was abundant, and the food was good with a choice of Japanese or Western food.

Check in and boarding went smoothly with no problems. Flight attendants are friendly and are there to help. It was a long flight made easier by this excellent airline.

title: Like the nation
review_text: If you are the kind of person(westerner) whof likes working in Japan or enjoys their culture of courtesy. Growing up partly in Canada a country of friendly folks who do take a bit of pride in their ability to be polite. Japan is the level up the airline even when faced obnoxious abusive beligerante and wrong customers they remain professional composure the, how I don't know. the gate staff in flight is love they offer japanese and western food take some pride in presentation. attentive staff actively seeking your comfort. It's not a luxury airline but they do try to make you think it is with service. Flown several times around Asia to and from Japan. good clean effective efficient.  All spring to mind. value for money I miss Japan so much. sumiming up flown more than a dozen times 100% positive experience can't sayou that about my favoured most flown top 2 in airmiless Virgin who have been pretty good practice 1

title: Amazing service
review_text:
Cabin crews were very patient and helpful, would come and check if we need any assistance with our child. 
Food and beverage was wonderful.

title: Business class Tokyo to Sydney JL771
review_text: This flight was in a smaller Dreamliner which had 38 Business seats.  There’s nothing wrong with the sky suites but what was evident today was that there’s not enough rest rooms for business passengers in this configuration.  Instead of the usual 3, there was only 2. It was disappointing as the lack for need to queue for restrooms is the reason I fly business.  Bad move!

title: Basic Economy
review_text:
This was my first long haul flight and it was a great experience. They made sitting on a plane for almost 11 hours as comfortable as possible. There was a decent amount of leg room, a foot rest, and great in-flight entertainment. The food was beautifully presented and delicious. My husband had to have the low salt meal, which was even better than what I had!
Baggage allowances were generous as well. 2 free checked bags and a carry on (plus personal item) were allowed, spirits were offered at no extra charge, and there was a small snack station on the plane. 
A blanket and neck pillow were great for my attempt at sleep, but I can never rest while I'm flying! I did appreciate being able to get cozy!

title: Amazing Airline
review_text: One of the best airlines in the world and I have traveled for over 35 years. Even if you are seated in economy, you are treated like a guest. From the moment you check in until you get off the plane, you matter to JAL.

title: Best baby friendly airline - loving it
review_text:
It was a excellent flight with JAL - I am not a good traveler when it comes to airport and airplane I have my phobia.  But I took a promise to be brave when my child was born that I will try my very best to take her on holiday as much as I can.

I felt safe and comfortable .. thumbs up

title: The new Boeing Dreamliner is a dream!
review_text: "Hand over foot" -you can actually stretch out your hands and feet- the Boeing Dreamliner is the best I have traveled in. Beats the 747 by a mile. The self dimming windows are a great invention, and the business class seats are comfy. Food between LA and Japan could have more selections for non seaweed lovers. Staff were exceptionally nice. This was an American Airlines code share. One note: Business Class was not available on the PHX-LA route, and the 737 was dirty, every seat taken, smelly, ich! We paid $8k for the round trip, and the AA agent told us we did not "pay enough" for business class on the PHX to LA segment. Poor customer policy.

title: Children are happy with their small gifts onboard.
review_text: Food are ok.  Fare is reasonable.  On board entertainment is sufficient. Children （below 12 years old) are happy with their on board gifts-- especially the cutlery set...

title: Full service
review_text: JAL people are respectful.  I fell asleep and they tagged me and offered my meal when I awoke.  And that's great service, in economy.  In addition, the leg room was sufficient for my height, 5'10.  Tho the width of the seats are typical, narrow.   The movies are current, I caught up with some great ones.

title: Secrets of Japan
review_text: Excellent, friendly and helpful staff, from check-in at Melbourne all the way during the flight and until we landed in Japan.  Our seats were Premium Economy which were very comfortable and even Economy looked pretty good.  Not as tight or as many seats as per other airlines.  They even gave us "travel goodie bags" during the flight with tasty snacks in them.  Slippers were comfy for the flight as were the blankets and pillows.

title: comfortable flight..good flight attendants ready to help
review_text: only if they could be more trained to know english !! Also food quality needs to be upgraded specially for Indian Food !!

title: Japanese Service In The Air
review_text: It's been at least 10 years since i had last flown Japan Airlines.  The business class fare were very reasonable so i decided to give it a try.  Not the newest business class seats but in terms of service, food and amenities all up to today's standards.  First i would like to mention the warm and friendly greetings. For amenities i love the cabin slippers and in the washroom love the individual mouth wash packets.  Oral care is so important when traveling. The drink menu was my highlight with sake's and umeshu as options and for dining i opted for Japanese cuisine presented beautifully.  A great way to travel to Japan.

title: Love it
review_text: The best staffs, very friendly and very very accomodating. Love the food, super delicious. Chair was roomy and entertainment on tv was great. Ontime and love the boarding process. Can't wait to fly to this airline again in February of next year!

title: Not flown yet, but amazing Business Class Avios deals
review_text:
Not flown yet but amazing Business Class deals on BA.com using BA Avios booking 11 months ahead. JAL offers reward seats to other OneWorld partner FFs. Flat beds in JAL 767 suite, 11 flying hours, Honolulu to Narita for just 60,000 Avios and $70 one-way. Also Kyoto to Shanghai J-class, 3 flying hours for 15,000 Avios and $50. 
Cash price ticket OSA-PVG without Avios is eye-wateringly expensive one-way for such a short very popular international flight.

title: Brilliant first flight with Japan Airlines
review_text: This was our first experience flying with JAL and it was wonderful. The food and service in first was superlative. It was intuitive service where your wish was anticipated before having to ask. I travel often with BA first class, but this is a much better product. I will definitely fly with JAL again. Great airline and service.

title: Wonderful experience
review_text: After a smooth check-in at the counter, I spend sometimes in the Sakura JAL Lounge. It may be a bit difficult to find. Following the sign get me lost. The lounge is quite big and is divided into several sections. Those who love window seats may enjoy the window counter seating that has an awesome view of the runway. For those who'd like to do some work, a photocopier machine and other facilities provided. There is also a room for reclining chairs. Smoking room is also available. Food is properly prepared and presented and is tasty enough to fill you up before boarding the plane. Drinks (soft drinks, wine, beer, tea, coffer) are served. Staff at the gate are very efficient. The flight departs and arrives on time. The flight is pleasant, seat is clean, comfortable, equipped with necessary facilities. Legroom is great too. Staff are nice, courteous and willing to help. Meals are ok, not that great but well presented. The amenity kit is average though.

title: Great airline!
review_text: My husband and I recently flew JAL for the first time and we plan on using them again in the future! Our trip was to Saigon from San Diego and from there we flew to a few other countries on a budget airline. I think that helped us really appreciate JAL. Their service was wonderful. The seats and legroom were pretty standard and I believe two of our flights were delayed but I think the good service helped me look past all of that. I loved our food on the flight to Asia and the food on the flight back wasn't bad either. They have young chefs that create the meals and they include a little bio about these emerging chefs with the meals which I thought was a nice little touch. I've flown Singapore Airline for a flight to Asia before and that was obviously top notch but I would say this is a good second place.

title: More Agony with JAL
review_text: JAL has serious problems. We arrived at Haneda via Qantas to onwardly fly with JAL to London. However JAL refused to recongise my Qantas issued Business Class tickets to allow access to the JAL Lounge (even though we were flying Business Class with JAL to London!!). Unbelievable.  Similar to my previous report - JAL cannot be trusted and don't bother trying to argue with JAL airline staff whose English is quite poor and obviously do not understand the real meaning of honouring code-share partners as part of their One World partnership. I am guessing we will have the same problems all the way home again - jiggidy-jig-rigged !  Off to have another arguement with JAL about my return flights ... wish me luck!

title: Another Good JAL flight
review_text: JAL operate 787's  which are comfortable and clean on the Tokyo Sydney route. This flight departed and arrived on time, the staff were the usual very pleasant Japanese ladies who smile and go out of their way to assist. The meal was good  but not always up to Business standard on some other more competitive routes.

title: Best airline in the world -- but -- check your fare type (even non-code share) if you value choosing your seat
review_text:
I hope that this review helps you because it contains information that I wish I had read prior to flying with JAL, which I have decided is the best airline I have ever flown with, despite a lot of difficulty at first concerning being seated with my spouse for a very, very long flight, from San Francisco to Haneda, Tokyo to Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam, and back. 

I booked on JAL's website, full-price for two economy seats, not on a code share. At the end, I expected to be able to select seats, but I was not given this option. This is not too uncommon for American carriers. Often you have to wait until 72 hours or however long to select them online. But because my husband has a painful medical condition which required him to be on medication while flying, I wanted to be seated next to him to be able to assist him with coping. He is fine to fly, medically, but his condition does require meditation and coping skills, which I have been trained to assist him with, and again, requires that he be on medication, so he is a little "out of it" when he flies. We picked JAL for our first long flight due to its outstanding reputation. However, we are not wealthy people, so we had no real choice except to fly economy.

JAL wound up being a FANTASTIC airline. But their customer service phone line and seat selection is horrible, and we will fly with them again in the future because we intend to go to Japan and several other places in Asia, especially after he found the flight tolerable for his condition. But I will get to the good part of the review AFTER the more negative and frustrating part.

So, after I had entered my credit card information, I was unable to select seats for us. As anyone would, I immediately called their phone number, which in the U.S. entailed waiting and waiting and waiting for many hours, dropping connection several times, and taking days to get through. I considered cancelling the flight but felt with JAL's reputation that once we reached someone, it would be resolved. Finally, I did reach a customer service person on the phone, and I was told I could check in prior to the flight, online, 72-hours in advance, and we could get seats together. I briefly mentioned a medical issue being the core of my concerns, but I did not belabor it, simply trusting in the process and reputation of the airline. 

72 hours prior to the flight, I logged in and was unable to select seats still. I again called JAL's customer service number, and I received the information that it was 24-hours in advance, and to be sure to log in to the moment. I queued up to log in to the website, which was extremely complicated to use, with many different pages nested strangely, but I managed to log in within one minute after 24 hours, and there were no two seats next to one another. We had been seated separately. My spouse began to have a tremendous amount of fear and to suggest cancelling the entire three-week, pre-paid vacation to Vietnam. I called again to the JAL customer service number, again waited (in total, I believe I called and waited for about 7 hours over about five months to JAL's customer service people). I finally got through to a representative who said there was nothing he could do, he was terse, and he said we should arrive at the airport early. 

We live almost three hours from the airport, but we arrived four hours early anyways. There was a customer service agent at the check-in counter for JAL, fortunately, but she was unable to assist and said she could only "make a recommendation." We waited in the line so that we were first to check-in for another hour, and then the next customer service agent said the flight was overbooked, and she could not assist either, but to ask at the gate. At this point, my spouse looked like he was not going to get on the flight at all, but he soldiered onwards. I was so profoundly disappointed that nothing we had done had helped us simply get seats next to one another so that I could comfort him during a painful, stressful time. At boarding, they again could not assist us, and so we boarded the flight in separate cabins. 

I found myself in a middle, side seat next to what appeared to be two fairly young people, perhaps college aged, and I wound up asking the young man next to me if he would switch seats for a price, and what price it would be, and I said I would with extreme sincerity that I would not be upset if he said no because it was a long (11 hour) flight. He said for $200, he would allow my husband to sit in his seat, so I gave him $200, and they switched. I think that was a fair price. I would have been happy to give it directly to JAL, but they did not allow us to upgrade or anything. 

My husband found his condition considerably less painful than expected, much to our tremendous joy! And he enjoyed the flight. He loved JAL as did I. We flew from SFO-Haneda-HCMC and then from Hanoi-Narita and took the limo bus to Haneda-SFO, so that's quite a lot of flight time with JAL. We enjoyed every moment with them, and my husband found his medical situation tolerable for a flight of this length! So we will assuredly be taking more JAL flights, and we even signed up as members. 

I asked, finally, why we couldn't switch flights since I could not find anything online about this except for people using miles or on codeshares, and I wanted to avoid the problem in the future. The JAL in Tokyo easily explained that the economy flight we selected was something called N-class, a term I don't exactly know or understand, but it must have mentioned it to me somewhere during my booking and meant nothing to me at all since it's not a familiar code. So my review is to let you know a few things, as a traveler:

1.) If you want to sit together for a flight, do not book N-class flights on JAL -- not only can you not change your seat, you also cannot even upgrade

2.) JAL has serious customer service problems on their phone lines in the US and have room for improvement there

3.) Take JAL anyways! I always fly economy, I always hate flying, and JAL is absolutely the best airline I have ever taken. The food is amazingly good with a wide and changing menu plus great drinks and everything is free, the staff on-board are incredibly nice and professional, the seats are comfortable and large, even in economy, the in-flight entertainment is excellent, with top U.S. films that change regularly, they give you real pillows and blankets, the captains were kind and present upon boarding, the actual boarding process was a breeze, the airport at Haneda is easily my favorite airport in the world due to the great shopping, food, and concept in pre-boarding, and Narita is also an incredible hub with a train station to Tokyo or Narita right underneath and luggage check (everyone is so kind and friendly and helpful), and the entire plane is comfortable and classy and clean, with a large percentage dedicated to sleeping seats. It felt like luxury, or maybe just civility, to be able to fly this way, as though we were flying back in the early 80's when airlines still took a sense of pride in their work as more than just cattle cars. 

But I will find a way to ever avoid N-class tickets again. I don't quite understand yet what these are, but I will be Googling soon. 

Also, avoid the bassinet row. That's where we sat, a few rows behind the bassinets, which is where they (wisely) offer families with young babies seating. 

On the way back from Hanoi, incidentally, there was no way at all to check in online for anyone in economy, but in that case, we arrived to the airport four hours early again, and we got the best economy seats on the plane since we were first. In the U.S., being first did not assist at all.

I believe that they always do put families together? That seemed their priority. A grown husband with a medical condition who was still cleared to fly seemed a little harder to explain the urgency about. But all's well that ends well. We are now JAL members! And if you can afford the lie-down seating, I would take that, although I didn't find much difference that I could see between priority-economy and economy (we flew in economy).

I do sincerely hope they improve their phone customer service and website; both are beneath the status of this carrier.

title: HAPPY JAL!
review_text: Few airlines can perform both with “great service and on-time departure and arrival”. Online check-in really helps ease up the line and the stress for travelers. The meal is far best compared to all economy airlines servicing same routes. Absolutely the best service over-all and will definitely fly again with JAL!

title: Best airline I experience so far
review_text:
This was my first time with JAL. I was deciding between ANA and JAL but eventually decide to give this national airline a try. It did not disappoint me. First, the service was as good as Or even better than SQ. Secondly, they were extremely caring and customer centric. Mine was a midnight flight and my experience with other airline was meal served after two hrs regardless of the timing. But JAL only served small snack after we come aboard and served breakfast two hr before landing. This allowed the passenger to get enough sleep. I must commend their seats - more spacious than many other airlines. It was comfortable but only thing is their cushion was a bit hard.

When we reached Tokyo for a domestic transit, we just need to deposit the checked in luggage after we cleared the custom. And the luggage can be picked up at your destination airport. Very customer centric and make it convenient for us.

I will go for JAL from now onwards whenever I am travelling to Japan.

title: Best Flight
review_text: Booked flight with JAL and as no direct flight from Manchester they arranged for a Finnair flight to Helsinki (which was fine)to connect with JAL flight to Tokyo. The service was above and beyond the usual economy flight. The Air Stewardesses  worked hard all the way through the flight making sure everyone was looked after. The plane was spotlessly clean.
