Food, drink, snacks  and entertainment were very good. Would definitely fly with them again.

title: redemption
review_text: this was my first time on JAL since I had a negative experience. They well and truly redeemed themselves. Seats are comfortable with lots of leg room. Nice food, they had a menu which was created by young Japanese chefs. Cabin Crew were so helpful. The only negative was that the in-flight entertainment didn't change at the end of the month, so the selection was the same in both May and June

title: Be extra careful with your luggage!!
review_text: Be extra careful with your luggage! Two expensive backpacks were soaked wet with fishy smell liquid which ended up damaging our personal belongings, gifts and souvenirs. Japan Airlines will not assist with your losses, if it does not fit perfectly in their description of luggage damage policy. According to the JAL representatives, there are many passengers transporting undeclared products such as, fish and seafood that can cause this type of big problem in your trip. Be prepared to protect your valuables! No wonder why they emphasize waterproof luggage in the Japanese stores when buying a new bag.

title: Best experience..
review_text: This was our first time flying premium economy and it was worth every cent. Entry to the lounge made the start to our trip much more pleasant. The seats and the screen were very large and there was a leg rest that came out to support your calves and also a foot rest. There was a reading light in the seat and the entertainment was good. The staff were very polite and friendly and the toilets were the largest I'd seen on a flight. We were given a snack bag with chips, water, a pastry and a tim tam as well as the usual amenities pack. I would definitely fly with JAL again.

title: Wonderful Service
review_text:
This entailed two flights. One from Helsinki to Tokyo(Narita Airport) and the other onto Sydney. Both flights are over 9 hours long with a 10 hour layover at Narita. Overall quite a long and tiring flight from start to finish.
JAL is a wonderful airline. Very punctual and the Hostesses cannot do enough for you. Food is either Japanese or Western and quite filling. Planes are spotless.
Definitely recommend

title: Just amazing
review_text: Thank you FF miles....it was absolutely amazing...The flight was good...I expect that regardless of class...However 1st class on JAL is wonderful..The seats are wonderful.  You "bed" is made up with a nice mattress, Amenities are very nice, the service is superb...and the food and drink is better than superb.  They pride themselves on the food...with good reason...This flight made the trip..Thank you JAL...

title: Very Disapointed with Business Class. Other Airlines were much better
review_text:
We chose this flight after much reviews. 1) This was the only non-stop flight. 2) Haneda Airport is much closer to Tokyo. 3) We were able to get reward miles with a partner airline (Jet Blue). Hopefully this will materialize. 4) Somehow we assumed JAL had a great reputation. 
Now for the complaints. We generally fly business class when it is a long flight. We can compare this to past flights. The flight was delayed 6 1/2 hours and we were not informed. Japan Airlines does not have it's own well stocked business class lounge in JFK. This was totally unexpected. The lounge was overfilled and we went to another lounge at the airport. The design of the business class seats were designed after a rectangular casket with a hard floor. They ran out of food. Seems as though I am whining but it was not worth the extra expense and could have done better.

title: Sky Premium
review_text:
I was very lucky to be up-graded to Premium Economy on the return flight from Japan on the 787-8 (dreamliner) 
I had traveled over in Economy on a brand new Boing 787-9, and I was very impressed, it was very comfortable with good food & the usual great service from JAL.

But the Sky Premium was just a notch above in both the seat & level of service, & i would be more than happy to travel on either.

title: First class service  but i economy
review_text: Whenever I have flown domestic services in Japan JAL is the one to choose.  First class service and extremely efficient embarking and disembarking procedures.

title: A Good Flight
review_text: The flight was on a  new 787 and was a good example of how JAL runs their airline. Staff were pleasant and courteous, the meal as good as it gets on aircraft these days and the flight arrived on time. Baggage always comes out fast. A good airline.

title: Excellent business class
review_text:
Flight left at midnight which is not great but the meal was light and just right.
Breakfast into Narita was tasty.
Service is restrained and polite in Japanese way but excellent.
Will use them, again.

title: Flight from US to Toyko Narida
review_text: New 787 12 hrs in the air and service was great...like a previous reviewer  mentioned...one of the best international flights I have ever had!!! If you are taking a cruise out of Yokohama, best to fly into Haneda Airport ( much closer but this was booked through Holland America and the price was much less!.

title: Good experience
review_text: The flight was very good as was the return leg from Narita to Bangkok. Good service, reliable and new B787 planes on both legs. Food was also OK as far as airline food goes.

title: The best flights I have had!
review_text: Recently flew premium eco return to Tokyo. Staff fantastic...food good...seats excellent...airport lounges great....especially at Narita. I have even decided if i fly to Europe again I'll go via Tokyo on JAL. (PS: I have flown business class and even Ist...on Emirates...last year to Paris...they managed to lose my luggage in Dubai and not even an apology!!!!) Yes..it was all very luxurious, but you can't beat JAL Premium for value for money!!!!

title: The best international flight I've had taken in years
review_text:
The flights from NRT to CGK and back were nice and uneventful. The planes were pretty new and the staff.... very good service, even in Couch/Economy. I was told that JAL is the only airline that offers UMESHU for free, that is Plum wine. I tried it and loved it. The food was surprisingly good and I enjoyed them and the snacks too.
I used the wi-fi and thoroughly enjoyed the entertainment selections. Can't expect anything better than my flights with JAL. Loved it and will fly it again soon!

title: Delayed, but well compensate.
review_text: Our flight was suppose to be on 10.50 am, Tokyo time. But by the time we were checked in on 9am, we were informed that the flight was delayed for 4 hours, and we were given meal coupons as compensation. After we dropped our baggage, we spent the time to travel to the Narita city, visiting the shrine. Then we returned to Narita airport to have lunch using the coupons. The departure was on time as per delayed ETD. The flight was nice, and the food was also okay. We travelled with our 1 year old baby, so we specially ordered a bassinet for her. All is good. no complain.

title: Seating space is very generous at Economy Class
review_text:
1. Seat space is very generous for me 1.6m height, 1.65 height for my husband and my 3 year old can sleep comfortably head on my lap and feet on my husbands lap =)
2. Food is great
3. No delay~

title: The little things
review_text:
Always flew Delta whenever we flew from Ph to US (via Narita), but tried JAL because they had a direct Narita-San Diego flight instead of Narita-LA-San Diego. Seating space was slightly more comfortable. Food was a little more palatable than what I'm used to, and they offered more choices on the tray. There were less English movie choices but it was interesting to watch the Japanes movies. 

Overall, its the little things that made this flight more comfortable than my usual flights. I liked the array of pockets in front where I can store water, gadgets and magazines separately. Service was lovely. Flight attendants were always nice and respectful despite the long flight. Best of all, bathrooms were remained pristine even at the tail end of the flight, with toothbrushes and ammenities laid out of you inside. Will definitely book JAL next time I fly west coast

title: Bows and smiles at 36,000 feet.
review_text:
From the time you approach the check-in area, a personal assistant greets you and takes you through the check-in process. Each question is greeted with a bow.
The boarding area was thickly packed with people. Attendants walked through the crowd with signs in three languages to inform us of which rows were boarding and when making the entire process stress free. 
On the plane, the overhead bins can swallow lots of carry-ons. the seats were modern, comfortable, blankets, pillows, and noise-reducing headphones were all standard.
I flew on American Airlines and we were packed like sardines. Airbus is the right term as you need to bring everything you want on the plane. JAL provides it all.
Foodservice you get a choice of a Japanese meal or a western meal along with complimentary alcoholic beverages. This is definitely the way to fly. 
The choice of movies was astounding as well as games, music and tv shows.
Go Japan Airlines. 
The flight attendants bow each time you ask a question. They show up within 15 seconds of pushing the call button. ( The lady next to me used this service quite a bit).
They are in a league of their own.

title: LONG FLIGHT MADE EASY !
review_text: Although a very long flight, I was pleased with the comfort of my seat.  Flight attendants were well organized and service was excellent.

title: Loss & found
review_text:
We flew Jal 35 from haneda to Sg Changi on 20 may 18.

My wife lost her glass case on plane. We wrote to JAL cust service. They responded swiftly and advised us they have found the lost.

We collected the lost case in Sg JAL. Thumb up JAL !!!

Cheers,
Adam Nic
Singapore

title: Jal services
review_text:
JAL gives us a not so nice in online reservation at first. We might have make an error even we have selected gender male but thought it should auto populated as Mr. but required to select respectively.

It took us $60 to make changes from Ms. to Mr. to reflect it correctly on my boarding pass. This has to go through via email and phone call to make this small change. We believed this needed to be improved in term of online application system should auto once we have choosed correct gender.

Nevertheless, JAL boarding check in counter was a hassle free with quick n tip top check in services. Plane services was great too.

Still will select JAL as an air carrier to Japan.

Cheers,
Adam Nic
Singapore

title: On time, many new entertainment movies
review_text: That's quite good there are so many new arrivals of the entertainment movies. And every time depart - arrival time is on time!

title: Love JAPAN AIRLINES
review_text: My husband and I have flown JAL from Perth to Sapporo and return for several years now and have no complaints. We usually fly Qantas from Perth/Sing – Sing/Perth and I can honestly say that there’s a significant difference in leg room. Price wise we choose JAL due to the luggage allowance (2 pc @ 26kg checked plus  7kg carry on - a no brainer since we take our own ski gear). We like the large variety of food although the actual food service is somewhat slow due to their attentiveness of each customer. The staff are kind, friendly and helpful.

title: JL772 Business Sydney to Tokyo Narita
review_text:
Absolutely great schedule leaving Sydney at 8.10am and arriving at around 5pm in Narita.  Great timing because you can connect to onward flights or do a stopover in Narita.  Very nice cabin service although a huge imbalance of men and women in the business cabin - very few women were in the cabin making me want to pull my screen up and invoke my privacy option. Japanese men slurp their noodles and soup,  -  be warned.  
However this is a very good value flight. Recommended.

title: Tokyo Narita to Boston JL8 Business seat 2A
review_text:
I sat in SkySuite 2A next to the window on this particular JAL flight. SkySuites afford good privacy when the dividing screen is up. This was particularly important on this flight as I was astonished to be just 1 of 3 women amongst more than 30 male travelers in this cabin and therefore valued the privacy.  I also thought that the flight attendants pandered to the male passengers or maybe it was because they were more demanding.
I was thankful that the privacy factor was so good in this aircraft configuration, and I really like the personal suite entry “ corridor” meaning there are no legs to step over.
Having used JAL Business many times over the years my only other disappointment is their menus which always consist of a “Japanese” or “Western” menu.  The choice rarely deviates from fish or beef which I find monotonous.
However, this airline has an impeccable schedule. It has the ability to depart an airport up to half an hour late yet arrive at its destination on time.  I also find all their schedules socially friendly and connect well.  Their prices too are good value against the top tier airlines yet seat and cabin comfort is in many cases, superior.
Excellent comfort and value.

title: Service
review_text: My passport fell out of my pocket while I slept and disappeared under my seat. The purser and all her staff were very helpful trying to locate it while we were flying but it took very prompt support from a technician, who  dismantled the seat within minutes of landing to find it. Great service

title: Travel in comfort
review_text:
I’m someone who doesn’t like flying or airports so travelling business class is a must on long haul flights. Though I’ve flown many times this was my first on Japan airlines and I was pleasantly surprised. There was more storage than most other airlines and seemed more space maybe because of better design.
The cabin crew were first class and the inflight meals were excellent for dining in transit.  The whole experience had a fresh feel as some other well known brands are getting a little tired and it shows.

title: Attentive service, no ice cream from special meals.
review_text: Great crew, very professional and friendly. They worked hard from the start of the flight until the end. However, for those passengers who order special meals they will not get the ice cream. The airline attendants will hand the ice cream to only passengers who requested normal meals. I did not like this, and a couple of passengers became upset with the ice cream issue. Perhaps JAL should come up with a better way to distribute the ice cream. Aside from that and horrible turbulence that lasted nearly four hours, the airline is worth the money.

title: Simply the Best!
review_text:
I've been to Asia many times over the years and knew what the long flight entails. 
My wife has never been that far on a plane and wasn't sure what to expect after 24 hours of flying time. She was very impressed! 
We selected the Premium Economy seating for the full round trip. 
The seats were very spacious and comfortable. 
We had over 100 movies to choose from, plenty of music choices along with games to keep us entertained on the screen as well. 
The cabin attendants to me are the very best in the business. They're always smiling and super polite. Even after 12 hours into the flight, they all were very pleasant and happy to serve. 
This is how an airline should treat their customers.
All of the food options were great too!
Traveling by plane is no longer enjoyable as in years past and can be very stressful. However, Japan Airlines has giving me hope that there is still a friendly and comfortable way to fly out there.
Other airlines should follow their lead.
If I could give six stars...I would.
Simply the best!

title: Any other choice?
review_text: Nice and friendly service, good video device, delicious food and comfortable seat. Are there any other choces? I think the answer is No.

title: Great Service!
review_text: The flight going over was on American Airlines. Nothing special, typical AA service.  The return flight was JAL.  Seats were wider and more leg room.  Flight Attendant service was excellent.

title: JAL Premium Economy Flight
review_text: Roomy seats, great movie selection. Only advice is don't rely solely on the meals they serve. Some really weird meals. I would pack my own before. The lounge in Tokyo was great so eat there but the lounge at JFK was the Air France Lounge which was a complete embarrassment.

title: Babes in flight
review_text:
I was tired and was looking forward to a rest on my trip home. Then the guy next to me sits down with a 'babe in lap'. Great. Well I was lucky in that this was the best behaved babe on the flight, in that he whined a couple of times, for a few seconds until dad gave him what he wanted. And a few times his foot 'relaxed' and fell on my seat, then dad pulled it back. Like I said, I was lucky that this babe sat next to me as he actually didn't bother me at all. I am glad I wasn't sitting next to the two or three other babes on the flight that were bothering me. For a good portion of the flight it seemed they were tag teaming so at least one of them was crying.

Also, I am more comfortable not reclining my seat, and when the seat in front of me is reclined, I found it hard to focus on the tv screen, as it is too close to my face.

title: Nowhere for my feet
review_text:
I have flown on many different airlines, and different types of planes. I must say that this 787 had very little room for my feet, under the seat in front of me, because the electronics box for my entertainment screen took a generous portion of the room for my feet. There was plenty of room for my legs, but not for my feet. Other than that, I thought the flight was very good.
I would think that this was a 787 thing, and not a Japan Airlines thing.

title: Attentive
review_text: It was around 2 hours no snacks plenty of offers for beverages but for a 2 hour flight an option firs acts would have been great staff attentive

title: Horrible ground service
review_text: Time and time again we were impressed flight service but yet always treated pretty horrible by JAL ground staffs. Whilst some a friendly most of the time , we get snobbish , slow moving stone faced ladies. This time served by a lady named Kobuchi who spent lengthy minutes rechecking our travel documents like we were criminals. Been to japan 20 times and immigration is always a breeze . JAL please train your staff on international travel documents and some.manners if they wish to thorough in their checks. This is my last  JAL flight.

title: Overnight direct to Japan
review_text: The service and food were exceptional. Getting on, in Melbourne, after midnight, the main idea is to sleep and wake up refreshed in Tokyo.

title: Flight JL 784 (Japan Airlines)  from Tokyo to Honolulu with Excellent Service
review_text:
I took the Flight JL 784 with Japan Airlines (JAL) from Tokyo, Japan [Narita International Airport-(NRT)] to Honolulu, Hawaii (HI), [Daniel K. Inouye International Airport, Honolulu] in March 2018, with a Boeing 767-300 (in a 2+3+2 seating configuration) and the flying experience was a very positive one.
The flight was long haul (about 7 hours) and  the flight attendants provided excellent service [served meal and  also generously coffee, snacks and beverages / alcoholic drinks (free of charge)]. The given amenities were very satisfactory.
The seats were very comfortable having enough legroom (SKY JAL WIDER-increased seat width) to make the journey really nice and enjoyable.
Japan Airlines (JAL) is a member of the One World Airlines Alliance, considered to be one of the best airlines in the world and has gained the recognition of customers, collecting many awards and accolades over the years [e.g. for 2018, JAL has been voted Asia’s Leading Airline 2018, Asia’s Leading Airline for Economy Class (2018), for Business Class (2018), and also for First Class (2018), etc.] and continues to enhance the quality of the services provided.
I enjoyed my flight with Japan Airlines from Tokyo and Honolulu and I will fly again in the near future, if the opportunity arises.

title: Fitz trip to Tokyo
review_text: We always travel JAL when traveling to either the UK or Europe for a few reasons JAL service is always excellent, the on time commitment for the majority of times is achieved, you can Break your trip at an airport hotel with a good nights sleep, meal thrown in on the ticket price and JAL is still the cheapest business class fare. I have been flying for over 15 years with JAL and would recommend the air line to anybody.

title: Good flight with great service
review_text:
JAL experience was all good and better than BA with whom we flew home. The JAL was code share so good opportunity to compare. We had seat allocation at booking and on check in were given lounge access. An unexpected bonus. New seats in premium economy were good and new reclining system excellent. Food was reasonable but not fantastic but service from crew was excellent.
Good flight.  Haneda is also much better to fly into with monorail and train access to Tokyo much quicker than Narita.

title: Consistent Experience
review_text: I have flown this route many times.  Japan Airlines provides a consistent experience in both their hard product (seats, meals) and very helpful attitude of their employees.  The seats in business class for this short flight (about 4 hours) are not lie flat and the window seats do not have direct aisle access.  Typically these aren’t problems for a short flight.  The boarding process was a stress free experience.  On this particular flight there were high winds at Narita forcing multiple landing attempts.  The pilot informed us of this possibility shortly after takeoff.  It was useful to know this in advance.

title: WOW
review_text: While we had some language problems with the flight attendants, they went out of the way to help.  While most airlines have a 24 hour window for special meals JAL is 72, however, AA sent a note to JAL and JAL came through.  The flight crew was attentive, friendly, and actually seemed to care. I was impressed.  That being said, there could be better coordination with AA for executive platinum members.  Sometimes the oneworld benfits get lost.  It also sucks to get stuck litterally at the back of the plane as an elite flyer.

title: Superb service
review_text: My wife and I flew to Japan on JAL a couple of weeks back in economy class. We flew on the 787 which was new and comfortable. Service by the JAL stewardesses was quite superb, so polite, efficient and friendly. Hard to believe we were in economy, this was as good as business class. Food was excellent too, possibly the best flight I have ever been on and I have flown extensively over the last 50 years.

title: True Japanese Experience
review_text:
After living in Japan for five and a half year, the one thing I miss the most about Japan, aside from the food, is its super advanced toilet. And, I did not expect that Japan Airlines would actually bring that toilet experience onto its flight. Literally. The amenities, those buttons (gosh, THOSE buttons), and the cleanliness screamt Japan and it almost moved me to tears.

As for the rest, it had just the right legroom space, entertainment was plenty enough for an 8-hour flight, and the service was overall nice. Not a big fan of the in-flight meal, but it was paid off with a great glass of umeshu. :)

title: Japan Airlines supports dangerous seating
review_text:
Getting onto a flight from Japan to New York and realised that Japan Airlines had put a mobility impaired man in the aisle seat with my partner and I on the window and middle. Of course everyone has a right to travel but my question is whether they support dangerous seating conditions with tow. Able bodied people to now have to navigate over someone who can’t move out of their seat. If there was an emergency or fire where evacuation was required we would be stuffed literally!! He wouldn’t be able to get out in time and we would have to physically get over him or assist him to get out. This is a highly dangerous situation which Japan Airlines condones. Unfortunately Qantas did a very similar thing before and after complaining realised it was a fault in their system that shouldn’t allow it. 

Very disappointed with Japan Airlines. You may wish to rethink your journey with them.

title: Fantastic
review_text: Wonderful experience! The attendants went out of their way to make you feel comfortable. I’ve flown many airlines and JAL’s team understands what customer services is unlike other companies out there.

title: service is excellent but the meal is disaster
review_text:
Cabin crew are excellent, there service is the best, they always try to maintain the cleanness of the toilet .  The movie on the plane is new and variously for choose.  
The last thing I will recommend is the meal on the plane, it's worse than ever and let us feel a little disgusting.

title: Awesome service and Great Food
review_text: The flight attendants were very attentive and smiled all the time. During the last two hours, I slept and missed the last snack. They left a purple note as a reminder to let them know if anything is needed. That was really thoughtful. The food meals are delicious and healthy. They even made rounds for tea, coffee or juice from time to time. I like the attached cushion on the seat head and soft pillows, more comfortable. Leg room was more spacious and has stainless footrests. The bathroom needed to be cleaned often during the flight.

title: on par with other asian airlines...
review_text: booked AA but flew JAL, because of codeshare, was glad i did cause got the chance to experience JAL and experience what others were saying...surely it was a long 14+ nonstop flight but the service, food, inflight entertainment for economy class is on par with all the other asian airline,a lot better than their american counterparts....

title: ORGANISATION MUST BE IMPROVED
review_text:
On line check in is permitted only 24h in advance and, unfortunatelly, despite beeing on the same reservation my husband and I didn't receive two seats one near to the other. We've been lucky that a passenger has been so kind to switch his seat with my husband otherwise we had to fly, for almost 20h, one far from the othter. On the web site is also impossible to book a special meal. 
Company doesn't offer such a great service on ground too because the phone service for the domestic flight hasn't english speaking attendandts so you need to talk to an interpreter, who translates you what the attendant says and vice versa. A never ending phone call. Japanese food on board is pretty good while the western isn't that great.
On board assitents are very kind and polite.

title: Good service, very pleasant flight
review_text: Having almost always flown Singapore Airlines, my family decided to try JAL to Japan. The price was slightly cheaper compared to SQ. We were pleasantly surprised to find that the seats were slightly bigger than normal, with good leg space. Cabin was very clean and the food was nice! My family actually finished the meal! Although it was an 8 am flight, there was no breakfast but lunch was served 2 hours into the flight. The only other meal served  was a small snack at about 2 hours before we landed. Of course there were no lovely Singapore Girls attending to us but the stewardess were very warm, sincere and polite. Service was very good. Perhaps a better command of the English language would help.  As the flight was filled with well behaved Japanese, it was very quiet and comfortable, no inconsiderate Behavioural nor people talking loudly etc. We will fly JAL again.

title: Great experience, pleasure flight. BEST!
review_text: Great attitudes, warmly welcome! Cleanliness, nice food, comfort and most important i got sleep well in plane.

title: Nightmare Booking
review_text: Never again JAL. We have travelled with many an airline, but your deception has spoilt our travel even before we have left the ground! Our booking was planned months ago - business class for a conference - but JAL has allowed the timetable to be hijacked!  What we didn't realise is that even though it was clearly a JAL booked itinerary, nevetheles one section was (covertly!) co-partnered with British Airways who cancelled their flight - throwing our itinerary to buggery. What was a one stop travel intinerary has now become three stops; what was only 24 hours travel has become filled with lengthy lay-overs extending the travel up to a possible 40 hours! Given JAL's short notice and a conference committment, there was no option for us to cancel and JAL has not indicated any compensation arguing that it was BA's fault who argued that it was JAL's fault - with no real explanation. This "corporate aerial ping-pong" with no apology or compensation is seriously frustrating and distressing which indicates a lack of care for customers who become vulnerable victims at the mercy of JAL's/BA's corporate whims - which actually costs customers time and money having to adjust budgets, accommodation, reorganise work and meeting schedules and even family committments, etcetera, etcetera. JAL/BA it is not good enough!  We, your customers, demand that you stick to your committments, accept responsibility and the consequences of your actions (that can decimate your customer's plans) and compensate us accordingly rather than cowardly whimping and leaving your customers to pay for your mistakes!

title: Impeccable service and timing
review_text: From the moment you check in to the moment the plane pushes back from the gate the service is impeccable.   The boarding time, for an entire international flight, took less than 15 min and we were on our way!!  We flew out of YVR and stopped briefly in NRT on our way to SGN.  We will fly JAL again and recommend it to anyone flying along the pacific rim!  `

title: Poor Service Baggage Check In
review_text: Not recommended to choose JAL. The staff at Kansai Airport Counter were very slow to handle baggage. Queuing for one hour to finish baggage check in.

title: Worst call centre
review_text: Useless call centre in Hong Kong. Lied to us about what dates we could change our tickets then said sorry and they will not charge us, but charged us anyway. They leave you on hold for 20 minutes while they "calculate" the fee difference but each come up with a different number for the same day.

title: Love the service
review_text:
The night flight from Kuala Lumpur to Tokyo was comfortable and the crew was very attentive. But the cabin was a bit too warm. Love the premium economy sits and extra spacious toilets.

From Tokyo (Narita) to Kuala Lumpur was great. The Sakura Lounge was very packed but organised. Food was good. As usual, the Crew was very attentive, continues flow of drinks and food. Love the cup Udon, Haagen-Dazs ice-cream, and bread.  Cabin temperature was just right.  The award-winning Prawn Curry rice was good too.

title: GMP-HND on 787 Dreamliner was very nice
review_text:
Excellent service and flight to/from South Korea to Tokyo.  
It's been many years since I flew JAL - last trip was from SFO to HND on a 747 which was very long.  Now, the new tech planes help take traveling easier.

This was our half trip to Japan and loved the great service, courteous staff, and nice flight.  Short trip from Gimpo to Haneda but flew in a huge Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner that had lots of leg room and great meal service which was unexpected considering the flight was only 2.5 hours.

For the money we paid about double what it would normally cost but that was because we were heading to Tokyo for the cherry blossom viewing (sakura).

Luckily we had already eaten at the airport lounge and did not have too much to eat on board.

On time performance and easy gate location on both ends made the flight that much more enjoyable.

title: My best airline so far
review_text: This is our second time with JAL. The first time was last year flying from vancouver to manila. The service is very good from check-in until we got off the plane. The cabin crew are very attentive to all the passengers and always smiling. Our seats are wider as compared to other airlines, the cabin smells fresh. The food they served is what i liked best, i have no complain with the quantity and the quality. They start serving the miso soup before they serve the main entree, and you can ask for more soup until you're satisfied. The last they serve is ice cream aside from the dessert included on the food tray. Coffee and tea are non-stop and i even requested for decaf for dinner. My only complain on our 2nd flight was the washroom because towards the end of the flight it was already dirty. Maybe because it was a very full flight and the attendants were so busy attending to all the needs of the passengers that's why they had no time to make-up the washroom. I hope it will not be the same on our next flight back to manila this coming august. Nevertheless, it's still our favorite airline and we'll keep on using it as long as they offer reasonable rate.

title: Great service
review_text: Japan airlines codeshares with Finnair and we found both the airlines very good. The route traverses Russia/Siberia near the north pole and the experience and scenery itself is a treat. Helsinki is a sort of northern version of the middle east transit terminals, but much more relaxed and less frantic. There are two stops at Tokyo and Helsinki but the waiting time was short.  The trip only took an extra 2 hours compared to the middle east routes and in my opinion is worth the extra time. The business class prices were several thousand dollars cheaper than the comparable middle east routes. The planes are modern and the cabin crew service was excellent.

title: JL 62, NRT/LAX Business in May 2018
review_text:
I flew JL 62 (B-777) NRT to LAX in business in May 2018.  Check in at NRT airport was smooth and helpful.  Being Oneworld Emerald, I was able to use JL First Lounge.  There are two at NRT airport. The one next to Custom/Immigration is more crowded than the other side of terminal 2.  The only notable difference between two locations was sushi.  The other side did not offer it.  But if you like less crowded, more relaxed environment, I’d recommend the far side lounge.  

Departure/arrival were on time.  As always, JL offered one of the best services in the class.  I like the mattress, availability of extra blanket, many food options, and you can eat whenever you feel like up to two hours before arrival.  Entertainment system is top notch.  Another great experience with JL.

title: Excellent Service
review_text: I have been boarding JAL since I moved to Australia. Their service has been improved since a few years ago, especially meal service is excellent, especially we can enjoy nice Japanese cuisine. Also full flat bed sheet provides private room for each passenger. Wi-Fi service is available with good connection. strongly recommend this airline when going to Australia.

title: Best route to Europe
review_text:
The dreamliner service on this route is very good and certainly a great way to get from Australia’s East Coast to Europe.  JAL staff seem to expect passengers to fit and remove their own seat mattress.. Also the little cardigans they provide are strange.
The Japanese menu is highly recommended.
The downside of this route  is Japanese immigration at Narita

title: JAL was the Best and From Now On All Other Airlines Will Pale in Comparison
review_text:
We took our first trip to Tokyo from JFK. I was nervous about flying that long.   Before you knew it, we were high above the clouds and the flight attendants started serving food, but first, in typical Japanese style, warm hot towels for washing your hands.

Not boring airline food, but tasty and distinctly Japanese. Also miso soup as well. Then they even served Häagen-Dazs ice cream. 

After a little nap, they came around with delicious sandwiches. And then finally another meal before we landed. This time it was pasta with the most delicious creamy sauce. Totally worth not counting the calories on this flight. It surely made this long flight seem very short. 

Our returning flight from Narita to JFK was exactly the same, as in great.  However this time around they pulled off entirely different meals. Except for the beverages and miso soup, everything else was completely different and completely delicious. And this was in economy class… Can you imagine what they serve up in first class?

The flight attendants were cordial, kind, efficient and pleasant. 

In-flight entertainment system was great as well. Dozens and dozens of movies and TV shows.

If we ever have the chance to go back to Japan, we know we will only be flying Japan Airlines.

title: Poor entertainment
review_text:
Not so many latest movies and music.
compare to other airline,it had a lot of explanation in the programme.
Too much hospitality.

title: Fabulous Flight to and from Europe
review_text:
I had a rush need to get to Europe hence buying the first available flight
What a surprise and contrast from my Qantas flights from Brisbane to Tokyo
The difference was chalk and cheese. Qantas at best waste best  mediocre whereas JAL was sensational. The staff were polite attentive and made you feel as if you were important to them. The in flight entertainment was great as was the food the choices and the variety - Japanese as well as European. On my return to Haneda I had an overnight staying at the airport and A day in Tokyo - brilliant 
If I had to use one word to describe the trip with JAL- "flawless" cant wait to fly JAL again

title: They were not going to disappoint and keep up the service to earn the title of "Japan's No. 1 airline."
review_text: It was superb.   Female stuff were all flawlessly beautiful and polite and attentive.   It is quite common knowledge among us this is the best airline within our country but it was far better than others and it felt as the customers were better crowd and I did not get the annoying and inconsiderate normal crowd who will do unbelievably rude things and they acted much better and that was important for me that there was no disturbance in that way or people around us have better sense or self-confidence around them and not bother people in a horrific way that we see on the news.   I did not see any fight or people abusing others like on YouTube videos.   Every time I have to go home from the States, I would choose this airline.

title: Magnificent
review_text:
JAL have check-in, security, and flight connection procedures down to a fine art. What a pleasure to deal with their staff - they are courteous beyond belief.
The aircraft was whisper quiet and the cabin crew and service were outstanding.
Well done JAL we will certainly travel with you again.

title: Delayed over 1 hour due to bad weather
review_text:
It was inevitable to be delayed due to the bad weather but they made late announcement and kept changing gates, which was annoying.

By having said that, flight was smooth and short with professional cabin crews. 

I have lost my headphones in the airplane upon arriving at Oita but they kept it for me to retrieve.

Except bits of miscommunication, well recommended airline.

title: Best service from the flight attendants
review_text:
their flight attendants always serve you with  warmest smile and kind hearted. They walk all the the time to serve your drink and food. 
the toilets/ restroom are always in a clean condition and nice smelling.
The seat was clean and neat.
The plane arrival and departure is always on time.
the food are delicious and lucky me, I got the food menu from the chef competition. Many choices for drink. Try their  originally juice from Japan.

My son only complain about the lack of anime movie in the flight entertainment that using english subtitle.( only 2 available)

title: Excellent long haul airline
review_text:
Travelled to Tokyo and back on JAL. Punctual and efficient. Extremely courteous service with excellent food choices. Good clean cabin and spacious seats for a change. Were seated together(without having to pay)

The return flight from Tokyo was to leave at 2 am. All passengers were offered food and drink in the lounge- to avoid disturbing sleep on board- excellent touch.

Strongly recommended!

title: Comfortable flight , inconvenient as flight was delayed stayed plane was on runway for one hour on the flights back .
review_text: I can’t click to rate legroom,seat comfort,in flight entertainment,customers service and the rest. I would give 3 points for all of them. Flight was delayed one hour. Plane stayed on runway for one hour before take off on the way back to Melbourne. No reasons offered besides all communication are in Japanese with minimal English translation. Meals are basic very hard to ask for a glass of water. We offer to refill by bottle but they refuse just give one child cup at a time. They are not happy as we asked for a lot of water to hydrate .

title: JAL from Haneda, more cost efficient than you might imagine.
review_text: Hotels in Tokyo are expensive, particularly if you are visiting in Cherry Blossom season! I don't normally fly with JAL because the cost is relatively high but this flight departs from Haneda at 01:55 in the early hours. This gives you a full day but saves 1 night in the hotel.  Also, it's a lot cheaper and quicker to travel to Haneda than Narita. Even a taxi is affordable if you have luggage. The airport is also quieter and smaller with only 1 international terminal. If you can sleep on the plane the timing is good and easier to recover from jet lag. Finally it's in the same club as BA so you still get your air miles. I spent £200 more on the airfare but saved an expensive hotel, had less hassle and got home early the following day.

title: Deserves Thumbs Up
review_text:
Our eight hour flight to Tokyo was very comfortable and satisfactory.
The customer service was excellent, our every needs fulfilled.
The seat was spacey and comfortable, making the flight a convenient experience.
Two thumbs up for JAL! Keep up the good work!

title: New plane. On time.  Japanese efficiency. What’s not to like?
review_text:
I am normally a Star Alliance flyer, but for this particular holiday to Kyoto and Tokyo, we found a great deal on JAL and wanted to give it a try.  Both the outbound BKK - Osaka (KIX) and inbound from NRT were 787-8 Dreamliner, but the biz class configuration differed.  The outbound to Osaka was the traditional 2-2-2 JAL shell flat seat without partitions, which I thought was dated.  The return flight from Tokyo featured their Sky Suite, which was a great deal better. Recommendation is still for aisle seats if two of you are traveling together. 

Both flights were on time. On board service excellent.  Food pretty good.   Met all expectations that I would expect from a Japanese carrier.

Two criticisms. First was the limited English language capability at Narita Airport check in counter. One would have thought....And secondly, for some unexplained reason (which remains unexplained by JAL to this day), I couldn’t pre select seats on my return flight to Bangkok on JAL website.  

Will certainly fly JAL again, if the price is right.  Otherwise have to stick to Star Alliance for mileage purposes.

title: Great flight, roomy economy seats,
review_text:
On our most recent flight from Japan to LA, we decided to fly by Japan Airlines from Narita. Transportation to Narita was quick and easy, we used the Airport Limousine bus, which stops at many hotels in the Tokyo area. 

We boarded the bus at the ANA Intercontinental Hotel, the cost for the bus is less than taking the Narita Express, and frees you from having to push your way through Tokyo Station, and navigate nearly half a dozen escalators.

The bus dropped us off right in front of the terminal. The line at the check-in counter moved quickly. The staff, noticing our stroller (we were traveling with our three-year-old daughter) opened an additional terminal to get us through more quickly. 

Security was efficient and polite. When the flight was ready to board, we were allowed to get on early. We found our economy seats large and roomy, with lots of foot room, the size you might expect on “economy-plus” at another airline. Each seat had a blanket, pillow, and headphones.

The in-flight entertainment monitor had a good selection of movies, games, and music. However, the headphone jack was the kind usually found on airplanes, the two-pront variety. It worked well with the cheap airline headphones, but I had to be careful not to bump the jack when using my Bose QC headphones, or the sound would cut off.

Our flight left the terminal on-time, but it took nearly 20 minutes of taxiing before we finally took off. 

The larger seats and headroom were much appreciated on our 10 hour flight to LA (and even more appropriated on the 11-and-a-half hour return flight. The flight passed quickly enough. The in-flight meal was airline-mediocre, but we had brought food for the flight from a shop at the terminal. 

Arrival al Los Angeles was painless, and we got through immigration and customs quickly. The only problem we had was our Primetime shuttle, which never arrived to pick us up (or half a dozen other people who were also waiting). We had to spend $120 for a taxi to get to our hotel in Orange County. Avoid Primetime Shuttles at all cost. A month later, they still haven’t refunded our payment, though they promised an immediate refund.
 
Getting back to our flight, Japan Airlines gave us comfortable seats, good service, and a reasonable price. I highly recommend them.

title: Old planes, dusty cabin, cup noodles?!
review_text: One word - old! Everything is so old in the plane. It is so dusty and we kept sneezing! And who serves cup noodles as a meal for business class? Service is ok but the quality is poor. Seats are comfortable for business class... but they should really revamp their old planes.

title: Amazing flight
review_text:
So it turns out I'm not a great flyer (mostly takeoff) but I couldn't speak more highly of jal from check in to landing I've never been treated better in my life 
Seats comfy as, flight crew friendly and helpful and the food omg better than most restaurants 
Will definitely fly with Japan Airlines again

title: So Friendly @ JAL
review_text: This was a sensational experience the staff a very friendly and the service was second to none would not hesitate to flight JAL again

title: Old plane but good food
review_text: I recently took a flight with JAL (for the first time) to see if heir accommodations are worth the premium (plane fare) than those middle eastern airlines.  The food is at par, exceptionally great like those middle eastern airlines, well prepared, very good presentation, sumptuous and worth the calories.  However in the amenities side, JAL lags behind, double row window seats and quad row for the aisle no privacy, despite the "raising" divider. Your seat sinks to the ground when you want recline you could imagine the dirt on floor near your face. I think JAL is old plane and should be retired, those middle eastern airline are much superior in comfort and price much lower.  So would I take JAL, maybe if its a new plane that offers single row window seats that doesn't sink to the floor!

title: Economic price for PE
review_text:
Wanted to try JAL as there's hardly discount for JAL and usually flew with cheaper airline to Japan. 

Turns out the difference between ticket for PE and economy seat is just SGD200 one-way. So forked out additional SGD400 to get better comfort. It's all worth the extra money as they allow to use lounge,give priority for luggage, additional amenity and significant legroom compared to economy class. However, boarding was together with economy which I thought could be "adjusted" in the near future. 

I flew other airlines but JAL has two additional features which I don't see in other aircraft: 1) tiny foothold under everyone's seat which crew used to step and reach out to overhead compartment. Normally I would just step on the seat :( 2) mirror in overhead compartment which allows you to see if any luggage was left out without the need to peak inside. This feature is very helpful for petite and short individuals. 

Food was good and sufficient entertainment to survive any flight. One disheartened event for me is when JAL refused to compensate my damaged baggage claim. Definitely wouldn't fly JAL again due to its high price and unwillingness to extend customer service.

title: Comfortable & Great Service!
review_text: The 787-8 Dreamliner plane was spacious (seats are nice and wide) and the service was impeccable. They ran out of one of the options for lunch (which was no big deal as both options were nice) and gave us an apology treat! They really go above and beyond to make sure you are comfortable during your flight. Would not hesitate to fly with them again and recommend them to everyone!

title: Impecable Service
review_text: JAL continues to provide exceptional attention to service in terms of courtesy,  punctuality, comfort & care for its passengers regardless of the Class of Service. Seating arrangements in their 787-9 aircraft has placed long haul passenger comfort at the forefront of their travel arrangement. Well done JAL & thankyou for an excellent journey.

title: JAL
review_text: Excellent airline. On all 4 segments flights were on time or early. No other airline I’ve flown with can board and unboard passengers so quickly. AMAZING. Food was great too. Seats were comfortable and spacious enough.

title: Great services flight for family with children
review_text:
A pleasant impression flew with JAL. Children are prioritized in their flight.
When you start checking in flight counter you can request kids meal for your child but the rule is supposed to tell a few days before your departure date.
Passengers with babies and children are prioritized to board the plane first. 
Inside the plane you are also friendly greeted  by the flying attendant and will be informed if there is available kids meal for your child. For the baby will also be asked if you need bassinet or other needs such as diapers for your baby.
Toys from JAL as compliment also available and given as soon you reach your destination.

title: Cheaper Commercial flight to Osaka
review_text:
In April 2018, several friends and me took flights from Singapore to Osaka, to attend business meetings and took chances for sightseeing during Sakura season. We pre-booked the flights with transit at Tokyo in December 2017, because it was one of the cheapest commercial flights available then.

While I dislike the longer routes with transit of about 2 hours in Narita, however I enjoy the free meals and generous luggage allowances offered by JAL. The transit at Narita (need to check because it is from international to domestic terminals & vv ) of about 2 hours are sufficient and smooth.

On inward bound journey, arrival at Osaka Itami Airport is also nearer to the city, then KIX.

Overall, I enjoy the excellent inflight services by JAL.

title: JAL Airline
review_text: It’s my favourite airline so far. Food at its airport lounge is good. Seats can go down about 45 degrees for the premium economy so I could get a good night sleep. Spacious enough to stretch my legs and I m 1.63metres tall.  Service onboard is prompt whenever you asked for something, even for a pen, the aircrew always get back to you quickly and are always with a smile and very ready to help unlike SIA. But the food onboard need to improve a little. Kind of tasteless and blend. Throughly Japanese service! I would always choose JAL if they have flights to wherever I want to go to.

title: Great airline
review_text: Great airline with courteous staff and good food. Seats are comfortable. No problems with checking in. Entertainment is good.

title: A Little Tired and No First Class Sydney to Tokyo.
review_text:
Air crew were so beautiful. Nothing was too much trouble and they were very attentive.
We elected the Japanese meal option which was very nice, especially the Sake, and a great introduction to Japanese food. Cabin was older, TVs smallish and bed not so comfortable.

title: Mascot to Moscow.
review_text: We flew economy because my wife and I like two seats together and JAL have two four two configuration in Economy. The Bowing Dreamliner was very quite and the cabin staff were excellent looking after our every need. Because of the long distance we decided to stopover at Narita and this was a great decision as it cut the journey time in the air in half and we arrived in Moscow refreshed and ready to go having had a good nights sleep in a hotel close to the airport. Great airline and great way to do this journey.

title: Best flight
review_text: This was the best flight I have flown on. The 787-9 is a great plane. The seat leg room was better than an A380. The service was great as was the food/beverages. The entertainment wasn’t as extensive or appealing as I have experienced but I did find things to while away the time. Flying again with them in Nov 2018 so that is my endorsement.

title: Flight JL 954 (Japan Airlines)  from Seoul to Tokyo
review_text:
I took the Flight JL 954 with Japan Airlines (JAL) from Seoul, South Korea [ Incheon International Airport- (ICN)] to Tokyo, Japan [Narita International Airport- (NRT)] in March with a Boeing 738-800 (on a row 3+3 seats) and I really enjoyed it.
On the ground everything went smoothly (although it was necessary to take a shuttle train to the boarding gates), the take off was on time and on the air all the crew has delivered  excellent service.
Although the flight was not long haul (about 2,5 hours) the flight attendants served generously both snacks and drinks (free of charge). 
The seats were comfortable (having enough legroom) to make the short journey really nice and enjoyable.
Japan Airlines (JAL) is considered to be a very good airline as different awards prove it (e.g. for 2017, JAL Named Best Economy Class Airline Seats for the Second Time in the Annual Skytrax World Airline Awards at the Paris Air Show (the first time was 2015) etc.) and continues to try hard to provide excellence service.
I enjoyed my flight with Japan Airlines and I will fly again in the near future, if the opportunity arises.

title: The Best Airline I have travelled with
review_text: Once again I chose JAL to fly from Sydney to Tokyo and home. The service was immaculate with very courteous and attentive staff, amazing food and good entertainment. Fellow travellers were very considerate too - probably because you feel so welcomed. Highly recommend this airline.

title: Good service and comfortable business seats
review_text: Not as spacious as A380 but well laid out in business class with comfortable flat beds and very good service.  Food was ok. Complimentary travel pack basic.

title: Premium economy worth it.
review_text: Very comfortable seats with lots of room. Food like economy but that is ok. Plus access to lounge at airports. Luggage came promptly

title: Premium Economy with JAL is fantastic
review_text:
The legroom in JAL premium economy is great. Seats fold back into themselves so you don’t have person in front taking any of your space. The space in between the seats mean even if you are in a ‘3’ row you don’t touch the other passenger. Plenty of ‘2’ seats for couples.
Definitely worth it.
Food is the only let down.

title: Choose JAL
review_text: Brilliant food and service. Staff charming and kind. In flight entertainment all worked properly. Dreamliner is great aircraft, and very comfortable.

title: Gliding the sky on the Dreamliner
review_text: The journey was a pleasant one as the seat and legroom are spacious. The screen is also bigger than the other airlines. I only watch movie during meal time and had comfortable sleep throughout. For meal, it was quite a nice surprise to be given steel utensil and not plastic ones. And the best part, even the plane’s toilet was installed with electronic bidet

title: Nice Flight
review_text: Very Good flight. We will fly JAL again. The food was good and service was good. I can recommend this airline.

title: love the Dreamliner
review_text: Great service and I slept very well after seeing 2 good films.  The food was delicious and just the right amount.  I feel better after flying in the 787 Dreamliner, I think it must have something to do with the air?  Plus it doesn't seem so noisy, or maybe it was because the earphones were so good

title: Upgrade recommended
review_text: Decided on my first flight from Gothenburg to Helsinki that I needed to do some more work and get some good rest during my flight to Tokyo. So in Helsinki I located the Japan Airlines service desk and upgraded from Economy to Premium Economy. Cost was fixed at 330 euros. Thought is was a bit hefty, but in retrospect it was worth it. The seats were wide, the table big, the food really good and the amenity kit helped me on a couple of good hours of sleep. No problems with space for my legs (I'm 187cm) and I also enjoyed the size of the IFE screen. Only minus was that the in flight announcements cut right through the movie I was watching, at a non-adjustable volume. Which was really loud with my headphones. Otherwise highly recommended.

title: One of the best Airplane
review_text: One of the best airlines in the world, in-flight entertainment and food are also phenomenal. They really try to the fullest for their customers at all times. If you have any chance to fly JAL, do not think twice. Recomanded

title: Amazing service
review_text: Japan Airlines is by far the best I've ever flown with. From little details such as disposable house slippers for the flight and the quality of the packaging of the meals (which were also of superior quality) to bigger things like the friendliness and service provided by the flight attendants, JAL is always going to be my go-to airline when traveling to Asia.

title: My first time in Tokyo
review_text: Very good service - on time, well organized check in, boarding and cabin crew very efficient and helpful.

title: Premium Economy review
review_text:
It's a long-haul flight. Basically, it's difficult for the body. However, it was minimum.

The cabin, sheet and equipment are new and not tired. The cabin temperature is slightly warmer. Although I called an attendant a few times, they took care of my calls very smoothly.The food service is nothing special. But, it's enough.

The outstanding point is in a washroom. I used it several times. It was always clean. The crew tied to maintain the washroom constantly. And, I guess that the passengers are also trying to keep a clean themselves. Generally speaking, nobody does not want to defile the cleanness.

title: Awesome business class experience
review_text: Extremely friendly stewardess which I think is a Japanese custom but I was served by a good looking stewardess who is very friendly and smiling while serving. It adds a bit of bonus with that kind of gesture and service. Toilet is amazing, it has that latest technology flush! Just like what you expect in any toilets in Japan. Food is definitely amazing! Top notch! When I went to the toilet, I saw the stewardess took a big bamboo pot of rice out and mix them so you can imagine fresh hot white sushi rice. Since mine was a night flight, I went for a snack food Japanese style - it is served to me in a 3 small course bento ish with rice. Surprise to see that much of food. After 7 hours flight, they start serving lunch where I chose Japanese meal. This comes with a bento of cold sushi and other cold dishes follow by main course where I had a grilled salmon with rice and some condiments. I totally enjoyed my flight experience on Japan Airlines. The only downside for this airline is the headset - it doesn't really provide that much soundproof and I didn't like the way they packaged them up in a cheap plastic bag. Would love if they could put in a nice headset cover as if you are using the BOSE headset. Overall: I give 9/10 on my experience.

title: A Good Flight But!
review_text:
The aircraft was a new 787-9 and was comfortable and clean. The flight departed on time and arrived on time and the staff were typical JAL ladies, courteous and pleasant.
The food on this leg is very good as JAL have to compete with others so they do it well. Maybe she was tired after the long flight but the senior attendant took an order for the second meal and then completely forgot about it. Not to JAL standards.

title: Comfortable Long Flight
review_text: Long haul flights arways are always trying but this flight and crew made a long haul flight relatively comfortable. The crew were attentive, as Japan Air always are. there was very little turbulence Even the food was well presented and tasty.

title: Recommendable
review_text:
Their operation is very puncutal and the staffs are very polite so yu can feel yourself upgraded. You should check in advance from which side you can see Mr. Fuji and book
a seat of the side. In winter you can see the best Fujicovered by the snow.

title: Comfortable flight
review_text: The seat is very comfortable. Because the seat is made from rather. And very kind for my daughter. For example, elaborate airplane toy are presented.

title: Spacious seating, great entertainment, great staff
review_text:
My husband and I travelled to and from Tokyo/Heathrow with JAL on our honeymoon.

The seats are incredibly spacious and comfortable, with one of their planes offering 2 seated aisles as standard (no awkward middle seat!).

The quantity and variety of their movies and tv shows is insane! You're spoiled for choice. 

The staff are incredibly friendly and polite. I didn't get on with the food on both flights and the staff were very apologetic, and as we were departing they apologised again! Really great service.

The main downfall unfortunately is the food (except for the Soba noodles on the return flight!). There are very odd combinations and if you're near the back of the plane, the only decent sounding option is unavailable (1 choice was fried chicken or prawn curry, can you guess which one was left over?!).

All in all, I would definitely fly with JAL again, but I'd make sure to bring some snacks!

title: Once again JAL did an outstanding job.
review_text:
Once again we had the opportunity to fly JAL (Japan Airlines) to Tokyo.  Their premium economy is excellent and value for your money.  On the ground you have access to their Business Class lounges both at DFW and Narita.  The Dallas lounge is very basic, where the Narita Sakura lounge is two-levels and has every amenity you can think of.  In the air, JAL had the same high level of service as we experienced previously.  The premium economy seats are comfortable, have great leg/calf support, as well as a foot rest.  Since the seats slide forward rather than recline backwards, there is no problem within a reclining seat interfering with the monitor or tray table.

Food continues to be extremely good.  Well presented, favorable, and high quality.  There are several choices in addition to snack service and a snack bar.  If you go hungry its your own fault.

The flight attendants are attentive, pleasant and appear to really enjoy serving their guests.  Yes I use the word guests rather than passengers.  We look forward to our next JAL flight.

title: Excellent
review_text: Very nice, helpful and polite cabin crews! Yummy meals throughout the flight, spacious seats and hassle free check-in and boarding! Love it...

title: Fly JAL planes!!!
review_text:
In April of this year, my wife and I used the services of Japanese airlines when flying from Moscow to Tokyo. We used the services of this airline for the first time and our flight took place on the Boeing 787 Dreamliner. t was an unforgettable flight on a beautiful plane with a great airline. Business class seats allowed for a 9 hour layover sleep, drinks and food were excellent. Both Japanese and European dishes were offered. The flight attendants were nice and helpful. My wife and I Express our sincere gratitude to the Japanese airlines company for the wonderful flight.
As usual, I Express my gratitude to Yandex translator for the preparation of this post, because English is not my native language

title: Outstanding!
review_text:
Wonderful compartment seats that turn into beds. They put down a pad and give you a comforter and pillow. 
The service was outstanding and the food was the best I've ever had on a flight.
Would highly recommend.  
On the way to Japan we were in Business Class and it was very good.

title: New Aircraft And On-Time
review_text: JAL operate relatively new 787's on the Melbourne Tokyo route and do a good job. This flight was on time, the service was friendly and polite as you would expect. The meal was average but it departs after mid-night which is a negative so most prefer to sleep. You can do a lot worse than JAL.

title: JAL- great service
review_text: The pilot is superb. The legroom is comfortable The service is great with regards to food , staff and the timeliness of the scheduled flight ..If you bought your ticket through American Airlines ‘and you want to upgrade your ticket , JAL will not allow it until you call AA. The problem with that is , if you you are flying when US offices are close , you are out of luck

title: HIGHLY DISSAPOINTED WITH JAL BUSINESS CLASS, Paris-Tokyo
review_text:
I was expecting refined service, and comfort in JAL business class, but found neither!!!
Cabin crew was mostly matter of fact, or indifferent ( with one exception). One does not feel welcome as on other flights from different airlines. 
More important, six hours into the flight, I had an excrutiating pain in my right leg (not a leg cramp) and called the hostess who had no idea what to do!!! 
Thankfully, one of them knew about thrombosis and got me 6 pillows to help raise my leg and drain the blood. 
So, I do feel most JAL stewardesses are unresponsive and untrained for emergencies!
Layout for Business Class Cabin is charmless, extremely partitioned. It felt like a cheap office building and made me claustrophobic
Seating was not entirely comfortable as I felt squeezed, like in a cubicle
Entertainment quality is good, but TV screens are way too big for the space!!!  It's overwhelming and you can't help being bothered by your neighbours' lit screens while you're trying to sleep!
Poor air quality
Poor accessories: eyemasks turn hot when you open the package which is absurd and not relaxing, especially when the cabin feels stuffy. They should be cold, if anything; so I could not use it to block the light from a TV across the aisle!!!
All in all, JAL Business Class was inferior to that of other airlines I've flown. 
I was very dissapointed and will not fly them again, nor recommend them to anyone!
On the positive side, ckeck in was fast, and the food was excellent.

title: Staffs and cleanliness are excellent but connection is terrible.
review_text: I could stayed on airplane very comfortable thanks to polite staffs and clean seats but on way back to Japan, they asked me to move from Narita airport to Haneda airport to take domestic airplane. It takes 1hour by bus which requires expense about \3,000 Yen in addition. If they have such a bad connection, they should note me before booking. I was really satisfied with JAL by Narita, but I was regret to choose the company after Haneda.

title: Suprised by lack of service
review_text:
On my night flight from Melbourne to Tokyo I thought the beds were very hard.  On my return flight from Tokyo I was offered a mattress.  Just wondering why no mattress was offered on my initial flight - I had not flown Japan Airlines before but had traveled on other Business class airlines.
On the return flight we were given a towel but no drinks for two hours and then I was told there were no western lunches left.  
My daughter and her two daughters flew economy on the same flights but had no complaints.

title: Enjoyed flying with JAL
review_text: The gate and in-flight service were both well executed. The drinks, meals, snacks and entertainment were great. It made a very long flight very enjoyable. I would gladly fly with Japan Airlines again.

title: Ultimately the best of the best service from SFO
review_text: I was on the 405 pm flight from SFO to Tokyo on May 10, 2018.  I was stuck on San Francisco traffic for a long time while in traffic I discovered I left my passport in the hotel I stayed in..once I reached the airport, the ticketing staff already knew who I was because everyine else was already at the gate waiting to board. By this time, it was already 3:15 and told the ticketing agent my scenario and told them someone was bringing my passport, she asked me where they were...which was 10 minutes away,...i knew I wasn't going to make my flight but to my surprise, she said, you will make it if the passport is here by 330 pm...at three 25, the passport arrives and she took care of everything including have me swished through by another agent through the long security lines all the way to the front and on to the boarding gate...Wow! Now that is service in its upmost best...I was too much in a hurry and didnt get their names, but I wish Japan Airlines reads this review and commends the two special staff members, one lady and one young gentleman that helped me so very much! I salute your service par excellance and will recommend your airlines to everybody! Domo Arigato Gozaimas...Richard Nazareth Silva of San Francisco flight Jpn1 to tokyo continuing to Bangkok Thailand on May 10, 2018 at 4:05 pm.  Again I thank you so very much! Matane!

title: Wonderful service in every way!
review_text:
From the time we purchased tickets to the time we left the gate, the service was exceptional. Crew was well dressed, courteous and professional. Food was actually delicious and enjoyable. Staff always smiled.
Lots more legroom (I’m 6’4”) and this was in economy. Everything was very clean and smelled good. 
I got the feeling they actually wanted you to be there.
This was such a nice contrast to the terrible service and attitudes of pretty much all airlines in the U.S.
I will make an effort to fly with them again.

title: excellent service
review_text: Was able to upgrade on both longhaul flights which was well worth it. Plenty off leg room and wider seats in premium economy. Staff are very pleasant and attentive. It was a pleasure to fly with them.

title: Disappointed
review_text:
Overall I had pretty high expectations for my flight that JAL did not come close to meeting.  First the pluses:

1) The SkySuite seat was good for sleeping, and with a window seat provides great privacy.
2) The plane was very clean.

In relative terms, many negatives though:

1) The food (Japanese meal) was pretty bad.  Not as bad as some other airlines in business class (e.g. British Airways) but easily worse than most American carriers for a comparable length international flight in business class.  The food was overcooked, much worse than what you'd get in a moderately good Japanese restaurant in Boston.

2) Service was basically on request only.  The mandatory service items (meals, duty free, etc.) were offered, but nothing pro-actively beyond that.  If you rang the call bell and asked they were happy to comply but compared to, for example, JetBlue Mint, the service level was much worse.

3) The lounge in Narita on my return trip (Sakura Lounge) was just plain bad.  No food other than rice crackers and cheese balls, and very crowded.

4) The amenity kit and other onboard amenities were very basic.  For example no moisturizer in the kit or in the bathrooms.  The blanket offered was very thin and not warm at all.

5) No storage available at the seat at all.  The only option during takeoff/landing is storing all items in the bins.

Overall I would choose just about any other airline over JAL for a business class flight, unless you have no choice on the route.  In my case they offer the only nonstop, so I don't have other good options.

title: Mixed feelings
review_text:
After arriving at Narita with plenty of time for an early check-in on a very damp day, we were disappointed to discover that none of our group of four were sitting together. Our friends had been allocated seats a couple of rows apart whilst my husband and I found ourselves situated some 25 rows apart - not a good start to checking in!!! Our friends, on complaining were advised that the Flight was fully booked and it would not be possible to make any changes.
Fortunately, when I spoke to the staff requesting that my husband and I could be seated together, it seemed to take a short phone call and we were re-allocated new seats side by side and with the bonus of plenty of leg room. Needless to say our companions were not impressed.
Other than that we had little to complain about and we did enjoy having metal cutlery to use for our meals. We did wish the plane could have been scheduled to arrive into Changi at a more sociable hour as it was not great to reach our Hotel at 2am to find we had been transferred/upgraded because of maintenance issues. However, realise not always possible to suit schedules of all passengers.

title: Never again
review_text: I booked my tickets through British Airways from London to Tokyo and was really excited when I saw they partnered with Japan airlines for my stopover in Frankfurt on my return to London for a business meeting. I arrived early on the day I was to fly because strangely they didn’t allow me to book my seats in advance like British airways does.  When I asked the very polite girl at the desk if I could sit with my business partner she couldn’t have been more polite to offer two middle seats one in the front of the other thinking that would suffice. She was sneaky about it to because when I asked she implied it would be no problem, printed the tickets and was starting to load my luggage. However when I looked at the numbers I noticed they weren’t in the same row and asked where these were. Again with a sweet little smile she politely said they are in the middle seats one in front of the other. I was a bit confused. Since I’m almost six feet tall and needed to be seated next to my colleague to discuss our strategy and meeting agenda I asked again if she could please reconsider and give us two,seats “together, side by side”. Again she was very polite, made a phone call but only had the middle and maybe a window seat but nothing together.  I explained we were on business and asked her if we could possibly upgrade to business since I have a ton of miles and she said no. They don’t take BA miles even though they are partners (some partnership). I asked if I could buy an upgrade and again was told no. I became frustrated and practically begged the woman for anything but the middle seat. She had the one window seat which I gave to my colleague and then she just got rude with me and told me to either accept the middle seat and get out or just move on and get nothing. I explained I didn’t understand why she wouldn’t let me pay for an upgrade but she just got more obstinate and told me to speak to British airways. I asked where the BA desk was and she didn’t want to tell me. She just said it’s in the terminal (which by the way is the size of six jumbo jets). The frosting on the cake was when she said with a smile and her most polite voice  “is there anything else I can do to help you?”.  I was floored! Seriously, what help? She made it clear she was not going to help me nor did she want to help me. Help me off a bridge maybe. She was very rude and left me feeling like a criminal. I left after that and walked around aimlessly to find BA but couldn’t. I later found out that BA doesn’t open until 1pm (my flight departed at 11am). I decided to call BA and explained my frustration but they couldn’t help accept to say sorry and suggested to ask the Attendant once on board. I did only to be told my friend could take the other middle seat in front of me - they had nothing “together” otherwise! I saw a ton of open seats in business too but they wouldn’t let me upgrade. Even when we boarded the plane they seated our section last! Really?! Last?! When my colleague and I finally were allowed to board premium we were pushed aside last minute for another Japanese woman in economy! I got the distinct feeling we were pushed aside because we were foreigners too and that just made me feel sick to my stomach.  Needless to say, vvI will never fly with JAL again. They’re non-service Service, faux smiles, fake polite voices and disgusting food made me sick. I was extremely disappointed with them and will never fly with them ever again! They were the worst!

title: GREAT
review_text: One of the best airlines in the world. Sakura lounge is seriously the best, except CX lounges, service is outstanding, in-flight entertainment and food are also phenomenal. They really try to the fullest for their customers at all times. If you have any chance to fly JAL, do not think twice.

title: Great airline, great flight
review_text: Flight 061 from LAX-NRT was a great flight even though it was in Economy. The seats were more roomy and comfortable than US Airlines with a lot more legroom. Food was good and flight attendants outstanding and helpful. Entertainment system had a lot to offer, and it worked well. Comfortable flight than departed and arrived on time. Will fly again.

title: JL 61, LAX/NRT in business, May 2018
review_text: I flew JL 61, LAX to NRT in May 2018.  IMHO, JL offers one of the best business class travel experiences.  Food options, beverages, comfortable seat, entertainment, overall service was outstanding.  The only missing piece is not offering pajamas.  Instead, they offer some jacket to wear during the flight - which is fine, but I’d prefer pajamas.  Asked for extra blanket and got it without any problem.  Temperature was comfortable, and B777 aircraft was relatively quiet, although I was sitting right next to the engine.  Qantas First Lounge at LAX wasn’t crowded and very comfortable.  Overall, excellent flying experience.

title: jakarta tokyo
review_text: jal 720 departed from jakarta (CGK) to Tokyo (NRT). On february 2018 they are still using the Boeing 767-300 for this route which is they provided sky-wider seat in economy class. the seat was wide and the legroom was awesome but the seat cover quite rough and makes it uncomfortable especially on the headrest when it ajusted. The meal was excellent one of the best in the air.

title: excellent service but food is bland. overpriced
review_text:
pros:
friendly flight attendant

cons:
food is bland
in flight entertainment is so so. 
some movies no english subtitle
 check in long waiting time 
ground staff not approachable. 

paid high price on this flight but im not satisfied. 
wont be flying with JAL again.

title: Good flight
review_text: Cabin service was nice and very attentive. Food presentation was great but the taste is normal. Seat was clean and comfortable but the seat are not full flat bed  (Boeing 787-8). Overall fight was good with great service and value for money.

title: Ok but nothing special
review_text:
This was my first flight to Tokyo and first time on Jal.  A colleague of mine flies to Japan frequently and recommended Jal as being much better than BA.  What I found out was the just like many airlines business class has become ok - nothing special.  The crew was really nice and welcoming but the facilities and the food where just ordinary.

Would I fly with them again - yes, would I look for another airline in a heartbeat.
