title: Japan Airlines
review_text:
Would like to say thank you to the entire JAL team for a flawless trip to Bangkok from Boston and connecting through Tokyo Narita. From the airport, airport lounges and especially the flight crews they exceeded my expectations in kind, friendly and professional service. I would also like to thank American Airlines as i booked through them. They assisted with getting my seats reserved.  
I recommend this airline.

title: unexpected surprise
review_text: In the air, cabin service was great.  Not unexpected, as JAL cabin service is great.  FA are very friendly and attentive to your needs.  My surprise was with tickets that I bought.  JAL has a J class, which I was led to believe to be "business class".  J class is really a premium economy class, bigger/better seats, located at the front of the cabin.  Found out at Haneda airport, from JAL, that there was only a First class lounge, and boarding for J class was last.  Entrance to the plan was from the front, away from the coach boarding area, so it was no bad.  This must be JAL's general boarding plan, just not familiar with it.  Overall experience with jAL was OK, with the great in flight service

title: Fantastic service, great flight
review_text: I have taken this direct flight from Boston to Narita several times as part of trips to The Philippines. The service is great. It is a long flight, and they go out of their way to make passengers comfortable. There are three meals on the flight,and the food was very good.

title: Wow!
review_text:
I had no idea airlines treated customers/travelers this way.  The flight attendants listened to us and went out of their way to make our trip special whenever possible.  The only thing about the flight we would have changed is to fly business or first class next time and that is because of the flight time to Japan.

There are games (I was listed as #6 on the Tetris top leader board), movies, flight exercises (these actually helped), flight information, shopping, eBooks, and TV shows.  I watched three just released movies and a Panda special total, on the way to Japan and back.

A dinner was served, breakfast, and two snacks with beverages available the whole trip.  Also, a pillow and blanket were provided for the duration.

Let me just comment that if JAL flew domestically I would be on the flights.

title: Top Family Economy
review_text: Flew family of 6 on the 787 Dreamliner V2 with Sky Wider Economy seats.  Great leg room and seat width, excellent entertainment choices, and fantastic service always with smile.  The Flight Attendants went out of their way to make sure toddlers in the group had a great flight.  Although 13.5 hour flight, was a smooth ride.  Loved the windows which you get to adjust the shade darknesss level.  Will fly this specific flight again.

title: Fantastic Airline
review_text:
We’ve flow JAL a few times now, starting in economy and now in business.  It’s one of my favorite Airlines.  In economy, the seats on the TransPac flight from SFO have a whopping 34” of leg room and are very comfortable.  In Business, I was worried about the 2-3-2 configuration on JAL 1/2, But the seats are amazing.  They are fully lie flat and extremely private, roomy on comfortable.  I slept seven hours on the flight from Haneda to SFO earlier this year and on the recent SFO-HND flight, I think I got fully eight hours.  Food is very good.  I ordered the Japanese menu and the quality and variety is delicious.  The Sakura Lounges in Asia are typically top notch.  Sadly, the SFO Lounge in SFO was quite a disappointment, but I have yet to visit a lounge at an American airport that is even 10% as good as a typical lounge at major Asian airports.

All in all, JAL is a great airline.

title: Overall excellent service
review_text: Although the JAL lounge at Suvarnabuhmi Airport is nothing special and quite busy, the service starting from boarding the plane at BKK all the way to disembarking at Tokyo was absolutely excellent. On the six hours flight, there was a choice for Japanese or Western meal. The Japanese meal  was tasty and well presented accompanied by an excellent sake. The business class was clean and serviced, and the crew worked tirelessly throughout the flight with absolute dedication trying to please everyone in the full cabin. Kudos go to JAL for the impeccable service.

title: Excellent Service and Sakura Lounge Access
review_text: Japan Airlines gives excellent, attentive service in Premium Economy.  It also gave us access to the Sakura Lounge, which had excellent, freshly prepared food.  We ate our primary meal in the lounge prior to boarding the flight, and slept through the meal service on board.   The seats slide forward, rather than recline back, and are not as comfortable as some other premium economy seats.

title: Plenty of Room
review_text: I am 6'4" and seat space is no longer what is was. An economy flight to Japan has me in serious discomfort. The width of the JAL premium economy is only an inch or two wider but it is the pitch you are paying for and they deliver in spades. I could fully stretch out my legs and the recline was enough to allow decent sleep to happen. I'm not saying it was bliss in the sky but a huge improvement. Food is the same as economy (which is excellent) with pergaps some extra drink options thrown in. Slippers and fancy headphones thrown in too. A very strong recommendation if you are flying overnight. It will be hard to go back to regular economy

title: Great flight
review_text: The flight and staff were great. Although a long flight it was comfortable and the food was really good. The premium economy seats were very nice and had more room than economy. They give you an amenity bag with toiletries and a pair of slippers to wear during your flight. Each seat has it's own personal tv with free movies and games. Will definitely fly JAL again.

title: Recommended
review_text: I recommend flying JAL out of Seoul Gimpo as the smooth check-in and boarding is easy on the traveler. In the airplane, service is great and our shedule was respected with punctuality.

title: Best way to travel form Boston to Tokyo
review_text:
I love this flight.  I live in the Boston area and this is the only direct flight to Tokyo which means no hassle return connection through the USA.  It's such a hassle if you have to go through immigration and customs at the first USA entry point/connection. 
 That said, the service on the flight is excellent and the food is the best I've had in economy.  The plane is a new 787 dreamliner and is very comfortable.  The timing of the flight (departs at 1:30 PM) is a good time slot at Logan because their aren't a lot of travelers at Terminal E (international terminal), security lines are small and not a lot of people in the terminal.  It arrives at Narita at 4:10pm which is early enough to still easily get to your hotel via any convenient transportation (limo bus, or express train).

title: Great experience
review_text:
Not a fan of flying probably Iike most people. Flying jal recently restored some faith especially in customer service. Flights over and back on time and really quite pleasant.
Excellent selection of movies, plenty of food which was quite good, and staff were excellent. 
Flight over a bit better than return mainly as the pa announcements a bit annoying, mostly in Japanese and were more frequent, on the red eye special it got a bit painful. These weren’t safety announcements by the way. Included flogging even more souvenirs n duty free. I really hate this I think people have plenty of time to shop without doing it on the plane trips. Really wish airlines would not do this.

title: Great pleasure
review_text: Flying with Japan airlines turned out to be a really wonderful experience. Comfortable, spacious seats, delicious food and great service. One of the most pleasurable flights in my life.

title: Definitely top flight experience I had ever
review_text:
I had two flights from JAL, from Gimpo (Korea) to Narita, and Narita to Chicago O'Hare, and I have nothing but good things to say. 

in Gimpo, the staff let me know I had an extra bag check in available, and helped me save $60 by dividing the bags under weight and made my trip easier by checking in the second bag I had as a check-in. The boarding process was very quick as well. It was a short 2 hour flight but the plane I was on had big leg room so I could store my long bag under the seat, and got food too for a short flight as well as drinks were offered at various intervals.

In Narita, I arrived 4 hours early because I wasn't sure how the check-in process when I didn't speak Japanese at all, but the staff was very helpful and let me check in my bag early. The staff helping was also very respectful and courteous when I had questions to ask. Luckily I didn't have a passenger next to me on my flight so I had plenty of arm room but the legroom was spacey for economy flight. Food was delicious, snacks were offered near the back where guests could grab at will and also were handed out (rice crackers and bread), and also got drinks at regular intervals. The back part of the seat was a little bit too stiff for my liking but they do give you a neck pillow you can use for your back as well so it worked out.

One of the best, if not the best, flight experience I had, with both flights.

title: Manila-Tokyo
review_text: Great service but the line to check in at the airport was outrageous.  A giant hall with snakes of humans for various airlines. The lines were so long you couldn't tell where it ended up. I must have stood there for 45 minutes.

title: Best flight we’ve been on!
review_text: This was our first time flying Japan Airlines and it was a great experience!! By far the best and most comfortable flight I’ve been on. My boyfriend who has flown plenty more airlines then I have brought Japan airlines up to his top 2. The meals were great and so was the service. Hope to fly with them again sometime soon!

title: One of the very Best!
review_text: The staff at the airport were very helpful and so polite.On time performance was great as well as the service on board the aircraft. The meals were great for airline meals. I would recommend this airline to everybody & will definitely fly with JAL again.

title: Best Experience!
review_text: Food was great, Japanese hospitality from the stewardess were just as expected - great service. Seat was comfortable, didn't get much from in-flight entertainment cause I'm the sleep-all-away type but my partner who couldn't sleep was satisfied with it.

title: Best layout ever
review_text: Such a wonderful surprise the layout for club is amazing as no one has to climb over  anyone the space is well planned huge t v screen- so much store space - great goody bags and for the ladies soft comfy cardigans. On our return could only get travelled plus and was concerned but that was unwarranted as the internal part of the seat slide down so comfy and fell asleep for 7 hours . Service cleanliness fabulous and toilets to and bigger than normal so if u had young kids more than enough space . Thanks JAP airlines for your service

title: Super Friendly Service
review_text:
Brilliant 11+ hours flight with friendly crew and cabin staff who really looked after passengers needs!  
With seating at 2:4:2 there was more leg room and seats seemed wider with no additional payment for specific seats. Meals were served at appropriate times and food was of a decent quality. Refills were offered and staff were attentive to passengers needs.  
Important little touches included the provision of toothbrush and paste in the toilets prior to landing and the toilets were kept in pristine condition. 
Without reservation I recommend JAL and would  certainly fly with them again.  Compared to the codeshare with BA for our return flight which was appalling in every way, travelling long haul in economy class with JAL was comfortable with excellent service.

title: A Perfect Trip
review_text: It was a perfect trip. On time, service was high standard and very pleasant, willing to do anything for the kids and us.

title: Probably best for Japanese travellers
review_text: My wife and I flew on a new 777 in business class. The layout is totally odd. It's 2 - 3 -2. The aisle seats are ok. The window and centre seats are totally boxed in, hard to squeeze into, and largely devoid of storage space. Japanese meal is very good, western meal so so. The pillows are Japanese style, and if you have not experienced that before, imagine a rock 3 cm thick and you're in the zone. Service is friendly but formulaic. The cabin temperature was set to 26 degrees (hottest I've ever experienced on a plane), and there are no individual air vents. Just to make things slightly comical, instead of giving out pyjamas (go Qantas!) they give out cardigans! Hardly useful as the sweat runs down your forehead!

title: The flight was great
review_text: I had not flown JAL until this flight. Every aspect of the trip was first rate.  The boarding of the plane was orderly and pleasant. Though the departure was delayed a few minutes ulitmately we arrived early. The cleanliness of the aircraft, to include the bathrooms, was very impressive. I am a bit of germ phob so cleanliness is very important to me. The crew was extremely friendly and professional. They were proficient in their responsibilities.  The food was good.  The seating was comfortable and all of the equipment operated.  I will fly JAL any time I have the opportunity.

title: Old plane but great service.
review_text: Very good customer service. The plane was an older plane so the comfort level,of the seats wasn’t great. They offer a western menu in addition to Asian.

title: Much Improved
review_text: When I last travelled on JAL from Melbourne to Tokyo return I found the food inedible. During the 7 months since the improvement has been enormous. When making the same trip in April 2018 I found that not only were the vegetarian meals in both directions better, they were in fact delightful. Couple this with comfortable and spacious economy class seats, excellent service, competitive pricing and on time performance you could not go past JAL. On close inspection of the Premium Economy seats I could not justify spending twice the money for the same flight over economy. Well done JAL!

title: Good service & meals
review_text: Good friendly check in. Shared lounge with Qantas is excellent even though busy. Dreamliner seats are comfortable although the window seat has little headroom and it can be difficult to get out with the leg rest up. The extra window size is excellent and the light adjustment works well. Try the Japanese meal it’s excellent. Light and just right for a day flight. We would fly JAL again.

title: Best French Full Course
review_text: Japan airlines is renewed for its sophisticated, attentive but also non-pushy discreet quality service, as well as the quality of its insight meal services. I tend to enjoy authentic Japanese course, but to my delight I tried French Fish course from NY to Tokyo and it was absolutely impeccable, from the start to the finish, with full attention to details and quality of cuisine. In addition to beautiful presentation of food, the quality of French butter, Japanese sea-salt, French cheese selection, as well as the selection of wines, champagnes, Japanese premium whisky and digestives were the best I have ever experienced in the sky. The teamwork of Cabin attendants were also flawless, not to be over-present but always there discreetly. As the seat cross the aisle was vacant, cabin attendant prepared the bed there, so that I can switch between work and rest with no hustle and time-loss. I have been a fan of Japan airlines, but this was probably the best experience of all airlines so far.

title: Everything works as it should
review_text: What's the one thing you want when you travel for business? To get to your destination on time. There is nothing that beats an uneventful flight and that's what you get with Japan Airlines. My flights (all 4 of them) boarded on time, took off on time and landed either early or on time. What more can you want. On board the service is very good without being overly intrusive. The food, especially if you like Japanese food is very good. The selection is not as wide as some airlines but that doesn't matter. On board entertainment was the only thing that could improve with a wider variety of western films.

title: Good but could be better
review_text: Overall service was very good especially they were so generous with Crystal (yummy!).  However the film selection was somewhat disappointing...  Nothing interesting to watch...  Dunkirk, sorry I watched it on a Emirates flight in December 2017!  Wonder woman?  Watched it during my Antarctica cruise again in December 2017.  Also it was rather hot and although CAs kept saying that they would deal with it, it was quite uncomfortable all the way to Tokyo.  Free WIFI not easy.  Even a CA was struggling.  Still, 5000 times better that BA.

title: Average business class experience made worse by being kept awake at night by a howling child
review_text: My wife and I flew business class from Melbourne to Tokyo.  The business class experience itself was only very average.  The seats were narrow and the service was surprisingly inattentive.  The flight left Melbourne after midnight and we were tired, after a long day, and looking forward to some sleep on lie flat beds.  This was not to be.  There was a young couple on our row with an 18 month old child which cried and howled the whole night long, precluding any sleep.  I really cannot understand why people with very young children, with a proclivity to howling, choose to waste their money flying business class when they have no hope of having a pleasant flight and spoil it for all the other passengers who have paid high fees to fly business class.

title: Business Class comfort
review_text:
From the minute I stepped into the Lounge,I enjoyed a level of care and comfort I hadn’t experienced before.Might I point out,I don’t usually travel business class,a friend gifted me the flight.But still,the variety of food and drinks in the restaurant was mind blowing.
Once I got into my cosy pod ,as I call it,on the plane,I was in heaven.I was so comfortable,the chair tilts to such angles,as to cradle my older,arthritic bones,being able to make it into a bed was wonderful.The service by the hostesses was good,and when they noticed that I enjoy a plum wine,I kept finding sneaky refills on my tray.The food was delicious,and so beautifully presented.
Found the choice of films,series,etc was very wide,and so up to the moment.The noise cancelling headphones were top of the range.Slept like a baby when the lights were dimmed,though the complimentary bag of goodies also had earplugs and eyeshades if needed.Toilets were clean and nearby. One last item,the privacy screen between seats,another good idea,especially when travelling by oneself.At a press of a button,one felt safe and secure.

title: Nice Flight!
review_text: This was an aspirational trip using Alaska Airlines Mileage Plan miles. In exchange for 140,000 miles, I received a FIRST CLASS ticket worth about $24,000.00! What a BARGAIN! The trip was lovely, but the cabin crew was far superior returning from Japan compared with the crew enroute...which is a shame as I slept a good part of the return journey. Service was attentive without being over the top. I had read blogs of several frequent travelers who touted all the special attention they received. Extra PJs to take home, FAs insisting they try EVERY menu item, etc. I believe they get all these extra services because they are somehow flagged in the reservations system, because I got none of that. However, it was a great flight using miles, but there is no way in heck it was worth anywhere close to $24,000.00 in terms of service or amenities, however, personal space was exceptional!!

title: Great Premium Economy Flights
review_text: JAL is rated as having one of the 10 best Premium Economy cabins, and we decided to splurge on a trip to Hong Kong, before catching a cruise.  This class of service also allowed us to use the JAL Lounges in DFW and NRT to eat and drink while waiting for flights.  Both flights DFW-NRT and NRT-HKG were on the Boeing 787 Dreamliner with 2 -4-2 seating.  We were on the 2 side and the seats were comfortable with leg rests.  Service was OUTSTANDING, and entertainment system very good.  Our only small negative comment:  the food, as it was geared to the Japanese tastes.  We would have preferred more western options.  However, there were always snacks and we never went hungry.  Will definitely look to book JAL Premium Economy on future trips.

title: below average business class
review_text:
What started out as a state-of-the art business class product is no longer competitive.  I flew this because of my One World Emerald Status but never again.  i usually go to JFK and from now on i would rather take AA to a gateway and change planes instead of taking the JAL nonstop.

You walk onto the plane and it is like walking into a dingy and beat-up rabbit warren.  Cabins haven't been updated in years.

The Sky Suites on the 777 (and the 787) are claustrophobic at best.  Window seats are cramped, aisle seats are basically on the aisle and offer no privacy and if you are in a middle seat good luck!

Food is good but the meal service itself was horrible - on this flight, the meal service took just short of 3 hours from the time we took off until the time that the service ended- and i was in the first row!  there were over 30M waits between courses.  i have experienced this type of service on previous flights.

One of the issues was that menus were not offered and orders not taken until about 30 minutes after take off - not like other airlines where this is done before takeoff.

There are only 2 TINY lavs for 42 pax - not nearly enough.

Amenities are geared towards smaller people - there is one size of flight cardigan -it's a medium.  Slippers also were undersized - i wear a 10 1/2 shoe (not that big) and the slippers were too small.  it was a problem as you needed them when you went into the lav!!

i can't see how they can continue this level of service when competing with ANA

title: UNCOMFORTABLE BUSINESS CLASS
review_text: The Business class seats are at an angle and when they make a flat bed, your legs go into a box in front and its very uncomfortable. They also dont serve a welcome drink on this sector.

title: Comfortable seating and value-for-money, but decent food and sleep are hard to come by
review_text:
As anticipated, the cabin crew were very polite and efficient. The legroom in PE was comfortable, and the price was comparable with other airlines. The seating is hard-shell, meaning the pax in front cannot recline into your space. However, the seat slides down and forward for sleeping, placing you in an uncomfortable near-fetal position. I have slept much better on other airlines. Spending over 40 hours in flight to and from JFK meant that most of the decent screen entertainment had been exhausted before arrival back in Sydney.

The food, especially out of Narita, was quite ordinary. JAL is using "young innovative chefs" to create new dishes. (Just what is "burdock" anyway?) At least the delicious Japanese beer was free-flowing.

title: Wonderful counter service and good flight experience
review_text: It is always a good experience to fly with Japan airline. From the beginning of check in to in fly service, everything is excellent. The only area needed to be improved is the customer service telephone answering, it took too long of waiting time to speak to a agent.

title: 素晴らしいのですがおトイレが　Good but need more taking care of cleaning toilets
review_text: 飛行機を移動中の睡眠の場所と決めている私にとって例えトイレが汚くても、日本食のコメが不味くても、シートが硬くフラットになる限り問題ありません。ベッドとしての機能は問題ありません。Regardless of not-clean at toilet or not-satisfactory of cooking condition of rice, quality of sleeping bed is more than satisfactory and I love JAL.

title: Excellent Service with JAL
review_text: A great trip from Sydney to Tokyo. Plenty of space in Premium Economy. Friendly and efficient service from the staff on board. Food was fantastic, and plenty of movies to choose from. A relaxing flight that seemed to go by quite quickly.

title: Red eye to SIN
review_text: My flight from nrt to sin left late due to crosswinds at nrt. The cabin was clean. I was assigned a seat separate from my wife and couldn’t change it to Sit with her because the flight was fully booked. The in flight service was average. I still will fly with JAL if it is the best fit for my time table.

title: Have time for a meal first before a Red Eye flight
review_text: First impression was great as we were walking towards the Economy Check-In counter. We were greeted like VIPs and have our luggage placed on the belt. Then we were shown where to go for a complimentary Lounge access as Premium Economy passengers. The food in the lounge was so so but the beverages were very good. On the return flight, the lounge at Haneda was even better. There I had a good shower as I was prepared with fresh underwear and sox. But once on board, we were a bit disappointed with the in flight service especially the breakfast. On the return flight as well. So fill up first and relax on board. The headphones provided were above average and the movie selection have Orsca winners. The seating was very spacious with plenty of leg room. Most of all the slippers provided were most welcomed. So make sure you can kick off your shoes (no smelly feet please) and relax.

title: Wished I Could Have Rated It Higher
review_text:
We had heard great things about JAL so we're excited about our upcoming trip.  We have visited Japan 5 times on different airlines but have to say Air Canada wins for the best service.  Both the departing and returning JAL flights were delayed, by 2+ and 1+ hours respectively.  
JAL's service on the plane was fine, but the menu leaves something to be desired for the North American palate.  The food was well presented, enough to eat for most women, but very Japanese cuisine, with no Western food alternatives offered.  They have a good selection of movies.  The plane was fairly late model with tinted windows rather than pull down shades and there was the average seat leg and elbow space.  The staff was friendly and accommodating, but the Japanese female flight attendants speak very meekly and quietly so we could not understand any of their instructions over the plane intercom.  On the flight to Japan we sat in the boarding area 45 minutes because they announced that the plane was "not ready".  Then we boarded and sat on the tarmac in the plane for over an hour.  Because we departed so late, the air controllers had to re-schedule us into another flight slot.  On arriving in Japan we descended and were a few hundred feet from touchdown when the pilots thrust the engines and we climbed steeply back into the sky and flew back out over the ocean for another 20 minutes.  We were dismayed that a 10 hour flight became closer to 13 hours.  Anyone can have an off day, so were not expecting similar delays on our return flight.  The pilot then did speed up I suppose because even leaving an hour late, he got us back on schedule.  However we have never encountered these problems when flying Air Canada, our usual airline.  The flight prices were also almost a third more expensive than AC, even though we booked 7 months in advance.  However this could be because it was Christmas season travel.

title: Great flying experience with the exception of leg room
review_text: We flew economy, the flight attendants. food, and overall service was great.  The seats themselves were comfortable, however the leg room was really limited and especially if you are in a isle seat with the metal box that is attached to the outer legs of the chairs. I understand flying economy means you do have to give up some things but a place to put your legs should not be one of them.  On long flights it can be a serious health issue if you can't move your legs enough to keep from developing clots in your legs.

title: There's no better way to fly
review_text: WOW! Tired of paying for every little thing? Yes? Then this airline is for you. Checked bags NC (No Charge), two great on board meals NC, beer/wine/water NC, Blanket/pillow/headphones NC, Entertainment NC, great customer service NC. I have never had a better experience on a flight and in economy class. Plenty of leg room.

title: Rude customer service and flight attendent
review_text: Called to see if I can recover my JAL reward points and waited 30 minutes on the phone and talked for only 2 minutes and hung up on me after saying my points can not be recovered with bad attitude.  This made me associated with my flight experience with JAL.  Flight attendant pushing food cart and hit my knee while I was sleeping.  It was so painful and she didn't even say sorry.  JAL the worst airline I have ever experienced.  I will avoid this airline at all cost.

title: Premium Economy 787
review_text:
Was unable to secure exit row seats in economy so decided to give premium economy a go as I need the legroom. PE customers do not get any priority boarding but they do get access to the JAL Lounge which is very nice.
Was in seat 17K which is the first row behind the business class bulkhead so it has the most room of all the PE rows which meant I could get in and out without disturbing the passenger next to me. All other rows had plent of leg room too but if the person next to you "reclined" you would probably have difficulty getting past them. I say "recline" but in fact the seats move/slide forward rather than recline backwards so you do intrude on the space behind which I believe is a great way to go.
You get a small pack of stuff and basic noise cancelling headphones. The only let down for me was that the meal options were the same as economy so they were average choices. there were a couple of special alcoholic beverages in PE that were over what you could get in economy. The in flight service was very good. Overall believe that JAL PE is one of the best I have flown for the extra $.

title: 7 hours Jakarta, Indonesia (CGK) to Tokyo (Narita), Japan (NRT)
review_text: Even though I travel quite a bit this was my first flight on the Boeing 787-800 Dreamliner.  I booked my flights (except for in-country domestic Indonesia) through American who code shares with Pacific Cathay and JAL for Indonesia.  Even though JAL is a partner they would not let me get a reserved seat.  Not to worry...when I got to the Jakarta airport early for my flight they gave me a nice window seat in the exit row.  Their service is excellent including meal(s) and liquid refreshments.  The Japanese are extremely clean - the flight attendants actually vacuumed up around their galley and the exit row area.  I've never seen that done on a flight.  They keep coming at you to ask if you need anything else.  They keep the toilets immaculate.  JAL is an excellent airline/choice.  The Dreamliner pressurizes the cabin more like sea level (1 atmosphere) so you don't get the ear popping and you feel more relaxed after the flight.  Each seat has its own in-flight entertainment screen/suite.

title: Feel compelled to add to previous review
review_text:
In my previous review, I shared my mixed feelings after experiencing problems with seat selection.

On my return trip from Boston, I experienced what another traveler went through - waiting on the line for 1 hour before it was picked up.
However, the staff was polite and helpful. She could not change my seat to be seated with hubby but she put a note in the system that I have motion sickness and would prefer to sit next to hubby. I was advised to check in early.

At the airport, the staff did arrange  for me to sit beside hubby.

On both legs of the flight, a specific flight crew was designated to look after me. They would introduce themselves and check on me once in a while. Transiting at Narita, I exited the plane to find a ground staff holding a paper with my name and asking if I was ok. So much attention levied but not at all intrusive.First class service on board. 

If not for the hassle about not being able to choose seats for N class tickets, I would have chosen JAL anytime.

title: Excellent Service OnBoard & Spacious LegRoom
review_text:
Pleasantly surprised with excellent service onboard by their air stewardess & spacious leg room for economy class.
Meals were labelled clearly with the ingredients used in English & requests attended to almost immediately.
It was all smiles by their cabin members, didnt have to tolerate unpleasant feeling while onboard unlike with some other airlines that choose to serve you accordingly based on race or type of cabin class

title: Spacious, good service
review_text:
For a domestic flight it had spacious seating, even better than the international flights from Qatar Dublin-Osaka! Clean, nice service even received a beverage for free. 
Will fly JAL again.

title: Efficient and warm
review_text: My trip from Delhi to Tokyo was very comfortable and hassle free. Everything was moving like a clockwork. Typical Japanese efficiency with warm hospitality. Their collection of in flight entertainment was varied to suit all tastes. Food was excellent.  We were given "Second Meal" in advance, before they stopped serving. Great experience.

title: Hassle-free flight
review_text:
I was on my way home from Tokyo to Okayama. The train takes only a little longer, but I like to fly. This was a night flight with little to see and most people around me were dosing. JAL does these short flights as well as anyone and better than ost. Discreet, kindly service. Interference-free boarding and de-planing. A flight as smooth as the atmospheric conditions allow.

Which is more than I can say about the airport experience at Haneda. This was as full of hassles as the flight was free of them. Too many people, too many flights. Long walks through the airport buildings. Not fun. Good to board the plane and relax.

Good to be with JAL.

title: Superb service but not most modern cabin
review_text: JL #3 JFK (1125a) NRT (235p +1) was a 777 with four class of service (1st, business, premium economy and economy). Service from the cabin attendants was superb (would be nice if inflight service was half as good on U.S. carriers).  Food was ok.  Cabin configuration was not the most modern.  Seats were smaller, lacked storage space, laid out in older format with 2 seats along window side, but the inner seat does not have access to a window, and until the screen is raised between the two seats there is lack of privacy.  Lavatories are way too small.

title: Japan Airlines
review_text: Excellent flights! Both ways to and from Melbourne. Food was fantastic, especially from Narita to Melbourne. Toilets are always clean!! And I found there is more leg room on these flights. The price was average but well worth it!

title: Excellent customer service
review_text: We were really glad we upgraded to premium economy. This was a great airline to fly. Customer service was excellent. Seats reclined and there was a foot rest. Very comfortable flight with caring flight attendants.

title: Excellent Economy Service
review_text:
One of the best economy services I have had - The economy cabin was well designed, seats were super wide and had lots of leg room yet the seats were still comfortable. Pillow and blanket provided and unlike most airlines the pillow had some support and worked really well on the lower back.

Entertainment system was modern with lots of movie choices with USB seat power to charge your devices. 

Food service was good, limited options (just two choices) but lots of extra perks such as actual cutlery, a hot towel before dinner and lots of drink options.

Very impressed with the service on board from staff and the aircraft itself. Would certainly travel again with Japan Airlines.

title: Amazing Staff, good food, modern plane
review_text:
One of the best crews I have come across, great fun and super helpful. Could not have done more for us and the 4 kids we had travelling with us. 

Food was excellent and the plane was very modern and spacious. 

First time flying with JAL but would definitely fly again.

title: Very short flight
review_text: Had to go to Tokyo from Osaka and was using JAL. All was so perfect like everything in Japan. It was a pleasure

title: the best airline food for kids
review_text: better specify your preference in meal when you book.  They didn't have options for meal. in my flight to Tokyo, they only offer beef rice while i'm eating beef.  however, their kid's meal is the best among all other airlines that i have taken with yummy food and attractive decoration.  in plane equipment is a bit old but the overall conditions of the plane is neat and tidy.

title: The best airline food ever
review_text: I’ve never eaten good airline food (who has) but honestly JAL where amazing. Soba noodles with truffle sauce and fried chicken, egg fried rice. Really simple but really good and the best I have had on a flight by some distance.

title: Very comfy seats on premium economy
review_text: Enjoyed my flight on JAL. The attendants were very friendly and helpful. The premium economy seats were wide and spacious enough. Nice to be given a check-in baggage allowance of 2 pcs each at max 23kg each. The definite plus factor was that we were offered the use of a service lounge in Changi Airport that had a good choice of food and drinks.

title: Typical Japanese hospitality
review_text:
We knew we were in for some typical Japanese hospitality as the ground crew bowed deeply in unison on the tarmac as the plane taxied from the skybridge.

Our flight was uneventful, leaving and arriving on time, and the service was excellent.  The Dreamliner is quiet, the windows extra large and there is unusually good leg room for Economy Class.  However, the seats are surprisingly very hard.  They lack sufficient padding and become quite uncomfortable on a long journey.

The food was adequate but nothing special, but we were disappointed with the entertainment system, which had plenty of choice but poor sound, which made the movie soundtracks difficult to hear.

We were provided with the world's tiniest blanket, which barely covered a moderately sized male passenger. No doubt the airline wishes to reduce weight, but the blanket was simply inadequate.

title: Smooth, pleasant, on time
review_text: I have rarely experienced a problem-free flight, but this was it. Left and arrived on time. No hassles on boarding. Smooth flight. Regulation drink of complementary juice on the way, with a smile. A view of Mt. Fuji, pointed out by the pilot, for those on the other side of the plane from myself. No bump on landing. Suitcase rolled off the conveyor belt right on time. Great lunch with my daughter when I got downtown.

title: Short hop between Korea and Japan (ICN-HND) was excellent and on time w/ great service
review_text:
Excellent on time review of JAL. 
Took a flight from Seoul to Tokyo on a 2 hour flight aboard a Boeing 787-8 Dreamliner.

The Dreamliner plane made the journey very easy and felt great to fly in a better pressured plane.

Ground crew very efficient and quick to board & depart on time!

Flight crew was very professional and kept the plane very clean throughout.
Legroom was a bit shorter than the previous 787 I flew in but not too bad.
Food was great - full meal and snack/beverage service. 
Choice of western or Japanese style.
Real utensils !

Good attentive service and excellent IFE (entertainment screen).

Arrived ahead of schedule which was very nice!

Will definitely fly JAL again!

title: courtesy+efficiency+compassion+customer satisfaction...all there
review_text:
they were simply fantastic, their compassion is simply great !!! 
i have to return home, personal matter, and i expected them to 
charge me for change my flight,  they didn't and put me on their 
next flight home;

title: Comfortable flight, fantastic service
review_text: 12 hour flights are always a daunting prospect but JAL made this flight bearable with their professional service, good food and decent in flight entertainment.  Check staff were very helpful and the crew on board were super friendly.  Good leg room, nice choice of movies and music.  Pillows, blankets and headsets provided.  I usually do not eat a thing during flights, the food is usually inedible, but was very happy with dinner, snacks and breakfast.  Well done JAL.

title: Japan Airlines
review_text: This was by far the best airline we have ever traveled.  The staff were all very friendly and the trip was truly the experience of a lifetime.  There was more than enough room in the area and the flight was a total comfort.  Would definitely fly this airline again.

title: Sky Suite II nice but really narrow
review_text:
JAL operated this 10:40 am flight from Hong Kong to Narita with a B787 Dreamliner equipped with the Sky Suite II in business class.  Prior to boarding, I used the Cathay Wing First Class lounge instead of the Qantas business class lounge that is the JAL designated lounge.  Nothing wrong with the Qantas lounge as I have used it before but wanted to try the Wing for breakfast to compare.  There was a buffet with standard Western breakfast items as well as Chinese items such as dim sum and congee.  In addition, there was an a la carte menu with Western and Chinese items.  I ordered the glutinous rice chicken which was OK but served in an odd manner with the lotus leaves covering cut open in a rectangular opening on top which made it difficult to get to the food at the edges.  Service in the lounge was generally good and there was no wait for a table.  

Boarding at the gate was efficient with different frequent flyer groups separated for priority boarding so that JAL Diamond/One World Emerald members boarded first from a separate line, right after those needing assistance. 

The Sky Suite II is a fully flat seat but when fully reclined, it sinks very low to the ground and the space is very narrow so that lying on one's back, there is not much room for broader shoulders or much movement.  Nevertheless, I did manage some good sleep in the flat bed after meal service.   

There is a tray table under the video screen which when pulled out, can be flipped open to a decent sized table.  There is also a slot under the screen that can fit electronics with an outlet nearby to charge up your phone or other electronic.  A new addition is a contoured foam cushion (pictured) which is quite comfortable as a seat back but less useful as a pillow.  As always, service and food on JAL was excellent. 

A good short haul flight with a very comfortable seat and great food and service.

title: Best Airline ever
review_text: The best airline ever! All the flight attendants are so nice and kind. They always smile and that's make me feel good! The flight was so comfortable and clean. Recommend!

title: Excellent service
review_text: Check in staff were very polite and informative of where we should go after check in. The Sakura lounge has a very good selection. The JAL Shell Flat Neo seat was perfectly fine, not completely flat. In flight service was very good, from the meals to the very polite and respectful attentive flight attendants. Excellent experience.

title: Exceptional Value!
review_text: I visit Southeast Asia every three or four months and use one of the travel discount websites for the best price. Several times JAL has had the best price and most convenient times, they are a wonderful airline and the four or five times I've flown with them I've never been disappointed with any aspect of the flight, they're superb!
Very professional service crew, from check-in counter to plane crew. Nice food and extra legroom really helps especially on long haul flight.

title: Overall excellent travel experience
review_text: Wonderful first class lounge...very attentive, efficient and polite stuff in lounge, at boarding and inflight. Very intelligent seats and very nice japanese inflight food service. excellent inflight entertsinment system: definitely one of the best sielines in the world!

title: Website is tough to navigate
review_text:
Japan Airlines (JAL)

World

Review for their website to reserve/book air ticket

573148938

This review is for booking an air ticket on their website. It is usually recommended to buy the air ticket directly from the airline and I had a great experience with other AA, United, Delta website before. 

However, with Japan Airline, the website keeps showing tickets that are not available for booking or the seats are not available. You keep seeing the ticket, select it, fill in the passengers information and then, the website will pop the window say " It could not find the fare you selected". They should let the website hold the ticket the moment passenger choose the ticket, and give time to fill info and pay (say 15mins). 

The funny part is when I am on phone with a customer agent (for JL in USA- 1-800-525-3663). The agent is seeing the ticket in their system (9 seats left at the price for that flight). At the same time, I am trying to buy that ticket at the same time on my computer when she is on the other side of the phone, the same error popped up and would not allow me to book that ticket. 

Japan airline really needs to fix and integrate their website better with their ticket system. 

Customer service is generally great inflight and through phone (if you can wait 30mins-1hr).

title: First flight to Tokyo
review_text: Very impressed with this airline. Nice food, extremely friendly staff and more leg room than average. Both flights were on time and everything went very smoothly. At Haneda airport we were given complimentary access to the sakura lounge which was nice. Would recommend.

title: A delightful flight
review_text:
I would have given them 5 stars but lost one star because my breakfast had been overlooked after taking my order. I eventually press the call button and enquired about my "omelette" breakfast but because the plane was about to land in 2 hours, it would be too late to have the "omelette" and had to pick one of the Japanese dishes which was delivered promptly.
However, I could not fault the service, the care and efficiency of the staff.
The plane was immaculate and the restroom spotless.
That said, I would have no hesitation to fly Japan Airline again.

title: A Sadomasochist's delight
review_text:
Just before boarding, I requested help from the JAL staff.  I was carrying a 1 year old baby and I was in pain from a bad bac.  The JAL staff refused assistance and as I proceeded down the boarding ramp I collapsed with my child.  The JAL staff stood there and watched.  They refused to help.  Worse, they loaded all passengers of the 747 who had to step over me and my child to board.  It was only after all passengers had boarded before the crew came out to help me with a wheel chair.

The humiliation I suffered was nothing short of abuse.  I will never fly JAL again.  NEVER!

title: Sydney to Tokyo JL772 Business
review_text:
I've been lucky enough to take this flight a number of times and I marvel at the schedule.  It leaves Sydney at 8.15am and arrives in Narita at 5.05pm.  It's very reliable, and these are sociable hours. JAL uses the Qantas Business and First lounges which are more than adequate and serve a decent breakfast beforehand.  I traveled with family including a toddler.
Boarding is efficient with Business and First having their own boarding line at the gate.  Business passengers have SkySuites which regularly win awards.  The configuration is 2-2-2 but there's the added advantage of all window seat passengers having their own convenient entry "hallway".  
I do have a gripe.  After they turn the seatbelt signs off, they start the lunch service which in my opinion, is far too early.  By the time they serve drinks, hand out menus and take orders, lunch is served around 10.30am.  I'm convinced that it's to fit in with the staffs' break schedule because, after this, many of them disappear.  My second gripe is that over the years, they've hardly changed the menu.  There are 2 choices, - Western or Japanese.  Western is always appetisers followed by either "Western beef" or some sort of fish dish.  Japanese is a selection of appetizers, then a Japanese specialty.  Whilst it is very well presented and in some cases colorful, the format never changes.  The children's meals were very unappealing and were left untouched.   There's a variety of snacks which they say, can be served "any time".  The service is gracious and respectful and in all instances, every effort is made to help. The standard of English varies from very good to adequate.  
The beds are flat and you are supplied with a mattress and a thin quilt.  The pillows are a bit inadequate however it's possible to get some reasonable sleep.
The passenger/restroom ratio is positive and there's rarely a need to wait.  They're always spotless.
I always feel very safe on this flight and they're a stickler for keeping to the schedule.  Their business class fares are more than competitive when compared to other airlines. 
I find them hard to beat, all things considered.  It connects well with onward flights to Europe and the US but also arrives at the perfect time for a hotel stopover at Narita which I prefer to do.  
However, their attention to children is very poor.  There are no coloring books or amusements offered although there are some childrens movies. 
Apart from this, the schedule, safety procedures and value are good.

title: Best flight experience ever
review_text: Extremely welcoming and kind flight staff, both in terminal and on flight, excellent food, roomy seats, spotless plane, lots of amenities etc, etc, - I could go on and on. And this was Economy! JAL, Please don’t ever change.

title: Great business class pod
review_text: I have a bad back, and we’d still wanted to take our daughter to Japan. Flights in/ out of Haney’s offered business class pods. Everything was super comfortable, even for me. Seats fold entirely flat. Extra Futon cushion is available. Privacy dividers slide up between pods. Food service was excellent. Everything was very clean and well designed. Plenty of space to put all your stuff. Gift bag just so-so. The lounge at haneda was pretty crummy. We were totally surprised by the low quality accommodation and food. But to feel great after an 11 hour flight is really something special. Highly recommended, if you can afford it, we used a combo of miles and money.

title: Always Happy Flight with Wonderful Crew
review_text: I enjoyed the flight with JAL always.  Unfortunately the Japanese Diner is not so great, but I can take a rest in long flight.

title: Timely management and good services
review_text: It's true that you deserve to be among the best top 10 airlines, because of your outstanding services. From check in to Cabin crew services is good for someone to enjoy your flight. Some of the tips you gives us during the trip e.g, while across mount Fuji is important for us view and enjoy our journey.

title: Flying in style
review_text:
We recently flew to South Korea for the Winter Olympics and decided to use our miles on Japan Airlines for business class seats.  This might have been our most impressive flight in all of our travels from the states (includes Europe, Australia, and New Zealand all in business class). 

First the staff was impeccable. They were attentive, friendly, and regularly checked if we needed anything. I realize we were in business class but from what I could tell the entire cabin was treated just as well. 

The seats were plush and had a lot of space. My only reservation is the fact that the chair does not lay completely flat. Not that you couldn’t completely stretch out but I am weird and can’t sleep well at a slightly angled position. It feels as if I am sliding down. The tv screens were easy to navigate and the selection of movies (new and blockbuster) was perfect. If you decide to bring your own headphones make sure you have a double jack. 

My one negative of the flight are the windows. I like that you can greatly dim them into a deep blue to block the sun, but we were on the side where the sun was directly hitting the window and even with the dim selection we were blinded while laying back. There should still be an option to black them completely out with a shade. 

Finally the food was fantastic. An American and Japanese selection was available (my palette was not advanced enough to try the eel or squid, but the soups were amazing). 

I highly recommend this airline.

title: Best Airline in the World - Quite Possibly!
review_text:
I had never flown on Japan Airlines before, but had always heard great reviews.  On my last trip to India I flew China Eastern, needless to say I will never fly this airline again if I can avoid it because of the horrible experience from start to finish.  
Japan Airlines was fantastic - decent meals, well organized and a crew that is truly interested in making your flight the best possible.

title: Comfort & Service
review_text: Flew JL Flt#5, seats 21 H/K & returned JL Flt#6, seats 19 H/K We had the premium economy window & aisle seats on the right side. Seats were roomy, the service was very good. Close enough proximity to the bathroom without all the noise. Food was ‘okay’, but they made up for it with lots of beverages, soups & various side dishes. A large selection of free movies were available in various languages, some with subtitles (plus nice headphones).We were also able to use the lounge at both airports which had an assortment of free food & drink (especially Haneda).

title: Flight on schedule, lovely air stewardesses, delicious food
review_text: Everything was wonderful about Japan Airlines, especially the most gentle and well-mannered staff to the quality of the food served onboard.  Clean seats, clean toilets, punctual flight and good range of latest movies.

title: Best flight experience we have ever had
review_text:
We can't speak highly enough about JAL generally, and their business class in particular.  From the moment we checked in at Sydney airport till we walked out of the airport in Narita we had an amazing time and a lovely experience.  The flight attendants were typically gentle, beautiful Japanese ladies (yes only ladies in our section) who smiled and made us feel that nothing was too much trouble. Quite different from some other airlines (who will remain nameless) where the attendants give the unmistakable impression that they really are above serving the lowly public and that they really don't want to be here.  Not so with JAL attendants.

The seats themselves were brilliant.  Full lay back seats in their own quite substantial pods, so much better than business class seating on some other airlines where the seats are just much bigger and more space.  This we felt was more like a 1st class experience (although we haven't traveled 1st class, we can only imagine).  We chose the Japanese menu and it was excellent food, set out on a little table cloth with white linen, sometimes a bento box and sometimes plated food. Complimentary French champagne was offered frequently along with glass refills, plus other drinks of course.  

The screen was very large and down the end of the pod so the whole experience was perfect, sitting with legs stretched right out, watching the screen, eating lovely Japanese food and drinking French Champagne.  Ahh bliss. Shame it is only a 9.5 hour trip.

The toilets were clean and immaculate right to the end of the flight.  Fresh flowers in the cubicles were a nice touch.

We had heard that JAL is one of the best and we can 100% agree and say that it was the best flight experience we have ever had - the icing on the cake for 2 glorious weeks in beautiful Japan.  (Can you tell we are fans of Japan?)

title: Direct Boston to Tokyo
review_text: A very convenient flight that was dealt with pleasantly and efficiently.. Food was OK; addition of some western selections would help.

title: Mixed feelings- system can be improved; service is good
review_text:
My hubby and I had tickets bought at different times as he was flying on corporate account. We could not check in until 24 hrs before departure. When we did try, we were not allowed to change seats for the first leg of the flight. After calling the customer service line, the staff could not help either.  She was polite and apologetic. She would put a note in the system to indicate we would like to be seated together. She advised us to go to airport 3 hrs before departure at get it done.

We did arrive at airport 5 plus in the morning. The check-in counter staff said she could not change and we would have to wait till another passenger check in, upon which the staff would ask if he is agreeable. We were told to find out at the departure gate.
Since it is such a long flight, we were a bit anxious not to know till boarding. Thankfully, a passenger agreed to change seats.
The flight experience was good.

We now have to call again to request for seat change before our return flight. I hope we won't have to do the same all over again.

In short, the system was bad but the staff helped to make the experience a little easier to swallow.

title: Customer service is a joke
review_text: Booked a flight, then had to change schedule. It is still within 24 hour window so I thought it should be fine, since I've done that with Chase Ultimate rewards and JAL website says you can cancel within 24 hours. However, I called customer service and I waited for 1 hour, still no one answered the phone. LONGEST wait in vain in my whole life. Guess that's their way to make it pass 24 hours so you can not return.

title: Japan Airlines economy does not accommodate Sumos.
review_text: Seats in the economy section are designed for Japanese people thus someone my size (not much off Sumo) is almost impossible. Though the flight was only 9.5 hours, I was in pain for most of my waking moments.  The passenger next to me was aware of my quandary and did not get in my space; there just wasn't enough.  For those of us larger than an average carrier should always consider a western carrier.  Kansai was a very efficient airport and staff was very pleasant.

title: Good experience, reliable airline
review_text:
Boeing aircrafts to and from Narita International. Comfortable seating, good selection of in-flight entertainment, efficient and friendly crew. Food is culture and if you claim you are an airline that respects other cultures, the food choices and flavors should be taken care of. Despite JL has been flying to and from India since many decades, their food was bland, not filling and not satisfactory. 

I gave feedback and a senior member of the crew was professional and kind enough to come and listen to me, apologize and offer me a basket of snacks. It helped a bit but the flavors were light years away from any Indian palate. 

Over 10 hours flight without yummy food is pretty much a torturer but rest of the experience -  On-time performance, check-in, landing, luggage service etc. was great.

title: Great service
review_text: The food is beautiful, the service excellent and in Business class there is room to sleep. We are frequent fliers and the Japan Air service is consistently better than the other airlines we fly.

title: A bliss
review_text: I have made the round trip  Tokyo - Kyoto - Tokyo. Both flights were astoundingly comfortable, relaxing and stress-free. Even when I was slightly late the staff kept their cool and calmed me down. It is hard to find flaws in their service. I believe it is harder for them to think of ways how to improve their service which is impeccable.

title: Smooth, almost pleasant
review_text:
Not a hitch, not a problem. My flight was smooth, service impeccable. On time, efficient and almost a pleasure. The automatic luggage check in machine in Haneda was a trip in itself. Not quite a robot, but it took charge of my luggage and issued a receipt without any human involvement..

Haneda Airport is a bit of a maze but I knew enough to allow time to get to my gate. Okayama, much smaler, made everything easier. I barely slowed down between leaving my seat on the plane and boarding the bus for downtown.

title: Vacation
review_text: I fly a lot and on many airlines and really liked JAL much more than most. The plane was very clean, The staff were friendly and helpful.  Leg room is average. The meals were very good and did not leave an after taste. What really cought my eye were the staff continually cleaning, restocking and organizing their areas. I just wish they to more areas. Highly recommend.

title: JAL flight a highlight of trip
review_text:
Impeccable service, beautifully presented meals; plenty of leg room; comfortable, multiposition seats that lie flat (mattress and pillows available); 23" personal monitors (plenty of entertainment choice) worked perfectly; privacy screens between seats; outlets to charge electronics. I usually don't sleep well on planes; slept like a baby on this flight.

A splurge that was worth every nickel - especially for a 12-hour flight.

title: What a way to fly!
review_text:
I cannot remember ever having the type of attention I received on this flight.  Gentle, attentive, softly spoken, and willing to make me as comfortable as good be.  And, a small aside, they have a bidet on the
plane.  I loved it.  And they have two different menus.  One for Japanese food and one for American/European style food.

title: Long, but Comfortable flight
review_text: We all know that flying from N.Y. to Tokyo is a long flight.  With that being said, Air Japan was excellent all around.  The staff made sure that all was fine on a regular basis.  All of our needs were attended to and we never had to search out a staff member,  Instead they were there to ask us what we required first.  Good food (for an airline), comfy seats.  They even blocked out the middle seat of three seats so we had more room to relax.

title: Excellent and friendly service.
review_text: Flying JAL was clearly a better experience than flying with the three major US airlines.  And I have flown with all 3 to Asia.   The staff of JAL provide excellent service, and they do so with a genuine smile.  The customer truly feels they are appreciated by the staff and are responsive to any request the customer has.    This is the fourth time I have flown with JAL and each experience has been consistent and worthy of my highest rating.  the 787 I flew in was comfortable and I had sufficient leg room.  Also, the personal viewing screen worked flawlessly and the sound quality was very good.  the offerings of movies and TV shows were quite numerous.  Now for the food: the two meals we received were tasty, and again, much better than what I have received in the past from the 3 major US airlines.   Wine and beer were complimentary.

title: Great Airline!!
review_text: Flight left and arrived on time. Excellent service from take off to landing.  Restrooms were clean. Flight crew did a great job

title: Premium Economy
review_text:
Flights left and arrived on time, plenty of leg room and nice wide seats.Service was good,
plenty of food, really didn't eat all of every meal. It would be nice if they were a little more English spoken since flying between two English speaking countries.They would just show you picture and you had to pick. Less of the airline selling store...One landing was very ruff, not sure if we had a new pilot. Overall I was happy with flight and would fly JAL again.

title: THIS is what your call service. The Japanese/Asian way. Superb.
review_text:
hospitality and service is one of the top in the business. At every step of the way, the service was exceptional. From check-in, in-flight, to leaving. 

We also used our miles to upgrade us part-way to business class. If you are able to, this is the way to fly long-distance. Attentive. Hospitable. PE seats recline partially. but with the foot rest, it makes a world of a difference - to aid support (especially for those vertically challenged). Business seats of course recline all the way down. Giving you a good rest. Food was good, as usual. In between snacks even better. :D 

only negative is their max luggage weight is so much lower than other airlines flying the same route.

title: Good Service and sufficient leg room
review_text:
Good Service and sufficient leg room in economy.
Staff is attentive and provide drinks throughout the flight.

title: Comfortable and efficient service
review_text: Our JAL flights left and arrived on time...the seats were spacious even for economy class, and service was excellent. Food was also quite good...I especially enjoyed the miso soup and the green tea. Our little niece even got a free toy. Their inflight entertainment system is easy to use and had all the latest movies. I thoroughly enjoyed our 4 hour flight and would highly recommend this airline.

title: Very nice experience
review_text: Ive flew JAL overseas from Hawaii but this was and inter island flight in Japan to get to another location. Typical Japanese fashion, everything is always prompt and orderly. The staff was gracious and helpful. A bit of a language barrier but yet you still can get around. The flight was smooth and was able o get some undisturbed rest. Japanese flights to me seem so quite compared to US flights. No crying babies or people talking loudly. Wonderful.

title: JAL 787 Business Class Narita (NRT) to San Diego (SAN)
review_text:
Aboard their 787, I was expecting to have a roomy, modern business class, but instead the layout was 2-2-2. Normally, I would have been disappointed. I had just gotten off of the JAL SIN-NRT flight and the 777's business class was a 1-2-1 layout that featured weird seats in the center where the legs of the two center seat passengers overlap, but at different heights, making one person uncomfortably low and the other uncomfortably high, cramped, and claustrophobic. So, on the NRT-SAN flight, I was looking forward to try something different--and found the seats to be quite comfortable for sleeping.

Seated in the back row of the biz cabin was not a problem, until mealtime, when they ran out of entrees that my seat mate and I had ordered. I pushed back, at business class prices, I expected to at least get the meal I wanted. (They made someone else change their mind, which I felt bad about, but why did they target us for the forced change?)

The amenity kit was a bit lackluster, but in general they are a waste, so I didn't mind.

I wouldn't seek out JAL for business class travel. Their product is not at the same level as Cathay Pacific, or Singapore Airlines. But the cabin crew were attentive when you needed something and quick to pickup finished trays.

title: Comfy Seats in Business Class
review_text: Unlike previous flights on JAL, the Business Class attendants were a little more forthcoming with alcohol on this flight. I know it's a minor point, especially with all the "air rage" incidents, but they can look at my records and realize I'm a million miler on their partner. Seats were comfortable and angled flat. Business Class was not filled to capacity, so if you've chosen the wrong seat, you should be able to change. Sadly, these were "old style" seats in a 2-2-2 configuration, meaning that if you are travelling solo, get one of the middle 2 seats so no one is crawling over you to get to the bathroom.

title: Improved class of service
review_text:
On time departure ; fuss free
Stewardesses speak more English now better than ever
Service is excellent; always there to please passengers 
Food is a lot better than previous years
Cristal Roderer champagne 
Several compartments for hand carry items and bags
Movies:  up to date
Additional comfortable mattress always welcome 
Lovely clean  comforter

title: Much Better Service Than US Airlines
review_text: Flew roundtrip in economy between NY JFK and Tokyo Haneda on Japan Airlines (JAL).  Boeing 777 non-stop.  Good flights.  Economy is cramped as with nearly all airlines, but service level is quite high.  Flight attendants are well dressed, very polite, and always smiling - they aim to please throughout the flight.  Food is acceptable, including 2 meals and a snack, with ice cream for dessert at the first meal.  Definitely a step up from United or American.

title: Best flight I have had in a long, long time.
review_text: Outstanding service, peaceful flight, most courteous and efficient service I have received on a flight in a long, long time

title: Trans-Pacific flight made easy
review_text: I never fly to and from Japan with any other airlines than this one.  It's non-stop to and from San Diego, so you can avoid the hassle-bustle at LAX or SFO, and of course you'll never miss a connecting flight.  The service is superb and the food is excellent.  All my friends in Japan use this flight now.

title: Wonderful Flight
review_text: One of the best flights I have experienced.  Flight crew was very accomodating and made sure every part of the flight was comfortable.  Kudos for customer service above and beyond.

title: Almost like Business Class
review_text: JAL’s premium economy is pricey but worth it. Your luggage is tagged priority and you have lounge access. Air France Lounge is okay with a very limited selection, fruits, cheese and crackers and cup of noodles. Beverage choices from white and red wines, coffee, juice and water. If I may add, the gentleman when you check in, is by far, a person without personality. No greeting or smile came from him. Sakura Lounge in Narita is far better, good selection of food and excellent service. There are massage chairs that are very relaxing. Now the flight, Premium Economy seats are very comfortable and there’s at least a good 5-6 inches of legroom space for a 5’11. You don’t bother the person behind you when you recline. The seats would slide and you can release the leg rest and have a good comfortable flight. Food going to NRT was very good, coming back it was okay. The flight attendants are very attentive always with a smile on their face.

title: Nice flight, but you starve
review_text: Nice flight. Comfortable seats, kind staff. Clean toilets. Only one negative aspects: food is terrible. Japanese style boxes, meaning tiny servings and mainly salad. You just eat salad. Bring some food from home

title: Language Issues
review_text: I am indebted to the Japanese businessman traveling behind us in Economy Plus for knowing more about the electronics in the cabin, and being able to explain them to me in perfect English, than any of the flight crew, whose English was lacking. I wanted to read using my iPad without running out of battery, and knew there had to be a way on our Boeing jet to get that power. The flight attendants were clueless. The businessman told me the USB port would not work but that there was an electric plug near the floor on the barrier between seats. And so there was. And this businessman provided me instantly with the plugs I'd need, although I did have all those converters and plugs in my carry on bag in the overhead bin.  The flight attendants also had no clue why my iPad was picking up a full five bar wi-fi signal throughout the flight. Japan Airlines may have wi-fi with air to ground connectivity on certain parts of the flights, but the attendants were unable to either explain it or knew nothing about it.

title: Great business class, but you pay for it
review_text: Business Class on JAL is definitely a step up from that offered on UA, AA, DL, and AC, however, I'm not certain it was worth the premium price I paid.  The hard product (mini-suite) was great, especially if you have a window seat.  I slept better on this flight than any others in recent memory, primarily due to the amount of privacy, the large footwell, and the complimentary foam pad.  I thought the food was just so-so, and the service was on par with what I have experienced on US-based carriers in a premium class.  I paid a $900 premium to fly JAL, but I don't think I would do that again.  If I could find a JAL flight within $200-300 of US carriers, I would pay that premium for the privacy and enhanced sleep experience.

title: Friendly and Efficient
review_text: This was my first time flying solo, especially internationally. But JAL was so helpful and worked with me to cultivate an enjoyable and smooth experience.

title: Fantastic
review_text: After flying to Indonesia on Singapore Airlines and Cathay Pacific, we booked with JAL from Boston to Jakarta through Tokyo. We were very happily surprised with the organization, the beautiful Boeing 787, and the food and service. The other two aforementioned airlines are also very good. However, the JAL fare was a little cheaper and the premium economy seats were much better room wise and more comfortable. Plus there were only two flight segments to Indonesia rather than 3 or 4. I highly recommend JAL for flights from Boston to Asia or Southeast Asia.

title: Business class isn't great
review_text:
First class is not offered on this flight and the business class seemed to be only a slight level from regular class.  Not worth $18,000 of air miles.  Typically when we fly business we are offered a glass of champagne before departure and a menu, not on this flight.  They came around with a warm towel before food service and really that was all.  Snacks were rice crackers in a typical snack bag, on previous flights our snacks are on plates.  The group lounge in Vancouver is horrible, the food was awful and the only drinks they offered were beer.  We ended up eating before our flight.  The service on the flight was ok, the flight attendants seemed irritated that we didn't understand the menu options.  The food was awful, not one decent thing to eat.  We tried their Japanese menu, awful and then their western menu, awful!  

On the way to Narita the baggage handler destroyed my daughters luggage, they let us know our luggage would be bagged in plastic on arrival to Japan.  We had to find the JAL damaged luggage and even though this was inconvenient they were fantastic about replacing which is why I gave them 3 stars.  

Whenever we fly long distance we fly business and this is by far the worst business class we have ever had.  The seats do not lay down like a bed, the feet actually go under the seat in front very low so if you have swelling issues like I do you have to sit up the entire time so your feet aren't at floor level.

title: Flying Economy JFK - Narita and back.
review_text: Took the family to Japan and wanted to use miles. JAL was a participant in the milage program we use. We flew economy and expected very little as far as comfort and food goes. We were all pleasantly surprised. I am 6ft tall and thought the legroom more than adequate. The food was non-frills but good enough for my picky family. The snack of a Hagen Das cup of ice cream was a real treat. The attendants were all very friendly and eager to help. Boarding and exiting was straight forward and the entertainment system had all of us occupied as expected.  The only drawback for me was the seat itself. For long hauls like this, I would have liked something a bit more comfortable. I am not talking about the size but shape and or the cushioning. Passengers are expected to be in their seats for extended periods of time and this seat left me sore by the time we landed.

title: Convenience to Japan
review_text:
Convenient connections in Japan... the service is good, meals are decent compared to others, but the temperature during flight is always an issue.  Just about every flight I take, I have to ask the cabin attendants to decrease the temperature.

Check-in service at the terminals in Japan seem extremely time consuming and lines tend to be long compared to the US operations... don't know why?  So, it's good to give yourself some extra time to avoid the panic.

title: BOS to NRT Non-stop
review_text: We selected premium economy seats 17A and 17C bulkhead front row.  Service was excellent.  Seats were roomy with good layback.  Plenty of room on the floor to throw stuff. Highly recommend JAL.  Off on time and arrived on time.

title: Japan Airline flight from San Diego, California, USA  to Bangkok, Thailand
review_text: Very nice and friendly services to customers at checking in. All flight attendants were also nice and provided good service as well. I would recommended to flight with JAL rather than others. I love to fly with them again.

title: customer servece second to none.:
review_text: the best customer service I ever had.!Asian hospitality is the best..what a different culture..the staff is so friendly..

title: I ravelled coach but was still comfortable
review_text: We traveled coach and were still relatively comfortable. There was sufficient leg room, the entertainment was varied and there was lots of it to last the 14 hour flight three and 12 hour flight back. Bathrooms were CLEAN throughout the trip, pillows, blankets, tooth brushes, meals (all good and one was really tasty) free wine etc. made a very long rip in coach very pleasant.The flight attendants are polite and solicitous- they don't simply disappear. You can carry on two bags and check two bags for free. In other wrds, once you pay for your ticket they don't nickel and dime you. Another great thing i thoe majority of the customers are Japanese so the flight is quiet- no drama- and everyone is polite- how wonderful on a very long flight. I love JAL.

title: Feels like first class
review_text:
I was flying in Economy but the service made me feel like it was first class.
The flight attendants are the best.  Makes a long flight more tolerable.

title: Not as comfortable as I expected.
review_text: The departure lounge is Lufthansa based. It's nice but nothing spectacular. The service on board is impeccable. The food was delicious and varied. Unfortunately,I found the bed uncomfortable and difficult to sleep in. On a 15 hour flight, that's rough.

title: An Unusually Enjoyable Flight
review_text: Despite the fact that two hours into our 11+hour flight we had to turn back to LAX, sit on the tarmac for several hours while the problem with the plane was fixed, i was highly satisfied with the service... we were updated frequently on the status of the flight and arriving at Narita we were put on buses (at no expense to us)  to Tokyo Station and other places; then after submitting additional transportation expense receipts we were later reimbursed for that. The return flight had no surprises and the flight attendants were just as thoughtful and efficient.

title: Great service
review_text: Booked through BA who neglected to tell us that with JAL you can check in 72 hours in advance so by the time we checked-in there were only single seats available! Explained this at the gate and a member of the JAL team took us on to the plane and negotiated with other passengers and got us seated together. We were so impressed! Not only was she incredibly helpful and efficient but she negotiated in English, Japanese and French!!

title: Excellent Service
review_text:
I booked this flight using Alaska Airline miles and initially booked a business class seat but a week later I was able to locate availability for first class seats. Checkin at JFK Terminal 1 was a breeze and it took maybe 2-3 minutes in the dedicated First class line.
