Since JAL does not participate in TSA PreCheck we used the standard TSA line and that process took way longer than it needed to because TSA doesn't know how to get their act together. Luckily for us JAL added the Lufthansa Senator lounge at JFK as of January so we were lucky to get to use this lounge instead of the Air France one (still available and you can switch between both). The lounge was nice and the views of the runway were great for making the time pass by. We left the lounge 15 minutes before boarding and had no problem boarding with the priority section of travelers. The JAL first class cabin is really nice and with only 8 suites it feels both spacious and private. Everyone we interacted with during our 14+ hour flight was super friendly and I greatly enjoyed myself. The food was incredible and I would recommend that you try the Japanese menu as everything was so yummy. My single complain about this flight was the temperature at which the cabin was kept. I tried falling asleep but couldn't very well because the cabin felt so hot for the entire flight.

The seat is very spacious and when you're ready to sleep a mattress pad and pjs are provided along with a heavier blanket (you are unlikely to need it since it's so hot on the plane). 

Overall I look forward to earning more Alaska miles to redeem them for another chance to fly on JAL first.

title: You Won't Want To Get Off The Jet
review_text:
This service is a cut above the rest. The flight crew were incredibly attentive and the cabin was incredibly calm. It's quite a way to feel as though you're in Japan well before you arrive. 

I've flown other Asian carriers and I'd say one of the real perks here is the experienced cabin crew. Those on other carriers are OK, but many of these flight attendants have been doing this for years, which means they know service and "Omotenashi." Look it up!

You won't regret springing for this!

title: Golden Age of Air Travel Lives Here...
review_text: Travel in a Dreamliner and experience amazing staff and a throwback to when flying was a big part of the thirill and overall experience. We simply loved this airline, their staff and the larger seats in economy made it all so memorable.

title: The Best!!
review_text: I always enjoy Dying JAL First Class, but this particular flight was the best of them all.  I had the entire front cabin to myself, which included three JAL stewardess.  the service is usually a bit robotic, but this time the staff was energetic and full of personality. They were proactive in anything I might have wanted and offered extra caviar.  I had them dancing in the galley to American music and just had an overall great time with them.  The bed is always wide and comfortable and the food was excellent.  I do miss have Salon as the champagne.  I look forward to the next trip with JAL.

title: Courtesty plus
review_text: The most courteous flight attendants that I have ever had on any flight.   The uniforms were very neat and they all wore the same uniform on board.   They bowed each time when they were giving the safety talk.   Very attentive and accommodating.

title: Best flight experience
review_text: I flew from Boston to Thailand on JAL business class it it was such an incredible experience compared to my return on AA in first class!

title: Not much leg room!!!!
review_text: I flew flight 8411 (AA and Japan Airlines) from Narita to Bangkok.  It was around a 7 hour flight and the seat I had was a coach, aisle seat and there was very little room for my legs.  I was in seat 27H and the plane was a 787.  The flight attendants were great but the seat room left a lot to be desired.  The food on Japan Air was excellent!!!!  The flight was super except for the abbreviated room to stretch out on.

title: Another comfortable Transpacific flight with Japan airlines!
review_text: Flew Japan airlines Boeing B777-300 from JFK to Tokyo Narita.    Boarding was on time and orderly.    The aircraft looked like it was only a few month old from Boeing factory.   Cabin crews are super friendly and courteous.     Quality of in flight meals and snacks were also pretty decent.     They ran water and juice service literally every 45 mins throughout the entire flight.     Arrival in Tokyo was on time and really enjoyed this long haul flight with Japan airlines.

title: Enjoyable Flight
review_text: After a trip to Japan in 2016 with Japan Airlines we were just as happy to fly with them again this year. The staff are very attentive and helpful and the food and drink service was very good. Not sure if it’s standard size but there seemed to be plenty of leg room. Staff were always around even during the night, offering a snack when you went to the bathroom (which was kept very clean) and regularly walking through offering water. Would be very happy to fly JAL again.

title: No better or worse than any other carrier
review_text: I chose a non-stop JAL flight for our family trip despite the increased price.My families prior flights on JAL had been fine ,Dinner was not served until I was falling asleep and I  declined it. Only an Asian breakfast that I could not eat was available.

title: Top Notch!
review_text: Wow!  I never thought flying could be this comfortable!  13 hour flight from Boston to Tokyo was a breeze!  We also had access to the airport lounge, which had great food, snacks and drinks.  Seats in premium economy were comfortable and spacious.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.  Service was fast and the meals were good.  Highly recommended, I will be using Japan Airlines again.

title: Best flight ever
review_text:
We had seats in premium economy that were not adjacent, so we asked the woman at check-in if it would be possible to switch with someone.  She typed for entirely too long an then very apologetically said that premium economy was over-booked and asked if we would be okay flying in business class.  She was so apologetic that my wife thought we were being down-graded. 
After 14 hours in business class with lie-flat seats in a brand new Dreamliner snacking on wagyu, my wife suggested that we just keep going to Europe.  Not the typical sentiment after a long flight.
Aside from the upgrade, it was a great flight.

title: great trip
review_text: The staff were very friendly, we asked if we could seat together as there were 4 and they accommodated us well with plenty of leg room and seats were great and comfy and the food was hot and tasty, would not hesitate to fly with them again even if the price to fly was a bit high but well worth the money

title: Worst nightmare of my life while traveling
review_text: We have flown with JAL many times. The service has always been stellar. The employees on the ground and in the air have always been wonderful. However, this trip was HORRIBLE and unscrupulous. We connected in Chicago and were on our way to Narita International Airport in Tokyo. Once we would land, we knew we had a 2 hour and 15 minute layover. Surely that would be enough to land, taxi to the gate, deplane, go through immigration, get to the next terminal for departure, go through security, and check in to the departure gate. When we landed, a JAL employee met us at the airplane door and asked if we were going to Fukuoka? We said yes and she said simply, "late". We didn't know what she meant. Upon arriving at the JAL connecting gate for Fukuoka, we were told that the flight had already departed. We were 30 minutes EARLY, but for some unexplained reason, they said we were late. Since we were totally exhausted from the 13 hour flight, we were in shock. We started asking why, what to do, where to get info for next flight, why our flight had departed early...etc. We were shocked that few people spoke fluent English. Over the next 45 minutes to an hour, we were sent from place to place within the airport. Finally, I almost fainted from overheating and exhaustion. My wife was standing in yet another JAL line trying to get information. The line was extremely long. I shouted to her that I needed to get somewhere to lay down or I would faint. JAL was of no help whatsoever. No one inside Narita could speak English well enough to see that we were in extreme distress. Nor could they direct us to help. We ended up taking a chance and boarding a bus that was for the Crown Plaza Hotel. The police did not help us, the taxi drivers were useless. Only this bus driver would help. We were taken to this hotel where we told the manager of our problems and they accommodated us with superb compassion. We called the ANA airlines and made new reservations to continue to our final destination. Two days later, at our new hotel, we called our booking agent, American Express, to tell her of our plight. They called JAL to reconfirm our original plans and tickets. JAL told AMEX that, since we did not report our missed flight connection to the right party, our tickets home were INVALIDATED!!!!!!!!!!! Further, to get home, JAL wanted us to pay $15,000.00 for one way tickets back to the US. In other words, our $12,000 tickets which we had paid for 6 months prior, were now invalid, and it would cost us $15,000.00 more to get home. They told us this at 2:30 am!!!!! We were totally incensed and outraged. We argued for two hours with JAL, who refused to change their position. They said it was our fault!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!. My wife was on the verge of a nervous breakdown. I was about to have my fourth heart attack.  Our AMEX representative decided to get the JAL rep to get her supervisor on the phone. Our AMEX rep told us she would handle it and would call us back. Two hours passed and at 4:30 am she called us back. She was able to get our tickets re-validated and get us back on track. CAN you imagine how infuriated we were with JAL. They would have left us stranded in Japan unless we paid them an additional $15,000. They told us to read the fine print on our contracts. We will NEVER use them again. We will never use them for our company business trips again either. What a disgrace to do business in such a fashion. We are consulting our attorneys

title: A little pricier than some, cheaper than others, but excellent quality
review_text:
I always enjoys JAL flights.  Comfortable seats, good films, and fantastic food.  Plus, they generally carry 3 or 4 very good daiginsho sake.

One caution; we're Flying Blue (KLM) members.  We thought we'd be earning level miles with JAL, but you only get miles/points, nothing towards your level.

title: If only all airline were this good!
review_text: Fabulous service from check in to landing. Clean comfortable seats. Excellent entertainment selection. So refreshing to have such polite, well presented staff on an airplane.

title: Wonderful company
review_text: JAL economy beats the comfort and service of Delta,AA and UAL upgrade class any day. The seats have what used to be called normal leg room before the cram more rows in craze. Service is what one would expect in first class. Politeness is standard. Highly recommend them.

title: Up there with the other Big Boys
review_text: Much superior to JAL# 1 which was from SFO to Haneda. To be honest, the Japanese meal to Japan was mediocre to poor whereas the food prepared at Narita was simply outstanding! One of the better meals I had in some time and easily the single best airline meal I have ever had in well over a million miles flown in all classes from 1st on Lufthansa to Ryan Air in Europe. Fine service from start to finish

title: First time flying JAL
review_text: I was in awe of the number of attendants and the great service they provided. Always coming by seat with drinks of varying kinds, i.e. Kiwi Juice plus all the normal juices. 2 coffee pots were brewing fresh coffee and being served constantly. Meals were much better than U.S. airlines.Attendants were friendly & kind. they made a 7 hr. flight go by rapidly. I hope management will read this and compliment the ladies that were on this flight. Seats were larger with ample leg room. Boarding on/off were both organized and accomplished w/o difficulty.Plane was clean and organized. I am trying to determine why the U.S. Airlines have not gotten the msg.? I have a lot of Advantage miles with AA and never got this service and i am seriously considering moving to another airline. I will fly JAL when they service my area of travel when ever possible. VERY impressed.

title: A bland & disappointing experience
review_text: Our first time with JAL, to & from Tokyo. For business class we thought the level of service was below par when compared to Emirates or Air New Zealand. On our outward bound flight they could not tuck us up soon enough and service was minimal. On the return had to go for the 3rd main course option as they had runout. While the staff are pleasant and courteous enough, the environs are very bland.

title: On time flight and the best services
review_text:
I have great impression with JAL during my first japan trip. their cabin crew shows politeness and deserved various food and beverage on flight. 
You will receive blanket, pillow, and headphones for your entertainment service. i would like to fly with JAL again for another japan trip

title: South Korea to Fukuoka to LAX, 14 Hour
review_text: Loved the dinner & dessert.  Free alcohol drinks/snacks.  A variety of new movies.  Plenty of leg room.

title: Dissapointed with JAL
review_text: Having flown with Japan Airlines before and remembering earlier flights I was disappointed with this particular flight experience. The service, as always was excellent but the aircraft a Boeing 777 looked old and tired. The interior was drab compared to the American Airlines 777-200 that I flew from the US to Tokyo. The flight was on time and comfortable but for an almost 7 hour flight entertainment options were limited.

title: Newer plane is not so good as old one
review_text: Staff is very friendly and supportive. Meals was tasty. Space between sets was very comfortable. But when we returned on March 14 it was newer plane and it was not so comfortable as an old one. Especially spas between sets was very narrow.

title: Tokyo business trip
review_text:
Love flying Jal. The service is always impeccable and the food and drinks are excellent. The lounge at the airport is also very nice and comfortable. 
.

title: Super Nice Crew
review_text:
The food was better than other airlines.
But the hospitality of the flight crew was superb..!
Very attentive and always on a lookout to see if you need something.
It was a very long flight but the crew made everyone at ease.

title: Why can't American Airlines do this?
review_text:
Super efficient.  Boarding is organized.  Flights right on time.  Airline attendants some of the most friendly and helpful you will ever encounter.  JAL was flying an upgraded plane with more comfortable seats, tinted windows and other amenities.  Food was the best I have ever encountered on an airline.
Why can't US based airlines figure this out?

title: Elegant Japanese Hospitality
review_text:
I have to say I have fallen in love with JAL's business class. The service is calm, serene and efficient and the chairs were spotless and condusive for good sleeping. 

The food was a standout. I had the Japanese selections with matching saki and it was like eating in a fine Japanese restaurant. The flight attendant spoke of the history of the particular place the saki I was drinking was from which was delightful.

The ammenities kit was one of the best I've recieved in business class and I loved the slippers. This is such a great idea. You don't have to put your shoes back on to wander around the plane and you can simply leave the slippers on board if you choose. (I am now taking these kinds of slippers on board all long haul flights).

I arrived refreshed and ready to go- which is what you want from business class. I will definately fly JAL again.

title: JL domestic HND to ITA in February 2018
review_text:
I flew on JL domestic economy from HND to ITA in February 2018.  HND is the main domestic airport in Tokyo and it's a lot closer than NRT from downtown Tokyo.  Shuttle bus and train options are available from downtown.  Or you may take taxi (less than $100/one way from the most of the hotels in downtown).  

At HND airport, JL has a separate security line for Elite members and my Emerald status qualified for it.  Almost no one in the line and it was very quick to go through the security.  Used JL domestic business lounge prior to boarding.  Food/drink options for early in the morning (7 am) were limited.  So if you plan to have breakfast in the lounge, you may want to consider a plan B.  Coffee was very good, and many power outlets for laptop (be sure to bring Japanese power outlet adopter).  

Flight was short (about one hour) and comfortable on B777.  JL offers a discounted fare, if you buy at least a few days prior to departure.  On board free wifi was also available to keep working for the duration, or to upload to SNS, if you'd like.  

Departure/arrival were both on time.  Check in at Kiosk, boarding at gate were both smooth.  CA offered blankets before departure.  A few beverage options in flight, despite the short flight duration.  Overall, a great experience.

title: Modern, efficient and comfortable
review_text: With most japanese products and design their is attention to detail and polite and efficient service. I found all of the above on my flight to Tokyo, Haneda airport from Singapore. The flight is around six hours so it’s not overly long, but it was a red eye flight so it’s never easy trying to sleep, but not long enough to be uncomfortable for too long. The seats were comfortable and I found adequate leg room. The inflight service was modern and up to date so it was easy to use and the content was good. The food was light and simple and surprisingly tasty, consisting of a starter, some noodles and a yoghurt. Overall I had a pleasant flight, although it wasn’t of the highest quality it was adequate and reasonably priced so in my opinion, value for money.

title: First time on a airline that cares about service
review_text:
This was my first time on Japan Airlines. I got a very good deal on a flight RT from NYC to Singapore with a layover in Tokyo. It was my first time to Asia too, and having 34 inch leg room really helped in flying for 14 hours for 2/4 flights I took with Japan Airlines. I love that the flight attendants cared about my food restrictions. They gave me a ticket for each meal and asked questions, they never made me feel bad for having medical food restrictions. I love that I got a pillow, a blanket (even in economy), they had good films selection, and I listened to U2 and other music through both of the 12-14 hour flights. 
This was the best economy (which is the only class of ticket I can afford) I have ever been on, I was treated and respected unlike certain airlines here in the US where I have felt and been treated like cattle.  wish I could take Japan Airlines again, I know they are in the Oneworld alliance.

title: JL001, SFO/HND business class in January 2018
review_text:
I flew JL001 from SFO to HND in January 2018.  Prior to boarding, I used BA first class lounge. It was an okay lounge, but nothing special with limited food option. I may try JL lounge at SFO next time.  

SFO is a bit tricky airport.  I flew from SEA to SFO to catch JL001.  Due to the fog in the morning, my flight from SEA got cancelled, and AS rerouted us to OAK, then shuttled in to SFO.  It's a good thing that I had over four hours to make the connection.  I only had about 45 minutes before boarding JL001 at SFO.  

The aircraft was B777.  As always, seat was comfortable, TV screen was large, headphone sounded clear, amenities were good,  JL provided really thick mattress that made sleeping even more comfortable.  I got extra blanket without any issue. 
JL supplied a light jacket to wear during the flight, instead of pajamas - that was no problem as I dressed casual/comfortable for the flight.  .Meal was very tasty and I was able to eat whenever I wanted up to 1.5 hours before arrival.  Overall, IMHO,  one of the best business classes.

title: Almost perfect except.....
review_text:
Straight to the point, there were only 2 things that made it not as enjoyable as it can be. First is the luggage weight. There’s 4 of us so that means we’re allowed 8 suitcases of 23kilos each. We only had 3 luggage but 1 was 26kilos. Others were 13k and 17k. Even when we’re way under the limit they made us move the items around the luggage to make the 23kilos on the heavier one. It’s a hassle when your in the check in counter and opening your luggage in the open. 

Secondly, the flight we had has a special RED menu which means “your only choice or starve” It’s a dinner flight and just over 4 hours so yeah food is good. Unfortunately, the shrimp curry main dish, jello like dessert, spicy potato salad just didn’t blend right. The butter pecan BR ice cream helped but not as much. The flight going to Narita had excellent food and taste. Hopefully not all RED menus will be like this.

title: GOOD flight limited food options
review_text: Good flight, check-in very professional. Haneda is a charm. In flight good comfort, excellent service. However no meal choices even when seating in front of the economy class, wife cannot eat certain food which meant going hungry until HK.

title: JAL offers excelent services
review_text: JAL offered great food and services on this 5 hour flight.  The facilities were squeaky clean, and the food offered was both healthful and more than adequate. They were on time, and offered a geat value for what was offered.

title: Excellent flight  with comfort!
review_text: I am highly satisfied flying with JAL from Osaka-Las Angeles-Osaka flight for its fleet, service, cleanliness, enough space for leg rest, entertainment and delicious foods. Want to fly again with it!

title: Travel
review_text:
Very good service   Very good staff. Good food very pleasant travel  booked for special food
Special care

title: Very Comfortable Flight
review_text:
I recently travelled on Japan Airlines Premium Economy class, to the United Kingdom.
This is the first time I have travelled on JAL. 
I have to say I was very pleasantly surprised! The seat I had in their Premium  economy cabin was very comfortable indeed. The pitch of the seat was 42 inches! (Compared to other Asian airlines Premium Economy seats, which for the most part have a seat pitch of 38 inches) 
Those few extra inches  JAL provide, make a big difference when it comes to stretching out and sleeping. 
JAL's Premium Economy class passengers have a separate cabin as well. 

However, unlike other airlines which have the same class of travel, JAL do not allow their Premium Economy passengers the use of their lounges anywhere, not even at a cost! That, I would say was the only disappointment in my journey. As I had been told whilst checking in at Melbourne, that I would have use of their lounge in Tokyo whilst in transit. That does help on long haul flights when one has a few hours to wait for the next flight.

However, it was the service of the staff on board all my JAL flights who went out of their way to make a very long flight as comfortable as possible!!

title: Decent flight, good service, marred by less than excellent food
review_text: Good seats, decent service albeit the announcements were difficult to hear in English. Meals were slightly bad, hard to eat them especially compared to ana where the food were excellent.

title: Watch out SQ
review_text: Newer touch screen entertainment, better food, slightly more leg room and good service if not better service, plus lower fare, JAL poses a strong challenge to the aging SQ with deteriorating quality.

title: Economy Plus is downright comfortable
review_text:
I had a great flight with JAL last week in Premium Economy.  The seats were comfortable and the service was attentive. 
I've flown their business class previously and got PE seats for a decent price at the last minute.  
I was not disappointed.

title: Superb carrier
review_text: This airline carrier is exquisite and features great on board meal service, drink service, and the entertainment is great. They provide excellent service with exceptional leg room. This airline is truly above most others and comes with outstanding crew members.

title: Good experience flying, terrible experience dealing with customer service
review_text: I flew JAL many times International and domestic flights, the latest was last February.  Clean, good food and good in flight service.  Lounges are good too, with nice variety of food and drinks. They deal well with short delays, but...BUT is there is a weather related cancellation, they are the worst airline dealing with it.   I was about to start my second trip to Japan this year, when the fourth Nor'easter of March landed, and JAL sent an email 20 hours before the flight telling us our flight was canceled giving us a phone number to call.  After more than three hours being on hold with no answer, we try calling with different phones, four of them, and always on hold until 9pm Eastern time when they closed their office in California leaving us without an answer.  Calling directly the Japanese office, they weren't much help either, at least they answered the phone, and all that was offered was a two stops flight (more than 30 hours) next Tuesday. All other airlines flying the same plane re-booked their passengers, JAL got us grounded and being unable to have the dreamed vacation and the impossibility to cancel hotels before they became nonrefundable. Wonderful airline when everything goes as it should be, but if there are cancellation due to bad weather or any other problem, good luck! We are still waiting for a notice of refund when hotels.com already credited our credit card for the hotels we were able to cancel.

title: Purchasing First Class made all the difference - from blah to wonderful
review_text: I have found there to be nothing special for their relatively expensive economy and business class service. After all the good things I had heard, I was quite disappointed. I was able to find a flight with first class this week. What a difference. Large, comfortable, leather seats. Same excellent service, but this time with something behind it. They served a typical Japanese breakfast and even had a wine list to go with it. The food was very delicious and beautiful. First time on a plane all the fruit was actually perfectly ripe, too. They have free WIFI but no other entertainment, but that is just fine. They offer slippers and also have a charging batter for USB port items. Purchasing first also allows use of the first class lounge which is well appointed and comfortable and has some nice food and drink selections.

title: Good Seat and Excellent Service
review_text: Flight from Singapore to Haneda and Haneda to Obihiro (Domestic airport) is very smooth not having to rush. Leg space was surprising out of my expectation which enable me to stretch my leg fully! The crew is helpful and friendly and having Japanese meal on board is a good thing for easy digestion especially for overnight flight.. I would recommend anyone who has the intention to visit Japan to fly with JAL. I will not hesitate to fly with JAL again in the near future.

title: Just Absolutely Lovely
review_text: By far the best economy experience ever. JAL's Sky Wider Economy seat was A-rated and award winning, and after my flight I can see why. Seat was an inch or two away from the Premium Economy offering of another airline and the entertainment center was very complete for coach.  Service was impeccable and food selection was great. Beverage service was consistent from pre meal alcohol to post meal coffee or ocha. Definitely worth the extra coin.

title: Top notch
review_text: This was my first experience on Japan Airlines and it was a good one.  The airplane was a new 787 and so comfortable even in coach.  It was not full so I was able to move and have two seats which helped of course on such a long flight.  The service was excellent and kind and of course we were on time or early.  I will fly this airline as much as possible in the future.

title: Their punctuality is reliable!
review_text: We're glad we flew with JAL this time to Osaka.  The flight left on time at 22h55 and arrived 10 minutes ahead of the arrival time at KIX.  The boarding was smooth and efficient.  The best part was the courteous service even the way flight attendants asked some passengers to switched off their cell phones before the plane did a take-off.  It was one of the best flights.

title: Excellent Service,  Excellent experience, Excellent flight
review_text: Easy check in with priority through immigration, Lounge experience was fantastic, great food & beverage , very good lounge comfort, lot of charging for devices . Boarding was a short walk from Lounge to Gate , boarding was easy , hot towel & drink on seating , after take off another drink & meal service , I had the Japanese Set & it was absolutely delicious with some bubbles , heaps of entertainment to keep you occupied & the seats were very comfortable,  I would fly JAL anytime to anywhere the whole experience was exceptional .

title: Good seat configuration and nice meal
review_text:
I thought the seat configuration is good because it is 3-4-2. More 2 seater for couple and if you are a family, you can have be together too.

One thing good about Japanese Airlines is the Japanese meal they offered. They are pretty and tasty for us. 

The crew is also friendly and helpful. I do not mind flying with JAL again.

title: Can I live on a Japan Airlines flight?
review_text:
The title of this review is something of a serious question: would it be possible just to live on a Japan Airlines (JAL) flight? I can say very definitively that I thoroughly enjoyed my 11 hour flight from JFK to Narita and the subsequent 7 hour flight from Narita to Changi in Singapore. I was actually looking forward to the return flights! And I was in economy!

The flight attendants were the most attentive and courteous I've ever had the pleasure of meeting. Its silly of me to have liked this so much, but it was also completely thrilling that they all bowed to the travellers at the start of the flight.

You are almost constantly offered food and drink, and really good food and drink! The main/dinner meals I was offered were tasty, nutritious, and filling. Snacks and drinks came at perfect intervals and if you feel peckish in between meals and snacks, there's an area where you can pick up a snack on your own. 

For me the seats were very comfortable and the entertainment offerings varied (for example, there's digital manga available) and satisfying. 

It does help if you understand a little Japanese, but almost all flight attendants know some English. 

Because I generally travel budget airlines, I'm pretty happy if I get offered a pillow and blanket at no cost (which JAL did as well). When I've travelled on non-budget flights, I've always been made aware that I was travelling in economy, but not with JAL. The excellent treatment JAL offered was above and beyond what I have ever experienced on any flight and I look forward to travelling with them again!

title: Great seat space, legroom, food and service - pretty much all you could ask for!
review_text: All the airline staff are so professional - from their service all the way to how they dress (which is very classic). The flight itself is extremely long, but the airline does a great job of breaking it up - between meal service (3 total) to drink service (numerous). There is individual in-flight entertainment with a ton of movies, televisions shows and music. What could have been a long and boring trip turned out to be very nice.

title: A Higher Consciousness
review_text: Japan Air is, by far, the best airline on the face of the planet. The customer service is extraordinary in every sense. You will feel taken care of, like you matter, like you're someone of value and importance and will be delighted. The food was excellent, the service unparalleled and the amenities were fantastic. Can't wait to fly with them again.

title: Good legroom, excellent service
review_text: This is the second time I flew with JAL from Europe to Tokyo. First chosen simply on timetable and price, second I was explicitly looking to fly with JAL The food on the second flight was not excellent as on the 1st flight, but it was OK. Above average legroom and above average service (simply Japanese - that says it all)

title: A comfortable journey
review_text:
Flew JAL due to co-sharing with Malaysia Airlines (MAS).

Despite being in an economy class, the seat was comfortable, don't mind the long journey. The flight attendances were also helpful and very hospitable. 

Food was also good. Had rice with Shrimp Curry and it was awesome. Lucky for me since I can't take chicken or meat due to religious reason. They serve Hagendaz icecream for the desert. Cool!

title: They care about you!
review_text:
Japan Airline
OMG! Other airlines have a look and take a bow!!  More seat space..I'm talking  economy class! The passenger in front of you does not have his head on your lap!
 One of the toilets are BIG! I mean DOUBLE the size of other airlines! No kidding! It's clean and the attendants even made sure you have toothbrush to use when you wake up. Taps are automatic. There are even the water spouts as in other normal Japanese toilets.
It's really a breath of fresh air for us poor economy folks. They care about their passengers!..not maximizing profits . The flight is full, though...words must get around! A BIG congrats!! You bring some sense to air travel!

The flight attendants are polite and does not look like master herdsman controlling his cattle.

A bit of advice..coffee should be on the breakfast cart( but the attendant was willing to run back to the kitchen to get it just for you...with a smile). WIFI is available,  but too expensive to use..charges hourly rates.

title: Very polite and helpful cabin crew
review_text:
Very pleasant return flights to Haneda from London. During the daytime flight, the crew regularly pass through the cabin with iced/hot green tea/coffee, and hot facecloths - along with the regular snacks and meals. 

For dinner, I had the chicken and potato gratin, which came with a small salad, a side dish of dressed noodles, fruit salad, a bread roll, pickles and deli meat, and a yoghurt, with ice cream for dessert. For breakfast, I had the cheese and ham omelette, which also came with a selection of little side dishes. Because our return flight was at night, instead of serving dinner on the flight, we were granted access to the JAL sky lounge where we were able to eat from the buffet before boarding. I'm guessing this was to allow passengers to try and sleep undisturbed for as long as possible.

The cabin crew were terrific, at one point I felt slightly travel sick and the air hostess attending me made sure I was as comfortable as possible and checked in on me to see how I was doing.

title: A very nice experience
review_text:
This is the second time I have flown JAL. I fly all the time and this airlines stands out. They have excellent service and the flight attendants are great.  
Well done!

title: Great Experience
review_text: The flight was in one of their latest dreamliners with suite style business class seats which provides good deal of privacy. Great service from professional and friendly staff. Good selection of entertainment and food and drink choices.

title: Terrible Customer Service!!!
review_text: I need to call Japan Airlines to rebooked my ticket. I need to wait for more than an hour before I spoked to an agent. It happened 3 times! The last time I called I was asking for the confirmation of my reservation as I can't checked my reservation online and the agent I spoked with is a rude guy. He was mad and almost screaming on the phone! What a bad customer service they have! I hope JAL will make something on this issue. My flight was okay though only had a bad experience on their customer service.

title: Excellent food, nice people dreamliner the best!
review_text: This was just one of the legs of my journey to South East asia, but it was the best one! I was early for my flight so I had time to ask for a free upgrade but no such luck, how ever they moved me to the emergency exit at the bulkhead! Massive leg room! Plus the view was really nice. On to the food, I've always liked Japanese food but what I've had in the states was cra p compared to this airlines food and the amount was amazing! Plus in a 12 hour flight they fed us four times with miso soup at every course soooo goood! You can't get people to act and be respectful on a flight it just won't happen and yes I'm talking about westerners so other than that best flight of the trip!

title: Good service and punctual flights
review_text: Haven't use JAL for almost 12 years, their services to passengers are still excellent with good courtesy.  Food are not as good as before and with less choices, but they are keeping their metal utensils rather than providing the passengers with plastic knives and spoons.  Clean Blankets and pillows had been offered to each passengers.  Legroom and seats are widen than others Asian airlines, therefore it would be very comfortable for long haul flights.  Although JAL's tickets are a little higher than other Japanese airlines, but I think they are worth in these.  The entertainment centre has a wide selection of movies too.  But most important, their flights always leave on time and touch down punctually.

title: A perfect focus on their passengers needs
review_text:
With JAL, its very obviously all about their passengers. The organization and each individual team member are very obviously focused on their passengers, and that makes all the difference in any flight.  Their equipment is well maintained, extremely clean, and to my experience they operate on time.  

That said, it's about the team at JAL.  They pay attention to you as an individual passenger, looking to meet your expectations and anticipating your needs.  If you fly frequently, you know what the inside of a 777 or a 747 or a 787 or an A380 is going to feel like.  What makes any flight comfortable, even enjoyable is the flight crew's ability to meet needs.  JAL has this down to a science.

When you an, fly them.

title: Everything is just perfect
review_text:
Its just perfect . From the brand new 787-900 , to the sky suite III seat with extra width and pitch , the screen , the food , the service....Just perfect . 

There is just 1 design error i spotted , that is the switch for the  reading light and service call is on the LED screen itself . Very often , passengers will accidentally press it . It happens very often in the flight . 

and 1 more thing is , the temperature in the plane is a little warm and i am just wearing summer shirt .  There is no individual vent for each seat . 

other then these 2 design flaws , its just perfect . Singaopre airlines now has a very strong competitor .

title: Spacious economy seat and good selection of movies
review_text: was pleasantly surprised by the generous leg room for my first ever JAL flight JL 712 from Singapore to Narita. The entertainment console was also big and nice with touch screen capability. Movies selection was pretty good and recent. the music selection was a little bit below expectation though. Food amd drinks were pretty decent and acceptable.

title: Most comfortable flight ever!
review_text: This plane had the most legroom for a standard economy seat of ANY plane we have ever been on.  Also had really comfortable seats with lots of cool, well thought out features such as little cubbies for glasses, phone, etc.  Excellent service, good food and extremely clean throughout the flight.  If it weren't for the screaming kids it would have been one of the best flights ever!

title: Great way back from Canada
review_text: Travelling to Sydney via Tokyo on the way back from Canada was a great move. The aircraft leaves after lunch, and arrives in Tokyo late afternoon for a early evening connection to Sydney. This allowed me to stay awake until the overnight flight to Sydney, so I arrived early morning after a good sleep. Made the jet lag almost none existent. The aircraft are both 787s, although the Canada sectors looked like an older interior, with shell seats, compared to the Sydney sectors which were enclosed. I must say though the enclosed seats felt somewhat cosier than the flat shell seats from Vancouver. JAL service was very good, nothing was too much trouble, and the meal selections were great. I also like the service starting not too long after take off, as it allows you to get the meals out of the way in case you need to work. My only issue the the repeated announcements after take off, they can be annoying when you have just started a movie.

title: couldn't be better
review_text: Excellent service, excellent food and great attention.Plane and restroomnvery clean. Business class is the way to go!

title: Good piloting!!
review_text: On arrival at the airport the notice boards were saying that because of heavy snow my flight (along with others to other parts of Japan) may be canceled or diverted back to Tokyo. We did take off in a very new plane which was comfortable and roomy but the pilot did warn to expect rough weather and a possible return to Tokyo. The rough weather did not eventuate, service was polite and efficient, and the pilot showed great skill in landing our plane during heavy snow on a runway that was white!

title: Comfortable flight
review_text: My flight was from Seoul to Memanbetsu, in Hokkaido, Japan and i changed flight at Haneda airport.  Flight was excellent with good service and on schedule.   From Seoul to Haneda the aircraft was B787 which was comfortable.  Its service was nice and want to travel with JAL again.  Tokyo Haneda airport  is very convenient for transit travelers from intl to domestic flight.   Also, can easily access to central tokyo thru moro-rail.

title: Tasteful Japan Airlines (JAL)
review_text:
Remember the first time you learned how to respond to the greeting ‘How are you?’ and how self-conscious you were answering ‘I am fine, thank you’? Well, that’s how the JAL local ground crew did their obligatory bow-and-greet as they opened the check-in counters, self-conscioulsy. But that was the only self-conscious episode during the whole JAL flight from Manila to JFK, because everything else was done smoothly and efficiently and with an eye to real passenger service. The check-in counters readily accomodated my request for an aisle seat (their online check-in was not working that day) and even gave us the seat with the biggest legroom at no cost. I could only guess that maybe the long life expectancy common to Japanese made their society more caring to their elderly and attentive to their needs. 
The English language skills of the cabin crew are passable and one can request and get the usual amenities for a long flight. Of course, the Filipino cabin crews in PAL can engage in better small talk and can even give you tips on getting around Metro Manila with their greater English proficiency, but I digress..
What was a pleasant surprise to us, however, was the quality of the food. Although I readily confess, they had me at Haagen Dazs ice cream, standard dessert even in economy, the appetizer and the mains were no slouch either. They were tasty, or as foodie blogs always say; the flavors of their offerings are like a party in the palate. I finished everything. Maybe I am really just a man of simple tastes that a simple serving of Haagen Dazs vanilla ice cream was enough to leave me wondering: if this is just Economy Class, I wonder what First Class has on offer!
The layover was five hours in Narita airport, more than enough time to walk around the shops and have a snack or a drink at the good restaurants all over. Souvenir shops include wine stores selling the now trending Japanese single-malts and candy stores selling Kit Kats in various flavors found only in Japan.
By and large, flying with JAL was a thoroughly pleasant experience. And it starts with that self-conscious bow by the non-Japanese check-in staff.

title: Extremely polite and professional staff and excellent food -- so typically Japanese
review_text:
My outbound flight encountered a 2h delay after we had already boarded, as can sometimes happen. During this time, we were updated every 15-30 minutes as to the nature, status and ETA of the solution, in both English and Japanese, and were offered refreshments throughout the process. The professionalism of the staff during this time meant that nobody had any issue taking it all completely in their stride.

Part-way through the flight, the head of the cabin crew went to literally every single one of the hundreds of passengers on the flight and, with a gracious smile, offered her personal and sincere apology again in both English and Japanese, and asked if there was anything they could do to make the flight more comfortable. Truly above and beyond.

The food was also excellent. I had never tried Tokyo Soup Stock before, but I wish I had while I was still in Japan. This soup was served in-flight and it blew my mind, shattering my preconceptions about what is possible in airline food.

I will absolutely fly JAL when I return to Japan. Thank you for an unforgettable experience.

title: Excellent Customer Service
review_text:
I am a special needs traveller and JAL pays high attention to make your travel comfortable.
They arranged for pre-seating as well as tagged my baggage as priority traveller.
Service onboard was exceptional. This isn't my first time flying with JAL and I highly recommend taking this airline.

title: Premium economy is good value for money
review_text:
In early March 2018 I took my first flight on the relatively new JAL 787-8 Dreamliner from Melbourne to Tokyo.

Boarding was on time and well organised. The plane was in good order and service was excellent.

Food quality seemed reasonably good, although I didn't eat much as it was a very early morning flight (just after midnight).

The shell style seats in premium economy are good but not great. Leg room appears excellent but there was two problems. First, I was in seat 20C (aisle) and a support from the seat in front divides the leg/foot space in front of you. There doesn't seem to be any reason why the support could not have been moved to the edge of the seat in front but, then again, I'm not an aircraft engineer! I noted that the above was the case in all "C" and "H" seats (other than the bulkhead row 17).

Second, the seat bottom moves forward and the back slides down when you "recline" the seat. This takes up some of the otherwise generous legroom and seemed a less comfortable position than the usual recline back mode of aircraft seats.

On my return flight on the 787-9 to Sydney from Tokyo, I was in the bulkhead row (seat 17K). The legroom here is certainly impressive. I was able to prop my feet on my cabin bag that I placed against the bulkhead (after take-off of course) and get into a good position for a sleep.

One last thing was that the toilet just behind PE on the "AC" side of the cabin was especially large; a good spot to change into sleepwear if that is what you do on long overnight flights.

Overall, good value for money (@$2000 return) on a top class airline.

title: "Bow and Smile" goes a long way!
review_text:
We chose this flight, due to the distance, for the positive comments,seat width, and seat amenities that we read about.
Have to say, I am glad we picked this airline.  Everything was great except for their Japanese meal offerings that were a " little off"  for the typical American traveler.
On our return, we worked HARD to get an alternative meal choice. I say hard because we were on a code share flight, and the ball kept being passed back and forth between airlines. LESSON LEARNED... The meal choice lies with the ticketed airline, regardless of who flies the plane!!
With attentive flight attendants, who bow each time they encounter you, to the airport ramp staff who wave as a group when you push back....you can't get mad at them!
Our Premium Economy gave us a small private plane section, and a feeling we were somewhat special over the masses in Economy. Our recliner seat with footrest, deferred any guilt we might have by hampering the passenger behind.
Would we fly them again? As long as the price is not crazy...yes!

title: Nice Experiences
review_text:
It was my first experience onboard Japan Airlines and I really like it. The crew are very welcoming and theor do their utmost to serve the customer. Legroom in Economy vlass was huge and food are tasty.

For sure will travel with tis airlines again.

title: Nice refreshment meals and services!
review_text: The first time using JAL to fly from Jakarta to Itami ( Osaka). The meal is really good, the flight attendant keep on serving you with snack and drinks. For drinks, you can choose many kind of Japanese speciality drinks, such as Japan beer, red wine, white wine, juice, green tea, coffee, and miso soup. One thing that i really like is the space for your legs, in my opinion the class that i ride ( economy class) was so cozy and lots of spare room for your leg

title: JAL , what a surprise
review_text: This was our first trip on JAL , and what a pleasant surprise, if my memory serves me right , they never used to have great reviews years ago......Boy have they turned it around . Our  flights from Singapore were flawless...Easy FRIENDLY check in's , great modern , clean and comfortable planes.......Good food by airline standards, but the crowning glory is the cabin crews......They are fantastic in every area......We usually fly Qantas and Emirates, JAL made them look second rate in most areas.

title: Haneda to Hong Kong on Sky Suite III in B777-200
review_text:
I flew from Haneda to Hong Kong on Japan Airlines top level business class suite - Sky Suite III - on a B777-200.  Sky Suites have direct aisle access from every seat and in the Sky Suite III iteration, seats are angled out towards the window on the sides and in the center section, the two seats are angled away from each other - the same configuration as Cathay Pacific uses on its long haul business class.  The seat has a flat platform at the far end of the seat that forms the foot of the bed when the seat is reclined to a fully flat bed and below that platform is an angled foot rest that is used when the seat is reclined as an angled seat rather than as a fully flat bed.  The seat has a good size video screen and flip down table that swings out toward the passenger.  There is also storage under the armrest but it cannot be used on take-off or landing when the armrest must be pushed down to be flushed with the seat.  The recline is a bit awkward as there are not pre-sets that can quickly recline to several seat positions such as upright for eating, slight recline for watching entertainment and z-position for resting other than sleeping on a fully flat bed.  Instead you have to press the recline button which then reclines that whole seat in a pre-set path (ie you cannot separately operate the seat back and leg portion of the seat).  For a short haul flight from Haneda to Hong Kong, this was not an issue and the seat is very comfortable for such a flight.  For a longer haul flight, the lack of options might be more bothersome.  To be fair though, the fully flat seat offering is much superior to competitors such as Cathay Pacific which offers only regular slightly wider reclining seats for business class on the route.

Entertainment movies selection was good.  Wifi is available on the flight.  Lunch was a choice between Japanese and a couple of Western choices and as usual for Japan Airlines, was very good.  I had the Japanese meal with a starter box of a half dozen or so different appetizers, and then two hot items with rice.  I also tried one of two sakes on offer and it turned out to be a small full glass bottle served chill and was good.  Dessert was Hagen Daz ice cream.  JAL serves a special coffee in business class which is only available on board and I always order it because it is very good, strong and smooth with low acidity just the way I like it.  Service as always is superb.  The toilets are always clean because the flight attendants never stop going in to clean them.  

Prior to the flight, I used the JAL First Class lounge at Haneda airport and had breakfast.  There was a good selection of food, though less variety than at lunch or dinner that I tried when in the lounge for other flights. There was a chef on duty who made galettes - crepes folded around melted cheese and ham - to order and he was very popular with the guests in the lounge with a constant line of customers for his services.  An oddity of the lounge is that the wifi seems to be confined to certain areas whereas other areas do not seem to have wifi coverage and may be intended as quiet areas.

title: Very good economy seat
review_text: A modern airdcraft with one of the best spaces (seats) in Economy I have experienced. The service is excellent. The inflight entertainment is not the best in terms of selection, but the system works well. One major ciriticsm is that the food on this overnight flight was pretty bad (a lot worse than normal). Be prepared that you're not going to get much food at all because the airline works on the premise that people will sleep - which is not that easy in Economy class! So after take-off all you get is a tiny snack, and the next meal is a really bad breakfast before arrival. To be fair, the meals on the daytime return flight were better. Also, you're not given an amenities kit, which is fine as long as you are prepared and bring your own. There were some toothbrushes (in limited supply) in the toiltet though. If service, reliability and a comfy seat are your priority, then Japan Airlines is certainly a great choice.

title: Flying golfer
review_text: The day we were flying to Manila, the flight was cancelled due to snow storm in Narita. No plane was available in San Diego due to NO flight is taking off from Narita. The JAL staff in San Diego did a good job for re-routing us, so we can arrived the second day in the morning.... The service in the plane is A-one and the rest rooms are always clean. The convenience flying from san diego is outstanding. One stop and a 2hrs. waiting for a flight to Manila..

title: First Time with JAL
review_text: My first time experience with JAL quite good. I had smooth checked in until boarded. The flight's take off and landing was nice, the entertainment good with updated new movie, and the food service is also good with plenty variation of the food. I love the soup!

title: I love JAL
review_text: JAL is the best airline with good cabin crew, Good food, great entertainment. The only minor negative is I cannot online check-in from DFW to Busan.

title: I like JAL!!
review_text:
I go to Thailand a few times in order to meet sweetheart for year.
In that time, I always use JAL.
Formerly, I used ANA.
However, ANA and trouble occurred twice personally and I have changed to JAL since then.
JAL after breakdown greatly changed compared with formerly.
Of course, it is in good direction.
I change into JAL and think that I was correct answer.
Reason I use Japanese airline is clear.
Because there is heart of hospitality.
When I use JAL, I can be spending traffic with Thailand comfortably.
I use business class of 777 usually.
Business class of 777 was renewed and became more comfortable.
I like JAL as my private impressions.
I will love JAL and will use JAL from now on also.

title: Great meal and Japanese hospitality
review_text: I often use non-Japanese airlines because Japanese airlines are usually expensive. But I used Japan air lines this time for business trip. I was impressed by great meal on the plane such as soba (black wheat noodle) and soup stock. Cabin attendants were always kind and polite to passengers. I want to use JAL next time if price was affordable.

title: AMAZING AIRLINE EXPERIENCE
review_text:
We arrived to Japan Airlines and was promptly treated as if "royalty".  The same could be said for all the passengers we were with - including in economy class.  

The seats lay almost flat in business class.  Food was exceptional and the "anytime" menu really helped curb late night cravings during this 14 hour flight.  I cannot say enough positive comments about JAL and hope that many who read this review will consider to fly them to Japan from the USA, as well.

title: Wonderful experience
review_text: Fantastic experience in premium economy. At 6ft 6in tall, even room to spare in terms of legroom for me. Seats were fantastic, as they were the fixed 'shell' type, so if the passenger in front adjusted their seat, no problem, you didn't get their seatback in your face!! Great choice of films on the touchscreen monitor, film choice changes every month. Cabin crew were so attentive, drinks when you wanted. JAL is my carrier of choice flying this route.

title: Good service, good food
review_text: I fly JAL Busoness Class internationally on a regular basis.   Their flight crews are very attentive, and the food is quite good.  I've also found JAL fares to be very competitive.

title: My Choice Always
review_text: Have been using this airline for over 25 years. Friendly flight attendants. Excellent menu. Will only fly on this airline to Japan.

title: Excellent servicing airline
review_text: Airplane clean,excellent service,average food,two (2) luggages available,instead of 1 on Air France.

title: Not the best option to Asia or Japan
review_text:
I usually fly ANA or SQ for my TPAC flights out of LAX, but I decided to try JAL out after hearing positive reviews. Shortly after booking, I realized I made a terrible mistake. Unlike the other airlines I usually fly, JAL did not allow me to select my seats in advance, not even for an additional fee. I was forced to wait until check in, 24 hours before the flight. This is definitely not ideal for 10-14 hour long flights. Further compounding that, they do not even have a function English language app (their 'app' just contains hyperlinks to the website). This makes checking in while traveling very difficult, especially when you cannot get to a computer 24 hours before your flight. I -was able to get an aisle seat at check-in, but I do not care for suspense and drama when it comes to travel.

Another issue I had was regarding their baggage policy. My return flight from SIN to LAX was booked as a single leg, but it contained layovers in HND and KIX. The ground staff at SIN tagged my bags through to LAX, informing me that I would only need to collect them once at HND to clear customs, since the following flight was a domestic flight. I was supposed to be able to recheck them at HND to LAX. Unfortunately, after being ran around three different areas in two different terminals by the JAL ground staff at HND, they insisted on ripping off the HND-KIX-LAX tag and insisted on making me retrieve my bag at KIX. Since my flight was late at night, I did not have the option to recheck the bag or leave at lost luggage for my morning flight to LAX.

The actual service on the airplane was fine. The food was OK and the entertainment options were acceptable. The service was slightly better than NA or EU airlines offer, but not on par with their Asian rivals. The older planes had decent room in economy, but the newer planes were as cramped as any other airline.

All the hassle and stress from the trip will ensure that I will return to ANA and SQ for my annual TPAC needs moving forward.

title: The real measure of customer service is when there is a problem and Japan Airlines fails
review_text:
Return flight booked directly online via JAL portal - check ✔️ (Or I thought it was)
Itinerary emailed out - a little ambiguous given departure was 12.45 am 
Missed my flight due to itinerary ambiguity, partially my fault.
Now the real test of customer service or lack of surfaces, log into JAL portal entire booking deleted, hastily make contact with JAL to confirm and salavage booking, language differences and lack of empathy prove to be challenging, advised a No Show penalty will apply, however no ref of a No Show fee in terms and conditions. 
Customer service approach pay fee to secure flights, unable secure return flight as cancelled by their system, lose return flight, needed to be rerouted to Sydney, pay a higher fee, book local flights. Customer Service delegation authority lacking, care factor zero, customer service approach to solving customer concern low or non existent, language challenges..

title: Comfortable seats, nice crew, extra free chips and nuts
review_text:
Comfortable seats for long flight.
There are free chips, nuts and water in the galley area that you can take as you like. Good to walk around a bit there to stretch the legs and have some chips.
Entertainment was quite standard for long flight with movies and games.

title: Great flight
review_text:
Bought the air tickets 3 months before the date, most of the economy class tickets are pretty pricey by then. The Premium economy tickets are just cost USD$20+ more.

Took a red eye flight to Tokyo from Singapore. Premium economy tickets allow passengers to use the airport lounge before departure at both airports (Singapore Changi airport, Tokyo Haneda Airport).

Leg room is plenty. Most passengers seems to be resting okay. (I am someone who is unable to sleep on flight).

Check-in counter is fast. Service from the air crews is good. No complaints.

Will choose JAL again if I when I am flying to Japan from Singapore.

title: Great crew, Nice Business Class
review_text:
Our flight was delayed and that was a little frustrating.  Our checking process took longer than needed also - they can't check a bag when you have more than 3 segments in your reservation and we had four... so that delayed us a bit as they tried to figure it out and eventually just checked our bags to Narita Japan.  The lounge that JAL uses in Guam is absolutely terrible.  Its gone down hill DRASTICALLY in the last 5 years.
That said, once we got on the airplane things went well.  The crew was so friendly and caring.  They seemed to genuinely want to be helpful.  Food was pretty good quality.  Nice champagne and even better sake!  Flying them long haul today and looking forward to it.

title: Worst seat assignment policy
review_text:
i'm a frequent international traveler base out of shanghai and flying to japan, in particular, 2 to 3 times a year.  and this is my second bad experience with them in a row and i will no longer fly JAL again.

if you don't fly much, and are not fussy about where you sit, fly them.  they provide good service on board as well as good food with great entertainment.

i, however, always asks for certain seats when i fly, and with most airlines would give me these seats when they are available.  but with JAL, i just always seem to get lies after lies about the availability of these seats.  i would rather have them just tell me a reason why they can't have these seats than to have them lie about them over and over again about how they have been reserved, and after boarding seeing obvious non frequent travelers (many chinse, where i fly out of, have never even been on a plane, would not even care where they sit, let alone pre-select these) siting in these seats that i specifically show up early to get.  

well, no more!  JAL is never the cheapest, i fly them hoping to get a little better service than others.  if i don't even get the "normal" service i get from other cheaper airlines, why fly them?

title: Traditionally Tasteful
review_text: The seat room was larger than a few of the other airlines and the inflight movie selection was fine. The attendants were very polite and accommodating. Our dinner was nice and we were offered both a western and traditional Japanese meal choice, but breakfast was very traditional and I couldn't come at mushroom soup for breakfast.

title: Brilliant
review_text:
Was rather vary when my flight booked for BA was confirmed to be on a code share partner JAL, as previous experiences with BAA Code share from USA have been more than disappointing.

JAL, was absolutely brilliant, service, comfort and attitude of staff. Would now consider JAL for this sector o my next trip

title: On time and smooth flight
review_text:
Boarding was efficient and departure on time.Seats had extra leg room space.Seat could recline a little and was comfortable for a short haul flight.
Lounge near the departure gate was very convenient.Lounge food was excellent with wide choices and for alcohol drinkers, a fantastic variety to pick from on a self serve basis.Many plug points for laptops and cell phones.
Cabin service was excellent and flight entertainment channels very good.Cabin was clean and had ample luggage space.Toilets were sufficient and very clean.
Food provided was ok nothing great.I would have preferred less fried food and more of their pickles instead.I love the plum wine.Haagen Das ice cream was a welcome choice though I would have preferred Japanese green tea ice creams.
Captain spoke good English and we arrived ahead of time.

title: Great fkighy
review_text: Attendants were thoughtful and careful to passengers. Would recommend to fly again. I thought to food on board coming home was better than the food going there somehow...

title: Amazing staff
review_text: The staff on JAL are amazingly helpful & polite.  Immaculately presented & always professional.  The seats are comfortable & lie flat with added foam mattress available.  The food & drink choices are varied & substantial.

title: Japan Air is Outstanding
review_text: I fly to the Philippines once or twice each year, and I always fly on Japan Air at.least three quarters of my flight. The service of the crew is ALWAYS very professional, and to me 4 stars. Japan Air is by far miles above all USA carriers hands down.. The take great pride in serving you, making sure (no matter what fare you bought) you are comfortable.  If you fly to asia and have the chance, try Japan Air (JAL).  You will have a great experience and a good flight.

title: Quick trip
review_text: Great flight and service from staff. There is always something very unique and special about flying with JAL. Love it so much and highly recommend it.

title: Good service
review_text: Decent flight. Took off and landed on schedule. Bags arrived quickly. Nothing to complain about. All good.

title: It’s a Dreamliner
review_text:
Aside from Emirates, I rate this as one of my other favorite airlines. And why? Impeccable service, love the Boeing Dreamliner seat configuration and yes, the 3 bags allowance -32kgs each!!! Good for shopaholic like me. In terms of food, always order the Jap style to try different small dishes. Only thing which is lacking -amenity bag which is made of a small string pouch with some moisture mask and socks. Ya, perhaps it’s not really a long haul (about 7 hours) but still if it is an overnight flight, should consider a better kit. 
Other than that, always a pleasure to fly with JAL.

title: Great price on upgrade domestic japan
review_text:
If flying internationally, buy your domestic segments from out of country for best prices. Then, get to the airport early and buy an upgrade....only 1000 yen for business, and 8000 yen for first.

First is a dream. Separate security, use of great lounges, fabulous meal onboard. For less than $80 usd a segment, well worth it. Just the meal and drinks are worth the price, but the comfort and ease of priority checking, loading etc make it the best way to pretend you are always a front of bus type!

title: Horrible Customer Service on phone and online
review_text: Japan Airlines has the worst customer service period.  They never answer their customer service lines (I'm tired of calling and waiting over 30 minutes for a response). Their online website is down and their land building will be out of power this weekend.  Hope their flight is better because everything else is pretty embarrassing for an airline that touts itself as being one of the best.  So sad!

title: Horrible Customer Service
review_text: I traveled extensively internationally before retirement and this trip rates as the absolute worst travel experience of my life. Our flight to Tokyo (connecting city to Bangkok) left with an initial 3 hour delay. This was ok as they contacted us and forewarned although this put our Tokyo connection in jeopardy. We arrived in Tokyo with enough time to make our connection as everything was delayed due to a snow storm (this is where things began to go South, btw it was a total of 3"). We boarded the plane and then sat onboard 2 Hours while it was de-iced 2x. At the 2 Hour mark we were informed that all flights were cancelled and the airport was closing. We were not allowed to disembark for another 5 Hours, approx. 1-2 a.m.  I realize an airline is not responsible for weather but this is when JAL really failed. Upon disembarking we were given a sheet of paper with phone numbers to rebook ourselves in the morning. We along with thousands of others slept on the floor (not JAL issue) . However in the morning we all discovered the phone numbers given did not work, more so when JAL opened their ticketing windows they flatly refused to service anyone on a cancelled flight and informed us that they were taking care of the passengers booked for that day first. They would not help anyone (hundreds of people) . They realized the self rebooking numbers weren't working and still would not assist. We were informed that Perhaps that evening or the next day they would be able to assist cancelled passengers. In the end we booked a flight with Thai Airways for latter morning to Bangkok, at a cost of $1500+ for a one way from Tokyo to Bangkok.  Needless to say I will NEVER fly JAL again and will urge anyone who hears of our nightmare to do the same.

title: JAL using avios
review_text: We used avios (British Airways frequent flyer points) to redeem for a JAL (One World partner flight) on the Tokyo Haneda to Sapporo New Chitoise sector of our Japan itinerary. For the rest of our trip we used the ANA tourist travel pass (highly recommended 10,800 JPY per sector - JAL also do a tourist pass but they don't fly the Ishigaki leg we required) but there were no travel pass tickets on the date we required on JAL or ANA. I remembered that you can redeem avios on JAL and there were reward flights available for the bargain 4,500 avios and £2 tax. Yes you read that right £2 tax. You can check reward availability on the BA website when logged in to your executive club account. We couldn't check in online as it was a reward booking, and there was a moment of anxiety at check-in when the agent was concerned that 'Miss' as a prefix in Japan means 'child' and this was not a valid adult ticket, but this was resolved - largely to our ignorance as we don't speak Japanese. The 777-200 had 10 seats across and was full. There is a camera on the inflight screens so you can watch take-off and landing live from the nose. Using avios made our itinerary and our budget possible.

title: We always flew JAL
review_text:
Amenities on the airplane and food is always great. This trip, it felt like the crew catered more to the Japanese speaking travelers. Don't know if its because they have trouble speaking English. Upon arriving to Narita, they did not offer us a Disembarkation Card to fill out although we saw them give to others.  we just thought it was a form only for non foreigners. On our way back to Hawaii,  wish they were more knowledgeable about the custom declaration form. When asked a questions, she had to go find out and came back with "I thnik...
So, I think maybe next time we want to go to Japan, we will try another airlines.

title: Refreshing change after using too many low cost airlines
review_text: After many flights using lowest price as a bench mark , tried JAL and what a difference!! Service A plus, nice food, drinks included,headphone too, good selection of free entertainment.New dream liners , very quiet, good leg room, larger washrooms. Checking even in long line ups super fast and stress free . will use them in future as the price was very similar to Chinese line with zero service on same trip last year .

title: wonderful service
review_text: 2 flight for this destination with a stop over in Narita airport (Tokyo) the flight was well priced and the service was friendly and professional. The first leg was a 10 hour flight leaving after midnight and it was pleasing to not be given a full meal after take off a snack packwith treats and water was issued and coffee and tea etc. The breakfast was a large spread with a main course along with fruit, yogurt salad and a croissant and coffee etc in all a comfortable flight with a good range of tv and movies and a pillow and blanket

title: Disapppointing
review_text: Upon entering the aircraft, my impression was that the crew was not enthusiastic about service. Before departure we in business class got a tiny plastic cup of champagne (or sparkling wine); then we got a towel that was wet and cold. After take-off it took 45 minutes before we were asked what we would like to drink. Twenty minutes later I had to call and ask, then another ten minutes. I had asked to get dinner served quick, but it took more than three hours before i could finish the main course, skipping dessert in order to sleep. The, contrary to my request, I was called THREE hours before arrival in order to have breakfast. Upon my complaint, the answer was that the cabin had to be cleared before arrival. On a ten and a half hour night flight, I could sleep for four hours!

title: Tokyo holiday
review_text:
Excellent from start to finish
Very efficient
Check in 
Business lounge 
Boarding 
Friendly staff
Only hic cup food / average

title: I fly JAL!
review_text:
> BKK Check-in: handling by TG (Thai Airways) and supervised by JL staff.
The check-in was smooth and fast.
> BKK Sakura Lounge. spacious, lots of seats with power point to recharge battery.
Food and drinks were pretty good. Beef curry, stir-fried chicken with holy basil leaves (Gapao) were very popular. They tasted very nice.
There were also restrooms in the lounge.
> In-flight. B777-200ER Sky Wider
Economy class bulkhead seat was spacious with lots of leg room.
> Meal service/Supper
Had fried rice with grilled salmon. a bit dried and light taste.
Soba noodles were very nice.
> Service from cabin crew were excellent!

Overall very very good!

title: On time, very comfortable, great food and lovely service.
review_text:
This was our first time on JAL. We fly regularly to Australia, and wanted to have a change of stopover, rather than Singapore or Dubai, so stopped in Tokyo for three nights. I cannot recommend this enough. Tokyo was fantastic.
JAL business class was actually quite a bit cheaper than BA or Emirates, so we were nervous of what to expect. We were delighted with everything. Staff are delightful, the flights departed and arrived exactly on time. Business class seats were far better than both BA and Emirates. The food was fabulous, especially from Tokyo to Sydney.
JAL is definitely our preferred airline for London to Sydney, and we cannot wait to experience Kyoto on the way back.

title: The Usual Excellent Service Expected from the Japanese.
review_text: Travelled business class Tokyo (Narita) to Australia (Sydney). Good business lounge, check (apart from the Australian slob in shorts & thongs); excellent on-board service, amenities & food, check. So why not 5/5? The seats: comfortable but surprisingly narrow (I'm 177cm & 78kg), sufficiently so as to make it difficult to sleep in my preferred position (no, not transversely !). Not a problem in a daylight flight but this was an overnight flight.

title: CAs  offered better seatings for long flight.
review_text: CA checked my name before offering a more relaxed seat, (Mr. so and so, would you like to have more room by moving from 27F to say 30B?). It helped not only me but also other people to enjoy more leg room and space. I was able to sleep almost flat ,using 3 seats.

title: Japan Airlines (JAL)
review_text: I used the JAL to fly back to Vietnam twice last month in January, 2018.  The first time was good and without any hicup.  The second time was not so well.  When we reached Tokyo, Japan, there was a snow that covered about less than 5 inches.  Both the airport and the airline did not know what to do, and decided to cancel out more than 30 flight include the one I was on.  I had to seat inside the plane from 6:00 PM to 3:30 AM.  Next morning, there were more than 3000 people stranded at the airport, and the JAL did not provide any information, any rebooking information, and any accommodations to those 3000 people.  Lots of them missed meetings, family emergency, business meetings, and even charity groups missed charity works.  I was willing to purchase another ticket, but unfortunately, it was on Saturday and no tickets available.  All other airlines also ran into same situation.  There was not much communication between customers and the airline counters either.  We were literally begging for information, communication, and tried to get on another flight by standing by options.  It was a nightmare and was not a good experience at all.

title: Food:( not so good!!!
review_text: I was startled with the food they served us!! I had to spit them out! So grossed! I love Japanese Food, but boy!!! What they served us - presentation wise was really good. The taste was awful! I had to asked the FA a bowl of Udon Noodles - that also wasn't good. I starved myself on that flight. My hubby didn't even eat at all - after he saw me making faces when I tried them food. No offense JAL. Just didn't like what you served us.

title: Very confortable service in the flight both of domestic and international lines
review_text:
I usually use JAl if i have flight.
After JAl bankruptcy, It will be better.
For example how to communicate with passengers, some information and any service for passengers.
Airplane is kept in clean.

I'd like to recommend anybody to use Jal if you need to have flights.

title: nice, cozy comfortable time - in the air and on the ground
review_text:
I was recommeded to fly JAL and it did not disappoint me at all. infact it set new standards for both in air and on ground service. 

it would great to have better movie selection as most movies ( English) were quite popular once only and it would be nice they can put some japanese movies with subtitles

title: Best in class
review_text: You always get your money's worth with JAL. My recent flight to Singapore was no exception. Premium economy  is a very attractive proposition : comfortable enough to work and relax. Good quality headphones to enjoy the wide selection of movies. Tasty food (miso beef).And of course pleasant service. My only gripe would be with online checking : this is supposed to save time so why do we need to go to the check in counter to get a stamp on our boarding pass?

title: Great airline
review_text: I have flown JAL many times before, and have always found them a great airline. The economy seats are very roomy and comfortable. The selection of things to watch on your personal screen is excellent. The staff are very friendly and welcoming, which all helps making your flight pleasurable. My airline of choice for flying to Japan would be JAL!

title: SIN - HND red-eye flight
