review_text: This flight comes with only one meal (breakfast) so you can go straight to sleep after take-off. It's quite comfortable. Seats are arranged 3-4-2 from left to right on the B777-200. Staff noted my birthday and prepared a small treat. :)

title: Newly discovered best value for money airline to Japan
review_text:
This is my first time taking JAL to Japan and simply love it. Until this trip, my previous trips had always been on Singapore Airline due to the timing and also the use of my KrisFlyer points. Of late, using points to redeem a trip is not worth as much as it should be and decided to try some other airlines instead. To my surprise, JAL is not only cheaper but still offers great timing and great economy class seat. 

Timing
I like to fly in late at night and reach the destination early morning so that I don’t have to waste a day of my precious holiday there. Similarly, I like to fly out late at night to save, you guessed it, a day of my precious holiday! JAL has that!

Great economy class seat
Great leg room ✅
Great recliner seat ✅
In-flight entertainment screen is huge ✅

I suspect that I’m going to be a JAL fan for a long while whenever I fly to Japan.

title: Expected more for the cost of business class
review_text: When I pay 2-3 times the cost of economy, I expect a little more: a larger seat, first boarding, some nice refreshment or a meal, allowance for heavier luggage or more luggage, etc. The staff members at JAL (on the ground and in the air) were all very nice. But oddly, business boards in the last zone with general boarding. Fist zone was special needs and anyone with children, so that was already ⅓ or more of the plane. Then zone 2 is those with recognized status, I forgot what zone 3 is, but after that is general boarding. So already you don't get any special treatment. The seats were slightly larger than economy and my 52 lb suitcase was permitted. There was a lot of activity with the attendants, so I figured they were preparing some food for the 3 hours in the air, but the only thing they did was give everyone on the plane 1 tiny paper cup of juice, coffee or tea. There was nothing else. RE Entertainment. There is none, but WIFI was free (that was nice). Cost of flight was about $1,000 RT and length of flight about 3 hours each way. I'll have to try a different airline next time; it was disappointing.

title: Absolute Best AIrlines
review_text: We were treated royally from check-in to arrival in Tokyo and then Bangkok. There was great food, service, and comfort throughout the almost 20 hours of travel. We look forward to the return flight back to San Diego.

title: Great JAL flight
review_text: Beautiful new Boeing 787. Crew were amazing, super friendly, prompt and efficient. Aircraft was spacious and nice atmosphere mimicking a night flight during the day with the 787 window tint and dimmed lights. It meant pax could sleep...makes the flight go much faster!

title: very pleasant flight
review_text: Friendly & helpful ground and cabin staff, centre bulkhead seats with lots of legroom, clean Boeing 777-200 with pleasant cabin layout, on-time departure but 40-minute arrival delay owing to Changi Airport airspace overcrowding

title: Welcoming Staff for foreigners
review_text: Our first experience of Japan was on our Japan Airline Flight 549 to Kushiro, and it exceeded our expectations. The staff welcomed us in English and constantly checked if we needed assistance. Thankfully, they also announced all the inflight messages in English for us - which we deeply respect since we were the only English speaking passengers on board. I highly recommend JAL Domestic and will be flying again very soon!

title: Attentive and gracious service
review_text:
We have been a fan of Japan Airlines for a long time (almost thirty years). In Economy Class,  the service is professional, the food is good, and the seats are comfortable. Because of our Gold Status on American, they have provided upgrades to us in the past that even American has not. This was our second experience with their Business Class (We had flown from Dallas to Narita in Business Class as well). On both the flights the main meal was superb and the rest of the options for food and drinks were tasty and nicely served. I was surprised though that for such a long flight they only have one "scheduled" meal and rest is "whenever you wish". You almost wish they had another lighter scheduled meal.
The Sky Suite  gives a fully flat seat with extra cushion bed provided if needed. The planes are relatively new models and are fairly quite. Compared to our Business Class experience in other airlines this is still far better.

title: Love JAL
review_text: We can't fault JAL. The check-in was effortless, the staff are very friendly and attentive and the food is probably the best in-flight food we have had. Love the warm face towels they hand out so you can freshen up. The plane was very clean and the seats were comfortable. Would definitely fly with JAL again.

title: Domestic business class
review_text:
Comfortable seat for an hour or so long flight. 

J class cabin.

A drinks service was offered and was offered a refill. 

On a 777. No IFE available.

title: Best airline
review_text:
A lot of other airlines could learn from JAL. 
We travel a lot, and when it comes to long haul flights, we fly business. JAL definitely has the best service and kindest people.

title: Business class
review_text: Wonderful flight in business class. Individual suite seats. First class lounge at the airport. Great service. This was the first time flying JAL and we were very impressed.

title: Great simple flight
review_text:
Flew Japan Airlines from Seoul Gimpo Airport to Tokyo Haneda on economy.
Simple, efficient flight on a Saturday. Took 2 hours to reach Tokyo from Seoul Gimpo.

Polite service with a simple Japanese dinner, nicely served.

Only drawback about JAL is check in is only allowed 2.5 hours before flight, which means you have to store my luggage somewhere if you arrived in Gimpo early.

title: Efficient and friendly service
review_text: On-time flight.  Efficient and friendly service.  Business class flight included service to the Sakura Lounge. Sakura Lounge offered charging stations at each seat.  Food offerings were heavily Japanese as opposed to international offerings.

title: Excellent experience
review_text: From start to finish I can't fault this airline. The staff are always helpful, the food is good and the plane is clean. We have now traveled with them several times and I would highly recommend spending a bit extra and go Premium Economy. I take an iPad with movies etc. on it, as the movies are mainly catered to Japanese people, which you would expect. There is always plenty of food and drink during the flight. I will always use them.

title: On time and perfect service
review_text: Although a short flight of 50 minutes. There is time for a free hot or cold drink. As always with JAL the flight was on time. The plane is a 777. Flying west from Tokyo to Osaka if the weather is clear you get a fantastic view of Mount Fuji from the plane. For the best view get a window seat on the right side of the plane. If flying from Osaka to Tokyo the best to get a window seat on the left.

title: Perfect service.
review_text: The flight was on time. The economy seats on JAL are very good. With enough legroom. Only a short flight but enough time for a drink of tea, coffee, or juice. No charge. Landing At Narita was on time and smooth. This flight now uses one of the new gates at Narita Terminal 2. So it is a long walk to get out.

title: More leg room than expected.
review_text:
Having not flown to Japan in Economy before I was a little worried about leg room as I am over 6ft tall. 

I was pleasantly surprised upon sitting down and was even more pleased when no one was occupying the middle seat. 

In flight entertainment was pretty good with a nice selection of films. Good quality audio and screen worked well. 

Food on the flight out was good and bad on the way back. 

Staff where polite and the plane was clean. 

Certainly better a flight than I thought and would use it again for future trips to Japan.

title: Excellent transoceanic experience
review_text: Remember the days when airlines actually catered to their customers... some 50 years ago?  Well neither do I because I was only 1 then! And as much as I though those days were long gone... and they pretty much are... it’s so refreshing to actually come off a 13 hr flight and honestly say it was enjoyable! I have to admit, I find it hard to sleep on any plane... but the middle seats in business are the ultimate in isolation from anything around you... just put up the adjacent partitions and voila! Also JAL’s meal service is great offer choice of either Western or Japanese menu and after the initial service you can order anything a la carte anytime up until 2 hrs before landing directly from ur personal communication device.  The movie selections could be better and more numerous but not a problem on this overnight.  The service from the extremely friendly and accommodating flight attendants could not have been better!  See my separate review of AA flight over to Japan for a harshly contrasting experience!!

title: Sarisfactory experience
review_text:
This was the return flight with JL and we found Premium Economy to be a good experience. I'm a larger build guy and did find the bottom of the seat could be uncomfortable after a few hours. However, the food and service was of a high standard and as good as any other airline in this class. Also there was good space for personal articles and in-flight baggage.
though the entertainment service was a little limited. Other then movies, English shows were limited.

title: very nice flight
review_text: Would fly again. Great first class service and excellent flight. friendly stewardesses good entertainment. An enjoyable long flight.

title: Excellent Economy Class felt like First Class!
review_text:
Excellent service.  After traveling on Delta from the US to India, flying with JAL in economy felt like first class.  The staff is great.  They really made us feel welcomed.  The food was delicious. The seats were comfortable, spacious, and clean (definitely helped on a 12+ hour flight).

This was my first time flying with JAL, but I look forward to flying with JAL again.

title: The best service, and pleasant trip!
review_text: I have visited Japan many times for last 30 years. This is the first time to fly with JAL from Chicago to Narita in Tokyo. I get used to the service of other flight companies. I was so pleased and happy by kind and pleasant services by all of attendants.  Even though it took over 13 hours I felt the flight was so quick . Definitely I will choose JAL, next time!!

title: Disappointing this time
review_text: Have flown JAL many times and always been happy with this airline. However, this time, I found the Dreamliner, Premium Economy seats uncomfortable and the foot rest was awkward to adjust (my husband's would not lower at all). The worst aspect though, was the awful food which was served as an initiative to give young chefs an entree into the world of commercial cooking. I could not eat the thick vegetable soup  accompanied by a hard roll which was served for breakfast. The dinner was luke warm and tasteless. It seems they were trying to serve western food instead of sticking to their own specialities of noodles, delicate sauces and small dishes. I would think hard about using this airline next time on this route. The problem is the opposition has two night time flights and this only has one. Would consider for flights to UK via Japan as service is usually excellent, planes on time, clean and reasonably priced.

title: Comfortable
review_text: It was very convenience for us to go to Tokyo from our town. Nanki Shirahama airport was small but very clean and easy to move around, they have a good restaurant onsite.

title: Bad seating
review_text:
My wife and son and I recently returned from our skiing vacation from Hokkaido with Jal.
We did not get seats together although it could have been arranged by the flight crew if they wanted to. The premium economy seats are very uncomfortable. They also land from Syndney in Narita and you connection is from Haneda which is an hour away by bus. I don’t recommend flying JAL if you can avoid it.

title: Best Economy Class Ever
review_text: From leg room, to food choices, to cabin service, this is simply the best economy flight we have flown. Did a recent trip to Asia and returned Hong Kong to Tokyo to Boston via JAL. The food was particularly good, the closest to restaurant quality we have had. And the stop at the amazing International Terminal at Narita airport was a real experience. The only way to go from Tokyo to Boston.

title: Outstanding
review_text:
We just came back from Bangkok, via Tokyo to the US.
What an experience flying with Japan Airlines, I had forgotten the feeling of respect, confort and proper manners while traveling on a flight. Everything was perfect, actually, more than perfect. The sense of being treated special, as if you were the only passenger in the plane, every  employee dedicated their entire time to make you feel confutable made the trip a pleasure.
Absolutely amazing Japan Airlines.
Looking forward flying again with JAL.

title: great flight and great service
review_text: I caught JAL flight from Singapore to Tokyo (6 hours duration), and me and my family loved it.  The service was great, especially I have a 6 yrs old boys with me, and they were considerate in very detail:  The crew reminded me to take my boy to bathroom as the plane is going to land, this showed they put customer in their priority.  The airplane food were good, seats were wider and had more legroom than other airlines can offer (we were in Economy class) (the plane is B777).  I do recommend to catch JAL if you intend to go to Japan, you won't disapoint.

title: Enjoyable Flight
review_text: The Service and flight attendants "A1".  Cleanliness of the plane immaculate!  Food was very good with a Japanese touch.  In flight entertainment excellent.  Best part were the seats, plenty of room and lots of legroom

title: good inflight service at a resonable price
review_text:
Out of the two Japanese airlines, ANA and JAL, I still find that JAL offered good inflight service for a decent price.for 900sgd for two way flight it a bargain. The legroom for the economy class is spacious enough. Food is good in my opinion and the in-flight entertainment especially movies were good. A mix of 80s movies and to the latest. The flight attendants were friendly and go out of their way to make sure your flight are comfortable. 

The only gripe I have with the airline is their customer service. It seems like no one manned their call center.

title: Enjoyable experience JAL Dreamliner
review_text: Flight SYD-NRT-SYD economy class-excellent customer service, comfortable seats.Good selection & quality of food and drinks.

title: Unbelievable flight experience
review_text: We flew round trip to Tokyo on Japan Airlines and we had excellent service and a great flight. Our flight attendants went out of their way to make us feel comfortable and to offer us samples of Japanese food and wine.

title: Great airlines to fly with.
review_text: Tokyo to Manila, economy class, B767. All staff were amazing - very accommodating and hospitable. The seats were great and there was a good amount of legroom. The inflight entertainment had good movies selection although there's always room for improvement especially with those monitors. Nevertheless, it was always great flying with them and my number one go to airline.

title: Credit means zero!
review_text: I book 3 tickets for a family trip April 2017 via expedia.com website. Before the flight I had to cancel trip. After conversation with an expedia customer representative, Japan Airlines agreed to give me credit for next trip and this information has been posted on my expedia account. Because of this Japan Airline credit I missed many chances to buy cheap tickets from other airlines. Few days ago I called expedia to book tickets using my credit. After waiting hours of conversation between expedia and JAL customer representatives I was told that I have zero credit.

title: Efficient but basic service
review_text: Check-in at First Class counter was excellent, as was separate security counter for First class and Emerald One World customers. Lounge was small, very clean with comfortable seats. Limited food (salmon sushi, curry puff or miso soup) with tea, coffee, soft drinks or whiskey and beer. One English Language newspaper (single copy!) was there on the day. Boarding was pretty crowded with no priority queue for F and J class. Seating was standard domestic J class with no A/V. Only service offered was coffee/tea/cold soft drink with not even a biscuit for less a meal. This is really a bus service with no frills in the air.

title: Wonderful flight!
review_text: I travelled to South Korea and Japan 2weeks ago and I have to say JAL was excellent! The flight attendants were so professional and kind.The food was great and the leg room spacious considering it was economy section.I look forward to flying Japan airlines in the future.

title: Honeymooners - AVOID PREMIUM ECONOMY UPGRADE SCAM
review_text: Absolute WORST customer service and experience with this Airline. On my honeymoon and paid for an upgrade on the way to my destination and halfway was downgraded. They blamed JFK for not properly communicating the upgrade was only halfway. Why would I pay $700 for an upgrade to only receive half of it and even the half that I did have had NO WiFi on the flight and it was a 14 hour flight!! Either way we got the runaround with a few different people at the Haneda Airport. Most notably was an incredibly rude manager MASAMI OHASHI. I was shocked when she said she was a manager because the way she spoke and handled this was incredibly unprofessional. So rude and I felt extremely disrespected. I was interrupted nonstop by “no no no no solution unless you pay more”. We spoke with other staff members at Haneda and Bangkok and they promised to accommodate us on our returning flight but then when that time came they said “oh sorry we can’t, the flight is full for those seats” meanwhile we saw open seats on the plane. Just terrible lying to customers to save the money we paid and avoid refunding it.  Very cheap. Horrible experience I will never ever fly with this Airline again. Don’t use them if you want to avoid the worst headache and rude customer service. I would give zero stars if I could.

title: comfortable flight/心地よい出張
review_text:
i took the direct over the night flight leaving Haneda at night and arrive San Francisco early afternoon. Business class cabin including the (Sakura) lounge in Haneda is fabulous. 
The only disappointment is the (Sakura) lounge in San Francisco airport; this has not changed for decades but the facility and the service they provide is far from the satisfactory level of that of other leading airlines. 
出張で羽田夜発サンフランシスコ昼頃到着直行便をビジネスクラスで搭乗した。搭乗キャビン、羽田でのサクララウンジは期待通りの満足を得られた。食事、睡眠、仕事環境どれとっても遜色無い。
予想通りだが唯一の不満はサンフランシスコ国際空港のサクララウンジのショボさ。米国全体に言えるのかも知れないが、他国他強豪のラウンジのレベルに比べて、とてもじゃないが、ビジネスクラス向けとは言いがたいレベルである。

title: Terrible customer service!!
review_text:
On December 5,2017 I booked and paid online $954 for a round-trip ticket for my mom- outbound from Hochiminh city, Vietnam to San Diego, CA  on Feb 19 and return on May 15, 2018. Unfortunately, for some personal reasons, a few weeks later I had to call them for rescheduling our flights onto Feb 5, 2018 and April 27, 2018. After at least 3 hours waiting on the line, an operator answered my phone and told me that I had to pay extra $237 for rescheduling including $75 changing fee and the rest for difference in fare. I agreed with that cost because I know the ticket price was no longer the same, logically, the price must raise up day by day.
However I checked the current price of my mom flights on their website a few days ago. I was shocked knowing that the price at that moment is only $947, which is $247 lower than my actual payment and even $7 cheaper than our first booking price!!!They really know how to disappointing their customers!! I booked 2 months earlier and accepted the possibility that I may have to pay more for rescheduling because I didn't want to buy tickets when the price are already raise up. However it turned out to be my silly decision. That really doesn't make any sense to me. JAL has really brought me into the feeling that my family was tricked by the brand that we has been supporting for years!!

title: Avoid JAL. Will leave you stranded in Japan with NO ticket to go back home
review_text:
On 25th Jan 2018. Me and my brother were supposed to take flight from Fukuoka (7:10am) from Singapore through transit at Haneda (6:00am around). Considering we bought our ticket through Jal main site we didn't think much of the transit time as we had done so multiple times in the past.

Though this time, we noticed there was staff waiting for us to gave us a monorail ticket to domestic terminal. We managed to get out of immigration and luggage at 6:40am around which is 20min slower than my previous trip and would proceed to interchange counter to drop my bag usually. However, this time they want us to take monorail to domestic with our luggage. We got to station at 6:42am and board the train on 6:44am. We approached the reception counter 24 at 6:50 around. And after some phone by the staff we were asked to push our checked in baggage through security to go on plane as cabin luggage. However as we got to security, our Swiss army knife that usually accompany our checked in baggage were not allowed to go through and we were asked to abandon them which we are not willing due to the price of them. And hence we do not board the 7:10am flight.

To add insult to injury, we were told we could only be put on stand by without any promise of when or if we could get on to any plane. We decided to find other way to get to Fukuoka after another attempt at their ticketing office, which result in no ticket. So we wasted more money and lots of time on our first day to Japan where JAL effectively left us in lurch at Haneda airport.

The final blow by Jal was on 3rd day of the trip (the same day I'm writing this) where I went online to check my reservation and noticed it cannot be selected and my brother reservation just disappeared (I'm with their JAL mileage club). Which makes me think our tickets have been cancelled and effectively not only leaving us at lurch in Haneda but also in Japan with no ticket to get back to Singapore. There were of course no email about cancellation of our return ticket or any form of notifications.

At this moment, we are stuck in Japan with no ticket to get back. Given that all Fukuoka seats were full that day my gut says it's Jal elaborated way to seat bump passengers for their more prestigious members (unlike David Dao incident), if we were allowed to check in our baggage we would be on plane, if Swiss knife army an issue the staff could keep hold of them till we alight and we could board the plane. 

I'm currently reaching our to Jal on my 3rd day to check on my flight status before I escalate the situation accordingly. My advice is Avoid JAL at all cost, the slight edge of their company recently over ANA (due to ANA silly baggage policy few years ago which they have since fixed) had made them complacent. Avoid. Avoid. Avoid.

title: Excellent airline
review_text: In the second leg from Saigon to Tokyo to Vancouver with JAL. Excellent service with reasonable leg room.  Food in second leg muncher better than first but the barbque wasn’t working.  Will certainly fly with them again.  By the way they ran out of ice cream on second leg of trip - not that’s bad...

title: Australia - Europe via Japan an excellent  alternative.
review_text:
Flight staff were extremely helpful and welcoming  and all spoke English.
Flight leaves early and arrives early, with a long night for those who have trouble sleeping.  The two stages are of equal length unlike the alternatives through the middle east and south east asia which involve one particularly long leg. We arrived refreshed and ready to start the day with no sign of jet lag, unlike previous trips. 

There is a long stopover in Tokyo, where you are required to collect your luggage and transfer by road between airports. However when you arrive at Haneda staff are ready to take your luggage straight away so you are not required to hang on to it till checkin opens.

Haneda has a hotel adjacent to the departure lounge where you can have a meal and catch a few hours sleep after airline check-in. This means you can sleep until 90 minutes before departure.   

We left Sydney on the Sunday a week before Christmas and were very pleased to discover that the Monday morning flight is not popular with travellers. The plane was only about  a quarter full particularly  in economy.Every set of four seats was occupied by just one person sleeping across all four. How often do you  see that on a flight to  Europe.

title: Worst flights ever; sat in plane for 7.5 hr
review_text:
It started 3 hours late with no notifications and they have 14 hours to call, Email or text
Then after getting in flight Tokyo to Bangkok  with 3 inches of snow sat on ground 3 hours at which time they cancelled and made us wait 4+ hrs more to deplane with very lame excuses.
After that no customer service and thank  Sue from American for rebooking
When we finally boarded new flight they were 1.5 hours late loading cargo or whatever 
That’s the short version I’ll spare you the other nasty smelly parts

title: JAL abandoned us and thousands of other passengers at Narita
review_text:
During the recent Tokyo heavy snow on 22 January 2017 I was flying home on a JAL flight.  JAL loaded up our plane and then several hours later unloaded us at midnight with minimal explanation (the Captain was almost unintelligible) and then washed their hands of us at Narita airport.  

Once we were hustled back to the check in part of Narita there were literally no JAL staff there to offer and advice or assistance to the thousands of their customers who they had unceremoniously tossed off their planes.  The only ‘help’ we received was the advice that there were no hotel rooms and a poorly worded piece of paper which gave a range of phone numbers for us to call - none of which worked because they were closed for the night.

Apart from sleeping on the floor of the airport (which I get) - the bit I don’t get why the next morning should have been bedlam and chaos.  The few JAL staff who turned up after their refreshing night’s sleep had no idea (they were clueless) about what we should do next.  They kept referring us to a reservations number which wouldn’t answer.  It was a farce, and everyone was openly laughing at the incredibly poor service that JAL provided.  I am convinced that JAL lost many many thousands of future customers that night.

I finally got through to that JAL number almost 18 hours later and was offered a flight back a week later via Singapore.  I just laughed and asked whether it was an early April fools day joke.

By that stage I had given up on JAL.  

My experience with Qantas was the complete opposite.  They were at pains to help and got us on a flight the next day home.  In short they were fantastic - the complete opposite to JAL.  Still haven’t heard a peep from JAL....and if course never will.

It makes you wonder about the culture at JAL.  That they literally abandoned their passengers at their home base for half a day without any help points to the fact that the airline and its leadership have severe problems.

The reason I am writing this is in the hope that someone from JAL reads this and understands that their performance that night was completely unacceptable.

For my part I will NEVER EVER FLY ON JAL AGAIN!!!

title: It's not about the flight experience, it's the customer centre
review_text:
It's IMPOSSIBLE TO get through the phone with JAL!!!!! 
I have been on a call for more than an hour. (calling from North American line) 
UNBELIEVABLE. If there's any issue on line, it's impossible to get through. 
So tiring, so exhausting. 

KAL picks up the phone at least within 30 min. This JAL Airline is terrible on customer service centre.

title: iPad left at Haneda returned to Ho Chi Minh City! plus Gluten Free meals
review_text: I cannot say enough good things about Japan Airlines, for the wonderful customer service I received on a December 2017 flight! Near the end of a 9 hour layover in Toyko, my husband’s name was called from the gate while he was away taking a walk.  When I grabbed all of our bags to run over to find out why, I mistakenly left my brand new iPad on the chair (black cover on a black chair; I didn’t see it while rushing). I only realized it was missing right before the plane took off.  I told a flight attendant, who was VERY kind and helpful throughout the flight to work on helping me find it.  I cannot thank her enough. Another airline person met me when I got off the plane to get my information, and I soon received a follow up email (and several after that to follow up).  We arranged for the item to be flown to Ho Chi Minh City where I was able to pick it up a couple of weeks later, again with the help of a very nice employee.  I hope we get to fly Japan Airlines again - between that, and providing my husband with a very nice gluten-free meal (he has celiac disease), it was an exceptional experience!

title: Good first experience
review_text: Fly Singapore-Haneda-Chitose-Haneda-Narita-Singapore. Had to transfer at Haneda before continuing to Chitose on domestic flight. Clear signs were given. Had to clear immigration and claim baggage when at Haneda onwards to Chitose. Staff were courteous and attentive. They will bow before flight commences. Will definitely consider fly on JAL besides other flights.

title: Left high and dry
review_text:
Our family of 2 adults and 2 children flew Premium economy from Sydney to Paris via Tokyo. Excellent service by onboard crew, great access to airport lounges, limited movie options, ordinary food but quite comfortable. Inconvenient transfer from Sydney to Paris via Tokyo as overnight stay required and 1.5 hour bus to change airports which we had to arrange ourselves.

Our last flight from Tokyo to Sydney was cancelled due to the snowstorm on 22/1/18. Promised hotel and food vouchers when disembarking after 5 hours on the plane. Instead, all hotels were full - understandably with 200+ flights cancelled. Left with a sleeping bag, water and crackers to spend the night in Narita airport. I wasn’t too concerned and was willing to put up with a sleepless night to avoid unsafe conditions. I assumed we would fly out in the morning on the same plane, it seemed logical.

Atrocious communication and follow-up service. Nobody to speak to for 8 hours. We were told that our flight was cancelled (obviously) and we’d have to call a number to book another flight(on the public phone or use for those without international roaming). Hours of waiting, no answer on the number given, no ground staff to talk to. We were fortunate that we booked through Flight Centre who were excellent and got us on a Qantas economy flight 2 days after our original flight (which JAL covered). They wouldn’t, however, cover our accommodation or other expenses. We also had to get from Narita to Haneda - another saga of 4 train changes (with 50+kg of luggage) due to more delays and cancellations.

Others at the airport who booked online directly with JAL were left with no assistance and hours of waiting without information or food. I am unaware of how they managed after we left the queue of hundreds of people (with no one attending the desks).

Weather issues are an understandable force of nature, being dropped by an airline like a dirty dish rag is disappointing and unacceptable. This airline is excellent when all runs smoothly but terrible when things go wrong. I’ll never fly with JAL again.

title: Great service, economy felt like business class.
review_text: Fantastic service, staff amazing especially "c" who I fell in love with. Usually travel business class but had to sit with the riff-raff this time lol, however the experience in economy with JAL wasn't too far off.

title: First Class
review_text: If you want to enter the plane with ALL the flight crew courteously bowing to greet and welcome you on the flight. Take JAL.  If you like bento meals. Take JAL.  If you love love love Green Tea and Kiwi Juice. Take JAL. If your flight to be ON TIME. Fly JAL.

title: Super Efficient and Comfortable.
review_text: I have take this particular flight a number of times. If you can get to the airport early and take advantage of the Sakura Lounge. Flight left largely on time and after about 45mins drinks were served. Food was pretty good and plentiful. Drinks were served quickly. The seat is a full flat bed which is most comfortable for this kind of over night flight. I slept after dinner and woke up a couple of hours before landing. When I go back to SFO I will most certainly be flying with JAL.

title: Japanese what the is wrong with your logic?
review_text: So I paid extra to upgrade from economy to premium economy because i have leg condition and can’t really sit long.  And during the layover I was called upon and the flight attendant asked me if I can give up my seat and swap seats with a family with a baby. And I said “sure. But i paid extra money to get this seat because I have leg issue, is it possible to give me a bump up?” And the attendant looked at me very surprised and replied “ sorry not possible, but if you want you can pay another extra money to upgrade to business class and that is another $500+ each person” I was like seriously? What kind of Japanese logic is this? I don’t get it. I ended up saying I will think about it, and later I convinced my wife to give up the seats and take the swap with the other family but JAL told me it has been taken care of so I don’t have to. Okay... I was shocked and embarrassed again by their sarcastic smile. what the hell was it? Wow...impressed never jal again.

title: Brilliant Service
review_text: The US Airlines (American and United in particular) would do well to take a long hard look at JAL’s approach to service and passenger wellbeing not just on the flight but before and after as well. Bottom line... didn’t want to leave the plane.

title: Great Airline with Good Service
review_text: Great airline with a good business class layout from NY to Tokyo.  Go for the window seats.  Good food. Helpful service.

title: Courteous JAL
review_text:
Every JAL flight for me is pleasant because of the courteous staff. Service is one of the best I’ve experienced. 

This particular flight used a B767 and the seats were very comfortable. Inflight entertainment was beyond my expectation. 

Truly pleasant 4 hour flight.

title: Hot and stuffy
review_text: We knew this flight was going to be long but what we didn't know was that it was also going to be uncomfortably warm for 90% of the flight. What I do not understand about these enormous planes is why you no longer get an air vent above your seat? At one point I was fanning myself with the emergency card and the flight attendant came over and assured me that they had turned on the A/C. If they did, it was off again within the hour. The service was friendly. The food was very mediocre. In flight entertainment options were nice. Being on a hot sweaty plane for 11 plus hours was awful.

title: JL33 HND-BKK Economy Class
review_text:
First and foremost, nothing beats leavings from Haneda rather than Narita. It is close to the city centre and is less busy when travelling international. 

If you are flying to BKK this particular flight is excellent. Leaves at midnight and arrives during the early morning; therefore, you have the whole day to enjoy. 

The aircraft was a B787 with new economy seats; therefore, you have a bigger entertainment screen and more leg room. The only downside is the food. It’s not very tasty. Hope this review helps.

title: Premium economy - Melbourne to Tokyo
review_text: JAL premium economy experience is excellent. Starting with access to JAL lounge, were you can quietly sit and enjoy food and drinks prior to flight. Staff advise when boarding commences so you can go directly from lounge to the plane. Premium economy seats and surrounding space is spacious and comfortable, Cabin service is friendly and efficient. Food and drinks plentiful. Would definitely recommend JAL flight to Tokyo.

title: Budget airline customer service
review_text: A simple error in name cannot be corrected after hours on the phone and delays it seems that I will have to cancel and book another ticket due to the delay it will undoubtedly be more expensive and they will charge me around 30% cancellation fees. Most reputable airlines give you 24h to make corrections but not this airline they will screw you over while make things as inconvenient and vague as possible.

title: Delicious flight meals!
review_text: Good inflight service and entertainment, flight meals were impressive, loved the themed breakfast set, it was too cute!

title: Travel to Narita Japan during March 17 school holiday
review_text: My son won a free return ticket to Japan and the whole family bought a ticket to travel together with him. From Penang, we took MAS and the arrangement was very good where our luggage were check in direct to Narita even the airlines were different. Our flight to Japan we smooth, there was no delay in departure. The stewards were very helpful and friendly. We requested for Muslim food and they complied. Child food also served for my 7 years old and she also got a gift from JAN. Our agent arranged for special upgrade to premium economy on our return flight. The leg room was better, extra accessories/goodies were given and we were boarded first before the economy class passenger. All in all, good travel experience!

title: Average business class services
review_text:
This flight was operated by a Boeing 787-9 (JA866J) with latest SKY SUITE I business class cabin equipped. We took off from Hong Kong International Airport runway 07R at 11:04 (local time) and arrived Narita International Airport runway 34R at 15:19 (local time).

I was sitting in seat 7A, the bulkhead business class seat located in the first row of the second compartment. No welcome drink was provided prior departure (it was standard procedure in HKG <> NRT route). Lunch was served at around 45 minutes after take off. Overall the service is just average. It is definitely not up to par. 

The flight was smooth, however, the cabin of Boeing 787-9 was relatively noisy when comparing with Airbus A350-900 or Boeing 777-200/300.

title: Great trip
review_text: Caught plane from sydney going to japan hostesses were very friendly and helpful. Lots of leg room between  seats. Good food it was hot and very tasty. Very attentive staff. Would definitely fly with japan airlines.

title: Effective and efficient flight in a clean and roomy cabin.
review_text: We traveled on an AA ticket and were able to get window and aisle seats in Row 17 on a 777. My son needs a lot of leg room so we were quite happy with the seats. It was easy to get in and out of the aisle so we did not disturb the person sitting in the aisle seat. The food was very good (I did order vegan meals), service was timely and friendly, and the plane and restrooms were really clean. We enjoyed the 10.5 hour flight.

title: First Class!
review_text: Absolutely first class from start to finish.  Impeccably dressed, professional, smiling, eye contact, accomodating.  They open on time, they show respect. Planes are clean, food is good, plenty of leg room, all the screens work.  Highly recommend.

title: Japan Airlines - Quality Experience
review_text: JAL surpassed my expectations.  Great seats with loads of legroom, it almost felt like Business Class.  The seats are contained within their own pod so the person in front can recline as much as they want without any impact on your space.  Food was good and staff were excellent.  New Boeing 787-9 aircraft completed an excellent experience.  Premium Economy also gets you access to the Qantas lounge in Sydney.  If there is a negative, JAL flies into Narita which is much farther from Tokyo and the queues in Narita on our arrival lasted over an hour.  However I am guessing that this is not a regular occurrence.  JAL is the best airline I have flown in a long time.  Highly recommend Japan Airlines.

title: Great value and convenient arrival time
review_text:
JAL started non-start flights again between Kona and Narita.  One of few affordable options to fly into Narita at a more convenient time.  Noon departure with 4:30 PM arrival.  

Wearing a boot for a heel fracture and flight attendants allowed me to move to a front row in the cabin section, entire row was empty so had lots of room to spread out and stretch out my leg.  

Dinner food was good and a full meal.

title: Good Night Flight
review_text: The adjustment of the light after taking off was very nice... It put me into sleep. Sometimes it is difficult to sleep, but it was easy with this considerate way of controlling the light in the aircraft. Their service is always nice...

title: Much, much better than the my last JAL flight ...
review_text: After a less than stellar JAL flight from Canada to Narita, we hoped for a better flight -- and got it overall. The veggie meal this time -- was indeed vegetarian and tasty! I was content with the meal's quality and quantity. In addition, the crew were professional, yet warm. Check in, boarding and the flight itself were all flawless. We arrived to Bangkok without incident ...

title: Awesome Economy!
review_text: First time on Japan Airlines and wasn't expecting much since I had a very difficult time getting a seat and checking in online.  They wouldn't allow it because it was part of an American Airline booking. That's their policy. But I tried one more time the day of the flight and, bingo, I was suddenly allowed to check in and pick my seat. That flight had 2 together near the window, so right away I was happy. The seat seemed more comfortable than most economy and the food was excellent served with proper cutlery. Then the best part, the toilets! Very clean and attractive and they had some gizmo that sprayed your private parts with warm water and I think it also dried it. I made sure my husband went to use this awesome toilet!  I know they have them in Japan but I didn't expect to see it in economy! I would fly anywhere they would go, unfortunately, not that many places from where I live.

title: Very comfortable flight experience, amazing food and service
review_text: From the take off to landing, everything was very smooth. I traveled with a puppy, so I was hoping for a calm flight. The puppy was well when she got to the airport. Food was very very good. It is way better than Air Canada. The most important part is I got Haagen Dazs ice cream for dessert. The flight attendants were very welcoming, and they even thanked us individually before the landing. As long as it's not too overpriced, I'd consider flying JAL for sure.

title: It's the soft product that really shines
review_text:
We took this flight as a family of 4 on the Dreamliner fitted out with a Shell Neo product. As far as I am concerned, this is the best hard product for non-overnight flights. The seats are comfy and spacious, along with a wide screen for watching a pretty decent selection on the IFE.

The thing that really sets JAL apart is the service. Even though the cabin was full, the staff were really attentive and made you feel valued.

The food was another high point. Am pretty sure this is as good as plane food gets.

title: Excellent Service
review_text:
Very friendly and helpful service.  I found both meals to be above average, in quality and portion size, than I feel is typical, they also brought as all fresh washclothes beforehand.

The flight had been delayed due to a mechanical issue (they replaced a gauge), so we missed our connection in Tokyo, but they had booked us on a new flight and provided us with 3000 yen for food snacks upon disembarking the plane, so it was a relatively painless inconvenience.

title: Over the top experience from Narita to Honolulu!
review_text: My first leg from Beijing to Narita was a good experience and then on to Honolulu was among my best flight experiences ever! My second leg was a five-hour flight at night so I knew the crew would have some downtime as most passengers would be asleep. During the two-hour layover at Narita, I purchased a box of Chocolates for the flight attendants to share and gave it to them when boarding. They at first thought I wanted them to store the bag for me and I said no, it was for them to share with each other. Now I often do this because I am usually traveling as a backpacker and I am not especially well dressed after weeks/months on the road, on this occasion it was jeans and a Great Wall tourist tee-shirt. Foremost I like to do it because I know how hard they work and I want to express my gratitude for their efforts, that it also removes me from the category of just another person in cattle class in their eyes is a nice bonus. I am not sure if bringing a gift hit a Japanese cultural button but the reaction was like nothing I had ever experienced before. At different points of the flight, each attendant stopped by my seat to personally thank me and chat a bit, asking if I was a pilot or at least an airline employee. I literally could not pay for a drink, the Champagne flowed all through the night! Even when I insisted I had not done it for any kind of reward and would like to pay after the second one their response to this was to give me a diecast B777 in JAL livery, and more Champagne! When you fly your three biggest tools are, don't be a jerk, show appreciation and empathy to the cabin crew, express your gratitude before that moment at the door when deplaning!

title: Good, on time
review_text: Having flown JAL several times their service is very good and the comfort levels OK. They tend to have their cabin temperature quite high.

title: Mixed experience with JAL
review_text:
One of the best parts of flying with JAL are the flight attendants and their professional demeanor. I was on a recent flight where some of the passengers were sick and they still kept their composure and smile. They are excellent in working with children and infants to make sure they are comfortable and safe. My only itch was with a flight attendant that took issues with one person standing up for a few seconds or two people heading to the restroom in what seemed like an emergency. Hopefully, she  had a glass of wine or two to decompress and calm her nerves. 

The economy seats from SFO to Haneda were the most comfortable, but the economy seat that was assigned from Narita to LAX would have been tight on my knees had it been a middle or window seat. I traveled with my much shorter spouse which made the trip a lot more bearable. I highly recommend the premium economy seats if traveling from Japan to the US, since they often make offers to upgrade to premium economy at a reasonable price.

I'm not sure what happened to JAL's in-flight dinning. I made sure to eat a full meal before entering the plane on my way back to the states. In-flight dining was much better years ago when I flew JAL. What they served recently even my kids refused to eat. They preferred lunch food than JAL In-flight dinning. They couldn't stand the smell of the soup that they served. The only thing that saved the day was the little cartons of  Haagen-Dazs to make up for the terrible in-flight meals.

 I miss the days when flights to Japan served bento box style Japanese food and my kids actually ate the airplane food and never complained.

Another negative about flying with JAL is that if the flight is operated by Japan Airlines, you won't be eligible for TSAPre for that flight. JAL is not a TSA Pre participating airline. I didn't mind since my children were of the age that allowed us to go through metal detectors instead. In the future, we would have to book through a participating airline.

In spite of the negative, JAL offers some really good international flight deals. If you want to fly with JAL, I do recommend premium economy seating and flying one stop to and from Haneda if you're going to Tokyo. Flying through SFO makes for much smoother traveling than flying multiple stops to LAX from my experience. Flying with Japan Airlines really depends on how you customize your traveling experience. It could be a 3 star or 4 star flying experience. 

Flying through JAL was much better overall than Delta or American Airlines in my opinion. However, JAL needs to work on their horrible in-flight dinning selections and participate in TSA Pre. I would give my flight experience with JAL a 3.5 overall.

title: JAL
review_text:
easy check-in.  
excellent flight attendants.
wide selection of free movies.
okay seats with good leg room.
very good meals.
very good flight to Japan.

title: Great service great food
review_text: I have flown  JAL many times for international flights and the stewardesses are top-notch with their service. The service is always the best things about the Japanese carriers.  Food is always pretty good for airlines food. The planes themselves are okay, not wow.  Their luggage policy is standard for international carriers.  Decent selection of recent movie releases on the entertainment center. They are codeshare with American Airlines, one can earn some points. JAL is the only airline that flies direct to San Diego from Japan (NRT).

title: Japanese tradition
review_text: It was a red eye flight from Singapore to Sapporo via Tokyo Haneda airport. The crew of Japanese stewardess were most helpful and polite, in Japanese tradition. The flight from Singapore to Tokyo was shorter than normal probably due to strong tail wind, and before we knew it, we were awaken by the crew as the plane prepared to descend. Their food especially Japanese menu is quite good for economy class. Though I would rate ANA a shade better, JAL is still one of my preferred airlines.

title: Japanese comfort
review_text:
The JAL Premium Economy seats are some of the most spacious available, with plenty of space between seats, although the recline is only slightly more than economy. The seats have hard shells, so you never bothered by the seat behind.

The staff and inflight services are very good and probably represents some of the best value in the OneWorld network.

title: International Flight That Felt Like A Mediocre Domestic Flight
review_text:
I'm used to expecting, perhaps wrongly, that flying economy on an international flight will be a step above flying domestic economy. This is the first time I have felt that this was not the case. There were many substandard moments once we got on the plane (service prior to boarding was quite good!) ... but I will highlight that the saag paneer that I was eating turned out not to be paneer at all -- but chicken! I've ordered countless Hindu meals in the past -- and they've always been vegetarian. But, when I brought this to the attention to the head flight attendant, she wasn't at all concerned. When I asked about the next meal coming up, she said mysteriously, "We'll talk then." Well, there was no talk ... she simply gave me the next meal saying that she feared it also had meat in it. When I tried to give it back to her, she said I could eat the fruit and the zucchini/tomato ... So, I left a ten hour flight not only hungry, but also will my digestive track acting up (I had not eaten meat in about 30 years, and my system was reacting to it.) Doing some research on-line, it turns out that Japan Air offers a vegetarian Hindu and a regular Hindu -- but no such distinction was clear to us when we placed our special meals. 

In general, though, I found the on-board service quite mediocre, and will think twice about flying Japan Airlines again once this whole trip is over. 

(The woman who checked us in today onto another Japan Airlines flight was much more understanding -- I made an attempt to change today's meals. Whether she succeeds or not, for us the important thing is she made an effort. No such effort was made by the prior flight attendants. They had a tired and removed attitude to their jobs. 

On a positive note, the in-flight entertainment was varied and engaging ...

title: Excellent services
review_text:
My wife and I have been traveling by Japan Airlines and certainly enjoy every flight for the excellent skill of the captain and his team. Landing is just like feather
touch down very smooth.

Catering service is a learning of Japanese cooking art. Japanese and western meals are provided for choice. However in order to get Japanese meal it would be better to contact the airline 72 hours in advance to reserve , otherwise you may end up to eat the western food that is not very tasty.

In flight services are always top quality and attendants are always ready to serve.

The cabin is spotless clean including toilet that is maintained all the time.

The only problem is that English language needs improvement as very often it is hard to understand the announcement.

Comfortable, enjoyable and always like to travel with this top quality airline

title: Most proper service
review_text: The service was exceptional,  The attendants were very helpful and properly attired in very nice uniforms.  The food served was very good.  I would definitely fly this airline whenever I have the chance.

title: Customer service is appalling
review_text: We never actually took the flight.  Contacting them prior to the flight at their request  because their reservation booking codes had changed left us on hold for 2 hours before we were disconnected.  Another 90 minutes and I managed to speak to someone.  On the day of the flight, the flight was cancelled, but the email did not come in until we were on the way to the airport.  When we arrived there, there was a sign listing all the flights that were cancelled and to call their customer service department. 10 hours later, I am still trying to get through.  For a world class airline the service is the worst I have ever experienced.  I have managed to book a flight through another airline and I am hoping to get a refund from JAL.  Their website is not user friendly and their telephone support is non-existent.

title: Japan Airline U The Best
review_text: My first time take Japan Airline with my family .we very happy with the service from ground staff to flight staff all very good service. Good Job Japan Airline staff  U the Best.

title: Efficient & not too unpleasant
review_text:
I dislike flying no matter what class. This boarding of this flight was interesting in that Premium Economy passengers got on last. This was so they didn't block the passageways of the Economy passengers. Not a bad idea.
The flight was overnight & breakfast had a Japanese touch to it as you might expect. There was a mug of rich broth with some pasta, pickles & fruit in separate little bowls. A few people including me didn't eat the pasta. It looked Italian & there was no sauce.
The plane was a Boeing 787 & those aircraft are quite nice & quieter than previous Boeing I have flown in. The Business class seats looked unsatisfactory because they were all in little cells & I was glad I wasn't in them. If you were travelling with a partner, it would have been difficult to converse.
I never use the in flight entertainment & don't even turn it on. I bring my own.

title: Economy Premium Flight
review_text:
The seats was spacious. However, the inflight entertainment was not so great. Movies was mainly in Japanese which i think they should catered for foreigners as not all the flight are taken by japanese. 

Inflight meals wasnt that great too!

title: "JAL Do it again!"
review_text: As my first review flying JAL from Melbourne to Tokyo, JAL Do it again! On our return leg back to Australia. JAL really are a sensational airline to fly. Premium Economy is really worth the extra cost, it really is! Great food options again, amazingly generous room, great seating with full reclining option, food, service and even little things like the window tinting technology as opposed to the traditional shades. As they say... Do yourself a favour! ;)

title: Great flight JL042
review_text:
After a slight mess with ticketing, once on the plane everything was very comfortable and smooth. Even in economy there was more legroom than the outward flight on the British Airways flight to the UK. The seating of 2-4-2 is great if you are a couple traveling. 

The plane is a newer plane and so very clean and you don’t get the grubby feeling you experience on some older planes. The food was actually very good. The touch screen was of a good size and very responsive with a wide film selection. Service was excellent. Having gotten engaged over the winter period, we mentioned it to the staff just during conversation on the plane. Towards the end of the flight two cabin attendants came over with a model plane and a signed postcard wishing us a happy future. A small but very thoughtful touch. 

All in all a very good flight and 12 hours passed relatively quickly.

title: Flew business class. Comfortable. Great service.
review_text: This was actually two flights. Hawaii to Tokyo, 2 hour stop, then on to Shanghai. Makes for a long trip, but JAL made it bearable. The seats and service on both legs were good. Great quality food, served by friendly and courteous staff. The change in Tokyo was efficient with a good lounge to wait it.

title: Direct flight with many time choices to choose
review_text: Food is exceptional and airplane is new with lots of feature to choose for tv, music, games, and much more. Will definitely fly with JAL again and again

title: Japanese "HIGH" standard of service ...
review_text:
What would you expect from a Japanese company or airline in this case ... no nonsense standard of quality and consistent service.

That's exactly what they delivered ... Boeing 787, well maintained, clean, all in order, good entertainment system and impeccable service.

Food for inbound to Tokyo was OK (Melbourne supplied), but outbound from Tokyo was impressive, showcasing local chefs, variety, etc.

WELL DONE JAL ... looking forward to another flight to Tokyo, hopefully Haneda Airport this time.

title: flew on business class, nice seats, great service
review_text:
great service, friendly staff, nice layflat bed on 787. from tokyo to jkt we flew on the 767. the seats also lie flat, but i found the seats on the 767 narrower compare to the 787. which is interesting because they were able to put 3 seats in the middle aisle in the 787 yet the seats are wider. 

the japanese food selection were too exotic for me. half of the food on the plate i dont even know what they are. 

business class lounge in LAX was very nice, breakfast was really good. unfortunately the staff were not friendly at all at the LAX lounge. and they remove breakfast food before they put out lunch. and the food selection for lunch was like dorm food. 

overall it was a great experience flying with JAL. sakura lounge in tokyo was also very nice, much nicer than LAX lounge. overall, JAL is rated up there with ANA and EVA air in terms of service, food and seats.

title: Cheap fares did not justify the travails
review_text:
I was lured by business class fare that was about $1200 cheaper that its rivals.  You get what you pay for. First off the 787 from Vancouver to Tokyo did not have full flat bed, only old fashioned pod type recliners. To make matters worse they ran out of Salmon dinner (both ways !!!!) and the only other option was unpalatable for me.
Wine selection was modest.
They lay over  was long(19 hrs) but the flight gets in at about 4 pm in Japan, therefore not much time to go to Tokyo and enjoy the city.  
May be an OK flight if you were traveling to Vancouver to Tokyo and don't mid the seats. Good option from Tokyo to Delhi with full flat beds.
Overall not worth it if you are traveling to India.

title: ECONOMY IS TREATED AS WELL AS 1ST CLASS!
review_text:
We were taking a 14 day cruise departing from Singapore on 12/06/2017. We booked a flight from LAX to NRT (with a connection to Singapore). While at LAX, the Captain announced that the flight would be delayed by an hour in order to facilitate a cargo transfer. Unfortunately, they were unable to make up the loss time during the flight. So towards the end of the flight, a stewardess came to my wife and I and informed us that they were going to hold our connecting flight to Singapore (Flt 711), so that we need not worry. When we disembarked in Tokyo, we observed a display board with the names of approximately a dozen passengers (of which our names was amongst them). A very polite young female JAL employee handed us an envelope. She didn’t speak fluent English but she was able to communicate to us that there were boarding passes and bus vouchers inside the envelope. She further explained that we would need to claim our bags and catch a bus for Haneda Airport. By using our cellphone, we found that there was another flight leaving from NRT to Singapore in less than 2 hours. She then informed us that this flight was already filled. We then attempted to explain that the delay of our flight was not the result of a mechanical or weather issue, and that it was actually caused by a decision of the Airline to wait for delayed cargo. It had now been 22 hours since we left Las Vegas and we were quite exhausted. Were we now expected to retrieve our bags, go thru customs, somehow locate where to trade the vouchers for bus tickets, then find the correct bus stop, wait in line for the bus to load our luggage, and wait for the bus to make 2 other stops before arriving at the Haneda International Terminal?  We explained to the young lady that we were very tired and that we held Executive Platinum Status with “One World” (and that we were currently traveling in Business Class).  We pleaded “could you please arrange for a taxi or airport limo to make things easier for us? Apologetically, she said there was nothing she could do to help us.
At this point we insisted to speak with a manager. When the manager arrived he was very polite, professional, and spoke excellent English. He also informed us that he was unable to arrange for private transportation to the Haneda Airport, but that he would personally escort us thru baggage claim and would obtain the bus tickets and show us where to catch the bus. This was a huge help, and we truly appreciated his efforts. Just out of curiosity, I asked him if we had been flying 1st class instead of Business, would they have arranged for private transportation. He replied “I’m sorry to say, No”. This is actually very good to know. My wife makes several 1st class trips per year to Asia (as does her employees). There are always going to be occasional issues when taking long trips (this fact is entirely unavoidable). However, it all comes down to how well the issues are handled. Frankly, we believe this situation could have been handled far better than it was. It just seems to me that it’s counterproductive and ultimately self-defeating for JAL to treat their VIP travelers in this manner.  JAL made the decision to wait for a late cargo transfer which caused us to miss our connection. JAL also made the decision not to pay the $175 it would of cost to minimize our inconvenience (which was also their fault).
On the way back, we flew on Cathay Pacific. I found their business class to be superior to JAL. The Cathay’s seats are larger because the rows are 1-2-1 as opposed to JAL which were 1-3-1. Cathay also has a significantly larger library of movies and TV shows. However, the inflight service on both airlines was truly outstanding.

title: Nice 6-hr day flight
review_text: This was a 6-hr morning flight from Singapore to Tokyo Narita. The business section of the aircraft is in the form of 1:2:1 configuration is good for easy access and privacy. The crew serviced lunch pretty early (before 11am Singapore time) before dimming the light for passengers who would like to sleep. Surprisingly, slippers (disposable) were provided for a relatively short day flight. Light snacks were provided about an hour or so before landing. The seats were clean & could be flattened completely to sleep; the entertaining choices, including some Japanese and Asian movies, were adequate. Overall, this was a solid business flight. Passengers flying business on this flight should note that the JAL lounge was not opened before the flight and they have to use a commercially contracted lounge. where the coffee was good but not the food.

title: Best economy flight
review_text: Japan Airlines knows how to make their customers feel valued. The plane was new and spotlessly clean. Everything worked. The seats had the the little hygienic paper things on the headrest. The pillows were decent and had cloth covers. There was more leg room than we have experienced on American flights. The flight attendants were well groomed and most respectful and accommodating. Real cloth towels were provided before meals. I did not find the food palatable but that doesn’t mean it was bad. I just don’t have a taste for Japanese food. JAL compares more favorably than AA.

title: Great Sky Suite seats, great service but disappointed with the food
review_text: This flight had the nice Sky Suite seats, I was quite relived when I saw them I was somewhat expecting the old angled seats. This was a Boeing 787-8. The service and the seat was great but the food was pretty disappointing. I ordered the Japanese menu, I guess that was a bad idea, to order the Japanese menu on a flight originating from Bangkok. I barely ate anything.

title: One of the best business class flights that I have flown
review_text:
I had a whirlwind three-week trip to Seoul, then to Jeju Island, then to Busan, back to Seoul Gimpo overnight, then from Gimpo to Haneda, Haneda back to Gimpo, then Incheon back to Honolulu.  Lots of flights, lots of time spent in airport lounges.

I have to say that the business class experience on the Japan Airlines flight from Seoul Gimpo to Tokyo Haneda was amazing. Excellent service and the food was completely edible, which is not something you can say for most flights nowadays, even in first class seats.  

I have to add that I think there was only two classes of service on this flight--business (=first) and economy.  My seat was 1G.

title: Customer First Service
review_text: The level of service with JAL is unmatched.  The attendants come around to get to know you and then address you for the remainder of the fight with respect and kindness.  The overall flight was comfortable and without issue.  Food was excellent and they give eastern and western options depending on your preference.  Overall, excellent flight and service.

title: Very polite and very good
review_text: I tried the Japanese lunch meal which was lovely. Each of the wines was served properly and care. Even the luggage came off by class which is a welcome change. A pleasure to fly

title: Wonderful!
review_text:
Had a chance to try Japan Airlines fleet last month, a codesharing system with Malaysia Airlines and it was fantastic! 
Starting from great lounge to the food and punctuality, i couldnt ask for more. 
loved the seats too, seems bigger than Air Asia or MAS.
MOML were okay and IFE seems to have a lot of latest movies too. 
its a good 7hrs flying and cant wait to be board again next time

title: Impressed
review_text: Lots of overhead space, but I think that also is because few Japanese travelers bring carry on. Food was delicious, very impressed.

title: Nice Flight from LAX (Los Angeles, CA, USA) to KIX (Osaka, Japan)
review_text: Lots of overhead space.  Agents extremely helpful, english speaking, made sure my connections to/from a USA carrier went smoothly (unlike USA agent).

title: Great service and wonderful new plane
review_text:
Love the plane. Its cozy. What i found thats lacking is that the ammenities are not enough. 

I have a sensitive skin but they dont provide any moisturizer 

But overall the food is great and the staff are wonderfull.

title: Bring snacks
review_text:
5 stars for convenience, it is nice to be able to leave from San Diego without having to go thru LAX. Service is good with helpful and gentle staff members. Enjoyed the cultural bow to passengers by the staff when arriving to the gate in Japan. Seats not as comfortable or spacious as Emirates but better than others. Good entertainment choices and movies thru the flight. Have to pay for WIFI.
My party of 3 was interested in upgrading to business class but recent upgrades to their computer systems only gave us a choice to do so at the airport. Upon checking in their systems were down so it took some time to find out how much more for the upgrade. Once price was obtained  and we were going to proceed with the upgrade we were told if we did there would not be any food for us. 5k per person and no food? The staff said they didn't have any extra available for the upgraded seats. We stayed in economy and food was just ok so I suggest for you to bring snacks or food for the long flight. Rice crackers and chocolate offered as snacks. Japanese beer, wine and drinks made up for it but we were starving by the time we arrived at our destination. On our way back we were better prepared so we loaded up on snacks and food. Overall convenience a plus, service a plus but food just ok.

title: Remembering nice flight
review_text:
Seat is excellent because spacious leg room.
Free wifi throughout the flight.
Free beverages.
Courteous flight attendants.

title: Great services!
review_text: Flight was fully booked so it took a bit long to board. In-flight entertainment was really great, one of the best I had ever experienced. Cabin crew was attentive and quick in responding to passengers. Main meal, however, was a bit awful to me, particularly the ice-cream, more ice than cream! More than 9 hours on sky and only 1 meal was served - I think it should be 2.

title: Excellent Experience on JAL
review_text: From check in, on Halloween, complete with costumed  agents, to lounge availability for Premium Economy, the experience was wonderful.  We had booked the flight in February and sometime between them and the end of September, my traveling companion and seating had changed and we were no longer sitting together on a two leg flight to Bangkok.  When boarding was about to begin,  our names were called by the gate agent.  Long story short, the agent replaced our premium economy tickets with Business Class ones.  We were close to tears, and so grateful to have the fourteen hour leg of our flights upgraded.  Our return flights weren't upgraded, but premium economy  was a very good experience too.

title: Very reliable
review_text: Have experienced almost no delays recently. Food and wines are the best amongst competing airline services between the UK and Japan.

title: They are much better than before!
review_text:
They are on time, customer service is amazing and foods are good.
Also the price was quite reasonable. 

After the bankruptcy, they really improved the quality of the service.

title: A very good carrier to fly to Asia
review_text: Flew JFK-NRT-CGK in March and i was very pleased with the whole experience. Excellent service, from check in to on-board service. Tasty food. Flights were full but planes had ample legroom, more than the average you see in economy class. Local staff at CGK were not good i am afraid, the Japanese lady there though was exceptional and went out of her way to accommodate and rebook me. Would recommend them and of course i would fly them again.

title: Sensational way to Fly!
review_text: Wasn’t sure what to expect when flying to Japan with JAL for the first time, especially with 3 kids. However it was a sensation!!! We upgraded to Premium Economy and I would highly recommend outlaying the extra... we got to access in Melbourne to the relaxing private lounge.. JAL Premium Economy give you heaps of leg room, generous seating, great quality blankets and pillows, heaps of food, a little toy for the kids and excellent service! We had a little complication with our seating, and they handled and resolved it superbly :) For someone like me that’s not a great flyer, it would have to be the best experience I’ve had in the air! Thank you JAL.

title: So Much Nicer Than United or American
review_text:
We travel a lot and usually fly United or American so we can get membership points. Our last international flight on United left us with a bad taste, as our seats were even smaller and narrower than ever before, and the "friendly skies" didn't seem as friendly as they used to be. So when we compared flights to Jakarta, we found that JAL had a direct flight and was comparable in price, and we decided to try them. 

What a breath of fresh air to fly JAL. The attendants were amazing. They were friendly and very helpful. They even put an improvised vegetarian meal together for us after they found out that we had not eaten anything because we had not ordered a veg meal on time. Not only that, but during the flight they got in touch with JAL ground crew and were able to get us a vegetarian meal for our next leg of the flight. That is real service!

The food is so much better than the stuff that the other airlines offer. And instead of plastic utensils they use real flatware.

Another thing that makes JAL stand out from the two American airlines: they keep the toilets clean in flight. When we are on an international flight on the other airlines, by the time we are half way to our destination the restroom is filthy and smells like an outhouse. In contrast, JAL's restrooms are maintained by the flight crew so they are clean throughout the flight. 

We were were very impressed that even in economy we were treated with respect and like human beings. Thank you, JAL and your wonderful flight crew!

title: Jakarta to Tokyo Narita
review_text:
One of the best airlines I have traveled on. I travel quite often to Japan and have taken Japan Airlines before and the food varies depending on whether you get a Japanese meal or a Western meal. I actually never like their Japanese meals so much. The standard of Japan Airlines is high and the service they provide is excellent. Good entertainment system and they don't just service ice cream, they serve Haagen Dazs!

Check in and departure were very easy as I am very familiar with Jakarta Airport. In fact check in was exceptional as the service was so nice.

title: Average Airline with Some Critical Flaws
review_text: Travelled overnight on both legs of the Singapore-Tokyo trip. Breakfast was unappetising, with the main hot dish consisting of only a soggy omelette egg and a sausage on the return flight and some cold side dish. One of the criticial issues I encountered was that they changed my preferred seats twice and did not notify via email about the change even though the website stated that they will inform passengers of any change. On one of the changes which was due to a change in aircraft from a 767 to a 777, they even separated passengers that had chosen to seat next to each other, something which must have been done alogrithmically by backroom staff which showed they lacked service consideration in mind. Another seat change was made by the airline about 2 weeks before the flight without warning, and they rearranged our seating again, this time supposedly due to a new reservation system which they were rolling out between November and December 2017. Had to constantly log-in to their website to frequently check that our reservation and seats were in order. Other than that, the actual flight was uneventful.

title: One of the better airlines
review_text:
if you can spring for it, prem econ is definitely the way to go. First you get to use the lounge services. Which helps you with "relaxing" a little especially before a long-haul flight. The Sakura lounge in NRT is definitely better than the one in HND. The one in NRT has showers, massage chairs and even a masseuse!! Food is also pretty good at the lounges. 

Seats inflight don't go all the way down, but at least it props up the dangling ankles. Incline is good too. Not bad for those with back problems. Food is also good. Service is always excellent. They even celebrated my birthday enroute! Thank you HK CREW!!!!!

Was upgraded to business otw back. Nothing like attentive service. and free flowing of food and drinks.  The flat seat for sleeping definitely helps.

title: Primium Economy is the way to go!
review_text:
We have been using JAL for our trips to Japan, and we always get Premium Economy. It makes such huge difference for us, with the comfort of seats and other benefits that comes with it. The seats are wider, softer, and it comes with some goodies like slippers, toothbrush, eye mask and several other items.

The food and drink options are also better, and I do think we get treated better than in regular economy. Well, the food is not excellent, but it is airplane food, they can do but so much... From my experience, I prefer their food much better than food served on other non-Japanese airlines like United or American.  

One of the greatest benefit for us is the access to Airport Lounge. I call them the oasis at the airports, and it is such a nice way relax and enjoy some complimentary food and drinks while we wait for our flight. 

One negative thing is that their website and mobile app are not user friendly. It takes so much time and effort to check in, compared to any other airlines that I flew with. The app only comes in Japanese language, and it really is completely useless if you are not using it from Japan (if you don't reside in Japan). I with if they can change their website and app design so that it is easier for us travelers to process online check in... 

Trips to Japan is a long flight, and with more comfortable seats, we can rest better, even thought the seats does NOT become a flat bed like in business or first class. It is still comfortable enough to get some sleep and rest. I would continue for fly with JAL, in Premium Economy for sure. Read my full review of their food and drink offerings on my food blog, foodlovergirl.

title: Not the best but good enough
review_text:
First time travellers on JAL. 
Travelled business class for Sydney to Narita Airport Japan. 
This is not quite in the same league as Emirates or Singapore airlines, however, the cost is less and value for money is better. 
The service is first class and the food is choice of traditional Japanese or western style. 
The seats do lie flat, but if you a big person this is not for you. 
The movie listing is somewhat limited but is updated at the beginning of each calender month. 
Overall we were happy with JAL and would definitely use them again.

title: “Good Overnight Flight”
review_text:
We flew JL 771, an overnight flight, from Narita to Sydney. The trip was very pleasant. We went Premium Economy & were able to sleep with the extra space.

The check-in process was very organised & hassle-free. The staff members were very professional & friendly.

The plane was clean & the service was excellent, the food - our last piece of Japan, was very good for airline food.
