The plane was delayed leaving Narita due to the knock-on effect of bad weather in other parts of the country, & it was Friday night. We were kept up to date with our place on the runway via announcements. The plane made up some time on the trip with the help of a tail-wind. Although we arrived only 22 minutes late, after landing, the Captain made an announcement that they were humbly sorry for the delay of 22 minutes (I love Japan, they are so respectful & considerate).

I would definitely fly JAL again.

title: Not as fantastic as I initially thought of.
review_text: The cushion seat was hard though it has better leg room. No option to choose for meal unlike SQ flight. Taking night flight departing at 0215hrs without toiletries provided such as socks and toothbrush.

title: I will Fly JAL Again
review_text:
I chose to fly JAL from Sydney to Narita as it was the most direct & quickest route. I had considered Jetstar thro’ Cairns although when I investigated it was more expensive with add-ons, less leg room, service, etc, etc – just too hard. I had flown JAL many years ago & at that time, it was nothing out of the ordinary (in the days when Qantas was exceptional).

The process to book was extremely difficult as it was during the period of the JAL major IT upgrade – I ended up using a 3rd party (for the 1st time - & probably last) to book the tkts. Having said that, I did phone JAL to sort out our seats (after the Agent had us sitting apart in different rows & then gave me the JAL ph number), after waiting 45 mins the person I spoke to was extremely helpful, sorted our seats & was very polite & patient.

The plane was clean, well-maintained, good leg room, good food, good in-flight entertainment, great service.

We usually fly SIA (have done so since Qantas went downhill) however I will look at JAL & compare for our next trip as I would fly with them again.

title: A lounge in the sky!
review_text: The trip was a delight.  The Cabin Staff were very attentive and respectful.  The seat was like a lounge at home - but better!  The food was different, but enjoyable.  The boarding and disembarkation was not rushed and the ground staff were also attentive to our needs.  It was a daytime flight, but we had time to relax and sleep before our arrival, which made the Premium Economy seat worth the extra money!

title: I was suprised
review_text: The level of service offered was excellent, the seat pitch and width offered in economy  was great  which is important for me as I am 182cm and the food is the best I've had on any airline. I will be my consider option next time I'm going to Asia or Eurpoe

title: One of the best!
review_text: Leading the way in service, flight departures and just great service.  It was JAL who informed us that we arrive Tokyo airport and depart from another otherwise we would have lost our way.  Service on board was excellent with such beautiful stewardesses.  Cleanliness is also worth mentioning.  Of course legroom with the seat ahead of you is forward is ok but when back...

title: Online, Meh! On-board, Outstanding!
review_text: Although JAL's online services are difficult to navigate and often unreliable in terms of booking your ticket, seat selection, and check-in; the flight attendants on-board are sure to impress. Although the lack of leg room is typical of most flight today, the food is plentiful and tasty. My overall impression was greatly improved after having the pleasure of being served by a most gracious and attentive on-board staff! I will certainly consider JAL again, but hope they catch-up with much needed changes to online services.

title: Good service to Asia
review_text:
I fly to Asia several times a year.  This time I was offered a round trip on JAL for the first time in years.  JAL used to be "over the top" in amenities before the realities of competition forced them to rethink their business model.  This flight was efficiency itself from boarding to in-flight services.  I flew Business Class and the design was was different than I have experienced before.  On my flight you had what might be called an individual cubical where you could raise or lower a divider between yourself and the next seat over.  This would be nice if you were traveling with a significant other, or a colleague.  The food was good as was the service.  A nice feature is that you can order from a set menu throughout the flight. The seats fold out flat, and I arrived more rested than usual. 
One thing I like is that JAL is accommodating on stopping over in Japan as part of your flight plan, something that can be difficult with other airlines, in my experience.  An added bonus is that Japan has to have among the world's best organized airports.  Getting through immigration and into town is made simple and if you get mixed up, there are people to get you to the right service.  I mean it is really quite pleasant, for a change.
If you have dietary needs. let them know well in advance.

title: On line check in and seat selection proir to flight is impossible.
review_text: My wife is AA Platinum and it was impossible to get seat assignment prior to airport check in. On line it was impossible to do it. We called JAL and was told we could check in online at midnight Tokyo time. Surprise! It was not possible. We will see what they assign us when we get to the airport tomorrow. So much for OneWorld. Stay tuned, we will update later.

title: Superb service and comfort in business class
review_text: The cabin and seat in the JAL is in my opinion better than the business class cabin and seat of BA. The service is excellent, a great choice of meals and the entertainment system is also superior. JAL offers a anytime to the seat service for meals that can be ordered using the on board electronic tablet. Slippers are provided to use on the flight. All in all I really enjoyed this flight with JAL.

title: My son is the traveler, round trip from Bangkok, Thailand
review_text: This is written more in sorrow than in anger. I was not the traveler, my son loved the flight, the flight attendants and everything about it. It is his 2nd time on JAL this year. I, however am the unfortunate one who made the reservation. The earlier trip this year making the reservation was quick and easy, nice helpful people, but about November 17th they instituted a new reservation system. Let me say I did it all on the phone and perhaps the system works better on line but it was a nightmare! The usual wait time on the phone was close to an hour, they wouldn't book the flight till they sent me a form to fill out and made sure my credit card was accepted and you didn't even know if you had a ticket or not. For the departure from Bangkok we never did get a printed confirmation and there was a problem with which day the flight left. In all my many, many years of airplane travel I have never encountered anything like it. Conclusion, great flight but not worth the trouble to make the reservation.

title: JL2502 CTS to KIX
review_text:
Highly recommended: smooth and quick check-in, punctual (very small delay, must use the word punctual except for the absolute perfectionist), good service overall except that the wi-fi on board doesn't work, at least for me.  
The provision of "bag covers" (from the white box in the foreground in photo) albeit not useful for me, is a demonstration of JAL's attitude: service improvement is a never-ending pursuit.

title: Ride designed for smaller people
review_text:
Thought I could survive economy class on the short hop from Tokyo to Shanghai.  And I did, with emphasis on the word "survive".  

The seats are small and legroom extremely limited.  The plane was packed solid.  I had a middle of the plane aisle seat and needed every relaxation tool available to avoid claustrophobia. 

The food was forgettable.  But the seat did have personalized entertainment with both Japanese and English language programming. Crew did their best, but I got the feeling that there were not enough lids to cover all of the pots.

title: Throne in the Sky
review_text: If you want to feel like a god in the sky -this Flight is for you.  Even my shoes got their own charriot.    As expected , flying First comes with royal class treatment.  This flight has attention to details.  Not just the wide size of seat and but ability to stretch out -was very roomy.  Flight came with a five course meal and kitchen was open anytime up till 30 minutes before landing.  It’s top of the line treatment and best way to fly long international flights. See pictures.. Highly recommend it!!

title: I'd never even considered...
review_text:
...that we could move to London via Narita flying Japan Airlines.

It was only by accident that we came across JAL as an option when we were looking to fly another airline to try and use our points, and after arguing with other this other airline over something that should've been simple we decided to keep searching (thanks for the push!). 

Having seen that it was a reasonable price for 2 of us to be able to fly business class via Narita we thought we might give it a whirl. 

Admittedly we were moving overseas and the selling point (apart from the other good reviews) was the offer of a luggage allowance of 3 x 32 kilo suitcases - each.

Figuring that all of our belongings could squeeze in to 192kgs we took the plunge and booked it.

I have to say we made the right decision.

Whilst the lounge at MEL was a little boring we still had access to the Qantas lounge so parked ourselves there for a short while. The lounge in NRT on the other hand was amazing and we took advantage of it whilst we waited for our next and final flight (different airline unfortunately).

On boarding the flight we were greeted by the staff and took our seats. Moments later we picked our breakfast choice and were given the option of a polite prod to wake us up gently when it was being served.

I wish I'd taken photos of the food because presentation was excellent. The service was great and they have the only lie flat seat - that I know of - that I could stretch out on, and I'm almost 6'3".

The only thing I thought missing was a high armrest but it wasn't really needed.

All 6 of our very heavy suitcases arrived in perfect condition. We don't think that they were dropped or thrown either because there weren't any evident scuffs or bumps so I'd say they care there too.

All in all we thoroughly enjoyed the flight and can't wait to fly them again.

title: Flying Experience with JAL
review_text: Flying with JAL was the most comfortable, hospitable and feeling home with the service they provide. I love this airline and will definitely fky them again on my next trip to Asia.

title: Comfortable flight with JAL
review_text:
The only downsize was the high temperature on the flight, we didn't even use the blanket. It was too much on Paris-Tokyo but ok for the return.
Otherwise, the food is really good and the legroom is better than other company.

I would have liked to see some japanese drama but no subtitles :/ no roblem with the movies and a good choice.

title: great Business trip with JAL
review_text:
i went to Tokyo for short business trip at end ocober 2017, we go to japan total 4 people , we bought the ticket return , we go there for visiting tokyo motor show 2017
it's a nice journey with JAL, leg room is spacious, the food and beverages are very delicious and the staff is very nice and helpfull ...really enjoy , and hopely can fly again with JAL

title: Great flight. Very friendly staff. Plane was in fantastic condition
review_text:
The entire experience with JAL and their staff was fantastic. Friendly, attentive and the Dreamliner was an amazing plane to fly on.

No shortage of entertainment and economy felt roomy, not sure if that's the staggered seating the Dreamliner has but at the end of the flight we got off the plane and felt fine.

title: First Time Customers
review_text: First time travelling international with a very hyperactive 3 year old boy. Check-in was fast (make sure that you do the web check-in and print your boarding pass or have it readily in your smartphone or tablet). Plane itself is okay, enough leg room for us ( we are mid-size Filipinos). Food is great for both my husband and I but not so for our 3 year old. Tip for those who have very picky toddlers bring your own food, like for us we bought Popeye's and brought it with us in the plane. totally worth the carry-on. Then the same thing from Manila to the US,(Jollibee). Entertainment was awesome. Lots of new movies.  The only thing that I can suggest is maybe more english speakers for the flight attendants. Other than that Overall we enjoyed flying with JAL and will fly again with them.

title: We love JAL!  (ANA too!)
review_text: We always fly JAL when we can, equally avoiding U.S. legacy carriers on international flights when we can.  The biggest reason?  The Sakura lounge at NRT, which has the best curry and dumplings anywhere.  Effectively a pre-flight dinner fit for royalty.  Delicious and fabulous!  And what do they serve at AA's NRT lounge?  Peanuts.  That's right, peanuts!

title: Typical Japanese: Efficient, excellent service
review_text: Fast, efficient check in at the counters: from Manila to Narita then from Narita to New Chitose and vice versa. Competent, very cordial staff. Comfortable seats- and I'm in economy! Great flight attendants, and good food!

title: Calm and efficient service equals calm travellers.
review_text:
Thee attendants were very polite, always smiling and very efficient. Even when we went through severe turbulence, their demeanour meant that all of the passengers were calm and nobody seemed to be panicked. They also looked after my friend who has MS very well, escorting him to the toilet and back to his seat with no fuss.

Also - better legroom than BA flights on matching aircraft!

The food was also great ;-)

title: safe and clean
review_text: a business-class in the normal range, not espescially good, but neither bad. Friendly service, nothing special at all!

title: My Number One airline.
review_text:
I have flown many times with JAL. I have never been disappointed. From check-in to arrival and through baggage claim, the staff are attentive, helpful and courteous.
I have been in economy, premium economy and business class. The staff are always the same no matter which class I traveled. 
There were many little extras, such as the provision of toiletries, eye masks, ear plugs, etc. The toilet areas are cleaned regularly. 
There is a choice of either Japanese or Western food- all beautifully presented and delicious.
There is added comfort in the seating with the provision of a pillow and blanket for economy and premium economy. Business class has  semi private 'pod' with fully reclining seat and large pillow and blanket. Loose fitting jacket and trousers for sleeping are available. It also has a larger TV screen.
When traveling business or first class, the QANTAS lounge was available in Sydney and JAL lounge in Tokyo.

title: Small improvement to become a  5-star international airline
review_text:
One arrival to NRT, went to business class check in counter. The counter was not busy and plenty of counter available. I tried to go the counter directly, but stopped a female ground crew. She seemed to be checking the air ticket of a pair customers. She just told me to line up in an unfriendly manner. When I return to line up at the back. Then I saw a man spoke with another male crew in Japanese without any checking procedure and directly went to check in. Then I told the male crew about my destination and flying class. He allowed me to go the check in counter. I felt frustrated and disappointed about the airline for unequal treatment for customers. It seems that JAL to become a 5-star airline should consider the issue. 
Generally, all other crews were polite and professional. the flight was operated by Boeing 787-8.The JAL sky suite was contemporary, spacious, state-of-the-art controller and a large TV mon. The entertainment program with plenty of international selections. The food and beverage was good as well, thought they did not served in separate courses. You can be selected wide variety of beverage, including choices of Sake. All FA were polite and professional.

title: Great Flight
review_text: Most comfortable return flight we have experienced from Europe. Access to Air France lounge and showers at CDG and similar access at Narita to JAL lounge. The clincher was that all sectors were in Boeing Dreamliners - excellent pressurisation meant you arrived almost feeling refreshed. Only minor gripe was that movies were well past use by date. Will certainly fly with JAL again.

title: Very spacious economy class seats
review_text:
JAL recently introduced new type of economy class seats. I wasn’t aware that JL29 was equipped with the new seats. I was prepared to endure 4 hours flight. (I am 185cm tall) As soon as I took a seat I realised a difference. I could cross my legs comfortably. This new seats worth extra cost if you are taking long haul. 
Also foods are good as always. Punctuality is second to none.

title: Excellent Service
review_text: The crew members were really helpful. As we was travelling with young children got opportunity to board first. It was  so relaxing. Our kids enjoyed on board service a they got choose the orders.

title: Comfortable ride
review_text: Direct flight very comfortable service good entertainment good food enjoyable. I would recommend if looking for direct flight to Japan

title: Flying economy on JAL is like flying business class on American.
review_text: JAL now has a flight from Tokyo to San Diego using a 787 Dreamliner. This flight often has rewards miles seats available. The service on JAL is one of the best in the world.  They constantly clean the lavatories, the food is good, snacks and drinks are always available and the legroom in economy is almost as good as business class on other airlines.

title: One of the Best!
review_text: Great Flight and great airline! The space between my row and the front one was very big! Very nice entertainment, food and cabin crew.

title: Flight from a Tokyo Narita International Airport to Kuala Lumpur
review_text: I am impressed with the ground check in service of JAL. The service personnel stands behind their counter and they would come out all the way to your queue point to usher your as their guest. The lady is very polite and organized by reaffirming with you number of luggages and other checked in items. They would opened up more counters if there is long queue. All in all we are being served within ten to fifteen minutes. The security and immigration check point was also seamless.

title: The airline office in Manila was very helpful
review_text: They were very helpful with wheelchair assistance when changing airlines in Tokyo to their codeshare partner American Airlines. In general it was a good experience.

title: AWESOME AND GREAT SERVICES
review_text: Top notch services and comfortable seats, The best flight attendants ever on the thousand of flight i have flown.

title: Japan airlines, good service
review_text: We are frequent travellers all over the world and found Japan airlines, which we flew for the first time, very comfortable. Very good service and especially the food. Japan airlines has invited 6 finalists of the Red Chef's competition to develop good cuisine for the economy class and some dishes by two of those we could enjoy on this flight. Flight food does mostly not taste too much, but this was delicious. The time schedule was well kept.

title: quite good flight
review_text:
CA's Omotenashi was so good, but dishes were not so good.
The equipment in the airplane was nice.
The flight time was punctual.
I felt good totally.

title: Easy flight but domestic terminal is closed on arrival
review_text: Easy flight but pre-book some accommodation for arrival as this flight arrives when the Melbourne domestic terminal is closed.

title: Clean and Pieceful
review_text:
As Always, JAL offers me feeling as if I was in my home. Full of smile in cabin, and felt warm hospitability all the time.
I took JAL's Code Share flight operated by American. It was not so happy, for example, meal servisse was something as if they feed for animals.

title: Great experience
review_text: What a great experience.  The service was fantastic and it started from the check in desk all the way to the lounge in Tokyo for the connecting flight.  The midnight departure from Melbourne means a good sleep on the plane and waking up on approach to Tokyo (hopefully)  The food was fantastic both Japanese and western menus. I was so impressed I joined the frequent flyer program, I will fly with them again for sure.  There is something about the Japanese service, just first class no matter where you are sitting.  The Dreamliner was great, the plane was clean and the seats were fantastic in premium economy, well worth the extra cost as it also includes lounge access.

title: Impressive services
review_text: Excellent services from checking in, boarding at gate and enjoying a pleasant flight. The Sakura Lounge is also great. It offers a wide variety of food, pastry and beverages (alcohol and non-alcohol). I'm impressed. The flight itself is good. Cabin crew are very friendly, courteous, helpful and really pay attention to passenger's requests. The seat is private and comfortable though I wish it could be a real 180 degree reclining seat. But that's ok. It has a decent amount of leg room. In-flight entertainment is worth also mentioning. They are superbly categorised and well organised. You can't get bored while flying. The headphones are decent, with noise cancelling alternative. The cabin is on par with typical Japanese standards: super clean and well maintained. The food on this flight is awesome, given the late night departure. I love the way the airline communicate with passengers about the meal options. Cabin crew would ask you to choose your breakfast (Japanese or Western style) or you could write it down in a form they provided. If you follow this option, they would politely wake you up (when it's time) and serve you the meal of your choice. To sum it up, I'm impressed by services provided by Japan Airlines. I have few things to complain about. What's not to love?

title: Brilliant flight
review_text: The thing I liked most about JAL is the extra space you get in economy. Wider seats and more legroom than any other economy seat I have been on. The crew were so very friendly and attentive and were still smiling at the end of a 10 hour flight. The plane was modern and spotless clean. Great range of movies and entertainment on a large touch screen. Only thing I was not keen on was the food but that was probably just a personal taste thing. Totally recommend JAL.

title: our first flight in the Boeing Dreamliner
review_text: Hadn't flown JAL for many years so it was interesting to reacquaint myself with this airline. It was also our first flight on the Boeing Dreamliner that JAL had in service for a number of years. We weren't quite sure about Economy Class but needn't have worried as there was plenty of leg room and even though we were against a bulkhead we could recline comfortably. The service was very good and the food I thought the best I had been served in Economy in quite some time. Overall a very good and comfortable experience I would recommend to anyone.

title: Cost Cutting Will Not Solve The Problem
review_text: The US flights from and to Narita have been to a high standard until the latest flight from San Diego to Narita. They have reverted to a lower cost amenities pack and reduced significantly the food quality in Business.This is clearly driven by cost reduction but they missed the real opportunity to streamline  their boarding and check-in with contract rather than JAL staff ( A total of ten is excessive to board an aircraft and only one flight a day..Business Class should be lucrative but cutting costs will turn people away.

title: First flight to Nagoya from Yamagata
review_text: It is a nice trip from Yamagata to Nagoya and vice versa. I could enjoy the trip and the beautiful scenery viewed through the window of the airplane. Cabin attendants behavior is also comfortable for me. The crew's technical average is in high standard and well acceptable. You could choose this airlines with safety and relaxation.

title: Great experience with JAL.
review_text: As expected, Japanese always have high standard of service. It is very comfortable and food are great!

title: Excellent Value.
review_text: The economy seats were excellent value for the money. The difference between economy and premium is not worth the extra money. Leg room was ample, entertainment good, the food (vegetarian), absolutely terrible, but you can't have everything. The service was very good and we left and arrived on time in both directions. The route is provided by a Boeing 787 which is quiet and comfortable. The experience was so good we have booked to go again in April 2018 with JAL.

title: Trip to Sapporo
review_text: Excellent flight.  On time as you can expect from the Japanese.  Efficient and friendly service. Would love to travel more with JAL to Japan from KL but they dont have direct flight unfortunately!!!

title: JL745
review_text: I was on board flight JL745 last November 8. It was a good flight. The seat i was in was comfy enough. The entertainment was upto date and recent movies were in the selection. The food and the service was totally good.

title: Comfortable seats and Smiling stewardesses
review_text: The seats were very comfortable with more than enough leg room. The stewardesses always greet you with a smile while attending to your needs. Pleasantly surprised by the service and the comfort. These are the two things that stands out for me. Will try to fly JAL if I fly to Japan again.

title: A premium service!
review_text:
Was offered the chance to upgrade the Sydney-Narita leg of the outbound trip for $350.
Well worth the expense. The premium economy seats are like business class seats of a few years ago and are extremely comfortable. Enhanced IFE (leather sound noise cancelling headphones) and more food choices made the leg excellent. For just under 10 hours the extra expense was worth it.

title: good flight as usual
review_text: It was a short flight, as short as 40 minutes, but flight attendants are always helpful and nice to us.

title: B787-8 Business Class
review_text:
The Service was very nice. however the business class space is not for the big tall guy.
Others were very nice, the lavatory is super clean, no funny smell at all.

title: Great service
review_text: Great airline with great service, good seating , good food, good service and I have had 4 return flights and always consistent

title: JAL is one of the best Airline
review_text: Japan Airlines is one of the best Airlines in terms of services. Crew were polite and very approachable. Seats were comfortable and have good legroom space. Food was also good for brunch and much more for dinner, the RED U-35 which were collaborated with 6 young chef finalists. In-flight movies were up to date too. We had smooth flight and JAL is on-time.

title: Premium Economy
review_text: I usually fly business class any time the flight is over 8 hours, and so I was a bit disappointed that the convention provide me with Premium Economy, and was I surprised! The seats were comfortable and came with a foot rest, the food was quite nice and the service excellent.

title: Fanstastic Service
review_text: While I haven't flown Japan Airlines in years, the flight times for a meeting in Tokyo offered the opportunity to fly with JAL.  For a late night-time / early morning (2:00 am) flight, the service was remarkable.  The incredibly, polite staff made certain everyone felt comfortable. I was impressed with the service both on and off the plane.  I would highly recommend JAL and plan to use again for another meeting next year.

title: Review of return flight to Tokyo via JAL
review_text: The seats were comfortable and floor space was generous, 2 seats only beside window. The service was extremely friendly. However,  the Flight Attendant did not speak English either flight. As my seat was last row, the back of seat could not recline. On return to Sydney, I noted a passenger's seat moved forward and back automatically reclined. Bathrooms very clean. My vegan-vegetarian food option fine. I would fly JAL again but fly economy as I noted they had very generous leg room and the functionality of the seats was the same as Premium Economy. I flew October 2016 just over a year ago.

title: Excellent Service. Reasonable food.
review_text: 2-4-2 seat configuration with decent seats with good recline. Comfortable for a 4-5 hour flight with a snooze. Good media programmes and decent sized screen. Very good headphones. Reasonable food (same a starter economy) with excellent service. On time.

title: My perception on JAL was totally changed
review_text: I used to have a feeling that the service at JAL is square and rather cold, while it is true that they are sufficiently polite. However, the group of CAs this time was suitably casual and I could enjoy my flight back to Tokyo in a cozy atmosphere.  The age/experience mix of the staff was also appropriate, I saw.

title: Experience Japanese Culture From JAL
review_text:
First time flying with Japan Airline, My husband and I can feel beautiful Japanese culture. We chose round-trip business class flight  Bangkok - Kansai Airport. 

After checking-in at Suvarnabhumi Airport, we got a premium lane to go thrugh security checked and immigration formality. We had visited Miracle Lounge and Sakura Lounge. There were lots of foods and drinks, staffs were helpful and polite. I think it's a japanese standard that I heard before.

The really touching japanese culture, it was happened after boarding. Cabin crews were very polite, nice, smily and excellent service. I tried japanese alcoholic drinking (I didn't remember the name) and japanese breakfast. That's great!! I'm very impressive.

The Boeing 787-Dreamliner business class seat was angle-flat seat , so sometimes I slided down. 

For Sakura Lounge at Kansai Airport, it had relaxing, quiet zone. But less choices of food. No toilets in lounge area, we had to use toilets in gate area instead (I think it was under renovated).

title: Premium economy review
review_text: Having flown premium economy with a number of airlines I would have to say that the JAL flights have in all respects been the best to date . Priority check in , use of the business class lounge , service and comefort were excellent . Rather than those tilt back seats The aircrafts seats moved  forward and back within its ridgid shell. An excellent feature . The whole experience was fairly close to the old style business class . I just booked my next long haul flight with them

title: Business Trip to Japan
review_text: recently flew with JAL on a business trip to Japan. The service the airline offers is really high quality. good food selection between Japanese or Western Meals. Flight attendants are very quick to respond to your requirements be it a drink or snack.

title: Nice and Great
review_text:
Nice and Great flying with JAL
seat distance not so close (legroom) 
food combination nice
and flight attendants helpful

title: Upgrade!!
review_text: We received an upgrade on the flight to Tokyo which was a great surprise! The service was very very good. The return flight was Premium economy - not as good as business class of course, but still pretty darn good! First time flying with JAL - no complaints at all

title: My First time Experince with JAL
review_text:
This is my first time flying with JAL and it is a great experince.
The service is very good, they are very friendly and helpful.
The food is good but We just have one choice of meal.
i will fly again with JAL someday.

title: Courteous, considerate
review_text: Since filing for bankruptcy and recovering, I think this airline has done a great job of improving customer satisfaction by providing the first-rate service. Their crew is excellent, friendly and efficient. Their flights are mostly on time. I do hope they keep up their effort even after the memories of hard times fade.

title: Comfortable ride
review_text: It was a night flight. Staff was attentive and kept walking the aisle to check on the passengers. Food was japanese and ok for me.

title: Japanese hospitality "OMOTENASHI"
review_text: We enjoyed our trip and felt no stress over the travel around eight hours from HONOLULU to NARITA. We got the rest in cozy JAL rounge and enjoyed Japanese foods and beer. When got in the cabin, leg space was wide enough where we enjoyed the video entertainments and good sleep for eight hours flight.

title: Business class is not so businessy
review_text:
I used miles to upgrade to business class because I had two long haul flights from San Francisco to Bangkok.
While the seating area was roomy it did not compare to other business class flights. The food was good, but trying to sleep was a chore. The seat wasn't comfortable and I couldn't get in a proper position even though the seat reclined. My initial flight from San Francisco was much better, but also lacking. Especially the airline lounge!
I flew Korean Air on the return and it was a much nicer event.

title: Slight disappointment
review_text:
On my way back from a trip of south east Asia I flew back from Tokyo to Dallas in coach. I chose to fly on Japan Airlines instead of AA ( both have a non stop flights on that route) picked Japan because of two reasons, they fly a 787 instead of a 777. The other reason was my expectations of a much better food experience. I was terribly disappointed by the food and the whole meal service. Neither the Asian food selection or the western food offered were desirable AT ALL,this also applied to the beverages offered. I did not eat anything they offered I ate anything over the 11 hour flight except what I had in my backpack ( this reminded me the lack of any food on the US domestic airlines) 
If it was not for the airplane I would have give JL an even lower rating. Very disappointed

title: Standard Japanese Airline
review_text:
The staff at checkin was very friendly.  The staff was almost ready to let passengers to board the airplane, the announcement came out that the flight was delayed due to air control at Shanghai Pudong Airport. Very quickly, staff arranged food voucher for passengers to buy food from designated shops / restaurants for lunch. 

After 3 hours delay, the flight was okay, nothing special. I fell asleep as soon as I sat in my seat. When I woke up, I saw a note in front of me explaining food has been served, and they did not want to disturb me.  This was appreciated, comparing with some other airlines. 

Maybe because it is economy class, I felt the choice of entertainment, especially TV drama series are limited.

title: Really good service
review_text: It was my first time flying JAL. I heard good things about JAL and was expecting the high quality service. My expectations were met: the crew and staff were very courteous and helpful. I had to transfer in Tokyo and I mentioned that to a staff at the counter in NYC. When I landed in Tokyo, an airport staff was waiting for me to help me with the transfer (I had to go through customs, get my luggage and then re-register for a domestic flight-all within 1 hour). The food was nice and seats comfortable. I saw the crew leaving notes for passengers, who were sleeping during the food service, in case they want to eat later. A practice apparently common for JAL and ANA, but something I've never seen on any other airlines (in US, Britain, Spain, France). Considering that flight from NY is 14 hours the comfort of seats and service were very important.  Overall, recommend.

title: Great expierence flying with JAL
review_text: The service on Japan airline makes you feel so warm and comfortable, that in the future, I would like to use JAL as often as possible.

title: Great flights, services, value, and schedule
review_text:
We travel to Indonesia for a couple of months every year. We started with JAL several years ago. They are terrific right up there with Cathay and Singapore Airlines. The flight time from Boston to Tokyo(the first segment) is 13 hours
 They use 787's which are terrific air planes. They comfortable from front to back
 Way more leg room in coach then any other airline we have flown( Emirates, United, Singapore, Cathay, American, Southwest, Garuda Indonesia, Lion Air) . From Tokyo to Jakarta is about 7 hours.the food great along with the service by the cabin crew and their attention to detail and to peoples' needs. They are and have been consistently less, money wise, than the other comparable carriers; from several hundred to sometimes near a thousand less. We have booked them them the last three trip to Indonesia, all very good and on time. They are worth a look!

title: Airline of choice
review_text:
excellent in flight services
departure n arrival on time
checkin counter very efficient
seat was very comfortable

title: JAL lay-flat business class and endless Japanese food
review_text: Admittedly we used American Airlines points for this trip and are we ever glad we did!  We got first class domestic seats and JAL business lay-flat seats internationally (no first class on JAL flights) so we got to use JAL's excellent hospitality lounges in Dallas, Tokyo, Osaka (our departure airport) and Los Angeles.  Best onboard service I've experience in 40 years of airline travel.  Very gracious flight attendants, 21" TVs and unlimited Japanese cuisine during the flight ordered "online" from our seats.  Everything was on time with gracious presentation on the ground and in the air.  The only way to travel!  I highly recommend using JAL whenever you can and especially the lay-flat seats/beds.

title: Puts American Carriers to Shame
review_text:
Just returned from BKK flying JAL. Both the outbound flights were a 777-300 (JFK-Tokyo) and a 787 (Tokyo to BKK). The 777 was older and showed wear. However, I had a window sky suite seat which was very private (with the divider up) and the 787 was much newer without the privacy, but still lay flat seats. 

It is the service on JAL that was impeccable. Both flights were on time with boarding done in an orderly fashion and included bowing from the gate agents as we entered the jetway. The politeness and eye contact of every employee was impressive. 

The prepared meals were good. Although a bit too sophisticated for my tastes, with a salmon salad and amuse bouche. But the quality of the steak and flavor of the sauces was superior. There was also an anytime menu with a few options. 

The seats are comfortable and the in-flight entertainment system had plenty of options. The lavatories while small, contained mouthwash and toothbrush/toothpaste (get them while they last). All business class passengers, receive an amenity kit which was adequate but not stellar, slippers and wireless headphones. 

Apparently, there were mattresses that could be placed on seats to make them feel like beds in the overhead bins. However, I was not aware of them until my return flight. 

All in all. This is a great product and what distinguishes it is the service and attentiveness of the staff. The price of the ticket was lower than the carriers I priced (Cathay, Qatar) and I liked the connection through Tokyo. How many times have you seen ground staff line up and bow toward the aircraft during pushback???

title: Wonderful Japanese Airline
review_text: Just a nice airline who keeps their aircraft spotless.  Typically polite Japanese crew. Wonderful legroom. Food good and even "entertainment" screens!  Even at the airport they couldn't do enough to help.  What a shame about comparing them to Qantas which we flew from Singapore to Perth in - there was nothing to compare the first half to the second.  Qantas - suggest you send some of your board members and crew to experience a legacy airline who "does it right".  You don't need to squeeze folk into your seats.  You don't need to "throw" a cardboard box at your paying customers.  I didn't even experience that on US airlines - truly an Australian "tradition" food in takeaway containers.    Well done JAL!  I'll fly you again happily.

title: TOKYO VACATION
review_text: Non stop service on Boeing 787. Very comfortable even when flying economy. Absolutely the best way to fly from San Diego to Narita

title: Why so warm, dudes?
review_text:
JAL - not a bad experience except - its WARM on the flight.  why don't they shoot in some outside air or whatever it is they do to cool the interior.  Not the first flight with them so its not an outlier - prior flights were warm also.  I guess its better than having to wrap up head to toe but...So, to get some fresh air midway through the flight, I went to the bathroom and at least the vent in there is blowing out some air.  Also the flight crew station area seemed to provide a little relief.  
I guess the one good thing was we flew way up - passed Midway, which was pretty cool to see. Also flew right by Mt. Fuji - As close as one can get, i guess.  That was a pretty awesome sight to see.  
Check in at HNL a little long but that's almost everywhere.  Other than that, it was ok.  Just cool the jets !

title: A great flight with very nice staff members
review_text: This was one of the smoothest and most comfortable flights I flew between Japan and Chicago. My flight from Chubu International Airport to Narita was cancelled in the morning. Luckily, I was at the airport before 7 am for my 8:15 am JAL flight to Narita. The ground staff switched me to an ANA flight, and I could board JL 10 for Chicago right on time. The flight attendants were all very nice and attentive. They have class (elegance) and good manners as well as respect for their passengers, who keep them employed. I enjoyed both the dinner and breakfast, which was Gyudon made by Yoshinoya!! The Gyudon was quite a surprise, and it tasted really good in the cabin where the air is circulated and very dry.   A cabin attendance came to my seat, and she apologized about the cancellation of my flight from Chubu to Narita earlier that day. She said she wanted to make sure that everything else went fine with my transfer at Narita. It was very nice of her to do that. I enjoyed watching a few movies and listening to music on board. Overall, I enjoyed flying with Japan Airlines again.

title: excellent service on the ground and in the air
review_text: Both on the ground and in the air, JAL service was excellent. Check in both on the LA side and the Osaka side was brief and efficient. I was not able to check on line for the return part of the trip due to computer software conversion in the US. The check in at KIX went very smoothly. The staff were uniformly friendly and helpful. The lounge access at LAX was also very good. The seat is not quite as tony as the Dreamliner but was comfortable both sitting and flat. The quality of food available both western and Japanese was very good for an airline. Coming back on 11/16 there was a special wine, the just released Beaujolais Nouveau. I very much like the dimming mechanism of the windows.

title: Extremely impressed with JAL's service!
review_text: This was my first time flying in probably about 20 years. I'm glad I picked JAL to fly with. The flight attendants were all very pleasant and helpful, and the flight itself was comfortable for such a long flight. The legroom was far better than I had hoped for, and the food was always good! JAL feeds you often, too, which I wasn't expecting. So for anyone contemplating flying with them, know you'll be in good hands.

title: Excellent Flight and Service!
review_text: This was our first international flight experience with JAL and was based on the best Business Class fare for the period that my wife and I were going to Japan on business and pleasure. It turned out to be one of best business class international flight experiences in the past 8-10 years. Flight was on time, seating was very comfortable and folded flat for sleeping, attendants were great, and food and drink service was excellent. We returned on JAL with the same results. Will definitively strongly consider them for our next flight to Asia.

title: What American airlines should be.
review_text:
The flight is non-stop from Narita to San Diego.  Service is quite good, food given that it is on a airplane is quite good.  Food service in addition to regular meals is available most of the flight.  Seats almost but not quite fully recline.

I recognize this is not the cheapest way to fly but for Pete's sake why can't American airlines figure out that some people will pay for more than being shoved into an aluminium tube like sausage into a casing.  U.S. airlines feature only the lowest common denominator of service, JAL still does it right

title: Awesome Airlines
review_text: We used this airline for our trip to and from Vietnam. We flew on American Airlines until we changed planes in Dallas/Fort Worth. It was all arranged thru Japan Airlines. Japan Airlines treated us as first class passengers. Their flights were always on time. Every employee was very polite. We really appreciated the free toothbrushes and warm towelettes. We will always use this airline whenever we can.

title: Should have been more comfortable
review_text: Service was exceptional from check-in, boarding, and during the long flight.  The meals, Western or Japanese, were good and food and drink was available during the entire flight.  We were disappointed that the Business Class seats had absolutely no more privacy than the Economy section; there was no separation between seats or the rest of the cabin.  The seats didn't recline flat and made it more difficult to sleep.  The recliner position caused me to constantly slide forward as the seat material was slick.  The headphones provided were not noise-cancelling, or provided very little, as it was difficult to clearly hear movie entertainment.  Also, cabin announcements could not be understood at all due to the engine noise.  In hindsight, we should have saved a lot of money and flown Economy.

title: Warm, friendly and polite services
review_text: Flew Japan airline from Chicago to Tokyo, and Osaka to Los Angeles November 19 and 29th. We were very impressed by the fight captain ‘s skill that made flights very smooth. The crew were very courteous and helpful, especially the flight from Chicago to Tokyo, the meal were very good, making note of the passengers who slept through the meal, and making sure bring food later when they wake up. Definitely will fly the air line again in near future!

title: Awesome Flight
review_text: Great flight, awesome service, flight Attendants are very attentive to the passengers needs. I have flown other airlines and none have been as good as JAL airlines, I would highly recommend this airline to anyone traveling to Narita, Japan.

title: Great Service - comfortable seats
review_text:
The best thing about JAL is the service. First of all, unlike a lot of other airlines, they really take the spirit of honoring OneWorld status (I have status on American).

Check in was easy and we were able to get our seats changed to sit together. The flight was comfortable with decent food (never expect “great” food in economy on any airline)  and a lot of good entertainment options in terms of a movie selection.

What really set these guys apart was, on the way back, I didn’t realize that I needed an eTA (electronic travel authorization) to fly back into Canada - it’s a $7 form that you fill out that normally gets approved within 72 hours (note - non US passport holders now need this while flying to Canada)

The staff at JAL went into a helpful overdrive, showing me how to get to the website and apply and then bringing chairs etc for us to wait while it got approved (and the supervisor came in and called some special number that airlines have to contact Canadian immigration to accelerate the approval). 

This is the most polite and helpful ground staff and flight staff I have ever seen across any airline. Definitely added them as an option for me anytime I fly to Asia. Heads and shoulders above the service you get on any domestic North American airline!

title: great airline
review_text: Japan airlines takes care of its passengers from check in to landing. In the chaotic LAX with many rude airport staff, Japan airlines made sure the check in process in quick, painless, organized due to their own staff organizing the process. In KIX, we are able to check in our luggage several hours before flight time and spend the rest of the time further exploring and shopping in the airport. The food is much better than other airlines and their flight attendants are much more professional.

title: Wonderful experience
review_text:
We flew from Fukuoka airport to Yakushima Island for our 1 week hiking trip. The counter staff was very nice and helpful in checking us in. The exceptional thing was only after we landed in Yakushima, collected our luggage did we find a nice note clipped to our luggage tag. See picture attached. 

Exceptional experience with a nice warm and friendly touch.

title: Flew business class. Wonderful experience. Best food and wine and comfortable
review_text: Our second business class flight with this airline and they do an excellent job. If we are flying overseas, we do not take any US airlines as their service has been deplorable in comparison.

title: The finest business class experience.
review_text:
Superb service, extremely polite staff,good food. By far, the level of service was the finest
we have ever experienced.

title: True Hospitality
review_text: Japan Airlines’ flight from Bangkok to Tokyo on their Dreamliner was one of the best economy flights I have ever been on. Everyone on board truly took care of you with such grace and kindness. The plane was beautiful and comfortable, and the food was very good! I loved the Teriyaki Burger for breakfast, very yummy. I was definitely taken care of on this route. Thanks!

title: Great Service
review_text: The seating was very comfortable, the service was great, and the selection of entertainment was good.

title: Great Business Class service
review_text: Japan Airlines is the best, they cater to your every need.  The food is excellent and abundant.  The only thing was the seat on this flight; it reclined to a flat position while it tilted down so much you would slide down the seat.  Very uncomfortable, I just put my seat up and curled and a slept upright.

title: Business class does not ccome up to expectations
review_text: JAL have a partnership with Delta airlines and I booked on this airline since they booked my luggage all the way to Austin however food and comfort level did not come up to expectations. Menu had limited choice of warm food.

title: Fabulous (for coach)
review_text: I actually loved the experience of flying.  This was my first experience with JAL and it was comfortable and enjoyable.  The crew was, as expected, excellent and attentive.  The airplane was new, clean and comfortable (the kind with electronic shading of windows--important on a 12-hour flight), video equipment was easy to use and informative, particularly the flight information and mapping.  Food was fine, and extra snacks were available and abundant.  Legroom was fine for the class of seat.  If I go to Japan again (this was my 9th trip) I will definitely seek out JAL availability.

title: Awesome service!
review_text: As expected, service was outstanding!!!  Very courteous, professional flight attendants; always catering to every need of its passengers!  Comfortable seats, good in-flight meal, very clean cabin!!!

title: Best Service
review_text: JAL is obviously one of the best airline on the world. The service is totally satisfied both in check in and boarding. And they always took care each of passengers. Best flight I've had.

title: Where's the Sushi?
review_text: We were excited about our flight to Japan with JAL as we recall the wonderful experience some years ago:  best service, food (meals and snacks), refreshments...just the whole experience.  What a disappointment when we were served t.v. dinner like meals both flights going and returning home.  Both meals were western type meals, the first being a tomato based pork dish served with rice, veggie salad, yogurt, etc.  It was not appetizing.  Red and white wines were good, beer and sake too, but not like how I remembered with a refreshment service cart being strolled down the aisle.  Return trip meal was a hamburger w/egg, rice, etc.  I took a tiny bite of the hamburger...yahk, salad was just lettuce with tiny slivers of bell peppers, yogurt was warm, but I enjoyed the sweet roll.  After dinner snack was good, cupcake with nuts, water in a nice pouch.

title: JAL 777 Sky Suite Window
review_text: Wow. Very comfortable product. The window seat is the best option with JAL business class Sky Suites. I sat in 12 A. It was at the back of business class with 3 windows. I used the premium economy bathroom for convenience. It was clean and just a little smaller than business but only feet away. The only caveat about a window seat is that if you are a larger person, the little alley to get to your seat is quite narrow. That is the only negative I have to say about this airline product. The service was impeccable. The food delicious. The seat/bed was wide, long and comfortable. The TV huge. The partition screen moved up completely and provided me total privacy. JAL has the superior product across the Pacific in business class.

title: Amazing Customer Service
review_text: They are really nice and amazing hospitality! They really want you to feel as comfortable as possible. Best flight I’ve had.

title: Comfortable flight with complemtary food and drinks
review_text:
Short flight from Seoul (ICN) to Tokyo (NRT). The staffs were nice and polite. 
The plane has good legs room. There was inflight complimentary food and drinks.

title: Flight from Osaka to Tokyo
review_text: My wife and I took the domestic flight from Osaka (Itami airport) to Tokyo (Haneda airport). We booked and paid a few months in advance to get cheaper air fares. It was cheaper and faster to fly than to catch the train. The flight was full, which meant that plenty of other passengers thought the same.

title: Business Class - Shell Flat Neo (Seats) - Big Disappointment
review_text:
Flying Business Class across the Pacific Ocean is a big deal to myself as it doesn't happen often.  I had booked my flight from LAX to Osaka with business class and unfortunately I had done all my research assuming that JAL had the same kind of seat in their LAX to Osaka run as LAX to Tokyo (Sky Suites). Definitely not the case. Which had me somewhat wishing I had just booked LAX to Tokyo.  

The Shell Flat Neo seats DO NOT LAY flat, they are at a downward angle so you slowly slide out of your seat and it just feels odd.  The Shell Flat Neo seats are also not as comfortable as the Sky Suites on lots of other JAL flights.  You also will not have as much privacy with Shell Flat Neo seats as they are much more open.

I had a middle seat which in this case unless you know the person next to you is better than a window seat. Simply because if the person is sleeping or relaxing in the aisle seat and you have the window and you cannot get out of your seat without asking them to sit-up or re-position their bed every time you wish to use the restroom or move a bit.  Not great.  Still far better than coach of course but not a great choice by JAL to put these in.   One other note about comfort and I had read this before about JAL flights the cabin is kept extremely warm for westerners, so be ready!  

As for the service and food, the service was great, I will not say excellent because my travel companion and I many times felt like we were a bit overlooked vs Japanese passengers likely just because of our lack of speaking Japanese so they tended to get more service.  But extremely friendly service and helpful whenever they could be.

Finally the food as I skipped most of the Japanese meals since I do not love eel and other delicacies was not bad as I choose a "Western Meal".  In this case steak.  The steak on the way to Osaka was wonderful but that is about all I cared for.  If you are a foodie that likes fancy food then this menu is for you.  If you are more simple in your taste, well best of luck.

Given that I went on 5 other JAL flights after this all business class, if its a choice I would go LAX to NRT just to get the more comfortable seats and privacy.

title: BEST EXPERIENCE
review_text:
One the best experience in flight. Even though it was economy class the flight crew never stop treating the passenger any less. I have no words to describe my experience. Best customer service ever in flight (both way to and from). 

I was one happy customer and when I fly to Japan next time 99% chances i would choose JAL over any other airline.

title: Detailed service
review_text:
Today my husband and I flew back to Vancouver by Japan Airlines.  During the eight hour flight, they served us two meals: dinner and breakfast.  The dinner was designed by six red seal chefs and showed something creative and different.  We completed the full meal.  The breakfast was a Japanese gyuudon/ meat and rice package by a famous chain restaurant Yoshinoya.  I brought it home to share this comic like meal with our kid.

Better than the good food service was the attentiveness of a flight attendant.  My husband by mistake left his i Pad under his seat.  The professional and friendly, Ms. Inoue, brought it to us personally while we were picking up our checked-in luggage! I was awed by her service way beyond her duty.  It would not have happened if we had flown with any other airlines.  I possibly flew with 20 airlines in the past, but Japan Airlines service quality is incomparable.

title: Best experience in economy class flying
review_text: The whole flying experience with JAL was great. The staff were friendly & courtious. The planes were well kept, clean & tidy. The meals were of a good quality. Best of all check in at Narita was as soon as we arrived at the airport early off a cruise. We didn’t have to wait, the desk was manned and our luggage was processed straight away.

title: Nicely service from JAL
review_text: Japan Airlines is the one of nicely customer service by its ground and flight crews. The flight crew is very good to its passengers unlike other US and European based airline. The Japanese culture is ingrained into its daily routine which is extended to all passengers. Food is also very good,

title: It must be close to the best
review_text: I was flying on Monday and returning Thursday this week. When checking in I handed my OneWorld card and I was upgraded without asking.  The whole travel experience began when a young man meet me before I checked in and ended when I arrived back in Shanghai.  This is Service Quality at its very best.

title: Exceptional in-flight experience
review_text:
Travelled in their B767-300 back to Sin. Flight was delayed for 45 mins due to busy runaway at Narita.

Gate 99 was located at the other end of the terminal, hence a 15 min walk after passing immigration.

Meals were beautifully presented, especially the potato salad of the adult meal.

Leg room was good, the best in Y class. Younger daughter was given a child gift.

Air con of this flight sector was warm. I was given a ice pack to cool myself after the cabin crew saw me fanning myself in the midst of the flight. Cabin crew unable to regulate the temperature of the flight.

Senior cabin crew walked through cabin and thanked all for choosing JAL towards the end of the flight.

title: Good Service
review_text:
From the Check In to Boarding was well arranged and timed.
The gate staff was very courteous and accommodating.
The cabin was clean and crew attended to all our needs.

title: very long charter flight!
review_text: This was a charter JAL flight to Bangkok and Tokyo, but we stopped for passengers in Cairo, Jeddah, Kuwait (to refuel) and Karachi, took forever and since we were on a low cost tour excursion, we couldn't say much.  This was quite awhile ago while I was stationed on Crete, we actually started in Chania the night before.  JAL is a great airline with friendly and efficient staff and crew.

title: Excellency in the sky
review_text: From boarding to arrival it was excellent! The service was always with a smile, the cabin crew were very nice and polite, the food was a little bit disappointing but ok. Great flat bed seats and entertainment system. See you soon hopefully.

title: Comfortable flight
review_text:
Travelled from ITM to NRT in their B737-800 this pm.

Unable to upgrade to their J class as flight was full. Many international passengers today. FOC Wi-Fi available 5 mins after departure.

Air vents and inflight map were available in this one hr flight.

One round of drinks were made. Toilets were clean.

Legroom was good. Recline was minimal. 

A comfortable flight compared to budget airlines in Asia.

title: Always excellent service
review_text:
Always excellent service dedicated to the comfort of the passenger.
The lounge in Tokyo is also excellent with food, drinks, computer stations etc.
at the passenger's beck and call.

title: Exceptional Service
review_text: We were on cheap tickets at the back of a crowded flight, not usually my favorite spot. However as a tall man I appreciate leg room and seat width. JAL had both. The attendant's were a mix of Thai and Japanese were attentive and courteous. It was a night flight, so food was minimal. Still it left on time and arrived OK.That was the main thing

title: Great Experience
review_text: Little did I know that I was being upgraded on the Dreamliner 787 from Narita to Jakarta. Japan Airlines has to be one of Asia's best. From the aircraft to the flight attendants. This was a great experience. The customer service level is really really good. It was an 8 hour flight after a 12+ hour flight from DFW, so having a comfortable seat on the final leg of the trip was great. I will certainly look to fly JAL again soon!

title: Great experience
review_text: Very nice airlines:  great food, nice staff, smooth boarding. It was a short flight and everything went well.

title: Eye opener
review_text:
First experience in traveling in E90 on JL 2375. Cabin crew made one round of drinks in this one hr flight.

Cabin crew did not enforce to open window shades for this sector. Many window shades were closed due to sunny weather.

Y class seats were comfortable.

title: Higher Standard On A More Competitive Route
review_text: JAL step up their service and the quality of the food service on the Tokyo San Diego rioute which is more competitive than some others such as the flights to Australia. The aircraft was a spotless Boeing 787 and the service as expected from JAL. The flight was over quite late departing with no explanation which was a negative.

title: Good Flight And Service But Inconvenient  Departure Time
review_text: Japan Airlines has recently introduced a direct flight from Melbourne to Tokyo which is positive in most regards as it avoids the  stop over in Sydney. It is a smart move as it will bring Japanese tourists to Melbourne but the issue is the timing of the flight. From Melbourne it leaves at 12.45 AM which is not a good time . It also arrives into Melbourne late in the evening also inconvenient. The flight was a Boeing 787 and comfortable and the service is whay you expect on JAL. Food service at night was zero as everyone slept.

title: Great Airline to travel
review_text: We started our vacation from JFK and flew to Tokyo.  After three hour of layover we flew to Singapore. Service was excellent. Seats were comfortable. Air hostesses were very pleasant, courteous and helpful. All this made the long journey not so tiresome. I highly recommend this Airline.

title: Worth the upgrade
review_text:
Unable to check in bags all the way to ITM. We managed to cut Q as it's the peak time at NRT airport at 4 pm.

Check in at the domestic counter at the arrival hall was a breeze. JAL managed to check in all bags and the upgrades within 10 mins.

Only one small shop selling food stuff, newspapers near to the gate. Charging points available.

J class seats were extremely comfortable. PTV and charging points were available at each seats.

Cabin crew made one round of drinks in the one hr flight.

It wa worth the 1000 yen upgrade!

title: Comfortable flight
review_text:
Travelled in their refurbished Y class in their B767.It was 80% capacity. Seat was comfortable with 34" , best seat pitch in Y class.

PTV with USB ports were available in each seat. Seat had several pockets to hold small items.

Electrical ports were available for every 2 seats.

Meals were served 2 hrs into the flight with icecream. Metal cutlery provided.

Light meal was provided 2 hrs before arrival.

Flight arrived 30 mins after scheduled arrival time due to heavy traffic at Changi Airport.

It was the best Y class I have travelled. No wonder JAL is one of the best Y class in the world.

Just wondering why JAL is not a 5 star airline like CX, SQ.

title: Awesome
review_text: JAL is the best airline that i have flown with recently. The staff are freindly and helpful, with a very pleasant manner. The aircraft has the best economy seats. With plenty of leg room. Even if the person in the front reclines their seat, it does not impact on you. If you have the chance to fly JAL take it.

title: Great service & amenities, food not so much
review_text: Boeing 789 business class accommodations excellent, spacious, comfortable, with incredible toilets! Service friendly and attentive.  Food selections seemed repetitive and a bit tired, more humdrum than spectacular. When I want a special meal, though, it's not inside an airplane.

title: JAL from Tokyo Narita to Hong Kong!
review_text: Flew their red eye flight on B767-300 as part of my connecting flight from Toronto to Hong Kong.  Boarding was on time and we were bused to the aircraft and used air stair to board the flight.   Even though the aircraft had old style interior, it was immaculately clean and well maintained.    Leg room was pretty decent and I had the whole row to myself for this relatively long flight.    Cabin crews were all pretty friendly and polite.   They served one hot meal and some snacks along the way.    Landed in Hong Kong about 20 minutes ahead of  the schedule.    All in all, you just can't seem to go wrong with all Japanese carriers.  They are top notch in terms of safety, comfort and quality of cabin crews!

title: Premium economy- the "poor" man's business class
review_text:
Premium economy is an excellent value on Japan Air Lines.  Prior to the flight, I was provided access to the Sakura lounge at Narita, a large and comfortable waiting area with massage chairs and showers available prior to flight.  There are some light snacks and a meals available on the upper level as well.  A good start to a long day. 

I had a bulkhead seat which offered spacious legroom, search for this option on Seatguru when booking.  While the seats do not lie flat, there is a decent enough recline with footrest that will enable you to get some need shuteye.  The 787-900 is the way to go on long haul flights with better air quality and dimming windows.   I ordered a kosher meal for the flight which was OK, but there are snacks, soft drinks and tea available throughout the flight.  Bathrooms were clean and service was generally very good. 

The only weaknesses were the inflight entertianment and wifi.  The inflight entertainment is a little thin on interesting material in English.  Better to download and bring your own.   Wifi service is spotty,  on the flight over it did not work north of the Arctic Circle.

Overall excellent service and a very comfortable plane.  The price difference between premium economy and business class is significant, but you are mostly paying for the lie flat seats.  This makes premium economy and good value.

title: Skiing equipment
review_text:
I am very disappointed that JAL offers such generous baggage allowance of 45kgs but insists on a size limit for skis.
I have cross country skis which ways 5kgs for two pairs but JAL charges $100-00 each way for oversized bags.. Jetstar is horrible to fly with as you feel like a stingy mongrel and here is now no price benefit with flying with them as JAL and QANTAS are now as cheap but offering a full service.

JAL are shooting themselves in the foot by not aggregating the total size as they do with weight  I was told it would cost $200 US each way for my skis.  I can buy a pair for that.

Very excellent otherwise but this is a stupid policy and will put many skiers off using JAL..
  
This will put many Australian skiers off travelling to Japan to ski on their air line

title: Business Class between Shanghai and Tokyo
review_text: Flew from Shanghai to Narita, then again from Haneda to Shanghai 5 days apart in October. The first trip from PVG to NRT was pretty good, used the lounge in Shanghai which was ok but nothing special and shared with other airlines. Service onboard was good and seat was ok for the two hour flight, good entertainment. The flight back from Haneda to Shanghai was much better. Starting with the Lounge in Haneda, which was amazing. Great food and drink selections and nice views of the planes out of the window. The seat on board was much bigger than on the way out and the service was great. Food onboard was good and great inflight entertainment.

title: JAL Business Class LAX to Tokyo w/Lie Flat Seats
review_text: Lie Flat seats are the way to go. We used to fly coach when we were younger, then the time before this we went Premium Economy. The Lie Flat seats are infinitely better. We had a connecting flight from Haneda to Okinawa the next morning so took a Limo Bus to Haneda and stayed at an Airport hotel. I thought ii'd be more restful to break the trip into two segments with an overnight in Tokyo. It ended up being too much hassle. From now on we'll take a same day flight to Okinawa. The lie flat seats made the intercontinental segment quite restful and stress free.

title: Homeward bound
review_text: First time with JAL and delighted. At check in we were escorted to the desk instead of being beckoned which was nice touch. The flight was great and the service was exceptional. I would go as far as to say this was the best service ever experienced on a flight. I have a bony backside so never really comfortable for long haul.

title: Friendly & Helpful service
review_text: It was a pleasure flying Japan Airlines, with friendly service and good food and clean airline.  They helped me with Mobility Assistance and were so nice.

title: Excellent Service
review_text: Everyone was all smile and friendly. Enjoyed the bento set and Haagen Dazs ice cream after the main meal. I asked for whiskey and the portion was generous and came with an additional cup of water. Plenty of leg space, very comfy seat, big and clear screen. Will book JAL again when I next visit Japan.

title: Good Flight - Great Lounge
review_text: The Sakura lounge in Tokyo was fabulous. We spent 3 hours there and had draft sapporbeer and food. The flight was on time, service was nice, food was good...seats could be better...petty uncomfortable...

title: Awesome Airlines
review_text: 22 hour flight , very nice experience, a lot leg space , amazing staff . Definitely will travel with JAL again . Loved it ❤️❤️❤️

title: Superb First Class Lounge in Haneda and good overnight Bangkok Flight
review_text:
I took the 12:40 am flight from Tokyo Haneda airport to Bangkok and found the schedule to be very efficient and effective. The flight departs late at night and arrives very early in the morning lessening the risk of delays due to airport congestion.  Also by arriving so early in Bangkok, traffic time into the city is substantially reduced.  I normally allot 1 to 1 1/2 hour to get from the airport to my Bangkok city hotel in the Silom area but was told by the hotel car driver that before 6 am in the morning, travel time from airport to hotel is only 1/2 hour since there is little traffic. 

The flight is also well designed for sleep onboard.  The seats are older shell flat angled-flat seats without direct aisle access for window seats but as I had booked the first row aisle seat, my seatmate in the window seat could easily step over my seat even if it is in the bed position as there is plenty of room between the seat and the bulkhead in front.  The plane used is an older B777-200 with a 2-3-2 seat configuration in business class so if you are in the middle seat in the center section, access would be more of an issue.  

As the flight departs past midnight, meal service is breakfast 1 hr 45 min. before landing rather than shortly after take-off.  On boarding, each business class customer is asked to fill in a form indicating whether he or she wanted to be woken up for breakfast and whether the Western or Japanese breakfast is chosen.  As a result, lights are kept dimmed from take-off until about 2 hours before arrival, I and most other passengers in business class immediately switched to bed position after take-off as soon as the seatbelt sign was turned off and managed a bit over 3 hours of sleep on a less than 6 hour flight.  Also because it is such a late departure, pretty much everyone on board goes to sleep after take-off so it is quiet in the cabin and there is little to disturb your sleep. 

The Western breakfast served prior to landing was impressively full in offering.  There was a duck salad and a mushroom omelette, really good bun and/croissant, fruit and Greek yoghourt.  As always, JAL services its special brand of coffee in business class which is among the best coffees I have had on a plane.  My only criticism is that the coffee is not available for purchase and only served in flight. 

On landing, getting through customs and immigration was very quick as there were not many other flights arriving that early in the morning so the usual long lines at Thai immigration was non-existent and luggage delivery was quick.  From landing to getting into the car arranged through my hotel to arriving at my Bangkok hotel, it took only about an hour which is incredibly quick for Bangkok. 

Overall, this flight is a good choice for an efficient arrival and to get full use of your first day in Bangkok on arrival.

Prior to departure, I used the Haneda JAL First Class lounge as I have OneWorld Emerald status.  The lounge is truly superb.  Lots of room in the lounge, outlets at all seats, good view of the planes docked at the gates and a great dining area with plentiful food options.  There was even a cook to order section where a chef made grilled special Japanese cut of beef with either a Japanese sauce of a truffle sauce.  There were two soup offering including a lobster bisque, a Western hot food offering of multi-mushroom pasta, two kinds of dim sum, Japanese udon and curry, and a selection of bite size cold appetizers including foie gras on toast.  I arrived very early on a connecting flight that had landed in Narita airport and took the limousine bus between the two airports arriving more than 5 hours before my flight.  The lounge actually is very quiet until about 10 or 11 pm when it suddenly fills up as Haneda airport has a number of long-haul international flights that depart late at night for an early arrival at their destinations.

title: Time for JAL to update B787 Business Class Seats
review_text:
JAL continues to use an angle flat bed seat in Business Class on its B787 Dreamliner flights from Vancouver to Tokyo in a 2-2-2 configuration with the window seats not having direct access to the aisle.  Normally this is not a problem as I always select the aisle seat next to the window seat, and the typical JAL business class customer is a Japanese man who is not very large and can get in and out of the window seat by stepping over the aisle seat without too much problems.  This flight though, I had a Caucasian larger gentleman in the window seat next to me and he was not familiar with the JAL seat configuration.  He had to ask the flight attendants to help and to wake me to fully convert my seat to upright before he could access his window seat as he was not used to the step over concept and as he was probably not too coordinated having consumed at least 4 or 5 whiskeys within the first couple of hours of the flight.  This need to convert my seat from bed to seat position each time he had to exit or return to his seat made sleep difficult, so really given this is an overnight long-haul flight, it is time for JAL to upgrade this route to a plane featuring one of its more recent business class seats with a horizontal flat bed and direct aisle access from each seat. 

Difficulties with my neighbour aside, the flight was fine and featured JAL's trademark superb service.  The flight attendants were most polite in asking me to adjust my seat to accommodate the ingress and egress of my seatmate, were constantly cleaning the toilet after each use by a customer, and even paid attention to really small details like always turning the water glass each time they brought me water so that the JAL logo on the glass exactly faced the customer!

I had the Japanese meal for both the lunch and the prior to arrival snack and both were very good, featuring numerous little small bites with interesting seasonal flavours. 

One relative weak point is the entertainment system, which has a much smaller selection of movies than for example Cathay Pacific has on its Vancouver to HK route.  Also, many of the non-Western movies from Japan, Korea, Hong Kong, India etc. were only available in their native language and then maybe Japanese so that an English only speaker actually cannot take advantage of much of the movie and TV programs lists. 

The plane is new and the service is superb, but the angled flat bed and lack of direct aisle access from each seat makes this business class offering a bit behind the times for an overnight flight where undisturbed and good quality sleep is a prime measure of 
success.

title: Great Reliable Airline
review_text: Booked my flight with Japan Airlines.  Seats actually have room.  On the 10 hour flight from Melbourne, I never felt like I was crammed into my seat.  Cabin Crew was real friendly and the price of the ticket was reasonably priced.  Will fly this airline again.

title: Thoroughly agree jail website appalling
review_text: Flew from Heathrow ,told at the airport I had not checked in online even though I had confirmed seats online and had also been advised I had checked in, after a very frustrating time trying to fathom the worst website I have ever come across. We had a flight from London to Helsinki via BA then joined JAL who immediately informed us they had changed our seats!! Premium economy too I was astounded and complained but was not fully understood, I did not want to cause a scene as the flight attendants looked suitably embarrassed and did not really appear to know what I was going on about . I have checked in again for the home journey and I will not be changing my seat again, be warned JAL. I am so angry about the situation but know that complaining will I imagine fall on deaf non understanding ears!

title: The mobile web check in is a joke
