review_text: We went from the USA to the Philippines round trip with Japan Air. The flight itself was a good price and the movie selection and food were decent. The seats weren't the most comfortable but they were also fairly decent and the flight attendants were friendly. What really bothered us is the mobile check-in. We had 8 hours in LAX before our flight so we tried checking in online to get our seats reserved, the mobile site would not allow it, so we decided to wait at the gate until an attendant arrived so we could check in. 1 hour before the flight started boarding the attendant arrived and when we checked in they put us on opposite ends of the plane (it was our honeymoon) so we were not pleased to spend 14 hours apart for the start to our vacation. Luckily the airline was able to make some changes and put us together moments before the airline began boarding which we greatly appreciated. At the end of our vacation we didn't want this happening again, so 24 hours before our flight we attempted the mobile check in again. This time it let me put my information into the check in services but could not locate my name or reservation number. Highly displeased that we are having so many issues with our check-in with this airline. Hope it gets resolved.

title: Best Airline Meal I've Ever Had!
review_text:
JAL overnight to Australia served Wagyu Beef Sirloin which was absolutely the best airline meal I've ever enjoyed. Appetiser of Salmon Gravlax was also exceptional.
Great to see that some airlines still do value business class travellers and aren't cutting costs to the bone, instead focusing on higher quality and good service.

Lie-flat beds were good for the age f the plane - hard to beat the A380 lie-flat experience on other airlines - and the entertainment package was very good.

I will certainly fly JAL again after this experience.

title: Absolutely Awsome
review_text:
I flew SYD-NRT return recently on JAL and was utterly amazed at the level of service provided by all staff. The Sydney ground staff were outstanding. They were genuinely lovely people who ensured that I felt special from check in to boarding.
On board, the cabin crew seemed so much more attentive and professional than any other cabin crew I have ever seen. They just paid so much attention to detail.
The aircraft, a B787 on both flights, was new, clean and extremely comfortable.
The meals were delicious and they provided a selection of western and Japanese choices.
I have flown a lot over the years and on many airlines, but JAL was, without any doubt, the best I have ever experienced.
I have never recommended any airline on social media before, but I had never flown JAL before either.

title: Good service but the hard product is a letdown
review_text:
I have flow the Sydney Vancouver route on Japan Airlines a few times. I find their business class fares competitive, and their service is great, but there are some caveats and that probably explains the competitive pricing. 

On the Vancouver Narita route JAL flies the B787 Dreamliner. Business class is a 2-2-2 layout. There’s no staggering on the window side so it presents access issues for anyone on the window seat. You need to jump over your neighbor to go to the washroom. 

Aside from the layout the other big letdown is the angled flat bed. Seriously what was JAL thinking? Why put angled flat bed. They have a much better Sky Suite version which flies on the Narita Sydney route, among others. 

The service is very good. Organized. Punctual. Always with a smile. 

Menu is limited for business class. Pretty much a choice of Japanese or Western food. Wine selection is okay. 

This flight is a decent one for a daytime journey but not ideal for a nighttime flight.

title: Nasty Customer Service
review_text:
I booked 3 tickets for my sister in-law, niece and nephew for Oct. 5 departure through Priceline.com. From Manila to Portland, OR. They arrived early at the airport to check-in and when they we're being checked-in they found out my nephew was missing a document an ECC document (Emigration Clearance Certification). (By all means this is our fault in our part and we don't blame the airline what's so ever). This caused a delay on their flight. 
 
I called JAL customer service directly. The man that I talked to didn't sound friendly all but I told him the situation I am in. He reviewed my confirmation and told me that he couldn't help me out because I bought my ticket through a third party(like a person that doesn't want to deal with you kind a way).

I called Priceline.com, a person by the name (Tris) was such a great help. I told her the situation and exchanged information to JAL represented. I wanted to rebook the 3 tickets but JAL was asking $4100+, (Tris) advice just to purchase new tickets. I asked how much to cancel the tickets, according to JAL it's $600per/tickets for "no-show", they don't have proof that it was a "no-show". I told that my (sister in-law, nephew,niece) did show and were on time which and we have proof. I was supposed to be charged $300per/tickets because they did show during departure but just couldn't leaves due to documentation. 

The conversation wasn't getting nowhere, I was already late to work. I told (Tris) to just cancel all reservations and I can't deal with this airline any longer. JAL charged me $1800 with a refund of $300. 

This was my first and will be my last to book for JAL.

According to their Fares Rules and Restriction: PENALTIES
FARE RULES TEXT
UNLESS OTHERWISE SPECIFIED NOTE - RULE PS05 IN IPRG
APPLIES
GENERAL RULES TEXT
FROM/TO PHILIPPINES
CANCELLATIONS
BEFORE DEPARTURE
CHARGE USD 300.00 FOR CANCEL/REFUND.
NOTE -
IN CASE OF NO SHOW -
CANCELLATION CHARGE USD 600.00 APPLIES.
--------------

title: a very pleasant and comfortable flight
review_text:
The friendliness of staff is exceptional. The seats are super comfortable and very private. Good food with a choice of western and traditional Japanese cuisine. 
On board entertainment could have been better, the choice of movies was limited. 
A business lounge at Narita airport was absolutely fantastic, offering an excellent refreshment facilities, a free 15 min back massage as well as super modern and effective massage chairs to use at any time. Heaven after a long flight.

title: I cant say enough
review_text: Great airline!!  The service was beyond great.  Long story but it was a codeshare for work.  So i switched from AA to JAL.  I was having some luggage issues and was getting “0” help from AA of course.  So i went to JAL and asked and they said “AA” should do that and i explained how that went.  She took me to the customer service area from the ticket counter.  It was unbelievable how awesome she was.  I was also trying to upgrade by cash to business class.  Without going deep into it, she found my bag and said i can go in through security.  Once i was at the gate waiting on boarding, she came into the waiting area with my bag to confirm it was the right one.  I was amazed..  i said yes and she walked me down the concourse to the plane and said “i will personally put it on the plane”. I was like great and she apologized since she was unable to upgrade me due to “AA” rules of course on code share.  I said oh well, we tried..  after i boarded she came to my seat and said how is it?  I said if i knew it was going to be roomy and nice like this i wouldn’t have worried about the upgrade haha.  She smiled and said thank you and thank you for flying with us.  Truly first class service even in couch..

title: late 1 hr interconitenatal  flight with no expalanation from the crew for a long time,running to catch next flight
review_text:
I flew in the  last days of Sep. 2017 .Gate at Helsinki airport is in a lower ground ,far,far away, and with no facilities.Had to walk upstairs to a Jumbo and that was no fun .
A  bus takes you  to the Helsinki airport on arrival.
Plane to Tokyo was  late for 1hr,no information given for a long time.Connecting flight to Melbourne had less and less time remaining. Plane was circulating over Tokyo several times.
I think people should know what is going on, particularly now .No gate numbers given with 20 min left to boarding time,it was a run.
The Info Board ,only in Japanese. Running,no knowing the gate number. We Made it with 3 others ,only to wait 40 min again on the plane .That was never explained.
The closest area to boarding, does not have coffee shop,and not having time, does not allow you to have a look for one .Not good.
Time between long flights are essential for a walk,meal,relaxation  and coffee for me,not to be stressed and under-informed.

title: Decent flight
review_text: Service is great, the size of the economy seat is normal, Food is pretty good especially when the food is reload at japan. In my previous trips, they serve Mos Burger as a snack.  I like the dreamliner (787), the fleet is still new and clean. The only thing I do not like is the in flight entertainment which does not have many variety compare to other airlines, they have a lot of Japanese programs for the local.

title: not a bad experience
review_text:
Not a bad experience.  Plane was on time and clean.  Crew were courteous.
Unlike other airlines JAL does not sell seats.  But I was able to get good seats by calling them some 72 hours before the flight.  
The check in staff were accommodating.  They wrapped in plastic one of our bags to provide additional support  
JAL was in partnership with AA in these flights.

title: An awesome fligh!
review_text: That was an amazing experience. The flight attendants were friendly and cute. They always said 'Konnichiwa' or 'Arigatou' in Japanese and I love it. One more special thing was about the meal on the plane. I had breakfast and it was delicious. It was delicate and was one of the most delicious meal I had ever had. I will fly with JAL again soon.

title: Simply the best
review_text:
I cannot say enough good things about JAL. Over the years, I've flown both Business and Economy many times.  Utter professionalism and courtesy at every turn.  I think very highly of some competitors like Korean Air and Cathay Pacific, but _no one_ does it with the 100 percent commitment of JAL.  The planes are absolutely pristine.  The passengers seem particularly well behaved and I believe that is because of the sense of absolute dignity and kindness imparted by the crew.  The food -- even in Economy -- is excellent and immaculately presented.  The wifi service is bombproof and there is no restriction as to how it's used (as there is on most airlines).  

What I don't get is why some of these Asian air carriers are so so so much better than our domestic airlines in the USA.  What are we missing?

title: An extraordinary experience; excellent service
review_text: Japan Airlines have the friendliest and most helpful staff on the ground and in the air.  Their aircraft are the cleanest in the sky, and the business class suite is spacious and very comfortable

title: Aircrafts are good !
review_text: I had high expectation from the business class of JAL on a Boeing 780 aircraft but seats in the business class though reclineable to about 69 inches but not ideal for sleeping.

title: Elegant , Comfortable, right way to fly...
review_text:
First of all, I am travelling with my wife, a 6 years old kid and an infant. and I am flying economy.  Check in is smooth, as we had been Japan for so many times, these Japanese staff are constantly at it 100% , if we got any hiccup, then it possible language barrier causing it..

Going into the cabin, to my surprise, the economy seat WIDER than all flight I have taken with any other airline, I feel like we are flying the so call "premium economy"

Of course the overall flight experience is very nice, the stewardess gave my kids some toy and souvenir which they love it so much

The food is one of the best meal i had in modern flying days and they do take effort to prep kids meal for my daughter and baby meal for my baby boy... ...and everyone meals ends with a cup of delicious ice cream.

In flight entertainment ? yes... they have bigger screen too and ipad like touch sensitivity hahaha... 

Often time people fly with only designated airline for some reason, but I think as traveler, we all should sometime step out of the sand box and give other reputable airline a go, they might cost little more... but the experience I have with JAL is so pleasant this trip.

We had flight with JAL from Osaka to Okinawa, Okinawa to Tokyo and Tokyo to Kuala Lumpur, so I am here to give a big thumb up on all three flight with JAL

Did I mention on the domestic flight, they give free in flight WIFI too... my very first experience, delightful.

We will definitely fly again with JAL!

title: Friendly Staff
review_text: Early flight from Paris to Bangkok and the JAL staff was wonderful!  The plane was clean and the staff was attentive!

title: Excellent Premium Economy Service JFK - Tokyo  (HND)
review_text: Excellent service and seating. Took premium economy from JFK to HND. The seats and the legroom were amazing. The menu and complimentary slippers were a nice touch as well. Also, being able to use the Air France lounge at JFK (which I feel like should be advertised more!) and the Sakura lounge at HND were added bonuses. All worth the extra money from regular economy on a 14hr flight.

title: Superior service
review_text: We flew Japan air for the first time for a business trip to Tokyo.  The service was superb, the plane was new and very clean.

title: Efficient, friendly, personalized service.
review_text: This flight left me feeling very impressed with Japan Airlines. Apart from the friendly, efficient service I received, JAL was honest and sensitive in a way that I have not seen on other airlines. Soon after I boarded the airplane an announcement was made that our meal would be served early because the pilots were expecting serious turbulence later in the flight. As it turned out I didn't eat anything when the meal was served because I didn't feel hungry. Much later, a flight attendant asked me again if I wanted a meal. By that time I was hungry and accepted the offer. The flight landed a little later than expected because the pilots had to take a detour to avoid a storm. This, however, was explained to us in a very gracious, professional manner. I was so impressed with JAL.

title: Incredible service
review_text:
I don't normally review airlines but yesterday we flew from Tokyo to Okinawa in a typhoon and honestly the service was impeccable! To say it was a typhoon all of the staff, from check in, the constantly smiling air stewardesses and the pilot were calm, happy and helpful. There was a bit of turbulence but I slept through almost the whole thing! Fantastic!

Also, on top of this they gave us this postcard as we left! Thank you to everyone on flight 909! We look forward to flying with you next week!

title: Great Airline
review_text:
I travel about 5 time a year. I board at least 15 planes a year. I travelled from BKK to Japan via this airline. 

The services is superb and flight attendants are courteous and polite.

The meals were 'okay' but the drinks and speed of service makes this airline a winner.

title: Great friendly service.
review_text: JAL is a great airline to fly with. The staff, from counter staff to hostesses, were all professional and friendly. The aircraft was clean and comfortable, and the food was tasty and well presented.

title: First class service in Economy
review_text: We had the best flight to Japan this summer aboard JAL. It was our first flight with this airline and we were very impressed. We couldn't believe how much leg room there was in economy class and what great service there was too. The meals were delicious - there were 2 options: Western and Japanese. We chose the Japanese meals and they were scrumptious. During the entire trip, the stewardesses were constantly serving beverages and there was unlimited snacks after dinner. The flight was very quiet and the stewardesses were very friendly. We will definitely be flying with JAL in the future.

title: Airline of Choice
review_text: I always look forward to flying with JAL and I only had the chance if I an going to Japan. The food and service are great and they have an excellent customer service orientation. Typically Japanese . . .

title: 787 Economy class Hong Kong-Tokyo
review_text: Flew economy class HKG-NRT on a Dreamliner recently.  The employee at check-in at the Hong Kong Airport Express location in Central was the best airline employee I've ever come across...I had some ticketing issues that he had to call in and resolve for me, and then come find me at the nearby Starbucks to tell me he did so.  What a guy!  So for the good...attentive and classy personnel, good food quality (for a plane), wine, great entertainment options, cleanliness, on time and the 787 was quiet and has large windows that dim electronically.  The downside is the legroom...I would rate this flight much higher, maybe 5 stars if the legroom was decent, because everything else was great.  Unfortunately JAL has not resisted the urge to cram as many seats onto a plane as possible.  At 6'4", I notice more than others the difference in legroom.  I came into HKG on a Garuda Indonesia flight on an Airbus A330 (similar sized plane) and they are massively more gracious with the amount of space given in Economy class.  Also the fact that you cannot reserve your seat easily during ticket purchase or prior to the flight departure is another downside for Economy class.  Would I fly them again?? Maybe...but only if there weren't similarly priced options available on more spacious carriers (Cathay Pacific, Garuda, Singapore, etc.)

title: Good service and quality of domestic planes
review_text: I traveled JAL airlines first time when I am traveling back to Haneda from Kushiro Airport. Although due to some technical fault flight was delayed more than one hour still first experience of flight interior seat quality impressed me. Coffee served insider plan was totally different taste and I loved it. Apart from it there staffs were very supportive and humble. I want to travel again with JAL.

title: Always enjoy Flying with JAL.
review_text:
I have had 6 international and 4 domistic flights with JAL in the past 4 years and always found the food and service on board very good, flights have always been on time with check in smooth and friendly, baggage allowance is around 23 kg. plus hand luggage.  I found In economy class the leg room and seating on the domistic flights is even better. All meals and movies on International economy  flights are included in the price 
unlike some of our Australian International Airlines. JAL is my choice for my next flight to Japan.

title: Great service and planes
review_text: Very kind staff always willing to help (Japan attitude !), comfort everywhere, really clean, boarding officer offered (freely !) extra legroom as I'm quite tall (in comparison to Japanese people, I suppose)

title: Superb comfort and service
review_text: I can't speak too highly of the service and the comfort on the flight. The food was excellent and I will certainly fly with JAL again.

title: Premium Economy
review_text:
I flew Premium Economy from JFK to Narita continuing on to Manila in Economy. Check-In was fast and easy as I had arrived early to the airport and as a One World Sapphire member was able to use the Business Class counter. JAL uses the Air France lounge which is fine but the food was not replaced on a regular basis. I got the feeling the lounge was doing the bare minimum as there were not any AF flights departing at the time. Lounge access for all Premium Economy is a nice perk not provided by other airlines.

The seating was great and the configuration of the Premium Economy section works well. There are two toilets in the front that appeared to be for Business Class but were also used by the Premium Economy section too. This layout is much better than the Cathay Pacific layout that results in passengers walking over people in the bulkhead row or going to the back of the plane.

While I prefer a seat that reclines vs. “sliding down” the combination of a larger than normal pitch and the fact that the person in front is not reclining into your space makes the hard shell seat a winner!

The food was fine, nothing great and the service was very good throughout the flight. Some people may find the English language entertainment sections to be a bit limited.

title: Great customer service
review_text: Due to weather our flight was delayed. I have a tendency to fall asleep anywhere and I did just that before we took off. When I woke up 2 hours later, I thought my eyes were playing tricks on me. I still saw tarmac and grass. Turns out we have been waiting for the weather to turn for the better and haven't budged. While we were in the air, I realized I might not make my connecting flight to Akita. I asked the flight attendant about it and she did her best to give me updates. Even she didn't have more information she came back to tell me she is waiting for an answer. Turns out I only had 1 hour to get past customs, collect my luggage which I was planning to ship because they were large and awkward (I was carrying 2 instruments) and get to the other terminal and board. When I got off the plane, a JAL employee met me and helped carry my luggage all the way to the other terminal. Unfortunately the carts were not allowed so he carried them by hand. I felt very badly for him but was so grateful. Thanks to all the staff, I was able to make my flight and see my parents the same day. I was so concerned I would have to wait until the next day. I couldn't be more happy. My reason for not giving 5 stars is because the food really could be better. There is fruit on top of somen and other odd combinations. I usually bring my own food. Despite the food I will continue to fly JAL because of the amazing service.

title: flight experience
review_text: Excellent flight from Sydney. The seating arrangement was private and sleeping arrangements good. The food and wine was really good and the service excellent but not intrusive.

title: Amazing seat, food pretty average
review_text:
The business class seats for JAL are the best I have ever experienced.  I was in 5A which is by the window and the design means you are essentially in your own private seat with a small passage to get into the aisle.  This is more like first class suites.  Row 5 is also in it's own private cabin between first class and the galley so not many people and much more private than the main business cabin.

With their mattress it was very comfortable for this very long flight.  Service was very attentive with frequent and generous refills of wine.

A big disappointment for me was the food.  A choice of Japanese of western menu I opted for the western as some of the Japanese options were too adventurous for me. The squid for the starter has very little flavour and was very tough.  Beef fillet was ok and cooked well considering but on small side.  I had better luck with the Japanese Beef Curry which is on the snacks menu you can order anytime, tasty although a little cold.

If the food was better, this would have been best business class flight I have ever taken.

title: Average Flight
review_text: Average service. For the first few hours we were not served food which I thought was not a good practice.

title: London to Tokyo
review_text: Our tickets were booked with Japan airlines. The Tokyo to London return flights were with British Airways Premium Economy. I can't say it was worth the price as there was not much extra leg room. I am only five foot three but my husband is six foot three so it is very important for him to have the extra leg room. When the seats in front of us were put back it was almost impossible to get out of the seat. The flight from Sydney to Tokyo was very comfortable with more keg room and decent seat recline. We are sitting at the airport now waiting for our flight back to Sydney. It is an evening flight so it will be interesting to see how comfortable an overnight flight will be. The photographs are of British airways Premium Economy. I will update my status on Japan airlines in a few days.

title: great flight
review_text: great friendly service hot cloths   plenty of drinks  good food nothing was a problem to the staff  free motel on route very lenient on cabin luggage weights

title: Many surprises
review_text: First before taxiing I noticed four airline staff outside the airplane lined up and started to wave goodbye the passengers and bow down as Japanese do. Then I loved the toilet which was equipped with electronic bidet which is very clean and hygienic. Then noticed the windows can be tinted electronically and you can choose how dark the window you want to be as opposed to most aircrafts where you can only block the window. And lastly, the space between seats are decent compare to other airlines

title: Exceptional Service
review_text: JAL is the model of superb customer service by its ground and flight crews. The flight crew is very attentive to its passengers unlike other US and European based airline. The Japanese culture is ingrained into its daily routine which is extended to all passengers. Food is also very good with traditional non-plastic utensils.

title: Excellence in air and on the ground
review_text: JAL offer a premium business class service, with a modern setup that feels a decade ahead of anything BA, Qantas, United or similar mid-tier airlines offer. JAL are one of the best. Their in-air service is friendly and attentive. You feel like your service is personalized and that they are genuinely interested in making sure you have the best possible experience. On top of that, on my last outbound flight, one of the cabin attendants accidentally returned to me the wrong suit jacket. I didn't notice until I arrived at my hotel. JAL ground service and lost and found were amazing, sending me multiple emails, checking with cabin crew and genuinely trying to track down my jacket. On my departure, at the Narita check-in desk, one of the lost and found staff met me in person to sincerely apologize for this error. I was left with the impression that they had gone above and beyond what you'd expect from an average airline.

title: Japan Airline
review_text:
Travelling with a big group of family - 9A and 8C. Only toddler and elderly were given the priority boarding. Kids unfortunately are not given this priority.
In overall, I  like their service and the choice for meal. Serving was big. For toddler, they served the rice cracker and banana immediately after boarding, which was a good surprise. That ensure the toddler won't go crying because of hunger. The proper meal served was mainly assorted blended vegetable like mashed pumpkin, spinach etc. Not to my toddler liking though. But still very good effort. For kids meal, very nicely done up with lots of choice. Big serving. 
Seat was comfortable. Flight was punctual. The only complaint that i had was the aircond. The only flight that i felt warm in the plane compared to all the other airlines. It's probably good for fuel consumption and energy friendly, but slightly too warm for passenger as we ended sweating in the plane.

title: Best flight service ever!! Most Polite and Courteous Flight staff!!
review_text:
My whole family had the best experience ever with Japan Airlines. The flight crew was so polite and pleasant.  We have flown will all the USA based Airlines and a few international carriers like Cathay Pacific and KLM.  JAL has exceeded all are expectations. United Airlines staff should take some lessons from the JAL staff. Loved the attention to passengers even if they are economy class.  We traveled with 2 family members who have food allergies.  They were so attentive and careful with the meals.  
We will fly again with Japan Airlines.  Thank you for the most flight experience ever!!

title: Should Be a 5-Star Airline
review_text:
I've had the privilege to experience different J classes of various carriers and I have to say JAL tops the cake. From the gracious, helpful staff, sumptuous meal and comfy seat, JAL has really created a high bar when it comes to business class. 

I originally started my trip from Seoul to Narita on a 737, but my review is about the flight from Tokyo to Los Angeles on board the 777. 

Transiting at NRT was pretty painless - just had to go through security. Make sure laptops are out and no liquids more than 100 ml. Once past security, I made my way to the tranquil Sakura Lounge. Definitely try their curry with rice! I prefer the design of Haneda with its open floor and plenty of natural lighting. Narita is a bit of a dungeon compared to Haneda! But I digress…

After some r&r, I made my way to the gate. JL boards families with tots and those that need assistance. Afterwards, First Class (FC) and Diamond members are welcomed on board. Then Business and Economy. I soon settled into seat 10K (window) in the primary business section. There's a forward biz section just behind FC. A flight attendant came by to introduce herself and served champagne and offered reading material. 

The SkySuite is exemplary. Once the partition goes up, it's like you're in your own cubicle - in a good way. Although there is a seat next to you, you still have aisle access. For comparison's sake, British Airways has a similar layout but you're not afforded your own aisle access and (gasp) have to hurdle over your facing neighbor. The screen is quite large and there is also a handheld remote to control content. The seat is upholstered, comfortable and has a massage feature. The seat also changes to a full-flat bed and an AirWave mattress topper is provided. The inflight entertainment (IFE) is quite extensive and contains new releases as well as classic movies. 

Once airborne, the smiling FA s quickly commenced service. Unlike US carriers, I feel like FA s on most Asian carriers like their jobs and want to provide utmost service. I describe it as a "white glove" touch. They never seem hurried and pay attention to the detail (like ensuring the JAL logo on the wine glass is facing you). 

If you're keen at all, definitely go for the multi-course Japanese menu. Our menu started with tofu and a dish of tuna, followed by a bento of Japanese appetizers. Then the main course followed (beef tongue and cod) along with rice and miso soup. My FA kept offering wine I had to politely decline. 

Once dinner wrapped up, the FA advised me I could order anything off the handheld device. I think it's really great you can order anytime and not have to flag an FA or ring the call attendant button. The snack menu is quite extensive as well. Go for the ramen and pork cutlet sandwich. 

Sadly, before I knew it, I could see the California coastline and we began our descent into Los Angeles. 

Overall, I was quite impressed with the whole flight. From the crew, food, bed and IFE, I will certainly consider JAL for my next trip to Asia.

title: Poor delay
review_text:
My first experience flying JAL
International - more than 3 hours of flight delay in Japan, we had to take the last connected flight. Instead of arriving at 7.55pm, I arrived home at 1am the next day. Although they gave a food voucher of 1500 yen, that is hardly compensating.

Domestic - Osaka to New Chitose, and New Chitose to Tokyo, they served you 1/2 cup juice or plain water. 

That's how the service. 

I will never fly JAL again.

title: Fine experience
review_text:
I transferred from BA to JAL in Hong Kong.

It was relatively short flight compared to BA but its service was far superior to that of BA.

Only the problem is that seat pitch is small so bigger people JAL is not comfortable as it should be.

title: Fly for the food and service
review_text:
Fly with Boeing 787 Dreamliner for the food and service.
I gotta say JAL never let me down.
日航夢幻客機787商務艙，座椅舒適度不在話下，可以調色的窗戶展現科技實力；但最愛的還是貼心、親切的服務，以及好看又好吃的餐點！
精緻料理，搭配清酒、紅白酒、啤酒都完美！

title: Explore Nagoya/Kyoto with JAL flight
review_text:
Seat size is acceptable, meal serve only one prior to arrival early morning as it was a midnight flight.
For those who fly JAL mid-night flight should have taken dinner before boarding, otherwise you could have felt hungry throughout the flight.

title: Inspire me to go on next travel by Japan Airlines
review_text: This is my first time taking Japan Airlines. Even though it is the short distance from Taipei to Tokyo, I still enjoy the good flight experience because the comfortable seats (in economy class) and homelike space. And the flight ticket is not as expensive as I thought. Now that makes me rethink to treat myself well to relish quality as well as good price even if most people prefer to fly by cheap airlines.

title: A dark day
review_text: Chose a day flight to avoid jetlag. Did not expect to sit for 12 hours with all the blinds down and the lights off.  Only had my reading light.  Spent time at the back looking out of the tiny window as we flew over northern Russia as the inflight entertainment was rubbish.

title: Tokyo to London in the dark
review_text:
Flight was on time, check-in slick, cabin crew friendly, comfort so-so, food not bad. We chose a day flight (depart 11.20 am Tokyo, arrive LHR 15.50 pm) especially to avoid jet lag, a technique that has always worked in the past.  

HOWEVER, the airline insisted of keeping the blinds closed and the cabin lights off for pretty well the full twelve hours of the flight.  Sitting in aisle seats we could do nothing about this, apart from spending much time at the back where there were a couple of tiny windows.  The point of choosing a day flight is to have a normal night's sleep before, have a very long day travelling, then go to bed at the destination, resulting in minimal disruption to the body clock.  Passengers do not need to sleep for 12 hours during the day.  Westerly flight to the USA do not adopt this procedure.

Why on earth does the airline act in this ridiculous way?  My cynical guess is that it keeps passengers from making too many demands on the cabin crew.

Also, the in-flight "entertainment" consisted of a few children's films and some awful science fiction.  Dreadful.

title: Nice flight, good service.
review_text: good flight, good service, of course few space for legs, but better than many other companies. Food acceptable, good entertainement..

title: Best airline ever
review_text: JAL is the best airlines I have ever flown.  The level of service surpasses every single US based airline.  The cabin crewwas so attentive to our special diet needs as well as to my 7 yr old daughter.  The only downside is that they partner with American Airlines, so when the international leg of the flight is over and you transfer to domestic, the level of service basically goes away.

title: Pure Japanese Hospitality
review_text:
Our first trip to Japan & we flew JAL & I'm so glad we did. Check-in was seamless & easy. Our Japanese experience commenced as soon as we boarded the plane being greeted in Japanese & quickly given a lovely warm hand towel. 

On the way over we got bulkhead seats allowing lots of leg room but even on the return in a normal seat the seats were still comfy with good leg room offered. The meals were tasty & filling, often having choices between Japanese or western food & snacks. Personally I was happy to dive straight into Japanese flavours & cuisine. 

Service was fantastic with nothing being a problem for the extremely professional staff. I found the choices of movies & entertainment good as well. The dimming of the cabins after our meals was great allowing a peaceful rest if so desired. Staff assisted me in learning some key Japanese phrases & pronunciation, which I was really grateful for. 

We look forward to travelling to Japan again in the future & will not hesitate to go with JAL. Great flight, great service, great food & very friendly staff. Thank-you

title: Comfortable.
review_text: Excellent service at the airport and in flight. Kind attention even in small details. Free wi-fi is another plus.

title: IN THIS CENTURY, AN AIRLINE THAT TRYS THEIR BEST.
review_text:
2 Stewardess speaks English, with the Director of cabin attendants division but the young
ladies except the director was very afraid to answer important sensitive questions regarding food ingredients. I must say service is fine but the quality of ingredients for food served are not MADE IN JAPAN. what meaning does this kind of choices means for JAL ???.Not promoting own country's products or just saving cost or simply blind to the fact that passengers have no say ???.

title: Clean, comfortable and great flight attendants
review_text: The legroom was actually better than the American Airlines 787 we took on the return trip to the USA from Narita.  We felt the cabin overall was clean, especially the bathroom was very clean on a very long flight. Kudos to the flight attendants for constantly maintaining cleanliness of the bathrooms - I don't think any other airlines' flight crew do this and it is really appreciated. I wish other US carriers could be more attentive to such details as well.  Overall flight attendants were very kind, patient and pleasant - as a customer, it made us feel we could reciprocate to be respectful as well.

title: Excellent Service
review_text: I flew Tokyo from BC several times by JAL and appreciated   the excellent service, food, entertainment and cleanliness on this international route.  I tried the domestic  route from Narita to Fukuoka and found their services standard as good as international route specifically Tsuchiya, the stewardess

title: Will not fly JAL again
review_text:
Have flown many airlines in 46 years
But never one that will not let y pre book your seats if you're coach ticket does not have a certain designator. 

Not allowed to choose a seat nor even allowed to seek out a seat from JAL Reservations in the US,

They should note that at the time of your acceptance of a booking as well as all internet companies selling a JL ticket that you cannot reserve a seat until day of boarding , if your ticket designator blocks y from a pre reserved seat designation because of price .

Buyer Beware

title: Excellent😊
review_text: Great service, comfortable seats, 2 meals plus snacks, free entertainment, movies and games, free luggage check in for each passenger 50lbs each. Crew so pleasant, hot towels , foods was served with real utensils! All our needs were taken care of, including tooth brush, socks and tooth paste.

title: Pampered even in Economy Class
review_text: The Japanese know how to treat well their customers. It was a long flight and usually we get tired and bored during so many hours inside an airplane. But the JAL's crew didn't want us to get bored and they were coming all the time to offer something to drink or to eat. Even during the night, they would pass in the aisles very silently with a tray with water or juice, just in case you were awaken and wanted to drink something. The meals were very tasty and very fulfilling, even if I was flying Economy. The crew was very solicitous and always smiling. It was a great flight.

title: Quintessentially Japan
review_text: Have been flying with them all the time, never been disappointed with their attentive services. Their services are getting better considering their competition with ANA. Sushi served at their First Class Lounge in NRT is one of the best lounge foods.

title: Culture of country
review_text: Very polite, good service, clean and not too expensive cost. Will choice again if have a chance. Narita airport are nice to look around, but business waiting room are poor.

title: My preferred airline
review_text:
This is my preferred airline and I am also JAL mileage collector so I always chose this airline over others where they fly if not my preference will be one of the one world member's airline. 

Usually good on-time departure/arrive to the destination. Easy check in. Unlike others very generous baggage allowance too and usually connect well for domestic flights or other international connection flights. 

In flight service: great selection of movies, games, music from personal screen in front of your seats. Good selection of complimentary beverages are always helpful for long flight. 

Business Class: seat is exceptional and personalized attention to detail service is fantastic. They even come to your seat and make a bed with real good quality pillow and comforter, not to mention food & drink selection, quality, quantity are perfect! 

Economy Class: 
Functional well designed seats (USB charger, bottled water holder, etc), good polite service (not like many of Nothing American Airlines....there are no bad attitude to the guests). However, I feel quality of service and quantity of food has gone done slightly  compare to previous years (I use this airline 4+/yrs for last 20+yrs).

There were few incidents that encounter over the years with them, but at the end they usually make it right for the guests and overall still consider good flight experience. 

I have no hesitation recommending this airline.

title: Japanese efficiency and subtle charm
review_text: We have flown this route (actually it's 2 flights with a stopover in Nikita - hotel accommodation included in ticket) 5 times over the last decade and have found it a perfect way to make such a long trip from Australia. The flight from Sydney to Tokyo is under 9 hours and a Business class or premium economy ticket gets you into the QANTAS lounge in Sydney and the Sakura Lounge in Nikita (Tokyo). After a good night's sleep in one of the airport hotels, and a leisurely start to the next day, the Nikita-Paris flight is 12 hours, flying with the sun, so you arrive in the afternoon Paris time and, if you can force yourself to stay awake for a few more hours, usually you can get another good night's sleep and wake early to start your holiday. JAL offer both western and Japanese meals and the food is excellent, portion sizes are just right (not too big) and you can eat as much or as little as you want as they do a set meal, and then have an anytime menu. The staff are all lovely - so polite and charming. The seating pods are comfortable and, if you're lucky enough to score a window seat, they are completely private when you raise the screen between seats. In business class they stretch out completely flat and there are mattress pads, blankets, cardigans etc available. They usually have a good range of movies and games.

title: Japan Airlines Excellent Service and Comfort as Usual
review_text:
You’ve seen those headlines.  Passengers bribed, coerced, beaten and dragged off of planes, people sitting on the runway for hours on endless delays, kids and babies booted off seats that were paid for, etc.  This type of thing would be unimaginable for a service-oriented country and culture like Japan.  They’d probably commit seppuku before being portrayed in the media in any of the above incidents I kid you not.  Just look walk into a Starbucks, McDonalds, or any store, supermarket in Tokyo.  Excellent service is common in Japan from the low to high end.

Japan Airlines comparatively is more than competent.  Boarding and exiting is well organized in a low key manner.  The staff greet and thank you as you embark and disembark.  The seats are not squeezed in to maximize profits as it cuts off circulation for people over 6ft.  Food is awesome with some local flavor dishes minus the third meal on long flights that is a more a snack (99c hotdogs for me), the attendants are all smiles and attentive asking if you need blankets pillows, extra snacks & drinks.  Long periods cooped up in a confined space is much more bearable with good movies, tv selection or just play games on your own iPad or Nintendo Switch.

Overall Japan Airlines is a rare beacon of light in today’s airline industry one that still treats its customers well coupled with the Japanese propensity for service it’s a win.

title: Bangkok to JFK
review_text: As good as it gets in Economy class. Flight crew maintained a constant smile and was very helpful. Unfortunately, after I got to JFK, I had to fly JetBlue to Jacksonville. They were terrible! They made the cabin freezing cold and then wanted to charge $5 for a blanket! and they MAKE you watch advertising the whole flight unless you RENT headphones to watch movies!

title: No blinds on the windows! But effective new method!
review_text: Great flight. Great food and able to catch up on movies I have missed. Would fly again!! Cabin was very comfortable and first time I have experienced the windows that don't have blinds but have the tint adjust. Surprisingly this was very effective and I was able to catch some zzzz's as well. Love technological advances.

title: Seamless service in a new revamped  787
review_text: I have a theory , always fly the airline  of the country I flew Japan airlines from JFK to Tokyo on the beautiful 787. The interior was stunning with low lighting ,tinted windows that dimmed as to adjust time zones replaced by the standard shades . The super comfortable  sky seat was like a cubicle with flat beds and  a big tv monitor. Partitions went up automatically. I never saw my neighbor the entire flight . It was like a private little room .I ordered the Japanese dinner which was superb and the highest end sake . The fight  attendants  were young and impeccable. My one complaint was the bar which only had half a bottle of wine a bottle ,water and some crackers. The entertainment system should add more english movies .over all excellent ! I almost didn't want to get off the 16 hour flight!!

title: Great choice from Bangkok to Hawaii
review_text: This was our first trip to Hawaii from Bangkok and we were thankful that JAL made the  trip pleasurable and with very reasonable and competitive fares.  Business class check in was smooth and the lounge in Bangkok was excellent, unlike the lounge for the national airline which is always over crowded.  The first leg to Narita took about 6 hours, with a 3 hour transit which was perfect to get down and stretch our legs, and it was another 7 hours to Honolulu.  Narita airport is a fun place to walk around, do some shopping for snacks and have a delicious meal.  But the food in the plane was high quality as well and offered Japanese, of course, as a choice.  Most importantly, I found the service by the air hostesses to be excellent.  There were no male stewards (I'm not complaining), and I'm thinking perhaps it's a Japanese culture reason.  Inflight entertainment was good, with decent choices of new movies.  No problems at all checking thru our bags to our final destination and upon arrival our bags arrived at the baggage claim without issue.  Overall, I would definitely fly JAL again.

title: SS6 Comfortable Economy Class Seat
review_text: Even if economy class,  a seat of SS6 was very comfortable.  A seat size of 86 cm pitch long and 48 cm wide is larger than other airlines.. Before and during boarding,  I was satisfied with staffs' service.

title: Happy with service and food
review_text: The plane was very clean and fresh smelling. Stewardesses were professional, polite and friendly. In-flight entertainment was good. In one of our domestic flights, there was free wifi. The food was very tasty and they catered to my partner's dietary needs well. They did rounds to make sure we were well hydrated. Toilets were quite clean too. The seats were comfortable and the legroom was sufficient on both international and domestic flights. Only thing I don't understand is why our luggage did not go straight to Sapporo. We had to remove our luggage at Haneda, and check it in again for Sapporo.

title: Comfortable seats
review_text: Very comfortable flight with attentive cabin crew. The breakfast was appalling breakfast. I could see what they were trying to do with a different type of breakfast burger but by the time it had been heated and served it was just horrible to look at and to eat. As a general rule just don't eat airline food.

title: Comfort and excellence
review_text: Made this flight last October. This was a very comfortable flight. Ample space and service was excellent. Food outstanding and you could choose different courses. In short a pleasurable experience.

title: Setting and maintaining high standards of service
review_text:
As a frequent traveller on the Paris-Tokyo route, I favor JAL over ANA and AF, mostly for the consistency of their service quality, which I have experienced in business, premium and economy class. It is not flawless but dependably satisfactory, meeting expectations in each class of service.
Seating is comfortable, food and beverages are tasty and servings are just right.
Drink refills and tray removal can be slow at times, but staff is usually courteous and gracious.
The size and quality of audio selections are a plus, even though English descriptions are scarce. Video/movies/special programs are abundant and wide-ranging.

title: Excellent service, great food and comfort
review_text: I have flown JAL to Canada and back several times now and am never disappointed. The new dreamliner is comfortable as are the other planes flying this route. Boarding procedures are efficient, well organised and on time.  Cleanliness of public areas is superb, I am especially happy that the toilets are kept in really good condition for the duration of the flights.  Staff are consistently helpful and friendy, the meals are very good and the Japanese menu offers a lighter but filling meal suited to time spent in a seat.   My only minor gripe is that the entertainment available is limited compared to some other airlines I have used but this is not a reason not to choose JAL.  I thoroughly recommend this airline.

title: Great BC experience
review_text: We flew BC from BNE>HKG>NRT-NRT>SYD>BNE in May and I have to say it was me of my favourite flights yet. Attention to detail is great, we slept well and arrived refreshed in both destinations. My husband has flown BC from BNE thru to BOS via Japan on many occasions also and can't fault them.

title: Great Service!
review_text: Hadn't flown with JAL in a while and I finally flew with them again during my recent trip and I wasn't disappointed. The flight attendants were polite and service was good! Airplane food usually isn't something to be raved about, but I thought the food onboard was quite good.

title: good flight
review_text:
Its my first time to fly JAL and it was very good all in all.

Seat was comfortable with good space.  The entertainment (TV) has plenty of channels and movies to choose from.  Food was great! The flight attendant was okay.  Didn't encounter any rude or unfriendly ones.

Minor negative factors were the rough touchdown when we arrived at tokyo (Narita).  I am not sure if weather played a role with it.  And another one was that my miles (asiamiles) weren't credited for the flights.  After checking the ticket type, it should have earn miles.  I didn't report it via missing miles anymore because the process was a bit tedious.

Overall, I would definitely consider booking with this airline again especially for flights going to Japan.

title: Exceptional Service
review_text: Everything about this airline is meticulously superior to any US flagged carrier--the customer service at the gate; the service during the flight; the number of flight attendants; the food quality; the attention to details that focus on passenger comfort.  One prime example: there were disposable toothbrushes and toothpaste available in the lavatories. On a flight that lasts 14 hours, that is a very welcome amenity

title: Japanese efficiency and Japanese cleanliness
review_text: In the usual Japanese style the flight boarded on time, the boarding process was calm, easy and efficient. We departed exactly on time and the flight was the most comfortable short haul domestic economy flight that I think I have ever had in 40 years of flying. Leg room was excellent even for a 190 cm plus passenger. The seats were comfortable and the plane was clean and even the floor was spotless. We even had free WiFi. Unfortunately the flight was too short to enjoy all the luxuries of the flight. I normally hate flying but I really enjoyed this flight.

title: getting worse than before
review_text: I booked my flight   by my mileage account,  from website of JAL,but wrong name is on my ticket that  I received before boarding.....it's so dangerous...

title: Will fly again!
review_text: The service was great and the plane itself felt bigger than most I have been on before. Will for sure fly Japan Airlines again. Bathrooms were really clean.

title: Beware Your Bike Box!
review_text:
This is JAL you're talking about so (IMO), you're almost never going to have any serious qualms about the level of attention and care in their service. The movies were up to date, I managed to snag an exit row seat, and the food was good (but not very filling for me). One minor quip - I watched the "English" version of The Minions movie in...Spanish - something was wrong with the system there! 

Finally, they were pretty strict about the dimensions of my bike box - just a smidge over the 203CM - and I wound up paying JPY10,000. I usually "get away" with it but these people play by the rules :)

title: Tokyo to Sydney Premium Economy
review_text:
Overnight flight to Sydney.  Boarded last together with other economy class passengers... 
Premium economy seats are slightly wider than economy.  Seats are in a shell, so can slide forward, but not completely.  Just a little bit more and it would have been a comfortable flight.  Couldn't get any sleep as we got seats next to the restrooms that flushes noisily.  Food was same as economy.  Premium economy gets champagne.  Choice of entertainment was OK.  Flight attendants very attentive.

title: Pleasant Flight
review_text: It's quite a pleasant trip with JAL, from check-in, boarding, cabin cleanness, crew curtesy to food flavor. The only thing annoying is high frequency of flight announcement (in 3 or 4 languages).

title: Skyhigh
review_text: My wife & I flew from Boston to Tokyo, and then on the next day to Sydney, the service on both flights was excellent. The staff were so courteous and looked after us well. I had flown on the Dreamliner's before and never cease to be impressed by their smooth flying and fast service between destinations. Certainly would not hesitate to fly with them again.

title: Tokyo - Honolulu is the best service route of this airline
review_text:
Seat was good and the space was reasonably wide. TV screen was large ans I could enjoy the movies.
Food was also good far better than JL002 fly to San Francisco. 
A pair of mules was also equipped which was not for JL002 to SFO. 
Since it was high season, the ticket price was extremely expensive.

title: Best Service
review_text: Have flown Premium Eco with a number of airlines, the whole experience from ease of booking to pre flight and in flight service was the best by far. The only minor gripe was that the seat was a little firm, but with the seat "Capsules" you weren't disturbed by the person in front or behind reclining their seat as it all happened within their capsule, it more than made up for the firmness of the seat. Changing flights we were only charged A$100.00 each, but this was our choice, so considering what some of the "low cost" airlines charge, it wasn't too bad. Ticket price was very competitive- in fact cheapest at the time. For us flying this way to Europe is the best when you consider the time spent in the air to get to your destination as compared other routes. Efficiency of cabin staff and cleanliness of plane and Japan in general is very good.

title: Flight to Japan
review_text:
Happy with Japan Airlines although we're not impressed with the mandatory stop over in Tokyo.
The flight itself  was good with comfortable seats & good service. The food was a bit hit and miss. 
What we were not happy about was the hotel we were taken to on the way to Europe....it was very ordinary. On purchasing our tickets we were advised the stopover included dinner. Bed & breakfast plus transfers. Upon arrival at the hotel we were advised no meals were included.....reception staff were helpful & phoned the airline to no avail. I eventually had to speak to the airline and after much discussion they reluctantly agreed to cover meal costs. All this took around an hour to sort out & was quite annoying.  We still have had no reply from Japan Airlines as to why this happened.

title: Comfortable and relaxed
review_text:
I could reserve exit row seats for my wife and me where we did really enjoy our stay in the flight.
Smile of cabin attendants added our stay more comfortable.

title: Everything is great
review_text: You can feel that everything is crafted with Japanese Zen style. Service is very good, I will take JAL into priority when fly to Japan.

title: Its was one of the most enjoyable flight i have taken
review_text: The stewardess are very friendly with a lot of complimentary offerings to make your flight the most enjoyable.

title: Slightly Better than Others.
review_text: The overall flight experience is above average. Especially in premium economy. Is it that much better than other international flights, that is debatable. My upcoming trip to Japan is going to be on delta airline. Package price became a consideration. Premium economy is my choice.

title: Japan Airlines economy class was better than business class on some other airlines.
review_text: The flight attendants provided personal business class service to their economy class customers.  The food was also better than I have experienced on some business class flights.

title: Solid Service
review_text: The cabin crew were reliably helpful and spoke excellent English. Their service was efficient and quick. The food quality was medium to good, depending on what was ordered. I had the Asian vegetarian meals, which were fine but not good enough to look forward to. The regular meals seemed more appetizing. The selection of films was excellent. The flight departed and arrived on time. I would definitely recommend this airline.

title: One of the best economy class
review_text:
JAL was one of the very few airlines that provided metal cutlery and serviette that was large enough to cover the thighs. The food was well prepared with salad, hot main and dessert. The service was good and the seat had sufficient leg room. The rest rooms were cleaned regularly with supplies refilled.

As comparison, Cathay Pacific gave me a pie that passed the expiry date. Qantas' cutlery worked like toys that could not cut anything and the serviette was just slightly larger than a tissue paper. For Air Canada I became hungry 3 hours after the main meal (luckily I got a lot of snacks with me). 

But you need to be careful about one thing with JAL - do not choose the flight with connecting domestic flight provided by Jetstar. Not only you need to pay for everything (drinks, snacks) on board of Jetstar, the choices were limited and the service was below satisfaction.

title: Excellent service, way better than airlines in US.
review_text:
Japan airlines make details count, from boarding the plane, finding your seat with, eye mask, sandals, noise cancelling headphones (I am talking about Economy seat!!). The flight departed on time. If you fall asleep while the serve the food, you will find a sticker in front of you telling you to call the attendants when you wake up so you can get your food.
Lavatory had tooth brushes available and cotton swaps. So next time I have an intercontinental flight I will make sure I look for Japan airlines or anything else rather than airlines in US.

title: Great airline !
review_text: We flew on the new dream liner 787 - 8 series. The seats were standard business seats but very comfortable. We chose the Japanese food option. It was great!  The service offered by cabin crew was excellent! I can highly recommend this airline to any travelers.

title: Flew on JAL to Tokyo Narita.
review_text:
Outbound to Narita was 787 Dreamliner and inbound on 777.  Although the Dreamliner is a much newer plane I much preferred the 777 as it is definitely more spacious and comfortable.  I didn't quite like the way the seat reclines in comparison to the conventional seats on the 777 apart from the wider seats on the 777.
Much have been said in forums about the less dry cabin conditions but on this approx. 7 hr flight it would not have been an issue. However I have to say the dreamliner is a much quieter plane and more high tech. Although the 777 is obviously older the condition is  still good.   
In terms of person to person contact experience I would say JAL is very good from the word go - checking in was pleasant enough on both ends.  Cabin service was also very good.

title: Good flight
review_text:
Took a flight from SIN to JFK with a 1 hr stop over in HND. Was initially concerned that I could not make the flight if the gates were far apart. On that day, we just had to go up the escalator and the new gate was there. Whew!
On the flight staff left snacks at the galley along with bottles of water (during the overnight portion). Snacks were nicer than the meals they served (too dry).

title: Economy space better than  expected, but seat just had the wrong shape
review_text:
While it is clear that the airline had upgraded it's seats in economy to provide more space, the lumbar was permanently fixed in a position that I could not bear for the long flight.  Then I needed to fly from Tokyo to Singapore.  This was a very uncomfortable round trip journey on the same style of aircraft.
All other aspects of the flight were perfectly fine.

title: First time on JAL
review_text: I chose JAL simply because of its schedule.  We had not travelled on JAL before as we are usually quite faithful to Qatar or SIA. Therefore we did not have high expectations for JAL Economy class. Imagine our delight when the service was excellent! The staff were pleasant and efficient.  Best of all, the food was of exceptionally high quality!  The servings were large, the menu was varied  and the salads were fresh -- better than most other airlines in Economy class. We will definitely fly JAL again!

title: Amazingly attentive and polite crew and service to match.
review_text:
From the moment you board the flight you are greeted by warm and attentive crew. In typical Japanese style the proffessional manner in which you are greeted and taken care of is simply the best that I have experienced on any airline. The business class seat is private and comfortable. Try to avoid the middle seat as my partner found it rather "boxed in".
Your ability to order using your personal seat device makes it much easier and your meal is prepared and served prompty. I would fly JAL long haul when ever I can!

title: Hospitable as only the Japanese can
review_text: We flew Boston-Tokyo (Narita) on a 787 and Tokyo-Singapore on a 767. Both flights on business class were excellent with the famed Japanese hospitality in evidence. A comfortable mattress was provided for sleeping on the flat bed but no pajamas. I was in the window seat, with complete privacy,;but the space lacks storage surfaces. Vegetarian cuisine was average and in-flight entertainment was not as good as some other carriers.

title: good service and good F&B
review_text: JAL's business class is always better than the average of all airlines, especially F&B, attendants' attitude, seat comfort as well as cleanness.

title: Excellent service
review_text: The service from the time we checked in until we arrived at Narita was excellent. Really enjoy flying with JAL.

title: Timely, Courteous, great flying experience
review_text: JAL has great staff, from check in to baggage pickup.  Flight attendants are great, service conscious and always super courteous.  Airplane is a 787, great plane to fly with comfortable seating.  Seats are fixed,(reclining is within the shell), flight has on board wifi as well as adjustable table trays.   Only nuisance is difficulty with internet check in and seat selection.  However, check in clerks were great in making adjustment since I wanted seats, side by side.  Another issue might be heavy use of Japanese language, with more English/korean might be considered.  However, I would use JAL again.

title: Premium Economy Sydney to Tokyo
review_text: From start to finish, we were very happy customers. In Sydney we were able to take full use of the Business Lounge at Qantas as part of our ticket price, which was excellent and full use of the business lounge in Tokyo before our flight home. As is typical with Japanese people, we were shown kindness and care during our flight. I love the warm, moist towels to clean your hands before meals and the attention of the flight stewards was really appreciated. Nothing is too much trouble. The food was good for airline meals and the plane was very clean. We loved our flight and Japan so much we re booked to go back there again two weeks after arriving home!!

title: Excellent flight - Logan connection tricky, due to the airport
review_text: I actually had two other flights with JAL during the course of my trip, and they were all excellent. The only issue was the international->domestic connection (AA) at Boston's Logan airport, where it was unclear that we were to drop off our bags after clearing customs at this side counter, that seemingly was marked for airlines other than AA and JL. It seems Logan does international to domestic connections differently than other airports (other airports have an obvious baggage recheck place). They did have a list of people making connections and their baggage though, so presumably they were looking out for people.

title: Best flight
review_text:
Excellent flight and services
I am frequent flyer with Japan Airline and have enjoyed travelling with them several times a year. I would definitely recommend them without any hesitation. 
Food, beverages, drinks, hospitality, and flight check-in are excellent.

title: Almost perfect in many ways
review_text: Flight was delayed flying with American Airline from LAX , but attendants are very helpful in transiting and gave airport restaurants voucher due to the delay.  Feeling welcome and appreciated.

title: Excellent flight and Service
review_text: Excellent flight, excellent service by attendants, good food warm and fresh. They are on time or landing early. Passengers are treated with the highest regard. Fares are reasonable and overall, JAL is comparable to Cathay-Pacific and Singapore Airlines, and much much better than Emirates for food and service. We go to Indonesia every year. This has become our airline of choice after flying Emirates, Singapore, Cathay-Pacific, and United.

title: I love JAL Premium Economy
review_text: It's well worth the extra money to fly this route in PE. The seats are great, the service is fantastic, AND you get lounge access!

title: Comfortable seats; Good food; Excellent Service
review_text: Very pleased with JAL.  Easy checking in and lounge available for business class passengers.  Flight personnel very attentive.  Food very good and both Asian and Western menus available.  Seats can be adjusted to lie flat so comfortable for 12 hour flight.

title: Always great service!
review_text: Myself and family always fly with Japan airlines between Vancouver and Japan after several sub-par experiences with Air Canada 10+ years ago. Since then, we are nothing but pleased with the level of customer service from booking/inquiries to the staff on board. Japan Airlines makes flying long haul economy bearable and often times enjoyable! Meals offered are often more than adequate in taste and portion size. Would highly recommend this airline

title: A Little Skimpy On Cocktails In Business Class
review_text: Not to generalize, but I've noticed that many of the Asian airlines tend to be a little skimpy on their cocktail service. Small pours and it's quicker to go back to the galley and ask. That said, the seats were comfortable, but not true lie-flat beds (angle flat). The great food with a lovely presentation. Decent in-flight-entertainment system with enough English language titles to keep me amused.

title: Great flight experience
review_text: When I first purchased the ticket through the AA website, I didn't realize it was a codeshare with JAL until a few days before my trip, when I was reviewing my travel paperwork. Having flown through Narita in the past, I expected the long flight to be an ordeal to forget about, and nothing more - instead, I was quite pleasantly surprised by the excellent service and equipment. There was more than enough leg room (which I often have trouble with), the food was great, and the in-flight entertainment offerings made the trip much more enjoyable than I could have anticipated. I would definitely recommend flying JAL!

title: nice service, super friendly FA, I do really like their angel smiles.
review_text: Nice service, Udon noodles are delicious, champagne is wonderful. Super friendly FA, I do really like their angel smiles. Spacious seat for average person.

title: Passable, nothing wrong with them just could be better knowing the others are trying
review_text:
My first time flying with them on this route. As expected, their service, amenities and food are solid but not to the point where impressed. Considering them usually getting rated higher than many others, I expected more. 

Their seating arrangements, the type of Jet, all normal, but not A380. Flight attendants weren't as attentive as they used to be.

title: Good service, loooooong flight and layovers
review_text: My wife and I, veteran travelers (40 nations), decided to tour Vietnam (Viet Nam, the real name) and a bit of Cambodia (Siem Reap, Angkor Wat, ...).  We looked at options, including using our 42,000 FF miles on American.  The price to fill in to 65,000 mile each on American was stunning, so we picked JAL.  We also know that Asian airlines are noted for better service, and it proved true again.  We had a code-share flight ELP-LAX, a six-hour layover (it's good we had United Club coupons from our son and his wife), 9.5 hours to TKO, 2 hours in TKO, and 5 hours to HAN.  All the reservations, check-ins, and flights went very well.  In TKO we took a break to make block prints of Hiroshige's famous wave picture.  On the way home, ee retraced our route, this time with a 10-hour layover in TKO (Oof!  Again, we had United Club coupons).  We had one interesting episode, trying to get from what I recall was terminal 3 in TKO to terminal 2, to get to the United Club for about 6 hours before returning to terminal 3.  Were we officially in transit on the inter-terminal bus and not entering Japan?  It took about 4 officials of various levels to figure out that it was OK...and it was the shuttle-bus driver who made the decision!  Again, the flights were all fine.

title: Long flight made tolerable
review_text: Tokyo to Boston is a 14 hour flight. I am 6'4". I flew economy. This is a recipe for disaster. Fortunately, Japan Airlines makes this flight eminently tolerable. The 787 is a great plane to fly! The legroom was sufficient, the food was plentiful and tasty, the entertainment options were varied. Most of all, the flight attendants are extremely accommodating. Why can't US airlines provide the same level of comfort that foreign airlines provide.

title: Overseas flight
review_text:
The flight with United was smooth, very attentive flight attendants. Beds were comfortable and food was superb.
Ditto for JAL. I would fly with both airlines again and again

title: Not keen on going back to Japan via Haneda
review_text:
This is something that really put me off from travelling back to Japan especially via Haneda: the flight was un-memorable with that cabin crew simply looking at your face as if saying 'maybe if I go away you will stop asking me something' and I could not wait from leaving that kind of environment.  Worse, as I was flying Business class on an almost empty flight which was delayed, I could not believe when reaching Haneda airport (although being the first to leave the flight and reach security) I witnessed lots of people (could not understand if they were Japanese or from nearby countries) who were joining the security queues together with friends, thus coming in front of me from what was originally an empty queue.  I moved queues 3 times, as this kept occurring, and I did not want to travel at midnight in a new city which I did not know.

The security guys kept asking people to open their suitcases - as if expecting to find diamond rocks!!!!!!! - and asked me the same then kept patting my 10kg suitcase (as I tend to travel very minimalistic everywhere) and only stopping when he reached my underwear bag!!!!!!  I could not believe these people are so intrusive, and worse, the security guy (a very tall, slim guy in his '30s) asked a tiny Japanese girl to check my body.  I said that I do not mind to check my there, in front of everybody, so she decided to pat my body absolutely EVERYWHERE!!!!  I was shocked as this did not happen to me in any other part of the world - worse than security people in third world countries!!!!

I told this story to so many people and not one single person told me of a similar experience - clearly this show that 'important security guy' wanted to warm himself up by telling this kind of story and 'what he is capable of doing at work'!!!!

This was truly shocking and sickening to me, no wonder it put me off from ever returning to Japan.  Should this airline move their hub to a different location, I might consider visiting Tokyo again as no woman would want to encounter such rude, un-civilised and primitive people with such huge issues at work affecting people who simply travel the world thus contributing to the economy of that country!!!

title: Great staff, great food, great seat, great experience
review_text:
Flew for the first time in JAL business class. Although it was just a short flight of little more than 3 hours, the experience was very very good. 
The flight attendants are, as in typical Japanese service, very attentive to details and very courteous to the passengers. The food was one of the best business class meals I have had in a while. Although the seat was not the newest lay-flat type, but it didn't matter for our short flight. 
In all, a very memorable experience and will surely fly JAL again in the near future.

title: Comfortable Economy Experience
review_text: Having flown economy in various other international airlines on trans-continental flights, Leg Space and Seat Wdth in JAL seems to be best-in-class. Food choices could have been better, and their code share with AA doesn't translate to the same levels of comfort in AA economy. Overall, a good flying experience.

title: Attentive Staffs, Spacious Room
review_text:
The title says it all. 
This is the first time for me flying with Japan Airlines, and definetely will not be the last. 

Their stewardess are courteus, and so keen on serving its passangers. I never had a flight where the steward go round and round offering different kinds of drinks each hour during the flight. I think, Japanese culture is essential in JAL and we can see it directly on how we are served. 

Their economy class is on of the moat spacious for boeing. It was like flying with Airbuss 😊

Great experience and very reasonable price!

title: Leg room!
review_text: Even in economy class, JAL offers more leg rooms than any other airlines. I was surprised by how comfortable the seats were and very attentive service flight crews provided. Food is nice and unique. They offered some local delicacy on our flight. I would certainly fly with JAL again and highly recommend to others.

title: Overnight flight from Narita - Great service, great plance
review_text: Great service again from JAL. Very attentive staff, food selection is great, flight was great.  Toilets are spacious.  Seat in Premium economy is great, plenty of room.  Would fly JAL again.

title: Dreamliner is a great plane, very roomy, service great
review_text: Dreamliner is a great place, plenty room, service is great,  Movie selection was good.  Food was great, loved the Mos Burger for breakfast, a little strange but still nice.  Great airline with great service. Wouldn't hesitate to fly again on JAL.

title: Great flight
review_text: Great direct flight from CDG to Haneda, clean airplane, cost me only 750 euros not expensive if you compare with the prize of ANA and AF in this route.The food was good, personal cabin very nice. I watched great recent movies...The seat was confortable, I'm only 1m81 so I didn't have any problem concerning the legroom. I will fly again with this airlines.

title: Excellent!
review_text: On an extremely long flight it is important that you feel comfortable - and on our 13 hour flight from Chicago to Narita we felt just that. The flight attendants were very accommodating and spoke excellent English. The seats in the economy class were comfortable and spacious. It was nice that JAL gives their passengers free pillows, blankets, headphones, and complimentary meals, considering most other airlines make you pay for such things. The in flight movie selections were excellent. They had wonderful vegan meals provided to my boyfriend and I at no extra charge. Overall a very positive experience, I look forward to flying with JAL on my return to Japan next year!

title: Fantastic airline
review_text: One of the best airlines I have travelled with!  Their flight attendants are one of the most friendliest around!  We were well looked after on our flights.  Nothing was too much for them and they went out of their way for my daughter.  My daughter wasn't too keen on her kids meal, the attendant noticed this and made another meal especially for her.  The food was tasty and beautifully presented.  The seat was very comfy.  Would definitely fly with them again!

title: In a real crisis, how would this flight attendant react ....
review_text:
No no no said the flight attendant in the galley,backing away from me with her arms crossed ( meaning no) I actually said " don't panic" because of her actions and the look on her face. Her backward steps took her to the end of the galley where another female attendant appeared.They spoke in their native tongue , with the initial attendant voice being high pitched and indicating by arm and hand gestures ,a  person injecting themselves into the arm joint .I was distressed ,what had I done ? Here am I , a 68 year old bald short man who has a history of blood clots and I had just injected myself with clexane ,a blood thinner in accordance with medical advice, on long distance flights .I recapped the needle in the toilet ,stepped out and asked the flight attendant whether they have a needle disposal container , with the capped needle lying in the palm of my hand. I couldn't believe it.Another  flight attendant also in the galley , then looked up at the fuss, responded very politely that they cannot take needles , would I like a plastic bag .I  declined but told him I am a long term recreational traveller and am really distressed at how the attendant responded.
I put a comment on JAL face book page but they have deleted it .This could be a safety issue .The attendant's  training or the attendant needs to be reviewed- how would she react in a real crisis!
