When I said I would report the matter and wished to left alone for the last 4 hours of the flight .This was not complied with- I was approached in my seat , whilst in the aisle waiting to disembark,I said leave me alone but another attendant approached me dispite my protests  walking up the air bridge with me .when I ignored her and again said leave me alone ,she approached my travelling companion who is Japanese about my concerns- shocking.  This is both a possible safety issue as well as the manner a passenger  was  treated and thereafter in my opinion harassed when I said I would report the matter. Really really disappointing and distressing at the time.I went to JAL comments/ complaints section .They say in effect , they may not reply , they may reply after a short period , ,if they do reply the reply is copyrighted to JAL  so here is my experience of JAL business class

title: Always a pleasant airline to fly with
review_text: I have flown on and off with Japan Airlines for many years, staff is always courteous and professional. The planes are new and clean. Food and entertainment are usually what you expect from a good international airline. Snacks are laid out for customers to help themselves. What I'm most impress is the amount of legroom that you get even if you are in economy class. This says a lot when the rest of the industry is trying to get by with as little space as they could. Always a pleasant experience with them.

title: A great option between Sydney and East Coast USA
review_text:
This was my first experience of both JAL and premium economy. It covers 4 sectors - SYD-NRT, NRT-JFK and return

Check-in: priority bag drop for online checkin, but PE has priority itself

The Aircraft: 777-300 (3 sectors), 787-8 (one sector - NRT-JFK). Overall the 787 was quieter and more comfortable than the 777. The dimming windows on the 787 didn't block light fully, a problem on the south facing side of the aircraft trans-Pacific. On the 777, I understand PE is meant to share toilets with economy, but PE travelers used the Business class toilets immediately in front of PE. JAL has switched to 787-9 for SYD-NRT since March 2017

The seat(s): legroom is good (although still not quite stretch out and sleep for my 6'3"). Plenty of adjustment. Large tray table, although this is reduced for bulkhead seats due to the seat arm storage of both it and the video screen. 777 is 2-4-2, 787 2-3-2 seats across (economy is 3-3-3 and 2-4-2 respectively)

Lounge access: a real selling point for JAL PE. Access to quality lounges in Sydney (Qantas), Narita (Sakura Lounge) and JFK (Air France) in order of preference

Food and drink: interesting and tasty if you enjoy Japanese food. Certainly a cut above most economy offerings, even though PE is only a couple of add-ons. Champagne and shochu are PE specific, wine offerings average. Good range of soft drinks and beer. Normal barely drinkable economy and black tea as hot drinks, but also green tea and miso.

Service: Overall polite and attentive. Personal welcome by name as "head" of our family. My wife and I chose to sleep from boarding our final sector, and awoke to handwritten notes that our main meals were still available if wanted.

Entertainment: "JAL Moove - new sky entertainment" is the musical sting at the beginning of every.new.entertainment.episode. Aaargh! The selection is quite reasonable for adults and teens, less so for younger. Not extensive, but reasonable quality.

Summary: A very enjoyable experience. I've already booked JAL PE for SYD-NRT-BOS and return later this year :)

title: First class experience in Business
review_text: We had a good experience in the Air France lounge at CDG with good quality food and beverage. My husband had a nice shower prior boarding to freshen up after the ordeal of returning the car hire. BTW, please check the exact return location at CDG before driving there, as it's in terminal 1 and all international flights  depart from terminal 2, which requires a train transfer. An interesting observation of the flight was that all cabin crew were female on both legs. They were very polite, sweet and carried out their duties with charm and grace. I've fallen in love with the Dreamliner the first time I flew them on Royal Brunei a few years ago. The seats are so spacious and takes up the length of 3 windows! The monitor is large and the noise cancelling headphones are effective. The entertainment options were somewhat quite poor comparing to what Qantas and Cathay Pacific offer. The PA also is another area where they can improve on. I'm used to listening to Qantas, CX etc. cockpit crew more comprehensive announcement, and to struggle to hear a minimum need to know basis announcement was inadequate for me. Having said that, the food really made up for the shortcomings! This was by far the best Business class food we've had, and we have been flying BC on a few different airlines every year for the past 4-5 years. The Japanese menu offer, which I took came in a beautifully presented Bento box and everything was delicious! I would not normally eat twice when I fly, but I made an exception for this one after having read the menu. I was happy to wake up to the second offering, again from the Japanese menu. We also suffered minimal jet lag coming home, and I would attribute that to the Dreamliner environment, with extra amount of Oxygen, soft lighting and the light Japanese food. Will look forward to flying them again, perhaps on the direct route to and from Melbourne!

title: Very pleasant economy class!
review_text:
A short and very pleasant trip.

My wife, mother and I travelled from Busan to Tokyo earlier this year and it was our first flight on JAL. What a pleasant and easy surprise. I must admit that everything from the boarding to the staff and even the fellow passengers were so considerate and helpful.
My wife was pregnant at the time and everybody made a great fuss over her. 
The meals was basic, but palatable. The flight was smooth and the landing too!

Just a great overall experience for today's economy options.

I highly recommend the airline.

title: Roomy seats and lots of food
review_text: I have flown with JAL a few times now. The seats in economy are very roomy and there is plenty leg room, and I am a cuddly sort! The food is very good and there is plenty of it. The Flight Attendants leave out snacks and juice when they are having rests. The entertainment variety is not as good as other carriers but is adequate. I watched 5 films on the way out to Japan and on the way back I watched 5 films plus some short features about Japan. I had almost exhausted the film selection by then. The flight ran out of Diet Coke and they only gave a small plastic cup of drink at a time so make sure you take plenty of water on board. The crew are very friendly and helpful on board but the bag drop was very slow despite checking in online. One of the best airlines I have used but doesn't top 1 or 2 others.

title: JAL lives up to its name!
review_text:
My first time taking JAL and I loved it! I must say that it is the best medium haul economy class experience for me. Not only are the seats comfy, there is much more leg space compared to other airlines. I wished they had direct flights to Hokkaido instead of connecting flights. Was a bit of a hasdle having to pick up our luggages, clear immigration before heading to the domestic terminal. 

And I wish that the airlines website could be more user friendly. The look and feel seems a bit dated for a reputable airline.  

Fare was affordable and I managed to get a good price even though I booked my tickets quite last minute. 

No doubt JAL is the best economy class airlines!

title: Checkin counter is not well manage
review_text: I only have limited time to bag drop and there was no specific counter to bag drop for me. Running with rushing travelling is really not comfortable. Connecting flight without check through is the problem. Due to rushing from International Airport to Domestic flight, I don't even have a meal. And the flight only serving the drink without a snack.

title: First time flying with JAL, very good but not excellent
review_text: Night flight to Tokyo for next morning taking the domestic flight to Hokkaido. The leg room and space between the seat are big enough. The food is ok and miso soup only available from SG to TKyo and not available in return trip. The screen is high resolution and big. The service is good. But not outstanding things as I expected before taking JAL.

title: Good tentative service, but bad good planning
review_text:
Overall experience,,,just average.
Check in process was clumsy, on line didn't work due to tech issues. Airport check in was complicated and had to provide ticket number even with confirmed flight.
I sat on the business, seat was comfortable, but old. Side of my seat was taped up. Very shabby.
Ordered Japanese meal, even I was on the bulk head and ordered meal early, 15 minute later flight attendant told me they ran of Japanese meal. I guess Japanese guests have priority over non-Japanese. Very discriminatory, but not surprising. Entertainment system is average but big screen. wifi connection was good. Other carriers had better headphones. No USB changing option.
Tentative service throughout the flight. On demand meal was ok. Flight crew was friendly, but seems very routine and 
Decent selection of drinks.
I am not sure if I would fly JAL again since so many other carriers fly to Japan now.

Overall good flight with good service, but nothing that stands out against other Asian carriers.

title: Best flight and airline to date
review_text:
We travelled direct LHR - Tokyo (Haneda) with 2 children, superb service from the start with excellent food round the clock* (see below) with drinks and snacks and much more as and when required. The 11/12 hr flight felt like a few hours, no jet lag (both ways) excellent cabin crew standards, flight smooth, no issues with taking off or landing etc. 

Excellent entertainment system, check in very quick and efficient, Haneda airport excellent clean and organised, would recommend this airline and will use it again before others, hope this info is passed on to all staff who work for JAL as they should be very proud of the customer service delivered.

*Only criticism is the vegetarian food on the return flight and the confusion between what is suitable for vegetarians (eg rice crackers, Häagen Dazs). Also the gluten free and vegetarian meals were identical and the puddings were not as nice as the meat meals.

title: Flew from uk to Japan best flight ever
review_text:
Flight was delayed and they informed us straight away. 
Provided vouchers 
Good boarding schedule 
Very clean aircraft  
Very good entertainment and staff were great 
Food was great 
Will fly with them again

title: Providing services that go above and beyond travelers expectations
review_text: I travel often between USA and the Asia region and have had a few opportunities to take flight with JAL, member of the Oneworld Alliance. I purposely chose JAL over other air carriers serving between Tokyo-Narita Airport and Taipei Taoyuan Int’l Airport due to the positive experiences I had on-board its flights. From the time I was at the check-in counter to the time I waited at the gate for boarding and the use of its airport lounge, I observed that everything was carried out in orderly fashions by its highly trained professional and courteous staff. There was hardly any rush or chaotic moments observed at the JAL boarding gate area. In one occasion I observed in ICN (Seoul), the JAL staff workers were waiting behind the check-in counter for the clock to strike 12 noon, the scheduled time to open. Immediately after the clock reached 12, they all stood up, bowed to the queued passengers first and then started serving them. I was very impressed how much staff workers take their jobs seriously. My experiences with their services on-board have been extremely pleasant as well. For each flight I had taken, whether I was sitting in the main cabin or in the business class cabin I was treated like a VIP. Flight attendants always use both hands to offer their service items and then bow and thank you before they move on to their next tasks. In some occasions the flight attendants even got down from their standing positions to talk to me while I was sitting. For paying attention to the details: they kept themselves very busy, offered service items and checked frequently for the comforts of each passenger on-board. They checked and cleaned up the lavatory after each passenger has used it. They folded and shaped beginning roll of toilet paper to pointed down triangle and prepared the facility for the next user. The choices of the foods served are always at the high standards and presentations are elegant and artful. In my own opinion: the levels of the customer services, the professionalism and the attention to details by JAL are almost flawless. There are many ways to run a good business; JAL certainly knows the most important element is not about how to make profits; but rather, about how to provide utmost services to the travelers who choose and trust the company. TripAdvisor’s reviewers picked JAL as the 2017 Traveler’s Choice Award for many good reasons; but most of all is its commitment to serve at the highest satisfaction level. It has earned customers’ loyalty and reputations by ways of perfecting its services.  I salute to JAL for earning TripAdvisor’s prestigious award and felt honored to have been served by its flight crew and ground crew several times in the past 7 months.

title: Sydney to Tokyo Business
review_text:
I've travelled this route many times with JAL but noticed that the service and hospitality has slipped..  They now employ Thai cabin crew who are not as well trained, gracious nor are they as attentive as the Japanese.  Many times I wished they'd pick up my meal tray so I could read/sleep or just move about. They did not make any special arrangements for our child.  No child's meals were offered (you have to pre-book them) nor was there anything given to the child to make her journey more interesting. (No colouring book and pencils).
On this flight, our entertainment system didn't work and my husband's tray wouldn't fold away. As the flight was full, he could not change seats. Poor maintenance.
Having travelled this route many times, I've been looking forward to a menu change.  It's always "Japanese" or "Western" but with very little choice in either style.  I crave a change!
Nevertheless, their flight schedule saved the day.  I've never known an airline to leave late yet manage to arrive early, every time!

title: Great, friendly service
review_text: I have flown Japan Airlines for more than 10 times and never had a bad experience. Professional and courteous. I would prefer Japan Airlines every time I fly to south east Asia.

title: Return trip from the philippines
review_text: After flying JAL from Manila to Tokyo then Tokyo to Dallas the next day, all I can say is outstanding! Coach is as good as first class on some other airlines. Good Food, Leg room and friendly Flight Attendant's. I will always check with JAL before choosing a flight again. They can be a bit more expensive but it might be is worth it if it isn't too much more..

title: Unbelievable service
review_text: From the preflight bow by the crew before they boarded the plane till the final thank you, JAL manages to provide a level of service that is incomparable in the contemporary world.  So many airlines could learn lessons from this organization. The level of courtesy, professionalism, and polish of the cabin crew is simply beyond par.

title: Amazing airline
review_text:
I was very impressed with Japan Airlines. Knowing I had at long flight ahead of me, I did a lot of research and was very pleased with my choice. 

The counter staff both in the US and Japan were extremely courteous and friendly. Actually I can say that for all the JAL staff I encountered. At the end of the flight, the flightstaff came and thanled each passenger for choosing JAL.

Two meals and a handful of snacks were very adequate and filling. The meals were served warm and fresh with a good assortment of dishes.

The flight entertainment system had recently been upgraded. A good selection of videos both new and classics,  games, tv, radio. There was a usb plug for charging and a few pockets to hold charging items.

The seats were comfortable enough. Good leg room and cushion.

title: JL 18    Tokyo to Narita
review_text:
I flew in economy while my wife and young daughter flew in business class.   The airline staff were not attentive at all as compared to Cathay or BA service.   When my wife asked for milk for our child she was given a quarter cup of milk.  When she requested more she as it wasn't nearly enough she was told there was a shortage of milk which i found quite unbelievable. 

Although the majority of flight attendants were smiling and very helpful the senior attendants, noted by their brown jackets seemed jaded and completely disinterested and provided the bare basics when it came to customer service.  

I must add that the check in was smooth and efficient.  Also the boarding procedure was just as smooth and efficient.  

The best part of the experience was the new dream liner.  It's a fine plane and the journey was quick and smooth.  

The return flight was the most disappointing aspect of our three week trip to Japan where we had amazng experiences in Tokyo, Kyoto and Osaka.  Amazing sights and sounds and great customer service.  Next time we will fly Air Nippon.

title: Good staff, standard seat, worse than average airplane food.
review_text:
This airline is doing so many things right but for someone with a decidedly western palate, like myself and my kids, the food is just inedible. We had an overnight stopover in Narita en route to Helsinki.

Check-in on both outbound and return flights was very good. Staff were polite and efficient. Again on the plane, staff very friendly and efficient. I do wish they would have considered walking the isles offering coffee more than once - on all flights, the coffee was almost impossible to get.Other times it was only offered down one isle and not the other. Plenty of green tea on all flights though, so again, I am maybe a bit out of step with expectations.

As for the food, the first regular meal out of Australia was ok, the others on all the flights were almost impossible to eat. My kids have eaten the food on Thai but they refused this food. They were almost without food for the duration of two 10 hour flight and the same happened on the way back. Please drop the rice burger, it does not even sound like a good idea and, surprise..The vegetarian meal was also refused and when I tasted it, I must admit it was quite inedibly awful, I admit I didn't dare to taste everything on the vegetarian meal because it either looked or smelt foul.

I tried to pick up some snack for the kids from the free basket they have on offer. How wrong can you go with potato chips, right. Well, they tasted dried fish.

Entertainment system is reasonable and quite standard, better than Finnair but not as good as Emirates.

I was once told my a professional in the airline industry to never expect anything from the entertainment system so to plan on something else and to bring my own food. Best advise ever.

JAL does a good job of getting you from A to B and they have nice staff.

The overnight stop over worked out well. Staff ask you at check-in whether you require your bags for the stopover. Bus transfer is easy to find. Hotel check-in is quick. The only draw back is that all the three restaurants in the Marroad hotel have very japanese food (surprise!) and not of the kind easily identifiable by naive westerners. It maybe would have been ok if they could explain the menu but as nice and demonstrably helpful as they were, they did not speak a word of English between them. I was looking for japanese ramen/noodle/miso soups, japanese rice bowls of some kind, gyoza, sushi, sashimi. This left it very hard to satisfy three kids for dinner. I did still appreciate the stopover and the chance to sleep in a bed. Needless to say, we skipped breakfast. My nerves were just not ready to find out what we would get.

I would fly JAL again but would then take some sandwiches. The overnight stopover and the full day return flight stopover makes it worth it. Japan is really such a nice place with the loveliest, most helpful people and they actually have very nice food as long as you can avoid anything that is not to your taste of course. The airport has a wonderful free stopover program with guides that will help you. Our guide really went over and above and made the stopover a really nice experience.

title: Better than I expected
review_text: I hadn't used JAL for years.  I am star alliance kind of person.  However there is no ANA flight from Chitose to Hanamaki.  So no choice.  They have comfortable leather seats, and free in-flight movie.  I actually enjoyed it.

title: Great flight and in-flight service.
review_text: This was my second time flying with JAL to Japan. Awesome as always. Arrival time and departure time are super accurate. The airliner was great and there was wide leg room even in economy class. The seat was comfortable. In-flight entertainments, food, and services are great too. The domestic flight from Handea, Tokyo to Kansia, Osaka has free wifi. The crews are very friendly and they are always ready to help you. The price are very reasonable for full services airlines.

title: Great for disabled travelers
review_text: Amazing service at counter at the haneda airport.  Had requested a wheelchair in advance but didn't expect one while just checking in...such fast and courteous service.  They even upgraded us to their lounge, which in haneda is a real treat. Thank you JAL for the amazing service!

title: great airliner/in flight service but terrible company
review_text: Bottom line, this is another example of an airline company caring more about making money than making happy/repeat customers. Long story short, I work in South East Asia and travel back and forth from the States often. On my last trip back to America, my family and I used JAL/ Japan Airlines for our round trip tickets. They seem to have good reviews and ok prices, so my family gave them a shot. Everything went well on the trip to the States but on the return flight we had a family emergency that cause us to move our flight back one month. When I called JAL to see what the "fee" would be to move my flight, I was told that because of their policy, we would be charged almost the same amount as our round trip tickets! Of course our family didn't have the budget for that so I spent the week on the phone with their "slow" customer service team. After speaking to multiple managers, it became clear my best/cheapest option was to cancel our JAL tickets and only get our taxes back from the thousands we spent on the round trip. I was forced to book new one way tickets for my whole family, with a new airline company, just to get back to my job. I won't be using JAL again.

title: Amazing flight at super dreamliner! :D
review_text: It was very pleasure flight with JAL! New Dreamliner with high quality sistems on board - such as windows automatic curtains, movie ans sound system, light control. Our seats were in Economy class, but they were as in normal business class - wide and comfortable! All inside is very clean. We had food and beverages on board, and always it is possible to ask about drinks or food more if you need :) Service and staff are perfect! - they helped us with all our questions! I was with my son 11 y.o. and he could choose presents from JAL company :) I recommend JAL for everyone ;)

title: Great flight!
review_text:
Seats were very comfortable; almost simple but functional.   You can lay completely flat for sleeping.
Pillows are very big and comfortable, and very nice blankets.
Amenity kit is a case designed by Zero Hali Burton, with the basics inside.  You also get a por of slippers. 
Screen is large, a good 23", however the movie & TV selection was very limited. 
Service was very polite and informative. 
Menu delicately crafted.  Seafood options were very good, vegetarian meal was also great.   They have a special international coffee program and the wine and liquor selection was outstanding. 
Japan Airlines in my opinion is still not as good as Singapore Air or Cathay Pacific; but still better than most other Asian airlines and way superior to American Airlines.

title: Fantastic Service
review_text: Excellent service from checkin to deboarding.   The cabin crew were not only beautiful, but were polite, friendly and professional. The food was standard fare for an airline. Seats were comfortable.  Premium economy  is equal to what used to be business class.  Foot rests, slippers, eye masks, noise reduction headsets, etc., makes a 14 hour flight bareable. JAL does all the little things that add comfort  as much as possible. Food and drink service are almost constant. Even complementary toothbrushes in the lavatories. I will never fly on any international flight that is not an Asian carrier.

title: Great flight
review_text: This was a very comfortable flight, and the service was very good. The flight crew were very attentive and helpful. The meal service was good, as was the beverage service. In flight entertainment was excellent. Warm towels were a nice touch.

title: Great service
review_text: Just flew in from JFK to NRT on JAL 003.  I was very impressed with the professional and caring flight attendants.  The fight was very comfortable in the suites and tge service was great.  The attendants had a very busy flight and always maintained a comforting smile and a welcoming attitude. I highly recommend this airline.

title: Great Service - tough to book seats
review_text: We booked coach premium for a little more leg room but we couldn't select seats on outbound until we arrived at the airport. this MAY have been because we booked thru American Airlines - the alliance partner. AA gave us the run around and we couldn't get thru to JAL to speak to a person directly and and reserve seats. We did both end up with aisle seats which we needed for 14 hour flight, but we were in the back of the plane. Other than that snafu would highly recommend JAL, the service was great!

title: A very clean flight
review_text: Flew Japan Airline (JAL) from Tokyo's Haneda airport to Kagoshima Airport. The flight was very clean and looked new. As a South African I am so used to getting snacks on board but only juice was offered during the 1h30 mins flight. The crew were friendly. My destination was TANEGASHIMA island. We connected via Japan Airline Commuter Air for a 30 minute flight to Tanegashima.

title: Economy Class Leg Room
review_text: Being a 167cm I always have legroom issue and first time traveling on Japan Airlines, I was surprise to experience my knees not touching the back of the seat in front of me. Service and F&B lived up to Japanese standard which is always excellent. Highly appreciated is mini bottled wine which prevent spill having limited space rather than on a cup.  Little wasteage is better than required intensive cleaning plus time constraint on air plane.  Definitely will fly with Japan Airlines again.

title: Poor seat selection process, great inflight service
review_text: The toughest part about the flight was getting seat assignments. They don't open up the option until 48 to 72 hours prior to the flight. (can't remember exact timing). My son and I were flying to the USA on American through Narita. American code shares with JAL. We got ALL our seat assignments months in advance when we booked our tickets but JAL doesn't allow it. They don't have an office in Singapore. I call their toll free number and told must wait. Very 1970s. Onboard, it was a great flight and good staff.

title: Fantastic start to a great holiday experience
review_text:
- check-in was a breeze, handled very quickly and efficiently.
- they were offering an upgrade from economy to premium economy for an extra $350 $A, which we took them up on. We weren't disappointed.
- generous luggage allowance for checked luggage 2 bags/suitcases @ 25 kilograms each.
- service was great, very friendly and professional.
- excellent food & drink.
- comfortable and roomy seats
- noise cancelling headphones a big bonus.
- bathrooms very well-maintained and clean.
- no request was too little or too great.
- air hostesses walked and checked the aisles and passengers on a regular basis.

title: Solid business class selection
review_text: Having flown business class on several airlines, JAL is a solid choice. The service is good and their 787's are incredibly comfortable. The meals are enjoyable and visually appealing.

title: I'm traveling to Japan more often!!!
review_text:
OMG!!!
Friends have told me to pay the extra and fly JAL.  I did and don't regret it at all.  
Having flown nearly every major domestic airline I can confidently say that they are all a joke.
First, the food.  The food they served me in economy is better than first class meals I've had flying domestically.  The food that was served on JAL was tasty and fresh.  It also looked good which is something that is hard to do.
Second, the service.  Attentive and pleasant.  
Third, the flight attendants were all dressed impeccably and anyone that has flown on international airlines knows what I'm talking about.  US airlines can't compare.  
Fourth, the seats are more comfortable and even have footrests.  What the heck?  When was the last time domestic airlines thought about a small thing like that?  Oh, I forgot, they don't give a crap about their customers because they've got a captured market.
Fifth, no fee's.  Yup, domestic airlines continue to rip customers off with fee's but not JAL.  I think domestic airlines don't charge either for international flights but that's only because they probably wouldn't be able to complete if they did.
Sixth, I can't confirm but I swear they handle baggage with care.  Not a single ding on my suitcase.
Seventh.  Cost.  About the same as it would have cost me to fly to the West Coast or Vegas.  I'd rather go to Japan.  No tipping (save 20%), food in general cheaper, and you won't find crappy food in Japan.  
Eighth.  Clean.  The entire plane was clean.  Even the bathrooms!
This was my first time to Japan but not my last.  I'll definitely consider JAL again, or ANA or Korean Air or pretty much any airline that isn't US based!!!

title: Comfortable with the service you expect in Japan
review_text:
I fly to Japan often and this trip was the roomiest, most comfortable and best served of any level of economy. It probably helped that it was a 787, a fantastic plane to fly in.
I was in 17K, first row, bulkhead, of premium economy. The leg room is enormous; I could get out without disturbing the aisle passenger. Plenty of overhead bin space is available. This is important when sitting at the bulkhead. The seat was wide and comfortable.
The service was precise, polite and attentive, what you would expect in Japan. The food is good and nicely but efficiently presented. Teas and all other manner of drinks are offered throughout the flight.
Overall a great travel experience and introduction to Japan.
The flight departed almost an hour late due to late arriving plane. We ended up landing within minutes of schedule so there effectively was no delay. I received an email and message a few hours before the flight informing me of the delay and apologizing. When I checked in for the flight, entered the Sakura lounge to wait, was waiting at the gate lounge and upon boarding announcement, apologies were given for the late departure. Once seated, the flight attendant addressed me by name to apologize for the delay. 
Yes, the service is that good.

title: Recommended
review_text:
I love this flight. The seat and the crew was spotless. Although I am reviewing based on a business class seat, I have tried enough business class seats to know that this was one of the best I have flied on. Before flying, they give you these eye masks and earplugs and they also have slippers on the seats which you can take home.

Leg room: Perfect. It even has a little area off to the end of your foot, for those like me who don't want to put their bags on the carry on over head.

Space: This plane has a LOT of space. From little nooks to stick your phone while charging, to the little side cabinet you'll have where you can stick your bulky headphone case, or sleeping masks or whatever it is, as long as it's within 2kg, you're good.

Food: Food is good. All through out, I ate the Japanese style, and my only problem there, is that I did not know that the wrapped cube was my rice. I thought it was dessert or something, and I was finished with my food before I knew that the wrapped thing was my rice.

Drinks: They were very generous with drinks. I have been on flights where they don't give you a bottle of water, so you don't have to feel bad calling for them, whenever you're in the middle of the flight. They were abundant with coffee and tea as well.

Staff: These ladies were SUPER helpful. My uncle's cane got stuck under the seat, and these 4 ladies were very helpful, to the point that they had to remove all of the seat's padding just to be able to reach under it.

Restroom: Toothbrushes and mouthwash. I love these, since I forget to bring my own when I go to the restroom.

My only problem: Flight home from our layover (Tokyo - Manila) for some reason, the air condition was REALLY HOT. And I mean sweaty hot.

But overall, would recommend. Again, I am reviewing based on business class seats, do not take my word if you are flying economy.

title: The perfect flight - minimum jet lag!
review_text:
I have had some very difficult Asia-US flights as far as jet lag (often taking over two weeks to recover), but finally found one that had minimal impact on me:  JAL's non-stop flight 008 from Tokyo to Boston, which leaves at 6:10p (Japan time) and also lands at 6:10p Eastern time.

What solves the problem is the departure and landing times:  it leaves at 6:10p and a good meal is served not too long after takeoff, which makes it easy to fall asleep by 11p or so Tokyo time (which is 10a Boston time).

This allows for a good 4-5 hours of sleep, by which time a breakfast meal is served - which is around 3p Boston time.  That leaves just a little more flight time before landing at 6:10p in Boston.  This is absolutely perfect as you're then tired by 10p Boston time - so that you can go to bed at a regular time.

Though I definitely was a bit tired over the next few days, I never had the annoying issue of incessantly waking up at strange times once I was back.

I highly recommend this flight - JAL has solved the jet lag problem, as far as I'm concerned!

title: New plane 787-900 and new seat concept
review_text: The business class on this flight was fairly empty, but with the design of the all isle access cabin, full flatbed and kind of Suite design one of best business class seats I ever had. The service was nice and friendly...

title: worst airline meals ever
review_text:
This was the 1st time we use Japan Airline!  We were couple + one child 5years old, a kind of disappointed there was only one kind of meal which you have no choice, 1st time ever compare to many others Airline in our 15 years travel. Poor Meal in order the taste & the quality, the worst meal ever in the plane. 3 of us only eat 1/10 of the meal, we force ourself to eat more as the flight was 7 hours from Singapore to Tokyo then transit to Memanbetsu Hokkaido; even the snack also no good, my son always like snack, he don't want to eat the snack after one bite!

We try to find a restaurant in Tokyo when  return trip back to Singapore as I know that we will get hungry in the plane.

The smaller blanket ever in the plane which only can cover upper body!

We try not to take Japan Airline in future even the service was good, but the meal was important for long flight.

Thanks for the vote if you found this helpful :D

title: The best Airline to flight to or from Japan
review_text:
Absolutely without a doubt, the best airline to flight to Japan.

Super clean, cosy, great food, responsive and attentive flight attendants.

Definitely recommend!!!!

title: Our first flight with JAL
review_text: It was our first flight on JAL for long haul route from Los Angeles to Tokyo. Check in and boarding were fast and agents were very courteous. The cabin was very clean, seats were wider than other's and leg room was good for my long legs. Food was decent and the crew offers a lot of drinks during the flight. The passengers were very quiet, I have never had a flight so quiet.  All in all it was a great trip. Definitely will fly with them again.

title: BOOKING MISTAKE BY JAL
review_text: BAD mistake by JAL Staff meant that we had to change to earlier flight to catch connecting flight. Staff at CHITOSE airport was a helpful but language was a struggle

title: Our first (but not last) flight with JAL
review_text: Our first trip to Japan to visit our son, stationed in Yokosuka Naval base.  We tried consistently to find a good fare, looking at alot of flights.  We finally found a decent fare on JAL.  We flew economy over and got the chance to upgrade to Premium economy for the return for a minimal charge.  The flight over was very nice with a fair amount of room for economy.  The premium was really nice.  Plenty of room and with the reclining seats and leg extension it was really nice.  The attendants were courteous, attentive and  very helpful.  Definitely plan to fly with them again.

title: Efficient stewardess, quiet passengers, standard meal without choice
review_text: The seats for the flight from Singapore to Tokyo was hard, uncomfortable with limited decline. They only serve one meal without any choice. The flight from Tokyo to New York was much better, with soft and bigger seats. There were more meal choice on this flight too. I've been around and I must applaud Japanese for their neat laundry usage and quietness. They did the right thing to include lots of travel and food shows introducing their country. This is good marketing strategy to entice and educate their foreign passengers.

title: Excellent Airlines that has track record of safety and top service!!
review_text:
Flew with them for ultra long haul route from New York to Hong Kong via Narita.    Check in was smooth with friendly and courteous check in agent.   Boarding process was calm and very orderly.   Our B777-300 was almost brand new and immaculate.
Seats were comfy and had lots of leg rooms.     Meals and snacks were pretty decent and crews make water and juice runs every 30 min or so to keep the passengers hydrated.     All in all excellent trip.    I think they are almost same level as ANA but ANA seems to have cabin crews that are a bit more cheery and enthusiastic.  North American carriers have a lot to learn from these high quality Asian Airlines.

title: Honestly, the leg room is no worse than anyone else's.
review_text: It's a relief to be treated courteously (and even pampered a little) on a long flight.  The other guys occasionally rise to the occasion, but sometimes live up to their "What do YOU want, Mac?" hostile reputations.  Never on JAL.  Too bad they don't fly everywhere!

title: Yes I know this is only one hour in the air if that
review_text: My flight today took 53 minutes. With JAL it's not just the flight is the greeting  at checkin, the genuine feel that you are really either the only person on the plane or someone special. Today was my third JAL flight since 5/6. By far one of the best J class experience. Hard to beat JAL.

title: New plane - very clean and quite spacious
review_text: We flew economy from Sydney to Tokyo and had quite a pleasant journey. It seemed like a new plane and everything was clean and in working order. There also seemed to be more than usual leg room. The ability to darken the tint of the window rather than having to pull the shade up or down also gave greater options. The food was decent.

title: Good but not amazing
review_text: JAL don't have their own lounge at Heathrow so use British Airways which is a fairly standard issue business class lounge so nothing to write home about and a fairly ordinary start to a first class flight (if you have one world emerald then I'd advise using Cathay Pacific first lounge which is very good and you can get a good sit down meal at). Boarding was a bit of a scrum with everyone diving at the gate once an announcement was made so no real separation for first/business. On board the cabin was very nice and secluded, it felt like we were the only ones on the plane which was great and the seat had a phenomenal amount of space. Service was very attentive throughout however only one of the cabin crew spoke English well enough to understand any questions which caused issues with the food for my wife. The bed was very comfortable (as was the seat) with lots of space and the TV screen was massive despite being quite a way from you (the bose full noise cancelling headphones were also excellent). The mattress was very comfortable but (with the pyjamas) made it quite hot as the cabin temperature was high on this flight so I didn't sleep that well due to being uncomfortable. Food and drinks offering for me were superb and I had the Japanese menu which was great, as well as a couple of the wines, sake and suntory 17 year old which I tried. My wife had issues with the food as we had call in advance to book her meal due to dietary requirements which had been noted (as the FA came and check with her at the start of the flight about them) but not taken into account (for example she can't eat fish which they acknowledged but then they brought out the starter of lobster), subsequently she didn't each much at all which was a shame. They also didn't have any flexibility to find food from another cabin that she could eat so we were disappointed with that part of the service (she had the same issues with breakfast). I tried the al a carte and had a couple of things which were nice and brought very quickly - the attentiveness of the staff is indeed good but their flexibility or ability to deal with anything non standard is not. I felt that like other airlines they should have more of the senior staff in this cabin rather than junior member (all senior were serving business on our flight). The arrival was very good and the flight overall was comfortable and the nice surroundings made the long flight time fly by. The pyjamas and amenity set by Porsche were very good. The snack bar (well I say bar, every time you got up to get anything from it the attendants dived up and got it for you!) was good. The best bit about the cabin is the exclusive part of it, on this flight it had 7/8 seats full but I felt as if i barely saw another passenger the whole flight, it was very quiet and nice and relaxing. Downside was the food for my wife who had fairly simple (not overly fussy) dietary requirements which, for the cost of the ticket I'd expect JAL to cater for especially as we called in advance to let them know.

title: Outstanding service. Cramped seats.
review_text: Outstanding customer care. Polite, efficient flight attendants. They found out it was our wedding anniversary and came up with a gift in flight. We travel a lot and these were the most uncomfortable plane seats of my life. Cramped. My knees touched the seat in front of me. I am of average height. Very narrow seats.

title: Best flight ever!
review_text: One of the most pleasant flights I have ever taken was Japan Airlines.  Great plane with good seating and the crew was absolutely the nicest and most professional I have had the pleasure to observe.  Best flight ever!

title: The best
review_text: Amazing experience, super good, excellent service and very luxurious, best business class I have traveled by far

title: Excellent Premium Economy Experience
review_text:
I often dread a long-haul flight in any other class than business ... but then I traveled to Japan with JAL.

I cashed in my Avios points to experience the premium economy service to Tokyo and the whole experience was just a few minor points off being excellent. So I'll focus on what those minor points was ... because everything else really was excellent.

Check In at JFK
Despite checking in online, the check in at JFK seemed a little chaotic, with the line snaking all the way back to the entrance when I arrived. There was no clear signage (or staff on hand to ask for assistance) in determining where the bag drop line was. So, I stood in line for at least 30+ minutes before deciding to break out of the line (at the risk of losing my place as I was traveling alone) to find a member of staff. The bag drop line was then pointed out to me (it was totally clear) - the signage had been blocked by fellow passengers standing in orderly single file (I guess my first exposure to the Japanese queueing). My bag was checked in and marked with a 'priority' label. 

The Lounge(s)
This for me was the big benefit of traveling premium economy with JAL. You get full access to the lounge (Air France's lounge at JFK) and the JAL flagship lounge at Narita. At Narita I took a shower BEFORE boarding the 12 hour flight back NY, which felt really decadent.

Seat
The JAL Sky Premium seat is excellent. This is a very well designed product. Fully adjustable footrest, power, holder for a full bottle of water, great seat slide, privacy screen, great width and lots of legroom. Comfortable enough for me to sleep both on the way to and from Tokyo. And the best thing about it, is that the seat in front does not recline into your space. I couldn't offer an improvement here.

Service (including F&B).
The in-cabin service was flawless, with ample food and beverage being served (or being made available throughout the flight) all of a very good standard. Where a minor point gets deducted is in that some passengers with totally Western palates may feel as though the options are limited. 

Entertainment
This was the only 'average' thing about the flight for me and is the only area that I felt was lacking. But the plus side was that a lack of great entertainment meant that I had no option but to sleep, and sleep in that great seat was easily forthcoming.

I intend to travel back to Japan and this airline will definitely be my first choice for my return trip.

title: Exellent
review_text: Everything was just perfect.Best flight attendants I have ever seen, great food, new airplane, good entertainment ecc.

title: JAL customer service Wow 😳
review_text:
Deciding which airline to take when going to Japan 🇯🇵 or Asia JAL is the airline of choice !
Yes we are seating coach class but the service tho is excellent or 5 star ⭐️ whatever you ask they will provide it for you and the flight attendants walk the aisles every 20 min to make everyone are comfortable. When booking JAL flight please make sure it's not an American Airline codeshare flight ... please don't fly American the service is not as good as JAL .... American Airline flight attendants just plain lazy and not very accommodating ! To everyone.... it's just my opinion  ... hope this help when deciding Airline to fly to Asia ... safe travels 👍

title: Memorable due to amazing service and fabulous ground and in flight staff
review_text: Our first time travelling with this airline and it will be my first choice next time we head to Japan again. Long queues at Haneda, due to many travelers checking in various airlines from one set of counter. Plane had surprisingly enough leg room for my tall husband, and seats were comfortable. In flight staff were beautifully groomed, friendly and very gracious. Food was very tasty and had my favourite sake to drink. Food and drinks kept coming throughout the flight. In flight entertainment was great and all inclusive. Overall, this has to be my favourite airline to fly with and would definitely recommend Japan Airline

title: Excellent service and comfortable seat
review_text:
JAL is one of my top choice airline.
Attendants are attentive and food is good. Moreover, Economy seat has more leg space.
You can check in up to 30kgs of luggage this time.

Highly recommended.

title: One of the Best Economy Class in the World
review_text: Japan Airlines has one of the Widest Seats and Longest Leg Rooms in Economy Class. Their Economy Class may be even better than some premium economy class of other Airlines. The Service was great and really fast. The Food although not up to par with Business Class Quality, made up for it in Quantity (Entree, Salad, Rice Crackers, Appetizer, Fruits, Ice Cream for Dessert, Miso Soup). Their Inflight Meal was very filling.  As for Entertainment, their Screens were fairly Big and the Choices were sufficient for the trip. As a Bonus, Japan Airlines offers 2 (23KG) Baggage Allowance vs. 1 (20-23kg) Baggage Allowance for Others. Overall Japan Airlines is one of the most comfortable flights and I would highly recommend its economy class for short or even long haul flights.

title: Very comfortable flight
review_text: The seats were very comfortable, plenty of room to stretch out and places to put things. I pre-ordered the Japanese meal. and it was delicious. Service was efficient and friendly. Movie selection was moderate, the music selection for a baby boomer 60's and 70's  fan was awful nothing i could find to listen to!

title: Timely, comfortable flight
review_text: We flew on the first flight of the day to Tokyo from Manila. The staff were very polite and accommodating throughout the flight process and made us feel very welcoming. The food was surprisingly good, with a good selection of dishes and a welcome break from the usual fare on flights. The flight was on time and very smooth throughout. Definitely on the preferred list of airlines from now on.

title: Comfortable flight.　No problem. But immigration process is tooooo bad at DFW!
review_text: My friend passed the immigration very smoothly, but it took me to get out more than an hour. We cannot find any reason to divide us.

title: Excellent service.
review_text: Absolutely fabulous. Booked business class with my AA miles and the service, food, flat bed seat and entertainment were one of the best. He flight attendants are very friendly and accommodating. We also flew economy with JAL and the service is excellent.

title: Magnificent 8
review_text:
All I can say is WOW!!!!
The Ladies are the most amazing ladies. You would never know that we were on a 9 hour flight. Always a smile, always helpful, and always caring. The head stewardess, her name began with a T, touched my heart. She was so kind. I can see why the other ladies are good. 
The pilots were smooth flying. 
Again, if going to Japan, fly Japan Air. 

We were returning home from Japan on the 23rd , flight JL060, at 5:30 p.m..

title: Good rest on long journey
review_text:
I really enjoy going JAL now to Europe, when I was younger I just wanted to get there, but now can't wait to get out at Narita and sleep in a bed and coming back four hours at the airport is great to get out, have a shower and something to eat

The staff are always friendly and helpful, I had to rearrange my flight dates and it wasn't a problem to do that for me

The food is okay, normal airline food, but got upstairs seating last time, which was great

title: BUSINESS CLASS is EXCELLENT!
review_text: I am frequent flier with history of over a million miles flown. JAL was EXCELLENT! I brought along my elderly mother which they accommodated with wheelchair service. When we arrived to await the JAL check in counter to open, the agents and their manager formally greeted the passengers in line, announced they were open, and thanked us for flying JAL with a bow. Was so humbling and grateful. Once checked in, we were taken to the JAL Lounge and the lounge was well set up with shower facilities, sandwiches, pastries, soups, salad, curry, rice, etc. In the back of the lounge they offered asian foods; dumplings, noodles, veggies, rice. Great assortment and choices. Drinks included juices, coffee, wine, beer, soft drinks. Variety of multiple language newspapers with a nice window view of the airplanes. When it was time to depart, the JAL agent came and drove us on the little "golf cart" to the gate. JAL had already reserved special seats in front of gate for wheelchair passengers. I've not seen this with other airlines. Once we pre-boarded, the plane was 788 and spacious. Offered slippers, warm cloth, First class kit, casual jacket to change into, newspaper/magazines, two meal services, snacks, movie/audio, and headsets. When your plane pulls from the gate to takeoff, the ground crew are lined up and all bow to the plane and wave! Choice of western or japanese meals on menu. Japanese meals were excellent presentation and delicious.My husband gave the staff several boxes of Hawaiian Chocolate Macadamia candy. Each of the flight attendants walked over and personally thanked us and in return a gift bag of Japanese snacks and personalize written thank you card! We were so relaxed and enjoyed our long flight. The restroom was spacious and provided toothbrushes and mouth wash.  JAL really know how to provide customer service and we will definitely be flying again.

title: Best service
review_text: This was a great airline especially if you are travelling to India. The service is always so friendly and kind. The staff always have a smile of their face and always address to any issues you may have. Flights from YVR to DELHI usually have a overnight stay complimentary from JAL. I stayed in Nikko Narita and it was a fairly good hotel with a full breakfast in the morning. When we reached Delhi, we were fresh and weren't as tired as we usually are when we take different airlines.

title: First class service
review_text: Japan Airlines is professional. Their employees treat customers with the utmost respect. The old mantra, the customer is always right rings true with them. Customer service is excellent from pre-departure to inflight service to arrival. You even get little house slippers for the long flight. Food was very good. Flight attendants very attentive and pleasant.

title: Somewhat Disappointing
review_text: For many years I had heard of Japan Airlines exemplar service but our experience fell short.  I would describe the service as inconsistent and the on-board cuisine was average.  A 10-hour + flight should give the flight attendants enough time to offer you more than 1 glass of wine during dinner service.  We received significantly better service and cuisine on our South African Airlines flight from Johannesburg to Washington DC.

title: Recent  Trip to Japan
review_text: My wife and I flew to and from Narita Airport from JFK recently. Our carrier Japan Air was excellent. The flight both to and from Japan were on-time. The air crew were friendly, very professional, and available throughout our flights. Even though our flights were long (12-13 hours each way), our time on-board went by rather quickly. Meals, drinks, and snacks were provided throughout. We were even able to get some sleep each way, to ease the jet-lag we both experienced. The plans were clean and comfortable. I would recommend Japan Air to anyone requiring travel to and from Japan.

title: Very good airline!
review_text: I flew to Japan quite often recently and most of the time I flew with Japan airline. The flight timing is perfect!, the service is exceptional, and the seat is comfortable. One of the plus is that there are Thai flight attendants on board every time.  Highly recommended!

title: Best First Class
review_text:
In my opinion, the best First Class overall.

Check-in and lounge were both wonderful.

Service, seat, and food/beverage are all top-notch.  Other than some language barrier, flight attendants are extremely friendly and helpful.

Only things that were average would be the inflight entertainment options and sometimes the cabin temperature (too warm).

title: FAST
review_text:
Clean, orderly, fast.

If you're flying for the first time in Japan, please note that they board the plane very very quickly. Don't break the rules and come up and board when it is not your time. They simply scan bar codes, nobody checks your tickets - they sit down quickly - no fussing. 15 minutes to board a big 350 seat plane.

title: Excellent Airline with Good Service
review_text: JAL remain my first choice of airline especially if I travel to Japan. In flight service is good and food was great. Recently they also made some some enhancement to their food menu which bring the in flight food to a greater quality. The last recent flight I was travelling with my 1 year old son. This is my first time travelling with baby with JAL. Everything is good and bassinet is comfy for baby.

title: Totally Over the Top
review_text:
Spacious seat and comfortable enough for flying long-haul, super-friendly and agile flight attendants, tasty food and beverages, clean lavatory, various in-flight entertainments and newspapers. Overall service is very good. Value for money: *****
I would definitely recommend JAL.

title: Love this!
review_text:
Extremely clean cabin, and free beverages are good. JAL Boeing 787 has perhaps the best available legroom for economy classes, and meals were definitely superior over Korean Air. Both ground and flight crews were very kind and responsive, and landing was one of the smoothest I've experienced. 
Seat comfort was actually better in older JAL planes, where Recaro seats were fitted in. Another drawback: JAL does not have its own app(at least in English) and self check-in must be done through JAL website only. Also, boarding passes cannot be downloaded to Wallet app in iPhone.

title: NICE FLIGHT WITH JAL
review_text: My family and I really had a nice experience flying with JAL from Jakarta to Narita and returned to Jakarta on the 12th day of our holiday trip. Onboard meals were good accompanied with wine.

title: economy was tolerable at 185cm. Service is good,
review_text: Economy pitch is never great but this was of the 34 inch type so tolerable. Our check in was quick and some care was taken to meet our requests. We managed to have a three to our own. Flight was on time both ways and food was tolerable. Only real choice for non-stops and we needed to be in Narita for starting our vacation

title: Wonderful
review_text: Spur of the moment trip. Could not have been happier. Some economy seats were on the upper deck. We asked if it was possible to have seats with better legroom. They were so accommodating - unlike others who fob you off with excuses which turn out to be untrue. Included was an overnight stop in Japan. We were able to check in and get our boarding passes at the hotel.  They gave us snacks to nibble on whilst in the hotel. Lovely experience. This trip was taken in 2000 (I couldn't put that in below). Wish they went to more places from Australia!

title: Meal was very good and hostes was very nice.
review_text: Very roomy and comfortable inside of cabin, very polite hostes  meal was excellent. I had best flight I ever had.

title: Good experience, Good Service,
review_text:
We fly back and forth from San Diego to Narita once a year as we live there part of the time.  Flying direct from San Diego to Narita saves us about 4-6 hours in total as our only other option is to fly via Los Angeles.  For anyone who has had the most unpleasant experience of flying via LAX you can appreciate why we would not want to do that and put up with the abuse that you experience at that airport.  Rude, surly, hostile TSA, Customs and Immigration staff there.

By contrast San Diego is a breeze, you are treated with respect and courtesy and the time to get through is a quantum less than LAX.

JAL's food is better than average for an airline and while not as plush as it was a few years back the buffet at Narita in the premium section is still good.

title: Very comfortable flight
review_text: Good service, good meal (the general one) great movie selection with translation to different languages (was no Wi-Fi on this plane), very comfortable time ( 1:20 pm). The seats are just ok.

title: Very nice airline with the greatest smiles on air
review_text:
I had the chance to fly with Japan Airlines last April and I would say it has been one of my best Economy class experiences ever. First of all, I don´t think I ever saw of one the cabin crew members without a smile; they were amazingly nice during the whole flight.
The cabin was clean, the legroom was larger than what you can usually find, and the on board meals were very good. They even offered Miso Soup before every mealtime.
I would definitely fly with them again.

title: Excellent Airline with Excellent Food and Service
review_text:
We had 2 wonderful flights back from Bangkok to Toronto with Japan Airlines. 

All their seats have really great legroom, the plane was not too cold, and all our electronics worked (tv, sound, etc.)

The bathrooms were all kept clean and they took our trash regularly.

The staff were all very polite and was able to speak English and Japanese perfectly!

Food on this airline was amazing compared to North American airlines that we've traveled with. There was enough of each option for everyone and the food was delicious. 

Thank you for a lovely experience JAL!

title: They know service!
review_text: Even in Economy class, service is just fantastic. Attendants work non-stop offering beverages, snacks, etc. and are extremely pleasant. Plane is immaculate with surprisingly a lot of space for economy class. Decent international movie selection. Overall, a wonderful experience for a very interesting price. American carriers should send mystery shoppers to learn...

title: Pleasant Flight
review_text: Our first time on Japan Airlines.  Impressive!  Easy and attentive checkin and boarding was fairly organized.  Cabins were clean and kept clean throughout the flight.  Flight attendants were helpful and pleasant.  Seats in Premium Economy are far better than the same level of service on other airlines, with almost 42" pitch.  Instead of a dinner and snack prior to arrival, they served two full meals, both of which were tasty (remember - this is airline food at 33,000') and filling and plenty of alcohol was available .  We departed on time and landed on time - what more could you ask for these days.  In flight entertainment was "meh" and the lounge at SFO was less than stellar, although the lounge at Haneda was excellent.  Would not hesitate to flight Japan Airlines again.

title: great service indifferent food
review_text: Service standards impeccable but the vegetarian food offered was indifferent to put it mildly. Perhaps the Japanese can`t understand why anyone except monks would opt for vegetarian food when there are so many Western and Japanese meat options. While the usual business class trappings are amply provided, the storage in the window seat (787) is minimal, much better in the aisle seat; furthermore my entertainment system didn`t work.

title: The optimal trip between Boston and Ho Chi Minh City
review_text: I fly to Ho Chi Minh City for work periodically, and the ultimate route is JAl 7 (and on the way back, JAL 8) flying premium economy.  The numbers refer to the loooooooooong flight (13 hours) between Boston and Tokyo.  Premium economy seats are not much more than regular economy ($300 if you upgrade at the airport) and well worth it (though even the economy seats are pretty good since this route uses the gigantic dreamliner planes).  On this trip, you leave Boston at about 1pm; eat a big meal a couple of ours after takeoff, and either sleep or watch movies or work for the next 8-9 hours, then they feed you again, then you land in Tokyo.  A comfortable 2-3 hour layover and then on to Ho Chi Minh City.  You land at about 10pm HCMC time, by which time your system is mixed up enough and traveling has been tiring enough that going to bed when you get to your destination is just right.  JAL service is terrific; the flight crew is lovely.   I like the food a lot, especially the ice cream.  the Wifi is the best ever; I always use it for work and it's never failed me - totally unlike the lame gogo inflight nonsense on US domestic flights.

title: Great airline.
review_text: This was a pleasant surprise as we didn't expect too much from an economy class flight. The food was excellent, service very pleasant, polite, frankly, We couldn't fault anything.We took off and arrived exactly as scheduled, boardng and seating was smooth and efficient. Highly recommend this airline!

title: A disinfectant like chemical in my food that made me sick
review_text:
After eating some rice that I was served (special vegan meal) I noticed it had a chemical like smell & taste.  It was supposed to be plain white rice with a little saffron.  Although it had no hot spices in it, my mouth & tongue & throat started feeling hot.  
      I notified the flight attendant about it &  she suggested that I drink a lot of liquids to FLUSH OUT what I had been served.  But the symptoms got worse. 
      After they returned my plane ticket which they requested (the head of the flight attendant spoke to me), I was told to stay after the plane landed.  They had  me talk to a man, who took me aside & said this could not have happened. 
     The man acted arrogant.  I assured him that this was the last thing I needed or wanted but he just walked away & acted like Business as usual. He said I would hear from them thru e-mail.  Surprise, surprise, I have not heard a word from them.

title: There was something that smelled & tasted like some chemical in my food!!!
review_text:
As I was eating my rice (which had NO hot pepper for my special Vegan Meal,)  I noticed a funny smell & taste like some chemical disinfectant.  It was supposed to be plain white rice with supposedly a little saffron. Even after just a few mouthfuls of just the rice, my mouth and tongue and throat started feeling hot.  And after a few minutes it felt like it was on fire.

I told the flight attendant after drinking an entire bottle of water & when the burning feeling didn't go away.  She told me that I should keep on drinking liquids to try to flush this out of my system.I could not drink any hot tea because it made my mouth and throat feel worse so I drank another bottle of water.  My eyes started feeling irritated as well. 
    I was told to wait after the plane landed at SFO and a male (I'm assuming a JAL employee) took me aside as I was walking on the ramp & he immediately told me that this incident couldn't have happened but that he would have the rice tested & that I would get an e-mail from them. 

I have not heard one word from them.  I could tell by his attitude that they would just deny what had happened.  I told the man that I didn't need or want this to happen but he just acted like he really did not care & he just walked away & acted like business as usual.

title: Nice airline with good comfort
review_text: Japan Airlines has good service and nice comfort for the Business seats, offering 4 windows for one seat. The food - especially the Bento box - and the mattress you get to sleep on is nice as well.

title: JAL surprises
review_text:
the business sets are arranged in an offset 2-3-2 configuration with privacy screens that effectively give you a private "suite"- each seat has access to the aisle, so no stepping over people, very ingenious layout.

The service was excellent, the food was good and there is an ala carte menu that operates for the whole flight. Seat turns into a bed, and they (like Air New Zealand) provide comforter mattresses which when laid on the flat seat make a very comfortable bed (as opposed to the gaps and lumps of a flattened seat- unlike a lot of airlines (united  polaris being the most uncomfortable)

The entertainment content was, however somewhat limited, a few "new" movies and not much else, though there was an excellent large screen and great noise cancelling phones

I will certainly fly them again

title: Flying with JAL is really nice
review_text:
Since so many airline reviews are negative(including some of my own!) I wanted to write a positive one for an airline which is exemplary.  

I flew on the 787 Dreamliner from YVR to NRT in October, 2016 roundtrip.  The #1 sign that JAL actually cares about their passengers is they are one of only a handful of airlines that followed the recommended 2-4-2 seating arrangement in the 787 plane. Most airlines greedily have shoved in 3-3-3, making the cabin and aisles very cramped.  With the 2-4-2 it's really a nice in-airplane economy environment, especially combined with other Dreamliner features.

My only real complaint with this craft is that the space in front of you was quite small, and cramped, especially if the person reclined.  I know JAL has retro-fit a lot of their planes with a larger economy seat and legroom, so look to see if you can snag a route that has it if you fly them!) This plane wasn't updated just yet at the time, so personal space was a bit tight. 

The food was really solid for airline food as they basically prepared you a little bento meal with real silverware and little plastic boxes for each food.  

Service was good.  Lots of extra tea/water/soup if you wanted throughout the flight.

Anyway, if you're going to Asia, would absolutely recommend JAL.  One of the few airlines left that actually cares about their passengers from top to bottom.

title: Hong Kong to Tokyo
review_text: I took a flight from Hong Kong to Tokyo, Everyone I met was Very nice, everyone was polite, everyone was smiling! the Flight was Good, seats were roomy, and food was good. I will try to fly them on longer trips, from Dallas to Tokyo.

title: Unbelieveable service.
review_text:
After arriving at Haneda airport last April 2017, we cleared customs and immigration and rechecked our bags with JAL at the ground floor desk and were directed to another security checkpoint and then down to the ground where we caught an airport shuttle bus to the domestic terminal. We then had to get to the farthest gate away from the bus station (go figure..) and the plane to Misawa Japan eventually arrived and were boarded in less than 10 minutes. JAL does not fool around when boarding folks. Everyone gets on and sits down right away with a minimum or folks trying to put bags in the overhead compartments. In just a few minutes we were being pushed aaway from the gate and I watched the ground crew stand at attention and salute the pilots then wave at the passengers on the plane. Wow !!
We were in the air in no time. Arriving at Misawa was fun. Came in over the ocean to a one gate terminal on the Air Force Base @ Misaawa. Everyone deplaned in an orderly manner and in just a couple of minutes, were were off of the plane. Talk about efficient. 
Our bags came in to the carousel in less than 5 minutes and we were on our way to visit with family. 
Returning was even better. We checked in at the desk where there were 4 ladies working and our agent was able to give us boarding passes for the next flight but because of an equipment change in Tokyo, she could not do the boarding passes for that flight. 
We went to the second floor and thru security in a breeze and sat down to wait. About 30 minutes later that same desk agent came up to me and said that she could now give us boarding passes for our remaining flights. Wow! She had come upstairs past security to find us at the gate and then took our passports and paperwork with her back down to her desk and returned about 10 minutes later with everything including the boarding passes. Holy Cow, that's just amazing. 
We boarded again in less than 10 minutes and as usual everyone sits down right away and buckles up and in no time we're being pushed back from the gate. Again, the ground crew stood at attention - in the rain I might add - and saluted the pilots and waved at the passengers. I believe that the employees of JAL are really happy people and they must really love their jobs. Their smiles and attitude is infectious. 
We took off quickly and landed at Haneda in Tokyo.
After gathering our bags, we took the airport shuttle to the International terminal and had to pass thru security and immigration again and then we sat down to wait for our flight. This was a good time to get a bite to eat. There were lots of places to get food there. 
The airplane that had been scheduled to fly to L.A. had a problem and they substituted an older model plane and it was just O.K. but not great. Every seat had a pillow and a blanket and headphones on it as we boarded. This flight was full. It was a "Red Eye" and I don't sleep on airplanes. Oh Well. 
Service was excellent. The food seemed to be never ending. It was hot and tasty and the beverages (free) were easy to get when you asked for one. There were toothbrushes available in the bathroom in cellophane  so you could brush after eating. I've never seen that on any other flight I've ever taken. And again as usual, all of the crew were smiling and seemed to be very happy. 
So other than the less than super airplane on the flight from Tokyo to L.A., JAL was tops. I'd fly with them again in a heartbeat. I actually booked my entire flight thru JAL and they code shared with American Airlines for portions of it. PHX to LAX and then LAX to Tokyo and then from San Francisco to Phoenix. Everything else was on JAL.

title: Helpful staff
review_text: From the moment we sat down, we had been treated like we were in business class. Staff were very attentive and did their best to make us feel comfortable. When my 8 year old son cried due to the air pressure, the staff came over couple of times making sure he was alright. Thank you for that, we don't feel neglected. Moslem food were not that great but it was ok to keep us full.

title: One of the best airlines in the world......
review_text:
In total we took 4 flights via JAL in this trip.

The planes were all very clean. There is always this natural smiles & politeness from all the cabin crew.
Food was good too. Fares reasonable too.

Hallmarks of the beautiful Japanese culture. 

We have taken many airlines over the years & in our opinion, JAL is one of the best.

title: Worst flight in my more than 30years with JAL
review_text:
Japan airlines used to be the first class airline with excellent meal and services.
But after they restructured, they cut the flights and service became the 3rd class, their service is getting worse and worse.
I would not recommend JAL anymore.
For oneworld alliance, I recommend AMERICAN or Cathy !
Unless you take a business class which ok but AA/CX business are better overall.
JAL NEEDS TO IMPROVE THEIR PROFILE.
The above flight was the worst, sitting in the noisy 15C,they should not sell this seat when there are babies on board because both passengers with baby and without are suffering. 
They should use exclusively for passengers with baby. I asked Purser to change my seat to give more room for baby and peace for me but she refused. She doesn't care about the passengers wellbeing.it is shame she as a senior crew, she doesn't care about the passengers!

title: Excellent Services and flight from Bangkok to Tokyo!
review_text: We flew on Japan Airlines (code shared with American Airlaines) from Bangkok to Tokyo in June 2017. The airplane was new. The services were wonderful. The staff were friendly. The foods were delicious. The entertainment system was excellent.

title: My favourite air company
review_text: Regularly using JAL for 10 years and always fully satisfied with quality, price and - more than anywhere else, - Japanese service. Since new Dreamliner started operations on route Moscow-Tokyo it became even better. Thanks to Moscow office stuff: I got connection to flight of another air company in Tokyo (Cathay Pacific), but JAL helped me to chek in luggage to final destination.

title: Excellent as always
review_text: JAL's quality of service has never diminished in any way. I first flew with JAL back in 2003. Today, their service is still exemplary. They always go beyond and give that extra mile. Our flight was only 4 hours but all kinds of drinks were provided, food represents what Japanese food is all about, FAs were always courteous and accommodating. Splendid indeed!

title: Excellent Service
review_text: It was our first time flying JAL and the service was the best we've ever received on any airline. The attendants are courteous and professional.  Flights are on-time and the meals and extras are very nice. On a long flight, they make sure the bathrooms stay clean and fresh, they regularly walk up and down the aisle with coffee, tea, juice or water.  All of it with a smile.  We will definitely fly JAL again.

title: In-Flight Foot Massage
review_text:
I'd already done the 13-hour Dallas to Narita flight and now was on the six hours Narita to Suvarnabhumi leg back to Thailand.  I was stiff and my legs and back were aching, so as the seat belt sign was off I got up and walked up and down the aisle a few times between all my sleeping fellow travellers.

A delightful Thai flight attendant saw me doing leg stretches and asked me if I wanted a "bamboo foot massage".  I had no idea what this was, but went along with it.

It turned out to be a very simple device - a piece of thick bamboo split horizontally to form a flat surface that was placed on the floor.   

The flight attendant told me to step on the rounded surface with my toes, then slowly move forward to the balls of my feet, the soles, then the heels, and to keep repeating this for a few minutes, holding onto the counter in the galley to steady myself.

It was amazingly effective -  almost like having an hour-long Thai traditional foot massage.

Many thanks to the Thai flight attendant for making my trip so much more comfortable.

title: Unmistakable Japanese service
review_text: I have flown JAL twice so far on this trip. Tokyo (HND) to Nagoya and Sapporo (CTS) to Tokyo (HND). This time I chose J class. The aircraft (737-800 HND-NGO 5/6/17) and (777-300 CTS-HND 12/6/17) were impeccably clean. The crew were very caring and helpful. Both flights departed on time and landed and arrived at the terminals on time. I did have a choice of airlines on this trip but chose JL because I was curious about their service. I was not disappointed. Well done JL. Thanks for looking after me.

title: Good Service
review_text:
JAL has a renovated lounge at BKK airport with much improved menu and it is also more spacious than the old one.

As always , JAL flight boarding and inflight services are courteous and customer focused.

The drinks and food menu is much better than other carriers on this route.

I am an American Airlines Executive Platinum member however, always look forward to flying on JAL.

title: A wonderful long-haul trip
review_text:
This was our first (and long overdue) really long-haul flight, so we wanted to have the best chance for comfort.  Hence, we used awards to get two F class seats, and we are glad that we did!

Thus, our experience is only with the First Class experience, but we expect to use Business class in the future.

One very special "touch" was that the Flight Attendants appeared to clean the restroom after every use.  In one case, one of us went to use the toilet, and someone else had just left... and a Flight Attendant hurried over and asked that we wait a moment while she cleaned up.
