Needless to say, this was THE cleanest airline bathroom ever.  It was probably the cleanest bathroom we've ever encountered in a public/semi-public space.  And airline bathrooms/toilets are generally not known for their ongoing, uh, cleanliness as the flight continues...
Yes, F class has a lot of advantages, but we wouldn't fly F without using awards, given the cash price.

We had read that the shared F lounge at JFK left much to be desired, and that was definitely true.  (We haven't flown JAL outbound from Japan - we used CX - so we can't speak for any F lounge in Japan.)

The food was quite good.  The Flight Attendants kindly arranged for us to share (using the companion seat) a "noodle tasting" with the 3 types of noodles.  They also spent a bit of time helping to teach DH how to use chopsticks a bit better.  Nice "extra" ;-)

The F seats/beds were great, and that was a huge reason we chose F class, in an attempt to get some sleep on such a long flight.  When we were younger, we could have slept almost anywhere, but... no more...
(We flew out of Japan via Hong Kong on Cathay, as we wanted to compare the two F class products.  CX definitely has the more comfortable seats/beds, especially with the nice width.  Otherwise, both F classes provided a remarkably nice way to travel long haul.  And without awards, the price would have been commensurately high.  We'll continue to save our awards for F class!)

title: Plane almost empty, service great as usual
review_text:
This was a very expensive flight. When I got on board, I found out why: a big plane, almost empty.

Of course we were well looked after. This was JAL, after all, and there was no real excuse for not doing it well, with so few people on board.

Left and arrived on time. Luggage turned up soon. It actually took longer to get to Akita airport on the airport bus than to fly to Osaka.

title: Hugely expensive, but good customer experience
review_text:
I took the first flight in the morning because it was the least expensive. It still cost an enormous amount of money for a flight that took only about 75 minutes.

JAL's service is legendary, and on the basis of this flight, its reputation is well deserved. Very pleasant check in, smooth boarding, nuts and juice elegantly presented, - not easy on such a small plane. Luggage deliverdd promptly.

The pilot woke us to tell us about the mountains we could see below and the flight attendant distributed panoramic views with the mountains named. Nice touch.

title: Truly, Japanese Hospitality
review_text: Flew NRTKUL 3JUN, on transit from Sapporo (CTS), on JL723. As a frequent traveller this was my first time on Japan Airlines. From the ground staff at the check in counter in CTS, to the gate managements staff and right through the cabin crew, the service was nothing short of EXCELLENT. They staff and crew member were all courteous, polite, helpful, and so respectful. A special mention to the crew of JL723/03JUN. From the moment I stepped in there was not a moment that the crew did not smile. Every passenger was treated equally regardless of your nationality or class of travel. Throughout the 7 hour flight, the crew were always visible, vigilant and ready to attend to your requests. The one thing that makes the JL crew stand out from the rest was the fact that their service was genuine and it definitely came from the heart. They actually loved doing their job, This I must say, is a very rare sight on any airline. The crew represented their nation, their culture and their airline very well. It represents a truly warm Japanese Hospitality. The seats on the 787 were comfortable. Food choice was also far better than any other economy class selection. The inflight entertainment was awesome. the crew also spoke English well enough for anyone to understand. I have no complaints but instead I have nothing but praises for this airline.  Its my first time on JL and will definitely not be my last. This airline is highly recommended especially if you are travelling with children and elderly passengers.  Its the small details that makes a huge difference

title: Excellent service
review_text:
Wow, service is so much better than any of the US based airlines. Kudos JAL.
Food was average for an Asian based airline

title: excellent flight and service
review_text: excellent flight and service, seats are very nice, the staff are the most helpful and friendly of all the aircraft i've been on. bonus is that they offer free wifi on their plans too.

title: Comfortable and good service
review_text: Flying is never exactly a comfortable experience but the JAL plane seemed to have a little more space than some other airlines I have flown. I think maybe the seats were very slightly wider or perhaps just a better design but very comfortable in any case. The service is good and professional and the generous allowance for checked baggage allowed me to bring home plenty of souvenirs. In general I find it best to pack light for Japan but bring a suitcase to take home your holiday purchases.

title: Let the buyer beware!  Scrutinize connecting flights.
review_text: When booking online, site doesn't tell/alert you that connecting flight (before return to LA) is to a domestic airport (Itami) instead of international (Kansai).  You are responsible for schlepping your baggage and self for the transfer.  Takes 1-2 hours by bus, costs approx. 1900 yen/pp  (just under $20).  We learned of this at check-in in Haneda and tried in vain to be flown directly to Kansai.  After 45 minutes of discussion with supervisor of supervisor, they finally said we could change to a direct flight to LA from Haneda at a cost of $200/pp.  We said no and requested reimbursement of bus transfer costs but they refused.  Will be writing to company.  If their website had made it clear that we were being sent to a domestic airport and would have to transfer ourselves to international one, we wouldn't have booked that flight or that airline.  Has anyone else had this experience with other airlines?  Is this standard practice?

title: JAL-1 TAKE IT!
review_text:
To the seasoned traveler. this will not be news, but to the rookie, it could be a life saver. From San Francisco (SFO) to Tokyo (Haneda), Japan Air Lines (JAL) flies a 777-300 ER. That ER means there is EXTRA leg room. The flight is 11 hours and that extra 3 inches soon becomes a blessing. Plus, they have nice food and stewardess

See also:  JAL-1 Take it, The rugged path, On the hit seat. Popeye needed.

title: Flight Crew to the Rescue
review_text:
I booked this and other legs of my flight to the USA on line many months ago and when I did so I paid extra for seating in the exit rows to give me extra leg room.

When I arrived at Suvanabhumi International Airport JAL check in the ground crew had no record of me having made this payment, and unfortunately I had only bought my e-ticket with me, not the itemized receipt.

The check in operator refused to do anything about it and said I would have to take the matter up with American Airlines, which was the co-share ticketing issuer.  That was a fatuous suggestion at 5 o'clock in the morning with all American Airlines offices closed for the night.

However, once on board I explained the situation to a flight attendant who quickly fixed the situation and moved me to a vacant exit aisle seat.

I then sat back and enjoyed my flight from Bangkok to Narita with the smiling, courteous flight attendants service, good quality meals and refreshments, and good in flight entertainment.

I am awarding this flight Five Stars, but if it was up to the totally disinterested ground crew member or American Airlines itself, I would award a Big Fat Zero.

title: 5 Star Airline with Great in-air service and poor gate customer service
review_text:
I flew from Portland Oregon to Ho Chi Minh City in May, 2017.  I was on Japan Airlines for the legs from Vancouver, CA to Narita, Japan and then on to Ho Chi Minh.  

Service on the planes was amazing!  On the tarmac in Narita, takeoff was delayed by a thunderstorm.  The attendants were reassuring and very present in the business cabin.  Reading materials and water was offered to everyone.  The actual flight was great with wonderful food and comfortable sleeping conditions.

The problem I had was with gate agents in Narita.  Before boarding, a gate agent approached me and told me she was checking my bag.  I only had a small carry on bag.  My handbag and computer were inside of my carry on.  I asked her why she was checking my bag.  She kept asking me if I agreed with her checking it.  I said I would comply if it was required but I just wanted to know why.  I looked over at the people lined up in the business class line and they all had between 2 and 5 bags with them (yes, 1 guy had 5 including a laptop bag, portfolio, suitcase, over the shoulder bag and shopping bag).  Why was I being asked to check?

Another gate agent came over and asked to see my ticket.  She then told the gate agent who had been trying to check my bag that I was in business class.  The original agent replied that she had already asked for my bag.  The other woman walked away.  So I took my bag, laid it on the floor, opened it and took out my handbag and medicine.  She put the checked ticket on the bag and reassured me it would be prioritized to come out first in Vietnam.  She then took the bag away.  I lined up to get on the plane, clutching my med bag and handbag like a character from the Beverly Hillbillies.

On the plane, business class was less than 1/2 full.  I was in a row of 6 seats (2, 2, 2) with only 2 people in the row.  There were no bags in the bins over my head.  After I was seated, another woman boarded.  She was in the row behind me and had no bags.  I asked her about it and she said the gate agents took her bag.  We were the only 2 women in business class that night.  I don't know if that was the reason our bags were taken but I did think it.  

When I got to Ho Chi Minh, my bag came out last, despite the agent telling me it would be priortized to come out first.  I was thankful that I got my bag and for the wonderful in flight service.

title: Some booking errors but apologetic and professionally rectified
review_text:
We travelled on JAL in April 2017 from London Heathrow to Tokyo Haneda and back.
I booked tickets via expedia as there were some problems with the JAL website in July 2016.  We called JAL to choose seats and special meals, which were all confirmed by telephone and documented by myself.  I tried to call JAL several times before we were due to depart but I could not get through on the phone.  Upon check in at Heathrow it became apparent that our seats were not those we had been promised and our special meals had not been prepared.  We were not pleased with this additional stress on a 12 hour flight.  The staff member at Heathrow was very apologetic and wasn't sure why the problem had occurred.  In the end our seats (6 travellers) were still together so this was not a problem, but our meals would be standard which we did not want.  We were given £50 cash to spend in duty free for meal replacements to take on the plane, they were very apologetic about the error.
The lady who helped us, made sure that our meals (halal) for our return flight were booked correctly.

Boarding was straight forward.  We could board with priority due to having children with us which helped a lot.
We were sat in rows 25 and 26 A, B and C which were reasonably close to the toilets, without being too close that we would be disturbed.  We also seemed to have an extra overhead storage compartment due to the way the seats were in that section of cabin.
Leg room is generous in economy class on JAL with their SKY wider seats.  I am 5'8" so was comfortable with leg room.
The seats are reasonably comfortable, perhaps slightly on the hard side for a 12 hour flight.
Entertainment selection was very good in terms of international films and language options.
Meals were served in good portions in my opinion, plus I had the benefit of eating my childrens left overs haha!  On the way out, luckily the regular meals had a fish option that we could eat which was very fortunate, as I was not looking forward to cold sandwiches the whole flight.
We packed plenty of snacks too, so we didn't ever feel too hungry.

I found it very hard to sleep on the flight as I simply couldn't get comfortable, with having little legs strewn across my lap, and not wanting to move for fear of waking the little one.  All our fellow passengers were well mannered and there were no disruptions.  
Upon arriving at Haneda we were greeted by a member of staff with my husbands name on a placard.  She wanted to apologise for the problems with our meals.  We thought this was a wonderful touch from JAL and it was much appreciated.

The return flight was pretty much the same as the journey out, except this time we had our halal meals as promised.
We would certainly fly with JAL again.

title: Excellent Service
review_text: I went to Tokyo Japan for a short vacation from April 29-May 7,2017. Japan is the best country I've ever been so far. Their food is fresh and delicious and the people are very disciplined and organized. I like the cleanliness of their public toilet. But of course JAL is the best airline so far when it comes of their amenities and service. Thank you to Okuda Ayaka she's very nice and helpful during I dropped off my luggage going back to Manila.

title: Wonderful Customer Service!
review_text:
As always, JAL never ceased to amaze me!  Their crew at the airport is always friendly, polite, and helpful!  The on-flight staff is even more amazing!  Throughout the flight, they offered water, tea, and juices to keep us travelers hydrated.  There were snacks and drinks available for your choosing by the flight attendant station, which my children loved and I appreciated greatly!  
If you have young children, I highly recommend contacting JAL prior to your flight to request children's meals because they were pretty amazing!  My 7 yo loved all her food, as it was presented beautifully!  There was so much food she gave her food to her 12 yo brother, who preferred the children's meals, go figure.  Our meals were not first class, but it was delicious nonetheless, and there was a lot of food.
I was actually surprised to see there was a good amount of leg room in the economy cabin.  We love to fly JAL and we will continue to fly JAL!

title: Love Flying With These Guys
review_text: As per usual had an excellent experience start to finish. Great check-in, left on time, plenty of room, excellent entertainment and food and superb service. Cannot recommend enough.

title: Perfect Flights!!!
review_text:
I visited Japan in March 2017 flying Japan Airlines in Premium Economy Class. I traveled in a boeing 787-800  on the way to Japan and left that country on bord of a JAL 777-300. 
I have tried Premium Economy class of other airlines but the product offered by Japan Airlines in this class was beyond comparison. So good. The personal space in both aircrafts was excelent, the features of the seats and the seize of the in seat monitor really good. Food was delicious and many snacks served aditionally to the main meals. The attention of the flight attendants reflecting the unique japaneses philosophy of service towards the clients. You get even access to the Japan Airlines Business Class Lounges in Japan flying in Premium Economy Class. I  would fly JAL again for sure, as the Price-Quality relation is absolutly worth flying in Premium Economy.

title: Love their service!
review_text:
Traveled with my husband and 5 year old kid from MNL to Calgary.  It was my son's first long haul  flight and i was prepared for the worse.  Luckily, he slept almost throughout the trip.  They had give aways for the kids to keep them entertained.  My son got the Utensils case and a JAL toy.  The only downside was that my son was not fond of the food that they served.  He just ate bread with butter and the ice cream that was served as dessert.  Good thing that I didn't choose a direct flight knowing that my son might get bored in the plane.  During our lay over, that was the time that he ate.  What I loved about their service was how concerned the flight attendants were when they see that my son wouldn't eat.  They would always check on him.

Our plane from MNL to JAP had a bigger leg room, which unfortunately wasn't the same from JAP to CAN.  Going back, we were lucky that we were seated right behind the Business class area since it had a bigger legroom.  I also noticed that their lavatories (i forgot what route it was) were more spacious.

title: Excelente service
review_text: My husband and I went to Japan last year for a week and loved the experience. Japan is a great place to go and we chose a japanese airline , really recommended !

title: Excellent Service, But What About Safety?
review_text:
I flew on Boeing 787-8 for the first time.  I had requested seat 2B, but 1C was allocated for me, as I bought this ticket as a Qantas frequent flyer.  As it was right behind the kitchen, it was quite noisy.  They didn’t provide a glass of drink before taking off and no bottled water was given to us.  So I asked my small bottle from Qantas to be refilled.
  Japanese flight attendants were very polite and cordial.  But I wasn’t sure about their safety standard.  It was very bumpy between Beijing and Tokyo, but the seat-belt sign was not on and flight attendants kept on serving.  (Qantas would have stopped, I’m sure.)  When taking off and landing, some of the Chinese passengers took off their seat belts and moving around.  But there was no warning announcement.

title: Disappointed with products offered
review_text:
First time on JAL, I was on a late flight (past midnight) but was hungry since dinner was some time ago but there was not meal service as I think the airline feels that everyone would want to sleep at such a time.

OK, I tried to sleep too...drinks were served on a tray before they turn the lights off.  Come time for breakfast, it was dismal...there was no choice, you either take the rice breakfast or nothing at all...I was looking forward to a good Japanese breakfast but the food is just not good.  

As I was famished by that time, I ate everything...

Except for the products, the cabin crew were very accommodating and service comes with a smile.

My return trip was much better - there was meal choices and food tasted much better.  I would say it is probably the catering services in Singapore that contributed to the bad breakfast...

In both cases (JL 38 and JL 37), the flights were delayed.  
JL 38 was delayed because the incoming flight was late in arriving.
The return flight (JL 37) was delayed initially by an entertainment system issue, we waited 30 mins.  Then it got further delayed with some other technical issue, another 30 mins wait.  Finally got to board, and was then informed that there is some other issues...so we waited on board for another 30 odd mins...and was informed that now they need to replace some parts...only took off 3 hours later....I am surprised that most people were quiet and took the delay in quite well.

We all just watched movies or slept while we waited it out...

Not too great an experience for a first with JAL...

title: Great experience in Business Class
review_text: I received a free upgrade to Business Class. It was really nice. The seat is comfy. I recommend ordering the Japanese meals. The bed is an angled-flat bed, but I was still able to sleep. The tv programs are limited though for English speakers. I recommend bringing an iPad with your own movies.

title: Japanese hospitality is dead
review_text: The smiles on the faces of the flight attendants cannot hide the contempt they have for their customers.  I'd rather just be treated badly than to have someone fake like they care about my comfort.   During the meal service I was giving the wrong meal.  I pointed this out to my flight attendant (seat 50K) . She smiled at me walked away and never came back to correct the situation.    Upon collecting the meal you think she would have inquired as to why I had not  touched it.  Nope she took my plate and walked away.   Yes I know I'm one passenger in a full plane and in economy class no less.    Even still this one employee of JAL made my entire flight a miserable situation.   More than likely I will never fly JAL again.   Service your customers with a smile and just an once of compassion.

title: JAL 777-300 LAX-NRT Coach
review_text:
In typical Japanese fashion the service and interaction with all JAL employees was without flaw.
The flights to and from Tokyo departed on-time, the flight arriving in NRT was deplaned onto the tarmac which is a rare these days and a bit of a pleasure for those that enjoy aircraft as I do.
The only complaints that I really have with this trip is the comfort of the seat, while the legroom is great the actual seat is a human rights violation in terms of comfort and the crew kept the cabin temperature far too hot, if you are a little cold you can put on clothing or use a blanket but if you are too hot there is no escape and it was miserable, all 4 of the people in our group had the same gripes.
One other small complaint was that they served soup for breakfast, I actually found it odd but tasty but the other couple didn't care for it.
And lastly departing from terminal 2 that JAL uses at Narita is not nearly as nice as terminal 1 which offers much better and more choices for shopping and eating and the observation deck is also much more enjoyable on that side.

title: One of the best
review_text: Great simple check in, no hassles about cabin bags, when they x-ray your bag before checking in security check staff will help with lifting on and off, planes clean and comfortable and both boarding and getting off are super fast. Wonderful polite and helpful staff, and even the ground crews bow when you depart and arrive, good manner still exist here, one of the last places on earth! JAL leave on time, tell you how long to departure and are very clear about boarding procedures, all too often a sharp contrast to Australian airlines. One of my favourite airlines.

title: Excellent Service in All Aspects-No Other Airline Can Compare to JAL
review_text: JAL leaves nothing to be desired. They have covered every inch to enjoy a long flight. My husband and I live in the US and visited Japan for my husband's first time. The trip was very enjoyable and a large part was due to the wonderful treatment from JAL. They have slippers/eye masks/toothbrushes/blankets/pillows/gaming/delicious food/eye refreshener/hot towels/alcohol/hot tea and on and on and on. The attendants are top notch and very helpful. in every way The plane is so very clean. There is a plethora of shows/movies/games and etc to view while on a long flight. The lounges are fantastic as well filled with delicious food, drinks and alcohol. They were so great with our luggage.  The restrooms were always clean. The staff for JAL is so helpful that even when they are not on the plane they assisted us. It is completely service oriented.  Any chance I get, I will take JAL and I will certainly recommend JAL to anyone.

title: Excellent flight
review_text: Very happy to recommend JAL in view of our current flight from Sydney to Narita.  The version of 787 we flew on had a 2 4 2 seating configuration which seems to give heaps more room than the 3 3 3 configuration. The food was good, if a little too much too regularly. Staff were friendly helpful and attentive and the new touch screen entertainment system is great although some newer movies would be nice. Maybe new releases?

title: A Good Airline With Good Service
review_text: You can expect good swervice on JAL and this flight was no exception. The aircraft was a new Boeing 787 so it was as comfortable as they get.The food service fro and tow Sydney is not up to the standard you can expect if you are flying from Narita to Europe or the US where competition is tougher (Qantas does not better and perhaps worse) and this is something JAL might look at. Overall a good flight.

title: Great genuine experience
review_text: Flew JAL return SYD>NRT for the first time last week. Great experience! Yes, website etc is a little out-dated, but service on-board was amazing. I had 787 over and 777 return - both had the roomiest economy seat I have ever sat in - so relaxing! Cabins very clean and bathrooms cleaned regularly by crew. Food was good and service was very attentive - it seemed like the crew genuinely wanted to be there (always smiling, etc). Neither flight was 100% full and crew were attentively moving passengers once boarded to ensure everyone had a spare seat next to them that wanted (very thoughtful!).

title: Wonderful airline
review_text:
This is our third time we have travelled Japan Airlines because their service is consistently excellent.
The cabin crew offer every comfort, consistently looking to make your trip a great experience. And the selection of food is wonderful. 
I think the highlight of travelling with Japanese Airlines is their staff - they are they epitome of wonderful Japanese hospitality and service.

title: Five Star Experience
review_text: Could not have asked for more.  US airlines need to learn from their foreign competition on how to treat their passengers.  JAL's excellent service started before we even boarded the flight.  Premium Economy passengers have access to one of their lounges - nice touch.  On board the service was non-stop and attentive.  The seats were comfortable and the selection of amenities extensive.  Food was excellent with numerous choices, well prepared, and nicely presented.  A delightful treat was their Udon in the Sky.  The best tasting "cup" of udon on the market.  Just prior to landing, each of the flight attendants assigned to our area came by and personally thanked each of us for flying JAL.  A real thank you.

title: Outstanding service right from the ground
review_text: I had a remarkable experience with the Airline. Both ground and cabin crew are hospitable. Transit in Narita was smooth. Would highly recommend JAL for a smooth travel experience.

title: Worst Business Class Seats of any Global Carrier
review_text: The seats are ancient 170 degree, uncomfortable, worn out to the point you can feel where the previous 800 passengers cheeks wore out the seat, and impossible in which to sleep.  JAL is woefully behind in its business class seating on this route and should not be able to charge business class prices for this seat.  It should be Premium Economy.

title: Excellent service
review_text: My first flight with JAL was a very nice experience. Plenty of room even in the economy class, excellent service and very attentive personnel.

title: Outstanding service, food average, seat comfort disappointing
review_text:
I usually fly BA First but I thought I would give JAL First Class a try because the Japanese normally do things particularly well.

The JAL cabin is a pleasant enough place to be, although I'm not overly keen on their frequent use of brown for the decor. It's not an offensive colour but it does make the cabin look a tad dated.

I didn't find the seat anything like as comfortable as BA's equivalent, which I find to be one of the best. It's not awful but I found towards the end of the flight, it felt a little firm. I'm also not a fan of the vinyl material they use for the seat covering. Don't get me wrong, I wouldn't have liked to see leather seats but I think a fabric covered seat is better for a long flight.

The's a lot of space around the seat and loads of cubby holes to keep your stuff in. They also give you very nice amenities, which are much better than on other airlines. Additionally, you can relax in a the Porsche Design PJs they give you.

Sleep comfort was good and the cabin temperature was ok but perhaps verging on the side of being too warm. A choice of mattress topper is offered (firm or soft) which is a nice touch, although I found the pillows to be much too soft.

Food was average, wine excellent. I'm vegan, so I'm used to being disappointed by airline food and this was no different. I don't know why the fancy chefs these airlines hire for their premium cabins can't come up with some more creative vegan offerings.

Best part was the service, which was simply outstanding. The crew were very friendly always immediately on hand to help.They really couldn't do enough and anticipated my every whim. I think it was probably the best service I've experienced in the air, rivalling even CX, who I rate pretty highly.

Overall, a very pleasant flight. If the seat was a little better, it would be up there with the very best.

title: Great Attentive Service
review_text: It was my first time flying with Japan Airlines. The service is really very attentive and the plane is really very clean. US carriers have a lot to learn.

title: Great experience
review_text: Super flight and lovely staff, food was fantastic, entertainment was better than I expected it to be,  a really great start to our holiday in Japan. I would absolutely book again and recommend this airline, our flight home was with BA -  which was poor in comparison.

title: Comfortable journey
review_text: We booked JAL flight to Japan and we flew in to Osaka and depart from Narita Airport. The flight was in the wee hours and transit at Haneda Airport. The legroom is spacious and comfortable. Service crew are friendly and the food is superb from Singapore to Japan. It served miso soup which was surprisingly good! The not so good was there were no announcement when we boarded the plane and just switched off the lights assuming passengers will be sleeping due to the timing (1.50am flight). The in-flight entertainment was not working for few hours and only got it rectified when we were waken up for breakfast. Improvement needed in the communication so that passengers are aware of what's going on. Overall, not bad experience and will list them in my preferred airlines record.

title: Best service ever
review_text: I have maybe 400 flights with different airlines, but never I got such a fantastic service. The crew is so polite and so friendly. They always check if everything is ok, and don't just lazy around. Food was excellent, I don't remember having IceCream with any other company. Baggage delivery was quick, boarding excellent.

title: A Very Special Airline
review_text:
My wife & I flew from Honolulu, HI to Nagoya, Japan.. This was our first time flying with JAL.  We found the service 
excellent......The ticketing agents were very professional and went out of their way to help travelers.
The stewardess on board our flight were very friendly & all of them had a smile on their faces......the food & service was excellent.......We flew economy but the leg space on our plane was great.  Lots of amenities on board: personal 
slippers for your comfort, free movies with free head sets, free snacks & drinks (including wine or sake for dinner) !
Love it !

title: Top rate service and comfort
review_text:
We flew round trip from SFO to HND then to TSA to visit Tokyo and Taipei.  We've been to these cities many times.  This is the first time we flew with JAL and we certainly were not disappointed.  As with many of the Asian airlines, you will feel that you are really welcomed by all of the airline staff; unlink the United Airlines which makes you feel that they are doing you a big favor.  
The seats in the economy section are very comfortable and have plenty of legroom.  A large TV screen in the seat back offers many entertainment choices including recent Hollywood movies, etc.  The food was delicious too; although I feel they could've put less rice and more food in the main dish.  But I understand that rice is the "main dish" for Japanese so that's how it goes.  The restrooms are kept very clean throughout the flight.  They also provide disposable tooth brush for you convenience.  I think on JAL flights most of the passengers are Japanese and they tend to be more polite and quieter so you will enjoy the flights even better.  I will definitely fly JAL again!

title: one of my best flight
review_text: excellent service, i bought roundtrip tix cgk-narita-cgk, is totally worth it. but music collection from IFE not good enough. meal from narita to cgk is one of the best . but not from cgk - narita is little bit tasteless (seafood fried rice)

title: One of the Best Customer Service Ever
review_text:
We had one passenger traveling with us that required a wheelchair.  At every layover, a JAL representative was at the gate ready to transfer my Mom between the gates or terminals.  Everyone was courteous and helpful.  One customer representative even pushed my Mom from Haneda International to the Domestic terminal.  Wow!  I was expecting him to say, this is where you catch the bus to the other terminal.  He brought us to the domestic JAL (smile) service center, who then took over.  Don't expect the rude treatment of Delta Airlines toward passengers on this carrier.  Not expecting they would drag people of the plane here, ever!  Quite the opposite!!

We also had a child with us and had requested a kids meal for the flight.  This was honored without even having to ask the attendants.  As we boarded, the attendants had my son's information and had confirmed the request.  He was served his meal before the general distribution.   Really helpful when traveling with a young child.  The adult meals served were good.  Had a selection of two meat options.  Bonus was the Haggen Dazs ice cream served after one of meals.  Passengers are able to go to the mid or rear of plane to get snacks, if the choose.  Assortment of chocolate, cookies, and crackers available.

Entertainment available on the flight was great.  A great mix of current and relatively recent movies.  Also had option to customize audio, monitor flight plan maps, play games and purchase merchandise.  

Restroom facilities were clean.  Assuming the attendants perform a sweep through every so often as the toilet rolls were always full and folded in a point.  Also, didn't smell bad from over usage with a 12+ hour flight.

The planes arrived and left on time throughout our various legs to final destination.  Now I'm spoilt and will be expecting this level of service from U.S. carriers.

title: Nice Design Plane
review_text: Can't imagine JAL can have a very good leg room on the plane and with very good and advanced technology entertainment system. That's is really impress me that JAL provide a nice plane for passengers. Service is really good and fast. Food is good also. Overall is 4 stars in stead of 5 stars.

title: JAL provides excellent service and above average accomodations
review_text:
Jal provides a good customer experience flying directly to Haneda from SFO.
Be sure to check into your flight at the first available time, otherwise you might not get seats where you want.  Thankfully when checking our baggage in the clerk was able to get my wife and I two seats together.
Staff was attentive and friendly.  Food was good.  In flight entertainment had lots of movies available in english.

title: Why so hot in your plane?
review_text:
Pros: leg room is good enough, flight attendant are corteous, inflight movie is updated. The 1st class and business class looks good
Cons: We travel during th spring time and i understand that the weather outside is rather cold so they use the heater.... but heater for the whole 6-7 hrs travel was uncomfortable. I had to fan myself and it was hard to sleep when its too warm. Probably use heater on the first few minutes but do cool down the temperature after. I had a migraine after my ride

title: Racial zdiscrimination and Insensitivity to Handicapped Travelers!
review_text:
Disappointed that Japan Airlines has not responded after 3 weeks of "management is researching the simple facts. My original post can be seen one wek ago here on atravel Advisor. Hmm... They would not sell me an available seat in business clas after requesting this at the time of reservation, then check in then at the gate and ON THE PLANE WHEN I FOUND AN AVAILABLE BUSINESS CLASS SEAT!!!!

I have given them till 12 noon Cebu City time on May 1st to respond . Notification was to Customer service (by phone) last week and here onFB, LinkedIn and Travel Advisor that if i don't get a response in this reasonable amount of time I will be taking further legal action. Why don't they just take care of this so I can close this chapter and move forward? Hmm...  😐

title: Very desapointed
review_text:
Very desapointed With my first flight on JAL 
I have booked a flight from Nagoya to Helsinki for my family on JAL(4peoples). I was not able to registered online. I Arrived at the airport more than two hours between take off. At the moment to registered the steward told us that it is not possible to have seat nearb6 but it will tried to solve this. He said the flight is full. He couldn't and he propose an other solution where seat are not a nearby at all. We noticed that the seats are at the middle of the plane instead in the first rank.
When we arrived in the plane we observed that there first places which were planed where much more comfortable that the places we have : more space and when you are tall as I'm it's important. If the steward told us that we will have choose the more solutions (the same we have on the flight from Helsinki to Nagoya).
Overbooking?
So we are very desapointed with the  first experience with JAL.
And no email to contact !

title: Most courteous flight crew ever!
review_text: Can't say enough good about the entire experience on JAL.  Nozomi bullet train drops you off a Terminal 2 for easy access to JAL.  Check-in was efficient, easy and staff were very polite.  The Sakura (Cherry Blossom) lounge for Premium Economy was delightful with full salad bar and delicious main courses plus desserts and free wines and a full array of adult beverages.  Airplane seats were spacious and offered many sleeping comforts.  Food on board was excellent.  They provided headphones that actually allowed you to hear the in-flight entertainment.  But most terrific part of this flight was the amazing courteousness of the flight crew.  Couldn't have acted more pleasantly or been more friendly or more helpful.

title: Best airline from the land of perfection. Best flights ever!
review_text:
Top service standard.
Crew was very friendly and professional, and very helpful.
Seats were spacious and comfortable, with good legroom.
Food was lovely and delicious, and very well laid out and plated.
Check-in was very warm and friendly, and boarding was done Japanese style, with great precision using announcements to board in groups by seat rows.
Punctuality was tops.
My favourite airline.

title: Domo Arigatou Gozaimasu!
review_text:
As typical of Japanese service, check-in and boarding was efficient and courteous. The sky-wider seats in economy were the best of any airline I have ever experienced, with more leg room than needed and a wider seat. Also loved the folding headrests to nestle my head with neck-styled pillow. Although I used the pillow and blanket as lumbar and bottom rests as the seats can be deemed a bit thin on cushioning after 10 plus hours. The inflight entertainment was on one largest screens I have ever experienced including premium economy on other airlines with a nice selection of movies from Hollywood and beyond.

Meal service was pleasant, with a snack of rice crackers and drink of your choice of beverage (sodas, juices, beer and liquor). Dinner was served about 2 hours into the flight with choice of fish or chicken, minimally Westernized Japanese entrees. It came with 4 sides of a soba, salad, seaweed salad, and a fruit mix, all very high quality and crafted with care (unlike those of American based airlines, this was on par with meals of BA and AF from Europe). Choice of beverage including wine was served with dinner. As usual with Trans-Pacific Asian airlines Haagen Daz was provided shortly after dinner. After lights out, was self serve snacks and drinks by the galley, this included juices/water, various crackers, cookies, chocolates and candies. Toothbrushes are available in the restrooms midway through the flight for those wanting to freshen up before breakfast. The last meal consisted of a warm pasta salad, yogurt and fruit. Overall the flight was very well serviced including flight attendants walking throughout the duration of the flight checking on any customer needs.

What happened next was extraordinary and confirmed what I believe to be outstanding of Japanese service/culture. While deplaning in HND, we had left a small cloth satchel containing cosmetics, chocolate and a toothbrush, we did not realize this until we were settled in our hotel a few hours later. We naturally assumed it would be disposed of along with all the other things that people leave on board airplanes so they could get it turned around for the next flight. Fast forward 6 days during our check-in from HND - SFO. After we were handed our boarding passes, we asked by chance if they found our satchel on the plane from a flight a week ago, after a brief description and confirmation of our previous flight information, the agent said someone would be out with it in 5 minutes. WOW and in 5 minutes??? While waiting I walked by the money changer and notice a JAL employee burst our a door running by with the satchel we misplaced earlier. Much to my wife's delight she go her bag back. This is very Japanese, where honor and customer service are of the upmost importance executed with respect, efficiency and grace. Domo Arigatou Gozaimasu!

title: Racial Discrimination and Disregard for Obvious Physical Handicap
review_text:
From My FACEBOOK Post: 
Poor Customer Service Alert on Japan Airlines (JAL)' I tried to buy this seat 3 times (during reservation, at check in and on the plane) and was told it was not available. On the plane it clearly is available and with my back injury (demonstrated to the flight crew with photographs and my obviously swollen feet) was told " So Sorry" by Chief Cabin Attendant Kyoko Ono after my offer to purchase this on the plane, Not sure is this is stupidity, racism (Japan's history) or insensitivity to handicapped people. I have requested a call from their management twice now and have got nothing back so far. If not today this gets posted in my LinkedIn profile with ove 1,000 contacts that travel extensively.Good service from JAL over the years are erased by this blunder, his flight commemorated my 1,000,000th miles actually flown for business on their Partner American Airlines, This is a good chunk of my 4,500,000 actual flown miles with various carriers over my 40 year career span. Still awaiting a call from JAL or American Airlines,,,

It's now been over 2 weeks and I'm STILL WAITING to hear back from JAL Management. yesterday I sent a message to management  through their customer service contacts (very weak trained) that said I must wait without any commitment on a due date for their response, This is to be considered my official notice that the due date is May 1st (AKA Mayday : Universalr Term for Distress) by 12 noon Cebu City , Philippines time or before for appropriate apologies and financial consideration. If someone has contact info on the firm handling the United Airlines Fiasco, please share this in case I need to take action I sincerely do not want to take. My preference is to update and remove my Facebook post yet they drag their feet and show further disrespect towards white people and handicapped Americans,This will now go on LinkedIn with the same sincere request for professional resolution... All the best, Dave Kilian

title: One of the best flights
review_text:
The service standard was high in Japan. Similarly, compared to the airlines in many other countries, Japan Airlines is a lot better. The seats were comfortable. The leg space was the most generous among all the airlines I have flown. The service was amazing. The flight attendants were very friendly and always smiling. They remember the simple requests. The meal was much better than most of other airlines, in terms of both the portion and the taste. There was also Japanese beer, sake and plum wine to choose from (on top of regular drinks).

I strongly recommend JAL.

title: Excellent Way to Get to Japan
review_text: Quite possibly as good as it gets in economy class. All of the flight attendants were polite and provided great service. The seat itself was great (for economy class). Because JAL only has 9 seats across on the 777, each seat was a nice ~18.5 inches wide with ~34 inches of pitch. Compare that to the ~17 inch wide seats on the same plane on American Airlines with only ~31 inches of pitch. The food was also very tasty and dessert was Haagen Dazs ice cream! In terms of inflight entertainment, each economy seat had a pretty big screen on the back of the seat containing a good selection of movies and TV shows in both Japanese and English. There probably could have been more Hollywood blockbusters included, by that's just nitpicking on details. Overall, it was a great flight.

title: amazing
review_text: We flew from DUB to Tokyo via Helsinki and on the way back flew from Osaka (Itami) to Dublin via HND. I thought that the transfers would be complicated in Helsinki and Tokyo but they were seamless. The worst was Heathrow, so poor in regards to the service and their standards. I cannot fault Japan Airlines, they made our honeymoon special and made us feel like family. They know how to be a full service airline and they are proud of their job. Fantastic all around and I can verify that they are one of the best in the world. Thank you JAL

title: JAL remains Japan JAL
review_text:
Just experienced JAL after a lapse of many years. Had to go to Osaka to via Haneda,
The transit experiences were efficient but lacked the  expectations; transit information (English) was incorrect; suspect the Company never reviewed the English version.
I thought the planes (4) were old . The entertainment panel and the programmes were 
behind the the newer competitors - fundamentally old.
Another old positive is the Japanese service which was good. But the linguistic skill of the announcers were similarly like before. English pronunciation remains old Japanese standard. (But this is throughout Japan - standard of spoken English remains archaic)
One great positive was the breakfast 2 hours before landing at Changi. It was superb. 
The plane landed at 6.25am; 10 minutes behind the schedule - the pilot apologised.
What great courtesy ... that's Japanese. These make me going back there. Imagine when the Japan Tourist Board wakes up!

title: Class act!
review_text: I fly JAL, every 3 months. They are my first choice. Wish they did Hnl to Bkk.. Highly recommended! They go out of there way,with classic Japanese style.Great service,and amazing food,drinks! Very comfortable!

title: Wonderful experience
review_text: I flew with a of 31 people to Japan and without a doubt the flight to Tokyo, and the return flight, was one of the best air travel experiences of our lives.  For me personally I can confidently state that this was THE best flying experience (in coach class) I have ever had, and I have flown a lot - including many international trips.  The seats are 18.5" (compared to 18" for domestic flights) wide and have an extra 4" of legroom (due to increase pitch and a slimmer seat design).  One of the things which stands out is that when we were about to land in Tokyo, the Flight Attendants took the time to walk through the entire aircraft, look each and every passenger in the eye and personally thank us individually for flying with them.

title: Best flight I've ever had
review_text: Excellent food, comfy seats, free wine, excellent inflight entertainment with lots of choices of new movies, easy checkin and efficient and friendly flight staff.

title: Japan Airline Rocks!
review_text: Best airline experience I've ever had!  The seats are very comfortable-- if you aren't able to upgrade to business class with mileage (we weren't) I HIGHLY suggest Premium Economy.  We found out about it for our return flight   and the seats were roomier and the foot position was movable (up and down)- very important on a 17 hour flight. The food is also terrific-- BY FAR the best coach food I've ever had.  An extremely pleasant staff.

title: Simply "The Best"
review_text: Superb customer service. Polite, gracious and friendly FAs.  Excellent meals - a choice of Japanese and Western food.  I opted for Japanese cuisine which was sublime. The passengers were predominately Japanese who exhibited utmost respect for fellow passangers by not reclining the seat and the toilets remained clean from take-off to landing. The flight with JAL set the tone for my holiday as it was a wonderful relaxing experience. I highly recommend this airline to everyone!

title: Really recommend
review_text:
Flown with JAL many times. Japan hospitality is the best compared to Australian airlines.

On top of great service you can check in twice as much as most airlines.

At Narita airport I had a connecting flight to Osaka, however the staff realised for me that I actually needed to be at Haneda airport! Quite a shock for me, but the check in lady took me to the correct bus counter in the airport to get to Haneda. She even knew when the bus was leaving. Good luck getting that service from Australian airlines.

Small tip: if you plan to buy a data SIM card in Japan for your photo, you can do buy it from the flight attendants during your flight  (check the on-flight shopping section on the entertainment system). It's cheaper than buying at the airport.

Flying domestic from Tokyo to Osaka is also a pleasure. I was really worried I might miss my flight as I had to bus it between the two Tokyo airports, but in Japan you can check in with less than 30 minutes from flight departure. Again good luck checking in on an Aussie airline with less than 60 minutes before the flight.

If you are flying to Japan, JAL should be your top choice.

title: Wonderful Experience flying JAL
review_text: Flew JAL home from Thailand. It was a wonderful flight including having to be bused from  Narita to Haneda. Staff were exceedingly nice and made the flight ever so enjoyable.

title: Excellent service
review_text: Best flying experience I've had. We flew Economy and the seats were very comfortable and we did have good leg space. The crew was so nice and attentive to our comfort. The food was super good.

title: Best airline as occassional I have ever been on.
review_text:
On Mar. 28th, 2017, I took flt. #9 out of Ohare.  On Apr. 4th, 2017 I took flt. #10 back from Narita airport.  
Impressive
   The economy seats, cloth, comfortable, nice t.v. with new cleaned headphones
   The selections were very good for everything except music choices. 
   Bathrooms seemed very clean as well as the entire plane.
   Above average food with nice hot wash clothes offered a couple times ea. flight.
   Blankets and pillows for everyone, even in economy. 
   Very friendly, always smiling flight attendants.
   Very patient and diligent workers at counters and baggage areas.
   I am a first time flyer on a foreign airline.  It beat every domestic airline I have been  
   on in the U.S.  
   I see they made the top ten airlines in the world on tripadvisor, after my flight.  I did  
   not see ANA like I read other reviews for.

  I did like row 26 in front of the bathrooms.  Behind us was a crew storage I believe.  I could put my seat back without feeling offensive.  No extra noise or smell.  It fact most foreign travelers did not get up but usually once on the 13 hour flight.  I got up 7 or 8 times.  I'm not a well sitting person.  

  Smooth flight and landings were without any bump on the runway.  That impressed me.  I liked the crew before boarding, looking at the travelers and bowing and smiling at them, then turning to man the aircraft.  I felt comfortable as I am usually stressed before any flight anywhere.  

I would recommend this airline to a friend and take it again myself.

title: I've never been on a more quiet flight in my life!
review_text:
This was the second leg of a flight from LAX to Singapore (a code share, United flight). I boarded in Narita, and thought I might want to sleep part of this leg, as I was exhausted. But I'd see how the flight went. (I generally wouldn't have, but the first leg of the flight from LAX to NRT was brutal. In business class, but the seats in front of me had passengers who insisted on talking to each other across the aisle, the person behind me insisted on using my backrest as a leaning device every time he got up, and there was a screaming child three rows over. I couldn't sleep but a half hour all the way across the Pacific.)

I wasn't sure I wanted a middle seat on this flight, but I was assured I was the only one in the middle seat. When I boarded the plane and saw that seat? Oh my! Little tables on both sides of me, the lay flat seat in the middle, fully featured set up in front of me (power outlet, pull out drawers and ledges, screen, etc). I settled in and...

I think I was asleep before we were even 15 minutes into the flight. I missed meal service, but didn't really "miss" it. I think I woke up once, and headed to the lavatory, and when I got back to my seat, the "flight angels" had fluffed my pillow, reset my duvet, rearranged my slippers... and vanished. I never heard a single sound the entire flight but the light whisper of the flight attendant's skirts and they whisked past down the aisle. The other passengers? The most polite passengers I've ever seen on any flight anywhere (and remember, this was just coming off of a flight with some of the loudest and rudest passengers, so oh my gosh, heaven!). A full seven hours of utter silence. I didn't even really know there was anyone there, unless I pulled a "gopher" and popped my head up over my little seating area.

Absolutely the best service anywhere. Bottles of water were replaced before they were 1/4 empty, and I had two bottles put into my hands before I left the plane. Most polite flight attendants anywhere. And the bit of food I ate was truly lovely! I felt like I was in first class, I think the only thing missing was a shower and bathrobe!

title: Great airline to fly with
review_text: Seats are nice with noticeably more room than any American airline. Service was excellent. entertainment was first class I will fly with them every chance that I get

title: excellent customer service
review_text:
superb customer service. FAs are friendly. 
In flight meal is okay. 
with in flight entertainment and can charge phone.  
but why is the doraemon movie has no english subtitle :(  

overall, had a good flight experience.

title: Fantastic as always
review_text: Food is great. They serve some traditional Japanese food and Western food. The flight is on time and smooth.

title: A Popular Flight From US
review_text: This flight was full and left on time and arrived on time. The aircraft was a new Boering 787 with the benefits that aircraft supplies. Food service was good and better than most.The staff were as usual friendly and courteous. They do need to do a better job in providing customers with arrival documents as none were supplied. Baggage collection in Narita is always fast.

title: Nice Manila-Narita Flight
review_text:
It's my second time to fly Japan Airlines on Business Class. The flight is very nice and very smooth. We had a comfortable and fuss-free flight on both ways.

What I Like:
- The flat-bed seats in Business Class is superb. Plus the pillow is very comfortable. 
- Nice and smooth plane ride.
- Flight attendants are very nice and accommodating. 
- Entertainment selections are good. Movies are current.
- The Sakura Business Lounge in Narita is superb. They have a Relaxation Room where you can get free massages. Food selection needs improvement though.

What I Don't Like:
- The headsets are stored in a tacky plastic bag.
- The menu can be improved. They are good but I had better Business Class food selections in the past.
- In-flight wifi was wonky on our flight back.

title: The best airline!
review_text: I have flown with JAL twice to go to Japan. The cost is comparable to other direct flights. The in flight service is amazing! I have flown many North American airlines and there is no airline that even comes close to JAL. My next trip to Japan will definitely be with Japan Airlines without a doubt.

title: everything was excellent
review_text: The service of JAL is 5 star. It had the best food including japanese noodles, yummy fruits etc. The lavatories are clean. Crew are very professional. If you are a oneword frequent flyer it is 5 star.

title: Comfortable ride
review_text: I was really surprised to find that the economy class seat of JAL is spacious with enough leg room.  The vegetarian meal was also a surprise  and the Haagen-dazs ice cream was just wow!:) The cabin was quiet and I really appreciate the plug where I could charge my phone to get me ready upon landing.

title: Great service
review_text: Took JAL business class round trip from Vancouver to Hong Kong and have to say the service was amazing.  JAL has US based airlines beat on service.  It is a shame that they don't fly from the US to Europe!

title: Great service
review_text: I flew from Copenhagen to Tokyo for a meeting with JAL. However, from Copenhagen to Paris was flown by Air France under code share. The flight from Paris to Tokyo was the best for me (have been flying since 2006). The warm towel provided on board is fantastic, that is only provided in business class on other airlines. Food and drinks quality is great. I would recommend it.

title: Comfortable and efficient
review_text:
Not the best in business class travel but very comfortable and efficient. 
Offered a turn down service as well.
Speedy check in, fast track immigration and priority boarding, everything you'd expect in Sydney. On the way back we had a stopover in Tokyo and I guess JAL would have a lot of business class passengers and didn't offer the fast track service.
Plane was a bit worn and not the new planes they've been operating eith previously.
Was expecting the Japanese food offering to be better and although the presentation was good overall quite bland and was slightly disappointed on the quality. Steak on the way back was wonderful though not enough in my opinion. Wife didn't even want to share her steak, as I had the Japanese option.

title: Good service airline
review_text: The services of JAL is very good. They give cuatomers a good care. They are very professional when in task. Their food looks small but delicous and high quality.

title: Buyer Beware! - Bait and Switch
review_text:
Caution!

I purchased 2 tickets (for me and girlfriend) to fly from New York to Tokyo on one of their 787 Dreamliners.  We were extremely excited about flying on a Dreamliner.  It was a big reason why we chose to fly on JAL.  We elected to stick with economy seating because the 2-4-2 configuration allowed us to have a section to ourselves, with no middle seat.  

Before our trip, however, the airline made two unilateral changes:

1)  Delayed the flight to Tokyo by 2 hours, which impacted our plans upon arrival.  They called to tell us this, yet made no mention of a plane change or moving our seats; and

2) With zero notice, the airplane swapped out the advertised Dreamliner to an older model with 3-3-3 economy seating.  Additionally, they separated the two of us on the 14-hour flight, and we no longer are seated next to each other.  The flight is fully booked, so we were stuck.

Overall, we are extremely disappointed and frustrated with JAL, and would advise caution when booking with them.  JAL advertised a certain plane and seating chart, plus specific flight times, then after they received our money, switched us to a worse plane, moved our seats apart, and shortened our vacation.

As others have noted, JAL's customer service is awful.  They don't even pretend to care, and make no effort to address travel issues they have created.  We made phone calls and emailed customer service.  The only option they offered us was to cancel our flight just weeks before we were scheduled to depart, when other airlines are booked or super expensive.

Anyways, if you are going to purchase tickets on JAL, be prepared for disappointment.

title: Medical service
review_text: I flew this flight on March 6th. The first meal was fine and then after 8 hours or so they passed out a bunch of mush. Wow, how disappointing when hungry. It looked good but there was not much to it. But my main beef is that upon arriva after nearly 14 hours we were dumped onto a remote tarma in the rain to walk to buses for ja ostling ride to the terminal. It was worse than a Lufthansa intra-Euro shuttle. Beyond that there were plenty of available spots with jetways. It was a cost saving stupid decision.

title: Not Up To The Standard Of The More Competitive Routes
review_text: Japan Airlines is always good and the staff are friendly and courteous. The aircraft was clean and the flight left and arrived essentially on time. Baggage arrived promptly as it always does in Narita.The food service is definitelynot to the standard you get on other more competitive Japan Airlines flights such as those to London and LAX where there is much more competition. The food out of Japan is usually better than into Japan where JAL rely on other suppliers. Overall good but Business Class food service could be better.

title: comfortable
review_text: I flew to Tokyo from New York stopping in LAX briefly. This was a code share with American Airlines. The return trip was with Japan airlines. The trip going to Tokyo was comfortable and what I really liked about it was that since I do not sleep at all on planes, I read the entire time. The AA plane going from LAX to Tokyo had an actual plug so I could plug my Kindle in [not a USB port but they had that as well] so I was able to read up until the time we landed. The return trip [JAL} had the USB port but I had about 3 hours left and my Kindle ran out. Otherwise, the food was good and the staff extremely accommodating. I would fly JAL again but it is difficult to reach them on the telephone and their website is not the easiest to navigate.

title: Great airline
review_text: Very clean airline, humble staff , got an upgrade to premium economy, food was really good, way better than any international airline I have tasted, also soft drinks and water and tea ☕️ was offered all over the flight, tooth brush offered too, hostess were very very friendly ❤️❤️❤️

title: JAL Steps Up To A Higher Mark
review_text: JAL does a good job on this very competitive leg between Narita and LAX. The aircraft is a standard 777 but the food quality was a signiricant improvement over some other JAL international flights when there is not as much competition. Service is always friendly and good. The flight departed on time and arrived on time so overall a very good experience.

title: Poor Business Class
review_text:
I flew Business Class Japan Airlines from San Diego. If first impressions count the lounge they share is beyond sad and bare. I should have known then we were in for a bumpy ride. 

The seat is very small in comparison to most other major airlines. Their seats do not go into a flat bed and the front of the seat is lower that rest of seat so you keep feeing like you slipping down. 12 hours of this was agony on my back. I just could not get comfortable.

The food fell below standard too. If you want to order from their "anytime menu", you have to wait an hour after meal service which I passed on.

Hanea airport is faaaar out from anywhere in Tokyo and took us 2.5 hours in a car to Sinjuku. 

I am not looking forward to flight back home. Being cramped on a limp seat for 12 hours is no fun.

title: New aircraft and excellent business class
review_text:
JAL changed the aircraft of their Tokyo-kl route to Boeing 787 dreamliner instead of Boeing 767 in September 2016.

We used our Enrich miles to redeem a single trip back from Narita to KL. The aircraft was fitted with Jal Skysuite, which is spacious and have a lot of privacy,  however, as a travelling couples, we were unable to sit side by side as per conventional seats, as the seating arrangement is in staggering form. 

JAL's BEDD business class meal is always our favourite and it's wasn't disappointed. JAL is also one of the very few airlines providing pyjamas for a 7-hour day-flight, it was a nice touch. However, compared to few months ago, they didn't provide the face masks and eye masks for the passengers this round.

The monitor is of HD quality, and the earphone is great. The level of service is as usual top norch and the flight was smooth and pleasant. 

It's certainly much better than the Malaysia Airlines new A330 business class.

title: Professionalism and service at JAL
review_text:
I am writing to you to express my ultimate appreciation for the service and absolute professionalism to the entire staff at JAL Narita airport. Coming from Boston on a non stop flight to Tokyo I was initially worried about the flight experience, not having been on a flight nearly that long(13 hours). I was amazed at the food, comfort and best of all, service through out the flight. My economy class seat felt like first class. 
  Now, to the staff at Narita on my return trip to Boston. Because of delays and traffic conditions we were arriving extremely late to the airport. We called ahead and informed JAL of our situation and they told us they would do everything possible to get us on the plane. When arriving I was sure there was no possible way I would make the flight. Arriving at the desk with two large bags to check in the staff quickly sprang into action checking the bags and expediting my way through security to the plane where I made my flight. I salute the employees at Narita airport and throughout the company for being the pinnacle of airline service and professionalism. JAL will be my first choice wherever I go. Thank you

title: Good Old Fashion Service
review_text: The Economy Class in this Airline is Top Notch. Good Old Fashion Service. The Flight attendants were very attentive. I left my back pack in one of the terminals, but I wasn't sure which one. I only learned of this when I was boarding the airplane. I told the ladies at the gate, they made some calls and within minutes my back pack was found. The employees at JAL told me, the flight had to depart, however, they would get the name of my hotel and make sure it arrives at my hotel on the next flight. Sure enough it did. Great Service, Great Food, Excellent Leg Room. #1

title: Excellent service, let down by poor connections
review_text:
Again, poor connection within Japan disappoints with JAL. The domestic flight from CTS arrives in Haneda. One has to take luggage from this to a bus, transfer for 1 hour to Narita. Then check in again at Narita. I'm sure it's not beyond the realms of possibility to provide a smoother service for premium paying customers.

In addition, at check in at CTS the JAL staff directed us to the economy check in, despite explaining we were travelling in J class domestically and X internationally. This caused a misunderstanding, (later overcome) about usage of the Business Class lounge at CTS, and no application of Priority labels for luggage that we had to pick up and transfer to the bus for Narita. The answer is one should check in at JAL Global counter, (as there is no Business Class counter at CTS for domestic flights). Staff should have known this.

In flight service on both sectors was excellent.

title: Excellent service let down by connection issues
review_text: JAL provides an excellent service, only let down by the inability to through book luggage from international to domestic, despite connection at the same airport, (Haneda). Luggage has to be taken off at Haneda, cleared through customs, then taken by hand to be dropped for the domestic flight.

title: Good Service, more leg room
review_text:
The seat is quiet wider for economy class and also the pitch between seat relatively more room. The quality of food is good, but the taste relatively plain for Indonesian passenger, overall is OK.
Cabin attendants professional, helpful, and keep Japanese culture traditionally polite.
The fleet itself 787 quiet new and maintained well.
Inflight entertaiment actually good, but we can't tilt the display to adjust viewing.

title: Unbeatable service
review_text: It has been years since my last flight with the Japan Airlines. Service is still top among other competitors. Comfort of seats in the economy cabin seemed to have been improved. Limited choices of meals but of above average quality.

title: Great economy class.
review_text: Excellent service, more leg room (787) than in the past and decent food and drinks. Seat did get a big uncomfortable towards the end of the flight.

title: Awesomeness!!!
review_text: I traveled on flights JL-66 /JL-3007 2/22. & JL-66/ JL-3006 Flight attendants were amazing!!professional, charismatic and friendly. Made my traveling experience amazing!!! The quality of service you get from JL is unmatched w/ any airlines I have ever flown on in my life. One word: Awesomeness!!!!!

title: Top Level Service!
review_text: The service and professionalism on JAL is unsurpassed. I flew from Chicago to Tokyo and was lucky enough to be on board the Star Wars Themed BB-8 , 777 airliner and it was phenomenal. The first class seat/cubby was wonderful. Seat folded flat into a comfy bed with an additional pad available and a fluffy comforter. The flight attendants were impeccably dressed, neat and extremely polite. They were very attentive without being intrusive. Whenserving they even wore aprons with the BB-8 robot on them...it was so cool. The food and snacks were varied, very plentiful and delicious. Breakfast choices included either a traditional Japanese breakfast or a traditional American breakfast. Will fly them again!

title: OK economy flight to Tokyo - good seats, bad food
review_text:
Was on a family trip with my wife and 2 young kids. Short checkin queue in Singapore and got 4 seats in the middle in the bassinet row, so lots of space. 

There was wifi on board but we didn't try it. The Inflight entertainment equipment (touch screen & could use my kids headphones instead) was good, but did not have enough international options. Nonetheless it kept me occupied as I could not sleep. 

There was only 1 regular dinner option that was bad. As was my wifes'  gluten free meal.

We landed on time & got our luggage soon. All was OK except the food and the inflight entertainment options.

title: LONG HAUL  but nice experience.
review_text:
No long haul return home flight is ever primo.  To this I will say,  I did not feel good the entire trip home.

However,  I will say the seats were comfortable, the leg room for me was great. entertainment was great.  Food was very Japan, which is to be expected,  Just not my taste at all.The planes were very comfy, but the take off and landings were very fast, to the point my ears hurt.

I would def fly again for the service and comfort

title: Japanese service in the sky
review_text:
The staff at boarding noticed that we had booked our family in different parts of the airplane and proposed to move us together with the added bonus of having more leg room for me at the front.
The breakfast was really good (except maybe the croissant) and we all managed to sleep during the red-eye flight. Boarding was a breeze from start to finish.
Transfer at Haneda could be explained proactively (you have to take a free bus from domestic to international airport)

title: Awesome
review_text: I have flown a lot of different airlines around the world and JAL is now my favorite. From the amazing staff to the fabulous food. Couldn't ask for a better experience.

title: Incredible trip!  Fly JAL if you can!!
review_text: My son and I flew from Hanoi to Tokyo in June, 2016.  Our seats were initially unassigned as we ticketed through American Airlines, but at check in we were upgrated to Premium Economy.  I have flown first class several times on domestic airlines in the United States, but this was the most pleasant flight I have ever had.  The flight attendants were incredibly gracious, warm and calm, the seats were incredibly comfortable, the food and drinks were outstanding, and the in flight music and movie selection was first rate.  I will look for every possible opportunity to fly JAL's premium economy class in the future!

title: Amazing
review_text: Very pleasant flight on a nice new B77w, food was fantastic. the cabin is nice and clean! Me and my friend were sitting at the very back of the fight and without a question it was very comfortable!

title: bes service
review_text: Japan airlines has the best service available in flying , courteous and caring flight attendants make you feel comfortable the whole time ! I wish to fly JAL everytime i fly to asia !

title: Wonderful flight home!
review_text: A wonderful and enjoyable flight home after our honeymoon in Tokyo. The flight was comfortable, service was excellent and lunch was tasty! I actually watched 3 movies during my flight and took a short nap in between. It was amazing experience to fly with JAL.

title: Amazing overnight flight
review_text: We flew from KUL to NRT for a overnight flight and it was a very pleasant and enjoyable flight. It's our first time taking JAL and we were so surprised to be upgraded from economy to Premium economy! We enjoyed the comfortable seats, tasty breakfast and good in-flight entertainment :) Also worth mentioning their service is impeccable! Such a great start for our honeymoon.

title: Incredible food and service.
review_text: I was fortunate to fly on points in Business class on Dream liner 787. Seating was incredibly comfortable and food and service were excellent. Staff are very friendly and courteous.

title: Amazing service
review_text: The two flights it took from Chicago to HCMC, Vietnam was through Tokyo.  Service on both flights was very cordial and thorough. The in-flight movies, documentaries, music, and flight information was extensive and spot-on entertaining.  Ground staff I encountered were also quick to respond to my requests.

title: Great, comfortable flight from Japan
review_text:
When flying between the US and Japan, I'd highly recommend Japan Air Lines. Clean, spacious and comfortable. Food is good with plenty of entertainment to make the long flight go by very fast. 
Check in attendants at Narita were extremely helpful. I was traveling with ski equipment. Sitting in Economy I was only allowed 2 checked bags (skis & my suitcase). When I showed them my small ski boot bag, they checked it free of charge. Wonderful customer service and I would definitely fly them again.

title: Great service not so good food
review_text:
Flight was great business class seat private and very comfortable  I do like Japanese food but not for all meals. Was unhappy that there were not more choices being offered

Have been to Asia on other airlines and the food choices were much better for westerners. 
Flight attendants could not have been more attentive 
Due to food probably will not fly them again

title: Near-seamless experience
review_text:
This review pertains to both outward (SYD-NRT) and return (NRT-SYD) flights.
JAL first class was truly delightful. This was our first international flight in First (as opposed to business) class and the difference was very noticeable, both in terms of service and seat quality. The privacy afforded by the seats on the 777-300ER we were fortunate enough to occupy was lovely. Most of the time one could relax and imagine there was no-one else nearby. Until, that is, one wanted a drink refill or something to eat, when the staff would immediately appear.
I was mildly annoyed by the fact that our party of 4, including 2 young children, were not seated together on the return flight, instead seated at the four corners of the 8 seat cabin. I was concerned that our children would not be able to remain quiet without a parent seated next to them (something the airline had been helpful in arranging on the initial flight) and that I would need to apologise to other passengers for noise or crying. Fortunately, as the flight was a night one, they slept nearly the whole flight (a testament to the comfort of the beds!), but I was rather surprised that the airline would not have grouped us together, given that our booking was made 10 moths in advance and the ages of the children clearly noted.

title: JAL Blows It's Code Share Partners Out of the Water!
review_text:
Wow! Our American flights were changed around because of weather, and we were placed on Japan Airlines on our way home from the Philippines. I cannot even begin to tell you how much better this airline was to fly. First off, their coach seats are as roomy as extended leg room upgrades on American...maybe bigger. And you don't have to pay more! That alone makes me respect them, because they treat people like human beings instead of sardines! 

 The video screens were on then back of the seats, and they were a nice size, more like an iPad rather than a large phone like on American. Plus, there are little stretchy pockets on the back of the seat where you can put your glasses or a water bottle or whatever you want to easily keep within reach. SUPER convenient, and smartly planned. 

The food was amazing. I was stunned, actually. They kept us well fed throughout the flight. And the flight attendants are incredibly sweet and attentive. 

I actually enjoyed our super long flight.  We are going to Indonesia in October and planned our trip in such a manner that we will be flying with Japan Airlines the whole way, even though we are American Airlines mileage members. We got lucky that we could use Japan Airlines for the whole trip! I'm actually excited to fly because of this great airline. American and United could take some lessons from this airline company on every level!  Sorry I can't remember what kind of plane it was!

title: Pay the extra to Japan.  Service and comfort far above AA or UA
review_text:
I actually booked this flight as an American Airlines codeshare, and didn't know it until American wouldn't assign me any seats 3 months before the flight.  The 777 seats in economy were the roomiest compared to all US airlines.  I'm 6'1" and I had 4-5" in front of my knees in regular economy.  I didn't get this much room paying extra on AA and I never did on United because the upgrade to "economy plus" price is ridiculous.  

Each seat in economy had its own power port and USB port to keep you electronic device going.  There was a larger than average screen to watch movies that you could start or resume at any time.  The food was good and beer and wine were free.
JAL has made the 12 hour economy flight bearable.  I'll shop with JAL right from the start next time and forego any of my AA miles because they only gave me half on a codeshare anyway.

title: Quality Regional Service
review_text:
As with every flight I have taken with JAL this was a very comfortable, relaxing and enjoyable flight.
They were very efficient at boarding and getting the flight away on time. The seat was very comfortable and spacious for a regional business class. Staff were very friendly and helpful and were willing to offer advice and recommendation on our destination.
