The food and drink was of a high quality and of a good quantity for flight of a reasonably short distance. It was definitely good value for money. Every time I have flown Business with JAL, domestically, regionally and between Europe and Japan I have found them to be of a very high level and would always recommend flying with JAL.

title: JAL WAS AWESOME!!!
review_text: As this would be a very long flight from Chicago, I researched both JAL and ANA, thoroughly.  I talked with co-workers and family. I flew to Japan for business and leisure travel in October/November, 2016.  I chose JAL since they were offering a promotion with the Premium Economy seats.  JAL's staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful at all times. Seating was comfortable and excellent choice!! Food was excellent and I was introduced to a new snack - "Natto".  I saved a bag so I could purchase this product in the USA, yet, it wasn't available here yet so I will consider ordering this thru EBAY or Amazon since it is only offered overseas. JAL's airplane was clean, comfortable and thoroughly enjoyable. JAL also included slippers at no extra charge.I would rate them #1 - outstanding!!

title: love this airline for its overall comfort
review_text: excellent legroom, very good service and movie selection. not too sure about its boast of being the most punctual but I might prefer it to other options for a flight to Japan in future.

title: Excellent service and marvellous Muslem Meal serve
review_text: This is my first time travelling to other country and the very first country that I travel is Japan! For your information, I'm Malaysian and it is just like wow impression that very first travel is go to Japan.. There a lot of country in ASEAN that have so much attractio but Japan is my choice to start my travel agenda.. So, in order for going to Japan, 'Japan Airline' is one from 4 flight that I take.. Main  thing that I reaally love of Japan Airline is they can serve a really great Muslem Meal for Muslim passenger..

title: Great service and excellent food
review_text: Food is great and never stop coming. Started with light refreshment and .The main meal was great and later serve ice cream for desert. Within 2 hours, they serve around of cake and refreshment.

title: Best flight attendants in the air but some drawbacks to JAL
review_text:
Pleasant enough flight.....and the flight attendants are outstanding.  There is a discernable different between how these flight attendants treat passengers in coach versus what most other (and especially US based airlines) flight attendants do.  Lots of smiles, very polite, very respectful.  A breath of fresh air.  However, there are some distinct drawbacks to JAL.

1) In certain lower cost fare classes, you cannot secure a seat assignment until, generally, 72 hours before departure.  This is annoying.  Then, to secure the seat assignment, online, you need to know the JAL booking reference code.  Therefore, if you book a JAL segment through a travel agent or through another partner airlines, call that provider and get the JAL booking code - and it will be different from the partner airline's code.

2) The legroom is significantly less (I'm guessing 6 inches less) than say AA's economy "extra."  For short hauls, okay - for long haul's it would be torture.

3)No frequent flyer miles, for example, for most economy fares in the AA frequent flyer program - even though JAL is a partner airline.

4) Finally - announcements are NON-ENDING and say the same thing time and time again.  Very hard to watch a movie in JAL with all there interruptions.  Having said that, their selection of entertainment options is quite good.

title: It was just okay, nothing special.
review_text: Our short flight was delayed by about 2 hours, mainly due to TPE's inept traffic controller that couldn't handle the traffic like towers from other parts of civilized world. The seats were similar to U.S. domestic business classes with probably a little more leg room and more reclining. I actually slept for about an hour during the flight, so that was good. The executive lounge at HND was far from our gate (but with the long delay, we had no problem getting to and back to the gate), but unfortunately, there was no first class lounge. So, the choices of food and drinks were quite basic. As noted above, nothing special about the flight or the lounge, though the service was decent.

title: The flight was pleasant, but certainly was not as nice as I remembered.
review_text: My wife and I decided to try JAL instead of our regular airlines AA for the flight to Taiwan with a change of plane in Haneda. We had really good memories of the last few times that we flew JAL on pacific crossing flights. This time around, it wasn't as good. The service was good, but the food has fallen a little from our previous flights, though they still serve hot udon soup, which I enjoyed. The seats, however, were not lay-flat (it was my fault for not checking the plane before booking, as I expected all pacific crossing flights.) On the other hand, the angle-flat seats were still better than AA's angle flat seats on those flights from LAX to PVG.  We don't recommend this flight unless JAL changes the configuration on its planes; alternatively you should look into flights from LAX to Narita instead.  One good thing about flying JAL instead of AA out of LAX is that as Executive Platinum member of AA, we have access to the Qanta's first class lounge, which is probably the best lounge that I have ever used.  Had we flew AA, then we will be out of terminal 4 and only have access to AA's Admiral Flagship lounge, which is not nearly as good as the Qanta's lounge.

title: dependable airline with great service
review_text:
This was the first time I flew in the Boeing 787 dreamliner...and I was impressed with the overall spacious cabin and high-tech feel of the plane.  I was slightly disappointed with the seat arrangement in business class...but found the seat to be rather comfortable, nonetheless.

JAL has two versions of the Boeing 787...the larger one has the JAL suite in business class that comes with a more private fully lie-flat seat (flies to Narita Tokyo from LAX).  I flew on the smaller version from LAX to Kansai airport in Osaka).  The seat appears to be the older type business class seat in 2-2-2 arrangement and has an angle lie flat seat.

As expected of any Japanese airlines, the service was spectacular.  The stewardess are very attentive and courteous.  Prior to takeoff, the chief stewardess goes to each passenger and introduces herself.  She does the same at the end of the flight asking for any suggestions or comments.  They are always cheerful and seem to really enjoy their job.

The food is spectacular.  They offer both Japanese style and Western style food.  I can't say anything about the western style, as I ordered Japanese style on both trips.  Food is tasty, and they give you ample amount of it.

The seats were comfortable.  But as most airlines now offer lie-flat seats in Business class, I was surprised that JAL didn't do that for all their airplanes.  But the seat was comfortable enough.  good thing was that the flight was not full, so the stewardess changed my seat to a row all to myself.  Hence, I got a window seat, and I didn't have to jump over another person to get to the aisle.

title: Pleasant flight BUT the worst airline food we've ever eaten!
review_text:
My husband and I recently flew premium economy from Boston to Tokyo (Narita) on JAL's new non-stop Boeing 787-9 "Dreamliner". We were pleased not to have to make a connection on the west coast and based on JAL's excellent reputation were looking forward to a great flight. 

Check-in was straightforward and the flight boarded and departed on time. The seats were comfortable, personal entertainment options plentiful, and many amenities provided. The flight attendants provided professional yet friendly service for the duration of the flight.  

Since neither of us eats meat, we ordered a vegetarian meal, normally of good to excellent quality on every international flight we've ever flown. In this case however, the food quality ranged from poor to positively inedible! On our flight to Tokyo our main meal consisted of curly egg noodles with a tablespoon of thin tomato sauce while on the return flight we were served rice, a TVP "burger" with a speck of ketchup that was as rubbery and tasteless as it appeared (it was returned uneaten). 

Overall, the flight was very good and while we had no complaints except for the food, we were quite surprised at just how bad it was! If we fly JAL again we'll remember to bring along a plentiful supply of our own food!

title: A Good Airline Even Where There Is Little Competition
review_text: JAL have this pretty much to themselves but they did a good job as expected flying an older Boeing 767, which was full. Service was as expected as was the food. It was clean and left and arrived on time which is what you can expect with JAL which is one of the better airlines.

title: Excellent - great airline
review_text:
This is possibly the most efficient, professional and comfortable airline I have ever traveled with.

They left on time, boarded on time, landed on time.

The crew were exceptional. It was the fastest boarding I have ever seen.

Check in was smooth and helpful with a great grasp of English.

Highly recommend.

title: Free Wi-Fi on JAL domestic flight
review_text:
It was a perfect experience to fly JAL's domestic flight all the time, so just to share my most recent trip here.

I was travelling with my husband from Tokyo Haneda to Okayama last weekend.
The flight time was about 1.5 hours, half of the travel time by bullet train (Shinkansen), while the price is almost the same.

Since both of us have joined JAL's mileage program, we used the Touch & Go boarding flow by just tapping the membership cards on the security checkpoint and boarding gate. Everything was smooth. It is so amazing and convenient that you don't need to check in or get a boarding pass when boarding JAL's domestic flights!

When we entered the cabin, I found JAL was providing the cover bags for passengers to wrap their carry-on baggage. It is such great Japanese hospitality! Every time when I fly with other airlines, I try not to put my bag on the floor to avoid getting dirty.

Our seats were at the economy class section. All seats are leather seats and clean. The legroom is wide enough even I put my bag under the front seat.

During the flight, free drink was offered. We liked to try something special, so I chose "cosome soup" while my husband picked their original juice "SKYTIME". Not bad choices.

As the flight time was quite short, we didn't try to sleep. My husband read the in-flight magazine. I was excited to try their free in-flight Wi-Fi! On the day before, I found on JAL's website that they are offering Wi-Fi for free on domestic flights. I registered the Gogo account before the flight as the website suggests.

It was so easy to get connected than I imagined. The speed was fine. I just browsed some recommendations on restaurants in Okayama.

The flight landed smoothly and on time. The weather in Okayama was nice!
It was really an enjoyable trip with JAL.

title: Long flight
review_text: This was the first leg of our trip to Hanoi and the longest. The airplane was brand new and the seats were nice and wide everything was spotlessly clean on the flight even when we landed. Service was great too.

title: One of the best airlines
review_text:
I bought my JAL ticket from a third party vendor and it was cheap.  However, on the day of the flight, I decided to pay $300 one way to upgrade my seat to Premium economy.  It was expensive for a one way upgrade.  I thought I made the wrong decision BUT it was not a bad decision.  As soon as I saw my premium economy seat, I thought I was in a business class.  My seat has a leg rest and it reclines, leather seat, my own lamp, a couple of chargers and outlet. The seat is spacious and I still have the space to place my jacket, headphone and neckrest. The temperature inside the plane was warm. No blanket needed.  Bathroom is relatively wider than the other airlines that I had taken. The airline offers toothbrush, toothpaste, and slippers.  This is the cleanest airline bathroom that I had seen even though it was used by a lot of passengers.

The food was okay but I wish the airline would offer ramen and tofu (ha!).  For a premium seat, I was offered wine before and during meal.  It was a good wine, though. 

The only thing that I did not like was, the plane that flew us from Manila to LAX was an American Airlines.  I know that they are partner airlines but I wish it will be JAL again.  Tickets are not cheap though but I wish the airline will offer a one day tour of Japan.  I will take JAL to my future Asian trips.

title: Customer service top
review_text: It was my first flight with JAL. I've heard about Japanese airlines and I can confirm the service is very friendly, the aircraft is super clean, organized and new and the highlight beside the service was the food they've served, it was delicious for a economic class. I strongly recommend it.

title: Business seats- don't lay flat
review_text:
While the service is wonderful, what you come to expect out of a several thousand dollar ticket in business class on a 787-8 doesn't happen. The seats don't lie flat and are horribly uncomfortable for sleeping in your 12 hour 30 min flight. Window seats are seated next to someone else and are quite narrow. 

Tip- 7A is a great seat- bulk head so extra leg room, But you will have to climb over the person next to you. 

Seats 7 are in the sun side of the plane from LAX and get quite hot! (See the pic I posted) Ask for the "window stickers" to black out the windows- they do exist- there aren't any actual pull down window shades otherwise. Only window dimmers. 

Food- wonderful! Watch out for shellfish if you have an allergy. Scallops and lobster in several meals in both the Japanese and American meals. 

The Japanese noodles with seaweed are pretty good- a bit salty from the seaweed but if you want to try your 1st noodles now's the time and juts push the seaweed to the side if you aren't up for the green slime! :)

The chocolates are divine.

title: What a magnificent airline - both aircraft and staff !!!!
review_text:
I have travelled overseas many a time but to date had never flown JAL. This time I had the opportunity to fly on JAL's new Dreamliner plane on my own from NY to Tokyo business class. 
The plane was magnificent in its internal set up in that despite the seating arrangement in business class in pairs the arrangement was such that the seats were set with a slide up screen between each pair of seats, thus providing you with your own private area.
Initially you were provided with a pillow, larger than the standard pillow provided, and a light weight cotton doing. The seats lay completely flat and you were provided with a mattress to put over the seating once you were at a particular height so you could go to sleep.
Each individual unit had all of the standard business class goodies - remote control TV with a multiplicity of channels, comfortable headphones, your own personal lighting system so as not to disturb others. 
The menu provided was amazing, allowing you to provide from Japanese or Western style menu.  You could order when and what you wanted from the menu at any time during the flight.  At no particular time were you required to eat, but at the mere press of the attendant button you could order food or drinks, which were extensive, at will. 
The staff, right from the moment you joined the check in queue to those who farewelled you at the other end were amazing.  Nothing was too much trouble for them and you were never left to feel like your request was too much to ask for or unnecessary and were answered promptly and graciously.  
All in all the airline and its staff were absolutely wonderful.

title: leg rooms are horrific
review_text: I sat in the middle of 4 persons in a row economy class. The guy next to me had to stand up approximately 2-3 hours due to poor leg room and space between us. Yet, I only weighed 120 lbs

title: Average at best
review_text: This was a very average service that we experienced. Food was below average. Service was very slow. Only thing good was the aircraft was a new Dreamliner.The in flight entertainment had limited choices. This is no comparision to ANA.

title: The finest in-flight service imaginable!
review_text:
I have flown on many airlines all over the world and have experienced business and premium classes on some of the finest, but JAL has eclipsed all of them! The cabin, restrooms, and personal space were all immaculate and restful with attention to such details as to make a very long flight feel relaxed and brief. A supplemental mattress for sleep and earphones that actually cancelled out noise and allowed me to hear the films clearly, were just two of the welcome appointments. 

The meals were of gourmet quality. I chose the Japanese menu, and found it varied, delicious and completely satiating -- almost a part of the entertainment system as I explored the diverse offerings. The two brands of sake offered were both of top quality and nicely complemented the repast. 

But by far, the best part of the trip was the hospitality offered by the gracious flight attendants from the moment I boarded to the time I almost reluctantly disembarked. Though all were faultless, I must single out one. Okubo was absolutely splendid and went above and beyond any expectations I had of gracuoius hosting on an airline. It is one thing for an attendant to smile and exercise politeness, but for that hospitality to be utterly genuine and emanate from a truly warm person is quite something else. While all of my interactions with this caring young woman were highlights of an already exemplary trip, I was really touched when she brought me a little package of gifts for my 5-year old step daughter Okubo learned I was visiting. 

I wish I could travel everywhere on this airline with this attendant; I'm afraid that JAL and Okubo have left me quite spoiled. 

I would not hesitate to recommend any of JAL's international flights, particularly for any who might be reluctant to travel so far.  Oh, and lest I forget, the flight was among the smoothed ever encountered, even when we hit a bit of turbulence that would have gone unnoticed had the pilot not told us. And lest I forget, part 2: the check-in woman in Boston was also top-notch.

title: Amazing service
review_text:
JAL did everything they could to ensure our holiday was as good as it could be.
The over and above came as a result of our flights from Calgary being overly delayed, thanks Air Canada ( not sure why 3 hrs late leaving) and Westjet ( missing pilot).\ but the JAL staff picked up both parties in golf carts and rushed us to the plane which they held as long as they coould. The collected our luggage from AC and WJ and forwarded it to our hotel in Bangkok the next day.
When we left ko Samui, Bangkok Airlines flights were suspended due to rain, so we were 18 hours late leaving, barely made the JAL flight home and they located our luggage from Bangkok Airways for us and arranged for it to come to Calgary-something they were not responsible for as i wasnt their fault or responsibility.
They did help, they earned my respect for sure.
The flight itself was amazing, staff were terrific, service phenomnenal and the food outstanding. WIll definately fly JAL again overseas.
Cannot say enough great things about them

title: purchased ticket online and took my money. but never issued ticket. customer service can't help and blames alipay
review_text: Terrible customer service and experience through the Chinese JAL service. Their website offered alipay as a payment and I went through purchase. however, it took my money and never issued ticket. So, i called in and rep confirmed that there was a website bug that was not really operational but could not do anything about refund or issue ticket. she had all my reservation information but said that it was out of her hands and that i needed to take up the issue of refund directly with alipay, She was terribly unhelpful and felt no responsibility to resolve their  website blunder.

title: Never fails to impress
review_text:
I'm a big fan of JAL. I fly them frequently and always enjoy their in-flight service.

Their ground staff is also very helpful and courteous.

Meals are good and the planes clean and comfortable.

One of the reasons I love to fly on them is that I feel like I'm already in Japan from the moment I board the plane!  They are very customer focused and attentive to their guests.

Although the cabin temperature can be warm at times,  if you mention it to the flight attendants, they will make some adjustments to add cooler air to the cabin.  

The only thing that I wished is that they participated in the TSA pre-check program.

Fly JAL - you won't be sorry!

title: Awesome expereince
review_text:
one word - awesome
Felt like I am at home..
superb service staff
Food - very good
leg space - appropriate
seats quality - very good
comfort - very good

title: good service
review_text: I flied with this airline last year and I really love this company. The air crews and ground crews are very friendly and nice. The food is very yummy as well.

title: Imaginative in-flight food in economy!
review_text: The standard on JAL was a lovely surprise - generous legroom, good service, and really imaginative food. They have clearly given this some time & effort, involving food stylist Nami Iijima to create the menus - which are tasty & fresh (salads with tasty dressing, wide range of fruit in fruit salads etc). Other airlines take note!

title: excellent in service!
review_text: the attendants on this flight were so nice and friendly. even with a slight language barrier they made sure to ask me like everyone else about drinks food ect. they are by far the friendliest airline i have flown. i used them in OCT 2016 as well and service was wonderful then as well!!

title: Excellent service- very comfortable flight
review_text: This flight was the best we had among other flights we had had. From the boarding experience (at Narita airport) to on board service, esp. flight attendants...was absolutely wonderful! While we were boarding there was an attendant who held the sign and guided the business class group so that the line went smotthly. The best among the attendants during our flight was Mami Ito; she was very polite and made us feel like customers are kings & queens indeed. There was another customer who was next to us who was not feeling well and Mami treated him very nicely. I could tell that the whole staff - flight attendants- worked non stop to assure the customers were well served. We were definitely satisfied with this service and would book ticket from Air Japan again. On the flight back from Tokyo to San Francisco (on United airlines) the service was not comparable even though we were on the same (business) class.

title: Nice surprise
review_text: Codeshare flight. Business travel and the flight was listed as another carrier. Had a very good meal. Entertainment options were sound. 25 years since my last trip to Japan so it was nice to return on this carrier.

title: Happy to fly JAL again after many years
review_text: From 1996-2007 we used JAL usually once a year from Australia to Europe, until we found more competitive airfares. On  this recent trip MEL-SYD-TYO overall we found the journey again pleasant, the food SYD-TYO was the best airline meal we have had for years, however the return leg main meal was the worst we have had for some time on any airline. Staff were attentive, after lights out continuing to walk the aircraft with liquids for those still awake, unlike an Australian carrier whose staff have a tendency to disappear after lights out.  The airline lounge at Narita was busy, however a pleasant experience for us; for older persons a little comfort is appreciated: we have  not previously used airline lounges.

title: Excellent flights
review_text: Purchased business class on sale roundtrip from LAX to NRT (we live in San Jose but the business class prices from SFO were more expensive, so used reward points to fly free to LAX to take advantage of the business class sale from there). Amazing service and amenities were a great way to start and finish our trip to Japan. Flew a 777-300ER roundtrip. Individual pods with lie flat seats and large privacy partitions between seats. Excellent space for storing items that you want at hand (as well as overhead storage). Large screen for movies, videos, etc, with great earphones. Blankets, slippers, and amenity kits were waiting in our seats when we boarded, and cardigans were distributed shortly after takeoff. We reserved Western and Japanese meals ahead of time, but my husband and son easily switched to Japanese meals for the flight home once boarded. Also an amazing array of dishes (such as sandwiches, udon, bento box, even ice cream) available on demand during the flight up to two hours before landing. The bathroom was kept spotless with toothbrush kits and mouthwash available at all times. What really made the flights stand out was the service--attentive, friendly, calm and well organized--with flight attendants coming to our seats to personally thank each of us for flying. Arigato JAL! Will definitely fly this airline again.

title: comfortable seat
review_text: very comfortable seat with 34 inch pitch leg room.rated as one of the best airline in economy class. service is excellent with all smiling face from air stewardess. Food and beverage are superb. quality of touch screen LCD is very good. finally the air ticket price is couple hundred higher than low cost carrier. I will continue fly JAL

title: A little shy on the service
review_text: This was a good service and the lounge was very good.    The only down side I thought was that the service was a little lax.   I think that was mainly due to the Hostess's lack of proactivity and being a little shy.   On arrival in Helsinki we received our bags promptly.    This was a long haul flight and we arrived at the other end feeling fresh and ready to go.   The main reason to fly business class

title: Domestic travel the Japanese way
review_text: Flown the JAL international business class before and was pampered from start to finish. Got this domestic business ticket for around a 1000 yens extra and honestly could not see much difference from an economy seat except that I was asked if I wanted to wrap my check in luggage in a plastic bag. When we retrieved our luggage on arrival, a ground staff came rushing to help dispose of the plastic bag. Lounge pass was not included which was a bit disappointed but everything on the light was done in grace and perfection - the Japanese way.

title: Superb flight with excellent servise
review_text: Super comfortable seat in I have ever got for economy class. And the staff is very kind and very good.foods are very tasty and have nice smell as well.you can enjoy the world entertainment as well with JAL flights. From the beginning flight crew trying to give comfortable journey to us. Highly recommended.cheers !!!

title: JAL has a real racket going on its NRT-SAN route
review_text: When Boeing's Dreamliners first arrived, JAL jumped at the opportunity to fly directly from Tokyo to San Diego, which has a small airport incapable of handling the big passenger birds of yesterday. But JAL really screwed up. The interior they chose places entertainment equipment boxes under -- as far as I can tell -- 75% of the economy-class seats. In other words, JAL went out of its way to cause its passengers on this route 12 hours of pain. For tall people, it is impossible to sit behind a seat with an entertainment equipment box under it without pinning one foot behind the knee. This causes me pain that lasts for days. There are other problems. The seats themselves are the most uncomfortable seats of any kind I have ever sat in. They are worse than bar stools. They cause me hamstring and back pain that also lasts for days. Also, the jet's interior is beginning to age and look dirty. While these flights are an absolutely miserable 10-12 hours, they are still convenient. They save time in two ways. You do not have to make a stop at another airport and wait around for a connecting flight. And San Diego's airport gets few international flights, so customs and immigration is a breeze. Plus, it's San Diego. The airport is right along the harbor; it's a beautiful place to step off a plane. And the customs and immigration people are San Diegans -- friendly, helpful and genuinely happy that you are visiting their city. While I can't recommend San Diego enough as an international destination for anyone living in Tokyo, JAL really needs to remodel the interior of its NRT-SAN Dreamliner and make it not so painful. One more note: Since JAL has a monopoly on this route, it's super expensive. If you have the time, you're much better off taking United and transferring in SFO.

title: JAL just can't getanything right
review_text: Like most Japanese companies, JAL tries really hard to give good service to its customers. JAL tries too hard on its overnight flights from Tokyo to Bangkok. This is about a seven-hour flight that leaves Haneda Airport at 12:05, just after midnight. The airplane's interior is brand new. Seat pockets fit more stuff inside them. There seems to be more leg room. I saw no entertainment equipment boxes under seats. These hard metallic, immovable boxes can ruin a flight by pinning your foot behind your knee. If you are tall, you will feel the pain for days after disembarking. So cheers for JAL getting rid of these damn boxes on its midnight HND-BKK route. But why ruin the effort and all that added comfort by turning up the lights two hours before arrival to feed us a meal of flapdoodle airline food? Let your customers sleep on overnight flights, JAL. Don't force us to eat unneeded carbs at 5 o'clock in the morning Tokyo time and cause all kinds of commotion on a previously quiet flight. One more note: The new seats are mostly great, but the bottoms curve up in the back and jab your tailbone. The seats also seem to angle downward, which keeps passengers sliding forward. This runs from being unpleasant to annoying to painful.

title: Complimentary wi-fi connection once you landed in Japan
review_text: This was my first flight experience with Japan Airlines (JAL). One of the reasons I chose this airlines because they landed in Tokyo International Airport (Haneda), instead of Narita. The in-flight services were nice. I remembered we were served a cute Japanese bento for in-flight meal. They also provided various alcoholic and non-alcholic beverages during the flight. IMO the most useful benefit when traveling with JAL was the free wi-fi connection in Japan, provided by NTT-East and Wi2 Wi-Fi. To use this service, you need to register on JAL website and provide your ticket information. The wi-fi connection can be accessed easily by using the Travel Japan Wi-Fi app.

title: Wonderful Airline excellent airport
review_text:
The entire experience was a pleasure, a great advertisement for Japan! Courtesy and service all the way, the best airline I have ever flown with. 

BA and US airlines should take note!

title: Comfort, cuisine and polite service
review_text: A very pleasant day flight. Check in and security were very polite and calm. The seating was comfortable and the entertainment varied a worked faultlessly. The cabin crew were the picture or cheerful, caring polite as and the menu options wide to cater for most tastes. The Asian option hovered on gourmet standard. Well worth it and we will use the airline again

title: JAL Boeing 787 Dreamliner was the most comfortable flight I've ever been on
review_text:
Fly JAL. It might be worth it to depart from a city that has the JAL Boeing 787 Dreamliner if your city doesn’t.  Great food.  Lots of seat room (even in regular class). 2:4:2 seating. High ceilings = lots of air circulation. Lots of free movies.  Lots of carry-on luggage space.  Neck pillow (you won't need to bring one) and blanket.  Complimentary toothbrush & toothpaste in the clean and fresh smelling washrooms. Quiet. Super friendly.  I could live on there for a month with no complaints.  Seriously.  If possible, Fly JAL.  

I wrote some tips for travelling in Japan:

http://oscohm.com/blog/2017/1/1/visiting-japan-tips-for-foreigners

title: The top of luxury
review_text: Their is no way on earth we would have been able to afford such luxury without using miles.  A year ago I booked flights from CVG to ORD on American Airlines first class and then on to NRT First from ORD JAL 9 and then on to Bangkok JAL Biz.  The leg from Chicago to Tokyo was one of the high points of my flying experiences.  There are 8 suites on the 777-300 and only four, including my wife and I, were occupied.  Since it was New Year's Eve the whole plane was only about half full.  The FAs were fantastically attentive.  The food, especially the Japanese items, was over the top great.  You could order what you wanted, when you wanted.  Each passenger got one of the other suites made up into a bed so there was no inconvenience of having to transition between bed and chair.  I know, I know, FWP.  We did have to spend a 19 hour layover at Haneda at the Excel Airport Hotel after a 45 minute shuttle bus ride, but what the heck.  Today we flew from Haneda to BKK Biz on a 777-200.  The service was also great, just not as luxurious and over the top as the 13.5 hrs in First.  The food was very good, Salmon and pasta with one of the best deserts I ever had, a Green tea custard with white chocolate hollow balls filled with some kind of green tea syrup. Wow, knock your socks off good.  The whole trip was booked with 67,500 AA miles each before the AA devaluation early 2016.  We used Mile Value booking service for $125 each and worth every penny.

title: Superb service and food but angle flat seat detracts from Dreamliner service
review_text:
Flew JAL Vancouver to Narita round trip (JL17 & JL18).  Both were on the B787 Dreamliner which is a very nice newish plane with mood lighting, larger windows, very quiet, generous overhead bins and toilets with the sprayer function common in Japan.  Unfortunately JAL opted for angle flat seats on these overnight flights so sleep is not as comfortable as most other major international airline business class. I find I do tend to slide down the angle flat bed but width and comfort of the seat was generally good.  Entertainment is OK but there is slightly less selection of movies and programs than for example on Cathay Pacific.  The real strength of JAL however is in the service.  The flight attendants are constantly working, go about their duties quietly and with elegance and make you feel truly well cared for during the flight.  They are also constantly cleaning the toilets which on a long-haul flight makes a big difference to the comfort of using the washrooms.  Food is also very good on JAL.  I tried both the Japanese meal and the Western meal.  Both are very strong.  The Japanese meal typically starts with a box containing 9 different little appetizers - always intriguing and interesting but difficult to remember which is which after reading the detailed descriptions in the menu.  The Western meal that I remember was shortribs and it was succulent and tender.  Japan Airlines also serves a special coffee in business class and in its lounges which is really delicious - probably the best coffee I have had on any airline - but unfortunately is exclusive to their flights and lounges and not sold (I asked and it is not available as part of their in flight sales).  
I also used the lounges.  In Vancouver, it is unfortunately just the Plaza Premium lounge which is open to membership subscriptions or drop ins and is crowded and not very nice.  However in Narita, I used the First Class lounge as I have One World Alliance status and it is a superb lounge - elegant and understated as is the Japanese way, with two sushi chefs making sushi to order, a buffet area with Western and Japanese/Chinese food, massage chairs and also massage therapists for quick 10 minute massage treatments.  The lounge also served high quality Suntory whiskeys which are very enjoyable.     
When one flies Japan Airlines, whether on the ground or in the air, the one thing that you can rely on is superb attentive and elegant service at a level head and shoulder above Western airlines.

title: If you fly with an American Partner Airline, Expect American Food
review_text: I was surprised to be served hot dogs on Japan Airline in my flight from Chicago to Manila with no choice for an Asian food option. In flying to Manila Eva air and Asiana both had much better food. Otherwise everything was alright.

title: Bad service
review_text: I booked my flight from Tokyo to Bangkok in Business class and the experience was not a good one no one on business class was offered a drink or towel I had high expectations from this airline and service and I don't justified the ticket cost for their service I should flight economy for the kind of service I did experience

title: Airline of the year
review_text:
Top notch. Highly efficient boarding process, welcome towel, beverage, meals that would put a lot of restaurants to shame, super attentive and friendly staff whom go out of their way for your comfort. Cabin is nice and quiet, the most amount of entertainment I've ever seen on a plane.

To summarise this airline, they took out seats from the cabin to create more leg room and comfort for passengers. I can't imagine many other airlines that would sacrifice $$ and do this.

title: A great experience
review_text:
Great experience with Japan Airlines (JAL)  - flight from London to Tokyo and return.   I normally select BA but I've had some poor experiences on different routes so I decided to try JAL.

I was not looking forward to the long flight time, travelling in economy, however it was a super experience.  At both airports the staff at the check-in desk, were professional and welcoming, At Haneda they greeted passengers from the queue taking them to the check-in desk.   

On-board the crew were professional, polite and attentive.   Economy seats comfortable and more spacious, plane and all the facilities were very clean and frequently cleaned. Meals served efficiently but with a personal service.  Snacks and additional drinks available throughout the flight. 

Return flight I bought an upgrade to Premium economy at the airport, the seats have more space between them and foot rest, seats don't recline backwards so you are not being crushed by the passenger in front's seat.   Also a larger TV screen.  Special thanks to Colin and Federico for service on return flight. 

Both flights great experience, I will definitely be choosing JAL again.

title: Great Service, Late
review_text: On the way back from Japan the flight left about 40 minutes late and we arrived about 50 minutes late. Apart from that the service was faultless and the enternainment was very good. As always on JAL the crew were very pleasant and helpful. Flying them again for sure!

title: Just what you hope for.
review_text: Flew back from Tokyo after a crap trip over from BA. Contrast could not have been greater. Wonderful attentive and courteous service. Good food and a very comfortable seating. Flight on time. Well done JAL, you can have my custom any day.

title: Genuine Japanese Hospitality
review_text: A very good airline. Check in was efficient although there were many passenger in line. Cabin crew was top rate and was always friendly and smiling. Service was incredible and this is one cabin crew that works almost all the time without rest. Flight was smooth with some turbulence but nothing major. In flight food was good from Narita to KLIA but the same can't be said for KLIA to Narita leg. Most likely due to local caters and not JAL's fault. Overall, a superb airline.

title: Comfy seats, Excellent Service, Great entertainment
review_text: When we boarded we were given a very warm welcome and they helped us put our luggage in the bins and guided us to our seats. Great take off and breakfast was above average for airline food. Inflight entertainment was extensive and good, showing a good range of movies and TV shows. Crew were very friendly and cheery. When we landed we forgot our passports on the plane, and the crew kept hold of them and waited outside of the plane for us to return (which we did). We are flying with them again in JAN and would highly recommend them to anyone.

title: excellent service ever
review_text: very comfortable flight  even economy class and very friendly crew in flight.foods are excellent and tasty.....

title: A Good Domestic Flight
review_text: JAL 912 was a short one hour flight from Shirahama to Tokyo on an Emraer 730 which was clean and neat and the flight service was very good as expected. Despite a late incoming flight 910 departed and arrived on time and the luggage appeared within ten minutes which is a feature of JAL in Tokyo and Haneda. No food but just a cold drink but that was fine. Overall JAL using one of the subsiduaries J Airlines did a very good job.

title: Excellent service
review_text: I was fly from KUL to NRT by brand new aircraft B787-9, then transit to Osaka Itami by Domestic aircraft B777-200. Overall the journey was great and no complain at all becuase i can see how they treat,serve with smile as you can see from the heart, i can see quality of service here in everything from check-in until arrive at Osaka. My son also can choose his own like toy with is complementary from airline. Good job to Japan Airline.

title: Female refused boarding
review_text:
My girlfriend was very rudely refused boarding on a flight to Japan.  A mean faced attendant stopped her at the gate and demanded she show proof of onward travel.  We only had 1-way tickets since we were staying abroad for 10 months and did not have solid plans on when we would return.  I was able to check in fine and had to run back to the gate to see what happened.  Luckily we had data connection on our phones and quickly purchased cheap plane tickets to appease the rude attendant.  It was all very stressful and we almost missed our international flight.  Seems absurd as we were flying business class and they didn't ask me (a male) anything about my onward travel plans.  Asian cultures are known for female inequality, but this was absurd.

The plane was comfortable, but this whole ordeal ruined our experience.  I contacted their customer support and received some canned apology which seemed very insincere.

title: First time flying with JAL
review_text:
The cabin crew hospitality and meals made us comfortable throughout the trip. There is ample legroom for you to stretch your leg. The kids will even get a selection of toys during the journey. 

Even if there is an error during your checking in, just let the airline counter knows and they will sort it out for you. I had encountered that my seat does not tally with my online booking however the counter is able to rectify it and solve the problem for me.

title: Something to look forward to
review_text: Whether its in the air or on the ground.....you have to love the way the Japanese approach their clients.  I don't particularly care if its genuine or just a conditioned way of being, but i do have to say i enjoy it.  Everyone i encountered during my whole JAL flight made my trip a pleasure.

title: First time flying with JAL
review_text: It was 6 hours and 50 minutes flight from CKG to Narita, transit for 3 and 30 minutes then another 12 hours flight from Narita to JFK, yet cabin crew hospitality and good meals made us comfortable ! Nice experience in our first flight with JAL, hope we'll get the same or even better experience on our flight back home next year !!

title: Working on japan cruise line
review_text: Was amazing trip also no complain becuase i can see how they treat,serve with smile as you can see from the heart,recommended to all passenger traveling anywhere with this airline ,i can see quality here in everything around...

title: Clean Comfortable Best service
review_text: Great service, best food (especially creme brulee icecream) comfortable seat. Nice flight attendants.

title: Excellent service
review_text:
great service from cabin crews, sleep well and enjoy dilicious food especially icecream

About the plane is new and wide enough space for long leg !!

title: Excellent in-flight service
review_text:
Travelled on JL 304 yesterday via B767 with their new Y class seats. Flight was full in 3 classes.

Ground technical staff bid us farewell while plane was preparing for take off.

Cabin crew did one round of drinks.

It has more seat pitch. I have travelled with their previous Y class and felt that  there was little padding in their new Y class seats.

In-flight camera was not available. However FOC Wi-Fi was available for 15 mins.

Flight arrived on time.

Thumbs up.

title: Excellent ground staff
review_text:
My family and I miss the 745am flight to Haneda and were placed for standby flights.

We had a 1145 international flight.

The check-in ladies were nice. The senior and 2 other ground staff trying to help.

One of the ladies personally escorted us to the standby counter at the dep area.

My elder daughter and I were placed at the 820am (informed at 810 am and managed to check in all 7 bags with priority tags) while my wife and younger daughter were placed at the 9am flight bound for Fukuoka.

The ground staff personally escorted with a smile; my elder daughter and I to the gate running together to the gate.

Thumbs up.

We made it back home .

Thank you.

title: EXCELLENT SERVICE !!!
review_text: This is the second time my husband and I have flown JAL to Manila, Philippines.  Their lounge is exceptional.  Service on the airplane equally so.  We will keep on flying this airline -- they make the long trip very comfortable.

title: Comfortable Flight
review_text: Crew for this flight always give a great smiles to passenger and welcome gift are provided to child :) Stewardess did their job very well, they served verity of drinks to passenger all the times.

title: Good service
review_text: Flight was on time, Seats were comfortable and and food and drinks served were also good! Nice experience

title: A Job Well Done
review_text: This was a good flight on a new Boeing 787 which left on time and arrived on time.As we were upgraded from Economy to Business without requesting it there were no complaints and thes service was a good standard. As always on JAL the staff are very good .

title: Definitely in the top 5 airlines in the world... and unfortunately, I would know
review_text: This airline does everything right! The service is number one of all airlines. The food is good and thoughtfully accessible. Drinks, like all top airlines. Planes- comfort and media, standardly very good.  This airline is far superior to American, Delta, United, Cathay, Swiss International, British, and several smaller airlines. I have flown each in the last 12 months. Emirates is better than Japan, except for service. Japan is number one in customer service- I have not seen anything that comes close.

title: Excellent service
review_text:
We were unable to upgrade to J class for a fee of 1000¥ as the flight was full.

We checked in early and was informed flight was delayed for 10 mins due to aircraft change.

No issues as there were several shops and eatery at Haneda terminal 1 (for JAL).

Travelled in their new Y class in B777-200. Their tables seems to be made of a lighter material. Better seat pitch. However the seats has little padding.

I like their cabin flights and cherry coloured seat belts instead of the usual black / grey.

One round of drins were served in the 90 min full flight.

The cabin crew even found my face mist bottle cap for me when I drop it on the floor! Impressive !

title: Nice experience
review_text:
Compared to European Airlines the staff was really friendly and polite. The food was quite good. The plane was very clean inside including toilets. Also check in on Narita was ok. 
The only disadvantage was rather poor movie choice.

title: it was okay
review_text: i was gooing from yvr to manila phillppines wen i bordede the airplane it was a litle small leg space but the it was a smove ride

title: Great Airline
review_text:
Great Airline
Plane was comfortable and clean. Staff as with all Japanese people were pleasant and very helpful at check in.
Same with the flight crew. No movies for this quick trip but allowed a short time to catch up on much needed sleep.
Will look at flying with JAL for my next return trip to Japan.

title: Friendly Staff
review_text:
This was my first time flying to and from Japan on JAL and it was a very positive experience.  The service staff was super friendly and tried to do everything they could to ensure that the customers on the plane had an enjoyable flight.

They experienced in-flight entertainment issues the entire flight  home from Tokyo but did their best to recover service to the best of their ability.  Unfortunately, we had seats next to an arrogant person who was demanding and felt very entitled.   He couldn't stop yelling/complaining to every flight attendant on the plane about how the movies didn't work and how he wanted a refund for him and his family.  Felt horrible for the flight attendants to have to deal with a person like this, let alone him waking us up every time he would raise his voice to try and get something for free.

title: Flying at its best
review_text: JAL must surely  be the world's best airline. Its planes are immaculately maintained and its cabins clean and comfortable (as comfortable as flying can be). Staff are professional, always helpful and bilingual in Japanese and English. Food is a choice of Japanese or European. This is high class airline that is a credit to Japan.

title: Top Notch Airline
review_text:
Top notch service from JAL staff to and fro our international trip. So much priority given to us as we were traveling with our 2 year-old son--LOVE IT!!! Very attentive and helpful all throughout, and most of the flight attendants were super sweet to my son. On the 1st flight from Dallas to Narita, we had chatted with one of the flight attendants Annabella about our son's upcoming 2nd birthday that same weekend. Later on she surprised him with a little gift bag filled with goodies and small toys and a personalized note wishing him a Happy Birthday. That was sweet beyond words and meant a lot to us. THANK YOU!! 

Oh, flying on the magnificent Dreamliner is amazing! More room in general for the entire cabin and leg room at the seats and not filling like we're cramped sardines in a tin can. :) As long as we can get great deals, we will definitely be flying this route with JAL again.

title: Would take JAL again, depending on the connecting airport & feeder airline
review_text:
I flew JAL business class from Tokyo to Helsinki. The staff were very attentive and friendly. The plane felt new, and the interior was clean. The cabin was kept very clean during the entire flight.

My seat was an aisle seat in the middle section, in 2-2-2 seats. The layout is such that the window seat has its own little passageway, so it would have been just as good as an aisle, but with more privacy. The access to my seat was wide open on the aisle side - too wide - so it felt a little too exposed. There was a retractable blind blocking the other person next to me, so it was private on that side. There is also a foam mattress for every seat that the flight attendant will prepare, so it is really comfortable to sleep and then you don't feel all the usual cracks and bends characterizing today's business class seats. 

I had pre-ordered a vegetarian meal, and I was happy I did that. The main course otherwise would have been beef tongue (!) and something more Western, but the fact that beef tongue was the headline meal was a little shocking for me. Anyway, my meal had the best salad on-board I have ever had, both in presentation and quality, and the attendant tailored the offering to consider other food sensitivities and preferences I had. In addition to the wines, fine sake was offered, so it was interesting to try those. 

The inflight entertainment is much more limited than other airlines, there were not so many films to choose from. Screen and headphone quality was good. 

When we arrived in Helsinki, this huge plane was parked out away from the terminal. We had to walk down portable stairs and board a bus. That would have been really miserable in bad weather. I didn't like Helsinki airport at all or the connecting Finnair flight. JAL business class passengers had to queue for the security check in line with everyone, there was not any express or priority line.

title: Great experience
review_text: After terrible flight to Tokyo (made by Finnair and Airbus) I experienced great flight from Tokyo. Part of very good experiences were because of the plane (Boeing 787-8) which was really comfortable and spacious. Service was excellent, food tasty and online entertainment good as well. I think it was my best long haul experience in my life.

title: Great valued business class product with great service
review_text:
We originally booked on another airline for this tip but then JAL had a special offer of around US$1,000 for round trip business class, which was a rather good deal.   So we switched.

Service starts at the check in.   Upon seeing a dent on one of our luggages, the check in staff offered to wrap our luggage in a plastic bag, something that not all airlines will do (even for business class).   We were offered access to the Qantas lounge but we used the new CX lounge instead.    It was busy but staff was efficient.

Service on board was great.   They don't serve pre-take off drink which is a bit odd but no big deal.   No amenity kits were offered on this regional flight but there was a pair of slippers in each seat and one of the flight attendants came by with a tray offering eye mask and ear plugs.    

Lunch order was taken shortly after the seat belt sign went off.   I opted for the Japanese set.    Presentation was great.   And the taste was even better.    

The seat was an angled lie flat one which is more than enough for a 4 hrs flight.    IFE was nice, with a selection of Japanese and English movies and TV programs.   Quite surprised that they offer season 1 of ER so nice to watch an episode of the classic show.   

JAL business product (seat & IFE) may not be as good when compared to other airlines on this regional route but what they lack in hardware, they make it up with customer services and catering.

title: Excellent quality service
review_text:
We were flying from Narita Airport to Jakarta on our 50th Wedding Anniversary Celebration Trip to Southeast Asia on September 8, 2016.  In view of the delay of our previous flight, we barely made it and our suitcases didn't.   Aside from the good service we received on board from Misses Katsuyama, Hirose and Krissamon, including a nice handwritten card with wine and sweets to celebrate our anniversary, they were able   during the flight to confirm that our bags would put on the same flight the following day and delivered to our hotel (JW Marriott Hotel Jakarta), which was the case. On arrival in Jakarta, we were met by JL ground staff headed by Miss Rheta, who kindly escorted us through immigration and customs, helped us with the form for our delayed suitcases and provided us with a prepared envelope containing cash to cover minimum expenses (toiletries, essential clothing, etc.).

All of these showed the concern of Japan Airlines and its staff over the inconvenience.

title: Service above and beyond expectations by flight and ground staff
review_text: On our 50th Wedding Anniversary Celebration Trip to Southeast Asia on September 7, 2016, our flight from San Diego to Tokyo (JL65) was delayed at departure, leaving little time to make our connecting flight from Narita Airport to Jakarta (JL729/8 Sept).  Aside from the excellent service we received from Chief Purser Takebe Ayame assisted by flight attendants Koiwai Fukunaga and Patt Takebe, including a beautiful handwritten card with wine and chocolates to celebrate our anniversary, Miss Ayame was able to confirm during the flight that we would be personally met on arrival and escorted to our connecting flight to Jakarta, which was the case.

title: updated economy class
review_text: The latest economy class was more comfort than ever with wider leg space, USB port, Wifi, and new flight entertainment system, etc. It is fair to flight up up to 5 hours.

title: Amazingly Fine
review_text: Boarding was a breeze and on time all loaded up and off we were. Great flight plenty to do and super meals along the way. Crew was marvelous and supportive of all my needs.

title: Super
review_text: Boarding was fast and efficient, Long Flight but a good one great staff service and care. Very clean plane.

title: AMAZED
review_text: Amazed, the plane was so very very clean and the staff are extremely accommodating. Great meals and in flight care from the flight crew.

title: Amazing
review_text: This is one of the best flight I have even enjoyed. Great service plenty of leg room and delicious food. The crew was amazing.

title: Superb service. Warm cabins and JAL Sky Suite II product a let-down though
review_text:
Flew SIN–NRT–HNL and back with my husband on the 767-300ER.
Our seats in Business were the JAL Sky Suite II type throughout.

Service as expected was superb and intuitive. The Purser and attendants make it a point to address us by name. Bathrooms were cleaned after every use and toothbrushes, packet mouthwash beautifully presented for the next passenger. Every five minutes or so, an attendant would walk through the cabin and look to be of service. The US airlines can’t compare with this attention to detail.

Dining was served in courses (unlike Delta Business) but food (Western & Japanese) was not exceptional.

Two big gripes were the actual JAL Sky Suite II bed. Hard as a rock, narrow and no space to turn your feet when in bed-mode. Will never fly with this product ever again! The JAL Sky Suite III (which wasn’t available for our trip) is much, much better for comfort.
Other problem was the warm cabin. It was probably the warmest cabins I’ve ever flown in. Attendants obliged with turning the a/c down a notch but it was still uncomfortable. That said, our next flight is on ANA.

Again, service superb on the ground and inflight. Avoid the 767 JAL Sky Suite II – and if they could fix the warm cabins, I’d give the airline five stars!

JAL Lounge in Narita was fantastic though. Nap rooms, wonderful shower facilities, lovely spread of food, massage chairs, all add up to a great transit experience.

title: Surprise Surprise
review_text: Very 'Japanese' in terms of politeness, cleanliness and timeliness. And now for the surprise - very warm and friendly service - at the check-in and inflight. I don't do this often but this one, I would recommend for sure. Well done JAL.

title: Surprisingly not so good
review_text:
I had very bad experience during web check in. Terrible experience. The web interface is so old fashion, not user friendly and has missing data which I keyed in many times earlier. My friend and I, 2 passengers were allocated in the centre 3 seater by the system, in fact, there were still availabilities at the 2 seater at the side.  

I had a special meal request on this flight. After dinners, all passengers were given a tub of ice cream. When it was my turn, the air stewardess took it back and told the ice cream was not for special meal.  I was so surprised. I then asked if she had "Extra", without further thinking, she responded "No", harsh and hostile. 

The aircraft is an old 767, the seat cushion is so worn that I hardly felt any soft yet firm support. 

Food debris was found on the floor at the sides. Obviously the cleaners didn't do a  good job during their regular cleaning.

The bread served was as hard as a rock. Also they do not serve butter with the bread, you have to ask for it.

Overall, my experience with Japan Airlines is not so appealing.

title: Excellent
review_text:
Requested an aisle seat on check-in but due to full capacity none was available. The check-in counter staff kindly made arrangements to be upgraded to Premium Economy for free (without me requesting to be upgraded).
The upgrade was a pleasant surprise and made for a very pleasant journey (10 hours).
The seat has a lot of legroom and at 6' I could stretch out as much as I wanted to without issue. 
The seats don't recline but rather slide down and forward which is great as it doesn't bother the passenger behind. There is a leg support that comes up from the bottom of the seat and also a foot rest.
The foot well had a lot of space so even with my shoes off and stored there I could sit comfortably.
The seats have a double arm rest each so there's no issues as to 'who gets to use it' allowing for all passengers in this class to sit and move around in the seat without disturbing the person alongside.
Food was okay and inflight entertainment was also fine (controlled by either touchscreen or controller).
C.A.s were very professional, courteous helpful and always smiling which really does make for a pleasant atmosphere.
Upgrade to Premium Economy varies on distance. SYD to NRT would have been 30,000 Yen which really adds up on a return journey but some shorter flights to Asian destinations (H.K.?) can be had for just 10,000 Yen each way which I wouldn't hesitate to pay for!
Great seat, great service and made a 10 hour fight pleasant as opposed to bearable.
Highly recommend flying JAL and Premium Economy. I wouldn't even bother with paying for business class if a Premium Economy seat is available as the extra cost isn't justified considering how comfortable the seating was.

title: Great service
review_text:
Flew economy on this flight and as I'm rather tall I requested an aisle seat (to allow me to stretch out as it was an overnight flight) on check-in. I was informed that the flight was fully booked so no aisle seats were available but should one become available they'd let me know at the departure gate just prior to boarding.
I didn't expect one to become available and if it did I didn't expect them to go through the trouble of assigning one to me. Much to my pleasant surprise I was informed at boarding one was available and was assigned it.
That's an example of great service by staff who are already very busy! It made the flight much more comfortable.
The seat was a 'Sky Wider' seat and one of the most spacious for an economy class I've flown on long distance. at 6' I had no issues with leg room and the USB charger was very convenient.
Food was okay but the C.A.s were very friendly,courteous and professional.
I hadn't much considered flying JAL before but they're now the first airline I'll look to fly with!

title: Comfortable Flight
review_text: JAL operate their Boeing 787 Dreamliner on this flight to San Diego and back and it is a good service and the best way to enter the US and avoid the lines in US Immigration in LAX. The officers in San Diego are quite civil. The flight  leaves at 1.20 PM and gets in around 5.00 PM along with all other inbound flights from the US. The service on JAL is at their top level and food is good although the aircraft has the older style business class seats.

title: you can count JAL people are human
review_text:
When do you know you got best deal? 
When you are in trouble and airlines help you!
That is what happened to me on Nov 19 when I missed my flight, cause hotel did not do wake up call. I explained to JAL counter staff what happened and they knew there it was nothing on my side I could do more to be on time. I was given new flight,but it was explained to me that is it special case which I understand and am grateful. Thanks to JAL I could get back home.
My friends missed flight as well, but they were with Singapore Airlines, but no luck since Singapore airlines did not help them at all. So as you can see, it does make a difference which airlines you fly, I fly Japan Airlines.  
On top of that you get two pieces of luggage, plenty leg room, new planes, flight attendants with smile.

title: Pretty good international option
review_text:
I flew Japan Airlines flight 9 from Chicago O'Hare direct to Tokyo Narita and then continued on JAL to Osaka Itami. I paid extra for premium economy for the 12 hour (ORD - NAR) flight. The extra expense was definitely worth the price. You get a little more seat width, massive amount of leg room and slightly better food/drink choices. 

The staff on this flight were very, very nice. I've also flown this route on United. While there staff were also pleasant, they never seemed as gracious as the Japan Airlines ladies. At the end of the flight, my flight attendant stopped by every passenger and personally thanked them for flying their airline. She also asked if they needed anything right before landing.

Entertainment options were decent. I thought there would be more but the options were fine. Several recent English language movies. Several music channels (although most seemed to be Japanese). There was also a daily 30 minute news program focused on international news. I'm not sure if regular economy people get them but our seats included complementary noise cancelling headphones. Nothing extravagant (Sony brand) but a nice amenity nonetheless.

I think I had unreasonably high expectations for this airline. I heard that it's such a great option from USA to Japan. I sort of built it up to be this amazing experience. It is certainly a nice airline but I'm not sure it's any better than ANA. I just don't know. 

What I can say is that this airline and this flight was really nice. Premium economy made the flight more bearable. Let's me real, though. The trip is not enjoyable unless you have a lie-flat bed in business or first class, which is very expensive. But by looking at the people in regular coach, I think I would have been in hell had I not paid the extra money for premium economy. I recommend this to anyone who is tall or overweight ... or who just doesn't enjoy very long flights.

title: Japanese hospitality, not many drink choice
review_text: Good service, smooth check-in, comfortable seat, nice aircraft, most like the service and Japanese hospitality but not many kind of beverages, no food...it would be nice if they could serve a sandwich or cake/muffin for the price of the ticket.

title: Always a fantastic flight experience
review_text:
I was originally booked on J-class (Japan Airlines' domestic "business class"), but for roughly $70USD, I was able to upgrade to a first-class seat on the day of departure.

You are entitled to a use of their "Diamond / Premier Lounge", and you can enter through their "First Class" check-in room, which is connected to their own security screening area.

The lounge has private seating areas where you can rest or catch up on your work with minimal interruption.

They also provide a selection of beverages, food, and snacks.  But don't don't go overboard and fill yourself up, because the first class service provides warm meals upon departure; the only class of service that provides meals on domestic flights.

As a First Class passenger, I was invited to board first, along with their status holders.  There were 12 total First Class seats, all with beige leather seating and a lot of leg room.

The food was very beautifully presented and they were of high quality.  The cabin attendants were very professional and welcoming, and made the short flight a very memorable one.

title: Worth the money
review_text: The JAL airfare was a couple hundred dollars higher than United and other airlines, but worth it.  Our economy seats were extremely comfortable.  We are short people so we had no issues with legroom.  Overall, JAL's economy seats were much better than Premium Economy on United.  We had two full meals, service was attentive, and though the flight was over 10 hours, it did not seem that long.

title: Better before when in receivership. Fuller planes, higher prices
review_text: Pampered luxury, even in business class. Not worth the extra expense. Suffer for ten hours save eight grand!

title: One of the best
review_text: Great service, seat are comfortable. Food is OK. Very good help when needed to change ticket even though we had to pay extra, still very happy.

title: Superb
review_text:
Whenever possible I try to fly top-quality national airlines. Flew JAL JL004 this week - superb service from check-in to First Class Lounge to Business Class Travel. 

Amenities are superb; staff is incredibly warm, friendly and attentive. 

New aircraft (too few restrooms) which was very comfortable.  Any needs could be addressed by a new handheld pad - duty free, entertainment, meals and snacks. I really enjoyed the flexibility of the service.  The Japanese and Western meal options are very nice  - I always prefer the Japanese meal. Seats incredibly firm and comfortable for a restful sleep. 

A truly grand experience and lovely trip to the US following nearly two weeks of travel.

title: Best airline ever
review_text: Think about everything you like when you're on a long flight. You like good food? Check. Nice customer service? Check! In-flight entertainment? Check! There's not a bad thing to say about JAL. You'll have the smoothest and most comfortable flight ever.

title: Great
review_text: I always enjoy flying with japanese airlines. Great service and very helpful staff. The only drawback is difficulties with their internet pages when you do not read japanese. It might also be a inconvinient to travel from Narita to the hotels i Tokyo.

title: Fantastic service
review_text: Customer service was amazing.    Attendants were so attentive throughout the entire flight.  I asked for a little taste of two types of saki.    The attendant brought, and left, me the two entire bottles!    Seat and IFE controls were extremely easy to use.  Great flight!

title: Relaxing 12 hours
review_text:
excellent service, very friendly staff on board, cceptable leg room for 12 hrs ,
JAL, my favorite airline

title: The best airline
review_text:
Probably one of the best airlines nowadays. Much improvement since last time I flew with them 8 years ago.

Impeccably clean cabin. Great comfortable seats. They even give ergonomic pillows which allows you to sleep comfortably when seated without a problem. The most fantastic food selection I've ever seen - fresh tasty food and great selection of drinks which they serve during an entire flight (the stewardess was constantly walking with a teapot even when most passengers were asleep checking in case somebody wants fresh tea). And they do not economize on food: they served premium Häagen-Dazs ice cream. Great movie selection as well. Overall, the best, the most attentive and friendly service onboard I've ever seen.

title: Fly Japan Airlines from DFW to Tokyo Japan
review_text: This flight uses a 787-8 with 8 across seating in coach.  American Airlines uses 9 across seating.  The difference on a 12 to 13 hour flight like this is significant!  I have experienced the difference personally.  In August I flew American's 787-8 from Tokyo Haneda to LAX, and in May I flew American's 787-8 between DFW and Santiago, Chile.  Also the flight attendants were all excellent - as expected with JAL.  If you can, avoid American Airlines 777-200 on this route.  My return to DFW the following week was on this aircraft with their new 10 across seating in the main cabin.  The aisles are so small that the larger flight attendants have to move at an angle down the aisles.  Plus the usual so so service.  Avoid AA and fly Japan Airlines.

title: Fantastic Service across the board
review_text: We've flown on many airlines but this one might very well be the very best we ever flown.  The service is phenomenal from the way they check you in, it is extremely respectful and formalized, it is so refreshing to have a passport returned to you with both hands and a verbal thank you.  The service on-board is fantastic, you can see that everything the flight attendants do is to make your flight a positive, memorable one.  The beverages are non-stop, so you won't have to worry about staying hydrated, legroom is not an issue, you can get out of the window seat without having to ask the person on the aisle to get up because of all the legroom in premium economy.  Even the small things are noticeable, in Japan, the check-in agent comes out from the counter to the line and asks you to come to their numbered location, and on departure the ground crew came out and formed a three person line and waived and bowed while the plane taxied out.  They do it right, if you ever have a need to fly to the far east I would definitely say I look forward to flying on JAL when we go back to China next year!!

title: Fantastic service, food and legroom
review_text: First time flying with JAL and I cannot fault them. This is the most leg room I have ever had in any economy seat. The food was plentiful with 6-7 small dishes as well as a main course. Service was impeccable. The flight home via Frankfurt was just as good although the plane was a different set up.

title: Asian Airlines are better
review_text: My wife and I took our 2nd trip to Indonesia flying with an Asian Airline. This time it was with JAL. We booked our trip 6 months in advance and got an awesome rate ... less than $1600 round trip for both of us. JAL had great service, entertainment, and food. The American airlines could learn a few things from JAL. My only concern was JAL has a 3 day prior to take off policy to select your seats. Better mark your calendar or you could forget to select your seats and get something that is not desirable. On our leg from Tokyo to Jakarta we were asked if we wanted seats closer to the front. So we said yes ... the plane was not full and we sat in the row right behind first class. Wonderful Service, we will fly with JAL in the future!

title: Excellent airline
review_text: Really enjoyed this flight, lots of space and legroom, drinks served regularly both alcoholic and soft.  Food the best I've ever eaten on a plane, cabin crew courteous and attentive.  Inflight entertainment great, infact I cannot fault this airline.

title: Wow, a Asian legacy Airline transformed into a highly customer centric one?
review_text:
Wow, wow, wow! What a surprise!
I have flown many airlines (over 20 airlines) for the past 4 decades in Asia, US, Europe, Australia & NZ.
The best domestic Airline in the US - Virgin America - was an instant winner for me when I first flew within them  2 yrs ago in the US! 
In Asia, I am loyal to Qantas- naturally as I am from Australia!

You heard a lot of publicity about the Singapore Airlines for its sevive quality BUT can't be compared to JAL today! I flew with them about 20 yrs ago and the service was bad , really bad, as bad as US domestic airlines!

But what surprised me is that JAL has reinvent itself totally - from the time we check-in (I was with my parents on wheelchair) to leading us into our seats - incredibly nice &  polite service that I cannot find in any other airlines !!! The attention to details cannot exist in today's cut throat industry!

Wow, if U find similar services level in the US or in any country, I would love to know!

title: Best economy flight for past 5 years
review_text: This was our first flight ever on JAL. So far we had flown mostly on western airlines (european and north american). It exceeded our expectation  with excellent timeliness, very kind and helpful personnel. Food was superb with choice between Japanese and western. Anytime we return to Japan , JAP will be our first option

title: Wonderful!
review_text:
After a horrible experience with China Airlines, flying Japan Airlines has been a breath of fresh air. They really know how to do customer service right! I am pregnant and had shown a letter stating that I am safe to fly when checking in. Other than that, I never mentioned it to anyone. They gave me priority boarding. When my husband and I were seated, we had two middle seats with a disabled lady on one side, so a bit difficult to get out of. We never complained at all. But, after takeoff, the flight attendant came and asked us to move. We couldn't quite catch everything she said due to the noise, but two employees switched seats with us so that we could move to two seats on one side together with more room and easier access. Amazing! 

She later gave us an extra bag of snacks and repeatedly checked that we were alright. At the end of the flight, she even came by with a "gift for your baby." A little fork and spoon set in a cute Japan Airlines carrying case. So considerate! 

We flew back again and we were just treated so considerately by all personnel. We will now go out if our way to fly JAL every chance we get in the future! Thank you!!

title: Impeccable Service
review_text:
It was our first trip travelling in Japan Airlines Business class and the experience was extremely good.

It started from the Sakura lounge, the food was good and we love the curry rice and cold green tea.

The aircraft during that time was still the old 767(JAL has since September 2016 changed to Dreamliner 787-900), was was fitted with their new business class sky suite seats. The seat was comfortable and fully flat.

Even though JAL didn't give any pouch, but their have distributed very comfortable pyjama, and toiletries like eye and facial masks! 

The all new meal menu and alcohol selections were excellent. 

And, I would like to specially mentioned that even though it was a 7-hour journal, the air stewardess didn't stop patrolling around and attended to any request from the customers. 

It was indeed a very pleasant flight.

title: Best airline in the world
review_text:
I've flown many of the airlines in the world including most Middle-Eastern airlines and JAL is the best.
JAL is the one airline I feel cares about its passengers.
The service is outstanding, the food is actually delicious and the seats are comfortable with tons of space. In fact on the 787 they removed a seat so it's a 2-4-2 configuration instead of 3-3-3 on all other airlines, so there is much more space all around. 
Can't wait to fly with them again!

title: My first choice to Asia
review_text: Not only is this the only airline flying direct from BOS to NRT, it has the best service and equipment of the reasonable possibilities for this route. The service and food is impeccable.

title: Sydney-New York in business class
review_text: What a fantastic experience. Comfort level was exemplary with lie-flat beds and superb privacy. Access to the aisle is easy from any seat unlike BA. The food, service and in-flight entertainment were superb with good levels of choice and quality. The dine-any-time option was a touch of class and every member of staff were friendly, courteous and efficient. JAL J-class rocks. Also the Sakura lounge in Tokyo was superb with amazing shower and relaxation facilities.

title: Premium economy on a JAL 787-900
review_text: Premium economy seat is roughly equivalent to first class seat on 737 or MD80.  The seat does not lie flat, a recline that is close to 45 degrees. Leg room is very good.
