I ordered a kosher meal for both flights and I must say the meal was very good - BBQ chicken and rice for dinner, and omelette for lunch/breakfast.  Salmon on the way back was very good.  Noise cancelling headphones were a nice touch, the movie inventory wasn't very good and not everything is in English, probably my biggest complaint.  Dimming windows worked well.   Generally the service was very good, probably not far off of Singapore Air or Swiss, two of my favorites.  The better air quality on the 787 was much more comfortable than other planes.  I highly recommend the 787 for long haul for this reason alone. On departure, I got a comp invite to airline lounge which was a nice touch.

title: Terrible
review_text: A/C was totally inoperative. Seats are narrower than any other airline I have ever been on. Seat was broke. Whenever I leaned back it would fall back all the way. The staff could not fix it. After 4 hours of this they made me move before landing because my seat was unsafe!

title: JAL Business Class
review_text: I've been flying JAL Executive Class since 1988. The service is in keeping with the same high standard one experiences throughout Japan. The Sky Suites are thoughtfully designed - we all know that the Japanese are experts at maximising space. Huge tv screens that don't need to be flipped out and replaced, space for putting items where they can be reached, magazine holders and somewhere to put rubbish are all very welcome on a long flight. Compared to most of the other business class cabins I've tried on other airlines they are far superior - except for their food ! The menu is designed by someone who is attempting to be creative and innovative and is failing miserably !!! There are a few nice items but most is inedible. My sixteen year old son who us usually ravenous refuses to eat anything other than the rice. The other problem is that they don't serve breakfast at the end of an overnight flight. They serve food but I wish they'd learn from ither airlines and iffer breakfast foods at breakfast time. They need to replace their caterers. Then they'll be perfect.

title: Average food and service and late departure
review_text:
Our flight left almost an hour late (02.00am) so we were not even offered a meal! The service level was indifferent and prior to our arrival the European breakfast offered was very poor. The flat beds are okay but nothing special.
The return flight from Narita also left an hour late. Once again the service level was indifferent and I had to wait half an hour after my wife was served to get my meal even though our orders were taken at the same time. 
I will give JAL a miss for a while or until their standards have improved.

title: A pleasant flight
review_text: Very pleasant flight from JFK to NRT despite the long duration. On-time departure, slightly early arrival,  very friendly service. Good choices of Japanese and Western food and a nice feature: after the main dinner, one could order diverse food items as one  wished and pretty much at any time ( there was some period, where this service was not available).  The business class seats offered decent comfort and privacy and the flight attendants where thrilled by my attempts to speak Japanese. Overall a very nice travel experience.

title: Not As Good As Their European Service
review_text: The seating was old  and so was the aircraft (Boeing 777) and the service and food did not match  the aircraft or the service from wither Europe or US. JAL appear to set the food standard  to match competition and although the food was very well presented I have had a lot better. The staff are always friendly and courteous.

title: Great food and service
review_text:
Japan Airlines has always been famous for its good service and this flight does not disappoint. Even with a nearly full cabin, the service is still attentive and warm. 
Food is as usual, quite good. For breakfast, since I wasn't particularly hungry, I was going to choose the Western option but the flight attendant talked me into going Japanese.  The grilled Pacific Saury, she told me, is a particular seasonal specialty.  It was delicious and I was glad she took the time to inform me of it.  
The only item that could make this flight better is if JAL changes the business class to their Sky Suite configuration.  Nevertheless, I was able to sleep a couple hours on this flight.

title: Comfortable domestic flight from Hokkaido to Tokyo
review_text:
After our super stay at Club Med Hokkaido, we were flying to Tokyo to spend 2 days there. After a smooth checkin, we had some very good food at the airport restaurant.

The flight was on time, short, smooth and comfortable. My kids complained about no inflight TV, but managed to keep them occupied nonetheless.

title: Domestic flight to Hokkaido
review_text:
After reaching Tokyo on an overnight JAL flight from Singapore, we took this domestic flight to Hokkaido. Though we had checked in our luggage straight through to Hokkaido, we still had to do it again in Tokyo. That was strange. It was a long journey in Haneda airport to the domestic section. We stopped at the lounge which was spacious but the food was average.

The flight was short and quick. Obihiro airport is small & quaint. Seeing the snow was exciting, getting us ready for our ski holiday at Club Med.

title: Great food ans seating for economy class
review_text:
It was our first time to fly JAL. The service was great and staffs were friendly.
The food and beverage was better than other airlines.
I will use this their service very soon.

title: A comfortable overnight business class flight to Tokyo
review_text:
We were on a family holiday with friends to Club Med Hokkaido to ski. JAL leaves from T3 in Changi Singapore. Though we went to the lounge, our kids saw the play area nearby and after a quick bite, we went there. It was an overnight flight and though the food was tempting, we all slept. The service was good and the seats comfortable.

We landed fresh the next morning in Tokyo for our domestic connection to Hokkaido.

title: Great Airline for long haul economy
review_text:
This trip was on a 777.  JAL has removed a seat to allow for wider bodies in the seats.  That made the 13 hour flight bearable.  The service from the flight crew was amazing.  They were super professional.  I did bring a CPAP machine along so I could sleep on the flight.  My machine caused them considerable concern, and they woke me up a few times asking to look at it.  They finally decided it was something I could use on the plane and left me alone.  I did show them the sticker saying it was approved by the FAA for use on aircraft, but I am not sure they understood that.  

The interface for games and movies was a bit more modern than I am used to.  They had a great selection.  I think this must have been a newer plane.

title: Easy commute to Tokyo
review_text: An excellent flight with a pleasant staff at all points in the trip.  It was a fairly crowded aircraft but still pleasant none the less.  Ground crew were courteous and helpful.

title: Excellent service but cramped seats
review_text:
I picked JAL based on Youtube videos I saw where their Economy class seats had plenty of legroom. Imagine my surprise when I got on the plane (Los Angeles to Osaka) and saw how cramped and small the seats were. I used to be one of those people who didn't understand why passengers fought over reclining seats. After flying JAL, I see why. The woman in the seat in front of me extended her seat all the way back, which took up all my personal space. I literally wanted to push her and the seat out of frustration. With her seat fully extended, I couldn't get out of my seat to use the restroom, so I had to hold on to her seat in order to get up, which I'm sure it annoyed her, but oh well. Also, while trying to stretch, I accidentally kicked the feet of the woman sitting in front of me. There's not even enough room to stretch while seated, unless you're a really short person (I, for the record, am 5'5"). The seats were 2-4-2 on this flight. My friend and I sat in the row with 2 seats.

The food was quite tasty. The flight attendants were very friendly. The ones who weren't fluent in English tended hand me things and run away. The flight attendants who are fluent in English took their time explaining things to me. I really loved the fact that JAL darken out the windows so that people can sleep after they serve the first meal. This was my first international flight, so I've never seen that done before.

On my flight from Osaka to Tokyo, the seats were way more comfortable. There were no individual TVs on the seats though. The man seated in the row ahead of me asked if it was OK for him to extend his seat, which I thought was extremely courteous. There was plenty of legroom and I could extend my legs without accidentally kicking the feet of the person sitting in front of me. I loved everything about JAL except for the small and cramped seats on my 10 hour flight from Los Angeles to Osaka.

title: Nightmare trip would never end
review_text: Nothing went right on our return trip from Japan. Japan Air allowed my 17 year old daughter to bring a tripod on the plan to present at a summit in Japan with no problem. During our trip back, not only would they not allow her to bring it on the plane, not one representative of the airline understood English and we almost missed our flight because of this. I repeatedly told them we were happy to leave the tripod and they could dispose it as they saw fit, but they then told me I could not get on the plane unless I picked up the tripod from security. Either way they were not allowing me to get on the plane. They separated my daughter and me and made me run through the airport, not once, but twice insisting I was going to miss my flight if I didn't run at full speed with my carry on luggage in tow. After running for 15 minutes straight, I get to the gate to be informed there is an hour delay! No one could have told the airline representative that as she was insisting I run at full speed back and forth through the airport?!

title: Major legroom!!
review_text:
Was very pleasantly surprised when we stepped into the aircraft (a Boeing 787-9). First up, it was maybe half business class and the other half economy (with a small premium economy section).

Secondly, the economy configuration which was of the 2-4-2 configuration was great. It meant more width in the seat. Also, this flight has the biggest legroom I have ever seen. Was just on an Emirates Boeing 777 a couple of weeks before this flight and although quite good (Emirates does 3-4-3), this JAL 787-9 was heaps better.

Food was good too with great service. Do try their Sky Time Kiwi Juice. Its kinda weird but nice in a good way.

Only thing I had a slight issue with is temperature. Usually when flying, there are air-con vents above you which you can adjust. On this flight though, there werent any. Which made the aircraft a little on the warm side for me. Me and my dad were using the safety information card to fan ourselves during decent as it got warmer. Maybe flying a night flight might mitigate this.

title: Japan airline is awesome
review_text: japan airline best airline from the rest of airline , i had travelled to seoul via japan narita airport and return same , the service was fully excellent , i would suggest if you flying to canada , seoul , some part of usa , must go with it ,

title: Excellent service
review_text:
I love flying Japan Airlines. Service is excellent. Very polite and helpful. 

Seat arrangement was good 2-4-2. Didn't seem cramped. Personal enter monitor. 

Snacks mid flight.

They even arranged delivery if my cell phone when I list it at Narita Airport.

title: Pleasantly surprised
review_text: I was dreading this flight after a cramped JAL experience 15 years ago - but I was pleasantly surprised.  The leg room was comfortable, the flight staff were very accommodating and the special meal request was quite edible. My only complaint would be the aircon.  The cabin was very warm and there was no personal air vent. The in flight entertainment wasn't huge, but sufficient.  Connecting flight to Osaka actually left from Haneda airport - not Narita so read the fine print in the itinerary and leave plenty of connecting time for a long bus trip

title: High service standard even in Economy
review_text:
The very first time I flew with Japan Airlines (JL) was 1979, since then I have travelled many times with this carrier on several different sectors. Over the years I have found JL to be consistent in their service delivery.

From the moment you enter check in to completion of your flight you are dealing with smiling and service minded personnel and crew. 

Within reason nothing seem too much for JL’s staff and crew to ensure your experience is the best possible. 

Before I continue I just like to point out that over the last 30 years I have travelled with more airlines than I care to remember, some strand out as very good, few come up to a standard similar to that of JL.

I have travelled in all classes with JL, irrespective of class of travel their service level is high. Food even in Economy class is of high standard. I once travelled JL414 sector Tokyo Helsinki with a friend of mine. We had just being served our first meal accompanied by a small bottle of Sake; (at our request,) my friend said “if this is what we are eating in Economy class, what on earth are they enjoying in Business class”. 
  
I always find the cabin spotless the same goes for the toilettes, the crew are constantly cleaning lavatories throughout the duration of the flight making sure everything is A1. 

Only negative, the inflight announcements are hard to hear and understand, this due to low volume and sometimes poor English pronunciation the later depending on the crew member of cause. I would like to see JL introducing English prerecorded inflight announcements. I am fully aware that sometimes the operating crew has to make announcements in the cabin for various reasons.   

Summary of the above, I mainly had Economy class in mind here as majority of passengers travel in Economy class. JL’s premium Economy is of very good standard, entering Business and First class, we are talking excelent.

Legroom is ample, I’m 1.80cm (5' 11) I am very comfortable when in Economy class including onboard their 787 Dreamliner. Seat comfort I feel is good no complains there. 

Catering as mentioned above of high standard, the amount of food is just right, snacks are available throughout the flight.

Drinks are complementary on JL, however the crew rightfully so reserves the right to refuse serving alcoholic beverage to any passenger who may be intoxicated.

As far as fares are concerned, JL are matching other Airlines there is not a great deal of fare difference from any other carrier as far as I have found.

I can highly recommend Japan Airlines, If you are in Japan flying JL, try to see if you can obtain a special stop over package through JL

title: Fantastic Service
review_text: I traveled to the Philippines to pick up my Fiancé and her son. I was impressed with the fantastic food service and service overall. They were very kind and gave my future son a choice of coloring book or model airplane to play with. The seats were set wider apart and were very comfortable. I will fly with this airline again.

title: Love this airline but
review_text: This was my first time traveling with JAL, gotta say that i love space on the airplane and in flight entertainments. The service of cabin crews were smooth and nice. However, the only problem i had was the communication with JAL ground staff, they couldn't communicate in English which made the connections i had slower than expected. But overall, i will travel with this airline again, but next time i will try to book a flight without any connecting flights.

title: kind freindly service
review_text: always a pleasure to fly JAL.  Entertainment is a little lacking by Asian standards so on a 12 hour daytime flight can get a little sparse. Super fast and affordable inflight internet on my flight. Love to fly on their 787s.

title: Top notch service with average comfort
review_text:
This was my first time on JAL. THe flight from JFK is long (13 hrs) so comfort and service are key. I had originally booked economy seating but found out that you can upgrade to premium economy at the airport for 300 dollars, so decided to do that.
The extra room was worth it, but the seat was a bit strange. You could not actually recline the seat, instead it slid forward, which I did not care for. I stayed in economy on the way back, but found the seat a bit hard so put a few blankets down and was fine. The service is wonderful and food acceptable. The in flight entertainment was just ok...the movies did not change from one month to the next. All in all a good experience.

title: Wider Legroom Even In Economy
review_text:
Check-in at the Singapore airport was fast and smooth, except that there is no bag-drop counter for people who do online check-in, which defeats the whole purpose of doing online check-in. However the check-in process at the Osaka Itami airport was terribly slow. Once again there is no separate queue for those who have done online check-in. 

JAL just added on an extra 10cm to the legroom and yes, it means a lot. The seats are much more spacious even though you are in Economy. Meals on board are of good quality and I would say this is the most tasty airline meal I have ever tried! 

Drinks service are regular and the cabin crew are very friendly. However, I have only 1 complain - the cabin temperature is very warm.

title: great servcie as always
review_text:
always a pleasure , and a pleasant time .attentive as always , efficient
wat more can 1 ask for, Typical Japanese efficiency. 
also fly with them for all my international routes, closing in on a million miles with them
if they can come back with some services and awards to their most frequent fliers  which were taken away with their 2 bailouts would be a huge ++

title: The best airline in the world (seriously)!
review_text:
I have now flown with JAL over twenty times and rate them so highly I have to tell as many as possible. 
Firstly I get access to the business lounge on a premium economy ticket (less than half price) but can still upgrade to business for a few hundred dollars if there are spare seats when I check in. They have never been delayed. The plane is always a Boeing. You never get a really fat guy seating next to you (Sumo fly first class) The service is excellent. The toilets are always clean. The food is great and the Japanese beer is better. I can not recommend them highly enough.

title: Great service nicer planes
review_text:
JAL is simply great airlines with very nice and comfortable planes and great cabin.
Leg room is very nice and seats are very much comfortable.
Food quality is very nice.  lovely and cabin crew, overall great service.

title: Fantastic Journey with JAL
review_text: My 1st experience flying with JAL to Narita Airport, Tokyo was satisfactory and enjoyable.  Great service with friendly stewardesses though we had language barrier.  However, the air-conditioned on board was quite warm that night. Economy seat but comfortable.

title: Great flight!!!!  Great attendants!!!!
review_text: Great service by all the attendants on the plane... they were the most hospitable attendants I have ever flown with... I wish I would have been in business class for this leg of my trip... 6 hours to Bangkok but I was at the bulkhead and had some stretch room...overall a good experience!!!

title: JAL . A great way to fly.
review_text:
After being told several years ago, by friends, about their positive experience with JAL flying from Sydney to London my wife and I decided to fly JAL on our recent (February 2016) trip to France and Italy.
We decided to fly premium economy, as on a cost basis it was certainly cheaper than going via the U.A.E. plus it also included overnight accommodation at Narita airport before the on flight to Paris.

We flew the entire outward bound sector on a Boeing 777.
JAL's aircraft are modern, clean, reasonably quiet, comfortable and bright. 

The seating in Premium Economy is first rate. There is plenty of leg room and the seats have generous width. A big, big plus is that the seat in front does not recline into your personal space and likewise neither does your seat  encroach on your fellow passenger. You are also supplied with Sony noise cancelling headphones and a great selection of movies and to make the trip even more comfortable slippers and a blankets. The presentation of all these extra as one expects from Japan was impressive.

Another feature about JAL Premium Economy, which we did not realise when booking, is that JAL give you access to their Business Class lounge as part of the fare.

On our return leg to Australia and without going into great detail, as a result of the impact of the terrorists attack in Paris in late 2015, we were changed to a Qantas 747, "premium economy" flight not out of Narita but out of Haneda.

We thought that this would be an equally wonderful experience. Needless to stay, what a disgrace. Old, extremely noisey, uncomfortable, cramped. I cannot describe how disgusted we both were with the "Qantas experience".

When the passenger in front, reclined their seat, the only way out to the single toilet, also shared with business class, was to do a Chubby Checker Twist to get out of the row. The so called crappy noise cancelling headphone were served up in a reused plastic bag, making me think that the headphones from the previous user had just had the cord rewound and shoved back into a plastic bag. I did even want to put them on.

The food so so ordinary, we didn't eat it.

Also with Qantas you don't have access to the Business Class lounge.

When we fly again it will definitely be with JAL. A great airline.

title: We'll Book JAL Whenever We Can!
review_text: Timely, Courteous, Efficient, Great Service - they were always checking to make sure I was comfortable and that everything was fine.  No complaints from me other than I could have used a bit more leg room.  Everything else I was fully satisfied.  Even the food was delicious.  Sukiyaki type meat over rice, fresh salad, fruits that were sweet, noodles, ice cream and a drink.  I would definitely recommend JAL.  Also took the flight (JL086) from Shanghai Pudong to Haneda Japan - another great flight.

title: Great service
review_text:
Our first time fling JAL and we were most impressed from early check-in to completion of our journey. Whilst their grasp of English was limited, the air hostesses were able to provide an in flight service second to none. The planes were spotless although on one flight leg the plane was rather noisy which required ear plugs to sleep.
The inflight entertainment could also do with some improvement.
Overall, however, a very good experience.

title: Really good.
review_text: In the last four years Japan Airlines has improve their Airline considerably, modern aircrafts with probably the best economy seats that you will find in an Airline, really good service at the airport and much better on board, easy boarding and an excellent average of punctuality makes Japan Airlines one of the best options to travel today by plane, good choice.

title: A compagny wich have a real sens of service...
review_text: We traveled in September (for tourism purpose) with this company repeatedly to make connections between Okinawa and small islands (Miyako, Ishigaki, Yonaguni). It was a difficult period because of the typhoons, but we were warned every time at time and when canceled we had no worries for repayment. At the service level, everything was impeccable, I even ordered Indian vegetarian on board and really for the first time it has been a pleasure to eat in flight. A really nice compagny.

title: I will always use JAL for my trips to Japan
review_text:
Japan Airlines is definitely one of the best for your flights to Japan. 

I've been using JAL for my Japan vacations since 2014, and I have not looked at another carrier since. I currently use your JFK to Narita flight, (JL3 and JL6 on return) and will be using it again in two more weeks on October 16th in the morning. 

The flight attendants are welcoming, very friendly, respectful and definitely make sure those long hours on the plane will be as comfortable as possible. 

From check-in to getting on the plane was the most simple procedure. Checking in online is recommended, but even if you do it at the airport, It's not a big deal. Both are fairly simple processes. 

On the plane, you have a large variety of movies, music, games and maps to keep you occupied. They have multiple languages, so again, It's not usually a problem. You can also read Manga and watch Anime! Both of which I enjoy.

The planes are always in top shape, very clean and ready for the next customers to come aboard. The flight attendants also speak good English, and there is plenty of leg room! Even in the Economy seats. Overall, It's a very comfortable flight. 

Economy provides you with a very nice meal on the JFK to NRT route and then back to JFK. Last year, they had Beef Bowls from Yoshinoya on the route back to JFK. That was great! 

Overall, I love Japan Airlines for my flights to Japan and will continue using them as long as I go to Japan. 

5 out of 5 stars for me. A very happy customer with JAL. 

Thank you for all you do to keep the flight comfortable, and keep us happy. 

Keep up the good work over there at JAL.

title: nice new 787
review_text:
Nice to be on a brand new 787 with its' comfort and features.
Great overall service including food and entertainment.  The crew was exceptional, buzzing around calmly and efficiently taking care of everyone.  Impressive for Economy class.

title: Business class sweet!
review_text:
JAL SYD-NRT uses the Qantas Business class lounge, so I'm not commenting on that. The B777 was good and every seat had direct isle access, even with the 2-3-2 layout. They have the Sky suite Mk II and it was like a cocoon style suite. I tried the Japanese dishes and was delicious.

The lounge at Narita was busy, but roomy. they have an upstairs dining room which is well catered for and serves modern and traditional meals. As per usual, they have ample seating, free WiFi and food and beverages. They have an automated beer serving machine... a must to see it in action.

The flight from NRT-CDG was with a B787. Every seat has direct isle access (2-2 layout) and has the MK II Sky suite installed, however... It has marked improvements to it then on their B777. The suite is more digitalised and automated. The meals were again outstanding (I had the Japanese meals again). I also ordered the snack food from the seat PDA and it was delivered promptly. The aircraft and crew were faultless. 

The check in at both locations (Overnight stay in Tokyo) was seamless. I checked my bags all the way through so I avoided waiting for them in NRT. The Japanese staff at NRT didn't speak English to well, but we managed to communicate pretty well.

Can't wait for my return journey!!!

title: Polite and zen
review_text: Overall, very good. Polite check in service (minus one jerk), polite flight attendants and a clean airplane... but a bit expensive.

title: Service on air
review_text: A very friendly flight attendant abroad made or flight much comfortably. They come handy and always tried to give the best service they can for us.

title: best economy flight ever
review_text: From check in to baggage pick up everything went smoothly.  Staff very friendly and helpful. Seats comfortable, great movies and other channels to choose from. Food was really tasty too.

title: Pleasant Surprise
review_text: JAL was best airline I have flown to Beijing - and the airport experience in China was so much better than some of the Chinese carriers who had one single line for all check in :-( - Do leave time for Security and immigration though - it can be slow.

title: Premium economy was just that!
review_text: we were very happy with this flight as the premium economy seats were really spacious, particularly important for my tall husband. They were capsules and thus one was never bothered by the person in front moving their seat back.  There were lots of spaces for storage too.  The flight attendants were there when needed, drinks were available throughout, and the food was fine. We were also pleased that we could use the Qantas lounge while waiting for the flight

title: boston-Singapore round trip
review_text:
Solid performance, attentive service.
Mostly Japanese clientele -- which to whom they properly cater.  Correspondingly, their selection of movies is quite limited.  Almost no European movies, and not many Korean, Indian or Chinese...
On-time performance and easy, one terminal, hassle-free transfer in Narita.

title: Great Service for Long Hauls
review_text: This is a long haul -- over 13 hours of constant flying.  We actually started with a connecting flight from Hong Kong, also on JAL, so the total flying time was close to 17 hours.  Check-in was smooth and our bags were transferred without problems.  There were plenty  of food and beverage options, both Japanese and Western.  The quality of the fixed menus and the a-la-carte choices was excellent.  The number of flight attendants was sufficient to provide efficient and friendly service.  The aircraft from Narita to Boston was a 787 with comfortable seats in the upright, relaxed and bed positions.  Entertainment choices were plentiful and the electronics were in good working order.  I bought an expensive full-fare business ticket for myself and combined it with a low-cost companion ticket for my wife though one of our credit-card programs, which made the cost for two competitive with other business fare options on other airlines.  I highly recommend JAL for flights from the US East Coast to East Asia.

title: 777-300 jet, comfortable seats, delicious food, great service
review_text: After awful trans-ocean trips on American Airlines and British Air, traveling on JAL was reminded me of what flying once was until the airlines decided they could make more money by packing customers tight enough to provoke some poor souls to air-rage.  On JAL, the seats were wide enough and the leg room ample enough so that we didn't feel cramped.  Even the bathrooms were large, highly recommended for anyone with mobility issues.  There were enough bathrooms, too.  The food was excellent.  Our breakfast, a rice bowl with condiments, came with a card identifying the food and instructions on how to enjoy it.  I ate every bit.  If I have a choice, I will always choose JAL for trans-ocean flights.

title: Busan/Tokyo adventure
review_text: Flights were pretty much on time and it made so much more sense to board from back to front after the first class/elderly/children were boarded because it made getting on the plane and checking your carryon luggage in the bins that much more efficient and fast.  Stewardess were all very friendly, polite and professional.  Would definitely fly JAL again in the future.

title: Flawless service embodying the Japanese ometenashi spirit, great food & great seats too
review_text: Spacious ergonomical seats which are quite roomy and comfortable. The back is shaped in such a way that it moulds to your back and you don't have to put it on recline to be comfy. Generous amenities (full water bottle to last you throughout the flight, in flight comfort kit and of course fun kid packs for the little ones) shows how thoughtful they are in trying to make your flight as comfortable as possible. Easily my favorite airline and my 8 year old daughter's too (yes she always bencmark other airlines to Japan airlines due to excellent experience she had on board)

title: Great Airline and Great Service to go with it!
review_text: Having flown Premium Economy with another carrier this year we decided to upgrade for this flight also. It is very much worth paying the extra on a long haul flight and JAL were worth the upgrade but I have to say that the other carrier we used this year was slightly better...not much... the seat comfort and inflight entertainment were better although they did not have Wi-Fi as JAL did. All in all JAL was a comfortable flight and the cabin crew were very attentive and everything was kept absolutely spotless. Would have no hesitation in recommending JAL at all. Please see my other reviews on airlines.

title: Premium economy is the BEST!
review_text:
The extra money is worth it, with more space and better amenities - for long haul trips I would heartily recommend it! My husband is a little overweight (5'9", 230 lbs), so long flying times in cramped seats don't appeal to him. Premium economy let him recline comfortably, with a footrest, so he actually slept, which he normally can't do on airplanes (we did China awhile ago so I know).  Additionally with Bose noise cancelling headphones to watch movies and great meals and snacks (we were stuffed getting off the plane, both going to and returning from Tokyo) these were very pleasant overseas flights.

And the attendants were all so attentive and friendly, it made the trip all the better.

title: Great way to have domestic travel in Japan
review_text: Good old 767 aircraft that has great 2-3-2 layout in economy. Typical domestic service with soft drinks only and attentive staff. Punctual. I have one world Sapphire card so enjoying the perk like a airline lounge and priority check in and boarding are an advantage.

title: Polite, gracful and actually takes care of you!
review_text: They actually hold a banner from the side of the runway and wave you off with a banner that says "See You Again Soon"! Besides this, they are attentive to your needs especially with the call button. They answer all your immigration questions. They serve with a smile and not like someone who hates their job.

title: first and last time with japan airlines
review_text: not a good organised airline in Sydney but that was the best part approaching Tokyo the plane was diverted to the other side of japan because of a storm over Tokyo. Having been delayed for 3 hours I missed my connection to new York when we arrived back in Tokyo their booking office was closed and we spent the night on the floor with no blankets food or water no one came to apologize and we had to make our own arrangements for onward travel. This caused missing a day that was already paid for in new York. I wont recommend this airline to anyone

title: Need a larger seat tor the Business Class
review_text:
Have to wait more than 4 hours before we can check in, just because of the Taifun. 
Have to rush for boarding after check in. I agree with safety first policy and do not mind the wait. Luckily the airport facility in the area before check in, is quite good, so we are not too uncomfortable, because no waiting lounge in this area.
Flight was good, service were perfect. From my experience, Japan Airline stewardesses are well informed and always make note about arrival time, number of passengers, etc. The business class seats are a bit narrow ... and I wish the cabin temperature can be lowered to about 21 degrees C, so we can enjoy sleeping under the blanket, not sweating... When standing at the galleys area, the temperature is nice and cool... but the cabin is too warm. For me the availability of toilet showers are one of the best comfort. 
Look forward to fly again on JAL, the food is always good and by making a transit stay for one or more nights in Japan, we will not suffer from jet lag when travelling from and to the US. By allowing (no extra charge) for transit in Japan (one or two nights following the transit visa / shore pass regulation), I am sure more traveler will take JAL when travelling to the US and it will be good for tourism in Chiba and Japan ...

title: Quality ... relaxed. Nothing you dont need and everything you do
review_text: Always impressed with JAL. The service is just solid. I wouldn't go far as to say friendly... but it is efficient and quality. The seats in Premium Economy were good... certainly on par with the offerings from Cathay and Qantas.... and better than American or BA! The flight might take longer.... but its great way to get to NYC. Watch out for passport control in NYC... 3 hour line up! I want be so upset about early morning arrival in LA again... at least its only ever taken 90mins there.

title: Confortable flight from Australia to Europe and back
review_text: We flew the Sydney-Narita and Narita-Frankfurt legs and return with JAL (the Canberra-Sydney-Canberra legs were with Qantaslink). The JAL ticket was by far the cheapest business class ticket other than KoreanAir (and the Chinese airlines that require a long layover in a Chinese airport) and included hotel overnights in Sydney and Narita on the outward journey. The JAL route to Europe has two advantages over other Australia-Europe routes: (1) it divides the flight into more even legs (the total time is not longer than with, say, Singapore Airlines); (2) because it flies almost over the north pole it avoids war zones. The service on board was excellent, and there is a choice of Japanese or European menus. The only small downside is that, even with the mattress provided, the beds are a bit hard.

title: Fly JAL
review_text:
Very good service, very comfortable seats, good room leg. The inflight entertainment offered good choice of movies and entertainment. There is also moslem food choice for muslim travel. We enjoyed our 7-8 hours journey from Changi to Haneda.

Tq JAL

title: Japanese hospitality
review_text:
JAL is an example of Japanese service, friendliness and efficiency. I had upgraded to PE for a  reasonable price and the seat and extra space were worth the cost. Meals are the same as in economy with some added extra's like Champagne and noodle cups.
Staff very courteous and with a quick response to a call. Meals were tasty and unlike other companies there was no Western option. Regular drink and snack rounds.
The entertainment Programme offered enough variation to keep one from getting bored.
Regular information announcements from the staff and pilots.

title: Japanese Manga/comic lover?
review_text: If you like Japanese Mangas/comics and plan to go to Japan, take Japan Airlines. Many manga are available for you to read for the 8 or 9 hours spent in the airplane. You won't get bored at all. Also, their food was great -- I had Udon noodles and rice with salmon (instead of the chicken or beef dishes served in other airlines) on the way to Japan. On the return trip, I had the Yoshinoya beef bowl and Hagendaz ice-cream. I enjoyed flying round trip to Japan for the first time!

title: Fantastic airline
review_text: JAL were wonderful to fly with. We had our four children with us and they were very attentive to ensure that they were comfortable and happy. The meals were lovely and larger than other airline meals. The entertainment system was very up to date and modern. The plane itself was roomy and economy did not feel squashy at all. We would definitely fly JAL again in the future.

title: Best service I've ever had
review_text:
I don't normally leave reviews for airlines. Flights are normally pretty similar, maybe slightly better food or facilities, but you pretty much know what you're getting. 

However, JAL surpassed any airline I've ever flown on and the customer service and food was outstanding. We flew economy but this was even better than any premium economy either.

The staff went out of their way for you, without you asking for it. Jesus, who was in the back cabin of BA4603 on 24th September, noticed I was hot when I was getting on the plane and came with cold water and sorted out the air con. He was lovely to chat to and offered to bring my dinner later and heat it up as I was asleep when it was brought round. I'm not a great traveller, despite flying several times a year, so he made the experience much more pleasant.

The food was such a delight! Such good quality and I actually ate it all (which I don't normally do on a flight).

It felt like flying was, back in the 90s. Great service, great food, with some thought put into it, and the experience made you feel a bit special.

title: Th eonly way to go if flying economy class
review_text: JAL offers the best economy class product across the Pacific hands down.  With 34 inches if seat pitch and wide seats, the ride is very comfortable.  Crew is truly professional and extremely courteous and polite.  Meals are good, and flights almost always on time in my opinion.  Services to San Francisco are from Haneda airport, which is very convenient to all points in central Tokyo.  Highly recommended.

title: Losing it's lustre
review_text: Ouch, it all began with the officious crew in western uniform. I remember JAL staff in traditional (?) dress giving us a taste of their country as soon as you step on board. Seats are narrow and hard and at 164 cms I could not stretch out completely in a flat bed. Food so so.

title: Good service but I dislike the dish
review_text: I had a flight to Tokyo from CGK, and I had a good time during the flight. I remember the cabin crew gave us a disposable towel for cleaning the face. The leg room is long enough, the seat is comfortable. The entertainment is good as well. One thing that I dislike is the food. I didn't like the raw dish that they served to me. Tasted awful to me. But with the good service, I would say that my experience was fair enough.

title: First class was First class
review_text:
This is a little gem and a nice experience.
Although this is only my second first class flight I think I'm happy to declare its probably not worth the extra dollars/points up from business class.  MAybe Singapore suites may change this opinion.
You get into the Qantas first class lounge in Sydney, where the Neil Perry dining means there isn't much point eating on the plane too much.
When you are on the plane the service is terrific as expected and the pours of alcohol generous.  The Japanese appreciate someone who can handle their scotch and are respectful and non-judgmental.  The Hibiki 17 yr old and Chivas Royal Salute went down very well.
They are obviously proud of their menu which is very good.
The WiFi didn't work that well but why be on the phone when on a flight like this.
On the return the JAL Sakura lounge is good too with a sushi bar and sake bar.  Its the best thing about the otherwise uninspiring and long way out Narita airport.

title: Business class was great!
review_text:
Whilst JAL had most of the perks that usually come with business class, it's seats and your personal space could do with a a little face lift. Seats go into full bed mode, I even had a mattress in my overhead cabin to make my flight more comfy. Remote control was within reach without any effort to control my seat (which had a very gentle massager- did nothing for me really) and my 23" TV...hello! My husband got the window seat, and I got the aisle, so even though I couldn't get a proper view of outside, at least I could've slide my privacy window up...automatically, so I can hide my jealously. I had access to all the latest american movies and even japanese and indian films- with caption. 
I also had enough space to store all my knick-knacks, extra bags and books.
Food was awesome, I had 3 course options, japanese, western and I can't remember the other. I chose the japanese, it had so many different items from prawn, lotus root, egg roll, eel, duck, pufferfish and more. Some items in this course came in a tray, looked like food samples, but nevertheless was fulling. The meal was the most interesting, it was like a food feast in the air. I even got to make my own origami. My fight attendant offered to wake me up for breakfast- a first I've encountered on a flight, which I truly appreciated.

title: Loved it!
review_text: We were dreading a long flight, but it was so comfortable, excellent food, very good wine, and the hostesses were attentive and beautiful. We had such a good time with our friends when the plain landed we did not want to get off!

title: Pleasant and helpful serbice
review_text: As we have someone on wheelchair Travelling with us, we were assisted at every sector of the flights.  First we were told to check in early to get the needed seats near to the toilets.  We were able to sit together.  Upon arrival at Tokyo for the transfer to the Domestic Terminal, there was a ground staff who assisted us, accompany all the way for the transfer.  I m quite sure we Wong make it without his help and company.  There was a free transfer n the re checking in of luggage etc and he was a great and comforting presence.  I m so pleased as it was excellent service.  I have no hesitation flying JAL on the future.  By the way the seats and keg room on both planes were much spacious compared to many other airlines o have flew in.  Kudos to JAL

title: A Good Airline But With Variations
review_text: The service on the Narita to Honolulu flight is different to other JAL services such as to Europe and USA where there is more competition.The food selection was very limited and the food good but not to the standard you might see on other flights. There was no amenities pack.The staff however compensate and are always very good and pleasant. The aircraft was an older 767 and not to other Business Class standards.

title: Very good service
review_text: We flew from Los Angeles to Hong Kong with a 1 hour stopover at Narita in Tokyo on September 19. LA to Japan via Boeing 777 and Japan to Hong Kong via 787. Both new planes were very comfortable; I especially like the touch screen monitors and bathrooms. The cabin services were excellent throughout the trip. The pilot landed the 777 in foul weather at Narita very smoothly. However I was disappointed with the food served this entire trip. I had expected better tasting food from JAL. It may be just me but I found the packaging of meals especially annoying and difficult for someone with arthritic fingers. I did like the miso soup, served hot from a pitcher. My mochi ice cream was frozen.  Passengers with connecting flights had to go through another security check. Because Narita had only one machine operating there was a long queue. The bottleneck made us nervous about missing out flight. Turned out our flight was delayed by half an hour before takeoff anyway.

title: The best Premium Economy flight I have ever taken
review_text:
Very efficient and friendly check-in.
Premium economy seats have plenty of leg room. When the person in front reclines the back of their seat does not move - so you always have plenty of space. This is the type of seat you got in business class a few years ago.
Food was excellent.
Onboard service was excellent.
Well worth the extra money (above economy fare).
This is the best premium economy flight I have ever taken.

title: Amazing!
review_text: As platinum frequent Aa Flyer I can tell you that from the Check-in until luggage claim everything was perfectly organized and well orchestrated. Amazing good food and service. Hostesses very helpful and polite. A very, but very good experience. Western airlines can still learn from them.

title: first time with JAL and a good experience too!
review_text: a very nice trip with JAL on our first trip with them, great service and some very nice Japanese food to sample, overall an enjoyable trip

title: Great airline
review_text:
Everything worked perfectly from check-in to baggage claim. The seats were pretty comfortable and little bigger than usual, so there was atleast few cm's more space to spend the 10hr flight in. Flight attendants were all nice and really polite and always willing to help. Also there were lots of movies and series to watch from your own screen. Food was also pretty good. And the flight landed in Narita a few minutes earlier than expected. The must useful thing is that the price includes 2x23kg of checked baggage you can take with you, since nowadays some companies charge extra even for one 20kg luggage. 
So I'm definitely using JAL when I'm going to Japan next timw.

title: Arrived early despite cancelled flight by other airline
review_text: First leg is codeshare flight with Qantas (to aussie) which was cancelled.  JAL came to the party and booked us on another airline whch got us to Tokyo earlier than our scheduled flight.  Full marks for fixing what could have been a very sad day. (and whne finally on an actual JAL flight service very good).

title: Classiest Airline !
review_text: I have flown many airlines, but JAL is by far the classiest. I can't really put it into words, but there is absolutely no question that I have felt appreciated as a Customer while flying JAL. I've made the trip between Tokyo and Manila maybe 8 times now and have yet to be disappointed. It doesn't hurt that a nice cold can of beer is free just as the typical sodas. I have taken advantage fo this a time or two, especially since this 5 hour flight is usually immediately following my 14 hour Chicago to Tokyo flight. Anything to take the edge off is fine by me.

title: Very pleasant 787
review_text:
JAL has recently upgraded many of its planes to the 787. They are roomy (relatively) and comfortable compared to previous JAL airplanes, and much better than any US-based airline.

Meals are good for airplane food and service is very good.

Talk to the staff if you have any questions or comments. Japanese people are not likely to upgrade anyone for trivial reasons, but they will do their best to accommodate any requests.

title: 99% on time or faster
review_text: I've flown Tokyo⇔Honolulu, Tokyo⇔Paris, Tokyo⇔London, Tokyo⇔LA, Tokyo⇔Bangkok, and I've never been disappointed. Their premium economy is my choice if can't be on business class. Plenty of leg room, the reclining seats are amazing, and the meals are actually good. They usually have JAL brand cup noodles if you're not up for a whole meal or still hungry, and their selection of wines etc are quite nice, and plenty of newspapers and magazines too. If you're flying from NRT, must try the Japanese style beef curry served in the JAL Lounge.

title: Nice New Plane
review_text: Our 12-hour flight was on a newer plane.  The legroom was tight in economy, but the seat were comfortable with adequate cushioning.  The lavatories were spacious and clean.  They even had toothbrushes in the lavatory.  The flight attendants served 2 meals on the flight.  Neither was really tasty, but at least it was something to eat.  There was a box of snacks available between meals.  The flight attendants were polite and gracious as you would expect of the Japanese.  Check in, security, customs and boarding were a breeze at the Osaka airport.

title: Good for Infants
review_text:
We contacted JAL directly as we needed a bassinet for our son so were able to select our seats at the time of booking. Once on board the legroom and seating was good for an economy seat.
The service for infants is also good with staff providing meals & hot water and also washing bottles.
The food and drink service (for adults!) is also better than some airlines of a similar grade. JAL has improved considerably in recent years.

title: Best customer service
review_text: I love Japan Airlines. This is my first choice. I been flying with them for many yrs I traveled to Japan. I like how they treated me. They give excellent customer service! Everyone from the checkin to the stewardess are so friendly. I never had any problems. The staff are so professional too. They deliver service with a smile all the time. I know most people who choose airlines would usually go for the cheapest price first but not me. I always look for how well the staff treats the customer. I really do not mind paying the price to ride this Airline.,to me it is well worth it. I would give this Airline a 5 star . I also would recommend Japan Airlines to everyone out there. The food is also so good. So when I exit the plane,I always bow to the staff because I appreciate them. Japan Airlines is the safest to ride in my opinion!

title: Good Flight
review_text:
We decided to travel with JAL due to the advertised extra 10cm leg rooms. It did not disappoint us. However, the seat design is quite strange and I had to put 2 pillows to support my lower back.

The check in in the airport is smooth. Although the flight is full, we have no problem storing our hand carry in the overhead compartment. (Unlike some other airlines, it may be lucky that you find room to store your hand carry as other passengers seem to have so many hand carry luggage and the airline is not stopping them)

The JAL air hostesses are very polite and attentive, the meals are decent and JAL is generous with their drinks (and you can help yourselves to snacks during the flight).

title: Very Courteous Airline Crew
review_text: I love japanese cuisine and I would always fly with any airline that serves Japanese food. Of course Japan Airlines being Japans national carrier would make a tremendous job in serving the best Japanese "airline" food onboard. I also find their flight crew one of the most courteous crew among all airlines. There is something different on how Japanese talk and give service. They speak almost in whispers and they move very gracefully. The flight crew were all Japanese except there was one time we flew to Bangkok also using JAL and our flight crew were of different nationalities and they stayed in the same hotel we stayed in. We got to talk to some of them and the Japan Airline crew was being trained in Bangkok. I guess the training of JAL flight crew is very different and its very exceptional. I don't mind flying with JAL again, the seats are OK, food is good and crew is exceptional!

title: A pleasant journey indeed.
review_text:
Normally we'd pull an economy flight but there were none left. I must admit it was great having extra legroom and comfy recliner seats. Also you get a little Qantas lounge at the start! The best bit is that the seats don't move back when you recline so no-one gets in your face and you don't piss anyone off ever. My first meal was excellent 
(but my partner says never choose the fish) The staff are superb. REALLY good staff. One of the gentlest landings ever. There were some slight delays (Sydney Airport's fault) and you could tell they really cared about not being on schedule. They made up the time on the way and we arrived bang on. If you are flush with funds go for it for the space... but if money's too tight to mention their economy is pretty good too.

title: Lovely experience
review_text: Lovely experience, but then I had never really experienced going to Japan before. Their meals are a lot of fun if you like Japanese style , otherwise play it safe and request your meal before the flight.

title: Pleased Service
review_text: Night flight meal are excellent, as food was from Japan Catering. Furthermore, with Hagen Daz ice-cream as dessert, cheese bread as late snack. I requested for hot water and it was served real hot. So, pleased service.

title: My family favorite Airline
review_text:
I and my family are the big fan of JAL due to many reasons that you could get:
- Best Services
- Best/New Aircraft
- Good Food
However, the ticket price is quit high compared with those of others.

title: Awesome airline
review_text: Japan Airline is one of the best airlines I've flown with, everything from the time you check-in till the time you leave the airport at your destination is excellent, all the staff are extremely helpful, delightful and extremely approachable. The seating on the plane as well as the meal was fantastic.

title: First Class All the Way
review_text: Excellent Flight on one of JAL's 787 Dreamliners, Crew was so graceful it was a pleasure. Loved the Japanese Whiskey they gave out. Helped me sleep through 15 hours of travel time. I did like ANA's seating more comfortable though, but their plane was better.

title: Great First Impression
review_text:
It was great first impression lasts experience for us to try a different airline to Far East!
The service, food, in-flight entertainment is excellent! Comfortable flight. Free layover hotel, too.

title: Awesome, Awesome, Awesome
review_text: JAL are the best, from the moment I checked-in to the time in the Diamond Lounge to the boarding and the flight I was impressed but then that is what I take for granted as I have flown with JAL many times and know that I am always in the best hands. All the staff treat me like a king and spoil me rotten, I love to have a casual joke with them and they are always very pleasing to talk to. I won’t fly with any other airline in Japan as I believe that JAL is Number 1.

title: 1st impression was great
review_text: My 1st time to fly Japan Airlines happened because our original departure flight from Beijing back to the USA got cancelled and we were rerouted from PEK to Tokyo and then the US. The experience was very good with a very friendly staff that spoke very well in English. The food service was great and the in seat entertainment options were friendly towards an English speaking customer. If another opportunity happens, would consider flying Japan Airlines again.

title: could be better
review_text:
Dont get the bulkhead seat in economy. There is no seat pocket to store things in and the TV is small and cannot be used until after takeoff. Crew were busy and took 15 min before we could figure out how to select the English instructions on the TV.
Food was ok, comfy flight, angle flat seats so it would be awful to sleep on, but good for daytime flight

title: Best airline
review_text: What an excellent service JAL provides. The seats are the best I have sat in in either economy or indeed business class. Leather and full on soft. Staff totally attentive without being over the top and check in was seamless without barely a word of English.

title: An all around great experience.
review_text: This was one of the best "long haul" travel experiences I've ever had.  The customer service was incredible.  The efficiency was unbeatable. The award winning seats, menu and service made my trip unforgettable.

title: Quiet and comfortable
review_text: JAL was the best airline I have flown in years. I loved the 787 Dreamliner, a quiet and spacious aircraft. I very much appreciated the roomy seats JAL gave even in economy. The service was attentive and friendly, and the crew was very considerate of the time passengers needed to sleep. I don't know how economy class can get any better than this.

title: consistent
review_text: The good thing about JAL is that you know what you will get. Never Excellent Never bad just the same regular service. The airplanes seem to be a bit nicer lately. Service is always helpful and the lounges are consistent.

title: first class indeed!
review_text: this is my first time trying Japan Airlines and i never experienced such service from the other airlines before. everything in the plane is just so comfortable that you would want to extend the hours of your flight. all the crews were so friendly as well~

title: Fantastic!
review_text: Fantastic in every way!  I had traveled on JAL several years ago and the experience was OK.  WOW have things changed!  Now excellent service, on time arrival, and the food was a step above typical airline cuisine!  I highly recommend JAL!

title: Always amazing
review_text: The food was great and the flight attendants were very nice! The aircraft was very clean. Would definitely like to travel JAL again.

title: Just generally good
review_text:
Your experience on a flight is always defined by the class of service, in this case premium economy but it felt almost as good as business class!
The seats are wider and have more dedicated legroom than any other prem economy I've flown, the in flight service was excellent and the staff pretty good too.
If I'm flying JAL again I'd find it hard to justify the extra expense for business unlike other airlines.

title: Perfect choice if you travel with kids
review_text:
Seat and legs room were wider than most of the big airline. Adult food was average but the kid meal was amazing. Entertainment system was average in comparison but enough to kill time during the 10 hrs of flight. All kid will get to choose a toy/ gift once they on board and keep them accompanied. While waiting for boarding the domestic connection, the captain actually reach out every kid and say hi and give them stickers. This kind of service which I used to see 30 years ago but hardly see these days. JAL really give you a feeling of being a customer rather than a passenger. 
JAL was my first flight 30 years ago and after 30 years later, they did let me down.
Strongly recommended if you are travelling with young kids.

title: good service
review_text: on the long haul flight the choice of food and drinks was very big - local and international, entertainment was good with a big choice

title: Standard service
review_text: Standard services from the crews, the foods need to have some improvements. i expect higher from the aircraft but it looks like budget airline.

title: Very comfortable flight
review_text: Comfortable & relax. Very good service. An excellent opportunity to take some photos of Fuji Mountain. Feel lucky.

title: Pleasureable flight
review_text: I always have excellent flight experiences flying with JAL and this was no exception, the flight stewards are willing to share a laugh with you and are always willing to help. From the check-in to the lounge to the boarding to the flight I know I'm in good hands with JAL.

title: Fantastic airline
review_text: I love JAL, they are one of my favourite airlines, service and comfort is their speciality, nothing is too difficult for JAL, the ladies on the flight are always prepared to engage with the traveller giving you that warm friendly feeling.

title: Okay, Not Quite Impressive
review_text:
I flew JAL because an open jaw ticket from Tokyo to KL and from Singapore to Tokyo was available only on JAL. The air fare was quite reasonable for flying in a busy summer season.

The seats on the outbound flight (B-789) were spacious for the economy class, but the seat cover was a bit slippery and not comfortable. The seats on the inbound flight (B-772) were quite tight; it was an overnight flight, and I couldn’t sleep very well.

The meals were mediocre at the most. JAL used to provide top notch in-flight services, but I didn't feel that way this time at all. The general attitudes of the cabin crew were just okay, which may reflect some inadequacy of their current job training; it just wasn't like that before.

title: Narita to Taipei and back
review_text:
I flew this route early August and JAL has started using new 787's on the route.  It's a two class version- business and coach.  The business cabin has lie flat seats in a 1-2-1 configuration.

On the way to Taipei I had the Japanese meal and it was actually good.  On the way back I had the Western meal and it was passable.

Service was standard JAL which has improved over the years.

title: Not as good as imagined
review_text: No earplugs and slippers provided on the plane. Flight meals also not good as before.  Feel disappointed.

title: Excellant Service wonderful airline to fly!
review_text: I try to fly JAL whenever I fly to Japan be it for business or for vacation. Living in Taiwan and working in Asia means I am in the air a lot. The flight is almost always on time if not early, the cabin crew are very well trained and offer very good service regardless of seating class be it economy or business class you are treated with great service and respect. I will definately fly Japan Airlines within Asia as much as possible.

title: night flight
review_text:
I live in Japan so I traveled with Jal a lot of times to a lot of places and I always have mixed feelings about it. The price of the ticket was not too expensive but Jal usually is, they are a very prestigious airline famed for always being on time and their  very high standards. I agree, just like pretty much everything in Japan they live up to their standards, specially in safety and service. However on this particular flight I was not happy at all, the flight going to Bangkok the aircraft was much older and the way back had a very new, very nice aircraft. One good thing was there was more space, even my very tall husband was happy that the leg space on economy class was bigger and on both the older and newer plane. The entertainment system was much better on the newer airplane, but the movie selection was very good and similar in both. 
Now the bad, I never flew with Jal that I actually liked their food, this time was no exception, it was a midnight flight and they did not serve dinner, just a pastry that I couldn't figure what it tasted like and some nuts. I didn't eat at the airport cause Haneda does not have lots of options either so I was hungry until morning. Well, morning breakfast wasn't great either, on the flight back was the same thing, a dinner but no choice at all, usually every airline has a western choice, this did not thou the food wasn't as terrible this time. After flying 7 hours there was nothing at breakfast only coffee, well still they turn the lights on 2 hours before landing so you basically cut on the very little extra sleep you could have had. It seemed as they are trying to cut on costs. Also surprisingly the service was not the best, some of the flight attendants did not speak english well, it was a little hard to communicate and also a bit rude, not likely to Japan at all. I was disappointed, specially since my next flight was with Bangkok Airways and they won so much with me with service and super tasty food in a very short flight, I could definitely tell the difference. I was never a big fan o Jal for long flights and besides de extra space I'm not sure I would choose them again.

title: Best Flight Experience
review_text:
There is no direct flight from Toronto to Tokyo. We need To take AA to Dallas first and then connected the JAL to Tokyo.

Onboard flight crew were attentive and met any requests with a smile (and a bow). 

We loved the space that we had even though we just in economy class, so much more legroom and actual space.

The food was moderate but their service was good.

title: Excellent quality flight to Japan
review_text:
Although I had booked my flights on another company, issues made me travel with JAL instead and it was a very pleasent surprise to flight with this company!

Excellent quality at every level: nice staff, very good selection of programs to watch, good quality meal.

All this made this long journey to Japan very enjoyable and the start of very good vacations. 

I would absolutly flight with them again for another visit in Japan.

title: Very attentive and courteous service
review_text:
Japan Airlines is one of my favorite airlines with very friendly and smiling flight attendants.  The moment you are seated, a hot towel, japanese snacks, and drink will be served.  Every seat has direct access to the aisle even the seat configuration is 2-2-2. All window seats have a direct access without having to pass over your next neighbor's legs whenever you want to get out.

Even most of the flight attendants are Japanese but their knowledge in the English language is totally sufficient to answer passengers' question and request.

Seats are very comfortable although not very wide but they are fully flat which is very important for a long haul flight.  

Meal is served two hours after take off and everyone can request light meals anytime during the flight and 2 hours before landing.  Meals are created by renowned culinary chefs in Japan. I always ordered Japanese meals but Western ones look appetizing as well.  I once had lamb chop on the flight from NRT to LAX and it was surprisingly good!

Movies on board have many choices including the newest released.  Screen is very good size.

Sakura Lounge at Narita Airport for Business Class is very decent.  You just can go to the one nearest to your boarding gate.  If someone is fortunate enough to get into the First Class Lounge, made to order sushi may be the best choice.  At the Sakura Lounge,  you can also have rice, noodles, hot soup....besides all kinds of beverages.
The airport and lounges are sparkling clean!

One more hint is that reservation should be made as soon as possible if you plan to travel during the peak seasons which are usually Spring and Autumn.

title: Poor JAL experience
review_text:
What was a lovely trip to Japan (Sapporo & Tokyo) was 'spoilt' at the final leg of the trip from Tokyo to Singapore. The checking in was a long process. There were 6 of us, 2 with Singapore passports and 4 with Malaysian passports (all PRs). My son had a tube with a fishing rod to check in. After issuing the boarding passes came the surprises. First they asked for proof of residence in Singapore for the MY passport holders. 3 of us carried our SG ICs with us and had no issue. My daughter just had her SG driving licence. To them that was not good enough and we had to wait for a good 30mins while they 'checked'. They came back with the most ridiculous reason from their counterpart in Singapore...."sometimes the immigration in SG stops people who cannot provide residence status!" If only they checked the ICA site they would have realised no visa is required, if that is what they were after. We settled that by signing an indemnity of some sort, a CYA for their comfort. Then came the next surprise....the tube with the fishing rod exceeds 'dimensions' (203cm instead of max 183cm) and my son had to pay S$140 to get it loaded! Never had he ever experienced such an instance even on budget airlines where he carted his fishing tube, e.g. Tiger, Scoot and Air Asia. 
So, people with fishing gear, esp. tubes be careful and opt for other airlines. For PRs just carry your SG IC with you. 
JAL behaved worst than a low cost airline and this is the first and last time we fly JAL.

title: Ist class is absolutely amazing
review_text: If you ever have enough money (or points) to fly first class then I highly recommend Japan Airlines.   Only 8 first class seats on my flight with 3 wonderful ladies to attend to us.   It was an experience second to none.   I chose the Japanese menu over the Western menu and the food kept coming in small portions the entire flight.  It was wonderful.   The seat went to a fully flat huge bed much bigger than that of British Airways.

title: Second leg on a long trip.
review_text: Flying on JAL was a very great step up from flying on American to Tokyo. The plane was much newer or at least refurbished. There seemed to be a little more legroom and the seats were comfortable. The entertainment system was definitely an upgrade from the American flight. The food was quite nice and there was plenty to eat. We got two meals on this 8 hour flight. Beverage service was pretty normal and you could get alcohol if you paid for it. The flight attendants were helpful and courteous. JAL is now an Alaska Airlines partner so there is one more reason to fly with them in the future. I had left an item on the aircraft and it was difficult to get in touch with a JAL representative at the Jakarta Airport. Never did get the item back but that was not their fault.

title: Proably the best
review_text:
First buying direct from JAL website was only £30 more per flight than Expedia, but you got to chose your seat and types of meal at time of booking on both the flight out and the return, so I could book the same seats both ways. I won't say which seats we had ( I don't won't everybody booking them,but seatguru listed them as bad, . They were the best seats we've ever had. All economy seats have extra width and pitch compared with any other economy seat I've ever sat in, USB socket, power supply below seat and nifty drink holders, cubbies and folding tables.
 The films were up to date, the food was very good and self service snacks and drinks were available throughout the flight. The toilets were clean and were cleaned during the flight and a few toothbrushes were put out near the end of the flight.
 The cabin crew were excellent and were so charming and attentive both the Japenese crew and the English/Irish crew.
 Would I fly JAL again, you bet I would!

title: Japan Airlines
review_text: My first flight with JAL was in the year 2000. I was impressed with the courtesy and efficiency of the crew. I've flown many times since in a mixture of business and economy class. Whilst it may not be up to the standards of other airlines like Emirates, JAL is in a class of its own and is now my preferred carrier, depending on destination.

title: Space , service excellent pity the entertainment system didn't work
review_text: Japan airlines are great to travel with , there is plenty of leg room the staff provide great and attentive service. The food is ok by airline standards. It was a pity that the entertainment server crashed making a 10 hour daytime flight seem much longer. The staff were apologetic in typically Japanese style. I intent to join the frequent flyer  programme

title: Best connection from Frankfurt to Tokyo in terms of price and flight time
review_text: This airline offers really the best value for money for the FRA-NRT connection - at 700 Euros it is only a fraction of what the Lufthansa flight would have costed. Service on board was extremely friendly and the food was very good. Having said that, the service in NRT was not really great as many of the ground personnel were very complicated and took ages to check in. Nevertheless, it is such a good deal I would always choose this airline over Lufthansa to fly to NRT.

title: Extra 10bucks worth to spend
review_text:
他社同様に日本航空にはプレミアムエコノミーのサービスがあるが、国内線でのコストパフォーマンスは極めて高い。千円で得られるゆとりの空間、空席ありの場合は是非利用したい。
As the other airline company, JAL also has the premium economy class which also is available for most other domestic line. This class for domestic lines is absolutely affordable and I believe it's worth to spend. Spacious, comfortable and you may get early check in for upgraded customers. You may not want to miss when it's available.

title: Would not pay extra to go First Class
review_text:
We normally fly this leg Business class but were utilising points and First Class only was available.  
We tried the First Class Sakura lounge at Narita Airport which we didn't like as it was super dark and occupied by businessmen.  It felt unfriendly and we reverted to what we knew - the Sakura Business Lounge, much more spacious with great views of the airport.
There are only 12 first class suites on each 777 aircraft in the configuration of 1-2-1. If you like to sit together you are better to choose the middle two suites.   We decided to have window seats behind each other and the space is very good as is the lie flat bed.  The entertainment on offer isn't really extensive enough - there were a few recent movies but generally the choice is poor.
The dinner was very similar to that offered in Business Class but the breakfast is more hard core Japanese style, not an egg in sight and we found the choice completely undesirable.  We just had coffee and fruit.
I would not travel or pay to go First Class again.  The new Business class seats all have aisle access and the breakfast choices are far better. They provide everything a traveller would want - privacy, space, decent seats, a lie flat bed, decent food choices and a reasonable price.

title: My trip back
review_text: I traveled with Japan Airlines once before, but this time I traveled back with my husband. From the check in our luggage until getting to the gate everything was good. We loved the space that we had even though we just in economy class. The food was moderate but their service was good. I don't mind to travel again with Japan Airlines next time.

title: My new favourite airline
review_text: Checked out seat options of different airlines for this premium economy trip. JAL had easily the largest seat and leg space configuration. The most amazing courteous check in procedure I've ever experienced in any class of business travel. Great entertainment system and food. My new favourite airline

title: Very reliable schedule
review_text:
We use JAL often due to their favorable business class prices and seating configuration which allows window seat passengers clear aisle access.  On JL771 there are now flat beds.  After take-off at 0810 a drinks service is offered followed by lunch.  The timing of lunch is questionable as most passengers have just enjoyed breakfast in the Qantas lounge in Sydney.  There is no JAL lounge. Japanese and Western cuisines are offered.   The Western choices always include fish, beef and chicken but not a vegetarian option.  The presentation and level of service is excellent.  Each meal is delivered individually, not on a trolley.  However this all happens between 0930 and 1030 and I'm never ready for lunch at this time.  The entertainment is reasonable but latest movies are limited.  Before landing at Narita a snack is offered although a snack menu is available all day consisting of three types of Japanese noodles and other offerings.  
What sells this service to me is the timing of the service, the reliability of the schedule and the graciousness of the service. Leaving first thing in the morning and arriving just after 1700 makes for a comfortable journey or stopover if you're travelling onwards.  I'd give it another star if they moved lunch back 2 hours.

title: Spacious Economy
review_text:
The space for your legs is so spacious, makes it very comfortable for a long haul flight. Thanks to the newly designed seats.

The food was tasty and wrapped nicely, which made it interesting.

Flight attendants were nice and they did speak English well.

title: Every passenger on JAL receives slippers on board!
review_text:
First flight ever on Japan Airlines (JAL).   It was a long flight but service from the crew members helped make the journey much more pleasant.
We received slippers to wear on the flight over to Japan.   That was a nice surprise.

title: Fantastic service JAL
review_text: JAL is my preference of travel whilst I'm in Japan, you are treated like royalty from the moment you walk up to the check-in counter until the moment you disembark, their warm friendly, professional service is what brings me back to their airline every time. You are kept well informed by the captain during your flight and nothing is too difficult for the flight stewards. I was even asked if I needed the safety demonstration to be explained in English.

title: Flight Attendants are very friendly
review_text: When traveling for 24 hours (Charlotte, NC to MNL, Philippines), one's level of patience as well as frustration does get thin. It become more true when you're traveling with a 3 year old grandson. The last flight to MNL was with Japan Airlines so every minute counted with regards to keeping my sanity. The flight attendants did their best to make this a comfortable flight for me and  everyone else. For some unusual reason, I was severely parched throughout the trip, I kept on asking for gallons of water and not once did I sense any level of impatience from any one of the flight attendants. I say this because I actually experienced bad service on one of my other flight(s) quite recently (and this was even on a local flight). Food was even better in this airline.  When given a choice, I would look with Japan Airlines for a connecting flight to get to my (international) destinations.

title: Great efficient service
