review_text: From check in to departure at destination the staff could not have been more helpful. Good selection of western and Japanese cuisine

title: Disappointed!
review_text: This is the first time I flew with Japan Airlines and the layover from Manila-Tokyo-Chicago was overnight. I did get to stay in a unique hotel in the airport but my flight wasn't exactly enjoyable. I did not like the food that they served in the flight. I do like Japanese food but the one they served in both flights wasn't really a good one. Even the breakfast wasn't good enough compared to other airlines I've taken. To make things worse, I found out in Tokyo airport that the airline charged me twice on my booking! I found out when I was purchasing something that my card was declined and so I wondered why, and my bank told me I had 4 tickets from Manila-Tokyo-Chicago-Atlanta charged to me! As a result, I had to pay the hotel cash and I couldn't use Uber while in Atlanta. They have inconvenienced me big time so I don't think I will ever fly again with Japan Airlines. The only saving grace they had was the co-flight with American Airlines. The food was good and their service was better. It took them more than a week to return my money...and it was almost $4,000!

title: One of my favorite airlines
review_text: I had not flown JAL since I was a kid living in Japan and so I was really small and space was never an issue. Many years later I'm a bigger guy with much longer legs so I was a little worried when I was flying from Malaysia to Japan. I was very surprised at how spacious the economy section was with plenty of leg room. The airline attendants were excellent which was not surprising. Very consistently attentive and courteous and genuinely pleasant. I definitely will fly with them again in the future when I am in Asia. On connecting flights from Tokyo to the US JAL was partnered with American Airlines and despite their limitations in assisting me with American Airlines flight changes, they were very apologetic and tried everything they could to assist me. I found it so amusing that JAL employees were more concerned about helping me than any of the American Airlines employees. For me it reinforces the belief that Japanese companies truly put the customer first in theory AND practice unlike many US companies. I own the bias in this, and I am open to continue being open to US companies proving me wrong.

title: Exceptional service
review_text: JAL is one of the best airlines that I have had the experience of. The level of service, warm and friendly greetings, comfort and cleanliness is why I always fly with JAL whilst I am in Japan, they really know how to make you feel special.

title: Excellent Service
review_text: JAL is an excellent airline.  Great service, comfortable and clean aircraft a real pleasure to fly with.  Had not flown with JAL in many years but their level of service is still up there.

title: Best airline when going to Japan and back!
review_text: This is my favourite airline when travelling from Manila to Japan and vice versa. I little bit expensive compared to the rest but you won't regret it. Always on time or even ahead of time. Very few delays experienced here. Crew and staff are friendly. Food is great. Check in is always a breeze.

title: Japanese Service from the Moment we Board the Plane!!
review_text: This was our first trip to Japan. The service, food, and luxury set the tone for our entire trip. While it is a long flight, everything about the airplane, food, and service. When they saw my husband has some difficulty with his handicap, they moved him so he would be more comfortable. We couldn't believe the attendants changed clothes for food service and back for boarding and exiting.  We can't wait to go to Tokyo again and we will used Japanese airlines for sure!!

title: I like JAL Airline.
review_text:
I used JAL 4 times mostly  to travel to Europe. Check in is usualIy easy and quick. Only once  there was drama created as the check in personal (Aus woman at the Sydney airport) deemed  photo on my passport with "not much definition". One hour of stress and running around the airport for , finally being  approved to get on the flight with a warning I might have problems elsewhere. I did not: passed through 9 countries with no problem. Aus passport have electronic chip. My passport was in  its 10th year of usage and it  had its wear and tear. Now I have a new passport.

Tickets are good value for money.   Japanese stile food/ NZ wine is mostly  amazing in business class,  staff is very polite. Re food I say "mostly"  as on my last return flight from Tokyo to Sydney (flight 771) dinner served had too much of hot stuff in  it. It is funny that this happened: on my way to Europe I was giving compliments to the chefs! Food was simply divine.

 Seats and  space in Dreamliner are great. I would not  choose seat close to food prep area: it is a bit noisy.

There are 3 or 4 lounges to choose at the  Narita airport: one of them, near gate 70+,  is large on 2 levels, have showers, space for smokers, non smokers,  beds to sleep/ rest and more. They prepare cooked food as well as snacks. One of the best lounges if you have plenty of time between flights.

title: Seat is comfortable, food is delicious
review_text: I have a pleasant journey to arrive my destination. The seat pocket looks clean, the magazine is new and fun to read.

title: Excellent Airline
review_text: We travelled to Japan on Japan Airlines in January.  We are a family of five and we were all very happy with the service, staff and flight.  The food was fine but the breakfast on the return flight was quite traditional and came with instructions and I wasn't really up to it at that late stage of the flight and would've preferred a more simple option.  On the other hand the airline handled my daughters peanut allergy extremely well and we were very happy with their care and her variety of food.  Japan Airlines seems to have more legroom than other airlines I have flown with which was great.  Bathrooms were well maintained.  The flight attendants are so pleasant and helpful and really do make the flight a more enjoyable experience.  I would fly Japan Airlines whenever possible and highly recommend them.

title: Superior Customer Service
review_text:
Customer service cannot be faulted. I did not check my bags through to my final destination correctly. NOT JAL fault. JAL ground staff sorted it all out with amazing efficiency. Before I had passed through customs in Tokyo, I had been reassured on 3 separate occasions that my luggage had been sorted out.
The premium economy seats were comfortable with ample legroom. The flight staff were efficient, friendly and professional. Food top quality. Bathrooms always clean. Even after an 11 hour flight.
Airport lounges superb! 
Would recommend JAL very highly. Will definitely fly with them again.

title: Impressed
review_text: Very good inflight experience. One of the best. The meals are pretty good. And the kids' meals are so cute!

title: Best Airlines
review_text:
I flew JAL to Manilla after arriving on American Airlines at Narita. The seats were comfortable, the staff and service were amazing, the food was excellent, and the in-flight entertainment selections were top notch.  

I have flown many airlines and this by far was my favorite.

title: Great Airline with Great Cabin Crew!
review_text: Last December 2015, me and my family went on a trip to Japan.  We flew with Japan Airlines, as it was a redemption booking.  We simply loved the attention and care given by the cabjn crew to ensure our utmost comfort and pleasure.  We will surely fly with them again given the chance.

title: The best route from Europe to Japan, in great comfort.
review_text: My wife and I flew JAL to Japan for the first time recently. Flying originally from Manchester to Helsinki on a codeshare serviced by Finnair, the main Helsinki-Narita leg was on a 787-9 flown by JAL, in their Premium Economy product. The 787 was quieter, smoother and more comfortable than legacy aircraft and the actual route was much shorter than other European Hubs. Instead of the usual 11 hours it took just 8 1/2, which was a huge help. JAl were professional, courteous and the flight was superb. Highly recommended!

title: JAL - Amazing staff and service.  One of the best
review_text: This airline know how to provide first class service in economy.   Amazing leg room compared to other international airlines - staff are extremely polite and caring.  Inflight service was excellent.  On our return flight we were upgraded to premium economy which felt like business class to me.   Service was immaculate and the food excellent.  Wish this airline flew everywhere - come and teach our aussie airlines a thing or two.

title: Older fittings, comfortable though.
review_text:
JAL made it better. After arriving at Narita from Sydney on a newly fitted out Boing 777 with much better business suite, was disappointed on a number of counts. Transiting cost me my sealed booze even though staying flight-side. Reloading to Vancouver, JAL kept me waiting as their systems had not been adapted to accept details concerning the new Electronic Travel Authorization (eTA). That said Canada customs were not ready for it yet either. 

However standing and waiting in the heat at Narita when as in business you things would move smoothly was a bummer. Then to get to a pretty dated business fit out, in the capsule style seats was a disappointment as well.

However, a representative from JAL did meat me at Vancouver and apologised for the stuff up and even reimbursed me form the booze that I lost when transiting.

The service of those few both on-board and at destination recovered the experience for me.

title: Flight to Japan
review_text: The flight was almost 11 hours long.  The stewardess were all very helpful and polite.  Ride was smooth.  We had a red eye flight so we slept most of the flight.  Everything was perfect.  The carryon compartments were more than adequate and the leg space was terrific.  Never banged my knee once.  I am 5'6" tall.  We were fed two meals and it tasted pretty good for an airline meal.  The eggs almost tasted like they were just freshly made off the grill.  My only wish is that my seat cushion recline more toward the backrest.  My wife and daughter were right next to me and all of us enjoyed the long flight.  Definitely would try Japan Airlines again.  Everyone provided service with a smile.

title: One airline I really look forward to flying with.
review_text:
Long flights can be the source of anxiety and trepidation. Flying Vancouver - Singapore and back at least every year is no short haul. However knowing I have my JAL flight reserved and having every faith in their staff means I can look forward to relaxing, catching up with my reading and getting great sleep. The lounge in Tokyo is great in terms of the meals, showers etc. Connections are convenient.

I also feel that should there be a delay they would look after my wife and myself which is reassuring.

Also find JAL a great way to go to Hong Kong and saving myself a 12 hour journey.

title: The space is amazing!
review_text:
We are a family with two people who have long legs. This flight was just a dream in terms of space: the JAL seats are, I think, the best seats in Economy of 2016/2015. We had space for our legs, and could sleep really well.
The attendants are really nice, in the japanese style of courtesy.
I want to add the fact that the boarding is wonderfully organised

However, I will say that the food isn't very good, even if they do make an effort. Continue in this direction. We had a problem with the check-in too, the website needs to improve quickly.

title: JAL Gets it Right!
review_text: JAL is a throwback to what the US airlines were like in the 50s, and 60s.  Impeccable treatment (crew bows to the passengers before the plane takes off); good food; orderly boarding, you name it, JAL does it right!

title: wonderful airline
review_text: We were fortunate enough to fly business class which on JAL is amazing,  however,  second leg from Narita to Heathrow was code shared with British Airlines.  Their business class is not a patch on JAL and was very disapointing.

title: Good service and food
review_text: Very nice flight to Japan with good service, good food and a wide choice for in-flight entertainment. Refreshments were offered regularily.

title: Good alternative
review_text: Our second trip with JAL to London.  We found JAL provides an excellent way to fly to Europe if you are not in a hurry to get there.  A daylight flight to Tokyo followed by another daylight flight to London after a nights sleepover and an afternoon arrival makes it much easier to cope with jet lag.  Whilst the PE service in flight is 'normal' JAL provides express customs and lounge access.  We also like the fact that for about A$900 ea, we can fly back in business with their excellent lie flat beds for the London/Tokyo leg (sadly only angled flat for NRT/SYD) for the night flights

title: Perks for QF Flyers
review_text:
Wheh researching flights to Tokyo we looked at flying Qantas or JAL prem econ and found qantas didn't give you business lounge access whereas JAL did - access to the qantas business lounge and express customs passes to get you through the lines quicker. All that and qantas was $1k more expensive as well.
So we went with JAL prem ecom and it was so worth it. The extra leg room was well worth the additonal cost as well as wider seats. 
You can't beat the Japanese for their hospitality, friendliness and cleanliness on board as well as their on-time persona. It was all great.

title: ABSOLUTELY AMAZING LOOOOOOVE IT
review_text: OH MY GOD! This is THE airline! Business Class on the 777 was absolutely mind-blowing! The level of service that only the Japanese can provide, great quality food with a wide variety, absolutely tasty. Cabin crew was just wonderfully welcoming. It is sooo clean, so comfortable and very very spacious. Way to go!

title: Great service in Business Class
review_text:
Actually travelled May 2014.
Great airline, great attentive inflight staff. Airport staff also excellent, courteous & efficient. Food was pretty good for prepackaged airline food with a choice of Japanese or English menus. We were very lucky to be able to fly Business class...well worth the extra money....so had access to business class lounges at all airports which also were very good. Would definitely travelled JAL again. We picked them as they have a good name & had a sale on when we booked.

title: Good Short Flight from Tokyo to Nagoya
review_text: When returning from Tokyo to Helsinki we had a very short stopover in Nagoya. It was a very pleasant experience with JAL. Even though it was only a 1 hour flight the crew served drinks and snacks and gave a toy plane to my daughter. The in-flight entertainment was working during our journey. Good company. Polite staff.

title: best ecomoney for money and comfort.
review_text: It take off about 8.00am in winter and 9.00am in summer from Sydney . 45 minute would be the least time to check in and board. Check-in is self or desk. the line is always a minimum wait. Check-in staff and air crew have very good English. 2 x 20kg cases is standard and a standard carry on case. The flight is 9 hours with comfortable seating. Seating is 3, 4 in middle and 3. I very much dislike sitting next to drinkers. I am very happy that flying with Jal for over 6 years on this flight, I never have. Very Pleasant staff from check-in to disembarking at Narita. Price is very reasonable compare with other discount airline on this route.

title: Good connecting airline to places in Japan
review_text:
There is no direct flight from Singapore to Shikoku yet. My own preference is JAL, as it has always been known to be prompt. 
I book directly on the JAL Singapore website. JAL or ANA offers many flights to Shikoku, but usually the transit in Tokyo is from Narita to Haneda or vice-versa. However, whichever airline you choose, there is a major consideration when transiting in Tokyo : I never like to have to transit from Tokyo Haneda to Tokyo Narita airport(or vice-versa) just for the domestic flight. It's quite troublesome. There are unfortunately very few JAL or ANA flights whose transit airport is the same.
For the outbound flight, the transit at Haneda is a bit more problematic. You have to pick up your luggage and proceed quickly to the domestic counter to drop them off. Here, I find that the domestic counter staff is pretty slow in handling the queue. Then you have to take a bus at the bus shuttle area to the domestic terminal. The bus leaves every 20 minutes (the interval is a bit long). Then once at the domestic terminal, you may have to take a long walk to the gate. Our transit time was less than 2 hrs, so it was a bit rushed. We were the last to board the flight.
For the inbound flight, our luggage is automatically transferred to the international flight. But we had to ask where to take the bus to the international terminal. At the bus stop area, there is a big automated machine screen telling you the destination of the incoming bus. Take only the bus for the international terminal. The bus leaves every 6-8 minutes, so that's good.
Our transit time was 2h30 minutes, but we had plenty of time to shop at the Airport Duty-Free area.
All in all, a smooth flight. The flight meals are average and note that there are no meals onboard the domestic flight. The JAL counter staff are very friendly and helpful.

title: JAL/Finnair Code Share
review_text: First time flying with JAL & I have to say that I was very impressed. The aircraft was very clean, seats comfortable, plenty of room, the crew were very polite (lots of bowing), very helpful & attentive. We flew during daylight hours & the flight seemed very peaceful. The food was good with some interesting Japanese choices, as well as western food. Apart from juices, the choice of cold non-alcoholic drinks was limited to the Coke range & I found that to be a bit irksome - not a Coke fan!  A very pleasant experience overall & would definitely recommend.

title: Best airline to Japan
review_text: The seat, space and screens are excellent. Beats the European (and American) competition by far. Only problem is that there is flight to mid Japan only, the south-west part connections to Europe are missing.

title: Service was impeccable
review_text: Couldn't fault this flight. The service was excellent, the food was delicious and the staff were friendly yet professional. Checkin was a breeze no problems at all. The seats were spacious and comfortable, lovely fluffy pillows and large warm blanket. Well worth the extra money for Premium Economy for those long haul flights.

title: Excellent Flight
review_text: Took a round trip flight on Japan Airlines and it was excellent.  Gracious service from the check-in counter and throughout the flight.  Delicious meals and refreshments to keep you happy and comfortable.  The flight attendants are very courteous and work hard.  They take good care of their customers.  Wish all airlines could be the same.  We'll be flying JAL again in the near future.

title: What a travel experience? Japanese hospitality and Services too good!
review_text:
I was not all that well to take this long haul flight !  But, Japanese hospitality and care outsmart the health constraints.  Extremely attentive, courteous and professional.   I was really happy to have travelled in JAL though I used several times AEROFLOT in this sector.

Food was just ok and the seat configuration was good but entertainment was not international!

title: Personal attention good and punctuality excellent
review_text: A slim mattress is supplied to help you sleep on a flat bed.  A choice is offered between Asian and Western type food.  JAL takes pride in being on time and pay a lot of attention to detail, adding to the comfort of long trips

title: Best Asian Carrier
review_text: Flew from San Diego to Narita Japan first leg, second leg from Narita to Manila, no layover to speak of, Literally from one Plane to the next. The Flight from San Diego to Narita was virtually empty, I took an entire mid seat section in Economy , folded up the armrests and had a bed! The flight attendants were extremely attentive constantly there to serve, but of course they didn't have much else to do since there were probably 50 passengers! But even on full flights JAL always satisfies, I've been a frequent flyer with them for years. The Plane was a 787 Dreamliner and it was either brand new or had been kept to that level, plus avoiding Los Angeles (I live in San Diego), the flight only cost $1,080.00 TOTAL Roundtrip and was fast. I had large check on and carry on bags and was not charged anything extra. For an Economy flight this was truly hard to beat.

title: Extra 10bucks worth to spend
review_text:
他社同様に日本航空にはプレミアムエコノミーのサービスがあるが、国内線でのコストパフォーマンスは極めて高い。千円で得られるゆとりの空間、空席ありの場合は是非利用したい。
As the other airline company, JAL also has the premium economy class which also is available for most other domestic line. This class for domestic lines is absolutely affordable and I believe it's worth to spend. Spacious, comfortable and you may get early check in for upgraded customers. You may not want to miss when it's available.

title: Best Business Class ever!
review_text: The reasons why: very comfortable seats that easily converted to equally comfortable flat beds; remarkably large individual televisions with a good entertainment selection--including classical music (too often slighted) as well as informative and enjoyable programs on Japan; great food--comparable to that served in first rate restaurants on the islands; and excellent service on the part of the pleasant and helpful staff.  I so thoroughly enjoyed my JAL flights and was so well-rested that I was almost sorry to land. Perfect introduction to Japan, perfect ending.

title: Boston to Tokyo easily
review_text:
Flying internationally from Boston usually means a stop over somewhere, it is such a nice surprise to get a direct flight so I started out happy right there. 

The price was decent for business travel in premium economy. And with a premium economy ticket you get access to the lounge at the airport. 

The flight attendants were super nice, there was plenty of food and drinks and the entertainment was fine. 

It was also really easy to get in to Tokyo city (though I'd say do your research first so you know what you are looking for once you land)

title: JAPAN AIRLINES
review_text: Excellent service from all airline staff.  All very helpful and polite.  We needed wheelchair assistance and we were very impressed with the service and care provided.

title: Excellent airline
review_text: Relative to other airlines, their economy class was great. The seats are a bit more comfortable and spacious. All the ground staff and flight crew were unfailingly polite and helpful. The food was good by airline standards. The plane was properly maintained. And the price was really good. In fact, it was so much cheaper than the flights to Seattle, which was my actual destination, that it made sense to fly to Vancouver and take the train down. That was a delight in itself. I think I'll make a habit of flying this way. Oh, and since there was a long layover, they provided a free room in a decent hotel near the airport. Highly recommended.

title: Green tea
review_text:
What i like most is having japanese food and green tea in flight. 
I love JAL very much. Flying to japan with JAL is a pleasure

title: Fell in love with JAL!
review_text: Flew with JAL from Japan to Sri Lanka with a transit in Bangkok. This was my first time to take this airline and I was really impressed by their service, comfort and hospitality. The seats were so comfortable and had plenty of legroom. The in-flight staff was so friendly, helpful and offered some delicious food which I chose to have in Japanese style. Most amazing thing which I saw was they treated every passenger specially, as if they were personally known to them. As I've experienced by living in Japan, everything inside the flight was so clean and neat. I have only traveled in their Business Class for couple of times and the experience I had was top in it's class. I recommend JAL to anyone without a second thought and would love to travel with them again!

title: Japan Airlines is a Very Good Airline
review_text: Japan Airline is a very good to fly. There planes are up-to-date, although I wish they had more of there planes as three class cabins with a first class cabin. There food is excellent along with there service and care. I recommend them to fly.

title: Japanese Hospitality
review_text: The best service from check-in at the airport all through the way to my destination.  The Sakura Lounge was very good. The meal on board was well selected with good choices that you wished to have them all. Though the recently change in Japanese appetizers were a little disappointed.  Flight attendants were attentive and cared for all your needs.

title: Flew with JAL on QANTAS points, glad I did.
review_text:
Their service and comfort level really knocks spots of QANTAS their One World Partner with whom I flew the year before. 

This Boing 777 flight was a very comfortable and private suite in a 1-2-1 herring bone formation with fully flat beds. A French Champagne led wine-list with terrific food list to accompany was like a Tapas plate for lunch with 9 individual tastes, super service and wide 17" screen TV with wide choice of recent releases. A la carte menu on demand. 

Really a fine way to travel. On par with Etihad and Virgin Pacific.

Beware though, if you are transiting through Narita, even staying flight-side the Japanese security will confiscate your alcohol even if receipted and sealed in a duty free bag!

title: Great Staff and Flight
review_text: Before we even boarded the Hospitality lounge was great.  Then the plane, excellent service and smiling all the way.  The food was sensational, and they did not try to over provide.  We ordered as we went.  The hostess service is the best I have ever had on a plane.  Nothing was a problem and any concerns were quickly overcome.  Many thanks for a safe return to Australia.

title: Probably the best economy class out there
review_text:
We were lucky enough to try the new 787 Dreamliner and it's amazing. That on top of the awesome food and service, it's probably the best economy class out there. I've tried Delta, Korean, Philippine Airlines and none of them comes close.
Cabin Lighting - it does change like mood lighting. It's not bothersome at all.
Windows - it darkens when it's sunny and clear when it's dark. My comment as well as what I've heard from others is that it doesn't get dark enough that it's still bright. Sometimes hard to sleep.
Food - they filled up the tray and lots of food. FLight attendants going around with Ice cream, coffe and tea . Snacks every 2 hours or so.
Seat - the seat pitch, width and legroom is comparable to what Delta sells as Economy Plus.  I have nothing bad to say.

title: I was very impressed - we got an exit row seat on both of our long flight legs - very happy
review_text:
Received a very pleasant check in from a lovely young Japanese lady. Her manners and attitude were impeccable.
Flight and service was a little better than average. We also were seated in an Exit row which I really appreciated. They also made sure my wife and I were seated next to each other, even though we had booked seperately.

title: Understated elegance
review_text:
+ prompt and accommodating service
+ check-in was a breeze
+ gives off an aura of refinement or elegance

- limited english options in their in-flight entertainment

title: Very good flights
review_text:
We secured very good prices for our return Sydney/Paris flights but not having flown JAL for many years we were surprised how comfortable and up to date this airline is. We had lie-flat beds with good matresses, large pillows and very nice blankets.
The food was just amazing, we had the Japanese menu on the way over and the western menu on the return, included in the western menu were lobster tails, lots of choise and all dishes were delicious.
The staff were very attentive and the bathrooms were kept impeccably clean at all times.
The entertainment system had a reasonable offering of the latest movies but not as good as Emirates or Etihad.
This was one of the best flights we have had and we are happy to fly with JAL anytime.

title: Premium Flying With JAL
review_text:
I selected JAL for this trip firstly because it was the least expensive Premium Economy on offer at the time I was flying, and secondly because the 19-hour layover would give me a tiny taste of Japan, which I had not yet visited. My ultimate destination was London.

The Premium Economy cabin was quiet and the seats were just great--very comfortable--and there was plenty of room for me to stretch my legs out. One of the reasons I avoid travelling in Economy is that, at the age of 74, my knees are not what they were, and sitting with them flexed for hours is intolerable.

I believe the food was the same as Economy, but I had no complaints on that score. I liked the Japanese-style snacks that came with drinks--yummy soy beans, for example.

Service was impeccable from smiling flight attendants.

I can't comment about the entertainment because I was reading something engrossing. All I watched was the little aeroplane on the flight path display.

My overall impression of JAL was very favourable and I shall certainly consider flying with them again.

title: One hour flight to Hokuriku.
review_text: Though it was early morning flight, it was fully booked. Since the reservation was done at the Advance Purchase, the cost was less than 10,000 yen, even of J class seat. If the strip chedule has been determined, early purchase is desirable.

title: Friendly, polite  and food good
review_text:
I was traveling Cathay to Singapore, then JAL to Tokyo.
My bags went all the way through.
Food was a choice of Japanese or "other"  - I opted for Japanese and it was lovely, the majority of the JAL passengers were Japanese and the younger passengers opted for a change of food and went for the "other".
I have travelled JAL before and I love the friendly, polite staff.
I only had one hour changeover on the return flight, my bag and myself got onto the Cathay flight. Note: no dawdling - head straight for the next gate - it is a long walk, but you usually need a bit of exercise between longish flights.

title: One of the best Airways I have been on
review_text: One of the best Airways that I have been on. Flight Crew were fantastic. Aircraft was kept very clean. Meals served was really great. The seats had their own T.V. screen which was perfect.  Good selection of movies to watch and had video games on it.

title: Very Polite - good overall
review_text:
Pricing options led us to fly JAL on our recent trip to Vietnam - we flew through Narita to Hanoi and from Ho Chi Minh City, again through Narita, and back to Vancouver.  Check in was a breeze - staff exceptionally friendly / polite.  Lounge in Vancouver does not belong to JAL and it's pretty basic / crowded (Plaza Premium Lounge).  Seating in JAL business class on the 787-8 Dreamliner is 2-2-2 versus most other carriers at 1-2-1.  The extra two seats come at the expense of seat width.  Legroom is all you need. The seats flatten but when fully reclined are at a very slight downward angle toward feet.  Not a big deal, but not flat flat either.  
Service was very good although the food not close to other carrier's offerings. Again, ultra polite staff and very responsive.
The lounge in Narita was excellent - we had a two and a half hour layover which was plenty of time to grab a quick shower to wash off the airplane stink.
From Narita to Hanoi, we were on a 787-9 series which has these little compartments - true lay flat seats and you could exit from the window seat without climbing over the aisle seat - again the 2-2-2 seating made for tighter quarters but if you were a big person (in circumference), you might want to stick with an aisle seat.  JAL uses another private lounge in HCM City which was adequate / quiet.  Overall, we got great value and have booked them for two more upcoming trips to SE Asia in the next 6 months.

title: Significantly Improved
review_text: JAL have stepped up their service a notch on flights from Sydney to Narita. The food service is superior to Qantas by quite a margin and the staff are always friendly and courteous. The flight leaves around 8.15 AM so connecting flights from Melbourne can be an issue but JAL will provide overnight accommodation at Sydney airport free of charge. The flight arrives around 5.00 PM in Narita which is peak hour which can be an issue. if you are flying out on JAL within 24 hours they will also provide accommodation in Narita.

title: Comfortable flight
review_text:
We flew JAL in Business class between Tokyo/Narita and Bangkok.  Both flights were almost full but ground and onboard services were well organized and orderly.  The ground people handled crowds fairly well with courtesy.

JAL Lounge in Narita is comfortable.  The lounge in Bangkok was small and crowded.

title: Great Airline
review_text:
We travelled with Jal  because of a very competitive price. Generally, they are cheaper than competitors on that route. It used to be that it was cheaper because of lesser cabin fit out but now they have comfortable lie flat beds and a nicer fit out compared to Qantas.
The real clinchers for Jal are: service - nothing is too much trouble ever; cleanliness - my husband thinks they clean the toilets after every visitor - never water or litter in their toilets; and, food. The food is fabulous but mainly the Japanese food - my daughter was taking photos of the food all the time. The do regular meal times will hold food over for you or there's all flight snacks - an absolute must is the miso ramen!
Small niggle is that they want the cabin organised for landing a bit early which was a bit of a pest on the return overnight flight.
One thing you must do is wear lightweight clothing as they tend to run the air conditioning a bit on the warm side.

title: GREAT FRIENDLY SERVICE
review_text: As expected, the service on board is excellent!  Friendly, courteous service by the flight attendants, clean interior, comfortable accommodations to make a long flight enjoyable!!!  Definitely recommend!

title: Better than expected
review_text: I usually fly business class internationally, but this trip was with a group going to a martial arts seminar in Okinawa. I was impressed with the seating and the service.

title: Comfortable Bigger Seats
review_text: After decades of being in coach, JAL have been by far the best for me. Not packed in like sardines....So much more legroom and actual space, I could cross my legs now and then, and almost sleep...Real Coffee, Great Japanese inflight food, artisticly presented...in economy. I was with a little performance tour and had to present every day and travelling on JAL made it a lot easier. Professional, friendly, but most of all it was more spacious and relaxing. Definitely trying them again next time.

title: Non stop to Japan from California
review_text: This is a great way to travel to Asia from San Diego without having to go through Los Angeles. The type of aircraft used, a Boeing 787, is awesome!  Even though we were seated in economy, we felt like we had a lot of room because the airplane ceiling height is so high. We were served two meals. The flight was on time. Our luggage arrived safely. The movie selection and in seat flight entertainment was pretty good. The next time I go to Japan, I will definitely take this flight again.

title: Excellent
review_text:
Excellent service. Not absolutely certain about the Premium Economy seats. Loads of leg room is no good if you can't get comfy.
The staff were nearly as good as the food.

title: First time use of Premium Economy
review_text: Never having used this class of ticket, I was anxious to see if it were worth the extra charges. We make this trip every 12-16 months and have used many different airlines and have found JAL to be the best for our purposes - besides it gives us mileage with American Airlines. Having been fed up with the cramped conditions in economy, we decided to give the premium a try. The cost was a little less than double that of regular economy. I don't know how the other companies do it, but the extra seating space made what was a 13 hour torture session almost enjoyable. Besides that, the little extras in the snack and beverage departments were very good. As usual, the JAL flight crew was outstanding and extremely accommodating. Another advantage was that this ticket gains you entrance to the airport clubs normally used by first and business class passengers.I know this has been more about the ticket than the airline, but JAL really needs no superlatives from me.

title: Truly best in class service
review_text:
Truly the best service in the sky.  Great food, attentive service, and some of the best planes and seats out there.

I will do my best to always fly JAL when I visit Japan

title: I wish they flew everywhere!
review_text: JAL has amazing customer service, incredibly friendly staff, DELICIOUS FOOD and drinks, and a good movie selection. The planes are comfortable and the ride was smooth. They show you menus for food options and offer you amazing things liek kiwi juice and warm (or cold) green tea. When we missed a connection in Jakarta on our way home we had to re-book through American Airlines (they are partners and we booked through them). Despite not really being able to help, and despite the service desk being closed, they took us up to the command center and let us use the phone. Once we re-booked they even checked the records to make sure we had actual tickets. They were SO nice and I would fly JAL all the time if I could!

title: delightful experience
review_text:
The flight attendants were beautiful, charming, helpful,and a pleasure to be around.
I wish JAL flew to more destinations from LAX.
Flying home, we got to airport about 10 minutes before they opened and at 6am, all the ticket agents stood and bowed to all of us in line..The flight attendants did the same before we took off on each leg of the trip.
Food and drinks were fabulous...too much of everything.
seats and entertainment were perfect.

title: So good!
review_text:
This flight from Sydney to Narita was absolutely seamless.  After enjoying a delicious breakfast at the Qantas First Class lounge, boarding was a breeze. The JAL Suite (Seat 2K) was roomy, with lots of storage space and a huge viewing screen.  There are two menu choices: Western or Japanese.  I chose the Japanese, which was largely sea food, some which was a bit dry/over cooked, However the Salon Champagne and Sake were top notch. Would also recommend trying Queen of the Blue tea, a rare treat. The English movie selection was very limited, just enough for a 9 hour flight.  However the view out the window of the Great Barrier Reef and other islands made up for this. 

The highlight of the trip was the lovely flight attendants - they were attentive and friendly but never too intrusive.  Bravo JAL!

title: Absolute Best Flight Experience Everytime
review_text: Even prior to the economy seat upgrade, JAL always provided a good experience. The flight attendants are wonderful. Post seat improvements, the economy seats are as good as most other airlines' economy premium or business seats. The food, for an airlines, is good. An enjoyable, albeit long, flight.

title: Europe and Japan
review_text: Wow, if only the US airlines could learn this.  Very attentive cabin staff.  Entire plane was boarded very quickly and very organized.  No extra charges for any baggage, food was very good

title: Service great
review_text:
Service was great even in the economy
Flight attendants are walking around all the time making sure passengers are comfortable. Food was great. Drinks..also..wine is complimentary. Stop over was quick and Haneda airport has wifi.
I will fly  jAL going to Japan definitely!

title: Not impressed
review_text: Smaller seats - space kind cramped, but not as bad as V-----.  KA- was much better value.  I was just not impressed with JAL.  They were presented as a premier airline and they just are not.

title: Worth recommending
review_text: From check in to exiting, we had two great flights with JAL.  Plenty of check in desks (and they didn't care that one bag was a few kgs overweight).  On board the first thing we noticed is the seats seem to have more space in front than I have recently experienced.  The service is typical of that we found throughout Japan;  high quailty, efficient & very polite.  Meals were nice with Asian and western choices.  Personal in flight entertainment was excellent.  I'd have no hesitation in flying with JAL again.

title: Very nice but.....
review_text:
This airline would have been closer to the top of my list but....

THE FOOD IS NOT EVEN SUITABLE FOR A ZOMBIE ATTACK!!!

PROS:  The plane was nice, clean and well kept.  The attendants were pleasant, helpful and always had a smile.  The Premium Economy is well worth the extra money spent especially for a 23+ hour flight.  No complaints about comfort at all.  I was also very pleased that I was able to book a seat assignment at the time of purchase of my ticket unlike another Asian airline I took to Thailand.  No one wants to get stuck with a seat that doesn't suit their needs when traveling for nearly 40 hours in total.  That would be a complete nightmare!

CONS:  The food!  OMG.... the food! (face palm).  Let's just start with, that it was totally inedible.  It all looked and tasted like it was made of plastic and came out of a mold.  I'm also vegetarian but that doesn't stop me from picking pieces out here and there in between the food that I can't eat especially when I have no control over my environment.  THERE IS NO VEGETARIAN OPTION anywhere for you to choose from, either when booking the flight or while in flight.  It simply does not exist.  So people with ANY food restrictions are completely screwed.  You get what they have which is two meat options, and that is it.  If you are a Celiac, your screwed, diabetic, your screwed, vegetarian, your screwed.  I tried to eat the "fruit" cup but it had a weird taste, like rubbery gelatin plastic, so that wasn't an option either.  For the nearly 40 hours it took to get to Hanoi from Sand Diego.... all I ate was bread (and butter which I don't normally eat but I was starving!!!).  Why didn't I bring snacks you ask?  I did, and over 40 hours they went quickly.

My second complaint:  The in flight movie options are at least 3-5 years old.  That totally sucks on really really long flights.

Would I fly them again?  Probably, with hesitation.  I would look to find other available flights first and if I had no other choice, I would fly JAL again but bring with me a full backpack full of food items!

title: 16 Hr flight made comfortable by Japan Airlines
review_text: Very comfortable seating on Boeing 777-300ER, good legroom and good onboard entertainment system. The flight crew was very hospitable and we had our special meals as booked. On time departure and on time arrival. The flight was direct and long, but their food and refreshment breaks made it easier. Very satisfied with the overall service on board this flight and return flight as well.

title: Beijing to Tokyo
review_text: We had booked a cruise around Japan with Noble Caledonia so the best way to get there was via Beijing to Tokyo. We flew with JAL from Beijing to Tokyo return. What a service , the seats were large, food service outstanding and the best Sake I had ever tasted. Well done all at JAL for great service and culture.

title: Smooth and Courteous
review_text:
The flight itself was very smooth. The pilot was very descriptive when telling passengers about the flight. He explained what turbulence was, why we go the speed we do, etc etc. My partner is terrified of flying, and this helped sooth her a little bit. 

The flight attendants were extremely polite and caring, and considering it was such a large plane, it was very spacious. The entertainment was excellent, as there was a good selection of movies, music, shows and games. 

The windows of the plan have a dimming feature, so you can choose to have the window open without all the sunlight blinding you. That was great! 

The food was very good for plane food. They fed me so much. Almost too much but that's not a complaint ever!! Blankets, pillows and headphones were all provided. 

The flight itself didn't have much turbulence at all, and the landing was smooth. 

Highly recommended airline!

title: Loved the luxury!
review_text: I think we ended up in first class for the JFK to Tokyo leg, which was awesome!  We had individual cubbies with fully reclining beds, large flat screen TVs and lots of storage room.  Food was great - choice of Japanese or American and you could order anytime you wanted.  Service was outstanding.

title: a pleasant surprise
review_text: quite a nice flight. clean cabin, accomplished attendants. not as lavishly appointed as some others, and the bed did not fold totally flat.  good in flight service, good media, cabin was overall a bit minimalist as I expected. flights were timely, lounge was very nice. overall an A rating

title: One of my favorite airlines!
review_text:
The service was excellent for starters. It was a fairly large plane so I am assuming there weren't that many rows of seats in the economy section because there was so much space between each row. It's so out of the ordinary that an airline gives you that much space and being 6ft 3in I instantly took notice. I was seating towards the back of the plane since the upgrade was $300 bucks. Anyway, it was a welcomed surprised. The food was not too bad and the flight attendants were great. The return flight though was more like the usual "pack them like sardines" type. I am assuming the nice spacious flights are only going to Japan and not returning. Either way, the service was something that stood out, no complaints there! 

JAL check-in service sucks and lacks behind other major airlines. The portal is antiquated and it can be confusing even having all your information it's hard to maneuver around the site. The translation of the Japanese site to the English site is definitely the culprit. This part of the service definitely needs to improve ten fold. I had a transfer in Osaka on my return, but the first flight wasn't available to check in at the site and no further information on the flight was provided. I had to go to Terminal 3 at Narita and figure out which airline was handling the national flight for JAL as that information wasn't provided by JAL's portal.

title: Great Food and Great Service - Oh and spacious!
review_text: Just got off this flight 3 days ago.  So when I say spacious I mean that there is more space than other economy flights.  I read that where some airlines have 9 seats on this type of plane.  JAL only had 8 so that's where the extra room comes from.  It's not a dramatic difference but on a long flight you can tell.  The food is yummy.  It's a nice eclectic Japanese fair.  There is a lot of it too.  I counted 8 different items for one meal.  Their rice crackers are good too.  I really just can't say enough about how great JAL is.  This is my 2nd time to fly with them and both times have been great.

title: Nice Long Flight
review_text:
We had a nice experience on the flight from Paris to Tokyo even if it was a long flight (12 hours).
The seat were confortable and wide for the economy class. They provided some cushion and cover that we could use to sleep or be confortable overnight.
The food was very good with a Japanese style meal or european style. The stewardess came often with different drinks during all the fligth.
The Entertainement was good with a large variety of films in different langages.

title: Great way to travel back to the U.S. from Taipei and Osaka
review_text: Excellent experience in economy.  It was a Dreamliner plane and the flight was very comfortable--even though it was long haul in economy.  The food quality is excellent, and the customer service is wonderful  It was also more cost effective than comparable flights on Delta, China Airlines and Eva.

title: Top Notch Service
review_text: We flew from DFW to Toyko and onto Hanoi. JAL has the best service, from check-in to landing. It's obvious that customer service is of utmost concern. The business class flatbed seats are comfortable. I was disappointed, based on my other experiences in business class from various airlines, that we weren't offered a sleep suit, especially on a 13 hour flight, followed by a 3 hour layover and another 5 hour flight. Additionally, there is only one toilet per section of business class. That was at times inconvenient. Food selection was of high quality, yet offers limited selection. Overall, my experience on JAL was a positive one. I would definitely consider flying with them again.

title: Spacious Skies
review_text: The service was good, the food was fine but not memorable. The bathrooms were clean. The choice of movies was uninspiring. But the leg room was excellent even in plain old economy. I was amazed by how much space I had.

title: Comfortable Business Class Experience
review_text:
My wife and I booked this flight with American Airlines miles.  The first leg, Bangkok to Haneda Airport in Tokyo, was on a regional 777.  As such, the business class seat was not lie flat, although as a daytime flight, this wasn't critical.  The seat was comfortable and the food was quite good, as we both had the Japanese meal.  I should also note that business class passengers in Bangkok get to use a separate entrance into the immigration and security check, one that is much less hectic than that used by economy passengers.  It was a nice respite from the chaos that is Bangkok's departure area from mid-morning to mid-afternoon, when we have been in a line an hour long.  The entire process in the business class line was about 10 minutes.

Transit at Haneda was very simple, just an escalator up one floor and the gate was right there.  Our layover was about 7 hours (arrived around 5PM, well ahead of schedule and departed at just after midnight).  There was probably time for us to sneak into Tokyo for dinner, but as this was our first time at Haneda, we decided not to risk it.  We found a good sushi stand inside the airport (reviewed separately) and had a very nice meal there at not too high a price, given that it was in the airport.  The Sakura Lounge at Haneda was quite comfortable and had good WiFi service, so the time there went by quite quickly.

The flight from Haneda to SFO was on a 777-300ER, the elite bird of JAL.  Business class is set up in a 2-3-2 configuration.  However, the seats are very private.  My wife and I had two of the middle seats, with her seat being in the exact center and mine being on the aisle.  The seats were in the small mini-cabin directly behind first class, so there is only a single row there, meaning there was a lot of privacy.  My wife, who can be claustrophobic at times, had no such complaints, even in the middle seat.  The seats were fully lie flat and I would have to say were about the most comfortable seats I've ever been in.  I've only had one other business class experience and that was on EVA in a 1-2-1 configuration.  The seat there was nice, but this was great.  I'm 6'2" tall and had plenty of legroom.  I also had sufficient body room and didn't have to contort myself into any strange positions in order to lay flat.

It was about a nine hour flight and we both slept for at least six hours, a first for both of us.  I have read some complaints that JAL keeps their cabins too hot, but we didn't experience that.  We didn't need the blanket, but neither did we find it too warm.

Being a red-eye flight that left at midnight, there is only one formal meal and that's about two hours before landing in SFO.  We each selected the traditional Japanese breakfast and I found it very good.

The only demerit I can give JAL is the in-flight entertainment.  On both flights, it was pretty blah, with not very many selections.  But at least on the HAN-SFO leg of the flight, I didn't care because I slept so soundly.

We will be taking a repeat trip on JAL in December, when we return from Singapore to SFO (also on an AA business class award ticket).  The main difference will be that JAL has changed the schedule so instead of a midnight flight, we leave in the early evening.  Unfortunately, we had to change our flight going to Singapore to Cathay Pacific because the new flight times meant we would either arrive in Singapore very , very late, or that we would have to have an overnight at the airport, neither of which was palatable.

In summary, I'd highly recommend JAL, particularly for its transpacific flight.

title: Very pleasant flight attendents
review_text: Realy a pleasant flight. Very good service, smiling and helpful staff. The Food was typical Japanese and very good. More than enough Space (few People).

title: Wonderful Experience
review_text: I flew JAL non-stop from Tokyo Haneda to San Francisco. The service I received on the flight was fantastic! The flight attendants were consciousness, helpful, and kind. The seats were the perfect size and I actually was able to sleep. Normally, I can't sleep on flights. The entertainment was varied and seemed to offer something for everyone. In the future, I will definitely look to fly JAL again.

title: Great food, kind service, good selection of in-flight content
review_text:
My family tries to fly JAL whenever we can because we love how kind the onboard attendants are, and how helpful they can be everyone, but especially to families with very small children. 

We traveled with them when our youngest child was an infant, and again when he was a toddler, and on both instances we felt supported by the airline staff, both on the ground and in the air. We had the same experience when traveling years ago when our eldest was an infant and toddler as well. Too often you hear of stories where airline staff look at travelers with small kids as a source of potential discomfort during the flight. We did not get that vibe at all from JAL staff throughout any of our trips with them.

I love how they put effort into little touches to make a 14-hour flight comfortable for kids, such as allowing them to pick between a coloring pack or a small plastic model jetliner at the beginning of the flight, and having kid-specific meals on the menu, to kid-friendly content on their in-flight entertainment program (Street Fighter and cartoons always work).

The food on the JAL flights into Narita and from there to Manila is always good, especially for folks who travel on economy like we do. There's always a small salad, a protein and carb (typically Japanese themed), some miso soup (if so desired), some green tea or coffee, and some Haagen-Dazs ice cream for dessert. Our kids definitely enjoy the ice cream!

Needless to say, we're fans of JAL, both from a price perspective and an in-flight experience angle. We highly recommend them!

title: Amazing Flight from JFK
review_text: Our flight on Japan Airlines in May was simply amazing.  The round trip non-stop flight was included in our SmarTours Amazing Japan package.  We were concerned with a 14-hour flight, but the service was GR8, the food was very good, and we had plenty of movies for entertainment.  The 14 hours literally flew by.  We would definitely fly them again.

title: Nice journey
review_text: helpful and friendly cabin crew , foods and beverages well served with all sort of varieties. Crew members was helpful in helping to fill in immigration form.

title: Their website is a shame. The rest is average,
review_text: As BA Executive member (One World Sapphire) I booked this short flights from my miles. Unfortunately with the BA booking code one is unable to manage his flight on the JL website. I had to investigate to figure out the JL resevation code. Once I had it, I was shocked to realise that the two of us (in spite of both of us being Sapphire) were seated separately.  When I tried to change the seats it was impossibel. I have never seen such a bad and unfriendly website. Shame on Japan Airlines.   We were also unable to check.in online, so we had to go to teh airport early. At the airport we were checked in swiftly and got an invitation to the lounge. What shall I say, appart from the view, the lounge was so poor and the design was afwul. No food, and very limited selection of drinks. Well below the average of the other OneWorld airlines' lounges.   To my great surprise when we entered the plane, there were many seats empty even at the windows and I can npt understand why these seats were not shown on the websites?!!!  When I say plenty I mean at least 100 seats!!!!.  The flight was short and fine, nothing extra. The staff was nice, but not very friendly. Very average.

title: Customer Service is amazing
review_text: We had booked to fly from Kagoshima to the island of Yakushima for a couple of days and then from Yakushima on to Osaka.  Unfortunately our flight from Kagoshima was delayed due to weather which would require we overnight & catch a flight later the next day.  Technically we could have done this but one day on the island was not very appealing & we worried the bad weather could continue.  Our tickets were totally non refundable.  The agents at Japan Airlines in Kagoshima were amazing.  They agreed to refund our ticket to Yakushima in full, then rebook us to Osaka that evening at no additional cost.  And they called our hotel in Yakushima & our car rental to cancel. They turned a big disappointment into a very positive experience.  Thank you.

title: ALWAYS EXCELLENT F&B + HIGH LEVEL OF SERVICE
review_text: Have not use JAL for some time and it was a pleasure to be back. The planes are older  than say CX or SQ but food and in flight service is still excellent. In flight entertainment system is defective and programme can be better. Another unusal practice: plenty of empty seats on c class but check in counter put me next to someone! It was easy to arrange a seat without any passenger sitting next to me!

title: Comfortable seats! Great hosts
review_text: One of the best airlines ever. Good food, Great hosts, comfortable seats. I do recommend this airline to anyone.

title: Pleasant and just nice
review_text:
flew JAL for the first time after finding a decent price . So 1; JAL can offer reasonable fairs. 
I lousily tick wrong flight (my bad)  and end up with wrong timing. Help desk was appreciable and did their job :help. 
took a red eye flight; maybe the quietest for the last 2 years. 
well not much too say because all went smooth. 
i am just not fan of their coffee (served from transparent plastic container) and food can be slightly better - a little too much rations to open for me ( i do love japanese food but the dressing in a kawai plastic bag to rip was not a good idea, gentleman seating next to me can confirm... rip to his shirt)
try to preferably land / take off  in Haneda than Narita . it is more accessible and closer. 
overall, quite happy with all the smiley staff

title: Lovely airline flying to a lovely destination
review_text: Check-in was speedy and efficient. I liked the soothing dark brown decor of the business class cabin. I was offered the use of a JAL sweater for sleeping. They ran out of the Japanese bento box meal option,which was a disappointment. Lounge at Narita airport was very crowded. Had to go to three stores in the airport before I found my favorite white chocolate-covered potato chips.

title: Great airline!
review_text: Love this airline! Excellent service and excellent food. Very clean. Have flown JAL many times. The only thing you need to know is if you are flying from SFO to Bangkok you have to change planes and airports. We learned this the hard way two years ago when we had to get a bus and travel across Tokyo to the other airport in the wee hours of the morning after flying for hours! Did not have to change airports in the past. Lesson learned will not be using JAL again to get from SFO to Bangkok. That said I highly recommend this airline for other destinations.

title: One of the best!
review_text: Excellent company, service in the plane and outside in the airports were truly impeccable and courteous. A rarity these days. The planes were clean, and the toilets were regularly rearranged - in a 14 hours flight that really matters.

title: Great airline, helpful phone staff and comfortable trip
review_text:
After much problems dealing with Fair Depot on our flight changes, the lady at JAL was absolutely the best at fixing the proble. Very calm, courteous and went out of her way. Note: get your deal from those booking sites, then phone the airline directly. Most will match the price and you get better change and cancellation options and costs.
The JAL flight was comfortable, the food was okay. Prefer business class (who wouldn't) but for economy I would do it again. JAL also had 2 free baggage where other airlines was only one.

title: Great service and fantastic economy seats
review_text:
I've flown all over the world with many different airlines, including Air Madagascar, Air France, United, Cathay Pacific, Air Canada etc.. and I have to say that Japan Airlines has the best economy seats of all of them. The JAL economy seat is superior to many Premium Economy seats on other airlines. Plenty of leg room, I'm 5'10 and could still see my toes with my leg stretch straight. Service was great as always like many other asian airlines. Food and entertainment system was on par or better than other airlines. After flying with JAL economy, I have decided to continue to fly on economy in the future and put my savings elsewhere. If JAL can offer such great product, there's no reason for other airlines not to do so. I guess there's a reason why JAL economy is ranked in the top 5 on Skytrax. 

The only complaint I have is the onboard temperature. JAl likes to set it's a/c temperature slightly higher than other airlines, so I strongly suggest passengers to wear short sleeves on the flight. 

However, JAL has not updated all their planes with these wider economy seats, so make sure to verify when booking.

title: Good food, etc. but real difference between East (good) and West (not so good)
review_text:
The bigger the plane the better the story but that's pretty common.
Plane flights are not the most fun of experiences. 8, 10, 12 hours in the air are rather wearing. Being able to walk around a bit and/or stretch is nice.
On earlier ANA flights (and Qatar many years ago) they were kind enough to allow a few of us to quietly stand near the back looking out the rear window went a long way to relieving strain/pain.
Guess JAL does not believe it allowing that. However, what I noticed the most was the difference between how this was communicated by Japanese (I assume) crew and the crews that seemed to be manned by more western folk (like me). This difference carried throughout all interactions.
The difference in politeness was frightening, sobering, and (until I steeled myself to it on the return) aggravating.
Had forgotten all of this until I just got the notice that TripAdvisor was adding airlines. Happy to share this - they didn't seem to mind how they treated me and I am happy to return the favor. (Contrast this with my almost nauseating string of positivism for almost everything else I have ever reviewed. :-D )

title: Great Service & Comfort
review_text: We flew economy on a smaller jet to Tokyo.  It sat 2-3-2 across with good leg room (a surprise) so there wasn't that much inconvenience with having to move out for people in the center. Snacks were available throughout the flight, the meals were delicious (ginger pork or steamed fish, miso soup, ice cream), and the service impeccable. The flight was smooth with slight turbulence as expected. A great way to start our 17-day trip in Japan!!! We've always loved JAL!!!

title: Love Premium Economy
review_text:
So much better than the European alternatives. 
Over the last 27 years I've tried almost every imaginable airline to take me the 6,000 miles from the UK to Japan, some were good (the now defunct Virgin Upper Class) some were grim (KLM). Some airports are fine (Birmingham) some just awful (Heathrow) and some just too far from anywhere (Narita). 
So, I think the best compromise is JAL from T3  (yuck) to Haneda (yeah!). The new JAL economy seats are ok, the service is fine and the food is mixed (their UK based caterers are poor and their Japan based caters very good) so you might want to take some sardines with you for the outbound flight.
However, for a fee you can upgrade to Premium Economy and get some extra legroom, extra elbow room, and access to a Washlet (toilet with a bidet). The PE area seemed quieter than back in Economy so you've got more of a chance of a pill-free sleep AND at Haneda you can escape from the masses by using their Premium Economy checkin queue and retreat to their Sakura lounge - which was OK (not Great... just OK but it did have those fancy Washlets)

title: Economy seats very uncomfortable
review_text:
I had read good reviews of this airline and booked our round trip flight to Tokyo. 
I am so sorry that I did not upgrade. The seats were terribly uncomfortable and hard as rocks. There were three of us traveling and each of us was in pain when we reached our destination. 

The service was good and the meals were somewhat better than domestic International flights. Having a USB port at each seat was also helpful for a long flight.

title: Best airline service so far!
review_text: Positively surprised of the professionalism and service of JAL. On the way to Japan we took a finnair flight to Fukuoka and had a stopover there. Due to the amount of people lining up for passport check in Fukuoka, we missed our connecting flight to Tokyo. We contacted the JAL staff at the airport and they quickly got us new tickets and sent us a away only one hour after the flight we were supposed to take! On the way back we took JAL again, but due to mechanical issues the departure was delayed for over an hour. We were to miss our connecting flight from Paris to Helsinki and the flight attendant apologized profusely whilst explaining this. She told us to contact the JAL ground staff in Paris about this which we did. The staff in Paris was very helpful and arranged everything for us. We didn't have to be worried at all and felt well taken care off.

title: Unbelievably good
review_text: We were treated like royalty. The courtesy shown to us was unbelievable from all JAL staff both here and in Japan. We had to change airports to continue on to Hokkaido a first for us but it went so smoothly totally due to the staff and their helpfulness. Would only ever fly with them again to Japan.

title: One of my favourite airlines from now on
review_text:
The inflight meal was the best among all the carriers that serve the route. They had japanese style cold noodles, haagen daz and even miso soup for economy class passengers. I was so impressed. 
The seat was a bit old and tight but it was ok for a 4 hours flight. There was inflight personal TV.
Service was excellent and the cabin staff regularly checked on the passengers to see if they have any needs. They always service with great smile and attitude

title: fabulous 1st class
review_text: One of the best flights I have ever experienced. Check in was speedy, the lounge was great, the crew were amazing and overall the flight was as good as any I have ever had.

title: JAL Made Me So Happy And Satisfied
review_text:
A flew with JAL code-sharing. From Budapest to London it was British Airways, from London to Tokyo it was Japanese Airlines. It was the third flight in my life and first with Japanese Airlines. I and my girlfriend already had experience with British Airways, Alitalia, Lufthansa, KLM and Airfrance. JAL is so far the best ever.

The legroom is big enough, the chairs are also big too. I'm not a small men, (180 cm 90 kg) so it was a miracle to have enough place. I've never felt it before.

The cabin attendants were extremly kind and they were smiling all the time. Whatever i asked they answered kindly not like at the other air companies above. 

The plane was really clean and the service was amazing. This is what I was expecting from a Japanese company. Even the foreign cabin attendants treated us and and worked like the Japanese staff. 

The food was brilliant. The amount was enough, we got several meals (like in Japan) and everything was high quality and unbeleivable tasty. We could choose western and Japanese style meal. Both we asked for Japanese style. It was the tastiest meal what i have ever eaten on board. The dessert was also amazing. We got Häagen-Dazs icecream twice and Japanese puding, jelly, seasonal fruits and sweets.

Other good points:

- Variation of drinks and snacks (Western and Japanese snacks (2-3X times more kinds than in the other air companies, Umeshu (japanese „plum” wine), many kinds of tea (true green tea, barley tea etc..)
- Fast checkin
- Free foreign magazines and books in the lobby
- No delay (even 1 minute)
- Very interesting games and films (even brend new films)
- High tech remote controller
- Price: In my opinion JAL beats all of the european air companies easily. The only air company which is close to JAL is Lufthansa, but if you buy a ticket in a good time, it can as cheap as Alitalia or Finnair.

title: So much nicer
review_text:
Once again we see the difference between US and international - especially Asian - airlines.  For my trip, I flew outbound with American but returned on JAL, a OneWorld partner airline.

The AA seat wasn't even a full lie flat for a flight all the way from Chicago to Tokyo.  The JAL was completely lie flat and included an ergonomic mattress in the overhead bin that you could use at your discretion.  It also included a special ergonomic pillow.  The AA seat included a low def seat back screen, perhaps 10 inches in size.  The JAL included a 22 or 23 inch (I don't remember which) high def screen at each seat.  The food options were better and could be ordered at any time during the flight via a small touch screen remote at your seat.

There's all kinds of little differences.  It's the attention to detail that makes you realize how much better other airlines are.

title: Wonderful wider economy sheet
review_text: We took a flight to Heathrow to Narita via Helsinki (transit). We compared two type of carrier, i.e., JL414 (from Helsinki to Narita) has wider sheet (Boeing 787) with two row at the economy class, while BA has a normal sheet with three row at the economy. JL has a electric power plug (100-110 V). It was very convenient for me to go to a bathroom.

title: A completely Japanese experience
review_text: Once again the JAL website showed itself to be the only weak spot in an otherwise outstanding operation.  Even the cross keys concierge at the Mandarin Oriental could not check my husband in and print his boarding pass although she did so for me without any problem.  So we arrived at the airport a little bit early.  The counter clerk was able to check my husband in efficiently.  Another employee actually escorted us to the First Class lounge although it wasn't hard to find and we don't need any assistance.  The lounge itself has both a sushi bar and a saki bar, two of my favorite things.  On multiple trips to each I realized I was the only woman in the lounge who was not a JAL employee.  That changed slightly as our flight time neared, but clearly most JAL first class passengers are male.  Our flight left a little bit late, but made up the time before arrival.  First class was so comfortable, but then so was the business class we flew going over.  In fact, had I known how good the business class was, I would have saved some FFM's and flown business class back.  I have a new favorite airline!  (I'm not rating the in-flight entertainment because I read my Kindle, ate their wonderful food and slept for hours.)

title: The best way to go to Japan
review_text: Don't let JAL's difficult website prevent you from flying this great airline.  We chose JAL because we are in the One World Alliance and our primary carrier American does not have a non-stop flight to Osaka, where our tour was starting.  JAL knew several hours before that our flight would be delayed because of a problem on the incoming flight.  They sent us two emails and phoned us to let us know so that we could avoid arriving at the airport too early.  The flight itself was lovely.  Although the business class seats were not marketed as flatbed, with a little fiddling with the controls I was able to make the seat into a flatbed.  That and the quiet atmosphere along with what I assume is a good air circulation system allowed me to get several hours of sleep, something I find difficult to do on most flights.  The food was very tasty with choices of western or Japanese for all meals.  I hope to travel to Japan again and if I do, I hope I can fly JAL.

title: My Favorite Airline
review_text: I fly often overseas from the U.S.  I've come to love Japan Airlines for their level of service and attention to detail. The flight attendance are always nice and polite and you'll always feel special on their planes. The economy seats have more room than any other airline I've flown and the bathroom are well maintained throughout the flights as well.I will always fly on this airline when possible.

title: Great Flight and Service
review_text: Fabulous and courteous service, newly maintained 787 aircraft, comfortable sky-suite with large monitors, and very good food and wine, is what make JAL a great airline.

title: Cabin Service
review_text: Truly exceptional cabin crew service and attention to detail. Flew United Airlines the other direction- awful by comparison.

title: Outstanding Service
review_text: I was worried about traveling overseas with a 3-year-old, but the staff on JAL were fantastic on all legs of our trip. They went out of their way to make our ride pleasant, such as holding meals until after my son woke from his nap and bringing fresh milk without my asking. They were always ready with a smile, making it a fun experience for both of us. On the return flight, I asked a question at the check-in counter about my ticket for a different leg, and they not only answered it, but later two different supervisors followed up to make sure that there were no problems. I certainly would recommend JAL!

title: Great attentiveness
review_text: I sometimes use JAL between Japan and BKK or vice versa. Normally they are night flights and I find it always strange that there is no dinner served but only a breakfast. They have a choice between Japanese and Western breakfast but to be honest, there is not much of a difference. They use a B787 for this leg which is super. The staff is overly attentive and friendly and keeps on bowing in the Japanese way, even if they are Thais. They are all you can wish for but if you are not Japanese or not accustomed to their culture, you might find the experience somewhat strange. Still prefer JAL over the TG flight on the same route though TG uses an A380

title: Outstanding service
review_text: Following considerable research we settled on flying JAL for our return flight from Frankfurt. We had flown on other airlines on the outward journey, so were amazed at the quality of comfort and service on the JAL flights compared to the business class of the other airlines.

title: This is one of my favourite two airlines
review_text: We often fly Japan Airlines on our way to and from Europe.  This flight was as good as always.  The staff are wonderful, the food is excellent and the business class seats are very good.  And one of the best aspects is that we can stop over in fabulous and safe Japan both going over and coming back.

title: ordinary
review_text: Quite frankly, I was disappointed in this airline. I have flown many Asian carriers including a few Japanese. I found the service to be on par with American standards but not up to the Japanese standard that I have grown accustomed to. On the trip to Bangkok from Haneda we flew a newer 777 that was a nice aircraft with good leg space and new entertainment screens. On the return trip we flew an older 777 that was very cramp with small and barely visible small video screens. While the attendants are nice and always have a smile they don't provide the service that I've experienced or the feeling of being "wowed" as I do on the other Japanese carriers. Food quality was poor but beverage service was often.

title: Nice flight
review_text:
JAL is such a brilliant airline with great service and high quality meals ! 

It was quite memorable because the flight delayed for more than 2 hours and we were stuck on the plan with no air-con due to heavy snow. 

I was very impressed with one of the FA. She was very patient to take care with the passenger who sit next to me. He was very ill and he found difficult to breath. She was very kind to keep an eye on this passenger for the whole journey. 

However, the planes JAL uses for Hong Kong route are quite old especially the entertaining facilities and the seats.

title: Exactly what you want from a Business Class flight
review_text:
Exactly what you want from a Business Class trip: a great lounge, good food, good liquor, a comfortable bed, Wi-Fi, and a bit of entertainment, all politely and professionally executed.

We love the 787 due to its higher cabin pressure and humidity. The new lie-flat seat is a huge improvement over the original angle-flat seats JAL installed on these planes. Everyone has their own little cubicle and their own direct aisle access. There's a sliding partition between the seats that you can lower if you'd like to chat with your neighbor. 

The food looks a bit like an ekiben train station bento when it comes out, but it's several notches tastier. I appreciated that you could eat more quickly than if they'd brought all of those little things out one at a time. Everything was delicious and served with care.

The video system was great, it has a smartphone-like remote control that was easy to use. There was more than enough programming to keep us both busy for the duration of the flight. They also have in-flight Wi-Fi provided by T-mobile: $18.80 for the whole flight, $14.40 for 3 hours, or $10.15 for one hour.

They have turn-down service with mattress pads and duvets. They don't offer full pajamas, unfortunately, just a cardigan top. Love the self-serve bar and the midnight snack menu.

Would happily take this flight again!

title: Great Experience
review_text:
We were pleasantly surprised by flying JAL on an AA codeshare flight from Kuala Lumpur back to USA.  The staff was extremely friendly and attentive.  I have to stress again how happy we were with the staff, they genuinely appeared to enjoy their job and were in great spirits.  This was a 7 hour flight so there were 2 meals and a snack served.  The food was still airplane food, so not that great, but it was far better than any other we've experienced.  The breakfast was extremely edible featuring yogurt, fruit, and an omelette.
