I can't recall the other meal but it was edible too.  The snack was raw smoked salmon on croissant (gross!) but I got some rice crackers instead.  There was a blanket and pillow (standard on long flights) but they were much nicer than other airlines, with a decent pillow case and a thick, big blanket (I took mine home for my next AA flight!).  I had a couple of beers (no charge, nice!) as well.  All in all it was a great flight, the airplane was very clean and the in-flight entertainment had a great variety.  Screens were big.  Also to note, the pitch and seat size are bigger than those junk AA flights!

Boarding was great as well, unlike other airlines, JAL boards from the rear of the plane, making it much easier to get in and there aren't people constantly walking over you to get to their seats.

title: Excellent in-flight service but ...
review_text:
The in-flight experience was simply excellent.  From the time I walked into the cabin until I deplaned, the flight attendants were very courteous, friendly, and attentive.  The seat pods were spacious and very comfortable.  The beverage and meal selections were also very meticulously prepared.  It's as if I was dining in a Michelin starred restaurant.

The only down side to my trip was the customer service on the ground.  I had a flight cancellation due to weather (massive snow storm in New York City, my original destination).  Per the rules, they don't have to re-accommodate me on another airline.  ANA's flight to JFK was not cancelled and had availability in first class but JAL refused to put me on that flight (which is well within the rules).  JAL's next flight with availability was 3 days later.  They offered to fly me to LAX and then asked that I work with American Airlines once I get to LAX for an onward flight to JFK.  When I got to LAX, American Airlines informed me that JAL has not endorsed my ticket over to them.  When I went back to JAL to explain this, they informed that they have.  Seeing that the fully-booked JFK flight was leaving soon, I opted to purchase the ticket instead of waiting on JAL and American Airlines to figure out the error.

JAL was well within their rights to follow the rules.  However, this is what sets apart the very good carriers from the excellent ones.  I've had similar situations with Singapore Airlines and Cathay Pacific and they have yet to "follow the rules" during those situations.  They understood readily that they want to make things right if it was at all possible.

title: Everythings great
review_text: We had very pleasant flight with JAL. Seating was very spacious even in economy. The new Sky Suite -interior works perfectly. Staff was very helpful and friendly especially when my son got stomach problems. IFE (In-Flight Entertainment) had big selection of latest movies. Food was one of the best I've ever eaten in flights. Small minus is the seat. It was bit hard and the actual seat very short. So for guys sized as me (180cm) my legs got numb because I didn't had decent leg support from the seat. Other negative thing was pricing of the onboard WIFI. With those prices (18,80$/person) only person using the WIFI is the guy whom employer pays it. But all in all, I can recommend flying with JAL.

title: best value
review_text: When flying with Japanese carriers you can be assured of polite and good service, at least in most cases. This time JAL has proven as a very good value to me. With advance purchase you get low fare, not much more then LCC, with two pieces of luggage! (yes two pieces), lots of legroom space, good audio and video selection, but captain and staff kept talking so much for so long that almost half of the flight we were not able to listen or view anything. Still best value for money to me.

title: Uneventful flight with great food and service
review_text: Great food (a bit behind the best of what Singapore Airlines offers, but still delicious and better than the vast majority of international flights).  Great service (stewardesses were very friendly and proactive).  For negatives, for me personally, I enjoy anime greatly and I don't think I am alone in that I would like the inflight entertainment system to have multiple anime options, but this flight did not offer anime at all.  I do have anime on my laptop so I watched it there instead, so not a big issue but would be nice for this not to be necessary.

title: Luxury at it's Best
review_text:
Your comfort is their utmost concern.
Given that in business class, I have flown with JAL using Economy and I can compare that service is top notch.
I can never get enough of the Japanese food served onboard.

title: Everything you want in a flight
review_text:
Have flown cattle class with JAL a few times and have always been impressed by the quality of service and cleanliness of the aircraft.

Was nice to fly business class and they really do look after you.  Checkin was easy and the lounge was a really nice place to sit

Oh, and putting us up in a transit hotel was no fuss and well-organised

title: One of the best
review_text: Cabin crew service is the best and food is so tasty. Seat is comfortable and clean. Lot of variety on entertainment selection, you will never get bored. Comparing AA with JAL is like a motel vs a 5 star hotel. I can't find anything to complain about.

title: Great service Japanese quality standards
review_text:
Cabin crew speak Cantonese, Japanese and English. Food it's aways tasty even in economy class. I flight once a month and I am always amazed by the service quality. 
Schedule is always on time and staff are very helpful. If you are traveling with kids cabin crew always make sure you assist inland or on air.

title: Awesome Service
review_text:
What a great airline!
Of 50 years of air travel, I would rate JAL amount the top.
The services were great, from ground staff to the flight crew.
You can tell from their body language that they're genuinely happy to serve.
The 4 of us occupied 2 rows of 3 seats on both trips.
I felt there was more leg room than the other airline.
One thing that impressed me most was the cleanliness of the toilets, at the end of the flight (after 9 hrs) they remained spotless.
Each passenger was allowed 2 x 20 kg of luggage.
However you have to pay for wi-fi.
Highly recommended!!!!!!

title: Best Economy class by far!
review_text:
They are (at the time of my flight) the only one to fly the B787-8 with 2-4-2 layout abreast in economy, as it was designed initially by Boeing, while today all airlines have configured it 3-3-3.
Bravo JAL for that!
The service is a bit cold but impeccable.
I would pay extra to fly with their 787 without hesitation.

title: Good sevice
review_text: Excellent flight! Awesome cabin crew and nice food. Seats are comfortable (as far as airline seats go) and there was lots of overhead storage room. love to travel again

title: Always welcoming when you fly with JAL
review_text:
When I fly back to Japan, I fly with the carrier that I know that I can trust, and the trust that I have that I get a quality service on board. the service offered is based on the concept of "OMOTENASHI" a very inportant cultural concept in Japanese society to lookafter visitors and eachother.

Both cabin crew and ground staff for JAL always make sure you feel welcome when you fly with them.

title: They get it right ALWAYS
review_text:
From the check-in counter, to the boarding, to the welcome aboard, to the food and service.
By far the best ON TIME AIRLINE in the world.

title: As good as other Asían airlines
review_text: The Honolulu service is considered mainly for leisure so JL does not offer their best on its Hawaii services (and there is no amenity bag but lots of stuff given, including a lovely pair of slippers and a shoe horn). Yet the service, the food and the whole experience was very very good, as good as my experience on SQ. The aircraft was spotless. The flight attendans were excellent. The wine was good. As a comparison, I took BA from London to Boston couple of weeks beforehand and would rate the service much lower than what I received from JL. And am a Gold Card for life with BA. Only negative issue is their entertainment system which is not that good.

title: Great service; Inconsistent experience; Sky Wider makes big difference
review_text:
Four experiences on JAL. Service is consistently outstanding but the overall experience varies considerably:

777 w/ Sky Wider. Excellent.  
34 inches of pitch, 18.5+ seat width and a 2-4-2 configuration make this one of the best economy seating/cabin experiences out there. Clean refurbished interior. The small seatback cubbin is perfect for charging an iphone, the USB port being right below it. 

Seat cushion gets uncomfortably hard after 3-4 hours, however (remember, some of these flights are 12 hours+).

Nice, clear large seatback video monitor. AVOD maps function was useful but movie/game/info choices are monotonous and poor quality.

It is especially pleasant that these seats have very limited recline- there is little noticeable intrusion into one's personal space from a surprise recline by the person sitting in front.

Plenty of overhead bin space in this aircraft, too.

Service was outstanding- 2 hot towel services, 2 full meals, another snack meal and at least 3 beverage services on the way over was plenty from a service standpoint.  Flight crew professional, courteous and responsive. Peculiarly, the captain does little communicating with passengers, compared to American carriers, at least.

Meal quality was okay-to-good on two occasions, almost tasteless on the third. Snacks are bland, insubstantial, and probably will upset your stomach over a long haul flight.

767 NON Sky Wider. Good.

The 2-3-2 seat configuration on this aircraft makes for a comfortable cabin feeling.

Seats have just enough pitch for comfort (33"?) but are made uncomfortable when the person in front reclines. The recline is such it restricts access to your tray table and makes it very difficult to get up and go the lavatory.

AVOD okay overall, but not great in terms of quality options, screen clarity or ease-of-navigation. 

Annoying power box restricts leg comfort, at least in the window seats.

Service outstanding again and one meal service plus two beverage services is plenty for a four hour flight.

But the food was pretty much tasteless, or tasteless with vinegar added. Snacks not very tasty and will probably upset your stomach.

787 NON SKY Wider. Okay.

The "Dreamliner" has larger windows and a window tint adjustment that is helpful. The latter takes some getting used to as the controls are on a delayed response and operate somewhat counter-intuitively. I wonder if the control function will eventually break or fall into disuse.

The circulated cabin air does seem to be fresher in the 787, and the lavatories are larger and more pleasant than typical.

The seat pitch is not quite enough. With deep seat reclines by the person in front, it  will knock food off your tray table when the person suddenly reclines in front of you. AVOD screen quality okay, movie, game, info selections seemed of low quality or canned though.

Food okay, but not really tasty. Snacks dry and salty, will probably upset your stomach.

Cabin was clean but I noticed seat upholstery coming apart on the seat in front of me.

787 SKY Wider. Good.

Comfortable 2-4-2 cabin seat configuration.

Dreamliner advantages of bigger windows, fresher air, nicer lavatories.

Adequate seat pitch of 33 inches, and adequate seat width but annoying intrusion by seat recline in this aircraft. Seat cushion is inadequate, and slightly less good than in 777 SKY wider. In this aircraft, it becomes uncomfortable in 2-3 hours (so bring your own pillow).

Also the seat placement posts in this version of Sky Wider do not maximize leg room as does the 777 version. In this version, the seat post to the floor does not allow you to comfortably stretch out your legs on both sides of the seat post as does the 777.

AVOD okay but map function on this version difficult to navigate and use. Great screen image quality, but again, seems like low quality choices of video.

One tasty meal, one bland tasteless meal, poor quality and insubstantial snacks. Again, likely to upset your stomach on a long haul flight of sitting.

Service outstanding as always.

SUMMARY

The 777 Sky Wider is the design that needs to be copied to the other versions- very limited seat recline preserves the personal space of the passenger and allows him to get out to go to the lavatory without incident. Maximized leg room by careful placement of the seat anchor posts and elimination of power boxes makes the seating experience comfortable on a long haul flight.

As is, upgrade the snacks and beverages and restrict seat recline to 2 inches on all versions and the overall score, a composite of four flights, moves from 3.5 to 4 stars. Pure mango juice would be a great option on routes like these, add chocolate varieties of ice cream rather than only simple vanilla, etc.

Apply the 777 version of Sky Wider to maximize legroom and it goes to 4.5 stars.

Add a comfortable seat cushion for a long haul flight, and Japan Airlines is 5 stars, even without consistently good meals.

title: Mediocre customer service for Japanese standard
review_text:
The review includes my experience in booking their tickets.
I made a mistake when I bought their tickets in January 2016.
Hence, I decided to search for their local number only to realise they have a number meant for all English and Mandarin speakers, and it is not a local number.
Called in and asked for help.
The customer representative was help and offered to assist in making the amendment after I have sent in a copy of my passport.
I promptly did it but there was no news for a working day.
Called them subsequently and mistake was remedied. This was not the standard for a Japanese company.
The flight from Singapore to Tokyo was great with good entertainment system.
The flight from Tokyo to Singapore showed dated entertainment system and seat.
Overall, a decent flight. But I prefer ANA, having tried it in 2015.

title: On time and good service
review_text: The flight was on time, services were good, stewardess were helpful, and I got basinette seat for my baby. Need more improvement on food and the entertainment.

title: Great Service, good accommodations, but inflight entertainment can be improved
review_text:
1. Telephone Service:  I waited 15 to 20 minutes before speaking to anyone.  I have food allergies.  I read the menus online before leaving and realized that I was allergic to almost everything.  I spent about 30 minutes on the phone with an agent.  He was able to recommend a Hindu Vegetarian meal as my best alternative.  Although I am in no way Vegetarian, it ended up being one of the best meals that I have ever had on a flight. I also explained that I had a foot injury that made long flights difficult.  I was placed in a bulk head seat.  I could not have been happier as I was able to get up, stretch, and even use a Tens machine during my flight. This was a 45 minutes well spent with a calm, professional agent.

2. Boarding Agents: Our flight from Toronto to Chicago was about an hour and 15 minuted delayed.  I had a two hour connection.  I hustled over the JAL counter at my gate.  The boarding agent was welcoming, friendly and did her best to calm everyone on my flight that had sped walked.  She ensured that I had the seat that I had requested, actually gave me a better seat, and even checked to make sure that my  luggage made it onto the JAL flight.  She told me exactly how much time I had before boarding.  Before boarding, I was assured that my luggage had made the flight.

I will say that in Japan, at NRT, they were very strict on the weight limit. I was about a kilo over and had to repack. I thought that was a bit harsh. After repacking stuff into my carry-on, I was then somehow 2 kilos over with my carry-on, which they actually weighed.  I complained that this was unreasonable (it took up about 45 minutes of my time), and they let it go.I think it is because I made the boarding agent lift my suitcase...it was almost her height, and I thought that she was going to tip over.

3. Flight Attendants:  I have never seen flight attendants that keep the same level of professionalism, attention to detail, and courtesy throughout an entire flight.  They never looked jaded and looked genuinely happy to be working in their jobs.  I loved the safety presentation - it was graceful and introduced me to the bowing culture. Every flight attendant made it a point to say goodbye to everyone as they were leaving deplaining.  As my foot condition was listed in the Passenger Information List, they checked on me almost every two hours to make sure that I was OK and did not require help.  They were also very efficient in terms of getting drinks or snacks to you.  A wait of no more than 3 minutes tops.  I was incredibly impressed with the calmness they demonstrated with my grumpy elderly neighbour that did not want to stow her bags in the overhead compartment.  They managed to calm her down without grabbing her bags or raising their voices.

4. Seats - the seats in economy are ergonomic.  There is a great neck pillow/lumbar support pillow that supports your neck and back very well.  I sat at the bulkhead, so I cannot comment on the spacing in a normal seat.  But, the bulkhead is fabulous and on my flight, no one bothered to walk across in front of our row.

5. Food - If you have any sort of allergy to seafood or fish. make sure that you order a special meal.  On the way down, I had the Hindu vegetarian meal.  It actually did not taste like plain food and was completely satisfying.  The only thing that was not is the fact that I was not allowed to have a Haggen Dazs ice cream because I ordered a non-dairy meal.  I tried to explain that I was not Hindu and was not allergic to dairy, but that was lost in translation.  

On the way back, from Tokyo-Narita to Boston, I did not order a special meal as "Hamburg steak" was listed as the meal.  Hamburg steak is actually not beef, but a chicken patty, sort of, with pieces of seafood in it served with rice that also has seafood in it.  Luckily, I ate in Narita 2 hours before boarding as I could not eat any  of that meal (even the salad had bonito flakes and shrimp I think).  The snack was a beef noodle box, which only had a packet of seafood something to add if desired.  My other gripe is that the sake brand on JAL is awful and the coffee is borderline non-consumable.  Stick to the green tea or juice on JAL.

6. In-flight entertainment:  This was the only thing that was not good.  The English movies are limited.  On the way down, the movies were from 4-5 years ago.  The music was also fairly dated.  On the way back from NRT to Boston, there was a much better selection of recent movies and slightly better music.  I found that strange as the plane from O'Hare to NRT was actually newer.  The system is not that intuitive to use.  It took me about 15 minutes to get to English movies.  I pressed a whole bunch of buttons and eventually found it. If you have a DVD or Ipad (and any sort of Ipod or Walkman), I recommend bringing it for JAL flights.

Baggage Claim - this was also surprisingly efficient.  I don't recall waiting more than 10 minutes.

7. Connecting Flights - I connected from NRT to a ITM (Osaka). The boarding agents realized that I could make the early flight, advised me of this, and bumped me up.  So, instead of having to endure a 4 hour layover, I was out of Tokyo an hour later.  The plane from Tokyo to Osaka-ITM was an old school Boeing plane out of the 80s.  If was clean, but definitely looked shabby.  Drinks were served as was some wonderfully delicious candy on the way out. I was so tired that I did not observe anything else on that flight.

8. Check-In and JAL points - You can check in 2 to 3 days before your flight.  If you sign up for a JAL points card, the check in is a lot faster.

title: I love this airline
review_text: The configuration of business class is great. Very much like a first class seat. The food is very good and the service is right up there with Korean Airlines for politeness. The First Class Lounge at Narita is also very good. They have a fresh sushi bar. The only limitation is if you are not Japanese and you travel the airline a lot you'll run out of decent entertainment on the flight. Highly recommended.

title: Sky-Suite is a winner!
review_text:
We'd been to Europe twice before with other carriers, flying Economy Class. This time we decided to use JAL Business Class, and we are so pleased that we did so! The "Sky-Suite" cubicle-style seats, used on the 777-300's on the Sydney-Tokyo route, and on the 787-8's and 787-9's on the Tokyo-Paris/Frankfurt routes give you comfort you might expect of 1st class in many airlines. 
The ability to fully recline the seat into a completely flat bed, with a comfortable mattress, pillow and blanket, in the semi-privacy of a cubicle means that you can get a really good sleep and arrive feeling refreshed. On our return from our final destination, London, we did the entire trip to Sydney via Frankfurt and Tokyo with no stopovers, except for the few hours between flights, and yet we were still in reasonably good "shape" when we finally stepped off the plane. You couldn't do that with economy class! The "Sky-Suite" is a great concept, with its 24" TV monitor and numerous storage compartments and large stowable table. 
My wife, who normally hates flying because of the cramped conditions and inability to sleep, was full of praise for JAL's Business Class and said she would be very happy to fly to internationally with them again. 
We loved the food too! When does anyone say that about an airline? The meals we ate aboard were of wonderful quality and imagination. We generally ordered the Japanese choices and were treated to imaginative cuisine better than you would eat in most Japanese restaurants. Food service was sensibly timed too. A large and leisurely main meal about 1 hour after take-off, then you could order a wide range of other foods during the flight on a casual basis. 
The Cabin staff were just wonderful. They were incredibly attentive, always ready with a smile and very caring. Nothing was ever too much trouble for them! JAL can be congratulated on the standards of service their staff deliver, which I would rate as being of the highest order! The ground staff and Lounge staff were all superb too! We watched baggage being loaded into JAL aircraft, and were really impressed at the deliberation and care shown in the way it was handled. The aviation of the flight too was perfect. The aircraft was well flown and landings were very smooth. We'd rate the 777-300 as being marginally better than the 787-8/9's, as the 777 seems quieter inside. We had seats 8H and 8K on all four JAL flights, so a direct comparison is possible. 
Negatives? The PA announcements in English are sometimes hard to understand. 
It is unfortunate that the individual air vent nozzles provided for most seats are not available with the Sky-Suites. The cabin was rather hot (25-26 C) and it would have been nice to have been able to direct cool air onto one's face at times. It is a pity that the aisle seats could not have been spaced so that the storage alcoves near the passenger's head had a window at the end of them. Window seat passengers have no less than 3 windows available to them, and when belted in it is impossible for the aisle seat passenger to lean forward enough to look out the window adjacent to the partition between the seats. Minor issues though, given the excellence of the Sky-Suite concept!
Overall - I would rate JAL as an outstanding airline, and from now on it will be our choice whenever we go overseas.

title: Top Notch Airline!
review_text: Excellent flight! Brand new Dreamliner plane with state of the art infotainment system. Awesome cabin crew and decent food. Seats are comfortable (as far as airline seats go) and there was lots of overhead storage room. It beat the pants of their partner airline (AA) on the flight home.

title: Good airplane , Service with Care
review_text:
I take a flight from Bangkok to Japan and transit to take another flight to DFW , USA.
I was impressed by new airplane Dreamliner .
Food amazing ,they serve hagendas not nestle or Wall's
I love that you even can find toothbrush in the WC for economy.

title: Best of the bunch
review_text: Booking in was very easy.  Did it at the airport. The aircraft was a 787 Dream liner and even in economy there was a ton of legroom. I fell asleep and when I woke up the stewardess had left a not to contact her if I wanted some dinner or a drink.  Don't that sort of service often.  Flight left on time and arrived on time (take note Lufthansa!!)

title: Why is JAL not a five star airline?
review_text: One of the biggest mysteries in commercial aviation is why this airline is not ranked up there with the best in many major international rankings. From my experience, JAL is one of the best airlines in the world. The service on both my flights with JAL was extremely friendly and warm - the cabin crew greeted me warmly and were helpful with small requests. I had some of the most delicious meals on board and the portions are also generous. The seats on the refurbished B767 aircraft operating the Singapore-Tokyo route are the best I've flown on - 34 inches seat pitch, 18 inches seat width - you can't get that on some major airlines these days! In terms of inflight entertainment systems, passengers can get to their movie after one or two ads and not five or six on the gulf carriers. Drink service is also very regular on a seven hour flight. Check-in is certainly very friendly and processional, bags are on the belt within 20 minutes after disembarking in Tokyo and Singapore. I'd put JAL down as my first choice to Japan in future.

title: Fantastic child-friendly airline
review_text:
My family of four (2 adults, 1 child and 1 one-year-old baby) travelled on Japan Airlines for the first time ever (2 international and 1 domestic flight), and we were impressed.

I would definitely fly again with them - the service, food, seat comfort, entertainment and flight punctuality were on par with Singapore Airlines (my usual preferred airline for international flights), and in some ways, better.  The child meals were generally healthier, but still very tasty and beautifully presented.  The types of toys/children's souvenirs offered were more useful (I ended up collecting several of children's cutlery sets) and I particularly liked their collection of wooden toys (sadly, I didn't manage to collect all of them).  But the best thing of all was the complimentary carseat provided for the baby.  We had booked a seat for him as he is much too big to fit into a bassinet and is too fidgety to stay on a lap.  As he was under 3, Japan Airlines provided a carseat for him on all three flights (I just had to submit a request about a week before our first flight and provide a couple of measurements so they could set it up for him).  He was so comfortable and settled in the carseat that it made those three flights so much more pleasant for all of us.  The domestic flights with Qantas between Adelaide and Sydney were a nightmare in comparison.  If only other airlines would provide a similar service...

We were also impressed with their land-side service and their awesome loan strollers (at the airports in Japan) which had ample storage space for hand luggage and steered like a dream.  The loan strollers provided by the airports themselves were just ordinary umbrella strollers.

The only (mildly) annoying point was the language barrier, which resulted in some confusion when we asked whether passengers with travelling with young children had priority boarding (a sign showed that this was meant to be the case, but they weren't letting other families through).  A fellow passenger kindly translated our request into Japanese and we were allowed to board first.

title: Love the new planes
review_text: love the new JAL logo and the new planes these days. they have great leg room and the seat are good. best of all the meal serve is good and we like it   the server is a litle rush some time maybe due to language or timing  but all in all we love the meal and drinks you get alcohol , water , juice then Miso soup  that's lots for a lunch meal   ent set was good too have lots of new movie and brand new. though there is still old planes and we got one on the way back but the food makes up for it

title: Business Class & Lounge
review_text: Ladies & Gentlemen, I wish TripAdvisor would already have this "flight review function" earliier, there are so many flights that could have been reviewed. But overall, in the past years / months / days airlines trying to always seek room for improvement and Japan Airlines has improved dramatically. Comparing my last JL flight to this one, you can clearly see the improvement, but still they are a little picky about how many ice-creams are being passed onto their Business Class passengers, or "they need to check" if there is still bread available, which is unacceptable. If a passenger wants an ice-cream or a bread, especially in Business Class, so give him a piece of bread or an ice-cream, also, I tink you headsets belong to an Economy Class, but you do offer slippers / which is fine. Mouthwash in your lavaotories, but no actual towels, as a man with a bit of beart, you will see that you are having difficulties in drying your face, there will be paper fragments all over your face and you have to wash your face again and again. (save is waste!). Member of staff extremely friendly, but I don't think that you need to reject offering ice-cream / or more bread to a passenger. If you don't want to offer Whiskey to a passenger, simply don't write in on your menu. Please make your passengers happy and let them have a pleasant journey. Small details can make a big difference. Your airline lounges are pretty nice, your food and beverages very well prepared. You even have a locker for baggages / which is great, the passengers don't have to carry their items all around the lounge, but simply lock their belongnings, which is wonderful and extremely convenient. Will fly again, great airport, great airline, but there is better / worse. Etihad, Emirates and Qatar are setting standards and exceed expecations of passengers, but those are your rivals.

title: good and efficient service
review_text: this one-hour flight was with Boeing 767-300, yes it was an old plane yet the cabin looked clean and well maintained. no snacks offered, only coffee, tea or soft drinks given. the service was good and efficient, no PTV onboard, and the inflight magazine is in Japanese language. as this was a connecting flight from Garuda, the transfer service was a breeze, and all I did was took my luggage from the belt and after custom, I went to the transfer check in desks for JAL's domestic flight and leave my luggage there.

title: My First Flight with Japan Airlines
review_text:
The flight is Good

The Service is Good

The Meal - OK

WIFI ONBOARD ARE AVAILABLE 1 hours - 3 hours or a day..... but not available when in above China Territory and Alaskan Area Flight to America *depends on Satellite

But you could use Roaming Partner of Your mobile phone account too....  

But my cabin luggage could not put above my seat, because some of passenger cabin luggage put on my area by the stewardess, she is know i got cabin luggage, but she don't care :(

i complained, and they just saying sorry about that......

title: Premium Economy - SoSo
review_text: We had ever flown Japan Airlines before, decided to give it a go and do premium economy. In a nutshell while the service was good the seats were pretty average, we had exit row but felt that seats could have been better, bit wider but no real advantage reclining. Biggest bug bear was poor leg support and table tray far too small, also acute lack of storage space. On a later flight with another carrier, I booked standard economy, exit row, seat and space much better. So premium economy, with this carrier, for me no way, won't do that again, not worth the extra money.

title: Great trip to Japan and Okinawa
review_text: Great flight to Nagoya international airport  and then to okinawa. Good service great meal and movie entertainment. Lots of included drinks both non and alcohol as part of the trip. Able to communicate in english and helpful in providing tickets at one airport for the entire trip. It is a long flight but it went very well.

title: Best economy flight in a long time
review_text:
The 777-300ER economy is the most spacious economy around. At 34in pitch it was more than adequate for my 6ft3 solid frame.
I was very impressed with every aspect of the flight, but cabin service has declined as JAL follow the lead of other carriers in utilising non-Japanese staff who do not uphold the once impeccable JAL service.

title: Great people and excellent service
review_text: Paid more for the Business Class and was not disappointed.  A very pleasant flight.  The staff were so helpful.  Although the seating was a bit tight to get into - I am not your average Asian size - the comfort was excellent.  I liked the idea of having your main meal then if you required follow up service you asked.  So nice not having food pushed upon you.  Great meals.  I wanted to take the air hostess home to Australia.  We have so much to learn about good service and being nice.

title: Safe, comfortable and great service when travel with children
review_text: I would book anytime with this airline. Especially when travelling with my family. A very comfortable flight. Very accomodating and modern.

title: Impeccable service
review_text: We upgraded to Premium Economy and it was well worth it because of the length of flight.  We then were able to use the the JAL lounge during our 4 hour layover where there are beds and showers.  I was able to get a solid 3 hr sleep lying down.  One of the best airlines we've ever flown .  Sorry to say it really puts US airlines to shame.

title: Wow, what a wonderful experience!
review_text: Travelled from Frankfurt on brand new 787 Dreamliner and it was a pleasure! Plenty of legroom, comfortable seats, large video in seat with loads of movies etc. Chargers available in seat. Food and service excellent. Thoroughly recommended!

title: Excellence airline
review_text: The aircraft is nice and comfortable.  Japanese food served was delicious. I could have eat more .  The flight was smooth

title: Overall fine, but not like Qatar / Emirates
review_text: Old aircraft, you can feel that Japanese management is always greedy and controls even how many ice-cream you are allowed to eat and this is not how a Business Class should be. The food was fine, their aircraft had black cotton seats, which is fine, but I didn't feel very comfortable. Their business class headsets are plastic and extremely cheap, they should get better ones, those remind me on Economy Class, however, I always take my own tools, I use Bose or Sennheiser and have my own plug.

title: JAL insensitive towards mother traveling with baby
review_text: My wife recently flew to my homeland, Japan, with my 3 year old son.  I chose JAL bc I believed they would deliver the best service.  But that couldn't be further from the truth.  My son ingested too much ice cream and vomited during the flight.  The airline followed procedure and interviewed my wife about my son's health, held them until the plane was empty, and then detained them further at the airport.  We understand the protocol when there is a sickness on board but they treated my family with a cold, insensitive, disrespect that left my family in tears.  The treatment JAL delivered was completely unacceptable and we will NEVER fly JAL nor will be recommend that anyone, especially families, take this uncaring airlines.  We've traveled around the world and this flight was the worst experience for us.

title: The Touch Of Japan Hospitality As You Would Expect
review_text:
As an One World Emerald member, I regularly travel with Japan Airlines. This is one of the countless flights I am delighted to have looked after by the JAL team.

The JAL business seats are comfortable and provides good rest for long haul flights with all the connectivity you need. This is a seat you can sleep in comfortably with a true full flat bed configuration.

Complimentary amenities especially the comfortable cardigan is a nice touch to ensure you are well dressed for your night flights. I truly appreciate given a cardigan to which is exceptionally soft and comfortable to help me settle into sleep compared with other leading airlines which do not provide this on-board.

No disappointment and no unexpected surprises from JAL. Sit back, enjoy and relax the warmth and hospitality of JAL team.

title: JAL Flight
review_text: I've flown on most of the major carriers & JAL crew was by far in my top 3. Very friendly & courteous flight crew, check in staff & pretty much any employee I talked to regardless of which airport I was at (I flew from Vancouver, Narita Japan & then to Hong Kong) was more than willing to assist & very polite. I'd fly JAL again for sure! The only minor gripe I had would be there's was not Wifi in the business  class section.

title: A wonderful way to travel
review_text:
Our group of 6 (ages 73, 70, 39, 39, 11, and 8) traveled from Boston to Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam with a connection in Tokyo.
Japan Airlines (JAL) was fabulous. The monitor in the seat back in front of each passenger was a fabulous option, particularly since there were an enormous number of English language choices. These included numerous new Hollywood movies (Star Wars VII, The Revenant, The Big Short, The Hateful Eight, many others) as well as old standby films (the original Star Wars series, all 3 Men In Black films, many others). There were extensive options for kids as well such as kids TV and movies and video games with a controlled in the armrest. 
The cabin attendants were incredibly pleasant. They were available and polite. One woman went out of her way to bring me my travel pillow. I left it in my seat and she tracked me down all the way in the baggage area about 1/2 hour after we had departed the plane. 
The food was good. The kids' meals had an Asian focus and were not to our kids' tastes but were fine meals. We got the vegetarian options, which I enjoyed though my wife liked the regular meals my parents had more (pasta with meat sauce was one that was really good). Overall, the food was decent.
I will definitely look to fly JAL if we head to Asia again (or anywhere else JAL flies) as all six of us had a really positive experience, especially given that we were on the plane for 19 hours each way between the two flights.

title: confortable seats even in economy class
review_text: Confortable seat and lot of place for legs, nice flights. Good food  good service and a very comfortable , made the journey to paris a pleasure. Friendly flight attendants, generous meals . The inflight entertainment definitely has than enough to choose from i watched 4 movies.

title: The good and the bad
review_text: I flew roundtrip Singapore to Tokyo with experiences to both extremes.  From Singapore to Narita, Tokyo we started off just fine.  New aircraft with nice seats and good electronic systems.  The flight attendants were very nice and the food was better than average for an airline.  All was well until we were diverted to Haneda due high winds at Narita.  They made us sit on the runway at Haneda for 4.5 hrs before flying us to Narita.  They had no food and very limited beverage service for the 6 hour delay...  turning our 7 hr scheduled flight into a 13 hr fiasco.  Upon landing, Narikta was not prepared for us and all public transportation stops during the night.  Japan Airlines did NOTHING to accommodate their customers.  Even first class customers were stranded at the airport.  Finally at 2am they handed out a bottle of water and some crackers.  The trip from Haneda, Tokyo back to Singapore was fine in terms of timing, but the aircraft was old, the seats were worn thin and extremely uncomfortable, the electronics were substandard as was the quality of the food.  Drink service was terribly slow and climate control was uncomfortable.  All in all not a good experience.

title: Summary of both multiple economy and business class flights
review_text:
I want readers to fully appreciate this review so I will do my best to pithily and concisely summarize my experience:
Simply put, JAL is awesome: flight attendants are wonderfully attentive, helpful, and friendly, food is decent to tasty, and overall experience is quite nice. I've flown multiple economy flights and business class flights with JAL from 2012-2015.  The amicable service varies little from business to economy class except economy receives more individualized service/luxury (seat reclines, food & drink on-demand, larger TV screen, privacy window, etc.).  Flying from LAX to NRT is not terrible in economy.  Of course, business was BETTER, but economy was remarkably better than the longhaul with Asiana from LAX to ICN.  I digress, I've flown with JAL to Japan and to Thailand from Japan.  My experience was always pleasant and I wish I flew with JAL instead of trying to save money and flying with Asiana.  If it gets down to simply pinching pennies, I would still choose JAL over other airlines.

title: Under Rated!!
review_text: I was surprised on so many levels with JAL. The staff are extremely polite and courteous, and managed to cobble together a meal on an out bound flight when my choice was not available. Seats are really comfortable, entertainment great and punctual...in fact I have never been on a flight that boards before the stated time. I had 4 flights..two international and two internal and this applied to all flights. The aircraft for the internal flights were brand new and high level service on both flights taken. Food is good standard and snacks available throughout long haul.

title: Impeccable service
review_text: Both ways, the flight was perfect. The plane is clean, the bathrooms are kept immaculate, the food is tasty (and varied), the flight attendants are superbly trained.

title: Personel weint out of their way to find a vegetarian meal
review_text: The stewardesses here went out of their way to find me some vegetarian food when they found out that my pre-order somehow hadn't gone through. I felt it really mattered to them that I had a decent meal and they brought me compensatory bonbons :)

title: All good but misses on food
review_text:
JAL offers comfortable flights with good inflight entertainment. However, JAL did not get it right for indian food. If you pre book indian meal, they offer a very bland sort of thing and i guess their cook has not got it right at all. 
They need to improve a lot on their food front which lacks variety and taste. On this front they should learn from Emirates or Air India

title: Amazing !
review_text:
Ground staff is very nice,planes are super clean, the crew is amazing with a good attention to detail, super polite and always attentive.

The food experience is super nice even on this short flight !

title: A great First Class experience
review_text:
Japan Airlines might not have fancy suites or showers onboard, but their First Class product can match any airline.
Firstly the sushi bar at the lounge is really fun and a great way to start the trip.
I couldn't book a massage though because it was busy and it was a 2 hour wait.
The food offering in the Sakura first class lounge was also fantastic and plentiful for breakfast.
Onboard the semi private suites was very roomy and the seats really comfortable.
I had the Japanese meal from Michelin chef Seiji Yamamoto and it was amazing. One course after another, each meal tasting like what you would find at a top restaurant in Tokyo.
The crew on my flight were one of the best crews I've ever had on a flight. They were so attentive.
In the middle of the night, I was watching a movie and a crew alerted me when the captain spotted the northern lights!
It is one of the most experiences of my life, to see the Northern Lights 35,000 feet in the sky, just mind blowing! wow.

title: Pure pleasure
review_text: The flight is comfortable and overnight which makes it even better. In flight entertainment is diverse and latest. Aircraft is well equipped and service top notch

title: On the ground incompetence
review_text: Round trip flight YVR to MNL via NRT. In the air ir was a great flight in business class. I was told in YVR my luggage may take a different flight but I will have it the morning after landing. Next day, no contact and after I initiated contact luggage would be delivered later in the day. 3 days passed until I saw my belongings again. Frustrating !! Knowing Japanese efficiency I blame the MNL part of JAL incompetence for this.

title: Great Service
review_text:
Excellent service, friendly and unobtrusively attentive. Comfortable seats with good legroom (I'm nearly 2m tall) and a wide choice of inflight entertainment options. Nice choices of food and drinks. A more than adequate baggage allowance of "two pieces".
Probably the best flight experience I've had in many years, will definitely fly with JAL whenever possible.

title: Comfortable flight
review_text:
Efficient and good service from the check-in up to arrival.

Great costumer service (even to the domestic flights). Superb in-flight meal.

title: Excellent legroom
review_text: Good service.  Ground staff and flight attendant are very polite, helpful and hospitable.  The aircraft is new and provides good legroom.  Seats are comfortable as well.  Since I don't really enjoy any in-flight meals, foods served is not bad but the desert ice cream is the best.  As for the in-flight entertainment, movies selection is not bad as well but I wish they could add more.  I hope there are English subtitle to other foreign movies (Korean movie, etc.,) too.

title: Extraordinary service and food
review_text:
Check in was very efficient (had no line to wait in) and conducted with gracious service not found with most American-based airlines.  As business class passengers, we were permitted access to the one-world lounge in LAX, which was decently nice.  The seat/pod was more than roomy for me as a petite (5'3") thin person.  A very large person might not be very comfortable.  There was plenty of storage area within the pod and in the overhead bin.  Everything looked clean and sanitary.  The bathrooms on board were always clean, and as a  person who absolutely hates these tiny bathrooms and tries not to use them, I had no problems using them frequently throughout the flight.

The amenities were typical and nice (eye mask, toothbrush, slippers, etc...) and the movie/video selections were fairly up to date and varied.

The dinner service (our flight was before noon) began within an hour after take off, so don't eat too much in the lounge.  There are both Japanese and Western selections; I chose the Western selection, which was a filet.  The two courses that preceded that were delicious, but the filet was amazing - tender and seasoned nicely.  Wine selections were pretty nice.  Food is unlimited on this flight so after dinner is served, one can eat as much as one can tolerate.  There were "snacks" of sandwiches, pasta, ramen, tempura and fruit/desserts.  There was a fantastic coffee mousse dessert that I absolutely loved and asked for a second helping.  Passengers are able to order up until about an hour before landing so one can get a lot of eating in those 8-11 hours.  It was 11 hours to Tokyo and 8 hours returning to LAX.

The service was impeccable! They were very gracious and helpful.  They never made you feel that you were inconveniencing them or ordering too much food or alcohol.  They made up our "bed" when we wanted to sleep and removed them as we prepared to land.  Once everyone had a chance to eat and relax, they dimmed the cabin lights and made sleeping very easy with hushed voices and quiet service.  I can't say enough about the quality of service from all the attendants.  They try to fulfill your requests and provide items not on the menu or in the amenity bag.  I had a sore throat and asked for a hard candy; the attendant returned with a whole cup of various flavored hard candy and let me know I could get as much as I wanted.

I have no reservations about recommending this outstanding airline.

title: Clean interior, room for legs, and a friendly staff
review_text: I was pleasantly surprised to find that JAL had an updated 767-300 that had a good interior and ample size IFE behind each seat back.  As a westerner the food was a challenge, but nevertheless it was fresh.  I would recommend flying JAL again in the future.

title: New York To Bangkok
review_text: JAL and American Express have a companion fare deal that makes it worthwhile to travel in Business Class at a reasonable price.  My wife and I flew from NY to Bangkok and for 22 hours business was the way to go on this trip.  Service was terrific and the meals were excellent.  I wouldn't want to travel this route on another airline.

title: Will use them again in July.
review_text: Patient, Polite Comfortable etc, etc, ontime. Enjoyed flying this long haul trip.  Saw how they treated some old age passengers and was impressed.

title: Great Airline
review_text: I needed to fly to Beijing at short notice. Decided to fly JAL almost on a whim based on this experience I will fly them again. Their customer service is nothing short of astounding. Due to a delay out of Honolulu my transit in Narita became very short. Their customer service people escorted me personally and rapidly thru the terminal and security to make sure I made the flight with a minimum of fuss and stress. Both legs of the flight were really comfortable great service I will fly them again

title: Good
review_text: Nice flight to Tokyo.  Good service at check-in and on the flight.  It was a smooth flight and a good way to start the trip.

title: good business class seats BUT
review_text: plane was new, seat was great BUT service is terribly slow! on a 7 hour night flight, dinner started to be served only two hours after take off and took another 2 hours to finish! all this in glaring cabin light which you had to endure regardless whether you gave up eating or not. very unflexible crew which was not able to arrang paid upgrades for three collegues

title: Amazing Hospitality
review_text:
My family and I were flying from Hong Kong to Tokyo on JL736 the first leg of our flight home to Vancouver. From the moment we walked up to the check-in counter we were greeted with friendly smiles and made to feel very taken care of.  The flight JL736 was fantastic. Our inflight crew was absolutely the best. I must however mention I was seated in 1K and the young lady (her name started with a "M" and is based out of Japan) who took care of us was positively wonderful. With her big smile she constantly made sure we were comfortable and had everything we needed. We thank you Ms. M and truly hope to be served by you in the future! 
We cannot wait to fly JAL again!

title: EXCELLENT SERVICE
review_text:
I just returned from Japan today, and I had to write about the excellent service we received on Japan Airlines.  My husband and I were traveling with our two grown daughters, one son-in-law and our three young grandchildren (a granddaughter of three and one-and-a-half-year-old twin boys)...YIKES!

I was so dreading the long flights, but every step of the way, from buying tickets to picking up our bags when we got home, was a very positive experience.  They made sure our check-in was as easy as could be.

We are a tall family, but legroom even in economy was fine. The seats were comfortable and the food delicious.  They had very nice meals for the children and a special meal for a vegetarian in our group.

 Both flights were right on time, and the entertainment offered was great.

EVERYTHING is great, but the star of the airline is the staff.  I have never received such pleasant and efficient service while flying. (Even when I have upgraded my seats.)  I am not sure how the flight attendants remain so cheerful on such a long flight.  They even cleaned the bathrooms during the trip.  

I will certainly put this airline at the top of my list, and I will definitely book JAL when I am going anywhere they fly.

title: Top Service airlines
review_text:
I　ｈａｖｅ　ｂｅｅｎ　ｔｒａｖｅｌｉｎｇ　ａ　ｌｏｔ，　ｎｅｖｅｒ　ｓｅｅｎ　ａｎｙ　ａｉｒｌｉｎｅｓ　ｓｅｒｖｉｃｅｓ　ｃａｎ　ｂｅｔ　ｔｈｉｓ　ｏｎｅ．
ａｌｌ　ａｉｒ　ａｔｔｅｎｄａｎｔｓ　ｗｅｒｅ　ｖｅｒｙ，　ｖｅｒｙ　ｆｒｉｅｎｄｌｙ　ａｎｄ　ｗｉｌｌ　ｔｏ　ｈｅｌｐ．

title: Japan Airlines flight
review_text: Japan airlines was great.  Polite, attentive flight staff.  Food was good.  We flew a 787-8, which seemed brand new.  It was a good experience.

title: World Class Airline
review_text: I flew Japan Airlines from KUL-NRT, the NRT-ORD. I was amazed. Even in economy, I felt special. The flight attendants were very personable. It is my favorite airline by far. I've traveled on a lot of large airlines, and this is the best. Better than Cathay and Emirates. Way to go JAL, I'm not easily impresed.

title: Good flight journey with sufficnet leg room and seat space, but not sure about touch screen panel
review_text: I am pleased to say I had a relatively pleasant flight journey from London to Narita un like most other airlines I had used in the past. What pleased me most with this JAL flight was the fact that there were enough leg room and seat space for someone like me , being over 170cm, who would often be troubled with lack of such space thanks to some fellow passengers in front of me who would decide to recline their seat to a great extent without due care. Hence I always get nervous for the first quarter of the flight journey in to find out if the passenger in front of me is going to be a mindless moron who would recline the seat straightaway once the seat belt sign is switched off. In this flight, there was no exception to this. However despite the reclined seat in front of me I was not troubled by the lack of space in this flight possibly due to the good seat design devised by JAL. I still had enough space in front of me and leg room to move about during the whole journey. Another good thing was I could get some sleep and wake up to the time of destination without much interference from the sun glare or some curious passengers itching to opening up window blinds to peak outside every so often ( towards the end of the journey in to Japan). It's a good idea that once you had your main meal, all the lights were out driving the passengers to believe that it's time to take some nap. Maybe I was fortunate enough to be surrounded by passengers with good common sense and decent social  etiquette in this flight alone. I managed to have some sleep during a long flight to Narita. There was a good selection of in-flight entertainment programmes and the seat was comfortable enough. The only issue I had  was to do with the touch screen of the entertainment system. It's a great idea to have a touch screen panel embedded to the seat, but I still prefer the one with remote controller. With the touch panel, depending on what kind of passenger you get behind your seat, if the person happens to be a mindless 'baboon' type who keeps *bashing* the touch screen ( not tapping) with fingers, fists or whatever every time he/she wants to change the channel, that would create a nightmare-ish situation for the poor passenger who is occupying the seat in front of them and it happened to me in this flight. I felt my seat was tapped each time this guy behind me kept changing the channel. Luckily it was just for awhile and most of the passengers were asleep after some hours later.  I do appreciate JAL is trying to keep up with the modern technology and trends, however in my view having the latest gadget does not mean it's the best for the passengers. Anyway I would fly with JAL again possibly in less busy season.

title: Cannot book seats
review_text:
because this is a code share with AA, JAL customers (I booked JAL specifically) do not have the same status as AA passengers and cannot book aisle or window seats online. 

This is a bad deal for JAL and as a result, makes the flight horrible for JAL customers who then will have to sit center seats...maybe because thier customers do not normally complain???

THIS TREATS JAL CUSTOMERS AS SECOND CLASS CITIZENS and results in them getting worst seats on the flight. 

I guess this is the last time I will ever fly JAL again because you just dont know at time of booking that you will be stuck with middle seats. I fly often and just can't deal with center seats so now looking at booking a new ticket on another airline so I do not have to sit middle seat...HORRIBLE PERFORMANCE JAL...no wonder you have profitability problems...

title: The Japanese really do things with class!
review_text: Wonderful airline! I think they should be rated 5*! Foodwise very good. Service is always very polite. Seats are fairly comfortable and the airplane very clean. Inflight magazine is above-average. I must consider Tokyo as my transit destinations and flying Japan Airlines more often!

title: Excellence
review_text:
Excellent service, Excellent people!!!
We flew with our 2 kids and all staff at the airport and the airplane took very good care of us. Whatever we requested they were there to help.
Big thank to all of you

title: Long flight, very friendly crew
review_text: We had a very uneventful flight. Which is Great!! It left on time, the crew is so friendly, bathrooms were clean the entire flight!? We had lay flat seats, with the biggest tv screens I've seen on a business class seat. The plane was very very warm during the night flight.

title: WOW WOW and WOW- The most amazing airlines without any doubt. I will fly you guys again
review_text: I flew NYC to Tokyo then onto Singapore, JAL definitely made the 21 hours traveling lot easier and then we flew back with them two months later from Singapore to NYC and guess what? Their service DID NOT CHANGE. Way to go JAL. in staying constant with your exquisite customer service and comfort

title: Very nice
review_text: Food was very good, and the flight attendants were very courteous and hospitable. The seats were very comfortable with lots of legroom. The in-flight entertainment was up to date and working, unlike the broken wifi problems United has been having.. Would definitely recommend this airline!

title: Customer Experience @ Best
review_text: JAL, 1st Double Decker Airline ..... Amazed by the customer service .... Requested for Vegan Food and Window Seat at the time of Check In and Booking... Airlines called up twice, did a follow-up to check if Vegan with Tofu is fine ...

title: Japan Airlines really live up to their reputation!
review_text: Fantastic service with helpful, classy on-board crew.  Great food served so nicely - typical of Japanese hospitality.  Very clean aircraft for the whole 13 hour trip (even toilets).  Have to say we had a wonderful Boeing 787 - top-notch!   It made a very long trip more comfortable!

title: Fantastic
review_text: JAL will always take care of you.  Their flight attendants are amongst the most attentive in the world.  And their first class cabin is one of the best.  The seat turns into a true bed with a mattress.  Fantastic!  Only thing is that I wish they had a better snack/small meal selection since full meals are pretty meaningless on this overnight flight.

title: Amazing experience, definitely worth the price
review_text:
Talk about an amazing airline. 

We flew from Los Angeles to Osaka last year and the experience was great. The seats were comfortable, the food was tasty and the entertainment was top-notch. All the recent movies that we hadn't seen in theaters was available on this airline. They also gave us plenty of free beer. Will definitely be flying with them again.

title: Great service, great food and arrived early!
review_text: Ultra polite and helpful cabin crew. Tasty food on board, as well as the quick snacks which are available at any time throughout the flight (udon, cake etc). The JAL Sakura lounge at Haneda airport is also exceptional: comfortable, an excellent selection of alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages, hot and cold foods and other helpful amenities such as showers and lockers.

title: Great flight to Taipei!
review_text: Seat was about as comfortable as it gets in economy, and the incredible service made the flight fly by like a pleasure. The free-flowing plum wine definitely helps too!

title: Poor management of code share ticketing, misspelling of non-Japanese first name
review_text:
Very disappointed in their confusion about a code share flight with Cathay Pacific. Impossible to resolve with Cathay. On return could not reach JAL after their working hours, but Cathay has 24 hour phone number, but could not handle change of return flight date because the code share was only outbound from Japan.

This is the third time I have used JAL in the past 4 months and I used to think it was a superb airline, but now I am quite inconvenienced and do not want to do business with them or Cathay if I can avoid doing so.

title: Trip to Kaohsiung, Taiwan
review_text: We flew Japan Airline from JFK to Kaohsiung, Taiwan and back and had a really good experience with the airline. We booked economy flights and at first did not realize we would not be able to select seats until 72 hours before the flight. We were really nervous about not being able to sit together....we are a family of 4....but had no problem on all 4 flights getting seats together. The service on the flight was exceptional, the food was really good, and the entertainment was good too. The seats were comfortable. Our only complaint was the heat...all four flights were extremely hot....so just dress in layers so you can take off layers when the heat rises. We were extremely happy with Japan Airlines and would not hesitate to fly with them again.

title: Great service for passenger in wheelchair
review_text:
It was service with a smile from the moment we checked in at the airport. The cabin crew warmly welcomed us and helped us with our hand carry luggage. Being a tall person, even the leg space in the economy seat was spacious enough to accommodate me. I checked in my wheelchair at the boarding gate and transferred to a cabin chair. It was waiting for me the moment I got out from the aircraft.

In the 7 hour flight, I had to go to the toilet at least once. I informed a cabin of this and he said to call them when I needed to go. Two cabin crew attended to me, one to push the cabin chair and the other to make sure we didn't roll over another passenger's foot in the semi-darkness and narrow aisle.

The toilet at the tail end of the aircraft was rather small but I just needed some privacy to perform intermittent catheterisation without having to sit on the toilet bowl. The space outside the toilet leading to the passenger cabin could be locked while the cabin crew pulled the curtains at the other end. This created a rather spacious area or me to empty my bladder.

The overall experience for flying with this airline as a wheelchair user was positive. The service on the return flight was similarly helpful and courteous.

title: Quick round trip flight
review_text: Recently went to Japan to visit family upon the death of a relative. Going to Tokyo the plane was a bit older but clean and the food was edible. The staff was very friendly and came around constantly to check if anyone needed something. However coming back the staff was friendly but it seemed forced. The food was horrendous. The first meal we had a choice but neither was edible. The second meal there was no choice, it was some supposedly special noodles with sauce. This had no taste at all. Fortunately I was exhausted and slept a lot. My one plus to this return trip was how the stewardesses took care of a family with a crying baby. I have done that before and it is very stressful. They were kind and helpful to the parents.

title: Our Vietnam/Thailand Trip
review_text: Very nice airline: clean, everything was sealed before use. Food were very good, healthy and you can choose Japanese entree or American food, Haagen-dazs ice cream, generous beverages green tea, juice, wine/Saki. Most of all, we love our own small but individual TV screen so we can watch different movie or channel we wanted. Flight attendants were also very sweet. I saw one of them holding the baby for a mother on board. One of bathroom is also larger than American or United that we have flew before.

title: Great service!
review_text: The flight attendants are nice and polite. They smile all the time.The cabin is a little old and lousy though.

title: Great Service, a little skimpy on the food
review_text: This was a comfortable flight. The business class has individual cubicles so no one is crawling over you to use the bathroom. The crew is first class, friendly and helpful. The plane leaves around 01:00 AM and the meal is a light evening snack. If I am awake at 02:00, I am still hungry. You can order sandwiches at any time, which I did every two hours when I woke up. They were very good. I enjoyed the flight, and slept most of the way.

title: Excellent Airline
review_text: Extraordinary service, airline staff from check-in to staff to flight crew!!! The flight crew had smiles from beginning to end of my flight. I say Japan Airlines is one of the best airlines to fly on!!!

title: Good & Poor Customer Service
review_text:
Being 2 meters tall, I asked JAL call center to assign me a seat with leg space. Even the supervisor was not able to assist with this simple request. (Other airlines have no problem with doing this.)  The supervisor was not flexible at all. This left me very frustrated and stressed about my long flight to India. 
However the staff and the supervisor at the airports (both in Japan and in India) were far more accommodating. They were kind, they listened and they were able to help me with my request for a seat with leg space. The actual flight, the service on board, inflight entertainment and the food were all good. I would fly with them again if the call center staff were a little more flexible and caring and understanding.

title: Best airline EVER!!
review_text: I was lucky enough to find people working for Japan Airline when I go lost into the airport in Chicago trying to find my flight. Customer service is amazing it was a very nice flying experience. It was my first trip oversea and I didn't regret it! If you have to take a flight to Asia going with Japan Airline is the best way to go!!

title: cgk - narita
review_text: the crew is cheerful, polite and keeps smile... the food is so standard for muslim snack but the meal is ok, the cabin is moderate with 2-3-2 configuration for economic class, have bigger restroom at left behind aircraft. free flow of water/ orange juice etc.

title: Not up to standard
review_text:
A somewhat disappointing in-flight experience with JAL on this overnight service to Sydney. Cabin lights were left on at full brightness for well over 3 hours. 
Sure, the dinner service needed to be completed, but the harshness & intensity of the lighting was about as comfortable as a hospital emergency waiting room.

I asked if the lighting could be dimmed even slightly, to no avail (little surprise).
The foot rests were troublesome, locking in a half way down position unless forcibly reset by hand to the max up position.

Cabin crew were courteous & helpful as ever.

title: Great Customer Servise
review_text:
JAL is my "go-to" air line. I always loved JAL for their professional attitude.
I'm not just talking about their cabin crew, but their ground crew have great customer service skills also.
Last year, when I needed assistance with reservation for trip to Japan (from DFW) for my father's funeral, they helped me through it. Despite the international part of the whole trip was not JAL's flight, they treated me with very kind and caring words, and helped me with each steps to ensure I'll be there for my father's service.
JAL will be always my first choice, and I'll recommend JAL to everybody.

title: Wonderful flying experience
review_text: This was my first time flying with Japan Airlines and I must say, it did not disappoint. The attendants were attentive, kind and made sure that you were comfortable and taken care of. I have never seen such attention to detail on any other flight. When they noticed my wine bottle was empty, the attendant quickly replaced it with no questions asked. The food was interesting, there was one dish with ham, a sweet sauce and walnuts that tasted odd but apart from that, everything else was delicious.

title: Dislike "Premium Economy" class, I tell you why ...
review_text: JAL has always fantastic reviews by many people from different cultures. I like JAL overall, except for "Premium Economy" class I chosen from Los Angeles to Narita, Japan. Get to the point, issue was reclining seat. Seat does not recline at all. Instead seat roll down toward forward. Despite of you get more leg room than Economy Class, when seat roll down forward, you loose leg room tremendously. I did not like that. When seat roll down forward, you don't recline your back, your entire body roll down forward, just like seat. It was very uncomfortable. Premium Economy seat cost me near US$2,400. Believe in me, if your budget is around US$2,000, and need more comfort on your seat and around you, take Singapore Air "Premium Economy". Their seats actually recline comfortably. You also get choose meal from 3 selections when you purchase a ticket. Their entertainment program is far better than JAL. So, for near 12 hours flight, go for Singapore Air. You won't regret it.

title: JAL from HCMC to LAX
review_text: Very efficient and comfortable. Delightful service and generally good food. Business class seats were comfortable although did not go flat on the outward journey. The code share flight with American Airlines was not as good as JAL.

title: Very good business class!
review_text:
I began using JAL a couple of years ago, when they started offering a flight into HND arriving and departing at very convenient times.
Their business class product is of very high quality. All seats offer good privacy and, most important, aisle access without the need to climb over someone's legs. Furthermore this allows staff to serve you directly, i.e. if you have an aisle seat they do not need to lean over you. This makes the whole service a very smooth and pleasant experience. Talking of service: Very friendly and swift, amongst the better ones you experience when travelling in C.
The seats offer a full flatbed, and an aircushion is provided for additional comfort. I always have had very good sleep in these seats. Lavatories are up to Japanese standards, which is pretty unique in air travel. 
Western food options are a bit of a mixed bag, but still good. The wash bags look very impressive (Tumi), but the contents are spartanic, e.g. no moisturizer and socks. But a sweater is on offer, if you want to get out of your shirt. Large movie screens, I think it was the largest in C when launched. 
I noticed there are more crew announcements than on other airlines, which can be a bit annoying, as the entertainment system stops. Nevertheless, when given a choice, I prefer JAL over other carriers on most occasions. And the JAL lounges are very impressive, too.

title: Impeccable service
review_text: Truly one of the best airlines, the seats in economy class are really spaciius, the 767 aircraft though old is well maintained,  the AVOD screen is huge, the selections are really entertaining. The service by the crew is really impeccable.

title: Wonderful experience, Highly Recommended
review_text:
I traveled from New Delhi to Tokyo and back. After my first experience, they have reached to the top spot in my preferred airlines.

The flight crew is very service oriented. They take very good care of the passengers. Food and Drinks are good and many options are available. In flight entertainment is excellent.

Most importantly, they have a very good sense of time. For business travellers, this is one of the most important factor. 

Highly recommended.

title: Skytime Yuzu
review_text: Very nice drink. The meal came with a hot soup, rice crackers, and a Haagen Daaz ice cream for dessert.  For my beverage, I selected JAL SkyTime, which is a yuzu (citrus) flavored drink.  I’m a Sky Time fanatic, and it’s pretty much the ONLY beverage I order when I’m on a JL flight other than green tea.

title: A pleasant surprise
review_text: Everything about the flight was impressive - the food, the service and the comfort of the cabin, but perhaps the most impressive was the cabin staff. Regrettably we were forced to disembark from our plain before it had taken off due to some technical problem. The staff were so apologetic that they seemed close to tears of humiliation. To make up for the inconvenience while we waited for another plane to be made available, the staff handed out food vouchers of 2000 Yen so that everyone could have a meal in the airport while we waited. It was a very generous and welcome gesture and by the time we had eaten the plane was ready to board. There is much that airlines in other parts of the world could learn from this great example of customer service. This could have been a customer complaint nightmare for them instead it became a plus point.

title: Good but needs improvement
review_text:
The service is good. With some air hostesses the experience was quite good. They were quite hospitable. Food quality is good. Cleanliness is also upto the mark. 

The seating comfort however needs improvement. For long flights, it becomes taxing.

title: JAL a very good flight experience
review_text: Very good leg room, I know this matters most for many. Crew is very hospitable and friendly. As I arrived early, they put me on a earlier flight for free from Tokyo to Osaka (my final destination) w/o a request.

title: A bit disappointing with the in flight meal
review_text: Perhaps I have high expectation with the JL inflight meal, I had a beef pattie with rice and it was just soso.  The kiwi juice was good though.

title: Good food, service, entertainment and cabin crew
review_text:
I had ordered the low sodium meal and the flight attendant confirmed this before the flight even closed the door. 
The toilet was spacious! I was amazed at how much extra room there was. At one point, one passenger told me one of the stalls was dirty and let a flight attendant know. The flight attendant told her it will be cleaned and immediately started to do so. 
Dinner and breakfast was served and in between there was a Häagen-Dazs vanilla ice cream offered as a snack. 
The overhead bins are small. It's not one long bin shared by a couple of rows but for one row only. I had a poster which didn't fit so my boss had the cabin crew stow it elsewhere.

title: Best airline so far, A+++++++
review_text: This was the first time I flow with First Class, way beyond my expectation. Serve the delicate Oolong tea & Champagne after seated then hand over the right size of pajama then my 5 star Japanese style meal started. For the 13 hour flight, I enjoy every minute in the air, did not even want to go to sleep, I watched 3 movies and drank unlimited high quality tea and numerous 3 star chief unforgettable dishes, it was a flawless flight from the beginning to the end, would like to fly again even have to fly from Vegas to Chicago in order to take this flight, that's how much I love this airline and this route to Japan.

title: Good but not the best
review_text: I was flown from Manila to Narita round trip on November 2015. The flight time is 3 hours. They served us one meal that has only one menu for everybody. The food was just fine, mixed Japanese and western food. The seat is OK, good space between front and back row. They have not much movies in the entertainment system and the personal TV is so small. Overall service is good.

title: Pleasant, Efficient, Flight
review_text: Pleasant service on this flight. The snacks were not as good as you would expect on a Japanese flight but still a comfortable flight.

title: Alternative last minute flight
review_text: Customer service was simply elegant and genuine.  The flight attendants were in constant motion, there was always one flight attendant walking around to ensure safety, and to provide service.  This is my second time on JAL and I must say, I am truly impress, the delivery of customer service was consistent throughout the entire 7hr flight.  From the moment you embark on the plane you are greeted and welcomed by a courteous smile, all the flight attendants ensured that if assistance was needed they were prompt in addressing the request and smiled the entire time.  This is the kind of service that would make a return customer and loyal frequent flyer.

title: One of the Best
review_text:
We  were very impress with the level service of this air line, from the time we checked in to on board . Their personel always have the smile on their face , their professonialism is second to none . We can feel how serious and how proud they are to provide service for their customers. We all agreed that the way they handle themself seem like they appriciate the job they have
The plane is clean both international and domestic  , the seats are comfortable and the food is pretty good . , their entertainment system is outstanding , a lot of movies also include some new release
We all agreed this is  the best airline we have been traveled. Thank You for made our fly enjoyable

title: Excellent Service On board
review_text:
JAL can be highly recommended. 

Service was excellent from start of flight to the finish.   The Stewardess were professional and warm.

Food on board was excellent.   I chose the Japanese option.  Delicious and fresh ingredients were used.

Flat bed was comfortable and the equipment on board user friendly.

I would definitely fly JAL again.

title: Economy from Vancouver to Tokyo Narita was excellent
review_text: My family were all impressed with the quality, comfort, food, entertainment and service  on Japan Airlines. we flew from Tokyo  to London on 10 Dec and were fortunate to have a quiet flight with a fair nnumber of empty seats.  However the flight from Vancouver to Tokyo was full and it was equally as good.  Having been on a 'round the world' ticket with  One world on number of airlines, this airline was the top performer. The seats were slightly more roomy and longer, the service was far superior, ie  how quickly drinks were offered, hot towels, etc and the bathrooms were very clean throughout the flight.I would most definately fly with Japan Airlines again in the future.

title: Highly recommended
review_text: Travelled on this airline for the first time recently and was very pleased I did.  The seats were very comfortable for a long haul flight, the in-flight service was very attentive and courteous without being over the top. Food was average and I have had much better on other premium airlines.  The flights departed and arrived on time. The in flight  entertainment was OK although I have had better on other  airlines.  The 20 inch TV screen was excellent though. The noise cancelling headphones were very good as was the ability to charge my phone and tablet in flight.
