This enabled me to play games on my own device without running down the battery. Would definitely travel with them again.

title: Best One We've Used
review_text: We have flown this airline many times to different places.   There aren't many ways airlines can differentiate themselves, but JAL really tried hard.  Their flights are usually on time, and when they are late, it usually isn't by more than a few minutes.  Their in-flight staff is the most courteous we have experienced - they know when to check in and when to leave you alone.  Their bathrooms are larger than most airlines.  Their legroom tends to be larger.  Their seats are quite comfortable (only caveat here is that lumbar support isn't great). They have more inflight meal selections than any other airline we have experienced but to take full advantage of that definitely call a few days before your flight.   Their inflight entertainment system is the best we've seen with a wide selection of movies and shows which you can watch on demand.

title: It was my first time with Japan Airlines for 7 hours journey. I went to Japan for exchange program of my university.
review_text: I really enjoy myself with this airline. The food served was really delicious. Besides, I was impressed with the service and cleanliness of the airplane. Highly recommended for those who wants to go to Japan.

title: Enjoyed the Economy Class Expereince
review_text: Was pleasantly surprised by the Economy Class experience by JAL 94 from Seoul to Tokyo. The leg space was comfortable, service efficient and good inflight entertainment. I did not expect such an experience for a cheap ticket bought through a travel website.

title: Impressive
review_text: I accidentally got a great ticket deal from Expedia and it was an impressive experience. I was impressed by the cleanliness and service. There were always smiles on the fight attendant's faces and they never hesitated to help. They served tasty food and drinks. The on board entertainment was great with old and new movies and music. The plane itself was very clean and I didn't feel uncomfortable at all even though I was in economy class. Highly recommended.

title: Excellent Service on all flights!!!
review_text:
It was my first time with this airline and my first flight was great and the second one, the 13 hour one was even better. They give 2 meals plus snacks as well as several snacks at the back of the plane that you can get yourself.
It mentions Wifi when I fill out this review but I was not aware if there was or not.
The flight attendants were very friendly and very patient. The Japanese are so Zen and  made the flights easier. They were always available.
The longer flight had blankets and U shaped pillows which actually are comfy to sleep.

title: The Rising Sun
review_text: After a long layover while I tried to sleep in Kennedy Airport, Japan Airlines opened it's ticketing area for boarding passes around 7:00 with a welcome and a bow to us. It was uphill from there because the service was great! They had about six stewards in economy, they were all polite and helpful. We had two full meals on the 14+ hour flight, plus two snacks. One meal was dinner, and the other was lunch. Dinner included pork with vegetables and rice, Miso soup, salmon over potato salad, green salad, fruit and picked vegetables. I Certainly did not lack for food! Oh, and the beer was free!  That helped me sleep. The 787 was comfortable, with a USB plug, large screen TV in the seat back, and they even provided slippers and neck pillows (the "U" kind for your comfort. Three seats next to me were empty so I lazily stretched out to sleep. When I got up and was thirsty, I walked to the back and found a steward eating. I apologized for interrupting him, and he graciously offered me apple juice instead of water, which was great.

title: Just wow
review_text: The best airline and service ive seen in a long time. Really nice seat and lots of place. Best food and service. The staff is so attentive to your demand. Wow

title: Great service
review_text: Service on board was fantastic. flight attendants never showed any impatience or rude behavior. They were always polite. I get the sense that some of the flight attendants don't have a great grasp of english so I wasn't sure if they really understood what I said but it was never an issue. The first part of my flight from yvr to nrt was on business class. The plane did not have 1st class which I think is nicer because there were more business seat options. This flight used shell flat neo which is not completely flat but at an angle. This leg was a longer flight (about 10 hours) so we had 1 additional meal as compared ot leg #2. I had thought the seat would not be as good as leg #2 but actually this seat was very comfortable. I give it a 8 out of 10 minus 1 for not fully flat and minus 1 because it never seemed to give me an ideal length for my legs and I'm not that tall (5'8"). Leg #2 was sky suites II which gave you a lot more storage areas but felt smaller even though it really wasn't. Overall, great food choices and snacks and the anytime food selection is a great idea. Movie options I thought was just ok. The fact that it was the same options on my return flight was a bummer as I had already watched everything I wanted to see. Most movies were not really recent. I think my biggest negative would have to be the  lounge. In vancouver you use a shared lounge with other airlines (premium plaza lounge). It got very crowded. I think some of the folks in that lounge hadn't eaten in days because they were rushing the lines and ate 4 plates of stuff before I finished having my 1 cup of tea. So trying to get food was a battle. I was disappointed in the sakura lounge however as that is their main lounge. There is the main sakura lounge and smaller sakura lounge. I used both and had issues with both. In both cases they made announcements about the lounge being at capacity and it felt like it. However, in the main lounge there was plenty of room but they separated their dining area to an area where you need to walk up. So you had to eat in that dining area which was very small. If the food was in the main lounge area there wouldn't be such a sea of humanity clustered together. I opted not to have any kind of food in either lounge because of the crowds and because the food didn't look very good. The lounge at singapore was also a shared lounge and the food there was also mediocre. JAL's biggest negative for me was their website. Its not very well done and the check in process is not well thought out. They ask for a lot of information including your passport info which I had already previously provided. When you are on the road more than likely you are on slow hotel wifi. Their check in page asked for too much and not user friendly. Additionally, they expect you to check in each segment separately. They also don't provide you with electronic boarding pass. Thats bad if you are connecting to their flight. If you were connecting without a boarding pass you likely will have to go to the main departure terminal and redo security because inside a terminal you're not likely to find someone who can print the boarding pass for you. This will vary from airport to airport.
